1.description: Proximity smoothie place. It's not bad but i dont crave it ever. I like the Peanut paradise because i loveee peanut butter. The only thing i don't think it that they add sugar to all of their smoothies standard. So you have to make sure to ask for it without sugar. I mean what kind of fruit smoothie needs MORE sugar?? they are already sweet as is. It is in the psychology building at UIC and I think they close at like 5.

2.description: Place is almost busy every hour a bit on the expensive side but customer service and turn around is great love this place.

0.description: I absolutely love the Mango Magic smoothie! I am hooked on it! The sandwiches are also so yummy! They are all very nice as well. No complaints.

1.description: The food here is decent, and I appreciate that there are some healthier choices available on campus but... O M GWHY did I just watch an employee make my sandwich without gloves on after digging in her pockets and texting on her phone!? That is so disgusting and unhygienic.

0.description: I absolutely love Au Bon Pain cafe bakery. They have an assortment of baked yummies, wraps, sandwiches, baked breads/cheese sticks/corn bread, and a create your own salad bar. I am obsessed with making my own salad here! Unnnnfortunately it is located right outside of one of my classes, so I can't help but to frequent and spoil myself often. Also, the coffee is pretty good. I have not tried any of the soups. They also have parfaits, fruit trays, protein trays, and others goodies. Also, when getting a salad, you get your choice Of free breadstick, roll, corn bread, etc.. I also have to make a mention to the women in there that all work so hard. Sometimes they may seem unhappy or moody, but if you really are polite and get the courage to talk to them, these women are really sweethearts. The food is always fresh, these women are doing a good job!

3.description: Friendly and professional staff! Called to check if they had specific scrubs in my size, they were nice enough to hold a pair for same day pick up. I will definitely shop here again!

1.description: Really nice service. Found exactly what I was looking for without any hassle or attitude from employees. Great experience

2.description: Staff was very friendly and helped fit my white coat perfectly. All their white coats are Lando brand and reasonably priced.  Their embroidery was very well done and I got it back in less than 5 days .  I would definitely go back again.

9.description: Great service. Had really good selection. Had everything I needed.  I'm very satisfied with their service.

10.description: Went to this new location today! Same great selection as before. There was a nice guy that helped me find what I was looking for (navy blue scrubs). I was hoping they had IguanaMed or Grey's Anatomy and they did! I purchased IguanaMed from them back when they were open - was excited to see they had some of the same brands they carried before (Cherokee, Landau, Koi, random fun printed tops). The new store is in a Jewel shopping center - it was easy to find, plenty of parking. It's not at all like the warehouse before - but still better then a normal scrub store. I purchased both Grey's Anatomy and IguanaMed navy scrubs today and then went to the new Costco! Win.

4.description: It's really hard to write a good review when you get to the store 15 minutes before opening. Only to wait another 15, and no one ever showed up to open the store. What's the point of store hours if you don't adhere to them. Smh

6.description: I needed to find some maroon/wine colored scrubs for a 235 lbs male in a short period of time. I did not know this would be as difficult as it was to located and my deadline was Monday. I went to the local resource suggested through my hospital of employment, only to find a severe let down in terms of availability and overall customer service. The gentleman from that location, I believe to have been the owner, stated that he would call me back by 10:00 am with some answers pertaining to their other locations availability for the items I was seeking information on but he never did. Thankfully he never did because I am glad to have given my business to Chicago Scrubs. (He did eventually contact me about 5 hours later stating that they could not locate the items I needed, I told them thank you and that I already purchased the items through another resource.)After contacting several other locations, without having any success I eventually reached out to Chicago Scrubs seeing if they had what I needed, Will was the individual helping me and he was able to confirm that they actually did have 3 sets available in the size/color I needed. He was very helpful and assisting me with placing these items on hold so that I could drive downtown tomorrow and pick these up since I was coming from the western suburbs. He relayed to me all of the necessary information in which I needed for tomorrows pick up so that everything would flow smoothly as expected. In my eye's, he went above and beyond the normal call for customer service and for that he should be recognized in appreciation for his excellent skill set. I ended up having some afternoon flexibility between work so I contacted Will to let him know I would be by his location within the hour. When I arrive, he greeted me with the same professionalism I received from him over the phone. He had everything prepared and ready for me once I arrived. Bottom line, Will is an outstanding professional at what he does and Chicago Scrubs is lucky to have him as an employee. Due to the absolute amazing experience I was presented with today from Chicago Scrubs, on Will's behalf, Chicago Scrubs has just earned themselves a customer for life. I will happily spread the word about my experience to everyone I come in contact with that is looking for the same results I received today. Keep up the good work Will, and thank you Chicago Scrubs for all your help today, and in the future as well!!!! You save me the anxieties of Monday if I was not able to locate the items I needed and for that I am forever grateful!!!

12.description: great service!

5.description: This is a small location, but don't be fooled! David can find anything quickly/easily and he is super friendly/kind! Even for "larger, curvy" girls there are a variety of sizes. Great loyalty (bring back your reusable tote bag for a discount!)/ quantity discounts and even a sales/clearance rack in this new (3 mos. old) store! I'll be back for sure.

11.description: This store was great! The manager was really nice, funny and helpful. They also have a great selection of scrubs, including my favorite, Greys Anatomy scrubs. If you need scrubs I would highly recommend going to Chicago Scrubs to buy them!

8.description: Great friendly service.  Great prices. Wish they had a bit more selection of lab coats but, I still found one I liked and I will definitely go back!

0.description: I walked in looking for scrubs for Halloween and wasn't expecting much customer service.  I was immediately greeted by one guy working the floor and thought I would just brush it off since I wasn't a real healthcare worker and just look on my own.  He came up and asked if I was looking for myself to which I said yes and he said "Well, why don't you come over to this side of the store, you're looking at women's scrubs" I thought I was going to die laughing.I told him I was looking for some scrubs for Halloween and he walked me over to the section that I needed (the cheap stuff) and helped me get my size and everything.  Very nice guy, not trying to push any product or anything on me and I walked out with exactly what I needed.  Highly recommended

7.description: Great personalized service. Smaller store than previous but has good amount of selection. Store manager was very helpful in choosing sizes and colors. Will definitely return. Would recommend more brands and brighter colors.

58.description: Super friendly staff and owner. Well maintained and clean. Food is heavily processed, featuring battered meats, waffles, sandwiches, etc. Great place, I suppose, if you want "comfort" food. Not a place to go if you like fresh, whole food.

56.description: I'm well aware my main man Guy pulled up to White Palace in his muscley red car and spikey head of hair and slammed back some late night diner creations. I'm also well aware that this is not a diamond in the rough, it's just a typical 24-hour joint with the proper decorations, expected menu items, and a mixture of really awesome and really sad, apathetic employees. Luckily, I've gotten a few of the former in my lottery of visits, and I can't say anything terrible has come out of the meals. I will say their inability to split checks past a certain hour is irritating when you're with 5 of your drunk, brain-dead friends and you're the only one who can see the numbers on the receipt, or remember math from high school. PS - go for the pies.

29.description: Beyond awful, the food sucks. For this place to have been on Diners Drive Ins and Dives (Guy Fieri show) is a jaw dropper. Not only is the food pricey for the low quality of the food. They don't even allow you to split the bill. At the end of the day you're getting paid(white palace). I don't know why they (white palace) make it that difficult to pay. All legal money is currency! No matter how and where it comes from White Palace. If you're coming for the chicken and waffles.... don't. The meat is processed taste like McDonalds chicken. The waffles are bland. I recommend going to Churches Chicken ( as greasy as that sounds) They have some "bomb @$$ chicken &waffles cost way less (4 something) and you leave satisfied . Just a heads up.

42.description: The white palace is awesome top to bottom! Great wait staff, great food, great atmosphere too. I can't say enough good things about this place; definitely worth the stop and nicely priced as well.

23.description: This place was jam packed. I couldn't substitute the hash browns for bacon or anything really till I talked her into it. She gave me wet fries that tasted like the potato wasn't cooked. I didn't ask for scramble eggs and got scrambled eggs. The only good thing was the 8 pieces of bacon I got for 8$. This place was terrible.

47.description: Be prepared to wait for a table in a cluttered area by the washroom. The greeter isn't that friendly and she makes it seem like it's your fault their is no space. My wife ordered the fried tilapia with fries and I ordered the chicken and waffles. My wife liked the food, but I wasn't a big fan. The waitress was nice and she checked up on us. This place is definitely   overrated. We will not be going back.

8.description: I came here for dinner on a Friday evening with friends.  Upon arrival, we were seated immediately.  As others mentioned, it is just an average diner.  However, I gotta give credit for all the food options they have here!! wow!Food - reminds me of Denny's, but with a lot more options!Grecian Chicken - Generous with food portions.  The chicken tasted ok, nothing too amazing.Costs - around $10 for a meal with generous portionsCustomer Service - nice, seems like the folks that work here have been here for awhile and they just seem happy which is always a plus.Decor - I really liked the decor inside the restaurant, pretty neat! :)Parking - plenty of parking if you park near the whole foods and just walk down to the restaurant.I would come back here to check out the other food items on the menu since there's just soo many!!

31.description: During the day it can be quite empty but this location is 24 hours which means if you go there after midnight expect a crowd of loud possibly drunk people. The menu is full and packed. This always tell me that they specialize in nothing particular. I had a spinach chicken wrap which was good. I am a fan of their chicken soup and they do give you large portions for the price. Overall the food is good, the atmosphere is diner dangerous at night with security and prices are fair.

34.description: Stopped in here for breakfast, after being referred by a local Chi town man. I am a huge fan of breakfast, and the menu offers many choices for those who enjoy savory or sweet dishes. The flexibility of the menu and the staff made ordering the food simple and stress free. The staff and quickness of the meal made my entire experience that more enjoyable.

16.description: Solid and filling moderately priced diner food! Biscuits and gravy are tasty. Nice place to eat alone or in a large groups. Avoid weekend nights

13.description: We wanted to eat lunch somewhere after cheering all morning in the Blackhawks 2015 rally. Hubby remembered this place called White Palace Grill that was nearby and it was on diners drive-ins and dives and Chicago's best tv shows.When we walked in, we were greeted right away and we were able to sit in a booth by the window so we can people watch.  The place had a dinner feel with red/white/black colors of the interior.  The place was pretty clean and neat, not bad for a restaurant that is open 24/7 for over 70 years, wow impressive.  They must be doing something right!  They make everything from scratch even their Italian bread crumbs! I believe it's owned by a Greek family so you know your portions will be plentiful.Here is what we ordered for lunch:-Chicago Deluxe Burger-it was juicy on toasted brioche buns.  Served with crinkle fries that were hot and crispy.  It came with a soup which hubby chose creamy mushroom.  His soup was thick a hearty with sliced of mushrooms.  I tasted it and I would get it too lol.-Catfish Sandwich Deluxe-it was two large pieces of breaded catfish filet on toasted Italian bread with crispy fries and a soup.  He would get this meal again. -I got the hot Meatloaf, it came with mashed potatoes made fresh topped with beef gravy and a cup of soup which I got the chicken noodle.  My soup had plenty of noodles and it was also hearty and not salty, I would order this again.  I LOVED this meatloaf dish, I got 4 pieces of moist meatloaf that had a crispy crust on the outside.  The gravy was so good not salty at all, I even asked extra on the side for dipping.  The meatloaf was flavorful with bits of carrots and celery in it.  I wanted to save some to take home, but I liked it a lot that I ended up eating it all.  If I say hmmm while eating without thinking, then I know it's good haha!   Good comfort food. Even our server was really nice and polite.  She was very attentive when we asked for more mayo , we got more, I asked for more gravy, I got it.  Our drinks were filled without us asking, nice.  Overall, I like this place and it's 24/7 all year round.  I'll be coming back as I want to try other things on the menu as seen on TV  lol!

11.description: My wife and I love this place!! We eat breakfast here at least twice a month. It's our go to place for guaranteed good breakfast choices and strong coffee (none of that watered down stuff you get at other diners). It's always clean, and we love the staff.

39.description: The place was crowded and the service was lacking. They do not split checks. The place was dirty but the food was fine for the price!

37.description: Great place to come in after a long night of partying.. I usually go to IHOP but you can defiantly taste the difference.. 4 stars for the food 2 stars for the interior 4 stars for the hospitality and service . They are very nice here love it!

0.description: I don't know why this place has such low ratings! I found the food to be delicious, and I shared a skillet with my BFF & we were both full and satisfied! The place is pretty janky, but I like the diner atmosphere. There are some weird rules about pre-paying if you have a party of 5 or more and paying $3 per person if in a booth. No splitting the bill either, so it definitely has a lot of terms and conditions!The food, however, is very good for your buck! Paid $10 for a chicken fajita skillet and pancakes came with! Love how the place is open 24 hours a day! Will come again!

38.description: Great food, the biscuits and gravy is amazing. I live an hour away and it's completely worth the drive.

51.description: Seems really overhyped. Perhaps I just didn't pick a winner.Everyone knows what constitutes a typical DDD place. I've been to a few and always had some great tasting food, whether it was a dive or a nicer-looking joint.I ordered the fish/grits/eggs (perch) for about $9. Also came with toast. This is a ton of food for the price, no complaint there! The grits were flavorless and disappointing and the eggs had an odd texture. Can't mess up toast, nor fried fish. All in all it was very disjointed - I felt like it was eggs, grits and toast with a side of fried perch. Maybe that's how it was supposed to be and maybe I'm an idiot.All in all, I feel about WPG how I feel about Navy Pier -- I'd bring a friend here if they wanted but I don't think I'll be back.

27.description: ThIs is great, the food and the strive can't be beat.  The prices are reasonable.  This was wonderful.  You need to watch the parking to avoid a ticket.

32.description: Yummmmm!!!! I had spaghetti and sausage. It was delicious. The customer service is great. Even being as busy as they were they still were able to make you fell like you matter. ( that's important to me )

54.description: On the outside, it looks exactly like what a diner is supposed to. It has a very old-fashion style. The food is good. I haven't gotten any breakfast food there yet. I have gotten their quesadilla and I thought it tasted great. What makes the place great is the people, though; they deserve a lot of the credit. They are always happy no matter what day or time you go there.

48.description: OMG. They sent me a plate of salt. I went here tonight with my brother and his girlfriend thinking that this place would be good because I saw it on TV. Big mistake. I ordered the baked meat loaf and they sent me a salty turd and dirt flavored mashed potatoes. I wouldn't give this mess to my dog. BEWARE OF THE SALT!!!!!!! Oh, but on a positive note the water and the waitress was good!! That's where the one star comes in.

44.description: They're most always crowded and the wait can pile up at times, though it's always been worth it. Service is prompt and friendly, and the food has always been exactly as we ordered. Delicious too. The loss of two stars is for the chicken strips. They're far from something straight from a chicken, more of a McDonald's McNugget kind of chicken. They've been dissected, some stuff added, then squashed back together in the shape of a chicken tender. The taste is marginal at best, and the texture is fair. My suggestion: Avoid the chicken tenders at all cost and stick with just about anything else on the menu.

24.description: Terrible terrible terrible. I went here with my boyfriend because we were starving and both wanted nice, simple comfort food. We both ordered breakfast food (because I'd heard how good it was here) and when my plate arrived (strawberry french toast) it had a long hair laid across the top. We told the waitress, who apologized and took the plate, only to bring us a "fresh meal" from the back that also had hair in it! What was unbelievable to me was the fact that several people saw this plate before it got to my table and not one saw the hairs when they were the FIRST things I saw both times!! After that she then brought a 3rd plate but at that point I'd lost my appetite. Haven't been back since.

7.description: We tried this place for the first time yesterday. It has been here since the 1930's so they must be doing something right. The decor is classic diner of days gone by. Really nice if you like that kind of thing. The service here was very good, polite and prompt.As for the food it was ok not great. My wife had the patty melt with fries and chicken noodle soup. She said it was very good but not great. i had the chicken and waffles which came with 2 eggs and hash browns. It was pretty good but the chicken was average. You get 3 strips which are just ok. I do not see what all the rave is about this place but I may try it again and this time something else as the chicken and waffles cannot be the best thing here.

49.description: I've been coming to White Palace for years now, and while I gave it 5 stars, I have to admit I've only ordered two items... ever. But the Skillets are on point if you love a no-nonsense, greasy spoon, hash, eggs, and cheesy skillet.  It was so good the first time, I can't seem to get myself to order anything else.  Every time I've been for breakfast/lunch on the weekends it's normally packed, but they seem to move you along and clear the tables pretty efficiently.  Nice wait staff and management, no frills, good ol' diner food.

40.description: Went here on Guy Fieri's recommendation. It's a diner, open 24 hrs, surrounded by "no-peddling" signs. We took a cab here and found it easily. The environment is like walking back in time. The staff were friendly, especially our waitress.What I really wanted were the braised short ribs, but they didn't have it as a special the day we went, so I ended up with the breaded porkchops. It was a LOT of food but delicious. I couldn't finish the gluttonous masterpiece but was happy I got to experience it! (My crew got chicken and waffles, which were decent.)I expected more, after the Food Network raving, but I'd recommend it to anyone who's hunting for food late night and everyone else shuts down.

53.description: pros:-It's a diner-24 hour Breakfast**grub at 4 am is always niceCons:-gentrification has killed the vibe of this place a.k.a University village. University village doesn't feel like a neighborhood or a village. ugh! come on UIC. -Target and Whole foods are ironically right next to this neighborhood staple.

30.description: The food was just okay, and on the not great side of the diner food scale...I got the ribeye with hash browns and eggs. I ordered a chocolate shake but the waitress completely forgot about it because she was sitting at the counter eating chicken fingers and fries. The steak was very overlooked and all gristle. I am not that lucky and was not expecting a steakhouse quality steak, but edible would be nice. After we finally after about an hour got our food, we never saw the waitress again, this time too busy eating a burger at the counter. I understand it can be rough working long hours serving with possibly no breaks as I have been a server before for YEARS but the last thing I want to see is my server licking food from her fingers and then handing me my glass.. I'm only giving one extra star because I really felt for the older gentleman that appeared to be the owner as you could tell he cared for his restaurant. There was a loud very aggressive group that went yelling and cursing through and threatened the owner and he remained calm and got them out without further incident, where I was quite alarmed something bad was going to happen. Never never again....

46.description: This is a great breakfast spot open 24 hours they serve lunch and dinner as well .. The food is very delicious here. The service was great. The phone comes pretty quickly.

1.description: I had the Chilaquiles and the taste was just good, they were serve with beans and avocado but I can tell they were from a can. My daughter had the 2x2x2x2 and she loved it. Maybe some music will help in quiet times.

55.description: If you have a craving for chicken n' waffles this is the place to go! I always order the Mama White's because it also comes with hash browns. Adding cheese to the hash browns hits the funny bone. It is right by my school by UIC so this is a great  place to go for a cheap, comforting meal. The staff was attentive and kind to me as well.

9.description: The service is very poor. The waitress was very rude and unprofessional.  It was five of us she got everyone's order wrong and then had an excuse for every mistake she made.I will never ever go there again and if you're smart you won't either.

26.description: The Food Options Are Varied, & The Food Is Always Great!!!! I Continue To Come Back For More!!

25.description: With all of the new construction around White Palace Grill, it looks even more divey than it actually is, and make no mistake my friends- this place is a dive. Don't let that new construction fool you though- there's good people and good breakfast.Our waitress was right out of the "stereotypical diner waitress" handbook- she looked like she had a little attitude, she playfully messed with the regulars at the counter and she definitely called me "hon" more times than my grandmother. But she was super nice and moved around the restaurant like she knows it blind and backwards.The walls are covered in faded news clippings and paintings that celebrate Chicago lore- everything between the Bulls, Harold Washington, Oprah and everything in between. Forget the Chicago History Museum- just get a booth at White Palace Grill to get your fill of Chicago's history.My cousin and I had a pretty straightforward breakfast- pancakes, eggs, sausage and the like. We definitely got our food in less than fifteen minutes, even with a packed house and a line almost out the door. Everything tasted great and came at a reasonable price.What I was most impressed with was the speed and efficiency with which the staff took care of their customers, all while remaining warm and friendly. I'm not sure what breakfast restaurants are in the new mega malls surrounding White Palace Grill, but don't count out the old guy on the block- not by a longshot.

12.description: This place won't receive one star as they try I imagine and perhaps I came in when better chefs were on rotation. That being said I think Guy Fieri is full of shit when he came and ranked this place so highly.The burger I ordered was mediocre at best and a bit on the over done side; the veggies that came with were what you may have had in grammar school as a kid and obviously straight out of a can; they were soupy, tough and sad looking. The soup options were clam chowder and chicken noodle; I opted for the former and learned that there are tomato based clam chowders; the soup was average.The second dish I ordered was the Grecian Tilapia, and from the menu description lead me to believe it was expertly prepared and high on taste; I don't know what the hell I was thinking as it was anything but. The saving grace to this entree was the greek rice that made it passable. The fish was over cooked, burnt on one end and looked like the cap came undone on the seasoning bottle; something akin to a young girl discovering makeup for the first time, too much.The nail in the coffin was when I asked the manager if I could charge my phone as it was on 16% and I figured I would be here for at least an hour; he asked if I was a customer and I motioned to the table directly in front of him with my winter attire and open menu. He said no. I just stared at him and took my seat. This review was written on my dying phone after the meal had been finished. I could forgive shit service or bad food, but not both; the twenty minute wait time to be served would have been dissmissable had other things been different.I opt you check out laurence fishery for some decent seafood on canal and cermak as that was where I intended to go originally, but hunger won out for me.Stay curiously hungry and adventurously hungrier on the quest for good eats.

59.description: Classic diner feel. 24/7 and HUGE menu. Could be a go-to place for breakfast/lunch/dinner if it was closer to my area. Not the fanciest place since it's been there for a while, but who cares because reasonable prices and our waitress was super thoughtful and nice. I got the chicken and waffles which was pretty decent except they were just chicken strips instead of traditional. They accidentally made me two eggs (yay), and the french toast was dense and filling, "melts in your mouth" as my friend said. But overall, the taste of the food was predictable. Typical diner, but would possibly come again to try other things on the menu since that was my first time.

21.description: They serve a nice hearty portion of food , I got the bacon egg and onion omelet that came with hash browns and toast . I don't like the oil they use for their food , I'm not sure what it is but it leaves this gross taste in my mouth .. Also I couldn't finish it because there was a piece of hair in my food, I was grossed out ! I told the waitress and she looked at it against my hair ! I said I don't have grey hair so no that's not mine !I get that things happen , I wasn't expecting her to cut the bill or anything just letting her know but to then be treated poorly after was unbelievable .

17.description: My husband & I came here because my husband said it was on Diner, Drive ins & Dives and apparently we drive past it when we go to Chinatown. So we decided to stop here for breakfast.We sat at the counter and it was a few minutes before anyone greeted us to take our order. It seemed like there was a lag time between greeting us, giving us water, etc but they were busy so I guess I will give them a pass.I got the Ultimate Meat Skillet - holy cow there was a lot of food! It came with a choice of toast or pancakes and I picked pancakes....bad choice for me because my eyes are bigger than my stomach. There was probably enough food to feed at least 2 people. My husband got biscuit & gravy and he said that he got more biscuits than he expected - he scarfed them down like there was no tomorrow.I would go back again...for sure!

10.description: A mid priced all night joint, what more can one ask for? I've only eaten breakfast here and it's plentiful and good. The service is usually quick and the place is bright and clean.

5.description: This is simple as it gets, it's a diner, it's open 24 hours! The coffee is always fresh, hot and a good medium brew. It's what coffee was in Chicago before all those dedicated coffee storefronts popped up on every corner.I've heard many good things about the fried chicken so I tried it once, imo it's good but not worth the hype. I do like any of the breakfasts here, and yes places do manage to screw up breakfast, they make it to order and they make it right. My husband generally gets the catfish and has been happy with it.At times the place can get loud, remember it's a 24hour joint, so all the sudden you may find them vacuuming around you. There used to be more of these places in the city, now they're dying off, I hope this place stays around for a long, long time. Everyone needs a diner in their life.

3.description: OMG this place was delicious ! Had the chicken and waffles and they were perfect Definitely coming back here !

35.description: We wanted to eat lunch somewhere after cheering all morning in the Blackhawks 2015 rally. Hubby remembered this place called White Palace Grill that was nearby and it was on diners drive-ins and dives and Chicago's best tv shows.When we walked in, we were greeted right away and we were able to sit in a booth by the window so we can people watch.  The place had a dinner feel with red/white/black colors of the interior.  The place was pretty clean and neat, not bad for a restaurant that is open 24/7 for over 70 years, wow impressive.  They must be doing something right!  They make everything from scratch even their Italian bread crumbs! I believe it's owned by a Greek family so you know your portions will be plentiful.Here is what we ordered for lunch:-Chicago Deluxe Burger-it was juicy on toasted brioche buns.  Served with crinkle fries that were hot and crispy.  It came with a soup which hubby chose creamy mushroom.  His soup was thick a hearty with sliced of mushrooms.  I tasted it and I would get it too lol.-Catfish Sandwich Deluxe-it was two large pieces of breaded catfish filet on toasted Italian bread with crispy fries and a soup.  He would get this meal again. -I got the hot Meatloaf, it came with mashed potatoes made fresh topped with beef gravy and a cup of soup which I got the chicken noodle.  My soup had plenty of noodles and it was also hearty and not salty, I would order this again.  I LOVED this meatloaf dish, I got 4 pieces of moist meatloaf that had a crispy crust on the outside.  The gravy was so good not salty at all, I even asked extra on the side for dipping.  The meatloaf was flavorful with bits of carrots and celery in it.  I wanted to save some to take home, but I liked it a lot that I ended up eating it all.  If I say hmmm while eating without thinking, then I know it's good haha!   Good comfort food. Even our server was really nice and polite.  She was very attentive when we asked for more mayo , we got more, I asked for more gravy, I got it.  Our drinks were filled without us asking, nice.  Overall, I like this place and it's 24/7 all year round.  I'll be coming back as I want to try other things on the menu as seen on TV  lol!

19.description: Husband wanted classic diner food for New Year's Day breakfast. This wasn't far from our hotel so I drove over.  Had to wait but that was expected.  Large menu, lots of choices. Husband loved his skirt steak and eggs but when did skirt steak go up to $16??  Hashbrowns good, omelette typical, good Greek toast.  Would go again for sure if in the neighborhood.

28.description: Huge portions, great value, good tasty food. They have everything you could ever want. It's like Golden Corral met Waffle House

45.description: I used to love coming here (1-2 times a month). However, I will NEVER be going again due to terrible service, hair on my food, and rude management.It all started off with having to wait 15 minutes, after sitting down, for staff to come over to our table of four people to get our order. The place wasn't busy at all. Once our food got to the table, we didn't have any silverware. However, that's not even the worst part! There was hair on THREE DIFFERENT PLATES of food. Disgusting. The waiters took the plates back, and once they brought back the replacement plates there was ANOTHER PLATE WITH HAIR IN IT. It was at this point that we all decided we didn't want to continue eating here. Our waiter said that the manager had removed one of our orders, but we would have to talk to him about removing the rest of the orders. Okay, sure. All four of us go over to the manager and complain about how terrible our experience has been. He has the nerve to ask if we purposely put our hair on the plates, and says that it's impossible for hairs to have gotten on the food plates because all of the cooks wear hairnets. This manager was by far the most incompetent person I've ever spoken to in the food industry. We ended up having to pay for a meal that we didn't eat, and terrible service.I WILL NEVER EVER BE GOING BACK HERE OR RECOMMENDING THIS PLACE TO FRIENDS AND FAMILY.   I WISH I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE 0/5 STARS!

33.description: if you are a tourist, don't waste your time here.  the food is seriously stuff you would buy from wal-mart, and make in your kitchen.

43.description: This restaurant used to be one of my favorite places, the food was always great and reasonably priced. However, I will not be returning to this restaurant ever again! I went with 3 other people for breakfast, and had the worst experience of my life.Our waitress didn't come to the table for 15 minutes after sitting down, our food (three out of four of the meals, anyway) came before she brought us silverware. My meal came out at least 10 minutes after the rest of the meals, and in two parts. I ordered chicken and waffles, a popular choice. The chicken was brought out 5 minutes after the waffles, and once I took the chicken off the plate to eat it with the waffle that had been getting cold waiting for the chicken, my boyfriend pointed out a hair on the empty plate. Throughout the the meal we found two other hairs in the food on different plates, and my chicken was grey and uncooked in the middle. We were made to walk around the restaurant to find a manager to ask for something to be done about all this. The head manager proceeded to accuse us of lying, as all of his cooks wear hairnets and hats (but nothing to catch the beard hair, like the ones we found). He wouldn't comp our meal, apologize, or make any effort to rectify the situation. I've worked in restaurants for years, and his reaction was simply ridiculous, he should lose his job, so they don't keep losing customers.WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

2.description: This place gets a three stars just by being open all night. The food here is great if you are drink but it gets really noisy and shady at night. The service was a little bit underwhelming considering that my party was forced to pay up front and a mandatory gratuity. However, the overall feel is still welcoming.I want to just start this off with a summary but I can describe more of the food. The coffee is unlimited refills as expected but it was difficult to get a refill. I ordered a reuben sandwich that came with soup and fries. First, I love how they have crinkled fries, but the reuben was okay. Standard reuben. I had a clam chowder soup that had a fair amount of clams. Another plus for this place. Overall, it is still hard to beat a late night diner. Skillets and pancakes or chicken and waffles. I would recommend pregame before coming in at night ; just to fit in with the environment. Really noisy at night, but will come again.

18.description: Really delightful meal. Ribeye steak, eggs, hash browns, and toast. Typical diner feel in terms of atmosphere and food served. I will come here again when I want a greasy feast.

41.description: This place was just about average. I first saw this place on tv and had to try it out. Ordered the country fried steak and biscuits, i thought the gravy and biscuits was average but the steak and breading was the best part of the meal. i would go back for the country fried steak alone.

52.description: Had breakfast here on a Saturday and the place was absolutely packed. Typical diner atmosphere with big greasy portions of food. I got 2 eggs sunny side up which were slightly undercooked, bacon which was a little chewy, and hashbrowns that were barely browned. It came with a choice of toast or English muffin, I chose the English muffin and it was charred on one side. The pancakes were fantastic though, very fluffy and plenty of syrup and butter. Service was quick but not the best. My favorite part if this place was the place itself. Amazing murals, art on the ceiling, old newspaper clipping and art on the walls with a typical retro diner feel.Open 24/7 with breakfast served all day.

50.description: Pros:+Good Location+Good Portions+ On Diners Drive-In's & Dive's Cons:-Shady Practices-Prepayment -No Splitting the Bill-No Warning of Refill Charges-Cleanliness Our waitress approaches our table and asks us if we're ready to order, we hadn't noticed the menus had been tucked behind the condiments so we needed a minute and ordered soft drinks. After she gets back to the table with tiny 10 oz tumblers filled to the brim with ice, she takes our order. An eternity later, watching her eat her soup to completion, she finally gets up to get our food & another set of refills. We get the pleasure of seeing her again 20 minutes later to ask for the things that had been missing from our order & a third round of refills. Finally after a whopping 40 minutes of watching our waitress slather toast with butter using her finger, yes HER FINGER, and handing it to the cooks as we ate, she finally came to us to drop of the bill and walk away without a word. I was feeling another refill, naturally, so upon asking she informs me that she had already charged me for a refill 3 times already and this would be my 4th. My eating buddy declined their refill on lemonade as well. Finally she returns to our table with a bill close to $46 for two $8.99 entrees and soft drinks that surmounted to $46 some how. When approaching the counter to pay, the sullen man at the cash register informed me that they cannot split the bill or charge two cards so I swallowed the $46 and tip. Long story short I don't think I'll be back here again unless they get rid of their questionable business practices, their should be a sign informing guests about no free refills , just like the massive sign that says parties over 5 must prepay after 1am, as well as a sign stating their inability split a bill at that high of a price point.

4.description: This place is worth the trip. Beautiful decor! The service was outstanding! The french toast was fluffy and tasty!

6.description: Went to the White Palace just for a quick bite to eat in the evening. Our meal was far from being served quickly. We were seated very quickly, but the waitress made error after error with our Order. I had the corned beef skillet which was tasty. My sister ordered chicken and waffles. It cost her extra three dollars but received chicken wing dings. My brother had the 2 x 2 x 2 and it was just OK. This is a place that people go to because it's open late. Otherwise not on my top list of places to dine.

22.description: Really delightful meal. Ribeye steak, eggs, hash browns, and toast. Typical diner feel in terms of atmosphere and food served. I will come here again when I want a greasy feast.

15.description: My mother used to read me a picture book called "The Little House" when I was a tot. It's about a house in the country that, over time, gets surrounded by a city. But when it was built, the owner declared that it could never be sold, even for gold. (You can hear someone else's mom read it here: youtu.be/YqlOJKt4-RA.)This is my impression of White Palace. It's been there forever, and whoever owns it gets a big tip of my sombrero for not selling out. Moxie is worth an extra star. It's one of the few independent businesses in the area, after being surrounded by every chain store that you ever find in the suburbs (can you say Marshall's, DSW, Michael's, Best Buy, Home Depot, Bed Bath Beyond, Staples, Nordstrom Rack, whew, I've gotta stop... Though I'm giving you a pass, you over-priced gem of a goody-two-shoes health nerd, Whole Foods!). And it's a classic diner with consistently tasty, value-priced large portions, especially good for breakfast. (And the perfect antidote to a trip to Whole Foods, I might offer.)I've been coming here since I moved into the neighborhood more than ten years ago. In fact, I used to phone ahead for comfort food takeout on the way from a god-awful job in the north suburbs. I NEEDED that open-faced roast beef sandwich on white bread with mashed potatoes and a lot of gravy as a mommy replacement to soothe my nerves. In fact, one night the counter guy had accidentally made a strawberry milkshake. Did I want it? Hell yeah! And that's exactly how it tasted. Hell yeah!On a Saturday afternoon at around 2 or 3, I sat at the counter and the waitress offered me the Sun Times, the perfect read for the occasion. I had the skillet with corned beef--long, sandwich-style strips of corned beef, rather than the little cubes of beef and potatoes, which I also appreciate, but this had those crispy hash browns that I can't get enough of. Yum. A good afternoon was had by all.I only hope that this place doesn't end up like The Little House in the picture book, whose owner's granddaughter finds it in disrepair in the middle of the city and moves it out to the country. I love this place, but not enough to move out of the city to partake in its haute cuisine.

57.description: Wow cream and cherries. Wow.

20.description: I came here for dinner on a Friday evening with friends.  Upon arrival, we were seated immediately.  As others mentioned, it is just an average diner.  However, I gotta give credit for all the food options they have here!! wow!Food - reminds me of Denny's, but with a lot more options!Grecian Chicken - Generous with food portions.  The chicken tasted ok, nothing too amazing.Costs - around $10 for a meal with generous portionsCustomer Service - nice, seems like the folks that work here have been here for awhile and they just seem happy which is always a plus.Decor - I really liked the decor inside the restaurant, pretty neat! :)Parking - plenty of parking if you park near the whole foods and just walk down to the restaurant.I would come back here to check out the other food items on the menu since there's just soo many!!

36.description: Great diner food! They're open 24 hours which is great, and I love the atmosphere in there its designed like an old school diner which is really cool! I got a Polish Sausage meal which was great and filling so u get your money worth and our waitress was super friendly. I will definitely come back!

14.description: Service was great, the diner looks like a blast form the past, classic 50's diner which is cool, but the food was mediocre. If people come here its for the great service and vibe, not for the food.

29.description: What can I say. Fast food at it's finest. Patio is staple on Taylor St. I grew up on this food. In it's hey day the lines would be out the door. The food hardly has changed. If you are hungry and driving down Taylor between Ashland and Laflin it wouldn't be the worst thing to do to stop here. The owners is in everyday to check up on things. I asked him once how much would you sell me the Patio for, he said $1mm, that's how much he loves this place. Get a sausage sandwich with fries. Have them spoon beef gravy on the bread w/sweet peppers, put some fries on top of the sausage sandwich, so delicious.

42.description: This place is solid as gold.  I go for the combo no peppers no dip.  Ketchup on the fries.  Also what is clean is the $2.15 dogs on a poppyseed bun with mustard, onions, and sport peppers.  I usually pair that up with about 6 cans of Bud and there is your Sunday afternoon.  If you go in there when it is busy the cook, Felipe, is usually getting bitched at so that is dinner and a show.  One time this lady asked for a doubled dipped beef.  She took one bite and that sandwich fell the fuck apart.  Then she was asking the owner for a new sandwich and he told her to not let the door knob hit her where the good lord split her.

23.description: I don't know how late this place is open but would get an additional star if it was open after bar hours.  For $2.50 you can get a decent hot dog and a huge handful of fries.  Not too shabby.  I don't know if I would go here regularly, but it is nice to know I can grab a hot dog somewhere close by if I really want one.

47.description: This is my first taste of a Chicago style hot dog and all I have to say is Wow!!! I don't think I can look at a hot dog the same way. For one thing the meat was much juicier and filling. Of course this probably means it's more fattening but who cares?Best part is my entire meal of hot dog and fries was under $5, perfect if you're on a budget. Side note: Space is small so be prepared to eat by the booths or take it to go.

8.description: The food at Patio's is inexpensive and plentiful yet sub par.  Honestly, the quality of the food could easily be overlooked if the service were just average. The staff openly make it known that you are an inconvenience and unwelcome. Their unsatisfactory dispositions has lead me to no longer do business with this company.

31.description: I've been a customer since 1984 and today, as it was 27yrs ago (wow! can't believe it's been that long), it is the best fast food for the best price that I know of in Chicago. These days, I take my two little boys here for double dogs (for them) and polish (for the wife & me) or sometimes a tasty Italian beef. The old man who is sometimes there... is the same one from 27yrs ago.You can't go to McD's and feed 4 people for $17, but you can at the patio! (2 double dogs, 3 polish, fries & drinks all around?! Who can beat that price?)

34.description: Mmmmm.... The Patio,I grew up on The Patio and recently converted my "west side mild sauce eating" fiancee' to this glory of glories "vienna hot dog-like" restaurant. My personal favorites include italian beef which includes the well done roast beef simmering in delicious flavored seasoned broth I get mine's dipped cuz it's only right with spicy and crunchy giardinera with mozzarella cheese. My hot dog and fries must have ever thing and the buns are soft with poppy seed on it my fries must be salted with tons of ketchup because when I get those fries alone... in my home... well they dont survive...The pizza puffs are rectangular shaped and deep fried to a crisp that leaves it to be ultimately desired.I please go to the patio and love itif not for me... do it for America!

16.description: Best beef in chicago, old school place which is the best place. Ive been going to patio for over 20 years and I wont get a beef from anyplace else. If you dont like patio that means you are not a true chicagoan. Great food, great staff, and no they dont accept credit cards oh well suck it up and move on, that's the old school way.

13.description: Patio is a Taylor street institution that reminds you of what quick good fast food should be . I been in this neighborhood now 11 years and Patio given me some great sandwiches as well as nice little catering packages that have had my guest going um mm good .

11.description: I'd read several reviews rating the Italian beef here pretty highly and happened to be in the neighborhood, so thought I'd try them out.The beef, on a dipped sandwich, was tough but bland - bland just like the sauce/juice. The Italian beef should be flavorful. If this is the "best beef in Chicago," as some reviewers claim, Chicago is in real trouble. I've honestly had better Italian beef at the takeout places at O'Hare.

39.description: I don't know about this place.  I ordered a combo sandwich (beef and sausage), peppers, dip, the works.  I'm pretty new to this whole italian beef thing, so maybe it's just not my thing (but I doubt it).The sausage was tough.  Tasty and all, but tough (like, got out a knife to cut pieces).  Sure, maybe that's the style here.  The beef was tender and juicy, but strangely low on flavor.  The peppers tasted like all of their flavor was left in the container they had been cooking in.  That's just not right.  I'm also not sure about the dip, but I'll give the benefit of the doubt on that one.I was also surprised by getting the ketchup (which I asked for) on the fries in the bag.  No points against them for that, just a surprise.I'll try it again (it's really close to home) and add an update if I like it better next time.

37.description: This place has wonderful EVERYTHING.I usually get their beef (as dry as humanly possible to avoid having it fall apart in my hands-- with sweet peppers) , hot dog (either regular, or a double on italian.. with everything -- which excludes ketchup. they actually use tomatoes instead), or the pizza puffs. All three are fabulously wonderful.One of my favorite items from this place are their fries. They use large steak fries and douse them in ketchup. If you're craving an unhealthy snack... this place is aaaammmmmaaaaaaaaazing!Cash only.Even though you *can* eat in the restaurant... you would be sitting on a twisty-stool facing a wall... so I think it's better to brown bag and take home.

0.description: I love this place the food is great and growing up on Taylor and loomis.The taste is consistent and the service is awesome and friendly unless you want ketchup on your hotdogs what are you goofy Hi Nina and Gigi

38.description: whoever says al's has the best beef in town has it aaaaaaall wrong. ive been going there for yeeeeeaars since i was a child. my parents grew up in this neighborhood even worked there as teenagers and it hasnt changed one bit. i love it. and they got hot dogs with poppy seeds, true chicago style NO KETCHUP lol.

51.description: Best Beef in the city (Chicago). Wonderful people, best value for hot dogs and fries. Always get the lemonade with whatever you order.  Parking can be a problem, so bring a friend who can jump out and get the order while you circle the block. Get the beef dipped and the sausage dry with peppers.

27.description: If you want a good,quick and cheap meal check The Patio. The Italian Beef sandwich I find better than Al's Italian Beef down the street. Remember its cash only and if you ask for ketchup they'll put it directly on the fries.

32.description: Growing up on the west coast, The Italian beef and Chicago style hot dog are new to me, but since moving to Chicago, I have fallen in love with both. I have to say, The Patio is one of my favorite places to go for both. I strongly base my reviews on what you get for what you pay, and I have to say, this place beats all. A Chicago dog and fries for $2? It's not the best dog in the world, but well worth the money. All in all, this is my new go to place for a good, cheap meal.

54.description: Best drinking food for very cheap! You can get a pizza puff (in all it's deep fried glory) with fries or a polish with fries for only about 3 dollars. The staff has always been very nice and extremely patient with us. I highly recommend the Patio if you're looking for cheap yummy eats.

48.description: my favorite place to get a beef in chicago. i definitely think it's better than Al's. i'd give it 5 stars, but i have an issue with their ketchup policy. they won't give you a bottle of ketchup if you're eating there...rather, they squeeze it all over your fries themselves. i find it very strange.

44.description: Italian beef with hot peppers and mozzarella, dipped real good.Excellent fries.

24.description: The food at Patio is pretty bad. Don't waste your time or money eating from here. If you're near Patio, go somewhere else instead, such as The Rosebud or Potbelly's.

7.description: Ive been going to this place all my life.  Lately the prices seem to be going higher and higher and the sandwich is getting weaker and weaker. Today I paid for a beef over 5.00 asked for it to be dipped with hot peppers. It was not dipped and hardly no peppers and hardly any meat?? I'm highly disappointed.  I don't know if it was dude that made my order or if this is their way of doing things.  Nevertheless I won't be back. This is Chicago. Home of the Italian beef...there's other places that'll appreciate my business.   I'm so disappointed.

49.description: We stopped here after the Taylor St. festival, and I was truly blown away by the goodness of their Italian beef sandwich ($4). I actually think it is better than Al's--there is something about the spices that make it delectable. Definitely worth a try. The other items look like garden variety take out stuff. But that beef was yummy! Also, beware, the "Potato Sandwich" is only bread loaded with French Fries. Or Freedom Fries. Or whatever they are calling them now.

40.description: I stopped by 3 weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised they had one worker to handle the money!  If these folks were reading my post, then I had accomplished something useful.  I now upgrade them  to 3.5 stars.

53.description: Man oh man.Perfectly dressed polish chicago style(relish, mustard, sports & diced onions), wrapped in a sack-o-fries.  Perfectly plump and snapped to bite into it.  Yummy greazy fries.   Cheap cheap cheap.Exactly what I wanted when a coworkers said "Anyone want a polish?" today.For lunch tomorrow, maybe we'll have polish maxwell style!

30.description: Could possibly be the best Italian Beef I've ever eaten!. Cooked with just the right seasonings, try it slightly dipped with sweet peppers. I'm not a big fan of steak fries (prefer mine thin and crispy), but everybody else seems to enjoy them here. Can't beat the price, but be prepared to take everything to go...

46.description: i always get my fries "bloody".. its the only way.  i like the hot dogs and pizza puffs as well.since when has this neighborhood been known as "university village"? f that...

1.description: CASH ONLY! just putting it out there if yall dont know..anyways.. after reading most of the reviews here about this place having some bomb ass beef sandwiches.. i decided to give it a try and find out myselfi ordered a beef sandwich with peppers and a order of fries..the beef was good .. nice thin slices.. but the flavor was lacking and not enough beef on the sandwich! a few people compared this with al's beef and saying this is way better and some say this is the best beef in chicago..i find this to be false.. definitely not the best in Chicago and no it is not better then al's beef in my opinion..

55.description: This is probably the greasiest place i've ever been to!  If you're in the mood for grease and bad fast food then this is the place for you... for food that will go right through you this place is pretty good.

9.description: The food is amazing. The service is fast. Its a cash only place, that's pretty much the only reason I don't go as often as I would like.

26.description: Went here for lunch with a friend.  It was just okay.  They have your typical Chicago staples, hot dogs, polishes, Italian beef and sausage.  I had the Italian sausage with sweet peppers.  The sausage itself had a nice bite and tasted pretty good.  Also got some fries.  I thought they were pretty sub-par.  They were flimsy and not crispy at all.  Good potato flavor, but there was more to be desired with the texture.

25.description: This place is a hot dog joint.  They have regular hot dog, polish, chili, and so on.   Good food.  Especially considering the price, this is one of the best deals you can get in the area.  I admit this is not the cleanest restaurant, but until I see something apparent, I will go to this place once in a while.

12.description: Working our way thru the Tribune's list of top beef places in Chicago from this summer.  Been to 16 of 20 and this is in top 2 for us on the basis of the sandwich.  Fries are nothing special except they ask if you ketchup on your fries.  Never heard of that and it tends to slow down service got non regulars.  Counter personnel are not to be rushed so chill and the beef will be worth the wait.Spouse rates this place 100 times better than the Trib's #1 choice.FYI cash only

21.description: Best part about this place is that the food is very affordable with a beef sandwich being about 5 dollars and the fries are tasty at 2 dollars a bag. What I did enjoy was that the beef was thinly sliced and had a pleasant texture but the beef gravy/broth it was soaked in just did not have enough flavor. It was missing that richness I've had at other italian beef places. As I chewed my food and swallowed it down, only the taste of the hot and sweet peppers really came through.Fries here come in a bag and if you order them with ketchup, they're fully doused in the condiment so prepare yourself for a messy, but fun meal.Cash only!

17.description: Apparently my review got deleted..not cool. First off I want to say that the food here is pretty good, hence why the two stars. However, the staff there is so entirely rude. They don't greet you when you walk in (I've been working in food service for 6 years). Secondly, the last time I went there, the lady that took my order looked so annoyed. I accidentally said italian sausage instead of italian beef (whoops) and the lady looked pissed once I had corrected myself. Then after some lady finished my order, the original hag of a lady sat down in a chair and was complaining about how she didn't want any more customers coming in and that she couldn't wait to be off work. They should know what it means to work in the food industry and how to be accommodating and respectful. Never going there again and would rather go to Al's Beef for italian beef and fries.

10.description: Best part about this place is that the food is very affordable with a beef sandwich being about 5 dollars and the fries are tasty at 2 dollars a bag. What I did enjoy was that the beef was thinly sliced and had a pleasant texture but the beef gravy/broth it was soaked in just did not have enough flavor. It was missing that richness I've had at other italian beef places. As I chewed my food and swallowed it down, only the taste of the hot and sweet peppers really came through.Fries here come in a bag and if you order them with ketchup, they're fully doused in the condiment so prepare yourself for a messy, but fun meal.Cash only!

5.description: CASH ONLY- it's good, cheap food. I've never tried anything except the hot dogs, and it was very very good! Nothing spectacular or revolutionary, but a nice place to go to for some cheap eats! I've heard the Italian beef is the best in Chicago, but I have yet to try it... Maybe for my updated review I will!

3.description: Best combo I've ever had! Never ordered anything else there, since hundreds of combos can't be wrong. Good value and good food. Just don't order the fries with ketchup.*Edited to 3 stars for shrinking combo sizes as of late.

35.description: A VERY limited menu, But GREAT Italian beefs. Oddly enough, They also have Potato sandwiches?????????. As well as hot dogs, probably average pizza puffs, shrimp, etc.

19.description: I don't know how late this place is open but would get an additional star if it was open after bar hours.  For $2.50 you can get a decent hot dog and a huge handful of fries.  Not too shabby.  I don't know if I would go here regularly, but it is nice to know I can grab a hot dog somewhere close by if I really want one.

28.description: Reasons NOT to eat at the Patio.1. The ketchup fries. If you say yes to ketchup, they will serve you a side of wet fries soaked in tangy tomato paste. Gross, gross, gross. Who would possibly think this is ok. I wish I had a picture of this nonsense.2. Cash only, no cards. Ill walk down to Al's beef if i want to pay cash for trash.3. No alcohol, yet not BYOB like EVERY OTHER restaurant adjacent. Stupid, silly, dumb idea. They laughed at me when I asked, assholes. 4. Staff seems to always be bitching at each other. I think it is a family and they clearly do not like each other or working that hot dirty dingy fry grease kitchen all night.5. Dirty Dirty Dirty. There is grease dripping from every crevice of this dark dirty cave, including off the employees foreheads, vomit.6. The beef sandwich is soggy and salty, (really your go to item stinks?)7. The hot dogs are small, soggy, and always covered in the effing ketchup fry slurry. WTF, you cant even get the dogs right? Useless, utter waste of space. A four-alarm grease fire is the only hope for this cesspool of disgust.This place holds the trophy for my least favorite place to eat in Chicago, congrats on really sucking Patio.

45.description: It's a decent greasy spoon. The food is what you would expect, but the prices are the real draw. It's cheap as hell.My biggest problem is sanitation. Bare hands go straight from money to food and back. With a $2.75 double-dog with fries though, I'll keep going back.

33.description: I don't like Italian Beefs, but as far as Italian Beefs go, Patio is right up there with Joe Boston's for the best Italian Beef in the city limits.

43.description: If there was a medication I could take that would make my body immune to sodium, fat, and cholesterol, I would eat a dipped combo with hot peppers at Patio every day of my life. And maybe throw in a double dog for desert. Even the shrimp basket was good, and its probably the only fast food place in the area that offers it; however, when you're craving deep fried popcorn shrimp I suppose it would be good anywhere. The biggest draw for this place has to be the fact that their prices are extremely reasonable considering just how good their food is, and the preferred alternative to going to Al's and paying extra for peppers. How the hell can someone eat a beef sandwich without peppers... Al's is really screwing us over here people and we should not stand for it. Remember to bring cash though, not taking credit is probably one way they're keeping the prices so decent.Also, does anyone know if that jukebox in there actually works?

2.description: From Cali and this is the first place my in laws brought us! That's got to stand for something... Right?We ordered the Italian Beef, Chicago Dogs, and Fries.Since we've been to Portillo's before I wrote this review, I will say the Patio has the better Italian beef! The Chicago dog was good and fries were good, but didn't stand out.It's definitely family run and they seemed short at first but once I mentioned being from out of town, they seemed a little more friendly.

18.description: Three stars solely on food critique. The staff don't seem to pleasant or nice to any welcoming guests. It's really sad casue it's harder to find a great hot dog n beef joint. This place seems on the verge of closing it's doors. Every restaurant u walk by in that area is thriving n pack. I would hate to see this place go. The food is great, they just need a new attitude on customer service.

41.description: Perhaps it's the low prices of all their menu items (dogs and frieds for $2, a beef for $5).Perhaps it's the tastiness of the food (well made proper Chicago style hot dog, juicy tasty beefs on good buns).Perhaps it's the friendly staff who calls everyone honey while they're ordering.Perhaps it's the old memories of eating here at least once a week as stress relief from medical school studying.I don't know what it is, but this is likely my favorite Italian beef in the city of Chicago.  Their fries aren't always perfectly crisp (though often are), the giardinera is not always made quite right (had one bad experience), but the main food has consistently been good and affordable... and even now with a job that pays for more than when I was a student, I cannot help but crave the beef here at Patios.Verdict:  Go forth.  Pay little.  And eat.  And tell me if I'm wrong.

52.description: Best hotdogs in Chicago.. Trust me. They put everything on it. I'd say Uno's is to Pizza as The Patio is to hotdogs :-)

50.description: The place is probably a neighborhood staple of some sort, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it unless I was broke.I had an Italian beef, dipped and sweet... As far as beefs go, I've had a lot in Chicago that were much better.  But the plus side of theirs was the price--$3.75 or so.  Other places are up to $6.  So it's hard to argue with cheap food being "just OK" ...  The fries were very crisp and good; she asked if I wanted ketchup and when I said "yes" she doused them over with ketchup--could've done without that since it was "to go." ... "All of their sandwiches come with fries" ... this isn't true.  I think only the hot dogs and polishes may.  The beef and combos do not.Then they overcharged me $3 and I had to look at my receipt to realize it and tell them.  But all in all, the place is OK I guess.  Didn't try the polish or hot dogs, but I can't imagine they're anything too unusual.

4.description: Where it all began... My family and I would walk over after church. My first, ever Italian beef with all the fixins. Dipped with sweet and hot peppers. American cheese came in later years. Fries drizzled with ketchup. Some days I'd have a polish or hotdog, no relish or tomatoes. Times have changed and now I load them up. Chicago or Maxwell style. My first love. Only thing is... I wish they took debit cards.

6.description: This place has a better Italian beef than Al's Beef. Living on Taylor St. for a couple years now, I've had the beef from both places many times. The beef itself tastes better and is juicer, especially if you get it dipped. I cannot vouch for anything else on the menu, and the place is cash only.

22.description: I came a little late to the game of Italian Beef sandwiches, but I know where to go when the Hawks win and I need to celebrate with a "Victory Beef". It's the Patio on Taylor. Possibly the only place where you'll see guys paying with $50 or $100 bills, but there you are. Little Italy. Love the staff, I'll take mine hot with a light dip. Hold the fries.

15.description: Old school cafeteria style. No frills but highly recommended by me and all the locals. Same family for 65 years! Clearly family run! Great conversation.... If you are in little Italy in chi town.... And craving Italian beef.... Gotta try it!!

20.description: A simple and delicious hotdog and fries for under $3. You can't go wrong. And the Italian mother taking your order is hilarious. I will stop here for every quick hotdog fix I have when I'm in the area.

36.description: Excellent and cheap beef sandwich! The fries are perfect 98% of the time (say no to ketchup for the fries) they put it all over them. Easy parking on Taylor street. I believe it's cash only. I've never had anything other than the Beef with fries. I would imagine all of the fattening greasy food is good here if that's the mood you're in! There are some spots in here to eat...But trust me you want to bring this home.

14.description: In my opinion this place is the goto place for an Italian beef or combo sandwich in Chicago proper. Once more their hot dogs fries are great as well. Very reasonably priced and quick service. They have been here for decades and deservedly so.Atmosphere: Small takeout spot but you can eat at the counter if you want.Not much to look at but a jukebox that I always wonder if it still works.Service: Quick and friendly. Love the folks here. Alway no-nonsense but very nice.Food: Top notch for a Beef / Hot Dog place. Way better than Al's beef...way way way better. Been to just about all the beef places in and around Chicago and this is in the top 3 or 4. Get a beef or combo and get it dipped. Messy but you will not be disappointed.

3.description: Nice location in Little Italy. Good prices and friendly owner. If you want to smoke your cigars, however, you will have to do it there, in his shop or down at the janky patio of Hennessy's. He's got a couple of very unique, not too expensive options that I recommend asking about. Cheers!

1.description: Bought 4 cognac infused cigars because they are fabulous! Try the 708 brand as well...They have a wide selection here.

2.description: What a great cigar shop. The staff couldn't be friendlier. Very low key and laid back. Try the coniac dipped cigars. They are awesome and Ralph is the only one that has this particular method of dipping. The only caveat is that because the shop is small, the selection is limited.

9.description: we were visiting chicago for the first time and a friend of ours told us about Ralphs we went down there met the owner who was a great guy and he had us try his gorilla fingers cigar that are cognac infused and let me tell you this so far the best i had ever had you must try it. The atmosphere is great and the prices are reasonable. We have already ordered some more and cant wait to smoke them again.

10.description: Ralph is super nice guy. My boyfriend loves coming here and just chills with all the guys smoking cigars for hours.  I've only been here a few times, but I see why my bf likes it here so much.....everyone is friendly, and it's just a cool place to chill at

4.description: After grabbing a little lunch down the street, I needed to finish up some x-mas shopping for my dear old dad.  Dad loves a good cigar, so I figured a couple nice ones would make a great present for him.  My boyfriend convinced me to check out Ralph's, and I am so happy I did.  It's a really cozy dark place, which I love, a few chairs and a big ol' tv that was playing the Bulls game.  I could totally see Dad chilling out for an hour or 2 in here.  The first thing that caught my eye was an amazing selection of fedoras and other really nice hats in a case.  The gentleman behind the counter told us to open it up & try some. He also offered us coffee.  I explained why I was there, and a few minutes later, after a few simple questions, (mind you, I know NOTHING about cigars) Ralph was grabbing a nice selection and putting it all together in a gift box.  He really took his time to make sure each cigar was special, and even told me if Dad didn't like any, he could bring it back, no problem.  I had such a great experience here, even the other customers just hanging around were friendly.  If you're looking for a friendly, no pressure, no bull place to buy some cigars, a pimp-ass hat, or just sit around and be all manly, Ralph's is the place to go.

6.description: Small selection of cigars. Not too many brands. This review is more about the selection than the establishment & service. Beautiful neighborhood for sure.

12.description: Ralph is the most knowledgeable cigar man around; he knows a lot about hats, too. There isn't a better selection or pricing in any cigar shop around the city, and I've been to most of them. It's an ideal location, right on Taylor Street, and Ralph's is an institution in the neighborhood. With his display of nice hats and humidor of beautiful cigars, the quaint little spot is what a lot of us think of when we think of our idealized Chicago. There's a great camaraderie amongst the regulars, and Ralph treats everybody with a no-nonsense kind of respect that is widely admired. There is a staff of beautiful, smart women working the counter--just another of the many bonuses you won't find anywhere.

5.description: Awesome place! I stopped in to get my dad cigars for his birthday. I was worried I would pick the wrong kind but the girls at the counter were so helpful and even gift wrapped them for me. I love the ambiance as well, great place to just have a drink/smoke.

11.description: I stop in here to pick up rolling tobacco once in a while.  I wish I liked cigars so I could sit in there with the guys in a comfortable chair with the game on and lie about the chick on the escalator that flashed me her panties.

8.description: Ralph's cigar shop is exactly how I envisioned a small neighborhood smoke shop in Little Italy. Always full of local funny-guys and personalities, Ralph's is a quiet relaxing place to sit back and enjoy your favorite cigar while watching whatever's playing on the massive television. Although the room is small, it is not unrealistic to find 9-13 grown men relaxing and gabbing in comfort undoubtedly telling stories unfit for the dinner table back home. I know nothing about cigars, but when I went in to get my brother a nice selection for his birthday, the young woman sprung into action and helped me pick out a great selection (he liked all of them). Ralph must have taught her well as she knew her way around the extensive collection of finely wrapped tobacco and was very helpful explaining the different styles to me so that i had some idea about cigars the next time I had a chance to get a good one (ie the Cubans in Cozumel, MX). Go to Ralph's for Cigars and a little local culture, whys donts yaaas!

0.description: My favorite Cigar shop. Whenever I find myself in the area, I have to stop by and stock up the humidor with about $150 worth of Ralph's Cognac Cigars. My favorite are the Black Cherry Cognac and the Gorilla Fingers. Can't go wrong.

7.description: Ralph's is the bomb!!! Would I come here to stock my humidor? Sure I would. Would I come here to buy a Cigar and hang out with the locals? Absolutely. If I lived in the neighborhood, this might be my second home. The Cigar selection wasn't that broad, but what they had in stock was wonderful. Ralph took the time to ask what I normally smoked and introduced me to some new Cigars that I haven't had the chance to smoke yet. I have smoked two of four I purchased on my visit and both were delicious.  The smoking lounge is a man-heaven. Ralph's had a nice little area equipped with a large Television and some comfortable chairs. The four people who were in the lounge looked like they were having the time of their lives. I wish I had more time to hang out and smoke a stick or two. The bottom line is: Ralph's is a wonderful little Cigar shop and lounge in little Italy. Ralph and his daughter could not have been nicer. This Cigar Utopia looks like a wonderful place to buy a Cigar, light it up and enjoy a ballgame. The next time I visit Ralph's I will bring my Cigar smoking shoes and kick back a while.

36.description: My fav. starbucks location. Baristas are very friendly and helpful.

29.description: Overall a great coffee shop with great service. Sometimes a long line and no seating but always worth going.

42.description: I've found the baristas here to be really friendly, and whoops! They accidentally gave me an extra shot of espresso. I appreciate them asking questions about how I want my beverage prepared because if I haven't had my caffeine yet, my brain does not function. Holy lack of seating though.. but I guess that is what happens when everyone on campus comes here to study.Oh, and while this isn't specific to this location, their salted caramel hot chocolate (minus whipped cream, plus espresso shot!) is addictively delicious.  Consider yourself warned!

23.description: My local Starbucks.  The usual offerings.  Excellent location across from the Italian American museum on Taylor.  Free wifi, an assortment of pastries.  The husband and I like the dark roast vente.

31.description: Great people watching place. Fills my caffeine "Jonesing" needs. Heavy student population. Hoping all  the mental workouts going on here rubs off.

34.description: not a big fan of Starbucks so I'm a little bias but it's in a convenient location and I enjoy pretending to be a student when I come here since it's so close to UIC but I also enjoy being done with undergrad and not having to study haha!

16.description: It's been about 4 months I have been going there quite regularly. Every once in a while they run out of the blonde roast- pretty much doesn't matter what time of the day it is. One of the cashiers is so not polite and makes faces which has made this place sort of obnoxious for me. Only reason why I would give the second star at all is that their barista is pretty enthusiastic.. Funny and ironic how the person doing most work is nice and enthusiastic over the person who just has to press buttons!Also these guys are dead slow- even when they just have to hand out already made coffee.. Sigh.. it's the only starbucks in my neighborhood..

11.description: I decided to treat myself to a starbucks mocha frap before work today. As I was drinking it, I noticed a stringy substance. I pulled it out and it was a thick brown short hair (the color of the baristas hair)! I was so disgusted I threw out the coffee and called Starbucks. They told me there was nothing they  could do about it and pretty much said I was out of the 8 dollars I had just spent there. Not to mention the dry and brittle marble loaf I had purchased. The man said I could come back in and they would remake the mocha for me, however I cannot leave work through the day and after that experience I don't think I want another drink from there. I asked for a refund and they said I needed to come in with my card. They did not take my name or number to get that completed for when I did come in. I also did not get a receipt for the purchase. So, I guess I can kiss that 8 bucks goodbye. I wouldn't recommend this location. I realize that this is only one bad experience, but it is enough for me to never go back.

39.description: This was my first time visiting this location in the Little Italy neighborhood and I always passed by here, but never stopped by until one day after passing it for the 50th time I stopped in. The staff was really courteous and really helpful in getting your order right.
