I also liked how the place was clean and maintained well, but one glitch that didnt sit right with me was how they didnt put enough whipped cream on my frappachino and putting the carmel sauce in the cup. Other than that they get 4 stars for high professionalism and courteous and prompt service.

37.description: As far as Starbucks go I really like this one. The menu is predictable, like at any other Starbucks, and the coffee ok but what wins stars for me on this particular location is it's ambiance. My girlfriends and I used to come here once a week or so to study Human Anatomy or do homework in the mornings and were always happy with the quiet atmosphere with chill music playing in the background. The staff were very friendly and we got to know them well. It was definitely nice to walk in on a cold winter day and be greeted with friendly people, pleasant music, and the smell of coffee. The only reason I haven't been back recently is because I've moved out of the immediate area but I have to say my new Starbucks just can't compare.

0.description: This place is almost always a zoo. My experiences with service haven't always been the greatest. Not the best place to study. HOWEVER, they have great outdoor seating next to the fountains and Joe DiMaggio statue. You can watch the birds eat trash and run from the bees. There is usually a guy outside selling Streetwise magazine. Beware, he will try to hit on your girlfriend. Oh yeah, cold brew is good.

38.description: I know what you're thinking: it's a Starbucks, why are you reviewing it?  The answer is, the staff at this one are especially friendly.  Even when you're coming in at 10 minutes before closing and firing up the laptop.I'd give it 5 stars, but it's always full of people doing the same thing I am.  I suppose that's not their fault, but still, it's hard to get a table! :)

27.description: A great go-to place for Starbucks coffee. The staff are friendly, and efficient in the mornings as well (the line moves pretty quickly, as expected). I get a tiny bit irked when I bring in my coffee mug to be filled; I find it a hit and miss, as I ask for them to pour it to a specified line and at times, it's not. Understandably, not many people come in bringing their own mugs, and they may not be used to the additional request (for the record, it's 10 cents off your order and you're helping to reduce waste :D)For studying, this place was renovated during the winter in time for the spring semester so that there are more tables and seats available, but it is still a challenge to find a good study spot, even on the weekends. The wifi is also rather slow (as most Starbucks in the city are). For drivers staying around the area, there is metered parking on Taylor, free parking on Loomis St towards Roosevelt, and on Roosevelt (watch the signs).For the morning rush, it takes me about 5-10 minutes to get through the line for coffee. There are areas around the street where I've seen people often put on their blinkers to grab and go (on both sides of the street).Overall, a great place to drop by to fulfill your coffee needs. For those not studying, the outside fountain makes a great place to sit down, chat with friends, and enjoy on a sunny day. (Being around the medical district, it'll be harder to find seating inside though, as it's more of a student-studying atmosphere, versus a location to hang out)

32.description: Yet another star£ucks. What a joy. While the coffee and treats are generally decent, you have to live with the guilt of fueling a beast. Generally, I would rate this a three star, but the propensity for over the top hipsters and sheer magnitude and overabundance of police from every agency possible definitely guaranteed no greater than two stars. This place has more fuzz than the Easter bunny. Always crowded = generally flustered and often irritable staff. I don't blame them. Id hate life too if I had work here. Of note, it is extremely convenient, however Conti next door is cheaper, faster, friendlier, and tastier. Can't wait for the Keurig to be fixed.

13.description: Always friendly service but it's the only Starbucks near by and being surrounded by a college campus expect a wait for your favorite Starbucks brew.

24.description: A pretty good Starbucks for studying. Make sure you get there early because it can get pretty crowded. Also, the only outlets that work are in the big center table right when you walk in. Bring a sweater because it gets pretty cold in here. And be warned, the number of chatty loud college students is pretty high.

7.description: Easily one of the worst customer service teams in the city. The staff prefers to chat and have fun with each other.  Customers are a mere annoyance to them.

40.description: I once was forced to go pick up a coffee at this place for my caffeine addict ex girlfriend.  I went in and for a moment was actually enjoying myself.  I almost forgot why I hate these places, then I saw a woman in line with a latte in one hand and a bag of poodle shit in the other.  Never again.

30.description: Stopped here for wife's coffee break as far as coffee shops go this one was above average for sure. She said coffee was a bit strong but good.

1.description: EXCELLENT customer service, and positive atmosphere. I'm there 6/7 days a week studying, and virtually everyday so thank you for putting up with me and my love for your coffee. Nothing but good vibes from the employees always and every time! Jeff, Manny, Tod, Nicole, s/o to you guys for always starting up a convo and getting to know me

9.description: I come here regularly because it's the only Starbucks in this neighborhood, but it can be a less-than pleasant experience. There is one cashier who is especially rude to me every time, as if she has some sort of vendetta against me. I wish I could record the eye rolls and make a gif out of them--I'm sure it would end up on Buzz Feed for some reason. She also consistently forgets the food I order and gets upset when I ask about it 15 minutes later. The guys are all very friendly, but a couple tend to move very slowly. I only come here when I know I'm going to stay to do some work, otherwise it doesn't tend to be the quick in and out routine you find at most Starbucks. It can also be very full from all the students around here, so be aware that if you're expecting a guaranteed place to sit for a bit, especially with someone else, you may be out of luck.

26.description: Starbucks is ok.  When in a pinch I can pick up breakfast and lunch pretty cheap and healthy.  I like their fair trade products.  I don't like the fact that they changed the packaged good's containers.  They were more eco friendly before, I don't know why they switched.  The containers were recycled paper now they are mostly plastic.

25.description: very nice starbucks.full parking on street (with meter).we went and grabbed some kid vanilla mistos and adult mistos before the circus.nice service, they answered all my questions of the verismo, which i'm considering buying.we sat on the barstools in front of the window, the kids loved it.i like a smile and thank you and your welcome when we come to any starbucks, and this place did it. thank you!

12.description: Someone needs to explain what a macchiato is to this place.  I came on today for a badly needed short pickmeup and left with a 12oz cup of about 4 inches of  steamed soy milk I had to scrape off layer by layer with s straw to get to the shot of espresso hiding below. .. so not worth it. Walked two doors down to the Italian deli for a real espresso. .. too bad they don't have soy or almond milk there, or I really would have had the perfect cup of coffee.  Starbucks, thought coffee was your thing?

21.description: I live right next door to this place and am in there several times a week. Despite everyone saying how friendly the staff is here, I always find the people who work weekday mornings to be disinterested and grumpy. If you see the same person coming in all the time, it's a good idea to get to know them. It builds brand loyalty and would keep me coming back even though I don't even like Starbucks coffee that much. Often my drink is not made correctly. I am in here all the time, and my drink is really simple (americano with room). The same woman who made the same drink for me several days in a row failed to leave room for cream EVERY time. In general, the weekend crew is much friendlier. Anyway, it's convenient for me, but I've started walking down to Coffee Alley (the staff is even more incompetent, but at least they are friendly, and the coffee is better).

17.description: Starbucks is ok.  When in a pinch I can pick up breakfast and lunch pretty cheap and healthy.  I like their fair trade products.  I don't like the fact that they changed the packaged good's containers.  They were more eco friendly before, I don't know why they switched.  The containers were recycled paper now they are mostly plastic.

10.description: This location does a great amount of business. The one constant irritating drawback in my opinion is that like today they have a long line and one person on the register and only ONE person making the drinks. Two baristas would speed up the service as well as a second register.

5.description: Liked this place. Good one to sit for an evening to hangout with some friends or to do some work on your laptop! Will recommend this place for sure!

35.description: This Starbucks is in a great location and has a really friendly staff. I am glad they don't get upset and force the "Starbucks Lingo" down my throat when I order a small coffee and even make a great job of suggesting other drinks to try. It's usually a struggle to get a table here, being so close to UIC, students are constantly camping out and glaring at you if you make any louder than a whisper noises. Go to the library if you want quiet, this is a coffee shop and I am allowed to answer my cell phone in here. I was very impressed that even through Snowmageddon 2011 they stayed open. It would have been easy to close down like every other busniess on the block but they must have some dedicated employees to get here on time in a blizzard. Props.

19.description: very nice starbucks.full parking on street (with meter).we went and grabbed some kid vanilla mistos and adult mistos before the circus.nice service, they answered all my questions of the verismo, which i'm considering buying.we sat on the barstools in front of the window, the kids loved it.i like a smile and thank you and your welcome when we come to any starbucks, and this place did it. thank you!

28.description: This Starbucks is in a great location and has a really friendly staff. I am glad they don't get upset and force the "Starbucks Lingo" down my throat when I order a small coffee and even make a great job of suggesting other drinks to try. It's usually a struggle to get a table here, being so close to UIC, students are constantly camping out and glaring at you if you make any louder than a whisper noises. Go to the library if you want quiet, this is a coffee shop and I am allowed to answer my cell phone in here. I was very impressed that even through Snowmageddon 2011 they stayed open. It would have been easy to close down like every other busniess on the block but they must have some dedicated employees to get here on time in a blizzard. Props.

3.description: I give it only one star because Starbucks is usually much much better than this. Everytime I come to the Starbucks I ask myself why am I here? Really, the only reason is that this is the only location near my house. Just like the last reviewer I agree the staff would prefer to chit chat with the regulars then serve the people that have been waiting in line for 10 minutes. Then, I have to wait another 10 minutes for my drink. Not worth it for the premium price that you pay to go to Starbucks!

33.description: Could do with more lounge space, but does the trick. Good service, good coffee... and well, starbucks value (slightly overpriced as usual)

43.description: This encounter took place in February. I remember all the details as if it was recent. Me: Hi, May I have a large ice latte please?Barista (with a puzzled look on her face): A "venti" ice latte?Me: Yes, a "large" ice latte please. (I refuse to speak their stupid jargon.)Barista (giving me a sarcastic grin): It is too cold outsideMe: Yes, I like my coffee cold and tea hot. You do not warm up your soda just because it is winter, do you?? And if you did, that would be pretty stupid.Barista: no response (startled look on her face)Me: And please do not correct me when I say "large ice latte". I refuse to use this stupid jargon. Now, may I please have my ice latte??And then she goes behind the counter to make my latte. The latte was good and I had my caffeine fix for the day.Don't mess with me when I need my coffee.

2.description: Way too crowded. Too many nearby coffee places that serve better, are quieter and have better coffee. Walked in for a cuppa on a Friday evening (in a quest to complete a presentation). Didn't work too well. Place was crowded with no place to sit. Decided to sit at the fountain place right outside. Cup served was standard Starbucks (no plus or minus point there) though I found the barista to be rather reserved (would expect friendlier service especially since it's a new customer). No questions were asked about further customizing the coffee. Order was quick (within 4-5 mins) and that's a plus as the cafe was busy. Overall, an average experience.

18.description: The place is cool and all but they REALLY need to do something about that dude who stands outside there every morning selling papers. Makes coming here an annoying experience.

41.description: I don't go to Starbucks very often, but with warm weather approaching, this location is a nice stroll away  from home and provides a destination during spring time walks. Starbucks beverages being all the same to me, the high rating is based almost solely on the staff. This location has some great people working there. When my twenty three year old roommate tragically spilled her iced tea all over the ground outside, the staff understandingly gave her a new one free of charge. That's kindness! Also, when helping a costumer buying a coffee mug I overhead a staff member say, "I don't have any boxes, but I could give you three different bags," which I found hilariously helpful. Nice outdoor seating area and pleasant indoor ambiance makes the place an overall great Starbucks location.

4.description: I love Starbucks. But this location's baristas aren't very streamlined. And, there's one girl with a huge chip on her shoulder or something; she hardly ever looks you in the eye or reciprocates kindness. I've been to this location at least 50 times, and am always rubbed the wrong way. Let's get some secret shoppers in here!

6.description: Service was great! The barista's are on their game... I wonder how much coffee they must drink to be so happy that early? Haha I actually appreciate it! This morning a woman grabbed my skim latte instead of her tea... Ya I'm not sure how that happened either? The barista watched what happened and immediately I had a new drink. As my customer and I sat down we had 2 free drink coupons. Thank you that was very kind! Great neighborhood location!

22.description: They never participate any deals. When the  hazelnut macchiato just came to market and there was a deal to get a free tall hazelnut macchiato, and I think this is the only starbucks claims "I never heard of that deal". On April 22, which was the Earth's day. Starbucks website said "bring in a reusable mug or tumbler and get a free brewed coffee" . I went there with my mug and  again, the staff said "we don't participate". How come you never participate any of the deals that the rest of starbucks in the US have? However, it's the only starbucks in university village, what can we do?

15.description: I love this Starbucks. Often times I come in I ask the baristas to invent something new-- yesterday I became addicted to my newest summer drink- venti iced caramel macchiato upside down with one pump of toffee nut- Holy GOD. Love the baristas, love the location, I'm going to miss living in this neighborhood!

20.description: Service was great! The barista's are on their game... I wonder how much coffee they must drink to be so happy that early? Haha I actually appreciate it! This morning a woman grabbed my skim latte instead of her tea... Ya I'm not sure how that happened either? The barista watched what happened and immediately I had a new drink. As my customer and I sat down we had 2 free drink coupons. Thank you that was very kind! Great neighborhood location!

8.description: I ordered a simple tall cappuccino: it was literally 70% foam and 30% coffee. What a waste of money.

14.description: My local Starbucks.  The usual offerings.  Excellent location across from the Italian American museum on Taylor.  Free wifi, an assortment of pastries.  The husband and I like the dark roast vente.

58.description: Great spot to grab a quick bite and knock down a cold draft. True sign of legit barbecue is when it isn't smothered in BBQ sauce.Good job guys!

56.description: Delicious food. Tough for delivery. I assume the $5 fee (which does not cover the delivery tip) is to encourage pick up servicek

29.description: For BBQ fans and meat lovers alike, you must come! This is a very laid back bar with a backyard and picnic tables where you can drink and eat in a very relaxed, welcoming setting. I'm starting with the burger, which was definitely 4 star worthy. Juicy, with bacon jam, which was not a spread but real bacon pieces carmelized topped with a fried green tomato. For an extra $2 you can add sweet potato or garlic fries. I chose the blackened cauliflower, which was served spicy, and could have been great but was so salty. The mac and cheese with brisket was also a crowd pleaser. Other meats such as ribs, rib tips, bacon, brisket or pulled park are served bare, with your choice of homemade sauce to drown them in. So why only 3 stars? They have a limited menu and it's all about the meat. No side salads, or veggies other than cauliflower and standard or kale Cesar salad to choose from, not many options for me. Also, they only serve smoked chicken, and again, it's a preference thing, so I went with the burger which was great. Service was friendly and prompt. For a meat lover, so worth it, and very light on your wallet. They also have a daily special and today's happened to be chicken tacos, which were also pretty good.

42.description: Ordered the brisket plate and fried green tomato / bacon sandwich along with a couple sides for delivery. First (and hopefully last) time I ever throw an entire order of food from somewhere in the trash.

23.description: The best BBQ that I have ever had in my life, hands down. I love their mac and cheese, their corn pudding, their fries...everything. Out of all the meat cuts, the brisket has got to be my favorite, as it is flavorful, tender, and seasoned perfectly. My favorite thing on the menu though, has to be their pork puppies, which are absolutely bursting with flavor and absolute perfection. Perfectly shredded and seasoned pork is balled together, and fried into this crispy, crunchy little bit of heaven- and the aioli that is paired with it makes for a heavenly combination. The food has always been amazing every time I have gone, and their staff is consistently friendly, helpful, and very sweet.The atmosphere of County is very homey and comfortable, and the outdoor seating is perfect for nicer weather. Without a doubt, this is one of my favorite places, and my number one option for when I'm craving BBQ.

47.description: Not good at All!!! My cousin and I wanted BBQ so we ordered a slab of ribs, rib tips, cole slaw, corn pudding, Mac and cheese, bbq chicken and some garlic fries and the only thing that tasted ok was the chicken (that's saying a lot for me because I'm not a big fan of chicken). Nothing had BBQ sauce and I asked for extra sauce on everything. The food had a freezer burn taste to it. Wouldn't eat here again and wouldn't recommend to friends or family. Thumbs down I've had better.

8.description: For BBQ fans and meat lovers alike, you must come! This is a very laid back bar with a backyard and picnic tables where you can drink and eat in a very relaxed, welcoming setting. I'm starting with the burger, which was definitely 4 star worthy. Juicy, with bacon jam, which was not a spread but real bacon pieces carmelized topped with a fried green tomato. For an extra $2 you can add sweet potato or garlic fries. I chose the blackened cauliflower, which was served spicy, and could have been great but was so salty. The mac and cheese with brisket was also a crowd pleaser. Other meats such as ribs, rib tips, bacon, brisket or pulled park are served bare, with your choice of homemade sauce to drown them in. So why only 3 stars? They have a limited menu and it's all about the meat. No side salads, or veggies other than cauliflower and standard or kale Cesar salad to choose from, not many options for me. Also, they only serve smoked chicken, and again, it's a preference thing, so I went with the burger which was great. Service was friendly and prompt. For a meat lover, so worth it, and very light on your wallet. They also have a daily special and today's happened to be chicken tacos, which were also pretty good.

31.description: The rib tips and the ribs themselves are very good. I suggest this place to anyone who is craving BBQ. You may have to wait a bit for seating and your food to be made but it's worth it. Make sure you try all of their sauces!

34.description: Love love love this place! You don't always think great BBQ when you think of Taylor St, but you can thank the DMK people for that! I've ordered take out and dined in here multiple times and the service and food are consistently great. The selection of beer and daily whiskey specials are also good if you're in the mood for some adult beverages with your food too.This was 1/2 of my usual spots to bring visitors while I was living by UIC (the other being Three Aces) and all of my friends have loved it. The staff here are very helpful and attentive - you can tell they love the food there too and want you to try everything if you can! Some of the nicest wait staff I've experienced in the city.My go-to is the pulled pork or the chopped brisket sandwiches - yum! Really, you can't go wrong with anything*  (*see my note below). For sides, I suggest the mac and cheese (loaded or not, either way creamy and delish), corn pudding, and the hush puppies. The three bbq sauces on the table are good to mix Be aware - their sandwiches don't come with sides but their platters do.Reason for 1 star docked: I've had the blackened cauliflower and collard greens but it's a 50/50 shot on the potential of them being soggy, so I just go with the other options. Also, I did order their brisket with the meat and three once and the piece of brisket was basically 3/4ths fat, so that wasn't super appetizing.

16.description: The best BBQ that I have ever had in my life, hands down. I love their mac and cheese, their corn pudding, their fries...everything. Out of all the meat cuts, the brisket has got to be my favorite, as it is flavorful, tender, and seasoned perfectly. My favorite thing on the menu though, has to be their pork puppies, which are absolutely bursting with flavor and absolute perfection. Perfectly shredded and seasoned pork is balled together, and fried into this crispy, crunchy little bit of heaven- and the aioli that is paired with it makes for a heavenly combination. The food has always been amazing every time I have gone, and their staff is consistently friendly, helpful, and very sweet.The atmosphere of County is very homey and comfortable, and the outdoor seating is perfect for nicer weather. Without a doubt, this is one of my favorite places, and my number one option for when I'm craving BBQ.

13.description: Not sure what the hype about this place is...we ordered everything the waitress recommended and still wasn't impressed. We started with the smoked pork hush puppies and fried green tomatoes which were pretty good and got me excited for the rest of the food, but then our entrees came out...we ordered the Meat and Three with the rip tips and brisket (extra $5). For our sides we chose the Mac n cheese, collard greens, and garlic fries. First off, they got our order wrong and we were missing two of our three sides (got garlic fries and cheesy grits instead of Mac n cheese and no third side). Secondly, the rib tips were so incredibly salty after just one bite nobody else touched them. It was as if they were literally dunked in salt! I had about 5 full glasses of water that night. We also ordered the taco trio and it was just okay. Nothing special even though it was recommended by the waitress. The only reason I'm giving 3 stars was for their customer service. For getting our order wrong, they packed up a free dessert to go, but according to my brother who took it home that night even that was mediocre. Won't be going back.

11.description: Our family went to County BBQ last night and had awesome food in a very cozy atmosphere.  We loved the pork puppies which were very tasty.  The service was great!!! We will go back for sure.

39.description: Had the beef brisket & hot links, both delicious, but the brisket had a little too much fat on it or I would have gone five stars. The hot links had an excellent consistency and great bite afterwards. The brisket had a wonderful smokiness to them and were super tender.  Our sides were just as impressive, garlic fries, just enough garlic to savor, not overpower. The sweet, creamy corn pudding was a great complement to the salty smokiness of the meats. Cheesy grits were cooked to perfection and again, just enough cheese to add flavor, not dominate it. Service was great and attentive.

37.description: Although I have tried many BBQ places, this place is definitely worth going. Especially on Taylor Street. You'll only find a few decent restaurants for brunch and dinner in my opinion and this is definitely on my list. Upon arriving to your destination, the entrance to the restaurant is pretty small. When I was waiting for my friend, I was unsure whether or not their waitress even knew I was there. It was a good 5 mins while standing there before they came along when my friend appeared through the door. That was a shame.We were seated outback of the restaurant (spacious) given the fact, its behind the restaurant. How to imagine the place: a cute cloth resting on the table with a candle. Depending on where you're seated, you may be next to another customer. Food wise, I ordered the St. Louis Spare Ribs (Full). It's a big order, I thought I could share but even then there was lots of food leftover. Garlic Fries on point but wished there was more. My friend tried their special that night I believe it was Greens and the Maple glazed chicken. I would say it looked amazing. I was quite jealous but next time!All in all, best restaurant to dine in for dinner on Taylor.

0.description: Never seen this place before till I was driving thru Taylor street and I saw "BBQ" on the side of the building, pulled over and without any hesitation went in a ordered. From the exterior of the building appear to be a large building but once inside, the exterior is much different then the interior. There is a large long bar that takes up most of the room and the rest of the floor are different size tables for dine-in.  I had to admit that I had a hard time ordering due to too many items I want to try now, glad to see that there are combo's listed for people like me who can't decide on just a specific item. I choose the best two items for beginners to County BBQ.1. "Meat and Three" : Protein of your choice and three sides - I've picked the St. Louis Ribs (Dry)2. Texas Two-Steps" : Brisket, Grits and Greens.After a few hours eating all my goodies from Country BBQ, I have to say that the brisket is my favorite. The brisket was well-made, the traditional smoke ring was apparent but what made the brisket so good was the "fat cap" (intramuscular fat: fat that is between fibers within the muscle, in other words "marbling" which gives the meat rich texture and flavor) in the brisket.From my experience from eating brisket in other places other than Country BBQ, the brisket is more on the leaner side which sometimes leaves the brisket itself on the dry side. The second protein I've ordered was the ribs which I choose "dry" on purpose to taste the smoke and all the spices rather than have the sauce mask all the nuances of flavor. From the sides that came with my meal basically was an OK and the only thing that I like was the sweet potato fries that was decent. I enjoyed the smoke salt that was sprinkled on the fries. Overall my picks for the dinner was the brisket and the sweet potato fries.

38.description: So we made it back for another visit. When you get a craving for good barbecue, you must do it right. General Mgr., Leslie and her team once again welcomed us and quickly made us feel at home. Our server Bridgett got us going with beverages and BBQ. One order of tender rib tips and one order of spare ribs did the trick. Yes the food was great and satisfied our BBQ fever. The cherry on top was a delicious bread pudding. Wow I need a nap now! Thanks for the great meal and we'll be back soon.

51.description: Yelp has this place dead on. Solid 4 star. Had one of the best servers I've ever had at any restaurant, Sam take care of us. Great guy. Food was all really good. Hush puppies and ribs were my favs. I wasn't a huge fan of the sauces they had and it was a little expensive for BBQ but I would def go back.

27.description: This place is sooo good! The hush puppies are great, the sandwich with fried green tomatoes, bacon and pulled pork was amazing.  The greens were ok.  The cocktails were really good too. I definitely recommend it.

32.description: I visited this excellent bar/restaurant almost 2 years ago and hope little has changed since it was such a great experience that I visited twice in my 3 day visit to Chicago!  The beer selection was remarkable and so reasonable!  They had pitchers available of some of the best craft beers on the market for around $20, let alone that they even had the beers on tap!  The food was amazing.  I was obsessed with the Fried Green Tomatoes and this place introduced me burnt bits. Yum!  The manager was one of the nicest people I met in the city.  It definitely helped that he had an affinity for Boston Sports and had Red Sox and Patriots games on the few TVs in the bar.  I will definitely go back when I visit the Chicago area again.

54.description: I saw this restaurant featured on a restaurant television show but can't recall which one. The brisket was very tasty and tender but overall, the portions were very small and the prices too high...next time I'll go to Jake's.

48.description: I usually don't review a restaurant, until I've frequented it at least 2 or 3 times. However, I'm in the car on my way home and I just had to. I'm no barbecue expert so take my words with a grain of salt. It's a Sunday afternoon, not crowded, so hopefully that isn't the only reason our service was superb. Also, it's a little too dark inside, I'd like a tad bit more light so I can actually see what I'm eating. It is kind of small, but that's kind of typical for Chicago restaurants theses days. However they do have an outdoor eating area, also typical. First off, I always  appreciate when my server can tell me the menu front and back. John did just that. He knew the food, how it was prepared and what side items complemented them. I didn't order any alcohol, but I watched him Bartend a couple seated at the bar and he was equally knowledgable. He told me that they don't freeze any of their meat, and the smoker runs 24 hours , 7 days a week. The taste of the Chicago Rib Tips definitely reflected that. I offered the Meat & Three combo. One meat & three sides. I feel the portions were very reasonable. The rib tips had a dry, smoked rub on top, with succulent and moist meat underneath. One mistake many make with rib tips is leaving too much fat on them or too much grease. But nope, not the case here. They were perfect. I'm not very picky on BBQ sauces because I'm not a big BBQ eater as is, so their sauces were fine with me. However I could see how other would be less impressed. There was no real staple flavor amongst the 3 they offer. I had a side of Mac n cheese. Listen. I'm not a fan of rotini pasta used for Mac n cheese. HOWEVER, this is the exception to the rule. My god, it was soooo creamy, flavorful, and not too rich. Order it. Don't ask any questions. I don't even want to discuss the corn pudding because if you're reading this, I want you to be just as taken aback as I was. Again, order it. Don't ask any questions. It was so good i ordered an extra side to go. The collard greens. Yes. Order it.  They were cooked just like a southern grandmother would approve. Little bits of hamhock, cleaned with minimal stem, a hint of vinegar, and lots of flavor. I also ordered an extra side of this to go. Lastly, the raisin & nut bread pudding topped with bourbon & banana cream. I'm not a big fan of bread pudding because it's usually dry and bland, but this was very tasty. You can actually taste the bourbon and banana in the Creme topping. They say first impressions are lasting impressions, and I can't imagine that my future visits here will fall short. Great customer service from everyone in the restaurant. I already know what I'm ordering the next time I come. Keep up the good work County BBQ.

44.description: I went to lunch with co workers on Friday and got the brisket with 3 sides.  My choices were the greens, corn pudding and asparagus.  It was so good that I went back the next day for the same meal for dinner.  The brisket is nicely seasoned and you get a nice portion.  The greens have a vinegary taste and the corn pudding is simply delicious.  The asparagus is nice and crisp and seasoned very well. You have to try this place.  My co workers had ribs tips and chicken and they looked good also.

24.description: Excellent brisket sandwich...filling!  The macaroni was off the charts. The smoke pork puppies as a starter was the best manner to start this fantastic lunch.  I'll have to stop in soon to experience their ribs.  The service was great...knowledgeable servers describing items to the tee.  I was not expecting this high level quality from a venue that appears more like a bar.  I'm impressed!!

7.description: The place is smaller than we thought it would be.  Good meat!  The sauces are great.  Some sides are good.  Cauliflower is one of the good ones.  So is the Mac and cheese.    Service was good.  Not a full bar and they only have Chardonnay and white Zinfandel as we choices.

49.description: Sorry, but I'm not sure what all of the hype is about. The service was fine, but I personally didn't think the food was spectacular. Our meat was a little dry and the sauces left something to be desired. Maybe I caught them on an off day?

40.description: WOW! I wish there was room for more stars. The staff were super friendly and knowledgeable and passionate about the menu. The venue is small and enchanting but there is enough room for elbows and the atmosphere is awesome with a great beer and bourbon selection to cap it off. Prices are relevant and well valued.Now for the food. I've eaten BBQ from Texas through to the South and up through the Carolina's. This has been my favourite BBQ by far. And I've eaten great BBQ. So often you find BBQ joints do only one thing great - they either do a great smoked meat, or its the sauce that you go for. Not often do you find a place that nails them all but you will find that at County Barbeque. The meat is smoked ALL the way through to the bone. And that rub on the ribs! It's all kinds of delicious. But their House sauce, which is one of three sauces you will find on your table, is a revelation . The only sore point I have is just plain greedy guts me, wishing that the House sauce was available to purchase online so I can buy it back home in Australia.

53.description: County BBQ was amazing both times I ate at the restaurant. I had the Meat and Three both times. The Beef Brisket was good but definitely needs their BBQ sauce, which they have on each table. The Mac and Cheese with Beef Brisket was bomb!!! Definitely got that, and also, they let you get that for 2 of the sides and something else for the third. Servers were very informative and pretty cool each time I went. Overall, great experience

30.description: Loved it! Food was great and a happy staff. The ice tea was Served from really cute jars a+ guys and it tasted great! Try all three sauces they all are good! I got the brisket and it was amazing!

46.description: Food is awesome. A guy who works there, John, is a sweet guy who knows foods and gives you the best suggestion. I love this place.

1.description: My wife and I ordered take-out, and I was disappointed with the food and service. I ordered a slab of ribs and they were tough, my wife had the rib tips which she enjoyed. We ordered the bacon appetizer, which was good but minimal. There was nothing special about the garlic fries. The service was horrible, I walked in and stood by the end of the bar by the pickup sign. The male bartender was at middle of the bar, looked up at me and never said anything. The place is not big , so he could have easily said I'll be right with you without disturbing anyone else. A female came behind the bar, was further away from the male bartender and asked if she could help me. I told her I was there for a pickup, gave her my name, and she went to the back to check on the order. When she came back without the order, she never said anything to me. I expected her to at least say that your order will be right up, isn't ready, something. She walked over to talk to someone that I assumed was her friend, because she wrote a note on a napkin to let him read it. 5 minutes later, another young lady came out and handed me my order.Won't ever be back.

55.description: Pleasantly surprised at how good it was. I'm usually a chicken person but here u have to try the ribs!! I've never had dry ribs but they were delicious :) and garlic fries were also very good and the staff was very nice and helpful with describing the menu. If ire here for just a drink, the BBQ wings were very good, I usually order side wings when I go for a drink but today I got them as my appetizer and was instantly happy.

9.description: Visited Saturday for lunch driving down Taylor with the family and smelled bbq so we knew we had to stop. Small place but comfortable, we had between the 4 of us rib tips, brisket, chicken ,pulled pork, hot link , greens, Mac and cheese, fries and corn pudding. The meat was DELISH!!!!! My brisket was tender and juicy and the hubby rib tips were great. The sides were ok ( greens were a little bitter) and the CORN PUDDING WAS WONDERFUL:) Great service and very casual atmosphere. I would go again with my hubby and my 17 year old, not sure if I would take my 8 year old again.

26.description: Had a great experience at County Barbecue. From the minute we walked in the door, the service was excellent.  From the hostess to the bartender to our server, everyone was extremely attentive. We started at the bar with a firefly Manhattan which was excellent. For dinner we shared the rib tips and the brisket with sides of garlic fries, grits, roasted cauliflower and greens. All fabulous. We will be back for sure!

25.description: Very good. Felt like I had stepped into an alternative atmosphere. Not your typical Chicago bbq. Dry rubbed ribs with bursts of flavor and crunchy texture. The meat and 3 allowed us to try quite a few sides but the cauliflower and corn pudding were the most standout. Planning our next return. What a fun place to dine in. Server was very attentive as well.

12.description: Excellent brisket sandwich...filling!  The macaroni was off the charts. The smoke pork puppies as a starter was the best manner to start this fantastic lunch.  I'll have to stop in soon to experience their ribs.  The service was great...knowledgeable servers describing items to the tee.  I was not expecting this high level quality from a venue that appears more like a bar.  I'm impressed!!

59.description: The best dine in BBQ restaurant in Chicago. (Better than - Green Street Smoked Meats, Smoque, Honky-tonk, Fat Willies, Q BBQ, lily Q, Chucks, Famous Daves, etc..) I love BBQ. While no restaurant can beat homemade BBQ food, County BBQ really did an exceptional job coming close. The Ribs tips , SPARE RIBS ARE THE FLAGSHIP MENU ITEM , and the very tender & juicy brisket  all were great with a nice peppered seasoning and a smokiness.  (The brisket is high quality , the juiciest brisket ever, super tender and melts in your mouth like cotton candy. It could use a little more smoke flavor. I personally like a lot of smoke flavor in my bbq but I understand that that restaurants have to cook for the masses) . The corn pudding " its really a moist corn muffin like cobbler, with corn kernels) was sweet and tasty. I was really surprised how much I enjoyed the Greens and the Maple glazed chicken (perfectly cooked, juicy, and lots of smoke flavor). Definitely will be coming back for more!Only thing that i didn't care for was the BBQ sauces, (the mustard one was decent) but when you eat real BBQ (the meat is smoky and well seasoned) you really don't need sauce.

21.description: Stumbled into County Barbecue late one Friday night when another place we tried had a long wait. Was glad we did. We were seated right away. Izzy, bartender, was high energy and a fantastic waiter. Great beer selection, but the big surprise was the Bourbon selection. CB could be marketed as a Bourbon Bar.  Food was fantastic, service was great and we definitely felt like our business was appreciated.  Izzy even gave 2 of us an extra taco each because he felt our order had been scrimped. Great customer engagement.

17.description: I have to preference this first by saying I'm not a huge fan of barbecue food. The only place I seem to like so far is Chicago Q, but even then there's only some things I will order. I went here with my mom and sister (huge barbecue fans) and we started off with a few appetizers. I like to try a few weird things when I go out to eat so I figured why not try the bacon and barbecue parfait. Um....ewwww. Tasted like weird baby food covered in barbecue sauce. Totally not a fan of that one. I however, did enjoy the hush puppies. It was an interesting mix with the pork and I liked the lemon aioli dipping sauce. We also got an order of the garlic fries loaded. The jalapenos and chili over the garlic fries was excellent!I wasn't impressed with the entrees we ordered. My sister got the rib tips (way too fatty) and my mom and I shared the BBQ Sampler: Hot Link (probably the best item of the sampler. Nice spicy kick), Chicken (okay), Ribs (way too fatty), Brisket (Is this supposed to be fatty???) LOL.I'm not a fan of barbecue sauce and out of the 3 sauces on the table (House, Mustard, and spicy) my favorite was the house sauce. I think the reason I wasn't a fan is because I want my meat to already be marinated in sauce. I'm not into doing the work myself when I go out and eat. The dessert was also a disappointment. Ordered the Bourbon Banana Bread Pudding. I am a huge fan of bread pudding, so you really got a bring it for me. It was dry and not sweet. The whip cream on top didn't even melt into the bread pudding because of the lack of moisture. If I were to come back it would definitely be for the appetizer and sides. Main courses I could do without. I also have to mention the service because it was great! John was as sweet as can be and did a great job explaining the menu items to us and checking on us throughout the meal.

10.description: I usually don't review a restaurant, until I've frequented it at least 2 or 3 times. However, I'm in the car on my way home and I just had to. I'm no barbecue expert so take my words with a grain of salt. It's a Sunday afternoon, not crowded, so hopefully that isn't the only reason our service was superb. Also, it's a little too dark inside, I'd like a tad bit more light so I can actually see what I'm eating. It is kind of small, but that's kind of typical for Chicago restaurants theses days. However they do have an outdoor eating area, also typical. First off, I always  appreciate when my server can tell me the menu front and back. John did just that. He knew the food, how it was prepared and what side items complemented them. I didn't order any alcohol, but I watched him Bartend a couple seated at the bar and he was equally knowledgable. He told me that they don't freeze any of their meat, and the smoker runs 24 hours , 7 days a week. The taste of the Chicago Rib Tips definitely reflected that. I offered the Meat & Three combo. One meat & three sides. I feel the portions were very reasonable. The rib tips had a dry, smoked rub on top, with succulent and moist meat underneath. One mistake many make with rib tips is leaving too much fat on them or too much grease. But nope, not the case here. They were perfect. I'm not very picky on BBQ sauces because I'm not a big BBQ eater as is, so their sauces were fine with me. However I could see how other would be less impressed. There was no real staple flavor amongst the 3 they offer. I had a side of Mac n cheese. Listen. I'm not a fan of rotini pasta used for Mac n cheese. HOWEVER, this is the exception to the rule. My god, it was soooo creamy, flavorful, and not too rich. Order it. Don't ask any questions. I don't even want to discuss the corn pudding because if you're reading this, I want you to be just as taken aback as I was. Again, order it. Don't ask any questions. It was so good i ordered an extra side to go. The collard greens. Yes. Order it.  They were cooked just like a southern grandmother would approve. Little bits of hamhock, cleaned with minimal stem, a hint of vinegar, and lots of flavor. I also ordered an extra side of this to go. Lastly, the raisin & nut bread pudding topped with bourbon & banana cream. I'm not a big fan of bread pudding because it's usually dry and bland, but this was very tasty. You can actually taste the bourbon and banana in the Creme topping. They say first impressions are lasting impressions, and I can't imagine that my future visits here will fall short. Great customer service from everyone in the restaurant. I already know what I'm ordering the next time I come. Keep up the good work County BBQ.

5.description: Honest review: i saw this on check please so i came here on the quest for best barbecue in Chicago. Must orders corn pudding hush puppies ribs. Dislikes everything fried was burned. Food was a little to salty and i love salty food. Service is to unprofessional either their busy socializing with coworkers to laid back or literally doing nothing at all. Its really really small be warned about thatFood: corn pudding with fixings: best part of meal i was really skeptical about this dish  it was so great. The texture of it is really good thought it was gonna be really dry its not to sweat its savory the fixings on it were great really gave alot of pop from the jalepenos and creaminess from the sour cream i believe there was chili on it to it was so good i would just come back here for this dishParfait: i dont like grits but i did like the grits they were really good  really creamy idk why i jus didnt like the combinations of everything like it was to much like there was to much clashing of the other ingredients i wouldnt recommend this At all worst part of mealMacaroni: got this with the brisket i love macaroni and cheese i am really picky on it i didnt like the brisket it was dry and flavorless. The actual macaroni was ok nothing special wouldnt order it again Chicken wings: surprisingly these were really good a little dry but not as dry as others i have it has a really good flavour to them there really flavorful probably one of the best wings i had problem they were really salty i love salty food but its really really extremely salty and no ranch dressing or blue cheese? Then the waiter told us oh ya everybody asks for those condiments then buy some then or make ur own! Smoked pork puppies: these were the best hush puppies i ever had they were so delicious supper extremely crispy and the inside is really cheesy and meaty like a meatball fucked a hush puppy and they had a baby the sauce is really rich really complimented everything perfectly problems it was a little bit to salty and was to dark meaning a lil burned would order again thoughSweet potato fries: i love these kind of fries i prefer them over regular fries the problem was they were burnt so i couldnt pretend to like these it was really bitter since they were burned the sauce was okGarlic fries: ok not anything really special just normal garlic fries picture mcdonald fries with garlic powder Texas Brisket: this was horrible there was no flavor it was supper bland and dry wouldnt order this again ever after this im done getting brisket never getting it again its always dry and not that flavorful.Ribs: omg must order the crust was to die for supper supper crunchy like these were so good. They were so tasty best ribs i ever had they werent fall off the bone they had some meaty chew to them these were so good defiantly ordering again soooooooo good only problem though was there wasnt alot of meat on it at all like one bite and youd be like halfway done with it must order though cant come here without ordering thisBread pudding was really good kinda dry though but not so bad loved the nuts on top they were so crunchy needs more though. There was something tart in it that i didnt like if they could get rid of that then home run it was really good i ate the whole thing the brown sauce really goodService: he was nice just i hates the service like the waiter was to chill like we walked in n just sat down a lil awkaward nobody wears a uniform a little un professional then he would be to laid back it was kind of annoying then the bar tenders were just goofing off and having a good time not being helpful to anybody at all then this chinese lady would just watch and not do anything like nobody woule pick up our plates and it took forever to pay then there was this another guy that didnt do anythingThe ambiance: outside its a cute colorful building inside is really reallt small be warned ut gonna bump in to people and kinda ugly inside like confused on the orange flag?

3.description: Good BBQ and very friendly staff. Would definitely go back. Meat & three is a great deal, a must  !!!

35.description: Do NOT order Delivery!!  We decided to try this place, as it seemed to have good reviews.  We ordered delivery at 6:45pm and the food was not intended to arrive until 8:15pm...pretty long, but alright.  After two calls to the restaurant, the food still did not arrive and the driver came by our building twice without delivering the food??  We eventually received the food, but hours later and stone cold....

19.description: Went here with a couple of friends for some delicious BBQ. Just came back from my favorite BBQ place in San Diego, Phil's, so this place had a lot to live up to. I ordered the spare ribs with garlic fries. I wasn't too sure about the ribs since I'm used to getting baby back, but these were really tender, fall off the bone ribs. I also liked that they serve them dry so you can add the sauce yourself. They have a house BBQ, spicy, and mustard sauces. I tried all of them and they are all pretty good. My one complaint is the  sides. The garlic fries tasted ok, but I'm pretty sure they just made some fries and added some garlic powder. I was expecting the kind with chunks of garlic and parsley, but oh well. And the cole slaw was not your typical cole slaw. It was really dry and kinda reminded me more of sauerkraut or kimchi. I guess I'm used to cole slaw with a little more mositure. My friends got the fried chicken sandwich and the brisket which they said were good too. I tried the corn pudding my friend got, and it was delicious! I would have a side order of that next time I go. It is a little pricey ($14 for ribs, fries, and cole slaw), while at Phils I can get more food for half the price. But it's good BBQ and I'd go again to satisfy my BBQ craving.

28.description: My husband and I were in the mood for barbecue after having a very bad day and found this place on Yelp. When we walked in, our server Scott welcomed us as first timers to the restaurant and explained the menu to us in detail. He was very polite, cordial, patient, and the food did not disappoint. My husband got the Feathered Pick combo and I got the burger of the week. It was delicious and most of all, the customer service was great. When the manager heard we were having a bad day, she was sympathetic, and Scott our server brought us his favourite dessert, bread pudding, on the house. To have such caring service on a very bad day really made the difference for us, and we will definitely be back here. Well done, County Barbecue, that is how you make for repeat customers, good food and excellent service.

45.description: I'm in this area for business a lot and always looking for GOOD places to stop on the fly. I pulled up outside of County on a hot day and popped in. I ate inside which was very dark and hip, but wish I had been offered to sit outside---I didn't know they had an outdoor patio until other people that came in after me were offered. Not a huge deal, just something that could make the experience better.I had the fried chicken sandwich which was GREAT. Super moist and spicy but not over the top. The garlic fries were very good but a bit too garlicky for me-----this is a preference thing and I'm sure many would disagree with me, so I'll leave it to that. Wish the salad menu was a bit more robust--eg fried chicken salad, brisket salad--incorporate the BBQ into the salads more. Just an idea that I would buy!LOVED the music....lots of Rockabilly and county Elvis. Great.

33.description: My experience at County BBQ has been surprisingly one of the most pleasant and enjoyable, out of many dining occasions on Taylor Street. My group of friends and I arrived with minimal expectation and left not only full, happy, but also impressed. We picked the restaurant randomly while strolling on Taylor St, looking for a new place to try out. The entrance is actually quite small, so if you're with a big group, there's a great chance that you'll have to graciously bob and weave the pedestrians before getting inside. You'll walk in a standard set up of any restaurant, with a bar on one side and dining tables right across. The atmosphere is casual, typical for a BBQ place, but let me tell you the smell was everything! You'll know right away you're in the right situation for some pull pork sandwiches, maybe baby back ribs, and fried pickles? yes please! It was a nice, breezy Sunday evening, so we decided to sit outside (they had a little patio in the back)! Our waiter was super nice, informative, funny, and on point with getting our drinks and food. I ordered grilled pork in chimmichurri sauce tacos, which was their special tacos for that night. It was definitely filling, an order comes with 3 tacos for $8, and I was full after finishing my 2nd one, yay for leftover! My friends ordered some chicken sandwiches, ribs, and sides of fries (sweet potatoes or garlic! and both were really tasty). My bf got an order of pull pork burger, but they accidentally forgot to put in the order, so his food ended up coming out...5 minutes after our food! You know what they did to make up for this mistake? They started bringing out a side of "complimentary" corn pudding, grits, garlic fries, basically every side we could have ordered for an extra $2 each, but instead..they were all FREE! The amount of side dishes my bf got was insane, no exaggeration, to a point that he was quite full by the time his sandwich arrived lol it didn't stop there! When we were about to pay and leave, our amazing waitor came back and gave each of us a card with his name on it, to any DMK restaurants/bars, and if we present it, our next draft beer is on the house! I mean..we will have to come back now!! I absolutely, 100% recommend County BBQ! If you live in the UIC/Medical District area, it's a must try. And I believe our waitor's name was Sam, so ask for him. He's a good man!

43.description: We visited here on a Saturday w no reservation at 8pm and was sat right away. John our waiter was great he welcomed us and sadly informed us right away what we came for the spare ribs they ran completely out of but would be will to substitute any meat on menu. We had the hush puppies and two specialty house cocktails that we watched on check please and other yelp reviews. The hush puppies were great starter a must try. We then order as our main meal the meat and sides platter due to the ribs being unavailable we decided pulled pork and BBQ chicken the sides we choose we Mac n cheese, the corn pudding and the sweet potato fries w dipping sauce. The pulled pork was good nothing special to write home about but the smoky crispy skin on the chicken was amazing this chicken didn't need any sauce it was that great. Every side recommended by yelp reviews and check please are a must try. The corn pudding was so yummy good we actually argued over last bite but our server resolved it and sent us home w a extra cup of corn pudding. The sweet potato fries were crispy and not greasy very addicting especially the nice sauce on side for dipping. The mac n cheese was creamy and cheesy and not to heavy or eggy tasting and very nice job. The restaurant is a little dark hard to see the menu had to use phone to read menu as others did comment on previous reviews I do have to agree. We thought it was a cozy dining experience staff was very attentive and nice throughout our whole visit. The only reason not giving five stars is we couldn't taste the ribs the whole reason we came to try this restaurant but overall a great experience. They do have outdoor patio in rear of restaurant looked cute what we could see from street but wasn't clear how you entered to patio.

2.description: Confession: I've only had BBQ MAYBE 4 times my whole life. Luckily County BBQ was a great suggestion to help catch me up a little!Marissa was our server and she was super welcoming and gave us the run-down of the drinks not posted on the menu. (Not updated since apparently they have a healthy rotation.) Beverages:I could have sworn the Mosaic on tap was advertised as a $5 special, but looking at the bill later, they were itemized at $7. Hmph. I would have just gone with a Revolution since I've grown to love heartier brews and my guess is they'd be at a similar price point. The flavor of the Mosaic was still fine. Oh well. I had a sip of the Milk Stout, and it was nice and full with chocolatey notes.Pork Sandwich ($10):My +1 had the Pulled Pork sandwich and declined a side add-on. The sammy was HUGE - stacked high (primarily) with pork and a bit of coleslaw. He enjoyed it but said it was a bit too saucy for his particular tastes. He ended up going the fork + knife route at the end due to the wet, slidy sloppiness. That's how BBQ is supposed to be though, right? Not exactly sexy date food. 1/2# Brisket ($14):Speaking of sauce: the Mustard sauce was pretty darn good. My brisket didn't need much flavor help, though, since the rub + natural juices all but covered that base. My +1 boasted it was fall-apart tender... not quite, but not too far off!  A half pound equates to 4 slices, btw, which doesn't seem like much. If you're ravenous, you might want something with a larger portion size.  The Garlic Fries were plentiful (enough to share!), well-seasoned, and piping hot. Total win there.Food runners were friendly and relayed a request for water (which the bartender brought over). There were two unisex bathrooms and the one I used was clean, but absent of paper towels. I'd definitely head back to County BBQ! To sum, it's good food and service in a cute casual space.

18.description: Pros:1. New favorite jalapeño infused tequila drink, right here! 2. All of the sides are worth making a meal of! Garlic fries, delicious! Blackened cauliflower, incredible (who knew I could rave about veggies?!) Corn pudding, umm yes please! Mac and cheese, savory goodness! 3. Service was super friendly, attentive and helpful!4. House made BBQ sauces and mustards are an excellent addition to any BBQ!Cons:1. Actually wasn't too big of a fan of the actual meat.. My brisket was tasty and had a nice layer of fat to add extra flavor, but it was overcooked and chewy. The ribs had a ton of bones in it, with very little meat, which made it difficult to enjoy.To sum it up:  I will definitely will come back for the drinks and sides. Maybe I'll have better luck with a sandwich next time

41.description: How in the world can this little place on Taylor St. of all places serve up some of the best BBQ I have had here in the Midwest?!I dropped by County during my first weekend here in Chicago after a friend recommended it (since I live so close by). This restaurant definitely sets the mood with its dim interior lighting, but the outdoor seating is larger and can accommodate bigger groups. Right as I got here, a big group of Japanese tourists were leaving and wondering whether to go to the Sears Tower or not. If County is big enough to attract tourists, then that is a sign.Our waiter Chris was awesome in explaining the menu and recommending some of the limited beers they had here; some of which can only be consumed outside (weird huh?) I immediately drew my ideas to the brisket because I've been hella disappointed in the Midwest with what I've found. I figured I'd give it another go.We got some pork puppies to start, and these crispy little pork balls made me ready for the main meal...BAM. Best BBQ decision ever!!The brisket was juicy, smoky, and downright delicious. My one meat/three sides combo ($16) came with a healthy portion of the meat, and I was super satisfied with how great it tasted. The real winners here were some of the sides: CORN PUDDING is a MUST. Forget the rest and just order three helpings of these. I wasn't a fan of the collared greens as I found this a bit too salty for my taste.With the food being bomb and the stellar service, I know that County is going to be one I keep in the books for when I am craving a good beer and some lean, mean BBQ.

52.description: I've ordered County BBQ on Grubhub in the past, and it was super yummy. Last night I finally visited the restaurant and the entire experience was outstanding! Food was great (do yourself a favor and get the corn pudding), service was spectacular! Sam was our waiter. He had awesome recommendations and was super knowledgeable about their beer selection. Easily one of the best service experiences I have had in a long time! Definitely going back.

50.description: My husband and I live within a few miles from this restaurant so we frequently drive by, always making a mental note that we need to try it sometime. So last night we did. First off, we wanted to call our order in and pick it up, but could not do so. Their phone goes to voicemail automatically, no pickup orders, which I find really strange. Grubhub it is. Our order came really fast, that is about the only good thing about this place. We got a half slab of ribs, mac n cheese, pork hush puppies and a pulled pork sandwich. The ribs were delivered dry with 3 different bar b q sauces to choose from and they all sucked! That's pretty sad when your a bar b q place and you don't even have 1 good sauce out of three! One was some sort of pineapple fruit or something, why would you want that on ribs? I used my own Sweet baby rays sauce out of my fridge, always a good choice. My husbands pulled pork sandwich was a wet mess! They put the cole slaw on the sandwich, as do most places, but should not do so when it is delivery. His bottom bun was like a sponge! Speaking of the cole slaw, it is disgusting, I spit it out! Even if it was good the portion was embarrassing, it was literally 2 bites, that's it. The mac n cheese was so salty and the portion was also tiny and they charge $7.00 for it. Are they insane? I didn't even try the hush puppies, my husband said they were super salty as well. Everything was so salty, everything! The only thing decent was the fries, how sad is that? I agree with some of the other reviews as far as other bar b q places, if you want great bar b q, go to Smoque for sure and Fat Willies, they know how to do bar b q. This place is expensive and the food is not good, don't waste your money!

4.description: How in the world can this little place on Taylor St. of all places serve up some of the best BBQ I have had here in the Midwest?!I dropped by County during my first weekend here in Chicago after a friend recommended it (since I live so close by). This restaurant definitely sets the mood with its dim interior lighting, but the outdoor seating is larger and can accommodate bigger groups. Right as I got here, a big group of Japanese tourists were leaving and wondering whether to go to the Sears Tower or not. If County is big enough to attract tourists, then that is a sign.Our waiter Chris was awesome in explaining the menu and recommending some of the limited beers they had here; some of which can only be consumed outside (weird huh?) I immediately drew my ideas to the brisket because I've been hella disappointed in the Midwest with what I've found. I figured I'd give it another go.We got some pork puppies to start, and these crispy little pork balls made me ready for the main meal...BAM. Best BBQ decision ever!!The brisket was juicy, smoky, and downright delicious. My one meat/three sides combo ($16) came with a healthy portion of the meat, and I was super satisfied with how great it tasted. The real winners here were some of the sides: CORN PUDDING is a MUST. Forget the rest and just order three helpings of these. I wasn't a fan of the collared greens as I found this a bit too salty for my taste.With the food being bomb and the stellar service, I know that County is going to be one I keep in the books for when I am craving a good beer and some lean, mean BBQ.

6.description: I give this place 3 stars because the food is way too salty and also the food is way over fried.  I was not able to eat the sweet potato fries because they were burned.  The popular hush puppies extremely salty and the water we got had no ice.  This restUrant is over rated.  We came here because I saw it on check  please.  I think I should stop watching that show because I get to disappointed when I personally taste the food and I think WOW are the people from "check please are they for REAL?"  I like our waiter he was pretty knowledgeable of the whole entired menu.What I loved the most was desert, the bread pudding.  I also loved the fact that I took another adventure with my son and he paid the check.  Thank you COCKEY

22.description: Went here for anniversary with boyfriend. It was amazing. The ribs were delicious, I was able to cut through it like butter, I ordered garlic fries on the side, it was really good. and I definitely recommend getting the smoked pork puppies. You will not regret it :)

15.description: Spent a couple hours here on a lazy winter Sunday afternoon. If you have read any of my other reviews, I have spent a LOT of time in Kansas City, and have pretty high standards for BBQ. This place first of all is much smaller than the storefront would make you believe. As the bar takes up a good amount of the available space, I will first say that the beer selection is limited to about 8 taps. Not bad historically, but not exactly what I would call diverse in this age of ever expanding beer selections. I went with the chopped brisket, which is a personal favorite of mine. I much prefer the texture of chopped brisket to that of sliced. The reason it isn't offered chopped as often as it is sliced is moisture, and I have to admit that in the case of County BBQ, that was its failing here. There was a good amount of smoke and bark, and the sauce is more than adequate to the job, but the sandwich I had was just too dry. I probably needed to be there on a busier day, or go against my preference and try the sliced brisket instead of the chopped.Service was pleasant and always there when I needed it, no complaints. The Taylor Street corridor has many more offerings than I had previously realized, and I will probably add the area to the places I come and look for unique offerings in the future. I will update this review if I come back and sample any of the other offerings. But for a first impression, Smoque blows this place away.

57.description: Um all I can say is more please! Nice ambience, service and pricing. I had the rib tips- dry rubbed no sauce needed. Ample portions, nice presentation. Just need a pillow and blanket- felt down right cozy.

20.description: We had a most enjoyable dinner and evening at County Barbeque last week!! The staff was extremely friendly!!! One gal in our group ordered Texas Two Step which consisted of brisket, grits and greens. We all tasted the brisket and it was deeeelish :) She was also surprised at how tasty the grits were. The rest of us ordered the pulled pork sandwich and sweet potato fries. We all agreed the sandwich was very good and the fries were terrific. We will definitely return to try some other menu items. The atmosphere and friendly staff made the evening especially nice.

36.description: I came in with my wife to try the bbq brisket sandwich with garlic fries and it was very good.great smoke meat,great portions and very affordable. The food came out fast and the service was good. The bartender was very helpful with the drink selections.overall great food,nice helpful staff,affordable great food,great beer selections.I will highly reccommend this taylor street establishment.

14.description: My husband and I brought our brother and sister in law here last night. The food was fabulous. The waitress and other staff were very attentive. We had a wonderful time. We will definitely be going back again.

28.description: OMG..I LOVE this place..small and friendly..I've had the large 18" pepperoni and on another visit I had the veggie specialty pizza and we added sausage (link not ground) and pepperoni it was GREAT..We basically tried all the side items..The beer battered crack fries, hot wings, jack wings, cheese sticks, and the garlic knots (not my fav)..everything was good..the wings are baked and grilled not fried..lastly my honey wanted dessert so we got their large $2 brownie and it was delic. as well!!! ENJOY fyi it avaliable on GROUPON!! :)

1.description: I'll give maybe 3.5 stars. It was good, but maybe I'll bump it up if I try another pizza.They were friendly, but the inside was pretty bare. I think if you can do carrry out, that would be the better option. Garlic Knots - They were okay.Jack Daniels Pulled Pork Pizza - I liked the crust a lot, but it did have a bit of burnt taste to the bottom. I probably would not order this one again as the sauce was a bit sweet for us.Would definitely like to come back to give a sausage and mushroom pizza or another specialty one a try.

9.description: A group of friends and I visited this location to redeem a groupon. The pizza was possibly the most bland and greasy pizza in Chicago. I felt like I was in college again between the atmosphere and mediocre food. I would say it's great for a party night or hangover the next day but not if you're looking for anything with an ounce of quality.

29.description: Tried them for lunch recently.  Haven't noticed them before, the storefront is pretty invisible with the scaffolding work going on to the West of them.Got two slices.  The CRUST is really nice; crisp, thin, but with a nice chewy border. Slice is average sized for the price.  But the rest of it was pretty un-remarkable.  Sausage and mushroom had some kinda canned mushrooms on it, and the cheese and sauce and sausage really were bland.  No fennel in the sausage, barely could find it.  The tomato sauce was like just wet; not sweet, not tart, not oregano-ey, not tomatoey.  Just bland.  The cheese didn't seem like 100% mozarella; melted weird, didn't have much flavor.The other slice was the Nacho pizza, and that was actually pretty good, like nachos but on a crust.  The steak meat on it had quite a bit of gristle on it, but otherwise, this at least had flavor, even if it wasn't the flavor of PIZZA, but of pretty tasty NACHOS!Overall, I was not wowed.  I may try again, but it seems they are more about doing weird pizza topping combinations, but don't seem to execute the basic pizza all that well.

23.description: I've ordered from both locations and have always received great service with tasty pizza. My go to pizza is the Philly Cheesesteak. Yummmm!!!

5.description: My first experience at Big G's was interesting. Memes everywhere, ridiculous (in a good way) amount of pizza choices, and a scary door that leads to a scary staircase that leads to a basement which is probably just as scary. This place definitely has a style of its own. If you want a burger, get a hamburger pizza. If you're feeling very Italian, get the fettuccini pizza. They're vegetarian friendly and it all just make you go "huh, is that good as a pizza?" And yes it is! The staff is nice and they have varied choices in music. The staff is on the smaller side (haha) so it'll take a while for a delivery to arrive. P.s. The mac & cheese pizza is overrated. It's good, but not that good.

31.description: I ordered there on 8/21, regular pizza. I was quoted the wrong price for delivery, not by much. The pizza was OK, it could have been cooked longer.I called back to order again today, on 8/29, was put on hold twice and when finally I got someone, the music was so loud in the background they couldn't hear me? I kept having to repeat the order, which they kept repeating back incorrectly. I finally hung up, no order and called Gino's East.

25.description: Love the pies at Big G's (we've had three different ones so far) but the real secret here are their wings: fall off the bone tender and delicious seasoning, some of the best I've had anywhere!

12.description: Mac n' Cheese pizza!! Yes! Big G's combines my two favorite foods to create a cheesy, carby masterpiece. They sell pizza by the slice so it's nice for a light dinner or heavy snack. Their famous "crack fries" were decent, but certainly did not live up to the hype expressed in the menu. A different, and more flavorful sidedish would be the garlic knots, those things were tastey, but not ideal if you're on a date. It's also BYOB!

21.description: Big G's on Taylor offers outstanding pizza at a reasonable price. Super thin crust, the way  pizza should be, delicious sauce, great toppings.

16.description: Had their CHICKEN PARMESAN PIZZA at Italian fest. I'm not typically a fan of a bird on a pizza but this is something that you SHOULD TRY.  I wouldn't shy away from their traditional pizza either,  although I've never had it.  They had a well-made pizza dough and a tasty sauce so I have confidence.

17.description: I checked this place out when my friend and I were doing some errands. The restaurant itself is a nice and cozy  pizza parlor. The menu was creatively done on a huge blackboard. I liked the "school and pizza'' themed menu. Only con about the place is that it was awkwardly quiet. Maybe some background music will liven up the mood.There were so many options to choose from, but I decided to order a slice of the mac and cheese pizza. Let me start with the crust. It was crunchy and buttery which was the perfect combination! The mac and cheese portion was put together nicely. A little greasy, but it's a pizza! Overall this is a great quick stop for a bite for some delicious pizza.

10.description: The flavors they have here are insane. I've had the Philly Cheese Steak and the Mac 'n Cheese pizzas. They get much crazier than that. I suggest everyone should come in here at least once; they will have a topping to suit every palate. And they occasionally give out free slices if you answer a riddle posted outside their location. However, I have a few gripes. First is their prices are quite high just for a slice of pizza. You can get two slices for about the same price at Taylor Made just down the street. Second is while the pizzas are very tasty, they are very thin. Probably the thinnest I've ever had. One slice won't satisfy a grown person and may lead people into buying an additional slice. However, this will just lead you to trying a new unique flavor that you may end up loving.

11.description: Average pizza for a decent price (2.75 a slice). My buddy and I went last Saturday afternoon and the cashier was using his bare hands (no glove) to grab each slice... So there's an area they can improve. They're wings are good though. Not sure if they give a student discount since it's right next to UIC. Many better options on Taylor Street in my opinion.

26.description: The penne chicken Alfredo pizza is to die for! The combination of the crispy pizza dough with the penne pasta is a combination of flavor that makes my taste buds dance for joy! Food is awesome a must try for any pizza lover!

27.description: Decided to give them a shot when a Groupon was offered.  Wow, glad I did!  We ordered the three veggie pizza, and it was by far the best thin crust/NY-style pizza we've had.  The shrooms, spinich, and red peppers were super fresh - nothing frozen here!  The crust was great.  The only thing preventing it from a 5 star was that the center of the pizza was a little doughy.  Still very edible, but the center didn't have the same consistency and crunch as the crust.  If this is the trade-off for avoiding any burnt crust though, I'll take it.  The 18" can easily feed four adults, making the $21 price tag acceptable.  We loved it so much we purchased a second Groupon!

0.description: Had a slice of cheese pizza, soda, fries, and their smores ravioli. Yes that's a lot of food, don't judge me. Food was excellent it's a nice spot to eat and chill with friends. Service was really nice he gave me an extra ravioli since it took a little while to serve. Clean place, decent prices, and good quality for being in a college town.

20.description: So good. I usually cook most of my meals and are 9 times out of 10 disappointed by delivery food. I went on a limb (well, on a group-on really) and have to say...this will be the first place I think of next time I'm craving pizza. It arrived SO fast, it was still hot and not to mention delicious. I went with a simple pizza this time but would love to try some of their more unique toppings next time around. Yay!!!

19.description: So good. I usually cook most of my meals and are 9 times out of 10 disappointed by delivery food. I went on a limb (well, on a group-on really) and have to say...this will be the first place I think of next time I'm craving pizza. It arrived SO fast, it was still hot and not to mention delicious. I went with a simple pizza this time but would love to try some of their more unique toppings next time around. Yay!!!

33.description: Had their CHICKEN PARMESAN PIZZA at Italian fest.
