25.description: I wish I could live somewhere in between the mountain of caramelized onions and rows of charred Polishes. Nestle my noggin on a bed of steamed hot dog buns.24/7, 365 a year. I even went here for breakfast before a 6:30am flight outta Midway. THAT's how good it is. Drunk, sober, it matters not!Everything comes with fries and it's dirt cheap to begin with... what more do I need to say? NOTHING.Shane-O, OUT.

12.description: Just as good as Jim's even though the fries are a bit greasier(which is not a bad thing). It doesn't matter to me which stand I go to, sometimes one of em might be a bit more crowded than the other one, but idc. I go to whichever one has a shorter line. Sometimes I end up going to both!

59.description: This is a review of Express Grill.I boldly mention this because there is _another_ hot dog stand very nearby, and in the past, I believe there was a keen possibility that persons reviewing either of these hot dog stands may have mistakenly assigned the attributes of one to the *opposition* hot dog stand.The *opposition* hot dog stand run by a feuding brother of the entrepreneur of Express Grill is at *1250* S. Union Ave. (I shall not mention its name here - it is already confusing enough.)The snag is because; depending on when you were here, you might not especially remember all the details of what you had, much less which stand you visited. But the fog of your memory would express [oops] that this was the northernmost stand. Then, in a lucid state, you logged on to Yelp and looked the venue up. You saw an address of *1236* S. Union. You posted your review of that venue as being "Express Grill".And you were erroneous.There is no stand at 1236 S. Union Ave. That is a non-existant address. (It would be in the middle of the street just south of Roosevelt Rd.) The northernmost stand is *NOT* Express Grill. You reviewed *the opposition*. Please cut out your review of the opposition and paste it into that restaurant's reviews.After we finished videotaping 'Chic-A-Go-Go!' one Saturday evening, I had extra time before I needed to get to the Twisted Spoke. I was on another CTA 1-day pass. I walked over to Halsted St. and caught a #8 Halsted bus south to Roosevelt and walked the two blocks over to Union St. I deliberately chose Express Grill.I opted for the beef Polish ($3.35) and a 20-ounce bottle of black cherry soda ($1.25). My money was collected in a small tip tray. (I haven't seen any business using that since I visited Tokyo.)I had mustard and grilled onions on my polish. It was a good all-beef polish slightly pink on the inside, but with enough roasted meat flavor to be succulent. The french fries at Express Grill are institutional. They're not great. Interestingly, you will get generic ketchup packets for your fries at Express Grill. [Oh geez. How did the "never ketchup!" hot dog purists miss that in their reviews?] In a sense, those who visit here are also doing so to absorb the atmosphere. But unlike Superdawg [c.v.], at Express Grill, it concentrates on its food. The prices are low. It is a solid value for the money. This is the cheapest restaurant in the Roosevelt | Halsted area (to briefly mention the opposition - it charges the same prices - there is no 5¢ or 10¢ undercutting by one stand from the other). Which is likely why it is sequestered off on a freeway frontage road. Fancier, more expensive restaurants and lounges do not want you to know about venues like this, especially when it's walking [or staggering] distance from them.Transit options: Express Grill is open 24 hours a day, and buses which serve it run for all of that time. The #8 Halsted bus runs northbound from here until 1:00 am; southbound until 2:45 am. The #12 Roosevelt bus runs east from here until 12:45 am; west until 1:11 am. After that, catch the #N62 Archer bus [30 minute intervals] on the corner of Halsted & Rochford St. [1230 S.] to downtown. It is a one-mile walk (or bicycle ride) north to the Halsted Blue Line "L" station.

21.description: Just now reviewing after eating here back in July or August.Stopped by with friends after a White Sox game. Ordered a cheeseburger, a polish and a regular hot dog. Each one hit the spot.

17.description: Best pork chop sandwich in Chicago!  Fries come with everything but they suck. Lol must have the chop!

10.description: The best polish sausage and pork chop sandwich in the city.. The best place to go after a late night out . Good hangover food .

5.description: It's the best hot dog of my life. I've probably eaten there 40 times, and I don't live in Chicago.

3.description: Seriously, this place serves up some AWESOME! Chicago-style street food. I was in Chicago, visiting a friend, and he suggested we go here after a long night. The hamburgers, hot dogs, polishes all great. I ordered the all beef Polish and my mouth is just watering thinking of it. Very nicely sized frank, with a great snap to it when bitten in to, and perfectly spiced. Fried onions are a great addition! I think they use yellow Spanish onions, but they add a really nice flavor and sweetness. Hot peppers are a must! Well, I am a huge fan of spicy foods, so do beware if you are sensitive to spiciness b/c and these are SUPER spicy, but I am addicted! My brother is also a huge, huge Chicago-style hotdog fan (probably eats them twice a week), and their hotdogs pass his test! I'm telling you, that is saying something!! Prices are reasonable, the food is quick, tasty and perfect for a late-night or quick meal! Super friendly staff too! I think the guy who took my order was Tommy. Go Express Grill, Go!!!Give them a try, I know you want to!

35.description: This is a diamond in the rough. Amongst so many impostors this Joynte still remains to be the epitome of classic, not to be confused with classy, Chicago dining. For around $5 you get a full meal. Sandwich, fries, drink. It's that simple!Maxwell street is as Chicago as the saint valentines day massacre!Get a Polish Sausage or a Pork Chop Sandwich and you wont be disappointed.

19.description: OMG! now your talking some damn good food that gets down to the soul of Chicago!This is what its all about it's Chicago's equivalent of Tommy's Burgers on Rampart street.I've had dreams about this Polish since I was there last and I made my cousins drag me there, I didn't care how safe it was lol.This was delicious, you have to stop there and try it all!

28.description: "The Chicago hot dog - we don't have a Chicago hot dog. It's just done street style. But it is a Vienna hot dog. So Vienna beef hot dog. The difference is though; the main thing down here is the grilled onions. That's what people come down here for. The main thing down here is the Polish sausage and the pork chop sandwich.""Especially made for this place here. The polish sausage seasoning? It's my dad's.Some are perfected and whatever, but we own a patent on that. So, the polish itself is made specially for here, you can't find 'em anywhere else."I interviewed staff at both Express Grill and Jim's Original for my journalism assignment. Both are successful family businesses (2 stands of the 40-50 hot dog eateries that used to be on Maxwell Street pre-2001). After the questions, I decided to order the Polish hot dog for myself. The owner insisted it was on the house. Polish Hot dog: 5/5. Was great. Had a unique flavour; didn't taste like it was a normal sausage (i.e. Jim's Original). Onions were browned and not a soggy mess.Fries: 3/5. Served hot and were definitely fresh, but still tasted average (I did fail to use the salt packets provided).

45.description: FAMOUS FOR (My rating in parens)Maxwell Street Polish (10/10)ALSO TRIEDPork Chop Sandwich (8/10)Cheeseburger (10/10)Hot Dog (5/10)Fish Sandwich (3/10)Chicken Sandwich (3/10)Oh, poor Maxwells! Nobody knows you by your real name, "Express Grill!" Back in my UIC days, the debate was always "Maxwells or Jim's?" That's why Express Grill only has 19 reviews, and Jim's has 129, which, ironically, also shows the sudden shift in clients!Express Grill or "Maxwells" and Jim's were always next to each other (why? I dunno). Jim's was always the desperate ones. No line and no customers. Their cooks were always leaning out the window calling out to you as you walked by to go to Maxwells. Us frequenters went to Maxwells because we believed the Polish tasted better here. Newbies went to Maxwells for fear that Jim's was unsanitary or something because their lines were empty. Lol @ Newbs! Each item comes with some thick, flimsy, tasteless fries (add salt and it's pretty good) and last I remember a Polish was just over $3 and the rest was under $3. Been a while though.POLISHYou have not tasted a Maxwells Polish until you've tried it here. Do NOT even think about saying that you had a "The Original Maxwell St Polish" at [Insert Venue Here]. I don't care if it was Wrigley Field, Portillos, or some random hot dog stand. You have not experienced the real thing. It's funny too, back in the day, you had to literally risk your life to get Maxwells, now it's in such a nice area! It's a polish cooked on a greasy grill with greasy grilled onions on a bun slathered with mustard only, and really hot peppers (sometimes). The peppers aren't jalapenos, they're something else. My mouth is watering now just thinking about this! The polish is just perfect! It's smoky, salt, flavorful, but not overpowering! The bun is sitting in a steamy container, so it's thin, so you don't just taste bread. The mustard with the polish is just heaven! And finally, the onions. Oh yes the onions...I don't know how they make these, but I've been trying to recreate it myself and have failed on all accounts. Their onions are so perfect! They're "sauteed" so to speak, but are grilled on the same greasy grill with the same grease rained down upon them. They caramelize to just the absolute PERFECT point where they don't have the crunch and sharpness of raw onions (I hate raw onions) but they're not so mushy either. They have a softened texture of their own and they are OMG so freaking good and sweet! The entire collection just melts in your mouth as your eyes roll in the back of your head. Yeah it's that good!You want to know about Chicago? Have a Polish, it tastes like Chicago. Figuratively, literally, whatever, you cannot die before having one of these! ThePORK CHOP SANDWICHIt's a bone in pork chop, just so you know before you go breaking your teeth! It's got the same mustard, onions, and peppers as the polish. TIP: For a pork chop, you can't go when it's too busy - you have to wait a long time, and you run the danger of getting a not-so-cooked one. You can't go when there's nobody there, those pork chops have been sitting on the grill for a while, so they're dry. You have to go either at the tail end of a rush or after the rush. You'll get the perfect pork chop then. Trust me, I lived about 50 paces from Maxwells and skipped class to test this out (I did just about anything to skip class)! TIP 2: BITE CAREFULLY!When you get it right, this is pretty darn good! Pork chop doesn't have too much of a pork flavor, but when you get a good bite (bun, condiments, and pork) it makes a great combination! The texture is what does it for me!CHEESEBURGERI have never in my life had a cheeseburger that melted! The beef and cheese on a flimsy bun with the mustard and onions are so incredibly good and buttery! I don't even know if they use butter, but it feels as good as butter! And you bite it, and it literally wants to melt in your mouth! OMG! Drool!THE RESTNot good. I'd rather have a Filet O Fish instead of their fish. Chicken sandwich is whatever. Don't waste your money. The hot dog is just a hot dog, bun, and the same mustard/onion condiments. Now, I hate hot dogs, but love a good Chicago Style Dog, and this is not a Chicago Style Dog, so no thanks! In fact, if you order a hot dog with the onions and mustard, you take a bite, and you think to yourself, "Now why in the hell did I not just give a few more cents and get a Polish?"The whole world tries to copy Maxwells...but nobody even comes close! Oh yeah...24/7/365! Gotta love it!

33.description: The best Polish in Chicago. You can stop searching, because all the locals in the know stop at Express Grill, which everyone calls "Maxwell St Sausage", but that's another story.This place is always open, they do accept credit cards and seem to attract everyone from college students, late night clubbers, wannabe bangers, ubiquitous panhandlers, retail store managers that get out late (that was us!) and last but not least, the police. Thankfully every time I've been there, the cops have been customers. They frequent this place a lot, so although you get some questionable looking characters in the neighborhood late at night or early into the wee hours of the morning, I've never had problem other than the homeless which beg you without shame. Although they do have a full menu of grease-filled goodness, the only real reason to come to Express is to savor the one-and-only Polish that tromps everything else in Chicago, a city that put the Polish on the map!There's just something magical about the combination of caramelized onions, peppers, that sausage and the way the mustard makes it all come together. Throw in a bag of greasy fries and you have the perfect comfort food when you're done partying up the Chi. If you want a true taste of Chicago that can't be replicated elsewhere, pay a visit to this shrine. I'm normally not one to rave about food, but for only a few bucks, you won't find anything tastier in the city and that is open 24/7.

43.description: A monster polish and fries for $1.50 during the start of a blizzard?  SOLD!

2.description: I'm a bit a disappointed. Came here expecting to have my mind blown by an original maxwell polish. Don't get me wrong, my polish was good, but not mind blowing. Got a polish with everything. It had way too many grilled onions. It kept pushing off my peppers and overcrowded the taste of the Polish.Yes, I understand I could've just pulled some of the onions off. Also, my peppers still had the stems. Yes, anything thing I could've resolved myself but I don't like to work for my food. I'd prefer to pull it out the paper and be able to eat it.Additionally the fried had absolutely no salt. This was good but not great.

18.description: Lemme get that polish and hot link please! Fries are included...tasty as it gets buddy for your late night eats! And it's not only good drunk, but sober....and that's pretty important!This little hut is open ALL the time....literally ALL the time.A few things to appreciate/understand1. It's a hut! So no seating and exposure to the elements...it's one of those meals you eat standing outside or sitting in the car...or on the curb.2. It's delicious and everything comes with a healthy portion of fries (the bad kind of healthy).3. You're in the city so be mindful of your surroundings, but it's in no way shape or form scary or sketchy.4. It's decently price since they don't have to pay a lot for rent...you can get a hot dog and fries for $3.5. It'll hit the spot.

41.description: The red-headed step-child of Maxwell St. stands.  It is not terrible, but not all that great.  Its existence is wholly unnecessary because of its proximity to the superior Jim's Original (they are neighbors).  The sandwiches are much greasier at Express, and the fries are not crisp.I ate here once when my drunk friend insisted that Express, and not Jim's, was the better one (I didn't want to argue), which he conceded after his first bite.  In hindsight I should have been more assertive, but at least it gave me a chance to be able to definitively say that Express was inferior to Jim's.All Express Grill has to do is move a few blocks away from Jim's, and I'd bump up the rating to A-OK.

52.description: This is simply the best.  I went to UIC for undergrad and my dorm was right by it.  I remember I'd always be walking and smell the beautiful sweet fragrance of the polish sausages, tender and juicy pork chops, and grilled onions all the time!  This always made me salivate and seems to be a way they brain wash us.I can't tell you that I prefer Express Grill over Jim's any time of the week!  The quality of the meat isn't the issue but its the way Jim's cook it.  I know I've had dried porkchops from jims and their polish just didn't have that mmm mmm goodness that I wanted.  And their onions are just undercooked or just doesn't have that texture that I want.But Express Grill has all the right ingredients and the right chefs!  Hands down the best polish sausages to the point where I can't eat it anywhere else.  The pork chop is always tender and man the grill onions are done perfectly!  Dripping in all its goodness, nice texture, and the taste is amazing.  Oh and all this at a student bargain (under $5)!  Use to be cheaper but still good for what you get.I tell you when you got a beautiful piece of meat and topped with grill onions!  It's hard to reject this but somehow Jim's falls short.    *Though Jim's Beef Polish and fries is much better than Express Grill.Plus on top of your sandwich you get free fries!!!  And do not make the mistake that IF YOU ARE A UIC STUDENT FREE DRINK!  SHOW ID!  I found out the last day I graduated undergrad!  And it only happened because my friend was wearing a UIC sweatshirt in which the cook said, "are you from UIC?  You get a free drink."  I was devastated as I already bought my stuff!  Anyways could work for any student but letting you all know. But yes open 24/7 and make sure to eat em' hot peppers.  You will enjoy it but the aftermath ain't too pretty but who thinks of that?

50.description: I think I would have starved to death during collage if it wasn't for the express grill. Back then it was a $1.60 for a burger and fries... What a bargain. While the burger here isn't the greatest in the world it was cheap and fast. The waldorf ketchup is kind of festive and was better used as a table decoration then on the burger but that was easily fixed but just buying our own ketchup. The bums begging while you order are a bit on the annoying side as well but they are part of the experience of coming to the express grill. Even if you give them the quarter you are still getting a great dal here.

4.description: I was here recently and it is back to a 5 in my opinion. I guess the lst time was a fluke. I will be back again and again.

6.description: Awesome!!! Compared to Jim's next door, the fries are a MILLION times tastier and the Polish was actually a bit bigger than Jim's. Basically the same quality and menu as Jim's all around, but the fries at Jim's were definitely fishy like they had been cooked in the same oil as the fish sandwich.Express Grill will be my go to the next time I'm in the area.

22.description: These retards were more concerned with making sure I got fries then actually putting what I ordered in the f**king bag!!! Are you serious? Who put 3 orders of fries in one bag and totally screws up the rest of the order? No wonder this p,ace caters to a bunch of drunks in the wee hours of the night. Don't go to this place unless you are completely sober and are willing to babysit the staff and make sure you inspect the bag and get everything you ordered.

15.description: Just now reviewing after eating here back in July or August.Stopped by with friends after a White Sox game. Ordered a cheeseburger, a polish and a regular hot dog. Each one hit the spot.

57.description: there is a place next door.... this place has better fries.Any hot dog or polish comes with fries.  Its so cheap, thats probably why its busy no matter what time it is you come by.

20.description: Thought I'd give Chicago hotdogs another shot after Portillo's disappointed. But I guess I'm just biased towards California bacon-wrapped street dogs. While the dog was good enough, there wasn't anything spectacular about it that would have me craving it again. The Polish Sausage was much the same. Also this place seems like it's in a sketchy area.

36.description: Best polish in the city...just about $4.25 will get you an amazing polish sausage, french fries, and a root beer or choice of pop to wash all of that down.Can't be beat. No one comes close to this polish.

14.description: Got food poisoning.  Ordered two Maxwell St Polish.  The female server put mustard on one bun.  Opened the other bun, it already had mustard on it, they looked confused, opened and closed it a couple of more times, looked at the person who handed them the bun.  I didn't realize the significance of this.  I suspect the bun was adulterated in some way with the mustard already on it.  About an hour later, severe diareahha.  Hadn't eaten anything else except cereal for breakfast.  This used to be my favorite place for Maxwell St Polish.  No more.  This was Sunday 6/21/2015 around 3 pm.

58.description: OMG! Yum!!! I had a fully loaded Polish Dog and a Pork Chop Sandwich, bone in. Incredible. I loved the dog so much I had to put a photo on Facebook. Each sandwich comes with an order of fries. Some street parking available out front. It's the one on the corner, not the other one. ;) there's another one right next door. Lol

56.description: I have been here a couple of times now. I have only tried the hot dogs here. They are very good as are the fries. In my opinion, at least for me, the place next door has a better dog. I will come back here though to try the polish and pork chop.

29.description: Been here before, but nothing like it use to be. Wasn't impressed anymore. Won't be back. Sorry Jim

42.description: Great food, great people. A must do when visiting Chicago.  The polish dog with lots of grilled onions is the best thing on the menu. Don't forget to ask for some hot peppers. They are just the right amount of hot to enjoy with the polish dog. French fries are just right. Don't forget to add a pop, they have a nice selection of pop that you don't find everywhere.

23.description: Had the polish sausage and it was all it was cracked up to be. Thank you for filling my belly and not picking my pocket!

47.description: Standing room only! The Vienna dog was so good with onions mustard and relish! My husband also got the polish dog. Each order comes with fries and they are fat, greasy and crispy delicious!! There aren't any tables just a small counter outside the building to stand and chow down. Open 24 hours, I bet this place is crazy at night.

8.description: Express Grill right next to them reminds me of how Pat's and Geno's is in Philly. (Jim's is the Pat's in this comparison). Food here is so good, we had to make one last stop before leaving Chicago. Pork chop sandwich is delicious and messy, fish sandwich with cheese is amazing, and the fries are some of the best fries I've ever had. The hot dog is a-ok but the sandwiches are what you need to get. Also the peppers, my god are those things hot! Don't bite down on them all willy nilly or you'll regret it for a while.

31.description: So they have one of the best polish sausage I have tasted in Chicago! I love them. But be careful getting the peppers! They have the hottest peppers I have tasted in my life! No joke. My mouth felt like it was literally on fire! I had to stop eating and suck on an ice cube. But other than that it's great. A staple late night greasy joint that never disappoints.

34.description: Late night stop to soak up the booze simple is best mustard grilled onions I only get a beef polish or the double cheese burger food always taste better standing up

16.description: This place is a little gem!  The hamburgers and hot dogs are so amazing, they are made to order and you can top them with kraut.  I had the double cheeseburger with sourkraut and my husband got the loaded hot dog.  Both were very good however the hamburger is the winner in my book.  if you are getting fries you have to get the cheese cup, its a little side dipper of hot cheese.... yum!  I would be a repeat customer of this place if I wasnt just visiting.

13.description: Delicious hot dogs and sandwiches with great prices and Chicago history. Pulled up in my car for the first time on a cold winter day, ran to the window, got my Polish sausage within a couple minutes, and promptly ran back to my car to chow down inside. Saw many others do the same. Great stop for a quick bite any time!

11.description: Childhood favorite for a "Jewtown" polish. I will NOT patronize any other knock off Maxwell polish stand! It's this Jim's or NOTHING! I love the Polish with extra onions, mustard, and hot peppers w/a seven up. I also love the bone in porkchop with their infamous onions and peppers. This was actually my 1st restaurant of 2016  to get food from at 4am after I got off work 1/1/16. Not much more to say than if you haven't tried this you're not living!

39.description: No-frills. No muss, no fuss. However, one of the best dog stands in the city. The Polish are to die for. Open 24 hours, and you could go to get your fix on anytime.

37.description: Best hot dog joint in the city. This place always has a crazy line of customers. Definitely at great place to stop and grab some quick food super late at night. There fries are so delicious. Probably the best fries I've ever had. And if you have a UIC student ID, they give you a free pop. And at a great price too!

0.description: This place is great for what it is trying to do! It is just off the highway by UIC (if you are an UIC student and show ID they give you a free can of soda). They are pretty much open 24/7 and their prices are ridiculously low. Despite having hot dog in its name, my go to is their fish sandwich with extra onions and cheese. Have you had the Fillet'O'Fish at McDonald's? This is leagues ahead of that. Did i mention it comes with fries and jalapeno's? If you are downtown for the night and heading back home in the suburbs definitely stop by. All around just a great greasy late night snack. Sometimes I would drive 20 min with a couple friends just to come grab a bite after a night of catching up/hanging out.Be prepared in the winter as you stand in line outside as well as eat outside or just come with friends and take turns hopping in/out of the car and eating in the car.

38.description: Opens late, cheap food, love the pork chop sandwich with raw onions and grilled whole jalepeno and really really good fries.

51.description: Pretty good. Had to try their polish sausage . It was good, but the onions  and mustard made it. And free fries too! Friendly. Overall,  a must try.

27.description: This place is a little gem!  The hamburgers and hot dogs are so amazing, they are made to order and you can top them with kraut.  I had the double cheeseburger with sourkraut and my husband got the loaded hot dog.  Both were very good however the hamburger is the winner in my book.  if you are getting fries you have to get the cheese cup, its a little side dipper of hot cheese.... yum!  I would be a repeat customer of this place if I wasnt just visiting.

32.description: One of my favorite spots in Chicago... Hard workers and great cheap food.

54.description: best. fish. sandwich. ever. the. end.(good luck the next mornin doe.. ^___^)

48.description: This restaurant has been in business at the same location for decades.  I have eaten here for many years!!   The quality & taste of the good is still the same (delicious)  the food is also very affordable!!!!   I usually get a beef polish sausage with extra extra onions, extra mustard & extra hot peppers.  No charge for the extras.   The burgers are delicious too!!!   They are open 24/7 they never close!!!!   Delicious, inexpensive food that's worth the trip by car, bike or public transportation, just stop by & try everything on the menu, bring family & friends to share the experience!!!!

44.description: This is the best late night drunk food around. We recently moved away from the UIC area and still find ourselves inexplicably craving Jim's from time to time in the middle of the night.That being said, do yourself a favor and order a fish sandwich with everything (if you're nice, they sometimes won't charge you for the cheese slice!) and a Polish. I've had times where I've ordered extra fries and they've just thrown in like 3 extra bags (no lie) so I ended up with 4 bags of fries. Get a cheese cup for your fries! If you bring your UIC ID, they'll give you a free pop with any sandwich purchase. Also, just FYI, all sandwiches come with a free side of fries.

24.description: I didn't know about this place until last year when I was walking my roommates dog. It's a small stand that serves great Chicago-style hotdogs, polishes and burgers. It's always packed, especially when the Sox are playing and you can be standing in the back of the line and smell that sweet onion from all the way there. It's great and very easy to pig out there. The dog, that greedy fool, was barking and drooling over the food. Of course, we slipped her a small piece of the hotdog. That goes to tell you that it's so good even dogs will want a bite.

7.description: Five stars for the pork chop sandwich. Three stars for the polish sausage. Pork chop (with bone) was awesome- was expecting it to be really fatty and chewy but it was surprisingly tender and was complemented well with a heap of sautéed onions and mustard. Would definitely go back out of my way for another one. Sausage wasn't bad, it just wasn't anything that great.

49.description: Jim, Jim, Jim... I need to quit you lol.My first meal near UIC- both when I was interviewing here and being privileged to live close-by.This shack has been around for what seems like generations (70+ years to be exact). This is a no frills, sandwich/burger joint with some damn good Polish dogs. Every single meal comes with fries as well, which are some of the best I've had in the city. Prices are dirt cheap, tax included, but make sure when they ask you if you "want everything on it," to specify whether you want cheese, cause that'll be 50 cents more.If you're looking for cheap, albeit basic fast food for post drinks or just when you're feeling super greasy, then Jim's is perfect for you. Worth a try if you're in the area, or if you visit me in Chitown, I'll take you there.Parking is available around the shack and can get busy!!PS: Who owns the shack next door?! They essentially price match with each other! Maybe Jim has a brother he's trying to compete against.

40.description: Ok, so, by now, ya'll know how I get down. Let me just say that Chicago is BY FAR, my favorite Midwest city. After cruising the city, sitting in federal buildings, and paying astronomical amounts for parking it was time to head home. No visit to Chicago is complete without pizza, Italian beef, a good steak, Garrett's popcorn or a Chicago style hot dog/polish sausage. This particular trip, I opted for the latter. Jim's is located on a corner near the interstate and upon arrival the smell MAKES you pull your car over. The menu is what it is and if it's not what you're craving, you'd better check your pulse or rethink your life. Hot, FAST, delicious food... Every sandwich comes with fries and there is no way to understand how quickly your food comes to you. Accompanied by peppers that will blind side you with just the right amount of heat, the all beef Polish played in perfect harmony with the sweet, tender grilled onions. For those who can't wait to get home, there is a counter along the front of the building where you can stand and ingest the steamy deliciousness if you're not to afraid of looking like a pig in front of the never ending wave of customers that continue to make their way to the window. Or, you could do like my wife, daughter and myself did and just sit in the car and scarf down your meal like you're ending a 40 day fast. However you get it done, YOU WANT THIS.... TRUST ME! I'd go back right now, but u-turns on the interstate are illegal..... I think.

53.description: Got off the plane, pork chop sandwich before I kiss my mom.Snuck a polish also.  Best in Chicago. Legendary.

30.description: Yessssah!!! This polish hot dog was the bomb! Ok let me say first off that I am NOT a huge fan of mustard. So when I heard this dog would be dressed with mustard, I almost said forget it. Then I was told that it has grilled onions (love 'em) & hot peppers. Annnnd they sold grape soda (a childhood favorite).  Helloooo nostalgia! First (second, third...) bite = fantastic!!  I love that this dog has s rich flavor but not the weird flavor that gives the diner heart burn. Not even with the mustard, onions & peppers. Now that's a feat!The staff was fun & encouraging. They need was traveling and do joked about getting the works. That's what I got. Their best polish dog. Definitely worth the trip. Speaking of trip. Know that to get to this place you've gotta go to the end of Maxwell St, (pass the Indian, Japanese & breakfast restaurants, check out the signs & sculptures about the history of this street) go under the brick awning that says maxwell st. & turn left on union. NOTE:  there are TWO hot dog places about 6 steps away from each other. Be sure you go to Jim's. THAT's the one THISReview is based on. Enjoy!

46.description: I just recently got back from my first trip to Chicago and everyone recommended I go to Jim's Original for a polish. Unfortunately my high hopes were let down because in my opinion it was just okay. The best thing about the place was the free French fries you get with the sandwich. After the wait in line I was hoping that it would have a little more flavor but unfortunately it didn't. I think I'm going to stick with the good ole street vendors from here on out.

1.description: Ordering is short and to the point---whaddya want? Everything on it?  Parking is nuts, so DBF dropped me off and circled the block, which appears common.We split a Polish (with everything) and the accompanying fries. The Polish was cooked just right, hot all the way through and with a good snap to the casing. The fries were crispy outside but fluffy inside, and I devoured my half on my way back to the pickup point.They take card, which puts them another step above Original Maxwell Street--much easier to track expenses when you're traveling on business.

55.description: Although I'm totally in love with their food, I'm not in love with their attitude. I went to this location with a family member of mine about 2 weeks ago and the cook that was there spoke to us as if we were bothering him telling us to "move to the right and go". I understand that this food stand gets pretty busy, but I've seen street walkers that had better attitudes than that cook at Jim's Original. I would hate to see how this guy treats people once he is moved up to the cashier position, lol.

9.description: Hell yes.  24 hour place.  Get the polish with grilled onions and fries on your first visit.  For your second visit (because you will be back) get the grilled porkchop sammie.  This is the best place to go when you are fine with saying screw the low carb, non-gluten, low salt, no fat, paleo bandwagon folks...I want some greasy goodness and I want it now.This is a true Chicago gem.  Screw you NY and LA.  Try to compete with Jim's!

26.description: This place is needed after a few too many. Greasy inexpensive food, no wonder it's right next to the dorms of UIC. I am not a fan of "this type" of food, so maybe it's a bit of a biased review. If you're looking for a decent hot dog, than look no further. Not for me.

25.description: Five stars for the pork chop sandwich. Three stars for the polish sausage. Pork chop (with bone) was awesome- was expecting it to be really fatty and chewy but it was surprisingly tender and was complemented well with a heap of sautéed onions and mustard. Would definitely go back out of my way for another one. Sausage wasn't bad, it just wasn't anything that great.

12.description: This is a pretty good place to get a bite. Food is pretty good and cheap too, not to mention the fact that just about everything comes with free fries! Favorite thing I've gotten here is the Polish, it's juicy and comes loaded with onions that were grilled and caramelized  to perfection. Burgers are very good and not too greasy, hotdogs are good as well but even though it's a hotdog stand, not my first choice. As far as lines and speed of service goes, you have to be mindful of when you go. Lunch time is pretty packed most of the time. If you wait about 30 mins or so after the "typical" lunch time, you should be in n out pretty quick . Parking is the biggest issue, street parking only and lots of people double parking makes it a bit of a hassle. Other than that, this place is awesome for a quick bite.

59.description: Amazzzzzing fries. Great polishes. Cash or credit makes no difference with friendly staff. In and out the line in less than five minutes with food in hand. Will keep going back.

21.description: Sloppy, greasy food right off the highway. The only way they could make it more convenient is if you didn't even have to stop to pick up your food!

17.description: Tastes like God's fingertips.  the fries.  the polish.    everything really.   And the line is always long for a good reason.

10.description: Been here before, but nothing like it use to be. Wasn't impressed anymore. Won't be back. Sorry Jim

5.description: Legit hot dog stand! Excellent hot dog with everything. Make sure to bundle up or you're gonna be dancing while eating to stay warm

3.description: Outstanding dog. We walked a good 2 miles to get to this place and well worth the walk. Even get free fries with your dog! Awesome. Be sure to get everything on it to have the while "bite."

35.description: Skip the hot dogs here and go for the polish dogs! They offer much more flavor with a kick and tastes more authentic than the regular dogs.  We got ours with grilled onions which added some nice sweetness. It's a little greasy but definitely satisfying. Would love to come back and try the pork chop sandwich. We didn't know that all the dogs came with fries so we ended up with 3 orders that we couldn't finish :P

19.description: Ordered the Polish Sausage and Pork Chop.  Both were okay.  Nothing special.  Fries were better than average.Not a must go in Chicago.

28.description: $5 got me a polish sausage in mustard and fries. Best polish sausage I've ever had! It's fast and delicious. Definitely looking forward to coming back.

45.description: I've eaten Jim's Original Polish sausage for breakfast and for dinner. It's so so good and open 24/7, so why not? I didn't think I would like the grilled onions on it, but I would have it no other way...it is the perfect accompaniment! The Polish with fries is a little over 4 bucks and you get it all within a minute. Cheap, quick, and delicious!!

33.description: Jim's, I need to seriously stop going to see you. For under $4, it is such a steal to get a cheap and tasty meal here (plus a free drink if you're a UIC student). Everyone raves about the polish and the pork chop, but my favorite is the fish sandwich. I don't really understand why it doesn't automatically come with cheese (it really should), but I'll let it slide. On the good days, the fries here are absolutely spectacular- they are crunchy, crisp, and delicious! However, over time they have become quite stingy with the portion size of food, PLUS the prices have gone up a good amount over the past two years that I have been a customer here! But regardless of that, Jim's is just so good and convenient that I always come back, even though sometimes I think I shouldn't!

43.description: Growing up in Chicago would not have been the same without these bad boys! My dad would pick sacks of these delicious smoked sausages up for the family (there were 11 of us!) and oh what a treat when he returned with them, their mouthwatering aroma permeating the air! Some of my best childhood memories! Dad used to tell us how "Jim's original Jew town polishes" was mentioned in an old war movie he watched where a few soldiers were reminiscing about their favorite foods. We've long since moved from Chicago but think nothing of taking the long ride into the city just to savor and consume these bad boys again. No other polish sausage, and we've tried plenty, comes close to comparing in flavor and aroma. I always wondered about the polish sausage stand right next door to Jim's Original, the one just down the street until tonight. Jim helped two nephews come to America from another country and these ungrateful thieves robbed his recipe and opened up two stands behind his back! How heartbroken he must be! Please don't patronize the polish sausage stand next to his.  Jim's Original is located on the corner. Thanks, Jim!!

2.description: Was in the area and my friend was hungry and craved a burger so we stopped by this place to get 2 hamburgers and a polish hotdog. The hamburgers were not the best, we basically just got a bunch of mustard, on a patty and bun. There was no flavor but the mustard. My friend didn't even want to finish hers but I did since I don't like to waste food. The polish hotdog was better and the friend were also very good. I don't think we will come back, I'd prefer to go to Wendy's since it seems their junior bacon cheeseburger is the same price and has more toppings and flavor. The staff was very friendly and so I will give them 3 stars.

18.description: Jim, Jim, Jim... I need to quit you lol.My first meal near UIC- both when I was interviewing here and being privileged to live close-by.This shack has been around for what seems like generations (70+ years to be exact). This is a no frills, sandwich/burger joint with some damn good Polish dogs. Every single meal comes with fries as well, which are some of the best I've had in the city. Prices are dirt cheap, tax included, but make sure when they ask you if you "want everything on it," to specify whether you want cheese, cause that'll be 50 cents more.If you're looking for cheap, albeit basic fast food for post drinks or just when you're feeling super greasy, then Jim's is perfect for you. Worth a try if you're in the area, or if you visit me in Chitown, I'll take you there.Parking is available around the shack and can get busy!!PS: Who owns the shack next door?! They essentially price match with each other! Maybe Jim has a brother he's trying to compete against.

41.description: Best drunk food lol why because at night this is where almost all drunks come to buy food. But in all seriousness now hot dogs are awesome and you get so many fries. Wait time is crazy sometimes but their pretty fast in getting your food.

52.description: I never eat hot dogs, but when I do it's in Chicago.I hadn't eaten a hot dog in literally *years* but after 3 days straight of deep-dish pizza on my first trip to the windy city, I figured it was time to mix it up with a local dog.Say what you will about hot dogs, but this place serves a mean one. Delicious, not too greasy and quick.

50.description: Perfect for dogs, maxwells.. quick greasy food. I believe they are open late and are close to UIC. Im sure it gets interesting around 10p or later.. I usually get a bone in pork chop. The quality isnt fantastic but its good fast greasy food and gives you nice little chicago food experience.

4.description: Yessssah!!! This polish hot dog was the bomb! Ok let me say first off that I am NOT a huge fan of mustard. So when I heard this dog would be dressed with mustard, I almost said forget it. Then I was told that it has grilled onions (love 'em) & hot peppers. Annnnd they sold grape soda (a childhood favorite).  Helloooo nostalgia! First (second, third...) bite = fantastic!!  I love that this dog has s rich flavor but not the weird flavor that gives the diner heart burn. Not even with the mustard, onions & peppers. Now that's a feat!The staff was fun & encouraging. They need was traveling and do joked about getting the works. That's what I got. Their best polish dog. Definitely worth the trip. Speaking of trip. Know that to get to this place you've gotta go to the end of Maxwell St, (pass the Indian, Japanese & breakfast restaurants, check out the signs & sculptures about the history of this street) go under the brick awning that says maxwell st. & turn left on union. NOTE:  there are TWO hot dog places about 6 steps away from each other. Be sure you go to Jim's. THAT's the one THISReview is based on. Enjoy!

6.description: If you want an original Chicago hot dog experience, this is your spot. Locals will all agree that Jims is your go to for that perfect greasy hot dog. Ordering from a window is as real as it gets. This was a perfect last minute quick stop for my friends touring Chicago and wanting the true food experience. Sensitive stomachers beware though, it's as greasy as the place looks. All combos come with fries also!

22.description: I mean, it's fine. Nothing to write home about (Unless you have a food diary and are required to write about what you ate and then mail it home).

15.description: I really enjoyed the food here. A small corner stand with big flavor. I had the polish dog and it was by far one of the best I've ever had. The entrees come with fries so you don't have to pay extra for them.  The sautéed onions were full of flavor. I was told this was one of the best hot dog/polish stands in Chicago and I believe it. Just don't take my word for it. Try it!!

57.description: omg!  just get here!  polish sausage to die for!  24/7 too!  Just the right amount of grease!   ;)

20.description: We reached here late at night. It was a cold winter night and the place had perfect food to warm us up. I ordered the polish dog! It was cooked perfectly and the peppers were super spicy. Yum!Did I mention the price is amazing too.

36.description: I've had every thing on the menu and the only thing that isn't fantastic is the pork chop. This may be just me because I have a number of friends who crave it. This is known around here as drunk food, but I think can be eaten at anytime, especially considering its open 24/7. The prices have risen recently which is a shame, but it doesn't take it away from being a must try in Chicago. I recommend (almost) anything on the entire menu.

14.description: I'm from outta town (los angeles) and you can't get a good dog out there, save for 2 spots that are far and usually extremely crowded. Chicago style hot dogs and polish sausages are famous,  so I had to grab one as soon as I got it. I knew Jim ' s was an original and I knew I had to try it. I love places like this because they don't need to sell you on a gimmick or something trendy. It's just old fashion, authentic great taste. It brought back my memories of the original Tommy's burger stand on Rampart in L.A.  That smell, that taste. Perfect.  I had a Vienna hotdog and Polish sausage.  I walked 4 miles round trip from my hotel in 30 degree weather and it was worth it. The fries surprised me. They were crispy and flavorful.  So good.

1.description: I was at Fleet Feet in Old Town for a running event and K-Suerte were there to let us sample their cookies.  I tried the lemon buttersmash.  I don't even like lemon desserts but I almost died after tasting them....SO GOODIt's been almost two years since that fateful day, but since then my best friend ordered a dozen for her room mate's birthday.  She was very satisfied with the service, as the cookies were delivered to her office in the Loop.My birthday is in July and you can bet your bottom dollar I'll be emailing these folks to deliver a few dozen to my office to share with my co workers!

0.description: I had the opportunity to try these cookies when they were brought into my office as a gift. These are seriously the most amazing cookies I've ever had - the original buttersmash is to die for!!! It seems like the two owners cater towards the corporate world and ship these out and/or deliver. I would love to see them target the community a little better. These are fantastic!!!!!

58.description: This place by far sucks. It lacks absolutely everything. The food is gross-'no flavor or bad flavor. It's not "inexpensive" it's over priced for the crappy food they serve. The service people...they don't belong there. I've been treated better at  mcdonalds. They need new management; new cooks new everything. People believe the poor ratings and trust the reviews!

56.description: I went in last December and loved the place but when I went back today it was such a disappointment! What happened to the amazing potato wedges? It seems the menu has been reduced a lot! I ended up having a Hawaiian pizza it was good but definitely not anything special and not worth $16. I will miss the old Leona's but probably will not be going back to this one.

29.description: Well, Leona's lost us as a customer again.  I am writing this after a pizza delivery that has taken 1 hour and 45 minutes to get here.  This is the 2nd delivery that has taken almost 2 hours and been delivered ice cold.  The first one I forgave because it was snowing out.  No More.We came back to Leona's because it had new owners.  The previous owners lost us as customers over a delivery issue, we ordered dinner and it never came.  On top of that the girl that answered the phone was rude and unsympathetic.I could understand if I was a long distance from the restaurant but my home is 1.3 miles from the restaurant, a 5 minute trip no matter what way you take by car.  Since the order was done online, I could understand if I did not give a generous tip but we add almost 20% in addition to the delivery charge up front.After an hour and a half we called to find out what happened to our pizza.  The response we got was "he left about 10 or 15 minutes ago".  Ok, so why does a 5 minute trip take over 30 to get here.  Completely unacceptable.It is a shame too because Leona's does have good pizza, and good food.  They put so little stock in pleasing the customers who for whatever reason can't make it to the restaurant.  Good bye Leona's, there are plenty of other good restaurants that will make an effort to satisfy their customers who think so highly of their food that they are willing to pay extra to have it delivered to them.

42.description: Pizza was excellent, crust was crispy throughout. Ian our server was fantastic, very personable.

23.description: 7 years when I was dating my wife, this was one of our go to places for fast casual dining. Prices were reasonable, service was good and the food was passable. At times a solid 3+ possibly four. Sadly things have changed and not for the better. I went there with my wife and I was not happy with the experience. So much so, I will likely not be back. From the second we ordered, we knew things were not going to go well. My wife wanted an iced tea, they were out of all flavors. She asked for a lemonade, they were out of all flavors. I overheard at another table that their ice machine for frozen drinks was broken so none of those. My wife had the pizza Margherita and I had the lasagna. The lasagna was delicious as it has always been though the portion is shrinking. My meal came with a roll that was swimming already in the pool of tomato sauce around the lasagna. The side salad was bagged lettuce with 1 piece of celery and 1 piece of pepper. Now a pizza Margherita is simple, crust, fresh tomato, fresh mozzarella and fresh basil. Usually these 9" pizzas are on the menu for $9-$12 at equivalent places. This one was $15 plus a two dollar up charge for gluten free which I have no issue with leading to a total price of $17. I am not Italian but I am taking offense on behalf of all Italians out there. There was nothing fresh about this pizza. It had some weird oily pesto on the crust with rubbery mozzarella covering the whole surface and a few slices of watery tomato on top as if it were pepperoni. The taste was ok but it was not what it purported to be and it is not worth 30% more than most other places. Overall not a good experience and with so many good Italian restaurants around, completely unnecessary. For $10-$15 more I could have gone to Rosebud or Francescas.

47.description: PIZZA delivery is great. Decent pie, arrived quickly and was very tasty. Also got a Cesar salad which was great. I saw lots of other negative reviews on yelp, but don't let it scare you away from getting some 'zza delivered to your abode.

8.description: I am kind of baffled with regards to what is happening with the Leona's chain. The Taylor Street location has completely died. There is never more than a few tables of patrons and when the restaurant resorted to serving processed chicken fingers, that was the end for me, someone who used to go to Leona's two to three times a month for almost 15 years. I can't understand how this Taylor Street location manages to stay open? I could speculate but probably would be extremely cynical (and possibly correct).Meanwhile, I go to the Stony Island location on occasion and at that location, you get food that is more reminiscent of the old Leona's, at least when it comes to the chicken tenders. I do miss Leona's burgers, used to have some of the best but not anymore. Once upon (a LONG) time, Leona's used to make my favorite Chicago pizza. That has been gone for a long time but now the pizza is the same level of Tombstone pizza for twice the price. Tombstone may actually be better.We are now going to Jak's Tap a lot more. I miss Leona's chicken tenders with the sesame seeds! I miss well-executed wedge fries. And of course, the Lena Cakes.

31.description: I would give 0 if I could. We ordered from this place because of course the snow has kept us stuck inside so we needed food!Decided to try Leona's out and I'm so disappointed. Especially since it's kinda pricey for take out. I thought, "It's probably really good though!" We ordered two sandwiches, one with soup and one with salad and then we shared a side of broccoli.First off, the delivery guy went to the wrong address so our food was cold when we got it, but it wasn't his fault that the restaurant gave him the wrong address. The first sandwich, the Buffalo Chicken, came with a measley/small piece of lettuce and one tomato slice. This sandwich bread is quite big so I expected enough lettuce and tomato to cover. This sandwich came with the side soup, very very small container. The soup was extremely salty that my bf had to put water in the broth.I got the Tuscany chicken sandwich and it was ok, nothing special. I also got a side salad or as they call it a "psychedelic salad". There was nothing "psychedelic" about it, it was plain lettuce in a small container. Really? Don't use words like that to sell a shitty side salad. I've had better side salads from two star restaurants where they at least put it tomatoes, cucumbers and onion.Then the side of broccoli which was $3.99. It was 4 pieces of broccoli.... To say the least, we are very disappointed that we spent any money on this place.

34.description: We live about 10 minutes drive away from Leona's and frequently order food delivery. This place is awesome. I've only been there once in person but the service was fine. However, the quality of their delivery food and time/accuracy is really great. We order from this place at all hours of the night because I work a late shift. The food always comes when it says it will, it's always hot and delicious. We've gotten most of the things on the menu and never been disappointed. During Lollapalooza we ordered from this place every day and they came within an hour of placing the order. We've also ordered beer when we couldn't get our car out last winter. I seriously love this place. Maybe it's a service issue, but their delivery drivers are awesome and the food is great. The service I've experienced from this place has always been phenomenal.

16.description: The food is good, but these people CANNOT get orders correct!!I used to have my food delivered to my job from Leona's, and all of the simple requests/additions I made to my orders were not made (even after being charged for them). Also, after speaking with the manager the last two times I ordered from there, he STILL got my orders wrong, so I was like forget it! My experience with this location makes me not want to EVER order from a Leona's again.

13.description: Constant problems with to go or delivery I don't understand why if this is a franchise why Leona's corporate doesnt do spot checking to see if they can get their orders correct.I seriously have NEVER ordered here and not had them screw up at least one item. Ordered this week and, sure enough, they remembered my extra dressing but but grilled chicken on my salad when I ordered buffalo chicken. They just can't get it right.They're overpriced and hopeless. Definitely would never eat there in house. Not a classy atmosphere at all. The only reason I keep ordering is I eat low-carb and work late hours and they're the only Little Italy delivery option that does both.PS I've tried to talk to their managers about their constant screw-ups, but it never changes.

11.description: I have not ordered a pizza from Leona's in a very long time and after last night I never will again! It used to be really thin and consistently good, what happened? I knew as soon as I opened the box it was not the same. It is thicker now, the dough is really heavy and the sauce is really bland. We ate a couple pieces from the outside because we were hungry, but then I look at the inside pieces and they weren't even cooked! I could stick my finger in the dough! Nasty! There was this white, bumpy, plastic pan thing on the bottom of the box that the pizza was on top of. They must cook it on there because it made the indentations of the bumps on the crust. It reminded me of the pan things you cook a microwave pizza on! Terrible pizza, what a waste of money!

39.description: Ordered Pizza. Didn't have my ingredient; that was OK. They called, replaced it, but brought the pizza 1hr and 20 minutes later, cold. Taste: horrible. Really bad pizza. Used to be a big fan before, not anymore. It's a shamed as I was a huge fan of the place in the past. Things I'd tried before are definitely worse, too. Not a good place now, sorry. Look for Pizza elsewhere.

37.description: The Leona's franchise is dying.  I've been going to the Leona's on Taylor Street since I was in college in the early 1970's.  When my wife and I moved to the neighborhood in the late 1980's, Leona's was one of our regular favorites.  Sadly, tonight is the last time I will ever go there, despite the free parking.  This once excellent, reliable franchise has deteriorated into a horrible restaurant that serves bad food.  I knew that something was seriously wrong when my wife and I walked in there and a saw that the place was virtually empty on a Saturday night at 6 p.m.  We were seated in one of the front booths and were the only customers in the front half of the restaurant.  Since no one was there, our college student server was attentive and brought us the now sparse menu.  Even with the limited menu, a few items were blocked out with paper strips and when we asked for certain menu items, we were told the restaurant didn't have them.  Leona's was recently sold and has undergone a radical transformation and downsizing of their once fabulous and extensive menu.  When I asked the manager who owned Leona's now, he said that he didn't know!  (He didn't know who employed him and signed his paychecks???)  However, he did come back later and said some Greek lady owned it; a Greek lady now owns an Italian restaurant on Taylor Street.  That explained a lot about the changes to the menu.  My wife ordered iced tea, braised short-ribbed ravioli, and cheesecake with strawberry sauce.  I ordered Pepsi and a chicken parm sandwich that they now put on a panini.  I could tell by the way the place was being run that they were attempting to run it "on the cheap:" the little table games were long gone, no bread before the meal, generic condiments, e.g., ketchup from some off-brand, unheard of manufacturer (probably made in China).  A couple came into the restaurant and sat in the booth behind us.  My wife overheard the man ordering coffee, and the server apologizing because their coffee machine was broken and they had no coffee!  My meal was below average and barely edible, but my wife's was horrible.  Her iced tea tasted like something bought from a cheap generic wholesaler and her ravioli contained some grey substance that tasted foul.  She actually put some of the ravioli filling on her fork, called the manager over, held up her fork to him, and asked him what it was.  He said that he would find out and ran back to the kitchen.  He returned later and said that it was shredded beef (not hardly).  The cheesecake was generic and frozen and tasted like cardboard.  It was with much sadness and anger that I crossed Leona's off of our regular restaurant list.  I predict that they will be closed forever by January 1st.

0.description: My husband and I booked the upstairs room with Leona's for our rehearsal dinner.  We called months in advance to make sure that our order was set, and they were ready to go.  Leona's seemed a little confused and overwhelmed at first with our order the day of when we showed up with a group of 40 a little earlier than expected, but they pulled through.  We called ahead to make sure there was enough wine selection, and they ended up not having any whites available at first.  They had to call other stores to bring in the wine.  The food turned out great, and we received many compliments on the deliciousness of the pizza and fettuccine alfredo.  It ended up being a great time, and the upstairs room was perfect for a group of about 40 to fit.  I'd recommend this place for such an event, just need to make sure they're prepared!

38.description: This place gets one star only because yelp won't let me give 0. We live a block away and decided to order a carry-out order of pizza and shrimp alfredo.  When my husband went to pick up the order the man informed him that they ran out of alfredo sauce - so my husband asked why didn't anyone call us to let us know, the man looked puzzled and said that would've made sense lol! Anyway the pizza was HORRIBLE the crust was like a cracker and there were like 5 bits of pepperoni on it. Little Caesar's pizza is filet mignon compared to the pie we got - seriously I think they get better pizza in prison.

51.description: I dunno what the deal is with every ones reviews but our pizza and service was great! We had 1950 specialty pizza. It was pretty good! The waiter were constantly checking on us and our water glasses were never empty once. The pizza took a little while to get to us but that because they make the pizza fresh to order. It was delicious!

27.description: Pros:+Good Decor+Good ServiceCons:-Portion Sizes-Food QualityWent here with a large party, we were seated promptly and had an excellent waiter. The interior is nice and it's very spacious. The downside is the food, for being a pizza place the pizza is very mundane. The portions on the pasta and salad are as small as they are bland. The flavored lemonades are great.

32.description: Good Italian food and some other American fair.    We are staying at  Rush Hospital and our daily visits here for lunch are super convenient.    They also have parking in the back of the building so it is a lot easier bringing a good.     Both lunches we had excellent and attentive waiters.

54.description: I was not aware that the management had changed and now that I know,  a lot more makes sense. The last couple times i got delivery, the portions have been exceptionally small and the prices are higher. Today, I ordered the Italian beef sandwich for delivery, and at first glance I thought they might have forgotten to pack the other half of my sandwich! After opening it up, I realized this was my whole sandwich. There were about 5 small slices of beef on a very thick roll. I was appalled I paid $10 for it. Probably never going to give my money to this restaurant again.

48.description: Wow, what a difference 6 months makes. I have been going to this Leona's for 20 years, since they opened. It was the best branch, and the most recent manager was great. The menu was great for large groups with food allergies/restrictions. Service was almost always excellent. The quality of food was reliably good. The bread, soup, salads, Lena cakes, pizza, pasta, chicken, all very good. The tiny ice cream sundaes, kids menu, and plethora of choices made it fun to order. The menu was cute and entertaining, fun to read and plan what I would order next time. Today I went and don't think I'll be back. The portions were significantly smaller, there was no bread, the side orders were nonexistent, no more Lena cakes, kids meals were smaller with fewer choices, no more ice cream sundaes, the menu was much smaller, much fewer options, etc. The service was good. Apparently the family sold  to another family, and this family believes in giving very little for the money. I liked the old family, I miss them. New family, please change everything back to the way it was. I feel like I had a big argument with an old friend and now can't see her anymore. The extras and quirkiness were what made Leona's a place where customers felt like family. Now, you might as well be a generic chain, a niggardly stingy chain with nothing to distinguish it. I don't expect them to improve or change anything. I'll just have to find another place to love and take family and friends for fun and good food. So sad.

44.description: Currently waiting over two hours for our single large pizza... I have never waited this long for a pizza delivery. At this point I don't even care about what it tastes like.

24.description: Don't use this app to order from leona's because after waiting for 2 hours for my order to arrive, I called the restaurant and was told that they didn't receive my order and they do not use yelp

7.description: When did Leonas get so incredibly bad? I lived on the north side for years and loved the Leonas up there. This one is absolute garbage. Every time we have ordered via grubhub they have forgotten or screwed up something. No kidding, they are now 4 out of 4 on incorrect orders - shame on us for thinking they'd get their act together. Pizza is a joke. They got rid of the boom boom sauce for the chicken tenders, and everything else has lacked in taste as well. Do not order/eat here, unless you feel like burning your money.

49.description: Had dinner with my wife the other day and everything was great.  The service was attentive and prompt.  We tried their new summer shrimp specials and it was delicious.  It tasted fresh and the seasonings were well balanced.  We will definitely go back to try out their other dishes!

40.description: I don't know if I should start by discussing the rubbery, cold calamari (that was, in fact, only 1/3 actual calamari and 2/3 fried, unknown vegetables- a fact not advertised on the menu), or the fact that the garden salad that I ordered came piping hot (yes, if this conures up images of slimy lettuce and soggy tomatoes, your imagination is accurate). Like any good tale, though, I suppose the best place to start is the beginning, where we placed an order on GrubHub. We were both under the weather and had a busy day, so we decided to order out. Initial estimate, 45 minutes- no problem. Flash forward OVER AN HOUR AND A HALF LATER, still no food. GrubHub kindly offers $5 off and assures us the food will be here soon. And they were right- heavens to murgatroyd- that congealed, single solidified wad of cold noodles did finally come to our door masquerading as the "fetuccini Alfredo" we ordered. Also, I probably shouldn't mention it here, but something illegal happened- we were also delivered a lethal weapon- the rock hard day old bread that came with the fetuccini! (I'll be keeping it for defense purposes). The fetuccini was not only a solid formation of cold noodles, but even heated up (because, you know, you should have to microwave your order), it was bland and disgusting.  The "salad" was about $10 and was nothing like the old, awesome, huge, flavorful leonas salads of the golden ages (before new management). It was (inexplicably) piping hot- how this happens when the rest of the order is totally cold is as mysterious to me as how every single ice cube in our raspberry lemonade a melted between leaving the restaurant and landing at my front door. Anyway, I will say we got a hamburger in our order that was cold but at least edible- but all in all, it's hard to f*%k up a burger. Leonas used to be SO awesome- in guessing those big square cheese sticks and in incredible lasagnas are gone for good. Sigh.

53.description: Ownership of this restaurant changed In Oct. The food is definitely not as good as the original owners and there is much less of it. They no longer bring you the complimentary hot bread before the meal. If you are lucky you might get a room temperature breadstick with your pasta. I am done with Leona's. When we tried to tell the waiter he suggested we tell them up front but when we left there was nobody up front and it was obvious he wasn't interested. It was about 1:30 in the afternoon on Father's Day and there were only two other tables with diners,  that should tell you something.

30.description: Last 3-4 pizzas we got weren't good and the delivery usually take closer to 1.5 hours.

46.description: This review makes incredibly sad to have to write. This used to be my absolute favorite take out place in the city. They had amazing, oversized burgers, great sandwiches, huge, fresh salads and a lasagna type mac and cheese that I would have ordered at part of my last meal if I were on death row. Apparently, their ownership changed hands and it went downhill from there. They removed a TON of their go to menu items (no more mac n cheese). My office was looking for a place to order food from and I suggested Leona's. A few of my coworkers ordered pizza which was good, but 3 of us ordered the Leona's chopped salad - which USED to be my favorite salad in the city. As soon as they arrived, you could tell they were different. Smaller and the ingredients looked old and the lettuce like out of a bag. The chicken on top also looked sad and we couldn't tell if it was breaded or not. The worst part is when you opened the salads, they overwhelmingly smelled like FISH. How does that happen?! And the overall taste of them was fishy. It was so bad that we called them back to have them switch out our order and sent back all of the salads so they could see (smell) what we were talking about. I felt embarrassed to have been the one to recommend this place. Sad to lose one of my favorite places :(

1.description: Like so many other reviews, I at one time adored Leona's. The service has suffered. The portions and food quality have also suffered. There seem to be no "extras" anymore. I won't be back. RIP cheese Twinkie, baked garlic chicken, good marinara.

55.description: Happened upon this place via GrubHub. I had the veal and mushroom ravioli. Can't complain - it was good. Ended it with the Tiramisu - I love Tiramisu and theirs was very good. Solid Italian inspired food and I would definitely be willing to try some of their other dishes. Price is excellent for the amount of food you get as well. Not bad.

9.description: I am just heartbroken when I came to Leonas to dinner tonight for the first time in 5 years. We used to go to the Bridgeview location all the time but they closed. I was so excited to get some yummy hot garlic bread before my meal, eat the best chicken fingers I've ever had, and top my meal off a Lena cake, an absolutely amazing desert. Well I can't be more disappointed. As I sat down and asked our waiter where the bread was he said the new owner got rid of that. I got my chicken fingers and they are not the same strips like before. These are disgusting processed chicken that you can get out the freezer section at your grocery store. I was even more upset when I learned that you no longer get a Lena cake with your meal. I can't believe the new owners got rid of all the things that made Leona so wonderful. The food is just terrible now. I WILL NEVER GO BACK AGAIN... Unless some new owners take it over and change it back to the old Leonas we all know and love :(

26.description: The food is good, but these people CANNOT get orders correct!!I used to have my food delivered to my job from Leona's, and all of the simple requests/additions I made to my orders were not made (even after being charged for them). Also, after speaking with the manager the last two times I ordered from there, he STILL got my orders wrong, so I was like forget it! My experience with this location makes me not want to EVER order from a Leona's again.

25.description: I don't normally write reviews but almost every time I order from here the delivery time is ridiculously longer than projected. I've ordered online several times and again this time, it was almost 2 hrs before I got my order. I called around the 1.5 hr mark and they said it would be leaving soon..to make it worse, I live less than 10 mins away. When I finally got the order, the promise time was an hr earlier than what I actually got it!The food is usually good and I keep giving them the benefit of the doubt, but this delivery service is definitely making me not want to give money to this establishment anymore.

12.description: Ordered delivery 10.21 at 622pm, food still isn't here at 732, it's a hour and a half after I order online. Call and after 7 rings someone answers. I ask about the order and they give me a 10 dollar credit. 818 rolls around and food still isn't here. I call again because now it's 2 hours. They call the driver and he's parking...2 hours for wings, chicken breast, cheese sticks and two sides? By the time the food got to me it was COLD. The chicken breasts was dry and over cooked. The cheese sticks were cold and not crispy. 10 dollar credit, like I would ever order from there again? What a disappointment and I didn't expect to be eating dinner close to 9pm. Keep the credit.

59.description: It pains me deeply to write this review. I started going to Leona's in 1989 and had been amazed over the years in the consistency and quality of the food and the service at any location I had ever visited. Having moved back to the area after several years away, I could not wait to go back for some of my favorites like the lasagna, the cheeseburger pizza, the hamburger pizza, the psychedelic salad and even the occasional fruit cup. In October of 2013, Leona's did not disappoint. The psychedelic did not have all the specialty greens that it once had but is was still good. The other specialties were as amazing as I remembered. In January 2014 I read that Leona's had sold the business and had new management. Although I was a bit worried, I tried not to panic thinking that the new owners were at least smart enough to keep the current menu. Now it is March 2014 and I have had the misfortune of ordering from them three times in the last month. They do have a new menu, which is as basic as a mall food court pizza place. The food, delivery and the service are night and day different in a bad way. Gone are basically anything distinctive and unique. Gone are the cheeseburger pizza, the hamburger pizza, the psychedelic salad.Even basic stuff like the hickory burger that was on the previous menu, is now a build your own sandwich exercise, and even when you tell them the ingredients, it does not taste the same. I had a salad instead of fries and the salad came in the smallest little food container I had ever seen.  The items on the salad looked like something from a hospital dining tray. The dressing was terrible. My hubby had the fries and they were an embarrassment. He could not believe it came from Leona's. Instead of burger, I ordered fried catfish. You used to be able to order a small or large and you would have 2 very nice side items like pasta. That is gone too. I also used to have Leona's cater special events for me but no more. I am so very sad that the business and clients the Leona's family has built for 50 years is going down in flames in less than a few months of new ownership. I'm sure the new owners think they are saving money by cutting the quantity and quality of the food but if I am no longer a customer, how much money can you make from me?I woefully have to cut Leona's off of my go to list. Chicago doesn't need a run of the mill pizza joint. They need the family dining restaurant that has thrived of 50 years. Wise up new owners before it is too late.

21.description: Disgusting! I wish I could give it zero stars. We decided to hit up Leona's instead of Pompei because they have free parking. Next time I'll just keep searching for paid parking. The bathroom for starters was so gross on so many levels. I had two toddlers that of course had to go potty right when the pizza arrived. I always bring potty seats for them... But this time unfelt the need to clean the potty seat right after using it on the potty! The waiter was clueless and confused! He brought the wrong salad. We had no utensils for half the time (despite constant reminders). He even said he couldn't be bothered to box our pizza because he had "other things to do." The pizza was sub-par and honestly I question the cleanliness of this place. My niece was even served a dirty glass! Like noticeably dirty. The waiter said its because they use high powered washers? Huh?!?!? Oh yeah... And I wouldn't say their pizza is necessarily cheap either. We spent $130 in this dump... Not including our tip!!!!Anyways...never again! Just go to Pompei!!!

17.description: Well, Leona's lost us as a customer again.  I am writing this after a pizza delivery that has taken 1 hour and 45 minutes to get here.  This is the 2nd delivery that has taken almost 2 hours and been delivered ice cold.  The first one I forgave because it was snowing out.  No More.We came back to Leona's because it had new owners.  The previous owners lost us as customers over a delivery issue, we ordered dinner and it never came.  On top of that the girl that answered the phone was rude and unsympathetic.I could understand if I was a long distance from the restaurant but my home is 1.3 miles from the restaurant, a 5 minute trip no matter what way you take by car.  Since the order was done online, I could understand if I did not give a generous tip but we add almost 20% in addition to the delivery charge up front.After an hour and a half we called to find out what happened to our pizza.  The response we got was "he left about 10 or 15 minutes ago".  Ok, so why does a 5 minute trip take over 30 to get here.  Completely unacceptable.It is a shame too because Leona's does have good pizza, and good food.  They put so little stock in pleasing the customers who for whatever reason can't make it to the restaurant.  Good bye Leona's, there are plenty of other good restaurants that will make an effort to satisfy their customers who think so highly of their food that they are willing to pay extra to have it delivered to them.

10.description: Stay away from this place. The receptionist sucks. She took my order. Never came. Charged me and then they closed. I ordered with plenty of time btw. This is the third time this happens and for sure never ordering from here again. The service SUCKS
