5.description: It is absolutely tragic what the new owners of the Leona's chain have done to it.  They should be drawn and quartered.  This used to be one of, if not the, best Italian joints around.  Now, it is simply awful.  Most of the menu is new, but even the holdover items have been ruined.  Everything is bland and low quality.  Portions are smaller now, but that's actually good, because the preparation is so bad, you aren't going to want to eat much of it.  The cheapest pasta in your grocery store is better than what they are serving here these days.Service is fine, and I actually feel bad for the staff, who probably have to deal with no end of complaints about the "food".  Atmosphere was never a real strong point, but has gotten worse.Those really don't matter, though, when the food is this awful.  Please someone buy Leona's away from the current owners, and bring it back to life.  I used to practically live off Leona's, but I will never be back under the current ownership.  I cannot imagine how the previous owners feel about what has happened.  Like many other reviewers, I'd give zero or negative stars here if I could.

3.description: Wow, i never thought an actual sit down family restaurant would come in second after Burger King. I am new to the City and when my parents came to visit, i thought of this place.Dad order the blackened catfish, mom order the spaghetti and meatballs and I ordered lasagna. A few minutes after we got our food, no one at the table wanted to continue eating the food, it was just awful. This place needs help ASAP. I was told all these great things about Taylor street food, but the only go to that Ive found is busy burger.

35.description: Anytime I visit Chicago, I always want Leonas. It is generally a really good deal and food is plentiful and delicious. But I have never been to this one until yesterday and it was quite disappointing. They did not have any of there long island mixes, or frozen alcolic drink mixes. The server did make Margarita on the rocks., whick was mostly a sweet and sour mix and barley any teguila. It just gave me a stomach ach . My five cheese lasagna was really soupy, no bread offered to the table. The kids had pizza and they said the crust was too hard. The 15 minute chicken wings took 45 minutes. We had all finished eating by the time my husband got his food. The table before us had the same problem, everyone else had there food, but the dad didn't have his pizza and the fam was all done eating. The timing with cook staff was really dissapoing, food was was awful, The Greek manager could have cared less about really truly managing the place, I don't think this place will last at the rate it was going.It was a Saturday night dinner and only had  7 seated tables in the place. That shouldhave been my first indication that the locals knew something about the food and drinks that I didn't. I know I won't be back, truly dissapointing restaurant.

19.description: Ordered a chicken salad to be delivered to my hotel. Took over 1 hr, 2 little pieces chicken strip, and no fork. I had to eat a salad with my fingers at 11pm. Sucks!

28.description: Ordered lunch for my department since it was cold and end of the month is crazy for us. We ended up waiting 2 hours for a delivery that resulted in us having cold food. When I called to complain, I was blown of by the order taker Chris. I asked to speak to a manager and was told they were too busy to come to the phone. If you do not want to work at Leona's Chris, get a new job. I hope the owners appreciate you because today we did not and you lost any future business. I will also tell as many people as possible to help them avoid a similar fate. #HCShowtime19dacritic #HCShowtime19DONOTUSEBUSINESS

45.description: Can you give zero stars? Where to even begin with this place...Went to this place Years ago with the grandparents plenty of times. Food was always great. Kick ass garlic bread, stuffed artichokes, just good Italian food. Anyway took my gram to dinner thinking we could get some old favorites And everything was horrible. It's some type of pizzeria now. Bad service, dirty, food took hour + and the pizza was freezing cold. This place absolutely sucks. Period

33.description: Other than The pizza special on Monday this place has gone downhill. They used to have an expansive menu with many options. Now the menu is tiny and the items they have on there are simply not that great. I don't know why they decided to do what they did, perhaps corporate greed. But the product really has been downgraded. Service is good but the product is terrible.

43.description: Have gone to Leona's many times.  Was afraid to go back to Leona's after reading these reviews.  Happy to report we has a good experience.  Veggie burger, Ravioli, fish all very good.  However, couldn't order strawberry Daiquiri because out of strawberries....out of several items for entrees?  Service slow (long time to get our drinks etc) but we were in no hurry.  Natalie was our waitress and was delightful and working as fast as she could.  Owner needs to staff more as Natalie was alone.  I hope the new management figures it out and this restaurant succeeds.

2.description: I visited Chicago after moving away for 2 years and to eat at my favorite spot for Italian Food and I could not believe what happened to this place! It's like going to a neighborhood dive or something. The menu is very skimpy and missing a lot of the Leona's favorites. The mozzarella sticks look horrible with average taste, no red zinger lemonade, the blackout brownie is gone, and the lasagna is very average now. New management has not done this location well AT ALL!

18.description: Good food, TERRIBLE service.Walked in and stood at the front while three employees sat at a table gossiping and ignoring that there were customers waiting to be sat. Finally, I went back to ask if we could be seated. Elizabeth sat us with her food in her hand and threw the menus on the table to avoid getting her food all over. She hardly came back. The food took 40 minutes to come to us and we were the only people in the place. I resorted to asking another server to help us. I then asked for the waitress to get our bills, she took  way too long to get the bill back to us after I gave her my card. I will never go back here. Horrible service for only having three tables in the building. As a previous server myself, I am usually very understanding. But, tonight there were no reasons for the terrible service.

41.description: Today's order included: Hot wilted salad, raw potato wedges, rubbery calamari (which for some unknown reason, had more fried beans, fried peppers, fried onions, and fried tomatoes - but hardly any actual calamari), watery strawberry lemonade (that I am assuming it one point had actual ice it), dried pasta, and my favorite hard as rock bread. The worst part about this $70 waste of money, is that we were having friends over - and I felt like I had to apologize over and over again because the food was so nasty.This of course was compounded by the fact that the food showed up more than 45 minutes after it was supposed to.I know that the restaurant just got bought out by new owners, because the last time we went in it wasn't as good as I remembered. However, I was hopeful that given some time on the new management would get their stuff together and start producing some epic food - like the Leona's I remember from 2003. This has not happened.Don't waste your money. Chicago has so many different options, it be hard to go wrong going anywhere else.Update -I feel like it's proper to update that when I called Grub Hub to make the same complaint made in the review - the restaurant did give me a partial refund.... Which means I only wasted $46 dollars - plus the time it took to be on the phone with Grub Hub twice this evening and then the time writing the initial review and this update.Up from one star to two for the partial refund.

52.description: Food is ok. This location has completely lost it's charm. I'll stick to Taylor Street. I understand changes to the menu but they nickel and dime you got everything. Hot sauce for dipping shrimp is 50 cents extra! I think they lost their liquor license because the cabinets were all locked. What kind of family restaurant doesn't serve alcohol :) No thanks!  Also, the hosts are kind of rude.

50.description: Ugh, the new owners changed the pizza crust. The cheesecake is different now too. Bummer, as I am not impressed with any of the updates. Sigh :(

4.description: One word TERRIBLE !!!!!!From the cockroach crawling on the wall last night to the nasty bathrooms and small portions...CLOSE IT DOWN !!!!

6.description: What Happened to Leonas?I recall a time during which Leona's had all fresh, all home made and  never frozen foods.  I asked the server about the homemade lemonade - we've never had homemade lemonade he says.  Clearly, he has not been around and eaten Leona's when they had freshly made lemonade with a sugared rim and you could get it spiked too.  They also used to have a wine spritzer with fruit floating on the bottom of the glass which was delicious in the 90s -  but he would not know that.  Then we asked about the bread - they no longer give bread with the meals he said.  We asked about their chicken strips (a la adult - as they used to call them) No more.  Sesame seeds and that delicious salty taste gone.  Now its tasteless panko type of crisp.  And two sides - no more can you get fettucini alfredo (or lasagna for an extra $1) now fetuccini alfredo with your chicken strips will cost you an additional $4.99.  Everything has changed.  Leona's is not what it used to be, fresh, never frozen and flavorful. I am disappointed, and sad.  I won't even talk about the sticky table cloths or dirty bathroom. Sad.  Very sad indeed.

22.description: Constant problems with to go or delivery I don't understand why if this is a franchise why Leona's corporate doesnt do spot checking to see if they can get their orders correct.I seriously have NEVER ordered here and not had them screw up at least one item. Ordered this week and, sure enough, they remembered my extra dressing but but grilled chicken on my salad when I ordered buffalo chicken. They just can't get it right.They're overpriced and hopeless. Definitely would never eat there in house. Not a classy atmosphere at all. The only reason I keep ordering is I eat low-carb and work late hours and they're the only Little Italy delivery option that does both.PS I've tried to talk to their managers about their constant screw-ups, but it never changes.

15.description: I would give 0 if I could. We ordered from this place because of course the snow has kept us stuck inside so we needed food!Decided to try Leona's out and I'm so disappointed. Especially since it's kinda pricey for take out. I thought, "It's probably really good though!" We ordered two sandwiches, one with soup and one with salad and then we shared a side of broccoli.First off, the delivery guy went to the wrong address so our food was cold when we got it, but it wasn't his fault that the restaurant gave him the wrong address. The first sandwich, the Buffalo Chicken, came with a measley/small piece of lettuce and one tomato slice. This sandwich bread is quite big so I expected enough lettuce and tomato to cover. This sandwich came with the side soup, very very small container. The soup was extremely salty that my bf had to put water in the broth.I got the Tuscany chicken sandwich and it was ok, nothing special. I also got a side salad or as they call it a "psychedelic salad". There was nothing "psychedelic" about it, it was plain lettuce in a small container. Really? Don't use words like that to sell a shitty side salad. I've had better side salads from two star restaurants where they at least put it tomatoes, cucumbers and onion.Then the side of broccoli which was $3.99. It was 4 pieces of broccoli.... To say the least, we are very disappointed that we spent any money on this place.

57.description: Did this Leona's get new management??? what the hell happened to this place?  I'm not saying that it was ever a 5 star kind of place, but anytime we stopped by it was a great deal, good service - so much so that we were regular customers.  But today will be my last visit here.  They changed the buffet - trimmed it down to almost nothing but kept the price.  Chicken strips were cold, and are NOT the same recipe as before.  Not sure if the buffet still included dessert (like it did before) because the person who was supposedly waiting on us, did NOTHING but bring us water and utensils, no condiments besides salt and pepper (no parmesan, crushed red pepper, NADA). Never checked on us, never asked if we wanted dessert, never asked anything!!  He just walked by and picked up plates once in a while - except for my co-worker's empty plates, he pretended like they weren't there.  I had to literally wave my credit card in the air for him to give us the check, and when he did, he actually threw the little folder with the check on our table!!  Not even a thank you come again...nothing!  It was another person that came to take it when I put my credit card in there, at least he said thanks.  AWFUL!  No wonder it was empty during a time that use to always be packed with customers.

20.description: Good food, TERRIBLE service.Walked in and stood at the front while three employees sat at a table gossiping and ignoring that there were customers waiting to be sat. Finally, I went back to ask if we could be seated. Elizabeth sat us with her food in her hand and threw the menus on the table to avoid getting her food all over. She hardly came back. The food took 40 minutes to come to us and we were the only people in the place. I resorted to asking another server to help us. I then asked for the waitress to get our bills, she took  way too long to get the bill back to us after I gave her my card. I will never go back here. Horrible service for only having three tables in the building. As a previous server myself, I am usually very understanding. But, tonight there were no reasons for the terrible service.

36.description: The Service is excellent that's why I'm giving two starts. The environment is not too bad. But the pizza is just 7 eleven crust with a bunch of ingredients not well mixed... Totally lack of flavour. I was disappointed as was very very hungry! :(

14.description: I went in today for the lunch buffet with high expectations since it is a Italian restaurant in little Italy!! I must say this was the most flavorless buffet I have ever had. Pasta had sauce but the sauce had no flavor it was like eating wet noodles. Pizza was OK, I would compare it to a poor delivery chain. Recommendation to the owners, a buffet attracts clientele put work into your sauces so you have return clientele. Sad sad day for Leona's

12.description: I very large repertoire of comic books. The owner is thinking of starting a book club.  He could use one of the comic books, some of them are large! They also have other  cute items, like t-shirts.

7.description: Today i was for the first time at First Aid Comics. The guys over there were very friendly and they even called the other store to ask if they have the comics in stock that i was looking for! Would recommend this place to everybody who is looking for a great comic store!

3.description: I first started going to First Aid Little Italy to play Friday Night Magic. They have alternating Standard and Drafts on Friday nights, and EDH on Sundays. The people who play at this shop are friendly, helpful, and really fun to play with. This is not a very competitive location: That is to say, if you want to hang out with some chill people, play some Magic, and just kill time on a Friday night, then this is the place to be. They charge retail pricing for boxes and fat packs (which makes them more expensive than buying online), but it's nice to support a local business rather than a big online retailer. On the comics side, they have a nice selection and are always happy to order whatever you're looking for if they don't have it. The store owner, Tom, gives great recommendations. He's very honest about what he thinks are good (or bad) comics and won't just try to give you the hard sell to make you buy things. There's also a nice selection of children's items, and I see a lot of kids come by the store. Also available are various figurines, board/card games, and knick knacks (buttons, magnets, shirts, etc.) which makes this a nice place to go if you need a gift for someone who is into comics or games.

1.description: This store has a nice mixture of old and new comic booksHas a nice mixture of comic book related apparel, action figures and what i do notsee everyday: buttons!Parking was a little hard to find Great customer service, and cool atmosphere for the area

2.description: A great shop that is well organized, has great variety, and an amazing helpful staff. My son has had a bad year at school with a teacher who completely turned him off reading. I took him to First Aid Comics on Saturday to try and get him to read something just for fun. He read some comics back to back, but when I asked to buy him some more he got angry and said, "No!" The man running the shop saw it all and asked me very quietly if he could slip a free Star Wars teaser comic into my purchase of Pez. I said, yes, he did and my son read the "teasers" that night. I was so happy to see him reading again. Definitely going back.

9.description: Two years later and I'm hooked on this store! I will never stop coming back, and Tom is the most knowledgeable man in the world when it comes to comics. I don't know what I'd do without this store, or the wonderful people that help keep it going!

10.description: Pretty decent shop , bargain box full of varius under rated comics, might come back for a few daredevil comics though

13.description: Our 6 and 8 year old boys love this place.  We have been coming there since the day they opened and even held a birthday party for one of our boys there.  The people who run the store are knowledgeable, friendly and all around nice.  The store has a great selection of comics, and a game area in the back.  We are lucky to live nearby such a great comic store.

16.description: I've been to almost every comic store in the city and this is hands down the friendliest place you'll walk into. Any request they will accommodate and this is truly a business that appreciates repeat customers. I only wish that their vintage selection was a bit bigger at this location, but that's only because as a collector I'd prefer to give them my business rather than Chicago Comics or Graham Crackers. This is definitely a store for the true comic lover that likes their weekly routines and BS'ing with the employees about the running stories. Just a great store all around.

17.description: I have visited this location several times because I live in Pilsen. The owner is super helpful and the location is perfect because no other comic shop is even close in proximity.

15.description: Love love LOVE this shop. Tom, the owner, is extremely friendly and an honest businessman. I've been coming to this shop regularly for over a year for Friday Night Magic. If you're into MTG you should really check out the community here.

0.description: I decided to start reading comics and walked into this store with no comic knowledge whatsoever. Tom and his employees were incredibly helpful with recommendations and now I am completely hooked. I've been to a few other stores and they just can't compare. The selection and the staff make this store a must visit.

5.description: I love coming to First Aid Comics on Taylor Street I wouldn't go anywhere else they treat their customers with respect I've been to other comic books stores and none can compare to the experiences I've encountered at first aid comics on Taylor Street I collect Scotty young variants and they have new Scotty young comics every week other comic book shops can't compare if you have any questions they're open to answering any questions on the spot other comic book shops charge subscription this comic book shop doesn't that's how much they love their every day customers and I will be taking my business there until the day I die I highly recommend this comic book shop if you love collecting comic books I love this comic book shop with a passion. From the Rudys

11.description: An amazingly friendly comic book shop! Me and my girlfriend first visited this place on a summer afternoon after we shared some lemon Italian ice from Mario's down the street. The owner of the store greeted us with a smile and was very friendly. Being a 25 year old that likes Archie comics and Peanuts, the owner helped me out and showed me the little kids section as we talked about how great Charlie Brown is. With that alone me and my girlfriend had to buy a bundle of comics and toys. Great store with great people!

8.description: Been here just once, but once was all I needed to realize this place is great.I came to pick up a menton 3 variant cover of an x-files book for my girlfriend, and wound up shooting the breeze with the owner about David Mack. I wound up picking up a few kabuki tpbs I didn't already have on dude's recommendation. Great shop with impeccable taste!

4.description: Comic book stores usually look the same. You got your endless racks of comics, a few expensive figurines, some fictional novels, and maybe a board game section. Though I'm sure keeping comic book stores orderly and clean is hard work, it doesn't change the fact that most comic stores look the same, give or take bigger or smaller spaces.With this in mind, what can make a comic store stand out are the people working in said comic store. A friendly face and great customer service can go a long way in making a specific comic store your go to place to get your comic book fix.This is where First Aid Comics stands out above the rest. The owner of this place is probably one of the friendliest people I know and the rest of his staff aren't far behind. Their customer service is fantastic and you can tell the staff are knowledgeable about at least the basics of any series you can ask them about. I've called them up a few times and they are just as friendly on the phone as they are in person.This is a great place to give your comic book business to due to the friendly atmosphere, especially if you're like me and only by comics once a month.

14.description: My first comic book store and I cannot get enough of this place. Tom is very helpful and patient with the newcomers to the comic book world. I love how you can send him an email and he'll respond quickly to any concern you might have. You feel welcome when you stepped into the shop. The layout of the shop is very organized. You can find anything on the shelves. There's a comic book for anyone too. You have the luxury to subscribe to your favorite comic books and Tom will hold them aside for you. Quick and easy system for those monthly releases. You cannot beat the service being provided here. I'll definitely be visiting this shop for more often and hopefully expand my knowledge about comics so I can start my own collection.

6.description: Love my local comic book store! Great selection and friendly staff. I even recently commissioned them to make custom buttons for my upcoming fundraiser.

3.description: Their Smoothies and sandwiches are great!!! I am addicted to island green and pesto chicken flatbread. Prices are not bad especially you can get a smoothie for 3$ with any food order.

1.description: Great post work out mealGrab a smoothie and a wrap for around 7/8 bucksAnd their smoothies are velvety and freshGo to:Mango smoothie and chipotle bbq wrap

2.description: Great selection of smoothies for a great price. I usually get the boosted smoothies with less sugar and they taste amazing. Sometimes, though not often, the smoothies run a little too icy or too watery in consistency. I also love the chipotle and pesto chicken flatbreads but I feel that they are slightly overpriced for what they're worth. They have Belly rewards which is a huge incentive to go often and rack up points. Lastly, like others have said you need to have your UIC ID to get to the shop so that's a little inconvenient.Overall, I like their menu items and would definitely recommend their food over anything in the Inner Circle/SCE.

5.description: The food here is surprisingly good, in large part due to the tasty bread.  Smoothies are also yummy.

6.description: The best meal if you don't have time to leave campus.  They have the best breakfast sandwiches, deli sandwiches, and smoothies.  If you join their text message alerts you receive a discount your first time there. They will also send you text alerts on discounts every week or so. Smoothies are made with fresh ingredients, natural sugars, and real fruit.  Staff is really nice and willing to give their opinion on what their favorites are. One of my favorite things they have is a toasted pita bread with a whole fresh cut banana, peanut butter, honey, and granola. It will keep you full while studying! Another goodie is their classic breakfast sandwich.  It is cheaper than Dunkin Donuts and bigger!  Downfall to this place is that you need a University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC)  id to get into the gym.  Upside is that I can at least tell people that "I went to the gym." =)

0.description: OMG MAH SAHMOOTHIE FIX.seriously.thank GOODNESS for tropical smoothie.and their texts!basically ALL their smoothies are goodi have this problem where i cant stop getting the CHICKEN PESTO AND ACAI BERRY BOOST.but DENGGG i LAV IT.haaaapeople there are really friendly and niceand patient with very indecisive people like mesmoothie portions are HUGEso theyre perfect :D

4.description: Their chicken pesto flatbread is pretty awesome. And pretty sure this is the only place you could get a flatbread sandwich and a smoothie for less than $10.

58.description: you will pay 40$ for nothing but rice, hope you love rice!!!

56.description: This place has good sushi for reasonable prices and was a usual stop of mine. However recently I had an experience there with very rude wait staff. They took very long, barley said anything, and charged us for food we didn't order, and then would not take it off the bill. Needless to say, I will not be returning.

29.description: Place is good. Good value for your money. A little outdated but I honestly enjoyed the food. Service was a little slow and dry for the empty venue.

42.description: Horrible! I just ordered from them via Grub Hub and this is the saddest sushi I have ever had. Tempura arrived cold and they forgot my mochi. Miso soup was bland and just tasted like broth. The asparagus maki was tempura which was not mentioned in the description. Will never order from here again and neither should you.

23.description: I am a frequent Ichiban diner, and only for a few reasons.1. I think the sushi is delicious and reasonably priced.2. I like the all you can eat special3. BYOBHOWEVER, the service is a little ridiculous. Sometimes, when they aren't busy, service is fine. When they are busy, it seems that the waitstaff gets stressed and starts becoming very unprofessional. For example, one summer day, I went in with my boyfriend. We waited probably twenty minutes for the ONE waitress to clear the outdoor seating after a party had left. We waited because we figured it would take 5 minutes, but nope.Last night I went in with a party of 6 at 8pm. The waiter told me the restaurant closed at 9... fine with us. I figured okay they don't seat any more customers after 9pm, typical for a restaurant.  After we had sat down, he told us that the kitchen actually closes at 8:30. Cool... So 9:10 rolls around, waiter comes by and tells us that their credit card machine closes down at 9... Okay yeah, bullshit. But whatever, we were done eating anyways. Didn't even offer us any to-go boxes for food or refilled waters. Not a good way to run a business. These people are completely rude. As I was walking home, I noticed Hana Sushi actually is BYOB too. I will probably begin taking my business there.

47.description: $18.99 all you can eat sushi Sundays and apparently every day after 4, "all you can eat to go" is 19.99 for 4 rolls. The lunch ayce is $13.99.... always so fresh and so amaiznggggg!

8.description: I have been here 6 times and they've only been open 2 of those times....  Sushi here is average and all you can eat is always a great option if you are starving but it doesn't really help when you go on a friday night at 6 and they are closed...  The all you can eat is a great deal but service takes maybe 30-40 mins per a round.  Put aside sometime assuming that they are open...

31.description: I am not a fan on paying for non-AYCE sushi spots.  I understand that not all AYCE sushi spots have the best tasting sushi out there, but this place makes me regret not paying for nigiri and rolls separately.  I've been here a few times and the most recent time left me unsatisfied for my occasional sushi cravings. The rice was overcooked--it didn't even taste like Japanese rice. I wouldn't be surprised if they used Chinese rice. Then they use so much of it in the rolls so if you plan on coming here expect to have a plan to burn all those carbs you are going to consume. Don't get the tempura because it doesn't taste like it. It tasted like it was fried in the same old oil they use to cook some Chinese dishes. I also thought all the rolls I got tasted about the same. I couldn't even tell the difference when I was reluctantly stuffing my face. I live in the area so I would come here to try to satisfy my AYCE sushi craving without having to  drive all the day up north to sushi para 2. I think I would rather drive up there now or find a different sushi spot that may not be AYCE.

34.description: This place does not disappoint. I honestly don't know why this place only received 3 1/2 stars. The all you can eat sushi special is superb. It totals to 18 bucks with tax and gratuity. The sushi itself is better than most places. I've been going here throughout the years and the quality of sushi has remained the same. I definitely recommend everyone to go here.Don't listen to all these hating ass haters talking about "forced gratuity, poor quality, etc". A mandatory gratuity was instituted because cheap ass people don't know how to tip. I can go on for days. Reading all these negative ass reviews from people disgusts me.

16.description: I came here for the AYCE sushi buffet and though the food may be good the services sucks really bad. I went with my brother here last month and there were only 4 table with customers and yet it took 45 minutes EACH time I put an order in...I assumed it's a tactic to make you full since you wait a long time before having seconds. I spent two to three hours here just to have lunch. What's worse is they force you to pay 18 percent gratuity when ordering AYCE even if you're the only person there. Overall, you're forced to pay the server for their bad service.Coming back here again would take some serious consideration.

13.description: Like many Sushi places in the area, this place offers an all-you-can-eat option. No matter how drunk you are, all-you-can-eat sushi is never a good decision. That being said, this place has a couple very good rolls, including the Ichiban roll. I highly recommend it. The ladies working there are very nice but the service was a bit slow on the day I went, surprising because the place was pretty empty.

11.description: I had the Gyoza, Sake and Arizona Sunshine. Everything was great. It was easy and quick ordering process thanks to GrubHub!

39.description: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE. If I could rate lower, I would!I went here for the first time with several other people.  We were in a rush to eat, since we were on a break from work.  Our waitress brought us the wrong food (udon noodles instead of the soba noodles we ordered).   Additionally, some of us ordered tuna nigiri, but it tasted old and the fish itself looked dry.  Two of us tipped ~18%, but the other 2 members of our party did not.  We left the restaurant, came back a few minutes later to retrieve a backpack we left behind and were confronted by the waitress (who claimed she was the manager) for not tipping!!! Who confronts customers for a lack of tip on a bill that was LESS than 8 dollars? WORST SERVICE I'VE EVER EXPERIENCED. I called back to complain about this to the manager, and the waitress/pseudo-manager lady yelled at me saying our food orders were correct!!! OLD, DRY FISH. RUDE SERVICE. DO NOT EAT HERE!

37.description: Girlfriend and I went here for a quick dinner our biggest mistake was not ordering the sushi at the very least. I ordered soba noodles with pork katsu, i expected the noodle to be cold and have the sauce on the side being slightly experienced in Japanese cuisine; however, it was basically soba noodles in a ramen broth. The pork katsu was tough and hard to chew and tasted like cardboard. My gf ordered udon noodles with shrimp tempura and gyoza on the side saying that the food was plain and nothing special. Overall the food was not good at all but we regret not giving the sushi a try. The sushi seems to be the ONLY reason to go there and not for quality sushi, just a bang for your buck.

0.description: I thought this was a really great deal for AYCE.  Tried the gyoza and spring roll appetizers.  For rolls I had the super crunchy and spicy crunchy tuna.  There was a very generous amount of tuna in the spicy roll and a great kick.  All food came out quickly, full disclosure, I visited on a Wednesday night.  Service was also on point, very accommodating and attentive.  The hostess/waitress even spoke Spanish with my parents and sent us off with extra candy for my nephews.

38.description: This is a budget sushi place...if you want a quick fix but refuse to pay for a higher quality, this is it.By no means am I a sushi expert, but the fish quality was not good and doesn't look that appealing. The rice was inconsistent and clumpy. Me and my party of 4 had the lunch buffet for $13.95 each with a mandatory 18% tip. This is definitely a place I will not recommend and go back again. Especially how the tip was mandatory 18% I would understand if its a party of 6+, so they basically robbed your money in tips without a choice.

51.description: I have been going to this restaurant even before it was Japanese!We have gone sometimes as often as 1-2 per month, bu the food has slipped in the last year.The last time a couple weeks ago was the last time. The service just keeps getting worse and worse and the sushi is not fresh.I really doubt the person making the sushi is a trained sushi chef.And it is not authentic Japanese tasting--miso was like some store packet, too much rice not enough meats.The last couple times we have been here were not good experiences due to the staff being abusive to each other (I do understand Chinese expletives courtesy of friends) and the chicken tasting pre-cooked/dried out and the sushi fish did not take like sushi grade fish.Stay away unless they are truly under new management and hire a Properly trained sushi chef who will be using fresh fish and not too much rice.

27.description: I absolutely LOVE this place. I can't count how many times I've been here for the all you can eat sushi. Crab rangoons are a fav of mine as well as the smoked salmon rolls and the miso soup. The service is a bit slow sometimes but the food never disappoints.

32.description: I'm glad Ichiban is so close.  I really enjoy their food.  Service is quick, even for last-minute pick-up orders.  I always get the California Roll because it's what I like!  I've tasted other items here but I keep going back to the California Roll.  Also, I always get the edamame.  They give you a nice serving.  Food is always fresh to me.

54.description: Always a great place to go for lunch or dinner. The servers are very friendly and helpful. Could not ask for more being so close to UIC and on Taylor Street. I have noticed sometimes depending on who is making the sushi the amount of rice to fish ratio may change, but again, I cannot really complain. I love this place.  Highly recommend it! The BYOB is also a very nice addition!

48.description: Went for all you can eat sushi at lunch time.The sushi is just alright but it's totally worth the price.There are rolls and individual pieces you can choose from as well as classic appetizers like miso soup, pot stickers, and tempura vegetables. They also have a few main dishes that you can also get.

44.description: I love this place, best value you can ever get out of 19 $ (dinner time) or 14$ (lunch time)Highly recommend it to all the students and budget tasters

24.description: Came because we saw the all you can eat sushi deal advertised from the side walk. If you enjoy high quantities of sushi this is the place to go but I feel that their sushi was definitely lacking in quality. It didn't taste fresh and we probably will not be coming again

7.description: The AYCE selection is very small. Service is very hit or miss. The quality of the sushi is sub-par.

49.description: Just came back- i upgraded to two stars from one.  They cut down (a little) on the rice, but you still have small pieces of fish.  That's fine. It's all you can eat sushi for $14- what do you expect. What I did not appreciate was tip already added to the bill- Who does that?! Is that even allowed? Shouldn't there be some sign on the menu about this automatic service charge? Come here if you're desperate- but I still stand by my previous recommendation of going down the street to Tatsu if you are willing to spend extra cash.

40.description: At home sick the last few days ordered takeout twice.. 4 rolls for 20 bucks! Awesome! Not my favorite spot but for 13 bucks all u can Eat lunch sushi, who can complain. I was especially pleased with ichiban roll! My favorite!  My tip order from them directly with their menu not third party like grub hub that may not have right menu

53.description: [UPDATE]There must have been new management. The bitter old lady wasn't there, who was there every day.The new lady was thinner, and had purple highlights, and looked younger. That is the woman, who was sweet and kind.The food was a lot better, less sloppy, this time.[RED FLAG]They will now include their own $3 tip into your bill. I went to lunch for $13.95, and the bill was $18.06I went to write a tip, thinking I made a mistake and went (12:15-1:00pm) during dinner hours (after 4pm). As I was writing the tip for $3, the kind lady said that the tip is included, all I need to do is sign. This could be from the lack of customers, on top of low tipping. aka we don't need to raise wages, we need to raise tipping to 20% from everybody: blacks, white, asians, mexicans, indians, rich, poor, aka everybody... its not a racial issue - its a personal integrity issue to not tip. "if you're there" - "you share" the wealth, by tipping well. Any place you go.

30.description: They get a star for BYO, but it sort of ends there. Is it a good value? Sure, but only if you are going for quantity rather than quality. It is good?  No. Is service polite and friendly? I don't think so. Would I go back? Probably not.

46.description: Bottom line: Buffet lacks variety.Time: Taking a stroll and had a sudden craving for sushi! Early Friday night dinner.Service: Beware...Gratuity is included automatically if you get the buffet!- Not as attentive and slow service.- Slow service = More water drinking = Get full faster = Eat less. - It's a lose lose situation.Food: Buffet lacks variety.- Sometimes they have good special rolls that are included with the buffet.- Miso soup was pretty whack. Although not as salty. It was just plain bland.- Some unusual rolls that includes fruit making it quite refreshing Needs more waiters/waitresses to make the flow of dinner more smooth. Less waiting time and more nom nom time please!

1.description: The restaurant is cute and aesthetically pleasing but the sushi quality was less than mediocre with poor service.  The rice is overly abundant and moist, which does not make for a good combination.  The only plus to the place was the all you can eat lunch special, which includes maki rolls, nigiri, soups, salads and other starters.

55.description: Got the all you eat for 18$. Not worth it for me. Little cuts of fish diluted with way too much rice. Plus they charge 1$ per piece of everything you don't finish. Maybe ordering individual pieces is better vs the all you can eat but I'm going elsewhere next time

9.description: I am a frequent Ichiban diner, and only for a few reasons.1. I think the sushi is delicious and reasonably priced.2. I like the all you can eat special3. BYOBHOWEVER, the service is a little ridiculous. Sometimes, when they aren't busy, service is fine. When they are busy, it seems that the waitstaff gets stressed and starts becoming very unprofessional. For example, one summer day, I went in with my boyfriend. We waited probably twenty minutes for the ONE waitress to clear the outdoor seating after a party had left. We waited because we figured it would take 5 minutes, but nope.Last night I went in with a party of 6 at 8pm. The waiter told me the restaurant closed at 9... fine with us. I figured okay they don't seat any more customers after 9pm, typical for a restaurant.  After we had sat down, he told us that the kitchen actually closes at 8:30. Cool... So 9:10 rolls around, waiter comes by and tells us that their credit card machine closes down at 9... Okay yeah, bullshit. But whatever, we were done eating anyways. Didn't even offer us any to-go boxes for food or refilled waters. Not a good way to run a business. These people are completely rude. As I was walking home, I noticed Hana Sushi actually is BYOB too. I will probably begin taking my business there.

26.description: I chose this place based on yelp reviews and driving past it a couple of times. This place definitely had my friend who didn't like sushi, give it another chance. We got the All You Can Eat for $13.95 + 18% tip, which isn't bad. It all adds up to about $16-18 per person which is great for AYCE sushi. They also have great variety. My only beef with this place is that the service sucked. Our waiter was slow and didn't bother to memorize whose order was whose so all we got were plates thrown in front of us. We even got a few orders that got forgotten. They also require 18% tip if the AYCE is ordered, and the service definitely wasn't worth the 18%. Then again, this is what you get for $13.95 AYCEAnd because I might be wrong, but isn't tuna sashimi suppose to be more red than pale pink?

25.description: I came here for the AYCE sushi buffet and though the food may be good the services sucks really bad. I went with my brother here last month and there were only 4 table with customers and yet it took 45 minutes EACH time I put an order in...I assumed it's a tactic to make you full since you wait a long time before having seconds. I spent two to three hours here just to have lunch. What's worse is they force you to pay 18 percent gratuity when ordering AYCE even if you're the only person there. Overall, you're forced to pay the server for their bad service.Coming back here again would take some serious consideration.

12.description: Its an ok place. Service was a bit slow on a sunday night near closing. The rolls were kind of small. Quality of the fish was spot on. They would bring the food out slowly rather than all at once. I would still go back when I want sushi near by but maybe not for the best sushi in town.

59.description: They have an all you can eat option, which is nice. You get to choose 5 pieces or/and 3 rolls at once, and individual pieces are $1 each. It's nice and clean, and pretty tasty. The lady running the business is amazing-- up and down the stairs every day!  Byob ;)

21.description: So I don't know what happened to this place. Or maybe it's just me trying more sushi? Whatever the case the quality here has been suffering as of late. It's not all bad, it's just inconsistent. The service time has majorly slowed down, there seems to be less fish in the rolls, and the fish is of noticeably lower quality. Disappointing change.

17.description: They get a star for BYO, but it sort of ends there. Is it a good value? Sure, but only if you are going for quantity rather than quality. It is good?  No. Is service polite and friendly? I don't think so. Would I go back? Probably not.

10.description: Came because we saw the all you can eat sushi deal advertised from the side walk. If you enjoy high quantities of sushi this is the place to go but I feel that their sushi was definitely lacking in quality. It didn't taste fresh and we probably will not be coming again

5.description: Had the all you can eat selection and their menu is so small compared to all the other AYCE places. Even the limited selection they had wasn't great at all! I really don't like how they automatically add tip onto the AYCE. The service wasn't even that great either. We've always been sat upstairs and there's only one waiter and he barely check up on us. We had to stare at him until he approached us.

3.description: Thought that the food was consistent but it wasn't. I remember getting a more positive experience with the food three weeks ago as opposed to this current visit. Both visits I ordered the spider roll with the bento deluxe. The price is decent and the portion is decent. However, the quality is not there for the price paid. As a fan of fried food, the tempura was not impressive at all. It left a layer of grease in my mouth and esophagus. Same thing with the soba that was with the bento. Good luck with your experience. I came on a Saturday evening at 5 and it was empty here.

35.description: BYOB and all you can eat for a good price. Is great for a casual evening with a yearn for sushi.  The fish is fresh and my favorite rolls are the Ichiban and Crunchy rolls.  I wish the Mochi was part of All you can Eat though.

19.description: The worst sushi I ever had.... Just received my order, hot water as miso soup, little piece of fish like they were searching for it somewhere in refridge... I am shocked - i paid 38 bucks with delivery!! And ate nothing!Guys, it seems to me that you have decided not to pay attention to your current work. Have questions? Write me or call me, you have my number. They don't care... Never again.

28.description: The worst sushi I ever had.... Just received my order, hot water as miso soup, little piece of fish like they were searching for it somewhere in refridge... I am shocked - i paid 38 bucks with delivery!! And ate nothing!Guys, it seems to me that you have decided not to pay attention to your current work. Have questions? Write me or call me, you have my number. They don't care... Never again.

45.description: Really sub par sushi.  Its all you can eat but the food wasnt very good.  If your looking for good sushi I would hit up somewhere else.

33.description: Love this place! Absolutely delicious. It was a little expensive, but definitely worth it. :)

43.description: So, I've been avoiding this place for a year due to the poor-ish Yelp reviews but finally stopped in as was craving sushi and caved.  It wasn't bad for the circumstances of really craving sushi and had to be near the University Village area, but if you have any choice to not be in this area (I was on lunch hour so had to be)... go somewhere else.  Chicken quality was poor.  All-you-can-eat sushi is a good deal and a cool roll with mango sauce and fresh apple is included, but quality is lacking.  Way too much rice in rolls too- obviously tactic to make their costs cheaper.

2.description: This is my second time here for the AYCE sushi and my experience was very different. The restaurant was empty except for a family who was complaining about the taste of the miso soup to the manager(?), there was NO music in the background, and multiple fruit flies greeted my date and I, which should have been a red flag. However we figured the BYOB and sushi special was worth it. We both ordered a couple of rolls, a couple nigiri, and two bowls of seaweed salad. The rolls were very disappointing- mostly rice balls with literal slivers of fish and avocado on top. I mean you are paying 18.99 for all you can eat rice here. The rolls are enormous and skimp big time on anything that isn't the imitation crab mix-which is prominent in most of the maki. The nigiri was alright but again- slivers of fish. Apparently Ichiban is under new management? If the sushi is going to be this disappointing at least bother to put some music on in the restaurant and make the atmosphere less depressing.

18.description: Absolutely delicious and fresh every single time. I've celebrated anniversaries and birthdays here and the service and food never disappoint. We like that the gratuity is included for the all you can eat sushi dinner. Good for those like me and the beau who can certainly eat a lot! I recommend the rock n roll as well as most of the chef specials!

41.description: We've been here almost every week in the last month...Big Bowl Udon ($4.95) with choice of 3 ingredients for $5 (including shrimp, mussels, scallop, shrimp tempura).Not only is it a great deal, it's delicious.  The bowl is sometimes hard for me to finish, but on the very cold nights we were here recently...it hit the (cold) spot and kept us warm while filling our stomachs with goodness.Staff knows us now too, and comes prepared to our table w/our big bowl menu sheets.  Love it, all around.

52.description: Warning!  All you can eat sushi prices include a MANDATORY 18% Gratuity charge.  Which normally isn't a problem if the service is good.  But, its not.  Also, it takes forever the sushi to come and when it does finally come, its full of rice.

50.description: I had the all-you-can-eat sushi dinner and really enjoyed it!While the Miso Soup was too dilute, the sushi was really delicious. They have really interesting sushi as well using strawberry and apple as ingredients. They tasted really good for such innovative idea!It is slightly annoying not being able to order more than 5 pieces of Nigiri sushi each round, but the rolls were so delicious they made up for it!

4.description: While Ichiban certainly doesn't reign high on the list of sushi buffets I've been to, it's certainly a hell lot better than the management over at Volcano on Taylor.Oh wait... are they owned by the same people?Yes, that menu DID seem awfully familiar. And here I was thinking that the "Ichiban" roll was unique to just this place. My mistake.Ichiban (一番) in Japanese means "Number one," and I honestly can't say that the restaurant keeps to the namesake. A large group of us came in for lunch one day and most of us decided on the AYCE option. This restaurant (and Volcano) allows each individual to order themselves, instead of doing one large order for the group. The good thing about this is that you can bring friends and NOT have them be forced to do AYCE if they don't want. On the other hand, it doesn't allow you the stomach room to try more rolls than you order.Each time an order is placed, you are "restricted" to 5 pieces of nigiri, 3 rolls, but as many appetizers as you like. Being a sushi fan, I usually just go for the nigiri, especially salmon. However, the overall preparation of the rolls was so slow that most of us got pretty full just on the first order.The rolls that I managed to try this one time were the Ichiban and Alaskan (which also contains samon). The Ichiban contains applies which is different from most rolls I've had, but the tempura in it was pretty bland. For $12 a la carte, I wish it had a little bit more POW in it.At a price of $19.50 lunch including tax and tip, I can't say that this is totally worth it, but I am giving it a few stars up for the fact that they let me take home my one order of food because I was experiencing a hiccuping episode that made me want to shoot myself. The servers are all nice (and they are all Chinese btw, so Cantonese will help here), so I was able to ask and get the few rolls I had left over carried out.Damn you hiccups!!

6.description: certainly not one of the best sushi place i've been to. The sushi, is overloaded with rice. the miso soup is too salty... the ginger wasn't enough. the choices for all you can eat is not that many. the usual, california roll and philadelphia. the maki, the fish...tuna and salmon were so thin...i can barely taste the fish.

22.description: Absolutely delicious and fresh every single time. I've celebrated anniversaries and birthdays here and the service and food never disappoint. We like that the gratuity is included for the all you can eat sushi dinner. Good for those like me and the beau who can certainly eat a lot! I recommend the rock n roll as well as most of the chef specials!

15.description: Went for all you can eat sushi at lunch time.The sushi is just alright but it's totally worth the price.There are rolls and individual pieces you can choose from as well as classic appetizers like miso soup, pot stickers, and tempura vegetables. They also have a few main dishes that you can also get.

57.description: We have been regulars there for about three years and when we cannot decide where to go... we go to "rice balls" as our 6 y.o. calls it.BYOB and under $18.95 all you can eat sushi.This is family owned and yes, some of the family does not have the best English which I think results in the confusion documented in some reviews.  Also they do now limit the first order to keep prices in check.   We have encountered that too, but can I again say, $19 AYCE and BYOB.  Be nice to hard working immigrants and go to the best sushi deal in the city and what they do not always have in English skills they make up for with nice.  The sushi is great and we might just go back tonight.

20.description: Had the All you can eat (AYCE)  sushi and it was really bad. 90% rice rolls. Be able to empty your schedule just to have lunch hear because it takes them hours to get you your food. It's like they play the waiting game for you to get full and not order any more or wait for you to get sick of their service and get the hell out of there. Not coming back unless I have a rice craving.

36.description: Discount sushi joint, but NOT worth the time and effort. Been there a few times and it has been a pretty consistently disappointing experience. Takes forever to serve food on a day with no one else in the restaurant. Average wait is 45 minutes for 5 rolls, even if you're the only ones there. Also, apparently sharing any food will add a $1 charge to your order. Staff speaks only broken English, and they cannot understand enough to answer questions, so if you have allergies they can't tell you if shellfish is in something. They Will get your order wrong. They will add an 18% gratuity even for a party of 2. Do not bother with them. Taylor street has better sushi options.

14.description: I usually do pick up and the rolls are very good for the price. When I have eaten there, the service was good. Solid sushi spot and great price point for all you can eat.

58.description: gets the job doneportions are kinda small

56.description: had the gyros cheeseburger and the jalapeno grilled chicken wrap. Both were really good. Also got the hot wings. They weren't bad but they weren't that great.

29.description: Staff is so friendly. Food is great - try the gyro burger! The only downside, if you're not a cash person, you'll have to spend at least $8 to use your card. Well worth it though.

42.description: A great spot for quick and inexpensive food. Its pretty much everything you expect from a burger joint: quick service, easy on your wallet, hearty burgers and sandwiches, and a casual feel. The double cheese gyros cheeseburger was great!

23.description: Delicious food, great service! Gyros with spicy sauce, jalapeño chicken wrap, and the gyros burgers. With cheese fries! Yum.

47.description: I'm still on the quest to look for a my favorite gyro cheese burger place in Chicago.. and jubrano's came across my search on yelp.. small place that can easily be missed when driving..ordered the spicy gyro double cheese burger and fries.. it was just OK.. i didn't really like it..  something about the meat just didn't do it for me.. and there wasn't much flavor to it... and the fries was just average... so the quest continues sigh..

8.description: Love Jubs! Delicious and Zabiha Halal! There is no other place that makes the buffalo chicken wrap the way they do. Anything I get is always perfect - you feel so satisfied.

31.description: Such friendly owners and the wraps are delicious.  Great lunch spot if you're running short on time, plus the variety in the menu is a huge plus.

34.description: This place is chintzy and mediocre, multiple times forced me to order a drink just so that I would spend a certain dollar amount on my visa (illegal by the way), and wouldn't let me sit in the restaurant with my co residents when all 6 of them ordered a meal but I brought my sack lunch.  They barely let me sit outside with my sack lunch and my 6 paying friends!  We vowed as a residency never to step foot in this place again due to their super awkward business practices.

16.description: This is a very good fast food style restaurant on Taylor street. It is very close to UIC, so many students are regulars here. The restaurant is zabihah halal.The cost of each dish is between 4-9 dollars. The total for the bill can vary from 5 dollars as the cheapest to 12 dollars at most.I think this restaurant is good if you like to eat large quantities of meat. Almost every dish has meat in it whether it is chicken, beef, or lamb. They even have a burger that has almost a pound of meat. That burger is the cheeseburger with gyros meat on top.My favorite food to get here is the chicken philly sandwich. It come with chicken, green bell peppers, mushrooms, and onion and mozzarella cheese on Italian bread. It is delicious and very satisfying.The french fries are pretty good, and they are crispy and perfectly seasoned.I recommend this place is you like meaty food or if you are a Muslim looking for some delicious halal fast food.

13.description: If you're looking for a Mediterranean/fast food place in the UIC area, this is your spot!! Service is fast and friendly, food is DELISH. My 2 favorites:-The gyro sandwich here is soooooooo amazing. It's just as good, if not better, than gyros in Greek town. -Cheese fries. Enough said. The only negative about this place is that it's closed on Sundays.

11.description: I really like Jubranos. I've been coming here for almost two years now, and I'm satisfied every time I leave. My two absolutely favorite burgers are the mushroom swiss burger and the spicy double gyro cheeseburger. The lady who takes the orders is extremely nice and always has a smile on her face! Additionally, the food is filling and the meat is always so flavorful. It's hard finding zabiha-halal joints that sell burgers for relatively cheap/average prices, but I've come to embrace the fact that I probably won't ever find a 2 dollar cheeseburger unless I go to Pakistan. My burgers at Jubranos always come out to be in the $6-$8 range, so it's not bad at all. Great for a college kid like me who dreams about juicy cheeseburgers and getting a 4.0 GPA. Go Jubs!

39.description: Peace, honestly I like the food here and really enjoy the crispy chicken sandwich, the prices are a little high and the fries are just ok and the owner is usually cool. But, the last time I was there I tried to pray and was rudely reprimanded by the owner and told "go to the front, go" to pray there. I cared less about being told where I could pray in the restaurant and more about how rude and disrespectful he was to me in the process, not sure if I'll ever go back and it's a shame cuz we don't have enough zabihah options

37.description: First time to Jubranos.  Overall I am pleased with the experience.  Walk in and it's a small mom and pop joint.  The overall cleanliness is above average and we were greeted immediately.  We had falafel and a gyro plate.  All of the food was prepared to order.  Therefore all of the food was served hot when it hit the table.  The French fries were on par with every Greek/Mediterranean place I've ever been to.  They must all order the same exact fry?  The meat was fairly flavorful and the falafel was delicious.  The prices are ok maybe a touch high but definitely not a rip off by any stretch.I think I would go back if I was passing by and craving a gyro.

0.description: Best philly steak Fast serviceBecame addicted to the philly steakTheir raps and buffalo wings are really good too

38.description: Great middle eastern food in this place! Though the gyro cheeseburger did look delicious, I opted for the grilled chicken sandwich. It was packed with moist chicken flavored with lemon herbs. There were fresh tomato and greens inside and a tasty tahini sauce on the side that I just poured into the pita. Wished they had dropped a few packets of hot sauce in the bag though.The prices here are a bit steep but it looks like they have great daily specials: 6 bucks for a different sandwich, soda, and fries. Solid place for college students to get some grub.

51.description: Had the gyros cheeseburger, but for how much I paid for it, the portion was small. It tasted good, but they should've atleast threw a small order of fries with it or something.  I never really went back after that. Just didn't seem worth it.

27.description: Best. Falafel. Ever.  Amazingly moist, delicious sauces, very fresh... I have been here several times always intending to try something new, but the falafel is just too good to pass up.

32.description: yo lupe fiasco eats here so I was like aye dats cool but aye jubranos is OP but aye

54.description: This place was amazing when it first opened up but unfortunately I feel that the quality has declined in the past few years. First off, yes it's HALAL which is of course bonus points above all else!My husband and I go here every now and then but we used to go here often while we were at school at UIC. The owners are such sweethearts, friendly and always welcoming with a smile. The food portions used to be bigger and the flavors were oozing from their burgers but I don't know what happened? They started cutting their hours down and the flavors went downhill.But regardless, I will still go here to support my fellow Muslims and because sometimes you're just craving some meat and the fact that this place is Halal is invaluable. We love their gyros cheeseburger and swiss mushroom burger and our daughter loves their chipotle chicken wrap, definitely still worth trying out!

48.description: The cheeseburger gyro was like heaven in my mouth.  My boyfriend got the gyro sandwich and it was also fantastic.  Owners were very nice, too.

44.description: We order from Jubrano;s at least once a week.  One of my bridal shower games asked what our favorite restaurant was as a couple and we said Jubrano's.  The owner knows us from our order:)  My husband loves the gyro cheeseburger and cheese fries.  I always get the Sante fe wrap and a veggie platter.  The falafel is so good here and there hummus is awesome.  Service is great.  They are a great small business and a good location to the neighborhood!!

24.description: Just ate their well-known Gyro cheeseburger here with fries.  I have to say, their fries are standard, pretty good. But the highlight was the meat and tzatziki sauce in the burger.  If you order it, you can have the option of spicy/non-spicy; I chose spicy but to me, it didn't seem all that spicy...There is some space for a group of people to sit down to eat, but the place is still kinda small.

7.description: Gyro cheesburger........nuff said

49.description: Great burgers and sandwiches.

40.description: you zabiha diners know the pain of slim pickings of restaurants in the area.  Jubranos somewhat relieves that pain.pretty good zabiha burgers/cheese steaks! i tend to always get the philly cheese steak-- extra spicy, and the meat is tender and the bun is the right amount of soft without getting soggy. I'm not sure how it would compare to burger places for non-zabiha eaters, but this is a regular for me and my husband!ONE REALLY REALLY BIG CON is that they don't have delivery. Jubranos is not easy to get to from where we are.  I'm sure we'd want to order from there more often, but without a car, it makes it difficult to get to. We can bike there pretty easily from the south loop in the summer time, but it's pretty much out of the question in the winter. I'd love it if you could start up delivery!! :)

53.description: They have fantastic gyros here! I love that they are halal! They place is small, but it's clean. And the owners are really nice! Whenever I go to jubranos, I am never disappointed with their gyros combo with fries and a drink. And it's really affordable! It's always made fresh too.

30.description: Teast gooooooood ,The burger teast good The food is halal ,We really like this food, good local food

46.description: I came in here to grab a quick bite.Got a friendly hello and a smile the moment I walked in.It's a classic mom and pop joint with burgers and sandwiches.The coolest part is they use Halal meat for their gyros (not sure about other sandwiches) which is a smart choice given the local community.The falafel was big and tasty and the fries were golden brown and perfect.I do wish they had a good hot sauce to accompany the falafel but that's okay.Would definitely return.

1.description: This place has good Gyro cheeseburgers, and its chicken wraps are quite tasty as well. I personally like spicy food, so I opt for the jalapeno chicken wrap. I would give that a go if you also like spicy food.The reason why I'm giving this place 3 stars rather than 4 is because of the fact that I found the food to be good, but nothing worth drooling over. If I was in the area, I would consider coming in and getting something. However, I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way for this place. This is also compounded by the fact that I live nearer to Max's and Al-Watan, and I find both of their gyro cheeseburgers to be better than Jubrano's. TL;DR: it's good, pretty good, but not great.

55.description: Found this place thanks to YELP users. It's HALAL.We read a lot of good reviews on Yelp and decided to try this place. From the reviews the dishes sounded quite appetizing. And yes, they are. We ordered the gyro cheeseburgers along with a side of hummus and cheesy fries. Everything we ordered was tasty. The service was friendly from the staff as well. The only thing I would say is that the portions are a bit on the smaller side than I expected. But still, they have quite a good menu with a lot of options. Since this was the first time we didn't order everything so next time, after we order more dishes, I will definitely update this review. The gyro cheeseburger is something I have never heard of and this was the first time having it...very tasty. It's a spin on the regular cheeseburger and it's a good spin. Definitely go and try this place.

9.description: Best. Wrap. EVER! The crispy chicken jalapeño ranch wrap is everything to me. I tried it today for the first time with a side of fries & loved every bite of it. The crispy chicken was flavored well & gave it the perfect crunch, the sauce was a wonderful balance between spicy and cool, the veggies took it to the next level of freshness... I could only finish half the wrap with fries, but loved the fact that I didn't feel heavy/weighed down afterward. I've also tried the philly cheese steak with everything & it was decent. 4 stars only because I haven't tried anything else there & have to be fair. I'll absolutely be back for that wrap though. Fast & Friendly service as well. I really appreciate that in the middle of a crazy work day. Try this place out!

26.description: A great place to chill during lunch break. Cheap and good burgers.

25.description: I was apprehensive to eat here at first since its on taylor, and let's admit it's a stiff competition to please the local UIC students taste buds. However, I was pleasantly surprised! I had the chicken tikka masala wrap, it came with a zesty little sauce and fresh iceberg and tomatoes. My friend had the falafel sandwhich and the gyros, they were all very good sized and had some fresh component which is necessary when you're trying to get some brain food.I am curious to see how greasy their heaving options are but for now, I think the wraps and halal options are satisfying

12.description: Fast and friendly service and food is outstanding. Food is simple yet very tasty and fresh. Burgers are amazing especially as a burger fiend and so was baklava and falafel definately coming back

59.description: Mike is my guy, and his food is excellent. You talk to him for 5 minutes and you'll know he's a passionate guy when it comes to his restaurant. This is my definite go to in the neighborhood. I usually get one of the wraps and falafal, or the gyro burger. Hard to beat..

21.description: This is a very good fast food style restaurant on Taylor street. It is very close to UIC, so many students are regulars here. The restaurant is zabihah halal.The cost of each dish is between 4-9 dollars. The total for the bill can vary from 5 dollars as the cheapest to 12 dollars at most.I think this restaurant is good if you like to eat large quantities of meat. Almost every dish has meat in it whether it is chicken, beef, or lamb. They even have a burger that has almost a pound of meat. That burger is the cheeseburger with gyros meat on top.My favorite food to get here is the chicken philly sandwich. It come with chicken, green bell peppers, mushrooms, and onion and mozzarella cheese on Italian bread. It is delicious and very satisfying.The french fries are pretty good, and they are crispy and perfectly seasoned.I recommend this place is you like meaty food or if you are a Muslim looking for some delicious halal fast food.

17.description: I have ordered from Jubrano's several times. The greeter is very friendly and makes you feel welcome. I always order the gyro cheese burger and fries, the meal is excellent and fresh (I crave it all the time and recommend it to everyone.) The restaurant itself is small and simple, nothing fancy (I prefer take away). A bit on the pricey side, but still affordable to college students.

10.description: I was apprehensive to eat here at first since its on taylor, and let's admit it's a stiff competition to please the local UIC students taste buds. However, I was pleasantly surprised! I had the chicken tikka masala wrap, it came with a zesty little sauce and fresh iceberg and tomatoes. My friend had the falafel sandwhich and the gyros, they were all very good sized and had some fresh component which is necessary when you're trying to get some brain food.I am curious to see how greasy their heaving options are but for now, I think the wraps and halal options are satisfying

5.description: You can't complain about a place with really good food, delivered promptly, and for a good price.  Gyros was fantastic.  Only critique I would give this place is serve their food in a different container so the fries aren't so soggy :(.  But not your fault...well done!

3.description: Cute little place hidden amongst other ethnic restaurants.  Nothing special on the inside.  Very friendly staff.  Basic menu on a lit up display with black bold lettering.  $3.99 for about 5 tablespoons of hummus.  It looks attractive, but the flavor is lacking.  It needs more sesame tahini.  It was a little bland.  The pita was warm and toasty.  The gyro is decently priced and is served on a warm and fluffy pita.  The gyro meat is tasty enough, blow didn't blow my socks off.  Not dry, but something again is lacking.  A couple fresh tomato slices and some onion.  The tzatziki is a little on the thick side not enough cucumbers.    About $13 for lunch including a bottled water.  Not impressed, I've had better.  Very disappointed with the hummus.

35.description: I read the reviews and decided to check it out--- will definitely be back here! They sell gyros, burgers, shawarmas, chicken fingers (as well as many other items). All food is halal. We had the gyro plate and gyro topped cheeseburger. Gyro plate was okay, but cheeseburger was fantastic! Will try the ranch chicken wrap next visit based on the reviews. Fries were excellent -- served right out of the frier! Best to eat those right away while they're hot. Restaurant is small, but has maybe 6-7 tables that seat 2-4 ppl each. I say eat here while it's hot!

19.description: Great middle eastern food in this place! Though the gyro cheeseburger did look delicious, I opted for the grilled chicken sandwich. It was packed with moist chicken flavored with lemon herbs. There were fresh tomato and greens inside and a tasty tahini sauce on the side that I just poured into the pita. Wished they had dropped a few packets of hot sauce in the bag though.The prices here are a bit steep but it looks like they have great daily specials: 6 bucks for a different sandwich, soda, and fries. Solid place for college students to get some grub.

28.description: This is a great mom and pop style Greek restaurant. Sort of fast food-y, you can sit in at a table or take it on the go, which I usually prefer. The falafel's are only $.50 each and they are absolutely delicous, imo. Even without the pita.

45.description: Delicious food and the owners are wonderful and personable. I just love hearing the "welcome back doc, crispy jalapeño wrap?" It's rare that I'm in the Taylor St. area and don't make a stop here. Good stuff.

33.description: Love love love their gyro cheeseburger! A small mom and pop joint awesome for summertime where you can enjoy the food on a small patio. Super quick service as well which is always a plus!

43.description: Their food is really good, I always order the Greek salad and hummus, my husband loves their fries and chicken salad. Now the service is a little rough- meaning its not super nice, but the food is great.

2.description: Jubrano's is brilliant. It's about $6 (tax included) for the best spicy gyro sandwich you'll ever have. The pita bread is soft but not too soft, the meat is delicious, tender and generous, and the cold tahini sauce served on top just makes the sandwich float in your mouth. Other items are great here too but PLEASE try the Gyro sandwich.

18.description: Just ate their well-known Gyro cheeseburger here with fries.  I have to say, their fries are standard, pretty good. But the highlight was the meat and tzatziki sauce in the burger.  If you order it, you can have the option of spicy/non-spicy; I chose spicy but to me, it didn't seem all that spicy...There is some space for a group of people to sit down to eat, but the place is still kinda small.

41.description: When I talk to UIC friends, Jubrano's definitely seems to be on every student's list!**Be aware of the fact that your order must be at least $7 for you to use your credit card**As previously mentioned, this is a mom and pop joint with a pretty decent selection on their menu.  They are zabiha/halal which is an attraction to Muslim students from all around!I've had their philly steak sandwich (which just didn't hit the spot) and have noticed that the portion sizes have gotten smaller over time.. I've also had their gyro hamburger, which was also okay.I will come back because the store owner is extremely nice (my first time here, I was a little shy on change and the owner kindly let it go) and with the hope that perhaps some of their other items will deliver.

52.description: I ordered the famous gyro cheeseburger that everyone is raving about.  It was good and tasty, but not something I felt was "OHMIGAWD THIS IS AMAZING!" like other Yelpers felt.  Basically, it's a quick fix when you can't decide between a burger or a gyro.  It's a bit on the "expensive" end of fast food, the gyro cheeseburger alone is almost $6 (without fries or a drink) when you can get gyros+fries+drink for $7 in Greektown or burger+fries+drink on Maxwell street for $5.

50.description: Ordered the gyro & fries.  Pretty tasty and good portion.

4.description: Great place that serves some Zabiha halal sandwiches near UIC! You can take the Taylor bus or a 10-15 min walk from UIC East Campus or a 5 min walk from West Campus. I've tried multiple things and was never disappointed (love their fries!!!!). Ask them to make your food spicy! It's a nice change up from Pizza, Carms, or Ghareeb Nawaz. Parking is difficult. You will most likely have to meter park because you need a zone sticker to park on side streets. Also, they don't have a huge dining in space, but it may not be a problem because I've never seen the place packed.

6.description: I used the Eat24 app for the first time to order from these folks, and as a side note, I have to say that app is fantastic.  Jubrano's, on the other hand, despite being just two and a half blocks away from my location, completely missed their HOUR-long promised delivery window.  If the food had been fantastic, that would have made up for the 80-minute wait, but the chicken schwarma platter was 75% bland white rice, 25% dry chicken.  The seasoning was great, but it was sprinkled on top rather than really coating the chicken.  End result was that I only ate about 10 bites.  The side salad was a bunch of bland iceberg lettuce with one small tomato slice.  Sigh...overall, this meal was not at all worth the $20 I paid for the food plus delivery.

22.description: Its a nice walk from UIC campus to Jubranos, like ten minutes. The prices are really good and depending on how many people are their they have pretty fast service. I would definitely recommend the wraps! They are known for the wraps especially the jalapeno chicken wrap its delicious.

15.description: A fantastic Halal option for people in the area. They have a great gyro here, arguably one of the best I've ever had. The only issue is that they only accept credit cards if your grand total is over around $7.

57.description: It is a little joint on Taylor St.  I usually get gyro cheeseburger and cheese fries.  They are very good.  I go there whenever I have no food at home and I feel like some quick bite.  I would definitely recommend it if you work/live around here.

20.description: This place is our new go-to! the food is always consistent and the crispy chicken sandwiches- OH MY GOD are they amazing or what?!!! TWO friend chicken patties with the best bun ever! There really aren't many zabiha halal options so this is a plus AND this beats anything over at devon/rogers park! the service is always fast. We got delivery for the first time last night and it was great. a tad long (1 hour) but no biggie since I didn't feel like going all the way to taylor st. You really can't go wrong with the crispy chicken sandwich or the gyro cheeseburger. The philly cheesesteak was meh and the fries are very average but I bet everything else is great!

36.description: Mushroom swiss burger- 4.5Buffalo chicken wrap - 4.5Philly cheese steak- 4Pulled beef sliders- 4.5Jalapeño crispy chicken wrap- 4Try;-buffalo wings- jalapenos chicken wrap- gyros cheeseburger-pulled bbq chicken

14.description: I love the burger with gyro really delicious. I highly recommended for who love to have a gyro and burger in Same sandwich.
