3.description: I happened upon this place and had a great shave, haircut, and beard trim. Wayne, the proprietor is a great guy and the school is lucky to have him.

1.description: Great haircut.  Fast, professional, and polite.For $14.00, you are not going to find a better deal.

2.description: Great place to get a haircut! Very authentic barber shop! Do recommend. The barber is awesome and is always nice! Great price too!

0.description: Some guys just want a regular haircut.  Or maybe a mustache or beard trim.  If this describes you, then you want to visit the UIC Barber Shop.  Haircut costs $14.  This includes a neck shave with a straight razor and heated shaving cream.  Not the cheapest haircut perhaps but IMHO worth every penny.Ask for Wayne and make sure to leave a tip.

58.description: Yes, great place...one of the best things about it is Friday night with John Sabal.  Crista L. is apparently unfamiliar with the kind of practice and talent it takes in order to use a looper to layer various tracks and instruments during a live performance. The fact that you thought it was a recording is a testament to the talent that created it right in front of your ears and eyes.  Go back and listen again with this understanding and you will have quite a different level of appreciation.  All said with love and smiles ;-)

56.description: Very cool decor. Great live music. Reasonable drinks.AND...they pick up food from Davanti Enoteca and Frenchesa's both around the corner and often have very long waits!Came in a group of 5 around 8pm--we were lucky enough to snag a table. Great drink specials! Wine flight for $12 and glass of champaign for $5. The waitresses were very nice and the music was enjoyable. Would definitely come back!

29.description: I purchased a wine tasting through Groupon and scheduled it, as required, through the site.  When we arrived for the tasting, at the time of our reservation, BeviAmo was closed.  No explanation.  I called the next day to see what was up and if I could either reschedule or get my money back, and the answering machine was full.  I finally was able to, after several calls, leave a message, which went unreturned.  In short, I ended up getting a refund through Groupon because BeviAmo was so unresponsive.

42.description: I certainly WISH I could review a great bottle of wine or a great time with one of my closest friends in town, but we didn't make it that far. We walked in through the door immediately across from the bartender, who was the only employee on site at the time. He wasn't busy. Shootin' the breeze on his laptop. Yet, he couldn't muster the breath or courtesy to say a word to us. We asked about the seating and if we could get a menu. He practically tossed us two menus and told us "sit wherever." We walked to a table and immediately looked at each other like, "hell no." Walked back to the front and told him we were going elsewhere. In response, he stated, "whatever you want," and continued to enjoy his porn or whatever had him so enthralled on his laptop. Who in their right mind would spend their hard-earned money here? Bad bartender attitudes ruin beautiful wine and beautiful nights. So, we went to Three Aces and had better wine and a better time. Will NEVER recommend this place or set my precious feet in there again.

23.description: Best experience ever!! Great wine and great service!! The owner is one of the nicest bar owners that I have met in many years. This place is cozy, eccentric, and fun! It was my first time there last night, and I had a blast!

47.description: Many moons ago, I lived in Little Italy, and used to walk to and from Beviamo regularly.  I found out that the brother/sister owners lived on the Southside and we had some mutual friends, which added to my vino fun.The vibe is relaxed and helps bring down your heart rate, after a stressful day.  The music the bartenders choose to play usually is indie with a bit of old school mixed in.  Some nights, there is a DJ kicking up the tunes, which adds to my toe tapping, while engaging in "deep", wine evoked conversations with others.Fast forward about seven years.  My cousin and I decide to swing by the hood and stop off at our favorite wine bar on Taylor St.  Still chill and inviting.  Still offers a plethora of wines.  Still has great music playing.  Still displays local artists.  Still employs bartenders who are knowledgeable and talkative.  Still makes me love my vino adventures with loved ones.Love this local gem close to UIC!

8.description: I've been here a couple of times and it's usually pretty quiet (as in not many people; i.e.: dead). I tried to come a couple months ago with a work group to celebrate a work achievement on a week day at 6pm and it was closed. No explanation; just dark space and locked doors.I came tonight to celebrate a friend getting a job in another city. Upon entering, we headed to an empty table. The bartender stating that there would be "no table service tonight." I was fine with that, it being a small bar and all. Then he said he couldn't serve us because my friend was too drunk. He is slightly clumsy and dropped his ID when getting out of his wallet, but seriously, we were both rational adults having a rational conversation with this guy. There were 3 people there other than the bartender, my friend and me (maybe his friends. They were deep in conversation when we first walked in). I guess this place doesn't need business. I won't bother embarrassing myself ever again bringing any other friends here. That was just ridiculous...and embarrassing. I'm so sorry I ever suggested to my friend that we come here.

31.description: Service can be slow and spotty, even when you're the only people in there... however despite that, decent list of wines, and a good spot to grab a glass of wine before dinner at Davanti or County BBQ

34.description: I asked for a lemon drop martini on a Wednesday when the bar was empty and was told they don't do martinis anymore. It's a bar! Why can't you do a martini?! I asked the bartender to recommend something sweet from their new drink menu and he recommended a drink with vodka, ginger beer and lemon...it was not yummy, just OK. The bartender was not friendly or helpful, he seemed annoyed when I told him that I recommend this place to friends for their martini menu. My boyfriend and I left as soon as our friends showed up and went across the street to Three Aces and enjoy delicious martinis!

16.description: Awful. Went there for a Match.com event, for which we were promised a flight of 5 wines (2 reds, 2 whites, and a sparkling), as well as "bar snacks".  The atmosphere itself is dark and unwelcoming, with seriously creepy and tasteless artwork. The bartender, the only staff we saw, was unknowledgeable and cold, we only received 4/5 wines, and the "bar snacks" consisted of a couple frozen pizzas, thrown on to an out-of-the-way table.  For a Wednesday night around 7:30, the only patrons were those involved in the event.  I think it's decidedly safe to say that we will NOT return, and will be steering our friends far, far away from this establishment.

13.description: We had a group of 6 girls and we came here because of a groupon we had bought. I was a little skeptical at first because of all the negative yelp reviews. However, my experience was a bit more positive than that. We were greeted friendly when we arrived and our table was ready. There is a selection of wines for the wine tasting and he accommodated us. My only thing is the service is REALLY SLOW and we had to remind him a few times to bring water and complimentary cheeses. The wines tasted pretty good and our favorite was the prosecco.  Would like to try some of their other red wines. All in all good expereince.

11.description: Beviamo isn't just a wine bar. They do martinis and a slew of specialty drinks. In fact, their selection is vast for all of the above! Seating is mixed from tables/chairs to benches and loungy seating. Beviamo's invites different local artists to play in its bar on any given day and also showcases paintings for sale hung on its brick walled interior. We had the martinis and wine. The lemon was the star - refreshing! The pear martini was super good too. I'd agree with others that they do martinis well here!Specials a plenty that are offered on school nights vs. the busier weekend days. So, I shall stop in for one of its wine flights that appear to be popular here. We shall see.

39.description: Let me start by saying that I have been coming to this bar for the past six years. Service is great. I have had twice issues with the owners brother. The owners brother is a hot mess. He is very rude and gets intoxicated while working as "security". This past weekend on April 27, 2013 we went for their 14th year anniversary. The place was packed and had a good vibe. The bar was very warm since it was packed. Earlier they had the door open facing Taylor street and someone closed it. Since I was warm I went to open the door. This is when the owners brother went up to be and closed the door and said if I ever open that door he will kick me out and knock me out while as he laid his hands on me to push me back. Of course I cleaned up the language he used on me. I was shocked that someone would threating me in a wine bar, use such language on me, and laid their hands on me. I was calm and told him everything was okay and backed away since it was not worth it and he smelled intoxicated. I was unaware that he did the same thing to my friend earlier while I was in the washroom. My friend told him that he should not be laying hands on customers and threating them. The owners brother got upset and stepped outside to wave police to kick us out. For what reason? I am not sure honestly. The owner a short older lady went up to us and informed us that we had to leave. We closed out tab and were surprised why we got kicked out. When the police where in the bar they saw how much anger the owners brother displayed toward us. The moral of the story is to be careful with this guy. He is a jerk and obviously should not be working while drinking. The problem is not the bar, not the owner, not the service. The problem is the owners brother. Very rude and threating to customers. He was wearing a cowboy hat and about 5'8, husky, pale completed, and very loud, normally stands on the short end of the bar by the cash register. You will be able to point him out as soon as you walk in.

37.description: I went here to see my friend's band play and the experience was overall.... ok. BeviAmo gets pretty crowded on the weekends and you can expect to wait a good 20 minutes for a drink. Only two bartenders behind the bar, serving dozens of  people. The atmosphere was delightful but there was limited seating. Once you finally sit down, you're pretty much stuck in that seat because if you get up, you'll lose your seat. I went on a Saturday so maybe during the week, it might be a bit different. Either way, the place is not bad. The bathrooms are nice, specially the sinks.

0.description: Great bar! Bought a Groupon for a wine tasting here & the service was great. The bartender was very informative & friendly, didn't talk down to us & clearly knew his stuff. It's a small, dimly lit spot with some interesting ambience: local art, funky light fixtures, an eclectic mix of seating options.We went early, & a band was setting up as we left. I'd be interested to see what kind of acts they book here. I'll definitely be going back.

38.description: Beviamo is always a nice go-to spot pre-Davanti or pre-dinner but also a nice place to enjoy a nightcap. I have been going to this neighborhood gem for about 10 years now and it is refreshing to see that it hasn't lost its humble charm.

51.description: Beviamo isn't just a wine bar. They do martinis and a slew of specialty drinks. In fact, their selection is vast for all of the above! Seating is mixed from tables/chairs to benches and loungy seating. Beviamo's invites different local artists to play in its bar on any given day and also showcases paintings for sale hung on its brick walled interior. We had the martinis and wine. The lemon was the star - refreshing! The pear martini was super good too. I'd agree with others that they do martinis well here!Specials a plenty that are offered on school nights vs. the busier weekend days. So, I shall stop in for one of its wine flights that appear to be popular here. We shall see.

27.description: Love the BeviAmo vibe!  Great place to sip on vino and enjoy live jazz.  They don't serve food, but do allow you to order in from the surrounding restaurants off Taylor Street.  Impressive wine list - South American, Austrian, African and more!!!

32.description: I went here with a few friends for a wine tasting recently. Tiny place, but cozy atmosphere. You almost want to just sit there with some wine, a book, and fall asleep. The bartender was super nice, joked around with us, and was great at recommending certain wines. Definitely a go-to place if I need to find some place to hang out in University Village.Word of caution, so to speak - no food menu; only popcorn. So don't come hungry! But there are plenty of places nearby to dine.

54.description: This place is really nice. Amazing drink selection. bar tenders give due attention to you and makes the drinks from their heart. Im a single man, and yes there are pretty girls who come here. It has a traditional old artsy look to it and it feels nice. Definitely a place i would hang out at.

48.description: My favorite wine bar in Chicago. It's not near me in the city, but anytime someone says Beviamo I will go out of my way to be there. Nice, intimate layout. They switch out the artwork in here and it's always cool to see what is new in there. They have a few wines on tap. Best bartender I have ever had in Chicago hands down is Jessica, not sure if she is still there, but she is kick a$$. She really gets it right when she makes a drink. They have some cool specials every so often like Monday night $4 martinis that are done right. Had a green tea martini once here that was dynamite. Their sangria is also really, really good. The owner is a great guy too, I've seen him once or twice there. Part of me doesn't want to boast about this place, because it is a hidden gem in Chicago. Great for conversations with friends and a first date. I need to come back here soon.

44.description: I'm not typically one to write reviews but after my last visit to beviamo, there's no way I couldn't. I've visited beviamo several times on Saturday's to see my friends and fellow musicians play live jazz. As a local musician I always try to support the live music scene when I'm not playing myself. My previous visits had been great and i enjoyed the bar and music so much that I recommended several people to pay a visit. Most recently however, I had one of the worst experiences I've ever had at an establishment in Chicago. Upon arriving with a friend, I ordered a bottle of wine and offered my credit card to the bartender. I was told it wasn't necessary. We enjoyed our bottle of wine and the great tunes. Unfortunately however, the stretch of Taylor st the bar is located on is not the easiest spot to find parking. We found a meter spot several blocks away. This is where our evening took a turn for the worst. After a couple hrs we decided to check our meter, as some meters in the area run 24hrs. I asked the bartender to please hold our drinks and seats while we checked on the car. Again, no credit card was asked of me. Upon our return to the bar (less than 10 min later), I found both our drinks gone and our seats taken. I asked the bartender what happened, to which the owner came up to me and asked me to pay my tab. I was confused. Not only did they clear our drinks, but then I was being asked (quite rudely) to pay my tab. I responded by saying that we weren't done drinking and fully intended on staying for more drinks and music. At that point the owner accused us of trying to skip on our bill. Never have I been so insulted in my life! As a musician, I may not be rich, but never in my life have i walked out on a tab. And if i had tried bailing, I sure wouldn't have come back in! Not wanting to cause a scene I paid my tab and tried to enjoy the rest of the set. Within moments the owner came to my table and told me that we weren't welcome in his bar and that we should leave. Unbelievable!! As a return patron, and paying customer I was being told to leave. The owner appeared to be visibly intoxicated and unimaginably rude. He practically escorted us to the door and disrespected both myself and my friend. Who gets in the face of a lady?? Is this guy serious? What type of business owner treats his customers like that? Honestly, I used to really enjoy this spot. Good drinks, great live music. It's very unfortunate that It's so poorly managed. As the manager of a Chicago business, where I deal with the public everyday, I could never imagine treating my customers this way. I am truly disgusted with this establishment. I will never, EVER, consider returning to beviamo. And as for my musician friends, they too will never play there again. If you're looking for live jazz on a Saturday night, do yourself (and your date) a favor and visit the green mill instead. A real establishment, where you don't have to worry about the joke of an owner at beviamo.

24.description: Love Beviamo. My fiancee and I had our first date there, years ago. When it came time for engagement photos, we knew we wanted to at least try to get some taken there. The management and staff were incredibly accommodating -- not only did they allow us to take pictures inside, they even opened early just for us so that we could get what we needed. We absolutely love the way our photos came out! Besides how nice they were, it's also obviously got great drinks and a cool vibe. That's why we met there for our initial date in the first place!

7.description: My go-to wine/cocktail place on Taylor Street. It is indeed quiet and doesn't draw a huge crowd. Many places on TS can bring in the college riffraff. If you're into that scene then you won't find it here. But you will find great service from Josh the owner or the lovely Adriana. You can also order in carryout from nearby favorites like Davanti.

49.description: I've been here twice during the weekdays, both for my friends' birthdays, and their service has been nothing but fun, friendly, and extremely welcoming. For people seeking an intimate, relaxed, and cozy environment, I highly recommend stopping by Beviamo. Their friendly staff and great deals make the experience a memorable one.

40.description: Cute little place with great service! Nice selection of wines, our waiter was very helpful knowledgeable, funny, and friendly. However, the groupon was misleading.

53.description: We went in last night and used the Groupon special for "wine tasting for four"...I was worried that it would be several splashes of wine, over with in 15 minutes, but the tasting included two whites, two reds, and a sparkling wine/champagne, and we were there for close to 3 hours. The servings of each wine were substantial, and our waitress was extremely helpful in suggesting what we would like based on our individual preferences. None of us ended up with a glass of wine we didn't enjoy. It was pretty crowded due to it being a Friday, but it wasn't overwhelmingly loud--even with the live music--we were able to have a conversation comfortably.  We were there with a group of girls but it would be a great date place, as well!

30.description: Very cozy.  There is usually live entertainment on weekends and the bartenders are friendly.  Its pretty small and intimate so I would really only come here with a significant other.

46.description: LOVE this place. The music, the decor, the drinks, the prices, the company. Trust me on this and go see for yourself.

1.description: I had a Groupon deal for wine tasting and visited them on a Thursday night. There was only one other couple there and I felt like it was pretty quite night for a college-town bar. The vibe inside is pretty interesting and most of the wines we had were great as well. My favorite was Sao Blanc from New Zealand. Light, bubbly, fruity and overall amazing. For a $15 deal, it was definitely worth the money to have ten total tasting of wines and complementary snacks. However, they do not offer the snacks to just anyone. Patrons can over food from next door at Devanti's. The bartender was alright but never offered us the actual menu and was not as attentive as he was to other customers. I'm not sure if they have the $5 martini Mondays but overall, I'm not sure if I'll be back based on just the service.

55.description: I found this place by accident a few months ago and find myself going back a few times a month.  It's a great place to go on a date - with candle lit tables, dim lighting, and an intimate setting - or with friends - with several couches for everyone to gather.  The wine list is great - my favorite is "La Maialina", or Little Pig.  It's a Tuscan wine that I wish I could find in stores!  Their martini list is extensive as well and the bartenders skills at making them are exemplary.  The decor is unique and awesome.  From the light fixtures to the custom artwork on the walls (which is for sale) there's no place like it.  There are DJ's on certain nights that play great music that always seems to be at the right level to enjoy it yet maintain conversation.  Beviamo was a great find and I can't wait to keep going back!

9.description: The guy "greeting" you when entering is the only worker probably because nobody could stand to work for him. It is usually dead but being that it's Italian fest at the end of August it was more crowded meaning there were like 6 people in there. Me and a couple I was with got greeted at the door with "hey! there's no service for seating so order at the bar." Well ok so we sat down and then I along with a lady went to the bar she left her boyfriend to save the seat. We asked about wine supple which he seemed baffled and gave short rude answers. I mean when it's your career to pour wine glasses I would think you'd know more about your product and when your means of supporting yourself is a wine business I would imagine there would be a sizable selection of wine not withstanding the fact that this is in the heart of Italy. Ok so the guy doesn't know what he's talking about and has a limited wine selection and is short and rude, well I was about to order when he said "hey why don't you move?! There's a guy there give him some space." Well nobody gets away with disrespecting me and expects my business. So we left. And I will never go back. There's enough Italian wine places that are better in the area that don't have a frustrated jerk of an owner who freaks out and breaks into a sweat when his business surprisingly draws an unexpected crowd (6 to 10 people).

26.description: We came in with the deal for 4 glasses of sangria and snacks.  The snacks are to be ask expected - super salty nuts.  The sangria was made there, like a martini.  We thought they were just ok.  The bar is cute and the staff is friendly.  I like that there isn't a TV in there.  I would hang out here if I lived in the hood.  Or if I were going to one of the restaurants nearby and there was a long wait - I'd hang out here.

25.description: My husband and I were excited to start our date night there.  We had a Groupon which included wine tasting for two, complimentary snacks and a tour.  What a total disappointment...The vibe of the bar was low energy and pretty much empty - on a Thursday night!  The one bartender running the bar was not at all engaged with us as customers.  He had a friend or someone sitting at the bar that he spent all of the time chatting with.  We felt like we were distracting him with our requests for cocktails.The wine tasting was executed very poorly.  There was no explanation whatsoever of each of the wines (I've done many wine tastings and never just had wine placed in front of me with the server just walking away).  The bartender didn't write down our requests (4 reds, 4 whites and 2 bubblies), which shocked me as to how he would remember who gets what.  Sure enough, a couple of our wines were mixed up and the only reason we noticed is because we're proficient in wine selections.  And to add to the disappointment, the Groupon included complimentary snacks, which were not provided.  Because we were hungry I actually asked the bartender upon arrival where to get food (the bar doesn't have a food menu), but he did not mention the complimentary snacks.  At the end of the night we asked him about our snacks, and he said they ran out due to high volume that day (keep in mind the bar was practically empty).  The Groupon also included a tour, which we didn't receive (I'm not not sure what we'd be seeing anyway).  And finally, the bathrooms were filthy, which made us question the sanitation of the rest of the bar.  Overall a poor, poor experience and we will not be returning.

12.description: PLEASE READ.....Do not go to this place the service is terrible and the bartender treats you as if your annoying him. I planned a date last night here with Groupon. The bartender acted as if we were moocers. Then a couple came in a couple of minutes later without Groupon and it was the same thing. Save your money and time and go somewhere else.

59.description: The drinks at Beviamo are decent, as well as the crowd. How does this work: the guitar player takes his hands off of his guitar (to take a drink) and the "live" music doesn't skip a beat. There is nothing "live" about this music except for the man who is alive standing in front.Nonetheless, I enjoyed myself.

21.description: Came here this past friday March 14th for my first time and I must say I really like the place. I loved the ambiance and feel of the place. Our server that evening was very sweet and she did take time out to suggest something on the menu depending on our taste preferences.  They have a nice wine and beer selection,along with a few cocktail selections.  The place was a little chilly inside and I did have to keep my Jacket and scarf on but, that wouldnt stop me from coming back again. I had a very lovely experience there.

17.description: My friend bought a Groupon for a wine tasting for 2.  Nice ambiance, good wine and with generous pours, but very poor service.We arrived on time for our reservation, but the one bartender told us we had to wait until the other couple finished their wine tasting before we could start.  They were the only other people in the whole place, besides one woman sitting at the bar.  They finally finished 20 minutes later, and the bartender took our first order for sparkling wine.  He then went back to the bar to give the woman a back massage.  He was so involved with his special friend that we had to wait a very long time to order our whites, and then our reds.  We were basically flagging him down each time, pointing to our empty glasses, which was so awkward because he was clearly trying to put the moves on this lady.  When it was time for us to settle the bill, we went to him because he wouldn't come to us.I can see how this place would be cool on a busy night, but I felt the service was unprofessional and I don't think I'll return.

10.description: My husband and I were excited to start our date night there.  We had a Groupon which included wine tasting for two, complimentary snacks and a tour.  What a total disappointment...The vibe of the bar was low energy and pretty much empty - on a Thursday night!  The one bartender running the bar was not at all engaged with us as customers.  He had a friend or someone sitting at the bar that he spent all of the time chatting with.  We felt like we were distracting him with our requests for cocktails.The wine tasting was executed very poorly.  There was no explanation whatsoever of each of the wines (I've done many wine tastings and never just had wine placed in front of me with the server just walking away).  The bartender didn't write down our requests (4 reds, 4 whites and 2 bubblies), which shocked me as to how he would remember who gets what.  Sure enough, a couple of our wines were mixed up and the only reason we noticed is because we're proficient in wine selections.  And to add to the disappointment, the Groupon included complimentary snacks, which were not provided.  Because we were hungry I actually asked the bartender upon arrival where to get food (the bar doesn't have a food menu), but he did not mention the complimentary snacks.  At the end of the night we asked him about our snacks, and he said they ran out due to high volume that day (keep in mind the bar was practically empty).  The Groupon also included a tour, which we didn't receive (I'm not not sure what we'd be seeing anyway).  And finally, the bathrooms were filthy, which made us question the sanitation of the rest of the bar.  Overall a poor, poor experience and we will not be returning.

5.description: Horrible!The service is awful, very unwelcoming. If you plan taking a date, I'd suggest you don't

3.description: After going in at 11 with live music and plenty of patrons, I was turned away with a cold "No" to all my queations/attempted orders by the bartender. Incredibly rude

35.description: Hidden gem! Well at least it was hidden from me! I'm unfamiliar with the neighborhood in general so it was a nice change to go out in University Village in the first place. Where do I begin?Venue's:I went on a Saturday night. It's a super cute, low key wine bar with live music. The layout is long and narrow with eclectic, rich décor. There are small tables lining the wall window and a few love seats and with low tables to choose from. Find whichever spot works for you! We went with the love seat... I was on a date after all! For starters we sampled the wine flight, which comes with 4 varieties, 3 white, 1 red. I wish it was 2 and 2 but oh well. I had never heard of wine on tap so I wanted to try it out. Our server said they are just 1 of 3 or 4 other spots that have wine on tap so it's exclusive! The flight included healthy pours of a Zinfandel, Riesling, Sauvignon Blanc and some other white wine that I had never heard of (Gavi) and I would like to never remember because it tastes like bland, flat water. Have you ever heard anyone describe wine as tasting like bland, flat water? What is bland, flat water anyway? I don't know either, but that's the best description I have for it. No bueno. Anyway, they change the wines on tap periodically and the flight only costs $12 so going 3 for 4 was still decent odds. They featured a few specials as well for between $5 and $7 and on average, the wines were reasonably priced and they had a good selection. For you non-wine drinking wanting to frequent a wine bar LOL... they also have craft cocktails and beer.I was having such a good time that before I knew it 4.5 hours had gone by! Over time, people came and went and later in the night (starting around 11 or so) it started to get pretty thick. The crowd was diverse, which I enjoyed and appreciated, and everyone was having a good time.Music:You can check the venue website in advance to see who is performing on any given night. Chris Slone (chrisslone.com) was performing the night I went and he was AMAZING! He is a true musician. He can sing, play the guitar, play the piano, entertain the crowd, ad lib, rock out to any genre it seemed, take requests, etc. I must say that I appreciated all of the MJ tracks he performed too! I was already impressed but once he sang PYT (my fave MJ song of all time!) I about died! Check out his website and see where he's performing next. I'm definitely going to keep an eye out for Chris Slone. My date was a little jealous... rightfully so. LOL.Tip:They don't serve any food... no peanuts, pretzels, chips, piece of bread, nada. So keep that in mind if you plan on being like me and spending 4.5 hours in there! Plan ahead.

19.description: This is a place I used to enjoy going to but after what happened last night, I won't be back. Our group of 6 sat at the bar. When the bartender asked our designated driver what she wanted to drink, she said water. He proceeded to yell at her and said she couldn't sit at the bar and drink water. We tried to explain to him that the rest of us would be drinking but he told us to f-off and said we weren't welcome there. To top is off, he called us douchebags. Classy place!! Based on some of the other comments about the jerk bartender, I'm guessing he is a manager or owner so I don't expect any changes soon. Too bad.

28.description: NO MORE MARTINIS?!? srsly? The martini list alone was what made this one of my favorite bars in the city. I've recommended this place to more than a couple dozen ppl but no longer. I don't know what the owners are thinking because the place no longer draws the crowd of fans it used to. On top of that, the overall vibe has deteriorated w unfriendly servers and new artwork that doesn't suit the joint (colorful girls... really? ). Y take such a good place and ruin it? I'm really disappointed and actually mourning the loss of what used to be a unique and amazing joint. Time to move on

45.description: Seriously this place is the WORST. Good beer, great music on Saturday, good wine - terrible service. I was there with a friend and were having a great time until we had to leave to pay our meter. We told the bartender we'd be back and to save our drinks. Not only she NOT save our drinks, but she has the manager come out and tell us to pay our tab immediately. We do, and stay to finish our drinks and try to enjoy the music. We are then abruptly interrupted by the manager - who had been staring at us the whole time - who told us to leave right then and there AND calls my friend "shady". I was dumbfounded. Working in the food industry/hospitality field, I never lose my temper out at establishments like these. I lost it. How unprofessional and inappropriate. I was so offended and insulted that I didn't even finish my beer and said ok and started to put my coat on. My friend tried to explain that our friends play there and we came out to see them. He then had the audacity to ask what their names were. He thought we were lying!!!!!  Unbelievable.  He was aggressive and got in our faces. As we made our way to the door, we said our goodbyes to our friends who were playing. While this was happening, the manager came up behind u nothing s and told us again to leave and said "There's the door". So rude. So inappropriate. Completely unprofessional. I will go here again though. I will go here again hoping to see the same manager. Chances are, he won't recognize me because my friend and I did wrong. He was drunk and ignorant and not acting like a businessman. I don't have enough terrible things to say about him so I'll just end it here.

33.description: WARNING:  Groupon deal "complimentary food" = microwave popcorn!Something bugs me with BeviAmo.We've been patrons here for about 4 years now, even shopping the neighboring family business boutique, Zia, on every visit - my wife loves this little shop.We still love the place, but this last Groupon experience just isn't right because it's misleading, and also "the guy" I think people talk about in the negative reviews is the owner's son, so things really won't change unless an attitude adjustment is made.  I just think maybe he doesn't have the right personality for this type of business - he's not friendly or customer oriented to be handling the front end.  There are some really great girls that work here and gave us a really positive experience in the past, and that's why we always return for drinks. Anyway...on to our Groupon experience.   We bought the deal for four, because we wanted to introduce some friends to BeviAmo. The Groupon does state:  "Guests sip on 2-ounce servings of two reds, two whites, and one bubbly recommended by a wine specialist, while snacking on complimentary food served at the bar."    So yep....just like the other reviews state, they microwave a bag of popcorn.  How low class.  It was embarrassing for us because we pumped up this place to our friends.  When we arrived, just "the guy" / owner's son, was working.   He's not friendly and doesn't make you feel welcome - he's just doing his job.  He dropped off the menus, asked if we were there for the Groupon, then told us to pick 2 reds, whites, and a bubbly and walked away.  I guess this was the "recommended by a wine specialist" part on the Groupon.   We had to wait for him to come back and then start asking questions to get him to help us make selections, and only then did he open up and go into detail about the wine.   When asked about the included food, he told us the "food" was popcorn, and recommended ordering in from across the street at Davanti.  Since it was my treat to our guests, and I was embarrassed looking at a seedy bowl of microwave popcorn, I felt I had order some real food for the table to save face.  So, yes, we'll probably continue to drink here when "the guy" isn't behind the bar, but I just would not recommend getting the Groupon.   At least now you know what you are in for, or in for NOT.  And if I was the owner, I'd get my family out from behind the bar and redo the customer service aspect of this place or you'll continue to get negative comments on social media, and have to resolve to Groupon to get customers in the door. You need friendly, knowledgeable bartenders, not family, working the front end.

43.description: My friends and I had a coupon voucher for a wine tasting and we were nothing but satisfied. The service was exceptional and the decor is super cozy that it makes you feel at home. Definitely making it a "crack-spot" for drinks.

2.description: I'm very confused as to why this place has 4 stars. First off, it was so very sad on a Saturday night (over a holiday weekend no less). It was virtually empty at 6pm so we thought we'd go somewhere else first and pop back in a bit later. 8pm comes around and still only a few people were inside. Nonetheless, I thought hm, might as well give it a try. Our waiter was very, very persistent, to the point of being almost pushy. She kept on swinging by the table to ask if we were ready and would stand there waiting.....awkwardly for us to make a selection. Finally, I asked the waiter for a drink that's light and fruity as I don't drink alcohol all that much. She recommended the blood orange collins which sounded great to me since I love citrus-y drinks. Unfortunately, the drink was the complete opposite of what I wanted. I almost spat out my first sip and although it looked like a pretty drink, it tasted like nothing fruity and basically pure alcohol. Yuck! Definitely not returning here!

18.description: I purchased a wine tasting through Groupon and scheduled it, as required, through the site.  When we arrived for the tasting, at the time of our reservation, BeviAmo was closed.  No explanation.  I called the next day to see what was up and if I could either reschedule or get my money back, and the answering machine was full.  I finally was able to, after several calls, leave a message, which went unreturned.  In short, I ended up getting a refund through Groupon because BeviAmo was so unresponsive.

41.description: It was just another night trying to find a new place to have a nice drink.  Beviamo is a cozy wine bar with an eclectic ambiance.  I loved the brick walls, the unique crown molding, the artwork, even the model statue set by the wine bottles behind the bar, and especially the live music being played by a solo artist with his guitar by the baby grand piano.  The service was great.  The only thing I was skeptic about was the space.  It is utilized wisely, with lined seating against the wall, however, the area is small, sometimes hard to walk through without bumping into someone.  Got a full wine glass?  Raise 'em up.  Beviamo is a great place for a date night or to pre-game before a night on the town.

52.description: $5 Martini Mondays! Great place to unwind after a manic Monday.

50.description: Hats down it's the best wine bar in the city!  It's cozy with bar, table or couch seating, relaxing music, and a laid back atmosphere.  They have a great selection of wine and Monday night martini madness is a great deal!  They have all of the standard martinis but a few of my favorites are the Godiva chocolate, buttery nipple, and the watermelon martini.  I work evening shifts so it's a great place to unwind after work.

4.description: Came here with a Groupon for a wine tasting. With the deal my boyfriend and I got to try two reds, two whites, and one bubbly. All of the wines in the tasting were delicious and the perfect amount (about 1/4 of a glass). The deal also came with complimentary snacks which was a cheese and cracker plate. I must have been hungry because the crackers were delicious and the two cheeses we got to sample were also very good.After the tasting I wanted to try one of the cocktails. The bartender suggested the dark and stormy which comes in a copper mug. It was really, really, good! I would come back for that drink alone!Not super busy on weekday night, a few other couples were also enjoying drinks while we were there. I appreciated the quiet atmosphere though. Definitely a romantic date night spot.For more pics and details check out: stellasout.com/wine-tast…

6.description: This place used to be me and my bf's go to place during the weekend. What i like about this place is its very calm atmosphere. We can just hang out here, drink some wine and listen to live music while sitting on our favorite couch. It is a good date spot. My boyfriend moved out from that area but I'll definitely come back if i get the chance.

22.description: We had a group of 6 girls and we came here because of a groupon we had bought. I was a little skeptical at first because of all the negative yelp reviews. However, my experience was a bit more positive than that. We were greeted friendly when we arrived and our table was ready. There is a selection of wines for the wine tasting and he accommodated us. My only thing is the service is REALLY SLOW and we had to remind him a few times to bring water and complimentary cheeses. The wines tasted pretty good and our favorite was the prosecco.  Would like to try some of their other red wines. All in all good expereince.

15.description: Went last night for a wine tasting. The place has an interesting smell of mildew and is very dark. We had a 6:30 reservation which I tried to make for 6:00 and was told the 6:30 was the first available reservation. When we got there it was completely empty so I don't understand why we couldn't come earlier. The wines were good but the bartender serving them lacked personality and was very short with us. Almost felt like we were bothering him. Overall, I would never go back and would rather spend money somewhere where the appreciate your business.

57.description: Just in case anyone will skip over this review I'll put in large caps to...GO TO A DIFFERENT BARI've been to Beviamo a few times now. The first two times went well. Nothing too extraordinary. The wine list is small but interesting and the whiskey / scotch list is typical for a bar.Last night I got off work around midnight. I'm not sure if other servers feel the same as I do but after a long shift all I really want to do is have a drink or two and relax and forget the stress and anxiety from a late night rush so I stopped in for a drink.The bar was empty except for the bartender and two guys at the end of the bar who seemed like regulars.I sat down and the bartender checked my id. I was robbed a week ago so I've been using my passport and we chatted for a bit about where I've been and where he's been. He seemed a little drunk but that's typical given how late it was. I ordered a scotch neat and he went to make it. I saw him put ice in the glass so I said again, 'I'll just take it neat.' He poured out the ice, put my drink in front of me and walked over to talk to the two regulars who were TWO SEATS away. I opened a book and started reading and heard him say, "What kind of fucking pussy orders a scotch neat?"I looked up from my book, then went back to reading. One of the regulars said something and he responded, "He just seems like an arrogant asshole."So I looked up and said, "I'm sitting right here, I can hear you," and he turned to me and said, "I know," then turned back to the regulars and said, "Fucking asshole." I then asked him, "Did I do something to offend you?" and he said, "Yes."I honestly had no idea what to do so I asked for my bill and he said, "You're a "server" (and he used the rabbit ear quotation marks to say that), you should know how much you owe." I stood up, took out my wallet and put a five on the bar and he came over and started laughing and said he was 'fucking' with me and just giving me a hard time. I asked for the bill again and he put his hands on the bar and said, "I will fucking destroy you. I will destroy you in life. I will destroy you in women. I will destroy you in money."So I left my five on the bar, put on my coat, and left.I really can not express how ridiculous the whole experience was. I have never been treated that way by anyone. There was absolutely no exaggeration in any of this. Everything quoted was as said. I'm still not sure what I did to offend him but I said less than five sentences to him and there was really nothing more than talking about the trip to Europe I took six years ago when I was in college. I'm not sure if he is the owner or not but that was the most incredible thing I have ever witnessed. I've been a server for eight years and never has a table, nor another worker ever acted the way he acted.So, yeah. I would give the place three stars because it's an interesting place and would have been a great place to grab a post-shift drink and relax for a little. But there is absolutely no way I will ever go back there and I recommend everyone else stays far away. We should not support an establishment that treats any person that way. Especially since there are four or five other bars in the area that have better wine lists and a better whiskey and scotch selection (Davanti, Three Aces are the two places that come to mind).

20.description: Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me. Fool me a third time and it would appear I'm a glutton for punishment. It got one star because I couldn't give it zero. I really, really wanted to like this place. The first time I went there the first 3 wines I ordered by the glass they were out of. I realize things happen and places run out of stuff. When I finally found a wine they had it came in this puny, spotty glass. I thought this was a wine bar? Not a great first impression. The second time it was a struggle for the 2 bartenders to serve us. We were met with annoyed scowls for disrupting there foul mouth chat session with their friends and a small group of Blackhawks fans. The only reason we stayed is because of the convenience of the location. The third, and absolutely my last time, it was a quiet night with not much going on in there. Upon facing the bartender to ask for a wine list it was evident that they were intoxicated. And when I say intoxicated, I mean slurred speech, lack of short term memory. Not only was I very unimpressed, it was sad. Their sub par service was ignored when their indifferent disposition changed to an aggressive and mean, scary behavior. It was unbelievable. That was my last straw with this place. Closed the tab and will never go back. To think that a business can be run like this is beyond me. May this be a cautionary tale for anybody else brave (or stupid) enough to step through those doors.

36.description: This is a fun night cap spot.

14.description: I haven't had any bad experiences like other reviewers, and have been here many times over the years. I love coming here on Friday nights for live music with John Sabal - it's a fun relaxed atmosphere and I love making requests for songs I like to hear. The prices are probably a little higher than I usually pay for drinks, so it's not a place you might sit all night and drink, but it's good to have a few drinks over a few hours while listening to the music. To be honest I only come on Friday nights for the live music so I can't speak to the atmosphere on any other nights, but I would highly recommend stopping by here to let loose on a Friday night after work!

58.description: Convenient location. Free parking. Has the basics of what a Home Depot would carry. Even has a garden center. Although, we were looking for an indoor plant bug spray, and they were out of stock.Still on the fence regarding staffers knowledge... will update in the future.

56.description: BEWARE!!  A Home Depot employee in a Penske truck turning left hit my car while my boyfriend was driving on Clinton (not even in the Home Depot).  The driver admitted fault at the time of the accident and told us that we just had to go into Home Depot to file a report and they would take care of everything.  Now they are denying that it was the Home Depot driver's fault.  If you get into an accident with a Home Depot employee, make sure you call the police and get an accurate report so the Manager can't lie about what happened later!  This company apparently has no morals.  In addition, the store and their insurance company will not return phone calls and have continued to drag out the process.

29.description: I love Home Depot stores, but find this location to be disappointing. Like all HD stores, the staff are friendly and knowledgeable, the store is bring and clean, and the holiday selection is relevant. Sadly, this is a very small location and caries a limited supply. If you need the basics, they will have it. If you need something small and unique, make sure to check out the website first to see if they have your item in-store.**Helpful Hint: They have an amazing Hot Dog Stand inside of the front entrance. For a few bucks, you can get a Hot Dog, Drink, Pickle, and Soda!

42.description: I had a great time shopping for my new BBQ grill. Plenty of things on sell this week I like the grill its a weber got it for 50 bucks. The customer service was good and the guy in the paint Department was helpful too.

23.description: Figuring out how many stars to give this place is really tough. On one hand I worked with Guy to remodel my kitchen and it was wonderful. We got a great, inexpensive, Christmas tree that was... Great. Now... The tile department. I don't even know how to explain how frustrated I became with the inconsistent communication. I think I received four quotes, and all four quotes had a different price tag. You'd think that given the number of times they called me on my cell phone and work phone, about once or twice a day for two weeks, they would have been prepared for a scheduled visit. Other than that? Decently friendly staff, clean store, and free parking!

47.description: Overall a pretty solid Home Depot. I've been coming here for about 8 years as of this review and I think that says a lot about it.The staff they have here actually really know what the hell they're talking about and have never steered me in the wrong direction. Biggest issues; The store can get really busy and getting help means you almost have to take a number. Because it's so busy and other shoppers can be... well, less than cool. So double check that thing you're picking up to make sure it's the right one. You need to do your homework on the vendors that do installs for Home Depot. Most have been good, but others are just ok.At the end of the day though. This is still just another corporate American big box store and I've never felt like I'm getting the best deal, or the best products (especially wood). This 4 stars is really for the staff.

8.description: I'm guessing this location is relatively new since it seems to be the best stocked (or maybe it's because it's out of the way/downtown.)  Service levels are friendly during the day but the night crew is definitely unhelpful to the point of making every effort to avoid you.

31.description: Absolutely horrible experience when purchasing several large home appliances for my new condo. I will never use home depot for any big purchases in the future. I ordered a washer, dryer and dishwasher from the store. The store associate assured me installers will be able to do side venting on that dryer model due to space constraints. I was not a clueless customer, I measured my laundry room and knew what I was talking about. I paid everything and the delivery was scheduled a few weeks later. The delivery and installing company are most incompetent I have ever seen. When confirming delivery few days earlier, I again made sure they knew I wanted side venting, person on the phone said yes they will do it. On delivery day, the installer comes in and says it is their company policy not to do side venting. Couldn't they have mentioned this before when I repeatedly asked about it? I wasted over a month waiting for my washer dryer, wasted entire day waiting for the installer to find this out? Here I am still without a washer dryer and over a week after the failed dishonest installation attempt and still haven't got my refund back for almost 2000$ of returned w/d. I am on the phone every day with their customer service who still cannot figure out how to get my refund back, absolutely terrible. At this point I just want my money back and will never again buy anything from this store that costs more than $100, definitely nothing that involves any installation or delivery. I will buy those $5 flower pots, they can't screw that up hopefully.Update : The dishwasher install was also poorly done. 30 minutes into the wash cycle, it started making noises and then stopped working very first time I used it. Obviously the installer just made sure it works for first 5 minutes while he was there. Now I need to wait for manufacturer's repair man to come check it out next week and pay additional service charge for that too. I should have just refused delivery on the dishwasher as well. Now I will be wasting more money just to get a brand new dishwasher fixed because these installers (whom I paid extra installation fees) couldn't do their job. I will never let another Home Depot installer enter my home and will warn all my friends and family as well.

34.description: The worst Home Depot ever!! Customer service completely indifferent when you ask for some help... I will try to avoid this one.

16.description: Home Depots are okay ONLY if you need an item, not a service. I went here a couple of months ago to get a new faucet. I went on a Sunday.  The old semi-senile service rep could not help.  I located the faucet, but he did not know how to schedule installation.  So that was a waste of time.  I ended up having my condo office take care of the faucet situation.I also went to check out prices on stoves and refrigerators,  but they did not have a big selection and the service reps were yacking around a fridge I was interested.  So, instead of telling them to get out of my way, I left and made a nice purchase at HHGregg.

13.description: I would agree with some of the others.    Service here is not good.    I'll tell you the most frustrating part is their inventory system.   I checked before heading over to the store about some electrical dimmer switches.   They said they had 20 in stock online.     When I got there, there were none on the shelf where they were supposed to be.   I had to hunt around for them and it turned out there was a full box of them high up on the stock shelf.    I was able to get them after climbing the shelving.   This isn't the first time that I've had this type of experience.

11.description: Too bad you missed a sale, I have to purchase carpet for a rental unit and was ready to BUY, but instead you walked past me several times and said hello can I help you to three other people. Don't know why I was ignored, I showered today and was appropriately dressed for Home Depot. Sure I could have asked for help, but I figured you would get around to it in light of the others arriving after me. My guess is that you really weren't looking to help or work, all these folks said no thanks. You ignored someone actively calculating sq. yard costs. Looks like HD lost a 2,500 sale today. I'll shop elsewhere tomorrow.

39.description: I really want to like this Home Depot as it's so close to home, but whenever I go in there I find the staff either really unhelpful or they just totally ignore you. Yesterday I went in and spent 45 minutes trying to figure out something, I just left in the end feeling defeated and intimidated. Same department, different day, I actually had an associate swear under their breathe when I asked for help getting something heavy from a high shelf. Today I drove to North Ave Home Depot, an extra 6 miles just because they are so nice and helpful in there. I always come out having had a positive experience and with everything I need for my projects!!

37.description: Arrived on a Saturday evening to buy a washing machine. Quickly picked the one I wanted and asked for an associate. The associate said he didn't work in Appliances and would call somebody there. Nobody showed up. I stopped another associate and asked for help. Same story. Finally, I stopped a third associate and the Appliance associate finally arrived. She excused herself and quickly got ON THE PHONE.Note that this was already 15 minutes after my first attempt to get help. And there she is, on the phone. I wait and wait, and many associates go by without even saying a word. I get more and more frustrated. The phone call takes more than 30 minutes! She didn't even put the person on wait and apologize for the wait or tell me how long it was going to take. I walk by to her desk and she doesn't even flinch. I wait 45 minutes, and it seems like Home Depot doesn't want me as a customer at all. I leave while she is STILL on the phone. I left and bought a washing machine at the Best Buy next door. On the roof parking lot, there's even a bridge where you can just walk over so I didn't even have to move my car! I'm so glad I did not spend $1000 at this location with such atrocious customer service.

0.description: During this weekend project of replacing the two front doors (the frames are rotted and also needed to be replaced) the contractor took out the old doors and frame, gave me the measurements, along with a list of things I needed to go get in order to get the job done. I've never bought doors, screws, drywall or anything about that life before, but I had a list, a rolling cart, an hour, and plenty of help from the Home Depot employees. In the lumber department, once the employee was done assisting someone else, he helped me pick and place the 8ft 2x4s I needed on the cart, he didn't know about doors because its wasn't his area but he contacted someone in that department and kindly transitioned me over there. Once there that employee got the doors I wanted on the cart and rolled it over to the next department I needed. In total I had about 4 different employees from different departments help me choose and lift the materials I needed. On the 2nd floor parking garage, they got two employees up there that help customers load, so I didn't even have to ask. I wish I got everyones names so that I can give credit directly, but they were all great examples of the good hardworking employees of The Home Depot South Loop location.

38.description: I visit Home Depot at least once a week maintaining multiple investment properties here in the city. I had an 'appointment' that I set online with the window and door department to discuss purchasing and installation of 2 separate exterior doors for 2 buildings. I showed up at 10 and there was one associate in the dept that was helping another customer. I was never greeted in any way. Even after the other customer left I waiting another 3-4 minutes sitting at the desk next to the associate without being acknowledged. I had now been there 15 minutes. I said "excuse me and notified him that I had a 10AM appt. He said he had no idea what I talking about and paged someone to come over. 10 more minutes passed with the first associate sitting there working on the computer ignoring me and then finally Miriam showed up and had a terrible attitude the whole time. Mind you she is now 25 minutes late for our "appointment". She acted like she had no idea what I was talking about (which is why I had made an appointment to get some help). She was rude and extremely condescending. I ended up getting frustrated and walking away from her after being talked down to for a few minutes. Congrats to your associate that you had a customer there willing to hand over money for a product and installation. Due to her attitude you lost that purchase and as much as i could possibly try to take from you in the future.

51.description: Okay so now you know what our errands were on my previous post.  Just a quick shout out to Home Depot for being awesome with helpful store employees who can direct you to the right areas for various and sundry items; almost like a pop quiz for these people!We quickly found what we were looking for because we did a preview online at their website (before going to the store) to confirm these items did exist.  One of the things we like to do is let our imagination run wild as we ourselves are running wild down each aisle.  Hard to believe there are so many DIY projects, but there they are.  I'm making notes for future supplies and tasks, so we will be back early next year for more goodies.

27.description: Over the l last 5 years Home Depot has stopped vetting the quality of products they sell. From garbage cans to mops to desk lamps. Seriously downgraded crap.  Broken lamp one week later. Turn mechanism just stripped. Mop head was manufactured cheaply so the mop head would slip out often. Guess they saved Millions not adding the small price of metal that will keep the mop head from falling out periodically. I wish Menard's would move to the South Loop area as they still vet their products. Also HD household cleaners and supplies are more expensive than any other store. I now avoid HD at all cost...no pun intended.. Rip me off once, rip me off 3 times..Toodles.

32.description: Too bad you missed a sale, I have to purchase carpet for a rental unit and was ready to BUY, but instead you walked past me several times and said hello can I help you to three other people. Don't know why I was ignored, I showered today and was appropriately dressed for Home Depot. Sure I could have asked for help, but I figured you would get around to it in light of the others arriving after me. My guess is that you really weren't looking to help or work, all these folks said no thanks. You ignored someone actively calculating sq. yard costs. Looks like HD lost a 2,500 sale today. I'll shop elsewhere tomorrow.

54.description: A+ for customer service.My roommate was especially upset about the mirror/tape situation I mentioned in my last review. She encouraged me to get my tough consumer hat on and give Home Depot a call.I spoke to Tom the manager. He was far more understanding than I had anticipated. They replaced my mirror, no problem. I honestly can't think of a time in recent history where a company has been so understanding and helpful. I don't think this is a reflection of Home Depots everywhere (in my experience HD customer service has been mediocre at best), I think that Tom and this location are just exceptional. Though I live right next to the North ave. Home Depot, I will be going out of my way to go here in the future.... I just wont listen to the lady who works in hardware ;)

48.description: The staff here is great!!I went to get moving boxes, some bulbs for Ikea lamps and other random things for my furniture. I was directed to the right aisles/locations easily and found most of what I was looking for. The light bulbs, I was worried about because I hadn't found an American equivalent to the Ikea ones I'd originally bought. A nice gent on the staff helped me out within seconds! He even checked the bulb with one of their Ikea like fixtures to ensure that I had the right one!I found this Home Depot to be better stocked and organized than the one in Lakeview.

44.description: Tenant ordered a new dishwasher from The Home Depot at this location. Contractors for The Home Depot came on August 3 and installed the dishwasher; unfortunately, they left without testing to make sure it worked. Tenant called at 6:00 a.m. on August 4 to inform us that water was leaking, causing damage to the cabinets and to the light fixtures and ceiling in the unit below. The Home Depot guys had broken a pipe under the sink and that the water could not be shut off with shutting off water to all units. Tenant had been up all night emptying the water pan every two hours to prevent additional damage. FIRST ISSUE: The Home Depot contractors broke a pipe and left it leaking (and did not check to insure the dishwasher was running correctly)!I called The Home Depot on Monday. Customer Service gave me the name of the company that did the installation, Spirit Delivery. I called Spirit Delivery and they returned to the apartment to fix the pipe damage; unfortunately, they couldn't do the repair (something about copper pipes) and told me I had to hire a licensed plumber (they were not licensed plumbers???) and that I had to pay for the repairs and that their insurance company would reimburse me. Having dealt with insurance companies before, I knew there would be no guarantee of this promised reimbursement.I called The Home Depot, armed with claims from their website that stated "We stand behind our contractors." They agreed to find a repair person and agreed to make sure I would have to pay no out-of-pocket costs.I again called Spirit Delivery. They admitted guilt. The owner was professional and said he would do everything in his power to make sure the leak was repaired properly, and the damage to the unit below was taken care of. The contact person for Spirit Delivery, Milva, was very nice and assured me that they would take care of the costs to repair the pipe and the water damage, and that they would find a plumber to do the pipe repair to stop the leak right away. She admitted fault and regret.It took The Home Depot/Spirit Delivery THREE DAYS to find a plumber. The tenant was up every two hours for three nights, emptying the water bucket. The leak was finally fixed, at no cost to us (we thought). The next day, however, when the tenant tried to use the dishwasher, it wouldn't turn on.SECOND ISSUE: The new dishwasher installed by The Home Depot contractors did not work!I called The Home Depot again. They gave me the phone number of the manufacturer. I called the manufacturer. Luckily, when the manufacturer's repair people arrived to fix the appliance, they were smart enough to realize that the dishwasher was under warranty and didn't charge us. They said The Home Depot installers had made a mistake.THIRD ISSUE: The Home Depot contractors failed to connect the wires inside the unit properly.Spirit Delivery had given us an insurance claim number and asked for an estimate for the water damage. Several days later, I was able to obtain a water damage estimate, and sent it to Milva, at her request. I received a call from a Farmers Insurance agent two weeks later. Stacy informed me that they insured the company who broke the pipe (not Spirit Delivery???!!!). She had a different claim number. I had not heard of the company who was apparently responsible. Stacy said the company did not admit fault, and that Farmers would be investigating the incident. I demanded to speak with her manager. He seemed unaware of the entire incident, and promised to get to the bottom of the two different claim numbers, the unknown "other" contractors who were in my building for The Home Depot, and their failure to timely address this issue.FOURTH ISSUE: It took five weeks to get a check from the insurance company for the damage to the unit caused by The Home Depot contractors.On September 1, the tenant gave us an invoice from Roto Rooter for the broken pipe repair that he received in the mail. It had not been paid by Spirit Delivery, as promised.FIFTH ISSUE: The Home Depot contractors not only broke our pipe, but they broke a promise to pay for repairing their mistake. We paid for the pipe repair out of the funds we received for the water damage. We were reimbursed for the damage, but NOT for the pipe repair, the frustration, and all the time we had to spend dealing with the tenant, general contractors for an estimate, The Home Depot contractors, the appliance manufacturer, the appliance repairman and the insurance company in order to solve the issues connected with purchasing a new appliance, with installation, from The Home Depot.WARNING: The Home Depot does not appear to stand behind their contractors.

24.description: gotta love having a home depot in your neighborhood!this is a fine store, stocked with probably most things you could ask for from home depot, and return policy if you order online is easy and straight forward.everytime i've gone i've found someone who's been really helpful wearing an orange apron--sometimes it's not the first person you ask, but you can't blame them for not knowing where everything in the store is, i mean it's huge.WARNING:  do not get your keys cut here.  i know they have a key cutting service, but the way they cut their keys make for less than precise copies.  go to a legit locksmith and they can make exact copies of your keys so you don't have issues with having to wiggle your keys in your locks.

7.description: The most frustrating 2 hours of my life trying to find just salt. Every person I interacted with was rude and uninterested in helping.

49.description: Our kitchen faucet broke so I came in to buy a new one.  I never replaced a kitchen faucet before so I googled what I needed before I came in.  When I decided and grabbed the box, all the extra stuff I needed like the plumbers pudding, basin wrench, etc was conveniently there.  I had to come back because I needed a special piece for my filter system that I forgot about.  I didn't know a way around it since it was a little different piece.  i showed a picture to one of their staff members and they got me the right thing to solve my problem. As soon as I got home, it took me an extra 10 minutes and my faucet was up and running again.

40.description: I need to go to the Home Depot on Canal Street but first, I thought it would be a good idea to call ahead to make sure they have what I need. I have been on hold for over ten minutes.  But they keep assuring me that my call is very important. lowes.com

53.description: What a great home depot.Super close to where I live and has a large selection.I don't know what a five star home depot is but I'm assuming this place is as close as it will ever get.The service I have gotten here in the past has always been good and friendly, unlike at some other home depots where the workers seem upset and disappointed that you asked them a question.Parking has always been easy for me to find but it is pay to park on the street and not in their parking garage.

30.description: Frequently fail to have desired merchandise in stock.  Plants are not well cared for.Free parking lot.Friendly staff

46.description: Beware: Prices are really high! But the service is pretty good and the people here really know what they're talking about. I have had a *few* uncooperative staffers, but generally the plumbing dept knows a ton about plumbing, flooring crew knows about tile, etc.Only things "on sale" are priced competitively; everything off the shelf has a nice, high markup. Oh, and you have to use the self checkout, so you get the joy of "do-it-yourself" at home and at Home Depot. Ever wondered what it was like to work at home depot? now you can try out...I needed help removing stucco from our condo ceiling (nightmare project) and they had a lot of good ideas. They couldn't make the work any less backbreaking, but at least they helped me do it right the first time.

1.description: I came here with my boyfriend to get a Christmas tree and since he lost his key, I decided to get a new one because there was no line. The service was fast this time around (I had to wait for 30mins last year) and I got three copies made.We came home and none of them worked. None!I only paid about $8 for the keys, but I don't want to go through the hustle of going back there and having them fix their mistake since it's a 20min drive from where I live. Going to ACE hardware next time when I need to copy keys.

55.description: Wide selection of everything. It's also helpful for my parents that they employ workers that speak Mandarin/Cantonese. It makes my life so much easier! Good job looking at your demographics!

9.description: I visited this location to order closet doors for my bedroom. I wasn't positive of the size door that I needed so I paid to have someone come out to measure and provide a quote. I had to follow up to get that appointment scheduled a week later.The technician came out, took the measurements, said there "might be a problem" because the closet tracks were buried in the floor, then he left. About a week later, I received a voicemail saying, "We won't be able to replace your closet doors, call with questions."  I understand if the Home Depot doesn't want to take on my project, but I had to place several follow up calls to attempt to get these measurements so I could at least order the doors. Needless to say, I was never able to get the measurements and had to follow up a week after I was told I would be refunded to ask for it again. A month after the initial visit to the store and I'm no closer than when I started. Worst customer service experience I've had in a long time.

26.description: Called to inquire about an item, was transferred three times to the specific department, then customer service picked up again just to transfer me a 4th time, how packed can this place be at 9pm on a Tuesday night?! Just hung up and moving on to the next; thankfully the one thing that's constant with retail is options, tons of other places/options to shop.

25.description: I was so taken by the Christmas spirit of one employee at the South Loop HD. Wendy was helping us with a larger tree when she saw our two daughters playing with the miniature trees. She offered to give them one, and then proceeded to pay for it herself. I was stunned. She would not take any tip and gladly loaded the tree in the car for us. My daughters are so proud to have a tree in their bedroom and it's helping to get them to sleep. Thank you Wendy!!!

12.description: Frequently fail to have desired merchandise in stock.  Plants are not well cared for.Free parking lot.Friendly staff

59.description: Bad quality. I spent two hours to buy wood there because I found most of the wood either broken or not straight. The staff who passed by has not offered me help either in moving the wood on the top layer to get the ones beneath. The staff who is responsible of mixing paint is also quite incapable. Although I have showed him the color, he insisted that he would need a bigger print to make color. After negotiating him for an hour, I decided to go to Ace Hardware to mix the paint and receive the paint within 15 minutes. I spent three hours at Home Depot, and got bad-quality wood. I was happy that I could get cheap primer at Home Depot, but it was not worth my time.Item(s): 2Service: 2Decor: 3

21.description: Home Depots are okay ONLY if you need an item, not a service. I went here a couple of months ago to get a new faucet. I went on a Sunday.  The old semi-senile service rep could not help.  I located the faucet, but he did not know how to schedule installation.  So that was a waste of time.  I ended up having my condo office take care of the faucet situation.I also went to check out prices on stoves and refrigerators,  but they did not have a big selection and the service reps were yacking around a fridge I was interested.  So, instead of telling them to get out of my way, I left and made a nice purchase at HHGregg.

17.description: For me is rather just drive a couple miles out of the way to go to Lowes.  The prices are better and the customer service is better.  The best part about this Home Depot is that they have a free parking lot and that's about it.  On this particular visit I went looking for a grill.  The selection was above average but then again you would expect at least that at a home store.  None of the grills had information available (IE: BTU's), instead you have to download the Home Depot app and scan QR readers for full details.  When I selected one I wanted to know how big the box was to see if it would fit in my car.  The store clerk pointed to another grill in another box and said about that big.  After about a five minute wait another clerk came to get the correct box down but unfortunately the electric lift was out of battery.  After another 5 minute wait the clerk came with another lift to pull it down and guess what?  The box was ginormus.  So after all that I left with nothing and will try my luck elsewhere.  When all was said and done I'm over Home Depot, I'll stick to Lowes and other home stores.

10.description: What I thought would be a 5 minute visit to get one nail turned into a futile 45 minute visit.  i asked 3 employees to help me but all said they weren't in the hardware department.  So I had the service desk page for "help in aisle 13, hardware."  I waited 15 minutes and no one showed up.  He paged again and same scenario.  I think F. and W. from the hardware department snuck out early to do some trick-or-treating.  Check their time cards!The nice young man behind the service center did take pity upon me and helped me during his break but couldn't locate a matching nail, so I left empty handed.  Such a simple mission and such disappointing customer service.

5.description: Wow this place is special. I basically had to beg for help from the guy in the plumbing dept. after I was fed up and went to someone else for assistance I find out the guy "helping" me in plumbing is the supervisor! Then off to the cutting center to have a piece of wood cut. I had to wait 3 minutes while the two employees in that department were done setting up a date. Honestly this place is special.

3.description: The people working there just like walking zombies, they only pretend to look busy, one cashier was texting while cashing me out, unbelievable!

35.description: Home Depot is the place where I like to go shopping for my gardening hobby. It has a great outdoor nursery and the people there are helpful. You can catch a sale on soil at the beginning of the planting season and deals on herb plants in the midst of growing season. It's the Home Depot we are closest to and it's nice to have one around the neighborhood. I haven't had any problems with their services.
