19.description: They did not show up to deliver our flooring within their 8am to noon delivery window.   We called the Service Desk and spoke to Janet.  She transferred our call to Delivery and we got a voicemail.  So we called back again and the same thing happened.  A third time we were transferred to the "Delivery Supervisor" Sandra and got voicemail.  The fourth time we called Janet said the delivery people left 20min ago, but couldn't give us any more information such as the new estimated time of delivery, the phone number of the people delivering the flooring, etc.  We're reasonable people.  If something happened to the delivery and we need to reschedule that's one thing, but to make us wait around and not communicate a new estimated delivery time is unacceptable.

28.description: They did not show up to deliver our flooring within their 8am to noon delivery window.   We called the Service Desk and spoke to Janet.  She transferred our call to Delivery and we got a voicemail.  So we called back again and the same thing happened.  A third time we were transferred to the "Delivery Supervisor" Sandra and got voicemail.  The fourth time we called Janet said the delivery people left 20min ago, but couldn't give us any more information such as the new estimated time of delivery, the phone number of the people delivering the flooring, etc.  We're reasonable people.  If something happened to the delivery and we need to reschedule that's one thing, but to make us wait around and not communicate a new estimated delivery time is unacceptable.

45.description: Very friendly, knowledgeable staff.Inventory is just okay.Prices are high but search online at Menards and they will match prices.

33.description: i ordered countertops. Price was decent, but the service has been awful. I'm pretty much given the run-around ...either there is no one to answer the call or I am on hold. I am also pretty sure if I never called I would never get my countertops as they never called to begin with...I waited until week three to finally call in and ask about the status of my order. Next time, I am calling a contractor.

43.description: Brought my nieces here to to do the free workshop they offer every first Saturday of the month. The staff here is wonderful!  Thank you for the patience! And thank you Home Depot for giving my ninja monkeys the hand on experience!  :)

2.description: Horrible customer service at this location.  When asked a question barely got eye contact by the employee and was advised to follow them as he talked to another. I must have disturbed their personal conversation with my question about where the paint isle was. I did ask another man a question and he was at least helpful.So the icing on the cake for this trip was a man bought his pit bull in the store and not one word was said to this guy. The man checking the receipts even saw and chose to do nothing. Nice....I was there with my child and I don't think the home Depot is a place for a pitbull. He came close to her at the register and I pulled her away toward me because I was scared. I can understand service dogs at the store but pit bulls are not service dogs. I did write to complain to the home Depot and have not heard a word back. If anyone from home Depot is reading this check your video surveillance at the south loop location on 10/3/15 st around 2:10pm at the cash register area. Absolutely ridiculous that nothing was said when this man walked in with his pit bull. That is a lawsuit waiting to happen home Depot.

18.description: Figuring out how many stars to give this place is really tough. On one hand I worked with Guy to remodel my kitchen and it was wonderful. We got a great, inexpensive, Christmas tree that was... Great. Now... The tile department. I don't even know how to explain how frustrated I became with the inconsistent communication. I think I received four quotes, and all four quotes had a different price tag. You'd think that given the number of times they called me on my cell phone and work phone, about once or twice a day for two weeks, they would have been prepared for a scheduled visit. Other than that? Decently friendly staff, clean store, and free parking!

41.description: Got a great deal on tile I've been eying! They also are giving an additional 20% off clearance appliances. Total...30% off clearance appliances until the end of January.

52.description: The hubby and I bought our first Christmas tree from this Home Depot...and this year we bought our second.  It's close to home and the price is right ($40-60 depending on the variety you pick).Once we picked out the perfect tree, they cut about an inch off the bottom and trim off the low lying branches.  Any branches they trim off your tree you can keep, if you want them.  Then they tied up our tree with twine mesh, carried it out to our little car and tied it on and we were on our way.  It's the full service deal, short of carrying it into your house.

50.description: This location is extremely convenient for me because I live right by here. It is a nice store and you can pretty much find 90% of the stuff you came here to look for. The parking lot is on the second level, which makes it a little more of a hassle to come here, but still nothing to complain about. Their employees can be knowledgeable depending on who you get. Most of the time they can direct you to the correct aisle when you asked them. However, the catch is that you have to go out of the way to find someone to help you. For some reason, every time I come here, I have to walk around for minutes before I can find any employee to help me. When you find them, they tell you which aisle it is and walks away like you are really bothering them. The last time I was here, which was a few days ago. I was with my dad and we were looking for a water heater since ours was leaking. I came here and stood by the water heater section for over 15 minutes doing our own research. Then, I realized that no employee was around so I walked around for another minute or so and finally found an employee. I asked him for help about water heaters and he told me he doesn't know much about them. I stood there looking like an idiot because I was thinking is he going to ask another person for me, or am I going to have to find someone myself? Without him saying anything, I then said nevermind. I just went back to the water heater and bought one anyway because we really needed it STAT.Another bad experience I had here was with the cashiers. Long story short, she was unable to find out the price of an item for me that I had bought earlier because there was no barcode on the item. She tried to look it up for minutes to finally quote me a higher price than I remember paying. I told her I will go back to try to find the price because that wasn't what I paid earlier. I then went back and found the price tag and I just went to the self checkout to pay for it myself.

4.description: If you haven't been to a Home Depot, you must live underneath a rock.  This location follows the same basic model: a cavernous box with long aisles and everything you might need for your home improvement needs.  The service at this location is sparse.  But given their lack of helpfulness, that might be a blessing in disguise.

6.description: I ordered some plywood and underlayment online for pick up and this was a very poor experience.  The order was not fully picked, and when I asked for help to finish filling the order, I was told it was not their department and they didn't know where the product was.  I wouldn't have thought anything of it, but multiple staff told me that exact same thing, and I ended up just finding it and loading it myself.  Still not necessarily a problem, but it just kept progressively getting worse when I kept getting the run around to get the right receipt to leave.  I kept my cool and did not visibly get irritated with anyone, but it took over an hour to get through this process and I simply do not plan to go back.  There are many other hardware stores to try.  I do not recommend going to this location, if you can help it.

22.description: Very difficult store to get customer service. We were here at Christmas looking at trees on a weekday morning and waited 45 minutes for the "tree guy" to help us. Despite multiple requests to other employees, they could never seem to find him.Finally, we dragged a tree over to the cutting area, hoisted it onto the table, revved up the chain saw and cut the trunk down ourselves. At that point, a clerk did come running. Secret to getting service here? Start up one of the chain saws!

15.description: Very difficult store to get customer service. We were here at Christmas looking at trees on a weekday morning and waited 45 minutes for the "tree guy" to help us. Despite multiple requests to other employees, they could never seem to find him.Finally, we dragged a tree over to the cutting area, hoisted it onto the table, revved up the chain saw and cut the trunk down ourselves. At that point, a clerk did come running. Secret to getting service here? Start up one of the chain saws!

57.description: I am very happy with this establishment.  The staff is helpful and everything is well organized.  I shop here for all home repairs, maintenance and gardening needs.  I haven't purchased anything really big here so that's why the review is missing the 5th star.  If ever I do a big purchased I will update.  Also, I feel that they have a pretty good selection.

20.description: Don't ever call to find out if they carry a product.  It is an exercise in futility.  Clueless employees who can barely talk.  They kept me on hold for over 15 minutes, transferring me repeatedly and eventually hanging up on me.  This place is a joke.

36.description: For me is rather just drive a couple miles out of the way to go to Lowes.  The prices are better and the customer service is better.  The best part about this Home Depot is that they have a free parking lot and that's about it.  On this particular visit I went looking for a grill.  The selection was above average but then again you would expect at least that at a home store.  None of the grills had information available (IE: BTU's), instead you have to download the Home Depot app and scan QR readers for full details.  When I selected one I wanted to know how big the box was to see if it would fit in my car.  The store clerk pointed to another grill in another box and said about that big.  After about a five minute wait another clerk came to get the correct box down but unfortunately the electric lift was out of battery.  After another 5 minute wait the clerk came with another lift to pull it down and guess what?  The box was ginormus.  So after all that I left with nothing and will try my luck elsewhere.  When all was said and done I'm over Home Depot, I'll stick to Lowes and other home stores.

14.description: Terrible and unprofessional customer service. Ordered a door and it took over two months to arrive and when it did; the door was damaged and had to be returned. No one from the store called to communicate the next steps. Thus, I just ring customer service and put on hold for a very long time and when I finally reached a manager she was rude and unfriendly.   I definitely do not recommend this store to anyone. The staff is very rude and unprofessional.

3.description: I had to make a return to A.S because the outfit I bought for my friend was too big. They exchanged it with no problem however, I didn't think the service was all that. I asked for help on some jeans and one of the ladies made a huffing sound under her breath like I was bothering her. Not Cool at all! The store seemed clean. I don't think I will be going back to A.S anytime soon

1.description: the latest incident, Yesterday on 11-04-15, I tried to return an item i purchased off line only 1 1/2 weeks ago and because they didn't have the item in store, employee Raven refused to accept it and then argued me up and down that i brought it on clearance which i did not on Oct.17, 2015 on-line. and Raven told me I had to send it back to Ashley Stewart on-line. Really? I have been in this store previously, where I have witnessed the employees rudeness.  This store has the rudest employees out of all the stores I have been to in Chicago area. I live a few blocks from this location and I would rather travel miles away for better customer service than spend my money were all of the employees are rude.

2.description: The C.S at this store is great. I can always find a nice out fit for any Occasions. The size are right to fit. For my juicy self.. Spring is on the way someday soon so check out the new colors for this year.. One of the things that I really like about this store is that if you need help with anything the ladies and 1 gent. Are more then happy to help..

0.description: I was in there the other day scoping out the sales and found some great deals.. Unfortunately someone tried to steal the shirt I wanted so it had a big hole where the tag was., DOH!  Excellent service.. manager is awesome and he is a MAN.. He has been there for some time now and he has adapted to being around all the curvy girls.  This store is always clean, friendly and well stocked with the latest itemsBRAVO!

58.description: Considering the availability of restaurants on Taylor Street, I would rank Hana as a preferable (but more expensive) option for sushi compared to Ichiban. There also aren't as many Chinese restaurants available, so Hana will fulfill your Americanized Chinese food cravings.The restaurant is clean, decor is modern, and their service is polite. I would personally go elsewhere on Taylor for Thai food, but they have a good portion for their Chinese  (unfortunately, Americanized and slightly on the greasier side [had their fried rice]) dishes and decent sushi. Food-wise, the restaurant is slightly below average.. but their ambiance (good noise level and presentation) and service bumps their overall score.

56.description: Amazing. I don't know why it doesnt have 5 stars. Good food. In the soup it was thick and had lots of components. Sushi delicious. Crab ragoons crisp and served hot :) coming back no questions about that

29.description: Ordered shrimp red curry.  There were about 3 shrimp in my watery flavorless curry.  They forgot the rice and took an hour to bring it after I called it in.  I think their Chinese food is better -- I've ordered it a few times and it was decent.  However, I won't be ordering from them again.

42.description: Nice spot for lunch quick with your order and rolls are well made. Also it's hard to beat the value if their lunch special large portion plus egg roll and rice. Love stopping by here when I'm at work. Have not tried one yet but I hear their smoothies are excellent as well.

23.description: What happened to Hana!?!?!? I use to order from here all the time and was always pleased! Food was always good, great price points, and portions were always great for sharing. I ordered the general Taos chicken, potstickers, the volcano appetizer, and crab Rangoon, which I've always enjoyed in the past. To my dismay the potstickers tasted like cardboard, the chicken in my entree was non existent, I mean seriously wtf did you deep fry?! My crab Rangoon was completely empty pockets of deep fried dough as well, and last but not least the volcano appetizer tasted super fishy! ( hope I don't get sick from eating it). If the food didn't disappoint me enough the extreme price hike on the whole menu sure did. And how do you raise your delivery fee to $6!? I will NEVER order from here again. Rather eat a stale piece of bread next time! Don't waste your money or taste buds here.Update on previous review, both my boyfriend and I got sick from the food! $60 in the garbage and we're both suffering horrible stomach aches. I have never been more disappointed by a restaurant. I won't ever be wasting my money here again!!!

47.description: My wife and I are very picky about our chinese food. Hana isn't perfect, but it's quickly become our go-to. Every dish we've ordered has been delicious. They're not the fastest delivery, but they're pretty good, and the food is always hot and fresh. Can't wait to try the sushi.

8.description: I very rarely give a 1-star review, but Hana earned it. I only tried the sushi so can't speak to the Chinese dishes on the menu, nor will I be trying it after my experience last night.I ordered delivery from Hana last night after a long week and not wanting to venture out into the icy grips of Chicago winter to satiate my sushi craving. The delivery was quick but that is the only positive thing I will say about this place. Every single roll we ordered lacked flavor and the quality of the food is noticeably subpar.We ordered a sweet potato, California, spicy tuna, Las Vegas, and the Red Dragon rolls, resulting in a free order of crab rangoon. Crab rangoon was basically just cream cheese in a greasy wonton, completely lacking in both flavor and the presence of crab. I should have know I was in for the second-worst sushi experience of my life (the first involved food poisoning) upon first glance of the California roll. Like with the crab rangoon, lack of crab! Hana pulls a cheap trick and mixes the crab with mayo to make a crab salad instead of using a solid crab stick. Just gross. The sweet potato roll is normally one of my favorites- this was just ok. The spicy tuna was unremarkable and tasted like watery wasabi. The Red Dragon tasted like old grease, and the Las Vegas was basically a bite of cream cheese wrapped in rice and covered in spicy mayo and a slice of jalapeno, which wasn't even spicy. Needless to say, I was completely disappointed with my Hana experience and will not be going back. The quality of all the components of the rolls are cheap and Hana attempts to hide it by slathering everything in mayo. For shame. I have eaten better sushi from the grocery store

31.description: Solid Americanized Chinese. Lo mein was particularly good. Intense chef special sushi selection, as well. Yet to try the Thai food.

34.description: I love this place.... and it is the best for Chinese delivery! Whenever I'm hung over this place saves me. Their crab ragoons are my favorite. There's a ton of the crab and creme cheese filling! Yum. Also, all of their portions are incredibly generous. One time I ordered delivery for 3 people. I thought we ordered just the right amount of food... but I kid you not our bag was about 10 pounds. Left overs for days! Anyways this place is great and you should try it if you haven't already!

16.description: Firstly, the waitress had to be told everything thrice before she could grasp anything, including our order. Eventually we pointed out our items on the menu. Next, we asked her if the TV there worked, she switched it on and made us sit through 4 minutes of YouTube commercial. No sports she said. Unbelievable right?! Then she poured more water into my already full glass of water. It was still better than what she did to the people sitting on the next table, where she poured water into the guy's glass of beer. The guy's reaction was priceless.She brought me the remote after I asked her to switch the TV off for the third time. Anyways, the food came before I lost all my sanity, it tasted bland and the portions were small compared to what I had experienced here earlier. At the end of the night all I was glad about was that it was over. I am never returning here.

13.description: Do not order for delivery!! After over an hour we called the restaurant and after they hunted around for our order, they finally told us that it was on the way. Fast forward 30 minutes, still no food. Call again. We're told the delivery man got lost and it would take another 20 minutes. At which point we cancelled our order as no Chinese delivery should take 2 hours. Not to mention, why not call for directions if you're lost?Absolutely horrible service.

11.description: Bad delivery experience. They took over an hour to get to me. Sushi wasn't cold. All I got was he's on his way. Then I raised my voice and they said the manager would call me back. Alas, no phone call. Will never give them my money again based on their lack of courtesy.

39.description: this place is just MEHthe quality of fish isn't the bestin fact some of it tastes pretty badi tried sushi/sashimi/rollsand the rolls were okayprices were moderate sushi pricescustomer service was fairthis is definitely not my go to sushi place

37.description: We order sushi from here and it is amazing. They are always consistent, fresh, and have a focus on service. We love their options as well.

0.description: It was an okay experience. The sashimi was awesome, it was fresh and delicious. I love sashimi but the only thing I noticed, they are overpriced. For 2 pieces of sashimi, it costs $5.00Well, it's downtown... what can I expect?

38.description: GREAT Lunch specials, I love their Szechwan Chicken and General Taos Chicken. Just good, authentic, fresh Chinese food. Done right, not rushed like some other nearby spots. They need to improve the heat in there b/c it's COLD on cold days. I can't depend on the Spices to warm me up!

51.description: you can never go wrong with a $10 maki roll special.  My fav. are the shrimp and asparagus and spicy salmon.  And they stay open pretty late which an extra addition for students getting out of class at 9pm

27.description: This review is based off my delivery experience tonight. Grub hub emailed me and raved about the good Chinese etc etc. it was pretty awful. I got Szechuan chicken, wonton soup, egg rolls, lo mein. Had it not been for the CLEARLY re heated egg rolls this place would have gotten three stars. How could this be regarded as one of the better Chinese places in Chicago? The chicken dish was ok, lo mein was good but who can screw up lo mein? All and all I'll give this place one more chance with sushi but I won't each their Chinese.

32.description: I order from here ever so often, since moving it's the only place that delivers decent sushi to my neighborhood. Their food is pretty good and the lo mien is awesome. The chicken they use for orange/ sesame etc is different than other places as they batter fry it instead of breaded. I have noticed the quality of fish used for their sushi go down a bit and I dont really order nigiri because of it now. If their fish quality went up I'd give them 5 stars. They also have great coupons and really large portions that you can share.

54.description: I love Hana. I think it affordable and delicious! I would definitely recommend it.

48.description: I've avoided writing a review for Hana because I didn't think it was right to judge based solely on the smoothies.  Finally was able to try some food and now I can say that I really like their food.  Notice, I said food - I've only purchased for take out - but what I had was good enough for me to return for not just their yummy smoothies - but for their Lomein. I will say one thing, it is a bit on the greasy side - both the Lomein and the Egg Rolls - but it was so yummy in a "bad day" kind of way.  The portions are big enough for two meals easy.  The smoothies are really yummy.  They have over a dozen flavors, and you mix them, and also get tapioca if you're into that.  I can't pick a favorite because I like probably all of them - however, they are on the sweeter side, so I don't get them as often as I'd like.The actual seating area is a little small and dark - and I don't think I've ever seen more than 3 tables seated at the same time.  Not sure why?  As for me, I am usually pressed for time so I just grab my grub and and go.

44.description: Hana was perfect for a weekday movie session. The pot stickers were great. We each had a Thai noodle soup. Great value, as we could have split one for $7 and it was a hearty soup.

24.description: Do not order for delivery!! After over an hour we called the restaurant and after they hunted around for our order, they finally told us that it was on the way. Fast forward 30 minutes, still no food. Call again. We're told the delivery man got lost and it would take another 20 minutes. At which point we cancelled our order as no Chinese delivery should take 2 hours. Not to mention, why not call for directions if you're lost?Absolutely horrible service.

7.description: Despite the other reviews I ordered the tuna roll and sashimi sake for pick up and thought it was great. Super fresh and quick service. The place itself is pretty small and would be good for a casual dining experience.The only downside was when I called she didn't give me a delivery pick up time and said she'd call me when it was ready, which was literally 10 minutes later. She said the chef was backed up and when I got there they had one couple dining so just a little confusing. Overall I would go back again!

49.description: Whoaaaaa! We just decided to pass by and my friend Lupe said "smoothie", but what I didn't realize was that "smoothie" also had lunch specials for $6.50. Lawd what?!!!This combo lo Mein is really good! It took longer then I thought but I must say it had to be fresh! This is really good Lo Mein indeed! I would highly recommend this spot, but know that it's not the biggest in size but definitely enough space to accommodateabout 15  couples or so.I also ordered a mango coconut smoothie that really made me a believer that  they ate on the right track with this spot!Prices are really fair and they also have Bento sushi boxes that of course I will try a a later date. Simply stated, this little spot will definitely give the area a run for its money as far as authenticity I just say. Yes, there are a few sushi/Chinese/Thai places in the area known as little Italy, but this ranks up there in taste for sure.

40.description: We ordered from here last night and I was super disappointed. We ordered for delivery. Although they're not far at all from my house, it took an hour for the food to get there. The miso soup was piping hot, which could explain why both of the rolls I ordered were so warm, which made them pretty gross. I ordered the Hamachi Guacamole and I swear they used a whole bunch of cilantro. It was disgusting. Had they put a decent amount in the roll, it would've been good. It was just too much. I spent time taking cilantro out of each of the rolls and by about halfway, I was over it. $30 down the drain. Very disappointing because I had this place before and they were decent. Unfortunately, I won't be trying them a 3rd time.

53.description: No Star!!!I went to get a Bubble tea - Sugar Free Mango and coconut with Tapioca. Well, it appears that the lack of sugar threw the blender off because it took the guy 10 minutes + to make it. Mind you that there was no one there. The last table had left.  The attendant said that it had taken so long because there was no sugar it was harder to make. Really? WTH? I tasted it and it was not good the texture was not smooth, but rather grainy and watery. I did not give it back to get another one and get another one did not feel like sticking around for another 10 minutes. As I walked down I finally tried a tapioca bubble and I almost broke a tooth! It was super hard. That was what did it, not only the bubble tea/smoothie was terrible but the tapioca bubbles (my favorite part of the bubble tea, the bubbles) were super hard. I took the bubble tea back. I said it was horrible. He said it was because it had no sugar. It's not the first time I take it without sugar and the taste has nothing to do with the texture or the softness of the tapioca. I always have my bubble tea without any sugar, I know what to expect. I wanted my $4.21, but he only offer to make me another one. I did not have 10 more minutes to waste. I had to get back to work. I will not go there ever not for their smoothies, not for their food. Do not waste your money. The bad service and the bad smell on your clothes is not worth it.  Sad, had he given me my money back I would have given them a second try. I guess at Yelp does not allow Zero star rating...

30.description: they increased the price，but they have not increased the quality. Lunch special costs more，but the "details" get less. I really like Hana before，but now it is hard to me to recommend it to friends.

46.description: Great spot on Taylor for a trifecta of Asian cuisine.  We stopped in for an early dinner last Saturday night (6pm).  We were the only ones dining in at the time, but lots of people coming in to pick up carryout orders.Greeted promptly and shown to a table near the back.  4 year old son fell asleep and they gave us a good table to fit our umbrella stroller (and kid) next to it).  Nice wall booth/chair and table combos lining one side.  And a smattering of 2 and 4 seater tables throughout the rest of the smaller dining area.Nice quiet interior, huge projector screen covering one wall.  They turned on Palladia TV for us and we were treated to good music and videos.Sushi bar in the back, no bar dining, but added to the ambiance.  Service was friendly and unobtrusive, though still very attentive.We ordered both Japanese and Chinese dishes.  My husband and daughter enjoyed a variety of sushi.  We ordered the combo fried rice, Seafood Delight, and orange chicken for the table.My daughter also had a strawberry smoothie sans tapioca, and she enjoyed it.Everything tasted good. The seafood delight had mostly imitation crab and fish, would have liked more or at least equal amounts of shrimp and scallop but it was still tasty. The combo fried rice had good amounts of chicken, beef, and baby shrimp. I probably could have had it as a meal alone. Orange chicken was tangy and sweet, we ordered it without the spice. Not too greasy.We'll remember this place next time we're looking for good Chinese, Japanese and will have to try the Pad Thai next visit.

1.description: Terrible delivery service. I had to cancel my order almost immediately after placing it. They refused to do it! The lady on the phone refused saying the order was already complete, which was a lie considering I ordered a minute ago.Disrespectful.

55.description: Affordable and delicious....just remember to ask for chopsticks or forks to be included if you get take out. For some reason they have left them out multiple times on me

9.description: I ordered grubhub from here and all the tempura on my sushi was soggy by the time it got to me :(also I just found a hair in my sushi.

26.description: I very rarely give a 1-star review, but Hana earned it. I only tried the sushi so can't speak to the Chinese dishes on the menu, nor will I be trying it after my experience last night.I ordered delivery from Hana last night after a long week and not wanting to venture out into the icy grips of Chicago winter to satiate my sushi craving. The delivery was quick but that is the only positive thing I will say about this place. Every single roll we ordered lacked flavor and the quality of the food is noticeably subpar.We ordered a sweet potato, California, spicy tuna, Las Vegas, and the Red Dragon rolls, resulting in a free order of crab rangoon. Crab rangoon was basically just cream cheese in a greasy wonton, completely lacking in both flavor and the presence of crab. I should have know I was in for the second-worst sushi experience of my life (the first involved food poisoning) upon first glance of the California roll. Like with the crab rangoon, lack of crab! Hana pulls a cheap trick and mixes the crab with mayo to make a crab salad instead of using a solid crab stick. Just gross. The sweet potato roll is normally one of my favorites- this was just ok. The spicy tuna was unremarkable and tasted like watery wasabi. The Red Dragon tasted like old grease, and the Las Vegas was basically a bite of cream cheese wrapped in rice and covered in spicy mayo and a slice of jalapeno, which wasn't even spicy. Needless to say, I was completely disappointed with my Hana experience and will not be going back. The quality of all the components of the rolls are cheap and Hana attempts to hide it by slathering everything in mayo. For shame. I have eaten better sushi from the grocery store

25.description: The food here is decent, both the Chinese and the sushi.  We used to order here all the time.  But after this last time, we're done with this place.  The service here is absolutely awful.  After our food was thirty minutes late, we called to check on the status of our delivery.  The person that answered the phone barely spoke English and it took ten minutes for them to even understand what the problem was.  They finally told us the food was on the way.  Thirty minutes later, we still don't have our food. We call again.  After another ten minutes of explaining what happened, they say the food is on the way.  The driver finally calls and says he is outside the door of the apartment.  He wasn't.  Shocker, he is at the wrong apartment.  He finally gets to the apartment and says he was late because of "traffic."  So we don't tip him and he calls us a jerk.  Great service.

12.description: What happened to Hana!?!?!? I use to order from here all the time and was always pleased! Food was always good, great price points, and portions were always great for sharing. I ordered the general Taos chicken, potstickers, the volcano appetizer, and crab Rangoon, which I've always enjoyed in the past. To my dismay the potstickers tasted like cardboard, the chicken in my entree was non existent, I mean seriously wtf did you deep fry?! My crab Rangoon was completely empty pockets of deep fried dough as well, and last but not least the volcano appetizer tasted super fishy! ( hope I don't get sick from eating it). If the food didn't disappoint me enough the extreme price hike on the whole menu sure did. And how do you raise your delivery fee to $6!? I will NEVER order from here again. Rather eat a stale piece of bread next time! Don't waste your money or taste buds here.Update on previous review, both my boyfriend and I got sick from the food! $60 in the garbage and we're both suffering horrible stomach aches. I have never been more disappointed by a restaurant. I won't ever be wasting my money here again!!!

59.description: They recently raised the lunch special price. It used to be the best deal on taylor street. It's still a pretty good deal but those extra 75 cents or so can add up.The staff is always friendly when I come in to pick up my food (I have never dined in but will most likely try it since UIC students get 15% off).

21.description: Despite the other reviews I ordered the tuna roll and sashimi sake for pick up and thought it was great. Super fresh and quick service. The place itself is pretty small and would be good for a casual dining experience.The only downside was when I called she didn't give me a delivery pick up time and said she'd call me when it was ready, which was literally 10 minutes later. She said the chef was backed up and when I got there they had one couple dining so just a little confusing. Overall I would go back again!

17.description: Food quality was poor, water tasted like sawdust. The servers and staff were very friendly, but the food needs a lot of work. Also it was 80 degrees in the restaurant with no ac running

10.description: How comes I paid $24 for two signature roll and then it was so tiny?! and the taste was very bad!!!:-(

5.description: Ordered takeaway last night and received bland food that had clearly been either reheated or cooked from frozen. The gyoza was fairly decent although you can't really go wrong with those. Tempura tasted like it had been fried in very old oil and it wasn't tempura batter it was breaded. Egg rolls had a processed paste in it rather than meat and veg and the pad Thai tasted reheated and bland with chewy chicken. Awful.

3.description: I came here during the Italiano Festival in the summer. I walked in late afternoon and asked if they had lunch special. The owner said yes, we do, and I told her that I need to use the restroom before ordering. I sat down and saw that lunch ended at 3 pm and I politely said I thought you said you had lunch special and as I got up the owner and server were very pushy and were adamant to keep me in the restaurant.  The owner/manager had zero customer service and accused me of just wanting to use the restaurant bathroom  (I never felt so disrespected in a restaurant). She then told me that someone from the festival clogged their bathroom (which wasn't my wrongdoing and someone else's). I decided to dine in and ordered orange chicken with fried rice to prove I "wasn't just using their restroom". The outcome: the food was bland and a little pricey as other Yelp reviewers have stated.Would never dine here again. ever.

35.description: Their sushi are great! Very delicious! A good place to have some sushi and soup~

19.description: The food was okay! But the service was extremely poor! How can you put up dishes on the table without a serving spoon? The server was nowhere to be seen. Extremely horrible experience! Won't ever visit again!

28.description: Hana sushi.   Well, I would call this a sushi restaurant. I didn't order anything else but sushi from this place, but if I were you, I'd go elsewhere.   I literally could not eat the sushi and they forced me to pay for the food I ordered. It was completely unfresh and worse than any whole foods sushi. That's not saying much since supermarket sushi is a day old usually.    Please do your friends and family a favor and do not eat at the worst sushi restaurant in the entire city of Chicago.    You can do better. As well, if you owner of Hana sees this and I hope they do, please make an effort to buy fish from a different supplier and take a little pride in your work. Maybe you should see the documentary " Jiro Dreams of Sushi" and get inspired.    Good luck and try to improve your restaurant.Aaron

45.description: I must admit I wasn't super hungry when I ended up eating at here so I may end up eating my words after I retry their food...i will definitely try their that food next time...A curry dish I think.  Not bad for what it is...A campus asian restaurant that's providing for mostly students who want cheap bites and aren't very picky.  The crab rangoon were good and a nice surprise because they were on the house after I ordered more than twenty dollars worth of food.  I ordered through the yelp online order service and it was so easy and convenient.i also ordered a spicy tuna roll that was very tasty and the arizona maki that had salmon and avocado (pretty good except the salmon didn't look too fresh) was pretty good.  I couldn't really taste the coconut in my coconut mango tapioca and the tapioca was not soft and chewy, the way I like it...but the edamames were excellent...

33.description: I really enjoy Hana. Their orange chicken is some of the best I've ever had. Crab ran goon is pretty good, too. They have some awesome deals if you order online. We spent $30 and got four crab ran goon for free! Good quality Chinese food and you get a TON for your money!

43.description: We went to place based on the reviews to this place the food was not what we expected it was by far not the best place out there. The food was not good at all the best thing we got was the fortune cookie and the gum. The basil rice was disgusting barely touched it and the golden shrimp was way over priced and not good at all. The only reason reason they got one star was because it wouldn't let me do anything less than that.

2.description: I ordered via DoorDash, and when the food arrived, more than half of the order was missing.  I can't blame the delivery company, they just picked up a bag and delivered it.  The food that DID make it to us was mediocre at best.  The Pad Thai had no flavor.  The Mongolian beef was loaded with chili pepper seeds, as was the hot and sour soup, to the point of being inedible. Maybe dining in its a better experience, but pickup/delivery is not!

18.description: Whoaaaaa! We just decided to pass by and my friend Lupe said "smoothie", but what I didn't realize was that "smoothie" also had lunch specials for $6.50. Lawd what?!!!This combo lo Mein is really good! It took longer then I thought but I must say it had to be fresh! This is really good Lo Mein indeed! I would highly recommend this spot, but know that it's not the biggest in size but definitely enough space to accommodateabout 15  couples or so.I also ordered a mango coconut smoothie that really made me a believer that  they ate on the right track with this spot!Prices are really fair and they also have Bento sushi boxes that of course I will try a a later date. Simply stated, this little spot will definitely give the area a run for its money as far as authenticity I just say. Yes, there are a few sushi/Chinese/Thai places in the area known as little Italy, but this ranks up there in taste for sure.

41.description: Fabulous sushi for the price! Teriyaki was eh but sushi were worth it!! Soup is generous and you'll leave full and contented. We will return again.

52.description: I went here yesterday with my sister because Tatsu was closed at the time and we didn't want to have to wait for it to open to get our sushi fix. The place is small and cozy with a wacky tacky kind of christmas decoration plastered in random places. The  servers are nice,but not as attentive as they can be. We ordered 4 rolls, the sexy beach roll, the chicago roll, the shrimp tempura roll, and the scallop one that i cant remember the name of. There sushi was good, the salmon was not too chewy and pretty to look at. My only complaint was that the seaweed was a bit too chewy for my taste. It made the sushi kind of hard to eat. The price was very cheap for how much they give you. We also ordered lo mein to go and the portion was hearty. There was A LOT for only $6 but the taste was only so-so. Overall it was an okay experience at an okay place with okay food.

50.description: We order from here frequently, awesome pad thai and huge soup portions. Great for take out & delivery

4.description: I'm giving Hana a five star review for their lunch menu because that's all I ever have. I've heard good things about the sushi but can't say I have tried it.For lunch they give you a ton of fried rice, a entree of your choice (orange chicken for example) and a choice of drink or 2 egg rolls or 2 crab rangoons, ALL for $7.50. It's the perfect meal.

6.description: I came in for a smoothie - left with a watery slushy (made with juice - NO real fruit) and tapioca balls that were hard as a rock all for almost $5. I called to complain and there was no offer for refund or compensation. It was more or less supposed to be a treat that was a disgusting experience. The smell in there was horrible too. I will never return here.

22.description: Love love love everything on the Chinese menu from here including the lo mien (good portions, fresh veggies), crab rangoons (huge! and you can actually see some of the "crab"), fried rice (again, plentiful and fresh), soups, and more. Even their egg rolls have a very unique and delicious seasoning inside. I was not a fan of the pot stickers as the dough was thick and gummy but other wise it is my favorite Chinese take out spot in the U.S. EVER. I have only ever gotten take out and it is normally ready to go in the time they said. If you go in and order take out you should expect to wait for a little bit as it is not super fast but that is preferable as it clearly leads to tasty food.

15.description: This is a delivery only review. Ordered a few items from the menu. I like that the place has a variety of dishes you can choose from. Prices are reasonable. Shrimp tempura is a little dry for my tastes. My main dish was the red curry. I liked the flavour profile but wished it had more chicken and vegetables. Rice was okay as it didn't taste that fresh. I'll try to visit the place to get a real idea of what the restaurant is really like.

57.description: Nice prices and good food!

20.description: Ordered general tso's and crab Rangoon from here via delivery. The flavor of the food was decent, but I've had to experience severe regret from the food the next two days after eating it. Unless you're looking to spend more time in a bathroom; I'd order from somewhere else.

36.description: Ordered Delivery. Crab Ragoon amazing! The quality of sushi wasn't impressive. Shrimp tempura..not enough shrimp and way to much tempura.

14.description: I've avoided writing a review for Hana because I didn't think it was right to judge based solely on the smoothies.  Finally was able to try some food and now I can say that I really like their food.  Notice, I said food - I've only purchased for take out - but what I had was good enough for me to return for not just their yummy smoothies - but for their Lomein. I will say one thing, it is a bit on the greasy side - both the Lomein and the Egg Rolls - but it was so yummy in a "bad day" kind of way.  The portions are big enough for two meals easy.  The smoothies are really yummy.  They have over a dozen flavors, and you mix them, and also get tapioca if you're into that.  I can't pick a favorite because I like probably all of them - however, they are on the sweeter side, so I don't get them as often as I'd like.The actual seating area is a little small and dark - and I don't think I've ever seen more than 3 tables seated at the same time.  Not sure why?  As for me, I am usually pressed for time so I just grab my grub and and go.

3.description: Unique cocktails and amazing new interior! Loved it when it was Beviamo, but the owners did a fabulous job with the new look and menu while keeping the same comfortable and welcoming vibe. Will continue to be my go to spot in the neighborhood!

1.description: Haven't been here in awhile and it's all new! Fabulous interiors. Great beers on tap, including my favorite stout. Jack Rose cocktail is soo amazing. I tried to hold off but I ended up ordering two. Check out Cetta's. Worth the trip. And they have purse hooks!!!

2.description: Great hangout for a date night or girls night out. Just remodeled. Amazing, friendly staff and great drinks.

5.description: Great place to grab drinks.  They just remodeled and it looks great.  In addition to wine and spirits they now have five beers on tap.

6.description: We stumbled on this place after dinner. It has a great vibe. Great looking people there too, so that was fun. I was impressed with the wines and the prices too. I'll go back.

0.description: Selected by a friend for a group of us to have some pre-birthday dinner drinks on a Friday night.  First visit and we were all impressed.  Excellent selection of beers and cocktails, very cool and funky decor and had a nice vibe.  We arrived early enough and we were the only ones there, save for the bartender and the guy setting up for the live music that night.  We weren't looking for a crowd, so it was nice to be able to sit in a nice space and be able to talk (not yell).While we only stayed for a couple drinks, we all said we'd definitely go back.  I know I'll definitely recommend Cetta's and visit there again.

4.description: Cetta's is warm and inviting. It's perfect for pre-dinner drinks, a date night, or late night cocktails. The vibe is comfortable and easy. Especially love live music with John Sabel on Friday nights! This spot is a great addition to Taylor Street!

12.description: best customer service in the industry... If you have any issues with service or product, see Ben (the owner) and he will make it right. It's my only stop for Uniforms or uniform accessories...

3.description: The Chicago uniform store has a variety of products from clothing to accessories. I have been visiting this location for years, from the time I was a security guard to now a police officer. The staff are very helpful and friendly and they make sure my appearance is always sharp.

1.description: I was trying to find a specific garment, I called before going they said they did have it in stock. When I got there the girl who helped said they all out, I told her I had called earlier and they confirmed they had it. So I tried asking for other garments and they were all out everything I asked for, ties, vests etc I wouldn't rely on this place.

2.description: Our visit here was great. The staff is super helpful and we were in and out very fast. They have great service. They carry a ton of different options. What every you are looking for you will definitely find it here. Strongly recommend this place for all your uniform needs.

9.description: Needed a uniform for my EMS course, and was told to come here to get it. Upon walking in, I was quickly greeted by Tyler. He quickly helped me with what I needed. My custom-printed polo took 35 minutes and was ready for me to pick up before I finished my lunch.

10.description: Always get great service at CUC. They are always very helpful and try to accommodate me as much as they possibly can.

4.description: Nice place to get scrubs or uniform stuff if you're a cop or fireman.  If your kid wants to be a cop or a fireman, it's a nice place to get a t-shirt and some cool gear for your kid.

6.description: Uniforms here are all up to standards for each respective Dept. They offer, but don't recommend "cheaters". They carry almost everything that you could possible need.Customer service is this place's big problem. On some days, they are your best friend, on other days...not so much. I have had emergency purchases done in 5 minutes and others that took DAYS. Alterations cost extra, and you really need to watch them. I had one shirt come in altered too small to fit, and another time my patches were on the wrong sleeves. 5 pairs of pants varied by as much as 1.5 inches in length.Street parking in the area is horrible and expensive.

0.description: Best service around!  Ask for Miranda.  She's the best!I stopped in to get a new pair of pants because I ripped the pair I was wearing.  Place was packed.  I got the new pants hemmed and ready to go and several other things I've been needing.  Most everything I wanted was in stock and one leather item no one else had.  Couldn't even find it on Amazon.com Huge location is the south loop.  This is my go to place in the future.Parking in front and I walked to the best deli in the city just right around the corner.I almost forgot the best part.  Miranda gave me a free tshirt because I'm a fellow Yelper!!Yeah Yelp!!!

5.description: Recently Yelp decided to remove my post I wrote about this company because they said it was second hand information since it concerned my sister. One of the things they were not aware of is the fact that I was there at the store when all of this happened. I know all the names of the staff who waited on her. I know all the areas she went to try on clothing and I know all the faces of police and other law enforcement personnel who entered the store during this fiasco of a day because they too were standing in line while we all received terrible customer service. Don't get me wrong, I love writing truthful reviews on Yelp, but if they are going to sensor my review just because someone at Chicago Uniform Company got upset...and did not want to hear the truth..well all I can say is that is never going to be good business policy on any lever. And if they think they hated that last review, you will love this. I returned to the store after we received calls that a pick up could be done for the order that was originally botched in the first place. As soon as we got there, once the floor staff knew who we were and who we were associated with, they immediately had an attitude again. The manager tried to shut me down by talking loud in front of all the police officers that were present on the floor. I explained that I wanted to see the new order that was placed because the old was was done incorrectly and I wanted them to give me a receipt of all the purchases and changes. The floor manager refused to give me a receipt. I did get my order and it was correct this 3rd time I was in the store, but all of this started at the beginning of April and was completed correctly in May. That is a real shame. And for the record, managers should never treat customers in this manner because you never know who the customers might know. As a person who deals in customer service myself, I always do right because that person that you treat nasty and give them the impression that you don't care about them as a customer in your store....that person might know the mayor or the president or they may be a police officers daughter or son. Do the right thing by customer service in the first place and you never have to worry about negative Facebook, Yelp, Instagram or any other post. Just sayin.....................

13.description: Good selection, great customer service! The store can be very busy, but they take their time with each customer and know what their customers want and need as far as uniforms and equipment!

11.description: After having shopped at this uniform store for years, spending a sizable chunk of money on uniforms and accessories, and also recommending this place to others as well, I find myself having to give it one star for what i think is their lack of regard for customers.I had previously bought two pairs of uniform pants at this store, and had them altered to size (alteration is an additional charge). Total cost over eighty bucks a piece.In the last couple of weeks, I noticed on one pair then the other that buttons had come off. I actually found the buttons on my car seat.I took the pants and buttons to Chicago Uniform to have them repaired, and they actually tried to charge me four dollars per button to sew the buttons back on the pants, pants they had sold me, and had the nerve to call it an 'alteration charge'. They were not altering these pants. They were fixing something that should not have come off. I took the pants and the buttons, and left. I will never go back. I recommend everyone else take their business elsewhere as well. I took the pants to the uniform store by 111th and California, and they sewed the buttons for free. That will be my new uniform store.

8.description: I bought most of my uniforms at Chicago uniform . In the past I've bought from other uniform stores and the service and quality of uniforms don't compare to Chicago uniform company . Prices are very reasonable and the staff are very professional . I give them my business every time and would recommend to all .

14.description: This place gets busy.. but they do their best to abide by all your requests. They generally have everything in stock, but since they are so busy they sell out quickly. Great customer service and they know their stuff so helpful also. Parking can be a pain at times, but its expected in that area.

7.description: The staff is always attentive and helpful. They have so much to choose from and can even make shirts for you!!! One stop shopping for sure.

28.description: After stuffing ourselves with Pompei, my companion and I stopped here for a few drinks and a rousing Cubs game.  The $6 PBR pitchers were a good way to get a little bit buzzed and afterwards, the chocolate martini was no less than an artistic masterpiece.  If you're looking for a friendly, old school piece of Little Italy, look no further.  Joe is a great guy and all of the regulars are his pals, so obviously they're amazing too.  I had a great time here, and I will definitely be back.

1.description: I have been here several times over the past few years. I've had some less than pleasant experiences but never enough to give Little Joe's less than 3 stars. A few months when I was there, I knocked on the women't bathroom door. Someone was in there so I waited. An older man thought it would be funny knock again so when the girl finally came out, she said "calm the f*** down b****". Later I bought her a beer and pointed out the man who actually knocked on the door. Turns out she knew him and but it still left a bad taste in my mouth. A months ago, few friends and I went in for a few drinks before dinner. Cheap beer, no college kids, only ones there=perfect. The manager, Gino, was a bit creepy; he bought me a drink and kept talking to me even though my back was turned to him, but sometimes that comes with dive bar territory. Tonight was UNFORGIVABLE. There was a fight that broke out between the manager (Gino) and a few other bar flies.  My boyfriend and I were sitting by the door  and the manager shoved someone into our table, knocking over both our beers. I told my boyfriend "let's go" and the couple next to us, with wide eyes, nodded in agreement. The other girl's beer was knocked over onto her purse. I grabbed my coat and ducked around the 5-7 gentlemen who were grabbing each other's collars and yelling obscenities and got out through the door, but not before I was ELBOWED IN THE FACE. My lip is still swollen.  I got outside and dialed 9-11. As soon as I hung up with them, I turned, looking for my boyfriend. He was violently shoved out of door and was being held by the throat by a short man with a goatee, who hopefully we can identify in a line up. The man with the Jafar goatee was yelling at my boyfriend "what's your F-ing problem?" My boyfriend yelled back that he wasn't part of "this" and he was "just leaving".He called the police as well. There was one other person who stood outside, terrified, who called the cops. This was a terrifying, unprofessional, and painful experience. This place is dirty, dangerous, disgusting.  I cannot stress enough, please DO NOT go to this place. It is not a college bar, despite being on a college campus. It is not a place for women who don't want to be leered at, and it is an egregious shame to any public bar. DO NOT GO HERE.  The manager should not have been drinking, let alone part of a violent fight. As we left, a girl bar fly (same one who swore at me) yelled after us that she was sorry and she hoped we come back. My boyfriend said "not the way this establishment is run" and her attitude totally changed. She snapped that "it's a bar, what the f*** do you expect"?I do not know who the owner is, but I hope he pays serious attention to the drunk trash he hires.

9.description: Little Joe's is conveniently located in the neighborhood and once in a while I like to step out with my friends and enjoy the night out. This was the first time as I had relocated to this area a short while back and happened to be in a locality where a lot of old friends lived.Last weekend we found our way there and were happy to join the already mellow crowd to partake of the fun. There is karaoke night on Wednesdays and Saturdays and it brings back memories of going to school at UIC. It is lively with friendly waiters and great service. The price of PBR pitchers is lowered to as little as $5 on karaoke night allowing for some serious guzzling! If you love a friendly crowd that sings along and good drinks, then there is no better p[lace to be on Taylor Street. It's now our regular evening joint

23.description: Little Joes, how have I missed your $5 Bell's drafts until just now? Your reasonably priced menu with hearty Italian fare is enticing me to want to return through your dark doors into the dimly lit room called the bar/dining room. When I popped my head in, they were pouring Point, Bells Amber, and Bells Oberon, with specials on pitchers (real size pitchers), not those fake small pitchers that accompany the undersized "pint" glasses. The waitress was real nice, but there was a crazy dude blowing balloon animals (he was good at it), but he was also spouting off at the lip like a mad man, so we didn't stay past beer #1. I did appreciate a local patron yelling at the crazy and telling him to change his tired subject. Gotta love a local standing up for his right to relax after work at his local pup. As for the Lounge part, not so much, more of a dive from yester-year. Id like to check out the karaoke nights that seem to be rockin'

5.description: Pretty straightforward dive bar, with a pretty big mix of people. $6 PBR pitchers are nice, and the food isn't bad. I'm not usually the dive bar type so it's usually not my first choice, but if you're looking to have a drink and talk this place is alright. There's one bar, darts, and karaoke twice a week. The kitchen is also not open on Saturdays, so keep that in mind.

25.description: this place rocks, literally, every wednesday and saturday with a sick karaoke night, jason!, staff/bartenders/joe are all nice good people, drinks are cheap and heavy, very rarely obnoxious patrons other than myself, five stars

12.description: Gets the job done!

21.description: Typical college bar. Cheap drinks. I've been here a few times before and I always find myself having a good time. The bartender is a nice guy. Since its a college bar I suspect he is a student. Make sure to tip him because he makes your drinks nice and strong and he is an overall nice guy.

16.description: What a quaint little bar... very cozy and friendly atmosphere.  The beer is reasonably priced and they have hot dog specials.  A group of us went after work and we sat by the Juke Box.  It was the perfect little spot as we chatted and laughed for a few hours.  It wasn't too crowded and perfect for an evening of unwinding. Be careful with parking, the meter maids are vigilant in that area!Overall, cute little hang out spot!

17.description: I can't think of a better college dive bar. This is exactly what I wanted.

10.description: Low key dive bar.  And this is a very good thing.

11.description: A small college bar with some of the most eye candy of the U of I C coed population. The girls in this place were of various nationalities and all top end barbies. Aside from this fact nothing else distinguishes this bar from any other small dive bar except it is a bit more interesting to be in a dive bar on Taylor Street. I saw that they serve Italin food here and this place has a big poster in back of all the famous gangsters. A good bar though not near the best for the city and neighborhood.

26.description: After doing a bunch of yard/labor work around my parents' house last Saturday all I wanted to do when I got back to my apartment was relax, watch some TV and call it an early night.  Turns out my sister had gotten off of a job earlier than she anticipated and wanted to grab a beer.  I hesitated at first until the words "...  but I'll cover the first pitcher" came out of her mouth, so I went back upstairs to my apartment to grab my keys and wallet.  Best decision I've made in ages.Joe's now does karaoke every Wednesday and Saturday night, and at least this past Saturday, lowered the price of PBR pitchers to $5.  Once the singing started and all the neighborhood folk began belting out the Sinatra standards, my sister and I both knew we weren't leaving after one pitcher.  Soon 11 PM turned into 2:30 and we'd made about six new friends.  We gave passing thought to maybe singing, but really, it was much better that the microphone just kept getting passed between the same five people for most of the night.  Not even a brief invasion of an annoying 21st birthday party crew dampened the jovial atmosphere.By Sunday night I had called, texted or IM'ed everyone that could possibly care with the tag line "I'm making this a once a month thing, at least."  I plan on sticking to that.

27.description: Nice little place in University Village, a neighborhood that brings back memories of going to school at UIC. Met some friends here for drinks at night. Comfortable, not too loud (except for one song on the jukebox that played way too loud for some reason). The staff is friendly and I don't really like PBR but when you're on a budget you can't say no to $4 pitchers. They kicked us out and closed the doors at midnight, but it was a Tuesday so I can't really complain.

0.description: Little Joe's is the perfect place to chill after class! I'll be back again.Service: GoodFood: Tasty! Fries are legit, give 'em a try! Quesadilla was pretty tasty.Value: Solid! PBR Pitchers for days!

20.description: Definitely a college town bar. Went here for Trivia Night on Tuesday. That was fun!The rounds get more difficult as you keep going. Did not try their food. They've got good deals on pitchers of beer.

19.description: Decided to try it out since reading the reviews on yelp... I went on a Saturday night when they had Karaoke it was about 1 am by the time we got there and he said he just turned it off, but had no issue of turning it right back out without us even asking him. The bar was really busy and the service was good, so I don't know what kind of service the previous yelper was expecting but it is a bar. The only con was they were out of apple pie shots.. All and all it was a good time, good drinks compared to the other taylor street bars and good company. I would def recommend this place rather then paying 8$ for an absolute and sprite at vintage with little absolute.

2.description: Little Joe's is a small dive bar in little Italy. Went there on a Wednesday night and it had a major student vibe to it, which is great if that's your thing and just background noise if it's not. Staff were very nice, but it's not exactly table service. Menus around, shout your order kinda place, with the occasional bus boy visit to pick up empty bottles and glasses, especially the latter. I don't know how this place could possibly have 4 stars. Come on Chicago. Even for a dive bar it's kind of lame. Really tiny. Uncomfortable seating. Music was varied though and the finger foods looked good, but not a great selection and no drinks menu, just hazard a guess or go for a fave.I RECOMMEND- a 312, once a local brew but now made in New York, smooth beerEXTRA TIP- wifi password on request and Wednesday is karaoke night

18.description: If you are looking for a cozy intimate environment to relax after a hard day of work or school, this is the place for you!!

13.description: Definitely a college town bar. Went here for Trivia Night on Tuesday. That was fun!The rounds get more difficult as you keep going. Did not try their food. They've got good deals on pitchers of beer.

4.description: I finally made a trip down to little joe's for the wednesday kareoke night . I have to say the place was packed very nicely with fun ,nice people who were thier for all the right reason to unwind grab the mic and pretend your a superstar. Having lots of fun with men and ladies out to mingle let loose and and have some great drinks, food, &service. Very nicely managed both front of and back of house. $6PBR PITCHERS on Tap. Great pizza,wings,burgers,chicken&Ribeye steak sandwiches always fresh,flavorfull hot on point food. Great place to have Great drinks,Great Food ,great mixed crowds,clean establishment affordable drinks,beer,food you must check it out for yourself. unfortunately,the chef has left and thier kitchen is not gonna be the same  he had the best food on taylor street to bad!!!!!!New update as of 10-11-2015

24.description: This has the potential to be such a fantastic bar in Little Italy right by UIC, but continually fails at the essentials: food, service, selection, atmosphere. After a several year hiatus, we thought we'd pop in to see if things had improved. Sadly, no. The beer was warm and like clockwork, they were out of Bud Light by 8:00 p.m. The bartender was unfriendly and getting her attention in this small space was exceedingly difficult. I wouldn't expect a gourmet meal from a small bar, but the authentic Italian cuisine touted on the menu was predictably mushy, unseasoned, cold and clearly cooked from frozen. When the hipsters and college kids occasionally play the juke box, spirits pick up, but crowds are infrequent and crickets are more likely to serenade you. Great place for a quick shot before you move on to the next.

6.description: Great place for karaoke on Saturday night.. This place rocks for people who like to get their hands on a mic.!

22.description: What a quaint little bar... very cozy and friendly atmosphere.  The beer is reasonably priced and they have hot dog specials.  A group of us went after work and we sat by the Juke Box.  It was the perfect little spot as we chatted and laughed for a few hours.  It wasn't too crowded and perfect for an evening of unwinding. Be careful with parking, the meter maids are vigilant in that area!Overall, cute little hang out spot!

15.description: The only way to describe this place is the Cheers of Taylor Street! If you want a place with friendly staff, great customers and hilarious times go here. on Tuesdays they do $3 Jameson shots, so be sure to go then.

7.description: A SOLID 4 - an only because I go there just as they open for economically priced PBR and Oberon.  Really neat old bar and I need to try the bar food so I can elevate one more star.

8.description: They recently changed kitchens, it is no longer Chi-Town Johnny's, it's now Jackie's.The full menu isn't out yet since they did it very recently but the turkey burger sliders are good. The fries need salt. I'm hoping they bring back the mac and cheese bites.

3.description: Awesome dive bar - it was cool that they served pizza pies to go. We came and got a pie very late at night and they were super helpful. The thin pie was really good. Being from NY it's odd to see a round pie cut into squares but my friends and I devoured it nonetheless. Really good pizza for a place off the beaten path. Didn't expect this from a dive bar. Definitely would come back again for a late night fix!

14.description: Despite being PBR, you won't find a cheaper pitcher in the city, $6. Cheap beer is great and all, but the service was so-so. Little Joe's is a fun dive with karaoke on Saturdays. Not the place I'd go all the time or often though.

58.description: I have not had the best impression with the Chicago version of "Little Italy" up until now. This is by far the best Italian bakery in the city. Everything I had the chance to sample was better than the next - the cuccidati (fig cookies), sfogliatelle (sort of like a danish, pastry with cheese filling), cannoli (filled to order) and the lemon ricotta cake. I feel pretty justified in saying whatever you get is going to be a winner.

56.description: The daily toasts were delicious. We tried both the strawberry and Nutella toast and the ricotta, honey, and walnut toast. Both were excellent although, I wished there was slightly more honey to balance the ricotta flavor. We tried the sfogliatelle and it was similar to Artopolis' galaktoboureko but less sweet and palatable. The peanut butter latte had a very nice flavor to it. I would definitely come here again!

29.description: Super cute italian bakery on Taylor Street in lil italy. The workers are super friendly and fun to talk to; ask for recommendations and you won't go wrong. I love anything lemon flavored so their $3.20 strawberry-blueberry lemon bar was perfect for me. If you check in on yelp right now they give you a free small coffee! Also, they were giving out samples of their delicious lemon butter cookies. Everything I ended up trying was so colorful & cute. They had these $1.50 pizza breads that looked good for a lunch visit.Also, I've tried their lemon riccotta pound cake at the Italian food festival last summer. It's very dense & sweet; so be warned it's quite the decedent dessert. But again, I love everything lemon flavored.

42.description: Wonderful bakery with a variety of sweet treats. You can't go wrong with anything you get here.Right now they're having a free coffee or tea when you check in on yelp. Perfect compliment to any of their pastries!

23.description: Popped into Scafuri during the Little Italy street festival to check out their entire selection, beyond what they were selling at their booth outside. This is a really cute little Italian bakery on Taylor street that looks like it's been passed down a generation or two. My gf and I ended up getting a couple chocolate chip cookies (very soft and delicious) and a couple cannolis dipped in chocolate chips as well. The cannolis were spot on and was the perfect treat to wash down the huge italian sub I had just 15 minutes prior. Everything tasted really fresh!Great place in Little Italy to kick back, relax and have a cappuccino and a sweet treat!

47.description: We ordered three King cakes (king's cake?) for our SuperBowl party (and thank god no one could come because of the blizzard - we have left overs!). The bakery has three flavors, but we went with the original for all three. Wow - they were so good!!! We had high expectations since my husband is from right outside of New Orleans, and these were amazing. The price is right for the size of the cake (they feed about 8-10 people). They even called us to remind us to pick them up. Order them a few days in advance - you will not be disappointed!!!!

8.description: Best cannoli I've had since Modern Bakery in Boston's North End. Super traditional and filled fresh.  Love to take these home with me if I'm in the area.

31.description: Went here while we waited to be seated at sweet maple café because it was pouring.  We only got a lemon bar but it was quite good.  Everything else looked really good and the staff was extremely nice and friendly.  I'll be back to try other stuff in the near future for sure.

34.description: Scafuri Bakery provided some sweets for our wedding and they did not disappoint! From jump Kelly was really sweet to work with, super helpful at customizing options (our vision was a table full of random sweets we love), all while working with our small budget (and not making us feel bad about it!) Their sweets are delicious (some of the best donuts I've ever had) and we look forward to having them again soon. If you're looking for delicious alternatives to serve for dessert at your wedding, don't hesitate to give them a ring. They also do wedding cakes, which I can only imagine are delicious as well.

16.description: Am a professional chef and have some skill in cake baking and decorating.  Wanted to make my 60th birthday party a little easier and ordered the vanilla cake with lemon curd filling and whipped cream frosting.  The crumb texture of the cake was excellent in an authentic way (not the super fine texture of grocery store cakes where the flour is denatured beyond recognition), and the flavor was superb.  Price was absolutely fair for a cake of this quality.  Highly recommended.

13.description: So far I've had the pepperoni pizza, eclair, and Horchata latte. All three were excellent. The inside of the eclair was soft and perfectly done. I've never had a better doughnut. I cannot recommend this place enough

11.description: Amazing! Stopped in here for the first time today and felt like I was walking into my grandpa's house (in the sense that he's 100% Italian, traditional, etc). pastries are amazing. Fresh, soft, delicious. Bought a box of pastries to bring to my moms but they didn't make it that far...! Would also be a great place to sit with a cup of coffee and get some work done, but they close at 4.

39.description: Stopped in when Scafuri was supporting Easter Seals Therapeutic Autism School (THANK YOU, Scafuri!!!) and grabbed a lemon knot. To die for.

37.description: The cake and cookies that we ordered for our wedding from Scafuri Bakery were beautiful and absolutely delicious. We were able to use some very unique flavor pairings in our cake tiers, including balsamic caramel and salted caramel with fresh fruits. We also had bags filled with lemon knot, pignoli, and butter cookies sandwiched with chocolate. Yum, yum, yum. The Italian buttercream frosting is delicious as it is not sickeningly sweet. I usually hate buttercream frostings but was so happy when we fell in love with the work of this bakery. Long live Scafuri, a wonderful part of our neighborhood.

0.description: O.M.Goodness!!!! I don't know what else to say....I usually order King Cake from Randazzo's in New Orleans when I'm not there, but for some reason Fat Tuesday snuck up on me this year!!! So I turned to my good friends here on Yelp to find a local place so I could take  a King Cake to take to work to celebrate Fat Tuesday. Was NOT disappointed! This was equivalent to Randazzo's! It may have been better since it is local.This King Cake was AWESOME! Moist not too sweet just enough cinnamon... Plus they let you place your order online so you won't have to wait. I got t there and my box was waiting for me and the young lady that rang up my order was soo pleasant! I can't wait to try their other baked goods! The only thing is I wish they had bags with handles big enough for the box that the king cake comes in. Would make life a lot easier for us commuters.

38.description: So I'm feeling what Scafuri is putting out there.  It's an adorable bakery right on Taylor Street in the heart of Little Italy.Gimmie all the lemon knots.Gimmie all the lemon ricotta cake. (No, I'm not joking.  This is a very real thing.)Gimme all the chocolate spice cookies.Hell, even gimmie all the pizza.  What?  At a bakery? You're lying, Angie M.  Nope.  I'm not lying.  Giardiniera pizza is also a very real thing. One thing you don't have to gimmie again is the cardamon scone.  It was completely overdone.  Hard to tell when just looking at it in the case, too, because it's got a chocolate brown tint, but trust me... no go.Treats are a little pricey, too.I'm OK with it.

51.description: Excellent baked goods and coffee. There's a small seating inside if you wanted to grab something to eat and drink with a friend or while doing some work.

27.description: Best cappuccino I've had since Rome, and the lemon ricotta cake is delicious, as are the pignoli! That's all I've tried so far, but everything looks great. The inside is comfortable and quiet - it would be a great place to get work done (especially since the nearby Starbucks is always packed). The prices aren't unreasonable, especially given the quality. I'll definitely be back!

32.description: Might just be the best espresso in the city. Hidden gem in the Little Italy neighborhood.

54.description: I just recently moved to Chicago and was looking for a bakery for my husband's surprise birthday party. I wanted a 'MAD MEN' themed party so after contacting a couple of bakeries, I picked Scafuri and I am so glad I did. Kelly contacted me right away and we patiently went over my order via email (which was a big help for me). I sent her a picture of the cake I wanted and she was happy /excited to help me with it. Scafuri also helped me with my party favors, which were 4 different kinds of specialized cookies and all I had to do is tell them my ideas. They were PERFECT! The prices were very reasonable and my guests totally loved the cake and cookies.  I would recommend this bakery to anyone who wants to stick to a budget and yet have a classy birthday party with absolutely delicious goodies. P.S the staff at the bakery who helped me were super sweet. I loved my whole experience with Scafuri. Thank you guys for making my party successful. Falak.

48.description: I stopped in here on Saturday morning to pick out a hostess gift for an evening at a friend's house, and picked up a 1 lb. box of mixed Italian cookies. My generous hostess shared with us as I was hoping she might,  and the cookies were all fresh and flavorful. My favorites included the lemon knots, the chocolate spice cookies, and the walnut cookies with the powdered sugar. My friend was in love with the chocolate toffee bars. The 1 lb. box of cookies was $15.95, and I also purchased a frozen pizza dough for $1.50 to use later at home.
