I've also had a delicious fresh-filled cannoli from Scafuri's during the Italian Festival on Taylor St. in summer 2014; the filling is the right amount of sweet and a great  creamy consistency. Free coffee with a Yelp check-in too!

44.description: I've been coming here since I been a kid and every time it's consistent. Great location!  I love Scafuri!!!

24.description: They are making our cookies and cake for our wedding and they are always extremely friendly. They gave us a complimentary rating and everything was phenomenal. I highly recommend stopping in just to have some cookies and espresso.

7.description: Popped into Scafuri during the Little Italy street festival to check out their entire selection, beyond what they were selling at their booth outside. This is a really cute little Italian bakery on Taylor street that looks like it's been passed down a generation or two. My gf and I ended up getting a couple chocolate chip cookies (very soft and delicious) and a couple cannolis dipped in chocolate chips as well. The cannolis were spot on and was the perfect treat to wash down the huge italian sub I had just 15 minutes prior. Everything tasted really fresh!Great place in Little Italy to kick back, relax and have a cappuccino and a sweet treat!

49.description: This is an awesome Italian bakery! I was buying a box of cookies as a gift, and I basically got one of each cookie they had plus a couple cannolis. I also got a pignoli cookie for myself. It's an almond cookie with pine nuts that was so delicious. My friends also loved all of the cookies and cannolis. What made this place so great is, though, is that the staff member who helped me was so friendly and knew everything about the cookies and how they were made, and she even let me taste one for free when I was ordering. FYI: if you check in here on Yelp, you get a free coffee or tea with purchase!

40.description: I cant say enough about their rosemary, fig, fennel, walnut loaf! DELICIOUS!! Only made on the weekends so be sure to hurry in Sat or Sunday to get one! Also, lemon ricotta pound cake. Eat one.

53.description: I ordered Thanksgiving pecan pie and an Italian cookie tray using the order form found on their website. Confirmation of the order was received the following day via email, but did not include the total estimated cost of both items, only the pie. I called and received a complete estimate over the phone the next day during working hours. This morning we picked up our order.The pecan pie was very good. The filling was lighter than most and not as sweet as most. The crust was a bit tougher than I prefer but still good.The assortment of Italian cookies was tasty and truly provided a variety of flavors. They were good.We also stayed a bit to leisurely enjoy a cup of Intelligentsia coffee enhanced with a shot of espresso. The coffee was very good!We shared 3 scones while drinking our coffee. The cranberry orange was my favorite. The blueberry was very good. The chocolate chip was the least interesting. All three had excellent texture and were very light! I liked them all and recommend them. Staff were very friendly, and had everything ready for us before 8 am the day before Thanksgiving.The decor is invitingly casual with a large glass display case.We will return.

30.description: Bakery staff is very friendly and accommodating.  They offer samples if you are unsure of something. I got the ricotta lemon cake which was super delightful with my free coffee when you check in as a first guest.  No disappointments over here. I got the green tea coconut cupcake to go for a later treat. I  am so impressed with the matcha flavor they infused into that cupcake. It had this passion fruit tart center which was really unique. I regret not ordering more to share with my family. I highly recommend coming to this cute little bake shop.

46.description: The bakery has a beautiful selection but if you order online, call before you go to pick up. I ordered online and got to the bakery to get a song and dance about computer problems. This about ruined my party plans for the evening. I can shop at other bakeries. They have lost my business.

1.description: I've been here a few times, the most recent time to try their paczkis which were all gone by the time I got there [sad face].  If you want some of their more popular baked goods (donuts and such) it seems you have to go in the morning.I was able to get a few cookies on my most recent trip here, which were pretty good, but not the best Italian cookies I've had, not sure they're worth the price.  Their soft baked goods like the donuts are better.  I was able to try the paczkis that a classmate had gotten earlier in the day and those were delicious.The place itself is small, I've seen people studying or meeting here, but there's only a handful of tables, so no guarantees you'll definitely find a place to sit and study.  But the place is cute, and the staff is friendly.  Free wifi (code is at the checkout)!  I'd stop by if I was in the neighborhood, but not a place I'm really going out of my way for.

55.description: Scafuri has absolutely amazing donuts! I came in one morning after I had gone to Sweet Maple for Breakfast. I got two apple cider donuts. One glazed and one with cinnamon sugar. They were both absolutely delicious! I also got a pumpkin spice latte which I really was not a fan of at all but Scafuri is a bakery first and foremost, not a coffee shop.I would have definitely given this place 5 stars even for the poor latte but the service here really wasn't very good at all. I asked the lady at the counter about the lattes and she seemed very disinterested and even a bit offended that I was asking for her opinion... She didn't make me feel welcome at all, the opposite in fact. Overall:5 stars for the delicious baked goods!2 stars for the abysmal service and bad latteRounded up half a star since the donuts were so tasty!

9.description: So I'm feeling what Scafuri is putting out there.  It's an adorable bakery right on Taylor Street in the heart of Little Italy.Gimmie all the lemon knots.Gimmie all the lemon ricotta cake. (No, I'm not joking.  This is a very real thing.)Gimme all the chocolate spice cookies.Hell, even gimmie all the pizza.  What?  At a bakery? You're lying, Angie M.  Nope.  I'm not lying.  Giardiniera pizza is also a very real thing. One thing you don't have to gimmie again is the cardamon scone.  It was completely overdone.  Hard to tell when just looking at it in the case, too, because it's got a chocolate brown tint, but trust me... no go.Treats are a little pricey, too.I'm OK with it.

26.description: A gem of a bakery. Amazing lemon ricotta cake and picolli (sp?). Grab a coffee and grab a seat to enjoy. I'm so excited to try the almond croissant that I also just bought.

25.description: We order a cannoli filling cake for birthdays and anniversaries. Super easy over email. Always phenomenal. We also had them do the wedding cake for my sister in law last year. Great prices, great cake! It was the least stressful part of the entire wedding. I'm also a huge fan of the pignoli cookies and buy a 1/4lb whenever I'm in the neighborhood. They also do homemade pizza dough by the pound, whole wheat or white and whatever you decide to put on top of it will become amazing. Great job rebooting this place ladies, you should be very proud.

12.description: Super cute italian bakery on Taylor Street in lil italy. The workers are super friendly and fun to talk to; ask for recommendations and you won't go wrong. I love anything lemon flavored so their $3.20 strawberry-blueberry lemon bar was perfect for me. If you check in on yelp right now they give you a free small coffee! Also, they were giving out samples of their delicious lemon butter cookies. Everything I ended up trying was so colorful & cute. They had these $1.50 pizza breads that looked good for a lunch visit.Also, I've tried their lemon riccotta pound cake at the Italian food festival last summer. It's very dense & sweet; so be warned it's quite the decedent dessert. But again, I love everything lemon flavored.

59.description: This bakery has the worst customer service I have ever had. I am waiting in line for 15 minutes and the girl in the counter, starts taking orders in the back of the line.  They didn't even appologize.  It's either you have to be Italian or you don't get waited on.  If I could give it a zero, I would.  The fig cookies are not that great for really bad service.

21.description: Traditional Italian bakery through and through. Just adored the atmosphere and the helpfulness of the employees. I could come up with any scenario, and she would have an answer for what to order that would suit me best in that moment. Very quickly becoming a regular stop.

17.description: Ordered their daily toast...and you should too! It is Ahhhmazing! +If you check in you get a free cup of freshly brewed strong/hot coffee. Definitely the perfect way to start your morning!!!

10.description: Today, I received an email for 40% off any pie order for Thanksgiving this year due to their poor pie crust last year. I am blown away by their customer service - and just placed my order for another pumpkin pie and cranberry apple pie for this Thanksgiving!

5.description: Stopped by here for some take out pastries after breakfast at Sweet Maple.  I got a pumpkin almond bar and a lemon ricotta cake.  Heated them up for a snack and they were some of the best baked goods I have ever had.  I will be back!

3.description: cute little casual bakery for a quick bite. Ordered lunch food and it was ok

35.description: We had a great experience working with Scafuri, and they made us a gorgeous, delicious wedding cake. Kelly was very helpful the whole way through, from our tasting to finalizing our order (after having to go up a couple of cake sizes as more guests RSVP'd yes than we had expected!). Our guests loved the cake, and we are looking forward to enjoying this same cake again for our first anniversary. (Scafuri includes a small complimentary cake one year later, so no need to freeze the top layer.) Would definitely recommend them, we tasted cake from several other bakeries and Scafuri's was our favorite. We were really glad we chose them!

19.description: Great cookies, the pine nut cookies are the best! But they have bad coffee lol. The coffee tasted watered down and it was lukewarm, thank God I got it for free with the check in. Prices were great honesty, coming from southern CA where everything is excessively overpriced. The quiche was good not amazing, I make a really good quiche so I'm a harsh critic. The ricotta on my toast was yummy. I would come here again and try the cakes.

28.description: Love this place! I'm over the fancy cupcakes and doughnut shops popping up everywhere.  This place is a neighborhood classic. They have the best almond croissants in town and the lemon ricotta mini cakes are heaven.  Both seriously deserve 5 stars. Staff is friendly, and the vintage mid-century decor makes me feel like I'm at home.

45.description: Four words: lemon ricotta pound cake.Four more words: get in mah belly!

33.description: Everything is way out of this world there. From the pastries to the sandwiches and coffee. Whatever you pick you will not be disappointed. Thank goodness we don't live near or else I would probably ask to move in.

43.description: Free coffee with purchase. Perhaps a limited time only promotion to entice uninitiated Yelp users to visit? Well it is limited, to drip coffee. And personally I am not enticed by a cafe who's sales pitch is free drip coffee. I imagine most Yelp users are searching for quality and an experience beyond drip coffee also...

2.description: I was looking for a cake for a party and came across Scarfuri and was sold when I saw that they had Nutella Ganache (sounds so good!). I got a chocolate cake with Nutella Ganache, assorted pastries and a pan of pizza. It was a moist three layer cake, but I was disappointed that the ganache didn't taste like Nutella at all. They had a good selection of cookies and pastries. The pizza is more Sicilian style with the thick crust and a tad on the dry side. The staff that I dealt with on the phone and when I picked up my order were friendly. Taylor street can be pretty busy, so parking is hit or miss. We found a spot a few buildings down on the Saturday morning that we went.What I had didn't feel like five stars, but good enough that if I'm in the neighborhood, I'd stop by for a snack and latte.

18.description: This is an awesome Italian bakery! I was buying a box of cookies as a gift, and I basically got one of each cookie they had plus a couple cannolis. I also got a pignoli cookie for myself. It's an almond cookie with pine nuts that was so delicious. My friends also loved all of the cookies and cannolis. What made this place so great is, though, is that the staff member who helped me was so friendly and knew everything about the cookies and how they were made, and she even let me taste one for free when I was ordering. FYI: if you check in here on Yelp, you get a free coffee or tea with purchase!

41.description: Visited on a whim since I had an hour to kill and can't get over how cute this place is! Old school Italian pastry shop furnished with probably someone's Grandma's living room and dining room sets. The pastry all looked amazing and they had a great variety - I was too full from brunch to try one, but I hope to on my next visit. A group of older Italian women came in and couldn't stop yelling about how excited they were to have a found a place with traditional pastries, so you know you're in the right spot here! They also had frozen homemade pizza dough - $1.50 for a pound. I made it on my cast iron pizza pan that evening & it turned out crispy and delicious. Can't wait to stock up on my next visit! The space is small seating-wise, but a perfect place to wait for a table next door at Maple Street Cafe!

52.description: Adorable cafe with wifi, couches, drinks, and great baked goods. The peppermint chocolate doughnut I got was phenomenal, as were several of the traditional Italian cookies I picked up. If you had a childhood bakery with chocolate dipped butter cookies that crumbled into deliciousness, check this place out. They also offer an interesting pizza selection by the slice, which hopefully I'll get to try sometime!

50.description: Kelly was amazing to work with. Our wedding cake was exactly what we wanted!

4.description: After seeing Scafuri featured on an episode of Chicago Best and beginning Italian I thought I would put their baking reputation to the test! And YES they passed with flying Italian colors! Old school Italian Bakery with a case full of all your favorite cookies, loafs and breads. Picked up a loaf of Italian White Bread,Fig, Pignoli and Chocolate Spice Cookies. The bread was still warm fresh out of the oven and the fig cookies are by far the best I have ever had. And you can never go wrong with a moist on the inside and little crunch on the outside Pignoli cookie. Will definitely keep them on my list for the holidays. Free parking on Sunday's right in front of the shop and had to take advantage of the free cup of Lavazza coffee with a Yelp check in

6.description: Came here with a friend for a quick dessert one day before class at UIC. I had the blueberry scone and she had the apple cider donuts. The apple cider donuts sell out quick so if they have them don't pass them up! Both were very delicious and although the staff member helping us seemed a little impatient, i would definitely recommend the baked goods here to anyone passing through.

22.description: I ordered a cake for my sons baptism. Although I did a taste test way in advance, when the cake was delivered it exceeded my expectations. The cake was so good. I ordered salted caramel with vanilla cake and all of my guests loved it!  I wish I could've eaten the whole thing myself!

15.description: Four words: lemon ricotta pound cake.Four more words: get in mah belly!

57.description: Great little gem of a bakery tucked away in Little Italy. Coffee is always fresh and the donuts and pastries are amazing. I will always get an old fashioned. The crunchy exterior and light glaze with a fluffy buttermilk vanilla interior. No joking here but it is the best donut I have ever had. Wonderful selection of delicious cookies both traditional Italian and american fare. Try the pine nut cookies and the fig ones. They are so good. Very friendly and helpful staff. A great place for a treat.

20.description: Ordered their daily toast...and you should too! It is Ahhhmazing! +If you check in you get a free cup of freshly brewed strong/hot coffee. Definitely the perfect way to start your morning!!!

36.description: Kelly and staff created our wedding cake for us.  The flavors - top layer of lemon cake with raspberry filling and bottom layer of lemon ricotta pound cake with cannoli filling - was really delicious.  Kelly totally delivered on the design of two offset squares with smooth frosting and a cascade of multi-sized silver, white and navy blue beads cascading down the layers was exactly what I had envisioned. The only thing I would have done differently is to have ordered either another layer or larger cake because all our guests wanted to take home a couple pieces of the cake!  We've been long time customers and all their baked goods are wonderful - cakes, cookies and donuts.

14.description: Visited on a whim since I had an hour to kill and can't get over how cute this place is! Old school Italian pastry shop furnished with probably someone's Grandma's living room and dining room sets. The pastry all looked amazing and they had a great variety - I was too full from brunch to try one, but I hope to on my next visit. A group of older Italian women came in and couldn't stop yelling about how excited they were to have a found a place with traditional pastries, so you know you're in the right spot here! They also had frozen homemade pizza dough - $1.50 for a pound. I made it on my cast iron pizza pan that evening & it turned out crispy and delicious. Can't wait to stock up on my next visit! The space is small seating-wise, but a perfect place to wait for a table next door at Maple Street Cafe!

0.description: Came in with a friend soon after it opened to check out the store.They have a lot of cool stuff inside, mostly T-shirts, hoodies, fitted hats, jackets, tank tops, and basketball jersey style shirts.It's mainly men's clothing but I'm sure there are several unisex items in store.The guy behind the counter was very helpful and seemed to have everything under control for a brand new store.

58.description: Only talking about the beer at this brewery. This is one of the few breweries in Chicago that aren't over carbonated. Their hoppy red is excellent. The brewmaster is also cool too. The service seems really slow at this place, so I recommend coming here for couple pints.

56.description: I've ordered delivery from here twice. The food i've ordered has been extremely good, the delivery service they use on the other hand is why i had to deduct them one star. First, the food....i've ordered the Gulf Shrimp & Crawfish Étouffée, Blue Crab Cakes, Cajun Popcorn Crawfish and the Blackened Tilapia Fish Tacos. The Etouffee is absolutely delicious and would recommend anyone to get this amazing dish. Its packed with so much flavor. The crab cakes were amazing as well, and fulfilling. The Cajun Crawfish was  a little disappointing, but think primarily because they were extremely cold by the time the delivery driver brought them. The Blackened Fish Tacos were good, except they forgot to include my soft shells to actually make it a taco. Instead i ate the fish and the rice which were still good. As far as delivery - Both times the delivery has taken more than 1 hour and the drivers act as though they cant use the phone directory so you are required to come downstairs. The issue is that by the time i get to eat my food, i have to warm it up in the microwave, and some things just dont taste good warmed up (ex: fried crawfish). I'm going to avoid delivery next time, and just dine in since the food is really good.

29.description: We live nearby and absolutely love the place. I've just about had everything on the menu - the food is plain great. My favorites are: the tacos, the blackened salmon sandwich and the brisket sandwich. Salads are also awesome.The beer selection is broad, and if you're in the market to try a new, niche spirit then they probably stock it and will gladly pour you one. They've got some interesting cocktails as well.Bottom line, if you want to have a private conversation, watch a game or just unwind over good food and brew - then this is the place.The jazz band Friday nights is great...for just a moment one feels as if they're back in 1930s Chicago.

42.description: The journey continues in finding some solid BBQ in Chicago, as well as naming the best restaurant here on Maxwell near UIC.My coworkers and I came here for lunch one day for some good All-American food. It was here that i realized a lot of restaurants in Chicago love to give out complimentary bites for you to enjoy while waiting for your food. Our server handed out a good piece of corn bread for each of us. While not the best, it was good and definitely quelled my hunger/I ordered two small plates since I wasn't feeling particularly hungry: a small gumbo and a side of garlic mashed potatoes. Not sure if you've read, but they definitely hook it up when it comes to the spuds. There was so much of it that I got full just from eating all the carby goodness.On the other hand, my gumbo was pretty forgettable. It was too salty for my taste, and not even an extra piece of corn bread could really fight the sodium levels.I heard that the wings here are the real kicker. They may not be on the menu, but the place still sells them. I'd definitely give those a go the next time I visit.Service overall was slow even though we were the only party for a good hour during lunch. Be prepared- they only take a certain number of cards from large groups, so be ready to Venmo a friend if you're looking to split the check more than six ways.

23.description: Come in to this place frequently and have never had any issues with service, food, anything. They have great food and a great selection of different dishes. I've had the pulled brisket sandwich, the ribs, the gumbo, and BBQ chicken. All of them are great. They also give out free corn bread..oh and try the sweet and sour cucumbers or mac and cheese for your side. You won't be disappointed. As far as drinks go, their house brews are delicious and they change during the season. They also have great craft cocktails and each bartender takes their time making them so you know they'll be right. They just started having happy hour special that run from 8-10pm. On weekends you can get Moscow or Kentucky mules for $5 plus everyday from 8-close you can get sliders for $2.50. This place just does it right, one of the bartenders Kyle is super nice and gives great suggestions. Went in this past weekend and played some shuffleboard and enjoyed their Kentucky mules and new Backyard Harvest Ale. If you haven't tried this place, it's worth your time. Sit at the bar and you'll have good conversation and be attended too promptly. Love Moxee and Mad Mouse Brewery!

47.description: Great place here! Now...I remember this location back when it was Juniors....and yea I am glad to see something new here. First off, FREE 2 hours parking, saweet! Second, in the Summer time they close off Maxwell St. on Saturday's (6-10) and even have events (there was a Luchador wrestling match this past weekend). Third, their drinks and food...it is delicious! It's southern BBQ and it.is.good! This is a great place to bring a group of friends, relax and enjoy some great grub and craft cocktails and beers. The service is on point as well, I went with a group of almost 10 and she even split the check between us (we asked from the beginning to help minimize the confusion with so many orders). We got the tiki burgers, pork belly and corn bread, all very tasty! Definitely give this place a try, I/we will for sure be back.

8.description: I enjoyed my first visit to Moxee yesterday.  My family did as well-ate here before going to a Bulls game.  It's a good space-open and while it wasn't busy when we were there, is likely a good place to go late into the evening.The menu contains items at every level (appetizers, small plates, big plates, sandwiches, bbq and desserts) that I strongly considered ordering.   I had the shrimp and crawfish po-boy, which was great.   Every aspect of the sandwich was good-crusty bread, cold and crisp diced tomato shredded lettuce and a tangy and spicy remoulade sauce.   My son liked his ribs and sides were really good-red beans and rice in particular was my favorite, while the sweet and spicy cucumbers were my wife's favorite and my son, when asked if he liked his mac 'n cheese, said "...Uh, yeahhh!!!".I had an Okey Proctor, their house IPA, and it was good-not too bitter, but a worthy IPA for sure.  Service was good-Manny was the right mix of attentive and personable.  Good parking across the street at the self park garage that is only $2 for up to 2 1/2 hours.

31.description: I've eaten here 3 times. Beer is great, but I've yet to find something on the menu that I want to come back and eat again and again. I will keep trying though!

34.description: I order delivery from Moxee's on regular basis. Good stuff, I've had a good portion of their menu and I can say it's got some pretty good BBQ, but personally I've grown partial to their pastrami sandwich, mac and cheese ( it's baked and it's awesome... this is a meal unto its own), and their Michigan blueberry crumble ( reminds me of home ). I also really like their BBQ sauce, which goes great on their pulled pork and chicken. Their brisket is good, though I've had better. I still have yet to sample their beers ( as they do no deliver that ), but look forward to in the near future.

16.description: Was pretty let down about this one.  Normally BBQ is the greatest thing in the world but the food wasn't good.  I think part of it was the fact that it was delivered.  Everything was cold, fries were completely cold and soaked in its own steam....threw those away immediately.  Im sure if you go there and sit and eat it'd be better but think about what you order if you choose delivery

13.description: I've been to Moxee several times and it's always been a great experience - but I'm pre-disposed to like them because I love good BBQ and ribs. Recently though, I decided to host a party for 20 people there for a friend's birthday. It was AWESOME. The staff was so helpful in planning, gave me a ton of helpful suggestions to keep costs down but provide a great spread for the group, and even made a custom physical menu for my friend. She was blown away and having the dedicated "room" (that still provides the ambiance of the whole open restaurant / bar) really made it special.  I would definitely recommend Moxee for events - it felt like a high-end affair but didn't break the bank. Thank you Moxee. We will be back very soon.

11.description: Every time has been great, including delivery ! Sirloin tips, mashed potatoes, gumbo, cucumbers, brisket everything has been phenomenal ! So pumped they here !

39.description: Yet another one of those times where so had to track down some gumbo. Actually stopped here earlier in the day while waiting for Au Cheval to open for dinner service. I'm a UIC alum, so I like going to all the newer restaurants in the area.   This restaurant is huge and had only like 2 people working lunch. Had to wait for a while to get greeted and seated, but was not too big of a deal. We chillaxed at a small table near the bar. I ordered the gumbo and a cider. We also received some cornbread to nosh on while we waited. The cornbread and gumbo were delicious. The cider, brewed locally, was good too, but had the most awful vomity smell. I got past that though and I'm still alive, so no worries.    Service was slow, but friendly. I wonder what this place is like at dinner time when it is more crowded. I may come back another time just to find out.

37.description: A little over due, but I must say I have so many great things to say about this place. It is conveniently located by my job so that makes it easy accessible when I am craving some rib tips, pulled pork , burgers you name it they have it. Meat is always cooked to perfection and the sides that come with the orders are also very delicious. This has all been ordered to go , so I cant' speak for the dining experience but the carry out has been smooth. One exception they forgot to add one side and we had to walk back but it wasn't a big deal.

0.description: We weren't sure what to expect when we visited today and we were blown away! First and foremost the space was inviting both physically (decor, space usage, etc) and socially (wait staff, brewmaster). Our waiter was extremely kind and attentive! He made our first time experience a joy! The food was yummy! I had the BBQ brisket sandwich with an egg bread bun. It was tender, hearty, and luscious! The vinegar/mayo/cumin coleslaw with jalapeño was glorious! I wanted an entire can to take away! The house made BBQ sauce was very tasty, as well. My partner got the pulled combo which had both pulled pork and brisket. He really liked the variety. I had the hand cut fries which were delicious and smokey. Very unique and addicting. My partner had the sweet potato fries and he loved them.The beers were fantastic! So bold with flavors! Many of the breweries I've been to lately have many beers with similar flavors. I appreciate that Mad Mouse had four which were all distinct and extremely flavor full. My favorite was the Weizen Bock: Rich and malty. However, I was shocked to find myself enjoying the IPA (okey proctor). It reminds me of the infamous Vermont IPA: Heady Topper!We asked about it and the brewmaster actually came and spoke to us since we showed interest. He was delightful, informative, and curious to know what kind of brews we'd want in the future.All in all, we loved our experience. It was a triple threat of great food, great service and great beer. It made me wish I was a UIC student with local access. Definitely coming back again!

38.description: Horrible service and the food quality is on the decline.  One server and one host who doubles as a bartender on a sunday night after crosstown classic and the air and water show.  We will not be back, and this place used to be a favorite.

51.description: Went to Moxee on a Friday night (5.30.2015) at 11:15pm after checking yelp and seeing that they are open until 1am. When I arrived to the restaurant an employee was locking the front door and informed me that the manager instructed him to close early. I called the restaurant to speak to the manager and ask why they were closing so early. His response was "because." I then asked why did the sign say 1am if they were closing at 11:20pm. He told me they can stay open until 1am but he chose to close now. He then came out of the restaurant and addressed me in a rude manner before reluctantly letting me in the restaurant. Honestly I'm afraid to eat my order. The food is great but with leadership like this Moxee is destined to fail.

27.description: We have been to Moxee about 10 times since they opened. We are big fans of the place. The food is great -- particular favorites are the bbq (any of it), Cajun shrimp, and chipotle tacos. They also have a Right Bee cider that I can't get enough of -- I know it's made by a couple in Chicago and I want to be their best friends. I knocked off a star for a little hit or miss service. While everyone has been very pleasant, there have been times where things have been very slow moving. At first we thought it was because they were new. While it's improved over time, they still have some room to up their game. It's not a reason to not check it out though -- I'd say it if it was. We have also brought our small dog to the patio on numerous occasions and they have brought him water, which was nice. Overall, it's a great spot. For those who have been in the University Village area, this is the old Juniors space. It's really large inside and the onsite brewery is great. The beers are top notch. We are moving to another part of the city soon and will miss this place greatly.

32.description: With so many other bbq options in the city it's hard to give this one more than 2 stars. I won't tell you my favorite but my top 4 are in no particular order, county bbq, green street meats, dinosaur bbq and bub city. Enjoy your BBQ! For the record I tried the chicken and ribs and while edible both were less than forgettable. I prefer the rotisserie chicken at whole foods.

54.description: Love this place! Delicious BBQ brisket for a reasonable price and some great beer on tap. Enjoyed the chill atmosphere and the quaint surrounding neighborhood

48.description: If this restaurant was in a busier neighborhood, it would be packed with a 2 hour wait every night. We are lucky to have it in University Village! The absolute gem that is Moxee hasn't been discovered yet and it's a shame. Every food item I've tried has been 5 stars (some favorites are salmon fingers, hoppin john, shrimp and crawfish etouffe, Brussels and bacon), and they have a fantastic beer and cocktail list. What sends this place over the top is the service and management. Please give this place a try!

44.description: LOVE Moxee! The food is really great. You could taste the fresh herbs and spices in all the dishes. I had an old fashioned and it was made perfectly. The ribs were to die for and smoked in-house. Also enjoyed the music playing and the bartender singing along to Morrissey.

24.description: Today's office lunch was supplied by Moxee. I figured I'd order the fish tacos since I was still full from my ronny's breakfast. My goodness, I was thinking it would be light fare but no, it was HUGE. I was expecting maybe three tacos but this was a big DIY taco platter. Six tortillas, a whole cornbreaded 12" filet, a quarter of an avacado (thought this portion was stingy when compared to the rest), a ton of rice, a bit of pico de gallo and some chipotle cream. That chipotle cream was delicious, I wish it came with more. Fish was fried real nice. Crispy outside, warm and flaky inside. The rice was meh, could've used less and it would've been nice to have some cabbage slaw included. What's a fish taco without the slaw? Other than that, it wasn't bad, wasn't great, it was good.

7.description: Place was a little dead on a Tuesday night. We sat at the bar and ordered the shrimp & crawfish poboy and chipotle pork tacos. I loved the poboy and didn't even want to think about tasting the tacos because the portion was humongous. Fries were crisp tender and seasoned just right, I almost didn't need ketchup (almost...what's fries without ketchup!). Free cornbread was a nice touch though I wasn't a fan of the black pepper flavor.Not sure why this place isn't more popular but liked how quiet & laid back it was. Prices were fair, food was fresh & good. I'll be back for sure!

49.description: Excellent service, food and location is exactly how I'd define this place! The quality of the BBQ and food in general is very good here! They have great outdoor seating as well and did I mention this is a brewery???Can't go wrong! Go here now!

40.description: Perfect if you go to UIC and want bar food and beer. Otherwise the food was very average along with the service. For a Saturday, at 730p, there were 4-5 groups of patrons. Extremely slow, not sure they will make it much longer. Not bad but not worth going back ever again.

53.description: Friendly service, the food was fairly priced and ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS ! A little outside of the downtown chicago area but worth it for sure.

30.description: Absolutely delicious Sunday brunch starting with the warm corn cakes, Bloody Mary, and white cheddar grits with shrimp, sauce, crispy pork belly, topped with two pouched eggs.  Insanely GOOD!!!!!

46.description: Full bar with TVs to watch games! In addition to the smokehouse section they have, they also serve other food options. They also brew their own beer here!

1.description: Extraordinarly dissapointing service, decent food though. I got a burger and fries which were a little greasy and I enjoyed that. I went on a Friday night and it was pretty much empty. My waitress didn't come to my table until I had been sitting there for 20 minutes and said immediately "I'm sorry, what do you want?" Which was nice of her to apologize even though saying "what do you want?" Made it seem like she felt that we were annoying her and made her apology seem insincere. I felt extremely uncomfortable being there after this happened. I didn't even want to order a drink because I wanted to just eat and go after how rude my waitress was.Other than that, the woman who brought our food out (not our waitress) was really nice to me and my date. Our waitress visited us again for a second time and seemed in a better mood to ask if we wanted dessert. I felt too uncomfortable being there and decided to take the check and get some dessert at the Coldstone nearby instead.

55.description: The food and atmosphere were great!  Loved the corn bread!

9.description: Yet another one of those times where so had to track down some gumbo. Actually stopped here earlier in the day while waiting for Au Cheval to open for dinner service. I'm a UIC alum, so I like going to all the newer restaurants in the area.   This restaurant is huge and had only like 2 people working lunch. Had to wait for a while to get greeted and seated, but was not too big of a deal. We chillaxed at a small table near the bar. I ordered the gumbo and a cider. We also received some cornbread to nosh on while we waited. The cornbread and gumbo were delicious. The cider, brewed locally, was good too, but had the most awful vomity smell. I got past that though and I'm still alive, so no worries.    Service was slow, but friendly. I wonder what this place is like at dinner time when it is more crowded. I may come back another time just to find out.

26.description: Wanted to like this place but it did not meet my expectations.  Came on a Saturday for dinner, and our host was also our waiter/ busboy.  He was pretty friendly but the only waiter. There were a lot of tables that had not been cleaned and the floor looked dirty. There was a big plastic container on the bottom of a cart in the dinning room area and it was filled with dirty plates and left over food...not what I want to look at when I'm eating.  I ordered the shrimp po'boy and it had too much cornmeal and not very flavorful.  The only thing I enjoyed were the sweet potato fries.  My spouse had the Moxee burger which was nothing special.  Later when we were almost finished with our meals another employee seemed to start her shift, picked up our dirty plates and simply grabbed another plastic container and filled it up next to the other one that had been sitting there....not coming back for sure..

25.description: This isn't the Maxwell Street I remember from my childhood--not a pushcart in sight.  This is now the University of Illinois at Chicago neighborhood, though Mad Mouse (and its partner restaurant Moxee) reports that the university is not a major factor in its clientele.  The brewpub occupies the back end of Moxee's big, open room.  Two TVs, dartboard; noisy even with a small Wednesday-afternoon crowd.  Two friendly and informative bartenders, one of whom turned out to be the brewer. There are only four house beers, two of them gypsy-brewed at Saugatuck Brewing in Michigan.  A flight of all four, at $10, consisted of:- Hippie Johnny Cream Ale.  5.0% ABV.  Clear gold, with a light head.  Dry and fairly hoppy, with a typical cream ale "meaty" note.  Described on the menu as a lawnmower beer; good enough for me, though I left my lawn back in California.- Schnickerfritz Kolsch.  5.1%; a collaboration with Saugatuck, where phyiscal production took place.  Clear amber-gold, light head.  Honeyish sweet malt taste, with only a touch of bittering hops in the fade.  Seems a bit short on tartness for a Kolsch.- Rathmandu.  5.0%; described as an American pale ale.  Another one produced at Saugatuck.  Light head, dissipating to halo.  Light hop nose.  Fairly hoppy front against a solid malt base, with a long bitter fade.  To my taste probably the best of the four.- 2015 ReplicAle Illinois Saison.  5.5%.  Mad Mouse's entry in the annual competition in which members of the Illinois Brewers' Guild produce their own takes on the same recipe.  Clear straw color, light head.  Dry but fruity taste; peaches are among the fermentables.  Also pink peppercorns (which, I learned from the  brewer, are, botanically, not actual Southeast Asian peppercorns, but the berry of a Brazilian plant; in any event, they contribute a bit of sting.Mad Mouse also has an impressive array of guest taps; at the time of my visit, these included:- Three Floyds Alpha Kong (see review below); Battle Priest; Permanent Funeral;  and Precious Porter- Two Brothers Atom Smasher- One-Trick Pony Spotted Saddle- Ska Modus Hoperandi- Revolution Antihero- Left Hand Milk Stout- Penrose Deminimus Mandarina- Half Acre Akari Shogun- Off-Color Troublesome Gose- Oskar Blue's Mama's Little Yellow Pils- Lagunitas Dogtown- Bell Oarsman.The only one of the guest taps I tried on my first visit was Three Floyds' Alpha Kong--a very different proposition from their familiar Alpha King.  The brewery describes Alpha Kong as a Belgian sextuple (apparently having skipped right over quintuple).  Served in a 10-ounce tulip glass, at $10.  Dark copper, with a light head.  Fruit and ethanol nose (no wonder, at 13% ABV).  Complex palate, fruity esters (pineapple and cherry notes), and ethanol rising well above the threshold of tastability.  Delicious, but 10 oz. is about as much as you'd want to handle at one time.I'll definitely be back for some of the other guest brews.Fairly accessible to public transportation; on the 8-Halsted bus line.  In normal times this is an easy connection (about ¾ mile) from the Halsted-UIC Blue Line station, but at present that's somewhat disrupted by the rebuilding of the "whirlpool" expressway interchange at Halsted and Congress.  About a mile and a quarter from Haymarket on the 8-Halsted bus.

on the 8-Halsted bus line.  In normal times this is an easy connection (about ¾ mile) from the Halsted-UIC Blue Line station, but at present that's somewhat disrupted by the rebuilding of the "whirlpool" expressway interchange at Halsted and Congress.  About a mile and a quarter from Haymarket on the 8-Halsted bus.

59.description: Lets start with the good stuff:The beer list is small but solid and the ambiance is nice - large space that isn't too loud and it feels welcoming. I had the 2 combo sandwiches with mac n' cheese and coleslaw. I always get sauce on the side if I know the sauce wasn't integrated into the meat early on, otherwise, they just smother mediocre meat with flavorful sauce. In this case, I am glad I got side sauce, because the meat was pretty mediocre, and the sauce wasn't very good. I am on to something with my theory...The pulled pork held up flavor wise, but it was dry and with only 2 sauces to choose from, there was no respite from the chewing. My table started the running joke of calling the "hot" bbq sauce, the red top, because it was more fitting than in fact calling it "hot." Both sauces were incredibly tangy, thin and lacking body. A good sauce would really alleviate people like me being critical of the meat, but lets be real, you're at a BBQ place, you should be critical of the meat. On to the weirdest part of the whole meal, the mac n' cheese and the coleslaw. I have never had either sides in such a way as Moxee served them. Normally, I order coleslaw to pair with my spicy/savory bbq, but in this case, the sauce was super mild and the coleslaw had jalapenos in it. The coleslaw lacked tang and had cilantro and tomatoes in it - it would have made a good salsa. THE MAC AND CHEESE! What did they serve me? My table called it mac soup, because it tasted like someone put pasta in a cream of mushroom soup with bread crumbs, lots and lots of bread crumbs. So many  in fact that much of them were dry even after being "baked" underneath the soup. Each bite was a cheese-less adventure with crouton-esque mouthfuls of clumpy crumbs. I dont know what they were thinking, but it was seriously off mark. All in all, i didnt have any expectations going in and Im glad because i would have been more dissapointed than I am now. To end on a more positive note, our waiter was good and my friend said the crab cakes were (shoulder shrug) alright.

21.description: Just ate their veggie burger.  Wow!  Amazing!  Also comes with the best tasting coleslaw I've ever had.  It's seriously amazing!  Got a side of red beans & rice, which was super delicious too.  I will be ordering this same dish again soon.  They really add quality details to their food and it doesn't go unnoticed.

17.description: EAT HERE.I do not jest. There has yet to be a bad meal here over the 4-5 times my fiancee and I have eaten here. Tonight we had a meal with two of her friends, and I just had to come on here to extol the pulled pork sandwich. Tender meat already in a mild peppery seasoning with a little bit of mesquite BBQ sauce in the middle -- this was a literal conversation stopper since I was completely slamming it. Oh what's this? A side of more tasty sauce? And it's warm? I would have used a straw if nobody were looking, but instead my medium was this sandwich that I couldn't get enough of. Part 3 on the plate was this mildly creamy / vinegar-y cole slaw, which I should have had a third hand for in order to fork onto the pork feast on a bun. One of our guests, who is normally turned off by creamy slaw, had both eyebrows raised in pleasure and surprise at how tasty it was.P.S. there were rice & beans too. I could have a plate of those on their own. Not too sweet, not too spicy, this is the baby bear of side dishes: just right.After all this, we were too full for dessert, but I can vouch for blueberry crumble cake topped with vanilla ice cream. I would recommend not sharing this one.Any gripes? Top food, great atmosphere, very pleasant service... and no patrons! We can't understand it. On the one had we don't want people to know about this gem so we have no problem getting a seat, but on the other hand we want people to come here so that we can keep coming back. Seriously folks. What are you doing for dinner tonight?

10.description: The journey continues in finding some solid BBQ in Chicago, as well as naming the best restaurant here on Maxwell near UIC.My coworkers and I came here for lunch one day for some good All-American food. It was here that i realized a lot of restaurants in Chicago love to give out complimentary bites for you to enjoy while waiting for your food. Our server handed out a good piece of corn bread for each of us. While not the best, it was good and definitely quelled my hunger/I ordered two small plates since I wasn't feeling particularly hungry: a small gumbo and a side of garlic mashed potatoes. Not sure if you've read, but they definitely hook it up when it comes to the spuds. There was so much of it that I got full just from eating all the carby goodness.On the other hand, my gumbo was pretty forgettable. It was too salty for my taste, and not even an extra piece of corn bread could really fight the sodium levels.I heard that the wings here are the real kicker. They may not be on the menu, but the place still sells them. I'd definitely give those a go the next time I visit.Service overall was slow even though we were the only party for a good hour during lunch. Be prepared- they only take a certain number of cards from large groups, so be ready to Venmo a friend if you're looking to split the check more than six ways.

5.description: Came here for drinks after having dinner with friends.  The atmosphere was  nice and calm. They had a live band playing on a Friday night. Not the spot to come for a night of dancing but more for a chill night. They had many beer selections which we enjoyed. We didn't eat here but the menu looks very promising. We plan to come back for the full dining experience.

3.description: Came here for dinner and had the pulled pork sandwich. The pork was bit on the dry side, but nothing that couldn't be fixed with barbecue sauce. The sweet potato fries were good but the polenta fries were even better. I'd come back! The environment was causal and relaxed. The staff was friendly.You can park in the garage across the street for $2.

35.description: I love this brewery! It's tucked away in the lesser known University Village neighborhood near the University of Illinois at Chicago. I often get red beans and rice to take back to work for a quick lunch, and the staff always offers me complimentary corn bread. The staff is always courteous and the food is delicious! The beer selection is quite good too. They also have an amazing patio space!

19.description: Love this place!  It has a wide variety of food so anyone can find something they like here.  They have the best corn crusty fish tacos I have ever had.  My kids love the plank salmon dinner.  Easy to come here with a large group.  Nice atmosphere.  Drinks are great!  I love the Prosecco.  Lot of beer brews here if you're into that.

28.description: Place was a little dead on a Tuesday night. We sat at the bar and ordered the shrimp & crawfish poboy and chipotle pork tacos. I loved the poboy and didn't even want to think about tasting the tacos because the portion was humongous. Fries were crisp tender and seasoned just right, I almost didn't need ketchup (almost...what's fries without ketchup!). Free cornbread was a nice touch though I wasn't a fan of the black pepper flavor.Not sure why this place isn't more popular but liked how quiet & laid back it was. Prices were fair, food was fresh & good. I'll be back for sure!

45.description: A special spot In University Village! Pulled brisket is great! Service is excellent! Nice outdoor eating!

33.description: Amazing Shrimp and Crawfish Po'Boy! Highly recommend. Beer selection is good, cocktails are delicious and very reasonably priced. It is a shame that this place has not been discovered yet. Especially, since they have live music -- the night I was there it was jazz of the '20s and it was very good. It has a lot of space and a quite big outdoor area. I will definitely be back!

43.description: Has potential, but missed the mark. We came in for lunch, and the service was slow and the food mediocre at best. With only one waitress, it was probably more than she could handle. It took about 5 mins for her visit to our table with waters. We ended up grabbing menus from the hostess booth because after another 5-10 minutes we didn't have any. Coleslaw was good. Chicken po'boy didn't do too much for me.

2.description: Not freshStrangely spicyWe ordered three food including a salad,Chicken strips and beef.Except for salad, the other were not fresh. We couldn't even have it.We told waitress and received no attention. I'm not going there again.It's only proper for young people gathering together with their friend and they don't care about what they eat as food, but just drink.

18.description: My husband and I stopped in for brunch after church and loved the ambience. The food was delicious would recommend the Restaurnt for brunch or lunch. We will be coming back for dinner soon

41.description: Had a good after work evening on Thursday with Maxwell street Serenaders playing  early Jazz. Very nice, Prices were reasonable and service was friendly and very fast. Parking was good for a Thursday and proximity to the Loop made it easy to get to. I'll be a reg.

52.description: We arrived just as the rain started on Sunday, May 24th. We were greeted promptly, When we were seated, water and fresh hot cornbread was delivered to the table.The beer menu is excellent and the food menu matches equally. I loved the decor. There is elaborate rustic framework above the bar and assorted mirrors on the walls leading to the bathroom. The dining area is large with lots of wood and metal finishes. One huge windowed wall showed us all of the breweries implements. We had a flight for $10 plus an additional Une Anee pour. If we had more time and lived closer, we would have tried more beer. We ordered the Butcher and Baker appetizer. OMG. Two hot, homemade pretzels with spicy grainy mustard, aged sharp cheddar cheese, homemade pastrami, bourbon cured pork belly and andouille sausage. We shared an entree: combo pulled platter with two sides plus two additional sides. The meat was tender, tasty and just what you would expect from good grilled meats. The sides were exceptional. I suggest you try all of them too. We had the sweet and sour cucumbers, garlic mashed potatoes, macaroni and cheese, and red beans and rice. I should have gotten a BOWL of red beans and rice. Try the spicy BBQ sauce. It was awesome. We are looking forward to our next visit.

50.description: It was a great experience. I personally didn't enjoy the cornbread as much because I felt it was kinda of hard, but the lemonade was really good (not cheap but good). My mom and I shared the pulled pork sandwich with sweet potato fries, the crab cake salad, and a side of mac and cheese. The food was all AMAZING! I absolutely loved the sweet potato fries and the crab cakes. I didn't really like the salad underneath the crab cakes so I would probably just get the crab cakes next time but I loved them. The pulled pork was the best I've ever had and the bun was soft and tasted amazing with the pork. The Mac and cheese was just okay in my opinion. It just seems like a "grown-up" Mac and cheese, which is probably fitting for a brewery but it just didn't stand out to me. Everything was amazing, I would probably make the hour trip out there to have another meal like this.

4.description: The more I go here the more I love it!.  Hippie Johnny Cream Ale -- tasty and ridiculously drinkable, paired w/the in house smoked salmon.  TO GO:  Pecan Pie -- heavy not too sweet and tenderloin tips with mashed and broccoli.  That dish is tasty and a REAL BARGAIN.Friendly customers and super good wait/bar staff!!!

6.description: Update: we've been back a few times since our original review, and we have had consistently great experiences.  Prompt, friendly service, delicious food, great beer!

22.description: The beer is amazing and the selection is great.  The service is friendly and fast.  The food is stellar.  The Coke slaw has great heat.  The bbq chicken is banging.  I am pleasantly surprised bc bbq isn't totally my thing.  I'd come back a bunch.  Delicious.

15.description: Had to try out the food and brew.  The corn bread was better than my place on 7. The gumbo was spicy and filling.  I have to come back for another brandy barrel stout.

57.description: Came here to watch the Bulls game with a buddy (not a good place for a game, btw... only a few TVs) since it's a few blocks away from where I live. I knew they brewed their own beer, but I didn't have any expectations for the food. It's GREAT. We had brussels sprouts and pork belly, salmon fingers and tiki burgers. Oh, and they give you cornbread to start. I'd recommend any of those items, but the salmon fingers were my favorite.I only tried a couple of their beers, which were good as well. The rest of the beer list is thoughtfully put together, and they have a couple small local options on the list (a cider made by a Chicago couple, a Marz brew, etc).We finished the night by playing darts (a real cork dartboard!). They also have a shuffleboard table.Anyway, a very cool space with great food and good beer--what's not to like?

20.description: EAT HERE.I do not jest. There has yet to be a bad meal here over the 4-5 times my fiancee and I have eaten here. Tonight we had a meal with two of her friends, and I just had to come on here to extol the pulled pork sandwich. Tender meat already in a mild peppery seasoning with a little bit of mesquite BBQ sauce in the middle -- this was a literal conversation stopper since I was completely slamming it. Oh what's this? A side of more tasty sauce? And it's warm? I would have used a straw if nobody were looking, but instead my medium was this sandwich that I couldn't get enough of. Part 3 on the plate was this mildly creamy / vinegar-y cole slaw, which I should have had a third hand for in order to fork onto the pork feast on a bun. One of our guests, who is normally turned off by creamy slaw, had both eyebrows raised in pleasure and surprise at how tasty it was.P.S. there were rice & beans too. I could have a plate of those on their own. Not too sweet, not too spicy, this is the baby bear of side dishes: just right.After all this, we were too full for dessert, but I can vouch for blueberry crumble cake topped with vanilla ice cream. I would recommend not sharing this one.Any gripes? Top food, great atmosphere, very pleasant service... and no patrons! We can't understand it. On the one had we don't want people to know about this gem so we have no problem getting a seat, but on the other hand we want people to come here so that we can keep coming back. Seriously folks. What are you doing for dinner tonight?

36.description: Delicious! Never had a bad experience here. Burgers are excellent. So is the pulled combo plate. Fries are great, the garlic mashed potatoes are on point! Service is always good and employees are friendly. Keep up the good work

14.description: Went of dinner on a Friday night and it was nice to see it wasnt packed but had a good crowd. The Kentucky mule was great and my wife had the Moscow, which she liked. Switched to a large beer selection after our cocktails. Food was good, we had the crab cakes for an app and they were great. Wife had fish and chips which were really good... and great the next day as well! I had the po' boy which was good though I prob wont get it again. Service was solid. Easy to get a cab right out front.

58.description: So, I've been here a few times before, and I love it a little more each time.  The menu has staples in it, but it is also diverse in what it offers.  The crowd is generally pretty laid back.3 dollar Jameson shots!??  Yes please!Also, I came on Wednesday, which it appears is country night.   AWESOME!  Music was all fun stuff to listen to with a live DJ.I'll be back for sure.

56.description: was there couple times and never had anything to complain about!food was great! i love their cesar salad and summer rolls!!! sooooooo good!!!drinks? first place I see where there is no pain in the ass to pour you more then shot-2 shots of liqueur in your drink, they just fill it uup! after 2 drinks I was already happy and ready to rock! while in other places you drinking for hours and not even get close to being little drunk! !!!!they play nice music, nice crowd, feels like really friendly atmosphere!And I loooooove it when you come there and people saying-Oh! it is a comedy night tonight!  or- Country night! Live music?-GREAT ! these people know how to surprise you!!!!!It was only once when we came and place wasn't packed, but even that time we had a great night- friendly bartender was taking care of us and felt like she is a good friend of us for a long time already!!!I definitely LOVE this spot!!!!!!!!!

29.description: Ok giving 2 stars because the outdoor patio was nice. But after sitting there for 15 minutes, while the place was pretty empty, during a street festival, we were never attended. So we walked out. Can't tell you how the drinks or food were.... Was a party of 5 of us.

42.description: I came because of its location and stayed because of the because the service was very lethargic.I've been here a few times in the past and wasn't whelmed by any degree. There's not much I can say about this aside from its dullness. When I visited they had a couple of decent beer choices, but everything else was pretty standard. The food I had was just alright. My friends also felt the same way. The service wasn't good by any means. One time I was there the food took an absurd amount of time to make it from the kitchen to our table. The waitress didn't even realize especially when her and the bartender just disappeared to the back to do who knows what. I had no idea that it took so long to heat up pre-made appetizers. At one point I had enough beer to make use the facilities. Upon opening the door I was witness to a mess that could be describe as Mogadishu in the early 90s.I don't hate the place, but I don't recommend it. Bar 10 Doors! Bar-ten-ders! My mind has just been blown to the fullest.

23.description: Great Music! Great Staff! Great food! Great Drinks! Every night is different and the place is VERY diverse! (Unlike all the other bars on Taylor St.) Try the 10 Door burger, 1 of my favs! And the Mai Tai Koko for a sweet drink! Your welcome :)

47.description: Do NOT go here!  The waitresses think they are slick and will try to get more money out of you.  Stephanie is trifling and will try you!!  My friends and I tried to ignore her dry personality in the beginning, but it continued to get worse. We waited forever for our food, my friend NEVER got his wings so he decided to cancel the whole thing and her attitude got worse.  Every time we ordered anything, whether it was a side of sour cream or another mimosa, it was a 15 minute wait.  Our food was cold when we FINALLY got it, too.  HERE COMES THE WORST PART...We asked for the bill and when it came, there was no itemized breakdown AND she charged my credit card when in the beginning she said she just needed my card to hold a tab and she wouldn't charge my card.  I asked for a breakdown b/c I wanted to make sure I wasn't paying for more than we got.  GET THIS!  The itemized bill comes, and the gratuity was ALREADY INCLUDED!!  She did NOT tell us this in the beginning.  So what she tried to do was get another tip outta us!  HORRIBLE!  We ask for the Manager, one of the Promoters comes over in a t-shirt...he clearly was NOT the Manager.  He tried to play us too.  He was unprofessional and really didn't care about our concerns.  We got up and left.  It's poorly run and they are shady!

8.description: Honestly my favorite place to go on Thursday nights. Everyone's so nice and you're guaranteed to have a good time

31.description: Just an ok jointA very good friend of mine had his bday celebration here recently. Decent beer selection as I just stuck with Blue Moon & Lagunitas for the night. They have a fireplace, TVs and seating as well. They have a jukebox that play some pretty good jams from the last few decades. They take debit/credit cards, but their machine seemed to be down the night I was there. Nothing special or anything like that, but a cool spot for the area.

34.description: I've been to this place a couple of times for a buddy's birthday parties. The layout is great, it's reasonably priced, they have a nice outside patio, and their food is great too. Whenever I'm in the area and I need a beverage, this is my go-to spot.

16.description: This bar has good food and great specials. I love their tacos and Ten Doors Burger. It's the perfect place to watch a game and grab a bite with friends.

13.description: I have given this place 3 tries.  I went last Sunday and once again the service is ridiculous.  It takes 20 minutes just to get the waitress to come to you or the bartender if you are at the bar and then it's another 15-20 minutes to get the drink.  It was ridiculous!!!  I experienced an unreasonable long wait each time I went, but I like to give places a chance.  I'm not going back because I refuse to spend my $$$$ in a place that takes 30 plus minutes for a drink.  The sad part is that they must know they are understaffed, but can care less.

11.description: Nice little spot. Went here recently with some friends and enjoyed it. It was kind of loud but enjoyable. I love the pool tables. It's nice to see in a small place. Beer selection was good. May be back.

39.description: I had invited a bunch of friends to dinner at Three Aces but a fluke private party had bumped their wait time up to 2 hours. Our party walked in here to see if we could pass the time with a drink or two and immediately everything about it reminded me of the "bars" in my college town with nothing in them but chairs and beer flyers. All 7 or so of us sat around a vacant but sticky table for about 15 minutes still deciding if we wanted to stay but the fratty atmosphere and the fact that not once were we approached for service that whole time (we weren't greeted or even CARDED at the door by a soul) gave us zero qualms about just leaving. Based on some of these other reviews, I'm glad we didn't stay long enough to have one of our identities stolen. I've never had a place I was in for so short a time give me this bad of a taste as to bother reviewing it, but I'm highly unlikely to give this place another chance. I moderate a Facebook account for another nightclub and this place spams us constantly with their event invites. Now I see why they're so desperate.

37.description: Fun fun fun karaoke!!  My sister and I joined some friends here.  We had such a great time.  The crowd was great, the food was good, I'll definitely be back.

0.description: I've been here a couple of time and each time is a blast.  I normally come on a Sunday for the day parties the atmosphere is great the food is great too!! The music is always the perfect fit for the crowd!Did i say I loved day parties yet!!! What's better than a day party on a Sunday that you can. Have a great time and still go home in time to get ready for work!

38.description: My wife and I were looking forward to checking this place out when it first opened. Taylor street is really trying. Unfortunately, this place was a bust for us. Overpriced for what it is. Nothing particularly outstanding about the food or drink menu. With places like Three Aces and the well-established Hawkeyes just down the street, there is no reason to return to this place.

51.description: Went to this place on a Wed night. My friend and I were hungry but also wanted a drink special. The $5 absolutes and $4 drafts brought us in. We then ordered the pizzette and tater tots. Our server Ashley was nice and took our order right away. Checked on us enough through the night. Even when it started to get busy. Wow to our surprise they were both great. The pizzette is small great as an appetizer with goat cheese, sundried tamtoes and pesto. Tator tots toped with cheese, blk beans, giadiniera, sour cream. They have karaoke but we didnt venture towards the back of the bar. I would definitely go back to try other items on the menu. Plus they have drink specials everyday.

27.description: Ive only been n here on Sunday and let me say its the place to be if you want to watch the game, get a goo drink, & later dance/listen  to some great music.  Djs are on point!!Security is present and efficient. Good space and two bars to choose from. Usual choices as far as alcohol but great specials on shots and mimosasJean and Denae are great eye candy and sad to say but I just dont see enough tips goin their way. I guess as a bartender this is my issue.  Food is nothing to write home about but after a few drinks who cares lol

32.description: They don't give a **** about their customers. Won't be going here again, wish I could give 0 stars.

54.description: For this year's Christmas Secret Santa dinner, my friends and I decided to go here vs the usual sit down restaurant. One of my friends suggested this place, since she has been here and liked it. Our server was nice, but very slow. I understand that this is not a restaurant. I've been to bars before. But it took her forever.... at least 15 min to refill a glass of water my friend had asked. The place wasn't even busy!The food itself was ok, expected for bar food I guess. The service, or lack of was just not good. It also took her a long time to bring the check.

48.description: There's nothing I enjoy more than a friendly bartender who gives out free shots.  My girlfriend would say there's nothing she likes more than a good looking, attentive, flirtatious and friendly bartender that serves up a shot of feel good.It was not busy at all when we stopped in for a beer...at 1 in the afternoon on a Saturday.  We nabbed front row seats at the bar.  The prices are average, as was the beer selection.  My blue moon was a big, tall, cold glass of happy....just the way I like my beer.The atmosphere was nice, not too loud either.  Solid.

44.description: Came here after Festa Italiana on Taylor street.  It was an okay place, prices were decent.  But overall I wasn't impressed with the people or the actual place (pretty run down).  There are better options on Taylor St.

24.description: Great if you want to go to an overcrowded place filled with highschool kids and wait 35 mins for "Tyler" to get you a beer because he's too busy getting his friends drunk. Food was average at best, but the service was absolutely terrible. That's what happens when you have a bunch of inexperience kids running the place since management is practically nonexistent. This joint is in a great location, they just need to bring someone who knows a bit about the industry to try to elevate it a tiny bit.

7.description: Taco Tuesday with live Comedy was good!However the lady charged me & my two friends $30 for a table. And they only had ONE bartender/server for the entire establishment. Wtf. Who does that. She forgot our drinks. My friend ordered some tacos and never got them. Just a mess. But the drinks were good, tacos too! They just need to change how they operate. Cause if I pay $30 for a table I expect the service to be on point!!!

49.description: This place..not impressed. It's like a big box of a place, no warmth, no personality. I don't understand the layout; it's this huge barn of a space with seemingly little thought put into the design. Example: there is one bathroom per-sex..why? That is such a turn off in a bar, and when you have that much available space, why not add as many stalls as possible? I guess there's an entirely other bar/space on the other side? It makes no sense.2 stars for a really nice waitress, decent drink prices, and a juke box that can be controlled via phone.

40.description: Five reasons why you should NOT EVER patron Bar 10 Doors located at 1259 W. Taylor in Chicago, IL:1. While sitting in Bar 10 neither of two waitresses bothered to ask my friend nor I if we wanted a drink at all during our entire stay. 2. After being ignored at the table, I went to the bar to get a drink and was ignored by the female bartender who asked for my drink order three times before actually serving it. 3. Somehow between 12:45am and 1:15am the price of the same drink went up by a dollar. After calling their attention to the discrepancy, they stood by it and refused to correct the error. (I STILL tipped.)4. While trying to finish my drink at closing time, a bouncer proceeded to come to the table in a belligerent manner and demand that we leave. After telling him we were waiting on the manager to resolve the poor service at the bar, he became even MORE aggressive and put his hands in my friend's face and angrily pushed the table away from us. He then moved towards us as if to physically remove us from the establishment. 5. After reporting these incidents to management, they dismissed my concerns assuming I was an "angry" Black woman and attempted to patronize me without actually addressing the overarching concern of dismal customer service.I have NEVER in my life been treated with such discourtesy.  If you do go to this establishment, be prepared for a severe lack of hospitality, lackadaisical bar and wait staff, and unresponsive management.In fairness, there is one bartender there usually on Wednesdays and Sundays by the name of Kendall.  This gentleman is wonderful at what he does.  He is extremely hard working (I've seen him break out into a sweat while tending bar), very attentive, always provides service with a smile, remembers your face and drink (he may even surprise you with knowing your name), and truly understands the value of great customer service.  Whenever I am in his care, I am compelled to tip a minimum of 30%.  I hope to find out if there is another location where he works on other evenings.

53.description: Yep, it's a bar. Yep, it's in "University Village". Yep, the website promises karaoke nights and tequila shot specials, so on paper, this place seems very Barleycorn-esque - the kind of place I have no business being within a hundred yards of. But, aside from a couple of minor issues, this place is pretty solid.Allow me to take you back - way back - into a time when I was just a young college kid myself.  We had a couple of places we frequented that we referred to as "Vomitoriums" because these bars were set up for serious partying and drinking.  These places were designed for maximum efficiency - nothing that spilling drinks or vomiting could stain or damage, so no light colours, no fabrics, no carpeting.  Instead, hard, dark surfaces that could be hosed down quick.   Walking into the Bar 10 Doors and seeing the hard tile floor, the dark wood furniture, the cold utilitarian nature of it all, brought back some memories. Not a fan of the interior at all, but hey, I am also not the one mopping up dark beer and Jameson off the floor every night either.Because there is nothing to absorb the sound, even though the place was half full when we were there, with some basketball game being shown on TV it was pretty loud.   We had a great server, she was really nice, but she was the only one taking care of the whole place. This seemed odd for a Saturday evening, but she was doing as good of a job as she could.We ordered the fried pickles. They were so close to being perfect. The problem was that they were cut into spears rather than chips, and the spears were simply too thick and juicy.  Had they slimmed them down they would have been amazing and the breading would have adhered to them better.Then I had the Tinga sandwich. The Tinga is served wrap-style and has Spicy chipotle marinated chicken, Romaine, Pico de gallo and Grilled Onions.  Problem is the sandwich was very heavy with raw onion.  Maybe it's just that I don't eat raw onions often, but it was really strong to me and sort of overpowered the rest of the ingredients.  Wasn't bad, per se, but nothing I would order again.But I do have to give them props for having a really fantastic Bloody Mary - loved how rich and dense it was, with a ton of spices and a ton of flavour.  Don't know if I would make a special trip down here again, but I would come back if I was in the area.

30.description: Last night was my second time visiting. I normally don't hang out on work evenings like at all, but I made the exception. The first time I went was at the invitation of an FBF who is a local poet and he was performing for their new weekly poetry session, the vibe was cool especially for a Monday.This time we went on karaoke night and I had a BLAST, met some great company and listened to some not so great but fun-having folks sing their hearts out and some of them could actually blow. I saw they sell food (???) though I didn't sample any but the drinks were great, crowd was adults and reasonably priced. Its a cool lil spot - would go back

46.description: This place is shady! My friends and I went here this past Sunday for the advertised, 50 cent wings,$5.00 grey goose cocktails & $3 mimosas. Here's the catch you have to order at least 12 wings, the grey goose IS NOT $5.00 and the mimosas are horrible. Here's what happened:My friends and I get there and we place our orders. We all got the 12 wings and either a cocktail or mimosa to quench our thirst. One of my friends also ordered a side of fries. We each take a bite of the wings....and they are alright. The dipping sauces that they use somehow made the wings worse. We all continued to eat our wings until we couldn't do it anymore. There's only so much a person can take and those flavorless, over cooked wings had done enough. Here's the topper:They attempted to charge us each $8.00 for 12 wings. If you do the math .50(wings) x 12(the number of wings) = $6.00, not $8.00! AND then the advertised Grey Goose cocktails were actually $7.00 & the shady "manager" refused to take the $ 2.00 off our bills. I have never received such horrible service in my life, nor have I ever been so disappointed in an establishment. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy!

1.description: You. Need. To. Come. Here. Awesome atmosphere and service! Mario and Rachel are favulous bartenders. And if the owner Narsi is around you may get a free shot or two. Plus, points for creativity on the name! I wish I could give it ten stars.

55.description: Really fun bartenders!!! Great drink specials!!

9.description: Such a fun place!! Always have a good time! Love the music! Pool is always a good time and they have many awesome arcade games. Coolest spot on thirsty Thursday's but equivalently awesome every day of the week!! Thanks for always providing quality customer service!

26.description: How in the hell do you run out of wings on game night? Why is there only mozzarella in a place that serves tacos, burgers, sandwiches AND QUESADILLAS? Who the hell puts mozzarella on a quesadilla. The menu is awful. More than two tables left because of the food issues. Seriously? MOZZARELLA?!?!?! I understand that some people don't tip, but please don't add gratuity to my table of only two guests. I tip 20%, minimum. I'm insulted when gratuity is automatically added to my bill when it's not mentioned beforehand. The ONLY thing that saved this place was the fact that there was Gumballhead. Someone needs to call Gordon Ramsey for a complete overhaul or it won't be open too much longer.

25.description: I think you come hear and understand why you come here and you will have an A-Okay time. The beauty of this place is that it's big enough to where they can section it off depending on what's going on. The night I went there was a party on one side and live music on the other. I've been when they've done Sunday Funday. They have pretty reasonable drink prices and getting there is easy.

12.description: Went here after a mixer with a friend. We met some people at the mixer who went with us it was quite a large group. Granted it was a wednesday night, it was a nice well behaved crowd. The waitress was very prompt, bubbly and efficient. The wait wasnt too long. The drinks were a tad watered down IMO. I ordered the hot wings which were ok, some ordered the crab cakes which were good and the steak tacos which were also good. The highlight of my night was the music it was a awesome mix of new and old....kept me singing and dancing (in my seat) all night long. All in all the ambiance was great, good food and drinks with new friends made for a good night.

59.description: I was scrolling thru some of the libelous and equivocal reviews of a few haunts I frequent today, so I decided to write some reviews....A server calling the police on a customer for not tipping????? Please....that caustic blasphemy seems fishier than Courtney Love's vagina.
