My jackass friends and I have been treated like the Prince of Zamunda the few times we've been here to paint turn our livers blacker than Sidney Poitier. I dunno. Anyway, I normally would have to go to Grenshaw and Throop  to buy n smoke a rock the size of a chihuahua's head in order to visit most bars on Taylor street, but 10 Doors is the exception.A bunch of neighborhood spots always make me feel like i'm intruding, not here. I don't know of many spots where i could get a shot of Jameson and a can of grandpa's nerve tonic for 5 hundred pennies everyday of the friggin' week. That's as rare as a fat Ethiopian, my friends. Maybe u can at a spot of two in wicker park, but who wants to hang out with a bunch of hipsters with their dirty, bedraggled 70s porn star bush beards and their skinny jeans that suffocate their bushy nuts cuz that denim is tighter than Hannah Montana's vagina.I digress, food and service are good. I've had the fajita wrap and the turkey burger (that I had to unhinge my jaw like a boa constrictor to eat). It gave the fat kid in me a stomach boner, and the fries have made me shoot my future sons and daughters into the front of my drawers cuz they are so damn tasty. The servers are cute  and the owners i've met are two nice dudes who have put more shots in my belly than a physician giving a rabies treatment  just cuz  they remember my face and I don't act like a dickhead (I'm assuming).  I like Puerto Rican bartender's taste in music. I think i've heard every song off The Beatles Rubber Soul there, but all the bartenders  have charisma oozing out their tear ducts and pour drinks stiffer than a wedding night dick....and i like that....drinks that is, not dick :)

21.description: 10 doors is the place to go if you reside in little Italy or the surrounding area. It's a 2 room bar with a completely underrated beer selection. Not to mention the staff and service is on a level in which I've rarely experienced in Chicago. They all make you feel right at home. Great place to catch a game, and awesome new patio for the summer. Younger UIC crowd on Thursdays, and hosts many local comedians/musicians. Definitely check it out.

17.description: My favorite bar to go to. We held an event here not long ago and the owner gave us our own private area for dinner. Drinks are always very strong and the environment is great. They recently added in arcade games and pool tables which really livened up the place. I definitely recommend if you're hanging out on taylor street!

10.description: Gang signs in bathroom.  Rowdy crowd, average food, overpriced.Definitely not a family friendly place.I cannot say when you average the price the crowd the service that it is worth it at all.The exterior is very inviting and very modern but once you get in and the staff ignores you and you wish you were seeing it as you walk away.

5.description: Nice bar to watch a game or play tunes on Taylor st. The fish tacos were excellent! I wasn't sure what to expect but they were so good I'd come back just to eat them again. Rachel is a great bartender and the drinks were tasty and not too pricey. Cozy area by a fireplace and new pool tables are a nice addition.

3.description: I have called several times left messages and even went down there .rude as hell.The management is horrible.Rachel has not called me back after 3wks of vm.my sister went to see if I could meet with her on Friday after 8. Guess what she was not there.and the staff couldn't give my shit.because they didn't know.finally my sister went with me to the Establishment and guess what  Rachel still wS nor there.sooooo9ko I will not go to the Establishment tosave my life ....so disappointed with management and staff.pretty much every there is racist. I've called since Oct 10.no respond. I'm sure by now I can't have my husband party there.I will be sure to spread the word African American ppl are not welcome... Close down Rachel.....you suck!!!!!!!I'm sure you booked now..........

35.description: I've been to Bar 10 Doors plenty of times and my experience has always been fun. You can bet that if there is a big game on they will have it showing and they often have DJs. The food is fine...not spectacular but it is a bar and it's tasty.  Plus they usually have drinks and food specials. I've never had issues with the service...it's usually pretty busy so a wait is to be expected. I would definitely recommend checking this place out.

19.description: Last night was my second time visiting. I normally don't hang out on work evenings like at all, but I made the exception. The first time I went was at the invitation of an FBF who is a local poet and he was performing for their new weekly poetry session, the vibe was cool especially for a Monday.This time we went on karaoke night and I had a BLAST, met some great company and listened to some not so great but fun-having folks sing their hearts out and some of them could actually blow. I saw they sell food (???) though I didn't sample any but the drinks were great, crowd was adults and reasonably priced. Its a cool lil spot - would go back

28.description: The bar 10 doors burger is the bomb, so is the southsider chicken burger. Great place to watch sports or kick back a few pbr's lol. They also have a huge selection of IPA's and yuppie beers for all you schwinn riding, american spirit smokin hipsters out there.Nice tv's for sports and a jukebox. Decent dj's on thursdays and weekends.

45.description: I've always wonder if this Bar really has 10 doors?!?...Well it sure doesn't seem like it, but their bar-ten-ders are very cool. They have a good drink selection, and their kitchen is open till midnight.This bar hosted a couple gigs for my band before. The place as a venue, is extremely small. With that being said, It has the smallest stage I have ever seen, so far, but it's not that bad. All in one, great place to host even about the smallest gigs.

33.description: Really really nice, I will definitely be back again.

43.description: Loveee Bar 10 doors! Maybe because I live around here and it is poppin on Thursdays. But the drink specials are always great!

2.description: Nice little spot, came here with friends for Cinco de Mayo. Music is super loud, you can barely here each other talk. The margaritas were served on tiny glasses packed with ice (very disappointed) it was ok but wasn't really that strong. Simple steak tacos takes about 40 minutes to get to you which is utterly ridiculous. Can't say how they taste because I'm still waiting.Free street parking on the side street behind the bar.Place was ok but nothing I would drive all the way out to come to.

18.description: I attended the bar on Sunday July 12th for my husband's birthday. This bar came highly recommended and I was disappointed by the atmosphere. There was a $10 cover and the scene was ghetto. There was no dress code, women were drunk and parading around like strippers (I saw a young lady get on all fours to dance on her date like they were in the bedroom), and tables were dirty. My experience was terrible. I should've known the night would be bad because I kept calling to see what was going on that night and no one answered the phone after I called several times that day.  Very unprofessional. I will tell my friends not to support this place. I was upset I paid for something to celebrate my husband's birthday and we stayed no more than 15 mins because of the crowd of people.

41.description: Great place to watch sports. Good crowd that is there & the DJ plays good music during commercial breaks & knows how to transition & fade the music out when the game is back on.Drinks good, a bit too strong though but better than weak & watered down.Place is drafty. They could use a better heating system. This is the Windy City for goodness sake.Not keen on going back but I wouldn't be opposed to going again.

52.description: The Bar at 10 doors is a perfect example of my dining motto. "It's all about the food". The minimalistic decor which featured bare floors, bare walls and a couple of flat screen featuring a Bulls game and the NFL playoff game. None of this really mattered considering how good the food was.  We started out with two appetizers. The fried pickles and the loaded tots. The fried pickles were a bit dissapointing and is the only reason I didn't give this eatery five stars. The pickles were a mess. The fact that there wasn't enough breading killed the appetizer. The loaded tots were a 5th graders wet dream. Tater tots topped with melted cheese, chili, sour cream and hot peppers. Not only were the tots topped with everything but the kitchen sink, the portion size of the appetizer was huge. It was a meal in itself. I enjoyed the leftovers the next day.  For my entree I opted for the Chicken-Chorizo taco's. The chicken was delicious. I have no idea what kind of hybred meat this was. It almost had the taste of a Indian dish. Whatever it was, I really enjoyed it. These three small taco's packed quite a punch. It's a rare occasion where I couldn't finish them all. My left over taco also tasted excellent the next day.  Here's the bottom line: If you are looking for a bare bones, bar food experience with great food, friendly service and a sports bar vibe, head on down to the Bar 10 doors. My wife and I feasted like royalty for under $40 (including drinks). It's a great place to chill out and watch a game. I can't wait to go back.

50.description: Headed to the Bar 10 Doors after a great meal and conviviality at Three Aces. Enter a bare box bar that looks like it's torn down and thrown back up every night. Picture your most bare college bar with a few crooked beer banners and that's a start.Service was pretty good, but the place is really loud (cement floors, no wood accents, and 90 degree angles will do that), but the jukebox is good. Well, it's the kind you can play anything from the Internet, and my friend was jamming that thing from her iPhone all night. youtu.be/_plB6u-P3tkBeviamo, Three Aces, a million places I'd rather be than here. I hated places like Bar 10 Doors in my 20's and apparently still do.

4.description: Good spot on a random Sunday Funday. A lot of people host events here over the weekends and I finally went to a Sunday party. Both sides were opened as well as the patio. The DJ - Craig and others did a good job keeping folks on the dance floor and the best part was definitely the $5 Absolut drink specials. The bartenders I went to were heavy handed and made my drinks well. I asked for a splash of tonic and that's what I got. No complaints.

6.description: Friendly bartenders and semi inexpensive drinks.But what it comes down to is if you like loud rap music and smokers (everyone around us reeked of smoke) then this is your place.

22.description: Hmmmm went here on a saturday night, the DJ was okay, and the food and drinks were okay. Im not sure what to say about the crowd here. There were a lot of different characters out that night(sigh). Im not sure this is where I would ever spend another 3 hours of my life.

15.description: I love this bar! Always a good time. Good place to go watch the games, or to listen to some good music with friends. Every night is different there, and they have a very diverse clientele which is nice compared to the rest of the bars in the area! I would definitely recommend the fish tacos or the mushroom melt! Two of my favorites! Also loving the newly added pool table and arcade games! I will definitely continue to visit here (:

57.description: This place is AWESOME! $3 PBR tallboys and $3 Jameson shots EVERY FRIGGIN DAY! Country night on Tuesday, live music or dj on Thursday, and house music Friday.

20.description: Favorite place in chicago on Sunday Fundays next to Duffy's!!! DJ Mark Flava + Sports + Food + Drinks + seating + a dance floor after the sun sets = PURE awesomeness!!! The wings rock, especially the ones with French dressing (don't knock it until you try it ;-) and the bat tenders are cool and the people lingering around are generally cool to converse with!

36.description: I'be been to Bar 10 a handful of times for DJ Mark Fullers Sunday Funday and have really enjoyed myself. The summertime slammer was slamming (ice tea with alcohol), the music was on point (ole school & new school R&B), the crowd if folks were young, professional, friendly, good-looking crowd. My experience in May 5th was terrible!!!!! Everything was on point except for the service. Only 2 waiters were working for a crowd of about 100 ppl, the waiter had an attitude, which was understandable since she had hardly any help! They charge 18% gratuity on Sunday's no matter how large your party!!!! When the menu says for a party of 6 or more (blank stare). They need to get it together! My friend told the manager that its false advertising and he basically laughed in her face. can we say RUDE!I would go back but just for the music. I'll have to drink beforehand

14.description: Just an ok jointA very good friend of mine had his bday celebration here recently. Decent beer selection as I just stuck with Blue Moon & Lagunitas for the night. They have a fireplace, TVs and seating as well. They have a jukebox that play some pretty good jams from the last few decades. They take debit/credit cards, but their machine seemed to be down the night I was there. Nothing special or anything like that, but a cool spot for the area.

3.description: The food is good, but when school is in session you have to wait 15 minutes of your 30 minute lunch to get it. They also need to have both cashiers open and running by the time lunch comes around or customers have to wait in one long line. This is the only really close place to eat if you work at UIC or JBVA. Maybe place more cashiers and service people so the wait isn't as long. Otherwise, food is similar to other Freshii locations.

1.description: I've eaten here before and liked it but today I tried their smoothies for the first time.  When I first arrived the guy working the smoothie counter was very friendly.  I ordered a California Cooler.  As I was standing there he added all the ingredients to the blender and then I watched him place a rotten banana in there.  I pointed it out and asked for a different one.  He took it out, went to the back, and then came back with a new banana that he quickly put in the blender so I couldn't see it.  Then he needed a lid and there were no clean one so he grabbed a dirty one out of the sink, quickly rinsed it and used that to blend my smoothie!  So gross because the smoothie stuff goes up against lid during the blending process.  To top it all off once the smoothie was done he comes back with gloves covered in avocado or something green and proceeds to grab my cup, poor my smoothie, and try to put the lid on it with filthy gloves!  When I asked for a clean cup and a clean lid and for him to switch his gloves he did but was clearly annoyed.For $6.05 for a 20oz smoothie I am shocked!  Back to my Naked Smoothies from the bookstore.  Terrible Freshii!

2.description: There is a certain procedure to order your food here. There is a stack of clipboards and pencils provided.  If you are ordering a food item listed on their menu, you simply write down the listed food item on the blank box on the form.  If there are additional prices or items you want, the prices are listed beside each item you check off so you can have a custom order.  I had the Spicy Lemongrass Soup.  The food here is exactly how you expect healthy food to taste, at least the soup I chose...tasteless.  Your taste buds won't be pleasantly surprised here.  There was no spice or flavor at all in the soup I ordered.  It tasted just like water with veggies shredded into it.  I imagine it is exactly how hospital food tastes for heart patients on a restricted low sodium, low sugar diet.  So this is a perfect place for people with health problems.  I guess it is good that this place exists for people that need healthy eating options.  In that case, those people can give this place a 5 star rating.They have a refrigerated section with pre-made salads and desserts.  I saw some chocolate pudding that seemed appetizing, but after the soup experience I am paranoid about trying anything else at this place.

0.description: I like Freshii a lot. It offers a lot of relatively healthy options. It's so darn expensive though! They offer some terrible energy drinks and this Stumphouse Coffee (see photo). I've never had this coffee before, but it's really good. The cost however is $5.54 after tax for a 10.5 ounce bottle! Kind of a rip off. For what they offer at the UIC SCW cafeteria, this is the healthiest option, but definitely not the least expensive.

29.description: I'm a casual Hookah smoker so take that into context with this review.  Diehard hookah smokers may feel differently.Sinbad is a decent spot in Little Italy.  Place is small filled with mostly wooden tables and chairs, which is negative for me.  I prefer to be a little bit more comfortable.  We were fortunate to get there early and get some couches in the back area (their VIP I guess).  Its a little pricey particularly if you are in large group.  Its basically $17 a person which for 2-3 ppl is okay.  But the splitting 1 hookah with 4 ppl at $68 dollars is a little ridiculous.  Best part about the venue is its BYOB.  But besides that its nothing spectacular.  Best way I can describe it is by saying its not bad.  Its just not good either.   And as it gets later in the night, especially on weekends, you will probably have to wait a while as it gets packed.

42.description: I came here on a week night around 9 pm. There were people there, but it was not overly crowded. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We were allowed to pick where we wanted to sit, so we chose a cozy couch in the backroom where we could watch TV while we smoked hookah. The girl who helped up out was fantastic, she was very informative when asked her a plethora of questions regarding the different flavors. I was overwhelmed by all of the choices, so I ended up having her pick one which was a minty fruit flavor (I forget the name). The owner even stopped by to make sure we liked the flavor and that we were enjoying everything. Sinbad has beverages like water, soda, Gatorade, and juice. It is BYOB, so next time I will probably bring some booze to enjoy while smoking hookah.

23.description: I came here around 3pm on a Friday while visiting from Indianapolis, and I am writing this review before I even leave. You folks are nuts for rating this joint so low. I had a most enjoyable time.I got 2 Diet Cokes and a hookah for about $20 after tip. I pay more at the hookah bars in Indianapolis, and the atmosphere in those hookah bars may be a little more swank, but the couches here are WICKED comfy, and the Megan's Blend hookah is delish.My only complaints are that there isn't even a snack menu, and the the service was rather slow. But the gentleman who served me is nice, friendly, and very knowledgeable about the city. I plan on coming back!

47.description: well, so we got there 30 minutes after "opening" yet they still werent "open" - i.e. looking to serve any customers... they were very nice about apologizing for this, and said they had just had a party there the night before... The place was FREEEEEEEEZING cold... they seemed to think of us as a "bother", instead of attending to us as customers...I might go back - cuz the staff was so friendly, but only as a last resort... and because it is in my neighborhood.

8.description: Great ambiance, very mellow, good seating, debit cards would be a plus, but cash keeps it simple.

31.description: extremely affordable for a really fun night! it's BYOB, which is A+ and you can bring your own food. what's not to love? the location is okay. near the blue line and the CTA bus route. TOTALLY worth coming here for a night out with friends - takes reservations and very attentive. also, there is a Latin boy that works here that's quite attractive. good flavors minus code 69 (samah has better code 69) overall, a really good experience and a great place to spend your Friday night!

34.description: I love sinbad!  been going there since 2009! Sam, Megan, Ahmed are always welcoming and down to earth. It has changed over the years however. 1, the price, from $10 to $17.50 per person has caught the eyes of many. 2, the crowd... it went from being very chill to very rowdy... im assuming that is one of the reasons for the price increase... to weed out those who need not be there and because the popularity has increased insanely. I dont like the wait now and the 2 hour time limits.... before, we could walk in with our bottles *when they didnt charge $3.50 for corkage* and chill out for hours! Over all, if you are a true sinbad lover, these things wont phase you, however, if you are new to this playing field * as most of you are*... you wont rate this experience appropriately.

16.description: The only people defending this place are the ones who are friends with the people that work there.  I was just in town for the weekend for work so me and two guys decided to check it out because it had okay reviews.  We tried calling ahead around 11pm and they said they wouldn't have a reservation till 1am but we just showed up hoping someone could get us a spot anyway.  We show up and the girl at the door, Ruby, told us "oh you're lucky because someone just canceled their reservation at a table for 2 so we can add an extra chair there for you 3 to sit."  Okay, great, what luck!  Well we sit down and the place is filled with a pretty gross crowd.  Our table was kind of sticky and no one came to serve us for at least 15-20 mins, probably because all the "employees" were too busy dancing and smoking hookah with their friends at other tables.  Finally, I flag down the hookah guy that says that the max is 2 people to a hookah (wtf?) and $18 per person for 2 hours of smoking.  I'm from NY, a place with some fantastic, upscale hookah bars that don't even charge like that. I've never heard of only 2 people to a hookah, it's usually 3-4 people.  The $18 didn't bother me because that's reasonable for 2 hours if you aren't paying for the hookah, itself.  So we had to get 2 hookahs for the 3 of us and they brought us the check immediately after which I thought was weird until you continue reading what happened next.One hookah burned out within 8 minutes.  Took a little while to get someone over to change it out (incorrect coal placement). Not even 10 minutes after someone replaced it, we are being asked to leave because a reservation came in for our table.  We had only been there about 45 minutes. If we took the spot of another reservation, and each reservation is for 2 hours, how could you have another reservation coming in already?  I tried to tell the staff and they said "we don't know about that but we know the table is here so you have to leave." We said "but we haven't been here even a full hour so we aren't paying for 3 people x 2 hours."  At this point, Ruby came back with a nasty attitude and basically started yelling at us, speaking down to us (probably not realizing that she was speaking to 2 physicians and a business owner who could more than afford to rent out the entire building, let alone pay the bill and leave a tip).  Obviously, they were lying so I said "there has to be some sort of miscommunication here because we were paying $18 per person for 2 full hours based on the fact that there wasn't a reservation for this time slot for this table".  Considering how rude they were being, I should be anointed sainthood for being so nice and calling their screw up a miscommunication. To which, Ruby replied, "listen i'll eat the cost of one person, myself, if you guys get out." what in the hell?! At this point, we had about 3 staff members basically circling us in the corner.  We said "well we still aren't paying full price for 2 people because that would still be more than what we actually got."  If it's $18/2 hrs/person but we were there an hour each, shouldn't we only be paying $27 rather than $36?  Well aside from being rude, these people are also apparently dumb as rocks and can't figure out middle school math.

13.description: Came in from out of town with my girlfriend and her friend and we were looking for a good hookah spot. The place looks nice and the hookahs aren't bad. But we had gotten a hookah for "double Apple" that tasted like black licorice. Would def suggest never ordering that flavor unless you like black licorice. Now to why this place should get 0 stars. We showed up with no reservation and the guy at the door said we were lucky a reservation just cancelled and we could sit and that its 2 hours and we thought ok that's not bad. Now after waiting 15 min to be seen then another 15 min to receive the hookah and another 20 min to get a different hookah after complaining about flavor we were told that they we had to leave because they had a reservation waiting. We were so aggravated and even after telling the girl she said this is why I say no reservations so service. But that didn't help me considering we had 2 full hookahs and they were taken away because of crappy service and en entire place where the left hand doesn't know what the right hand is doing. And the funny thing was that they gave the people waiting a different table and as we waited outside for our Uber for 25 min not a single person was seated at our table. Then they tried to make us still pay the entire amount. I thought they were smoking crack in their hookahs. There was no way I was paying 18$ for 3 people to have 15-20 of hookah. Sinbads hookah should be avoided. Also I'm not the only one on here that seems to have had this problem, just wish I would have read reviews before I wasted the cab fare and money to go to such an awful establishment. I have one star but take it as negative 5 stars. They are a bunch of crooks and scam you to get you in the door and ask if right away if you could pay just to get it out of the way meanwhile they do this so after you have only been there for an hour or less thy can kick u out and not give you your money back.

11.description: I was compelled to write a review because the place is great value and fun place for the money. Most of the reviews are complaining about price $18 per person and mixer fees $3.50 a drink even if tip is included. How do you expect them to stay in business? I feel for a byob place ( you would spend hundreds at a bar for booze) and if you spend a couple of hours it's an amazing value, and the ambiance is good chill and enjoyable.  Music was decent. And yes coal service is decent but could be quicker but still reasonable I think people don't know how to smoke Hooka so they complain they need more coals which you don't. I will be a regular. Good selection of smoke and gave good suggestions for flavors.

39.description: Sinbad Hookah is hands down the best hookah bar in Chicago.  I come here all the time, cool people, awesome atmosphere, and great price!  They have a huge selection of flavors to choose from as well as beverages.  Great place to come with to watch the games, HUGE screen tv and BYOB.  I highly recommend Sinbad Hookah!

37.description: The best hookah in town!

0.description: Over priced 25 per person  no parking  idk if I will be coming  back to this place.   Hubble hookah is 18 per hookah not person and you don't have to pay per n person just to get into the place.

38.description: It's a "sin" how "bad" this hookah place was?OK, that's a really lame attempt to be witty, but that's appropriate because this is a really lame attempt to be a hookah bar.If this is the "best Hookah bar in Chicago" then I need to move back home asap.  This place takes advantage of the fact that their clientele are drunk college kids who don't know harsh shisha when they see (smoke) it and think charging crazy prices PER PERSON is acceptable.OK so you're not big into hookah and just wanted a place to relax or lounge, this still isn't the place.  Even when the place isn't teaming with loud, sweating undergrads, the chair/table set up makes it look like a complete dive bar... and not in the good way like Little Joe's up the street.

51.description: The hookah was good but they pulled a price switch on us at the last second. We were told that the hookahs would be 12 for one and 14 for another and then she tried to charge us $10 a person. (There were six of us.) That's a 30 dollar price increase! We ended up complaining but they still insisted on charging us more than they had originally told us it cost. Not something I expect from an establishment in the United States.

27.description: I love Sinbad.....the staff is freaking awesome and the owner Sam is attentive to all of his patrons.  Coming here feels like you're sitting on the couch at your house house relaxing and smoking.  I recommend this place to EVERYONE.  Trust me, if you come once you'll be hooked.

32.description: DO NOT go here. I repeat, DO NOT. They charge per person, it closes early and the tobacco flavors aren't even good. There are so many other places that are better. This one is the only place in the south. I recommend going up to the north.

48.description: $83 for 6 people to smoke a hookah?The shisha was harsh and they said we have to get the premium tobacco if we want it to taste better. They said "we'll give you a free one since this one is too harsh."We were handed the ridiculous bill (compared to customary hookah prices), we noticed they charged us per person, not per hookah. One person did not even smoke any and they charged a "sitting fee". We whittled the tab downwith the owner  to $70 and left.

44.description: I hate to write negative reviews but this place needs to improve in several areas. I brought some out of state friends to this place hoping it would help reduce the overall cost of their trip to the city. It wasn't worth it.. the music was loud overbearing pop-rap music.. not typical middle eastern hookah bar music. Staff seemed friendly enough.. prices weren't ridiculous but slightly confusing. I expect a hookah bar to be a distinctly middle eastern atmosphere that's open and welcoming to everyone. My friend who was visiting from Saudi Arabia and I have been to far more comfortable and more atmospheric hookah bars during our college days in Iowa. Find another place to entertain your friends.

24.description: Bad attitude

7.description: Unfortunately, this place is all hype and little game. Just because some NBA players come here automatically doesn't make it a great place to go.A couple of friends and I went to spend some time there but left much sooner than we wanted- the flavors we smoked died out within 20 minutes and the rest of the time felt like poison in gaseous form.Customer service was decent and they were playing some good music, but the hookahs absolutely killed the whole session; not to mention that we paid over $70 for 2 hookahs..I feel like this is a trend with city hookah bars (all hype), but you're better off going to Al-Hambra or many suburban hookah lounges to smoke your money's worth and get other entertainment. If you're not at Sinbad's to smoke, then it isn't half bad. If you smoke there, you may very well regret it.

49.description: Very disappointed with this place!!!My friend and I wanted to go somewhere after work to unwind and catch up, so we thought, why not Sinbad Hookah?  We saw online that Sinbad opens up at 6pm, and my friend called to confirm at around 3pm, someone picked up and said "Yes, we open at 6pm today." We got off work at 5 and killed some time by grabbing dinner, got to Sinbad at 6:45pm and what do we see? "CLOSED" We tried the door, locked. We knocked on the door, thinking maybe they were still preparing or forgot to unlock the doors? Nope, no one there.We left very disappointed, and ended up just going home and crying ourselves to sleep (not really, but we're still bothered by this).Overall, I feel that they are very unreliable and think that in this day and age, a business should stick by the schedule they post (online, on the door and even via phone).  I thought this was America!

40.description: If you like to hang with the college kids, then this is your place. Well, what would you expect from a joint that is near the UIC campus? The price is pretty cheap ($10) and its BYOB, which is always a plus. The servers were good and helpful. Some eye candy too. Its a must to have your group sit outside! The inside gets way too crowded and there is too much smoke, unless that's your thing. Plus if the sofas are taken up, you'll get stuck on a cheap wooden table that will crowd up against the bar. If you have to go to the bathroom, ha expect to wait. There is only one bathroom. BTW, the place looks like an apartment rehabbed for the business. I felt like i was at the 21st century verse of animal house. So again, seating outside is a must. Had a good time, though. Just know what to expect, its a college hangout.

53.description: College atmosphere. Tight space, lack of decor, typical crowd. I've been here a few times--usually for private functions or just to kick it. Very chill even on the weekends, but I guess if that's what you're into, then by all means. Everytime I've been here, I never leave without a creepy dude on my case. If you're looking for a low key night with a few friends, this place is for you, otherwise look elsewhere.

30.description: I've visited SInbad's three times, each time the service was much less than exceptional. The cost winds down to about $20 a person, and you have to pay $8 to change your flavor. On top of that, the employees at this lounge are not very friendly and very far from attentive. I will not be returning.

46.description: There once was a time when Sinbad Hookahwas a relatively quiet place where you could go Hookah with friends for reasonable prices.  Then Sinbad's came under new management and a place that was okay became even better.  They installed new flat-screen TVs, they had board games, you could play Wii in the back with friends, the hookah was still reasonably priced, the proprietor (well one of them - a very skinny man with a receding hairline) would greet you, and to top it all off you could enjoy a BYOB drink with no corkage fee!  It was incredible and whenever I was in Chicago I brought friends and family and to Sinbad's.Then about a year ago things started to change and a visit to Sinbad's got increasingly less enjoyable - so much so that I will no longer return.  It first started when last winter I visited Sinbad's and instead of it being a chill place to Hookah (have a drink, play board games, wii, etc.) it had been turned into some make shift dance club for teenagers (and this place is so small it really has no place being any type of dance club).  There were cheesy Jersey Shore rejects that had hired a DJ and were pouring young girls (most likely underage) Grey Goose.  This was the first sign that things were going bad and the good times at Sinbad's were over.  Even after I had witnessed the cheesy party I still returned to Sinbad's, I figured that it was a one time party - less a reflection of the direction the business was headed and more so a reflection of whoever had rented the space.   Was I wrong.  When I returned my friends and I found that the prices had sky rocketed.  My friends didn't want to pay the ridiculous prices so we left.  Not having learned our lesson this past winter we returned once again, hoping that this time it might have gotten better - it had only gotten worse!  Not only was the place a complete mess but the staff was extremely rude.  The hostess was condescending and didn't come and ask us what flavor we wanted until we had waited about 10 - 15 minutes (although we were the only folks there and it was very clear that we were ready to order).  Although the door said the business closed at midnight (we arrived around 10:45 pm) when she finally took our order she informed us they'd be closing in a half hour.  The prices had not only remained high, but whereas before $10 gave you a large hookahs this time all they provided us with was two extremely small hookahs.  No longer could one play Wii, or boards games.  It was no longer a pleasant atmosphere but a run down interior.  Now when I hear of Sinbad's its through poorly made promotional fliers with scantily clad women and the announcement that there will be an 18 year old DJ that plays ghetto house music - I won't be returning.If you're an adult that expects reasonable service and a pleasant environment for your money don't go.  If you're underage and want to pretend you're in a club on the Jersey Shore then by all means Sinbad's is for you!

1.description: It's not a bad place. It's pretty small place and on the weekends they only do reservations. It's about $17 a person no matter if you hookah or not. It's BYOB but they might make you buy cups. I'm not sure.

9.description: I used to live next door to this place when I went to uic. It went though different managers possibly owners as well. The place is small but it does have a good look inside. This place become a CASH ONLY spot so make sure bring cash. Having owned a hookah for years Im not the biggest fan of paying to smoke, but if the environments right its worth it.  This spot charged us $18 per person!!! Once again not per hookah, per person with 1 hookah per 2 people. Its BYOB which can be a plus.Seems like most of the crowd comes for the BYOB and night out, not purely to smoke but thats alright.The hookahs do smoke well, but the only reason to come here is because there aren't many hookah spots around.

26.description: Not as bad as I was expecting....I read the horrible reviews before coming here and it definitely made me apprehensive to go. But a friend was in town so we went. The best thing about the place is it is BYOB and there are no corkage fees. The drinks for mixers are a bit pricey ($3.50 for a 12 oz. bottle of sprite) so if you can bring your own mixers. The music was surprisingly good. Hip hop was playing in the front area and the sound level was good. Hip hop was also playing in the back area with the couches where we were at. Unfortunately those speakers in the back sucked. The speaker on my cell phone is louder. A worker did come and try and fix them and turn the volume up but it was still very low.Service could use some improvement. We waited for a good 15-20 minutes for our waitress to come back and take our Hookah flavor order.It was a bit pricey. I spent about $50+ for 2 people to smoke 1 hookah and have 2 sprites....

25.description: I have been here several times - great BYOB spot to relax and hangout with your friends.  No corkage fee and tons of great flavors.  The crowd can be a little rough at times and now they make you pay upfront before they will bring a hookah to your table.  They take reservations and we always have a great time when we go

12.description: I'm a casual Hookah smoker so take that into context with this review.  Diehard hookah smokers may feel differently.Sinbad is a decent spot in Little Italy.  Place is small filled with mostly wooden tables and chairs, which is negative for me.  I prefer to be a little bit more comfortable.  We were fortunate to get there early and get some couches in the back area (their VIP I guess).  Its a little pricey particularly if you are in large group.  Its basically $17 a person which for 2-3 ppl is okay.  But the splitting 1 hookah with 4 ppl at $68 dollars is a little ridiculous.  Best part about the venue is its BYOB.  But besides that its nothing spectacular.  Best way I can describe it is by saying its not bad.  Its just not good either.   And as it gets later in the night, especially on weekends, you will probably have to wait a while as it gets packed.

21.description: Well, coming from the west coast..this hookah lounge was a huge disappointment. I arrived with my friend and found seating in a back room. Shortly after I was greeted by our server who stated they only take payments upfront before the hookah is made which I found extremely tacky and cheap. Then we asked the different kinds of shisha offered, and he proceeded to tell us all they had in stock was starbuzz...what is this, 2009? The hookah tasted poor and we noticed they use instant coals, gross. Despite the disappointing experience, I went to tip and as I grabbed the tab to calculate, I noticed they added a tip with the payment, (again, how tacky). This places charges more than the huge hookah lounges on Hollywood boulevard. Won't return.

17.description: This is my go-to hookah place. Always a fun and friendly crowd. Consistently good hookah and nice people serving you. I've been going there for about 5 years.

10.description: Awesome... Awesome... Awesome and Terrance was great! Hospitality at its finest, Terrence made great recommendations and made sure that we were well taken care of. We will be back... Thank you Terrence!

5.description: I went here with a group of friends and had a really nice time! We were the first ones in so it was pretty empty, but we got free waterbottles (usually $2 each) and we only had to pay $17 each (Usually $20 I think?). The employee was very helpful with us choosing flavors, and he regularly came by to check on our charcoal. Fun music and good ambiance! Would go to again!

3.description: 3-4 years ago, this place was awesome. I went here last night for a friends birthday and the staff WAS COMPLETELY RUDE!! As a paying customer at your establishment, coming to the back room, turning on the lights and telling us "grab your coats and things because you guys have to go" was SUPER UNPROFESSIONAL. There were plenty of empty tables in the front and there was still extra room in the back VIP room. It was super uncomfortable not to mention embarrassing being told to leave in the manner that we were told. Delivery is everything and they epically failed. They won't be getting my business ever again.

35.description: A little bit more expensive than the other but it worth it, the place is nice and elegant  the atmosphere is very living and the hookas are good.

19.description: Amazing place. Must try.. the staff really go above and beyond to ensure customers are happy. I can't say enough great things about this place. It will be my first stop when I'm back in Chicago :-)

28.description: Was expensive (min of $17/person).  Everyone has to pay (even if they don't want to smoke).  Quality wasn't that great.  Smoke was harsh, i.e. the ash burned quickly & got kind of gross.  We got mango something & Queen something.  Queen one was nasty.  Atmosphere was real weird.  Lot's -o- big bouncer suits & coiled ear pieces = Secret Service meet Thug.  Does the place throw down that you need that much muscle?  Weird.Clientele: If you're 18, you can get in.  Over 25ish = middle eastern-ish.  Under = everyone else.  Nothing wrong it.  Just say'in.    You can byob, so that's a plus.  Open late.

45.description: I've been going to Sinbad for about 2-3 years nowThe atmosphere is very relaxing very "chill" I specially  like the back room which has leather couches and a tv and somewhat dark.They do have a reasonable amount of flavors in my opinion. The prices seem reasonable to me, the bathroom is clean and they sell coffee , tea and juices they don't sell liquor but they are B.Y.O.B.Parking may be somewhat of a hassle , ummm they neighborhood is really nice with a burger place and pizza place almost right in front of the lounge and they don't have a problem with you bringing the food inside the lounge.They tried turning the lounge into a "mini club" having a d.j on Fridays which I did not like  too many people dancing and walking around and they got in the way of my smoking :/but the last few times I went it seems they stopped that.They also have some hookahs on sale if you want to keep smoking at home.Sindbad is still of my favorite hookah lounges , great place for a date (if she / he likes smoking) great place to smoke and have a conversation since its not a very loud place.2 thumbs up!

33.description: Sinbad was ALL BAD!!!I really would have found so much pleasure in giving this venue NO STARS(which is not an option). I was there with a party well over 20+ at $20 per person. And to add we had to share one hookah to every 4ppl, so $80 per hookah. We were placed in the back "vip" room of the venue. The co-owner basically walked right into our section and took over with no introduction, explanation, "are you guys having a good time?"....NOTHING! We were basically thrown out to the streets. I refuse to financially support a venue that has bad management and customer service. To top it off, after inquiring, the security informed us that the co-owners had gang ties and things would have been bad if they didn't move us out of HIS area quickly. if you care about your life, pick a different venue. Do not support the gangs of Chicago, this beautiful city needs to cut them off!!!

43.description: This place is Horrible!!!! The service sucks!!! They sit around and talk with their friends, and make u wait, we didnt even get a hookah till we had been there for about 35 minutes!!! We came there because we saw a post for 25% off, and we get there and the boss says they stopped doing that a week ago, when I showed it that it clearly said they started the discount 3 days ago lol.  Why try to lie? Or promote fake discounts to screw people over.  Then he tells us to make sure we tip our server on top of the gratuity they added?  For what!!!!!! making us wait while u smoke hookah, and chat with your friends.  This place is horribly managed, whoever owns it needs to definently rethink about who they hire.

2.description: Came to this place there was no one there to greet you or even let you know what's going on. Walked in seen a bunch of people smoking hookah but it looked like they had only 1 employee running everything. I asked him where can we sit he said sit anywhere so we sat down and waited 20 minutes he never came by the table or said anything we ended up leaving if they don't want my money that's fine I'll take my business else where so whoever runs this place needs to hire more people or work on customer service skills before they go out of business

18.description: Not as bad as I was expecting....I read the horrible reviews before coming here and it definitely made me apprehensive to go. But a friend was in town so we went. The best thing about the place is it is BYOB and there are no corkage fees. The drinks for mixers are a bit pricey ($3.50 for a 12 oz. bottle of sprite) so if you can bring your own mixers. The music was surprisingly good. Hip hop was playing in the front area and the sound level was good. Hip hop was also playing in the back area with the couches where we were at. Unfortunately those speakers in the back sucked. The speaker on my cell phone is louder. A worker did come and try and fix them and turn the volume up but it was still very low.Service could use some improvement. We waited for a good 15-20 minutes for our waitress to come back and take our Hookah flavor order.It was a bit pricey. I spent about $50+ for 2 people to smoke 1 hookah and have 2 sprites....

41.description: I've been to many hookah places in my life, in the suburbs and elsewhere. I have also owned several hookah's myself, and I can't find a fault with how Sinbad's prepares its shisha. The packing is immaculate, the hookah seems to last for ever because the tobacco is burning evenly. Their coal placement is great, it's supposed to be on an edge of the bowl, so that you don't quickly burn all of the tobacco. The water levels are perfect to provide a smooth draw of nice smoke without the harshness.It's BYOB and you can bring in outside food. We brought in a party of 8 and got some of the best service I have ever had. We brought in three 6-packs of beer and had a great time for about 3.5 hours. What more can you ask for?If you're looking to go to a club or act like you're from the Jersey Shore, this is not the place for you. The bad reviews on Yelp need to be read with a grain of salt. If people complain about the service or the fees, that's their own fault for not being respectful nor doing their homework.As of today, they charge $10 per person, regardless of if you smoke. Which is understandable, they need to make money, they don't sell food, and sell only an assortment of bottled soft drinks, they can't have people just lounging around and not paying.  There is a $3.50 "corkage/cleanup" fee per person for alcohol drinkers. They will provide glasses and ice, so that's understandable. They provide 1 hookah per 2 people. For a party of 8, we had 4 different flavored hookahs. They use Starbuzz shisha, which is pretty great and flavorful.If you know what you want, or just come in with a great attitude, this is the perfect place to lounge, drink, and relax with friends.

52.description: Cool hookah bar. Free wifi is also available. One hookah serves two individuals and is $10 per person. You get two different flavors to try. Fun event with friends. Also BYOB!!!

50.description: Very nice hookah bar. We went on July 4 right after they opened for the night, so the place was dead, but it was actually nice because we had the back room, which has large, overstuffed leather sofas and lit candles, to ourselves. Our waitress was very nice and even made sure we wanted the more expensive tobacco flavor so we weren't surprised when the check came. Prices are very fair. We had one hookah for two people, a couple of waters and we brought some beer from Gentile's Wine Shop nearby and the total was a little over $30. They don't have a place to tip on the credit card receipt, so remember to have a little cash on hand.

4.description: Terribly disappointed with my experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I was attempting to venture out and try a new place. 22 January 2016 at 8:30PM, a friend and I visited Sinbad's Hookah. We sat, paid cash for our hookah like everyone and after 15-25mins attempting to smoke we BOTH acknowledged there must be something wrong with the physical hookah. The hookah was EXTREMELY strong and there was burning sensation in both our throats. After calling over the 1st employee -a male- to assist, he made a few adjustments and it was much better. Less than 2 mins later, the issue returned once again. We called over a second person. We informed this young lady of the issue. I asked her if we could replace the physical hookah or the favor uncertain what was the issue at that point. She asked how long we had been there which was not long and we informed her that we had an issue since the very beginning. She said there will be a charge. For what are you charging, if your hookah is problematic? POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Your goal should be to please the customer 1st and less about the expense. Another young lady then came over and recognized the "HEAD WAS BURNT". She made a few adjustments and it was perfect. Smooth and Easy... less than 3 mins later we were again back and square one yet again. I called them over and to just take the hookah away and I was no longer interested in these failed attempts and since Sinbad's Hookah was not customer friendly nor attempting to reconcile the real issue by replacing the defective hookah. We decided to be done with the experience at that location. I would not endorse Sinbad's Hookah bar. I will in the future return to the others I enjoy in Lake View where I never have any issues. Sinbad Hookah = HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!  (please pardon any typos or brevity)

6.description: Wish I could rate it 0 stars... Dropped by this place to catch the game, celebrate friends bday, and pregame.Been a regular here about 2 years ago... Current people suck. Homie saying he needed to "clear the table for reservation"... On an empty night, don't bs me manStef was cool(sorry if I misspelled the name man) but other than him, poor coal service... Poor customer service... And mandatory tip for included (prepaid) for shitty service. Woulda tipped nicely if the service was worth it.

22.description: This place is decent. It has a nice selection of music. The back room is the best but it's better to reserve ahead of time cuz you may be stuck in the front (which isn't too bad) but I prefer the back. It kinda sucks that they charge like 15 a person. 33 dollars (including tip) is expensive as hell for ONE hookah. Also, they don't have a wide variety of tobacco so it's better to stick to Ambrosia Hookah.

15.description: A good place to meet up with friends after work and hang out for a couple of hours. Though their prices are a bit higher than most, there's a good atmosphere about it and BYOB makes it the right kind of place to get friends together to catch up, discuss the day's events, or talk about whatever. They often have decent music playing (fortunately it's not blaring loud, so you can actually hear people) and/or whatever big sporting events showing on the numerous flat screens. The service is ok, so long as you can get the staff's attention. I'd be more inclined to give it an extra star if the service was more in line with the price. All in all, I'm a fan.

20.description: Absolutely amazing time! Chill atmosphere and great service. Hookah is great and I'm a regular smoker so I know what's good.

36.description: Love this place....I stumbled upon it after my last favorite south side Hookah place closed down a few years ago. There aren't too many hookah lounges that aren't far north so I decided to give it a try.They offer a variety of different shisha flavors (Starbuzz flavors) and will mix flavors if you ask. It cost about 13 even a person for hookah and corkage (love that BYOB). There are a few places in the area that you can grab food from too. Just a few weeks ago, I threw my birthday party here and rented out a private space in the back. Sam (manager) did a great job of accommodating my guest and everyone had a great time with the flowing hookahs. It's not extravagant but if you're looking for a place to come mellow out, smoke some good shisha and listen to good tunes...then this is the place to come. They have also made several new additions in updating the decor...Overall... Great customer service, decent pricing and did I mention BYOB? LOL

14.description: Love it!!! Great service!!! Great hookah!!!! Good people!!!! I love this place when I want to unwind from a long day!

58.description: I've been here several times for various concerts and my experience has always been great. A spacious arena, this place can seat a load of people and the view from almost everywhere is decent. Really well-kept place with a good and convenient parking facility too!

56.description: Very impressively huge - came here for a graduation and thought that it was pretty cool how they had a large screen so you could see people.  I went to college where my graduation was on the beach of the Pacific Ocean.  Also think that it's neat how there are different concerts performed here, as well.

29.description: Arcade Fire/The National show was awesome. Really diverse, really mellow but excited crowd. Not a frown in the place, not even on my typically smug face. Imaginey that!Vendor lines were incredibly long for anything alcoholic (not a surprise) and very short for everything else. Prices are in line with what you'd expect at a venue of this sort.My only irritation here is the Monterrey security folks. If you're going to put on security theater, at least try to do it convincingly. I look forward to the free feel-up by the door staff, and was completely underwhelmed. The guard mumbled something to me like "up", presumably asking me to raise my arms. I didn't care -- I wanted a good grab or two, so I just nodded my head enthusiastically and inched my way closer. One little pat on the side of my jacket and another mumble of "ugroo" ("okay"? "you're welcome"? "I enjoyed that, too"?) and I was through the door. I could've smuggled the always-dreaded SLR camera *and* a small child in, and Mr. McFeely would never have noticed.Next time, spandex.

42.description: Went here for an event and had a good experience. The venue has great seating and there really isn't a bad seat in the house. Even the upper balcony was good to sit in. The beer was a bit over priced, but what venue isn't. $6.50 for a tall boy of bud or bud light. They did serve wine, and food as well. The staff was friendly, and it was easy to get in. There was a smoking section at gate five and was easy to use with a stamp of your hand. The pavilion is right off the Racine blue line stop which made it easy to get to and from. The venue only had two ATM machines and one of them was broken. None of the vendors take credit and so next time I'll make sure I bring enough cash!

23.description: So I went to see his holiness the Dali Lama on July 17, 2011.As you can see, I waited a few weeks because I wanted to explain how disappointed I am with my experience at the show.I saw his holiness years ago at the once great Medinah Temple and read a few of his books.So I understood that this was not going to be a rock concert, it was suppose to be an introspective spiritual day that I spent with my cousin. It started off bad with a really long and stagnant line of people just waiting to get into the stadium that unusually blistery hot afternoon.Then we entered chaos, crazy long lines everywhere. When we finally found our seats in the nosebleed section we had to climb up these odd cement block stairs just to barely squeeze into these pathetically claustrophobic roof top seats about give or take five rows from the wall.  DAMN!I COULD NOT HEAR NOR UNDERSTAND much of what his holiness the Dali Lama was saying due to the POOR ACOUSTICS/SOUND and POOR VIDEO quality provided by UIC. They need to CHECK their SOUND and VIDEO OUT!!! Maybe a few times for different angles; so they can add a few speakers and screens with subtitles for those of us in the GREAT VOID for forty bucks a ticket!I cannot even pretend that I had a good time there nor did I learn much while lost in translation of that experience. This is a moment that I had to just chalk up to just being there present for the occasion.Alas, the next morning I even had to check the morning news review on the internet just to make sure that I heard the same thing that he said so that I would not misquote him. I just wish that I was warned that the seats we purchased sucked and to bring binoculars or sat someplace else. Otherwise they should just stick to concerts and the roller derby if they cannot accommodate epic lectures.

47.description: Coming for the Windy City Rollers, I probably did the opposite of many. I didn't buy anything except a ticket to the bout. Yep. That's it. However, there are some really nice things that you can say about this place. Parking that is convient right across the street, its well lit so you don't feel like your car will get a smash and grab. Unless you have a big sign with flashing lights that point to your car and say "Take My GPS System Please!!!"Plenty of space, plenty of bathrooms, convience stands and beer vendors, (well that last one is great if you drink beer). Pretty much every seat is a good view for the bout. Staff was friendly and smiling as well as helpful... but c'mon.. can't I take a phone call outside and come back in? No!? Dang it....

8.description: I finally had the chance to check out this venue! I had heard of it, but never been before. Me and a good friend went to see the Macklemore & Ryan Lewis show 11-4-13. I was a little curious as to whether or not this place was serving alcohol. I hate going to dry venues. This one is located at the University of Illinois Chicago campus, and the last college show I attended was dry!!!! I was so happy my big ass could have done a back flip when I realized they were serving beer!!        The seating reminded me of the Allstate arena just a little smaller inside. The seats weren't too bad actually. I  didn't feel cramped sitting next to other people. The beer was expensive!! $9 for a can that they pour into a cup! But it's Chicago so expect to pay an arm and a leg, plus 7 years indentured service.             I think the UIC pavillion really needs to invest some money into getting a better sound system because at times I couldn't understand certain parts of the songs. When the music stopped and the musicians talked it was clear. The music kind of drowned out the artist at points. All in all I had a great time. I would go back! Until next time....

31.description: If I could give this place a negative five stars I would. The staff here is terrible. Went to a Nine Inch Nail concert here a few years back and had a security guard dig her nasty finger nails into me because I got a drink of water at the water fountain. then a male security guard man handled me because I was asking her to let go of me, loudly but it hurt! Now could it have changed since  then? Sure but I will never know because if it was the end of the world and this place was the the only place that was safe I'd rather parish outside.

34.description: Went to my first Windy City Rollers bouts yesterday. It was a good time... something different to do. I'd have to agree with a lot of the other reviews about the prices of food and drink. But you have to expect to pay $5-6-7 for food and drink at any place like this. That's what you get for not eating beforehand LOL (like what happened to me). I was surprised to see lots of kids at the roller derby, but it was cool. They had little game during intermission for both kids and adults (such as musical chairs, etc). About the pavilion itself, it's alright. The seats were really close up to the action. It was clean and comfortable enough... but nothing extraordinarily modern looking. I'm not sure how this is as a concert venue, but it was kind of hard to understand some of the commentary. If you're coming here, I'd recommend taking the Blue Line to Racine or one of the buses. I didn't drive, but it seemed like traffic was a bit of a hassle and parking was expensive.

16.description: I have been here many times to see the Windy City Rollers, and a few issues have come up.One thing is when I won tickets through The Onion, I was told to pick up at will-call.  I had to do the run-around to 3 different gates before I could get in.  No one seemed to know what was going on, and I don't think it was The Onion's screw-up.  UIC needs to train these people.More of an issue is the horrible horrible sound.  I can never understand anything the announcers say.  The volume is also VERY LOUD.  I have started bringing earplugs, but either way it is hard to have a conversation with the person next to you.  This is not because of the fans, and it's not a rock concert, it's just the sound settings.  Other than that, it's the usual overpriced food and so forth.  Seats are comfy enough though.  And you can get real close to the action, but even far away it's a good view.

13.description: Loved watching Macklemore & Ryan Lewis here! :) there is parking on streets and easy to get into the stadium.

11.description: Saw Sigur Ros here. The sound system was good, but the management is awful. When we got there people were in our seats, so we asked an usher about it and they said, "Yeah, usually people just sit in wherever there is a seat," and left us to fend for ourselves. This upset my girlfriend and I and ruined the first 15 minutes of the show or so. What is this, a baseball stadium? There's venders walking up and down the center isles during the show with flashing headlamps and beer held high in their hands. I SPENT 55 DOLLARS TO SEE ONE OF MY FAVORITE BANDS ON EARTH, what are you doing?The light let in by the curtains every time someone goes up to the hallway is also annoying. Not a good place to see a very important band or performance to you. General Admission would be your best bet for this kind of show. And get up close where no UIC Pavilion employee can ruin it for you.

39.description: My review is soley on the pavilion because to be honest, the shows I have seen here have been quite impressive and uh-mazing!However, the venue frustrated me a bit.  I showed up to the pavilion last friday for the Testament/Megadeth/Slayer concert.  I had a meet and greet with Megadeth so I got there pretty early (the time I was quoted) and went to the box office.  Low and behold, the people in the box office did not have a clue on what was going on.  I got the run around for a good hour before getting in contact with someone backstage to figure things out.The doors were obviously not open to the public yet, so they had the group stand out in the sun and sweat it out until they got our passes in order.  Finally we were let in!  After meeting the band and hanging out for a bit, we were able to grab a drink/food/seat before the doors opened.My brother and I went to grab a brew and some foodies and all of the workers behind the counter seemed lost in outterspace.  It took about 10 minutes to get a drink and we just decided against the food considering the price and the wait.  Also- they don't have the credit machine connected to their computers, they have an individual credit card machine at the end of the counter which takes a long time to process.  I suggest bringing cash!!Security was nonexistent, which didn't really bother me, we were able to pretty much sit wherever we want and do anything.. so hey, whatevs.The show was badass, the sound was decent, but the venue was kind of small and seats uncomfortable.  Good thing we didn't sit long!! Overall- not a bad experience, it was ok.. but just ok.

37.description: This place rocks! It's small for a bigger venue so there are no bad seats.  There is parking and it's next to the blue line.  The staff is also great as well!  I've seen many an event here and it never disappoints.  This may be one of Chicago's most underrated and overlooked venues.

0.description: Did the Northeastern Illinois University graduation here.  Basically it was nice.  Seats leave a lot to be desired.  No cup holders or space for your knees.  Staff was a bit gruff, but they have their jobs too.

38.description: Not my favorite venue.  The good parts are that it's fairly easy to get to, right off 290, the blue line, and the bus.  There is a parking garage right next door if you don't mind paying $15, and there is usually a decent lot scene (if you're into that kind of thing).  I usually go for hippie shows, so it's always fun to take a stroll around.  The sound is good, and seats in both levels are good, not so much the floor.The bad parts are that the fluorescent lighting in the halls makes everyone look yellow and they don't like to close the curtains during showtime, so light floods into the arena.  The food and beverages are way overpriced and the vendors seemed overwhelmed and confused.  Not impressed with the crowds, floor seats suck because I'm too short, and regular seats are kind of smallish.  The security guards and ushers are useless.Most recently, I attended the two Furthur shows last weekend.  Tried to buy a water, they rang me up, and then helped some ranting guy who kept asking where his water was.  Then they looked at me and asked if I wanted something else, to which I replied that I was in fact still waiting for the water I had just purchased.Sitting towards the back of the first level for the Friday night show, I asked the beer guy if he could back up into the hallway so that we could close the curtain and so that we weren't surrounded by the noise of people lined up to buy beer.  He replied that he wasn't allowed, he had to be in the arena to vend.  Really?Second night, a 16 year old boy passed out in front of us.  We alerted the usher five feet away and he told us it wasn't his problem.  Wow.They were letting smokers out on a terrace or something, which cut down on the nast in the venue, except for that guy waving a bushel of sage around (is that necessary?).  The bathrooms could use an update, but are adequate.

51.description: This is my university's sports arena, so I can't be too down on it.  It's a fun place to go for sports and other stuff of that variety.  Graduations are held here, which is convenient and allows for everyone to come and sit comfortably (there's like 89999 people at the LAS graduation).  Really nice television system so that you can see everything that is going on.  I've seen one concert here and, even though it's not the small environment that I enjoy for concerts, it was still a good show and I had fun.  We also saw Barack Obama here in early 2007 and it was a really great time.  Most of the seats were blocked off so that everyone was just on one side of the pavilion.  We were really close to the stage and it was really great.  Since the pavilion isn't that big, you're never that far away from the action in the center of the floor.

27.description: I ventured out to see Arcade Fire when they did their recent three night stint here. Its been a while since I came here so I had to refamiliarize myself with the place.The food selection is standard for these types of venues and the prices, although high, are also typical. Acoustics were good - the band blew me away even in this relatively large venue. Even the more low key songs from The Suburbs shined live. We were in the balcony. I disagree with some of the reviewers that the seats are comfortable - they're typical molded plastic. The aisles to our seats were narrow and steep - so beware if you have a lot of ($7.50) beers. My only real complaint is the lighting in the balcony. Some of the lights stay on during the show - I felt like I was under a spotlight. Although we got there fashionably late, we were able to park in the adjoining parking garage for $15.00. Bad news its FIFO (first in, first out for you non-accountants) so at the end of the show we had a half hour wait even though the garage isn't that big. I thought the parking attendants could have used both lanes on the Harrison St. exit to let cars out to speed things up a little.Essentially this is a mid-sized venue seating about 9000, somewhere between the Aragon and the United Center.

32.description: To put it frankly, this place SUCKS.Went here for the first time for the Mike Epp's comedy show. Show started at 8pm, there were no staff directing or managing parking. So it took us 1 hour to get a parking spot at the farthest lot. Not to mention 30 minutes to get out of the lot since there is only 1 exit/enterance. The seats are tiny. I am a size 0 and it was hard for me to get comfortable in my seat. The venue itself is dated and old. It was such a hassel to see the show because of the lack of signage and direction that shouldve been provided by the venue. To add to the bad experience was the horrible sound system they had. The comedians could barely be heard from the upper level because of the interferance and buzzing. Definitely wont be going to any events at the UIC Pavillion.

54.description: Good sound.  No alcohal served, no smoking.  Tough security too.  Not the best place to see a show, but not the worst either.

48.description: I recently attended The Killers concert here. Overall, the experience was pretty good. $13 parking...the cops dealing with traffic and pedestrians were funny and flirty...always a bonus! The lovely ID checkers were also funny and flirty. $7.50 for a Miller lite...seriously ridiculous, but it's a concert venue so it's to be expected. UIC Paviliion is clean, easy to navigate, and has fun staff. Get to a concert early and order 2 beers at a time, it will seriously save you an hour in  both the drink and bathroom line.

44.description: I was surprised not by how much I liked UIC Pavilion, but by how much I didn't hate it! Floor was amazing!I saw the Sunday show for WILCO (amazing) and was pleasnatly surprised at the number of concessions offered (yummy french fries and wilco? yes, please).The beer was expensive, but what concert-beer isn't?  Yes, indeed, I would see another show here.  I know you were asking, so I thought I would answer right away.Yep.  Just get it out there.  Ok....

24.description: My favorite thing about the Pavilion is its proximity to the West Loop.  I came here for the National / Arcade Fire show in April.  The show was awesome, but the main thing I remember was watching people almost wipe out on the stairs.  I don't know what was wrong with the stairs near our seats, but we saw at least a dozen people almost topple over - no one did, however, which was quite remarkable.  I was here over the weekend to see the Dalai Lama.  I agree with the other reviewers that the audio left a lot to be desired...  Also, I wasn't really sure what the purpose of the "security" at the door was - they made a huge deal ahead of time about how security would be really tight, there were huge queues outside of the arena, then I set off the metal detectors because none of the guards was interested in taking my keys, cell phone or change, and no on batted an eye - go figure.  Why bother with the security charade?

7.description: Obviously this facility depends on the venue you opted to do see, but there are a few things that are under their control and consistently bad; vending area are slow and understaffed; bathrooms are scarce and dirty; security is nil.Opted for a different venue, if at all possible. However there are a couple of annual events that I am obligated to attend at this facility. Too bad because I would go elsewhere if I could.

49.description: The Pavilion thankfully enjoyed a recent renovation and upgrade as the 1982 building was fast approaching "dump" status.  I attended the DePaul-UIC basketball game Saturday night, Nov. 22.  At 6:40 or so, 20 minutes before scheduled game start (not tipoff, but close enough), I only waited about five minutes to wait in line, pay $5, and park in the garage right next to the Pavilion.  The box office was slightly more annoying as there was no express line separate from the People Who Want to Take Plenty of Time queue.  All men's basketball tickets are $20; maybe court level is avail. for some games, but the ticket availability sign didn't mention them.  Even with a healthy crowd, the team hardly sold any balcony seats, and all main level seats are close.  At halftime, I moved down to the second row, and no one said anything.  A mostly enthusiastic crowd.  I did not patronize concessions.  I stayed to the end of the game, and leaving the Pavilion garage took just a few minutes.

40.description: I went to the Megadeth/Slayer/Testament concert at this venue two days ago. In a nutshell, I fully enjoyed seeing the bands perform here, but at the same time got disgruntled about the venue itself. The biggest flaw was the acoustic quality. Two out of the above-mentioned bands sounded muddy and indistinguishable, particularly low-frequency sound. Shouldn't be the sound engineers' fault. Instead, I figure it might be the architecture, building material and PA system that messed the whole thing up. They didn't serve decent food or drink, either. Very limited kinds of beer to choose from during a metal concert - FAIL.

53.description: Best concert I have ever been to was here: Jack's Mannequin and Panic! At the Disco. We were on the floor, which is where you wanted to be. My biggest problem with it (and it was more than likely just the venue) was the crowd was out of control...and not in a good way. Obnoxious UIC students that were drunk off their ass and did respect anyone around them. I think I got elbow punched and stepped on several times, and I wasn't anywhere near the front! But, those are two of my favorite bands, so I put up with the bad behavior and stayed on the floor.

30.description: Have been coming here for concerts for years. Heck, I even graduated in the Pavillion. Tonight, however at the Arcade Fire concert I was incredibly disappointed. Every bar here only took cash and all ATM machines were broken. In order to get money I had to walk across the street in the middle of the concert and wait for 20 minutes. I found this completely ridiculous. There needs to be some sort of new system implemented.

46.description: OK, I've had enough of the roller derby. But I got a little hungry and I had a slice of Connies pizza. For the price of a whole pizza. I could buy 6 pies at the hut. And that's including tax. WTF! But I did have a pulled pork sandwich from Robinson's Ribs that was a huge pile of meat. It was five bucks and they served it on a hot dog bun? The place is clean as a bell. Not like the Tweeter.

1.description: Honestly - I was quite skeptical of this place before attending a concert here but in the end I realized it was a rather great venue. I saw Sam Smith and had GA tickets. They didn't overly sell out the floor so we were able to move a bit and not feel like we were stepping all over people, which is nice at a concert venue. As for acoustics: either Sam has a perfect voice of the acoustics here were really good. Honestly it could be both. It was a bit smaller than other music venues I've been to but it worked perfectly for Sam Smith.

55.description: The sound IS actually not that bad for a place like this. Not my #1 venue choice, but at least it's not like the United Center or something.

9.description: This is now my 2nd time to catch a show at the UIC pavilion and had a pretty great experience each time. I was able to get pretty decent seats for each show, so I can't complain about that. The sound was also pretty great for an arena. I've been to some arena shows that sounded plain awful, but these were both pretty great.I usually tend to avoid arena concerts, but I would definitely return here to see more.

26.description: I headed back to UIC Pavillion for the first night of the Arcade Fire 3-night run and although some jerks decided to occupy our seats and there were no security guards to enforce seating, a kind woman in the lower bowl offered us her two extra seats that her friends for some reason or another decided not to use. The venue is a medium-large, roughly 8-10k person, dome shaped sports arrangement type room. The sound is decent to reasonable, with moments and positions that can be great if mic'd well. Of course, my opinion is based upon two great bands that cater well to large auditoriums (Arcade Fire and a three night run years ago by Phish). My guess is that the bands with the ability to bring enough power (and their own equipment) to UIC Pav. will sound well, but smaller acts may suffer from being stifled by the lack of acoustics. You really dont get to choose your venue if you like the band and they are coming to your town. When the venue is down the street, Im OK with that alone. Ill be back.

25.description: Nice venue.  I've only come here to watch professional boxing, but I can see this to be a good spot to watch a concert as well.  Comfortable seating, and spacious restrooms.  What more could you want in an arena?

12.description: Home of the Windy City Rollers. Good venue, with good visibility. Didn't feel crowded or claustrophobic. Plenty of clean bathrooms and well organized concession stands.I thought the graphics on the LED strip that ran around the venue itself were really well designed. And there's something cool about seeing "LEAD JAMMER" scroll around.However . . . $6.50 for a Bud Light? Pass. I'll save my wallet and my liver and eschew the beers, no big deal. And $5 for a hot dog? I'll pass those up too and blame a high price for not eating something I oughta cut down on anyway, and am.The problem I had with this venue was the Will Call area. And I'd likely not have this problem in summer. But, it is winter out, and it's a bit chilly.
