Will Call is over to the side of the main entrance, and you have to wait outside to claim your internet-purchased-at-a-discount tickets. Brr. It'd be good if they could move this operation indoors in cold weather. There is nearby, secure parking, but you can find something for free if you cruise around a bit, which we did.

59.description: I spent many hours at the UIC Pavilion watching my underdog college hockey team play its home games here. My college commencement took place here. This intimate arena hosts concerts, basketball games, and expositions. I was dragged here on a cold winter night to see Cyndi Lauper and Eddie Money, but I came willingly for a concert featuring the Pretenders and Iggy Pop.

21.description: Two rock 'n roll thumbs up from this music maven! Have seen several shows at UIC Pavilion - the most recent being the Miss Willie Brown and Dierks Bentley show (don't judge, y'all) - and have always enjoyed the experience this venue delivers. Beyond being spacious, clean and easy to get to, the sound is phenomenal, the parking is super convenient and there's nary a bad seat in the house. Absolutely love the feeling of accessibility to the artists despite this being a relatively large arena-type setting. I've sat up high for Coldplay and right down in it for Nine Inch Nails and felt cozy and close both times. Someone also once told me they didn't sell beer here due to its collegiate connection, but I can vouch for the fact that there most definitely is brew in the house. The vendors are plentiful and they actually smile while they gouge you on Bud products and Mike's Hard Lemonade. Hey, a smile is worth its weight in Bud Light Lime, don't let anybody tell ya different. Great place to catch a show... Go, Groupies, Go!

17.description: I went to this venue to see Macklemore and Ryan Lewis with Talib Kweli on November 4th.  I went with my boyfriend and we sat in the first row of seats outside of the general admission area.Parking here wasn't bad.  There's a parking structure right next to the venue.  The cost is average compared to other venues.The bathrooms are pretty gross.  They were staffed with one cleaning person per bathroom for the duration of concert, but the cleaning person was just standing around with a broom the entire time.The view of the stage was good and the sound was decent.  The seats were a little small considering the age of the venue.  Typically seats of that size are only found in much older venues.Being anywhere near the general admission was a poor choice.  People were throwing up on the floor in the general admission area.  Security would watch people do this and not even say anything about it.  I had asked if someone could be contacted to clean up the vomit the first time it happened because it was only a few feet away from us.  The security guard said no one will clean anything until after the show, but that the vomit should be gone soon enough just from people stepping in it.  (Sadly he was right.  One of the people who stepped in it though was a security who had watched her do it, so that made me feel somewhat better.)  He also said it could be worse because closer to the stage in general admission people frequently urinate on the floor.The group of people next to us at the show were over served before Macklemore even took the stage.  One girl was spilling part of every beer she had.  This included spilling beer on me multiple times.  At one point she fell down multiple times trying to go down the stairs to her seat.  She spilled her entire beer during this time and nothing was done about her behavior or drinking at the show.

10.description: This venue is so small and the sound quality is not good.  We went here for a Guster concert and although they are an amazing band, the sound at the venue sucked.    They also had everyone line up in one line to get into the venue.  It was ridiculous and irritating.

5.description: I go here for the boxing matches.- messy bathrooms- overpriced food and drinks- okay parking- entertaining boxing matches.what can I say?

3.description: It's a stadium alright.    Well-designed for what it is.   But not a lot of magic.

35.description: Cool Staff, and Seating is quite nice. Only been here to watch the Windy City Rollers, so I don't know how it is for concerts.

19.description: Two rock 'n roll thumbs up from this music maven! Have seen several shows at UIC Pavilion - the most recent being the Miss Willie Brown and Dierks Bentley show (don't judge, y'all) - and have always enjoyed the experience this venue delivers. Beyond being spacious, clean and easy to get to, the sound is phenomenal, the parking is super convenient and there's nary a bad seat in the house. Absolutely love the feeling of accessibility to the artists despite this being a relatively large arena-type setting. I've sat up high for Coldplay and right down in it for Nine Inch Nails and felt cozy and close both times. Someone also once told me they didn't sell beer here due to its collegiate connection, but I can vouch for the fact that there most definitely is brew in the house. The vendors are plentiful and they actually smile while they gouge you on Bud products and Mike's Hard Lemonade. Hey, a smile is worth its weight in Bud Light Lime, don't let anybody tell ya different. Great place to catch a show... Go, Groupies, Go!

28.description: This place would be getting two stars if the Arcade Fire show didn't turn out completely awesome. I think this is more to do with Arcade Fire being made of fantastic than anything about the Pavilion, but still. Three stars.First, the security will frisk you. Just get used to the idea now if you've only been to The Metro, Bottom Lounge, and other places that are not on vigilant lookout for contraband. I was wearing an outfit that you could have painted on, but I still warranted a frisk. Okay, I can understand if they feel they can't make exceptions to the rules because then the rules mean nothing. If, however, you are going to make me take out my phone and demonstrate that it is indeed a phone and not an incendiary device, I expect you to have noticed the guy who smuggled in a hitter box that is larger than my phone, plus a lighter, plus a hip flask. Seriously. You're going to hassle me about my phone and then make me sit in a cloud of pot smoke with Stinky McStoner?Next, lines for drinks or the ATMs (if they are working) get very long. Alcohol and some other lines are cash-only and kind of pricey, so bring a wad. The beverage vendors that walk around while the bands play wear distracting blinking lights, are hard to get ahold of, and don't all have the same drinks. Choose them instead of braving the lines at your own risk.Then, there were sound issues with The National, who played first. Sometimes, I couldn't hear the horns. Other times, the horns drowned out the guitar. When one of the Butler Brothers came to sing a song with the band, they forgot to turn on his microphone. This was the second of three shows, so I thought this would have been ironed out already. Alas.On the bright side, there was a separate sound check for Arcade Fire, the sound issues were fixed before the first song began, and everything was great during their set. In fact, I would go so far as to say that it sounded excellent (as it should have; this tickets weren't cheap). I have zero complaints about this portion of the evening, found it entirely wonderful, and generally enjoyed myself.Other notes:The bathrooms were surprisingly clean, though the line for the sinks was a little unruly. Getting into the parking lot was easy, but getting out was hard because for some cracked-out reason, they only had one of the two lot exits open. Maybe we should have taken the blue line? The seats in the balcony are plastic, not cushioned like the balcony seats at the Riviera.

45.description: I've had the opportunity to come here a couple of times, once for the Windy City Rollers (awesome) and most recently, to check out the Chicago Sky.The seats are pretty good (you can see the action pretty up-close and personal) and there is ample parking in a lot across the street (but ouch, $13 is highway robbery, seriously).Tips to you: Carpool or take public transportation, smuggle your own snacks in (I refuse to pay $5 for a candy bar, no matter how much whining my little sis does directly into my ear) or eat beforehand, and bring your cheering voice. A good time, for sure, but I just want to know why all sporting events (even ones that seem to sparsely attended) need to charge $5 for a stupid hot dog.  Ugh.  It's offensive.  So I protest by not eating their overpriced food.  You should too.

33.description: I'm sure UIC Pavilion is a great venue for all sorts of events, but it sucks the very soul out of roller derby.I remember seeing the Windy City Rollers at the tiny Cicero gym. Tickets didn't have a service fee. Beer was cheap. The place felt packed.The Pavilion is too big, too expensive and too sterile for the gorgeously rough nature of roller derby. And be sure to take the train or bus to events, because the $13 parking is a bastard.

43.description: Went to see the Roller Derby here last month and was quite surprised at how up close and personal the general admission seating was.  I was worried that we wouldn't be able to see the action, but, on the contrary, it was great!  However, I will say that the beer and food is WAY OVERPRICED!  If you go, I suggest bringing your own smuggled liquor or drinks and snacks.  Beer was $6.75 a cup, I think, and I accidently kicked my first one over.  Boo!  Otherwise, a great venue for watching an event.  And, as an aside, Roller Derby ROCKS... Go see it!

2.description: My first experience at the UIC Pavillion was for Friday Night Fight this past weekend. We won the tickets at a TV taping this week, so that may or may not affect my rating since it was free.Our seats were in the 114 section and we were really close to the action. The only downside was that the ESPN camera man was standing in the corner of the ring, so there were several times we weren't able to see the fight and ended up watching it on the screen on the wall. The venue itself was really clean and looked well maintained. It reminded me of a much smaller United Center. The staff were hurried and weren't overly friendly, which was kinda funny to me too since they were only at about 30-40% capacity of the venue. Snacks and drinks were about what I expected to pay at a sporting event. Mixed drinks were $10, a coffee was $5, pizza was $5 or 6. I ended up only getting a stuffed cheese pretzel for $5 and it was fine.Other tips:-Parking for boxing events is $15. You can check their website for specific parking price as it varies by type of event.-Doors opened exactly one hour pre-event-Their sign says "no outside snacks or drinks" however, they didn't check bags. Bring them at your own risk (but you may be forced to go back to the car or throw them out.)-Women's bathroom was really clean-If you get here too early and need to kill time, there's a bench across the street where you can sit down and eat or there's a Target 0.2 miles away.I would come back to another event here because it really is smaller than some other stadiums and also because parking was simple.

18.description: I'm a bit baffled to see no improvements to the seats... maybe they expect to only host rock bands, boxing competitions, basketball games, and anything other than 3+ hours of a commencement?? They expect participants of commencements to sit in plastic seats that are low enough to give people sores on their rear... For the amount that are racked in through parking (special occasions, $10 per car... high school graduation) there are no improvements to the seats. I would pass for other events hosted here. UIC can definitely do better than this!

41.description: I have been here many times to see the Windy City Rollers, and a few issues have come up.One thing is when I won tickets through The Onion, I was told to pick up at will-call.  I had to do the run-around to 3 different gates before I could get in.  No one seemed to know what was going on, and I don't think it was The Onion's screw-up.  UIC needs to train these people.More of an issue is the horrible horrible sound.  I can never understand anything the announcers say.  The volume is also VERY LOUD.  I have started bringing earplugs, but either way it is hard to have a conversation with the person next to you.  This is not because of the fans, and it's not a rock concert, it's just the sound settings.  Other than that, it's the usual overpriced food and so forth.  Seats are comfy enough though.  And you can get real close to the action, but even far away it's a good view.

52.description: "Stadium" atmosphere, no intimacy. Rock shows are meant for small venues. If tickets sell out, then they sell out. Are 7,500 seats and a general admission floor area necessary for a rock show? Not cool! Tack on no booze, OK sound and glow sticks...you have yourself one hell of a mess.

50.description: Negs:$5 hot dog. $5 Diet Pepsi. Having Pepsi in the first place. $13 parking.Grouchy staff. Pros: Windy City Rollers now play here!Most seats are good seats. Easily accessible by public transportation. (Ashland bus, namely)It's a decent enough venue, and I'm very happy the WCR has a place to call home in the city, but it's just like any other money -grubbin', large seating establishment. Nickel and dime the HELL out of you for everything and anything possible. Eh, such is life I suppose....It's a manageable space, fairly easy to navigate. GO WCR!

4.description: Back when I was in high school and a little bit after, this was the place the high school Public League Championship (final 4) took place. It has since been moved to the United Center in the early 2000s. I have watched numerous basketball games in this establishment and all have been good. I was lucky enough to be offered a ticket last Friday for Friday Night Fights featuring Mike Tyson as a promoter. I actually got to see Mike very close as I was in the third row. I also got to meet former World Champ Oliver McCall & former Bears player Jerry Azumah....def made for a good time. Beer in this joint was higher than Wrigley prices which is crazy...a flask may have to come into play next time..lol. Staff here was really nice and personable.Decent venue for high school, college & miscellaneous sporting events

6.description: OK at best... Crowded halls, messy bathrooms and meh... seats.I went to see Rise Against with a buddy a while back and am finally reviewing this place, it was THAT unimpressive(The Venue, NOT Rise Against).Here's the skinny:Small halls get crowded.Bathrooms are a mess but, hey... porta potties. Seats were kinda small and really really cramped together.Non-smoking but, good to go in the nose bleeds.Here's the fat:The halls to and from the seating area are pretty narrow considering it's a Sport/Concert/Whatever Else venue. Add to that the beer stands, food stands, t-shirt vendors and miscellaneous other vendors which ALL come with those fancy little stanchions to form neat little lines... YA crowd city there. Good luck on NOT getting bumped and nudges and then spilling your beer on that chick that you're inadvertently grinding on because of the guy(with questionable intent?) behind you, grinding on you...  Get like 6 beers at the beginning, bring the to your seats and just drink 'em warm later... you'll have more beer to drink, rather than spillage and a ticked of chica.Bathrooms are a mess, especially at concerts. I cant really fault them too much for that but, still... when there's piles of crumpled up paper towels on the floor and a urinal that just won't stop flushing and overflowing, I think it's time to get a better sanitation contractor.There are porta potties outside though... let's not even get into THAT. We all know porta johns.The seats are REALLY packed in there, especially up top. Holy crap, where is one to put their elbows? Tuck 'em in? Alas... there are some seats with a decent amount of room... not "much" more room but, enough that you can get half an elbow out from your ribs.It's a non-smoking venue... that said, it's non-smoking if you get caught. There's an outdoor area to smoke but, if it's cold or the show is too good or hell if you just don't care, go to the nose bleed section. Plenty of smokers up there hanging out by the roof vents and such. All in all though the UIC isn't terrible, nor is it great. It's just a place where concerts happen and if another band I like happens to be there, so will I.SYOY

22.description: I have been to many events here: Chicago Storm, Juanes concert and most recently the Dalai Lama's visit. For the last time we sat directly opposite the stage (which is usually on the north side of the building). In the upper deck, you can't see much but the big TVs they set up were nice. But that's dependent on the concert.The amenities are what you'd expect from a college venue: limited alcohol and limited selling space. There was a LOT of confusion as to which queue was for water, lemonade or the food. There's also a bit of confusion as to directing people and traffic to the entrances. Many instances they left you on your own to figure stuff out. And when you did ask, you'd get a surly response.It's a good venue for indoor soccer. For sporting events, we felt sitting on level 2 about half way down the pitch was perfect. It's small enough you can see everything you need to see. Sitting in the eighth row once you couldn't see anything -- just zooming by of the players. Not as fun.

15.description: Not enough bathrooms, exits, or snack bars. It was also pretty cold thought the show. I get needing to keep it cool with large crowds, but that was ridiculous. Any staff I interacted with were friendly.

57.description: I have attended several concerts here. Each time I was here I liked it a little more. I don't know if it's improvements they made or it was just I enjoyed the concerts. Very good sound for a indoor stadium style seating. Plenty of parking which was also well organized.

20.description: Windy City Rollers!  It serves it's purpose.  I don't expect anything amazing, but I'm glad the Windy City Rollers are able to utilize this as a venue.  I won't pay 6 bucks for beer here, I won't buy anything from the concession stand, and I wasn't too excited about paying $13 for parking.

36.description: Home of the Windy City Rollers. Good venue, with good visibility. Didn't feel crowded or claustrophobic. Plenty of clean bathrooms and well organized concession stands.I thought the graphics on the LED strip that ran around the venue itself were really well designed. And there's something cool about seeing "LEAD JAMMER" scroll around.However . . . $6.50 for a Bud Light? Pass. I'll save my wallet and my liver and eschew the beers, no big deal. And $5 for a hot dog? I'll pass those up too and blame a high price for not eating something I oughta cut down on anyway, and am.The problem I had with this venue was the Will Call area. And I'd likely not have this problem in summer. But, it is winter out, and it's a bit chilly. Will Call is over to the side of the main entrance, and you have to wait outside to claim your internet-purchased-at-a-discount tickets. Brr. It'd be good if they could move this operation indoors in cold weather. There is nearby, secure parking, but you can find something for free if you cruise around a bit, which we did.

14.description: To put it frankly, this place SUCKS.Went here for the first time for the Mike Epp's comedy show. Show started at 8pm, there were no staff directing or managing parking. So it took us 1 hour to get a parking spot at the farthest lot. Not to mention 30 minutes to get out of the lot since there is only 1 exit/enterance. The seats are tiny. I am a size 0 and it was hard for me to get comfortable in my seat. The venue itself is dated and old. It was such a hassel to see the show because of the lack of signage and direction that shouldve been provided by the venue. To add to the bad experience was the horrible sound system they had. The comedians could barely be heard from the upper level because of the interferance and buzzing. Definitely wont be going to any events at the UIC Pavillion.

58.description: GREAT sandwiches at a GREAT price.

56.description: Being Italian, I'm very particular with Italian things. I got the vegetable (eggplant and artichoke) panini and it was GREAT! My boyfriend got the meatball, said it was one of the best meatballs he's ever had, and another friend got the Italian sub, also excellent! I purchased some fresh mozzarella (amazing, still warm), fresh ricotta (equally amazing) and some seafood salad (alright). They carry San Pelligrino Chinotto, which was also such a plus!! Great food and great staff!

29.description: This place is an old school Italian Deli. Subs made to eat. Also the selection of Olives are outstanding. The Italian sub was perfect. The made how I wanted it. I will be stoping here again. There is a place to sit down but you can carry out just as easily!

42.description: This was my first visit. It was good overall. You order at the counter, just like you do for deli. Pick up a number, wait a little, go pay and enjoy.It is super casual since it's more of a bottega. There are traditional items and Italian brands on the shelves. Next time I'll I'll go for a stroll to see what's really available. It looks promising though.Panino mozzarella e sun dried tomatoes was good. Coffee was good, but I got the lungo.Paid 8.88 for both, I think it should have been less to make it great, 6.50 or 7max.

23.description: I love going to deli and sandwich shops, and this deli was no let down! My boyfriend and I ordered the turkey pastrami panini and a chicken panini, both with pepper-jack cheese and mayo. Everything tasted as fresh as it gets, and it they were both absolutely delicious. The guys making the sandwiches here were friendly, as well. The store offers a nice selection of wines, imported goods, a small selection of groceries and Italian foods. The prices here are amazing for a downtown location with food this good. If I ever have the opportunity to visit this area again, this will be one of my first stops.

47.description: Went here today with some co-workers and really enjoyed it.  My turkey sandwich was really good, you could tell that they used quality lunch meat and the bread was made that day, it tasted very fresh.  I cant wait to go back and try some of their other sammys.

8.description: I'm definitely going back, had a pretty good sandwich EXCEPT FOR THE BREAD. I don't know if I just had an over-baked piece for my sandwich but I know my Turano (which I was under the impression they used) bread and this was not it, didn't look like it, didn't taste like it. I'm from Berwyn home of Turano and well, sigh, this just was too dark and dry which is why I only gave 3 stars. The sandwich size and other flavors and textures were so good. Loved the convenience of on-line ordering and going straight to the register (yes, you still have to wait your turn behind all those waiting to pay) I had the Italian sub and added roasted red peppers and again - except for the bread it was so good!I guess I have to go back this week and see if I can change my rating! Really looking forward to trying a Panini as well. There was seating inside and out, which on such a beautiful day I hated to bypass but I had to get back to work. Service was fast and friendly and there's a small park like area just feet away heading East where you can sit as well and enjoy your lunch.

31.description: Good salads and cookies

34.description: The Italian with the fresh moz is where it's at! This is a wonderful find for Italian groceries / meats/ cheeses .  The homemade Italian cookies were fresh and yummy! Go...

16.description: This place is just a few blocks from my house. I love the sandwiches and pre made food! Also a great place for your Italian meats and cheese! Try the lasagna it's amazing! Only reason I gave them a is one of the old men that works the counter can be mean.

13.description: Very solid cold or hot subs here. I had both the Italian (cold) and the Frank (hot), both of which were top notch. They also have a small grocery where you can pick up many Italian items.

11.description: One thing I love about my job is it takes me all over the city and I get the opportunity to shop-dine all over. I love the Tri-Taylor area, and can spend some serious money real easy here. Cute little local shops and eateries. Conte being one of them.This place is second to my all time favorite for sandwiches, I won't name the other in fairness to this review, the other I rate really high so saying this is second is a lot. In addition to sandwiches there is stuff to take home, you want a tray of meatballs, or a selection of homemade pastas and sauces, go for it. They have homemade lasagna sheets if you want to do something non-traditional, how about pumpkin or some other squash instead of cheese and meat, or spinach and mushroom stuff anything you want between those sheets, easy. The other fun option is ready made pizza crusts, thin crust to bring home and add your own toppings. Tonight we'll do basil and mushroom!Then there is salami, so so good, and cheeses, pair that with some wine from their not huge but well balanced wine selection. They also carry a few varieties of coffee in bean or ground form. Speaking of coffee, their lattes beat the pants off the Starbucks a couple of doors down, and they cost less. That is of course if you can keep yourself from spending the savings on the cookies displayed right there.It's amazing that such a little place can deliver so much happiness.

39.description: We used to live right around the corner from here and having moved to Bucktown, we miss it dearly. I stopped in today for some smoked mozzarella, premade pesto, proscuitto and risotto rice. The guys at the deli were friendly as always and the prices are incredible! I got .25 lbs of cheese and meat, 8 oz. of pesto, and the rice for $16!! It might not have the bells, whistles, or star power but this family owned Italian deli beats Eataly in value and service any day of the week!

37.description: Simply put... their sub sandwiches set the standard for excellence and freshness of ingredients.  Lots of Italian groceries, neatly shelved, make up the rest of the store.  There are tables looking out to the Taylor Street scene and, in summer, a small outdoor café.

0.description: This is our first time here as we live in Indiana but came up to the hospital. Very good sandwiches! They even made aa grilled cheese not on the menu for my daughter. 6 policemen and 3 SWAT members came in to eat while we were there-we figured that meant it was a good place to eat!

38.description: The best Italian Delicate downtown Chicago. Most of the products are imported from Italy and all of them are very good quality. The people who work there are very experienced and it is owed by an Italian family with a very good understanding of Italian food.Subs, hot panini, salads, coffee are ready in 2 minutes. People usually go for lunch just because you can also seat there and eat(You don't have to worry about tip)

51.description: You can walk past and mistake this joint for a small grocery store, and it kind of is. The lunch here is quick and awesome; the best Italian submarine sandwiches.

27.description: I've been a customer for 7 years.  Hands down, the best Italian deli in Chicago.  I make sure to eat my Sunday lunch there at least 3 times a month.  A fully packed sandwich on fresh bread and an espresso at Conte Di Savoia are the best way to start off your Sunday afternoon.     All of the homemade food is amazing - fresh or frozen. The olive bar with homemade salads will never let you down.  They always have a phenomenal selection of homemade pastas in the freezer: several types ravioli, several types of gnocchi, cavatelli, etc...  The homemade sauces are also outstanding.  Finally, their fresh sausage is the best in town, both hot and mild.The prices are unbeatable, the service is excellent, and all of the employees are friendly.  It's a must visit.

32.description: I'm conflicted about giving Conte di Savoia five stars. On the one hand, they put mustard on my sandwich (I dislike mustard with a passion). On the other hand, I didn't notice the mustard until I was 3/4 of the way done and feel it only enhanced my sandwich. Given my mustard identity crisis, I feel my only recourse is to go back and try another sandwich.Staff is super friendly. They share my joy of deli meats.

54.description: Love their Caprese sandwich. Nice place to go to lunch if in the area. Prices are reasonable and the service is great. Also a good place to buy fresh Mozzarella cheese, Salami or other deli items.

48.description: Great neighborhood Italian deli.  Get the Italian.  Perfect.

44.description: This place is incredible. I walked in one day while strolling around Little Italy, not long after I moved to Chicago, and it was an excellent decision.I'm almost full Italian, and their prosciutto panini is as good as it gets. For like, $7, you get a HUGE sandwich made with Turano bread (awesome), lightly brushed with oil, toasted to perfection... add some paper-thin slices of salty prosciutto, fresh mozzarella cheese and some shredded lettuce to crisp it up, and you've got yourself one heck of a lunch. Great deals - make sure to enjoy the sandwich with a bottle of Orangina -- you'll get the full "Italian" experience. The atmosphere is pretty much what you'd expect for an authentic deli/grocery store. There are a few crowded aisles crammed with imported Italian goodies like wine, pasta, sauces, even the pickled eggplant strips that my Italian mother loves so much. There's a deli counter where you can order sandwiches, meats and some salads, and there are some refrigerators and freezers with fresh pasta and other dishes. There's a small room, kind of in the back, with drinks and cheeses. Another great deal - I got a huge bag of fresh basil for $1.25 and another bag of polenta (perfect for the bottom of pizza!) for $1.50. They're by the register.One last note - I don't live anywhere close to Conte di Savoia. I have to take two trains to get here, and it is completely, one hundred percent worth it.

24.description: One thing I love about my job is it takes me all over the city and I get the opportunity to shop-dine all over. I love the Tri-Taylor area, and can spend some serious money real easy here. Cute little local shops and eateries. Conte being one of them.This place is second to my all time favorite for sandwiches, I won't name the other in fairness to this review, the other I rate really high so saying this is second is a lot. In addition to sandwiches there is stuff to take home, you want a tray of meatballs, or a selection of homemade pastas and sauces, go for it. They have homemade lasagna sheets if you want to do something non-traditional, how about pumpkin or some other squash instead of cheese and meat, or spinach and mushroom stuff anything you want between those sheets, easy. The other fun option is ready made pizza crusts, thin crust to bring home and add your own toppings. Tonight we'll do basil and mushroom!Then there is salami, so so good, and cheeses, pair that with some wine from their not huge but well balanced wine selection. They also carry a few varieties of coffee in bean or ground form. Speaking of coffee, their lattes beat the pants off the Starbucks a couple of doors down, and they cost less. That is of course if you can keep yourself from spending the savings on the cookies displayed right there.It's amazing that such a little place can deliver so much happiness.

7.description: I love this place and after many more times of consuming their delicious sandwiches and encounters with their friendly staff I must say I'm a very happy customer. I always get the Italian sub with peppers and yummmmm! I'm not one to eat meatball sandwiches because I've tried many places and I've been disappointed but the meatball subs here are so delicious with great flavor that even though you may not like meatball subs theirs is the exception. The subs are great and their prices are too! If you're in the area and in the mood for a quick bite this is the place.

49.description: Amazing Italian subs, and lots more. I'm hooked.

40.description: This place has delicious sandwiches, salads, and hard to find pastas and authentic Italian sauces to go. They also have really good Italian cookies that are highly addictive. The service has always been really friendly and helpful.

53.description: Absolutely love this place. I agree with everyone who says it's a hidden gem. I live close by, and I frequent it once a week. It's more of a neighborhood market, with fresh meats, cheeses and pastas. They also have anything Italian you could want, like frozen/dried pastas, oils, sauces, bread, fresh basil, etc. It's all reasonably priced as well. My favorite part of the store definitely has to be the fresh cheeses. I can get a half pound block of fresh creamy feta (way better than the crumbled chain store version) for $3. They also make sandwiches fresh to order! I've had the mozzarella/veggie one and the grilled eggplant, and both were fantastic. The sandwiches are also reasonably priced, and you can order whatever size you want. The staff is also great, and are extremely friendly.

30.description: Local place for all your Italian grocery needs.  First off the Italian sub felt a little overrated, I've had better.  Though the meats were top notch, dressing was a little light but the bread was too much.  Some will say it's authentic but I've had better at another Italian deli we frequent.  Excellent meats and cheeses for cutting.  Cutter knew his meat when steering us towards the saltier prosciutto.  Lots of sauces (had Tuscany Brandy sauce I was looking for), noodles (all sizes, types and brands) and other delicacies.  Haven't tried their homemade frozen ravioli yet.  They have wine as well but didn't check it out.  Breads were minimal, again I've seen better selection elsewhere (I went at 1pm so in all fairness maybe selection was affected though I think not).  Cookies were disappointing more like a cake dough rather than a cookie.Ambience was like something from a NY storefront deli without the attitude.  Will definitely keep it in mind when we want authentic Italian grocery items.

46.description: Good sandwiches, nice atmosphere, good selection of food and imported goods.  I wouldn't make a trip just to eat here, but I do stop in for a quick bite when in the neighborhood.

1.description: This is my favorite Deli spot on Taylor Street and in the surrounding area. If I'm thinking a sandwich for lunch - I'm headed here hands down. They have a lot of home made options in their deli and their giardiniera is to die for. They have a frequent buyers card for sandwiches which rules if you pick your meals up a lot. The staff is very friendly, I've never had any kind of issue or quarrel with that, which isn't quite the standard around the Little Italy areas or at least from my experience. I've even had a couple of the deli guys remember my order, which is awesome - can't beat that. I always enjoy going in and peeping around at the new items they have or discovering something new I've never tried. They have a pretty unique grocery choice and a lot of hard to find items as well. I love it. You should definitely pop in here for lunch on your next trip to Little Italy.

55.description: Great, fresh deli sandwiches. I've gone a few times for lunch and have tried a couple different sandwiches and have not been disappointed.  You receive a high quality at a very reasonable price. i would recomment it to anyone in the area to check it out. The staff was also very friendly and helpful.

9.description: This place is classic, Italian, juicy good! Great taste, best value. Been going here since early 90's :)

26.description: Delicious sandwiches and great prices!Maybe it's the Turano bread, but their sandwiches remind me a lot of the sandwiches from Manginos before they sadly closed a few years ago.

25.description: Great fresh sandwiches.  Fast, easy, and everyone is very nice.  Love their turkey sub.

12.description: Delicious!!!! We got the meatball sub and the Frank, and they were both phenomenal. Bonus-the guy making my sandwich had a braided rat tail which I think made it taste even bigger.  I did a little shopping in the market part and was very happy with the selection. I could do all my shopping here and never complain. A must if you're in Chicago.

59.description: It's been awhile since I have gone to this restaurant, we had a Groupon and the sandwich we got was very tasty!  I'm actually surprised I haven't gone back!The food and the service was really great!

21.description: Great groceries for your Italian meals! Amazing in house made items as well, ravioli, pizza and pizza dough, gnocchi...all kinds of wonderful deli meats and cheeses. Great subs also!! Do yourself a favor and get over there, please!

17.description: Great groceries for your Italian meals! Amazing in house made items as well, ravioli, pizza and pizza dough, gnocchi...all kinds of wonderful deli meats and cheeses. Great subs also!! Do yourself a favor and get over there, please!

10.description: I've been here a few times, usually when I'm really hungry and don't want to wait too long to eat.  This place is a cute, little grocery store with authentic, home made, italian food and groceries.  They have a sandwich shop inside where you can sit down and eat.  There sandwiches are decent.  I had The Rosie the other day in a large size, ( I was really hungry) and half way through my sandwich I remember thinking, this sandwich is too salty.  I do wish they offered sides, like they have there ready-made pastas.

5.description: Stopped in at Conte during Festa Italiana (Little Italy street festival) on a Sunday evening. Their booth outside was only selling meatball subs and I was really craving an Italian sub so I just walked into the store and ordered it from the counter. Great choice! There was no wait inside and I'm pretty sure the prices were cheaper in the store! They have a pretty extensive sandwich menu up on the wall and the prices are really cheap compared to many places in the city. They put a healthy amount of ham, pepperoni and salami on my sub and I added hot peppers for only 40 cents. Sandwich was great!Everyone working there was really nice and I got in and out in less than 5 minutes. I would love to come back to have another sandwich and check out the authentic Italian groceries stocking their shelves!

3.description: They definitely do decent deli sandwiches here. Fast service, fresh ingredients, fair prices, and size-wise you get quite a bit for your buck. Overall it's a well oiled machine of an Italian deli. If I had any criticism at all it'd be that the selection is a little plain. There's not much outside of the standard lettuce, onion, tomato, and mayo except for giardinera. Not necessarily a bad thing since all the stuff they do offer is awesome, but if you're looking for more of the works on your 8 inch sub you might be disappointed. Other that sandwiches it's got all sorts of snacks, drinks, and other random stuff that you'd find at other delis like this. Overall a winner with friendly staff to boot!

35.description: First time ordered an Italian.  Fresh made, good bread and I love the spicy notes from the sopressata.  Grabbed some frozen ravioli as well.  Looked like a nice selection of wines.  Cozy front seating area with grocery/deli in back.

19.description: Delicious sandwiches and great prices!Maybe it's the Turano bread, but their sandwiches remind me a lot of the sandwiches from Manginos before they sadly closed a few years ago.

28.description: Yum! Since leaving the East Coast a few years ago I hadn't had an Italian sandwich (they don't have them in Portland). We stopped by for a late lunch and shared the jumbo Italian.  It was great! Bought a nostalgic tear to my eye....

45.description: Ordered some subs.  Italian and a meatball.  They were pretty good, but nothing special.

33.description: Hard to find at first, but it took me right back to Rome. It is a small grocery and deli cafe, with pellegrino sodas and fresh baguettes. Their cannolis are awesome, and prosciutto is perfect (a little salty like it should be).  Next time I really want to try their mozzarella and maybe pick up some italian grocery items. Make a stop here, you will love it.

43.description: Italian subs are a perfect lunch with my italian boyfriend, and I'm really glad this is where we ended up.  After five years of being spoiled by sandwiches in New Jersey, I often find Chicago delis lacking.  But not at Conte.  The bread, the meat, the everything was just perfect.  Followed by a trip to Ferrara for cannoli, it was a perfect Thursday afternoon on the edges of Little Italy.

2.description: After reading the reviews, I decided to stop in and try a few sandwiches.  Dropped in early afternoon and was pleased to see a minimal line.  Ordered the Italian sub and the Italian beef, dipped, with hot giardiniera.  Within a few minutes, I was at the table with my sandwiches, deciding first on the Italian.It looked and smelled fantastic.  It had all of the elements in their proper proportion, but the meats didn't have any heat. It was a decent sandwich,  but not the combination of spicy flavors I expect from an Italian sub.  The ham wasn't cured like prosciutto, it was standard deli ham, which seemed to have a big impact on the finished product.  The Italian beef was juicy, but the texture was a little chewy.  Not in a bad way, just maybe a little sliced a little thicker.  Something didn't jive with this one either.  The flavors weren't blending together.  There was ample giardiniera, which did little for the overall taste of the sandwich (but it added a nice crunch).  The bread was chewier and seemed to absorb quite a bit of the juice - normally not a bad thing, but the flavor of the bread itself dominated all others.  Obviously, everyone has their favorite spot for Italian sandwiches and Conte Di Savoia has no shortage of loyal followers, so they must be doing something right.

18.description: I love going to deli and sandwich shops, and this deli was no let down! My boyfriend and I ordered the turkey pastrami panini and a chicken panini, both with pepper-jack cheese and mayo. Everything tasted as fresh as it gets, and it they were both absolutely delicious. The guys making the sandwiches here were friendly, as well. The store offers a nice selection of wines, imported goods, a small selection of groceries and Italian foods. The prices here are amazing for a downtown location with food this good. If I ever have the opportunity to visit this area again, this will be one of my first stops.

41.description: Great Italian bread on the deli sandwiches! I had my own sandwich of Turkey and Salami with Provolone and a splash of Oil & Vinegar. The meats and cheeses are all the best so the sandwich comes down to the bread. The crispy crust and chewy bread dazzle the taste buds and everything comes together on the palate for a perfectly harmonious delight. Great sandwich!!

52.description: Best Italian sub I've ever had. Lived in the neighborhood for 5 years and ate there at least once a week. I've lived in other parts of the city for the last 4 years, and I still drive there maybe once a month for it. I've tried other places, but they've got nothing on Conte. Unwavering quality for 9 years now! Go there NOW! And get the large Italian!

50.description: It's the real deal. Great grocery selection (bought some ricotta gnocchi in the fridge section that was unreal) and fantastic, cheap deli sandwiches. Everything tastes just right, all high quality, low price italian sandwiches, textbook.

4.description: The reason I won't move out of Little Italy is Conte!The groceries are one of a kind the the food is so fresh and generous that it keeps you coming back. I eat here 3 times a week and I buy my meat and cheese and wine from here too. This is by far my favorite place in the neighborhood. DO stop by.Sandwiches are made to order from the deli/sandwich station. Both hot and cold are delicious. I think they actually put a quarter pound of roast beef in a 12 inch sandwich. Very generous. Groceries are affordable and there is a unique selections of cheeses and wines imported from Italy.

6.description: got squid ink pasta fpr 5.99. cheaper than Eataly for sure!

22.description: Get the Prosciutto sub, oil (I do mayo too but that's to your arteries' discretion...) lettuce, tomato, with sweet peppers. THE best cold sandwich in Chicago.

15.description: Hands down one of the best Italian deli/markets I've ever been to. Get the turkey pastrami. The taste is remarkable. Got a few other items to take home which were also great. They have that refrigerator/ freezer area as well which is stocked well. Everything you would ever need for a great Italian meal. Love this place.

57.description: Had always passed by this place and was so glad I stopped in. They have a little deli and grocery store so you can get a sandwich and choose from a large selection of sides (both from the deli and stuff in the grocery store) and tons of beverages. The sandwiches are made fresh and they have some pretty good ingredients there.The best part is that the sandwiches are very reasonably priced making them a great deal and a good incentive to keep coming back.Would definitely recommend to a friend and will definitely return in the future.

20.description: I love this deli! I've been going to this deli since the 90's when I was a student at UIC now that my daughter is attending UIC- we bought a house in the neighborhood and eat here 2-3 times a week. I had to bring lunch for 44 hungry and picky coworkers and decided to pick up 3 party sub trays. The place doesn't open until 9am but the owner who is wonderful was flexible and had my sandwiches ready by 7:40am even though we had a terrible snow storm that morning. The sandwiches were great - everybody loved them! I got a tray and a 1/2 of the Italian subs (my favorite), a tray of turkey, and a 1/2 tray of fresh mozzarella and sun-dried tomato. The mozzarella and sun-dried tomato was a huge hit everybody loved it, next time I'll get a full tray!  He also provided plenty of oil, mayo and mustard containers. If you need 1 sandwich or 75 sandwiches make sure you stop at Conte - you won't be disappointed!

36.description: This was a cute little place. Reminds me of the Chicago version of our Cicero favorite, Freddy's. It's like an old school Italian deli, with a section of tables so you can order at the counter and then eat in. I don't remember what I ordered -it was some kind of Italian sub sandwich -but it was really good. Nice crowd, good ambiance. It's really exciting to find some new places and get out of the Cicero rut!

14.description: The sandwiches are always delicious, the bread is fresh, and the ingredients are of the highest quality. The price is right for the items, and you get your bang for your buck! I'm not a huge fan of sandwiches or subs, but I will always go to Conte for theirs, because they are the best! It's an Italian deli with groceries. Tons of Italian pastries, amazing pastas, and sandwiches await you here at Conte di Savoia.

58.description: I came to Thai Bowl four years ago and had their pad Thai. Walked past yesterday and still remembered the place. The Pad Thai was delicious. Noodles slightly too chewy for my taste. We had the chicken red curry - they serve it to you on top a larger than average portion of rice. I'd come back to try more dishes no doubt.

56.description: Food is ok...but the only waitress there has gotten ruder and ruder over the years. I ordered something and before I could even finish giving my order she already slammed the phone down!! There are at least 3 other Thai places on Taylor St. with better food and service, that there's no reason I'll ever return! I called back and hung up on her while she was still talking and never canceled or picked up my order!!Save your frustration on better things and go to Golden Thai down the street instead!

29.description: I give them 5 stars for the Thai dishes I love. No one beats them in the tum yum soup, theirs is absolutely the best, especially on a cold day. They do a great job in Pad-thai and all their fried rice. For these dishes, I vote them the best in Chicago!!!

42.description: Food is fine, and made fresh... Their beef curry noodles is my favorite. The rest of it is decent too. Staff could be more efficient, and could work on their people skills, too.Overall, it's like a decently priced campus area Thai joint. Nothing too fancy, but decent food, decent prices, decent service and decent ambience. Good place to try out or even drop by once in a while.

23.description: The food is great but the last time my friend and I visited here, I have no idea what happened, the waitresses had such terrible attitudes. She asked if we were ready to order and I told her not yet. That was her first time coming over! After I said that, she rolled her eyes SO hard I thought I was going to have to help her re-position them.Needless to say, my friend and I grabbed our purses and left. Walked to this new Thai place just down the street. The atmosphere is amazing. The food was glorious and the owners are the nicest people you'll ever meet. They honestly helped in creating a joyful eating experience. I've gone back twice now!

47.description: Terrible service. Tasteless food. The girls that took my order were not pleasant.The food was flavorless. I had the beef fried rice which I had to drown in soy sauce just so I could taste anything. The pieces of beef were so dry and very tough. The potstickers were just OK. It came with sweet and sour sauce. I was expecting a potsticker sauce. Ugh. What a waste of money. This is why I rarely try other Thai places. I usually just stick to Royal Thai. I will never come back.

8.description: Place is very unkempt. We ordered spring rolls which clearly had been in the fridge for a couple days and we're not fresh, we only had one and we're still charged for them . Other than that the food was decent crazy noodles were pretty good.

31.description: When you walk in the decor is terrible. Is like they just don't care. The chairs are uncomfortable. The menu has food but nothing outstanding. The food is just kind of smelly. I see a lot of college students raving about this place but just don't get it. The plates are expensive for what they give you. There are no lunch specials. The taste is lacking. Service is under par. Will not be going back again.

34.description: Pad Thai is really good. Probably the best around the UIC area. The smoothies are good too! However their tapioca is bad.

16.description: Was really looking forward to the jade noodles with shrimp. Am never looking forward to rudeness from the one who takes the order. I'm over that as soon as bowl is ready because it looks pretty good. I'm back in the blue after a couple if "blah" bites. A dish, utterly devoid of any seasoning. Much like this review. Not many adjectives nor properly constructed sentences for that matter.  I require flavor in my food. I'm uninspired here just as was Thai Bowl. AM inspired to leave it behind. Sad, as it has nice patio but not sad because the indoor area seemed disheveled. I like me a good hole in the wall, but this one was a bit too cobwebby-feeling.

13.description: Typically when I read a review I am pretty skeptical when it comes to unfavorable reviews. I wonder if it is a competitor bashing another business or an  unreasonably demanding customer.  I dont fall into either of the aforementioned categories.   This is my honest opinion based on first impression and real life experience. Thai Bowl is great for anyone that is not concerned with extraordinarily high levels of salt and sugar consumption.  It was difficult for me to savor or recognize the Tamarind flavor in my Pad Thai because I could literally feel my blood pressure rising with every bite (needless to say I couldn't finish that meal).  Maybe it is the spot for financially challenged college students that just need a bite to eat, but remember you are what you eat.Also, this business is serving college students, why do they have their electrical outlets covered up?   Why wouldn't a community based business know their customers and contribute to meeting their basic needs i.e charging a battery, the use of the male and female facilities.  It is easy to collect money and not give back to the very community that pays your bills.  In my opinion it is just good customer service to offer free WIFI, electrical outlets to charge phones, laptops, and a bathroom.I will not willingly give up my dollar to someone that is not willing to reinvest a penny back into my community - covering up electrical outlets jeesh.

11.description: Honestly if it wasn't for multiple recommendations from friends, I would've never stepped into this place. It looks very run down and dirty which makes me wonder about the sanitation that goes on in the cooking. The food was delicious though, I ordered red curry shrimp. So good!

39.description: Very good and consistent although the quantity of the food has dropped especially when you have it delivered.

37.description: Pros:+Outdoor seating +Student DiscountCons:-Service-Seating-RestroomThis place is frequented by college students and you can really tell. It's strange that the curry dishes come in a bowl with rice in it already, it makes the rice soggy and strange. The Tom Yum could use a little work as well. The strangest thing is the restroom, you have to walk behind the counter and in the backroom to access it. The fruit smoothies are amazing and super fresh, topped with real fruit. The outdoor garden space in the summer is nice too.

0.description: Crab Rangoon and Thai bowl mixed... Can't go wrong with both of those!We usually get the hot n sour soup which is delicious. They offer a 10% discount for UIC students. Delivery sometimes can take a real long time, but picking up an order is fine. Usually ready within 15-20 mins.

38.description: Probably not a place I would visit again.I should have listened to a majority of the reviews,  but I was hungry, it was cold out and this was the closest place to where I was going, to get a bite. I had the shrimp pad see ew which I usually love. I have to say it was less than mediocre. The shrimp still had the tails on them, which was disconcerting. There was too much egg and it was over cooked. The noodles themselves were nice, but something about them didn't taste quite right. I felt like I woukd rather be eating the sparse broccoli. The thai iced tea was weak and not quite the right flavor. The service wasn't as awful as most claimed, but it wasn't good either. And to top it all off, the place is freezing and not very clean. Disappointed.

51.description: I like thai bowl a lot. It's a little small and the tables are a little sticky but I still like the food there. I really like the tom yum soup a lot. You can put shrimp or chicken and its tastes a little different depending on what you put in the soup but they are both great. I recently had the crazy noodle soup. That was very yummy as well. I also recommend the pad thai. When I go there, I usually order the thai iced tea. But the thing is, there are two types of thai iced tea. They make it like a smoothie or its a tea with ice. I don't like the smoothie one because it tastes water down but sometimes they get confused on which one you're talking about so you have to be specific about it. I remember they thought I was talking about thai iced smoothie so I had to ask them to change it. I felt really bad and now I know for sure I have to be very specific. And you have to ask for the tapiocca as well because they don't put it if you don't tell them. The chicken saute, crab rangoons, and the fried tofu in their appetizer section is really good too. One thing I don't like about the place is that they do take credit cards but they won't let you pay in card unless you buy something over $10. So if you were just to order a bubble tea or soup, you can not pay in card.Also, I want to try the Thom- khar next time which is like a creamy coconut soup.But I give them 5 stars because I always enjoyed there food and even though their place doesn't seem the most sanitary I like the food.

27.description: It is really close to uic east campus and I have been here a couple of times. Not everything on the menu is good though. I love their beef curry noodles, huge portions. The pad see ew are not that great and even the smoothies are just ok. I don't know why but I never get watermelon smoothie when I go to such places as they are always out of watermelons. Anyways... so this is not at all a 'must go' place but I'll definitely go back for those beef curry noodles.

32.description: Came here for lunch with a fellow classmate. When we walked in, we sat ourselves because the place seemed understaffed, but it was pretty busy, probably because it was lunch time. When we were finally greeted, the woman was very nice. I ordered the duck pad Thai, which I really enjoyed! This place isn't like a nice sit down Thai restaurant, but it is good for students in a rush or take out. The prices were kind of up there, $4.00 for a smoothie (half the price of an entree!) and I didn't see a lunch menu. They could use a revamp of the restaurant and more workers, but it is small so maybe adding more workers just adds chaos. Food is good though, definitely would come back!

54.description: I came here with a friend after we visited some friends at UIC a while back. The location is great because it is so close to the school. The place is small with sticky tables and musty menus. We ordered pad thai and their spinach spaghetti noodles. Both had pretty standard flavor except I think both could use a dose of spicy garlic sauce to break up the monotony caused by the homogeneity of the dishes. Would come again if craving Thai in the area but nothing to make a special trip to.

48.description: I wish this place was open a little later! Other than that, no complaints. Food is good and fairly priced and it's in a nice area. Some people have complained about the owner, but I don't know what that's about; I've never had any problems with her or the staff and I have a tendency to get the worst side of people.

44.description: One of my favorite thai restaurants!I go here all the time and when I bring people they all love it. delicious food, cheap and friendly workers. I always go there. Everyone needs to give it a try.

24.description: Best Thai food I've ever had and since moving back out to the suburbs two years ago I've missed this place terribly. When I lived on campus at UIC I would eat here weekly with my roommate. The pad woonsen was always my favorite dish and the crab rangoon is just incredible. I sometimes wish I could just easily get back into the city to eat here or that they would just relocate out here to Elgin.

7.description: Crazy noddles were so gross and greasy. Only had one spoonful. Thipi Thai is way better!

49.description: Was told by a co-worker that this was a must try umm I would have to disagree. On first looks its a small, dirty looking spot but sometimes places like that can still surprise you. Not this place tho. Ordered the panang curry chicken and my boo ordered pad thai with beef. Both meals had a water taste aftertaste thats hard to describe but its not good. I had to drown my curry in soy sauce to make it taste a lil better. Nice staff. Would not return for a meal.

40.description: Great place to get some Thai on Taylor! If you go the traditional route and get the Pad Thai you won't be disappointed, but the gem for this spot is definitely the Jade Noodles. Classic soups like Tom Yum and Tom Kha are on point and not too pricey either. The service is equally gratifying. The staff is super nice. An eatery frequented by college students and local law enforcement officials alike!

53.description: I stopped in for a to go order of hot & sour soup on a rainy day.  From the time I ordered, it took about 12 minutes before it was ready, but I didn't mind waiting since they clearly were making it fresh instead of having some massive vat of hot & sour soup that just keeps getting overcooked all day.  Very tasty, huge serving, and I highly recommend.Thai Bowl consistently offers one of the better Thai options in the area.  Not oily or greasy, fresh ingredients.  Don't let the atmosphere scare you - the dingier the place, the better the food in this case.

30.description: The best American-style Thai food I have ever had.  Their dishes simply have a flavor I have encountered nowhere else (and the portions are for people like me who eat like big boys).  Thai Bowl has been a favorite of mine for years, and when I recently brought my mother here she (a normally delicate, composed woman) scarfed down her food while exclaiming "I can't get over how delicious this is!" My standby favorite, consistent through the years, is the jade noodle - scrumptious, satisfying green goodness.

46.description: First thing I was asked upon entry- for here or to go. I was with another friend. She and I are both black. We ordered food. We got no water. We observed 5 patrons after us get asked if they are dining in, they too received a glass of water. We clearly was discriminated against. I ordered chicken satay, and it was a combination of dark and white meat. I've never had chicken satay with dark meat. Food was okay, but a disappointing experience.

1.description: Food is okay... Good flavors for a good price. The reasoning for this score is because of their service. I went with a friend but I only had an hour and a half to eat and get to west campus which should be more than enough time for 2 people to eat. I ordered a rice dish and 25min later, a server comes out and tells me there's no cooked rice and I'd have to substitute it with a rice noodle. It's not that I don't like noodles but this is an Asian restaurant and they didn't have rice coked by default. It took at least another 10min to actually start eating.Also, I took another friend here for the sole purpose of getting tapioca and what happened? There was no tapioca being boiled! They do not know how to prep foods in case someone might order it. No offense, but they're the cheap kind of Asians. Never wanting to do anything until it's needed. It will take at least 20min to make. So be ready or get it delivered.

55.description: Just tried this place and was very satisfied.  Good service. My delivery was quick and the delivery man was extremely pleasant as well.  The wonton soup and pad Thai were amazing!  The chicken satay was tasty but on the oily side. The panang had great flavor but the sauce was thin for me. Their prices are reasonable and I was given a free order of crab rangoon that was also really good.

9.description: Came here for lunch with a fellow classmate. When we walked in, we sat ourselves because the place seemed understaffed, but it was pretty busy, probably because it was lunch time. When we were finally greeted, the woman was very nice. I ordered the duck pad Thai, which I really enjoyed! This place isn't like a nice sit down Thai restaurant, but it is good for students in a rush or take out. The prices were kind of up there, $4.00 for a smoothie (half the price of an entree!) and I didn't see a lunch menu. They could use a revamp of the restaurant and more workers, but it is small so maybe adding more workers just adds chaos. Food is good though, definitely would come back!

26.description: Food is ok. But bad service! Slowly! The waitress is like I owe her lots of money! No smile!  I am not happy to pay tips for this meal.

25.description: Their food is good but their service was why gave it 3 stars. I ordered the chicken pad Thai carry out and I felt like their portion got smaller. The man who took care of me was very unfriendly. After I asked for the student discount he looked irritated and the tone of his voice was rude. I would only order from here if I'm really craving pad Thai since it's down the street from my apartment.

12.description: I've been coming here for the past five years. The food is always really good but I went there today and ordered the Panang Curry and a cucumber salad (which totals around $11). They tried to charge me $19 ( $7 in tax). When I corrected them they changed the total but I paid cash and they gave me incorrect change and of course no receipt. They ended up charging me the original $19 which I didn't even realize until after I had left as I was preoccupied with trying to catch the bus. Apparently they've done the same to my roommate multiple times. I do not think I'll be returning which is a shame because I love their food but it's wrong for them to try to rip off college students. So disappointing.

59.description: My friend and I ordered the red curry with chicken and the beef pad thai. Both were delicious! They also were generous with portions, allowing for leftovers. We each paid about $11 with tip. I would go back to satisfy my thai craving.The restaurant itself is not the nicest. Their chairs aren't super comfortable and the inside as a whole doesn't feel the cleanest. Regardless, their food was delicious and well-priced.

21.description: Great little place to stop in for some good, inexpensive Thai food. Nothing flashy, but the service is fast and there hasn't been a wait for seating when I've gone (mainly weeknights). I've gone a few times with my daughter and husband and we all enjoy their egg rolls, pad see eiw and panang curry. Look forward to trying other items off their menu. They also have a nice little outdoor patio for those nice summer days. It's also close to some yummy dessert spots (i.e., Mario's Italian Lemonade and Flirty Cupcakes).

17.description: Came here twice and this makes me decide not to visit again.The food does not meet my stomach.

10.description: Probably not a place I would visit again.I should have listened to a majority of the reviews,  but I was hungry, it was cold out and this was the closest place to where I was going, to get a bite. I had the shrimp pad see ew which I usually love. I have to say it was less than mediocre. The shrimp still had the tails on them, which was disconcerting. There was too much egg and it was over cooked. The noodles themselves were nice, but something about them didn't taste quite right. I felt like I woukd rather be eating the sparse broccoli. The thai iced tea was weak and not quite the right flavor. The service wasn't as awful as most claimed, but it wasn't good either. And to top it all off, the place is freezing and not very clean. Disappointed.

5.description: A must-go if you're a UIC student. I used to come here all the time while attending UIC. The food is decent. I used to get the pad Thai and the panang curry, which was ok but not the best Thai I've had. Their bubble teas are fairly good. Service is iffy. Don't expect the warmest welcome, they'll serve you then leave. Food is fairly priced, so if you're looking for a quick, well priced lunch in between classes, come here.

3.description: I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai and Crab Rangoon. $15 for both. The Pad Thai came in a large serving, but hardly any chicken. It was a good dish, but nothing really special. The Crab Rangoon filling has a different taste, but I quite liked it. Very close walk for UIC students, but pretty convenient street parking for drivers (although Taylor St. parking can be busy).

35.description: Typically when I read a review I am pretty skeptical when it comes to unfavorable reviews. I wonder if it is a competitor bashing another business or an  unreasonably demanding customer.  I dont fall into either of the aforementioned categories.   This is my honest opinion based on first impression and real life experience. Thai Bowl is great for anyone that is not concerned with extraordinarily high levels of salt and sugar consumption.  It was difficult for me to savor or recognize the Tamarind flavor in my Pad Thai because I could literally feel my blood pressure rising with every bite (needless to say I couldn't finish that meal).  Maybe it is the spot for financially challenged college students that just need a bite to eat, but remember you are what you eat.Also, this business is serving college students, why do they have their electrical outlets covered up?   Why wouldn't a community based business know their customers and contribute to meeting their basic needs i.e charging a battery, the use of the male and female facilities.  It is easy to collect money and not give back to the very community that pays your bills.  In my opinion it is just good customer service to offer free WIFI, electrical outlets to charge phones, laptops, and a bathroom.I will not willingly give up my dollar to someone that is not willing to reinvest a penny back into my community - covering up electrical outlets jeesh.

19.description: I stopped in for a to go order of hot & sour soup on a rainy day.  From the time I ordered, it took about 12 minutes before it was ready, but I didn't mind waiting since they clearly were making it fresh instead of having some massive vat of hot & sour soup that just keeps getting overcooked all day.  Very tasty, huge serving, and I highly recommend.Thai Bowl consistently offers one of the better Thai options in the area.  Not oily or greasy, fresh ingredients.  Don't let the atmosphere scare you - the dingier the place, the better the food in this case.

28.description: I love Thai Bowl!! Great smoothies, and I love the Jade Noodles. Most of all I love the prices:-))

45.description: Thai Bowl has some of the best and must flavorful Pad Thai noodles in Chicago. They always get my order correct and deliveries arrive in a timely manner. If you're looking for a place to dine in, I say skip this spot. They don't have enough staff to offer good service...they're accustomed to college kids ordering out.

33.description: I loovee Thai bowl.I get the pin noodles duck every time I go and it is delicious.My brother gets sweet and sour chicken,and my mom gets chicken pad Thai. The service is good sometimes they have a hard time understanding English but its still great.The little outside area is very pretty when the weather is nice.I love this place.

43.description: Good food but make sure you pay cash. My cousin and I tried to split the bill  and they  wound up charging her once and my card twice. When I brought it to their attention, they refused to do anything about it.

2.description: Three words Pad see yewIts a must have noodle dish, amazingg with the chickenthis place is student friendly, offering a student discountThai bowl also offers outdoor seating which at night is really pretty, with their service being quickOnly thing is i wish they would smile more and be more welcoming and friendlyGO TO MEAL;Pad see yew, coke + student discount=9.50

18.description: Great place to get some Thai on Taylor! If you go the traditional route and get the Pad Thai you won't be disappointed, but the gem for this spot is definitely the Jade Noodles. Classic soups like Tom Yum and Tom Kha are on point and not too pricey either. The service is equally gratifying. The staff is super nice. An eatery frequented by college students and local law enforcement officials alike!

41.description: Food was ok I ordered chicken pad Thai n some of my noodles were under cooked. My dish had a lil spicy kick which is ok in my book. Cost about $9. The Restaurant was kinda cold n seat were cold so wear layers.

52.description: The jade noodles with chicken are soooo good! I'm typically picky with Thai food but this place is really yummy and satisfying. If you're anywhere in the city you should most definitely stop in and try it

50.description: I love this place, never disappoints, pad Thai is amazing along with the crazy noodles. Their appetizers are really good too. Their tea you have to make sure they use fresh bags, because they tend to reuse the bags and your tea tastes like water, other than that I like!

4.description: This is a staple if you're a UIC college student. Their pad thai is absolutely delicious, and for a low price you get a big serving! Mine always lasted for 3 meals. Their pad kee mao dish is also really delicious. And don't forget the fortune cookie on your way out!

6.description: OUR FAMILY FAVORITE!!  We have been coming here for years and always have great food and great service.  Whether it's delivery, pick up or eat in, it's always fast and delicious.  They have the BEST Pad Thai I've ever eaten.  I don't ever like vegetarian food and I LOVE the tofu Pad Thai.  Great cucumber salad, curry, soups and spring rolls.  Not so crazy about the crazy noodles or the Pad See Ew.  FYI -the Pad See Ew has American broccoli and not Chinese broccoli.  They also have an outdoor dining area in summer that my kids love.  We pull up on our bikes and dinner is served!  Very very casual.  No alcohol but good bubble drinks.

22.description: Haven't had a thing on the menu that wasn't good. The service is sometimes choppy here as they don't speak very good English, but other than that this place is great. The food is awesome and the prices are even greater.

15.description: First time here  and the food was great,egg rolls we're amazing. Crab ragoons amazing.  I also got pad Thai and asked for it spicy. And wow with each fork full  I saw about 10 to 15 pepper seeds the food was so spicy it wasn't even enjoyable and mind you  I love spicy foods but this was beyond too much. Id definitely go again but this time won't ask for it to be spicy.

57.description: Fresh, fast, tasty. This may be my new go-to spot for Thai! I only go to this place for carry-out btw. But the outside sitting area is cute.

20.description: I go there every now and then ,maybe 4-5 times a year. This time I went in to buy a bubble tea. I usually get student discount. But the lady/owner standing made a really bad face and gave me the price with the discount, which was $4.50. Then the making process came. They were not that busy so I stood to see how they were making the tea. The girl but in minimal mango and one mango slice fell on the table and she picked up put in the mixer. She put one glass full of ice, which is 5 times more than the mango. I won't mind paying but $4.50 but I expected atleast 25-30% of the glass full of mango not 15%. Also, I won't be coming in for the bubble tea again because I saw many tiny fly around the juice bar area. I wonder how the food is cooked in the back now. I will be reporting them soon due to the unhygienic environment.

36.description: This place is so good! Anytime I'm in the area, I always go. The best way to start is with spring rolls; the beef curry noodles are awesome, as well as the fresh smoothies. I made my boyfriend come (he had only heard bad things about Thai food) & he ended up loving it too

14.description: I love this place and the taste of the pad Thai is the best I've had in Chicago. I don't order anything but the pad Thai and I've been coming here for over 10 years for it.

28.description: I'm never coming back to this Staples, especially the copy/print center. I went to go get my Step 1 FirstAid (basically the BIBLE for most medical students in their board examination studies) unbounded so I can 3-hole punch it and stick it in a binder. The guy at the copy station did such a sloppy job and then gave me such nonchalant attitude, I wanted to throw the mega 3-hole punch at him. First, he cut off the spine lopsided so when he gave me my book with its chopped off spine (it was a freakin' WEDGE) I gaped at it and point it out. He apathetically said, "it'll be all right." Um, no. This is MY book that I've annotated, MY book that I'm using as a major tool to study. You don't tell me that this deformity you've caused will be "all right."  I then took another look with a huge sinking feeling (hey, I'm a med student taking my boards soon, I can afford to be a little dramatic) and started, "I'm sorry but my book.." the guy cut me off and said, "you're sorry for what? you don't want to pay? then fine don't pay." Wow. Tables unexpectedly turned. Fine, I don't pay, I don't care, it's only $2.50 but still, it's the principle of it all. I can never get my book back. Unacceptable. It's unbelievable the incompetence and unprofessionalism some workers have.

1.description: Unless you really need something and can find out with help from the people who work here then go. The I received here was horrible. I asked a lady a question and she just turn and gave me a "wait 1 minute" finger and walked away. The cashiers there are like zombies. Not sure where they are hiring their people but seems like non of them like working there.

9.description: OkDifficult to get help if you need it.  The staff usually hangs at the front of the store, but they are very pleasant and willing to help, if you ask.Free Parking is great!Not a large store, but variety of offerings.  Very convenient to our home!

29.description: Geek alert!  Geek alert!I love office supplies.  Seriously, I walk into places like Staples and could spend hours and hours geeking out over stuff that I want, but really don't need.So, what's a girl with a new job to do?  Buy things for my new desk, natch!Sure, I know my new employer will provide the basics for free - but when it comes to writing utensils I am uber picky, so I had to get my own preferred brand of pens and pencils, in addition to a notebook or two to take notes on all things related to earning my shiny new paycheck.Staples has a fantastic selection - for some reason I have a hard time finding the pens I like, yet at Staples I can get them in just about every color known to man, and if I wanted black ink I could even buy them in bulk.  Score!Their employees are friendly and generally fantastic, and were very attentive to the growing line and quick to open another register.  This ex-retail manager was *loving* the fact that they were aware and on top of things.Sigh.  Oh Staples.  You are SO my happy place.

23.description: This location sucks compared to the others. Each time I walk in, each of the employees is on the phone yapping away so when I need help, they are not available.I give an extra star because they have parking.

5.description: Another visit and same story. Worst customer service. Slow, inefficient, and rude. I tried even ordering online to expedite it and it was still a bad experience.

31.description: I love Staples. :)  I agree with Maxxy....stationery, pencils, post-it's are so great....and I love my erasers....I don't know why, but I do!  Plus, the best thing is that theres always something on sale there!  And they have great rebate offers.  But I have been there once where they didn't have printer cables that weren't like $60 or something.....wound up going to Radio Shack and got it for $15.  But it's ok....I still love it there....  :)

25.description: A-okay in my books. Pretty well stocked and employees are nice. I just go in and get what I need and out. In a pretty good location with tons of other stores around. Just don't go about traffic time as Roosevelt gets pretty congested.

12.description: We came here for a paper shredder the other night. Several employees passed us without asking if we needed help.
