I finally grabbed someone to ask where their paper shredders were because I am new to this location and wasn't able to find them. Him and his fellow employee told me that they did not sell paper shredders. Apparently it was a joke and they tried to make me feel stupid for even asking because he was carrying one and I obviously didn't notice. I will admit that I wasn't in the mood for joking because I was already irritated from circling the store looking for something without help. The employee said he would be with me in a minute and showed me where they were. I looked at their selection and found one that I liked, but it wasn't on the shelf. I waited about 10 minutes before the employee came back only to tell me that they don't have that one in stock. We left and bought what we needed at best buy down the street.

21.description: It's very discouraging to see a huge store and always run out of supplies that I happen to need. I just need a pack of pens and they seem to run out when I happen to stop by!

16.description: OMG unbelievable, Staples really sucks lately. I was shopping for myself and my business today and while checking out, the store manager (yes!) started arguing with me that I was taking too long and was holding the line. There was NO line and no customers and 2 other cashiers were at the registers. Apparently my business is not appreciated and I will take this to corporate. Completely unacceptable!

17.description: This place is great staff is amazing I actually drive 20 min further to come to this location because management and staff are completely rude at elston location

10.description: Staples should consider customer service training. Terrible service. Asked a lady if she can please point me to the portfolio (just point). Nope her response "its whatever's out" -- then walked away. Hmm.... not my question. But thanks for letting me know never to come back.

11.description: I ordered 2 items for pick up at this location because their website said they had them in stock. I received an email about 10 minutes later telling me one of the items was unavailable, so I went back onto the website to order for pick up at another Staples location.While on the site, it still showed that this location should have some in stock, so I called to see if someone could double check. After giving the sales associate the item number and being put on hold for almost 10 minutes, another person picks up the phone and asks how they can help me. After telling him someone was checking on a product for me, his tone completely changed. "Yeaaahhh... we don't have that in stock if you got that email so I'm not sure why you want us to check."Then I asked him how long it takes for their system to update, because the site said this morning that they had 4 of the item I was looking for, and after I placed my order and received that email, the site said they had 3 in stock. He told me they have to manually update it and there wasn't "really a point" for him to go walk to the aisle and check.Needless to say I went to pick up the other half of my order, and the item that was "out of stock" was sitting on the shelves. All 4 of them.I get that being at work can be a pain in the ass sometimes, especially in customer service, but when a customer is politely asking you to help them, there's no need to cop an attitude. Your manager will understand you leaving your task at the moment to quickly answer a customer's question, especially if it's because of an error on the company's end.

26.description: I've never had a great experience here. The customer service, especially at check-out, is normally pretty dismal. Lines are long, and employees often just leave their posts. On the plus side, they do have pretty much whatever you would need, except good service, which counts for a lot.

27.description: What is it about me and office supply stores? Something about them in general and this Staples in particular make me wax poetic about paper clips and white out. I know, how odd. Is it the row upon row of paper and pencils and markers that take me back to that first day of school? Or the home office furniture that makes me long to work from home doing nothing but writing prose all day? Or maybe it's the briefcase aisle where I can sling briefcases over my shoulder to my heart's content and take imaginary computers in and out of the bag to see which one is the fastest release as I stand at the airport? Whatever the reason, Staples usually has what I need. At this particular location, I was successful in my quest for a new briefcase and a friend found a new home computer desk. They even have cold water and snacks for purchase up front (see others must spend a lot of time in here as well if they offer up refreshments!). The cashier was quick in getting us out of there as we did have a bit of a delay in trying to find the right computer desk in the warehouse. I was also a bit surprised that no one helped us out with the purchase other than to allow us to use their cart to get it out to the parking lot. I mean, this thing was bulky and heavy. But we managed and since they have their own parking lot I just backed up to the door and we loaded it in the car with no issues. I don't often have the chance to wander aimlessly through office supply stores- after all, at work, it is all ordered on line and boxes of whatever I need are at my disposal each and every work day. But on those days when I want to waste a little time and see what's new since I got that first magic marker set, oh so many years ago, Staples fits the bill-like paper and pencil - oh and they have those too- Aisle 3!

0.description: Ordered Engineer prints online easy, fast, affordable! Prints ready same day and service was great when picking up items. Will use again!

20.description: I went to this Staples Copy Center after having a terrible experience at the FedEx Kinko's across the street.  The staff at Staples were knowledgable and professional.  They printed a bunch of proofs right then and there for me so I could decide on a font and they got my last-minute order done in two hours.  They even called me when it was ready.  The copy center saved the day and now they have a new loyal customer.

19.description: The copy center people are always helpful and friendly. they will go out of their way to help you with problems.

33.description: They won me over for the past six months, but I'll have to give the new Office Max a try across the street.Staples as a chain is great as you might know.  However, let's be location specific.  Some of the employees try hard to help you out.  That's cool, but I personally don't need too much help picking out printer paper or office supplies.The big knock at this location would be their print/copy center.  You'll be gambling if you are doing anything more than xerox copying something.  I've had them direct print a bunch of PDF files on their color printer behind the counter and printed over 20 jobs at this joint.  I've personally only had a couple of problems, but they were normal 8 1/2" x 11" brochures.  However, there is always another customer complaining.  Someone had a messed up ink stamper created for them.  Some ladies had a scuffed large format poster that the employee suggested to "put whiteout" on.  The color printer is messed up... blah blah blah.What am I talking about?  These are problems at every print/copy place around here.  At least at Staples color copies are only 39 cents... for now!

2.description: I hate giving one star but I had by far the worst experience at this staples. Usually staples treats me good but I highly recommend skipping this location and going downtown or anywhere else (even fed ex express is better and they always have lines) . I have come here twice now and both have me upset. My latest experience I came to print a resume and they said I had to place the order ahead of time. However, in the past, I have come to the counter and they have orienteering. I got over that minor issue but it became worse. I was waiting in line And they redirected me to a line that closed and then I had to get back into line all over again. They could just use some organization and friendlier staff. Either way...there are others options! On an endnote, I'm not rating all stables poorly, they are usually very convenient and pleasant...just not this location

34.description: OK, confession time.... I am a nerd.  I love office supply stores.  Stationary, pens, post-em's, mechanical pencils, and highlighters... I LOVE THEM!!!

32.description: In a big city like Chicago, you can order office supplies online and have them delivered to your door within a day.  I think in order to keep the customers coming to brick-and-mortar locations they have to provide something  - specifically, good service, good product displays, knowledgeabe staff, and a large selection of in-stock items.  I don't think this location meets any of those criteia.  They offer absolutely no reason to actually go the store.  The staff that I dealt with weren't overly friendly and didn't know the first thing about the products that I asked about.  No need to go back - I'll do my research at Amazon and buy online.

18.description: A-okay in my books. Pretty well stocked and employees are nice. I just go in and get what I need and out. In a pretty good location with tons of other stores around. Just don't go about traffic time as Roosevelt gets pretty congested.

13.description: I have never been treated so poorly by a cashier. I struggled a little bit understanding the debit card system. He actually said to me,"well you can read, can't you?" I wonder if he would have said that to my 6 foot two, 240 pound husband?

4.description: Worst customer service ever. You'd think the employees have no idea that they work at Staples.. It seems as if you woke them up from a drunken stooper, and they're pissed off at you. Second, you check online for stock IN THIS STORE, drive all the way there only to have some manager tell you they don't have it. Which in 3 cases hasn't been true - they were just too lazy to walk the 30 feet over to the shelf and help you.This place is terrible - I hope it closes soon and gets replaces with a hole in the ground.

24.description: What can you say about office supplies?  Some people love 'em, some people just see them as the crap you need to have to get your job done.  Typically I prefer Staples to the other office supply places but this location really doesn't do it for me.  This is my usual spot but a couple of visits ago they really kind of ticked me off.  I had stopped in to get a new charger for my Kindle and I decided that it might be a good idea to get a cover... I've been putting it off forever.  I asked one of the guys that works there if they had covers for the Kindle that was one generation back and he insisted that any of the ones they had there would work.  I told him I was pretty sure that my Kindle was a bit larger and he (rather know-it-all-y and obnoxiously) insisted that he was right and pointed to the cover I needed.  Two hours later at home, while packing for a work trip I decide to put the new cover on.  Surprise, surprise... way too small.  Luckily I very carefully removed the packaging so I was able to put it back together.   Just beware... the staff might act like they know a whole lot more than they do and you should probably trust your instincts if you feel something is amiss.

6.description: Hands down one of my best experience in the service and help I have ever experienced in the copy & print business. If you're in a bind and can't get your files to cooperate look for Ryne. He'll do all he can to make sure that when you leave you're set up to do what you came in to do

22.description: Probably one of the worst Staples in the city. The few times I've been here the staff has been less than helpful. Don't see myself going back here unless I have a real office emergency.

15.description: I love Staples.  It is my go to office supply store.  But this location is going downhill fastIt is very disorganized.  Why are bound notebooks in three different aisles?  Why are day planners in three places? Why are business card holders in four places?The front displays by the door are always tossed about, no one fixes them up, they just leave everything a mess.Every time I go in this store, I have to climb around ladders left in the aisle or carts packed with boxes to go on the shelves left in aisles.  The check out counters are in packed with crap that is not displayed well.And the last time I went, I asked a worker in an aisle for assistance. I was standing two inches away from him.  I said "Excuse me, sir."  No response.  Again I said "Excuse me, Sir."  No response. I thought okay, maybe he is hearing impaired.  So I said it again and lightly touched his arm.  The worker turned towards with  a look of shear anger at the fact I touched him.  I asked him my question and he answered me with much disdain.  He was not hearing impaired, he was ignoring me!And during this trip we were buying ink.  A sign in the ink aisle said "Buy 50 dollars in ink get 10 dollars back."When we got to the checkout my husband asked if we could have the 10 dollars off our bill or were they going to give us a gift card.  The clerk flippantly said, "Oh that promotion expired days ago."  He promptly went into the aisle and gave her the sign.  At least we fought and got the 10 bucks back.This store needs a new manager, clean up this store!

7.description: This staples is horrible ! do not order anything online. The staff is incompetent and lazy. This is my second negative experience with this location. I spoke with a manager who appears to be as incompetent as the people he supervises. I wasted 35 minutes attempting to obtain information....still no information just aggravation.

8.description: First time ordering from staples for an in store pick up at this location and it was a horrible experience. Like the other reviews, their customer service is beyond terrible. I simply asked about my purchase and the sales associate literally just rolled his eyes, sighed extra hard, said "I don't knowwwww" with so much attitude, and just started mumbling to himself before the manager came to assist me. There are definitely better ways to talk to your customers than taking it out on them because you hate your job. Never coming back here again!

30.description: The people who work at this Staples are extremely helpful.  I wanted to order something that was out of stock and two staff members spent an hour or so trying to help me find what I was looking for.  They called lots of other Staples stores for me.  In the end, we found out that the item was out of stock throughout the country and there was no way to order it.Anyway, the people were very helpful and seemed to be happy working there.  I highly recommend this particular Staples if you need an item right away and can't wait for it to be delivered.

3.description: Best place to grab office supplies. Paper and toners for all my printers. Convenient and easy parking. They also always mail me coupons that I can use.

14.description: Came to ship some packages via UPS. Stood at the counter for a good 5 minutes before anyone even acknowledged we were there. A few minutes after that, someone finally came over to help and all was well.

58.description: Early morning breakfast right around opening on Saturday - no wait! We were seated right away. Delightful and quick service.Taylor street omelet - I enjoyed it! It's a pretty basic omelet but tasty nonetheless. The home fries were killer and even better with the hot sauce. The biscuit was the only thing I was unimpressed with - it's big but doesn't have the buttery, flaky goodness that you want to taste in a biscuit. Lemon raspberry pancake - I like that you can get a 1/2 order (1 big pancake) instead of the full (2 big pancakes) just for a little taste. 1 pancake was enough to share between 3 people who wanted a little bit of sweet next to our main savory dishes. Cute little cafe and a rewarding brunch after a long week!

56.description: Sweet Maple Cafe is a gem of a place. The eggs were cooked really well. And the blueberry pancakes.. yum! Loved the decor and the douthern style comfort the place has. Only wish the place had less waiting time.

29.description: This is one of the best breakfasts we have ever eaten had holiday French toast Taylor street omelet potatoes with bacon cheddar and jalapeños have enough left over for breakfast tomorrow will be back great home style cooking

42.description: This neighbourhood-favorite boasts the kind of breakfast your Southern aunt would serve - and their menu definitely matches up! We came early at 9:30 am and snagged one of the last free tables. By the time we finished, there was a line out the door - so come early!I ordered the chicken liver with grits, scrambled eggs, and a biscuit (this all comes with!). Surprisingly, the chicken liver was breaded and fried, which isn't my preferred way of eating it, but tasted good (as fried food does). My fiancé ordered the French toast which comes with toast and options for meat - he got the bone-in ham, which inexplicably does not come on a bone. The French toast was good, but the ham your standard fare (unusual, since they tout it as one of their specials on the menu).The prices were a good value for how much food we got, and we were tempted to linger in the welcoming warmth. We turned over the table after seeing the long line, and it was a lovely breakfast before our flight out of Chicago!

23.description: Food is on point .... Waitress are on point (and cute) .. Compared to stax it's smaller but feels more like home, also prices are cheaper then stax .... If I'm with the family I'd go to stax (more room) if I'm solo or with one person sweet maple is he spot .... I'm an omelette type of guy and I like it there .... Are there earlier today and everything Wes good besides the ticket I got when I was done but that's my fault

47.description: You can't go wrong with what you order at Sweet Maple cause everything is delicious!  Some of my favorites are: the biscuit, home fries, buttermilk pancakes, blueberry muffin, banana chocolate chip muffin, and the chicken egg and cheese sandwich. When I have a friend in from out of town, this is where we go for breakfast.

8.description: Great value, good portions at good prices and great flavor. Just delicious. Great spot for small groups no more than 4. Two of us in our party and we have a 40 min wait. Food: 4/5Service: 3/5 - I know they were busy but it would make more sense if we could pay at the table rather than trying to make way through the tight tables and long waiting line.Venue: 3/5 - Tight squeeze. Sat so close I just wanted to jump into our neighbor's conversations since we couldn't have our own.

31.description: Completely worth the wait: cozy environment + best breakfast I've ever had!

34.description: Excellent service sub par meals. Their biscuits are really dense, eggs aren't anything special, and the grits are bland.  When we asked the server about the pancakes she said it was better than iHop  Really? That's not a place you should be comparing your food to... iHop is gross. I think this place is trendy and that's why people are in love with it. My father, grandfather, and grandma make much better breakfast. Come on over if you want some authentic southern type breakfast

16.description: On the hunt for biscuits and gravy, we ended up at Sweet Maple Cafe. It's a small, totes adorbs, type family joint that's also super small. We had tried to stop by once before, only to be met with the indeterminate bull rush that is the Chicago brunch bunch.So, this is possibly the grossest looking biscuits & gravy you'll ever see in your life. It looks like a brown mush that most resembles the blended, oxidized, browned banana we feed the baby. I miss southern white gravy like a fat kid misses cake.The gravy is just meh, but the homemade biscuit is admittedly dang tasty. If I were to return, I'd recommend just going with a biscuit, sans gravy.I have a general non-omelet policy when I dine out, since it's so easy to make at home, but the wife's "Sweet Maple-Opolis" omelet was fairly fantastic, thanks to a nice feta/sundried tomato kick.Coffee is Seattle's Best and forgettable. If you can stand it, wait until after the meal, go to Scafuri Bakery next door, and get a drip using Passion House beans instead. And pick up a lemon ricotta pound cake while you're at it.

13.description: The food was nothing special. Standard breakfast fare. The service left something to be desired. We were not informed of their credit card policy (can't add tip on a credit card), which caused confusion and a rude interaction with the hostess. Will not be back.

11.description: Please put the cinnamon roll pancakes on the regular menu! They were SOOO GOOD and I want to come back and eat them again! They use a real buttermilk recipe that has a great acidity to match the sugary topping. Holiday French toast was also delicious, as were the home fries and biscuits (biscuits are a denser, more northern style baking powder biscuit). Portions here are big - an average person probably just wants an order of pancakes or French toast without the sides. We went around 10 on a weekday and only had a brief wait. You could probably do an early lunch around 11:30 here and do just fine if you work in the area.

39.description: This place is one of the most authentic restaurants in this Italian town. No fancy tables or flashy TVs. They just stick to what they good at Food and Service! Best place for brunch! Feels like I'm having brunch at my grand ma's (in a good home way) And they hit my stomach G-spot every time!

37.description: Good breakfast, I ordered the Carmen G scrambler + jalapeños & feta cheese w/cheese grits & biscuit. Coffee was hot & tasteful, place is small & the service is good I came in in a weekday around 10:30 & the place was almost full but I was able to get a seat quickly. My bkfst was good & hot which is a good thing some eggs come out cold. I'll come back.

0.description: Casual neighborhood breakfast/lunch, a little higher quality than diner food. the coffee was good, always a plus, and for being in the North, the grits were good too. It seems popular and it's not very large, a line had formed right after we were seated. It's in a cute, more quiet Chicago neighborhood so it's a bit off the beaten path. The service was prompt, friendly and unobtrusive.

38.description: All I have to say is yes! I enjoyed everything! I had breakfast for the first time at Sweet Maple Cafe and loved it. We were a party of 4, everyone ordered something different so we could each have a little taste. I ordered the corn beef hash, eggs over easy, and (to my surprise) one really huge biscuit. My eggs were perfect and my biscuit was extra fluffy. I also tasted the liver and onions, the salmon cakes and lemon/raspberry pancakes, which were both specials for today. Omg! The liver and onions is the best I've ever had dining out. Definitely what I'll be ordering for myself when I return. The salmon cakes, as well as the pancakes were awesome. Overall I had a really great experience. No complaints. The service was great, everyone was so attentive. I just loved the whole feel of the restaurant. The sign outside is cute and welcoming. The interior is warm and cozy...made me feel so comfortable. And I really enjoyed seeing the portraits hanging throughout the dining area. All of these things made my dining experience very special. I recommend Sweet Maple Cafe. Really, I insist you try it.

51.description: SO flippin' good!!!Be prepared for a wait, as the place is a little small and very popular. If you get there by 10, the wait should be no longer than 20 min, and there are chairs outside.*** It's a 15 min walk from the Racine stop on the blue line  OR there is a FREE gravel lot across the street ***Choosing something to eat here is tough, as there is so many perfect choices. I ended up ordering the Carmen G scramble- eggs w your choice of cheese, bacon, spinach, mushrooms, home fries and a biscuit and was sooooooooo happy with my choice. The portion size was big, but not huge to where I couldn't finish it. The home fries were nice and crispy, not overly greasy, and the biscuit was a huge square of carby heaven! YUM. I could go for the same meal again right now. Two of our other companions ordered a half order of pancakes- aka one pancake. It was the size of the entire plate! They had to quarter it to eat it and could barely finish it. I was impressed!They stayed on top of coffee refills the entire meal too. With tax, our meal/drinks was about $15 per person, which I didn't think was too exorbitant. I will be back!!

27.description: I love sweet maple cafe and just about everything they do. Stax is definitely the more modern brunch spot, but sweet maple cafe hits you with hearty portions at the right price. I came the Sunday after Halloween at 9AM and there was still a 40 minute wait for a table for 3. Either people go hard for brunch after halloween or this place is always busy--but it could be a mix of both.The interior features old wooden tables and chairs with old yellow peeling walls. However, it's warm, cozy, and the service is great. For food I had the Diaz y Noches scramble which featured chicken chunks, jalapeno, and cheedar scrambled with eggs. Topped with salsa, it was as good as i expected. I wouldn't say it's the main dishes that make sweet maple cafe good. It's the sides! The homefries here are crispy and flavorful with peppers and onions sauted with them. And the biscuits are massive and fluffy. My friend who doesn't even like biscuits was like damn, these are delicious. All in all, sweet maple cafe is a solid brunch spot that has some bomb biscuits. So get yo biscuits!!!

32.description: OMG! I had the best breakfast ever. Their biscuits are sooo good with butter and syrup. I chose the sausage omelet and it was perfectly cooked.

54.description: I think this place is pretty good. Their breakfast is not as outstanding as I would expect but they are good. The have a good variety of menu and their service is great. But not the best brunch/breakfast I have had. The waiting sometimes is pretty long, is it worth the wait? Only if you are super hungry. :)

48.description: An easy to miss little breakfast/brunch spot on Taylor Street--not as updated as Stax down the street, but the wait staff is really friendly and the menu is solid. The breakfast tacos are really good, and the breakfast potatoes are delicious as well. Prices are about $8-12 a plate. It gets crowded on weekends and there isn't much seating inside so get there early if you don't want to wait.

44.description: Please put the cinnamon roll pancakes on the regular menu! They were SOOO GOOD and I want to come back and eat them again! They use a real buttermilk recipe that has a great acidity to match the sugary topping. Holiday French toast was also delicious, as were the home fries and biscuits (biscuits are a denser, more northern style baking powder biscuit). Portions here are big - an average person probably just wants an order of pancakes or French toast without the sides. We went around 10 on a weekday and only had a brief wait. You could probably do an early lunch around 11:30 here and do just fine if you work in the area.

24.description: Awesome breakfast. The service was great. Parking in the lot across from the restaurant. The cinnamon roll pancakes looked awesome. Get here early as the line was long when we left at 9:10.

7.description: I love sweet maple cafe and just about everything they do. Stax is definitely the more modern brunch spot, but sweet maple cafe hits you with hearty portions at the right price. I came the Sunday after Halloween at 9AM and there was still a 40 minute wait for a table for 3. Either people go hard for brunch after halloween or this place is always busy--but it could be a mix of both.The interior features old wooden tables and chairs with old yellow peeling walls. However, it's warm, cozy, and the service is great. For food I had the Diaz y Noches scramble which featured chicken chunks, jalapeno, and cheedar scrambled with eggs. Topped with salsa, it was as good as i expected. I wouldn't say it's the main dishes that make sweet maple cafe good. It's the sides! The homefries here are crispy and flavorful with peppers and onions sauted with them. And the biscuits are massive and fluffy. My friend who doesn't even like biscuits was like damn, these are delicious. All in all, sweet maple cafe is a solid brunch spot that has some bomb biscuits. So get yo biscuits!!!

49.description: Pancakes moist, but strong taste of flour. Scramble meager and dry. Home fries bland.Biscuits fluffy and savory.Overrated.

40.description: This is very good brunch place. It's so busy on weekend we have to wait at least for 25 minutes. aApart from waiting time this is great brunch place

53.description: A small, quaint restaurant with wonderful food. I ordered their special with 2 pancakes, eggs and a meat of choice. They were serving cinnamon roll pancakes, which were amazing!!! Tasted just like a cinnamon bun. The eggs were certainly cooked to my liking and they offered turkey sausage, which is a plus in my eyes. The service was great, food was tasty, and I left full. I would definitely go back.

30.description: Went on a Friday morning and was seated right away. The corned beef hash was good ($11), made of real corned beef. The ingredients seemed fresh, which made me appreciate the flavor of the foods themselves without too much salt. Eggs were cooked perfectly too! Overall, my experience was very pleasant. Portions were big. I couldn't finish my biscuit, which to me was just alright. My waitress was extremely friendly and came by with coffee refills frequently. The coffee was pretty tasty too--a darker roast coffee not to be marred by too much sugar or cream. I would go back if I were to live in the UIC area

46.description: A great little gem on Taylor Street with friendly, quick service and accommodations. The menu here is simple and delicious-everything really tastes homemade and after an egg n cheeser ( sweet bscuit egg sandwhich), homemade applesauce, an order of apple spice pancakes with REAL maple syrup, ham cut off the bone, and unlimited quality coffee, my friend and I were very satisfied! The atmosphere is very warm and this place doesn't need breakfast food gimmicks to shine!

1.description: Small place, food was okay. The best was their special pancakes of the day. Which were Cinnamon roll pancakes. Very rich, you can order one. Coffee would get cold right away, it was odd. Scrambled eggs and omelet weren't fluffy. They need some Cholula hot sauce.It was busy and waitress interrupted our conversation and with a fake smile asked if we needed anything else. It felt like we were rushed. Overall it was alright, nothing to wait 30+ minutes for.

55.description: I was expecting good food but was terribly disappointed. We had a party of four that order different plates and it was all subpar. The three cheese omelette was bland and the cheese were not good. The fries were gross dripping with oil. The grits was ok. And the bread was alright. My friend's toasts were semi burnt. No one could finish their plates. It was disappointing and will not return.

9.description: The food was pretty good  but I more than  likely  might not come back due to the waitress who was not very clear about the way they charged. She was very rude and when I asked for clarification she rolled her eyes and smaked her teeth. In my opinion when you visit little places like this. You can only put so much in eggs and make  a new package batter. Your service is what really matters.

26.description: The ladies who work here are always soooo nice! They say hi to the kiddos and are very accommodating. We love the breakfast sandwich on the biscuit. We get extra apple sauce for kiddos too. Zero complaints about this place. So happy it's close by.

25.description: Not much to say got a sausage omelette with home fries(potatoes).  Sausage had no taste the egg was over cooked, home fries weren't crispy, and the biscuit that came with it was not good at all.

12.description: Early morning breakfast right around opening on Saturday - no wait! We were seated right away. Delightful and quick service.Taylor street omelet - I enjoyed it! It's a pretty basic omelet but tasty nonetheless. The home fries were killer and even better with the hot sauce. The biscuit was the only thing I was unimpressed with - it's big but doesn't have the buttery, flaky goodness that you want to taste in a biscuit. Lemon raspberry pancake - I like that you can get a 1/2 order (1 big pancake) instead of the full (2 big pancakes) just for a little taste. 1 pancake was enough to share between 3 people who wanted a little bit of sweet next to our main savory dishes. Cute little cafe and a rewarding brunch after a long week!

59.description: The breakfast here is always fresh and good, but it's the seating set up that I can not appreciate. Since there is no waiting area, those who are waiting to be called stand along the wall of the tiny restaurant and peer at those dining - creating an uncomfortable and almost rushed feeling. I wish they would or could add on some type of waiting area and I would be more likely to frequent this place more often. I definitely miss those banana pancakes.

21.description: I've been here several times and usually get the same thing -- chicken livers, with eggs, grits, biscuit, and coffee. The livers are well prepared, deep fried to the correct point of tender firmness without becoming tough or too chewy. Besides, I don't know of anyplace else that even has them on the menu! This plate is tasty and filling, although that is WAY too many carbs! I'd prefer two smaller biscuits instead of one giant one, and they don't bring enough butter.I tried a scramble once, and that just wasn't a big enough portion.The waitresses seem to be trying, but they've managed to screw something up every time.The bare softwood floor might be intended to suggest a down-home look, but to me it just looks like it needs another coat of paint.

17.description: This neighbourhood-favorite boasts the kind of breakfast your Southern aunt would serve - and their menu definitely matches up! We came early at 9:30 am and snagged one of the last free tables. By the time we finished, there was a line out the door - so come early!I ordered the chicken liver with grits, scrambled eggs, and a biscuit (this all comes with!). Surprisingly, the chicken liver was breaded and fried, which isn't my preferred way of eating it, but tasted good (as fried food does). My fiancé ordered the French toast which comes with toast and options for meat - he got the bone-in ham, which inexplicably does not come on a bone. The French toast was good, but the ham your standard fare (unusual, since they tout it as one of their specials on the menu).The prices were a good value for how much food we got, and we were tempted to linger in the welcoming warmth. We turned over the table after seeing the long line, and it was a lovely breakfast before our flight out of Chicago!

10.description: SO flippin' good!!!Be prepared for a wait, as the place is a little small and very popular. If you get there by 10, the wait should be no longer than 20 min, and there are chairs outside.*** It's a 15 min walk from the Racine stop on the blue line  OR there is a FREE gravel lot across the street ***Choosing something to eat here is tough, as there is so many perfect choices. I ended up ordering the Carmen G scramble- eggs w your choice of cheese, bacon, spinach, mushrooms, home fries and a biscuit and was sooooooooo happy with my choice. The portion size was big, but not huge to where I couldn't finish it. The home fries were nice and crispy, not overly greasy, and the biscuit was a huge square of carby heaven! YUM. I could go for the same meal again right now. Two of our other companions ordered a half order of pancakes- aka one pancake. It was the size of the entire plate! They had to quarter it to eat it and could barely finish it. I was impressed!They stayed on top of coffee refills the entire meal too. With tax, our meal/drinks was about $15 per person, which I didn't think was too exorbitant. I will be back!!

5.description: This place seriously has the best breakfast !!! Amazing syrup and cool specials each day ... Coffees good too

3.description: Nice little place, decent food. I tried their cinnamon roll, it was more like pancake with cinnamon syrup and frosting, but it was cute looking and tasty. I hope this place could be a little bit bigger tho so I would not have to block their walking isle while waiting in line. Parking could be hard to find, but maybe it was due to busy Sunday morning.

35.description: First of all I love the atmosphere and the decor. It feels like I took a trip to the South. The food is great. Homemade biscuits... Can't beat em!

19.description: This is one of our go to spots in the west loop...they are always really nice and although it's a wait each time you go do to the size they turn the tables really quick so the wait isn't too bad! The biscuit is worth the trip alone we usually grab a full order of pan cakes and the two eggs with turkey sausage ...all for under 30 bucks...I highly recommend it...never tried the French toast but it looks exceptional!

28.description: Not sure if I forgot how huge their biscuits are or they have been getting bigger.  I split a biscuit with my wife and still had more than enough.  Biscuit was great and everything else I had was good with solid execution.  The thing that stands out here to me is how large the portions are.  The omelette I ordered was basically falling off the plate given how large it was and how large the portion of potato hash was.  You won't leave here hungry.

45.description: This place is as good as it gets and very much worth the wait on a weekend morning. The coffee was excellent, as well the food and service.  It is small and can be a little warm in the summer.  I highly suggest it!

33.description: Good breakfast, chill atmosphere, not too expensive.There will most likely be a wait no matter when you go but the waiters/hostess are nice and so the wait is not felt too badly.The breakfast is hearty and filling.  Most include potatoes or grits and some type of grain (bread or English muffin) and even when you choose your side/grain there are more options (white/ multi grain, etc).Good place for brunch on the weekend.

43.description: Wowzer! The food here is amazing. Service is fast and the staff is pleasant. I had grits, eggs, pancakes, and turkey sausages. Delicious, and the portions were bountiful. Rated four stars due to the size of the establishment. Patrons, waiters, bus people, and cooks are literally crammed into this restaurant. From the time you're seated, they're kindly preparing you for departure.

2.description: Horrible Food. Horrible Service. Horrible Management.Today i ordered what i thought would be a chicken & egg biscuit sandwich, what i received was a egg biscuit and fried chicken fat/skin sandwich. Gross. (see pics). I immediately called the restaurant back to let them know that my sandwich didnt include any chicken at all and that it resembled fried fat. The manager told me that they only fry chicken and it couldn't be anything else. I dont know if you guys frequent Chick fil a, but i thought my sandwich would resemble the chicken biscuit sandwich they serve in the am but a bit more sophisticated since my sandwich cost $8.45.  After speaking with the manager over the phonw i told her that i would be bringing my meal back. I pur everything back in the bag and headed out. Upon my arrival i showed her what they were serving as fried chicken, she looked at me and said that chicken. I said thats not chicken its fried fat and should never be served for human consumption. The women behind her got an attitude and said thank you and the Manager told me if i didn't like, i didnt have to order there anymore. I will gladly take her advice. I will also search for the owner of this establishment to notify them of this. The supervisor was very nasty as well as the women behind the counter. I just walked out after getting my refund because i didnt have time to argue with restaurant workers, as i have enough stress trying to keep criminals off the streets.My advice stay away from this place, bad food & bad service don't mix! Try Stax Cafe, instead :)

18.description: So disappointed! I usually love this place, it's a family favorite and I recommend it to others.  Today the service and food was really bad. The time from ordering to getting food was way over 30 mins. The cheese grits were lumpy and not tasty, they forgot the warm maple syrup so by the time they got it the pancake was cold, and the eggs and turkey sausage were just ok.  The staff were lovely just not good at ensuring that food was making it to the table timely.

41.description: True home-style breakfast. The food here was amazing. I've had the sunrise omelette (sausage, sweet onions, and cheddar cheese) here, and it was great. The home fries were also really good, and I kid you not, the biscuit is the best biscuit I've had in my life. I literally ate every last crumb of my meal. I definitely plan on checking out more of the menu when I'm able to make it back to sweet maple.

52.description: Great service. The staff was super friendly. Very small space but the food was amazing. I ordered a scrambler and had the potatoes and biscuit with it. YUM! My friend ordered the cinnamon pancakes and they were heavenly. I wish I could have ordered both.

50.description: As a person whom visits Sweet Maple frequently, I am thoroughly disappointed that I can't give them 5 stars for my review today.    The food was AMAZING (as usual), however, the service was not. The waitress had a "mad at the world" attitude and you had to act like a contestant on The Price is Right to get her attention. It's still one of the best places for breakfast in Chicago, it was just not a good day to visit.

4.description: Sunday is brunch day and I happen to come across Sweet Maple Cafe on Taylor St! Great cozy brunch spot on Taylor in Little Italy. Open until 2pm daily this place is a must try. Space is kind of tight on a busy day but the delicious food makes up for it. All of the skillet and egg dishes come with a homemade biscuit that I highly recommend. Unlimited coffee refills is a bonus! Ordered a ham and spinach omelette that came with home fries and of corse I went for the biscuit instead of toast. Can wait to go back and try out the rest of their menu. If going with a group I recommend bring cash. They don't split the bill and it's only one credit card pre table.

6.description: Oh my goodness. This place is a gem. I love love loved every bite. I ordered a custom omelet with Italian sausage, spinach, potatoes and mozzarella cheese. It came with a biscuit that tasted like a cornbread-biscuit hybrid and some potatoes. Delicious. Coffee hit the spot. Refills were on point. I came in and was waiting for friends. Tables were available working 20 minutes. Honestly the service is excellent. I only come to Chicago about once a month. I will definitely be bringing other friends here.

22.description: Oh my goodness. This place is a gem. I love love loved every bite. I ordered a custom omelet with Italian sausage, spinach, potatoes and mozzarella cheese. It came with a biscuit that tasted like a cornbread-biscuit hybrid and some potatoes. Delicious. Coffee hit the spot. Refills were on point. I came in and was waiting for friends. Tables were available working 20 minutes. Honestly the service is excellent. I only come to Chicago about once a month. I will definitely be bringing other friends here.

15.description: Good breakfast, chill atmosphere, not too expensive.There will most likely be a wait no matter when you go but the waiters/hostess are nice and so the wait is not felt too badly.The breakfast is hearty and filling.  Most include potatoes or grits and some type of grain (bread or English muffin) and even when you choose your side/grain there are more options (white/ multi grain, etc).Good place for brunch on the weekend.

57.description: So fantastic. I am a pancake junkie and I found the pancakes from heaven! Manna from God! Go sweet maple go!

20.description: Amazing food. Omlette was great, toss up scrambler was amazing, and the biscuits were heavenly. Way better than any other nearby bfast places and worth the 30 minute wait.

36.description: I really enjoy Sweet Maple! Their pancakes are definitely in my top 4 pancakes in life list. Last time I had the 18th street scramble and loved it - it has a kick so I'd recommend for those who don't mind fresh jalapenos. Everything I've eaten here has been delicious! I've gone on Sunday mornings only and have never waited over 20 minutes which I found surprising given reviews.  I will definitely continue to return.

14.description: All I have to say is yes! I enjoyed everything! I had breakfast for the first time at Sweet Maple Cafe and loved it. We were a party of 4, everyone ordered something different so we could each have a little taste. I ordered the corn beef hash, eggs over easy, and (to my surprise) one really huge biscuit. My eggs were perfect and my biscuit was extra fluffy. I also tasted the liver and onions, the salmon cakes and lemon/raspberry pancakes, which were both specials for today. Omg! The liver and onions is the best I've ever had dining out. Definitely what I'll be ordering for myself when I return. The salmon cakes, as well as the pancakes were awesome. Overall I had a really great experience. No complaints. The service was great, everyone was so attentive. I just loved the whole feel of the restaurant. The sign outside is cute and welcoming. The interior is warm and cozy...made me feel so comfortable. And I really enjoyed seeing the portraits hanging throughout the dining area. All of these things made my dining experience very special. I recommend Sweet Maple Cafe. Really, I insist you try it.

58.description: I'm giving them 5 stars b/c their customer service was so excellent they deserve 5 stars.I'd been meaning to order a bike basket online for months.  I thought I'd check out Kozy's first and see if they had the one I wanted.  Well their website was awesome b/c it showed me that not only did they carry the exact basket I wanted but that they had it in-stock.I rode my bike there and was helped by one of the friendly guys that works there.  I don't think the poor guy knew what he had gotten himself into b/c my bike tires are pretty tall and my handle bars don't' adjust up and down so getting a basket to fit was no small feat.He was incredibly kind and patient and worked on re-adjusting wires, brakes, handlebars, the basket, lights, and reflectors for about 30 minutes!  He made it work and I was so grateful.I also purchased a U-lock from them and have been extremely pleased with both products.Thank you Kozy's!

56.description: Good selection. But do your research ahead of time on their website.  Know what deal works best for you before you go.For example, in store you could do a mail-in rebate, but if you printed out coupons/pages from the web you could get the price instantly without a mail-in rebate.  And many times the particular bike you want in the particular color may be at another location.  You can check inventory on their site.I bought a great bike, for about twice what I wanted to spend. Loved the way it rode, but it shifted poorly.  I'm still not sure whether it was because it had 30 gears or whether it wasn't properly aligned.  The first time I took it out for a 15-mile ride the seat started moving.  So I took it back in and they tightened the seat post screws.  The 2nd time out (it was colder) the same thing happened with the seat, though not as severely as before.Also I bought the 4-year service plan.  But, they were out of the forms which listed quite a few exclusions that I would have liked to have been aware of at the time of purchase.  I picked up the form at their Milwaukee Ave location, where I had a bad experience you can read about on that locations review.I just felt like I bought a great bike, but it wasn't assembled/adjusted properly for the price I paid.Now this is where I was completely impressed.  I took it back to Kozy on the 5th day mentally prepared to have to battle to return it under their "No Hassle" return policy.  I was completely blown away when the guy asked for my credit card without any argument to refund the full price including pedals, water bottle, and 4yr service plan.They've got some great bikes here.  My advice is if you're getting a bike here, take it for a real test-ride not just 3 blocks and back.  Change through all of the gears, (as I tested another bike in which the chain came off while test-riding it.).If you bought a bike, don't try to pick it up from the mechanic in 5 minutes.  Look around the store.  You don't want the mechanic to rush through your bike because he knows you're waiting.

29.description: This is a very pleasant bike store. Kozy's is lucky to have Brian Finnegan on staff.  He was friendly, cheerful, smart, and helpful.  If I had a cyclery, I would want him to work for me.

42.description: I ended up returning the bike I bought from Brian and it was no hassle whatsoever, within the 3 week period.  I had a super guilty conscious for returning the beauty but I found a traditional Dutch bike that fit like a glove and had everything I needed.  However, if you are going to chose a local bike shop, please consider Kozy in the South Loop location!

23.description: It had been so long since I owned a bike I was surprised to find out that bikes don't even come with kickstands these days. Ha! The guy who helped me pick out my new wheels was super patient and schooled me pretty well on all the latest bike-world details that I would need to know from what a hybrid type of bike is to the best lock to buy and the latest techniques bike thieves are using to rip off your bike.The parking meter outside is something like $4 an hour so take your bike or walk there!

47.description: This is an awesome bike shop! Very friendly staff; good customer service; decent priced items, etc. I had a fitting done here and they gave me a very good price. I'll keep coming back...

8.description: The South Loop/University Village Kozy's is frequently overpriced and always takes forever to do repairs.  I only buy gear or equipment there when it's on clearance, as that's the only time it's affordable.

31.description: The whole staff was very happy, friendly and knowledgable. I felt very welcome upon entering the store. The store is clean and well organized and prices aren't too bad. Eugene was really great and helped me out with any information I needed in order to maintain my bike's health ad life span. Definitely recommending this place to everyone in need of a nice neighborhood bike shop with great values.

34.description: This is the primary bike shop I frequently take my bicycles for repair.I bought about 4 high end racing bicycles directly from this store, until I started building my own, but I still take the custom bikes here without any problems.the mechanics are great and so are the sales people. I have yet to come here and have a problem with anything. yes sometimes they don't carry the latest high end gear but the market for those is small and the internet has definitely the better selections and choices.Bring your ride here if you want it repaired and be very happy, they also do servicing and have a great return policy on new bikes.Their clothing selection is also great and sometimes limited, just depends what you need but they cover all the basics right here.

16.description: It had been so long since I owned a bike I was surprised to find out that bikes don't even come with kickstands these days. Ha! The guy who helped me pick out my new wheels was super patient and schooled me pretty well on all the latest bike-world details that I would need to know from what a hybrid type of bike is to the best lock to buy and the latest techniques bike thieves are using to rip off your bike.The parking meter outside is something like $4 an hour so take your bike or walk there!

13.description: The prices are a bit expensive especially when buying a new bike here. However, the staff are extremely knowledgeable and friendly. I have used their mechanics over a dozen times and they've never let me down.

11.description: Awesome, awesome bike shop. I bought a bike from another seller and when some issues came up I brought it here and they gave me an honest evaluation, fair prices, and were incredibly friendly. I have since returned to buy a new helmet and they will definitely be my go-to shop whenever I need any new gear or service.

39.description: This is a big store with a vast array of bike stuff. If you want it, they probably have some version of what you are looking for.Needed a very specific bike chain tool, but no shop in the city seemed to have it, or those shops were not even open on a Sunday afternoon. So the fact that Kozy's is open until 6 PM, and that the shop tech said "Yes, we have that", I was very pleased because it meant I would be able to ride on the next morning.   When I got there a salesperson offered me a chain tool, turned out that it was not compatible. He would have sold me the wrong tool had I not pointed it out. However, that is a very obscure fact that a salesperson would not be expected to know, and I only knew that myself by checking it versus a parts list. Wrong call on the tool. But the point is that he was trying to be nice by saving the customer money (the tool is fairly inexpensive and would cost only about about half as much as the labor).  Thus, what they meant on the phone is yes, they have it in the service shop, not for retail sale. And that was as I had expected. So, they shortened the chain to the correct number of links, without having to be told. Also, the other part we needed, they must have charged for at-cost, because there is no way they were making a profit on it at that price.  While I was waiting, I looked around. Some of these gadgets are of questionable utility (as in "come on, does anyone really need this?") but that's just the way the bike industry is today, not a reflection on the store. They have a large selection of bikes in terms of genre and price range. Not a broad selection of brands, which is also common, because a given bike store typically has contracts with specific companies. They have bike stands (inside the store) near the entrance where you can park your bikes, and high-quality floor pumps you can use to inflate your tires. Some ladies came in who, on the basis of the conversation, didn't know much about the technical aspects of bikes. The shop employees were helping them out in a straightforward manner, and without being condescending, or trying to push unnecessary services. Some previous reviewers have said the repair shop is better than the salesroom, and that seems believable, although based on this one limited experience. Not a fascinating place, but they have a good combination of competence, friendliness, and convenience.

37.description: I haven't owned a bike in a good 13 yrs but have been wanting one for a while now.  At the suggestion of the bf i came to this bike shop.  Now mind you the only bikes i've ever purchased have been from Toys R US and Target, so i wasn't sure what to expect here.  We were approached by a salesperson within 5min of our arrival.  I flat out told the guy that I did not know what i wanted nor what to look for and that i had not owned a bike in 10+ yrs.  In any other store this probably would've have signaled the salesman "cha-ching!  i've hit the jackpot!" but on the contrary.  Our salesman, Eric, was (a) very knowledgeable (b) not pushy at all (c) patient.  He explained the differences in types of bikes, the different models, and brands, Not once did he try to upsell me or push the most expensive bike.  He sized me up and suggested I take a few out for a test ride.  I took out two... came back... couldnt make up my mind... and he suggested i take out the first again to refresh my memory.   When I came back he asked my thoughts on the bikes.  As i was making my decision on which to purchase he left me alone with my thoughts to make my decision.  I decided to purchase the bike but said i wanted a different color.  They didnt have it in stock so he called the Erie/Wells location to see if they had the other color.  I paid for it and yet still he didnt push any extras on me.  I'll be picking up my bike today at the Erie location... so stay tuned for that review.All in all though, i would highly recommend going to the South Loop location and asking for Eric.  He'll gladly help you, and at the end send you off with the peace sign!

0.description: I signed up for Yelp just so I could give this positive review.  They brought my dad's 1975 Schwinn Le Tour back to life after 2 decades in storage.  They are honest, friendly and professional.

38.description: I recently bought a bike for my girlfriend from Kozy's and had a great experience. They have a very good selection of bikes.The staff was very friendly and helpful. Unlike some of the other bike shops, we were able to test drive a few bikes before making the purchase.

51.description: I needed a bike lock because I am a dumbass and lost the one and only key to my other lock.  Maybe a Marc Jacobs panda clock keychain isn't the best place for a bike lock key.  Shame on me.  They were having a sale and are in the area, so Kozy's seemed good enough.  They had locks, they were on sale.  The lock came with FIVE, you heard me, FIVE keys, so I will not lose them.  I also didn't put the new fancy key with the light on it on that stupid panda keychain.  F U Panda.  And F U Marc Jacobs.  The sale price on the lock was right, but their bike lights are way overpriced compared to Smart Bike Parts.  They also had this beautiful tri bike on their website, way on sale, but it was a web order only item.  I know this isn't their fault but I wanted to sit on it.  Not that I have $1,100 for a bike, but a girl can dream.  PS- Buy me that bike, Yelp Santa!

27.description: These guys are fab!I had a pretty terrible morning a few weeks ago. Woke up to a slow leak on my front tire and it was flat. Not a problem, I thought. I pulled the tire off, seated a new tube, pumped it up to 60 PSI and BANG, the whole thing exploded off the rim. Try again? I pulled the tire off, grabbed another new tube, seated it, had my bf check that it was done correctly, and started filling it slowly... as it creeped up above 40 PSI, it would start protruding under the tire bead... oy.So the bf drives me to the train, I head to work, and stop in to Kozy's on my lunch break. I head to the service counter and relay what I've tried and the nonsense that's going on. The service tech takes a look, gets the tire and tube all seated properly and rolls it back out to me. No way. My bf and I literally spent 45 min checking it and he got it in less than 5 min? A wee bit embarrassed of my skills, I thank him and ride 10 min back to work. Indeed, this tire looks good!I step back outside around 5pm and my bike is slightly askew on the rack - yep. Tube exploded again. I catch a bus back over to Kozy's and am surprised to see the same front desk & service counter crew working. Thank goodness.Since the tire bead apparently wasn't holding long term, I ended up switching out both of my panaracer tires for some armadillo ones - and getting a great explanation of the difference between gatorskin and armadillo tires. Definitely awesome, and I'm really appreciative that they took the time to explain the difference and make sure I had the right set for commuting 15mi/day.The best part? They comp'd the labor! After the hassle of having to bus myself back over to fix what I thought was taken care of, that was really what made this visit great. They were happy to "re-fix" my wheels and make sure nothing else would explode! One of the guys at the service counter offered that they would fix them for just the cost of the new tube and tires, and when I got up to the counter, the guy checking me out reaffirmed, "Good. That's what I like to see. No charge for labor."Awesome, awesome, awesome place!

32.description: I had my high end MTB in for a tuneup and they did a marvelous job.  The staff was friendly and attentive to my issues and I really felt welcome there.  The tuneup is great and the bike rides like 100% now.  I am very satisfied with my experience there and thankful this store is so close to me.

54.description: Just bought two bikes here.  Service was decent, though I was expecting a bit more in-depth info from salespeople at a professional bike shop.  For instance, I asked about the price difference between two models and the clerk just said that the gear shifts were better.  Really?  I can assume that much.  Educate me.  Tell me what makes them better.  I kept having to lead the conversation to get any info out of him, which was often lacking.  He basically showed us one model of bike without suggesting alternatives and explaining differences to us.  The same thing happened when we looked at accessories; he just showed us the rack without talking about the products.  I can get that much help at Target - which is where we ended up going for accessories.They'll get you set up while you wait with whatever accessories you do purchase for your bike.  The service people were much more helpful and informative than the salesperson.  The shop on Erie seems to be better stocked.

48.description: Not impressed. Actually, a little annoyed.Like Robyn, I was taken aback by some of the obnoxious sales techniques. I just got my bike stolen three days ago and was looking for a replacement. Obnoxious salesman (OSM) was trying to upsell me from the very start. From baskets (didn't have what I wanted) to $65 anti-theft bicycle skewers (preying on a bike theft victim, anyone?) to more expensive bike locks than I wanted to purchase, OSM had dollar signs in his eyes the minute I walked in the door. Some particularly odious techniques:1. OSM tries to sell me the skewers. "You never would have gotten your bike stolen in the first place if you would have had these!" Yeah, thanks, I needed some salt rubbed in my fresh wound.2. OSM calls over dude-bro bike riding friend (DBBRF) to tell me how great the skewers are. "I'd never ride without them! Check them out!" DBBRF brings his own bike over to show me how they work. Thanks but no thanks. I wasn't prepared to be tag teamed.3. I tell OSM that I'm disappointed that this model didn't have the compass on it, like my old model. "You could buy a new one!" Thank but no thanks.4. After picking out a bike lock, OSM tells me that the one I picked was inadequate, and upsells me on another lock for $14 more.And the obnoxious sales technique winner goes to....5. After appearing budget conscious (who isn't these days), OSM asks me what I do for a living. Really? Is this any of your business? Then he proceeds to ask me what I study in school, where I plan to get a job, etc. etc. Dude - I came in for a bike, not to answer questions about my personal life. Oh! And then the icing on the cake. When I asked about what route to take back since I'm not familiar with that area, I was told to take Roosevelt since it has a bike lane which would take me right to the Lake Shore Path to head north. Much to my horror, I discovered this was NOT the case. Roosevelt's bike lane ends before turning into Congress Parkway, which then spits you straight out into Lake Shore Drive with NO access to the Lake Shore Path. THANKS Kozy's! You didn't get me killed, but you did get me hella honked at by angry commuters. Never again.

44.description: My first flat tire of my life...a tragic yet inevitable event occurred last weekend.  Luckily, I was within walking distance of Kozy's, and they took me in even though they were closing.  A few minutes later, I left the shop with a brand spanking new tire and tube, while receiving wonderful customer service.  Kozy's - you made my first time good...I'll see you soon.

24.description: I love this place!  They are always so nice and friendly.  And that goes a long way.  Every time I go in,they are so helpful.  Bryan, and the dog ( I think the owners: )) Are always so welcoming.  There is a bike shop a little closer tome.  However, I would rather go the extra few blocks to Kozy on Desplaines.  The repair guys are the absolute BEST!  I mean these guys really rock.  I'm almost sad when I'm done with what I need.  The best bike shop and the BEST Service.  They deserve your business!

7.description: KOZY'S ON HALSTED***I have never written a review for Yelp, but after multiple trips to Kozy's Cyclery, I felt super compelled. The Kozy's on Halsted isn't listed on here, but I had to write this somewhere. The service here is OUTSTANDING. The work staff is super knowledgable and the repair staff has saved me over and over again. THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!! If you need a repair, I highly HIGHLY recommend this place. They are never rude no matter how busy they are and they can see you right away. They have made multiple repairs on my bike free of charge because they were things that didn't require much labor. They fixed it right on the spot and I was in and out in 5-10 minutes. And that was even during a saturday afternoon when things can get super busy. Thank you Kozy's for being awesome!!!

49.description: #1 Obnoxious sales technique - tell your female customer that "women only buy a bike based on the color "#2 O.S.T. - you work at a bike store, but when said customer says she's a member of Active Transportation Alliance (formerly Chicagoland Bicycle Federation) ask why and proceed to act confused why someone would join said organization#3 O.S.T. - check your cell phone more than once which lets your customer know that nah, they're really not that important#4 O.S.T.- when your customer let's you know their approximate budget tell them it's really not enough money instead of working with them to find something#4 O.S.T - pick one bike and let the customer ride the bike in the parking lot across the street. State "really it's not that big of a decision".Yikes right? This sales style totally turned me off. I probably would have spent $400+ on a bike at Kozy but Mr. Sales Dude was working some strange mojo and really made me feel isolated on a pretty big purchase. I walked out of there interested in a bike but feeling used. Their selection is pretty darn big but if the sales people don't treat you like they give a s**t then why would you make a major purchase here?I can't assume that all the sales people are this way. I more than likely will come to Kozy again for smaller ticket bike items...I just hope my "friend" sales guy isn't there anymore.

40.description: I hadn't owned a bike for 15 years, and was more than a little overwhelmed with all the choices.  I felt like Goldilocks looking for the just-right feel:  "Hmmm, this bike is too big... these handlebars are too high... I'd really like a step-through."I test-rode several bikes, and went back to this location THREE times.  Each time, Dave B. offered me the most patient guidance. With his help, I found a comfort/hybrid that I love. And then after the purchase, Tom took care of all those tweaks I needed.  He adjusted and re-adjusted things until my bike fit just right!I admit that at the beginning of my search, I was dreading having to possibly deal with the infamous bike shop attitude I've read about, but Dave and Tom totally put that fear to rest. Super competent AND nice.Oh, and Kozy's wide selection is very hard to beat. Great inventory and staff. Thanks, guys!

53.description: I went in here yesterday because it was one of the closest bike shops to my house.  My wife's mountain bike needed new pedals and we were looking for a quick solution.  I walked in and quickly found the pedals.  They were 14.99 for a pair.  I heard cheaper prices elsewhere, but figured it wasn't a big deal to pay like $5 more and get it done with.  The problem was they had two kind (1/2" and 9/16").  I had no idea which to buy.  My wife suggested I just buy both and we'd return the one that wasn't right.  She works very near, so it wouldn't be an inconvenience at all for her to drop by during the week.  I went to ask the guy near the service area about their return policy and to explain my dilemma.  The guy told me it really could be either and it is just best that I bring in the bike and they'll install it for me.  I figured that would work out since we had the bike near and they would just do if for me.  I don't remember the exact wording, but he made it seem like they didn't charge for that...or he just outright said they didn't charge.  Anyways, it isn't "best" to bring in the bike and pay them to do the work that anyone with a wrench can do.  I figured it had to be free.I went to the register to purchase some other stuff and asked the guy at the register if they install stuff for free to ensure I wasn't misinterpreting anything.  He said, "We don't install for free, but I guess I can do if for you for free.  Almost all mountain bikes are 9/16" though, you rarely see any 1/2" unless it is like an old Schwinn, but no problem...we can do that for you."  I figured that was cool and told him my wife would be in shortly with the bike that needed the new pedals.  I kind of felt I should have just bought the 9/16" and done it myself at this point since he made me feel that would be what we were looking for...but it was free.So my wife goes in and I start attending to my bike while they fix hers.  She took it to the same guys I had just talked to and they fixed her bike without telling her they were going to charge.  They gave her a receipt to take to the register when they were done.  To her surprise, they had charged $6.My big problem is that they said it would be free.  I verified that it would be free just to be sure.  Changing a pedal is not hard and the only reason I did it through them was cause they assured me they wouldn't charge.  I really regret not just buying the two sets and doing it myself or at least just buy the 9/16" the second guy suggested.  To get pedals that would cost me $10 elsewhere cost me double here and that is my problem I guess.

30.description: I came in here to try a bike (my first road bike!) that was supposed to be at another Kozy's location but wasn't.  I pretty much knew I was going to buy it by the time I stepped through the door, so they didn't have to do any huge sales job, but the young woman who helped me was super-friendly and nice, and the whole shop vibe was laid back and friendly. They pointed out a good spot to take it for a spin, too. It was close to closing time, and parking was easy.

46.description: If you are a biker, then you know that there are two ways to see your cycle shop: the front (sales) and the back (techs).Back gets a four stars. Front gets a one.I was standing outside as the staff was milling in and smiling at me.  The door was unlocked.  Hours said open at eleven, but all I was looking for was a couple of simple parts.  I asked the salesman if I could just pop in, I already knew what I was looking for.  Reply: we open in about ten minutes. That was it.Waited.  Doors opened and I shot through to the rack grabbed the part and proceeded to the counter for my bike valve adapter.  None in the overpriced jar.  Salesman response: Nope, guess we do not (without apology or sympathy customary of good salesman).Knowing who to talk to, I proceeded to the back, where a tech was *gasp* telling a customer not to get the unnecessary work done. Who knew I would find professionalism and courtesy in this place.  Told him they were out of adapters, and he chucked me one and said to have it.Get serviced there, but don't give a salesman a damn commission.Oh! and it took me five full minutes to check out at the register because they just "have" to put my info in their system (as if I were going to return).....

1.description: I rode over to Kozy's, on a bike you sell, and was treated like an inside joke. I was informed that my bike is only sold in the store because of the people who come to Maxwell Street on Sundays. I explained I'm new to the sport and am just seeing if I like tri's and came in for a helmet, aerobars and saddle. Rather than help with that, I was showed new bikes. I get it. My bike sucks. I felt like an idiot with the staff snickering. What a pompous staff. Not everybody is a bike guru. It's okay though. Me and my crappy bike will still hit the streets and when I do upgrade this year, my business will go to a store that appreciates it.Word of mouth travels fast.

55.description: I needed four brake cable housing end caps, and didn't want to pay $10 for a bottle of 1000.  The guy at the service desk handed me them, and I was ready to give him a buck or two - he said it was on the house.  Sweet!Picked up some chain lube as well - price seemed a bit lower than other bike stores.  They seemed a bit short staffed, but one of the employees eventually came up and answered the questions I had.

9.description: I bought my hybrid (Specialized Sirrus) here about 3 years ago. Right after my purchase, another biker crashed into me after running a red light. This bent the rear wheel, so that I couldn't ride it anymore. Kozy's fixed it for free (even though it wasn't covered under my 3-year maintenance plan) and it rode almost like new. I've been coming here for 3 years now for service and accessories. The customer service has been nothing but excellent, and I've never had a bad experience. I love Kozy's!

26.description: I came in yesterday (08/08/2012) 10 minutes before closing time and was helped pretty quickly but the guy (wearing a hat) was rude. I'm not sure if he wanted to go home or what but I asked him about a road bike and told him I was looking into a TREK 1.5 road bike.  He quickly informed me that they did not carry Trek and I asked if he could show me some Trek 1.5 equivalent bikes in the brands they did sell. "I don' know" followed by " I don't go out to Trek stores on my days off"  .. what!?I thanked him and wanted to be on my way but he must have realized he was being rude and asked me more questions.  If you're working at a large bike shop like Kozy's I would expect you to know bikes, not just the ones you sell but the competition so you can convince someone to buy your products. I was going to buy a drink holder and a helmet but that ticked me off and I left.  Shame too because the first time I went to Kozy's another person was very friendly and informative. Probably wont be going back again anytime soon. At least to this location.The selection is good at least.

25.description: Bought a bike here for my son's 6th birthday. Fast, friendly service.

12.description: By far my favorite bike shops. I even make the drive from the south suburbs, it's that good. The selection is great and have something for everyone. The main reason for this review is how impressed I was that they had a vintage schwinn tire size in stock. It's usually something you have to order online. Always friendly and wiling to answer questions.

59.description: I called Kozy's about an hour ago because I needed my rear tire replaced on my beach cruiser bike. I'm already home! They were very quick and quite a reasonable price. I was actually pretty surprised they were not on yelp yet. They also have a nice retail floor and plenty of commuter bikes I perused as I was waiting the eight minutes to have my tire changed (fast!). I've been to a bunch of bike stores around Chicago, and this one had some real nice guys eager to help but not on the stalking side of things. I thought the prices were very reasonable, especially compared to the prices I have seen at other bike shops. If you need and all over tune, you need to book an appointment, but if you're looking for a quick fix or bike gear, I really think this is the place to head to in Chicago.

21.description: Came in here for a bike lock. I did stand around for about 10 minutes looking at locks before the cashier girl asked me for help. She was very friendly and cute - I really enjoyed talking with her.I got a good Kryptonite lock for $70. I think it's worth it, and from what I've seen online, the price was comparable. Store was open and cool, and I didn't feel intimidated by hipster cyclists working there. Felt more like a sporting goods store, which I like. You can also walk in right through the automatic doors with your bike, and there's enough room inside to maneuver throughout the store with ease.I will be back - I have a list of stuff to get for my bike now. And it's a nice ride from my apartment through the South Loop.

17.description: Great place for all levels of cyclers! I needed my first road bike looked at because I thought there was a hole and Ross the guy in servicing was so nice and knowledgeable. He took it to the back and saw that it was flat and filled up the tire as well as checked the other tire and filled it up some more. He then taught me about how to maintain my bike since I'm kinda new and just a casual biker (to and from work). My husband was also looking to purchase his first bike and Jeremy was super awesome. He was patient with us and showed us multiple ranges of bikes (since we didn't know much about them) and even adjusted each seat and got the exact sizes my husband needed. He was really patient since we were trying to stay in a certain price range but were eye some nicer ones as well. He helped with each step with bike locks and even the bike rack for me since I wanna be able to carry my groceries and lunch. Another worker even helped to bike helmet selection. Telling us which ones were popular and which ones were more realistic despite the cost. There's a $10 service charge so they placed my bike rack and bike basket on for me. I felt very happy during my time at this store, no snobby workers here, everyone is cool and patient, they're not forcing you to buy things, knowledgable and gives you multiple options. Done.

10.description: to start with I have a basic commuter bicycle, nothing special.  I had a rub on my front rim i was hoping the mechanic could straighten or true.  I paid for an initial tune up and problem was not fixed.  I brought it back several times and was told wheel had to be rebuilt completely because the "420" mechanic was too simple to know what to do, even though i explained this is a common problem.  i brought the bike somewhere else finally to fix, and 10 dollars later it was so.  again several trips to kozy's unprofessinal and nonsensical approach to rectify.  I tried contacting to get a proper refund after paying over 100 for a service i did not need and was rudely dismissed and ignored.  For your sake do not go there
