5.description: Great bikes,  great service,  great knowledge with the store associates.  Ask for Dave.  These guys are very good to ask questions regarding anything in the world of cycling.   Helped greatly with explaining differences between frames, making sure the size and fit were correct.  Accessories are expensive,  however they are at every bike shop.  If you want a trip computer, buy it when you buy the bike and they'll install in minutes.Also free tune up this year and next year.  Plus they'll make adjustments as you get comfortable with the bike and start riding around.

3.description: Extremely rude mechanics.  there are simply too many options when it comes to bike repair to choose this overpriced and unprofessional shop.  go somewhere that gives a shit about their customers.dropped my bike off to get a couple spokes replaced and mechanic said we'll know in an hr if rim could be salvaged come back later.  i never received a call and went in the next day to pick up the bike.  the mechanic, long dark beard, comes out and starts bustin my balls about where i was yesterday and i said i didnt receive a call and you werent exactly clear about when it'd be ready.Then he SCOLDS ME! "NEXT TIME YOU SAY YOU'LL COME BACK IN AN HR YOU BETTER BE HERE IN AN HR!"Ok dad, I didnt say I'd be there in an hour, and there wont be a next time.

35.description: Went here with Groupon in hand and looking for a helmet.  Was greeted at the door on a busy Saturday afternoon when the place was packed. I was shuffled into the area with the helmets and told if I needed help to let him know.. Cool.   I found what I was looking for in a jiffy and was checked out and on my way swiftly.  I will be back due to their great attention to customers and detail I saw when dealing with other customers.

19.description: Someone stole my seatpost and seat from the rack right outside where I work at Rush University Medical Center.  What a drag.  The next day after work I precariously rode to Kozy's and they hooked me up.  The mechanic was awesome and really took his time and knew his stuff.  I am back on the road and will never go to another bike shop.  Go here!

28.description: I would definitely purchase your next bike at Kozy's Cyclery. The mechanics are very nice and willing to fix the bike you purchased without making you pay an arm and a leg.

45.description: Kozy's is my lifeline for biking...They have a wide variety of products for the biker in you...When I can't go to my favorite bike shop, Mox, I head here for the products that pretty much will be in stock.The place has a huge selection of bikes as well as accessories.  The prices are moderate as well.   For me, I can always locate a cute bike hottie out here.  You know the type, lean build with great calfs and legs.  Oh yeah, he's tall too!  WINK! WINK!The customer service is pretty good too! They are knowledgable on bikes as well as additional equipment that you may need to outfit your bike.Also check out their website as there is a wealth of information and tips to help maintain your bike.

33.description: Good service and reasonable prices too. I bought a 26x1.95 tire and an innner rtube for 26 bucks and everyone was very friendly and attentive

43.description: The service dept is amazing. I will definitely be going back here again.

2.description: This is a fabulous bike store.  They have plenty of options for bikes and accessories, and super knowledgeable and helpful staff.We have been here a couple of times, and every person we have talked to was very helpful.  This store is not particularly cheap, but it's worth the price.  When you leave here, you will have gotten the best bike/helmet/lock/etc. for you.  They ask you a bunch of questions to make sure they are recommending the right range of products for you.  They let you try a bunch of bikes, so you can feel the difference between them and decide which is most comfortable for you.  Before you take the bike outside, they adjust the seat height, seat angle (I didn't even know that was possible, and it makes a big difference), handle bar height, and handle bar angle.  So when buy a bike here and take it home, you will be comfortable riding it for a long time!The staff are really nice people, that bike a lot themselves, and are bike experts in a lot of different ways.Everything in the store seems good quality.Really most of my review is about the staff, but that is because that is truly what makes this store worth going to.  If you order stuff online or buy it from a Big box store, you have to be your own expert in every way.  At Kozy's everything is easy, because they know how to make your bike experience perfect for you.

18.description: Came in here for a bike lock. I did stand around for about 10 minutes looking at locks before the cashier girl asked me for help. She was very friendly and cute - I really enjoyed talking with her.I got a good Kryptonite lock for $70. I think it's worth it, and from what I've seen online, the price was comparable. Store was open and cool, and I didn't feel intimidated by hipster cyclists working there. Felt more like a sporting goods store, which I like. You can also walk in right through the automatic doors with your bike, and there's enough room inside to maneuver throughout the store with ease.I will be back - I have a list of stuff to get for my bike now. And it's a nice ride from my apartment through the South Loop.

41.description: the day i walked in i was greeted by a nice and knowledgeable sales person that sized me up, asked what type of riding i would be doing and how much I was looking to spend.  while i certainly had not intend to spend, i have no regrets about my purchase or my experience inside the store.  I have gone in 2 or 3 times for adjustments and was satisfied each time.

52.description: I walked in here looking to purchase a bike and had a specific one in mind but still had a few questions. I was the only one in the store and started browsing around until I found the bike I was looking for. As someone else said, I stood by it for about twenty minutes. But unlike him, no one ever came and asked me if I had any questions or needed anything. I saw about 5 workers but none of them bothered. Needless to say I walked out, hopped on my old bike and won't be returning.

50.description: The place is great and will work with you esp Ross in service.  they go out of the way to makes things good!!!

4.description: I needed a helmet.  I got a helmet.  The Birthday Boy loved the helmet.  Enough said . . . but I'll say more:The staff here is knowledgeable and no nonsense.  The guy who helped me was more about helping me find the right helmet than selling me something.  If I need a new bike, this will be my store.

6.description: Knowledgeable salespeople who respect the customer's price point and intelligence.  Go here and ride happy!

22.description: I really like Kozy's.  I haven't bought a bike in years but the one I have (from the mid 90s) was from Kozy's, so it's been a while.  I went to the one on Milwaukee, which was nice.  The sales guy was new.  He seemed knowledgeable and fit me with a bike.  It was kinda girly but it seemed to fit.  I picked out a large helmet.  Both seemed OK.  I wanted to pick it up at the store on Des Plaines and I'm glad I did!  The helmet was too big and the bike was too small! LOL.I'm not mad about it, but, I'm glad I went to the other store.  He ended up upselling me a bike that I had seen online.  I thought it was cool, but perhaps a little pricey. The bike I had originally chosen seemed cramped when I tried it out and Dave noticed the same thing. He offered to get me the same bike in a little bigger size or...and then he brought out the very cool bike that I ended up buying. I tried on a medium helmet and it was the right fit.  Much better than the large.  Glad I went to the other store!Now I just have to ride the danged thing!

15.description: Just west of UIC on Des Plaines Ave. Lots of space and bikes. While they did not have my size in stock, they did check a few other items for me. Very knowledgeable and friendly staff. If you are in the area, worth a stop.

57.description: This place is great. Lots of merch and lots of floor space. The staff is very helpful. I was considering putting a roof rack for my bikes on our car and they spent a lot of time with me. I wound up deciding not to get the roof rack, but they seemed ok with that.  I really appreciate that.  I haven't taken my bike in for service, so I am just writing this review in the context of the retail store. Overall it's an impressive place and easy to find parking (unless you go on Sundays with the Maxwell St Market).

20.description: Kozy's has a good selection, good service, and fair prices.  I'm not a "cyclist" by any measure and they were appreciative of that and worked with me all the same.  I needed some advice on sizing, what lock was best for my uses, how to best lock the bike, etc.  They were very helpful with all of it.I wish it cost a little less to get tubes repaired but their rates are in line with other shops. Note: I've also been to the River North location for service and they were great, too.

36.description: I've gone to Kozy's a couple of times and both times the service was excellent.  Today was an "emergency", I was out riding and got a flat.  Last year when I got my wife's and my bike tuned up, it took about two weeks for a tune up because we went in there in the spring with every other rider on the planet, so I was expecting to just leave my bike and run home, but to my delight they fixed it right then and there.  They have a really nice selection of bikes and cycling equipment, if you need something for a bike they probably have it right there in stock. Pricing looks to be a little on the high side but its worth it for a specialty shop like Kozy's.  Plus, in my experience everyone who works there is super cool and not "bike snobby" like the employees at some other shops in the city who shall remain nameless.Make sure to leave a tip for your service guy!

14.description: GREAT service at this Kozy's Cyclery. I was looking for a bike rack and called the store. Talked to Matt. He recommended a particular rack for my Passat wagon while I also looked online as we talked. Then, I went over and Matt helped me purchase that particular bike rack in stock. The amazing part is that he came outside and showed me how to get it onto the car, and explained every last detail of fitting the bikes, plus did it all with a smile! It's so seldom that someone will go to that length and be so customer friendly. I HIGHLY recommend this store, from past experience and especially suggest you see Matt when you visit there.

3.description: The food is ok, nothing special. the service is great for the most part. Being a vegetarian, this is a change from Subway.

1.description: Nothing special, decided to pick up food here instead of Wendy's. Food was bland and wasn't horrible, could be better. I didn't like how the some of the food was already precooked and just sitting there. Especially for a place that barely has customers.

2.description: I got the tamales from here and I wasn't expecting anything special, but I didn't think it would be as bad as it turned out to be. They were those crappy Tom-Tom tamales, which are typically okay. But these tamales tasted like they were salted, salted, and then for good measure salted again! Disgusting! I was dying for something to drink and wasn't even able to finish half. I Will Not Be Back.

0.description: I've been going to UIC for two years now and only recently realized this gem. A veggie burrito is less than $5 and is really good. It's got beans (black or pinto), seasoned cooked rice, sauteed onions, lettuce, tomato and cheese. I get mine with no cheese add hot sauce. It's cost as much as a subway sandwich but you end up with a lot more protein and less carbs. I only wish that they would throw some fresh avocado in!

58.description: I love this restaurant.  I like to go early, so I have the place to myself, but I've been there at later times, when they're quite busy, and enjoyed myself.  They roast their coffee beans, which I just love.  Their menu is simple and good.  One of the many things I love about this restaurant is that they don't overserve.  Over time, I've had almost everything on the menu, and find everything delicious.I love the fact they showcase artists works in this restaurant, some of which are available for sale.  And, while I've had both good service, and not so good service, I find that many of their employees are very young who are just starting out, and will learn with time, how to be good servers.

56.description: Surprised this place has such low reviews.  I went there for the first time yesterday for lunch with a friend, and I was really really excited to find a place like this so close to UIC.  I got the vegetarian panini after much debate (everything looked delicious! they've got waffles, french toast, burritos, chili, etc.) with fries, and I really enjoyed my meal.  Afterward, I got a caramel/chocolate latte and it was sooo good. Seriously.  However, the service was total crap.

29.description: Slow service, but the food is worth the wait.  Better than waiting for Sweet Maple down the street.  And easier to find a parking place.  And if you still have room when you're done, you can get an Italian ice next door!  We'll definitely be back.

42.description: This place doesn't look like much from the outside or the inside, but the breakfast food is awesome...particularly the french toast.  It's three pieces of brioche filled with a sweet cream and topped with strawberries and bananas.  The sweet cream is AMAZING.  Though some may think it is a little too sweet, it's balanced out by the brioche which is soft and can be cut with a fork.  The strawberries and bananas are ripe and add just the right amount of fruitiness to the french toast.  The only downside is that you have to order your sides separately, but it only comes out to be about $12 for the entire meal...that is IF you get the french toast.If you do get the sides, prepared to be beyond full when you leave.  The french toast alone is meal enough for most, but I tend to like my eggs and sausage/bacon with my breakfast and the combo will keep you full until dinner.Now, looking at everyone's comments, people seem to be quite irked by the servers, but honestly, Demitasse is within the heart of the UIC campus.  The servers are college students...who wouldn't be a little stink-faced that early in the morning and then have to go to class?  Every time I've gone, the servers have always come back to ask if we're doing alright and though they can seem as if they don't want to be there, I sympathize with their situation and applaud them for having jobs and wanting to make money on their own instead of constantly relying on mommy and daddy.  If you want a fine-dining experience, there are other places to try.As for food, this place is great and I definitely recommend the french toast for anyone who goes!

23.description: I've been going to this place for a very long time. When I first went to this place, it was called Jamoch's. The owner is the sweetest man in the world. I've had mostly everything on the menu. The service is awesome here. Sometimes it's better than the food :) It's always what brings me back. This is one of those places that I hope I can pass onto my children or nieces when they go to college. Their chili is so fresh and like home made. The open face tuna sandwich is good. They have great coffee drinks and tea. And they make great Italian sodas. I love this place from the bottom of my heart.

47.description: Baaad service, okay food, coffee is good 3 out of 5 times. I keep going back because it's close and not as crowded as other places on Taylor St., but todays experience was the worst. Servers are not friendly and have poop face expressions. They take forever to come to the table, mess up simple orders, and don't refill coffee frequently. It's not cheap either so I'm expecting better service. This place would do a lot better with better service.Today it took well over 15 minutes to get a server and that was only after I went to the counter and asked for one. She seemed easily confused and glazed over.  The place was crowded by their standards but not by Sunday brunch standards. It was all around bad service and food is mediocre, but how creative can you get with eggs and bacon anyway.  I don't think I'll go back.

8.description: The food at Demitasse is ok. But, there are better places for breakfast and/or lunch in the area.

31.description: I like their coffee and food, but I barely ever get to go there because they close so early!

34.description: For 5+ years, this has been by go-to place for an awesome breakfast and coffee.  The BEST pancakes you can find and awesome fritatas.  The owner and staff are always helpful. Lunch is great too, especially the panini sandwiches!  Demitasse may not be cheap, but it is the best service (wait staff actually is super-helpful) AND quality food around... which keeps me coming back!

16.description: This place is great for coffees and drinks during breakfast time or during the evening. Chai Lattes and Cocoa Java are my favorite drinks.Not much of a fan of their food, mainly because of the small selection.

13.description: They took a really long time with my friend and I's order, and the food was pretty good when it got to us but I ordered an Angus Burger medium well to go for my boyfriend, and it was burnt completely through. It was hard for him to even bite into and felt like a rock. There is really cute artwork hanging around so I like how everything looks, but everything else was just okay.

11.description: It's a cross between coffee cafe and retro diner.  I stopped for breakfast-to-go during the week, it was pretty low key.I ordered an iced chai and an egg white fritatta.  The chai was a good bold and spicy brew, just the kind of kick I needed in the morning.  The fritatta was a bit of a let down.  The cheese was a little on the rubbery side, the eggs and potatoes were pretty flavorless.  And nowhere in my to-go bag did I have any salt or pepper.  However, I did have enough butter pads to butter an entire loaf of bread.  I digged the atmosphere more than the food.  Mediocre at best.

39.description: Stopped in early in the AM, coffee was terrible, very watered down , pretty gross

37.description: I would have given Demitasse a 5 star if I was rating their coffee alone. They roast they're own and it is honestly the best I have had! I enjoy going into Demitasse for a coffee when Laura and Justin are working. They are very friendly, provide great service and make a MEAN latte! However, I am not a big fan on the food service. It is very inconsistent on timing and portions... especially potatoes. Just throw on some more potatoes!I recommend you stop in for a bag of their coffee beans, they have a large variety of flavors and you won't regret it!

0.description: This place is a hidden gem in University Village. A friend and I stopped in on the way to church. All of the food was extremely good and fresh. The staff was very kind and the prices were affordable. They have traditional breakfast items--some items with a little twist. My friend ordered the waffles and loved every bite! I order the Italian frittata and it was so delicious. Everything was really good--the food is worth the trip! I will definitely come back again.

38.description: I have never had a bad experience hereDemitasse an inexpensive place to relax and have breakfast or lunch, nice and simplemy faves::French Toast  Tuna Salad/ Fruitcroissant breakfast sandwichplain old eggs and toast with chicken sausage (with pico)as far as service, It is   e x a c t l y   what it should be. cafe work is very tedious, and the hours are long, the check average is not that of a trendy brunch place, and for you whiny yelpers, I wouldn't want to run up and down and around for your $3.50 tip either Disclaimer(avoid the fritattas and scrambled eggs)

51.description: Despite its small size, this place knows how to rock breakfast!Don't be fooled if this place isn't packed. It is down the street from a few well known breakfast joints, but I think Demitasse is great. It may take a while to order your food or it can be very quick. It depends on staff. I've dealt with both before and sometimes you just have to roll with the punches and be patient. They do have coffee drinks that they make with care, usually the owner is around to talk to, really nice guy.Frittatas are pretty good (Open-face omelet served with house potatoes)At first it doesn't seem like a lot of food, then when you start, your belly fills. I am not a fan of their french toast with sweet cream and strawberries. It is a bit too tart for me (diabetic) and there is a lot of cream they put in between the toast. If you are looking for somewhere with a seat and cheap, give this place a try. In the winter, this place is great to get warm drinks at.

27.description: Demitasse is one of my regular stops in the morning to grab a great cup of coffee.  They roast their own coffee and are always super friendly as I walk in and out.I enjoy their breakfast as it's simple and affordable!

32.description: What a disappointment!  My girlfriend and I stopped in for brunch with a fairly tight schedule of 70 minutes.  Our waitress came quickly with menus, but walked away without asking if we wanted to order a drink immediately.  She returned after a short time for our drink order, but did not offer to take our food order.  Admittedly, we should have pressed our order right then, but the place was clearing out and we felt we had time.  Wrong!A few minutes passed when the waitress returned with our drinks in plastic to-go cups.  She gave no explanation, nor did we ask.  Everyone in the place had glassware, so we excussed the issue with thoughts that they must be out of clean glasses at the moment.  We sat talking a while when we finally discussed that it had been too long with no food arriving, 30 minutes since the order was placed at least.The place had cleared out, so we were concerned about why we had no food.  We decided to ask when we could, but our waitress was AWOL.  Next we saw her she was delivering food to a single diner who had arrived at least 20 minutes after us.  We caught her and asked on our food.  She made a quick excuse as she kept walking away from us that they had been very busy, so the kitchen was behind.  We waited another 10 to 15 minutes and asked her to box our food when it came up as we had no time to eat now.  We received our bill which showed an hour had passed since we placed our order with her and we still had no food.  We did finally receive our boxed food a few minutes later.My girlfriend rushed off to work with no breakfast and no opportunity to eat until 4 pm today and I returned home, less than 5 minutes away, to find my flapjacks cold.  I do not know who made the error and do not care.  I will not be returning and I suggest you chose a different Sunday brunch location.

54.description: Went here for brunch one Sunday because the other nearby brunch spot was packed and had a long line. They didn't have a large menu, but I'm not one to complain about that. The food was....good....but nothing to brag about. I was just happy to fill my stomach, and it was about $10 each. I might eat here again, but the food really didn't exude any great vibe or have any special flavor that would make me crave it.

48.description: Right next door to Mario's is a really cool coffee shop with great food.  They have an incredible coffee urn in the window.  Can't be in a hurry when you are here but the food is good and freshly roasted coffee need I say more?

44.description: Well, I will keep this short and sweet. The place is nice and trendy, but the service is HORRIBLE. Do not understand how when there are only 2 other tables in the restaurant with guest sitting at them and we were not approached by the server to ask for our order until after being there for 10 minutes. Then, after she took our order she went to go make our coffees, I am guessing, but then got side tracked by a gentleman who came in ordering an iced whatever. She begins to make his Iced thing a ma jig and totally forgets about our order. Another server came by and asked had someone taken our order. I told her yes and she went over to the other girl and you could see the other girl  make a face like she totally forgot what we asked for. She came by our table after remembering the appetizer and asked again what else had we asked for. By this time we had been in the restaurant for over 20 minutes and basically no one else in the place. We said not to worry about it. Ate our appetizer, paid and left.With the staff they have, amazing they are able to keep people coming in. Probably only because the other GOOD places are packed.NEVER, NEVER, NEVER AGAIN!!!

24.description: The worst service I have ever had at a restaurant.  The entire staff didn't acknowledge us, walked out after ten minutes of no service.

7.description: Some of the best coffee and scones in Chicago! When I have time I also enjoy the different breakfast sandwiches and lunch options. Great service, reasonably priced and excellent coffee and food.

49.description: We went this this restaurant today after going to a family event at UIC.  Very disappointed.  After sitting down with our 2 boys (ages 10 and 7) we noticed the the artwork of naked women on the wall.  Not what I was expecting to expose my kids to in a coffee/breakfast/lunch restaurant.Service was very slow and very bad.  We found it funny that they never asked us if we wanted coffee in the coffee shop!  Which we did, but no one asked.We were a party of 6 and we all got our food at the same time except for 1 person who didn't get his food until we were finished with our food.It was not attractive to watch the waitress sneeze on her hand, blow her nose several times, then sneeze again and serve the food.  It was also not fun to watch the waitress texting on her phone for most of the time we were there.  And also watch her sit down at the coffee bar and eat while we were waiting for our food.Toward the end of our visit, a glass of water was accidentally spilled all over our table and no one offered to clean it up.  Not even the waitress when she was picking up our dishes!Should have gone to Subway across the street.

40.description: Personally, I like the staff at Demitasse. Quirky, and fun. Also, I love all of their dishes! Everything always tastes fresh.The fritattas are awesome, and the pancakes are perfection!  (The Italian Flag is my favorite.) If you like sweets, they have an amazing stack of french toast. Also, the Caprese panini is great for lunch. Add chicken for a nice touch. My favorite brunch spot in Chicago.

53.description: When I walked in on a Saturday and noticed that only a few tables were occupied I immediately wondered "why aren't there more people here?" It's a good question to ask because I know if I head to nearby Meli or Sweet Maple that there definitely would have been lines. So why not Demitasse?The restaurant itself is nice enough. Is it charming? No not particularly. It's nice enough and there are a bunch of tables and booths which is nice. The staff is friendly and there are a good amount of options on the menu ranging from traditional egg dishes to sweet pancakes and french toast. So what is it about this place that makes it OK, but nothing particularly special? Well, the food is just OK. I enjoyed my breakfast, a frittata with cheddar, zucchini, onion and tomato, but really if you're putting zucchini as an ingredient why only shred it over the top? Coffee was fine but nothing spectacular either. For my entree, coffee, tax and tip I walked out of there spending $15 and again while it was all OK, I wished that I'd had something with a little bit more pazzaz for that price.

30.description: It's a cross between coffee cafe and retro diner.  I stopped for breakfast-to-go during the week, it was pretty low key.I ordered an iced chai and an egg white fritatta.  The chai was a good bold and spicy brew, just the kind of kick I needed in the morning.  The fritatta was a bit of a let down.  The cheese was a little on the rubbery side, the eggs and potatoes were pretty flavorless.  And nowhere in my to-go bag did I have any salt or pepper.  However, I did have enough butter pads to butter an entire loaf of bread.  I digged the atmosphere more than the food.  Mediocre at best.

46.description: My friend and I were tired of the food at UIC so we decided to go and try Demitasse, since it's close and we've always been curious about it. It's tucked away on taylor street in the mists of Al's beef and Mario's Italian Ice. Many people pass by it, not giving it a second look because it's never as full as any of the other places on Taylor street. We ordered food (which you can see in pictures that will be posted soon.Snicker latte, was ok, I would rather go to starbucks, but it's okThe grilled chicken sandwich was really good. It comes with chips on the side, provolone, chicken, pesto, and bacon. This sandwich I will come back for because it was pretty good! Overall, the staff is friendly, the place is clean but not full, and the food was ok. Hence the 3 stars

1.description: I ordered the grilled chicken panini. No chicken on this panini, only greasy bacon fat. The panini seemed soggy as hell and I did not have time to wait for a new one...I unfortunately had to go to subway.Maybe their coffee service is good but I would not come here again for food!

55.description: Hmmm, loved the nostalgia of this place.  But really, its nothing to brag about.  Makes me wanna yawn a bit.  The food was extremely bland.  We decided to hit this place up after going to SMC and realizing that they were closed for some odd reason.  It was truly heart breaking.  So we decided to venture out of the norm and try our hand at Demitasse.  Hmmm, I could have made better breakfast at home.  Its not too hard to make eggs just right or make sure the food is served fresh.  If you consider yourself a breakfast foodie, stay clear.  You will be disappointed.   I was heartbroken after leaving.  I ate at a place that left no memorable references of having a good meal.  Try harder next time.

9.description: I frequent Demitasse to cure those Sunday morning hangovers and when I don't feel like paying an arm and a leg for breakfast. I love the family-owned, friendly atmosphere and good vibes. Their fresh coffee always energizes me to tackle my Sunday strongly. I usually get the vegetarian breakfast burrito... it fills me up all day. I highly recommend this fine breakfast establishment.

26.description: I wanted to love this place, but the service makes that impossible.I came in to pick up a to go order and i was greeted, paid and asked to wait. What was I waiting for? The skinny, very blonde girl with massive hipster glasses to finish her lunch. I flipped through magazines, read an article or two and began thinking how long does it take to latte soup? I decided to put down the magazine and go ask what was the hold up. Upon eye contact the girl put down her fork and went to the window to pick up my soup. WOW. The soup was fine, nothing too special and you can get it as good from a can with more chicken. I hate to interrupt people so i won't be back.

25.description: Had a great breakfast here.

12.description: I was here recently and immediately fell in love with the place. The service was fast and friendly. I had the chicken pannini which was a bit dry for my liking. But I had the iced chai latte to beat that. The special of the day, bombay omlette was top notch! and the chicken quesadilla too. I would totally recommend people to this place for a nice sunday brunch!

59.description: "Meh" indeed.  Lackluster service, decent food, poor coffee (and it's a coffee place!), overpriced.My girlfriend likes their bacon-egg-cheese-croissant thing to go, and I think that's the best part of it.  Had breakfast there today and had a worse than normal experience: the staff didn't notice we had come in until they served the two tables after us (over 10 minutes), no refills on drinks (coffee and water), another table's food at first, still no refills, dishes didn't get taken off of the table... yeah.  The guy at the counter, who said he was the manager, was apologetic and took a couple of bucks off of our $23 ticket.We keep coming back because the lines are insane at Sweet Maple Cafe, and we keep hoping it will be better.  This probably isn't helping convince them they should do better!  Oh well.

21.description: I've gone here 4-5 times over a year, and the food has always been great. The customer service has not been an issue so far. The food is on the higher price for breakfast, but is still go because its good.

17.description: $3.75 for a cup of orange juice to go....

10.description: Great breakfast and great service on taylor street. If your in the UIC ares you must stop in and try the Jack special.

5.description: Great food for a great price. I had the banana and toasted pecan waffle with strawberries instead of bananas and it was fantastic!

3.description: Got the firecracker, one of the best things I've ever had. Service was decent, coffee was pretty good. The art made me feel like I was in a 1990s time capsule. Definitely would reccomend at least what I got to someone else.

35.description: I've never eaten here, but there coffee is really amazing, the staff is super friendly, and I'm a fan of their decor. I wish they were open later/more often because it's such a hassle to walk to Starbucks and I think Demitasse has better coffee.

19.description: The reviewers who complained about the service were spot on.  The problem is that the kitchen is small and seems to be staffed by well-intentioned amateurs.  We came at noon on a Saturday and found seats immediately.  (This is a "seat yourself" establishment.)  Unfortunately, our server warned us that we'd be left to our own devices for 15 minutes because the kitchen was backed up.  We tried to get things rolling in the right direction by requesting that she take our drink orders right away.  She did, sort of, but that didn't make our food come any faster.  We persuaded our server to take our orders fairly soon, but we still had to wait and wait before the kitchen was able to deal with us.I ordered the "special": two eggs, browned potatoes, bacon, Italian toast.  The latter consisted of toasted slices of Italian bread.  The bacon was overcooked by my standards.  In fact, it was overcooked by all standards: it was so hard that I couldn't pierce it with the tines of my fork.  The eggs were of supermarket-quality (i.e., nothing special).  There was nothing egregiously wrong with Demitasse but I'm sure that there are better options up and down the street.  Chez Joel looked pretty good to us when we went walking after our lunch.

28.description: This place has so many healthy breakfast options. I feel healthier just walking in. Coffee and fritatas are great. A few times I just ordered a breakfast sandwich to go.. I have been here usually on weekdays so service isn't too bad but the time that I did go on a weekend...service was slow. One waitress for the whole place. If you just want a place to relax and have some coffee and goodies...this is a good place.

45.description: This place is truly truly under-rated. The food at this place is some of the BEST HOME MADE breakfast foods in the area. If you're like me and are sick of fru fru breakfast places that are packed to the brim, with 30 minute wait, then you should definitely give demitasse a try. You can tell everything here is made with care and from scratch. You won't find any frozen shipped potatoes here. The french toast is dipped in their own batter recipe, and their pancakes are honestly the best i have ever had. Simple, but so delicious. Not that dry cardboard stuff you get at i hop. Get the pancakes with amaretto and almonds. WOW!! the ham is also off the bone. If you want an honest, simply delicious breakfast, with fresh ingredients,come here.Oh and thats only the food. What they are actually most known for is their coffee. All that talk about people roasting their coffee beans like its a trend, Demitasse has been doing that for YEARS. The guy roasts his own beans in the back of the restaurant, and you'd definitely know it once you walk in. The place just smells of freshly roasted beans all the time. And its great coffee. Great food, great coffee, no hassle, no wait.

33.description: The reviewers who complained about the service were spot on.  The problem is that the kitchen is small and seems to be staffed by well-intentioned amateurs.  We came at noon on a Saturday and found seats immediately.  (This is a "seat yourself" establishment.)  Unfortunately, our server warned us that we'd be left to our own devices for 15 minutes because the kitchen was backed up.  We tried to get things rolling in the right direction by requesting that she take our drink orders right away.  She did, sort of, but that didn't make our food come any faster.  We persuaded our server to take our orders fairly soon, but we still had to wait and wait before the kitchen was able to deal with us.I ordered the "special": two eggs, browned potatoes, bacon, Italian toast.  The latter consisted of toasted slices of Italian bread.  The bacon was overcooked by my standards.  In fact, it was overcooked by all standards: it was so hard that I couldn't pierce it with the tines of my fork.  The eggs were of supermarket-quality (i.e., nothing special).  There was nothing egregiously wrong with Demitasse but I'm sure that there are better options up and down the street.  Chez Joel looked pretty good to us when we went walking after our lunch.

43.description: I'm on a hunt for new brunch spots, so I've been hitting Taylor St. quite a bit.  This is not a spot I'll be revisting.  It needs an overhaul, which I guess shouldn't really matter, but there's something unsettling about eating in a place that looks so unorganized.  Food:  Meh.  If I was looking to get a quick breakfast sandwich on the go, I might stop by.  If I'm looking to sit with my mom and have our standard Sunday  brunch, I'm not doing this.  Mom wasn't terribly hungry, so she was fine with her egg, cheese, ham and tomato on a bagel for less than $5.  I, on the other hand, was ready to gnaw my arm off, and was underwhelmed by my bacon frittata.  Edible?  Sure.  Something I could have made at home??  YEP.  That defeats the purpose of me going to brunch.  I will agree with other reviewers that the coffee is pretty good. Service:  Meh.  Not terrible, but nothing to write home about.  Also defeats the purpose of me not cooking something at home.  Interesting note about the service - I'm pretty sure Joan M. (review below me) was my server this morning.  Thanks for playing, Joan M.  I'm going to disagree about things being made from scratch, *especially* the potatoes.

2.description: Tried this spot again and enjoyed my meal a bit more this time around. I ordered oatmeal and the hefty portion left me more than satisfied. Still sticking with the three stars.

18.description: This sweet little place near the UIC campus is a great place for breakfast. I enjoyed their french toast with bananas and pecans. There was some confusion about my order, but it was quickly remedied and they charged me less for the trouble. So nice.

41.description: After a long bike ride, we decided to stop by to have a quick breakfast.The staff was nice and attentive.  The restaurant was not full so I'm sure that helped.I tried their stuffed french toast which I thought was ok.  Nothing special about it.This brunch spot, overall, was just ok.

52.description: I'm not a particularly awkward person, but the servers here brought out the awkward in me.  I walked in here on a Friday afternoon around 2:40 pm, 20 minutes before closing, seeking an iced coffee and a baked good. After my eyes adjusted to the change in light, I noticed that both of the servers were standing completely still and looking at me like "uhh.."  Me:  Are you open?Girl: Uh, we close in 20 minutes.Me: So... can I order something?Girl: Uh, I don't know... we're closing in 20 minutes. [Pause as I glance around awkwardly and she is still staring at me like "uhh." The guy behind the counter runs to the back to hide, or at least that's what it seemed like.]Me: Okay, so is that a no?Girl: Uh, no, I don't know, I'm not sure. Me: Um.. I want an iced coffee. Should I go somewhere else or not? Girl: Oh, well yea, I guess that's fine. You can order that. I don't know if I am brave enough to go back in there and face the extreme awkwardness.  The iced coffee was pretty good.  There were very few baked goods available, and the chocolate cookie I got seemed like it might have once been pretty good, two to three days ago, when it was baked.  It's right by my house so I want to like it.  I want to be able to go every Saturday! But I won't.  I might not go back, ever. If I do ever gather enough courage and confidence to walk in there some other time and try one of the more substantial items on the menu, I will surely update my review.  As for now I give stars as follows:Service: 0Drinks: 3Food: 1The average of the three scores coming to 1.33333 but I'll round up to 2 for the sake of the iced coffee.

50.description: I've gone on a few occasions. The staff is friendly and I haven't had to wait long before orders are taken and fresh coffee was quickly brought over and i didn't even have to ask for cream; they were also willing to do separate checks. The parfait was delicious and I got a taste of what everyone ordered. From breakfast burritos to oatmeal to their breakfast specials everything was pretty good. However, somehow i'm left without a feeling of excitement and a wanting to go back (hence the 3 stars). Was it the empty feeling of the place? The mostly bare walls? The usual breakfast/brunch menu found everywhere else? Who knows... I feel like I need to come when its full (if the do have a rush period) and see if there is a different feel to it.

4.description: I go to UIC at the moment so this place is not a long walk from the engineering buildings! truly I think its closer and many times more delicious than dunkin donuts!I got a chai latte with a shot of coffee, I used to be a avid drinker of coffee although I no longer am but wow did I enjoy this coffee! It literally lasted me all day and not to mention that it was probably even better cold!I really want to go back any try some of their food..the place is really neat and has a bit of a retro vibe which is always fun - service was quick and painless also!

6.description: It's a solid breakfast/brunch place. It seems like a lot of locals are here. The food was fine, but the menu isn't huge. We got the bacon frittata and the frittata with chicken. They were both solid and very similar to omelettes. I think the only difference is that frittatas have ingredients scrambled in, and omelettes are just folded in.There's local art and decor, and it feels very homey. I like a larger variety and more creativity in breakfast goods so I'll probably try other places before coming back, but if you are looking for simple breakfast food without super long waits, this is the place to go in the area!

22.description: It's the sort of food you'd expect a bachelor would only make in the privacy of his home, alone.

15.description: I've been going to this place for a very long time. When I first went to this place, it was called Jamoch's. The owner is the sweetest man in the world. I've had mostly everything on the menu. The service is awesome here. Sometimes it's better than the food :) It's always what brings me back. This is one of those places that I hope I can pass onto my children or nieces when they go to college. Their chili is so fresh and like home made. The open face tuna sandwich is good. They have great coffee drinks and tea. And they make great Italian sodas. I love this place from the bottom of my heart.

57.description: Both my boyfriend and I have been wanting to go here for years, but it never seems to be open (that should have been our first sign).  The awning outside the place has a really nice and modern design which is what interested us. We finally went today and only ordered two small coffees.  I may have ordered a bite to eat but they never offered us a menu, and the pastries in the small case looked extremely unappealing.  Plus, the space seemed disorganized, dirty, and hodge podge.To top it off, the coffee was terrible.  Supposedly they roast their own beans here - and I would assume that anyone who takes the time to do this would have more care in the actual cup of coffee that they serve.  It was pretty much hot water (with a slight hint of coffee taste).  We literally ended up throwing both cups out and went elsewhere (not exactly how I want to spend my money from my tight budget).Sorry, but I would definitely warn others not to be fooled by the 'cover' of this 'book'.P.S.  Don't even that going here as a substitute for Sweet Maple Cafe to avoid it line is a good idea (the lines are long there for a reason).

20.description: Good:  they roast their own coffee and it really is delicious.  Bad:  they need to stick to just making coffee because they have NO clue what it means to provide customer service in a restaurant setting.   Sunday brunch--empty.   There were tables open, no waiting.   That speaks volumes.  We sat in our booth for 15 minutes before even getting a glass of water or put in our coffee order.  We ordered and didn't get our food for 45 minutes.    When our food finally came, it was below average.   The potatoes were not edible.   We had to ASK for water/coffee refills, syrup to put on our waffles, and hot sauce for the breakfast burrito.   There is NO sense of urgency among the staff (which was 2 servers...FOR SUNDAY BRUNCH). The only thing that came quickly was the bill, which we only had to ask for once.     When we got the bill, we were charged for pico de gallo which was supposed to be included with my burrito.    This was the final straw.   I spoke with the manager and his response was "I'm sorry you feel that way.   What do you want me to do?"           I want you to reconsider your plan for your business because this is unacceptable and I know that nobody in my party will ever return and bad reviews travel fast...

36.description: I went here as a youngster in the first couple weeks they were open...long ago!Sometimes I go often, I like it late morning it isn't too crowded on a weekday (closed Mondays I believe).I like the coffee variety, the baked goods and the waffles I have had here were excellent and I like the old ice cream parlor vibe.The au lait is usually the best.

14.description: I wanted to love this place, but the service makes that impossible.I came in to pick up a to go order and i was greeted, paid and asked to wait. What was I waiting for? The skinny, very blonde girl with massive hipster glasses to finish her lunch. I flipped through magazines, read an article or two and began thinking how long does it take to latte soup? I decided to put down the magazine and go ask what was the hold up. Upon eye contact the girl put down her fork and went to the window to pick up my soup. WOW. The soup was fine, nothing too special and you can get it as good from a can with more chicken. I hate to interrupt people so i won't be back.

3.description: Great little spot. We were pleasantly surprised especially since it was hotel food. We tried a couple of the salads and the crab cakes, which were very filling. Service was quick and pleasant, and ultimately the restaurant wasn't one I'd visit if it were in my town. If you're in Chicago, staying at the Marriot or nearby and are too tired to catch the train to go into town this will do.

1.description: Rooks Lounge is located within the marriot on Rush's campus just north of UIC.  I don't often eat in locations like this unless there is no time to go anywhere else.  But that being said, we ate breakfast and lunch here while sitting for a financial seminar over the weekend. Breakfast Buffet looked rough.... so we didn't get it.  Can't give it a grade because we steered clear of it! I ordered the breakfast sandwich.  B+  It was a warm tasty egg, bacon, cheese on toasted white bread.  Hard to screw up and I did enjoy it.  I did have to reduce stars due to the waiter disappearing for 20 minutes and making us late to our seminar.  We had to physically get up from our table to get him to take our order and then to pay our bill.  We were one of three tables.For lunch we had and hour and figured it would be tight to try to go elsewhere.  Also, a manager or someone came into the seminar and told everyone that if they at lunch at the hotel their parking would be validated.Sooooooo, everyone (50+ people) ate at Rooks Lounge.   Well, you would figure if they are going to invite that many people to eat all at once they would prepare......  Nope.So, orders were screwed up, meals were forgotten, drinks were never delivered.  Just kind of poor planning and preparation.  I don't know, I was annoyed.   Food was ok when It came out.  I had the Blackened Chicken Caesar Salad.  B+It wasn't the greatest dining experiences I've ever had, but it is also a Hotel Restaurant and Lounge so maybe my expectations are too high!

2.description: I stayed in the adjacent hotel during the week and would come down to the restaurant in the early evenings for a glass of wine and a few appetizers.  The wine list was nothing particularly special.  The wines offered by the glass were essentially wines you could find at a local grocery store chain. But the appetizers were outstanding.  The crab cakes were beautifully moist and flavorful, the pork popsicles were beautifully cooked with just the perfect amount of char.  Unfortunately it's been a few weeks since I've been there, so I don't remember all the details from the other appetizers I had.  But if you're staying at the UIC Marriott or anywhere nearby, make sure to check it out!

5.description: Friendly service from a knowledgeable bartender.  They didn't have either chocolate vodka or dark creme de cacao, but he does make a mean chocolate martini.  And he gives good advice about the neighborhood.  Take some time to get to know him.

6.description: 4.5 stars, if that were a possibility.I ate here for the first time today.  3:30 "lunch", we were the only group in the  pleasant dining area.  I had chicken soup with lovely presentation.  Longer, wide noodles, kindof hard to finish gracefully, but veeery tasty.  Comes with large white bread balls already soaked in the soup.  I asked for wheat bread instead, my request  was granted.Pace of the meal was a little slow considering we were the only ones there. The bartender served us and did a really excellent job.  I doubt we looked rushed, and we certainly gave him no indication that he needed to pick up the pace.One of the people in the group had the French Onion soup and found it to be a bit too salty.Validated Parking,  this  is the only option I've found with this type of food in the area that validates.The rest of the menu looked tasty, I can't wait to come back!

7.description: I love this lounge!  I go here often. Many intellectuals from the Medical Center gather here after work.  They usually have an excellent bartender, nice cocktails, small but lovely lounge area, TV, just great.  You can also eat in the lounge as it is connected to the restaurant. This is an ideal place for a meet and greet.  You have to do the valet parking, but the bartender will validate your parking ticket.  Fantastic!

0.description: great hotel lobby bar.  not 506, but great all the same.jim, the bartender was awesome.  everyone was real friendly - real good vibes at this spot.  stop in for a pop before you hit up the shuttle and go to couscous!

4.description: We were staying at the Marriott and decided we were just too tired on day 3 of our 4 day trip. We had already had picked up pizza on the way home so we just went down stairs for a bloody mary for myself and my husband just got a beer. Jim, the bartender was fantastic. We discussed a few minutes on what a Bloody Mary snob I am and he made a fantastic bloody mary. The man definitely knows his job. There also was a waitress that was briefly there that talked to us and played with our daughter. (We were the only ones there) Definitely a nice little lounge for a hotel.

3.description: Kudos to Julie for always making my eyebrows look awesome

1.description: Terrible.  She cut my hair WAY shorter than I told her.   I am very upset.  I told her more than once that I wanted long hair and to only cut the tips.

2.description: I've been going to the same woman for over 10 years now and she does a great job. Every other person I've ever let thread my eyebrows screwed them up, except for the ladies at Bollybrow. If I'm near UIC, I stop there instead of my other place. They do a great job for an amazing price.

0.description: SO affordable! I've gotten my eyebrows threaded here and underarms done on two different occasions and both times have been completely satisfied! Since I'm a student I don't have a lot of $$ for these services so for the price it's awesome since the estheticians are not any less skilled at more expensive places. Conveniently located on the UIC east campus in Student Center East so it's easy to get to if you're on campus for class or coming from the 8 bus stop on polk or UIC-Halsted blue line stop. The space is super clean and comfortable and the service doesn't take very long. Sometimes there is a wait, but it really depends on what times you go. Looking forward to my next visit !

58.description: I am rating this place two stars because I was not satisfied with the taste of the food. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't up to my expectations. I went there about two weeks ago and it was on a Friday. My interest to go to Rosebud was serious! Every time I would pass through Taylor street it would be crowded, so I figured this place would be exceptional. I ordered Chicken Parmesan. I was in the mood for something simple and so I thought that what I ordered would be extra delicious since it's a simple dish. The portion of the food was a very generous amount. I have no complains. My main disappointment was the fact that the sauce was simply not as saucy, and it was a little on the bland side. How could Chicken Parmesan go wrong? Overpriced as well. Out all things on the menu why would something this simple not be delicious in an authentic Italian restaurant? It's very weird to say that the sauce wasn't saucy enough because the chicken had a good amount of sauce in it but it wasn't thick and rich in texture and flavor. I don't see myself coming to this place again. Cheesecake Factory over this any time.

56.description: Taylor street is definitely where worlds collide and on this particular afternoon my husband, sister and I decided that we would treat ourselves to a decadent late lunch. We were distractedly amused to be among Blackhawk fans that began to drift in on this the 4th game of the playoffs. The area is also ground zero for the medical community which brought us into the mix. Our meals ranged from great ( my Eggplant Parm was awesome) to mediocre, (Shrimp stuffed Tilapia, my sister was disappointed with) and (Sea Bass, which husband did enjoy) but we were all bent on conviviality and left satiated. My reason for writing however; is motivated by what came afterward, I realized 45 minutes later (as I arrived at my doorstep) I did not have my purse (keys, I.D. etc.). Did I mention we were distracted and convivial? After an immediate "about face"  I called the restaurant and asked if my bag was found, and where we had been seated. "Gina" answered saying "It was not at the station...she would look, and call me back".  20 minutes passed and yet another 20 minutes away. I called back and was informed by "Joe" that "he had a full restaurant, no one turned it in and he would not send anyone to look"...Flash forward.... I was told not to enter the dining room... I was allowed to point out the table where we had short time before seated and icily told to "stand where I would not be in the way" , he "Joe" would ask the guest. When he returned with what can only be described as an expression of contempt, he handed my bag off as if it was filled with radio active material. The food is fine but served without soul...I hope my leftovers tomorrow can remove the bad taste from this evening.

29.description: This is a wonderful Italian food establishment. I came for a company dinner event and I was pleasantly surprised with the good service and delicious well prepared food. We started off with stuffed mushrooms appetizer which was pretty good, moist panko crusted outter layer. I had a garden salad to prepare me for my bone in ribeye steak. The bone in was cooked to perfection as I requested and didn't need any sauce. It had a great balance of fat and meat which made the meat delicious and savory.The desert with a rosebud tiramisu which is large and couldn't finish but it was not overly sweet but full of vanilla flavor.

42.description: My linguine with clams tasted really salty and incredibly bland. There were no redeeming qualities about this place. The waiters were trying to nickel and dime me because I didn't order any alcohol. The steak was also rubbery and not cooked to my liking. Don't ever go here.

23.description: What can I say about the Rosebud? Wood paneled elegance, lovely ambience, good drinks, nice wine list, superb service, excellent food, generous portions, variety of desserts, wonderful cappuccinos...music by the Chairman, whose portrait in the dining room raises a toast to this fine establishment!  Hubby and I have been here on many occasions, and have yet to be disappointed. Most any menu selection will be well prepared and delicious. Rosebud provides warm bread-focaccia and crusty Italian-with olive oil and grated cheese.  We requested antipasti, and were presented with a lovely selection of Italian deli meats, cheeses, veggies (including eggplant) on a bed of arugula. We highly recommend the ziti-pasta, tomato, basil, cheese, crumbled sausage, perfectly sauced. In the past, if we did not see a dish on the menu, we asked, and our requests were accommodated. Great service from all staff! Server Tony was knowledgeable about menu items and answered all my questions. Valet parking is available and recommended.

47.description: Awesome experience! Amazing food! Excellent service! Owner greets you as you walk in and checks up on tables. Celebrities from the 1970's come here, from frank Sinatra to al Capone! It's a must eat! You're all missing out!

8.description: How have I never reviewed Rosebud on Taylor? I've been here for numerous business dinners and lunches and stopped by with a co-worker today after a meeting at Rush MC.Rosebud is one of the OG's of Chicago Italian food, and they have pictures of just about every famous person on the planet to prove it - JFK, Frank Sinatra, Robert DiNero, Oprah and the dad from Tommy Boy. The interior is dark and cozy - if it's busy you might feel a bit crowded. They've got a very nice wine list (as I'd expect) with a good number of by-the-glass options at not terrible prices. Alas, it was a work lunch so no wine for me. I picked penne Bolognese and my co-worker went with carbonara which she kindly shared. The carbonara wasn't the "traditional" with beaten egg and pancetta - rather it's a creamy parmesan sauce with mushrooms and peas. Very, very rich but good all the same and if you love mushrooms (I'm indifferent at best) know that the ones they used were meaty and flavorful. I'm tough on Bolognese sauce because I make a mean one and Rosebud's was really good - very meaty and not too tomato-y. Again, not strictly traditional (I didn't see veg in there) but tasty, and who am I to question 40-year old recipes?Service was fine - waters were refilled regularly but we had to ask for a refill on iced tea. Prices are quite reasonable for lunch (most dishes under $15) and the portions were enormous. I know there are other Rosebud's in the city, but the original location has a lot of charm and is worth a visit.

31.description: I love this place! My family and I have been coming here for years. The service is great-friendly, attentive waitstaff who are happy to give recommendations (that are always on point by the way). Ambiance is also really nice. Kind of a dim, candlelit, romantic vibe going. They always have Frank Sinatra (or something similar) playing. The food is PHENOMENAL! The shrimp scampi is our favorite appetizer and it is absolutely delectable. My favorite pasta dish is not specifically listed on the menu, but I always get the pappardelle with vodka sauce and meatballs. SO. GOOD. Pasta is always cooked to perfection and the meatballs are the best meatballs I've found anywhere. The servings are huuggeeeee so definitely share your entree or do family style otherwise you'll go home with enough for the next 2-3 meals. The only thing they could improve upon is the take out service. They tried to charge me $50.00 for one order of my usual pappardelle with meatballs and vodka sauce. I cancelled the order when the person taking my order over the phone refused to accept that that was not the right price. I've been very cautious and careful in checking my bill here ever since. Bad takeout experiences aside, this restaurant is great and one of my family's favorite places to go for a nice meal! Highly recommend this location to anyone looking for excellent service coupled with amazing Italian food!

34.description: We had our first visit to the old flagship location of this franchise.  The seating is quite tight here, and if crowded, the smallish dining space can get quite loud.  It is a charming, old school kind of setting, and the host and server played their parts as traditional Italians.  Wife had their pork chops with bell pepper/mushroom sauce, and I had their veal parmesan with penne pasta side.  The portions were very large, as was the $15 chopped salad that we split.  On a side note, it would be nice if an individually sized and priced starter salad could be ordered.  We had take-home for every dish we ordered including the salad.  Overall, a nice dinner, but the quality wasn't quite 5 star quality (as we had expected) as the veal was a little firm and stringy and the pork chops were a little on dry side.  The cheese and breading on the veal was fine.  Metered street parking was easy right out front on Taylor Street for $2/hour.  Nearby side streets looked to be permit parking.  Come here if you are looking for large portions and old school rustic Italian.ps - I noticed a lot of out-of-towner Yelp reviews for whatever reason.

16.description: I'm not going to say the food is bad... cuz it's not.  But the way the business is run... REALLY?  Went in for pickup.  The price was $6.48.  The girl let me know they don't use change.  So... she only gave me back $3.00.  What kind of business ethic is that?  RIP OFF!  I won's be eating here or picking up from here again.

13.description: Classic Italian will always be close to my heart & far from my dietary regimen. Every once in a while a carb overload is due, so you may as well do it right. With a nice red wine & an exquisite pappardelle or a Parmesan of your choice. Quite a Manhattan by the way

11.description: Food: 5 starsService: 5 starsUpdate:  Following my 4-star review of the restaurant, the Rosebud marketing team reached out to me and asked that I give them another chance. They did not feel that my 3-star review of the service was indicative of their typical dining experience. I obliged to give them a second chance and I am glad that I did. The poor service we received must have been a fluke event as our second experience was great. This time we opted to sit inside rather than out on the patio. I would highly recommend taking this approach. Their interior is decorated well and the sounds of Sinatra playing sound much better than the traffic. The interior tables also come stocked with parmesan cheese to mix with the olive oil (for bread dipping) while their patio tables just have olive oil. To start, we got the bruschetta which was one of the better ones we've tried. Although it had too many tomatoes for my liking, the fresh mozzarella and slight char-broiled taste of the toasted bread delighted the taste buds. For our entrées, we ordered the pasta carbonara and chicken Marsala. Both were delicious and were more food than we could eat in one sitting. Although we were getting full, Amy, our friendly and attentive waitress, suggested we try the chocolate mousse cake. It was very good and would be a good choice for any chocolate lover. When we received the invitation to return to the restaurant, I refrained from informing them on when I would be back as to not skew our experience. Without knowing I was a returning, underwhelmed customer, the wait staff provided us a superb dining experience. I'm glad we came back. I wasn't a fan after our first visit but am definitely a fan of this establishment now. I would highly recommend coming here.  My original review follows in case you wish to compare my experiences.We came here mid-afternoon looking for some good Italian food. What we found was great ziti but mediocre service. The busser, who moderately reminded me of Lloyd from Entourage, was great. He was friendly and hard working. Our waiter, however, was not. While the busser ran around filling water glasses, the waiter avoided our table as much as he could. When he took our order, I asked for some butter for the bread. It wasn't until he brought our food out and I asked again about the butter that he finally brought. This wouldn't be an issue had they been busy. However, this was 3PM and there were only 3 tables needing service. The bread was good and definitely worth the wait. Likewise, the ziti was fantastic.  A must try if you like lots of cheese. The restaurant itself was nice and worthy of 5 stars. The service was not, hence the compromise on 4 stars. I would recommend giving it a try. Just hope your server is more attentive than ours.

39.description: This was our first time there and it did not disappoint.  The food and service was impeccable.  Loved the old school Italian environment.  A little on the pricey side but worth it for a special occasion.  We will be back.

37.description: I came here on a date with my boyfriend on a Friday night and had a spectacular time! Service was fantastic and so was the food. I had a white fish special that was stuffed with crab meat, delicious! My boyfriend had the gnocchi with chicken special and his was also delicious! We were too full for dessert so can't comment on that. Will definitely come back! :)

0.description: Efficient and friendly service. Zuppe del mare Caprese saladNice wine listAnd fabulous cannolis

38.description: Me and my girlfriend ate at the Rosebud on Taylor Street in Chicago on September 25th of 2015 we had a waitress named Amy. She was absolutely the best waitress I ever had, she is the reason I will return to this location. I almost didn't come back to this restaurant because last time back in March of 2015 we had a waitress Rachel G that was the rudest waitress I ever had and I could not believe the way she talked to us and I swore I would never come back, but I was at the hospital and decided to give it another try and because of Amy I'm glad I did, I'm also glad I didn't see the other waitress Rachel G there

51.description: Hmmm.....it's a nice cool evening out and I wanted something healthy but good.  Head over to Rosebud on Taylor and sit outside.  It's summer out and I like to eat lighter so the dinner menu is out.  BUT the apps are in.  For the same prices (ok a little higher but not too much higher than you can pay for a burger and fries somewhere else) I had the grilled calamari, baked clams and stuffed shrooms.  The shrooms had a reduction sauce that was really creamy and garlicy while the calamari was olive oil and lemon fresh - there were even little baby pulpo grilled to char crisp.  All were priced under $11 and were really fresh and especially tasty.  For those interested I didn't eat all that food but split it with a friend.  The apps and a couple of Pieroni's and I was immobile.  OH, almost forgot to mention the warm Italian bread and Greek EVO w parm cheese.....burp.

27.description: Absolutely love this place. If you can, make sure you get Patrick to serve you. Great service, awesome food, and large portions. Ensure you bring your appetite when you come here!

32.description: I love this place! I had the chopped salad, it was huge! But very tasty .  I also had the crab stuffed white fish, it was amazing!!  The vodka sauce was really good too! The service was great.

54.description: This classic Italian restaurant does not disappoint. The service is top notch and the food is thoughtful and perfectly prepared. My only regret is not asking for the price of the special I ordered (they ought to have told us upfront) and it turned out to be about $20 more than I would have chosen to pay and above the range of most other dishes. But oh, well! The lovely fish was absolutely delicious.

48.description: Had the chicken Parmesan which is my fav and it was great. The waitstaff were very nice. Will visit again pronto.

44.description: Really upset with Rosebud, as I have been told nothing but good things. We are from out of town & made a reservation for 5PM on a Sunday night (which happened to be the Sunday night of Taylor Street Festival). We walked in and three hostesses told us there would be a 45 min wait; I asked what the point in having a reservation was. They had no answer and told us we should have known Taylor Street Festival was going on. After speaking to a manager, we suddenly could be seated but the service throughout the whole night was extremely unacceptable. Will not be going back.

24.description: Wonderful experience from start to finish! Seated immediately upon arrival on a very busy Saturday night, manager stopped at table twice to see how things were going, our server (Jay) was outstanding!!! He knew everything about the menu and very detail about the specials.  We started with the shrimp special per Jay's suggestion.  Wow! Delicious.  I couldn't decide which pasta I wanted between 2 of themOn the menu so Jay said he'd take care of me and boy he did! He had the chef make a combination of the 2 (carbonara and vodka sauce) and it was perfect.  My husband had the Ciopanno for 2 soWe could take some home for our teenage soon.  There was so much seafood in that dish it seems it is more like a dish for 5!! Ended our evening with the very best tiramisu in the world!! Yes, I am the tiramisu expert and Rosebuds is truly mouth watering amazingly delicious.  Thanks to Rosebud for a wonderful evening and anniversary celebration!! We can't wait to go back!!

7.description: I'm disappointed with the food, not the service. I had high expectations of this restaurant given that it is a well known  Italian restaurant in an Italian neighborhood. My chicken marsala was extremely plain and the Marsala sauce was bland. It wasn't very appetizing in presentation either. I think I'll hold off coming here until the cooks learn how to cook a simple chicken dish.

49.description: Quite a treat. We had eaten at Moto the day before and yearned for some traditional Italian. The Trump Hotel recommended Rosebud. Took a while to find it but once in, we had fantastic service and some serious,y impressive marinara sauce. Eggplant appetizer was very good. Chicken parmigiana was huge and shareable and delicious. Great experience.

40.description: Nice spot on Taylor street! Love this place huge portions of food!! My dinner is always my lunch the next day!

53.description: Had very nice dinner with my cousin. Great service. Very good bar selection. Classic chicago steakhouse. They accommodated our special requests as well. Recommended.

30.description: How have I never reviewed Rosebud on Taylor? I've been here for numerous business dinners and lunches and stopped by with a co-worker today after a meeting at Rush MC.Rosebud is one of the OG's of Chicago Italian food, and they have pictures of just about every famous person on the planet to prove it - JFK, Frank Sinatra, Robert DiNero, Oprah and the dad from Tommy Boy. The interior is dark and cozy - if it's busy you might feel a bit crowded. They've got a very nice wine list (as I'd expect) with a good number of by-the-glass options at not terrible prices. Alas, it was a work lunch so no wine for me. I picked penne Bolognese and my co-worker went with carbonara which she kindly shared. The carbonara wasn't the "traditional" with beaten egg and pancetta - rather it's a creamy parmesan sauce with mushrooms and peas. Very, very rich but good all the same and if you love mushrooms (I'm indifferent at best) know that the ones they used were meaty and flavorful. I'm tough on Bolognese sauce because I make a mean one and Rosebud's was really good - very meaty and not too tomato-y. Again, not strictly traditional (I didn't see veg in there) but tasty, and who am I to question 40-year old recipes?Service was fine - waters were refilled regularly but we had to ask for a refill on iced tea. Prices are quite reasonable for lunch (most dishes under $15) and the portions were enormous. I know there are other Rosebud's in the city, but the original location has a lot of charm and is worth a visit.

46.description: Great Italian. Worth the trip. Ciopinno and Zitti were wonderful. My wife and I came for our anniversary. We had to take the metro here from downtown but it was worthwhile! Definitely visit.

1.description: I was in the neighborhood this afternoon running errands and came upon Rosebud.  I have seen the one on Rush, but this was right here, and I was thinking, well why not?  As I was seated quickly and Ol' Blue Eyes was just mere eyesight away in an old frame checking me out, I asked myself, what should I eat with Frank for lunch?  Chicken Piccata.  It comes with a side of rotini corkscrew pasta and marinara.  The setting is reminiscent of an old Italian grammas' house.  Some bookshelves filled with antique books, and memorabilia nic nacs, etc.  Old Italian music playing in the background and a few stained glass windows.  My only thought was that there was water damage in the ceiling and they really should fix that.My server is friendly, water and bread came out expediently.  I'm dipping the warm lightly crusted on the outside bread in the olive oil on the table and there's a little metal UFO on the table with parmesan cheese.  (the canned kind)  The chicken comes out, and it is HOT.  Wow, no mistaking freshness here.  That baby was juicy and the sauce was thick with a variety of capers and big caper berries.  There is so much sauce with the chicken it could have been soup.  Not that you'd want to eat it as soup. lol The pasta was okay (obviously not made in house) and the marinara was tasty enough, but nothing special.  I doused it in the UFOs cheese, better.  Not too pricey.  Good for lunch.

55.description: What a great place in the little Italy neighborhood in Chicago.  The food was amazing!  i had the Vodka Pasta with added chicken and it was amazing!!   The wine list is great and I had a great glass of chianti that was divine.  Service was great with authentic Italian employees who were so nice!  When I get to Chicago again I will be eating here again.

9.description: We had our first visit to the old flagship location of this franchise.  The seating is quite tight here, and if crowded, the smallish dining space can get quite loud.  It is a charming, old school kind of setting, and the host and server played their parts as traditional Italians.  Wife had their pork chops with bell pepper/mushroom sauce, and I had their veal parmesan with penne pasta side.  The portions were very large, as was the $15 chopped salad that we split.  On a side note, it would be nice if an individually sized and priced starter salad could be ordered.  We had take-home for every dish we ordered including the salad.  Overall, a nice dinner, but the quality wasn't quite 5 star quality (as we had expected) as the veal was a little firm and stringy and the pork chops were a little on dry side.  The cheese and breading on the veal was fine.  Metered street parking was easy right out front on Taylor Street for $2/hour.  Nearby side streets looked to be permit parking.  Come here if you are looking for large portions and old school rustic Italian.ps - I noticed a lot of out-of-towner Yelp reviews for whatever reason.

26.description: Sheltered here with some friends for a late lunch during a blustery snowstorm one recent Saturday afternoon.  Couldn't have picked a better spot.  We lingered for 4 hours over appetizer (tasty but super-rich stuffed artichoke), entrees (veal marsala was fantastic, and the lasagna was the most gorgeous I've ever seen), drinks (the house wine is a great deal), and dessert (go for the chocolate mousse cake, skip the cannoli cake).  Yes, four hours, and we were never once rushed or made to feel as though we were imposing.  Rather, the waiters seemed happy to have us lingering, almost like family.  The restaurant was beautifully decorated for Christmas and felt like a million bucks, and then the final tab was so reasonable (especially given the insane amount that we ordered over those four hours) that I thought they must have forgotten to add several items to our check.  If you want to have a special meal without breaking the bank, I'd go back here in a heartbeat.

25.description: excellent restaurant, the attention and the food is good quality and delicious desserts

12.description: The enthusiasm, smile and energy of the waiter while explaining the specials of the day sold me everything the flowed out of his mouth. Then there were two specials on the table. 1. A breaded tilapia with parsley chopped and sprinkled on top. Great lemon and buttery touch. 2. Beef lasagna topped with gooey cheese makes for a classic Italian dish. Absolutely would come back for that contagious friendly waiter and free valet from 11am - 3pm.

59.description: Brought our family to the Rosebud on the recommendation by a friend.  It was amazing!  We ordered the Caesar salad and there was enough to share for the four of us.  There's no kids menu, but not really necessary as the portions are huge!  I had the house specialty of Paparedelle with Marinara, my husband had the rigatoni alla vodka with a side of jalapeño potatoes.  The food was outstanding, ambiance of restaurant was great, and the service/staff was phenomenal- Amanda was our server and she was so nice and helpful!  A must eat at place!

21.description: Awesome menu. Portions HUGE!  Order carefully. Nice atmosphere and professional staff. Try Nana's Gravy. Outstanding.

17.description: Giant portions!

10.description: Eh, it was fine. It feels like a tourist joint. The service was fair (we were never told of the specials, which sounded great as we eavesdropped on another server at another table, and the bread was delivered late and slightly cool).
