The food was OK (the linguine shrimp I had was OK, but where I was expecting melt-in-your-mouth shrimp, I think I got the just-out-of-the-freezer shrimp).  All in all, I didn't *hate* anything, but I wouldn't recommend it.

5.description: This is a wonderful Italian food establishment. I came for a company dinner event and I was pleasantly surprised with the good service and delicious well prepared food. We started off with stuffed mushrooms appetizer which was pretty good, moist panko crusted outter layer. I had a garden salad to prepare me for my bone in ribeye steak. The bone in was cooked to perfection as I requested and didn't need any sauce. It had a great balance of fat and meat which made the meat delicious and savory.The desert with a rosebud tiramisu which is large and couldn't finish but it was not overly sweet but full of vanilla flavor.

3.description: Little pricey but good quality delicious food! Had the spicy shrimp special, rabini, and stuffed articoke. Articoke wasn't my favorite but the shrimp was amazing!! Staff was extremely friendly and a romantic atmosphere. As we were leaving everyone we passed on the staff said thank you for coming. Great Italian music too!

35.description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago. Now there are others that are a little more glamorous like RPM Italian but nobody has great food and service like Rosebud. We have been coming to this location for years and ALWAYS get excellent service. We recently had my son's baptism luncheon here upstairs and they did a fabulous job!  All of my guests enjoyed their meals. My glass never runs empty here and they are very attentive. I love their patio in the summer, we bring our Doberman with and she enjoys bits of our meals. My favorite dish here is the Rigatoni ala Vodka with crumbled Italian Sausage. Favorite appetizer is the bruschetta. As for drinks they make a great Moscow Mule and Chocolate Martini (my wife loves their chocolate martinis).  This is the best Italian restaurant in Chicago and if you have not been here yet you need to try it!

19.description: Went here for dinner before a Bulls game.  Service was old school and professional, they are going to take good care of you.  We all had the caesar salad, this is the best caesar salad I have ever had!  Had the Bone in Ribeye with the peppers (pizzaiollo style) and it was great.  The quality of the meat was good but it was the preparation with the peppers that really stood out.  It was so big it could probably feed multiple people.Definitely recommend this place for its old school vibe and great food.

28.description: The enthusiasm, smile and energy of the waiter while explaining the specials of the day sold me everything the flowed out of his mouth. Then there were two specials on the table. 1. A breaded tilapia with parsley chopped and sprinkled on top. Great lemon and buttery touch. 2. Beef lasagna topped with gooey cheese makes for a classic Italian dish. Absolutely would come back for that contagious friendly waiter and free valet from 11am - 3pm.

45.description: What a charming, authentic Italian restaurante! We walked in without a reservation and were warmly greeted and welcomed. Enza was our waitress who balanced friendliness and professionalism perfectly! We enjoyed their stuffed whole artichoke and pasta with Arrabiata sauce and Italian sausage... Nice wine selection, Italian bread served with flavorful olive oil. Rosebud's full house is testament to their success......Bravo!

33.description: Food: 5 starsService: 5 starsUpdate:  Following my 4-star review of the restaurant, the Rosebud marketing team reached out to me and asked that I give them another chance. They did not feel that my 3-star review of the service was indicative of their typical dining experience. I obliged to give them a second chance and I am glad that I did. The poor service we received must have been a fluke event as our second experience was great. This time we opted to sit inside rather than out on the patio. I would highly recommend taking this approach. Their interior is decorated well and the sounds of Sinatra playing sound much better than the traffic. The interior tables also come stocked with parmesan cheese to mix with the olive oil (for bread dipping) while their patio tables just have olive oil. To start, we got the bruschetta which was one of the better ones we've tried. Although it had too many tomatoes for my liking, the fresh mozzarella and slight char-broiled taste of the toasted bread delighted the taste buds. For our entrées, we ordered the pasta carbonara and chicken Marsala. Both were delicious and were more food than we could eat in one sitting. Although we were getting full, Amy, our friendly and attentive waitress, suggested we try the chocolate mousse cake. It was very good and would be a good choice for any chocolate lover. When we received the invitation to return to the restaurant, I refrained from informing them on when I would be back as to not skew our experience. Without knowing I was a returning, underwhelmed customer, the wait staff provided us a superb dining experience. I'm glad we came back. I wasn't a fan after our first visit but am definitely a fan of this establishment now. I would highly recommend coming here.  My original review follows in case you wish to compare my experiences.We came here mid-afternoon looking for some good Italian food. What we found was great ziti but mediocre service. The busser, who moderately reminded me of Lloyd from Entourage, was great. He was friendly and hard working. Our waiter, however, was not. While the busser ran around filling water glasses, the waiter avoided our table as much as he could. When he took our order, I asked for some butter for the bread. It wasn't until he brought our food out and I asked again about the butter that he finally brought. This wouldn't be an issue had they been busy. However, this was 3PM and there were only 3 tables needing service. The bread was good and definitely worth the wait. Likewise, the ziti was fantastic.  A must try if you like lots of cheese. The restaurant itself was nice and worthy of 5 stars. The service was not, hence the compromise on 4 stars. I would recommend giving it a try. Just hope your server is more attentive than ours.

43.description: Oh yes. If you are near Taylor Street, you need to eat here. The food is extraordinary. Went it comes to Italian food, I rate it by how their chicken marsala is prepared. The chicken is thick and moist. The mushrooms are freshly sliced. The sauce, oh the sauce, is tasty. You almost want more some you could dip their bread into it.The service is terrific. Attentive but not hovering. If you need anything, they are available. They are eager to correct anything you find amiss.These are the factors that have my wife and I returning every time we are in the area.

2.description: Wonderful experience from start to finish! Seated immediately upon arrival on a very busy Saturday night, manager stopped at table twice to see how things were going, our server (Jay) was outstanding!!! He knew everything about the menu and very detail about the specials.  We started with the shrimp special per Jay's suggestion.  Wow! Delicious.  I couldn't decide which pasta I wanted between 2 of themOn the menu so Jay said he'd take care of me and boy he did! He had the chef make a combination of the 2 (carbonara and vodka sauce) and it was perfect.  My husband had the Ciopanno for 2 soWe could take some home for our teenage soon.  There was so much seafood in that dish it seems it is more like a dish for 5!! Ended our evening with the very best tiramisu in the world!! Yes, I am the tiramisu expert and Rosebuds is truly mouth watering amazingly delicious.  Thanks to Rosebud for a wonderful evening and anniversary celebration!! We can't wait to go back!!

18.description: this was sooooooo delicious that i wanted to go back the next day!! a friend and i took our other friend here for her 40th bday! i had white fish stuffed with crab meat with spinach & lemon butter sauce and it was freakin AMAZING!! i didnt wanna stop eating it even though i was already full. my 2 other friends LOVED their meals as well! there were no complaints whatsoever in any of our food or service! they even brought out a little piece of chocolate type cake with a candle for her bday. very cute! i would love to return some time soon cuz this seriously was one of the best deals ive ever had in my entire life!!! ummmmm ummmmm!

41.description: Perfect and delicious tonight!  Service was impeccable - attentive but not pressing.  We had a party of 4 and all 4 dinners were wonderful and interesting and served hot and delicious.  The calamari and shrimp appetizer was a real treat.  I haven't been for awhile, but it is definitely on my favorites list.

52.description: Loved the seafood combo and the quality of food is really good. I liked their pasta and meat entrees. Highly recommended

50.description: Food: 5 seafood pasta was huge enough to feed 4 people, fried calamari was deliciousService: 5 Cleanliness:4Ambience: 3 too cramped and dark

4.description: An early dinner right after work with the family, easy street parking on a friday evening a major plus in the city. We had mussles for appetizer and the kids got linguine with shrimp and buttered pasta, we got Chicken vesuivo, White river fish with crab which was soaked in butter. I had a glass of pinot noir and hubby had a couple of morretis. For dessert we split the creme brulee which was perfect! I know the Rosebud on taylor is a chicago tradition but i will be a Francescas on taylor loyalist, just a personal preference. Our server Ana was very courteous and friendly.

6.description: Was good but wasn't as "old school" as I had thought it would be.  Had pasta and the sauce was way too much for the amount on my plate.  It was drowning in sauce.  My daughter had the Lobster ravioli...wasn't the flavor we were counting on.  Still good but I had talked up the place to her before a Bulls game.  Was definitely good but not the destination it once was.

22.description: Well this was my last visit here.  We had an annual family tradition of coming here. Placed a reservation 3 months out for a table at the front. Not only was that not to happen. My party of 4 were seated upstairs with no other guests. It was was creepy at best.  The server did a nice job but food was very middle of the road and with the size of the check, I'm done here.

15.description: We went here before a Bulls game. The spicy calamari and shrimp grilled was fantastic! Out if 4 dinners we enjoyed only 2 which was disappointing . The vealParmesan and chicken Vesuvio was fabulous . The skirt steak was so tough you had to chew 5 minutes a piece so not edible really , the world famous ribs were cold and old. So disappointing ! The waiter was Jay. He was not very pleasant. At the end he asked if we wanted to box it up and I said no. I told him the steak was not good and very chewy and he got mad and said I asked you if everything was okay. Honestly we just shared the good food and were ok but he was not a good waiter seeing that our bill was 250 you would think he would be nicer.

57.description: Over priced for mediocre food! The portions are generous but that doesn't really matter when the food is bland. First time going there with high expectations, but I was badly disappointed. The chicken and the pasta had no taste what so ever and was very watered down. Won't be going back that's for sure.

20.description: Great management!  Extremely reasonable prices for lunch.  Great atmosphere

36.description: Let me start by saying 'Wow'! We stopped in last night at the Taylor Street location for a late dinner (arrived about 10:30 pm; they're open until 11:30 on Fri.)...the specials were a shrimp appetizer and two lobster dishes, as well as a rib-eye.  We started with the shrimp appetizer.  These weren't shrimp; they were small Volkswagens.  There were four and they were ginormous! A little bit of spice thrown in and they were out of this world! He ordered the chicken marsala with a side of rappini and I ordered one of the specials; lobster risotto.  The chicken marsala was amazing, completely drenched in mushrooms, and the lobster? Um, let's see - could anything possibly be bad about a 26 oz. lobster tail served atop a pile of perfectly prepared risotto with garlic butter? No? I didn't think so either - I found Heaven and it was on a Rosebud plate.  I won't cite the market price...if you have to ask how much it is, order something else, because you can't afford it! There are other selections on the menu far too numerous to list - the Italian fare is authentic, from ravioli to bracciole, and everything in between. The ambience of the restaurant was gorgeous - stained glass windows, beautiful woodwork and an ample selection of celebrity pictures as you enter the restaurant.  Sinatra music playing throughout our entire dinner. Our server was Jay and he was amazingly good; in fact, the entire front of the house was staffed by great people.  We were there a bit past closing by the time we finished, however, we never felt rushed, the food we ordered was prepared fresh; no differently than if we were the first diners to arrive for the dinner shift instead of being the last! We were so impressed with The Rosebud and since (unbeknownst to me at the outset) this 'impromptu' stop became our engagement dinner, the excellent food and service only made the night even more memorable.  We will be back and highly recommend The Rosebud to anyone who's looking for a GREAT Italian restaurant with top flight service.  They more than earn/deserve every dime they make.  Let me end by saying 'Wow'!

14.description: I came here on a date with my boyfriend on a Friday night and had a spectacular time! Service was fantastic and so was the food. I had a white fish special that was stuffed with crab meat, delicious! My boyfriend had the gnocchi with chicken special and his was also delicious! We were too full for dessert so can't comment on that. Will definitely come back! :)

58.description: My friend just got a tattoo yesterday and I joined her on the adrenaline-piercing experience.  We walked right in, handed the design over and done.  The shop is very sterile that has a pleasant feel (well as much as a tattoo shop can possess).  The walls are covered with the average, ugly, strange, colorful sketches of clowns, bats, skulls, flames and foreign language characters.  One thing I did not like was the location of the massage/tattoo table is too small for anyone other than the client and artist.  So if you bring a friend, they can't accompany you by holding your hand or distracting you through conversation.  Other than that, it seemed to be a nice, well-priced tattoo parlor.

56.description: The place is decent.  I got pierced in January with my at-the-time girlfriend.She got a monroe, I got a rook.  We both had perfectly good experiences, but we both got robbed in terms of price (mine was 70 bucks, i think hers was a little more).good place, Justin was a good piercer, the work itself was solid, but I think the fact that this place is frequented by first-timers and college kids on a lark means that prices are was too high.

29.description: I went here on a referral basis from my sister-in-law. This was my first tattoo, and I've gotta say it turned out pretty good. I was all nervous about how much it would "hurt" but to be honest, it really wasn't that bad. I can see why tattoos are addictive, I'm already working up ideas for what I want next (even though I said this would be my first and only). I came in there with specifics on what I wanted, a picture and the artist hit it pretty much dead on. I couldnt get my initials in the font I wanted, but that was because of the placement and I understood why once the artiist explained. He was great, super nice, and quick! That was almost 2 weeks ago now and it's pretty much 100% healed. It was a lot more exspensive than I had anticipated, but I dont have anything to compare their prices too so I guess it was alright. $150 for about a 3x5in design, detailed, but nothing over the top. My sister in law got her tattoo there a few years back and paid $80, its about the same size with the same amount of detail, maybe prices have gone up, i dont know. Either way, I'm satisfied and had a very good experience at Taylor Street. I will definetly recommend it, but probably tell people to check pricing at other shops first if you know exactly what you want to compare.

42.description: After a lot of research, I selected Taylor Street for a tattoo to celebrate a life event. Chad took the art I brought in on a USB stick, printed, placed and inked the tattoo faster than I could imagine.  I thought he had finished *outlining* the left side of my back but, no, he had done the fill as well!  Chad was a little aloof when we first showed up but warmed up pretty quickly.Also Chad did a wicked dragon on my buddy's arm the same night. I was impressed again at the blazing speed.  No sacrifice of quality - Chad is just freaking FAST!!! I normally get all my ink done at a place at home in Austin, but I will be travelling to Chicago from now on. That's how highly I think of Chad and the folks at Taylor Street!

23.description: Terrible vibe and energy! Most unprofessional experience in small business I've ever had.  This shop gives the artists that do what they do a bad name and perpetuates the stereotypes that currently exist.  Its places like this that make you not want to see them survive in the business world when there are SO many willing to go above and beyond for their clients/customers.  I believe a change management implementation for Taylor Street Tattoo is necessary as Chicago is better than that! So the place has changed since the last time I've been there (about 5 years ago). There is a tattoo artist there that has horrible customer service and poor hygiene, ironically he had the nerve to try and tell me about the Illinois health code and was not only incorrect, but extremely rude about the way he choose to communicate it to me.  I would never go back, as I was there for someone else for their tattoo.  If you want the highest quality and cleanliness go to TOMATO TATTOO, you'll love it!

47.description: From what I have seen, I like the tattoos that come out of Taylor Street, but not the place itself. When it comes down to it, good quality work is more important then the actual customer service you get, but I prefer both to be above par.I decided to take advantage of their Tuesday "name day" special. Meaning, that instead of overpaying (as you do at most Chicago tattoo shops) for some simple script, I only had to pay twenty bucks (normally this amount of cash would get you a black dot, tip not included). So that's a pretty hot deal, even though it does not come without cost. Even though it doesn't say it on the shop's website, there are a number of restrictions as to where you can get the tattoo for the "special price." We're not talking extra for your forehead or palm of hand, but pretty common tattoo spots, such as rib, stomach, chest, back of neck. Luckily for me, these exceptions did not apply, but I would have been irritated if I came all the way down expecting it.Next came the LOOOOOOOOONG wait. I understand that I am not the only cheap ass in Chicago, but seriously the place was tiny, has seating for about four, and was completely packed. Good for the owner/artists that they are popular, but I know for a FACT that someone (if not more than one) came in asking for a tattoo w/ no appointment after me and was brought in back about five or six people before me. Not. Cool. I also understand that there were a lot of fools wanting to come in and get any old thing permanently needled into their skin just because it was a deal (dude who got the "Mr. 4.0 G.P.A" tattoo and then yelled out "see y'all again next Tuesday!" made my day- and the wait almost worth it!), HOWEVER it wasn't my suggestion for the shop to do monotonous tattoos all day for cheap, so I did not appreciate the snottiness of at least three of the artists working there, just because they were busy and their artistic abilities weren't challenged. They didn't make any effort to chat or be friendly during the process. Really now, the mightier than thou tattoos artist act has been done to death. Other not good things:-It is so small in back that friends are not allowed to come with you. I don't need anybody to hold my hand, but when I get something that I can only see by looking behind me in a mirror, I want a friend to reassure me that it's straight. This takes about 2 seconds and they had a HUGE attitude about letting it happen. I basically had to walk to the front room full of people with my shirt half off to get it checked.- They don't have professional chairs like most shops, so you are forced to either stand or sit in uncomfortable ways while getting your tattoo. This would not be good if it was a large piece.- After we waited forever, they rushed us and seemed annoyed when we asked for any tweaks/suggestions.Anyway, I like my tattoo, it was well done. My roommate got a colorful sparrow, which also looks very nice. The artists also became friendlier after we tipped (it didn't seem like many there were doing so, which would piss me off too). I would come back if I ever want more script, but not for anything else. I just did not get a great vibe and would prefer a calmer and more friendly atmosphere.

8.description: Awesome shop and awesome people! Donna and Jason are the best there and its always a good time hanging out on Taylor st. and getting some food and drinks after you get some work done.

31.description: I received an the first part of my half-sleeve from Chad back in 2008. When we scheduled to start working on the color, I was told the shop was definitely open on labor day and he scheduled me for 12pm. I had to work on labor day, but i took the day off to come in. After making the hour trip via 2 buses from the northwest side, I arrived to find the shop closed. I thought perhaps the shop just hadn't opened yet so i decided to wait since it was a nice day out and had a book with me. After waiting two hours, i double checked some signs on the door, only to see in very small font below one of the signs, that the shop was closed for the holiday. I was honestly quite upset and sad that i didn't even get a phone call to reschedule, as i saw him write our appointment on his calendar with my phone number next to it. It wasn't a tiny piece i was getting, and he had told me when we scheduled that i should anticipate at least 8 additional hours of work to finish up the color due to the size of the piece. I spent 3 years with just an outline when i finally found an artist that i trusted enough and had impressive enough work. The piece is finally finished and looks incredible. I'm glad that  i was able to find an artist (Alana Robbie currently based out of Columbus, OH but soon to be based out of San Francisco, I'll be writing a glowing review of her work soon) with the talent, and the people skills, to follow through with appointments to give me some incredible work.

34.description: The customers are great to talk to, but where are the employees?One of the customers I was talking with for ten minutes shouted for someone to help me.What was the shop's response?"Hey! No Shouting"I guess Hey! No Service is their policy too. DESPITE THEIR WEBSITE, THEY DO NOT CARRY ANY BODY JEWELRY

16.description: I use Yelp to search for online reviews of places I want to patronize. Sometimes the reviews are really off. There were some negative reviews of  Taylor st Tattoo and I don't know where the reviewers are coming from. The place is clean, the people are friendly and knowledgeable and they were very understanding of this being my first time. The experience was very pleasant and I will definitely go back and tell my friends. My guy Andrew was very cool. Damn thing hardly hurt and I have a smokin' tat!!! Thanks guys!!! Great place!

13.description: I went in to get a very simple tiny tattoo in honor of my grandmother who just passed and the lady at the front desk made us feel unwelcome as soon as we walked in. She said they couldn't do the color I wanted and when I asked for suggestions she did not offer any help. I then asked her if she would like me to draw it for her and when i did she called the artist up, she said we had to talk about pricing, the tattoo was the size of a pea and black, I said it should be the minimum and she sarcastically said "should it be?" I then left. I have never been treated like that at a studio and I have my fair share of tattoos.

11.description: Donna K is THE BEST! Very personable and instantly puts you at ease when you hop in her chair. Her tattoo work speaks for itself, just take a look at her portfolio. The prices are what you should expect to pay when visiting a reputable shop that does top notch work. I wouldn't even think twice about paying top dollar for a pair of shoes, you'd better believe I'll pay top dollar for something that I'll have permanently on my body FOR THE REST OF MY LIFE! People who complain about prices, GOOD LUCK finding this kind of quality work for a cheaper price! My suggestion for a few of the yelpers out there who have complaints on the prices or the finger tattoos is DO YOUR RESEARCH and then you would know what is a reasonable price to pay (keep in mind, you are paying for clean needles, ink, the whole set up of razors, medical tape, plastic clip cords, sanitation of all of the equipment, etc... and this is all BEFORE your artist gets paid their cut!!). DO YOUR RESEARCH and know that finger tattoos are a terrible idea and likely won't hold up over time! You can't blame an artist for a poorly chosen design. Listen to your artist. The folks at Taylor Street won't disappoint. Go in. Ask for Donna. You'll love her. I know I do! Keep it up guys!

39.description: I found out about Taylor Street's reputation through word of mouth and the fact that I pass by it at least once every week since I go to school around there. I got my first tattoo here and I am very happy with it! The girls that were in the front were very friendly and did a good job at explaining what needed to be done to make sure the design would turn out well. (The original design was a bit too small so they would have to make it bigger so that the fine lines wouldn't be lost). I ended up getting it on the same day, it was done clean,quick, and efficient.  They took the time to explain the after care and let me know that they were happy to help if anything came up.

37.description: Ok, to be fair I did not have any services at the shop. I'm annoyed because I didn't even get in!! I needed to get a new nose ring as I had lost mine and wanted a piercer to but it in for me since mine had shrunk a little. Called midday to find out how late they were open, the person I spoke with said 8pm. I spent $13 on a cab there, arrived at 6pm and they were closed. I tried calling and stood out front for a while -along with other people who had been there later than me and had traveled from the South Side to get there- no answer and no one appeared. I then had to take another cab to get to another shop somewhere else.Annoying. If you say you are going to be open be open. If not, put a sign on the door at the very least.

0.description: This place is fantastic! Had several tattoos from several of the talented artists here and they heal amazingly and the line work is stellar. I don't get the ridiculous reviews below, especially the girl who got upset because she couldn't get a $20 letter tattoo. I mean where in the hell do you think you could go and get a $20 and if you can't afford a $60 tattoo, you shouldn't be getting one.  Also another point her comment, anything that would be less than $60, would just be waste of the artist time, supplies, etc. Every shop I have ever been to has shop minimums. Being an artists (not tattoo, but graphic designer) people need to realize that your paying for the art plus the value of the artist and supplies.John and Jason are both amazing artists and I look forward getting future tattoos. My partner and I have have over 8 tattoos combined from artists in this shop, all of which healed amazingly, are vibrant, and top notch quality.Lastly, to the person who seems to think this place is disgusting, it is one of the cleanest shops I have been to in Chicago. Stop being sour apples and realize that this artists know their stuff!

38.description: I've had two pieces done here before so I was sure that I had already yelped it, but I guess I didn't. Oops. So, my first time at Taylor Street, I got the Black Flag bars (ubiquitous, yes, I know) done by Turbo who is quite the professional and great to talk to about what punk and hardcore you should be checking out. He did a fantastic job. I came back to Taylor Street for my third piece overall (second at Taylor St.). Once again, Turbo worked on it and again, he did a kickass job and it didn't take too long which was great because I had to be somewhere. Awesome work, great job! While I can't predict the future, I'm quite certain that I'm going to come back to Taylor St. to have Turbo do my upcoming tattoos.

51.description: I've gotten all of my work done here (granted not much) and love these guys.I may as well have been a frequent flyer for the number of times I went there this summer.Chad did both of my tattoos (a wimpy starter piece on my hip that I love for sentimental reasons and a kick-ass elaborate design between my shoulders that is gorgeous).  He was extremely detailed oriented and made sure I was 100% happy with the design before even placing the template on my skin.  He wasn't the most talkative of fellows, but that's fine.  If less talk means more concentration on a permanent addition to my body, he may as well be Helen Keller for all I care.Justin (who according to the shop's website no longer works there... Sad) did both of my cartilage piercings.  Working as a nurse, I know the value of sterile technique, and his was flawless.  Plus, he does this sweet glove-snappy-off thing that I now have incorportated into my daily practice at work.  Awesome.The shop itself is pretty small, tons of flash designs on the wall, mostly Johnny Sailor (I think that's what it's called) type stuff.  Since the shop is so narrow, there's not room for your friend to hold your hand during the 3 hour process of having a design meticulously engrained over your spine.  The shop is very clean though, so that's a huge plus.Anyway, if and when I decide to have more work done, I'll definitely be returning, even though it is a hike from the northside.

27.description: outrageous prices for nothing more than following a stencil. no creativity. They don't listen to what you want, and say they can't alter it, because they're not good enough. They were nice (save for the girl who was bitchy), but they're pretty amateur. Lack style, and listen to modern contemporary rock. That said I don't mind the tiny tattoo I got, just where I got it. 60$ for something my friend could have done better with a needle in 10 minutes.

32.description: OK, This isn't "me" reviewing it, it'll be my husband since he's the one who went but he doesn't want to deal with his own yelp account. From here on out, it'll be Jeff, my husband:Taylor Street Tattoo is where you go to get tattooed. I know how simple that sounds. How elementary. But that's all that really needs to be said. If you want some bullcrap fake garbage go somewhere else. If you want a tattoo by people who know how to do it right and have no problems being honest, go here. I've only had 1 tattoo done here, about a year ago by "Turbo" (Chris.) I've been too busy/broke to get another one. The pricing is dead on, in the city (where taxes/insurance/rent is much higher) the prices do not get better unless you know some schmuck doing them in his bathroom at home. You get what you pay for. I've seen more expensive shops that have had way worse work rolling out. You will not get better work in this city, especially for the prices.Again, it's a tattoo shop. No glitz, no bullcrap, real honest people, be respectful and they'll respect you. If they're busy tattooing someone, wait, would you want your artist to stop mid work to go talk to someone else? Just wait or comeback or make an appointment. Not a big stink. It has the atmosphere a tattoo shop should have. Honesty and hard work.I've only decided to write this review because I feel there are too many negative reviews for this place and unjustly so (in my opinion.) I'll be going back soon. I'll upload a pic of what I had done too. Turbo had very little to work with source wise (black and white blurry line drawing) and made it come to life. If I had the cash and time I'd have returned a million times by now. But I do try to push everyone this way.OH, also I noticed yelp says they take credit cards. When I went, cash only. Which is better anyway, you don't need to sink yourself into more debt! Don't forget to tip.

54.description: I'm very happy to be coming back to Yelp after an extended absence [thanks to the crap-tastic economy] and have Taylor Street Tattoo as my come-back establishment to review.I truly couldn't have asked for a better experience at Taylor Street Tattoo. From the moment I walked in I felt like and knew that I was in a clean, friendly and highly-professional establishment.I was greeted within moments of entering the place and asked to fill out the requisite paperwork. Once I was finished, Justin was ready to see me. He was very friendly but also extremely professional and knew exactly what he was doing and explained everything he was doing and how everything was going to do down even though this wasn't my first time to the rodeo, so to speak.Justin took his time to ensure that everything he was tasked to do was appropriate and professional and he even went the extra step [or two] to ensure that I was good to go. I left infinitely satisfied.The entire experience wasn't what I would call cheap, but in the world of tattoos and piercings, I think you get what you pay for. I'm convinced that the quality and the artistry is worth the price. If you want to take a risk on something or someone else, feel free, but I was happy to pay for the quality and service I received. It is very easy to recommend Taylor Street Tattoo and I will definitely be going back.

48.description: I've gotten 4 tattoos and my nose pierced here. Justin did my nose piercing and totally had me laughing the whole time... the piercing is really clean and his dedication was really great to see. My nose never bled, never got infected, no pus, no scabbing, no nothing... it was great. Really, it only took a second and was less painful than having a nose hair plucked out. Beware: their nose studs and rings are really pretty pricey but they all get sterilized and Justin will size them to fit you just right. For tattoos I got all 4 of mine done by Lana Wingo. I like her a lot and her son is a little cutie. For a while I felt like she was not a fan of mine but I think she had me pegged as a different kind of person... dare i say... tramp stamp, butterfly/dolphin tattoo person? I believe we're over it and I really enjoy her tattooing though there's a few things I'd like to have done that supposedly aren't possible even though I've seen them done other places... I think our communication is just off. She makes the tattoo as painless as possible and holds the perfect amount of conversation. I do think you pay more here than at other shops but I wanted my tattoos that day and I'd just prefer to have a female tattoo artist do them. Check them out and see if you like their work.

44.description: I went in with some friends on Wednesday. This was an amazing experience. The artists were great and fun to talk with. I got an amazing tattoo from Lana. I came in with a few ideas and a folk art design and she was able to suggest how to best do it in the size I wanted. She was gentle while tattooing and this being only my second tattoo that was great. The price was a good value for the quality of work and experience. I'm coming back here for my next one!

24.description: I just went this past weekend and had a really great experience. I had done a lot of research as this was my first tattoo. I got a quote from the Lord of the Rings movie that meant a lot to me. Rickybird was my tattooist and I would definitely go back to him. He was quick and empathetic, talking to me at just the right times to alleviate any stress/fear I felt. I was done within 20 minutes and it looks fabulous! Very very happy.

7.description: Got the best tattoo ever from Donna Klein. She is the best artist, period!!! She did a custom Ghost Rider for me, I LOVE IT!!! Outstanding service!!!

49.description: Awesome dudes with awesome tudes. Clean shop with very knowledgeable and talented artists. They wont bullshit either. If one of them can't do what you want, they'll let you know who can. Walk ins welcome all the time so check em out! They also use Good Color ink which is vegetarian and organic. It also leaves you with one poppin' tattoo. I know from experience dude...

40.description: I originally found out about Taylor Street because two of my good friends worked at Hazel down the street which is now closed, but Lana and Tim came in one day with their baby (who is adorable) and bought some things from the shop and mentioned Taylor Street. I had no idea it was there but I really liked all of Lana's tattoos so thought it would be worth checking out. A few months later an ex of mine got some work done there. Between the quality of his tattoo (done by an artist who has since moved on to Deluxe) and by checking out all of the artist's portfolios, I was sold. About a year and a half ago I went in to have Lana give me my first tattoo ever, a simple line of text down my ribcage, and went back in last week for my first large pieces. She drew them up for me and was very patient when I was being a pain in the ass about the detail on them. She worked pretty fast and was very nice when I started feeling kind of sick after the first few minutes of tattooing. I'm really happy with my work and get tons of compliments on them. Everyone in the shop has always been really nice to me and they don't have that hoity toity tattoo artist attitude a lot of shops seem to have. Slighty pricey but honestly I think  you get what you pay for in terms of tattoos, so if you're looking to drop $30 on a sweet tribal tattoo, I would recommend going elsewhere. Definitely call ahead and make an appointment though, this place seems like it doesn't have much room for walk-ins.

53.description: I got my first tattoo here... it was done by Lana Wingo and she is awesome.... her work is perfect.  My tattoo looked exactly like I wanted and during the actual process Lana was super nice and helped me relax since I was a bit anxious.  The place was clean and they even showed me the autoclave!  Everyone was friendly and the price of my tattoo didn't dent the bank account too badly.The artists here are talented and I totally suggest going here if you want to have some ink done.

30.description: I recommend Taylor Street Tattoo to anyone in Chicago.  The artist was helpful and patient while working on the design I wanted.  The one I do notice is their Yelp profile states that they accept credit cards, which is not the case.  They are cash only.

46.description: Ahh Taylor St.  Good work, but I really hate the atmosphere of the shop.  Such a cold sterile environment, but if it envokes good work I'm over it.Started coming here when my fiance and her sister suggested I try Chris.  So I did.  I got some shoulder work done as well as coloring of an old tattoo and I sat with Chris for at least three sessions that felt like we got nothing done. I like Chris, but I don't think this particular venue sparked his enthusiasm to work efficiently.  The place has virtually no rules besides no smoking or cell phones.  I think they have the cell phone policy just as a reason to yell at stupid people who can't read the sign... which I find hillarious.  Justin (piercer) is funny.After Chris left, I had to go to Deluxe so he could finish me up.  My next trip here was on a whim.  My future sister in law and I discussed a couple little tattoos we wanted.  I wanted some vintage flash that I always liked on the wall.  So, we came in and Turbo did a pig and a rooster on my feet.  Virtually painless and Turbo is a cool guy.  I like my work from here and the last time I went it was cheap.I am planning to get more work done, but I am going to try a few other places.  After I got the flash that I always knew would be from "Taylor St," I was satisfied.  I don't want to say it's the end of my Taylor St. story, but it definitely closed the chapter.  When I come back, I will try another artist.  Maybe one day I can say I've been to them all.

1.description: Went and got my shoulders tattooed by a traveling artist months ago. Their prices are way fair considering the quality of work. Whoever says this place isn't clean hasn't been to a TRULY dirty shop...you know one of those that pops up and closes down within a month or two? This place has lots of history and awesome artists. On the subject of 20 dollar name day: it says clearly on any advertisement I've seen that it can only go on the legs, arms or back. Maybe read harder next time?

55.description: I really had a great experience at this place (the best I've had at any tattoo parlor in Chicago to date).  I got my nose pierced by a guy named Justin; he was friendly, laid back, but completely professional at the same time.  Though this wasn't my first piercing, Justin explained everything he was doing, especially with the sterilizing of the piercing instruments, gloves, etc., which I could see would be reassuring if one had been misinformed about tattoo parlors being dirty.  The pricing was reasonable and the procedure quick and relatively painless.I would definitely consider coming here again if I ever wanted another piercing, though the resident tattoo artists seem to specialize in traditional American/Sailor Jerry art, which isn't really my style.  I would highly recommend people check them out when considering getting inked or pierced to see if their work is up your alley.

9.description: One day (about 6 weeks ago) my friend and I were having a day around Little Italy and let me tell you, it was full of excursions. Some of which I cannot fully disclose for the world to see! Haha, I'll leave it up to your imagination. It's not as bad as it sounds, I promise. Well, one of our many excursions ended us up at Taylor Street Tattoo. I wasn't planning on getting a tattoo when I woke up that morning. And neither did my friend, lol. So we walk in and she decides to get this intricate anchor on her side and I decide to get two little triangles on my inner arm. (They both have meaning, but I won't get into it). We were there for the longest time. I do understand that we were walkins and she had them draw up a design, but it was still around 4/5 hours total including tattoo time. About 1/4 of that was actual tattooing. They were great except for the fact that I believe I was grossly overcharged for my tattoos. My tattoos are two simplistic triangles on my inner arm that are no longer than an inch wide and 1/3 inch tall. No color, no nothing. I was charged $100...They told me it was because "The lines are so exact and straight and need to be perfect, so it's going to cost more." What? Aren't all tattoos supposed to be clean like that? Why are you charging me so much for something so little when you're charging my friend $200 for something that is 3.5x2 with color and even more intricate detail? It just doesn't make sense to me. I really think 3 stars fits here. They were nice enough, but at the same time kinda cold. I want to like this place more but I don't think I'll go back here. Don't go here if you're looking for reasonably priced tattoos and the results I see come out of the shop don't give it a credibility to be priced so high.

26.description: Great Tattoo studio. I followed Jason Hoodrich when he moved there and I really like the place, located in an awesome part of town. Good crew there, no fuss, no b.s.Just as an FYI, they don't do piercings; not that I am interested in those but just for info.

25.description: This place is tops. I've been getting tattoos for 13 years and this is my favorite place in Chicago over the last 2-3 years. It's also the place I've revisited more then anywhere else at this point.I've had tattoos done by "Turbo", Ricky Bird and Jason Hoodrich here. They're all certified awesome. I came in each time with a real vague idea or picture and they busted out a tattoo each time that was better then I could imagine it would have been.The place is clean and has no bullcrap. Sure it won't have a leather dentist chair or mood lighting, but it's clean and the artists know how to tattoo. It's not "LA Ink" or some junk but it's legit and a super solid tattoo shop. Pricing is fair/on par with most of Chicago. I've seen places way more expensive and I've seen places cheaper (but if they were cheaper, well you got what you paid for, meh.) You get more then what you pay for here in my opinion. Real talent and skill. I've referred coworkers and friends here and they're all super happy with what they got, the tattoos and the service.I'll try to get some pics of what I've had done up soon, I have to dig through my hard drive. Check out their Facebook or Twitter too for some examples of their work.Also remember, don't be a chump, tip these guys, they deserve it!

12.description: I went in on "$20 tattoo Tuesday", although I didn't get any  $20 tattoos(name tats). The guy that was at the front desk was just plain rude and was making up rules and prices as he go! Two other ppl and myself went in to get work done, but only 1 person and myself got tattoos. He was rushing us to figure out what we wanted to get. Then after I got done with my tattoo, that's when the rudeness went to another level. Had he done that before I got my tattoo done, I would have left! There were  2 women waiting to get $20 name tattoos for about 2 hours. At that point, it was 9:26p.m. The front desk jerk then asked how many more ppl were getting tattoos, then he went to back, made up something, and told the women that it would be $60 for the name tattoos after 10p.m. Even though, it was $20 tattoo Tuesday! They walked out angry. So I told him that they had been waiting for hours. Then he said that they didn't have to to $20 tattoos, they just do! With a hand gesture and very sarcastically! Ppl could take their money and take it somewhere else too! His whole attitude stank! I paid $160 and my brother paid $150, we could have went some place else that was more friendly! Don't get me wrong, all the tattoos artist were cool but that jerk at the desk was rude! Btw, Donna did our work. She rocked and was very cool. Also, if you're not getting tatted you couldn't go behind the desk. However, there was a girl getting tatted and her friend was in their with her. So my friend was in the sitting area using my phone then she brought my phone to the back where I was getting tatted. So the front desk jerk hurry up and said in a angry tone, that she couldn't be back there, so my friend said she was bringing me my phone, then he tried to hurry up and apologize! So it's ok for certain ppl to be back there when there not getting tatted? That's not fair! He's rude and disgusting! Don't go there, take your money to a more welcoming place!

59.description: If you want a top notch quality piece of art, go to Taylor Street Tattoo.  I got a piece done with Lana and I was completely satisfied with her work.  She met with me beforehand to get some ideas and pricing details.  She worked on me the next day.  Three hours later of top notch work in a clean and professional environment and boom...a smoking Tattoo on my bicep and I can't wait to get back in there for more work.

21.description: I went there tonight and got two fairly simple tattoos done by Kyle. I looked at some of his previous work prior to getting my tattoo done and I was confident he would do an excellent job. I LOVE my tattoos! Kyle is really nice, and chatted with me the entire time which helped to take my mind off the pain. I will definitely go back!

17.description: Lance Lloyd was our artist. I'm not sure if he's there on a regular basis but I hope so because I plan on going back and hopefully getting more work done by him. It's a great shop with good people and competitive prices. I've been there 3 times now and I haven't been disappointed once.

10.description: The worse customer service ever. Went to get a letter on my finger on tuesday, which is discount letter day. The guy I spoke to on the phone didn't say that certain parts of the body were excluded, and said that it would cost $5-20. When we came to the shop, the guy told us $60. When we said we weren't interested, he went on to tell us good luck finding another place to do it cheaper.

5.description: Friendly, great work, they work with you to make your ink great! Highly recommended to anyone wanting a tattoo.

3.description: Very friendly staff and reasonable prices. My tattoo looks great! Everything was very clean. (FYI, the order minimum is $60.00.)

35.description: Very professional and laid back at the same time.  I only had a vague idea of what I wanted when entering the shop, as my visit was a spur of the moment idea while visiting a friend in chicago, but  Turbo worked with me on drawing out a design.  The price was fair and the tattoo turned out way better than what I had originally pictured in my head.  Very happy with the service and the end result. Turbo's the man.  Will deffinitely stop back if I'm in Illinois again.

19.description: OK, This isn't "me" reviewing it, it'll be my husband since he's the one who went but he doesn't want to deal with his own yelp account. From here on out, it'll be Jeff, my husband:Taylor Street Tattoo is where you go to get tattooed. I know how simple that sounds. How elementary. But that's all that really needs to be said. If you want some bullcrap fake garbage go somewhere else. If you want a tattoo by people who know how to do it right and have no problems being honest, go here. I've only had 1 tattoo done here, about a year ago by "Turbo" (Chris.) I've been too busy/broke to get another one. The pricing is dead on, in the city (where taxes/insurance/rent is much higher) the prices do not get better unless you know some schmuck doing them in his bathroom at home. You get what you pay for. I've seen more expensive shops that have had way worse work rolling out. You will not get better work in this city, especially for the prices.Again, it's a tattoo shop. No glitz, no bullcrap, real honest people, be respectful and they'll respect you. If they're busy tattooing someone, wait, would you want your artist to stop mid work to go talk to someone else? Just wait or comeback or make an appointment. Not a big stink. It has the atmosphere a tattoo shop should have. Honesty and hard work.I've only decided to write this review because I feel there are too many negative reviews for this place and unjustly so (in my opinion.) I'll be going back soon. I'll upload a pic of what I had done too. Turbo had very little to work with source wise (black and white blurry line drawing) and made it come to life. If I had the cash and time I'd have returned a million times by now. But I do try to push everyone this way.OH, also I noticed yelp says they take credit cards. When I went, cash only. Which is better anyway, you don't need to sink yourself into more debt! Don't forget to tip.

28.description: Taylor St. tattoo is a great shop, everyone here was super friendly.  My wife and I wanted to get matching tattoos to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary and the talented artists at Taylor Street made it happen.  They took our idea and turned it into something even better.  Kyle and Travis hooked us up with some great art work, and we couldn't be happier with the results.

45.description: Today I had a rather large tattoo completed. I chose Taylor street based on the Yelp reviews and it's proximity to my apartment. Chris "Turbo" Goff was my artist and he was terrific. This was an excellent experience all around. They were busy but they got to me within 30 minutes. Turbo was very fast and efficient yet exceptional in the quality of his work. One person has mentioned on here that the decor of the place is boring...I totally disagree. There's lots of cool art to look at all over the walls and the place is cozy and comfortable. Ladies...you may want to know also that Turbo is a dead-ringer for Johnny Depp! I give this place 5 stars all around and highly recommend it.

33.description: Went there for a tattoo about a week ago(3/25/2011)  Donnie took care of me and he's a cool guy.   Nice and laid back.  His drawing of my description was great, and the final result was great.  My only issue was that the place smelled like cigarette smoke, and i would have liked to see Donnie setting up his tools so that I could feel comfortable knowing that single use needles were used, and etc...

43.description: I just went this past Tuesday for their $20 name day special. First of all yes, the special is $20. There are a few restrictions; you have to select one of a handful of fonts, it is for up to 7 letters with each additional letter at $5, and you can not put it on your chest. I wasn't very keen on the fonts they had available. So, I asked them how much would it be for the font I wanted and they told me $50, which honestly, was a great deal because at Tatoo Tatu (Sp?) I paid $65 for 3 letters on my finger. So, I went with 6 letters on my wrist for $50 with Chad who was awesome! Fair warning, if you are going on Tuesday it's going to be packed with college kids, cheapskates (like me) and some interesting characters. It's a hodgepodge of folks. The artists are patient, and not touchy-feely. So if you are looking for touchy-feely go some where else. If you are looking for no nonsense, good work go here. Oh, and if you are wondering what the quality of the $20 tattoos was, well 2 girls I was with got huge, beautiful tattoos for $20. Awesome.

2.description: My experience with this place was terrible. A woman who has been tattooing for 7 years messed up a very basic finger tattoo by going way too deep. When I came back to address it weeks later the shop denied it. Rather, they told me that this can occur with finger tattoos and I should have been aware of that prior to being tattooed. They offered to outline it in white as an attempt to improve it but the conversation was so frustrating that I won't be returning (not that they care).It's important to note that this was not a matter of aftercare but the tattooing technique itself. I wasn't there to get my money back but to see how we could fix it...it just sucked even more when they evaded taking responsibility.  I take fault for rolling into this tattoo shop on the whim and not checking out the artists first, even for something so basic. It was also overpriced for the quality and quantity of the work but that's whatever. I'm more concerned with having to get this reworked. I'm not sure about the rest of the artists that work here, perhaps some people have had awesome experiences and results, this is just mine.Advice: check out the artists at Deluxe Tattoo. You won't be disappointed.

18.description: If I could give 0 stars I would. I live right by here. I've gone in twice to try and get a tattoo, no I didn't get one...Not only is the place totally disgusting but the people are just dumb. I hate saying that but really they are. Anyways I'd never get a tattoo there it's like the ghetto inside. Sorry TST, clean up your act.

41.description: Nice little shop. I just showed up to keep a friend company, but decided to get a little ink done myself. They were able to get me in really quick, as I just wanted a couple of words. The artist guy (Chad) didn't really spend a lot of time talking to me about exactly what I wanted, so when I came back we had to resize my stencils. The work itself only took a few minutes, which was cool, but as my work healed, it looks like it only took a couple minutes. Pretty amateur. I hope if I go back I can get it touched up. I wouldn't have minded the lettering being a little thicker, too.My friend's work, though, done by appointment with Lana, was also quick and super nice. Clean lines, great shading. I guess I'll book Lana next time and hopefully be able to bump this 3 stars up.

52.description: I love this place. Look at some of the work on the artists profiles on the site, OUTSTANDING. I went to Turbo there and he did a great job. I've also seen work done by Lana Wingo, and its unbelieveable. Really cool stuff. Not ridiculously overpriced and not mainstream cheesy like some of the big places .My husband has gone to a few places in the city that have done really crappy work for him and news flash: IT's PERMANENT! He is planning to go to Taylor Street for some corrections and new tattoos as well. There are real artists here doing amazing work.UPDATE :) Went back AGAIN to Chris (Turbo) for another tattoo and it is even more beautiful than the first one! I trust the artists' here 1000% to create designs for me based on what I tell them I would like, and they are the best. I probably will never go anywhere else, and I fully expect to be having more work done here. I cannot say enough good things about their work. I love them.

50.description: Totally went to check out the 20.00 Valentines Day tattoo deal and ended up getting one that I really like.  Good job and a fun deal!!

4.description: Taylor Street is the only place I trust to tattoo me, ESPECIALLY after having the pleasure to work with Donna for a large Clipper ship I had done. The shop is clean, straight to the point, full of talented, competent artists and bullshit free- exactly what you should look for in a shop. Their ability to maintain such high standards will continue to be a driving point for me to only have business with them. I would give them 500 stars if I could, legally, I only have 5.

6.description: The first guy you talk to is named John and he's the coolest dude. He takes care of you and talks to you like a friend. The tattoos could be a little cheaper but that realistically depends on what you are getting. Highly recommend this shop. Great atmosphere and vibe, definitely coming again.

22.description: Such a great shop.  Really love the vibe and the guys who work here. Top tattoos in a real tattoo shop.  Plus the 'you get what you get' random tattoo machine is perfect for a quick cheap impulse tattoo!

15.description: My friend got his tattoo here. The place is dirty and not that friendly. On the outside of the tattoo they pressed too hard and there were placed on the inside that weren't fully filled in. I'm glad I did research and decided to go elsewhere

57.description: I'm surprised this place doesn't have more reviews. More glowing, five star reviews!I've been to two other well known Chicago tattoo shops and Taylor Street blows them out of the water when it comes to artistry, professionalism, cleanliness, and even friendliness. I got tattooed by Lana last week and I am in LOVE. Her work is PHENOMENAL. Line work, shading, color...BRILLIANT. Taking my idea and making it unique and her own...OUTSTANDING. I've had random tattooed-covered strangers on the bus tell me what gorgeous tattoos I have. I have two other tattoos/pieces and this one is by far my favorite. This lovely lady knows her shit!Another thing that's great about this place is the lack of holier-than-thou attitudes that I've experienced at the other two shops. Even the gal at the desk was super sweet! I will definitely be back...and can't wait!

20.description: I get that it is a tattoo shop and customer service is not the top priority but when I get a tattoo I want to feel like the person is actually interested in doing their job instead of feeling like everyone wants to get me the F out of there. Also, I coughed up 80 dollars for a four letter name in very small print, ripoff? Don't get me wrong it is not terrible; their work is decent but I have been to better places.

36.description: Where to even start...I visted Taylor Street last December when it was still under old management, Chad did my second tattoo (a georgous vintage sparrow on my rib cage).  I was so satisfied with the work and hospitality that I decided to take my sister and dad there on my dad's birthday (a family present in lieu of the fact that my father had recently survived a heart attack).  I went in the day before and made an appointment for my dad, he decided to get two tattoo's since he had to be taken off his blood thinners inorder to get them... I go in to make the appointment and get the pieces quoted and get treated as an idioc girl who knows nothing/nor has any tattoos.  Well this was recently after the shop was under new ownership... and Chad no longer there.After my dad recieved the tattoo's (the next day mind you with the quotes written down on the sketches) I went to pay was told something completely different $250 more than I was quoted.  Which okay $50 more I understand they artist didnt realize how much shading was involved in one of the tattoos he had quoted.  We said hell with it, my dad had some great work done, me and my sister opted to skip out because Chad was no longer there and Turbo had the day off (the artist who did her first tattoo, who was wonderful and very professional).A few months later I decided to go in and give this place another try, the work we had recieved was stellar.  Unfortuneatly I went in on $5 Tuesday, where the bargain hunters, ghetto thugs, and college kids all decide to go to get the cheapest most generic tattoos in the city.I walked in and said oh wow you guys are busy can i make an appointment for later this evening and was rudely greated by the front desk slave that "there are no appointments on Tuesdays and there's a wait" I was completely unaware of why (not knowing that this day is the almost free tattoo day for those who would like to have there serial killer boyfriend's names tattooed on them).  So I show the guy what I wanted and said I'll wait, he gos in back to get me quoted and comes out with a completely different design and quoted me a price that was far to high for the size and concept of my piece.  I then decided to show him my 5in by 4 in sparrow on my rib cage and say I paid 50 less for this in YOUR shop.  He says oh well and states the price, mind you I don't mind paying a premium for something going on my body for the rest of my life but whe I already have something 3 inches bigger with shading and intricate lines I expect that my generic gaelic knot that I want only 1 by 1 in would be far less expansive.  The door servant responded "this is what were going to do, we cant do what you want and this is what it's going to cost".Which was a blantant lie, I then relaized what was going on and felt as if they were trying to make up for their loss in revenue for the day with their "Almost-Free" tattoo day.  I walked out.. and went to Bridgeport Tattoo, I paid $100 less for the same exact tattoo that I asked Taylor Street to do, actually not the same Bridgeport Tattoo gave me the tattoo I WANTED, not what they wanted to put on my body. It's clean and welcoming and the artists are there to help guide you and do great work.Taylor Street is one of the most unwelcoming places since their new ownership, there staff is unhappy and frankly qualify into that "hipster-art snob-chauvenistic persona"   Who truely try to rip off people they deem uneducated or unworthy.

14.description: Went here for my first tattoo. I was a walk in, and I happened to be set up with Jason. He made me feel extremely comfortable even though I was considerably nervous. I had a basic idea of what I wanted, but I was indecisive as far as the colors I wanted and the placement. He told me the color scheme and placement he thought would look good, and I went with it. I'm very happy with the results!

3.description: Customer service at Sleepys on roosevelt sucks. They are not helpful at all the young lady must not wanted to be at work and it showed through her attitude. The bed is not of a good quality and spent over 700 for it and after six months went to Mattress Firm and bought another bed.  The service was great and I am in love with my new bed.  If you want an excellent experience go to Mattress Firm in North Lake, IL.

1.description: We bought 2 single beds for our sons. Had some problems with the mattresses sliding around on the frames, and although we still haven't completely resolved the issue, I have to say that the customer service that we received from Takara was above and beyond! I have dealt with many sales people and customer service representatives lately, and I wish that they were all like her! She literally checked in with me on a daily basis to let me know she was working on a solution. What a gem! Friendly, attentive, polite, and on top of the situation. Thank you Takara!

2.description: The service at this place is just wonderful.  Takara took me around and showed me all of my options, really listened well to what my needs/wants were, and helped me find exactly what I needed within my budget.  She was also just delightful to deal with!  I would absolutely recommend this store to anyone shopping for a new bed.

5.description: Leonard was the salesman that helped us and he was great!!  He great outstanding service and was very knowledgable. We didn't intend to buy a mattress but we felt extremely comfortable w him and didn't feel like we need to go anywhere else. There was no pressure.

6.description: If you're a fan of New York based chains that like to haggle people, by all means, consider buying a bed from Sleepy's. Even if you're not looking to buy just yet, they'll still try to shake you down. They'll convince you to leave a deposit, and claim they'll happily refund it if you change your mind. Except, they'll conveniently not do it. I made a wise decision to go to Back to Bed, and even they knew what reputable clowns the people of Sleepy's are.

7.description: My review is toward Sleepys in general, but mainly for customer service of Kamika. The bed I ordered was not the exact order I had in mind. When it arrived I was livid, and customer service was not helpful. They told me they would call me back within the next couple of days. I decided to call this store (where I originally purchased the bed) and Kamika answered and was SO HELPFUL. She stayed on the phone with me for an hour. I asked to stay on hold while she called the warehouse, her director, inventory, ect..  She then, told me she would call me back in 10 minutes, and called 10 minutes later! That same day, when I went in later to follow-up, she had all the paperwork ready to go. My new, perfect, amazing bed arrived yesterday and I absolutely love it! Kamika fixed the issue and within the next 2 days, I had the bed of my dreams delivered. I have total trust in Sleepys because of her. My bed looks AMAZING and is soo comfortable. Thank you Kamika for all your hard work and the best customer service I have ever received!

8.description: We were looking for a comfortable Queen size mattress within our price range.  Our salesperson, Darrell, delivered this and more!  We just got our memory foam mattress delivered today and it's amazingly comfortable, and a fraction of the cost of a Tempur Pedic mattress.If you're looking for a great mattress, go to Sleepy's!

9.description: postscript.  holy cow i wrote this review below before 2 (yes 2) botched/failed deliveries that are horror stories i won't get into...and i sit her now at delivery attempt 3 with 10 minutes to go in my 4 hour delivery window and the delivery man just called and said his "truck is broke down and he is right around the corner".  so at this point if i could give them a negative infinity score i would but i can't so the review stands.  sorry dan since you did call back and remedy my situation but it's the whole business that gets the horrible review and not you.  at least i removed your phone number below.--do not go here this place is a complete sham.  the place is understaffed and the few employees there know nothing.  go to back to bed right next door and you will get much better service.  the district manager dan said he will help me out and until he does this review will stand.---please please do not go here

0.description: I visited Sleepy's Roosevelt location this past Sunday with my mother who needed a mattress after using an outdated flip sided style.  We were greeted warmly by the manager, Dell and his assistant Vincent and guided to a set that my mother loved after Dell's patient informational style of questioning.  I would highly recommend their team to anyone purchasing a mattress set or needing to look for one!

4.description: Kameeca at the Roosevelt location provided me with one of the best customer service interactions I've experienced in a long time. She was pleasant, professional, did not badger me and went out of her way to answer all of my questions. I had an issue with a damaged item and she was super fast to rectify it to my satisfaction. Would highly recommend looking at the new lines in the store and trust that Kameeca would provide the best service.

28.description: Stopped in today with my husband while out for a walk in the neighborhood.  I was delighted to see that Skinny Piggy was open again.  i picked the chocolate cheesecake cupcake and the strawberry butter cream frosting.  I loved that I got to sample all of the frosting flavors before I chose the one that I thought would best compliment my cake choice.  My husband picked the vanilla cake with the cream cheese frosting.  The vanilla cake was moist and dense, and he loved the frosting.  We also sampled the creamy soft serve ice cream.  The new space is beautiful and we enjoyed speaking to the owner who is very friendly and shared her passion for what she does.  I will definitely be back with my son who would likely ask to top his cupcake with ice-cream and chocolate chips!.

1.description: I was looking for a small snack around the Little Italy area when I stumbled upon this place during my walk. The inside had this cute, modern, and clean atmosphere that drew me fairly easily. I was sad that they ran out of pistachio cupcake because that looked soooo good! I ended up getting the coconut macaroon and chocolate cupcake with strawberry frosting. From what I understood, you can make your cupcake fancy with your choice of frosting and toppings (e.g. sprinkles, mochi, candies). They definitely did not cheat you out on the frosting because despite my mini cupcake, the frosting was double the size of the cupcake. The chocolate cupcake was not too overly sweet and moist. Wasn't a huge fan of the coconut macaroon but that was only because it was on the chewier side (I like soft things). Overall, cute place and come check it out!

9.description: It wasn't the worst, but definitely not the best. I like the fact that you're able to customize the cupcakes. That's a unique idea and you can get creative and put your personal twist on it. As far as taste goes, I can say that the cupcake itself was not bad, the icing, however, had a moussey texture and taste. The customer service was so-so. We ordered a few cupcakes for a birthday and one of the boxes was kind of greasy - caked with icing. They didn't have a bag to carry our order in either. I'm not sure if they're used to smaller orders or what, but it was somewhat of an inconvenience because on the walk back to the car, the cupcake boxes kept popping open. Not cool. I don't know if I'd ever go back. I would encourage people to try the place out because they seemed to have an interesting menu aside from the cupcakes.

29.description: I dropped by while on Taylor street with my friend Gail and I saw one of the mountainous chocolate chip cookies and I had to have one. The chips are delicious and melting at room temperaure and the cookie dough is amazing. It's the best choclate chip cookie I have ever had.

23.description: I love that you can customize your cupcake on the spot! I had their red velvet and it was delicious! The owner is also super sweet

5.description: I'm in love with this place! I stop in twice a week, the cinammon bun is to die for!I'm writing this and planning my stop in at 4pm,lol.Monica and her sister who manages the shop are great. They always give me samples to help with my decision making, they are so helpful and never rush me, I feel like it's family serving me, feels great!  They have butter cream, whipped cream, and cream cheese frostings!  I've so far sent 15 co-workers they are daily customers of Monica and Lulu, I can say that I've influenced the pistacho, pina colada, cinamon bun, and the everything nice! I'm a bully lmao! I can't wait to stop in today. I'm a mental health councelar at Rush, and it's hard for me to get lunch in  because of how busy I am with patients. But let me tell you Skinny Piggy makes my day any day of the week, the staff is lovely. I'm sure all of you already know, I'm excited to go back!

31.description: Today is the soft opening of the remodeled and reconcepeted skinny piggy.  The store is completely redone. The candy jars have been transitioned into a create your own cupcake concept.  You can choose from an assortment of cupcake flavors (strawberry,  mixed berries, vanilla,  etc. ) and add your customized frosting (e.g. salted caramel, chocolate,  cream cheese,  etc) and choice of topping like marshmallows,  nuts,  or cherries.  Alternatively,  those who have a hard time making choices can opt for a house special such as the chocolate with chocolate cream cheese frosting cupcake which I tried.  It was very rich and full bodied. You can totally taste the cream cheese which balanced the chocolate perfectly. Very very yummy!

25.description: The best cupcakes in Chicago!!!!My kids and I love this place, the variety of malts is great and the service is amazing!!!The cupcakes are so moist and delicious, my favorite is the Pistachio cupcake, yummy! A must try! Don't take my word for it, stop in and try it yourself :)

12.description: Please don't ever go out of business. I haven't even been here, but what you're doing... It's incredible

21.description: Can't say enough about how awesome  these cupcakes are!! My absolute favorites!

16.description: What a super cool little bakery, tucked away in Little Italy. Great cupcakes and malts, etc.  Fun place to take the kids for a special treat.  A little pricey and would have liked for them to have at least one gluten free option and/a diabetic treat.

17.description: Best custom cupcakes around hands down picked up my special order and go check this place out

10.description: I would like to start off my review with all the positive things because I was not happy with my experience. First I would like to say that it's a really cute shop nice seating area nice and quiet. Also, I love the concept of build your own cupcake. Now to talk about what I came for, I went to the Skinny Piggy for cupcakes because they had such good reviews. First off the cashier wasn't even present when I walked in, when she did come out she didn't acknowledge me. Then I walked toward the register and said hello, she said I'm finishing off a order I will be right with you. The cupcakes on display didn't look appetizing they weren't decorated because of the build your own purpose I guess. The cupcakes themselves were really one noted. I ordered a strawberry cupcake and a salted Carmel cupcake I didn't like the fact that the cupcakes were not filled the only thing salted Carmel on the cupcake was the little Carmel they put on the top the rest of the cupcake was plain had absolutely no flavor and then the strawberry cupcake I ate it and asked myself what flavor was that supposed to be. All the icings was the same texture and flavor who ever does that baking here needs to go back to the drawing board. I would not go back to this place nor do I recommend this place. I really don't like giving bad reviews but this place was awful I'm really disappointed.

11.description: Yea the service at this place is not so great. One girl was sitting around talking to some dude out on the floor while the other girl kept asking her for help with my order. My order wasn't that big, just a cup cake, ice cream and a malt. But let me tell you.....those cupcakes and custard mmmmmm just so yuuuummmmo! I haven't had cupcakes and custard this good in a long time. Too bad for the service, I would have really given this place a 5 star if it wasn't for the lazy co-worker.

26.description: I am a huge fan of cupcakes, and I have tried just about every place in Chicago that specializes in the 'art' of the cupcake. In my opinion, the true element which separates The Skinny Piggy from all of the alternatives is the level of customer service provided by Monica, the owner.  First Encounter: I stopped by one day to sample the goods, in anticipation of placing a larger order for my girlfriend's birthday party. Upon entering, I was drawn to the display of various cupcakes with frosting and topping options as I tried to figure out how this all worked. I was greeted by Monica and she explained the concept. After an awkward silence, I decided to go with the salted caramel and the lemon drop. I had the option to pick any frosting and topping, but I went with the standard and the frosting was applied right before my eyes. The Cupcakes: The cupcakes were very moist and the frosting was a perfect compliment. The salted caramel even had some type of caramel center that was a great bonus of added flavor. The lemon drop was also exactly how I imagined a perfect lemon cupcake to be; moist and lemony, without being overly sweet. No compaints at all. And with all this in mind, I decided to place a large order for the party. The Crisis:     So, I returned the following week to pick up an order of 1 dozen cupcakes, 4 different flavors: Red Velvet, Lemon, Salted Caramel and The Evil Twin (chocolate filled with cheesecake - my new favorite). The order was ready to go as promised, and I was off to drop the cakes off at the party location. Upon arrival, I reached over to grab the box of deliciousness - and the box fell over and all the cupcakes toppled around until they looked like a horrible science experiment gone wrong. I made a feeble attempt to re-arrange them in the box, to no avial. They were ruined and I did not know what to do. As I stared at what I assumed to be a wasted investment (these things were not cheap), I decided to try my luck and call Monica and explain what happened. To my surprise, she recommended that I bring them back and she would see what she could do. To make a long story a little shorter, she fixed them. She literally repaired and replaced each cupcake. I tried to give her more money to show my appreciation, but she would not accept. And this is what I mean by excellent customer service. Would the same thing happen if I had gone to a different bakery? Who knows, but I am glad I decided to go to the Skinny Piggy. The Aftermath:The party was a hit and the cupcakes were the star of the show.
