A few friends asked where I got them and informed me that they would be sure to stop by the next time they plan an event or when they are in the area. I would highly recommend it. Not only are the cupcakes delicious and the options almost endless, but you are guaranteed to receive exemplary service.

27.description: Monica, the owner was very welcoming and friendly and waited on us personally. My 5-year old and 2.5-year old daughters enjoyed their vanilla ice cream with rainbow sprinkles. I wasn't even in the mood for dessert until I tasted the strawberry cheesecake Monica masterfully created for my husband. I decided on the red velvet malt which included red velvet cherries and a whole red velvet cupcake--half mixed into the malt and half placed carefully on top with cream cheese frosting. I needed a spoon for the malt because a straw couldn't handle it. I pretty much got weak in the knees with each bite... It was that good. Skinny Piggy is a hip dessert spot with a hint of childhood whimsy from Monica's blue highlights to the rainbow array of candy on the counter. Free wifi, coffee, tea and modern table and seating options make this a perfect spot for all ages.  Will definitely be returning.

0.description: There isn't enough stars to rate this place! The quality, taste and freshness of their pastries are beyond words! If you think you tasted a great cupcake you haven't gone to skinny piggy! Their caramel brownies are addicting! Establishment is in a great location and the staff and owner are great! Next time i need a dozen of the best cupcakes in Chicago, this is the place im going to!!!

20.description: I love it all! Great atmosphere, awesome staff (Monica and sis), and most importantly - absolutely delicious desserts!!! Love the concept - create your own. Texture is great, flavor is great! Not too sweet - just perfect. My faves: chocolate cupcake with rumchata frosting, pistachio cupcake as designed, salted caramel cupcake as desgined, pumpkin spice as designed (get it before it's gone - it's seasonal!) to mention a few! I have tried more and liked them all. Add a chocolate covered gummy bear or some bacon or glazed pecans! I look forward to going again and I'm always happy when I leave.

19.description: I came in here by accident while visiting from out of town. I'm not into sweets and was just looking to grab a coffee, but was struck by the idea of having a treat. I'm glad I did! Had the cinnamon bun and it was spectacular.  It was not that sweet, which I really appreciated.  It was light and flaky. Didn't feel like I just ate a sugar coated brick of dough. Coffee was served in a french press!

2.description: Came in today expecting the same quality service but the girl at the counter made me feel rushed and did not even let me choose a frosting. Disappointed.

18.description: This place is AWESOME if you're looking for a unique, personalized, and customizable dessert option, especially malts with ground up cupcakes.  The basic concept is that you can make any sort of dessert (cupcakes, cookies, brownies, malts, sundaes, cheesecake) from the multitude of ingredients that have available to you (different drizzles, candy toppings, frostings, ice creams, cakes, etc). Personally, I really enjoyed getting a malt made with vanilla ice cream, a ground up red velvet cupcake, crushed graham crackers, and cream cheese frosting with a caramel drizzle on top. It was phenomenal, reminded me a lot of the texture of Portillo's chocolate cake shakes, but with a taste that was more catered to what I like! For those of you who don't like having too many choices -- you can always go with their menu of recommended combinations/items, or you can ask for advice from their really friendly staff. The only downfall of this place is that they close pretty early (7 PM), so it's hard to go there after dinner dates or at late night hours. If they could expand their hours that would be great!

13.description: Today is the soft opening of the remodeled and reconcepeted skinny piggy.  The store is completely redone. The candy jars have been transitioned into a create your own cupcake concept.  You can choose from an assortment of cupcake flavors (strawberry,  mixed berries, vanilla,  etc. ) and add your customized frosting (e.g. salted caramel, chocolate,  cream cheese,  etc) and choice of topping like marshmallows,  nuts,  or cherries.  Alternatively,  those who have a hard time making choices can opt for a house special such as the chocolate with chocolate cream cheese frosting cupcake which I tried.  It was very rich and full bodied. You can totally taste the cream cheese which balanced the chocolate perfectly. Very very yummy!

4.description: I was having a bad day & saw this place on my way home so I stopped in ( since I've heard my friends brag about it). I ordered a delicious chocolate cupcake customized with chocolate ganache, cream cheese frosting & sprinkles. It was awesome how many topping selections they had including frostings. The service was pleasant & I left with a smile .

24.description: Best custom cupcakes around hands down picked up my special order and go check this place out

6.description: I happened upon this place after a meeting in the West Loop. The decor is minimalist and excellent, and the selection of cupcakes is eye-popping. But as if that wasn't good enough, prepare to have your cupcakes frosted. That is not a euphemism - they customize your dessert with frosting and toppings ranging from fruit snacks to chocolate-covered popcorn. Metropolis Coffee on hand is an added bonus. Would come back for sure.

22.description: I was having a bad day & saw this place on my way home so I stopped in ( since I've heard my friends brag about it). I ordered a delicious chocolate cupcake customized with chocolate ganache, cream cheese frosting & sprinkles. It was awesome how many topping selections they had including frostings. The service was pleasant & I left with a smile .

15.description: This place is amazing!You get to build your own cupcake! It's is such a unique, awesome idea. You can pick the cupcake flavor, fillings, toppings you want. It's so much better than going into other pastries and having to get pre-made flavor combos. Not just that but their cupcakes are fantastic!! I bought some for my friends and they LOVED them too. Overall, 5/5 experience with them: Nice staff, great service, unique place, and delicious cupcakes.

7.description: I have been coming here since the opened. I have always gotten the red velvet or salted caramel (which DO NOT disappoint), but today they were out of cream cheese frosting. I decided to go with the everything nice cupcake with buttercream frosting. OH WOW! Thank goodness I moved, because I would eat one every day! Love the atmosphere and the the malts are delish too! Wish it wasn't so pricey, but it's worth it!

8.description: Ok, if you want to have a dessert table for any occasion like a wedding, which is what we did, this is the place to come.  Monica is awesome to work with!!! We had a tasting at the bakery which was amazing as I left with a belly ache from shoving my face with all the awesomeness they have there.  They even detailed recipes to our taste and preferences.  Make sure whatever you do DO NOT under estimate quantity because our table was devoured in an hour.  So if you want an exceptional sweet table for any event make sure you call THE SINNY PIGGY you wont be disappointed!!!  This coming from a very picky couple as well....Great Job Manica we will be back and I will post pictures of our table soon!!

30.description: Ambience, music, staff, choices and most importantly create whatever the hell you want!!!! What life should be! Please add ice cream to your menu!

3.description: I really wanted to like this place but the best way I can describe it is "clunky".  You walk in and its cute decor wise and since the cupcake case is the first thing you see I immediately thought it was a cupcake shop.  Unfortunately, for me this place is no Molly's.  I was given the run down as I'm pretty sure the lady behind the counter knew I was perplexed  by the naked cupcakes, they just had the bottoms no frosted ones except the cupcake "mannequins" to show what you a couple options.  She described that the cupcakes could be filled and topped anyway you would like even with candy.  At this point I likened this place to a yogurt shop where you start with the base and get creative.  The only problem with that for me was, when it comes to cupcakes I get lazy and I just want to grab the one that looks best and has the most appealing flavor combo.  So that's a problem for me, too many choices, and you end up with a hodge podge mess that doesn't even go well together.  They do offer malts and s'mores which may have been the better route to go.  Another thing I noticed was that the lady had to keep going in the back to get ingredients, i.e. Nutella, reeses Peanut butter ( out of a jar to center fill my chocolate cake).  I know this sounds like a really terrible experience but it truly wasnt , as I mentioned I just think this place has to work out some kinks.  If you're going to go with a build your own option, I think a menu of frosting cake and topping choices would be really helpful or maybe suggested cupcake combos.  Also for 4 cupcakes it ran me close to $20.00, which seems really high to me.   I will say though, the  chocolate cupcake had a great texture and flavor so they're on to something, the buttercream texture was a little off to me, not exactly creamy enough but tasted fine.  Lastly, I like a cupcake shop to take me all of five min to get in and out before I can talk myself out of all those calories, this place does not give that kind of quick stop experience, took a while actually and I was the only person there, part of the reason was I couldn't choose toppings quickly, so I can't imagine how it would be if it was busy, probably a long wait.  I hope they work out the bugs, because I love small businesses especially I'm a neighborhood like tri-taylor that I love.  Good luck!

14.description: Monica, the owner was very welcoming and friendly and waited on us personally. My 5-year old and 2.5-year old daughters enjoyed their vanilla ice cream with rainbow sprinkles. I wasn't even in the mood for dessert until I tasted the strawberry cheesecake Monica masterfully created for my husband. I decided on the red velvet malt which included red velvet cherries and a whole red velvet cupcake--half mixed into the malt and half placed carefully on top with cream cheese frosting. I needed a spoon for the malt because a straw couldn't handle it. I pretty much got weak in the knees with each bite... It was that good. Skinny Piggy is a hip dessert spot with a hint of childhood whimsy from Monica's blue highlights to the rainbow array of candy on the counter. Free wifi, coffee, tea and modern table and seating options make this a perfect spot for all ages.  Will definitely be returning.

1.description: When I was living in Edgewater I was spoiled by living just around the corner from Frank's National Video; that place was the best and totally spoiled me when it comes to video stores.  Campus Video does its best to compensate though.  What we have is a competent little hole in the wall video store that has all the new release DVDs you'd anticipate and a smattering of older titles too, but don't expect a grand archive.  Prices are cheap and holding steady at $2.50 for new stuff and maybe $1.50 or $2 for older things.  I'm not sure where exactly the cut off is but there is a helpful sign hidden behind the counter which will tell you where in the numeric system the change over happens.  Math nerds, have fun with that.    Lately the walls seem to be emptier than usual and they've taken to selling TVs and computers; I'm hoping this isn't a sign of going under.  There's an Indo-Pak grocery store in the back but I can't really vouch for any of that since I don't live with the roommate I used to have who had "refined" taste.  Just a note though, it's always fucking sweltering in there.  You will literally be sweating if you spend enough time inside.

0.description: This was the closest video store to my old apartment. It had enough newer DVDs to keep us busy for a few months, but after we got through those the selection was slim. There were plenty of Bollywood videos I never got around to though. I didn't check out the videos when I stopped in tonight, but the shelves did seem more empty, as Bill M. mentioned.My favourite part about this shop is the grocery nook in the back. Since there weren't any grocery stores close to that apartment either, we subsisted on items such as frozen parathas and dhoklas from a boxed mix for many nights. It's probably the best place to go for Indian spices (kalonji, amchur powder, etc., which the standard grocery chains don't carry) unless you want to travel to Devon Street. They have plenty of dal, chickpeas and the like as well.I can't remember the exact store hours, but videos are due by 8pm the next evening. Good if you're in the area, but not a destination place.

58.description: I was in desperate need of a bed since I was unable to take my last one with me after moving to the city. All the fly hunnies be like "when you getting a bed? Doing it on the kitchen floor is getting uncomfortable." Mark Geezy likes crushing pink cookies like everyday so he had to do something quick. Purchasing a bed from here was absolutely stress free. I told them I wasn't looking to spend over a certain amount, and they made it happen. The best part being I actually like my bed. I opted to have it delivered on a Tuesday after walking into the store on Sunday. They didn't take more than 10 minutes to move it inside and set it up for me. I totally recommend them over those grubby used car salesmen-esque hacks at Sleepy's. They came off completely desperate for a sale and try their damnedest to make sure you don't leave without at least making a deposit on their crappy beds.Come to Back to Bed if you're in need of a mattress and don't want to deal with b.s.

56.description: I just experienced the absolute best customer service from this location. I did a little bit of research before I went in to the location and was happy to get helpful clarification on my final purchase. Kip was patient and informative. He helped me make a relatively quick purchase I didn't feel buyer's remorse about. The price was right too!

29.description: I came here because the mattress I bought a few years ago started to sag. I knew I didn't want the same one because of all the issue I had with a fairly new bed. I recently did the warranty process with took a WEEK. Yes, you heard right...the entire process of submitting my warranty and getting it approved to the bed at my house literally took a week! Wow, I have read a lot of bad reviews and I didn't expect the process to be this easy, but Rachelle and John made this experience so much easier. I came here because this was one of the closest store to me and I am glad I did. Rachelle was very patient with me and let me try about 5 beds. She never once rushed me and both her and John didn't try to pressure me into anything I didn't need. We decided to pay more to upgrade to a better mattress and they were nice enough to give me $80 more for my old mattress warranty credit and they also knocked off the shipping which was another $80. One day later, the bed came and they set it up for me and moved my old mattress out. Couldn't have it any easier. Thanks again guys!!

42.description: One day I woke up and decided I wanted a new mattress. I went down to B2B with pretty much my entire family, and we bought me a mattress. Glad I went there. There was no sales pressure. The manager Kip was friendly and helpful, and didn't try to upsell me at all, and even recommended a cheaper mattress based on my sleeping style. In the end I went with one of the premium mattresses - Beautyrest Black - ooooh! It's nice. I honestly think that I wouldn't have purchased the fancy mattress if there had been any sales pressure. I just walked in and bought a mattress. You're probably better off if you know the price points on comparable products, know what promotions the competition is offering etc.  This place is alright!

23.description: One can't really deny that a good night's sleep is of the utmost importance in life and so the quest for a great mattress is likely up there with finding the world's largest emerald. Luckily, visiing this particular location of Mattress Firm is actually much better than finding the world's largest emerald; it's more rewarding, more refreshing, more exhilarating and way more life changing--way more. Buying a Mattress from the men who work here is likened to when a man puts on the Three Wolf Moon t-shirt: everything just gets better and you instantly become more attractive to the opposite sex. Overall, you just start winning at life.On the rainy Monday morning that I decided to make my visit to Mattress Firm, I had no idea that my life would be forever changed. When I walked in with my Chicago Bulls tank top on, I was greeted with a "BULLS!" Initially, I thought this young, spirited man was yelling "BALLS!" at me (which I would have equally enjoyed, if not more) but then I remembered my shirt and realized this man was simply excited about the sport of basketball. His name was Joe and he quickly became the missing link in my life. Joe not only knows more about mattresses then the inventor of the mattress, he also knows a great deal about thread count in sheets. You'd be surprised how useful all of the knowledge Joe retains is. I actually felt my IQ go up 30 points after our first conversation. Additionally, Joe has swagger and was wearing his suit and tie like he was doing it a favor. Although Joe was not my main contact for my mattress sale, he was just as helpful, humorous and overall a joy to be around. Did I mention I got smarter from just standing next to him? Because yeah, I definitely did. (Most of the big words I am using in this review were taught to me by Joe).For as many great things as I have to say about Joe, I can say just as many incredibly wonderful things about Antonio. As you can see from reading other reviews, Antonio is the PROM KING of this Mattress Firm. He is the guy in high school whose locker you REALLY WANTED to be next to yours; and when you found it was, you basically died, then came back to life because you couldn't possibly have daily locker conversations with Antonio from the grave. Antonio is fit, strong like bull and very charming. I imagine he sells mattresses just by staring at humans; his charisma is similar to that of the love child of Harrison Ford circa 1982 and a panther. My experience at this location would not have been the same had it not been for Antonio; he is the part of your life that you never knew was missing. You can only know this by going to meet Antonio and I instruct you to run, not walk, to do so.As wonderful as both Joe and Anotnio were, my Mattress Firm trip was pushed over the edge of "this is the greatest day of my life" by Justin. Justin exceeded every single expectation I had for buying a mattress. I thought I was going to walk in and hear about springs, and coils and good night sleeps but Justin wasn't having this. He not only applauded my goal of wanting to lie down on every single mattress in the store, he encouraged it and cheered me on as I did so. He made sure I was comfortable & carefully and meticulously guided me through the difference between each type of mattress and demonstrated sleeping positions that were so graceful and amazing, I would have thought he was a modern dancer at Joffrey. This guy possesses the sense of humor of every best Match.com date you've ever been on; this allows you to make your mattress selection while simultaneously burning calories via laughter. He also wears a ring that has powers like the Schwartz ring on Spaceballs, only better. He uses this ring for good and not for evil. Justin will not only inform you about what he believes will ultimately the best choice for you sleep wise, but he will also help you through the financial aspects of purchasing the mattress as well. In my case, Justin actually made it RAIN money inside the mattress store; this was partially due to his dance moves and also due to the moment where he took a blade to one pillow and ripped out a wad of one hundred dollar bills. He gave them to me with a hug then asked if he could brush my hair; naturally I said yes. It was through this, along with his ability to give me the absolute BEST possible price he was able to give, that I could afford my amazing new mattress. Where as Antonio is the Prom King of this Mattress Firm, Justin is the Barack Obama. He doesn't need to be Prom King; he is leader of the free world and he will give you the best night's sleep you've ever had to prove it.Truly, these guys are top notch; if you want a good time, don't call someone's Mom--go to this Mattress Firm. You'll not only get a better deal than you imagined, you'll get smarter, lose weight, suddenly become irresistible to the opposite-and same-sex, and have a memory you can tell your great grandchildren about.

47.description: We had a really great experience at Back to Bed! Kip was incredibly helpful, and gave us a broad overview of different styles of beds, price points, and what to expect from different brands. He wasn't pushy at all, and gave us space to try out the beds while also coming back to answer our questions. He helped us navigate the products as my partner and I had different bed preferences. We ended up finding a mattress that we love! Would recommend Back to Bed to anyone looking for a great quality mattress.

8.description: First time here. Met Carmella L. as my sales help. Very pleasant, professional, and after trying a few models found the perfect set for me. The price was great. Am very happy with my experience at this store !!Update: Bed set arrived on time. Guys were very professional, polite, and got the job done. Overall, a very good experience from purchase to setup.

31.description: just bought our second bed here.  first one is extremely nice but the deal we got was superb.  great location, free parking, easy in and out.  wonderful customer service.  kyle took care of us the first time, kip the second.  kip manages the location and he really cares about his business and his customers.  if you're in chicago and you're looking for a high quality bed at a good, fair price, check this place out.  they gave us free delivery too and the delivery guys are top notch

34.description: Had a great experience. Excellent low-pressure, helpful customer service. Really helped us make a decision we're happy with.

16.description: I was at my patience end looking online and with the ability to talk to a sales person and actually try the mattresses I was searching for was the deal closer for me.....!

13.description: Pleasant and very helpful staff. Gave information when asked but didn't hover while I was trying out the mattresses!

11.description: Great place, helpful and friendly staff, and they deliver same day! The beds are also really great!

39.description: I hate shopping for furniture.  I have been putting off buying a new mattress for years.  Not because of the cost, but because of the time and hassle.  I decided that I could not put this off any longer since my old mattress was sinking.  It was like climbing out of quicksand every morning.  I checked Yelp and saw all the 5 star reviews and decided to check it out.  The manager Kip was there to greet me.  He listened to my preferences and had me check out a few based on those preferences.  He gave me all the facts and did not try to upsell me.   I ended up purchasing a mattress set, steel frame, and a beautiful oversized headboard.  They went over my bill line by line so I understood everything.  No hidden charges whatsoever.  I was in and out of the showroom in about 20 minutes.  The delivery process went smoothly as well.  Delivery is free and they remove your old mattress and box spring.  The guys were right on time and assembled my frame and attached the headboard quickly.  They were done in about 15 minutes.  It has been a week now and the my only regret is that I did not do this years ago.  I cannot believe how comfortable my bed is.  I actually go to bed about an hour earlier than usual because I look forward to it.

37.description: This is where you want to go to buy your next mattress. Kip was great and listened to my needs without pressuring me to buy a high end mattress that I wasn't in the market for. He was incredibly knowledgeable and then left me alone to try out various mattresses and come to my own decision. The one I chose was a $100 cheaper on their website (it hadn't been changed from their last special) so he not only honored that plus free delivery, but also let me use my groupon for an additional $200 off!  My delivery was right on time, quick, and I finally slept like a baby on my new amazing mattress. All in all, a great experience thanks to Kip and his crew!

0.description: Bobby M is an excellent sales associate at Mattress Firm -- professional, personable, and extremely knowledgeable.  He helped us narrow down our choice of bed and gave us an amazing deal. We will definitely come back to work with Bobby for any upcoming bed purchases.

38.description: My wife and I went here to get a specific mattress. I was expecting the typical heavy sell tactics and manipulation of the truth but I was wrong. Bob was honest, patient, and professional even in the face of our erroneous assumptions. We went to other stores that day to find the mattress but decided that Bob's salesmanship trumped the others. Back 2 bed had comparable prices and our mattress was delivered the next day!! I could not believe how quickly it arrived. Best nights sleep we've had since we moved to Chicago. Thank you Back 2 Bed!

51.description: I was in the market for a queen sized bed.  They had an option in each price range which gave me a lot of options.  The owner, Kip, was very helpful and helped explain the differences and benefits of each.  Once I picked out the bed I wanted it was a breeze filling out the paperwork.  He even included a few bed frame and was free delivery.

27.description: Antonio King helped us buy our first tempur-pedic king bed! He gave us free rails to hold us over until our new bed frame arrive in 8 weeks. Great experience and very helpful staff, also next day delivery!

32.description: Kip was great. He gave me a walk through to give me a sense of the mattresses available, and how they stepped up in quality and cost throughout the various ranges. He was happy to leave me to test each one, and I spent a good 10-15mins on each mattress trying them out. Kip didn't steer me in any particular direction and he was not pushy. I brought my partner back the following night, and Kip was again helpful, and was happy to run through the process again. I found him both knowledgeable but at the same time not prescriptive. He was able to solve our replacement bed problem with a great deal on the mattress and the box springs. The guys that delivered the bed were very efficient and assembled the box springs in no time in a time window that was convenient for me. The mattress started a little firmer than the showroom stock as Kip advised, but now I'm enjoying dreamy sleep. Thanks heaps!

54.description: Wonderful Customer Service!!! I went in and needed a bed on short notice and found what I was looking for with the help of Kip.He was helpful answered all of my questions and he was very personable to boot. I was also appreciated that he was not pushy and allowed me to try out the beds without hovering.I would recommend going into this location to anyone who's looking for helpful and informative staff that provides excellent service.

48.description: On a Saturday morning, I left Back to Bed and called my mom to inform her of the big-girl purchase I just made all by myself, and led with "I just had the best time buying a mattress!"Seriously!  It was Memorial Day Weekend, and that means you have to buy a mattress, right?  I had been waking up a little achy, which either means I am getting old or need a new mattress.  I refuse to believe the former, so I took a walk to Back to Bed.  I got there pretty much right after they opened, which was lucky because I got to work with all the employees.Darren helped me find exactly what I wanted (a firm bed with a pillow top...I was afraid it didn't exist!), Earl hooked me up with a great deal (and I caught him singing along with the radio to "Quit Playing Games with my Heart"...which was AWESOME), and Kip was an absolute blast to talk to (believe all the reviews you read about him, he's the man).Just when I thought the service couldn't get any better, three nice men delivered and set up my new bed in less than 24 hours (on a Sunday!!).  I've been sleeping like the dead ever since.If you're in the market for a new mattress, I can't say enough good things about this place!

44.description: OK...I know exactly why Back to Bed on Roosevelt has received almost all 5 star ratings=KIP!My husband and I bought a bed at another location and we chose the wrong bed for us. We went into Back to Bed on Roosevelt in total despair about purchasing another 1K mattress. We spoke to Kip about our 4 month old mattress and he gave us great advice and really worked with us. We came in a few times and really took our time in choosing a PERFECT mattress. We originally had a Beauty Rest that gave us horrible back pains. We ended up buying a Tempur Pedic- Prima and I can say that having it for 3 days, we are liking it a lot better. Kip was exceptional in customer service. Not pushy, informative, friendly and considerate. I truly enjoyed his knowledge of mattresses, as they helped with making our final decision. I would HIGHLY recommend this location of Back to Bed, as Kip embodies customer service. The delivery was seamless and the delivery men were friendly and efficient.

24.description: These guys deserve their 5 star rating.  We got in and out in under an hour, and these guys worked within our price range.  They matched competitor pricing as well.  Highly recommend to anyone in the market for a new mattress!

7.description: Bobby was fantastic! He gave me a great price and helped me get exactly what I needed!

49.description: I've been looking to replace the mattress that my parents gave me to take to college--it's 28 years old. I went into Back to Bed for the Memorial Day weekend sale and the guys there seriously hooked me up! I (of course) fell in love with the insanely expensive Tempur-Pedic right off the bat. They worked with me to find a bed that fit my needs and my price range.  If you're looking for a scientific explanation of the different bed types, they have it.  Plus, because of the holiday sale they were able to throw in some goodies to make my decision even easier. Kip is the bomb! We had such a great conversation and I was so comfortable there that I stayed for a good 15 minutes after the sale went through. It was overall a great shopping experience! I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a new bed.

40.description: I was in a pinch to find a good mattress fast and came to this location because of it's stellar reviews on yelp and I'm glad I did. I was greeted immediately and never felt pushed into anything or hovered on. Great selection and service. Walked in and out within half an hour and set up my delivery and everything. Kip the manager was beyond friendly and I would definitely recommend this Back to Bed location to anyone!

53.description: The customer service at Back to Bed was fantastic. He was extremely knowledgable and went over the philosophy of the beds and how they work. Best part about the experience was that he was not pushy and allowed us to lay on and check out the beds without hassle. Definitely recommend back to bed first before going anywhere else

30.description: I put off buying a bed/mattress for several months due to anxiety when shopping for any item.  HOWEVER, KIP at Back to Bed was the pinnacle of great customer service.  He was extremely accommodating and did not rush at all. We had great conversation and this friendly interaction, made it a pleasant experience to purchase a great bed.  I would recommend this place to anyone who is in the market for a bed and does not like to be rushed into making decisions.  Great job KIP!!!

46.description: This company does their homework so we don't have to!! We had a great experience today while shopping for a mattress.  Kip and Kyle were very helpful.  It was a no-pressure feeling.  We learned a great deal about how to choose a mattress.  We bought today and have the bed delivered tomorrow! Can't thank you enough for your generosity!J and K

1.description: I have been a long time customer of Bedding Experts on Halsted and 35th. So, when they moved, I didn't know where to go. Luckily Yelpers guided me here. I went in one hour before they close, and was immediately greeted by Justin. He was very helpful and friendly. He got me a great deal, and saved me from driving to the next closest Bedding Experts. I'm so glad I've found me a new mattress store.

55.description: This mattress store was awesome! The salesmen were super friendly, not pushy, and helped me find a bed that was both comfortable and affordable. Bonus--Kip remembered me from when I bought a bed 6 years ago at their Northbrook location! Highly recommend.

9.description: From beginning to end, this place delivered. My husband and I were greeted with friendly hello and from a manager who quickly summoned a salesman to help with our search for a new mattress.  The showroom was big, bright, with lots of selection in stock, plus free parking. We weren't big purchasers that day...just a twin set for our child's first bed...but the service we received was impeccable. The sales guy (I wish I could remember his name) gave us a great deal & made sure we got the right fit for our needs.  This location will be our first stop next time we're in the market for a new mattress!

26.description: John and Antonio were the best! Found me a great mattress at a great deal! Recommend to anyone! Thanks guys!!!!!

25.description: Antonio helped me finance my first mattress since 1997 (don't judge).  He was friendly & incredibly knowledgable!!! He patiently walked me through all the differences between each brand & style... Over & over, but I finally chose a BeautyRest, had it delivered the next day, & have been sleeping so much better ever since.  Go see Antonio!!!

12.description: This place was pretty busy, which is usually a good sign. My salesman, Tony, was really efficient at jumping between me and another customer like pro. Really happy with my experience here. Ended up getting a firm Posturepedic which is super comfortable.

59.description: Just moved to Chicago and needed a mattress for my new guest room. (Mom & Dad have to be able to visit!) Turned to Yelp for recommendations on good local spots, and it didn't steer me wrong.  Had the easiest, quickest, most pleasant experience here.  Since it was a guest bed and won't be frequently occupied, price was a key consideration.  The staff immediately showed me to items in my price range (no effort to up-sell - which I really appreciated, as I knew what I needed.)  I chose something and the whole process was done super fast - lovely conversation; nice people.   They even provided me with a free frame, box spring and delivery.  Delivery, too, was incredibly efficient...they worked with me to schedule a time that was convenient and the team was fast and pleasant with set up.  Absolutely recommend this location of Back to Bed!

21.description: Antonio was the best!  Made the mattress search a great experience and he definitely went way beyond the what was required.  I'd recommend him to anyone looking for a mattress.

10.description: First time buying a bed. Bobby was very helpful and very knowledgable. Did not try to sell me something he knew I wouldnt need. Was very upfront with pricing and information and got me a really great bed for a really good price.

5.description: I am back to purchase my 2nd bed from this store. All the guys are helpful and straight forward in finding the right mattress. Great prices, great product and great service!

3.description: Just purchased a bed frame from here. Justin was knowledgeable and friendly. Will continue shopping here.

35.description: My boyfriend and I walked into Back To Bed on a Sunday with the intent of just browsing the prices of a King sized bed. We were immediately greeted by Kip, who was informative and entertaining when explaining to us the different kinds of beds they sell at the store. He let us take our time to test out the beds without constantly asking how we were doing, but he was very attentive as soon as we had a question. We ended up leaving that day with a new King bed being delivered to us in 2 days! It was a great experience, we love our new bed and we would definitely recommend Kip and the South Loop location to family and friends!

19.description: Antonio helped me finance my first mattress since 1997 (don't judge).  He was friendly & incredibly knowledgable!!! He patiently walked me through all the differences between each brand & style... Over & over, but I finally chose a BeautyRest, had it delivered the next day, & have been sleeping so much better ever since.  Go see Antonio!!!

28.description: Love this place! Antonio was super helpful and I found the perfect bed! Great customer service. Would definitely recommend coming here to find your next mattress.

45.description: My fiance and I had no idea what we were doing when we went to Back To Bed over Memorial Day, but we walked out feeling like we had made an informed decision. Kip was immediately helpful and made the best customer service move ever by allowing us to "do our thing" and look around without holding our hands or pressuring us to buy one thing over the other. He respected that we weren't there for something that was top of the line and super expensive. When more customers showed up, he treated all of us equally and didn't take care of us any more or any less than he had been. This place is also a one-stop shop and they carry a variety of frames and headboards. We left without both of those things, but we are returning soon since it's the best and least expensive option out there.

33.description: I bought a mattress here in June, from Kip. Truthfully, I avoided the experience of buying a mattress for several months because I was so clueless about my options. I did some research on my own before coming into the store, but still wasn't sure what kind of mattress I needed or wanted. Kip was really helpful in giving me a concise and easy to understand breakdown of mattress density, fiber types, and coil structure. After explaining all the choices to me, he gave me plenty of time to test-sleep on a few. He was friendly, patient, and very knowledgeable, and assisted me in choosing a mattress that was right for my budget and my back. My great experience didn't end there -- my mattress was delivered in the first 10 minutes of my delivery window time! Thanks :)

43.description: My wife and I recently returned to Chicago after spending almost three years in London. Needless to say: we were in serious need of top-notch mattress. Luckily we were assisted by Kip! Kip gave us a very thorough walk through of every mattress type, and helped us select an excellent mattress to suit both of our needs and sleeping styles. Kip does a fantastic job making the process as simple and smooth as possible: he's truly a mattress connoisseur. Now the only problem my wife and I have is constantly dosing when getting into bed! Thanks, Kip.

2.description: Extremely low pressure sales and excellent prices. Ask for Justin who is super laid back and friendly and personable.

18.description: Great deals, outstanding customer service. Antonio is the best!! Very friendly, funny, and super freaking helpful!! So if you need a mattress come and visit him!! Thanks for everything!!

41.description: GREAT customer service!! I just have to get that out of the way so anyone seeing this will read it and know. Back to Bed has a friendly and knowledgeable staff that are there to get you a good night's rest - not just sell you some mattress and get you out. I went in with my fiancé over the July 4th weekend to check out the big sales. We've been in need of a nice mattress for some time and we thought a holiday weekend sale would be a great time to check some out.When we got to Back to Bed, we were immediately and cheerfully greeted by one of the staff, Kip. I have to say this guy made our mattress shopping experience a lot more entertaining. Lying around on beds may seem like a luxurious task but it can get boring and annoying pretty fast. He explained to us the differences, pros and cons, usefulness and ability of each and every mattress on the floor, and then left us to lay about and test them. Every time we had a question or concern, he was able to help. (He also was happy to give us some great restaurant recommendations as we're still new to the city)We ended up not being able to get a mattress right away as the one we ended up wanting was just a tad out of our price range. That is more on us than Back to Bed - their prices and sales were great. We just need to save more!!I can say we now know what we want thanks to the customer service at Back to Bed and are excited to go back once we've saved for our dream bed!

52.description: We went to Back to Bed for the first time to replace our old mattress. Nick was very helpful and helped guide us to the right mattress for my husband and me since we have opposite tastes in mattress firmness. He made sure we knew he was there if we had questions but wasn't pushy at all. Would definitely recommend this store!

50.description: This review is long overdue. I bought a mattress in August of 2013 from Kip at Back to Bed, and couldn't be happier with the customer service and general kindness of the manager and employees at the store. Earlier that day I had visited a few other retailers and had spoken with salespeople I felt uneasy with. Kip, on the other hand, was so helpful and genuinely eager to make my transition from the east coast to Chicago a smooth one. My mother and I took our time testing the mattresses and were left to make our own decision. When I selected a mattress, Kip threw in a cover and delivery for free. He was kind enough to let us leave our car in his parking lot while my mom and I explored downtown for the first time, and even called to tell us the car would be fine where it was after he closed the shop. He also gave us great recommendations for food in the city. It was so nice to meet someone  warm and friendly during my first days in the city, and I highly recommend this Back to Bed for any new transplants to Chicago!

4.description: Buying a matress with my parents. They wanted a specific matress, and Justin is a great. He was very patient and show us each matress according to my parents need.   Look for him when you are in the store.

6.description: Bobby did a wonderful job helping my husband and I find a great mattress. He was also very friendly from the moment we walked in.

22.description: I went to Mattress Firm yesterday and I had the best service experience ever!!!!!! I was greeted by Antonio who took me for a mattress experience. In search of my new bed. It all started with choosing my scented pillow. Then journey began. What type of mattress? What feature I'm looking for?  Etc....  Antonio was very patient and informative. At the end I found the perfect fit for me. Thank you for the great customer service and overall experience. I will definitely send people your way.

15.description: Darryl did an outstanding job helping us choose our new mattress.  Highly recommend this store!

57.description: Incredible customer service! I highly recommend this place!I was looking to replace my queen sized Beauty Rest mattress with something that was exactly the same. I have lower back issues so, I needed something extra firm but, comfortable.  I had always bought mattresses from department stores so, I was a little reluctant to try this place at first...but, I found a Groupon for $200 dollars off so, I figured why not?I went to this store on a Saturday evening.  As I entered, I noticed the closing time was 6 pm. I checked my watch, 6:05 pm. I said "oh no! are you all closed?" as there were only a few people inside.  One salesmen hesitantly said, well, we close at 6... Another immediately chimed in and said "Hi I'm Kyle, How can I help you?"  I was very surprised and impressed! At that moment, I knew I would be making a purchase here.  Kyle was very kind and knowledgeable.  He patiently listened to my needs regarding my back and pointed out the mattresses he thought would be best for me.  I never felt pressured or rushed even though I'm sure he was ready to leave.  He explained the pros and cons of each style and let me test it out each one.  Fortunately, I was able to find a mattress I loved (and my back did too).  Back to Bed delivered THE NEXT DAY! On a SUNDAY! Wow! Who does that?  I was expecting to wait several days even weeks for delivery.  The delivery men were timely, professional and respectful. They even put on shoe covers before entering my apartment!  The delivery was free and they even hauled away my old mattress set. I really cannot say enough good things about my experience at Back To Bed!  Great customer service is so rare these days that it was really nice to feel honored as a customer again.  I highly recommend them for your mattress needs and the prices are very reasonable too.

20.description: Antonio was great. After a bad experience at another mattress store. We went here andhe helped us with all our needs, with a great deal of kindness and great customer servicel. Finding a new mattress an be a quite  an experience., but due to antonio's great expertise our experience was so good. i would reccommend anyone looking for a new bedding to make that trip and recieve excellent customer service.ThanksClaudia Cheres

36.description: Kip was awesome! He put together a great package on a mattress set with free delivery for the next day! We just arrived in Chicago after traveling by car from PA. Kip made the experience so easy! 5 Stars!

14.description: My husband and I needed a mattress for our new house and had our minds made up about a certain brand of hybrid mattresses. Bobby took the time to explain the differences between the different high end mattresses in the store and after several days of back and forth and checking out deals at other stores we decided to go with a Tempurpedic. He treated us like family from the moment we walked in the store, and we are waiting on our invite over for Thanksgiving ;-)

29.description: Got to love when two people can eat two amazing dogs and fries for 5.00.

42.description: Fast food & friendly service at its finest. Lulu's has the largest assortment of fast food choices that I have ever encountered. They only accept cash, however they have an ATM conveniently located inside. One evening I came in and totally forgot to get cash. As I cried to myself a "damn, I don't have cash on me"...one of the sweet young guys offered to take care of the bill. As a strong, independent woman, I kindly refused and walked over to the ATM. I always look forward to eating at this place and catch some laughs with the guys. The guys are always friendly and never have an attitude. Come in and grab a bite to eat!

23.description: Good food, good prices, and really friendly staff. We stopped into LuLu's late one night on our way home from the bar and didn't have cash (FYI cash only = -1 star) but they were willing to throw our pizza puffs (which were amazing btw) into the fryer while we ran home to grab some cash. Had a good conversation with the guy working the register too. One of the many great lunch places in Tri-Taylor!

47.description: Reasons I keep going back - 1. service - the staff is very nice, a little old school (being called Sweetie or Baby won't get ya anything extra in the tip jar), but it's a mom-and-pop/family owned spot, and I'd rather support that than a McDonalds or BK any day.2. reasonable/reliable - more bang for your buck. Bigger and meatier portions than a chain for around $5ish.3. the yummy catfish sandwich...and it comes with fries

8.description: Dude, i had a fabulous meal!  I walked in the door chanting, "Lu-Lu's...Lu-Lu's...Lu-Lu's!"  The guy behind the counter was ecstatic to see me and my buddies.  He recommended the beef.  So, i got the Italian combo wet, hot, with provolone cheese melted on top (the only way), cheese fries with hot peppers on top, and a healthy glass of water to rinse it down.  Holy Christ was it delicious.  Not only was i starving, but the customer service was fun, the quality delicious, and the atmosphere nostalgic.Lu-Lu's...Lu-Lu's....Lu-Lu's!!!

31.description: Gyro meat was hard and chewy... like jerkey meat. Not impressed at all... pita bread was old and hard... very disappointed...

34.description: Lulu's is great. The main reason for their greatness is the staff.  They are all super friendly, and when they take your order, they repeat it in a really loud voice to the cook, even though he's like, 1.5 feet away.  It's much more fun that way though, which I'm sure is why they do it. Also, the main guy who is usually running the register looks JUST like Rahm Emanuel. As for the food, I can say that the hot dogs and the burgers are de-lish. Fries, not so much. They're kinda wriggly and not that great. Cash only, parking lot next to it, dining room is kinda like a cafeteria and has lots of posters from the 90's up.  All in all, a solid 4 stars! You guys are great!

16.description: This place... WOW. The quality of food for the price is great.Their hot dogs are pretty standard. Can't really mess up a hot dog. Their special is pretty good - 2dogs chicago style and fries for $5. What sets this place apart is their Italian Beef. It's the best I've had. Better than Al's beef in my opinion! The beef is perfectly cooked, tender, warm, and is paired perfectly with the jous. Add some pepper and celery salt... perfection.Oddly enough this place makes good gyros, ribs, and milkshakes also! Great hole in the wall place. The service is friendly. Every time I walk in the man behind the counter takes the time to talk to me while he's making my food. Great place!

13.description: Had the meatball sandwich and chilli tamale combo its was great! Great food, friendly staff and fast service. A must try Chicago spot.

11.description: I usually don't write reviews but I was so blown away by this place, I wanted to give them a shout out. I walked in and ordered 10 Chicago dogs and a few sandwiches. The food was prepared quickly, fries were made to order, and the price was crazy inexpensive. $5.25 for TWO HOTDOGS WITH FRIES.   The hots dog buns were nice and soft, hot dog was juicy and the toppings were perfect. Oh, and did I mention the staff? The guys behind the counter were friendly, funny, and overall cool. I'm only in town for a few days but I will definitely be back!

39.description: Pros: The hot-dogs...well they taste like hot-dogs. DELICIOUS.  The employees are suuuper nice. The hot dogs come with a healthy serving of fries.  Also tried the ribs here. I usually don't like ribs, but i ate these with joy.Cons: Some of their customers are creepy. Don't go there alone if you are a female, you will get stared at...hard.Note: its not on leavit St. its on the corner of Damen and Taylor.

37.description: Great place. Food is good and prices reasonable. I eat there quite a bit seeing how close to my work it is

0.description: Pretty much a typical hot dog place. They have a pretty large menu, the staff is really nice. Dining room is large. Added a star for free parking. Any time I don't have to feed the meter in this area I appreciate it.

38.description: Great service, fast and super friendly. I wish their roast beef sandwiches were not as dry though.

51.description: All the articles appearing in metropolitan Chicago publications about hot dogs prompted me to get to this fabled hot dog stand again. LuLu's has been around a long time. How can an 'insider' tell? Its street address is on Leavitt St. But Leavitt St. doesn't run by it any more. It was cul-de-sac'd a half-block north. LuLu's is now on the southwest corner of Ogden Ave. & Taylor St. Another way you can tell it has been around a long time is go inside and notice a reproduction of a Chicago Sun-Times readers' responses to one of Pat Bruno's fast-service-restaurant articles. It dates from 1983. You should recognize a familiar name represented thereupon.Was it a good hot dog? Yes, it was. The size here has always been the 'tens'. It was the best hot dog value in the city. Back in 1983, _not many people_ knew about it. Back then, the standard was a branded David Berg hot dog. David Berg ultimately was bought out by Vienna Sausage Mfg. Co., and whatever brand hot dog is being served here now is unknown to me. (It may even be not strictly kosher.)Is it still the best hot dog in the city? Sorry, no. But the bar has been raised considerably in the subsequent years. Lulu's is _still_ one of the best hot dog _values_ in the city. Two hot dogs will now cost you $3.25. The french fries are still institutional, but they're well prepared, and you get a reasonable quantity of them. (I won't spoil this review by otherwise mentioning other hot dog stands where it seems the amount of french fries you get with the "special" are strictly rationed to try and compel you to buy an additional order.)There are now a number of other entrees, including hamburgers, shrimp, catfish, perch, and chicken offered in a combination special. Amazingly for the neighborhood, there is a free parking lot aside. It is open until 11:00 pm on Monday - Thursday, 1:00 am on Friday & Saturday, and 10:00 pm on Sunday. Another aspect which has changed over the past quarter-century is that in 1983, I would not have attempted to walk the four blocks from the Blue Line "L"'s Illinois Medical District station [Damen exit]. The westbound #12 Roosevelt bus jogs north to Taylor via Damen along this span. The #38 Ogden | Taylor bus serves here, but only during weekday sunlight hours.

27.description: One word. YUM!

32.description: The first time I tried an italian beef I did not see what the big deal was.  Then I came here and tried it and it was AMAZING!  Also, the customer service there was awesome and they were helpful and great people!  Place was clean and food was awesome!  Glad I went there and I will remember it for future trips to CHI.  Must visit and do the italian beef with provolone and the spicy peppers.

54.description: Hungry and looking for a place with all the gritty feel of a Chicago detective story?  Lulu's is pure Chicago - hot dogs ('everything' does not include ketchup which every Chicagoan knows!), Polish sausage, Italian beef, and meatball sandwiches - served up fast and hot.  There's plenty of parking and a large dining area that's kept clean and tidy.Everyone from cops on the beat, docs from nearby County Hospital, neighborhood locals, and university students file in and out of Lulu's for good, inexpensive, authentic Chicago west-side dining.Hours: Monday - Thursday 10A - 11PFriday and Saturday 10A - 1ASunday 10A - 10P.

48.description: You gotta be kidding me. A grilled barbecued turkey leg with a mountain of fries (and garlic bread) and a drink for less than $4.89.  This is 2010, Baby, what's the catch? There is no catch! Ya' just gotta boogie down to Ogden Avenue.One of my jobs has me down in that neighborhood for long stretches on Saturdays. Today's breakfast was their 2 hot dogs (trimmings and fries) for $4.00. Perfect way to start the day.Dinner was this turkey leg dinner. Now I will try anything at a restaurant - anything. But the idea of a turkey leg meal for 4 bucks seemed too good to be true... or was it...I sat and waited for just a few minutes and was pleasantly surprised when I was handed my white Styrofoam container of heaven. This leg was succulent and delicious - not gamy and dry like a turkey can be.I - uncharacteristically - savored each bite (as opposed to wolfing it down like starving urchin). It was culinary highlight of 2010 (so far).The guys that run LULU'S are old-school guys from the neighborhood. They are polite and friendly - in a gruff kind of way. Everyone knows everyone and asks about the family.It is rare - these days - to be treated so well in a hot dog joint (except Donald Duk's on Ashland - but that is a different story) .These guys were like old buddies who were cooking your dinner.I have only one complaint is the seating areas has tables with affixed chairs - they do swivel out - but they are not built for tubby diners like myself. I had to do a little shimmy-shake to get into the comfort zone to enjoy my meal.They have regular specials - price busting deals - great service - awesome Chicago-centric art/photos on the wall.  If you haven't been there yet - yo ureally gotta get in there.I'll see you there...

44.description: It had been eons since I'd frequented Lulu's but I made it a point to do so one sunny fall afternoon, famished after running a laundry list of errands. I had been craving a burger and spotted the words "Paul Bunyan" in the corner of my eye as I strolled in to Lulu's. The Paul Bunyan is a double burger served with lettuce, tomatoes, onions and cheese served on French bread. For the massive burger, a side of fries and a medium iced tea, the damage to the pocketbook was only a mere dent of about $10. If you're looking for a little less to gorge on, try one of their combo specials.

24.description: Lulu's Hot Dogs is located in the University Village neighborhood.  It is essentially a glorified hot dog stand.  That is, it has a small, expanded menu in addition to hot dogs, e.g., Italian beef sandwiches and BBQ ribs, and a dining room with washrooms.My reason for going there is to get a hot dog.  The type offered is the traditional Chicago style Vienna brand hot dog with the usual assortment of trimmings, which includes onions, tomatoes, pickles, relish, and sport peppers, served on a poppy seed bun.  The dogs come wrapped in paper with French fries rolled in.  The dogs are good and the buns are properly steamed for warming.  The fries, however, are too soft and greasy.  The price is reasonable.  For example, two dogs with fries is $4.89.  The folks that work there are friendly and helpful.  The hot dogs at Lulu's are not the best in town, but if you are in the neighborhood and have a taste for one, stop in.

7.description: I love LuLu's! I have been coming here since I was in the womb! My mother had cravings of this place, which is probably why I love their food. Nowadays, I am stuck on their Italian Beef with Sweet Peppers. Beware if you ask for hot....I am a spicy lover but the hot peppers have been extra hot these days. I hope they are not using habinero but it sure tastes like it. I have my italian beef, double dipped in its juice. If there is someone else ordering with me, I order cheese fries or fried mushrooms. The other things I have order in past years are polish sausage, milkshakes (this was a veryyy long time ago) and hotdogs. Those who know me, know that I despise hotdogs and when I order them, its for other people but they claim they taste great. If you go during the weekday, I would call in order during 11a-1pm as the medical district and county employees have lunch, you dont want to be there during this time, because youll be in line for a VERY long time. The parking lot is in the back, big ample space. Altho, I rant and rave about this place, I could not give 5 stars as this place is more a pickup joint than a sit down type (altho they have a huge dining area 99%never use it) & it looks dingy and the floor is sticky n sometimes dirty. Also, they still dont accept credit cards!! CASH ONLY!!!

49.description: I was staying at the nearby UIC campus guest housing for an interview. I had no idea where there was any food so I just started walking west. Little did I know, if I had walked a little east, I would have eventually hit the Italian and Greek neighborhoods. Instead, I came upon this shanty hole-in-the-wall. It seems like this place came straight out of the 80's. All the decor was outdated, but it had a nostalgic feel to it. Although it was probably way past its prime, I decided to give it a shot because most good local places aren't particularly flashy in appearance. I ordered the double Italian special, which came with fries and a drink and the food came out in about 10 seconds. I sat myself down in a completely empty dining room and saw a very sad looking sausage with various toppings. It was greasy and didn't taste great, but at that point, I hadn't eaten in almost a whole day so I could have eaten anything. The fries tasted like the oil had been reused for a long time. As I was just finishing up my Italian dog, I overheard some people referring to me as "oriental." I guess that's how I knew I was on the wrong side of town. I quickly finished up my fries and left. It was an interesting experience and kind of weird, but don't think I will return for a second try.

40.description: After a couple of decades of never giving this place a chance, I am glad I finally tried it.  This is an old-school, dated, joint with perhaps the coolest guys working behind the counter in Chicago.Most of the napkin dispensers were empty and there was only one ketchup cup, but I asked for these items and they were promptly restocked.  The customers range from the gritty to the white collar worker, there was a nice mix on the day I was there, from those going to hear their punishments at the juvenile detention center across the street to those prosecuting them.  I had the cheeseburger with fries, I stuck to a basic item since it was my first time.  It was good, nothing out of the ballpark, but good enough to have again.  I had my cheeseburger trimmed with onions, pickles and mustard, wow, were those onions strong and plentiful.  I had to remove about half of them, so next time I will ask for easy on the onion.  Cash only, but they have an ATM in the spacious seating area.  They have one TV in the dining area, it was on the Cub's game.  When I am in the area and I am hungry, this is my spot.  And a big reason has to do with the great attitude of the guys working there.

53.description: If you are a meat-lover, try the double italian sausage combo. For less than five bucks, you will understand why Chicago is famous for it's meat foods. Food is cheap and delicious. Service is fast and friendly.

30.description: We were craving hot dogs on a Sunday and since none of our usual stands were open, we headed to Lulu's. Service was really quick and friendly. Just make sure you have cash, otherwise there is an ATM in back. The hot dogs were typical Chicago style dogs while the fries were a tad undercooked for my liking. I would like to frequent Lulu's, so hopefully they can cook their fries a little more next time.

46.description: For years my buddy has been recommending restaurants and they always seem to fall short. FINALLY, he suggested a winner with Lulu's.Lulu's is housed in a free standing building with its own parking lot. The dining area is quite large and clean. While busy on a weekday lunch, I was surprised the place wasn't jammed. It's in the area of several hospital complexes with many people.I ordered a beef-sausage combo, fries and a diet coke to absorb the excess calories. The combo sandwich was delicious and served on fresh Italian bread with sweet peppers. I'm not an Italian beef person, but this was excellent. The fries are of the standard frozen variety and just so-so. My sandwich was wrapped in a DQ (Dairy Queen foil wrapper) and our drinks were served in out-of-state surplus paper cups. I really like it when a restaurant does this. In this case I think it means they care more about a fresh, quality product than a pretty monogrammed box, wrapper or cup. The staff was friendly and engaging. They remembered my buddy, what he usually eats and joked about his girlfriend being absent. You won't find this banter at a chain store restaurant--only at a mom and pop.There's one bathroom that's faithful to a fast food dive, but it was clean. I wish this joint was closer as I would come on a regular basis. I hope to be back soon though and look forward to trying something else from their extensive menu. Nice job Lulu's!

1.description: The best place for cheap hot dogs and pizza puffs that you're gonna find. Typical Chicago style with no crap attitude, which I love. Just give me two dogs and a pop for 6 bucks. How can you beat that? How can you not go to Lulu's and love Donny. Been going here for years and not stopping anytime soon. Tip: point to the sky and ask Donny when the last time he talked to the big guy.

9.description: I had an Italian beef, ext5ry juicy w/hot peppers.  I also had an order of fries. The beef was very good & dipped exactly as requested.  YESSSSSSSSSS .... The beef was not fatty & they didn't skimp. The peppers weren't that hot, but that's ok. The fries were fresh, but they skimped on those.. I wasn't pleased with that I love fries. But I'll definitely be going back for more!!!

26.description: I simply cannot say enough good things about Lulu's! Every time I walk in it's like coming home after being away at school. Food is hot, it's made how ya want it, and the staff treats you like royalty. Cannot say that I've ever had a bad meal from there. Thank you Lulu's for making me feel special.

25.description: Good food- great specials.

12.description: Nothing was all that special to me about Lulu's. I live incredibly close but I tend to frequent Bacci's more often as I think their food is better. I love the sports/Chicago theme inside, but I never feel particularly safe at Lulu's. Their dogs were nothing special.

21.description: I can only base my review on the one item I ate here which was a hot dog.  I asked for it to he chargrilled however it wasn't & the bun was hard.  The fries on the other hand were tasty.  Staff was very friendly & personable.  I would go back but not for a hot dog.

17.description: I grew up eating this food, I just love this place,  I remember when you can get two hot dogs and fries for a $1.25

10.description: One word:  love. The dogs are as awesome as the friendly owner, who suggested a tasty combination of a Chicago dog, fries, and an Italian beef sandwich. Be prepared for a great meal, friendly staff, posters from the late 80s, and hideously-cool orange plastic seats.

5.description: I was bored with the $3.50 polish that did not include fries.  They were stingy with the mustard.  I also purchased turkey leg dinner. I think it was $5.99 and included fries and French bread. I thought that was a good deal.  I bought it for my son so I don't know how it tasted.  Plenty of seating.  Sufficient parking.  CASH ONLY and I didn't have enough cash to buy fries.  Staff was pleasant.

3.description: Lulu's could never do it for me. I've tried several different items, and absolutely disgusting. Hot dogs on down to their shakes.

35.description: not what i expected, fries were soggy and oily.. hot dogs were ok  buns were hard on one side,, i would not go again....

19.description: I really like this family owned business, both Don and Joe always treat me great even if I only make it by a couple of times a year.  Like my Dad (Doc), I love the Italian beef with hot peppers,

28.description: This place right here is 100% what Chicago is all about! I love the unassuming little neighborhood spots and this one gets the job done! I love the atmosphere. Cool Chicago sports stuff hanging up all around the dining room. They have it all! Dogs, burgers, gyros, ribs, chicken, the list goes on. It's all very affordable too. Try the shakes and the fries too. Parking is never an issue there either because they have a huge lot. In the restaurant industry there is so much competition, places popping up left and right. And they're usually out of business just as fast as they open. But Lulu's has been stuffing hungry faces for over 40 years! I guess they gotta be doing something right, huh? But forget about the food, the atmosphere, longevity, prices. All that goes out the window if there is shitty customer service, right? Let me tell you, Lulu's is hands down the most customer friendly place I've ever been in my life. They really couldn't be nicer if they tried. They remember faces, and if you go there enough they really get to know you. And don't be afraid to ask questions about the menu. After all, it's huge and can be overwhelming. These guys are so nice that sometimes I don't even have a particular taste for their food but I go there anyway just for the great customer service and to support this place. Another thing I love about Lulu's is they only accept cash. Little things like that just bring me back to how things should still be. Don't worry though, they have an ATM inside. The only reason they got 4 and not 5 stars is because they're not open 24 hours. And sometimes the tv is too loud. But that's just me being way too picky.

45.description: I went to try out Lulu's on my quest for the best Italian beef sandwich in Chicago and Lulu's gave me a pleasant surprise. I was expecting it to be a place where the hot dogs are good (which they are) and everything else kinda sub-par but I was wrong. The beef was so fresh and juicy. The sandwich was stuffed with beef, not like the skimpy ones you see at Al's Beef. The seasoning was amazing. The service was great as well. They remembered us when we came back the next day to feed our addictions. They also have a hot dog special with two everything hot dogs and fries for under 5 bucks. Who can beat that!? I will definitely be returning many more times. I am no longer going to waste my money at Al's (or leave with greasy hands because Lulu's has a bathroom unlike Al's). Lulu's here I come! One word of warning... they sometimes close earlier than 1 am on the weekends... I learned the hard way and had to settle for a burrito on Friday :(.

33.description: Good for a quick fast food bloated artery bomb but nothing that special. Their fries are good. Ribs are good, chicken wings are actually really good, but the creepy mural on the side of the building makes me want to say, thanks but no thanks. Also, I have been standing in line and def felt like I was being mean mugged, and I was. This is directly across the street from the Cook County Juvenile Detention Center and I think that bad energy fucks with the qi in this place, namaste.

43.description: Al's watch out--this beef is the real thing!!  Lots of meat great hot peppers and who could not add the friendly counter staff---they know the neighborhood and know their patrons--have gone back several times and they always seem to remember--and who could not love the views!!  LOL    Hot dog special is my second favorite, but they have specials all week long.

2.description: I've eaten here a couple of times on my lunch break since I work in the neighborhood. Cash only, but an ATM is located inside. Standard sub shop offerings: subs, burgers, hot dogs, fried things of all kinds, milkshakes, etc. First time I had the shrimp basket (great deal for $5), and thought they were really tasty and crispy. Fries are kind of similar to McD's. Second time I had the steak, and would definitely not order it again; my jaw ached from trying to chew through that rubbery mess; even my garbage disposal other half wouldn't eat the rest of it and I ended up throwing it out. Inexpensive, friendly staff, would probably try again sometime.

18.description: Food is better than Bacci's,  but it's hard to get over the uncleanness and urine smell in the dinning room. Overall decent diner food.

41.description: Woah crazy salty!  The Italian beef tasted like pure salt.  If you want a sandwich that actually tastes like Italian beef, go down the block to Al's- so much better!

52.description: I havent been to LuLu's in quite a while. But I know recall its a very popular hot dog joint in the West Loop. I will revisit Lulu soon and update this review.  I don't know why I had not visited Lulu's more often. Maybe because it is a bit west.  But, I'll revisit soon!

50.description: I find it interesting all the cups here are from restaurants that are not Lulus.  Hmm.  Food here is greasy and but ok.  I'm a fan of the pizza burger, but beware, they pile on enough garlic powder on it to kill you co-workers with your breath.  The garlic actually stings as you as you chew.  But that burger is delicious.  Prices are reasonable.  I prefer the "Twister" (curly) fries, which take a bit to cook up.  The normal fries are just fine.  I can't comment on the dog, as sadly, I like plain dogs, so its always a waste of money for me to order a Chicago dog, unless its like one dollar.  Minor gripe though, the shakes are thick, like frosties, they don't whip them soft, for either broken equipment or speed reasons I imagine.  If you feel like frosty though, this is the shake for you.  This place has long lines, but moves them out quick, eat in area is bigger than you expect as well.  Lots of us civil service type workers eat here for lunch, very working class type of place.

4.description: Lu Lu's makes going to see the Hawks at the UC that much better! The staff here is friendly, the food is unhealthy and absolutely delicious.  They have a burger called "The Paul Bunyan" burger, how funny is that.  They also having something called sea nuggets!  Pretty much everything but the dogs and salads are deep fried.  I'm OK with that because what they put out is always hot, fresh and just what I'm craving.  You know when you eat a restaurant buzzed after a night of drinking and you say "Dang, that was the bestest meal I've ever had!" (slurring of words is appropriate here).  Well with Lulu's you can go back stone cold sober and say the exact same thing but without slurring your words.   Go to Lulu's today and get a couple of dogs or a huge ass turkey leg with fries.  Their beefs are legit too.

6.description: Good food great service 1st time here and I recommend this place. The staff was friendly upbeat

22.description: Good place to eat, staff friendly and funny. Try the chicken sandwich! it is good!

15.description: Solid option for greasy food on taylor street, ive gotten the shrimp and the polish sausage, both were good, as were the fries

20.description: Lulu's is a classic hotdog stand, Chicago accents and all! The food is great and the staff is even better! I love supporting this CASH ONLY spot! I've eaten many things  there, from the twofers(Chicago dogs), ribs, shrimp basket*(my favorite) and shrimp and catfish combos, corn dogs, onion rings, deep fried mushrooms, shakes, slushies and the bacon cheese burger, it's all been wonderful.

36.description: I have such love for Lulu's I can't even describe it properly.  This place is old school in the absolute best of ways.  The service is prompt, funny, and from guys who take the time to get to know their customers in an unobtrusive way.They've got a huge menu, and if something's not up there, if you beg, they can probably come up with it.  Honestly, this lunch-counter (and it's totally a lunch-counter place) is MY hot dog stand in the city.  Their food is cheap and good, but what really ups the experience is the staff.  I've been coming here off and on for twelve years, and I'm always remembered and greeted with a smile and an inquiry about what's going on in my life.Chicago's neighborhood hot dog joints are really where it's at, and this one will always be mine!(They are cash-only, but there is an ATM in the seating area.  They also have a parking lot, and are super-accessible.)

14.description: A family favorite since the 1970's.  I've had just about everything on their menu.  What keeps me going back is their back to the old days hot dog special.  Their Italian beefs are very good as well.  Although, I don't understand why they would offer American cheese to add to their beef.  Wouldn't mozzarella be the ideal cheese of choice?  Anyway, there's nothing like having a beef minus any cheese.  Lulu's does a great job with all their items.  The restaurant is great for dine in as well...plenty of seating.

1.description: Very good. Nice decor. I got the chicken tacos with rice and it was excellent. The rice is very flavorful and sticky with bits of carrots and peas, I love it this way. They have an iPad for a register and paying is fast and easy. If paying by CC you sign with your finger. They are very efficient and I seen five guys hustling orders in the kitchen. Been there twice but got the same thing both times. Very hard to deviate from the chicken. They serve you the rice in a container piping hot. They also have extra salsa you can buy. Try the spicy pineapple, chunks of pineapple with red onions and chili. Excellent. My tacos were so hot in couldn't pick them up. This is my new favorite tacos place bye bye chipotle. Do not get the tamales. They are horrible. Mine was hard like a rock and very dry.

9.description: Great addition to the neighborhood. Service is still working out the kinks, but the food is fresh, well seasoned, and so much better than you would expect. The al pastor, tinga chicken, and guacamole were all very good. I will definitely return.

12.description: Outstanding taco. An explosion of flavor and freshness. A nice find. I got 2 tilapia & 1 seasoned chicken taco. Very warm corn tortillas and fresh fish/chicken. Server behind the counter Aisha was so friendly.

21.description: I ordered a steak burrito and the price is $8.95 not out of hand for a burrito. When I receive my food I was quite disappointed I have had tacos that have had more meat than this burrito. After eating my $14 meal I'm still hungry. Food tastes good portions were just to small.

16.description: Finally an upscale taquería! Everything is high quality and prepared with a gourmet touch. I love the pastor and tinga de pollo, and of course hot churros!!

17.description: I was excited to check this place out and was not disappointed. I had the steak tacos -- delicious. The staff is super friendly, the decor is bright and inviting.  Will definitely be back.

10.description: Jerk. Tinga. Pastor. Repeat. These guys have amazing tacos! Everything I have had was delicious. Ive had the pastor, jerk, Tinga, asada, zucchini and a few more. Basically they are an authentic taqueria with a modern feel. I've been to latinicity, el patron, and pretty much every taco place in the city and have to say this place is legit. One day I ordered 3x! Addicting.

5.description: Stopped here for lunch today and had the fish tacos which were excellent. Not only was the price great, but the portions are superb. I will be coming back and highly recommend this place. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. They also have lunch SPECIALS which fits anyone's budget.

11.description: Three words: Jerk Chicken Tacos. So flavorful, so spicy, and so on point. We've gotten delivery from them, and it has always been tasty and flavorful. Def a surprise that paid off for us, and great service.
