22.description: If you're looking for fresh, healthy Mexican, this is your place! Just had some chicken tacos....soooo delicious! Toppings were all very fresh and tasty. I also shared a guac and housemade chips (yum) with my 2 yr old son and he eventually just ditched the chips and grabbed a spoon...couldn't get enough..lol! Interior is trendy, contemporary and LOVE the artwork. Can't wait to go back!!!

0.description: I had to come here.  All of my coworkers have been raving about this place. They were raving about the elote, the cinnamon tortilla chips, the tacos and the guacamole.  I ordered one shrimp taco, one jerk taco and the elote. The shrimp and jerk chicken were well seasoned.  The green sauce and toppings were fresh.  The corn was ok.  I will return to try other dishes. Oh, don't forget to try the Tortilla Cinnamon chips, you won't regret it.Update: Today I had rice with my tacos.  The rice was delish!!  I'm not a fan of rice. It was well seasoned and perfect. It didn't have any veggies and that was cool with me.

20.description: I live down the street and was really excited for this place to open.  It opened this week so I went there, and it did not disappoint - food was SO good.  I had the chili relleno and street corn, my husband had the burrito.  Both were super.  I'm also excited they have breakfast and am looking forward to trying that.  It's not fast food - so if you plan to go over lunch when it might be busy you should probably call ahead if you can't wait for your food.

19.description: Worse food of my life. Who thinks that fajitas don't come with quac or salsa or even the tortillas??? My fajitas were made up of brown beans and large cut (somewhat sautéed vegetables) after a good 45 min wait. The people working there are confused as to what goes with what. There is no sense of sidings or substitutions. You can't request any changes in the menu or get anything added. I also wanted to get chips and salsa - who runs out of chips in the middleOf the day when it's only 2 pm and you are in a prime location at a Mexican food place. Never ever going again.

2.description: Through the social media person on Instagram, I found out that this restaurant is around the corner from where I work. Went in one evening after work and while it has a nice fast food feel to it, the food tastes exactly like what you'd get from a taqueria where only Spanish-speaking people go.Elote. Quesadilla. Tamale with chicken. Chips and guacamole.The elote is not on a cob, but it's all good. The quesadilla and tamale were my favourites. The chips are made in-house and the guacamole is how I like it: chunky. I must admit that I was afraid this was going to be almost Chipotle style Mexican food, but it reminded me so much of the food my Mexican neighbours share. It's authentic and that is a good thing.

18.description: If you're looking for fresh, healthy Mexican, this is your place! Just had some chicken tacos....soooo delicious! Toppings were all very fresh and tasty. I also shared a guac and housemade chips (yum) with my 2 yr old son and he eventually just ditched the chips and grabbed a spoon...couldn't get enough..lol! Interior is trendy, contemporary and LOVE the artwork. Can't wait to go back!!!

13.description: Stoped by after work on a friday, it was early so no crowd and proceeded to order a basic meal.Steak burrito and Horchata. Have to admit I was surprised at how good the burrito was. Simple but easy to get wrong, they got it right and got a new customer in return.

4.description: I tried out this spot with my Friday Lunch Crew, and it has earned is place in the rotation.  Why? It's a hybrid, not an authentic Mexican taqueria, but not Chipotle.  I got the nachos for lunch with jerk chicken, and it was awesome.  Better than Chipotle because of the nacho option, and it taste waaay better than Burrito Beach.  A bonus that the nachos came in a nifty take out container, in case there are any nachos left.  Nacho leftovers? Never heard of it.

6.description: Much better that other places around. Tasty. Came with friends from the office. Had the tilapia taco special. Friends had the jerk chicken taco and the chicken mole tamale. Spot on. Will come again.

15.description: Best tacos and salsa in Chicago. Jerk chicken and tinga all the way. That avocado cream salsa is on point!

7.description: Just one of the best mexican restaurants in this area. Everything is always fresh and delicious. We eat here at least once per week. Try the jerk tacos and thank me later! Also, New Grubhub orders get $10 off their first order with code CHNFGZ6KSRD7 until May, 2016!

8.description: I came here for dinner one night and breakfast another day (chorizo burritos both times). Both meals were great, tasty, and filling. The staff was nice and while the atmosphere is rather spartan, it was comfortable. I wish they served beer. I'd be a regular if I lived close.

3.description: I like this place! The prices are reasonable and the chicken Nacho's were tasty. They came with lots of toppings and the portion size was decent. This place isn't big, but most people seem to be taking their meals to go so lots of empty tables for those looking to dine in.

14.description: Gem of a spot to get authentic Mexican in a modern, comfortable setting. The tacos are incredible - the carnitas, in particular, are some of the best I've ever had. Freshly made chips and guacamole, and horchata also come highly recommended. Definitely making Don Fresco a regular stop!

1.description: I have difficulties writing this review because as I remember the exquisite trip my tastebuds took  to the Caribbeans my mind is taken over by craving for Lucero's amazing meals.  Try her food and you get hooked forever as I did. Trully awesome!

2.description: Amazing food, great service, and exceptional professionalism. I've done a substancial amount of business with Lucero and Ray of Lucero Caribbean Catering and would strongly recommend ordering from them!

0.description: I've had a Yelp account for several months now, but was waiting to write a review until I discovered something amazing... And so my first review goes to Lucero Caribbean Catering, because it is that amazing! We had Lucero cater an event in our graduate department, and everyone agreed it was the best food we had ordered in a long time. Our menu consisted of garlic roasted pork, stuffed poblano peppers with tomato sauce, and Puerto Rican rice. I called Lucero on rather short notice, and she suggested these items based on our budget and requirements (one meat entree, one veg entree, etc). The prices were very reasonable - in fact, the total came out well under our budget, and we had just the right amount of food! (It might have been helpful to see more options on the website; but if you just call Lucero, she can give you the options and customize them to your type of event.) And everything was delivered super hot and right on time. I agree with the other reviewer, and wish we were having another event soon!

28.description: Wow! World Market is my new favorite toy store.  They mostly carry home furnishing and decor. Much of what they carry has a heavy "Asian" to Middle Eastern influence, which I love.  In addition to home furnishing and decor they are also carry kitchen wares, body products, jewelry, hard to find candy and food items, and a pretty kick ass wine selection.  The candy selection is pretty out of this world.  If you're a fan of European chocolates you'll have fun here.  What else can I say?  World Market is FUN!  This is a great place for browsing, shopping for yourself, and gifts.  The employees are real sweeties too.

1.description: Went here for Halloween stuff AGAIN LOLthey had a great sale on jams and spreads that interested me. And was located right near downtown and a couple of minutes from the expressway for a quick getaway.Mostof the Christmas stuff is out and they again had a great selection

39.description: Another rockstar store for the Southgate Shopping Center. This place is fantastic for finding cool furniture, posters, and cool and unusual gifts and snacks. I heart their chocolate band-aids and vintage reproductions of posters. This is a great place to go for bar ware too. Although the cocktail shaker I got here started to rust...it was probably my fault for putting it in the dishwasher. They also have great seasonal items. Cute stubby nutcrackers and Dancing Reindeer wine at Christmas, shaped pasta at Halloween, etc. etc. etc. Totally go here.

9.description: Found this gem with amazing products! A little bit expensive for a college student, but worth checking out.

29.description: I love World Market! So much stuff..little odds and ends that you really don't need but you want, and you buy them anyway because you know your not going to be able to find it anywhere else :)Single bottles of beer, candy from Italy that I haven't seen since I was there...just awesome! The staff is really nice as well. I will update more as I continue to visit..I'm always rushing through here because I work downstairs and don't have much time..but always worth visiting!

42.description: Wow, I can't believe that this Cost Plus World Market hasn't been reviewed yet!! I stumbled across this World Market when the bf had to locate an AT&T location. Once we found the location and entered from the parking garage, I saw the holy grail of fun shopping-Cost Plus World Market. I beelined for this while he took care of his phone needs. I love, love Cost Plus World Market. Did I mention that I lurv this store?? This location in the South Gate shopping center is huge!!! This is my dream store and it's not too far away from my other dream store of Target. The store has everything from linens, chairs, dinnerware, stemware, wine, English chocolates, mini sausages, and many others. Seriously, the list could go on and on. I originally buzzed in here for some little candies for a tea swap package. While there, I tried some tea and biscuits while debating on getting some PG tips. I also lusted after a cute mini llama, but resisted because it wasn't an alpaca, my favorite fiber. I left with three boxes of tea (two Republic of Tea on sale), candy, and a desire to spend a lot more. My boyfriend had to practically pry me out of the store. I managed to cover most of the store on this visit and future visits will cover more. Though the location of the store is a little funky off of Roosevelt, this store is huge and filled with everything.

23.description: Check the expiration dates on the food items; there are an awful lot of things bumping up on their sell-by date. Though usually obvious given a light coating of dust, some items looked clean but were not the freshest of the lot.

5.description: This review may be slightly skewed since I was there on the day before Christmas.  Lots of people were fluxing in to get their last-minute shopping done.  I dislike those procrastinators, but what can you do?  Items on the aisles were pretty much picked-over.  My primary mission was to find some salad dressing, but I didn't see any.  Thus, the plan B was to get a bottle of vinegar instead to go with the olive oil I had at home.  Like usually, I picked up some Japanese marble soda, coffee, and latte.  I also got some canned dill salmon and udon.  Please note that the World Market isn't going to be substituting your typical grocery shopping trip at a ethnic market; their selections are much fewer than what they would offer at Montrose deli, Mitsuwa, and other ethnic markets in the Chicagoland.  Moreover, the prices at the World Market are, for the most part, not so competitive unless certain items are on sale for the week.  With that being said, why do I continue patronizing the World Market?  If you've signed up with their World Explorer program, you will receive coupons periodically via your e-mail.  My favorite one is the $10 off with $30 or more worth of purchase.  Therefore, you will experience a significant amount of savings with such strategy.  This location is inside of the Southgate Market on Canal St.  With a store validation, the parking is free for the first two (2) hours.  However, I believe it is going to change, effective January 1st., 2015.  If the parking policy were to change against car-dependent shoppers, I wouldn't be severely affected since I'm a frequent user of public transportation, or of my own skinny legs.

31.description: I LOVE WORLD MARKET....Sheesh, Shavon and Mabel are great managers and helped me make a purchase.  Customer service is top notch and you can't beat the products in the store either.  I go there at least once a week.  I used to love Pier 1 but I've traded in Pier 1 for World Market.There's a nice selection of wine, coffee, and items that I love to try.  The prices for furniture are not bad either.  As for the location, I've never had a problem parking and waiting in line for hours.If you are not hip to World Market, truly understand that this place is a must-go for items for the home.

25.description: An array of unique home goods and more; furniture, kitchen & bakeware, soaps, jewelry and wine & food.  I always stop in when I'm in the market just because it's fun to browse.  I love their seasonal selection.  They have some serious stocking stuffer nick-nacks.

12.description: I always love World Market. Such a random assortment of everything you can imagine so you are always entertained. I always end up leaving with something I never knew I wanted but definitely had to buy as soon as I saw it. This one had a pretty well stocked furniture area and a comprehensive foreign food selection. These are my two main interests at the store so I was very pleased. The staff was friendly at checkout as well.

37.description: You cant help but fall in love with World Market. There is something for everyone. I found the cutest chair pads for my dining room and the cutest bracelets. Its not that expensive, you can certainly lose yourself in this global bazaar, and buy items that you certainly don't need. I have always been able to find good parking on the streets. I'm not very fond of the parking garage its very hard to get out.

21.description: Love love love this store. Its so close to work and they have such great items for the home! :) Great place for unique chic gifts as well for the home :)

16.description: There are so many things I would love to purchase here but they are not economically feasible at this moment.  So I buy little things like chocolate pear hand soap which was made in France.  Awesome purchase and not too much money.  Also, a very useful product.They also have the best prices for journals, rugs, towels and various other little things you might need. The larger items are also priced moderately, just not in my budget.  All and all,  a very pretty store with attractive items.

17.description: I could seriously spend ALL DAY in this store. From home goods to food items to bathroom soaps, CPWM has so many fun things to look at, smell and play with!! While most of the stuff is not quite my style, I still love to come here and browse. I've bought candles, picture frames and soaps here, as well as some beautiful Champagne flutes and SNACK FOODS! Most of the people who work here are super friendly and helpful!

10.description: ~ Infrequent Buyer ~Outside of the odd trip to Holland or occasional pass through Holland (that's Holland, Michigan), World Market is about as close as I'll ever get to world travel.  See, I couldn't care less about world travel.  I'm of the mindset that travel is to women what sports are to men; generally, neither side gives a flip about the other side's pastime.  Anyway, a trip to World Market is about the extent of my cultural and international diversity.  I can go into World Market and experience a bunch of European, Asian and good old retro American culture all in an hour's time.  Exotic cultures?  Scenic landscapes?  Divergent foods and drinks?  Abridged virtual vacay.  Boom.  Done.  And without the hassles of packing, the TSA or flying.  Let's face it, World Market is a cool store for browsing, with plenty to check out, including wine, candy, cooking materials, coffee, tea, pop, beer, furniture and other assorted goodies.  The problem is I end up being more of a looker than a buyer because even though some of this stuff looks good I hardly ever buy any of it.  I think I could probably count on one of Antonio Alfonseca's hands the products I've bought in World Market: coffee, pop, scone mix, pint glasses, candy and tea - and never all at the same time.  The last time I went in I bought two retro bottles of pop and a coffee sampler.  Maybe because World Market is better for just browsing rather than buying is why it doesn't seem to be doing so great.  This particular World Market has always been dead when I've shopped there.  And I know they've closed the one outlet they used to have in Lakeview.  Hopefully, at least this location will remain open so I can generate some embellished world travel stories I can brag about from an hour of skulking it.  Five Stars.

11.description: What's not to love about this place? It's like a carnival! I can never walk out of here empty handed. That bench in picture one, I have it. Now I have my eye on the chair. I've bought glasses from here, and recently some of the plastic martini ones for using out on the deck, no broken glass YAY! A decent selection of wine, sure it's not Binny's but they're not trying to be, so quit you're whining. The coffee cups for my office come from here too, along with other stuff in my house. Some artwork for the bathroom, the wind-chimes on the deck, Italian sodas, and some spices. Also an area rug or two. The list goes on and on. Okay, so what can't you get here? Milk and eggs? Well then just run across to Whole Foods then. However, don't come here if you're parked in the lot by Roosevelt, you will get towed, and there are signs posted.

26.description: Um, excuse me but I refuse to call this place "Cost Plus".....if you are givong "Love" a bad name what about this one?!? I mean....Cost Less, sure, but Cost Plus?I don't get it.But I am no marketing genius.It's always hard to resist the temptation to walk in every time I go to the neighboring Whole Foods. Or Panera. Or DSW (SMS*). I swear that must use some sort of subliminal device to attract customers within their nets. Ultrasonic siren song? spray of pheromones gathered at midnight on a moonless night on your sexy crush? I don't know. But it sure works pretty well.And for once I am glad it does. I was lured in last time by a sign, nice and bright, announcing 50 % off on outdoor. And guess what? I need outdoor!! Furniture, that is. And outdoor furniture I found. The set was called Maldives. 1 table, 1 bench, 2 chairs, 2 armchairs. 100% wood. A selling price of $845. Sold on the floor for $299.Double check.$299. Still. And still.Explanation: the manufacturer failed to weatherproof the wood.Big deal. Nothing that a trip to Home Depot, a brush and a few hours of labor can't fix.SOLD!!!!!!!!!!Big props to the very friendly staff who held everything for us until we were able to come back for pick up the next day, and loaded it in the car for us. And of course, big props to the endless collection of chips, chocolates, soaps, cookies and candy for keeping us alive and perfumed.* Save My Soul. Really. Addictions are no fun.

27.description: There are so many things I would love to purchase here but they are not economically feasible at this moment.  So I buy little things like chocolate pear hand soap which was made in France.  Awesome purchase and not too much money.  Also, a very useful product.They also have the best prices for journals, rugs, towels and various other little things you might need. The larger items are also priced moderately, just not in my budget.  All and all,  a very pretty store with attractive items.

35.description: Do you have a little sister that collects rubber duckies? Do you like interesting snack items that are hard find at major super markets? Do you like unique home items? Are throwing a party and need some wacky party favors? Do you want to wow someone with a hard to find or unique bottle of wine? It seems like you could do all that and them some here. I really like the mishmash of things here. They have a big selection of coffee's, teas, snacks, beer, chocolates, soda and other drinks, from many different places on the globe. I really like the Japanese section in this location in particular. The day I stopped in they also just happened to have Ramune soda's on sale for 99 cents, almost a whole buck cheaper than where I usually buy them in Chinatown. They also have a flavor of Pocky that I never seen anywhere else "Milk Coffee" So darn tasty! Aaron S. also came across a very unique rubber duckie for my little sister here. (yes yes she collects rubber ducks, i think she has something like 117 right now...) So yeah stop in, find some great items that you would not find at other stores, and you probably didn't even know you wanted. Who knows it might even be on sale that day! (My only gripe is that about this locale is that do not sell bulk pistachios like the De Paul neighborhood one does)

8.description: This place has so much...From wine and sangria to the best red velvet cake mix in a box EVER to furniture and stemware...I could go on...This is the ONLY place I will buy a cheater box of red velvet cake mix.  It is to die for!  If you are a red velvet lover, you need to try it!We have several pieces of furniture, all of which are made with...wait for it...REAL WOOD!  What?!?  They have all held up through three moves with only a few scratches due to human error.  They are definitely great pieces that hold up well.We also have a few glasses...they always have a nice selection of beer glasses.Also, try the Sangria!  (the red is my favorite)  It is pretty good for being cheap.I have to bump it down one star for the prices.  Everything is overpriced.  All the furniture we have bought was either on sale or discounted with coupons.If you are every by one, stop in and take a peek!

0.description: Last week I purchased a fog colored mushroom couch, for $399 (originally $699 so quite the steal). My boyfriend went to pick the couch up so we could assemble it but at 110 pounds boxed weight it was too big for his truck so he went in to arrange delivery. Though delivery is free for purchases of $500 and more, mine was $60 shy, however the sales associates gave us a coupon code for free delivery and I'm getting my couch in a few days! Great customer service, though beware of long waits at the cash wrap as the store seems woefully understaffed. They have a wide array for pillows, glasses and other lovely homewares, all of which I wish I could buy!

38.description: I just bought some cute jewelry here for a present.  It was pretty unique, fairly inexpensive, and at the counter the woman pulled out this cute little box/tube to put it in.  Now I don't even have to wrap the present!  I am very excited by my purchase, and hope the recipient likes it as much as I do!

20.description: Eclectic collection of items !  If your looking for something unique for your home this is the place to go.

19.description: This place is great! If you are buying gifts and haven't yet decided what to get for people, have a wander around here and some great ideas will definitely jump out at you. They have a cool food section with a lot of novelty candy and foreign snack items, but there's also furniture, tableware and tchotchkes, all of which are very unique and reasonably priced.

33.description: Who knew that it'd be tough to choose between White Cheddar Popcorn and Parmesan Garlic Popcorn? I mean their big popcorn bags cost buy $1.99, I come here every now and than just to get away and look for items that normally I can't find anywhere else. You want Bollywood type items, Here it is. I think that one might get overwhelmed with the items here but its really a nice place to get a look at other things around the world. I mean, you can easily gift someone a card and a gift card, but here you can easily just pick out something that is unusual. I mean where else can you buy a window shade with the silouette of the Budda? The prices are great as far as wines are concerned. Here you can get a nice bottle of Liberty School Cabernet Sauvignon for less than the price of a movie? I mean the taste is really soft and goes down smooth but with a blackberry layed with dark cheery taste! Gotta love it. I mean the wine is warm on the palate but has a nice supple firmness. And this goes so well with beef or grilled meats. Its hard to find these types of wines, and if you go out to eat at one of the better restaurants, you will pay as much by the glass. So get a bottle and enjoy a nice night with a friend. Okay I ranted about wine can you believe it. Its all about the complexities of Cost Plus World Market, items that are by far different. Check them out and enjoy also their beers that you canno find anywhere else in Chicago. And make sure to get your ticket validated for parking in the inside parking garage.

2.description: Sing it with me now: They've got gadgets and gizmos aplenty. They've got whosits and whatsits galore. You want thingamabobs? They've got 20. In all seriousness though, this is a great place to browse if you have no idea what you're looking for; it's just filled with so much random stuff you never knew you wanted. There is unique furniture, a beer and wine section, including a mix your own six pack section, kitchen items, home decor, food, knick-knacks, tchotchkes, and on and on. I picked up quite a few fun stocking stuffers around Christmas time, and always enjoy poking around to see what's new. Joining the Explorer's Club for free will earn you discounts on your shopping trips as well.

34.description: I've always loved Cost Plus before it made it to Chicago (by ways of  other cities like my hometown in KC) .. This particular location is great!! the parking is free.. you can shop at other stores like DSW and even have a little bite at Panera bread while you're at it. The staff are always Nice.. and helpful. They don't Stalk you like some stores but they do ask if you have found everything that you need. I love their Regional Wines!! .. the prices are cheap compared to other places.. I love their  gourmet foods and snacks.. Good Place!

32.description: I could seriously spend ALL DAY in this store. From home goods to food items to bathroom soaps, CPWM has so many fun things to look at, smell and play with!! While most of the stuff is not quite my style, I still love to come here and browse. I've bought candles, picture frames and soaps here, as well as some beautiful Champagne flutes and SNACK FOODS! Most of the people who work here are super friendly and helpful!

18.description: This place is great!  If you're looking for a place to get international items, gifts for loved ones, or just something fun for yourself - welcome!  They also have an online service if you would like to order online.

41.description: Great location, ample parking. Inexpensive prices.

13.description: They sell some cute things, but they have the absolute worst customer service. There is always a line and not enough cashiers Yesterday I went and had a particularly long wait, because one of the two cashiers, Nickola(sp?) sat there for 10 minutes waiting for someone to do a price check on pillows for a customer and just let everyone stand in line behind them while the chatted away. How about saying "I'll take the next customer in line while we wait," or "unfortunately we are waiting for a price check, it might be quicker if you step into the other line." Seriously Nickola, this isnt rocket science. Almost more shocking than the complete lack of attention to the customers, was the fact that the employee doing the price check was the manager, and she couldnt figure it out! But while she was fluttering back and forth to the register with no useful information, the OTHER cashier, (who thankfully was paying a bit of attention,) pointed out that the price is on the INSIDE OF THE PILLOW when you unzip the cover. The cashier and manager dont know this??? Hello? McFly? Is anybody home? Seriously, this place needs to get it together. They need a complete overhaul. Starting with the manager, Mable. If you need to go to World Market, do yourself a favor and pick an alternate location to visit.

4.description: A lot of of unique, worldly items. You can tell that a lot of products are handmade or from other countries. It's different than most stores around the South Loop. I really like their floral accent chairs. I think it makes any room stand, especially since I like the antique (some call it my "grandma" style) look to my apartment. For example, there's this medium-sized stone elephant statue with an umbrella on it and you can see it from the window. It is one of the coolest pieces I've seen. It would make a really good decorative floor piece. I see it there every time but I haven't convinced myself yet to pay for it yet. When you go to World Market, you'll find really unique things like this.

24.description: I love coming here to buy wine. They offer a pretty good variety and the prices are fair. They also have tons of chocolates and snacks. Yum! I bought some cute bowls here too. They're always getting new things so keep your eyes open and you will find some great stuff!

6.description: It's smaller than the one that used to be in Orland park but I get my fix. If they don't have what I'm looking for, i just check them out online

22.description: I like this place, when I am bored its always cool to shop here, interesting stuff from all around the world, cool food items you don't see else where.rugs, baskets, candle holders...what ever you need.

15.description: I really like World Market and I feel like I find a lot of good deals here. Just recently I bought glass jars with wooden lids to hold my cotton balls/q-tips. I was originally going to buy them at Crate & Barrel for $16 each but found practically the same thing at World Market for $8 each. What a stealllllllll :)Sometimes though I feel like this store is a little bit messy. I feel like the staff is centralized to the registers, and that they don't spend much time cleaning up the aisles, re-organizing, or helping out customers.The other day I lost my parking validation tickets, so I did a full loop, retracing all of my steps, and did not find a single associate to help me until I got back to the register at the front (luckily the person I spoke to happened to have found my validation ticket, saving me $25)Overall the staff is nice- I've never had a problem with anyone, but I just don't think they're very helpful... There's always two at the register, one ringing people up, and one opening up a box of something or other. I go mostly because I like some of the products and it's in the same building as my gym.

40.description: Today I was in the store in search of Merino scarves (on sale for $5).  I was glad to see that all of the colors were in stock.In general I love stopping by to pick up a few exotic items (food or home decor) or browse.  The sales people are pleasant and the music (a majority of the time) makes me want to dance around the store.As referenced in my first line, they also have some pretty good sales.

7.description: This store not only has the most unique household items, but the customer service here is top notch! Every single employee goes out of their way to help you. I purchased a dining room table here and I LOVE IT!! I have also purchased countless other items including wine and food and other furniture pieces. Steve is an amazing asset to the store, so helpful. So, if you want great products and friendly helpful staff, this is the place to go! I'm hooked.

36.description: Very friendly staff and the store is very clean and well stocked with all kinds of goodies for folks to buy. Its hard for me to go there and not come out with a few bags of stuff I never knew I wanted or needed.. Good location and free parking never hurt.. hope this one stays open.. so many stores have closed at this location.

30.description: Very helpful staff.Huge wine selection---become a World Market Explorer to enjoy special pricing.Merchandise includes unique food stuffs, tea, coffee, soft drinks, Italian syrups to put into coffee drinks, European candies, cookies, canned and jarrred goods, baskets, furnitureMerchandise includes costume jewelry, tableware, table linens, Christmas tree ornaments, unique items of every kind.I love to go in here and browse and almost always find something of interest.Watch for coupons or sign up to be a World Market Explorer on their website to collect rewards points.I highly recommend World Market.

3.description: Long story short... Excellent customer service! Thank you, Mable, for all the follow up and help with my gift card today!! Best customer service I have received in a long time. Mable= my Angel. :  )

14.description: Who knew that it'd be tough to choose between White Cheddar Popcorn and Parmesan Garlic Popcorn? I mean their big popcorn bags cost buy $1.99, I come here every now and than just to get away and look for items that normally I can't find anywhere else. You want Bollywood type items, Here it is. I think that one might get overwhelmed with the items here but its really a nice place to get a look at other things around the world. I mean, you can easily gift someone a card and a gift card, but here you can easily just pick out something that is unusual. I mean where else can you buy a window shade with the silouette of the Budda? The prices are great as far as wines are concerned. Here you can get a nice bottle of Liberty School Cabernet Sauvignon for less than the price of a movie? I mean the taste is really soft and goes down smooth but with a blackberry layed with dark cheery taste! Gotta love it. I mean the wine is warm on the palate but has a nice supple firmness. And this goes so well with beef or grilled meats. Its hard to find these types of wines, and if you go out to eat at one of the better restaurants, you will pay as much by the glass. So get a bottle and enjoy a nice night with a friend. Okay I ranted about wine can you believe it. Its all about the complexities of Cost Plus World Market, items that are by far different. Check them out and enjoy also their beers that you canno find anywhere else in Chicago. And make sure to get your ticket validated for parking in the inside parking garage.

58.description: Good pizza by the slice or the pie.  Chocolate dipped cannoli are also great.  Far better pizza than a nearby national-chain competitor.Plus they have soft serve ice cream.$4.75 for 1/4 pizza plus a soda is a great deal.  Ask nicely and they'll cut the slice for you so you can share it with your date.  Which you really should do...have you taken a look at your waistline lately?

56.description: We ordered a 14" veggie deep dish.  It was ready exactly when I said I'd be there to pick up, kudos to that.  The order came to a little over $15 with the help of a Groupon Now deal.  Can't complain on the value there.The pizza was okay; crisp crust, filled with cheesy cheese, etc.  Not bad, but not memorable.

29.description: I really wanted to hate this place, and I pretty much did.  Oh oh, see what I did there?Seriously though, Taylor Made has a thing for overloading homes with menus to the point that I almost didn't want to try them because I was sick of them before even ordering from there.  I need to be on their payroll because I'm sure that person is making bank with as often as they're out there distributing said menus, especially since they always end up in the recycling anyhow.  Must be nice to be able to throw away money like that.I should have made an executive decision and ordered Phil's, but I was kind of curious and one of their coupons included mozzarella sticks for free, so Taylor Made it was.  Bad.  Bad bad bad.  You know how I know it was bad?  I was drunk and still coherent enough to complain.  Little known fact (that is somehow mentioned in many reviews), almost all food is created equal in my drunk eyes and therefore by default, is delicious.  The cheese wasn't dark enough (in fact the whole pizza seemed undercooked), the sauce was really sweet, the crust was doughy and bland and the ingredients were minimal.  C'mon, this isn't NY!  We're better than that.  I actually forgot we ordered giardiniera on it until many bites later when I heard a crunch.  Even still, most pizza that isn't so good hot is at least decent cold, right?  No, apparently not.  I had a piece for breakfast 2 days later and it was awful.  Oh, and those mozzarella sticks that are normally $5?  Pass.  Tasted and looked exactly like frozen ones from the store.Phil's is still my go-to pizza in the area, even if I'll never live a Phil's pizza related incident down.  I'm sure I'll give Taylor Made another shot at some point, but not for quite awhile.

42.description: I know it's blasphemy to say this in Chicago, but I don't LOVE deep dish pizza.  So, when I have the urge for a slice of thin crust, I head to Taylor Made Pizza.  Don't get me wrong, Taylor Made also makes a great deep dish pizza, but my point is, I can get deep dish pizza at a thousand other places in the city.  Taylor Made offers both deep dish and thing crust pizza by the slice.  The variety is pretty small (usually only sausage, cheese and the special of the day), but you can order a full size pizza with pretty much anything on it.  I should also add here that I've rarely actually ordered a full pizza from here.  Although I've never had any problems on the days that I did order, I just prefer to buy pizza by the slice (It's a portion control thing).  Regardless, the individual slices are huge and each one comes with a drink.  The staff always seems very friendly when I'm in there, and I've never waited more than a couple of minutes for my food.  I'd highly recommend Taylor Made Pizza to anyone, especially students studying late at the University of Illinois-Chicago (It's right down the street!).

23.description: I would give it 3.5 stars if I could.  Good, quick, affordable.  As an undergrad, this was one of the better pizza locations nearby.  Beats any of the chains.

47.description: I eat at Taylor Made at least 3 times a week and each time I order the hot wings with a personal stuffed pizza. The wings may be the best I've ever ate.  The stuffed pizza is very good as well. I will say ONE time I tried the deep dish pizza and it was not good. but if you are in the mood for some wings, why not have it TAYLOR MADE?!?!

8.description: Ask for a slice and they give you two. Its a pleasant surprise. However, they recently increased their prices. For thin crust pizza, the pizza is pretty average. They do not have the unique toppings Big G's down the street carries. I have not had anything else on the menu and my rating may change after eating more.

31.description: Seriously, where was this place when I went to college around here?Just under $5 for a slice (which was essentially two slices because of how big it was... they literally cut the pizza slice in half to make it manageable) and a pop/drink.  This would have been a staple in my college haydays.The quality is okay, and if you're looking for some easy pizza to down, fits the bill.  Verdict:  No longer a student, I probably won't come back unless I"m looking for a quick/cheap bite.  Yes, I'm still that cheap.  It's good to be frugal.

34.description: Horrible pizza!! It was on chicagos best for margherita pizza which happens to be my fav. After one bite I am convinced it is the worst Margherita. Lack ingredients and super soggy crust. The Worst part is the girls that answer the phone are soooooo rude and lack customer service skills , pretty much could care less.  Still waiting for for the manager to return my phone call about my refund....I wont.hold.my.breath.

16.description: This is a small dive pizza place with the best deal around. For under $5 you can get two slices and even a drink.

13.description: I placed an order for delivery at 6:48 or so today. It is now almost 2 hours later, (8:37 currently) and the food is not here. I called close to 8 since I was told it would be an hour or so when I would get my food. The girl who took my order apologized and said the delivery guy took an order out and did not return and said she would contact him and then hung up. Um, okay... a half hour goes by and I call back to cancel the order. She seemed somewhat understanding, but I said to give me back my money and not to worry about the food. She then says she would void it and I can keep the food since the food is out for delivery, and then hangs up the phone. Apparently they are using a new delivery service. WOW! Close to 2 hours to delivery a meal? Really? I won't be ordering from here again.

11.description: Ive been going to this establishment for 4 years now. The slices are big and are always fresh. Had the fried ravioli today very tasty. The raviolis are not delicate at all, very sturdy pieces soaking in marinara sauce. Yum!

39.description: The service is really slow. Like really, really slow.The pizza is also very greasy.However, it opens until 3 am on the weekend, which is seriously like the best thing ever.3 stars for opening till 3 am.

37.description: We stopped in here before a concert last night at the UIC Pavilion because some of the other places nearby had waits.  We were crunched for time; otherwise, we would have gone somewhere else.  I got the egg and pepper sandwich.  It wasn't anything to write home about.  I tried some of the garlic bread and pizza as well.  Everything was just mediocre, but I guess you get what you pay for because it was definitely inexpensive.

0.description: My Boyfriend and I ordered delivery last night for dinner. We called in and a young woman took our order, she was very cheerful and took very well to our specific instructions! No complaints! I should mention that I have a strict food restriction. I'm a vegetarian and it was nice not having to worry about anything! Kudos to the young woman who took our order, everything was great! Our order consisted of:Mozzarella Sticks18" Pizza - Half Pepperoni / Half Spinach & JalapenoBaked GnocchiEggplant Plant Parmagiana over SpaghettiLiving in the area, the food didn't take too long to be delivered. Everything was really good! Oh and I should mention, BONUS: Our leftovers are even better the next day! This was not our first time ordering from Taylor Made Pizza, my Boyfriend is actually a big fan of the place and I have to say that it is definitely growing on me! I would definitely order from this place again and even recommend that you try it for yourself!!

38.description: This little hole in the wall pizza place in a great inexpensive stop for lunch.  For $5 you can get a small soda and two slices of pizza!  It has an old school mom and pop feel complete with a couple tables and a little tv.  The sauce could be a touch more zesty, but it's great for the price.

51.description: Eh, the pizza here was just average.  The toppings were okay but the sauce tasted like tomato paste and crust was puffy and cardboard like  It seems their slices have been sitting around all day because the pizza always tastes kinda stale.  This place will do if it's 1am and you're starving but it's not much better than the Papa John's a few blocks down.

27.description: Decided to try the stuffed crust deep dish and plain deep dish. Both delicious and great price! Delivered right on time and it was a great surprise for my hubby. We will definitely be getting this pizza again soon!

32.description: Solid deal and great thin crust. My favorite in this neighborhood. ConvenientFast DelishCheapOpen late

54.description: And the quest continues for super tasty excellent delivery pizza.  We ordered a deep dish with pepperoni.  It arrived on time and hot which are pluses.  It really isn't deep dish, so be advised.  It's about as thick as a pan pizza in total height, maybe, but not really, with a super tall end crust.  Not like any deep dish I've ever had before.  It was cheesy cheesy cheesy, bordering on almost too much cheese, even for me which is hard to do.  The pizza looked nothing at all like the picture I see below as I write this, that's for sure.  Overall the sauce was decent.I mean, it was all just ok.  Maybe we'll give them another chance but we won't be ordering a deep dish again.

48.description: Taylor made is an excellent pizza joint. I'm never disappointed with their pizza . The service is so-so.  One time when we ordered the pizza, we were told the pizza would arrive within the hour. 2hrs later, the delivery guy showed, and we didn't tip him. My advice is to pick up the pizza, instead.It disappoints me that people go to papa Johns, which is across the street. All I can think is that those dumb college kids are missing out on some fine pizza that Taylor made has to offer. Taylor made has REAL pizza; not pizza that tastes like cardboard (Im referring to papa johns).  Their loss.

44.description: Try the deep fried monkey penis, it's delicious! Taylor Made's GM, Eric, totally allows Jews in his establishment. What a nice guy! Liz, one of their main workers, looks like Megan Fox shrunken in a dryer. What a friggin knock out! They don't even get mad at me when eat a slice of pepporoni pizza with a raging boner and I accidentally start knocking over salt and pepper shakers and napkin holders with the diving board in my pants that their employees give me. They just clean that shit right up....I think only the service at The Last Supper was better. I say that supporting any other pizza joint would be like supporting German National Socialism. How dare you.

24.description: Went there last night got a slice of Pepperoni pizza n it was so cheesy n hot. Open late and the line moved quickly.

7.description: I really don't know what's so great about the pizza at this place. You pay just under $5 for one fourth of a pizza that tastes like high school cafeteria pizza. It is so oily that if you place a paper towel on top of the pizza, it will be soaked with oil (all Pizzas are oily... but not to this extent). Papa Johns is right across the street and you can get a large pizza for $8. The service is really nice though, the owner is very cool/laid back too. He gives you discounts when they are about to close so he doesn't have to toss the pizza. There are others who do like the pizza, but seeing how this place has 3/5 stars on yelp, it's average overall. My favorite thing about this place is when they gave out free Pizzas at the beginning of my freshmen year (2010). Other than that, I only got it when I had no other choice.

49.description: I mostly go here for late night pizza because it's open pretty darn late.For five bucks you get two large slices of pizza and a drink (bottled water or soda)It's a great deal and always hits the spot.I have also tried their mozzarella sticks and fried dough balls (which are sprinkled with cinnamon & sugar or garlic salt)DO NOT order their deep dish pizza. I tried it once and it isn't even close to real deep dish pizza. They just add more cheese, make the crust higher, and make it like a regular pizza.P.S. they have "stuffed" pizza which is not bad, this is not the deep dish pizza I am referring to

40.description: Decent pizza.  Ny style.    But very skimpy on toppings.

53.description: I've been here a few times and always get the pizza slice with pop deal, great for a quick meal.  The slices are huge too, they give a fourth of a whole pizza just to give a general estimate on the size.  It's a little thin and oily for my taste but whenever i'm craving pizza, it's good enough for me!

30.description: So after Taylor Made has been leaving menus rubber banded to my gate like every damn week since moving to the area, I finally decided to give them a try. I'm getting tired of throwing their menus away. All I need is one menu, you dopes. And what do they give me attached to my pizza box when it arrived? Another menu. Argh!Calling their pizza average would be generous. The crust is NOT crispy, and tastes like that boxed pizza crust mix you can get at the store. They seem to gyp you on ingredients too. If I were to order from here again, I'd definitely ask them to cook my pizza longer so that the crust tastes like crust instead of doughy bread. "If" being the operative word. I pretty much would rather order from Roasti's or Bacci. I've been hoping to find a good pizza joint in this area (besides Phil's). But this place just ain't it.

46.description: Their thin crust is awesome. Best pizza I've had so far since I moved downtown. Perfect if you're into really thin crust pizza. And inexpensive.

1.description: College students assemble.Taylor made pizza has huge portions, not too far from campus, and cheap, great, greasy pizza that'll contribute to your freshman 15. $5.50 for 2 huge slices and a pop isn't something I would argue against. Plus, the staff is friendly and approachable. They've got some good desserts and aside from pizza, the rest of their menu is a bit pricy but who really cares? It's some good Italian food.But VERY BIG NEGATIVE!!! My friends and I ordered a pizza for delivery. 2hrs later, and we never got it. We called about 4 times asking where our pizza was after the first hour past, they kept saying it'll be there in 15min. We were in MRH which I assume to be a somewhat common place for them to deliver. We ended up canceling the order and going somewhere out to eat. The manager, Frank was nice about it and we got a pizza half off later (in the restaurant). Long story short, NEVER get Taylor made delivered.

55.description: I love this place, the pizza's and the ingredients are fresh and really good. The price is reasonable and their menu has a variety of items for you to choose from. The entire staff is very friendly and this is a great place to dine.

9.description: I really wanted to hate this place, and I pretty much did.  Oh oh, see what I did there?Seriously though, Taylor Made has a thing for overloading homes with menus to the point that I almost didn't want to try them because I was sick of them before even ordering from there.  I need to be on their payroll because I'm sure that person is making bank with as often as they're out there distributing said menus, especially since they always end up in the recycling anyhow.  Must be nice to be able to throw away money like that.I should have made an executive decision and ordered Phil's, but I was kind of curious and one of their coupons included mozzarella sticks for free, so Taylor Made it was.  Bad.  Bad bad bad.  You know how I know it was bad?  I was drunk and still coherent enough to complain.  Little known fact (that is somehow mentioned in many reviews), almost all food is created equal in my drunk eyes and therefore by default, is delicious.  The cheese wasn't dark enough (in fact the whole pizza seemed undercooked), the sauce was really sweet, the crust was doughy and bland and the ingredients were minimal.  C'mon, this isn't NY!  We're better than that.  I actually forgot we ordered giardiniera on it until many bites later when I heard a crunch.  Even still, most pizza that isn't so good hot is at least decent cold, right?  No, apparently not.  I had a piece for breakfast 2 days later and it was awful.  Oh, and those mozzarella sticks that are normally $5?  Pass.  Tasted and looked exactly like frozen ones from the store.Phil's is still my go-to pizza in the area, even if I'll never live a Phil's pizza related incident down.  I'm sure I'll give Taylor Made another shot at some point, but not for quite awhile.

26.description: Got the thin crust cheese pizza to go, and it was solid! Just the right amount of cheese and sauce. Perfect for late night cravings or any time you want pizza! It's nice having local options instead of pizza chains since those are all over the place.

25.description: Fast, inexpensive, delicious thin crust pizza.

12.description: the pizza was okay.. i ordered a vegetarian stuffed crust from the online menu and added pepperoni.  its 14.49 plus one dollar for stuffed crust plus 1.75 for pepperoni. total should come out to 17.25 plus tax... we got charged 20.99 for the pizza because they charged us for each ingredient already on the vegetarian plus an extra ingredient we didn't order.. the person behind the counter wouldn't even listen to me saying that i must be mistaken. well check your website

59.description: Sub-par.  Had two groupons.  First I had a slice of cardboard with tastless sauce and some cheese and pasta carbonara which was tastless, I couldn't even fix it at home.  I don't remember what else I had ordered.  Second time it took between 15-20 minutes to get three sandwhiches (SP?) and fries and there wasn't anyone else there!  My beef ( $7.09) was dry and there wasn't much meat. At that price didn't even include fries.  My freinds combo disappointed him, he said the sausage seemed boiled, he like grilled.  Also they charged me for peppers on the side and didn't give them to me. Steak sandwhich rated a Meh.  Fry orders were skimpy. Everything was served at the correct temperature and the place seems clean, and the parking was easy, that's why I don't rate it 1 star.  With so many fast food/pizza slice places in the area I can't imagine why anyone would waste their time and money here.To the owners:  Sorry, I don't want to be mean, but there is alot of room for improvement. Take note of the other recent reviews.

21.description: Bad, bad, bad.  All bad. Ordered through Grubhub the other night, and after an hour and a half, I called the restaurant to check on my order.  The first girl I spoke with was friendly enough, and told me that my food had left the restaurant 10 minutes earlier.  Ok.... Well considering I live around 8 blocks away, I was mildly concerned that my driver was hopelessly lost.  I decided to hang up the phone and see what would happen.  After Another 20 minutes, still no pizza.  I called back and spoke with the most flippant and rude server/hostess I've ever had the displeasure of conversing with.  I told her my concerns about my meal being AWOL, and she told me that it had only been an hour and fifteen minutes.  I was placing this call at 9:49, and my order was put in at 8:09.  She then, in the most condescending tone, informed me that the restaurant doesn't always get the grubhub orders at the time they are placed, and that my order wasn't received until 9:15.   I work in a place that utilizes grubhub.  You get the faxes immediately. That's a major issue if you aren't, and someone should look into that. I pointed out the fact that another (nicer) girl previously told me my food had left the building.  She then proceeded to tell me that it was the weathers fault.  I incredulously asked her to explain herself, because it was raining. Not acid rain, mind you.  Not fiery comets, but just your every day average rain.  She said that people drive more slowly in the rain, again with her "you idiot" tone. I pointed out to her if the driver had left a half an hour prior, and still hadn't made it to our house, (which I will reiterate is approximately 8 blocks away) then at this point even the best of pizzas would be garbage and asked for her name.  I wanted to put a label on the person who, despite my best efforts to be patient and polite while dying of hunger was making my life so heinous.  She said Liz I think.  Or Lisa.  I would have remembered better but I was pretty low on blood sugar because of my lack of pizza.  I  wonder what life will be like for people ordering from this place when winter hits, as opposed to on a Sunday night with some November rain.  I'm certainly not going to find out.Needless to say, food: ice cold, mediocre.Liz/Lisa:  the worst. I Probably wouldn't have been upset enough to write a yelp review 2 days later without you, girl.  The service industry is about customer service....  Work on it or get a new job.  I'd recommend dock-work or maybe something at the DMV with your attitude.

17.description: This place is amongst my top 3 favorite pizza places. I probably order from this place way too often in one month. I love that they put seasoning in their pizza and am in love with their mozz sticks! Each time I've ordered I've had great customer experience, except for one night where I ended up speaking to the manger due to the delivery boy's rudeness. Despite that incident, this place ALWAYS delivers! I love that I can also order late when me and my family decide to have a last minute movie night or I'm just too tired to cook after work.

10.description: So after Taylor Made has been leaving menus rubber banded to my gate like every damn week since moving to the area, I finally decided to give them a try. I'm getting tired of throwing their menus away. All I need is one menu, you dopes. And what do they give me attached to my pizza box when it arrived? Another menu. Argh!Calling their pizza average would be generous. The crust is NOT crispy, and tastes like that boxed pizza crust mix you can get at the store. They seem to gyp you on ingredients too. If I were to order from here again, I'd definitely ask them to cook my pizza longer so that the crust tastes like crust instead of doughy bread. "If" being the operative word. I pretty much would rather order from Roasti's or Bacci. I've been hoping to find a good pizza joint in this area (besides Phil's). But this place just ain't it.

5.description: If I could give this place a 0, I would!!!! Do NOT BOTHER EATING AT THIS HELLHOLE! The food is okay, but the service is whack as HELL. I honestly think 2 of the girls who work there are racist as well as their contractor. I have sat down, watched, and experienced how they treated me and others versus "others". I am one of the first people who hate to say someone is a racist as I try to give people the benefit of the doubt aaaaall the time and try to see good in them, but at the same time, I am far from naïve when it comes to that.Furthermore, on Monday, March 23rd, I opened the door to order food and was immediately yelled at and cursed out by a contractor who was inside painting. I was talked to soooo inappropriately as if I had rudely said something, stepped a whole foot in the door, or made him spill his paint. Hence, he was nowhere near the reach of the door. In the middle of me opening the door and trying to quickly ask a question, the guy quickly hopped off of his ladder and shoved the door closed on me. I swear, if I did not know any better, I would have hit him with a quick combo and popped out the stun gun on him, because I IMMEDIATELY felt threatened by him from the way he approached me for just simply opening the door. If they were closed for "maintenance", why not LOCK THE DAMN DOOR ASSHOLE (and that's the nicest name I can come up with for him)!!!!!!The hell is wrong with y'all??????!

3.description: So this pizza was okay I guess when it arrived, meaning it was edible and I was hungry. And I am happy we had a coupon as well, since there wasn't a ton of flavoring or spices packed in this food....Not really sure why? I feel like it is hard to mess up melted cheese and carbs, but when you aren't excited to eat the leftovers--and day old pizza I actually find one of the most amazing things in life!! so versatile for any meal!!--you realize a place can't be that good. We got a cheese pizza and a sausage and pepper pizza and then an appetizer combo. The pizzas were just bland, but I did appreciate that they were cut into square style slices--always makes it more fun. And the appetizer combo? Well the garlic bread wasn't really garlic like, the mozzarella sticks were probably the best part, and the chicken tenders didn't taste the best either. Delivery took about an hour, but the pizza did arrive hot and all that. Just where was the flavor and fun? I had high hopes...

35.description: It's cheap pizza and it comes with a drink but I can take that money and buy a tombstones at Jewel, a better alternative..

19.description: The food is good but the girl at the cashier is extremely unfriendly. This is my third time coming to Taylors Made Pizza and she's always been unfriendly to me.

28.description: Pricing is great! For a little less than $5 you get a huge slice of pizza, which ends up really being two slices because it's so big AND you get a drink! One order is sufficient for the average person.Taste: it's ok. It's not bad, but it's also not out of this world. If you're craving pizza and in a rush or looking for a reasonably priced place to eat, it does the job. At $5 it's worth stopping by.

45.description: I've liked everything I've ordered from Taylor Made, although that's mainly limited to pizza, calzones, and eggplant Parmesan sandwiches. I can't comment on other reviewers' issues with delivery, though, since I live so close it's much quicker to walk over there and pick it up myself.In comparison to the two other nearby pizzerias, it beats Sofia's on taste if not price, and beats Papa John's on both counts. Taylor Made's pizza-by-the-slice is a good value, too.

33.description: For under $5, you get a large slice of pizza with a drink. Actually the large slice is so big that they cut it in half and it looks like 2 decent slices.  Overall good flavor.  But it's your average slice and a drink stop. I have to say that i do prefer Damenzo's. This place has a pretty good bang for your buck, I just wish it was around back when I was at UIC!  Although at that time, the slice and drink deal was $3...but you can't get something like that in most places anymore.  If you're in the city for a fancy dinner and end up leaving still a little hungry (and guilty for spending so much and still being hungry!), come share a slice with your spouse/date and you'll end the night with your belly properly full and happy...like I did ;)

43.description: Trying to complete my tour of Taylor Street before I move, the bf and I stumbled into Taylor Made around 1 am on Friday night. We both ordered reasonably priced slices of pizza and pop and brought them home to eat. The sausage pizza was huge and awesome. After making the journey down the other way on Taylor to Bacci's and DaMenzo's, I found out that Taylor Made is better than both. And its open really late. A great place to come and get a huge slice for a reasonable price!

2.description: Decent pizza for the price. My son loves it, warning he is 7! If you take classes at Sheridan park, it is a short walk and a quick dinner option especially for a hungry kid that loves pizza.

18.description: Bad, bad, bad.  All bad. Ordered through Grubhub the other night, and after an hour and a half, I called the restaurant to check on my order.  The first girl I spoke with was friendly enough, and told me that my food had left the restaurant 10 minutes earlier.  Ok.... Well considering I live around 8 blocks away, I was mildly concerned that my driver was hopelessly lost.  I decided to hang up the phone and see what would happen.  After Another 20 minutes, still no pizza.  I called back and spoke with the most flippant and rude server/hostess I've ever had the displeasure of conversing with.  I told her my concerns about my meal being AWOL, and she told me that it had only been an hour and fifteen minutes.  I was placing this call at 9:49, and my order was put in at 8:09.  She then, in the most condescending tone, informed me that the restaurant doesn't always get the grubhub orders at the time they are placed, and that my order wasn't received until 9:15.   I work in a place that utilizes grubhub.  You get the faxes immediately. That's a major issue if you aren't, and someone should look into that. I pointed out the fact that another (nicer) girl previously told me my food had left the building.  She then proceeded to tell me that it was the weathers fault.  I incredulously asked her to explain herself, because it was raining. Not acid rain, mind you.  Not fiery comets, but just your every day average rain.  She said that people drive more slowly in the rain, again with her "you idiot" tone. I pointed out to her if the driver had left a half an hour prior, and still hadn't made it to our house, (which I will reiterate is approximately 8 blocks away) then at this point even the best of pizzas would be garbage and asked for her name.  I wanted to put a label on the person who, despite my best efforts to be patient and polite while dying of hunger was making my life so heinous.  She said Liz I think.  Or Lisa.  I would have remembered better but I was pretty low on blood sugar because of my lack of pizza.  I  wonder what life will be like for people ordering from this place when winter hits, as opposed to on a Sunday night with some November rain.  I'm certainly not going to find out.Needless to say, food: ice cold, mediocre.Liz/Lisa:  the worst. I Probably wouldn't have been upset enough to write a yelp review 2 days later without you, girl.  The service industry is about customer service....  Work on it or get a new job.  I'd recommend dock-work or maybe something at the DMV with your attitude.

41.description: Total waste of $5, wings are extremely small, im still hungrry....never eating this again, that's what I get for ordering wings at a pizza place...SMH

52.description: Good pizza for being drunk...... Haha just kidding. But seriously, I loveeee Taylor Made Pizzaa! It is open late and the pizza is sooo cheesy and the price is right!! Their "slice" is huge and I always think I was given extra!!

50.description: I was really disappointed.About 70 minutes after we placed our order, I called, and was tols it would be another 20 minute for delivery. I said I would just come pick the pizza up, as there were kids waiting for dinner.When I got there, I was told my pizza had been sitting out " for awhile", when asked how long awhile was, Mary Beth rolled her eyes. I asked for the manager, and was told he was not there. Eric, manager of Taylor Made, your employees are RUDE!The large vegetarian pizza we ordered was $23. It was not bad, but not great, and the crust needs work. The service was flat out rude. Pizza Hut is a better bet.

4.description: This place is conveniently open late, but that is the lone redeeming aspect of it.All the discomfort of having to finish an incredibly bad slice of homemade pizza...made by your Irish friend's Mom.

6.description: Great pizza , the hubby and I love the stuffed cheese pizza! However, I ordered from Grubhub, and have no problem tipping but when the delivery guy asks, "Would you like to leave a tip?" I consider that unprofessional and downright crass. Is that apart of the job description???

22.description: Such nice people I ordered without realizing I didn't have my card with me and just gave me the food. Gotta get back to make it up to them. And the pizza is awesome!

15.description: Seriously, where was this place when I went to college around here?Just under $5 for a slice (which was essentially two slices because of how big it was... they literally cut the pizza slice in half to make it manageable) and a pop/drink.  This would have been a staple in my college haydays.The quality is okay, and if you're looking for some easy pizza to down, fits the bill.  Verdict:  No longer a student, I probably won't come back unless I"m looking for a quick/cheap bite.  Yes, I'm still that cheap.  It's good to be frugal.

57.description: Had a slice w my boy today, it was good, the service was good. Can't complain, didn't have much else. It's nearby so I will have to check out some other stuff later. I was eyeing desert, but the cupcake place is next door..pizza n cupcakes, yes it was a greasy food day.

20.description: Ordered two large pizzas for my coworkers and I here at the united airlines headquarters on Franklin st.  First time eating their pizza as my normal place was closed for New Year's Day. I have a new favorite now.

36.description: Decent pizza, amazing fried ravioli. I ordered here on a Sunday night and I was told that my order would arrive in an hour and fifteen minutes, which did not make me happy but at least I wouldn't have to cook. To my happy surprise the delivery guy showed up forty minutes later with piping hot food. I really like a crispy thin crust pizza and theirs was on the softer side but still tasty. The pizza sauce had good flavor and it was spread evenly and not chunky, which I feel important if you prefer thin crust.  The fried ravioli came with five larger pieces with the sauce on top, so if you prefer to dip your ravioli ask for the sauce on the side. All in all I would eat here again

14.description: Great find, fast service, friendly staff, a wonderful pizza! Definitely need to remember and return.

3.description: I used Blohaute on the recommendation of a friend.  WOW....awesome idea and incredible stylist (April)I highly recommend this!!!!

1.description: Blohaute is simply amazing! Amanda the owner is the kindest & most humble soul and her girls are great. Their work is stunning and the service is easy, breezy and affordable. Genius idea and insane talent to back it up. Thank you Blohaute!!!!

2.description: If you're even considering using Blohaute, do it. We were lucky enough to have Amanda this past weekend for my sister's, small, low key, wedding. Aside from this being just plain a magnificent idea, it's perfectly executed. Amanda was professional and still hilarious, engaging, knowledgable and really really really really really (you get the point?) great at what she does. She was respectful of our time without sacrificing quality. You can tell Amanda loves what she does and that shows in her work. We talked to her about the company and she seems so focused on ensuring quality and friendliness that seem to come so naturally, I can't imagine that Blohaute will be anything but an insanely huge and successful business within a really short time. The hairstyles are beautiful and natural and wear so well. My sister and I both have really fine hair which never holds curl. After having great looking hair all night- This morning, we both woke up with curls left.

9.description: My stylist was on time, brought everything she needed, did a fabulous job on my hair and was fun to boot! We decided to do a half up do with a braid. It looked awesome. Will call again next time I have an event.

10.description: Simply the best!  I've always had the best experience with Blohaute. Amanda does a great job and gives you a more natural "up-do" style. This girl is so talented and you will immediately feel like you have known her your whole life, just like an old friend. You won't be disappointed!

4.description: I can't say enough great things about Blohaute! Amanda is amazing at what she does! Although her braids are amazing, my "go-to" style are her beachy waves- before going to Blohaute I'd leave salons and the typical dry bar salons less than impressed thinking" I could have done that" then one magical day back when Amanda was at Asha she gave me the greatest beachy waves I'd ever seen- I didn't know my hair could actually look like that.  The prices are super reasonable annnd they come right to your door?? I mean, does it get any better? No, no it doesn't.

6.description: Great experience! Amanda arrived promptly for our early morning appointment times and was cheerful and professional (despite our yapping chihuahuas). She did both my sister and my hair in our living room and made us feel at ease. She is a great conversationalist and delivered our desired blowouts in no time. I got beach waves that are still looking great 12 hours later and I loved the products she used! Blohaute is a great concept and I look forward to using it in the future!

11.description: BloHaute is truly amazing.  The process is simple and it is so convenient that the they come right to your door.  My stylist Amanda showed up perfectly on time with her stylist kit.  She will setup anywhere in your house and is more than happy to look through pictures of ideas you have for your hair.  Amanda can do anything with your hair and will make any tweaks until you are perfectly happy.  Once you love your hair (and you will), she packs up her kit and you are on your way to a perfect night.  Love them!

5.description: I absolutely loved my experience with blohaute. I'll be honest I had something different in mind but I ended up with something much more beautiful. Amanda was amazing she was on time and I was late but she was still so friendly and interesting to talk to. She's definitely professional and I'm so glad I got to try Blohaute out the one time I was in Chicago.

7.description: Amanda is amazing at what she does. Whether it's a blowout or styled braid/up do, I've never been disappointed. I love that I don't have to hire a sitter anymore when I need a blowout, so convenient! A+ service

8.description: This is my first YELP review ever...but I felt compelled to write about my experience with BloHaute.  My fiance actually stumbled across this company on Gilt City and purchased a 4-blowout voucher for me.  It doesn't get any better than someone coming to your house at YOUR convenience to give you a fabulous up-do for a wedding, blowout for a night out or fancy braid for brunch with girlfriends .  They bring the salon to YOU (providing all tools and products), meaning no extra fuss for customers.  Scheduling is easy and simple (they are about to create an app too!). The stylists are always on time, not a minute too early or late - a huge plus compared to the 10-15 minute wait at most salons.  Amanda D. recently did a blowout for my engagement shoot.  She took the time to ask me exactly what I wanted.  Not only did my hair look fabulous, but she gave me the rest of her bottle of AWESOME hair spray to keep and use at the photo shoot at NO extra charge!  This company has EXCELLENT customer service.  I can't recommend them enough.  The convenience factor coupled with the professionalism of all the stylists and Amanda's creativity makes the decision between DryBar and BloHaute a no-brainer in my opinion.

0.description: Mandy came and did my hair for an event I had to attend a few hours later. I had been rushing around all day and was running late so I called Amanda and she was so understanding. They were both so tolerant of my shenanigans and frazzledness (I pulled up to my apt as she was arriving while I was still on a conference call, talk about a hot mess!). Mandy did a beautiful job and was so friendly and chatty. It was an all around great first experience and will definitely but in touch again for my next spur of the moment hair-do needs! Update: got so many compliments on my hair tonight!

58.description: The restaurant is a little expensive for what you get, but its a solid experience otherwise. I love the salad bar.

56.description: We were out & about in our neighborhood and needed to grab lunch but didn't want to do the typical Potbelly/Panera.  We came across Jason's Deli which was in the same shopping center as a Dominicks.  I wasn't expecting much.When we walked in we could not figure out the ordering process. I do not like this.  I haven't returned to a Baja Fresh for this very reason. Two registers up front which were labeled for take out and online orders but nothing pointing you to order for eating in. There's a big menu board behind the two registers which had a few items on it. Once we figured out you need to walk down to the lone register by the salad bar to order for dine in, we found a much bigger menu. I choose the California club with steamed veggies and my partner had the chicken panini. My club was very good, although there was more bacon on one half of the sandwich than the other and I would have  liked a few more green veggies than carrots in my side but it was still an excellent sandwich.  The croissant was incredibly flakey!  Partner loved his panini. We both were pleasantly surprised by out entire meal.  We didn't try to the free soft serve but we both thought it was a cute idea.Overall, it was a very good lunch in a nice atmosphere that made you forgot you were eating a Dominick's shopping center.

29.description: Jason's Deli is the type of place where it's fine to eat if you're in the neighborhood, but not worth much of a drive. The menu is extensive, so I keep trying different things and so far everything tastes about the same and average. The free ice cream is fun and the service is typically friendly. You can order ahead for pick-up, so it's a good option for carry out.

42.description: I was quite ill in 2011 and my sister and I ordered some food to be delivered.. It was so-so, but I went back a few weeks ago and it was the bomb!  I had a club sandwich and some beef stew.  The beef stew was just like mama used to make it.  plus, ice cream is free for everyone!  I love this place!

23.description: Nice, simple & quick!  Enjoyed a Nutty Salad with grilled chicken and accidentally forgot to say no feta please. When the server brought and I realized my error I said is pick it off. He said no and had it remade for me. That was super nice and more than most would do since as I said it was my error. There's free ice cream!

47.description: For some reason I have found it hard to find a salad bar in Chicago. That's what I live about this place

8.description: I love Jason's Deli for what it is: a great place for a fresh salad, yummy sandwiches, unlimited iced tea and (of course!) free soft-serve ice cream.  I'm disappointed only in the error in this Yelp listing: they don't have free WiFi -- they don't have *any* WiFi at all (despite my recommending it to the manager every time I've gone in since they first opened.)

31.description: WOW!  I experienced Jason's Deli as a catered lunch and I must say I was nothing but impressed.  Although there was a large volume and variety of food was delivered it was all fresh, hot and delicious.  The portions were generous and I'm not going to lie...the variety of sandwiches caused me to have way too much for lunch that day... but it was worth it.I had never heard of Jason's Deli prior to this experience but I took a napkin that day so I wouldn't forget.  I am delighted to find out there is one in Park Ridge near me... I will be headed there soon and I can only hope it's as good as this one is!  bravo!

34.description: This is a great "fast food" option for those who are sick of the same old...PARKING- Jason's is located in a shopping center, so parking is easy.PRICING- I think everything is pretty fairly priced. For example, you can get a MASSIVE loaded baked potato (about the size of a dinner plate) for around $6.00FREE ICE CREAM!STAFF- Very friendly and pleasant. DRINKS- There is an awesome fountain concoction called Blueberry-Pomegranate. It is a "Jason's recipe." It is very refreshing and light tasting. I highly recommend it. ORDERING- Ordering was a bit confusing. If you are dining there, you simply go up to the cash register and you physically look at a hand-held menu. Seems like that might get backed up during the lunch rush?BONUS- It seems like this place originated in New Orleans..the menu includes seafood gumbo, French bread from New Orleans, and a variety of muffulettas. What a nice surprise!

16.description: This is a great "fast food" option for those who are sick of the same old...PARKING- Jason's is located in a shopping center, so parking is easy.PRICING- I think everything is pretty fairly priced.
