For example, you can get a MASSIVE loaded baked potato (about the size of a dinner plate) for around $6.00FREE ICE CREAM!STAFF- Very friendly and pleasant. DRINKS- There is an awesome fountain concoction called Blueberry-Pomegranate. It is a "Jason's recipe." It is very refreshing and light tasting. I highly recommend it. ORDERING- Ordering was a bit confusing. If you are dining there, you simply go up to the cash register and you physically look at a hand-held menu. Seems like that might get backed up during the lunch rush?BONUS- It seems like this place originated in New Orleans..the menu includes seafood gumbo, French bread from New Orleans, and a variety of muffulettas. What a nice surprise!

13.description: I've been a fan of Jason's deli for years!!! But since the last few visits here not sure if that will continue. I remember getting a GOOD sandwich that was stuffed with meat and trimmings, now it's barely a sandwich!! Then the few times that I did ask to get it fixed it was a problem. Their French onion soup on several occasions was too salty!!!!! Shocking today it had no flavor!! The servings of food are getting skimpier and skimpier!! I remember upon a time I would leave Jason's deli full with just a half a sandwich and soup. Now I'm leaving disappointed and still hungry!!! I've been to a lot of Jason's deli all over, but this location seems to be the only one where I seem to have difficulty with...  It's real disappointing when your use to be favorite sandwich place is now somewhere you won't be returning no more!! The only reason I'm writing this review is because I've compromised so many times and I'm not happy spending money somewhere and not leaving satisfied!

11.description: Really great place to sit down and eat for lunch. Some buddies of mine and I would go here probably once a week for the longest time. Nice atmosphere, great price, and nice people. My favorite and go-to sandwich is the Club sandwich. And I LOVE that they have Cholula hot sauce here! It's a big deal because i find that a lot of restaurant don't offer this hot sauce. I think its a great touch. It's the little things, I suppose. You should definitely try this place for lunch sometime.

39.description: This is my favorite Jason's Deli location because it's consistent each time we visit.  Been to many other JD's and you can't really go wrong with anything at Jason's Deli, but the S. Canal spot always does it right.My favorite is the hot corned beef.   Thinly sliced, fresh, and piled high.  I always only adorn it with either mayo/mustard or both.  Never seems to need much more than that.  Salad bar is terrific too.  Staff is always pleasant and fast.  Plenty of seating.  Place is always clean.They're in a strip mall with lots of parking,  free parking in the city is always a bonus, just as good as the free ice cream.

37.description: My daughter and her friend told me about Jason's Deli. I shop at Target, Whole Foods and Best Buy a lot and since I work in Law enforcement, I am always at the Chicago Discount Uniform store. After all that shopping, I usually get hungry but can.t make up my mind what to eat. Well I decided to try Jason's after they kept telling me how good it was. Now, I can't stop going in there. I have to be honest and tell you guys that I have not tried a lot of things in the deli, but the salad to go is what I get all the time. I love all of those veggies, salad dressings, eggs, different types of lettuce and when I make my salad, I really make it. My children love it when I come home with this salad because they have these little corn muffins and ginger muffins that I get a lot of to put in the bag. Then they have graham crackers that I also get and put in the bag. They give you a cup for extra sauce for the salad, a cup for that wonderful ice cream and by the time I get home, its just a wonderful treat to eat. I would recommend them to anybody who shops on Roosevelt Rd and gets hungry but can.t make up their minds what to have. Jason's is it.

0.description: The sandwich gets one star, while the customer service is four stars. I had a chicken panini that came with spinach, provolone cheese, pesto sauce, and tomato. I don't eat a lot of sandwiches, but I love panini's.. Let me say that while I appreciate the type of bread they used, which was a French roll baguette type, I prefer my panini's with flat bread. Btw, I requested extra spinach, which is the star of chicken panini's, in my opinion.My order is ready and placed before me is what looks like a sandwich, pan toasted a little, with chunks of cubed chicken and spinach. The spinach was spilling  out of the sandwich. I. Was. Annoyed. Panini's are neat sandwiches. The ingredients are pressed together to form a tight little neat sandwich. Half of the ingredients shouldn't fall out. I picked up the panini and more spinach started falling out, as well as the chicken cubes. Who made this travesty??? I hate half of the fake panini. Eventually, the ever so caring husband grabbed the manager and I explained to her that this was no panini. She offered something different from the menu, which I accepted. I ordered some sort of chicken on a croissant.. It was good. The manager was apologetic, aimed to rectify the matter and please a customer. I love great customer service and I will go back for more sandwiches. Just not that fake panini..

38.description: I go to Jason's Deli at least once a week.  While on a trip to Chicago, of all the local joints spread about the city that I should be trying.. I elect to have my weekly ritual..  My trusty Yelp app let me know that there was one right near downtown.  It's located in a shopping center with a perfect view of the Sears *cough cough* I mean Willis Tower.  After posing and snapping pics in the parking lot, we head on in.  It was lunch time so I was expecting throngs of people but it wasn't too bad.  Maybe everyone was at the local joints that I should have been at.  But no, I was happy with my choice.  The consistency of Jason's Deli food no matter the location is always impressive. I ordered my usual, the Nutty Salad and it came out looking bigger and better than I've ever gotten in my usual location in Texas.  See, not everything is bigger in Texas.  However, it did come out sans salad dressing.  I let the guy know and he told me I can proceed to the salad bar and get my own dressing. Okay.  So I go up to the salad bar, and there are no cups to put the dressing in.  So I had to go hunt him down to tell him.  Awkward city.  But anyway, other than that little blunder.. We had a delicious lunch! Even got a free cookie. Yay!

51.description: I've only tried their Reuben, so my review is based solely on that sandwich as well as the salad bar and fruit.Everytime I crave a Reuben sandwich, I head straight to Jason's Deli. It's a HUMONGOUS sandwich with plenty of corned beef and sauerkraut that are stacked a mile high on rye bread with Russian dressing. A half sandwich is more than enough to satisfy my appetite, especially since I like to get a side of fruit or salad with the sandwich instead of the potato chips.  They serve this yogurt sauce with the fruit which is absolutely delicious and is the perfect dip.  You make your own salad from the salad bar, which is piled with almost everything you can think of that you want in a salad (no meat products except bacon bits).  Best part? FREE soft serve ice-cream! YUM.Side note, my husband absolutely LOVES their California club and says it's the best club sandwich he's had.

27.description: My husband ate there on Tuesday.  After costuming a chicken sandwich he was hospitalized at Lutheran general hospital for food poisoning. Called Jason's deli twice and no one returned our call. Would never recommend this place. Bad food and no one  cares to talk to you about this. Will be contacting the health department.

32.description: The food at Jason's Deli is pretty good. I like their soups, salads, sandwiches and baked potatoes.

54.description: I'm not sure why, but I had always though Jason's deli was simply a sandwich place, similar to Subway's or Quiznos.  But its so much more than that!! The place reminds me more of Panera in that they offer a sit down restaurant to eat their soups, salads, and sandwiches.  They even offer a salad bar and soft served ice cream!I had told the lady at the cashier that it was my first time at Jason's and I had no idea where to start when it came to ordering my food.  The lady was very nice and offered me a menu and told me how to to order.  I ordered the California Club which is Oven roasted turkey breast, guacamole, tomato, bacon, Swiss, mayo on toasted all butter croissant. They offered the sandwich with my choice of fruit, baked chips or steamed veggies.  I went with the steamed veggies which was a mix of broccoli, cauliflower, and organic carrots.  Both the sandwich and the steamed veggies were delicious.The best part of the process was the waiting because I was allowed to eat free soft served ice cream on a cone while I waited.  I'm a such a sucker of soft served ice cream and its even better when its free. I am definitely coming back here!

48.description: I have nothing negative to say about this place... maybe I just know what to order here.1.  Their baked potatoes are BIGGER THAN YOUR FACE!!!  Now, I understand that this is a commonality for burritos, but as a hardcore Irish chick, potatoes this large are super AMAZING!!  Baked potatoes doused with cheese, butter, sour cream, and broccoli sounds like a clogged artery, but makes me wish that I could buy chapstick flavored like loaded baked potato.2.  THE SALAD BAR = GREAT.  Load me up on those fresh fruits n' veggies!  And the potato salad is pretty great, too. ;)3.  As if you aren't full enough after eating your main course, there is free soft serve ice cream... a perfect lure to get your unruly children to behave.

44.description: First time I went here I ordered a Reuben and it was amazing. I was craving it again today so I decided to head over here and grab another one. This one was good as well, but unfortunately it gave me food poisoning. My stomach was feeling queasy all day after I ate it until I finally puked it all out (sorry for the unappetizing image). Food is good, but eat at your own risk. I'm not sure employees here follow standards of safety when handling food.

24.description: Jason's Deli!!! okay they have a lot of seating and it's kid and family friendly yes those thing are good. They have a nice menu with soup and sandwiches and salad bar deal with all you can eat and soft serve ice-cream is free! It's great right? But the problem is their food isn't that great and isn't worth the stomach issues afterwards.I feel so bad for my husband he hasn't stop going ot the bathroom since we got back from eating at Jason's deli. I feel bad for him and I felt bad I chose to dine there tonight. I'm feeling okay though hope he is going to feel better.He ordered their french onion soup it was very salty. And I had their chicken noodles soup not too bad. SIGH I learn my lesson don't go back to Jason's deli with hubby. I stil like their soft serve ice-cream.

7.description: I came here tonight and has dinner with some girlfriends.  The soup and salad was great and my friends all enjoyed the free ice cream.  I appreciate they had a gluten sensitive menu & I also appreciate how kind the staff was to our party.

49.description: we have frequented Jason's since it opened at this location.  Hits and misses.  the problem is employee and manager turnover.  When they have a good manager on duty things go well. When no one is running the restaurant there is no consistency.  I have often watched new product placed on top of old product at the buffet which is not following the "first in first out" sanitation principle they should be following.  We were there the other evening for a late evening meal and they were breaking down the salad bar because it was closing time.  One of the employees was using her hands to clear and store the salad buffet items, TOUCHING ALL THE FOOD WITHOUT PLASTIC GLOVES!  I actually got up and shouted "you cannot do that.  You need gloves!!"  One of the other employees told her to stop and throw out the lettuce but she was throwing out the bag of lettuce all of which had probably not been touched but ok throw that out too. What she had touched went into the bins for service!  So I asked for the manager and he came out and said that the lettuce would be thrown out.  I asked why this is going on anyway and he said she was new and was being trained.  Being trained by who??  What standards?  This should have been an easy one.  Do not touch the food with bare hands!!!   They have no current training program - that is obvious from the other night!  We have had a love hate relationship since Jason's Deli's opening.  We love the concept of fresh food but it always comes at a price - not the right ingredients in the preparation of the menu items, turned product, and now blatant disregard for sanitation standards.  We will not be going back.  This manager was not competent and I doubt he had a sanitation license.  I regret that I didn't ask if he or someone on site had a license which is required by law.  Definitely a place that should be inspected!!

40.description: Came here on Saturday.  Everyone was very friendly and the place is really clean.  Did I mention free ice cream? I ended up getting a wrap + fruit + ice cream for $6-$7.

53.description: Great  food, very nice employees, reasonable prices. I like their Reuben sandwich.  Some of their soups are just okay but the Chicken was very good. Corned beef was not to fatty. Free ice cream for dessert. Great for a chain.

30.description: I am always lured in by the free soft serve and cake cones. FREE SOFT SERVE.Jason's offers up a ton of sandwiches/salads/etc and has a pretty decent salad bar should you find yourself in this area. Plenty of seating inside, and a big parking lot outside. However, the cashier set up confused me a little - there is a "carry out" cashier that is closest to the door, and the "eat in" cashier is further along. I may just be a newbie though. No WiFi (in case you were trying to get some work done in here over lunch while waiting on Kinko's), but you can definitely just spend that whole time eating the free (!) soft serve until you're ready to head out.

46.description: Always wanted to try out this place because I heard many good things about this deli and I must say I definitely agree with what I've heard! I had the Mediterranean wrap with steamed veggies  as my side and it was delicious and healthy and fulling! Of course I could not resist the free soft serve ice cream either! Place was very clean and had a good flow of customers around dinner time. Will definitely go back again and have the impressive looking garden salad bar!

1.description: Went in for a quick bite.  I haven't been to this location in years, but I frequent their Loop location - the takeaway salad bar has saved me from many a hungry day at the office. Place was packed with a mix of families, delivery drivers on break, college students.  Ordered the salad bar and a cup of soup.  The salad bar was a little sparse on selection.  While I understand that the Loop location caters to a totally different demographic, I was a little surprised at its overall lack of appeal.  Not a large variety of vegetables - no cauliflower or broccoli - eggs were absent due to the egg shortage.  There were two unnamed concoctions - the one I tried was some kind of cabbage salad.  The Italian pasta salad was bland at this location, but it's one of my go tos downtown.  The cottage cheese was a little off and the pickles were nowhere near crisp.  There was something off about the chili and the ice cream was too sweet somehow.  I chalk it up to being accustomed to a location that caters to a totally different demographic.  My review is limited to the salad bar and the chili, and I'm fairly confident that their sandwiches meet Jason's standards (everyone there was more than happy with their lunch).  One thing that needs to be addressed - for one reason or another, the staging area faces the dining room.  That's a mistake.  I had the displeasure of watching the manager dump a large bag of pre-made, processed soup into the warmer bin.  It was disappointing  - I kind of thought that a fast casual establishment at that price point would at least make their soup in house.  I'm sure some of their competitors do the same, which should improve consistency from location to location, but like I said, not so much with the chili here.

55.description: Decent chicken pesto sandwich with chips. I liked eating there because I could get free soft serve after my meal. All the workers there were friendly. Traditional lunch soup/sandwich/salad spot.

9.description: The service can get a lil awkward, I feel like everyone is still in "customer service" training.Food is good, chocolate mousse at the salad bar is awesome! It's not the cheapest sandwich place around but it's pretty decent. Nothing bad and nothing too exciting. There's many other better places around. This place is sort of franchisey.

26.description: One of my favorite fast places to get food. Beef stew and chicken noodle are really good. Haven't had a sandwich I didn't like here (I'm really picky about food). Always tastes fresh. Boyfriends obsessed with the seafood gumbo. The salad bar has plenty of options and is always fresh. Only downside is they need to offer more options (healthy) for sides without having to pay extra, not everybody wants chips. FREE ICE CREAM!!!

25.description: Nothing like a place that provides healthy food with a huge variety of dishes. Anything from the salad bar to the sandwiches to the pasta tastes like you are at a 5 star restaurant. Honestly there aren't many words that can describe this place so if you are thinking of something quick and reasonably priced come here. Don't forget to try the seafood gumbo ... did i mention free ice cream!!!

12.description: Jason's Deli!!! okay they have a lot of seating and it's kid and family friendly yes those thing are good. They have a nice menu with soup and sandwiches and salad bar deal with all you can eat and soft serve ice-cream is free! It's great right? But the problem is their food isn't that great and isn't worth the stomach issues afterwards.I feel so bad for my husband he hasn't stop going ot the bathroom since we got back from eating at Jason's deli. I feel bad for him and I felt bad I chose to dine there tonight. I'm feeling okay though hope he is going to feel better.He ordered their french onion soup it was very salty. And I had their chicken noodles soup not too bad. SIGH I learn my lesson don't go back to Jason's deli with hubby. I stil like their soft serve ice-cream.

59.description: Good sandwiches but if you're the only one that's hungry and want something delivered you have to either order extra food or call somewhere else. They have a $20 minimum order for delivery. Sounds stupid considering they are always busy and in the South Loop. I would think volume alone would be a good reason to deliver.

21.description: Food is good.  Delivery sucks. We ordered at 11am and it's now 12:53.  We knew it would take awhile since they are ALWAYS late, so that's why we ordered at 11, but this is ridiculous.

17.description: Ok Jasons Deli - I've given so many chances and now I have to yelp about it.We order lunch at my office everyday.  Jasons Deli has been the place chosen many times.  The food is awesome and that is why we do like ordering from here.  However - THE DELIVERY IS TERRIBLE.  I don't get it.  We have ordered over 15 times in the last few years and every single time it takes as long as 2 or more hours to get to us.  Today we ordered....same results.  We ordered at 11am for the food to arrive at 12.  They say allow 30 minutes....so ok latest 12:30.  It's 1pm as I write this and still nothing.  When I call they can only tell me "They should be there any minute".  Yeah that was 20 minutes ago lady.  To rely on them for any kind of business lunch or pretty much ANY kind of lunch that you want to have at, say, lunch time - is pretty much super pointless.  THEY WILL NEVER BE ON TIME.Now am I insane to keep ordering from them knowing their 2 year long track record of never being on time?  Yes.  Yes I am insane.  Right now I have an entire office of hungry pissed off people.  Sadly I think this will be our last Jasons Deli order too.Hey just some advice Jasons Deli....if you can't give people their food when you promise it...maybe you need another driver or two.  Something is clearly not working due to the fact that you are consistently late.  My boyfriend is more on time than this.....THAT IS BAD.I'm done now.

10.description: I had never heard of Jason's Deli yet if I think back on it I have seen it many times when I went in the area and truly didn't think much of it or ever wanted to go into this restaurant.Well, one Saturday afternoon after volunteering at an event for women my girl, her mom and I decided that we would go check out Jason's Deli, now this wasn't their first time here and they even warned me if it was as crowded like it normally is that we would have to go some place else.Well, luckily it was only semi-packed so we got the Spicy Shrimp Gumbo, the Chicken Tortilla soup as well as the unlimited salad bar which was only 7.50.  The salad bar was filled with some great and fresh items; I just wish they had some different lunch meats as one of their selections.  They did have some unusual selections like the potato salad that taste like a baked potato it was so good.  They had different kinds of nuts like almonds, sunflower seeds and granola. 3 different kinds of greens(spinach, iceberg and mixed green).  They had a wide variety items so you could make a different salad each time.  They also had chocolate mouse and pudding both were great.  The dressing was real good and it took everything in me not to just drizzle and pile it on it was so fresh.  All in all the items are fresh just wish they had a selection of meats.The soup was so good but it was not unlimited I believe for a bowl it was 4.99 but don't quote me on that it was somewhere around there but not more than that and it was so good.  I got the Spicy Shrimp Gumbo and boy did I want more and it truly wasn't that spicy but flavorful.  They will allow you to have a sample of the soup before you commit to one.  The Chicken Tortilla was also very good and after I tasted it I wish I had got that one instead of the one I ordered I just didn't want Tortillas in my soup...lol but then it wouldn't have been Chicken Tortilla soup.The staff was friendly and boy we had to keep tabs on our plate a few times because they were ready to take them away before we were done.  It was a great causal atmosphere, people were on their laptops, reading books and actually have a genuine conversation.  I was surprised I only pulled out my phone to check in to yelp before putting it in my purse and enjoying a lazy Saturday afternoon.The bathrooms were clean and had the those special toilets that has the up for 1 and down for 2...which I found interesting and very environmentally friendly. To top it off you get a free ice cream cone which I filled with chocolate fudge and then added the ice cream it was so good.  I wish I had topped it off with some almonds....I know that would have made it even better.  If you are not a cone person they also have small bowls.  If I had known that this Deli that I saw but I didn't see before was so good and inviting I would have tried it out a long time ago.Enjoy!

5.description: Always awesome sandwiches & seasonal soups & chowder.  Staff always friendly & ... love the free self serve cone.  Hits the spot! Great place for a quick meal on the way home fm work.

3.description: I love the selection and the salad bar at Jason's. All meals include a free ice cream if you are dining in. The food is always fresh and flavorful. God for lunch or dinner!

35.description: Great sandwiches. Good soups. All you can eat salad. Free soft serve and cake cones with a chocolate flavored syrup..No hydrogenated oils. No high fructose corn syrup (except for the soda fountain).It's a little pricey but it's got quality and a conscience about ingredients.

19.description: For what it is, this place is great. Fairly cheap, quick, and actually seems healthy! Tons of options, nice drink selection, and the salad bar looked delicious-a friend who had ordered in the past confirmed it is. Plus, free ice cream! Great for lunch or a quick dinner.

28.description: The broccoli-cheese soup didn't taste much like either.  Meh.I've never had a muffaletta, so I don't know if theirs was good.  The bread was dry.  I don't think I'd order one again.And the soft serve smelled of nail polish remover.  Mmmm.  My second visit to a Jason's Deli, the first time was in Park Ridge.

45.description: Jason's Deli is one of my fav places to eat with my kids. I order a kids meal for them and a organic turkey wrap for myself. Love the broccoli and cheese soup with fruit side. Can't beat free ice cream at the drink bar either!

33.description: Delicious salad buffet and free ice cream? Pastas, paninis, sandwiches, and soups? All on the cheap? GOD BLESS AMERICAPlease open more of these in Chicago.

43.description: LOVED IT!  Can't go wrong w/a Jason's deli.  Food is awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Service is good too.  A Chicago staple!

2.description: This was my return visit after a 2 plus year hiatus. And all I can think is what happened? Maybe it was the after lunch clean up or something but the salad bar had not been replenished and seeing a staff member wiping some toxic cleaner around the food that was left should've have been a sign for me to get a refund and leave. I was starving so I made due. Don't know if the whole food and jewel have punched a hole in jds balloon but the place is officially deflated.

18.description: They have improved to the point that I'm giving them 5 stars.  I've completed their feedback surveys (online) and mentioned the soups were too salty.  The soups that I've tried are now better.  I usually go with half sandwich and soup specials or the pasta dishes then supplement with the free ice cream.  I like that the tables and floors are keep clean.

41.description: I once had a complaint and asked to speak to Jason. I was told there was no Jason that worked there. I replied, "you've got to be kidding me, isn't this his deli." I'm hilarious.. Great place to grab a quick meal. Especially when you're with people that can't decide what they want. Great sandwiches, salads, and even pasta. Every time I eat here I say to myself, "I should come here more often." Parking is abundant and easy.

52.description: We were out running errands around Roosevelt Road and decided to eat first.  On foot because of taking the bus, and we saw a sign for Subway near the Dominics strip mall so we walked in that direction.  As we got closer we talked about other potential choices, what are we in the mood to eat, etc. and actually walked past Subway to see if there was anything else interesting, and guess what, we found a Jason's Deli on the end!  Both of us are fond of Jason's Deli in other states so we knew what to expect.Delicious and satisfying sandwiches.  I did the half sandwich and soup combo called the Manager's Special, and she ordered the chicken salad on a croissant.  They give you a number to put on your table, and after you get your drinks and sit down, a server will come by soon to deliver your food personally.  My club royale hit the spot, and I enjoyed the spicy gumbo with shrimp, rice, vegetables.  Her croissant was flaky the way she likes it, not stale or soggy.I did not know about the free ice cream, but if that isn't enough of a reason to return soon just take a look at the menu.  We saw a wide variety of interesting things that will keep us busy for a while.  And if you want to take your drink with you, just ask for a to go cup.  Simple.

50.description: We came here for a quick dinner before our movie. I had their salad bar and my husband ordered one of their royale sandwiches. I also ordered a cup of chicken noodle soup and he had a bowl of broccoli cheddar. We liked that they have so many different soup options. Pretty awesome we weren't restricted to two kinds of soups and a soup of the day.Anyway my salad bar was like any other salad bar. They have a good variations of greens and veggies to add. There were limited selection of the pasta salads that I normally find at salad bars, but it's alright. My husband's sandwich was okay too. We always like Jason's Deli, but this time it was just an average but we don't want to give it a bad rating. Food is still good. Although both our soups were pretty salty.

4.description: Today I stopped in to get my lunch for work.But I have been in hear a few times. I love the service. Always service with a smile and asking is it anything else I can get for you. I have had the fresh salad bar and the soups( chicken pot pie and southwest chicken chili) is my favorite Have not had the sandwiches. But this places get my stars because of the nice and neat salad bar. Not over crowded and just fresh.I think this is a nice place with plenty of parking for grab and go or even if you can grab a seat and enjoy even betterAnd yes you can have your free ice creamyummy

6.description: Fresh food, good veggie options, good customer service. Seating area very open and little like cafeteria seating so we just get it to go. The lobster soup was very watery compared to when they first introduced. Otherwise good late lunch:)

22.description: I had never heard of Jason's Deli yet if I think back on it I have seen it many times when I went in the area and truly didn't think much of it or ever wanted to go into this restaurant.Well, one Saturday afternoon after volunteering at an event for women my girl, her mom and I decided that we would go check out Jason's Deli, now this wasn't their first time here and they even warned me if it was as crowded like it normally is that we would have to go some place else.Well, luckily it was only semi-packed so we got the Spicy Shrimp Gumbo, the Chicken Tortilla soup as well as the unlimited salad bar which was only 7.50.  The salad bar was filled with some great and fresh items; I just wish they had some different lunch meats as one of their selections.  They did have some unusual selections like the potato salad that taste like a baked potato it was so good.  They had different kinds of nuts like almonds, sunflower seeds and granola. 3 different kinds of greens(spinach, iceberg and mixed green).  They had a wide variety items so you could make a different salad each time.  They also had chocolate mouse and pudding both were great.  The dressing was real good and it took everything in me not to just drizzle and pile it on it was so fresh.  All in all the items are fresh just wish they had a selection of meats.The soup was so good but it was not unlimited I believe for a bowl it was 4.99 but don't quote me on that it was somewhere around there but not more than that and it was so good.  I got the Spicy Shrimp Gumbo and boy did I want more and it truly wasn't that spicy but flavorful.  They will allow you to have a sample of the soup before you commit to one.  The Chicken Tortilla was also very good and after I tasted it I wish I had got that one instead of the one I ordered I just didn't want Tortillas in my soup...lol but then it wouldn't have been Chicken Tortilla soup.The staff was friendly and boy we had to keep tabs on our plate a few times because they were ready to take them away before we were done.  It was a great causal atmosphere, people were on their laptops, reading books and actually have a genuine conversation.  I was surprised I only pulled out my phone to check in to yelp before putting it in my purse and enjoying a lazy Saturday afternoon.The bathrooms were clean and had the those special toilets that has the up for 1 and down for 2...which I found interesting and very environmentally friendly. To top it off you get a free ice cream cone which I filled with chocolate fudge and then added the ice cream it was so good.  I wish I had topped it off with some almonds....I know that would have made it even better.  If you are not a cone person they also have small bowls.  If I had known that this Deli that I saw but I didn't see before was so good and inviting I would have tried it out a long time ago.Enjoy!

15.description: I've only tried their Reuben, so my review is based solely on that sandwich as well as the salad bar and fruit.Everytime I crave a Reuben sandwich, I head straight to Jason's Deli. It's a HUMONGOUS sandwich with plenty of corned beef and sauerkraut that are stacked a mile high on rye bread with Russian dressing. A half sandwich is more than enough to satisfy my appetite, especially since I like to get a side of fruit or salad with the sandwich instead of the potato chips.  They serve this yogurt sauce with the fruit which is absolutely delicious and is the perfect dip.  You make your own salad from the salad bar, which is piled with almost everything you can think of that you want in a salad (no meat products except bacon bits).  Best part? FREE soft serve ice-cream! YUM.Side note, my husband absolutely LOVES their California club and says it's the best club sandwich he's had.

57.description: I'd eaten here once before with a friend over 3 years ago and remembered that the food was pretty good, if pricey.  So I stopped in for lunch today.  The restaurant was about half full.  At the entrance there was a sign directing people who wished to place orders for carry-out, but nothing instructing customers who wished to dine there.There was one employee talking to a couple in Spanish at the door, but when the conversation was over she disappeared.  I seated myself at a table and waited for about 3 minutes.  No one approached me.  Then I saw a customer at a register by the salad bar.  It reminded me that I thought you placed your order, paid for it, and then were given a number so that a server could bring it to you when ready.  So I got up and went to the register, but the employee had disappeared. I waited there for about one minute, but again no one approached me so I walked out.  In this economy it really ought not be that difficult to spend money in a restaurant.  Will never be back

20.description: Ok Jasons Deli - I've given so many chances and now I have to yelp about it.We order lunch at my office everyday.  Jasons Deli has been the place chosen many times.  The food is awesome and that is why we do like ordering from here.  However - THE DELIVERY IS TERRIBLE.  I don't get it.  We have ordered over 15 times in the last few years and every single time it takes as long as 2 or more hours to get to us.  Today we ordered....same results.  We ordered at 11am for the food to arrive at 12.  They say allow 30 minutes....so ok latest 12:30.  It's 1pm as I write this and still nothing.  When I call they can only tell me "They should be there any minute".  Yeah that was 20 minutes ago lady.  To rely on them for any kind of business lunch or pretty much ANY kind of lunch that you want to have at, say, lunch time - is pretty much super pointless.  THEY WILL NEVER BE ON TIME.Now am I insane to keep ordering from them knowing their 2 year long track record of never being on time?  Yes.  Yes I am insane.  Right now I have an entire office of hungry pissed off people.  Sadly I think this will be our last Jasons Deli order too.Hey just some advice Jasons Deli....if you can't give people their food when you promise it...maybe you need another driver or two.  Something is clearly not working due to the fact that you are consistently late.  My boyfriend is more on time than this.....THAT IS BAD.I'm done now.

36.description: Food here is descent nothing extra special. But DO NOT GET DELIVERY. first of all it takes over an hour. And the unbelievable part is that they charge $7.00 for delivery. We just canceled a $60 order because of the high charge & placed it with Jimmy Johns instead.  Never have I heard of such a price for delivery & I only live 1 mile from the store.   If you add a tip to it your well over $10.00 for a delivery. Unreal!!! It's too bad because we would be ordering from here at least once a week.  Instead it's only the occasional time when I am passing by the deli. On top of it, the food is already over priced.

14.description: WOW!  I experienced Jason's Deli as a catered lunch and I must say I was nothing but impressed.  Although there was a large volume and variety of food was delivered it was all fresh, hot and delicious.  The portions were generous and I'm not going to lie...the variety of sandwiches caused me to have way too much for lunch that day... but it was worth it.I had never heard of Jason's Deli prior to this experience but I took a napkin that day so I wouldn't forget.  I am delighted to find out there is one in Park Ridge near me... I will be headed there soon and I can only hope it's as good as this one is!  bravo!

58.description: Great Italian spot in the middle of a veritable food wasteland, I get the same thing almost every time I come here:Summer Salad w Tuna - Delicious, grapes, bleu cheese, olive oil and regular salad stuff with a health dose of mayo laden tuna so I can justify it as being proteinSpinach Pizza - BombThey recently got rid of their pizzas, which I thought were awesome, and if you come in here at noon it gets super crowded from the hospital people. This place is solid, def. try it for lunch.

56.description: Although I've been going to Ferrara for many years, I've not written a review mainly because I just don't know where to begin.  It's a bakery, and yes, I have ordered more than my share of Cannoli cakes for family events, I've eaten many cookies and pastries - more than I care to admit, but it's so, so, so much more.  It's been awesome to experience the expanding menu of savory items on Ferrara's menu over the years, some have been misses (no one is perfect), but most have been hits, from soups, to sandwiches to pastas to pizzas and salads - so much good food!!  On my most recent visit, I decided to keep it simple and try something I never had before - a Garden Salad with ranch dressing on the side.  I figured it would be a small salad - something I could eat at my office to get me through the end of the day.  When the young lady came out with a big bag I had to ask "What did I order?"  She repeated exactly what I ordered...when I got back to my office I pull out this huge container with a beautiful salad with romaine, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, olives, roasted red peppers, croutons (made in-house), celery, carrots and more that I can't remember.  And the ranch - which tasted like it was also made in-house, was SUPER-DELICIOUS!!  Seriously, sometimes, it pays to keep it simple.  This was one of the best salads ever.  The staff at Ferrara are also worth mentioning, they are all so friendly and attentive.  It's always a pleasure to go for a visit.  Hope Ferrara is around for many more years.

29.description: I'd give this place a 3 for the sandwiches, but a 3.5 for the cookies and ambiance...well call it a 3.I love the no frills flavor of this place. Decor is mismatched, and menu options are standard. The Italian sub is ok, not great: it's much better with Parmesan cheese sprinkled in it, which is easy with the old schoolish Parmesan shakers on the tables.The desserts though, are delicious, especially the various butter cookies. I work around this place so I'll be back often I'm sure, and Ill have to get a cannoli next time.

42.description: Came to the bakery to get Tiramisu for my sister's birthday.  The store is huge and full of all kinds of delicious looking sweets.  The tiramisu was some of the best I've had.  If I come back, I'll resist getting it again, simply to try some of the other delicious cakes and other desserts on display.  Definitely a hidden gem.

23.description: We come here regularly from work, as this is one of a few places to eat in our neighborhood. The chicken sandwich with pesto (order extra) is my favorite, followed by the pizzas! I've never had a dish here that wasn't good. I don't love the pastries or cookies though. They are a bit flavorless and bland to me. So, come here for lunch but get your sweet treat fix elsewhere.

47.description: One of those hidden bakeries in Chicago... they have excellent pastries and they struggle with some of their more savory dishes... but the SFOGLIATELLA is out of this world!  I did find lots of their food to be too oily for my liking and my friends too. Update 9/6/12:This restaurant is difficult to find with only an old sign on their brick building, but it is a great place for lunch, especially if you are not wanting to spend too much money and are craving some Italian food.  The crowd varies from nurses to doctors to students and construction workers.  Whatever you do, everyone comes here hungry and leaves satisfied!

8.description: A chicago institution!  I think this maybe affiliated with Ferrara Pan Candy located in Forest Park.  I think both were started by the same family but I could be wrong.  Who cares?  This is a great little place.I'm not much of a sweet girl so this place for me is all about the sammies, focaccia and pizza.  You cannot go wrong with any of these!  Trust me, my middle name should be bread...or yeast...or gluten.  Whatever!  I adore anything this place creates with a bread base.  I know it's a bakery but they really  are a legit place for lunch.  Ya, the service is often surly and slow but I still think their food makes up for it.

31.description: Honestly their baked goods are not very good.  I would recommend the chocolate caramel cookie and a cannoli. but everything else is dry.  I think the cannoli would be better with chocolate chips on the ends rather than nuts though. The food is actually pretty good. I highly recommend the tuscan? sandwich (red peppers, spinach, and chicken). The summer salad is also tasty.  I should have asked for the dressing on the side because they put too much dressing on the salad for my taste.I did not like the pepper and artichoke pizze (aka pizza).  They only have pizzas from 11-2 pm on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays. I bought into the exclusivity and thought this pizza will be delicious. Nope, I was wrong.  The sauce had a really odd flavor (almost tasted sour) and it was covered in cheese (usually a good thing but that's not like an original Italian pizza). The red peppers were soggy and the artichokes did nothing for flavor. Overall the pizze tasted like a bad frozen pizza. As for the frozen food, the chicken pastini? was very salty. My grandparents could not finish it.The stuffed peppers took forever to warm up.  I asked the owner how long to put it in the oven for. She said 30 minutes in 350 degrees Fahrenheit.  Not even close, I had it in the oven for 1 hour and it was still cold in the middle.  I eventually had to put it in the microwave to warm it up and then it was soggy.  As for the taste, a bit flavorless. I have tried the frozen lasagna and that was worth the money.As for the service, I think the young girls work hard and are relatively friendly.  The owner, however, is not  friendly and she is constantly barking orders/ correcting her staff making for an uncomfortable environment. She takes your order or rings you up and you're on your way.  She makes no effort to engage her customers. I only come here because I live very close. I would not suggest going out of your way for it, unless you want a cannoli.

34.description: This review is purely based on customer service.Little did I know when I bought the groupon that I wasn't just paying for a dozen cannoli, oh no... I was also buying the opportunity to be mean mugged the whole time by employees. The moment I walked in, I wasn't greeted, smiled at, or even acknowledged. Instead, the girl that was behind the counter glared at me until someone from the back came and helped who said "did you want something?" ... No, I just came in to fucking do nothing and stare back at your dumb asses. The experience didn't get any better from there, as I was cashed out by a server who could not be any more disinterested in being there. Needless to say, I will not be back because there is no way I'm supporting the wages of all these useless teens. ......... PS. The cannoli were fucking amazing. :-(

16.description: Original Ferrara Bakery catered the cocktail hour and the sweet table for our daughter's wedding reception. O. M. G. everything was absolutely out of this world delicious!  Nonni and her staff are wonderful and she made placing our order a breeze.  They even delivered out to Oak Brook and everything arrived on time, fresh, and plated beautifully.  We live in Orland Park and to be honest, there isn't a bakery in our area that makes authentic Italian bakery offerings like Ferrara. ( believe me, we have tried them all in our search ) Our daughter and her then fiancé don't like cake, so we didn't need a wedding cake, but we knew that the sweet table was going to have to be spectacular and we were not disappointed.Our daughter's absolute favorite item is the cannoli, which they made a separate box up just for her to take to the hotel after the reception.  The cocktail hour sandwiches and pasta salad were a huge hit. The cookies and pastries for the sweet table had all of our guests going back for seconds and thirds! Everyone wanted to know which bakery we had used because it was just that good.  We couldn't have been happier in our choices and we will be using their services every chance we get.

13.description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and ordered five different pastries that the cashier said were all made fresh that day and everything tasted stale, not to mention the lemon cream tasted like it had gone bad. Will not be visiting again.

11.description: I had lunch here yesterday and it was satisfying. I am not sure I think I was expecting a little more based on the reviews I read. I ordered the chicken tuscan, it was good but I felt like it was missing something. I also ordered the lentil soup, the soup was ok tastes burnt but evened out with the sandwich. Today I went in for some cake and a custard filled eclair and I was not impressed. The custard was not what I expected, it was bland and I felt like it had been sitting on display for a few day by the way it tasted. Overall, its ok , a lot better than fast food sandwiches. The lady on the phone was really nice though!

39.description: I can't believe this place only has 70 some reviews!  It is one awesome place with some delicious Italian fare and pastries.  Their tiramisu is by far the best and what I believe to be the most authentic I have ever found.  A young man that was working the counter when I was there for one of the first times was a descendent of the original owners and said all thief recipes are old family recipes that are much older than the bakery itself.  Recipes that were probably brought here by his clearly Italian heritage past.  The cannolis were delectable as well as the red sauce I took home after finding out the recipe was most likely older than my grandparents.

37.description: came with a groupon and boughtcannoli - the cream too sweet and the shell too hardpasticiotto - the lemon cake outside was good, but the cream inside too sweetchocolate eclair - good chocolate crust but bad fillingfocaccia - the crust too chewy and stalethe cannoli cream that's ever-present in all their pastries is the downfall. too sweet and lumpy.

0.description: I absolutely love this place. What a gem! Came in this late afternoon for a sugar fix and came out with way more than I can chew! The staff is amazing, every one of my visits is always such a great experience. Today my boyfriend and I came in for gummy worms and ended up getting chocolate chip cookies,pizza slices, and cannolis!This particular visit, we were greeted immediately by a very nice (handsome) man who ended up giving me 2 free slices of the spinach pizza with the 2 slices I already picked up!!! That just goes to show how amazing the staff is, real personable too, totally adds to the bakery's at home atmosphere. Can't get any better than that!The baked goods / desserts are nothing short of perfection! The candy display always makes me feel like a kid. I love the selection and always leave wishing I ordered more!!! They have a full menu equipped to fill your hearts Italian desire!Oh and I have to mention that my very first cannoli was from this bakery and I'm totally hooked for life!  This is a local neighborhood business that my Boyfriend and I will continue to support. The kindness of the store doesn't go unnoticed. Thanks!

38.description: Pretty good Italian sub.  OK minestrone soup. Really good cannoli.  I would go back.

51.description: Very cute and quaint place! Ordered a tray of various small pastries for a potluck. Everyone enjoyed them and commented on how delicious they were. Service is also very nice and helpful. :)

27.description: Good but not great. The biscotti is light to the point that it disintegrates when it hits coffee. I prefer a heavier biscotti that can get dunked into coffee and still be intact for a bite.Other baked goods are similarly okay. This place is the best thing going in a sort of lackluster neighborhood :/

32.description: Pretty good place to go to for lunch!They have coffee, sandwiches, pasta, desserts, candy, and a lot moreI've tried their Italian beef and Tuscan ChickenAnd a couple of their desserts on a whim, I have no idea how Italian desserts are like so I picked out random things but they always turned out decentThe sandwiches were pretty good as well, but nothing extraordinary, but I did prefer the Italian over the chickenI live right by this place, it's not something I'd go to everyday if I had the chance, but when I do I'm usually satisfied.

54.description: Every year my dad would buy me my birthday cake from here growing up. It was the only bakery I knew as a kid...even though I did not grow up in the area. Once in awhile I still go back for their famous signature cannoli cake or strawberry shortcake. I can't believe that the cake tastes the same after all these years....absolutely 'eat the entire cake in one sitting' delicious. I can't get over how light and perfect their frosting is (not too sweet not to bland). Oh and the fresh strawberry filling...beyond yummmm....I have been to many bakeries and had many cakes in between...but in the end I always compare all of them to Ferrera's....no cake has topped my expectations.

48.description: Ah Ferrara's.. I'm a fan.  And even if I wasn't, I have no choice as it's one of the few good Italian eateries in the area.  I tend to go with the sandwiches here, particularly the Positano (prosciutto, mozzarella, tomato with EVOO and balsamic vinegar on french bread).  It's delicious!  The place is very Italian authentic, including in food, decoration, and, unfortunately, service.  Lots of chatting, which is not a bad thing, except when you've pre-ordered and are in a hurry to make it before the short lunch break ends at work.

44.description: The place when I first entered recently. Was actually better than I expected. Lots of Italian cookies to choose from. Some other Italian pastries as well. The selection of beverages, take home foods, even Ferrara Pan candies are a real treat.

24.description: I come here for lunch weekly and always order the summer salad with double chicken. Everything I have had here is good but small space and always crowded.

7.description: Went out in search of authentic Italian pastries and lunch  and we were satisfied leaving! Their Caesar salad was big and delicious! The girl taking my order was very nice ! The decor is very authentic and you can tell this business is family Owned. I got a very unique cake that was amazing. It's a pound cake with cannoli cream as filling. Also got 6 cannolis to go! Everything tastes amazing ! This is my go to place in Chicago for pastries! Thanks Ferrara!

49.description: Just a quick review, not much more I can say that hasn't already been posted. Great Italian food and pastries.  Good portions and fair prices. Had a nice sized meatball sub for lunch, with a bag of chips, pop and of course desert, all for about $10. Cannot say enough about how good the pastries are here..  Don't walk out with out trying something sweet.

40.description: I used to live down the street from Ferraras. The saddest part about leaving the neighborhood is missing out on my sfogliatella every Saturday morning. I docked two stars because they haven't taught their counter girls how to make a proper latte or cappuccino. The "foam" is dish-soap like bubbles that pop in your face and is quite frustrating. But again, the sfogliatella is to die for! Go there for it NOW!

53.description: Delicious cookies, wide variety.  Cannoli is FANTASTIC.  Signature sandwich hits the spot with fresh ingredients and great bread.  Place is clean, lots of seating, friendly staff.  Highly recommended!

30.description: I havent had the privilege to stop by the store myself, but my husband brought cookies here one day and i was BLOWN AWAY! Maybe its a good thing i dont stop by myself coz i wud go crazy on a cookie/pastry spree! The cookies are delicious and im actually writing this review while munching on the salted caramel cookie w a nice cold glass of milk, and its frickin awesome. Now whenever theres a potluck i always pick a box of it and everyone loves it. Cant wait to try other pastries.

46.description: Fantastic cannoli!  BUT when you go in, do NOT pass up on the bow tie pastries!  Buy yourself at least 1/2 lb!

1.description: Love this bakery / cafe .excellent selection of Italian sugar cookies , cannoli and pasta/ paniniA great part of the neighborhood!

55.description: 1/20I ordered a cake for my GF birthday.The cannoli cake was really awesome. I opted for no custard with extra whipped cream.Because it was snowing so bad I was really scared they might close early or think I wasn't coming. I was pleased to see that they were still open with my cake ready to go.I did also leave with two pieces of lasagna that was really good. Not phenomenal not amazing but good.One cake two pieces of lasagna for $48....not so bad.Why just A OK?  when I called to place my order the first time on wednesday around 10am the girl wasn't sure if I could substitute, wasn't sure about a lot so I had to call back at a later time....All in all I think I will try them again.

9.description: I didn't have great luck with baked goods here, so this time I stuck with a solid sandwich.  I went with the Tuscan chicken and the hubs had the grilled chicken sandwiches.  Both were simple sandwiches with solid, fresh ingredients tucked inside amazing Italian bread.  The kind that has that classic crusty crust, a soft inside and a slight meaty chew to it.  Best.Bread.Ever.  The sandwiches were not large like a Subway sub but the portion was just right for me.  Only downer was they are pretty pricey for what you actually get, less than 6" and not very large girth for over $7 after tax.Overall, it's a nice lunch option if your in the Tri-Taylor area.

26.description: Cannoli cakes. Cannoli. Babas.  PERFECTION. Have loved this bakery since I was a kid and we are 100% Italian. It is the real deal

25.description: For some reason when I saw the address on Taylor I figured it was east of Ashland, and then realized that this was actually west of Damen! I made the trek  out even though my Groupon was expired so that I could try out some of these pastries. I understand I was a couple of hours away from closing time, so they had already run out of a lot of stuff. I missed out on tiramisu and probably many other more popular items. It was also the day before the 4th and they were selling the goods at 50% off to reduce inventory and avoid tossing stuff out. I got the apple tarte, carrot cake, and the strawberry shortcake. I think these are all a little more on the sweeter side for me, which is a little too much. I like that the place also sells other food items like sandwiches, salads, pizza, and other entrees. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is pretty quick and efficient.

12.description: This bakery is very close to my work and have had some catering orders for meetings and such. The salad and sandwiches are good, nothing to write home about, but fine for a quick lunch. The bakery portion isn't huge, and I've only tried the limoncello cake as far as their pastries go, and I thought that was a little too sweet for me, would have liked a touch more lemony vs sugary taste. I'll probably try a few other baked goods at some point and update then.

59.description: Decided to go Little Italy to find the elusive pignoli cookie. I have been searching and searching since I moved to Chicago to find these nutty delights. Now Ferrara has a pignoletti (which means small) that is pretty tasty and close to what I have been making for years, and what I find every time I go to NY to visit. Their other cookies and pastries are spot on, fresh, creamy and delicious. Service was good, the people friendly, and even though it was a little crowded, quick and efficient. Definitely reminded me of the bakeries I grew up near in Brooklyn!

21.description: Cool little bakery and plenty of lemon head variants as well! A little bit of a hike but a nice stop.

17.description: For some reason when I saw the address on Taylor I figured it was east of Ashland, and then realized that this was actually west of Damen! I made the trek  out even though my Groupon was expired so that I could try out some of these pastries. I understand I was a couple of hours away from closing time, so they had already run out of a lot of stuff. I missed out on tiramisu and probably many other more popular items. It was also the day before the 4th and they were selling the goods at 50% off to reduce inventory and avoid tossing stuff out. I got the apple tarte, carrot cake, and the strawberry shortcake. I think these are all a little more on the sweeter side for me, which is a little too much. I like that the place also sells other food items like sandwiches, salads, pizza, and other entrees. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is pretty quick and efficient.

10.description: Cannoli cakes. Cannoli. Babas.  PERFECTION. Have loved this bakery since I was a kid and we are 100% Italian. It is the real deal

5.description: I've been to this place a few times and what I always go back for is their cappuccinos and the sfogliatella. I get the cappuccinos made with whole milk (as one should always do). They're always really good and have the perfect amount of foam . The sfogliatella is sweet, but not overwhelmingly so. They have an excellent texture and a hint of orange zest, which gives them a unique taste. As for their cannolis, I don't find them particularly great. The shells are better than the cream, which always tastes a little off to me for some reason. Overall, Ferrara is a good place with an interesting history and is nicely located. Definitely worth going to.

3.description: Original Ferrara Bakery is one of my favorite bakery store in Chicago. It is a hole in the wall as you drive by Taylor street, BUT you gotta try it! And believe me, one you did, you will be hooked! Their tiramisu is soo good, it makes you dreaaam about it. They cannoli is oooooh delish! Even when I am writing this review, my mouth is drooling thinking about their tiramisu and cannoli!

35.description: This place has been in my neighborhood since the 70s.my mom use to buy my birthday cakes from here when I was kid.i been coming ever since I was a kid.they have some very tasty cookies,pound cake,rum babas,canolis,chocolate strawberries,etc.when I was a kid i use to come here to get my lemon heads,Boston baked beans,fishies an other candies.love this place:-)

19.description: This bakery is adorable. I've lived by it for years and would always go in for baked Italian goods and to grab some Lemonheads. I finally stopped in for lunch and it was quite good! The place was packed at noon. I ordered a soup and sandwich and it was reasonably priced and quite good! I will keep coming back for more cookies and another lunch! And you can't beat their cannolis!

28.description: I am giving this business a low rating based solely on their HORRIBLE customer service!!!  I have worked nearby for years and been in countless times.  To their credit, I must say that they are consistent. The food (soup and sandwiches) are always quite tasty.  The cookies all taste the same all the time.  And, the business owners are regularly unpleasant, unwelcoming, unappreciative and generally just nasty.A few years back after a several month stint of daily trips (Monday - Friday)  for their soup, I ordered a salad.  The salad came with a live green bug on it.  After quietly calling it to the attention to the woman in charge, she barked "What do you want me to do about it?  We don't make the lettuce?"  Needless to say I swore of the place from that day forward.Admittedly, I occasionally give in to an urge for one of their items and find myself going back for some more EXCEEDINGLY POOR customer service.  Today was one of those days. I am regularly surprised (shouldn't be) that the rudeness continues.  I have once again sworn off of Ferrara's because I prefer that my business be appreciated and not be regarded as a bother.  Do not waste your time if you value customer service at all - the same or similar items can be purchased elsewhere and you may even get a "thank you" for your purchase.

45.description: This place has been around since I can remember.  My mom used to get all our birthday cakes here when we were little.  We lived a couple of blocks away and she remembers the small cake costing 8$.The canolli cakes are still delicious and their trays of cookies and pastries still mouth watering.  Apparently they sell pasta and sandwiches now.  I guess this is convenient for all the people who work at the nearby hospital.  I have not had a chance to try the food but I will soon.Still my favorite Chicago birthday cakes!

33.description: Armed with a $10 Groupon and my italian boyfriend, I walked in seeking dessert after a delicious Italian sub lunch at Conte di Savoia.  The cannoli and tira misu did not disappoint, and I left wishing I'd bought a box of cookies for the train ride home.  If I'm ever back in the neighborhood to reminisce about my boyfriends college days again, I'll be begging to go to Ferrara.

43.description: Awesome tiramasu and other desserts. Always stop by here before having guests over so that we have a tasty treat for dessert.  They have awesome sandwiches too!

2.description: Family owned since 1908!! I make a point to ALWAYS stop by before heading back home to pick up Italian cookies and pastries. Having spent a lot of my childhood in Little Italy-NYC I may be a bit fussy when it comes to Italian sweets and this place NEVER disappoints!! The absolute BEST Sfogliatella in the Midwest, now I just need to create a reason to order a cannoli cake

18.description: I come here for lunch weekly and always order the summer salad with double chicken. Everything I have had here is good but small space and always crowded.

41.description: Came here to try out some bakery items.I had the tiramisu. It wasn't the best I've had, but it was okay.Cannoli has peanuts and not pistachios like other have stated, but I wasn't really a fan of it.My sister didn't care for the strawberry shortcake. She said it tasted like cheap cake and overly sweet.Sorry, but doubt I'll be back.

52.description: My chocolate horseshoe cookie was so hard that I thought I made one of the brackets on my braces pop off.  I had an assortment of cookies, and all but one type were stale. The cannoli filling lacked something...it just wasn't sweet enough. And WTF, garnished with peanuts? The spinach and ricotta foccacia is still awesome, but by the time I got there (around 4pm) there was only one piece left.Meh!

50.description: I haven't been to this establishment for 35 years.  I almost got into a car accident as I saw Ferrara's in the corner of my eye as driving by on Taylor St.  Naturally, I had to stop to taste the cannoli.  Yep, they are the same as I remember them, and to be sure they are the standard by which all others are judged.  However, the bakery is a mere shadow of its former self.  I remember when as a kid in the 50s this was the center of the universe when it came to Italian cookies and pastries.  Today, except for the cannoli, I not sure about the baked goods.  I would have given the establishment 5 stars for the cannoli alone if they had not pre-filled them.  World class cannoli must always be filled on order and not a moment before.

4.description: We wanted an authentic cannoli and eclair and oh boy did we get them!! The sweets and treats are delicious! The cannolis are enormous and they are very liberal with the filling which is fantastic! The eclair was enormous too and an absolute treat! I can't wait to go back and try some other sweets!  My only concern was the area... It's literally 2 blocks away from juvie. But that has nothing to do with the quality of the food in this gem of a bakery!

6.description: We went here to get some slices of cake for my birthday and some cannolis. Decided to get some lunch while we were there. The Italian beef sandwiches are tasty enough, but we loved their cannolis the best. If you want some authentic cannolis this place definitely has them (according to my girlfriend, I never had them before myself). They also sell a lot of candy. We didn't buy any of that though.

22.description: I have gone here multiple times and I have no complaints! They have never messed up my order, and I mostly go during the lunch rush. I normally get the pasta dishes which is around $6. They give you a huge bowl of pasta with a side of bread and salad. You can't beat that price for good quality food.

15.description: Great lunch spot in this area. Food is homemade and pretty consistent. I don't care for their baked goods but I don't  eat baked goods very often.  I like the fact their Chicken Parmesan sandwich is grilled chicken and is not breaded or fried.  I'm a regular.

57.description: A quality Italian bakery. I was here yesterday, about 8 minutes before their 6:30pm closing time.  I came specifically to try their cannoli ($2.25).  They didn't have any left in the case, but they offered to make one on the spot for me. In the meantime, I took a look around. They have so many different Italian cookies to choose from, I ended up getting two, a lemon knot and an Amaretto meringue type cookie (I don't remember the exact names).  The cookies are $9.99 and two cookies were $1.09 by weight.I ate the cannoli about 25 minutes later.  The filling was spot on, perfect.  The shell, however, was way too thick and unbelievably crunchy, not in a good way. I like a crispy, fresh cannoli shell, but it needs to be thinner to be enjoyable. Also, the ends are dipped in peanuts. I am really used to the pistachios on the end, so it seemed a bit of a downgrade.On the plus side, the cookies were amazing.  The lemon knot especially - I loved it because it was straight-forward lemon. Many times I have bitten into a lemon knot and have had an anise aftertaste, which is not something I look forward to. They have many sandwiches on the menu, they all seemed reasonably priced, about $4 - $6 each. And they sell Mr. Luigi's brand of frozen pastas (love, love, love the gnocchi), and Ferrara Pan candy (same family) such as Lemonheads and Red Hots.Also, metered street parking in front was very easy to find when I was there.

20.description: Just judging from their chocolate truffle moose, I knew everything else has gotta be completely fantastic. And then I tried their pasta, and wow, fantastic!!

36.description: I didn't have great luck with baked goods here, so this time I stuck with a solid sandwich.  I went with the Tuscan chicken and the hubs had the grilled chicken sandwiches.  Both were simple sandwiches with solid, fresh ingredients tucked inside amazing Italian bread.  The kind that has that classic crusty crust, a soft inside and a slight meaty chew to it.  Best.Bread.Ever.  The sandwiches were not large like a Subway sub but the portion was just right for me.  Only downer was they are pretty pricey for what you actually get, less than 6" and not very large girth for over $7 after tax.Overall, it's a nice lunch option if your in the Tri-Taylor area.

14.description: Came here to try out some bakery items.I had the tiramisu. It wasn't the best I've had, but it was okay.Cannoli has peanuts and not pistachios like other have stated, but I wasn't really a fan of it.My sister didn't care for the strawberry shortcake. She said it tasted like cheap cake and overly sweet.Sorry, but doubt I'll be back.

3.description: I would not recommend going to this nail salon at all. It's all about getting your money and not about providing a top class spa experience. Go where they value you as a customer.

1.description: I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND GOING HERE! They were extremely rude and had very poor customer service. In addition the salon was very dirty and didn't seem well maintained at all.

2.description: Very fast service and thorough. I took off a star because the water they ran for my pedicure was scalding hot. Only $20 for a pedicure so I will definitely be back!

5.description: DIRTY, UNSANITARY!  I went there on a busy Saturday afternoon for a mani pedi.  It was very busy, but that doesn't mean you should sacrifice quality.  they didn't wipe down any of the pedicure tubs.  I was so horrified from my pedi, I didn't get my manicure. You would think this place would be more sanitary with new instruments and brushes for clients since its part of a huge beauty supply store.I WOULD OF GIVEN THIS 0 STARS IF I COULD!!!!

6.description: The Nail salon owner is really nasty and the workers they have very nasty attitudes they talk and treat you any kind of way and i have a problem with that you have to be professional at all times and customers should always be right.Then it was very hot they had no air and it was 90 outside shop was very dirty no room to breath or be comfortable while getting serviced.  If you mention anything about they job they have a problem no matter if  you are right or wrong you can't say nothing about they job at all i let them know that i wasn't putting my feet in no dirty tub because he just rinsed it out with plan water no cleaning supplies after he finished with a customer that he would have to clean it first he got mad and told someone else to do my nails.They supplies they do not clean them at all,they wax for eyebrows make bumps on your face ,they reuse the strips on your face as well and thats nasty and you can catch something from that.When i told him that the polish was to thick on my nails he got very upset at me and yelled and jump in my face cause i asked him to do it thinner now mind you i had tip him and payed him before he started so when he began to yell i was clam and told him your not gonna yell and be rude to me then all the others got involved so i said let me get my money back they all start going crazy on me saying they wasn't giving me my money back and while all that was going on he started doing someone elses nails no respect for me at all so i called the police when they came now they wanna act like it wasn't nothing that was the worst experience i ever had when im paying my money i will never go there again only reason i wen't and let them start cause i was rushing and its closer to my house cause the way it was i would have turn around and wen't all the way across town my first and last time ever going again im really disappointed at the job they did and the poor service they gave i still can't believe the experience i experienced there still in shock....

7.description: Attached to this nail salon is their enormous beauty supply store!  They've got everything you could need, hair products, beauty supplies, wigs, jewelry, even undergarments and shoes!  Its definitely the one stop for all your beauty needs!

0.description: I visited their new salon which is around the corner in the same strip mall. The salon is pretty big in comparison to others I've visited and definitely larger than their old location next to the beauty world supply store. There were plenty of pedicure spa chairs so I don't anticipate long waits during pedicure season. They have actual towels for drying hands which I do enjoy versus paper towels. They also have a nice assortment of OPI colors, which is a must for me when choosing nail salons.Overall, I was very impressed with service. Service was quick and I'd say that I was 95% satisfied with my nail service. I am generally picky on how I like them done so it's hard to get 100% without me telling the nail tech exactly how to paint my nails. I will defintely come back here and get both nails and pedicure done.

4.description: a tad on the ghetto side.......and sometimes the wait is terrible, but all in all, they get you in and out.  Depends on if you want an in-and-out spa service.  Don't expect much more from this place.Friendly to me, as I was a regular patron when I was attending UIC.  I was getting a good set of gels and good fill-ins for the price.  However, the manicure I got here did not last.  The pedicures are very good.

12.description: Working nearby, I've been coming to this DD for nearly four years on a weekly, sometimes daily, basis.I have to say that the staff here are absolutely wonderful people who really get to know their regulars.  In a world where good customer service is hard to find, this place blows me away regularly with their staff and kindness.  Sure, there are the occasional hiccups (they're a small location so tend to run out of donuts towards 11/12, and don't have the variety that other stores do), but this is and will remain my go-to place.An oasis in a criminally under-commercialized medical district!

7.description: Dunkin Donuts in the El station is not an appealing combination for the mind: it superimposes images of startling amounts of pigeon crap (usually covering the El platform in winters) with coffee creamer.   When I get off the El in the morning sometimes there are 30 people in line for coffee and I have to chuckle a little: don't you have somewhere to go?  Can't you save the 300% markup and have coffee at home before you go?  Doesn't your office have coffee?   Yet I now add myself to the list having tried it once on cold day where I just wanted something warm to go, and I was met by the efficient and cold protocol of this little machine shop: obviously I did not know how to order given the terse one word questions from the employee.   The thing I really hate about DD is that they mix everything for you, no control over what goes in your coffee.    It tasted ok but I don't like being treated like mindless cattle.

3.description: Fast service, friendly staff.  No non-dairy milk option.  :-/

1.description: This place always has a huge line in the morning when I get to work. I would probably stop there to get stuff more often if the line wasn't so bad. They take your order and then you are pushed to the side of the window until they call your name. There is not much room there to wait. The layout should be rethought and maybe open another register and hire more people if they have that much business. The 3 stars is for the deliciousness behind the register; 2 if you also consider the above.

2.description: As far as coffee shops in public transportation stops go, this is a decent one. It's not open on weekends, which is a bummer, and there's almost always at least a line, but the folks at the order window are efficient. My only frustration was that I tried to use the DD app once to get a discount on a drink, but their scanner wasn't working. Probably (hopefully) just a one-time thing, though.

9.description: 3.5 starsI don't know whats happening at this DD, but the line has been moving slower, the people have become less friendly, and I'm waiting for my order a lot longer. My DD visit used to take about 1-5 mins. Today, it took me 15 mins. In the past month or so, it's been averaging about 10-12 mins. It would be really sad to see this DD continue this way.

10.description: with so many DD's to choose, why go here?  because they are fast and the coffee is still made in glass coffee pots (which tastes better than coffee made in those huge metal cans they have in bigger DD locations) and more importantly, I love that it's been pretty much the same staff for YEARS, and they are really good at their job.  Most days, I just walk up and all I get asked is "1 or 2?"  (meaning 1 coffee or 2, because sometimes I get a ride from my boyfriend and buy him a coffee), and they know exactly how to prepare them depending on what I say.  All I do is hand over payment.  I love that....it's priceless to me so much so that I go out of my way to come to this locale.

13.description: First time here, I should be back.  Ordered 2 ice coffees that wer..ok..I think I would need to go back to try again.  Let me say this; it was my frist time getting an iced coffee from dunkin donuts, so I would need a second visit to try it out again. Staff was quick and friendly, small place too.  Tactfully next to the pink line to get all the students and passerby getting on or off to buy a cup o' joe.  Open only on weekdays, no place to sit outside it (wasn't meant to)  However, across the street is a sitting area is quite nice and I am sure alot of their customers are from the medical center.  I hear on the opposite side there is some seating as well.Wish I had my camera....will try to next time.

16.description: This place is located in the Polk Pink Line Station and only opens on weekdays.  It does not have its own sitting area, but the Sbarro/UIC next door provides an outside sitting area which people use.  Base on my visits to about 5 locations of Dunkin Donuts around Chicago, service of this location is one of the faster ones during rush hour.  People from nearby hospitals and research centers count on this location for their cup of Joe in the morning!

17.description: Donut holes, hot coffee, and most standard Dunky-D's items right in the polk pink line terminal. Great location, but it does close early when neighboring UIC classes finish. Very convenient and generally quick is always a win.

15.description: They did a little remodeling to move their services better and it has worked and the workers are outstanding always eager to take anyone's order.

0.description: This DD is a tiny little stall in the CTA station. Don't miss it! Perfect for people on the go with quick service, everything you want in the menu, and no detour needed. I came on an off-time, so I bet it gets pretty busy on weekday mornings. I bet I will be getting my iced unsweetened tea and Boston cream here again in the future.

5.description: The donuts are fresh and very tasty. Also, the place is always kept clean! And the coffee is wonderful. I found the employees to be very friendly and quick to fill the orders. This place is a donut paradise!  I will continue to patronize this place. I loved it.
