11.description: Your standard Dunkin. It has a good proximity to school, which is why I'm always there. Lines can get long, as in any coffee place, in the mornings and afternoons. Service is standard, nothing exceptional. The staff basically just wants to fill orders as soon as possible, which is understandable in a train station shop/

8.description: I luv Nicole!!!!! She rocks!  Always nice and she makes theeeee best sweet Tea!

4.description: These people are very busy at the el stop but despite that they have a great service hot coffee and fresh donuts. This team of employees have their act together and always get their orders right!

14.description: Stopped here for a quick cup of joe. Should have kept going. I don't know what it is about DD coffee but I'm not a fan. I don't care what flavors you add and how much milk you pour into it, this is some nasty coffee. P.U.

6.description: This place is closed on the weekends :(

58.description: Definitely will get your bang for the buck.  Might not be the greatest bang.  But, it is one regardless.  You get a ton of food.  But sometimes a little hit or miss with the quality of the food.  Can't complain because prices are fantastic!

56.description: Been there a lot of times when i was in uic. the food was not so good,  I gave it three stars coz I was there with my friends, good memory.

29.description: I have been going there for almost 10 years and although the interior had improved,  unfortunately the food hasn't. After tonight's take out experience I think I need to find a new thai spot. And this was my go to spot and that makes me sad. I ordered pad woon sen with shrimp and specifically said shrimp about 3 times so that it was clear that I wanted shrimp and the meal had 1 piece of shrimp!  REALLY?!?! I also ordered pad thai. Probably the worst pad thai I have ever had. Maybe they have a new chef,  but how do you screw up pad thai? !?! Then ordered cucumber salad with no onion and got a handful of onion. The lady who took my order told the kitchen about 3 times no onions but clearly they didn't pay attention. So disappointed.

42.description: The food is decent but the service is terrible and they are disorganized.  We put in a group order for pickup, got there, and had to wait 30 minutes because they had given our order away. I get that accidents happen,but we weren't offered a credit, discount, or even an apology. While waiting all of the staff were yelling at each other and the atmosphere was tense. Wayyy to dramatic for a lunch run. The food is not worth the aggravation. Not going back.

23.description: Love the food but the waiter didn't understand English she forgot my chicken and the curry chicken who does that!

47.description: I recently revisited Yummy Thai, after no being so impressed the first time I went. Still, I see the rave reviews on yelp and think I must be missing something, so I tried again. The food is OK - pretty good. My chicken rama, though, came with three pieces of broccoli, and that is one of the main ingredients listed in the dish. I asked the waitress if I could have more broccoli, but she wasn't willing to bring me it. The service was really, really bad. I had to get up to ask for a napkin, water, and eventually our check. The waitress never checked on us. It was also really cold in there. I'm going to stick with Golden Thai in University Village. The food is better, the broccoli is plentiful, but the service is also sub-par. Two out of three, though.

8.description: I'm surprised I never wrote a review for Yummy as I have enjoyed their food many times.Everything about Yummy is great. I only gave them 4 stars instead of 5 as the price is just a tiny bit high for the volume of food compared to some other Thai places I've frequented.  Don't get me wrong, the volume is appropriate, it's just that for the same price at other places, you might get extra to take home.ANYWAY, the pad Thai is good, spring rolls, basil dishes, curries...

31.description: I did not care for the Pad Thai. I ordered it spicy but it tasted bland. I added the pepper flakes and one of the other spicy condiments that was on the table but it didn't enhance it much. The egg drop soup was strange. The consistency was thick, like they added too many eggs. Also, the broth was buttery, not brothy which turned me off. The spring rolls, however, were very good and light.

34.description: Slow and rude service plus congealed rice noodles with watered down hot sauce make for a sad experience.  My order of tofu phad thai was more a mash of slop rather than anything resembling Thai.  Sadly Yummy Thai does not live up to its name.

16.description: LOVE LOVE YUMMY THAI! I wish I could give Yummy Thai more than 5 stars, but unfortunately I can't :( I've been going here with my family for about 7 years now and I have tried almost everything! They definitely live up to their name because everything is yummy :) I've been reading other reviews and was surprised by the negative ones. It seems like some of the reviewers reviewed the wrong restaurant because yummy Thai does not have shrimp tempura chicken nor do they have bubble tea. The prices here at Yummy Thai is remarkable and definitely affordable. The entrees usually range from $6.95 to $10. For appetizers it's from 2.95 to 4.95. From the many Thai restaurants in little Italy, this is by far the most affordable one. I'm surprised some customers would not choose yummy Thai over the others to go too. Affordable and delicious! Also great customer service.  GO YUMMY THAI!!

13.description: Upon walking in, all the servers were very friendly and we were led to a table right away. My boyfriend and I ordered 2 Thai Iced Teas, Crab Rangoons, Beef Fried Rice, and the Panang Curry with Chicken.The teas were super yummy and perfect for the 80 degree weather that day, it was pleasantly sweet and the balance between milk and tea were great! There also wasn't too much ice like some other places I've been to, which is a plus!The crab rangoons were very delicious, the wonton skins were crispy and the cream cheese filling wasn't too over powering. I felt like I could've eaten a whole order to myself! The beef fried rice was tasty and the amount you get per order is quite a lot in my opinion. There was a good amount of beef in it and an assortment or vegetables. This is defining stable and delicious dish to try!The Panang curry with chicken was amazing! I ordered it to be mild and it was delicious. It had a nice kick to it but it didn't make me run towards my glass of water. There were slices of bell peppers in it and some basil leaves which just added more depth of flavor! I would for sure order this again!

11.description: Their Pad Thai is great! The flavor was perfect! I will definitely go there to try some of their other items on their menu! I wish their place was bigger because many people came to eat there but they had less seats. Service was fast and everyone is really nice there.

39.description: How is this restaurant? I wouldn't know. After being quoted an hour for delivery I gave up after 2.5 hours and no food. Seriously worst delivery service ever. I only live about a mile from the restaurant. Never again. Take the advice of other reviewers and never get take out from here.

37.description: They don't call it yummy thai for no reason. Expected delivery was an hour, however the food arrived within 45 minutes. My favorite thing? Tofu pad thai, authentic enough for me. Sure, their English isn't wonderful but it works. I can still get my yummy thai. I usually order tofu pad thai and edamame. One of my favorite Thai places of all time.

0.description: I don't understand why this place is only 3.5 stars. The haters need to stop because the food here is great AND reasonably priced. My experience was with delivery and it was excellent- easy to order, everything arrived warm and with silverware AND extra hot sauce. My Panang curry was delicious- perfect blend of flavor and spice! It comes with a generous serving of rice. Others got chow mein, spicy pad-ped, and Siam fried rice- all tasty!! Overall, I would definitely recommend this place for quick and delicious Thai delivery!!

38.description: I strongly suggest not to order "delivery" from Yummy Thai!!  I have never, ever had such horrible customer service!  Yummy Thai delivered the wrong order to us.  When we called to let them know, the manager argued with us that we must have ordered from a different Thai restaurant because he couldn't find our order ticket.  After leaving us on hold for 10 minutes, he came back and asked to call us back.  When he didn't call back, we called him.  Again, he placed us on hold and said that if he doesn't find the order ticket, there is nothing that he can do.  We provided him our Seamless Grub Hub order number at which point, he began to argue that Seamless is in charge of our order and that we probably didn't order properly.  He told us to contact Seamless.  At this point, we decided to walk to Yummy Thai and show the manager our receipt, which clearly showed the correct order.  The manager continued to argue and said that the receipt doesn't show that Seamless charged us $2 for shrimp and therefore, there was nothing that he could do.  We explained to him that we had ordered shrimp as shown on the receipt and that if Seamless didn't charge us the right amount that Yummy Thai should have at least contacted us to let us know.  He continued to argue with us.  It was only after we reminded him of online reviews did he agree to give us the correct order but he insisted that we pay $2 extra for shrimp.  Unbelievable!!  I will never frequent this establishment again.

51.description: Two words: Curry Noodle. I seriously have dreams about this place.  Long live yummy thai!!!

27.description: I dont know what authentic thai food is but, i imagine this. Crab rangoon, orange chicken and sweet and sour chicken are the greatest. Everything is so crispy and their table sauce is amazing. Very affordable.

32.description: Four stars for flexible and good service and a couple great menu items.  My residency comes here every week for years and they are very accommodating to multiple checks and the food is pretty good too.  I have tried a lot of items and my favorite is the combo fried rice(huge portion and very tasty).  Second runner up is the yummi fried rice(hot dogs and pinneapple-don't laugh it's delicious).  Pad Thai is my third choice,  good but nothing special.

54.description: I am shocked at all the good reviews. Cute little cafe from the outside. Unfortunately food is inauthentic. Pad Grapow had a bunch of crappy, soggy, veggies, was not sweet, not savory, not spicy....everything thai food should be...just greasy and salty. The rice was not Jasmine or aromatic in any way. It was so overcooked that it was mushy and I didn't even eat more than a few bites, which essentially ruined my lunch. How can you fuck up cooking rice?!?I did finish the meat portion of the lunch, which was greasy, salty ground chicken and unripe green peppers. It did have some scallions, which would have been great. Prices were average with seven bucks for entrees. I also had crab rangoon, which was average. Wrappers were too delicate and fell apart. Little or no crab in the crab rangoon. The duck sauce was the best part: homemade and thin, it had a spicy kick. At least they served sanbal oleak as their table hot sauce. If it were not for the hot sauce I would have disregarded the rest of the meal also. What a shame. This cute little cafe could be so much better. One note, the staff here are not thai or interested at all in thai food. They do not know the menu at all and I had to open a menu and show them the dishes I wanted to order. tsk tsk what a shame. Also, what is up with all the people reviewing this place saying there are so few Thai places to eat from?!? christ people, there are three thai places on this very block alone!!!

48.description: FREEZING INSIDE AND NOT VEGETARIAN FRIENDLY.We walked into the establishment and nearly all the tables were dirty with dishes and leftover food.  I just figured they must have been busy or understaffed that day.  So, the waiter wiped down a table for us and we sat down.  As we were looking through the menu we all realized how cold it was in here.  We moved tables, now seated the furthest away from the door as possible.  It was still freezing!  My boyfriend looked at the thermometer in the restaurant and it read 58 degrees!  This was in January.  We immediately told the server how cold it was in there and asked for 3 hot teas.  They never brought the hot teas, so we asked again after 10 minutes or so, still no hot tea.  Also, no attempt to turn up the heat.  Other customers agreed apparently, because they were eating with their winter coats and hats still on.  Anyway, a man comes over to take our order.  I order the only vegetarian entree on the menu, and had him confirm that the dish had no oyster/fish sauce in it.  The man said it did!  Well, then my sir that in fact  is NOT vegetarian!  What if a person with shell fish allergies ordered the vegetarian dish thinking it was shell fish free?!  I asked if he could make the dish but without the oyster sauce, and they said no that they did not know how to omit the oyster/fish sauce- what kind of chef is back there?  Then the straw that broke the camel's back, the table next to us started complaining about how bad her stomach hurt the last time she ate there, and she just figured it was from eating the fish so she was going to try a safer dish like their soup!  We told the server never mind and went to Cous Cous down the street.

44.description: Overall, the food is great. I personally like drunken noodle both regular and crispy, phad thai, and even fried rices etc. The only problem is there are times that a sever to customer ratio is too high that people dont get served on time. You can also get a free appetizer if you purchase over 10 dollars for to go ordrers.

24.description: It's my go-to take out place for Thai. The restaurant ambiance is pretty relaxed too. The crab rangoon and rama noodles are delicious!

7.description: I ordered Pad Thai, thai iced tea and tom yum soup. pad thai was good but no vegetable inside even bean sprout, littile dissapointed, But the tom yum and thai iced tea were great. Took 45' to deliver to my house, faster than I expected. I will order more next time!!!

49.description: I forgot it was Golden Thai I liked, not this place. I ordered the Pad Woon-Sen, amazing at Golden Thai. This one was made with a horrible frozen vegetable mix that I couldn't get over. The flavor of everything else was very underwhelming. The spinach pot stickers were two stars as was the Thai iced tea. Do yourself a favor, skip this place. The prices would be reasonable if the food were any good.

40.description: If you want mediocre thai food with the worst customer service and horrible delivery times this is your place. 1 hour and 50 minutesto deliver...I live 1/2 a mile away. If i wold have known that i wold have driven to pick up their terrible food. You're much better off ordering from Manee Thai, butterfly or just call Dominoes. Don't waste your time.

53.description: We ordered Chicken Pad Thai and Basil Fried Rice for carry out. The Pad Thai  was pretty good  and a good sized portion and I am pleased to report that this place remembered to comply with no peanut request and extra spicy. I have dined at several other Thai and Chinese restaurants and had to take food back due to there being peanuts. Positive notes were that it was easy to find, and it was fast. Negative note would be parking, I ended up parking in a no no zone and enacting my flashers and giving a silent prayer that the parking ninjas didn't make my very reasonably dinner cost a more extravagant outing. Thankfully I avoided their wrath, definitely would dine there again.

30.description: Sometime Yummy Thai is just what you need. The service isn't always ideal, but they have the best crab rangoons on Taylor street. Great for ordering delivery or carry out when you're out

46.description: I have never given a restaurant a bad review, but in this case I have to make the exception. The delivery service for this place needs to be changed. After one hour and a half of waiting for my food, it comes back to me partially missing. The Thai Coffee that I ordered was spilled into the meals inside the bag and when I called to complain that this has happened, apparently without them physically here to see it, they weren't taking my word for it even though the coffee was missing. You would think ordering from a major University Near by they would want to offer a remedy or at least a substitute meal that would be exchanged for the meal that was compromised by the spillage. Don't order from them!!!! Thank you power of social media for giving me a voice to voice my displeasure!

1.description: Excellent food. Very fresh and not greasy like the local Asian restaurant we were accustom to ordering from. Vegetable pad Thai and spring rolls for me. Pepper chicken with veggie fried rice for the mister. Ordered veggie egg rolls but they were left out the order They were very apologetic when we called and gave us credit for the next visit. We will be going back

55.description: Food was real good and came quickly.  Staff was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed .  Location was very neat and clean, defiantly will be back again soon .  Highly recommended location for great food .

9.description: A cozy interior for sit down with good pad see ew and veggie options. The service is quick for takeout, and the prices are reasonable. The menu is standard for most Thai places. Recommend the shrimp with broccoli or tom yum soup.

26.description: This review is for the office lunch that we had delivered to our office on W. Taylor.We ordered for 10-11 people and it was the perfect amount of food for us. The only thing I was a little disappointed about was that I told the woman over the phone that I was ordering for 10 people and could I please get something thrown in for free? She said, Sure! I'll throw in some eggrolls for free! They gave us 2 little eggrolls as part of the complementary extras LOL! Oh well, I can't really complain. Free is free, right?Anyway, we ordered a variety and everything was a hit!Crab rangoons: it was actually still pretty crispy and warm by the time we got it! Perfect with the sweet and sour sauce.Papaya salad: I love the crunchy texture and the tangy sauce. Complementary to all the other hot, carb-y dishes.Basil fried rice: Just your basic fried rice, imo.Thai fried rice beef: I like that there's pineapples in here!Beef pad see ew: This was just your basic wide noodle, too.Pad thai with tofu: The tofu was a nice change from all the other protein.Spicy crazy noodles: Definitely order this one if you're not sure which noodle dish to order. The flavors are awesome, and I love the ground chicken in it more than the other way that they cook their chicken (which leaves it pretty dry).I'm excited for our next office birthday lunch so that we can order another variety of dishes and eat together family style!

25.description: I've dined in and picked up a take out order here. The location is convenient for me, and the menu is simple enough that you know what you're getting. I'd recommend the Pad Thai (because when ordering from a Thai restaurant...) and the yellow curry. Good enough food and fast and friendly service.

12.description: FOOD POISONINGI wish I could give this restaurant negative stars. For a company lunch my job ordered from this place. At 12 noon I sampled the veggie pad thai noodles, green curry, chicken tempura, beef n broccoli, and some seafood dish. By 4 p.m. I was sick as a dog; vomiting and diarrhea that lasted until 1 a.m. the following morning. It took almost two days of rest and one day off from work to recover. Two thumbs down.

59.description: This has to be one of the few good Thai restaurants in Down town.I love the Basil fried frice and Coconut soup here.The entrees are good sized and can serve two people. We always end up taking half the food we order home. My favorites - Basil fried rice, Pine apple fried rice and Coconut soupReasonably priced, good and quick service. Ambiance is okay.

21.description: I'm surprised I never wrote a review for Yummy as I have enjoyed their food many times.Everything about Yummy is great. I only gave them 4 stars instead of 5 as the price is just a tiny bit high for the volume of food compared to some other Thai places I've frequented.  Don't get me wrong, the volume is appropriate, it's just that for the same price at other places, you might get extra to take home.ANYWAY, the pad Thai is good, spring rolls, basil dishes, curries...

17.description: Walked in here this evening as 1. My friend wanted Thai food2. This was the closest Thai place at walking distance with the highest reviews.3. Apparently authentic Thai food (per reviews)Now keeping in mind that both me and my friend have spent a few years in Asia including Thailand, I knew what to expect for "Authentic Thai food"Here goes the reviewFood 2.5/5 - not really "authentic" as reviewed by few. Food was palatable but nothing remarkable about it. Fried tofu was stale. Green curry was spicy but not much else flavors to it. Tom yam noodle soup felt too "watered down" being neither tangy nor spicy. The zing was missing.Service 4/5 - this is where the restaurant scores. Servers are exceptionally polite. Taken to a seat promptly, served quickly as well. My friend was feeling cold and was asked if heater should be turned up a notch.Ambience 3/5 - just alright. Could have been a cozy little place except for bunch of noisy students at next table. There was no background music.Price 3/5 - most food is 7-8 usd while appetizers are 3-5 usd. At par with Thai restaurants at this area. Serving size are satisfactory for the pricing.

10.description: Great value for above-average Thai dishes. The Pad Thai here is quite good-not too heavy on the sauces and well balanced between the noodles, veggies, and protein. The Pad See Eiw was also highly recommended, and those who ordered it in my party loved it. Everyone in my party of 8 was at least satisfied with their meal, some were exuberant.  Food: AService: BAtmosphere: B

5.description: Very decent Thai place for students in the neighborhood! I love the Pad See Ew, I usually order beef for it, and they always make it so tender, surprisingly delicious!! I also enjoy the fried tofu appetizer a lot. Price is really reasonable. Given how many Thai restaurants in the Tri-Taylor area, this one makes awesome food. I've tried Golden Thai & Thai Bowl, and this one definitely outdid the other two. I'll def become a regular since I live just 3 blocks away :)

3.description: This review is for the office lunch that we had delivered to our office on W. Taylor.We ordered for 10-11 people and it was the perfect amount of food for us. The only thing I was a little disappointed about was that I told the woman over the phone that I was ordering for 10 people and could I please get something thrown in for free? She said, Sure! I'll throw in some eggrolls for free! They gave us 2 little eggrolls as part of the complementary extras LOL! Oh well, I can't really complain. Free is free, right?Anyway, we ordered a variety and everything was a hit!Crab rangoons: it was actually still pretty crispy and warm by the time we got it! Perfect with the sweet and sour sauce.Papaya salad: I love the crunchy texture and the tangy sauce. Complementary to all the other hot, carb-y dishes.Basil fried rice: Just your basic fried rice, imo.Thai fried rice beef: I like that there's pineapples in here!Beef pad see ew: This was just your basic wide noodle, too.Pad thai with tofu: The tofu was a nice change from all the other protein.Spicy crazy noodles: Definitely order this one if you're not sure which noodle dish to order. The flavors are awesome, and I love the ground chicken in it more than the other way that they cook their chicken (which leaves it pretty dry).I'm excited for our next office birthday lunch so that we can order another variety of dishes and eat together family style!

35.description: Ordered the panang curry and tofu pad thai to go and both were delicious. There are quite a few thai places in the area but I would recommend this one for sure.

19.description: My favorite place for Thai food, it is a great value for the portions, it tastes the best. I always get the pad Thai with chicken or shrimp and it is the best I've ever had. I usually go with a group and they are more adventurous with their orders which I always try (I'm that guy) and everything is always so tasty and yummi :)

28.description: So good! I got the veggie pad Thai and it was delicious! They delivered fast, and the delivery guy was so friendly! I definitely recommend!

45.description: Yo. YO. I mean really. I love Yummy Thai. I wish they made tee shirts and baseball caps because I would wear them all the time and probably try eating one. Their food is all delicious. Pad thai? CHECK- chicken, shrimp, beef, tofu. They're all great here, and I've had them all many times. The orange chicken is basically the best thing ever (okay maybe not, but it's pretty friggin delicious). And the portion sizes are HUGE. I can never finish an entire portion of anything when I'm there , and trust me I have a lot of room and try very hard. Their fried rices and even the chicken dumplings are delicious. This is my go-to Thai food place. I go to UIC and tell all my friends to go there. I take dates there all the time. Friendly, quick service and delicious food have made me a regular customer.

33.description: This is THE place to get pad thai and other delicious Thai food! I love it here! I've been here for lunch, dinner, and carryout. Have to say, every time was perfect, mouth-watering, and overall, just great. The Thai tea is also good.Price is..decent. I don't come here often but the portions usually allow for two meals (that is, one now, one for later) unless you are really hungry.Service is average. Could be a little more attentive, could be a lot worse too.Parking sucks in the evening. Be prepared to battle your way into street parking. Also, I believe this location is near a police station. Either that or they love the local eats also because cops are thick in this area. Fair warning in case you decide to go Fast and Furious through University Village/Little Italy(aka "Cop Town").To wrap things up, I'll definitely be back and highly recommend Yummy Thai Restaurant.

43.description: I ordered vegetable green curry, it was very soupy but delightful.  The portions were plentiful.  The staff were friendly and didn't seem to mind much that my friend and I stayed a bit late.  The overall vibe was good and very low key.

2.description: Really cool place. Such a low profile entrance on the foot of Taylor street but when you go inside its quite large. Interior is interesting. A lot of art and all the walls are in exposed brick. Food is very good too for the price. I had an entree called 'Chef's Choice' which was deep fried chicken (KFC style) but was dipped in a sweet brown gorgeous sesame sauce. Nothing to complain about here :)

18.description: I've dined in and picked up a take out order here. The location is convenient for me, and the menu is simple enough that you know what you're getting. I'd recommend the Pad Thai (because when ordering from a Thai restaurant...) and the yellow curry. Good enough food and fast and friendly service.

41.description: Yummy That is a restaurant that I consider to be reliable. The food may not be the best Thai food I have ever eaten but it usually doesn't disappoint. Today I had the basil fried rice (med spicy) and my friend had the chicken fried rice. The basil rice had a nice flavor but some of the rice wasn't fully cooked. Also the med spicy tasted like there was no spice at all. I found myself adding extra spoonfuls of chili sauce to give it a kick. My friend that her rice was good but experienced the same problem of undercooked rice. Since the rice issue has never occurred on previous visits, I hope this doesn't happy again. Overall I was satisfied with the food and will go back again

52.description: I have tried their pad thai and pad woo sen, and both are delicious. Each time I've come in, it's been for take out, and it's always quick, great service.  Their staff is very attentive, and the food is priced reasonably. This place is great for quick takeout when you want some delicious Thai to take home. Also, they have a waving cat near the cash register, and who doesn't love that?

50.description: Went on a cold afternoon and the place was freezing. We sat next to a heater and that was the only way to get any warmth.Cucumber salad and potstickers for appetizers were very good.I had orange chicken for my entree and wouldn't recommend. There was very little meat and the flavor was off. Fried rice was good though.My gf had the beef pad see ewe which I preferred. Our waitress never came back after she brought the food and had to find her for the check. Overall, don't visit during the winter or take-out!

4.description: Curry noodle is my absolute favorite dish in the entire city. Get it- you won't regret it.

6.description: This is my kind of Thai place!! It's right in the restaurant district of UIC and is a fantastic place for lunch (and I'd assume dinner). We are sat immediately at a nice table with pretty dishes. We were given water and offered drinks (Byob) if you have it.The menu had all the favorites and some of their own dishes. We ordered the crab Rangoon and the yellow and green curry. Everything was absolutely fantastic.  It came quickly and tasted very fresh. We loved everything we ate and especially loved the bill. It was so cheap! The atmosphere is casual and comfortable. It's well lit, well staffed, and was a great location. Parking was a little tricky, but we found a spot. I wished we lived closer! This is a place I'll try and come back to.  There were lots of other things I'd be interested in trying.

22.description: Two hours for delivery, called resturant they said delivery left 30 minutes ago with 6 other delivers!!!!!!!!!!  and was told they'd call you back no reply 20 minutes later.  Food was warm @ best, so spicy I couldn't eat it!

15.description: Bang for your buck.  Food is always good and ready when I pick it up.  The restaurant itself is pleasant and can accommodate larger groups. For the price, there are few better in the area.

57.description: I ordered takeout and so cannot comment on service quality.  The food was delicious here, although just a tad under seasoned.  I am a huge Thai food fan and have tried a lot of places in the city.  This one is definitely among the best in Chicago, although I hate to say it, Chicago does not have the best Thai food overall.  I had the spring rolls, drunken noodles (they call them crazy noodles) and chicken satay.  All of them were perfectly cooked and delicious.  I prefer a little more spice on my drunken noodles, but the noodles and vegetables were perfectly tender.  Overall a great and reasonably priced meal.  I'll be back for sure!

20.description: Walked in here this evening as 1. My friend wanted Thai food2. This was the closest Thai place at walking distance with the highest reviews.3. Apparently authentic Thai food (per reviews)Now keeping in mind that both me and my friend have spent a few years in Asia including Thailand, I knew what to expect for "Authentic Thai food"Here goes the reviewFood 2.5/5 - not really "authentic" as reviewed by few. Food was palatable but nothing remarkable about it. Fried tofu was stale. Green curry was spicy but not much else flavors to it. Tom yam noodle soup felt too "watered down" being neither tangy nor spicy. The zing was missing.Service 4/5 - this is where the restaurant scores. Servers are exceptionally polite. Taken to a seat promptly, served quickly as well. My friend was feeling cold and was asked if heater should be turned up a notch.Ambience 3/5 - just alright. Could have been a cozy little place except for bunch of noisy students at next table. There was no background music.Price 3/5 - most food is 7-8 usd while appetizers are 3-5 usd. At par with Thai restaurants at this area. Serving size are satisfactory for the pricing.

36.description: I am on my quest to find a good Thai restaurant. Came to Taylor street with my friend who is a student at Rush, and Yummy Thai was highly recommended by her friends. It does seem like a popular place for gatherings in the medical district. There was some type of celebration at the table next to ours. I can only give Yummy Thai two stars though.  I ordered panang curry with beef. The curry sauce itself was delicious, but I thought the meat was dry and also tasted funny (not fresh?)The price is reasonable, and pretty cheap compared to most other places. I still need a place near here that can fill my cravings for Thai food!!

14.description: Ordered the crazy noodles for delivery.  Their minimum is $10 so I added shrimp for $2 and extra veggies for $1 to get to $10.50.  Add on tip and delivery fee and it was kind of expensive but normal for delivery. The portion was huge and I loved all the veggies they added.  I asked for it spicy and it had a nice kick to it.  The noodles tasted average to other thai places in the city.   The delivery took only 30 minutes.  Would recommend if you need delivery in the area but wouldn't go out of your way to come

58.description: This place is close to UIC and pricing is good. I like the double cheese burger under $4. Food is not really special but it is good.Sometimes I found the counters greasy and there were lots of dead and alive flies (hundreds - no kidding) by all the windows. Last time I went there it was clean. I sometimes go to this place but it is mainly because it is cheaper than around.

56.description: I still like the folks at this place, but the prosciutto sandwich seems to have less meat on it every return trip that I make.  It's no longer worth nearly $10 for a large prosciutto sandwich and a fountain pop.  Like Natalie Imbruglia, I'm torn: do I continue patronizing a place that I did dearly love once upon a time or do I try to find a worthy successor?

29.description: I've been on a mission the past couple summers to find the best Italian Ice in Chicago. On Saturday I went to Carm's and tried their Pina Colada ice. It was creamy, sweet and not too heavy like other ices can be. I just need to try a couple more flavors but Carm's gives Johnnies, Mario's Gina's and Freddie's ices a run for their money. Plus there is usually not a line around the block like other establishments.

42.description: A favorite place of mine when I went to UIC and walked back to my apartment. Food is more than decent, but what's great is getting an italian ice here if you don't feel like going to Mario's. Also, I did like their chocolate italian ice quite a bit.

23.description: This review is strictly for the italian ice. I have never ordered food here.  The italian ice is delicious. The ice is chopped much smoother and the flavors are stronger. It is much, much better than Mario's. Also, they let you get 2 different flavors in one cup. The portion sizes are huge for the price. I personally cannot finish a medium. Lastly, they are very friendly there. Definitely recommend for italian ice!

47.description: Yes, the Italian Ice is better than any (cantaloupe is my favorite), but that's not what prompted me to write.This afternoon, I forgot to buy bread when I'd gone shopping, and I'd lent my car to someone, so I strolled over to Fontano's to get bread for a dish I was making for dinner.  Alas, it was closed, so I popped into Carm's hoping they would sell me some of their supply.   He didn't want to sell me any bread because he was short-supplied and was open to 8 tonight.  But when he noticed how keen I was to have the bread, and that I was on foot, and that I was willing to pay him 10 bucks for it (I really wanted that bread!) he relented.  And in true small-neighborhood business fashion, he wouldn't accept my premium and only charged me $2.50.  Really, really decent of the place and of the man.  Thanks Carm's!

8.description: This is a ghetto place where we usually come and eat together with my friends.I usually get the double cheeseburger and the Hot Dog with fries. The Tuna & cheese here is also good so I would also recommend that one.A fine place to eat with fun.

31.description: Carms is great! It is a great little family owned place right in the heart of Little Italy. The prices are reasonable and service is fast. Be sure to step up your ordering A-game though because these people don't mess around. Step up to the register, tell them what you want (minus the details) and there you go. Once you pay, (CASH ONLY!) step over to the right and then tell whoever starts making your food exactly how you want it, what you want on it, etc.

34.description: Definitely a 5 star as far as fast food places go!  I've had almost everything on the menu. A few of my favorites are the cheeseburgers, tuna sub with extra homemade giardinaires,  Italian sub, the watermelon and cantaloupe Italian ice, homemade meatball subs (with melted provolone and giardinaires), and the Italian beef.

16.description: We had a great lunch at Carms. The owner took incredible care and time with my family and threw some Italian ice our way as well. This place is a Chicago Classic while retaining its freshness and not to mention cleanliness. Must visit again!

13.description: Italian sausage, Italian beef sandwiches delicious and a bucket of fries wow!  Fast service and neat place when visiting UIC.

11.description: I think you might have to attend UIC nearby to really like this place. . . I didn't go there but I indulged an out of town friend who wanted to visit this old haunt from his school days. Not sure we should have bothered. Some people seem to love the staff, and maybe you get better treatment if you're a regular. My experience was of the "you're making me get off my chair and put away my cell phone and I resent you for it" variety. I ordered an Italian beef with french fries, and both tasted like the beef and fries came straight from a freeze dried bag. Granted, the food was cheap, but come on, these aren't pricey foods to begin with. . . charge me an extra $1.50 and upgrade the ingredients. I teased my friend about choosing this of all places for having a nostalgia meal, and he sheepishly said "it was better when I was in college!" So, if I ever get a chance to eat here in 2005, I will be sure to update this review.

39.description: If you think the Chicawwwgo accent doesn't exist anymore, then you haven't been to Carms. If you were born within a mile of this place they probably strap a sausage to your chin on your first birthday and proclaim you Ditka's next biggest fan. I stopped in after I drove to Fontano's across the street only to realize they are reopening this month due to a fire. Looking the other way, I see this place open. Carms? Why the hell not.It's a bare bones setup which is really all a place like this needs. They serve classic Chicago favorites to classic Chicago folks who are working on their classic Chicago accent. I saw students, cops, and other service workers that have probably been regulars for 20 years. It's what I would call a "joint".It's not fancy, it's not gourmet, but it's the type of food a Chicagoan needs now and then. And when I'm in the mood, I'll be back to Carms.

37.description: I went here today for the first time. They are staffed by real Chicago people, with real Chicago accents, and its a real neighborhood ma and pops place. I love to support places like this. Who cares how the food is?

0.description: A great independent fast food place, with a simple but adequate menu. Really good, unfussy burgers. The location is on a residential street but only a short walk from UIC or the main Taylor Street drag.

38.description: I had one of the worst experiences eating out ever thanks to Carms Beef. I ordered an italian beef and found it very dry and bland. Comparing to Johnny's Beef on North Ave, even if Carms paid me to eat that disgusting thing again I would say no.The staff was loud and rude. Funnily, when the cashier lady was talking on top of her lungs, she complained about how people go to Carms only because Fontanos across the street is closed for remodeling. She is absolutely correct. I only stopped by Carms because Fontanos was closed, and will I stop by this place again in the future? NO!I found the service rude and very distasteful. The same cashier lady yelled "No credit card" out to me. Who doesn't allow customers to use credit cards nowadays? I know that their reason is to keep the cost low. But excuse me, I didn't think the food was that cheap either. Again, I cannot see why this place stays in business with that kind of customer service.Do yourself a favor and wait until Fontanos reopens again. DO NOT EAT AT CARMS. In all honesty, I hope this review will show Carms that you have to treat your customers like kings. If you are rude to your customers, then you should not expect that you can compete with other surrounding restaurants who offer better service, better value, and an overall better experience.

51.description: You can get a giant prosciutto sub for like 6 bucks. What more do you need?

27.description: Been going here for years.  Great food!!!

32.description: Carms you have been my go to Italian ice spot since I can remember. Over the years owner Steve has become a buddy and makes you feel like family with his big greetings. Top 5 reasons to go to Carms.#1 Say hello to Steve#2 Homemade Italian Ice...duh!#3 Homemade Italian Beef#4 The chicas like being treated to Italian ice.#5 Prices so reasonable you will slap your mama!

54.description: The fact that it is cash only is somewhat of a bummer since if I'm not carrying a lot of cash I can't eat here. Carms is good for italian beef, hot dogs, burgers, and italian ice. Of course for all four of those things you can walk a block and get it somewhere else too but Carms does a good job of keeping up with their competition. They have the cheapest burger in the area and it is pretty good. They're everyday special for two hotdogs is also a great value. My only complaints are that they only accept cash and that I wish they cooked their fries a little longer since they are not crispy at all and don't look very well cooked.

48.description: Don't go for the food. Go to watch the family that runs it. Esppecially the son!

44.description: I have only been here to try out the Italian Ice.  I had heard that Carm's Italian Ice was even better than Mario's.  I decided to try it out.  Carm's Italian Ice was the same price as Mario's, but it did not have the flavor or amount of fruit as Mario's Ice.  Also, there is a limited number of flavors and less than half of them have actual fruit in them.  I also was not the biggest fan of the consistency of the Ice... portions were chunky and flavorless.

24.description: Stevie D is a trip, great guy and the hot dogs are even better. My daughters like the Italian ice better than Mario's thanks to Mary and her convincing of them via a free sample.

7.description: I visited Carm's with my girlfriend, sister, niece, brother, and two of my cousins who are locals. We were greeted by Stevie (I believe) who I think owns the place. He was really cool and recommended different foods for us non-Chicago people. My brother and I were trying to pay and he said to relax and eat and we can pay later. He also told us to shut the door if we wanted since it was cool out and we had a baby with us, what a nice guy. I had the special of two dogs and fries and a drink for something like $4.95. Dogs were delicious and spicy and the fries were crisp and tasty. My sister had a beef sandwich with house-made peppers and it was good and had a lot of kick (if you're not keen on spicy food you might not like the beef)! After we ate, we tried some of the flavored ice and lo and behold he comped all of the ices for us! They were all good, even the chocolate one which sounds weird initially but is actually quite nice. My favorite was the cantaloupe. We paid and tried to tip him but he wouldn't take it! What a gentleman. Cash only, but I don't blame them. Small neighborhood place and probably keeps the overhead down. Overall good comfort food, friendly and warm atmosphere, and delicious flavored ice. Will definitely come back next time I'm in town.

49.description: If you're a student at UIC, Carms should definitely be a part of your lunch break rotation. Great chili cheese dog.

40.description: Very much a truly local, family-owned and operated Chicago sub shop. The subs are pretty good, but not the best I've ever had - I'd definitely go back to try the italian ices in the summertime.

53.description: This place is small but cozy and the owners are very friendly. I love their burgers, dogs & italian beef! Food is fairly priced especially for the college kids that come through, but very tasty!

30.description: I went there for italian ice... better than Mario's but not as good as Johnnie's Beef in Arlington Heights. I can tell they used SOME fresh fruit juice but mostly artificial flavoring. At least its MUCH better than Mario's italian ice.I also did not like that the guy behind the stand at first did not allow us to taste test flavors for us to decide on a flavor. Finally he agreed.

46.description: Yummy Italian Ice. I picked up watermelon, She picked up "Blue". The watermelon was refreshing and a small is the perfect size! With little delicious chunks of watermelon on the inside I was craving more. Blue was good. Full of sugar and exactly what you would think it tastes of. Definitely give it a try in this very cute Italian neighborhood....with the older men sitting in a circle talking, children playing in the pumps and great all around vibe.

1.description: The rating I'm giving is for their service, not their food. My kids go here as a treat from their school once in a while and when I picked them up today was curious enough to try them out. They're a very friendly, down to earth local fast food joint and are fast...food? Was not impressed. Had cheeseburger...on thick bun and very thin patty...think white castle thin patty. Fries were so so...Nothing spectacular about the food.Quality food? No...but for all those school kids who don't care and have $2-3 bucks to spare? Who cares?

55.description: Oh Carm's. Many, many afternoons during breaks between classes have we spent together. You were the highlight of my afternoons.This fast food place located on Polk street near the UIC campus is a "university staple." Every kid who went to UIC had to have gone here and if they didn't then they should be ashamed for not being a true UIC student. I visited this place not too long ago, well actually last summer and that was the first time I've been there since I graduated in 2002. They've renovated the place and the prices have been adjusted slightly to accomodate the growing market. Rightfully so, but still nonetheless cheap enough for a college student to afford.My favorite: the meatball sandwich. Three gigantic lumps of meatballs covered in marinara sauce on french bread. Holy sh*t, someone bring the defibrillator and place it right next to me. Eating this sandwich is worthy of your heart stopping more than once. Thank you Carm's for being delicious and affordable for all these years. Pay a visit to this place, your stomach and your pockets will thank you.

9.description: Decent and cheap food! If you're looking for a quick bite to eat around the UIC campus, this is a good place to go. The menu is limited but it's all you need for a fast food joint. The service varies from time to time. Sometimes they are rude and sometimes they are nice, and when they are nice they load you up with fries and other food. Finally, they only accept cash which is a real bummer, although there is an ATM inside. There isn't much space to sit since there are no tables and chairs inside (only outside) They only have the high stools like a bar where you can eat your food.

26.description: Four stars would be five if only Chicago dogs, Italian lemonade. One of the best, if not the best. I ate here hundreds of times while at UICC. It's quick, easy and cheap. Well, mostly quick, unless it's really hot!Loses a star for other sandwiches, which aren't bad, but there are better in the neighborhood. (Al's)

25.description: I love their different italian ice flavors, something for everyone. I used to go to school next door, back when it was AJLA.

12.description: I went to UIC for a few semesters a few years ago and this place became my mainstay for cheap food. I love hotdogs, and this place has cheap hotdogs. I mean sure it's your standard dog but when you can get two of them and two orders of fries for five bucks then what else can you really ask for?I enjoy the burgers a lot too. If you're a health nut, you'll want to avoid them, but if food is an adventure for you, this is a fine flat top burger to try. Very juicy and greasy.After not being in the city for a few years, I went back recently. All the same people worked there, which was nice since they're all great people. I found that they started serving tacos recently.Now see, I'm from Texas, so nothing really compares to the guys selling tacos out of their trucks on the side of the road at five for a dollar, but I'm always going to hold Mexican food in the south on a pedestal above all Mexican food I eat in the north. But as far as traditional Mexican tacos go, I can't ask for more. They're better than the ones in the UIC cafeteria.When I start going back to UIC, I'll probably become regular here again. Nice people, decent food, great prices.

59.description: i went to grammer school right down the street from there and till this day my motto still is SCREW MARIOS italian ice they got nothing but location on this place

21.description: The people that work at this establishment are Lunatics! I can't believe the cashier who works on the Italian Ice side threw a snowball at me & several at my car because he didn't approve of my parking choice. No I'm not blocking the sidewalk or dbl parked at all. Even if I was does that mean a grown man should chuck and ice cold snowball at my leg? Seriously that's physical abuse in front of 6 yr old kid. Wht if it hit her? So yea I call the cops cause I don't have to tolerate this ignorance and what do these folks do when the cops show up u wouldn't believe me! It was so unreal! The guy who hit me charged out the store & got all in the cops faces blurting some crazy nonsense then the elderly woman comes at me balling up her fist ready to hit me screaming, "U stupid Bitch all of this over a snowball!" The cop grabbed her & had to pull his taser out to threaten the guy who assaulted me in order to calm down! WOW he needs a tranquilizer!!! Never have I ever experienced such chaos & hostile behavior anywhere in my entire LIFE! Good luck not getting beat up at this establishment. U never know what might trigger this ghetto behavior by the employees themselves!!

17.description: I visit here whenever I'm at school, since I go to UIC it's 2 mins away. Their service is great! Food is really good, the burger and fries always hit the spot for me. Pricing is perfect for college students somehow the dollar goes a long way here. If you are ever in that area I recommend stopping in, you are transported to a family run diner as soon as you step foot inside.

10.description: If you are close by and want a good Vienna dog and fries, this is the place. Just your typical fast food joint.

5.description: Gave this place a few tries and I've been consistently disappointed.  Bad service and bad food.  Maybe it's time to get a cashier under 100 years old so I don't have to repeat my complicated order of "HOT DOG" 3 times and then get attitude for asking for a soda that should've been given with my girlfriends meal.  I asked for a hot dog with everything and it had like half of the things a Chicago dog should have.  Too lazy to chop tomatoes and throw a pickle and celery salt on there?  Come on, man.  I guess this place stays open because of the steady stream of UIC students.  Apparently they think college kids won't know the difference between quality food and doing the bare minimum.  It will do the trick if you're hungry, but you'll feel like an idiot for giving them your money! Just because you have  70 items on your menu doesn't give you the right to make 50 of them badly.

3.description: I stopped in here instead of Fontano's for once, since I always pass it up, and I instantly regret it. The service was super rude and they were barely paying attention to anything I was saying. I had to repeat myself at least four times. The older lady straight insulted me to my face asking if I had a mother because she saw visible tattoos. Like, really lady? I understand this place is a neighborhood staple, and that's great - it's at least clean and the food isn't terrible, but super bummer on the atmosphere.

35.description: Never tried the food but the Italian ice OMG!!! Soooo good!!! Banana, strawberry and piña colada are all great! Perfect summer treat!!

19.description: A favorite place of mine when I went to UIC and walked back to my apartment. Food is more than decent, but what's great is getting an italian ice here if you don't feel like going to Mario's. Also, I did like their chocolate italian ice quite a bit.

28.description: It's Carm's! It's good food, cheap prices and very quick. So why not? Plus you'll never get mugged thanks to the 24/7 cops chowing down there ;)

45.description: Haven't been back here in years.  Stopped in for an ice and a walk down "Memory Lane".  I remember coming here years ago and sitting outside with a lemon ice just watching the world go by.  This family run place has it all--great food-excellent ice (the chocolate is great just like a fudgesicle in a cup).  They are really friendly and let us sample several before we decided which one we would take down to the park and watch the ball game.There are a few tables outside where you can sit and enjoy a great summer evening.  Though I am an Italian girl thru and thru and am a loyal Taylor Street fan--the comfort, quiet and friendliness of Polk Street will draw me back time and time again.

33.description: This is the best Italian Ice in all of Chicago!!!  And the homemade beef and meatballs are to die for!  A little off the beaten track (2 blocks north of Taylor on Carpenter Street) but well worth the find.

43.description: Italian Beef Crawl Stop #2: Carm's BeefCarm's. Beef. Hungry, we all unwrapped our sandwiches to get the first crack at the inaugural beef. The first thing I noted was the lack of juice on this sandwich. I mean Italian Beef dipped is supposed to give you bread that's soaked up in juice melting in your mouth with the intoxicating beef. This sandwich was inferior beef lacking this defining quality of well-dipped beef and caused many heads to shake.  The one redeeming quality of this beef was the spiciness of the peppers, they didn't have a great texture but the spice was undeniable. As for the rest of this beef, I will gladly deny eating any of it.

2.description: After reading the other Yelp reviews, it seems like only regulars like the place while those who went out of their way to come here didn't. Honestly, I too wouldn't drive here from the suburbs just for their food, but if you're on the UIC campus and you want food quickly without walking far, then Carm's it is. The owner is mostly at the register (old lady) and she always recognizes me even though I don't come as often anymore. There were a couple times I didn't have cash (they are CASH ONLY), and she gave me the food and said pay her later. Now, I always get the Fish sandwich (with giardiniera) and it tastes really good! I love it. I don't get anything else besides that, but my UIC buddies never complained about their other food. However, I gave a minus one star because the fries aren't that great. They don't taste horrible, but you have to dip it in ketchup to eat it (like I can eat McDonalds fries without Ketchup but not these). Also, I don't think this place is really made for others besides UIC students, you can't park outside the restaurant because it's all zone parking (you need a residential sticker). So you would have to park on Taylor street and walk here. Also, this place is surrounded by Apartments, so it stands alone (I guess they were trying to be as close as possible to UIC). There aren't tables and chairs inside, they have those high rise wall tables with stools. They do have some tables and chairs outside though.

18.description: Italian Beef Crawl Stop #2: Carm's BeefCarm's. Beef. Hungry, we all unwrapped our sandwiches to get the first crack at the inaugural beef. The first thing I noted was the lack of juice on this sandwich. I mean Italian Beef dipped is supposed to give you bread that's soaked up in juice melting in your mouth with the intoxicating beef. This sandwich was inferior beef lacking this defining quality of well-dipped beef and caused many heads to shake.  The one redeeming quality of this beef was the spiciness of the peppers, they didn't have a great texture but the spice was undeniable. As for the rest of this beef, I will gladly deny eating any of it.

41.description: Good hot dog, great Italian ice! I prefer Carms over Marios ice any day.

52.description: Ooooooohhhhh, I love this place. They have dee best italian ices and dee hot dogs are great tasting and quite a deal! My mom loves their pepper and egg sandwiches; she carried one in her purse!

50.description: No doubt this is the best beef place on the planet.The peppers were sent from heaven.

4.description: Carm's is good a very quick bite. If your looking for quality, this isn't your place. You can definitely come here from class in BSB, grab a hot dog and fries, and get to your next class in SES right on time.  Plus they serve Italian ice for the 60 degree November days.

6.description: The meatballs and bread evaporated the instant they hit my tongue, graciously leaving behind their taste. I ate rapidly in hopes of a continuous stream of meat, sauce and bread into my mouth. I knew that my current place in time and space had been selected on the menu just as much as my side-order of fries. "Meat, Grain, Vegetable...", I chanted over and over in my mind. A substantial critique of America's over-indulgence through a satirical amount of meat.  Can you join the masses who have over-acquired mass in America? That was the challenge stated in the meatball sub. Cash-only, four stars.

22.description: Not sure what the big deal is about this place. The hot dog was average, italian ice was below average. The watermelon ice i had tasted superficial, kind of like a watermelon gum or soda drink flavor, not a real watermelon flavor. mozzarella sticks were not good, really salty. cheeseburger is pretty good.

15.description: This was my go to place as a student at UIC once one of my friend's told me about it. If I wasn't introduced to this place I would have continued eating the sub-par food at school. I risked my life walking on the icy sidewalks to this place in the winter in order to eat some hot dogs instead of the cold pizza from Sbarro, sad looking subs from Subway, or wait 10 hours to get a burger at the Wendy's in school.

57.description: Great, great place!  Just went there for my first time and will definitely be back!  Their eggplant sandwich is delicious and very fresh.  The fries were or at least tasted like homemade.THE OWNERS ARE SUPER NICE AND SERVICE IS FASSSST!!  So even if is line is long STAY!!  Before you know it you will be eating your sandwich.One tiny minus: they charge $0.35 for water:)  Not a big deal:)

20.description: Big mistake.I came here for lunch after reading the great Yelp reviews. The cashier was very rude and I decided to take my food to go after ordering. I had two hot dogs with everything and fries for $4.50. The fries were wrapped up with the dogs, and the steamed buns were warped around the few toppings. The fries were awful and you could taste the freezer burn. They also did not include ketchup packets. The Vienna hot dogs looked sad, barely any toppings (only onion & relish), a bit of mustard, and packed with sport peppers. Where's my tomato & pickle? These were NOT Chicago style hot dogs. Needless to say, I will be recommending a strong PASS.The only plus was that it looked clean and the kitchen was open.

36.description: An authentic Chicago hot dog place.  I started going here when I went to UIC and still stop in whenever I happen to be in the neighborhood.  It always feels the same.  Always the same people there.  It has character you can't fake.

14.description: Big mistake.I came here for lunch after reading the great Yelp reviews. The cashier was very rude and I decided to take my food to go after ordering. I had two hot dogs with everything and fries for $4.50. The fries were wrapped up with the dogs, and the steamed buns were warped around the few toppings. The fries were awful and you could taste the freezer burn. They also did not include ketchup packets. The Vienna hot dogs looked sad, barely any toppings (only onion & relish), a bit of mustard, and packed with sport peppers. Where's my tomato & pickle? These were NOT Chicago style hot dogs. Needless to say, I will be recommending a strong PASS.The only plus was that it looked clean and the kitchen was open.

58.description: Had tacos and dessert empanadas deliveries. Wasn't as hot as I would have liked but that's as to be expected with delivery. The chicken, al pastor, and steak tacos were good. Al pastor was my favorite. The banana empanadas was delicious.-Update: 20 minutes after reviewing Chilango, they called me and apologized for the temperature of the food and gave me a credit to try it again! Amazing customer service! Definitely will be going back.

56.description: Ordered delivery tonight - came in 49 minutes during diner time so I can't complain. Carne Asada burrito (added shrimp & guac) was great. Al Pastor taco was okay but the Al Pastor empanada was amazing. The Hawaiian empanada and steak tacos were great as well. We'll definitely order from here again.

29.description: Great empanadas and tacos. Ordered the shrimp and steak and both were great. The empanadas are generous and I feel could be a meal on their own. We had the al pastor and it was really delicious as well. One slight slight slight negative is that the guacamole was a bit too salty. Bonus was the hottest salsa (green?) was decently hot

42.description: Just came back from this place and was not super impressed. The service was very good but the food was just okay. For a place with such high Yelp ratings I expected a lot more. I got the beef empanadas, fish taco and al pastor taco as well as guac to share. The guac was good but nothing outstanding (hard to mess up guac). The rest was just ok but not memorable or particularly authentic/tasty in my opinion, especially considering I had to drive there from downtown. At least finding street parking was easy. Maybe the burritos are better ? Unlikely that I will be back given that there are so many other options.

23.description: So delicious! Many variety of Empanadas and other foods like torilla soup and bowl.

47.description: I love this place! Solid empanadas, just tried the steak taco and it hit the spot also. The price is right and I left feeling full and satisfied

8.description: Torta combo that comes with a soup is amazing! The quality and price can't be beat. Haven't had anything there that did not amaze me.  Service has always been more than accommodating.   They are always super nice and have even offered for us to stay a little after hours for me and my friends to finish our meals.

31.description: Gotta say, as a hungry college student looking to grab some grub after a long day of studying for university, THIS IS THE PLACE TO BE!!! My first encounter with Chilango Mexican Street Food was during the Summer of 2015 and I instantly fell in love with the Steak Burrito. She is quite the beauty. I frequented this place literally every week, sometimes two times or three times a week because it's just so good! Over the following months I was opened up to the empanadas, tacos, tortas, and taco salads that Chilango also offers. With over 11 different delicious empanadas and multiple varieties of tacos, tortas and taco salads, I can safely say that I literally enjoy everything on the menu. Nothing but top notch service every single time I've visited and the food always looks fantastic as well. If you're looking for some quality mexican food, amazing customer service, I highly recommend you give Chilango a try for your next meal!

34.description: Torta combo that comes with a soup is amazing! The quality and price can't be beat. Haven't had anything there that did not amaze me.  Service has always been more than accommodating.   They are always super nice and have even offered for us to stay a little after hours for me and my friends to finish our meals.

16.description: Great food and even better prices! I love tacos.....yea yea i'm hispanic so it seems fitting but c'mon who doesn't love a good burrito or taco :) This place has some delicious empanada's and burritos, try them all. The nutella and banana empanada is very tasty and the perfect amount of sweet. the steak burrito is very very good and perfect to split or if it's been a "rough night" it's also a magical hangover cure.

13.description: This place is consistently good. The three sauces they give you are incredible. I'm lucky to work so close by!

11.description: Had a student lunch at UIC catered from here. Easy to work with. Ernesto was a ton of help and set us up based on our budget. Seemed to be a fair guy who wanted to do the best for the customer.We ended up getting a combination of chicken and veggie tacos--both were excellent. The beans were fine, but the rice was excellent. Wicked good flavor. Will definitely order from them again and personally frequent them more often (apparently they're known more for their tapas, which I have yet to try). Very good first experience.

39.description: This place is the Best. I eat here  a few times a week. Staff is super nice. You can't beat the prices. The pastor is amazing. Best bets are-steak quesadilla, pastor burrito bowl, pastor taco salad.

37.description: Chilango Here's a case of Yelps 4 1/2 star review being a big disappointment to me.  First of all I don't live anywhere near Taylor street, but I had a taste for Mexican food and this was one of the restaurants I bookmarked on Yelp.  I made a trip down here to try their food.  This still is part of the old Italian neighborhood, but the gentrification of the neighborhood with UIC and Medical Center/Rush students, teachers and faculty has brought a lot of new business into this area since my days @ UIC.  First of all the parking is very limited.  The spaces consist of metered, resident parking or tow zones.  I'm told this isn't bad because it's Sunday, but I still had to park 1 block away.  I decided to try 3 different tacos to try and get a flavor for different items on the menu, none of which was very good.  The chicken w/red cabbage?  Really flavorless and very dry.  The Steak w/cilantro & onions very dry not much flavor.  Finally the Pork w/cilantro & onions. A little more taste, but the pork was dry & chewy.  They gave me 3 small containers, 1 of each of  a got red sauce, a green sauce and one that looked like 1000 island.  These sauces helped with the flavor on the tacos, but the serving size was so small it wasn't enough sauce for the 3 tacosNeedless to say I probably won't be going back there especially when there are so many great Mexican restaurants all over the city with easier parking.

0.description: Cabronas get your booty to this restaurant !! lol This place is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Chicago ! It's a small place but the food is amazing ! And you wouldn't think being this small they would come to your table and ask if you need anything , but they do ! Great service  to the comida !! get the burritos ! They are delicious and they can make half burritos .Empanadas are amazing as well . The soup is tasty and hearty. everything tastes so fresh ! The best part is their prices , so inexpensive .

38.description: Taco salad and chicken tortilla soup are standouts.

51.description: Solid Empanadas!   I've only tried the empanadas since coming from San Diego, the other menu options didn't entice me enough.  Among the other fantastic eats that Chicago has to offer and I've experienced, I'm so glad I stumbled upon this gem. The dough has a slight crunch to it and the fillings are delightful.  I tried the chicken and mushroom, beef, beef and rice, chori-cheese, and the al pastor.  My least favorite are the beef and beef and rice empanadas but they were still on par.  However, the other 3 empanadas were just slammin!  This is now a go-to spot for my future food and drink adventure in Chicago =)

27.description: Really loved the food! Never actually went there, just ordered a delivery, that was pretty fast and efficient. The empanadas are delicious. We tried almost all of the savory types and none disappointed.The chicken burrito was also delicious.The quesadilla is very tasty, better than many other places, although not the best we've ever had.The tacos were the only minor disappointment, mainly because they basically contain just the meat, and nothing else, which makes hem pretty dry on delivery. To make them better you really have to add other ingredients and a salsa. But that may be an inherent problem of tacos... The tacos are the only thing that kept me from giving them 5 stars.We loved the food so much we just ordered a second time :-)Great value for money too!

32.description: OUTSTANDING!! I love Mexican food and this place is doing a fantastic job serving unique, fresh and delicious take on Mexican food. I had a steak burrito, with a side of guacamole, both which was outstanding. The wife has a taco salad which was huge and full of fresh ingredients. Only minor complaint was the taco shell was more Asian than Mexican style. Great stuff! Will be back for sure.

54.description: I have had my share of burritos...this was exceptionally the best hands down. Whatever ingredients they use for their green salsa is delicious. Enjoyed my empanada as well, not greasy at all!!! Could skip out on their elote, though.

48.description: Great food and even better prices! I love tacos.....yea yea i'm hispanic so it seems fitting but c'mon who doesn't love a good burrito or taco :) This place has some delicious empanada's and burritos, try them all. The nutella and banana empanada is very tasty and the perfect amount of sweet. the steak burrito is very very good and perfect to split or if it's been a "rough night" it's also a magical hangover cure.

44.description: Great food and cheap love that they can deliver which is a plus, burrito is good and all the tacos are on point

24.description: Pretty good for one of those gringo-friendly Mexican places. Yeah, I said it. They have chicken tortilla soup and empanadas on the menu, bruh. Don't try to tell me any different. They created a modern-looking vibrant store front, in which they threw some Mexican slang phrases on the wall. Consequently hipsters flock to it, because "culture".I ordered a steak burrito and the aforementioned soup (I wanted soup. F*** you). The steak had way too many hard gristly chunks than I care to endure in one sitting. It's bound to happen with taco meat, but it was a little much. The soup was actually quite good. I'm not the biggest fan of empanadas, but I did get to try a few. I thought they had pretty good flavor.Overall, a decent pseudo-authentic Mexican spot.

7.description: We stopped in for lunch one day.Guacamolle & Chips - This was pretty good.Steak Torta and Soup - My guy said the soup was good, but he didn't really care for the torta.Chicken & Mushroom and Chicken & Rice Empanadas - These were pretty good too.Banana Nutella Empanada - A nice little dessert treat.The workers were friendly and the food was good, but didn't wow me.

49.description: I came in here after having eaten Mexican food probably three hours earlier. I wasn't hungry, but the person I was with was eating so I thought I'd get a little something. They had a late empanadas selection and I thought I could eat something sweet. So I got a Nutella- Banana and a Caramel-Apple empanada. I am unusual in that I don't like Nutella or Bananas. I'll only eat bananas when they are nearly green. The mushy later versions creep me out. This made me believe that I wouldn't like the Nutella version. I was totally wrong. The Nutella was the bomb! So truly delicious! I could have eaten more of them. I actually wish I had bought more because I was flying back to California. It's good that I didn't though because I'm so fat right now. That don't sell coffee, but there is a Starbucks across the street. Get your coffee,  come inside, order your empanadas and enjoy! Next time I try some real food first.

40.description: The carne asada burrito is delicious. The apple empanada is covered in cinnamon sugar and its perfection. The sauces that come with the burrito are also incredibly flavorful. I have no bad things to say about Chilango. Even the delivery is fast!

53.description: Great! But no food-gasms. Judging by the menu and the steak and al pastor tacos alone, this place has top notch street tacos. Like do not pass this place up.I haven't tried any of the empanadas but I hear every item is up to par to what we want from a restaurant. Also, the venue is well kept, the decor is bright and interesting, and the young staff is a friendly bunch. Overall my experience was very very pleasing. However, I'm reserving that last star for something special.

30.description: They aren't completely authentic in my opinion but I don't think they're trying to be. They have savory empanadas and that's not authentic in of itself but the ingredients in them are traditional. And I mention the empanadas first and foremost because they are the stars of the menu. I came with my Mexican parents, who are unimpressed with trends but they didn't turn their nose up at the empanadas, which says a lot :). I also came with a my Mexican friend, who just moved to the states and she really liked the food, which says a lot too. We tried 4 different empanadas but my favorite was the choriqueso. We also had tacos, a torta, elote, and tortilla soups. It was all really good. To top it all off with that last, and fifth star, the staff was pleasant and nice.

46.description: I've never had a bad empanada here. The fish tacos were also really good. Combined with their salsas you will find their food is amazing at really affordable prices.

1.description: Finally an alternative to Chipotle in the UIC, West Loop area on Taylor St. Chilango offers a nice selection of empanadas of which the beef and rice tops my list of favorites.Chillango has tacos, taco salad, burritos, and quesadillas as well - all in line with their Mexican Street food fare. Prices are reasonable for the quantity, taste, and overall value.I always order to go, but delivery is available. Give Chilango a shot on the empanadas alone. There's quite the selection! Branch out from there.

55.description: They have really  good food! The beef & rice empanadas and burrito bowl are my favorites. As for the augas frescas, guava and passion fruit are the best! I had the agua de horchata (rice water) today and I was very disapointed. It tasted so much like the powder mix. No need for the powder mix when it's so easy to make from scratch...but because of their wonderful customer service, I was able to exchange it for a soft drink.

9.description: CHILANGO!!!! Fun name to say. Anyway just wanted to say that this place is a gem! Word out in the medical district is that this is the go to place for tacos and I'm glad I took the advice. Each taco is about 2.50, unless you opt for the more expensive shrimp or fish at 3.25 a piece. Going the money saving route, I decided on a steak, chicken, and al pastor.When I unwrapped my food, there was an explosion of meat chunks overflowing out of the taco shell. The steak was especially impressive, nothing like the small chewy bits of fatty steak you will find at lesser taco joints. The meat is all grilled to perfection, and 3 tacos makes a satisfying meal. Also, the salsas accompanying the tacos come with good heat but aren't overly spicy.I'm so happy I found this place! It definitely beats most taco joints I've tried, even the more notable ones in little village and wicker park. If you like meat and flavor, Chilango is your jam. Watch out during lunch hours-- the wait for food is long because they have to fulfill about fifty bajillion takeout orders.

26.description: The food is really tasty. The portions are huge.  The delivery is fast.  The quality has been consistent. I didn't think I liked empanadas but I do now. This is crowd pleasing food. After I fall off of my New Years fitness bandwagon, I will go here again and again.

25.description: You guys have to check this place out ASAP!! It has a modern twist with tacos; the fish has a very sweet taste, the chicken breast have a nice crunch, and the steak is so juicy. I never really liked empanadas but the crust is nice and fluffy with great fillings. Overall great experience!!! Thanks for the excellent customer service

12.description: To whoever likes Chipotle, get your ass here and eat their burritos. You will never go back to Chipotle. I had their chicken burrito and I for one have been converted.  The burrito is bigger than one's head so I recommend sharing it with someone if you're a light eater. Also had the tortilla soup on the side which is a nice compliment on a cold/rainy day. Had the Apple empanada for desert, if you have a sweet tooth I definitely recommend this one, it's like an apple pie wrapped in an empanada. For drinks I had the horchata, now this one was a bit too sweet for me. I caught some hints of coconut water in the horchata? Not sure if they did add coconut water in there but they definitely did add something different, it didn't just taste like normal horchata. The hints of coconut where a setback for me because I prefer traditional horchata and I'm not a huge fan of coconut for that matter. Aside from the food the customer service is WOW! I have never ever gone to restaurant/cafe with the attention the people here gave to their customers. The waiters there brought our food to our table, helped us accommodate by telling us about their different salsas and over all just really made us feel really comfortable to be there. It's really rare coming across places, cheap affordable places for that matter, with people who genuinely care about their customers. It wasn't only their mannerisms but also the way they responded to you. They were all very cheerful and caring to your needs. If anything I think the service here is what sets it apart from anywhere else.

59.description: This is BY FAR some of the BEST Mexican food in the city. Yes, the food takes longer than average to prepare,  and yes the place is small and packed. But it is totally worth the wait!!!
