The fish tacos were a party in my mouth,  their soup is muy autentico, and their elote truly makes you feel like you've found the best street vendor on the streets of Mexico!

21.description: I've eaten in the restaurant it's nice however they seem understaffed. It's a decent take on deconstructed Mexican. That said, I ordered delivery from them and all would have been well except for the molded edges on my tacos. I noticed mine so I didn't eat it. My better half didn't notice, so he ended up eating it...All in all just make sure your tortillas aren't moldy.

17.description: Great! But no food-gasms. Judging by the menu and the steak and al pastor tacos alone, this place has top notch street tacos. Like do not pass this place up.I haven't tried any of the empanadas but I hear every item is up to par to what we want from a restaurant. Also, the venue is well kept, the decor is bright and interesting, and the young staff is a friendly bunch. Overall my experience was very very pleasing. However, I'm reserving that last star for something special.

10.description: Guacamole is delicious and has so much flavor compared to many of the Mexican places in the area. Also, I highly recommend the shrimp taco, but if you're looking for a lighter option tell them to go easy on the oil. The chicken taco is also good, but I definitely preferred the shrimp. The red sauce they give you at the restaurant is amazing!

5.description: I came in here after having eaten Mexican food probably three hours earlier. I wasn't hungry, but the person I was with was eating so I thought I'd get a little something. They had a late empanadas selection and I thought I could eat something sweet. So I got a Nutella- Banana and a Caramel-Apple empanada. I am unusual in that I don't like Nutella or Bananas. I'll only eat bananas when they are nearly green. The mushy later versions creep me out. This made me believe that I wouldn't like the Nutella version. I was totally wrong. The Nutella was the bomb! So truly delicious! I could have eaten more of them. I actually wish I had bought more because I was flying back to California. It's good that I didn't though because I'm so fat right now. That don't sell coffee, but there is a Starbucks across the street. Get your coffee,  come inside, order your empanadas and enjoy! Next time I try some real food first.

3.description: Love this place!!! Quick, fairly prices Mexican food that will melt your face off! YES it is that good. Let's start with the salsa- a serve set 3 squirt bottles on the table and I was automatically turned off. She explained that one was a creamy, sweeter salsa, one was a verde with a kick, and the last was a smoky version of a traditional salsa. All 3 were INCREDIBLE. On chips, on tacos, on my finger- I wish I could buy bottles of all 3 and never eat a meal without them again.My steak burrito was off the hook (that means amazing, right?)!! Tender, flavorful meat. Fresh lettuce, cilantro, tomato, onion. Toasty beans, rice and melting cheese. All inside of a soft, flour tortilla, pan fried with the essence of heaven. My boyfriends tacos were all delicious as well, though I was way too concerned with my burrito to hear the praises he was singing over the fish, pork, and steak taco. Guac. It's a big part of my life. We got a large side of guacamole, which was $8, and we felt a little salty about the size when it came out. However, it proved to be more of the delicious,filling, and flavorful that we ever expected.We will DEFINITELY be back :)

35.description: Food is good. Prices are good. Sauces bomb. My one problem is the delivery guy is creepy AF. Please send someone else. When signing the receipt I walked to a wall to write on it but he came and stood right behind me as I did so and watched me the whole time. No thank you.

19.description: Chilango, I love you. The taco salad has been a staple for me here, and this time it was not overly dressed - which made a huge difference for carryout (please keep it this way!). We previously have ordered the steak burrito (a bit too fatty for my liking) but tried the al pastor this time - a definite keeper! Great guac too. Will be back! Flavor + freshness heaven.

28.description: It's a go-to spot definitely for anyone craving Mexican food. Their take on the basics like burritos, tacos, and tortas have such an interesting yet satisfying taste. Formerly named Lito's Empanadas, you can also expect delicious empanadas stuffed with tender meats and cheeses; they even have dessert ones if your sweet tooth is nagging at you. The service, however, is what stops me from giving this place 5 stars. Each time I've been there, whether takeout or in-restaurant dining, I've had to wait a pretty long time to get my food. Twice I've had to wait 15-20 minutes to get a simple order that was supposed to be ready. Other than that, delicious food and a definite go-to spot.

45.description: Their chicken quesadillas are amazing and the portions are huge! I also loved the sauces that came with it. Looking forward to trying other things on the menu but as far as street food goes, this is a above average place to try.

33.description: I've been here twice, the first time I tried the torta de al pastor and it was okay, nothing special to be honest, and the tacos were pretty standard as well (Zacatacos is way better). I came back yesterday with a group and ordered the tortilla soup and elote and those were really good, some avocado would have really amplified the flavor in the tortilla soup, but oh well, I'll forgive because avocados aren't in season but I'll be disappointed if I order this again in the spring and no avocado. Regardless the soup and elote were tastier than the torta and tacos de al pastor. My friends ordered empanadas and their faves were the spinach empanadas and nutella-banana empanadas. Overall, this place is worth checking out if your in the area.

43.description: Possibly one of the best Mexican food establishments I've tried in the city. I will for sure always order from here and only here from now on. Amazing food and fast delivery.

2.description: Fist things first. I either write reviews to rave or to b!t@h. This is to rave. Not only has chilango replaced my chipotle (I get it like 3 times a month at LEAST) but it has exceeded my expectations. Customizable in the sense that you can get tacos, salad, burritos, burrito bowls, etc. and! The empanadas are fantastic, especially the Nutella banana one. Second, I frequent the elote in a cup. It's amazing and has great flavor. Unfortunately, the cook must have been in a hurry and dropped some plastic in the corn cup. Not anything that could have hurt me but would have been an unpleasant surprise had I found it in my moth while chewing. Upon showing to the register, I was apologized too and offered fresh corn and also guac on the house. Amazing customer service as recently, I have witnessed other establishments listen to your story about being unhappy and then move on with their lives. Chilango for life.

18.description: Had tacos and dessert empanadas deliveries. Wasn't as hot as I would have liked but that's as to be expected with delivery. The chicken, al pastor, and steak tacos were good. Al pastor was my favorite. The banana empanadas was delicious.-Update: 20 minutes after reviewing Chilango, they called me and apologized for the temperature of the food and gave me a credit to try it again! Amazing customer service! Definitely will be going back.

41.description: You had me at elote  So, my family loves Taco Bell (don't laugh). Since we moved to the city, we don't get a chance to eat it at all. We suddenly had a craving for it. So I found this place on Yelp looking for some great Mexican food. I ordered via the Yelp app on a Sunday for delivery. They delivered in a timely matter.  Everything we got was good, especially the elotes. Fast forward 3 days later, we're here on Wednesday, in the restaurant. I was literally craving it. Once again, amazing. Actually even better. We tried both empanadas and they are excellent. So crisp and good. Recommendations: steak burrito, quesadillas, salad, anything really.

52.description: I am sorta a weirdo when it comes to ordering certain foods for delivery, they just never seem as good as if you were to order it and eat at the actual restaurant. Finally, I can highly recommend a place that delivers great food every time & on time. You must try the Fish Taco, it is by far my favorite!! I also enjoy the beef&rice empanada as well as the amazing fresh guacamole and deliciously seasoned salsa which comes with their fresh chips. Price is super reasonable for what you get too.

50.description: I've never eaten in the actual restaurant, but we've had takeout / delivery twice now. It's very, very good and that's coming from someone with high taco expectations. The empanadas are phenomenal, especially the chorizo and cheese. Surprisingly non-greasy. Fish and shrimp tacos are both excellent, nice flavor balance, not too heavy on creamy sauce which is a common mistake, and nice crisp on the seafood. Steak tacos are also good, they're basic Mexican style with cilantro and onion so if you want other additives make sure you specify. The elote is good too, great balance of cheese and spices and not too mayonnaisey. It comes on the cob, so be prepared to slice it off or eat it like an animal. Hot sauces are one of the high points, the serrano sauce is excellent. The only thing I've had from here that I didn't like was the chicken tortilla soup, it had too much acidity and tomato flavor for my taste. Delivery times are ok, estimates were off so the food arrived early and we had to rush home, but that's better than the alternative. Solid place.

4.description: Had the pleasure of trying this place out for the first time last night. My boyfriend took it upon himself to bring home some dinner after work. Everything was good. I will say that the the 3 different sauces our meals came with were tasty - my favorite being the spicier of the 3. The sauces added an extra kick to the meal. I'm sure if the sauces were forgotten the meal would have been a let done.I had the Veggie Burrito Bowl and a Spinach & Cheese Empanada. I loved the empanada, it was so tasty and the sauce made it even better! Wish my boyfriend brought me 4 of them!! The one and only complaint I have has to do with my Veggie Bowl. Unfortunately the rice wasn't cooked all the way threw! There were a few times I had to spit a few pieces out! It happens; it was ok, would've been better if the rice had been cooked. Uncooked rice is just terrible.My Boyfriend had a Steak Burrito and a Beef Empanada. He absolutely loved his picks and agreed that the sauce(s) topped it off just right! He had zero complaints!I am inclined to come in for a dine in experience! I'm thinking that the food might be better when eaten on the spot. If anything I'd definitely come back for the empanadas!

6.description: Pretty good for one of those gringo-friendly Mexican places. Yeah, I said it. They have chicken tortilla soup and empanadas on the menu, bruh. Don't try to tell me any different. They created a modern-looking vibrant store front, in which they threw some Mexican slang phrases on the wall. Consequently hipsters flock to it, because "culture".I ordered a steak burrito and the aforementioned soup (I wanted soup. F*** you). The steak had way too many hard gristly chunks than I care to endure in one sitting. It's bound to happen with taco meat, but it was a little much. The soup was actually quite good. I'm not the biggest fan of empanadas, but I did get to try a few. I thought they had pretty good flavor.Overall, a decent pseudo-authentic Mexican spot.

22.description: Pros:+Prices+Fresh+Original TakeCons:-SeatingChilango's is a great place to eat if you need quick, fresh and filling food. You order at the counter, take a number and the food comes to you. Three sauces are provided in squeeze bottles for those who want to add a kick of extra flavor. The salad is huge, empanada's are amazing.The seating situation needs to be corrected, sometimes a party of one will take up a 4 person table. Bathroom could use a mirror, but they are remodeling so not sure if it's done yet. Lastly when the door opens in the winter the whole dining area freezes over.

15.description: Late review but came here about a month ago. Ordered shrimp taco's with the elotes style corn. Honestly some of the best Mexican street food I've had. Really good flavor in the tacos and the corn was good enough for me to place another order. I've craved this since i came and have been waiting to go again, but it will be soon. Only downside was that it take a little bit to get the food but when it's that good, it's worth to overlook.

57.description: Great Food. Easy on your wallet. And cool place. Nice service.

20.description: Had a steak burrito and it was AMAZING-everything was seasoned to perfection! The horchata was very tasty, it had a slightly different taste than usual because it had an amaretto taste to it but it tasted good! The only thing that I didn't like was the rice pudding empanada because the rice pudding itself was bitter and too watery.

36.description: Still a favorite. Staff is helpful and welcoming as always. Tried the shrimp tacos for the first time- SO good! Definitely top 5 in Chicago.

14.description: Chilango Here's a case of Yelps 4 1/2 star review being a big disappointment to me.  First of all I don't live anywhere near Taylor street, but I had a taste for Mexican food and this was one of the restaurants I bookmarked on Yelp.  I made a trip down here to try their food.  This still is part of the old Italian neighborhood, but the gentrification of the neighborhood with UIC and Medical Center/Rush students, teachers and faculty has brought a lot of new business into this area since my days @ UIC.  First of all the parking is very limited.  The spaces consist of metered, resident parking or tow zones.  I'm told this isn't bad because it's Sunday, but I still had to park 1 block away.  I decided to try 3 different tacos to try and get a flavor for different items on the menu, none of which was very good.  The chicken w/red cabbage?  Really flavorless and very dry.  The Steak w/cilantro & onions very dry not much flavor.  Finally the Pork w/cilantro & onions. A little more taste, but the pork was dry & chewy.  They gave me 3 small containers, 1 of each of  a got red sauce, a green sauce and one that looked like 1000 island.  These sauces helped with the flavor on the tacos, but the serving size was so small it wasn't enough sauce for the 3 tacosNeedless to say I probably won't be going back there especially when there are so many great Mexican restaurants all over the city with easier parking.

58.description: I really don't get the big hype with Pompei! Food was pretty mediocre and a little expensive. I could see how a big family could make it a tradition to eat here AND this place has been open for a lonnnng time, so maybe that's what it is. I dunno, I just wasn't impressed with the flavors or selection. I got the stuffed pizza and it was still cold in the middle. My friend got the clams and they were chewy and smothered in garlic sauce. There's just so much better Italian down Taylor.

56.description: Great place to come for dinner; either as a family, friends, date night (casual) or if you want by yourself (loner).  Delicious specials and as always great tasting pasta.  I usually get the baked penne pasta with marinara sauce and if I'm hungry a slice of cheese pizza to go. Their soup selection is quite good.

29.description: Opt for the pizza, instead of the pasta. The pasta is average, and quite simple, the worst being the lasagna. Do not expect anything special, this is just casual, basic Italian fare.

42.description: Pompeii is a very casual place.  You walk up and place your order..yes they have some alcoholic beverages as well and then you are given a number and the food is delivered to your table.  Great for groups as you each can place your individual order with no complicated check splitting.   The food is quick and decent ..nothing mind blowing but a good variety.  You will find something you like..even if it is just a slice of pizza..give it a try for simple casual night out!

23.description: Awesome salads love the Large chopped chicken salad with grilled chicken.  And Marie's dressing rocks.

47.description: Not certain how some reviewers think this place is expensive. We had wine ($4.50 a glass), meat lasagna ($9.50), a meat ball sandwich ($4.50), and a plate of Arancini ($4.95)). We shared a tomato/cucumber/onion salad ($4.75) and a Tirimisu ($4.75). C'mon, dudes, this is inexpensive. Additionally, the sauces were terrific and the coffee ($1.95, refills) was excellent. It's not an elegant setting, more like cafeteria style, but the the ambiance radiates fun and creativity. Sometimes I want to go to RoSals down the street and get knowleagable waiters, creative presentations and distinguished wines, but then I'm prepared to pay twice as much.. For good Neapolitan flavor, reasonable prices and a lively atmosphere, bring your friends to this traditional place (since 1905!) . It's on my go-to list-- and we live in Milwaukee.

8.description: I was looking for a place with great Salads because sometimes a nice green chicken salad is just what I need. I tried their chicken Cesar salad and I must say it is great! The chicken is cooked to perfection and grilled just right! Their dressing isn't your typical creamy dressing its light and zangy which goes just right with the chicken. Their croutons are also great, the seasoning is just perfect. I would definitely recommend this place for a quick lunch.

31.description: I'm a fan of Pompei on Taylor Street. I think some people may be expecting really fancy Italian food here, which you won't get. This is a fast-casual place but for me - it hits the spot. I'm a big fan of the pizza. The flavor is good and I enjoy the thicker than thin but not quite deep dish style of pizza. I also really like the Italian chopped salad - full of cheese, ham, salami, olives and a tasty vinaigrette. I always stick to those items, but everything looks and smells great here. Save room for a desert! No minimum delivery fee which is great, since I work close by.

34.description: One of my local go to restaurants when I want fast and cheap. Is the quality the best? Probably not. Is it the most tasty? Not really. Do they put out a consistent product that satisfies you every time? Absolutely. Their best dish is the baked minestrone which is a giant bowl of minestrone  with bread and gooey mozzarella on top. It is so big, it is really a meal in itself. The salads are always tasty. The pizza is ok but better than any of the chains.

16.description: Casual place. I remember the sausage being better the last time I was there, but I love the stromboli and the pizza--really great.

13.description: When you're sick of hospital food options, easy ordering and drive thru window for pickup.

11.description: I debated between a 4 & 5 star rating, and I haven't decided until I was done writing the review.The restaurant is easy enough to find from the Polk stop on the Pink line, and it is quite spacious inside.  I loved the "Italians in Chicago" mural, and especially loved the original family photo on the wall, circa 1909.  Paying tribute to the ones that built what you have is always a nice token.I had the homemade meatballs for an appetizer (a friend who is Italian/Sicilian says this dish is a great indicator of the cuisine for the entire restaurant), and they were GIGANTIC! 2 enormous meatballs in homemade fresh sauce, and WOW was it delicious!!!  then the pizza streudel came, and I was completely full for about 6 hours afterwards. and it was very VERY reasonably priced too!!!

39.description: Great daily Italian specials, awesome variety of soups and salads generous portions and friendly staff.  Also very safe as there are always a minimum of 5 CPD officers eating somewhere in the place.  Had the chicken/broccoli penne pasta with sundried tomatoes and olive oil/garlic.  Was delicious, highly recommend!  Also a fan of the caprese salad and baked minestrone soup.

37.description: Came here after a pretty long walk, ordered spinach arancini (fried rice ball with marinara), tiramisu & cappuccino...yumm...loved the way they set up the restaurant, kind of like a cafeteria with fast service but really good food.

0.description: I come to Pompeii all the time because it is near my work and school. The food is good, fast and relatively cheap. I really like Pompeii because of the family like feel - while it is a big restaurant, I always feel like I am being helped by an owner - maybe I am! Yesterday, I was late for class and trying to pick-up an order through the drive-through. The drive through was blocked by a giant bus! I was a little frustrated since I was late for class, but waited while the bus unloaded a bunch of tourists into Pompeii. Afterward, a manager came out and gave me a piece of chocolate cake for my patience - I should be patient more often! I have never had their chocolate cake before, but WOW. Now I am going to have to order that every time I go in there - super moist and delicious - just what a pregnant woman needs!

38.description: That CALAMARI made me stop eating, get my computer out and write a review. I don't need to say anything else. I'm very PICKY about my Calamari being that it's my favorite dish. Lakeview/Lincoln Park location.

51.description: I order lunch from here almost everyday and the menu is so big and everything is so delicious we could eat it every day and never get sick of it and always have something different.  My favorite person to take my order is Anna she's always very helpful with the menu and always helps to make sure that my food gets there on time and fresh and delicious thank you so much Anna for all your help. They also do parties and their banquet room so last month I had a birthday party for my best friend she was turning 30 . Everything was so great we had those little mini slider cheeseburgers those were and all the food was great. The drinks were great and our bartender was so nice and funny I think his name was Willie.  And the two beautiful ladies that helped us Paula and Franny I would have them work any party they made sure everybody was happy and everything went so awesome I can't wait to have another event there. Paula is just an angel from heaven I love her.

27.description: Great food, nice service, cool place. I recommend their Lasagna, and their salads.

32.description: I loved it! The food was so delicious,  either that or I was really starving.  But all in all I enjoyed my meal very much. After I was done eating my meal is when I realized I should have taken a photo. Lol order the pasta, you can't go wrong.

54.description: yummy! food is sooooo good. so many selections for pizza, struedel etc. the salads are 2 die for. great atmosphere on taylor and plenty of parking. now that leona's is gone this is the only place to go.

48.description: Cafeteria style Italian food that wasn't anything special. Ordered an Italian style pastry thing, that I didn't even want to finish. It was affordable, but in this area there are better, affordable Italian options.

44.description: I walk past this place almost daily on my way to and from work and always see a decent crowd inside. One day, I decided to give it a try myself. I hadn't looked too much into beforehand, so the cafeteria style of ordering and seating caught me a little off guard. The food was fine; I had the gnocchi, and it was alright but nothing spectacular.

24.description: Used to come here a lot. Decided to try again last week. Thought prices were a bit high for a cafeteria type environment. The price for a small Caesar salad was also high. The pizza slice I had was cold, and could barely cut the crust. The place was quiet at 5 pm. When I asked one of the bus boys for a real fork and knife he didn't offer to get this for me. He preferred to stand around and talk with another bus boy.  Will not make an effort to return.

7.description: Vegetarians and Vegans STAY AWAY!!!!!! I have tried to order a chop salad on several occasions without meat. I have either received a much higher bill to replace the meat with extra vegetables or salad with the meat on it to get the same price. This time is asked for the meat on the side and I got a salad with prosciutto and the chicken in a separate container. When I called I was then told that the vegetable cost as much as the meat!!!!  Really!!!! Now, to make it clear...the vegetable consist of red onions, romaine lettuce and olives. That it!!! I called this time and was told that the vegetable cost more than the meat!!!!!!! I live and work in the area and I will not ever order from there again. My business is not wanted. Not only will I never order from them again....I will not recommend them to my neighbors or coworkers!!!

49.description: I love this place. The pizza and ravioli are good. More than the food, like the ambiance in this place. Its very pleasant. That's why we frequent this place quite often.

40.description: if you happen to be a student at UIC and hunger strikes, pompei is a good choice to get some grub. The Mela Verde and the poor boy strudel are my favorites by far. The pompei lemonade is also really good.

53.description: Casual place. I remember the sausage being better the last time I was there, but I love the stromboli and the pizza--really great.

30.description: I had Pompei yesterday for the first time. I ordered the chicken parmasean pizza strudel and lemonade and both were excellent. The only negative feedback I have is that the chicken seemed a little dry to me.

46.description: Stop there for a quick meal - good stuff, best minestrone soup ever.  Wish to have Pompei cater? Forget about it.  Called them and asked for catering department,  I was told -we don't got catering.  I apologized and told them I thought they had catering.  The guy then tells me- we do cater, but we don't got a "catering department". Was just being a total jerk.  I told him he was meanest person and hung up.  My husband was hell bent on using them, so he called a couple of days later.  He was told to call back later, they were busy. Seriously?  Thankfully, this steered us to Connie's instead - their polar opposites!

1.description: Okay pizza. But, by far the worst cannoli I've ever had in my life. Staff was friendly and plenty of seating and nice atmosphere. Staff member replied kindly to my last review. Im not recommending this place, but perhaps I caught them on a "bad pizza-cannoli day."

55.description: I debated between a 4 & 5 star rating, and I haven't decided until I was done writing the review.The restaurant is easy enough to find from the Polk stop on the Pink line, and it is quite spacious inside.  I loved the "Italians in Chicago" mural, and especially loved the original family photo on the wall, circa 1909.  Paying tribute to the ones that built what you have is always a nice token.I had the homemade meatballs for an appetizer (a friend who is Italian/Sicilian says this dish is a great indicator of the cuisine for the entire restaurant), and they were GIGANTIC! 2 enormous meatballs in homemade fresh sauce, and WOW was it delicious!!!  then the pizza streudel came, and I was completely full for about 6 hours afterwards. and it was very VERY reasonably priced too!!!

9.description: Here on a Wednesday night with no rush order a sandwich, a slice of pizza and a pasta salad, got the pasta and slice within 5mins never got my sandwich waited for 15mins and asked the cashier that I have yet to get my sandwich, her respond was " it's almost done, a couple more mins well that couple mins turned into another 15 mins and never got anything. When I talked to the manager she laugh and said I think they meant 30 mins not funny to me because I was still hungry and didn't want to wait any longer thanks FOR NOTHiNG AND WILL NEVER COME BACK AGAIN!!!!

26.description: This place is a JOKE ! Found foreign substance in my pizza and they would not even check the other pizza of same type they had for sale to find out what it was. They kept on saying " I am sure you will be fine and don't worry we will give you a credit for it" REALLY ? I could care less about the credit I said over and over ... I just want to know if I ate something that requires medical attention. After several times asking for them to check other slices they checked for about 15 seconds and said nope nothing in anything else....The manager was even worse and challenged me to a fight ..... Every single thing they could of done wrong they did wrong .... Stay Away !!!!!!!

25.description: Just O-K... In terms of service and food.  Good spot to go if your are in a pinch and want to take advantage of free parking.

12.description: Very friendly service, awesome food, solid portions!!! Always leaving with left overs.The fried calamari is phenomenal!!!

59.description: Good, fast Italian food.  I enjoyed the pasta and the salad.  Didn't try the pizza strudel, but I will next time. Not the best Italian in town, but for the price it's pretty dang good.

21.description: Very friendly service, awesome food, solid portions!!! Always leaving with left overs.The fried calamari is phenomenal!!!

17.description: Nice, laid back atmosphere. Cafeteria style. Food was decent and the service was good.  Prices were very good and there is free parking!

10.description: My family and I visited Pompei during a recent visit to Chicago and we enjoyed a wonderful meal.  Located in an Italian neighborhood, our "hop on/hop off" driver recommended Pompei so we decided to give it a shot.  The restaurant is very casual - you go through a cafeteria type of line to order your meal, but the food is excellent - generous portions of Italian-American comfort food.

5.description: Average tasting pizza, average tasting everything else. Plenty of seating for group events or a birthday dinner etc etc. They have TVs so you can even come here to watch the Bulls win! UIC Clubs host events here throughout the year. You will most likely have to meter park because you need a zone sticker to park on side streets. If I was craving pizza, I wouldn't go here because there are a million other places for that in Chicago.

3.description: Inconsistent is probably the best way to describe Pompei on Taylor. We usually order delivery from their Lakeview location and it's always good, but you never know what will happen on Taylor Street. We just had an early dinner and it was terrible from start to finish. When we were ordering, the owner or manager was berating an employee in front of us about cherries. They were apparently so upset about last night's desserts that the woman ringing us up stopped with us and joined in. He finally left and started screaming at someone else. This set the tone.The food was the worst I've ever had at any Pompei location. My ravioli was hard and my wife's spaghetti had an unidentifiable object in it (apparently a burnt bone). The meatballs were clearly at least a day old.Maybe instead of screaming about cherries, the owners should focus on the food quality and service.

35.description: How do you not know what's in the food you serve?! I took my kids there for diner one night. My son is diabetic and I have to count his carbs. I asked a girl taking our order to give me nutritional info on slice of pizza but she was clueless even chef wasn't able or didn't care to provide me with the info. Really?! Although my kids were very excited about having pizza we had to leave!

19.description: Opt for the pizza, instead of the pasta. The pasta is average, and quite simple, the worst being the lasagna. Do not expect anything special, this is just casual, basic Italian fare.

28.description: I work nearby and frequently visit this place for lunch. They handle the lunch crowd well and consistently have GREAT lunches (salads, soups, pizza, calzones, dessert, and more).  Quality food at a reasonable price makes it one of my favorites in Little Italy for lunch.  Highly recommended!

45.description: It is a nice spacious building. There's lots of natural light and a high ceiling. You pretty much start at the front of a line and say your order. Depending on what you get, you have options to throw on extra ingredients. I got their meatball sandwich with peach tea. It smelled good and tasted great. It got three stars though because nothing was stood out to me as unique. Also, there's free parking in the back.

33.description: Great place for a lunch in an otherwise terrible neighborhood.Parking is at a premium, get there early to try and snag a spot.They have a huge menu with many options, so it can be overwhelming when you first walk in.  I was pleased with a calzone and slice of cheesecake.  The place was clean, and it was a relief to have a decent lunch close to United Center.

43.description: I have been going here for many years. I have never dined in, I always get my food to go. The food items are pretty good.  Always ready when I go to pick up. The poor boy strudels are the best.

2.description: My family and I have been coming to this place for the last sixty years and i have to say this place is taking a turn for the worst new hire suck at least I hope they are new hires and the manager is a spineless excuse for one if you have to take something off a quests check you come over and apologize

18.description: How do you not know what's in the food you serve?! I took my kids there for diner one night. My son is diabetic and I have to count his carbs. I asked a girl taking our order to give me nutritional info on slice of pizza but she was clueless even chef wasn't able or didn't care to provide me with the info. Really?! Although my kids were very excited about having pizza we had to leave!

41.description: Good Italian food, it has a great location near Rush Hospital so it was a great stop after taking my mother in for a check up. The atmosphere was relaxing and we had a great lunch. The service was quick and responsive and the prices were very reasonable. Look forward to the next check up!Large menu,  great prices, plenty of seating, clean and wonderful atmosphere. If your in the area it certainly is worth a visit.Update: I went a second time and was again delighted with the experience. I had the meatballsand caprese salad. Yum.

52.description: So good! The food is quick and tastes good. The only thing I've ever gotten that I didn't like was their Caesar Salad because the dressing had a weird taste to me. In my opinion, a good indication for great food is the number of cop cars consistently parked out front.

50.description: This review if for a pickup order of one (1) large minestrone soup. I phoned the order in 12/17/2014 at 4:22 pm.We arrived at the puck up window in our car at about 4:45 pm.Young man at pick up window did not acknowledge our presence. Just ignored us while he stood with his back to us as he entered an order into the POS machine per his ongoing phone call - for about 10 minutes! Our order had been phoned in and was ready for pick up. I had cash in hand to pay! He should have at least nodded to us! He also could have put the call on hold to speak to us! Better training in customer appreciation and service is needed!!!!! He never apologized for the delay in recognizing our existence! This added insult to injury!!!After we paid and were given our change, he did not thank us for ordering from Pompei!We have been loyal customers since 1989 when we moved into the neighborhood!I EXPECT better treatment when I give Pompei my patronage and money from my tiny pension!  These are hard times and customers should be appreciated! Without customers, the young man would not be needed on the Pompei staff! Perhaps a remedial customer appreciation and service refresher course is needed!!!! Irving it would be simple to turn one's head, nod or wave to the customer waiting in person, ask the customer on the phone if they could hold for a moment, apologize for the delay and ask if we had a phone order or needed to place an order, and say thank you for coming to Pompei.I really think I'm reasonable in my expectations.

4.description: Fast food Italian.  It's cafeteria style, which in itself is not a problem.  Sadly I've been here a few times and the food is just blegh.  The fetuccini alfredo was no good and seemingly had not a single shred of parmegiano reggiano. while it wasn't watery, it just wasn't flavored at all and I had to put salt and pepper all over it to make it edible.  The next time I tried the plain old spaghetti with tomato sauce.  Also, not seasoned and had no flavor.  I won't be back, and don't understand the draw.  I always have good service, although the people behind the counters can't tell you much about what's good and what's not because they haven't tried it.  The ambiance is nice, but I definitely need better with my Italian food.

6.description: Great place for a lunch in an otherwise terrible neighborhood.Parking is at a premium, get there early to try and snag a spot.They have a huge menu with many options, so it can be overwhelming when you first walk in.  I was pleased with a calzone and slice of cheesecake.  The place was clean, and it was a relief to have a decent lunch close to United Center.

22.description: Pompei is a good place to get a quick, inexpensive bite to eat if you're in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. The food is pretty average (though the lemon cookies are great!). However, the service is usually good though and the decor/environment is pleasant and spacious. They also have a private room available for a reasonable fee.

15.description: So many different choices .... Pepper and egg is my favorite ... My daughter is in love with the spaghetti and the chili mac is very good as well .... There is free 30 min parking in front and a couple parking spots in back so u can avoid a ticket on the crazy ticket happy Taylor st .... Very big area to eat and the people that work here are most of the time nice .... Nothing bad to say about this place .... Would I come back ummmm duh who wouldn't .... Plus my daughter goes to the school across the alley so I'm here at least once a week

57.description: I was pretty much raised on Pompeii Pizza and it is always good. Great calamari and excellent service.

20.description: This place is so friendly and the food is pretty amazing especially for fast take out. Very authentic

36.description: I have never been too fond of this place. Their food is overpriced for the fast food/frozen quality you get. Their salads are decent enough. Some of their pizza is good but I honestly think their are better places in Little Italy.

14.description: They had a bunch of different pizzas and pasta that looked very tempting . I had a chicken salad but it was delicious (:

3.description: This is a Social Enterprise helping to clothe unemployed and underemployed people to help them get jobs. The store is open to the public about 2 times a month and have a lot of designer names for sale at UNBELIEVABLE prices. This is a great place to add to your wardrobe without spending a lot of money!!!

1.description: I haven't shopped here but my friend and I did do drop off some donations for one of their clothing drives.The staff is super nice and helpful. Parking is sucky. I got luck and parked out front with my lights flashing. Thankfully there was one such spot. My friend not so lucky. She pulled into the alley and was able to drop off her stuff.I'm sure this place does well with the pedestrians. The items that I briefly glanced at seemed taken care of and in very good condition. I'd shop here if I didn't have to drive,here.

2.description: The place does not really have a large selection of men's clothes but if you need a suit or sport coat at a responsible price this place has some options. They do have a lot of women's clothes at reasonable prices since my fiancé loves to power shop when she comes here. The store is a not for profit business so all the money does go to a good cause. I did purchase a Hugo Boss sport coat for $40 bucks. Good deal, I think.

0.description: The Bottomline is a wonderful addition to the UIC Halsted street marketplace. The store sells high quality, gently used or new items at very reasonable prices. The store is laid out to provide ease while shopping. I have been to resale shops before and felt really overwhelmed but I didn't feel that way here! The employees are well trained in customer service and are easy to chat with. Its a great shopping experience all around.

56.description: Service here really sucked.  This may be a chain restaurant and they try to offer different types of pizza - the only appealing thing about here is their cheap prices but the lady at the counter charged me $1.00 for two things of side ranch for pizza (the boyfriend likes to dip pizza into ranch).  I had placed an order for pick-up and it still wasn't ready after 20 minutes (when they told me 10-15 minutes).

29.description: HOORAY!!!! Super easy online ordering, extremely fast delivery, and GLUTEN FREE PIZZA!  The pizza was great and we will be ordering from here MANY times in the future!  AND the delivery guy was very nice.

42.description: OK I know this is the complete opposite from what other people think, however here are my reasons for giving them 5 stars.1. The online ordering is ridiculously cool...When I am starving, there's nothing more nerve wrecking then wondering when my food will arrive. They give you an update of each step towards delivery and they let you know who is making your pizza. I LOVE IT.2. The service is pretty good, I called to place an order over the phone and I got my pizza super fast and everything was as ordered.3. I usually get the hand tossed with ground beef and green peppers, the meat is flavorful, however they could be more generous on the green peppers. Non the less, still delicious.4. Best of all, the NEW recipe they use for crust is lip smacking good. GARLIC crust! UGH, no kissing for the night, but who cares, I'm enjoying my pizza too much.5. You can get two medium pizzas for $5.99 each with two toppings. Well, if that's not cheap eats then I don't know what is. To all the yelpers that are whining, shut it up. This is NOT Chicago's finest pizza, so stop trying to compare it to what you are used to. It's DOMINOS!

23.description: No stars for this garbage!!!! Would have rather eaten my actual $16.00 and had a better meal!!! Terrible!!!  So disappointed and still HUNGRY!!!! Don't waste your money. Pizza was terrible, dry with zero sauce or cheese!!!  Highly disappointed even for Dominos!!!!

47.description: i used to work behind this location so it was convient tocome here for lunch. i ordered the cheesy bread which is SOOO good . its like a mix of garlic bread and cheese sticks . there are about 5 slices and cost 3. 87 . and i also have tried the buffalo wings which were good too. i think i used to get the spicy ones for about 6 dollars and it was maybe 10 of them idk. usualy i wud order the food ahead and  it would take about 15 minutes and usually my food would be ready but a fewtimes after coming 20 minutes after i called , i was told the delivery man accidentally took my order out and i wud have to wait or it was only one or 2 ppl there and it was slow .

8.description: Ordered 2 large pizza at 2 am, delivery said will be 45 minutes but came at 3:30am. Called them back to check if my delivery is on the way, manager Tyler was so rude, didn't even apologize.  Don't ever call delivery

31.description: It's not the Domino's we all remember from 5+ years ago. The pizza is so much different and SO MUCH BETTER! Also, crazy cheap. The flavors are really good. I have done both delivery and carryout and both are quick and easy. The carryout was done in around 15 minutes which is awesome! The iPhone app is really cool too. I like that you can see the process of where your pizza is and you know when its ready. No showing up early and waiting for it to be done.

34.description: For the most part, they've been pretty good at completing my order correctly, and getting it here hot....Have to give them kudos for that after the last review I wrote....

16.description: I enjoyed their crispy crust, regular pizza, stuffed cheese bread, and sandwiches they have here. I do have to say, it's best to order before you drop by. Unless you really need to check out the menu. Waiting here is pretty weird as you stare into the kitchen.The person taking the order is sometimes a hit and miss with helping you with the order. I've been here twice and the people are different.... Some would remind us or actually be able to make suggestions if you're not familiar with what they offer. Sad to say, I don't usually make additional requests with my food, so I'm not sure what can/ can't be done. For example, vegetarian friendly meals, no garlic, no onions, etc.Yummy pizzaaa

13.description: Save yourself the money and order from somewhere else. For starters, this location doesn't answer their phones. Called almost 10 times, on two different phones, no answer. After finally ordering online, the food arrived an hour and 45 minutes after we placed our order. Food wasn't even warm anymore, as if it were just sitting in the delivery car for a while. Honestly, order from somewhere else. This location is a joke.

11.description: Update. Dominos did promise me full refund that helps as I wait fir pizza to warm up in oven Nov 18 Okay I foolishly again.ordered for delivery.living less than.2 miles away. From out for delivery to delivered 30.mins. Thats it dominos go to heck! Pizza cold chicken cold how freaking hard is it?!?!

39.description: @Ramon DeLeon is probably the best thing to ever happen to Domino's. I changed my previous low review because he took the time of his day to fix the problem and message me. I appreciate that more than anything.Yesterday we gave Dominos another shot after not having it since November, and it was perfect.The pizza was wonderful, and I am so happy to be ordering from Domino's again, because it really is the best tasting pizza.

37.description: Online order is really fun, you can choose all different kind of topings you want. The coolest thing is that they have a browser plugin so you can go ahead and surf the web while watching the order process. And this is good for me living around the store so i can pick it up when it's ready.In addition, you can search online for a 50% off coupon for you carry out. So i got a nice pizza with an amazing price!

0.description: Purchased 2 specialty pizzas. Hawaiian and pepperoni supreme.Love their thin crust pizza!

38.description: @Ramon DeLeon, ftw!!!  I work at a college and some of the students needed meals provided for them (over Winter Break due to the dorms being closed).  Ahhh, how I miss college life.  Anyway, after soliciting a couple restaurants in the area, I remembered how awesome and generous Ramon DeLeon is when it comes to donating pizzas for a good cause.  (If you follow him on Twitter, then you know what I mean!)  After providing him with details of how many students, the date and why the students needed the pizzas, he graciously agreed to donate pizzas!  All I'd need to do was pick up the pizzas from the South Loop location.  Awesome!When I arrived, the pizzas were already ready and piping hot!  Ramon gave us 6 pizzas (for 15 students!).  How delightful!  And the spread of pizzas was just great - pepperoni, cheese and two specialty pizzas (one had feta cheese and looked incredibly good).  With the new revamp in pizzas (so tasty!) and the awesome customer service, Domino's is definitely a favorite in my book!  Thanks again, Ramon!

51.description: I usually never have a problem with restaurants, but this time was different. I was suppose to order pizza for class so I called the Canal location to order. I called to order for the location of my school and the guy said it was too far and gave me the 1-800 number which I had no problem with. Then he says call the division location at 312 da da da da and finished saying the numbers at warp speed. I asked him to please slow down so I may take the number down, he does the same thing and hangs up on me. I went ahead and called the 1-800 number which magically dials me back to the Domino's I just called. The guy with the same hispanic accent picks up the phone, I think they have caller ID because he says  rudely "you already called here". I then said " I know sir, but the 1-800 number brought me back here and I would like to know the number to the division location, but you spoke to fast". By this time I had him on speakerphone to show my friend how rude he was. The rude guy does the same thing again and says the numbers super fast...312 da da da. I said can you please slow down.....then he goes " 3...............(waits)......1...........(wait)............2.....I was thinking like are you frikin serious. He then ads " your pretty slow for a stupid office worker" then hangs up. My friend was in the room and was upset when she heard him on speakerphone so she gets the phone and calls back. She asked to speak to the manager and the same guy goes " I am the manager" scary thought huh...then proceeds to caller her a bitch for calling...my mouth drops to the floor..then she starts to call him an asshole. He hangs up once again and we call the other location to order the pizza. No on picks up and I have a feeling he called that location to tell them not to answer, as soon as we hang up, the Dominos at the Canal loation calls my house and when we answer he hangs up on us....I could not believe this happened. If that really was the manager than he need to be fired or deported asap...

27.description: Very unhappy.  Pizza is cold, driver had no Parmesan cheese or crushed red pepper. In addition, delivery took an hour when I live down the street.  Lastly, the bill was not legible.

32.description: Takes forever to get a pizza. Let alone for them to answer the phone

54.description: This place is horrible everytime I order pizza from here it is late. Which throws off all of the plans. I USED to order here for parties and the price is good. But I shouldnt have to choose between service and price.

48.description: As I eat my pizza...I feel the need to tell everyone how super awesome the new Pizza Tracker on dominos.com is!  If you place an online order it pops up a glowing bar that tells you exactly what time your order is taken, by who, when it is prep-ed, and by who, when it goes in the oven, is being boxed, and finally the name of the delivery driver who takes your pizza.  Super cool.Oh, and good pizza, although watch out for the real chicagoans who will judge you in the elevator for not ordering Giordano's.

44.description: So when hungry in the late evening on a sunday night and we decided on pizza, the suggestion was Domino's and I gave a look of disgust. I mean don't we all when Domino's pizza is mentioned? I asked him when was the last time he ate at Domino's and he said 6 years ago. 6 years ago?? That's great. Just Great!!! WELL..  they have a new recipe (i.e. the new commercials) We'll see about that. so we went ahead and ordered online. Their online ordering is pretty cool by the way. And you get to track it. It'll say stuff like: Josh is prepping your order 7:50pm. Josh is checking on your pizza at 7:58pm- while the stage of the order lights up, such as Prep, bake, box, delivery. So Kewl! We got the 2 mediums, 2 toppings for 15.18 after tax and delivery charge. The process of ordering and delivery was faster than I thought. So the verdict? not so shitty after all! The crust is pretty garlicky. I thought the sauce was pretty decent, was not too sour and not bland. We ordered a mushroom and jalapeno and pepperoni and jalapeno. It was actually pretty good. And for the price.. I'm not mad at all. Don't worry, I won't be craving this anytime soon or at all, pizza snobs. It just didn't taste like shit- I wouldn't fight it so much if we resorted to ordering this in the future. ONCE IN AWHILE though. A long while.

24.description: The product is great in comparison to other Dominoes locations, but the service needs to match up. It has been 36 minutes since I have called  this location, and I am still on hold.

7.description: This Dominos is quite possibly the worst of all-time.  I've had Dominos off the back of a Mexican's motorcycle in Cancun that is far superior to what this place tries to pass off as food.  The "specialty chicken" looks like someone puked on top of it.  The regular boneless chicken is often so small it looks like it came from a pigeon.  And they routinely forget to include the sauce I ordered with my cheesy bread, or give me the wrong sauce for my chicken.Do yourself a favor, never, ever order from this place.

49.description: We decided to come here last night. The pizza was ok. Breadsticks are better elsewhere. Cinnastixs were ok.For the price and quality, I rather go elsewhere!

40.description: Wayyyyy better now.  The cheese almost tastes real and the crust is delicious.There's so many choices, we actually did a chicken bbq pizza and it was pretty tasty.  Just in general, everything is better, the crust, cheese, sauce, breadsticks, etcThey have great deals online, too.  So go ahead, give Domino's another try.  I promise  you'll be surprised at how much better it is.

53.description: Here's my Domino's horror story - I ordered one of their standard pizza offerings for delivery, it finally arrived 40 minutes later, I paid the delivery dude & made the mistake of sending him away before checking the goods - opened the box & found a blob of what used to be pizza squished into one corner of the box.  Apparently someone had dropped the box in transit & not bothered to check whether the pizza was OK.  Called back & they delivered another non-mutilated pizza but that took another 30 minutes.  In the time I wasted on getting that pizza (which ultimately was not even that good - big surprise!) I could have ordered 2 or 3 pizzas from good, reputable places.

30.description: I really like the new dominos, they get minus 1 star for screwing up our order, actually they forgot the feta spinach cheesy bread then they gave us the cheese cheesy bread instead of the feta spinach one....it was NYE so they were busy I guess...the pizza is great for a restaurant pizza chain...maybe moving up to my favorite...its pizza hut and dominos in the running for my fav rest pizza chain...

46.description: order online or call....within 30 (usually closer to 20 minutes) pizza arrives. so far orders have always been correct and pizza tasting awesome!

1.description: Terrible terrible terrible experience. I have never experienced such horrible customer service in my life. I am so angry and frustrated (and still hungry) right now. I ordered my food online last night at 7:20. My estimated delivery was 56-72 minutes. I was watching the tracker online and saw that by 9pm, my order hadn't even been started. I called over and over to cancel the order, but I couldn't reach an actual person. The phone number was either busy or I was just on hold listening to music every time I called. A few times it even sounded like someone picked up and hung up. At 9:45 I receive a call from the delivery guy saying he's on his way, but he only has half of my order because they ran out of food.  I respond, "why didn't you call me when you knew you didn't have everything I ordered?" He says, "that's not my fault, I'm delivering half." I respond, "half is not enough--cancel my order and give me a refund." He, in response, HANGS UP ON ME!!! About 20 minutes later, the online tracker says my food has been delivered and my credit card has been charged.  We were so hungry, we ended up eating 2 packages of ramen noodles each and cookies for dinner. It's now the next morning (Sunday morning) at 10:45am and I STILL CAN'T REACH ANYONE TO ISSUE A REFUND. You just can't make up this kind of incompetence. Shame on these people.

55.description: This place should be shut down. I think when they get mean customers they put buggers in the pizza.

9.description: Look, Domino's pizza is what it is, but this location is great. Friendly and helpful ordering and prompt and accurate delivery. Would def order again.

26.description: Online ordering is easy.    Receiving what you ordered in a timely manner is very inconsistent.  The delivery people mess up the drinks almost all the time.   Either bring the wrong drinks, the wrong amount or oops not at all, even though you have been charged.   The management at the location couldn't care less and corporate management doesn't either.  Today I was foolish enough to try one more time, the order arrived very quickly and belonged to someone else.   Not what I ordered at all.   The guy had left so I called the store.   The phone answers and hangs up.    Unbelievable.   I deserve it for giving them another chance.

25.description: I enjoyed their crispy crust, regular pizza, stuffed cheese bread, and sandwiches they have here. I do have to say, it's best to order before you drop by. Unless you really need to check out the menu. Waiting here is pretty weird as you stare into the kitchen.The person taking the order is sometimes a hit and miss with helping you with the order. I've been here twice and the people are different.... Some would remind us or actually be able to make suggestions if you're not familiar with what they offer. Sad to say, I don't usually make additional requests with my food, so I'm not sure what can/ can't be done. For example, vegetarian friendly meals, no garlic, no onions, etc.Yummy pizzaaa

12.description: Ordered dinner from here last night online (apparently they don't answer the phone). The food was good. We got a sausage and pepperoni pizza with 2 orders of specialty chicken. The food was hot when we got it. I will say we had ordered some extra sauces for 50 cents per sauce and they forgot 2 of them so was out 1 dollar on that. Other than that no complaints. Nothing great but it was nice and greasy which is always good for a hangover

21.description: Food arrive on time and deliverymans are very nice and polite (even before tipping.)

17.description: Food arrive on time and deliverymans are very nice and polite (even before tipping.)

10.description: Occasionally, when drunk and disorderly, I order pizza from Dominos.  Why, you might ask justifiably...Whatever.  The important thing is that when I'm at my worst, they're still executing flawlessly.

5.description: Horrible. We placed our order at 6:55 and were told 37-52 minutes. Our pizza shows up cold at 8:15. The pizza was disgusting - pepperoni tasted like iron or blood, the cheese pizza tastes sweet. WHAT IS GOING ON? This once used to be my go to pizza but I will NEVER order from here again.

3.description: Update: Bumping up to 2 stars because it is 1:20 and although she canceled the order, the manager called her and said he had her pizza.  When the driver was in an accident, he went out to collect and distribute all the pizzas on the route.  He apologized and offered her $25 discount on a future order and asked her to meet him downstairs to give her the pizza.  She agreed.  So continuously disappointed in you Dominos!  I am at work and my boss is starving so put together this great order for a pizza.  She was told it would be 20-40 minutes delivery time, she agreed.  We kept the pizza tracker up on the computer screen, and after a while it said pizza was delivered! Only....we didn't have pizza. Who was eating our pizza? She went downstairs to check for a delivery person, no one.  After a while she called the store and was told the pizza was en route. Then she was told the driver was in an accident....no wait, different driver, our pizza was really on the way.  After 1.5 hours with no pizza she called to cancel, very politely in my opinion (I would not have been that polite had I been the one on the phone) and talked to Vincent.  She explained several times that she was going to have to cancel the order, because she was waiting too long and was terribly hungry and was assured she'd get a pizza, but there was no pizza....finally she hung up. She was not offered an apology, an explanation or compensation. I'd be surprised if she ever considered ordering from there again, and I know I never will.

35.description: I don't see why all these bad comments. We are regulars, and good tippers, so maybe for that reason the pizza gets delivered sooner than the time they give us. Sometimes however they force the baking process and it comes out a bit burned. I've gotten warm pop, but if you specify that you want it cold, you will get it cold. Polite people, never messed up my order^^^ i posted this comment before getting a silly pizza. I ordered a "spinach and feta" pizza and got one without the cheese that goes on every pizza. it only had speckles of feta. i often get that pizza from many different dominickses and never got a bare one like this. Dropped a star because of this

19.description: It depends on who is making your Pizza! Sometimes its good, other times its just oil soaked "pizza".

28.description: So we went online to order from them... They have this great app that lets you watch every step of the way... we watched our pizza go through the cooking step to "quality inspection" where it sat.... and it sat.... about 25 minutes after we watched it enter "quality inspection" we called.... The first lady we talked to said:You should never use the internet to order from this location!Yes that's right - Dominos is spending millions on a marketing campaign to get people to order online -but this location apparently doesn't have the right technology, or something because they want you to call to place the order -or so their staff told me.  So I asked to talk to a manager and I explained my dissatisfaction (it had been about an hour since we ordered and it was still waiting to be send for delivery).  The manager went to look up our order - and mysteriously right when she came back on it updated to say it was now on its way for delivery.  I asked her if our pizza had been sitting for a half hour and she assured us not - that they were just backed up.10 minutes later (the store was a mile away) they show up with a cold pizza that was clearly sitting out for a half an hour waiting for delivery.Called back and they said they could re-make the order or give us a credit for next time....  My question -does Dominos care so little about quality that they would rather send a cold pizza rather than remake it?  (Apparently, yes)   The only positive is the manager did credit us back for the order, but why order if they don't care if they deliver an unacceptable product?

45.description: Delivery near Columbus and Randolph usually took about 45-60 minutes, which is to be expected. The food was also what I expect from Domino's, which is consistent but unremarkable.But I was surprised how many doormen of nearby buildings would call with the cell number the delivery drivers would give them and tell me the pizza was there. If I lived in the building, why would the doormen need to be given my number?

33.description: I'm one of the rare Chicagoans that actually think Domino's has amazing pizza. Well, maybe "amazing" is a bit of a stretch, but I enjoy Domino's and think it has a very nostalgic "je ne sais quoi"...I've had HORRIFIC experiences ordering from the Papa Johns on Cermak in the South Loop, so Domino's was a much better option.I downloaded the iPhone app and ordered my pizza. It was a seamless process - - so easy, quick and efficient. Within 20 mins my order was at the door... my COMPLETE order (something Papa John's struggles with... but that's another rant for their Yelp review page lol).All of the food was received nice and hot. Only complaint? I wish the wings weren't as soggy (hot wings), but I was hungry and still ate them.

43.description: 2 pizzas, 2 toppings, cheesy bread and a 2 liter of coke for $22 AND it was delivered super fast. I know it's not Lou Malnatis or Giordanos but for 4 hungry people that can't agree on toppings and don't want to spend a bunch of cash this was some good food.

2.description: I actually think I may faint... I feel that crappy from waiting for food-I have only a package of crackers in my place, which is why I placed an order with Domino's, I have no food!I placed my order at 6:39, it is now 9:40 and no pizza-I have tried calling so many times, I mean seriously like 20x but the phone would just ring or be busy, I'm assuming busy from everyone else calling to see where the heck their pizza is-I called again and this time there was an actual Domino's add playing over and over and over again, been on hold with this thing for 25 minutes...no one is picking up!I want my card refunded, I don't want the food b/c I'm 500% positive it's probably as cold as it is outside-There is no rain tonight, no snow, no protest, no traffic, no mass crowds-I live 2 miles if that from this location, so it should not take 3 hours to deliver a pizza-And if the delivery was to be over 2 hours I should have received a call from the store to notify me, but nothing-I am fuming mad right now, on top of freaking starving-I mean I am so freaking hungry...I already wrote a complaint to headquarters-I mean if it said over 120 minutes, I would have never placed an order!********************It is now 4 hours, no pizza-I have tried calling over 50 times, seriously, that is how many times my phone shows-I have gotten to some "fake" Domino's answering service a couple times and have waited 25 minutes those times and still no answer-********************It is now 11:00, I placed my order at 6:39, no pizza, can't get through to anyone at the store-And  all I've had this evening was a pack of peanut butter crackers...the owner has one seriously ticket off starving female on their hands...*********************It is the next day, 12_6_2015 and the store opened at 10:00 and I've been trying to call since then and no one is answering...no pizza, no call nothing...*********************Update 12_8_2015Spoke to Vincent at this location and he was so nice and refunded my card-He apologized and was helpful-I did not want a store credit b/c I didn't really trust a delivery option again-But I should see the refund in my acct this week-I was told from a person on Sun. that it was super busy due to some Black Friday 1/2 off promo-I had no idea b/c my order was not 1/2 off-So they said they had orders coming in and couldn't make them nor did they have the drivers to deliver-

18.description: Extremely slow service and delivery. Quality is below average. They have messed up my order multiple times. Definitely would not come back to this location.

41.description: I think Dominos has come a lonnnnnng way from the drunken pizza I used to consume every Friday and Saturday night in college. The new crust and sauce is totally my favorite. Of course it isn't gourmet pizza or anywhere near authentic Italian but sometimes you just need a yummy slice. I love garlic butter so this crust is great for me!The online ordering is awesome! The pizza tracker is super cool and yes I'm totally the dork that hits refresh to see where my pizza is along the prep line. This place is pretty speedy too. I've only ordered online so I can't speak for actual customer service over the phone. They all seem pretty friendly when I bop in to pick up my pizza. Careful when pulling directly up from to run in and grab your pizza because the parking lot monitor (haha glorified security guard my ass) will rush you along.

52.description: Ugh, wtf?? I don't how Domino's manages to exist at all. How can a chain pizza restaurant have online ordering where you can't even use a credit card?? Explain this one to me please!!! Isn't that the point of online ordering, the whole ease of use thing, and magic of the Internet. They have the absolute worst online ordering system ever. Again, how does this place do online ordering where credit cards aren't used?? Their highly unintuititive website lets you order pizza online and make sure you use caps or you can't even get into the website or will be really frustrated. After tonight's ordering experience, I think that I can fully say that Domino's doesn't get the Internet or online ordering. If they did, then it might mean that ordering a pizza from them would be an easy transaction not a headache with on an empty stomach. I've ordered from this place a few times and had crappy experiences every time. Mediocre pizza and bad online ordering system make for a truly one star experience.

50.description: I wish I had nice things to say about this particular Domino's, alas, I really don't. We have problems whenever we order from them. Despite being literally a block and a half or so away from us, they always take more than 45 minutes to deliver, completely ignoring their 30 minute rule, and many times our pizza is lukewarm, and once in a while it's cold. We don't really hold that against them though because it is the city and we're used to having to wait that long for food (though not from places that close to us). I guess as far as that goes we're just jealous of our friends in Naperville who get apologies and vouchers anytime they're late in delivering.Anyway, our main problem really is that they're not good workers. They forget our coke (and sometimes other things) about 98% of the time and have only offered to take it off of our bill once, though nicely one delivery guy brought it back to us, which we appreciated(not that they're far). Now, I love greek salads. I tried to order them twice because it appears on the menu. Makes sense, no? No. It actually doesn't make sense. You see, as the last delivery guy informed us, they don't actually have the ingredients for Greek or Caesar salad at their location. Do you think the woman answering the phone could have told us that? Of course not. Because she deemed it totally acceptable to just send the only salad they do have (it's not, I would've have preferred she just be upfront and say they don't have Greek salads). So I sent it back because I did not order it. And then not only was it the poor delivery guy who had to tell us that, but then he told us that WE THE CUSTOMER had to report it to Domino's corporate. It took me forever to locate a place to report it, but I did. As part of the Domino's corporation, that is something that they should have done themselves ages ago, and I still have no recognition from corporate that they know or are dealing with that issue. I can't be the only one ordering Greek Salads. I almost called back after the last time to find out from the lady why she didn't bother to tell me they didn't have the ingredients, but I knew it wouldn't do me any good. This is a simple thing to do I would think.Unfortunately, this is the closest Domino's to us, so if we want it again, we'll have to order from there. In the meantime, we're working on trying out new local places :)UPDATE: as of 11/5/08 (at least) they now have Caesar salads with chicken. Still no Greek salad ingredients, but that's at least one step in the right direction.

4.description: I had a coupon for a free handmade pan pizza due to the No Hitter MLB promotion.  The pizza was great and ready on time for pick up.  They are a little selfish with toppings and I ordered double toppings.  I'm not sure if this is normal or because it was free.

6.description: Where do I start? The pizza is ten times better than it tasted back 8 years ago and I would recommend for anyone not willing to shell out cash and in need for a fast pizza. My wife ordered online the first time and we got our pizza within 15 minutes...crazy! Impressed, and not in the mood to wait, we ordered a second time on a Saturday night at 11. We didn't expect 15 minutes again, but knowing Domino's reputation of getting you pizza delivered fast, we still expected something quick enough. After we placed our order, the wait time said 2-4 hours. What?! We tried to call to verify the wait time or cancel it, because at 1 we were not going to eat pizza, we were going to sleep. No one answered. We called a second time, again no one answered. Around 1:15 A.M. we get a call from the delivery driver. Well, sorry that you had to drive, but you can keep your pizza. I would order just for the pizza, but honestly I'm scared for the wait times and I probably will never order from here again.

22.description: Quick, close and always friendly service. If you live in Park Michigan Apts and don't want to wait on Lou Manati's, definitely recommend this one.

15.description: So we went online to order from them... They have this great app that lets you watch every step of the way... we watched our pizza go through the cooking step to "quality inspection" where it sat.... and it sat.... about 25 minutes after we watched it enter "quality inspection" we called.... The first lady we talked to said:You should never use the internet to order from this location!Yes that's right - Dominos is spending millions on a marketing campaign to get people to order online -but this location apparently doesn't have the right technology, or something because they want you to call to place the order -or so their staff told me.  So I asked to talk to a manager and I explained my dissatisfaction (it had been about an hour since we ordered and it was still waiting to be send for delivery).  The manager went to look up our order - and mysteriously right when she came back on it updated to say it was now on its way for delivery.  I asked her if our pizza had been sitting for a half hour and she assured us not - that they were just backed up.10 minutes later (the store was a mile away) they show up with a cold pizza that was clearly sitting out for a half an hour waiting for delivery.Called back and they said they could re-make the order or give us a credit for next time....  My question -does Dominos care so little about quality that they would rather send a cold pizza rather than remake it?  (Apparently, yes)   The only positive is the manager did credit us back for the order, but why order if they don't care if they deliver an unacceptable product?

57.description: That the home of deep dish pizza allows this chain to operate within the city limits is mystifying. That anyone actually would buy it is flabbergasting.

20.description: This Dominos is quite possibly the worst of all-time.  I've had Dominos off the back of a Mexican's motorcycle in Cancun that is far superior to what this place tries to pass off as food.  The "specialty chicken" looks like someone puked on top of it.  The regular boneless chicken is often so small it looks like it came from a pigeon.  And they routinely forget to include the sauce I ordered with my cheesy bread, or give me the wrong sauce for my chicken.Do yourself a favor, never, ever order from this place.

36.description: Ridiculously fast, quality service on a Friday night!  I ordered my pizza online at 9:13pm and it was delivered in under 20 minutes!  It was still so hot, I had to let it sit a bit.  The best deals Domino's offers are for ordering in groups.  It's hard to get a deal for a smaller (2 person) meal.  With delivery and tip... it's still about $18 for well, Domino's.  There are some great online codes for weekdays.  The website is currently offering free delivery ($2.50) if you sign up for a trial subscription of something (sorry, I don't remember and now the site isn't giving me the offer), but you have to give them your cc#.I agree with everyone on the improved taste.  It's much better and the mix and matching of the make your own pizza allows you to create the perfect slice!  The crust was a little salty for my tastes (I had the normal garlic crust, they have a a few options), but overall a pretty good pizza.Tracking your pizza online is fun and accurate  Pretty cleaver new feature.

14.description: Customer service is bad. You should not leave a customer standing at the counter waiting to place an order. This girl walked past me twice and didn't ask if o needed help until I Waite's 5 minutes. I hope this pizza is better than the service.

3.description: Just to reiterate what everyone else has already said: this service is absolutely horrible. I don't know why UIC hires the rudest, slowest, incompetent people to work at its dining services instead of just hiring students looking for work. I have a running theory that the university gets a fat tax exemption by hiring "at risk" women (or something along those lines) to work at Au Bon Pain (and Wendys for that matter) because because the staff at these places clearly hate their job and don't give a crap. The food itself is fine, especially the soups.  But for the price and god awful wait, it's worth walking to Fontano's or Jimmy Johns. Or subway if you're really desperate.*there have been one or two friendly cashiers that don't fit this description, but that's about it

1.description: I don't mind the food here, I mean it's not bad for it being on school grounds. But the employees are why I gave it a 1 star. As others have said here, they don't seem to hire students which is odd. Anyways, I used to frequent here literally everyday before classes. But one day, I decided not to purchase anything, and simply took two (2) napkins. Suddenly, a woman notifies me that I cannot take napkins if I did not buy anything, and threatened to charge me 28 cents LOL. By the way, this woman was the only cashier at that time, and left her duties to tell me that when there were about 5 people in line.  This place is a joke!

0.description: I love Au Bon Pain, but I have never been to this particular one without questioning my sanity. The sandwich station works at the pace of a snail, even when it's a not busy time. I'm not asking them to rush, but after 10 minutes of waiting for my Newport Turkey I'm tempted to hop the counter and start slicing bread myself. So be warned, if you are in a hurry grab a southwest salad (best one IMO) from the cooler and then pray to your god the check out line isn't ridiculous......

2.description: Get ready to wait forever for subpar food. While waiting, I always think how this business stays open. I understand it may take a bit when its busy, but its consistently garbage. Service: poorFood: poorIt's usually a hard decision between eating here or starving. sry not sry

5.description: Soup was the only decent food there other than their bagels. Everything else is a little bit pricey & the bread sticks that goes with the soup are pretty stale :/

6.description: All six of the coffee makers were out at 9:30 AM. Multiple people told the staff, but the coffee wasn't brought in the back to be refilled for several minutes. I asked an employee when she thought the coffee would be done (I had already been waiting 8 minutes), she stated that she didn't know and was sick of people asking her that...excuse me? These people need some training in costumer service, with the exception of the two ladies that were making the sandwiches.

7.description: Staff often rude and very slow. Most food prep staff seem to have not received any training whatsoever. I have received sandwiches made incorrectly several times. Service is pretty abysmal all around. Portion sizes are fine, but seem small for this price point. Unfortunately this is the only healthy option nearby available between classes so we're stuck with Au Bon Pain. I wonder if other locations suck this much?
