8.description: If I could give this place no stars I would and that would still be too much. Wanted a sandwich, just a turkey club and mac and cheese. I stood by the sandwich counter watching the two women make sandwiches for about 8 minutes before they took my order. I went and packaged a small mac and cheese and came back to wait for my sandwich. The two women didn't seem to care about how long they took and there didn't seem to be any logic to what they were doing. The guy behind me commented on how they might benefit from a Subway style assembly line. 7 minutes later the women who I ordered with looks at me and asks if I want Chipotle mayo. The turkey club has regular mayo, and I told her that was what I wanted on it. Turns out they were out of mayo and I wasted 15 minutes of standing there for her to realize it. I said forget it and grabbed a wrap out of the cooler. The wrap was good, but not worth the $. Also the paper around the wrap was wrapped in the lettuce, so be careful or you'll be eating paper. I've eaten here before and had the same experience. Stand in line to order, get sick of waiting, give up and grab a wrap. This time I wanted a warm sandwich, but I guess it just is never meant to be. Also, I went at 1:10 so it wasn't in between classes and not at the peak lunch times.I wouldn't recommend this place. Au Bon Pain would be much better off to hire students, but I doubt UIC catering would let them. Eat at the cafe in UH- they actually hire students that WANT to work, have good food, and aren't as overpriced. They are also SO much quicker.

9.description: This was the first week that it opened and boy is it crazy! I don't know if it's just me but the sandwich people are always asking if I want to buy a sandwich. If I said no the first 3 times, you think they would get the point and stop asking. Wrong.  So haven't tried any of the sandwiches for that reason, but the soups are yummy.  I will come back to try the various pastries and probably a sandwich too.

10.description: I got a chicken cesar wrap which fell apart as soon as I took a bite.  It was not cut in half which is probably why. I basically had to re wrap it myself.  I don't mind paying $6 for a decent sandwich, but this was sloppy, and an inconvenience especially since most students get food to eat in class.  Im giving it two stars because I've been waiting for UIC to open a place like this, but I wish it as good of quality as the other chains around the city.

4.description: Terrible service.  I once ordered a sandwich here and heard the women making it talking about the name(Jesus) on the order,  "How could you name your baby Jesus"... bla bla bla... etc.  Needless to say I was offended, and on top of that the sandwich sucked.  I mean, you can talk about my Momma if you make a decent sandwich, but if you talk about my Momma and your sandwich sucks, we got a problem. Sidenote:  UIC People...  I hate smelling your stinking Au Bon Pain soups in lecture.  Don't bring your food into class everyday.  It makes people want to punch you.

12.description: It's 24 hours. Yes, it can seem sketchy with the people hanging around outside the store. It's pretty clean inside. Stock is usually good except the sale items can run out (which is usually the TP). Usually only one cashier at night and lines can get long.

3.description: I pretty much expect one employee taking their sweet time at a register when I go to Walgreens, but even the floor associates here act as if they're doing you a favor and that you're inconveniencing them by needing their assistance or simply asking where the bathroom is. Speaking of bathroom, apparently it takes a super top secret code to get in, so better hope you don't have to go too badly or you'll be pissing yourself before Ms. High and Mighty gets her attitude to the door to let you in.

1.description: Only giving 1 star cause it won't let me leave it blank. Cashier was lazy!!! Wouldn't scan items until I, the customer, took them out of the basket for her. Then didn't even ring everything up because she was busy chatting. If her name was on the receipt I would post it. Customers aren't paid to do your job for you. Learn some customer service skills you lazy person who probably complains she doesn't make enough money wah wah

2.description: It's a Walgreens! The staff, if you can find them, are helpful. Checkout is friendly.BTW, Walgreen's has a Senior Discount Day (usually monthly) when AARP members and Senior Rewards members can receive additional discounts on select items! Staff are not informed in advance of the public the schedule for Senior Discount Day.Selection here is smaller than most and they run out of sale items frequently!

9.description: Normally I don't have an issue with this place, they have my scripts filled in a timely manner.Today was the complete opposite. No waiting for the drive up lane, however it took 15min for someone to come to the window to pick up the script. We clearly said we would be back in 2 hours to pick it up.We came back 2hr 45min later. We are told its not ready and will be 10 to 15min waited another 30min still not ready.They need to hire more pharmacy staff. That is all

10.description: I actually loathe coming here - and I only come here because of the RedBox machine.  The staff here are good but can be a bit slow at times but the manager always knows when the line ups are developing and always makes a point to remind people that they can check out at the photo processing stand or the make up counter (unless you're buying smokes).Between the panhandlers outside their door and the drunken messes that are always inside, I really hesitate to come here unless I am renting a movie or returning one.  Luckily, there is always a good amount of cops in the area which helps me feel a little safer, but I swear that I was being followed back to my car yesterday (6pm on a Sunday) but he was unsuccessful once he saw a truck occupied by someone in front of my parked car.

4.description: Super helpful staff. My pops needed me to break a $100 into two $50s(giving cards with money for Xmas). I initially hit up the Staples nearby and that clerk just gave up. Selfie stick. They need to move the selfie stick bin to before where the checkout line begins. I'm waiting for the super helpful clerk to convert my change to two 50's and I'm eyeballing this selfie stick in the selfie stick bin(dang it has Bluetooth). But it's like kind of wedged between the two checkout lanes. I will say they need to properly put the pricing levels on that box. I initially thought those selfie sticks were $10 because that's what it said on one side of the front of the box. It's a quality selfie stick as well. I'm saying to myself wow $10 for a premium selfie stick; today's my lucky day.I tell the guy converting my cash hey ring this up too while your at it. Bam, $25, not $10, for the premium selfie stick. Wha?! I lean back a bit  to look at the price on the box and it says $25 on the other side of the box. Honestly y'all was so helpful and it was such a premium selfie stick(I was ready to pay 35, nay, $55 for a premium selfie stick) and I'm not that type of guy to hold the entire show up. There were at least 15 people in line waiting behind me; I didn't want to be the guy to hold everyone up for a price check on a selfie stick.There were so many people waiting in line that they opened up cosmetics as an additional checkout lane. It's odd though: the next guy in line was buying a massive teddy bear for his sweet honey and just didn't want to give up his spot to walk the fifteen feet to cosmetics. I can tell he was calculating the cost/benefit of the move; I think he made the right choice.I need to ask: do we need a plastic bag for literally every single purchased object, Walgreens? Can we curtail the bag usage? I don't need an environment-destroying, tree-branch catching plastic bag for my Chapstick and Snickers.Great Walgreens location, great people.

6.description: Horrible customer service which I've come to just expect from Walgreens associates. Ordered photos from here and the development was dreadful. Not only that she knew the photos were crap when she handed them to me, but shame on me for not double checking. Just disappointing, very disappointing.

15.description: Eric told me 10 minutes, but it only took 3 minutes to fill my prescription on a Sunday night at 10:00. Thanks Eric!!! I can always count on this pharmacy's quick and friendly service (even in the drive-thru :)

0.description: Not my favorite Walgreens, however because of it's location close to the expressway and the stores I frequent on Roosevelt, I'll stop here for milk when I know it's on sale or the occasional card on my way to family events.This store is smaller than most, and many times there are people loitering at the entrance, while the loiterers have nothing to do with the store inside, management should do something to make customers feel safe, and not be shaken down for loose change.

5.description: I can't deal with prescription after prescription that take 5-6 or more hours longer than the promised time. I feel bad for people who are uncomfortable while they wait on this seemingly understaffed or otherwise incompetent Walgreens pharmacy. I continue to go because it's 24 hours nearest my home. They say nothing in the way of apologies and ask you if you can just come back later.

13.description: horrible horrible horrible!

11.description: This review is just for the pharmacy. I will never use it again, and neither should you. I picked up a regular medication from their 24 hour window one evening. After four days of feeling strange, I brought the medication back. I told a pharmacy tech, "I know this sounds crazy, but I think this is the wrong medication." He poured some out and then got the bottle from the pharmacy shelf and poured some out. He obviously believed they would be the same, and was shocked when they weren't. He called the pharmacist over who continually repeated, "I don't know how this could happen," in between her accusatory questions, such as, "Did you pour the medicine out and put this one in?" The worst part was - when I told her I didn't know how it happened either, but I wanted my correct medicine, she replied, "You'll have to come back tomorrow when the pharmacy manager is here." So.... they filled my prescription with the wrong medication (I had adverse reactions to both the medication and to NOT taking my regular medication), then they refused to fill it correctly. Unbelievable. I even asked if there was a pharmacy manager on call, as I really needed m y regular medication at that point. She said no. The next day, the pharmacy manager was very apologetic. He said she most certainly could have called him. He gave me a small gift card. It was bad enough to be given the wrong medication - but that would not have made me write this review. It was the horrible, demeaning treatment by the female pharmacist that came afterward. No one deserves to be treated that way. And a gift card does not make up for it.

8.description: Usually have a decent experience at this location, however it reached a low point for me recently. Needed to quickly pick up a prescription after work. I was fourth in line for the drive through window, pretty typical for 6pm. However, it took twenty minutes for just one car to get through...unacceptable.

14.description: I love Walgreen's, and 24-hour ones especially, but man.... can't they do something about the guys who loiter around the front of the store and either hassle you for change, want you to buy some random paper, or just heckle you.  UUUGH X 22343.  I don't want to hear your comments.  You like my ass? Well me too.And even though this location is very convenient for me, and clean and well-stocked, the "front doormen" are enough to keep me away.  I've opted to go to the Dominick's behind it many a time due to them.In the weird photo that is mostly a Cadillac (without a driver mind you)- you'll notice that this was taken on a Sunday because the Maxwell Street Market is taking place.  The Market blocks up one of the heavily used exits/entrances to this store, which is a good reason to avoid it on Sundays unless you're on foot/bike.

7.description: Big store, often packed, friendly and helpful and fairly plentiful staff has all the basics, but is on the big side.

3.description: I didn't like the drink I ordered, but their food is really good. Nice place to go after work. They also have slot machines.

1.description: Of course it's not for everyone, hidden on the corner of Western. I can't say I am a fan of course, but it was fun for what it was. Co workers wanted a "cheap" drink, and let me tell you it was far from it. A hard liquor glass was almost $9 and for a place like this that is just, well: A DIVE, that shouldn't of been the case. I was rather surprised but at the same time I thought maybe its becuase we were dressed rather conservative and this place seems to cater to a less dressed crowd. Water Hole, hmmmm we should've really thought of that before entering do rained libations. But on the plus side, they serve a hell of a great fried chicken wing! Of course you have to order the food and really know what southern fried chicken is, yes they don't play when it comes to the fried chicken. It's been one of the least known spots to have it made this way. But again, is the bar part of this joint what I would keep coming back to? Nope.

2.description: Randomly ended up here after the laguinitas brewery closed. The ambiance was amazing-a lot of soul and the drinks were strong. Some of the regular clients were a little less than friendly but overall it's def a southwest side treat.

5.description: Visited Fri night several times to watch a friend play, and we really enjoy this place.  Can't be beat for being a great dive joint with live blues, warm friendly people that make you feel like family.  Very informal and comfortable atmosphere, not too loud, no one's shushing you if you talk, but why would you?  Mary Lane and her band are entertaining, and it's really fun when she invites guests up (lotta musicians there, and they all know each other.)  The regulars are a trip!  Mr. Sat. Night DJ, you da bomb.  We'll have to drop by to hear what you're spinning.It's split into two rooms, bar in front, and music in the back room with another bar.  You can order fried chicken or catfish, comes with fries and a slice of white bread.  Cook is very tall - and funny.

6.description: I visited this place sometime ago with my sisters and I have to say this was one of my memorable evenings. I never been in a place like this before, which made it exciting.The name says it all, "Water Hole Lounge".  It has a southern-like feel to it.Older crowd seemed to be in the front and younger crowd in the back, which had a DJ. The drinks were decent and easy on the wallet.  I recently found out they serve food. Overall we met new people and had a nice time.

7.description: a great place to hang out. reminds me of chances r, just no peanuts  to throw  on the floor, great music , food and fun.live blues some nights, comedy others, darts and bid whist.always ask about drinks speicals, you don't ask, you may miss out.grown ass fun  for grown ass people.ps. i heard thid place will be a part of the chicago blues tours.  kk.

0.description: super hospitable, very friendly, the jerk chicken wings and dirty rice, OMG so good. My friends wanted to leave, but Elmore James Jr. was going to play. This is a preliminary review based on one visit, but it was a very good experience. I'll be back.This is in a crappy location. People probably pass by a lot and think, maybe I should stop and see it, maybe it looks threatening, like a bar in the hood someplace. I wanna visit more and get a better sense, but I think it probably deserves more love than it's getting. If you've been driving by or taking the bus by on Western for years, going 'hm, what about that place?' like me, you should swing by sometime. I hear they do amazing sets during Blues Fest.

4.description: My coworkers and I had lunch from Chef Armando, and let me just say it was so delicious!! I had the turkey sliders and they are the best I've had yet! Beats Bacci's turkey burger for sure!!

1.description: This was my place for chicken until today when I asked the delivery person, who turns out to be the owner, why he consistently parks in the disabled space...his car had been parked there many times before...he told me me it was his space and he could park anywhere he wanted. Further he told me that I could call Jesus and he would not move it.Total disregard for customer service, total disregard for the disabled and senior citizens.Even the waiters at Ed Debevnic's are not this rude.Back to Sharks Fish and Chicken for me...please do not give this place your business!! Thanks.

0.description: The greatest R and B artist of this generation got his name from this local fast food chain. tosh.cc.com/video-clips/… Driving by and seeing one for the first time I figured I owed it Ice JJ to at least give it a shot.Like the clip says, they're actually known for their chicken so I went with a three piece just to try it. Although incredibly greasy, it was pretty damn delicious. Definitely loved the sauce they serve with it as well. The menu is actually really large with all sorts of fried fish, chicken wings, burgers, and even an Italian beef. It ain't health food, but it'll satisfy the soul for next to nothing. Now if I could only sing like the smooth throated superstar...

28.description: I've been to this bar a few times since it opened and I have to say, it's pretty cool! I love the lounge chairs in the patio, very comfortable and I like the fact that you can recline in them! Also they have bags and the service is pretty good, I came here on a few saturday nights and surprisingly, it wasn't packed, great place to go for a chill summer night.

1.description: Holy crap I miss staying in Pilsen and coming here - this place is, as Yelp so eloquently puts it, "As good as it gets!"We were sitting in our apartment in Pilsen and looking for a bar close by. We stumbled upon this gem and I couldn't figure out how this place had almost 5 stars - that's unheard of. I guess we had to come see for ourselves.The first night we were greeted by Mike who kept us company and kept great conversation with us. He offered a LOT of advice on places to go, things to see and do in the area. I was stunned by how impressive their beer list was, not only cans and bottles but also amazing beer on tap.The second night was even more fun than the first. We walked in and noticed a different bartender at the front.... Mike came out of nowhere to welcome us back and make us feel at home with an intro to our bartender that night, Ryan over a round of shots. Wow, where else do you get treated like a regular on your second visit?! This night was also sick. Ryan did an awesome job of getting our drinks, making recommendations and helping us navigate what we were doing in Chicago.The last night we met yet another new bartender, Ben. We asked about Ryan and were told he was on his way. Ryan later joined us and he and Ben did a great job of service and keeping us company - they have a great sense of humor and play subtle tricks on regulars there which is hilarious to watch play out. In true PhD form, we ended the night with a round of shots on the house (I was getting used to this - really miss my nightly free shot =/)We were really impressed by the atmosphere, drink list, lounge in the back of the bar and the outdoor patio (which I never spent any time on and somewhat regret it.)  The one thing that makes this place absolutely incredible is the bar staff who I can't wait to come back to visit. If the weather is good, this place is poppin' inside and out.

9.description: I am not a college student, and this place is pretty obviously aimed towards the UIC crowd. I still, however, appreciate what they are doing. 'cause it's not a college bar in the "ohmahgawd drunken frat party," it's the college "sit back, drink a beer, and play a game of bags on the patio." The patio rocks. The beers in mason jars rock. Of course, the patio is of limited use in the near future, though there is a neat fire pit out there so maybe they can salvage a few more months out of it. Friendly people, super laid back. Hope it does well.

29.description: This is a awesome chill spot that has a great craft beer selection.  There are plenty of stools to sit in the bar area.  If that's not your thing because you have a larger group, they have a nice size sit down area as well as a lounge area in the back of the pub.  They also have a great outdoor area where you can play bags. This spot is great whether you are here with a buddy to watch a game, need a place to hang out with friends, or just do some work on your laptop.  Their "beer of the month" selections are great, too.

23.description: This place is in a great area with lots of foot traffic yet it was kind of empty when we arrived. A group of us went for some drinks and realized why no one goes in there. A quick shout out to the security guy cause he was on his game. He carded efficiently and politely which is nice. We arrived starving only to find out that they don't serve food at this bar. BUMMER! However we are allowed to bring in outside food, which we did. The server was nice but a complete mess! She came to our table maybe 3 times. Dropped off menus, took our order, brought our drinks then disappeared. One of our guys actually went to the bar twice to get more drinks because our server never came back. She did come back in the end to charge our cards but that was it. One thing that did gross me out was that some of the glasses smelled like wet dog. Not the greatest smell in the world.

5.description: Went on a morning before yoga lol and had a couple bloodies and a shot with my girlfriends on our unofficial "Bloody Mary trail" nothing too special about this bar or bloody but I'd probably Coms here again next time I'm around!

31.description: Haven't been back to UIC area in couple years and again, not surprised to see another new bar in university village. However, this is place looks like it can stay afloat. Beer selection is above average, good liquor selection, friendly staff, and a great patio / garden area where you can play bags / cornhole. Pricing also seems to be on par with bars and seating is not bad. Go check it out.

25.description: I love Ph.D Pub. First of all, the staff is super friendly and kind. Really fun people that want you to have a great time. Mike, the manager, is very hospitable. The outdoor patio is a great place for summer afternoons and evenings with great music, bags, lounge chairs, and lights. There are also two big TVs for the sports fans. The beer selection is extensive and you can also buy beer to take back home. I would highly recommend coming here for a relaxed, fun afternoon especially if you are looking for a place for a large group. The location is also great because it is so close to many eating options.

12.description: We came to Pd.D after an event at the UIC Pavilion. It is in walking distance from UIC, so yea! Not at all pretentious. Good beer list, with specials. Good servers. Outdoor area has some heaters which is pretty nice. Prices reasonable.They have no food (no kitchen) so you have to ask the server for menus to local establishments that deliver to PhD if you are wanting food.

21.description: We came to Pd.D after an event at the UIC Pavilion. It is in walking distance from UIC, so yea! Not at all pretentious. Good beer list, with specials. Good servers. Outdoor area has some heaters which is pretty nice. Prices reasonable.They have no food (no kitchen) so you have to ask the server for menus to local establishments that deliver to PhD if you are wanting food.

16.description: The owner was mean and rude. He became angry when we put the tables together for our large group and when one of us asked for a redo on a drink, he slammed the drink down the sink and cursed he was f'ing tired of us.  The bartenders, waitresses and drinks were good and they get one star each. Otherwise this place would receive a big fat zero (if possible) for the rudeness of the owner.

17.description: This place is in a great area with lots of foot traffic yet it was kind of empty when we arrived. A group of us went for some drinks and realized why no one goes in there. A quick shout out to the security guy cause he was on his game. He carded efficiently and politely which is nice. We arrived starving only to find out that they don't serve food at this bar. BUMMER! However we are allowed to bring in outside food, which we did. The server was nice but a complete mess! She came to our table maybe 3 times. Dropped off menus, took our order, brought our drinks then disappeared. One of our guys actually went to the bar twice to get more drinks because our server never came back. She did come back in the end to charge our cards but that was it. One thing that did gross me out was that some of the glasses smelled like wet dog. Not the greatest smell in the world.

10.description: Nice atmosphere, very good patio area. Good selection of beers. They have a tent on the patio area for smokers when it's cold outside. The patio area has grills so you can cook your own food there, which is very cool.

11.description: Ph.D is a neighborhood bar. It's not always crowded and the bartender rotation is always consistent. The bartenders there are always friendly and the patrons are usually from the neighborhood. Making for a very laid back atmosphere.

26.description: I hosted an after work event here last night for around 20 people.  We brought in Qdoba catered for food and set up shop on the patio for a bags tournament.  Everyone had a blast and Mike, the manager, couldn't have been more accommodating.  The atmosphere was perfect for our casual gathering.  The drink selection and wait staff were also great!  Thanks for taking care of us!

27.description: Good beer list, GREAT outdoor space. I have high hopes for this place. Sad that LUSH Wine left..but at least it was replaced by another cool place.

35.description: 13 beers on tap, endless more in bottle form. Everyday a new beer and drink special. Reasonable shot prices and a few moonshines to choose from. Newly paved patio area complete with cornhole (or as you Chicago folk call it "bags". Great bartenders, Jessica and Hope RULE!! Jukebox for drunken sing alongs and 4 TV's perfect for sports watching. Great addition and new option for the University Village area. Check it out! It's in the area formerly occupied by Lush.

0.description: Came here with some friends to watch the Hawks game  chill spot and not too crowded. The BYOF option was perfect. Moxee has some great food and is a short walk. We had Ryan as our bartender and he was fun to chat with and made some good cocktails.Great spot to chill out at.

20.description: PHDs is pretty much perfect for what I want in a bar.  Friendly bartenders, reasonably priced drinks, an excellent (and always changing) draft beer list, excellent patio, cornhole/bags outside, and a laid-back environment.  To top it off, it's BYOFood and has a grill outside so you can cook too. This place is great.

19.description: Awesome staff and decor ! Different drink specials everyday! 8 tvs! Indoor and out! Patio is awesome with tents, plenty of high and low seating, heat lamps , and bean bags! Darts and jukebox inside! Friendly and assertive staff! I highly recommend this bar!!!

33.description: Beer garden and awesome bartenders! 13 beers on tap and always a daily craft beer on special. Don't forget the mason jar cocktails are on point! Try the moonshine lemonade or the nagshead lemonade both well worth it! Always showing Chicago sports, along with the start up of soccer!! Spread the word this is the place to be this summer!

2.description: Well this pub was the highlight of my trip to Chicago. Mike, Ryan, and Ben were the best bartenders you could ask for. They were helpful with giving us tips for where to go and what to do. Though watch out for the one that apparently kicks them in the balls! Hahaha. It was welcoming environment and one we very much appreciated. The place has an excellent Beer Selection. Tons of craft beers in bottles and a great tap selection.The bar itself is very nice, love the outdoor part as well and the dart board. Plus the little lounge area with the books are nice touch to the place and it's namesake. Next trip back to Chicago I'm looking to stay near here so I can keep coming back on a nightly basis!

34.description: Good beer list, friendly staff. Went here to check it out and watch the Hawks game. They just put their patio in and it's really nice. Lots of food options nearby that you can order for carryout and eat at the bar. Once this place gets some buzz around it, it's going to be a happening joint.

32.description: Best bar in University Village!!  Great beer garden. And beer menu is stellar!!!  Highly recommend this joint.

18.description: I had a great impression of the place at first, Emily the bartender is amazing. I had to say though, the owner a very old guy is mean and very bitter. He was extremely rood and when my was friend tipsy Hd kick us out into he cold and flipped me off and said "go fuck yourself". This is after we spend well I've d$200 in his bar Nd made friends with everyone but him. He seemed like a. Rey bitter old man.

13.description: I wish this place existed when I was going to UIC, but when I started there nothing existed south of Roosevelt. Now there's tons to do. Morgan's is now closed, but this little pub is one of many newer bars that fills the gap well.     I'm not a beer drinker (*gasp*), but the beer list here is extensive. They also have a beer flight where you can pick 4 from the list to try. The cocktails were tasty and served in a mason jar. Decently priced too.      Drinks only for this place, but they have a pretty sweet deal with Connie's Pizza. You can get a discount on your food to have it delivered to the bar. I believe on Tuesdays there is free Connie's for all patrons too, which is like a holy grail deal for college students.     There are plenty of places to sit, indoors or outdoors. The patio has a fire pit/smoker, there's a grill (maybe for grilling parties?), and a place to play bags. I came with a group of friends late at night, and service was ok. We were greeted by the waitress who decided to smoke and take our order at the same time (time warp to 1995?), but she was pleasant enough. Definitely a decent place to hang back and grab a drink though.

4.description: Matt is the best bartender I've met so far in Chicago. This bar also has Mario Kart 64, so 5*.

24.description: I am not a college student, and this place is pretty obviously aimed towards the UIC crowd. I still, however, appreciate what they are doing. 'cause it's not a college bar in the "ohmahgawd drunken frat party," it's the college "sit back, drink a beer, and play a game of bags on the patio." The patio rocks. The beers in mason jars rock. Of course, the patio is of limited use in the near future, though there is a neat fire pit out there so maybe they can salvage a few more months out of it. Friendly people, super laid back. Hope it does well.

6.description: One of a few places open at 1:30 on a Monday night in an unfamiliar (to me) area. We cruised down to the city on our bikes and after a while got hungry (and thirsty). Saw some people inside so we parked up and gave it the old college try....The inside is pretty cool. A bit nicer than I expected, actually. They have a sweet looking lounge area with a school-themed bookshelf and coffee table. Comfy bar chairs and other seating in the back.I had a watermelon moonshine cocktail and my friend had a beer. I thought the cocktail was adequately strong and overall pretty tasty.Everything here seems a little pricey, I know it's the city but apparently UIC/Taylor Street warrants a little bit more hefty pricing.As mentioned in other reviews, it looks like you can bring your own food, have stuff delivered, and even grab a drink to go from their giant fridge (at a likely higher than your corner liquor store price).Our bartender was pretty cool, he gladly welcomed us in even ~25 minutes before close and warned us about last call just in case.I would imagine on a certain Friday or Saturday night when class is in session this place gets popping. 4/5, unique.

22.description: Awesome staff and decor ! Different drink specials everyday! 8 tvs! Indoor and out! Patio is awesome with tents, plenty of high and low seating, heat lamps , and bean bags! Darts and jukebox inside! Friendly and assertive staff! I highly recommend this bar!!!

15.description: When I saw the Ph.D Pub sign, I thought this would be a bar/lounge where the UIC professors would go to sip on red wine and Cognac while reviewing thesis' and dissertations. I was delusional. The only decor that connects with the name is the bookshelf containing an array of books - but it's too dark to read in there. Other than that, it's just a bar...Well, not really. According their website, they have a large beer garden in back with cornhole. Kind of like a bars in Wrigleyville without all the shitheads.Drinks were good and inexpensive, the bartender was friendly as were the customers so that is always a reason to go back.

7.description: Great place. Regular prices and long beer list.

8.description: To be honest, I did not know what to expect before I came to PhD Pub. Part of me (a large, large) part was fully expecting to see a room full of the blonde ponytail guy from Good Will Hunting, but it was nothing at all like that. I was actually mildly disappointed by that development, but it is what it is.So, yes, it is a college-y bar. College students unwind there, but they do so in a chill way. And the place actually drew a decent mix of all ages on the night we stopped by. The crowd was friendly and energetic, the bartenders were talkative and attentive, and the decor was laid back and welcoming. I don't believe they have a kitchen but I did see a few delivery guys stop by, so food is covered. Decent list of beers on tap with most of the Chicago staples covered. There really isn't any aspect where PhD came up short.We definitely had a good time, and we definitely will be back.

30.description: Finally! An awesome bar right by UIC! It's by far the best one in University Village. I love how the location is right by JST, TBH and MRH. I would always have to walk so far to get to some "okay" bars down Taylor street in Little Italy, but Ph.D Pub has great selections, nice specials, big beer garden and the staff are very friendly. I hope they are here to stay!

3.description: The name of the place sounds cool, but that is where the bucks stops.  The bartender and server I had were unfriendly and rude.  The drinks were just average.

14.description: Really great spot in University Village near UIC campus! Decor is nice, staff is very friendly and drinks are great price. Also have a great selection of beers on tap and in bottle. Some really cool perks are that you can bring your own food and they sell cases and sixers of beer. They have Jenga available and darts for those who want to play some games too. Have got to know the bartender Ryan and he's a great guy and very helpful. Also a great patio. They have drink specials everyday which you can't beat. Definitely stop by this place for a drink if you're in the area.

58.description: Had dinner with my kids, yes my kids love sushi, and was referred here by one of my clients so I decided to give it a try. Thumbs up for being greeted immediately and seated quickly. The waitress was nice and the ambience of the restaurant was somewhat authentic. Now we order a lot of food, so we started with the Edamame, Asparagus Beef Roll, and the Jalepeño Bomb. Those alone should get 5 stars. I also tried the mojito which was ok. Then we ordered the Yaki Soba, which was the thin rice noodles with chicken, California Roll, Boston Roll, Longostino Loco, and the UIC roll, and it was just ok... the presentation was cool but flavorwise not impressed.I was slightly disappointed due to the fact I love sushi, and I'm always looking for a new place to go. It honestly wasn't bad and I'll probably go back but its nothing to make me fall over for. Just another average sushi place with good appetizers n decently priced drinks.

56.description: I went here by myself and sat at the bar. Ceasar was the chef. He did an outstanding job. I had the chef's choice~sashimi with two types of salmon, yellow tail, eel, white tuna(I think?), and octapus. All were very fresh and delicious. I also took his recommendation to try the oyster shooters and they were off the hook. I will be back again for sure! They also have real wasabi and the powder stuff, so I got to do taste comparison.  The real stuff is definately worth the extra dough. Go to Kohan and enjoy your life!

29.description: B.Ex

42.description: Overall - great experience here!Seems like based on the other reviews it could be a little inconsistent, but my mom and I had a great meal here. The fish was excellent, the udon was delicious, the edamame was perfect, and house sake was $5. We ate a feast for just under $40. And apparently they're going to start doing karaoke on Thursdays, which in my opinion is another reason to return besides the good food.Service was prompt and friendly, and the decor was pretty cute. They played lots of meh techno music during dinner. Definitely more a college place (obviously, based on location). Casual, tasty, nice presentation. Had the Mango Maki and it was weird and awesome. Oh, the wasabi was especially good here - it actually tasted how it's supposed to.

23.description: I always go here for the lunch special.  $10 for a sushi box.  Soup, 2 rolls, salad, fruit, and 2 dumplings and 2 cucumber rolls.  It fills you up for a good price and tastes good too.  This place has definitely become a staple for me.  The service is always solid too.

47.description: Don't let the fact that they are empty stop you this place has some unbelievable rolls. I would recommend the Original Volcano and the sunflower roll. Stick the the rolls unique to them. They do deliver and will gladly deliver to a local dive bar if you are close(great cheesy date idea).

8.description: This place is in a nice little nook area of restaurants. There is a parking garage right down the street, which is nice for anyone driving. Overall, the service was nice, they were attentive and polite. The selection of rolls were a good variety, the prices were in line with many other places. I am a fan of getting a Groupon deal for a sushi place. I wish they would partner up with them, I would go here so much more often. We got two rolls and that was just the right amount for two people. I am not sure if they are BYOB, they do have drinks to choose from though. They also have some lunch specials that contain a good amount of food with some options.

31.description: Food is decent, not the best I've had. Not comparable to sushi pink. The sushi just isn't made delicious.. The bibimbap also doesn't have enough flavour. Horrible service. The lady never smiles or says thank you! It feels like all she wants is tips and is on her period.

34.description: Phenomenal! My favorite sushi spot! I live 20 mins away and drive here because everything is on point! Fresh, great combinations, and great sauces. The larger specialty rolls are worth it, large sized rolls and totally different! I highly recommend it! Most sushi spots you have to get 2-3 rolls to get full. Here I get a house salad which is amazing and large with shaved veggies and pumpkin seeds and a house made ginger dressing and 1 large roll and I'm stuffed!

16.description: My husband and I were extremely satisfied !! The fish was fresh and the waitress was extremely attentive. We were there during lunch time on a weekday and I'm sure that had a lot to do with it but it doesn't change the fact that the chef took a lot of pride in his meal prep. I had the Korean beef bimbimbap. It was piping hot and delicious.  It's a small, clean restaurant. The dessert was presented well too. I recommend the red bean ice cream !

13.description: Sushi and Korean bbq? Places that serves two cuisine usually deter me from trying. I went there with a voucher and ordered some rolls. It was average . I probably won't try again. Nothing  special.

11.description: We ordered the volcano roll, dragon roll and the crazy chicago roll. The best was the volcano. The dragon roll was OK. The crazy Chicago roll had lettuce which kind of throws off the taste. We also ordered the sashimi platter but got the sushi deluxe instead.  We tried to wave down the waitress but after 5 min we just stopped trying and ate it. When we did mentioned it she said we ordered the sushi not sashimi. Yea...three people heard sashimi but what can we do...she insist it was sushi. The pieces we're nice but not worth the price. All the pieces including the rolls didn't have the right balance of vinegar... the worse deal was the udon. We had udon with an egg and beef gyoza. That was $12. Another udon with tempura was $10. The udon we're overcooked and was in a clump. Tasted like instant udon too.  The bill came out to be around $100 after tips. Not worth. Service was mediocre.  Not coming here again. There are better options out there! Maybe service was crappy because we came 50min before closing time.

39.description: Great visit every time.  The service is excellent.  They currently have a lot of great specials including even free miso soup, salad and dessert.  All very tasty.  I have been going to this restaurant since they opened and it a great experience every time.  Try the UIC roll -- it's DELICIOUS!

37.description: Order the W3 it is amazing! Comes on fire. The process are reasonable.service is great.  Location is really good.

0.description: This review is based almost completely on their Tonkatsu (described as Don Katsu on their menu).Regardless of the name or linage (Japanese vs. Korean) it means one thing: tender pork cutlets fried in panko flake batter served with a side of what could best be described as a "fruity barbecue sauce".  Most places I get this in the US end up producing some dark pork pieces which are 40% grisly pig fat.  Not so here though. Perfectly cooked, lean pieces with just the right amount of breading.  They are a bit on the thin side and I prefer the thicker cuts of meat I've had in Tokyo, but considering the difference between a 13 hour flight to Japan versus a 13 minute drive down 290 this place nails it.Also had a few rolls, salad, miso soup, and hot green tea which were all really good as well.  I liked that their menu is not so one-dimensional and had a wide selection to choose from.

38.description: I came here with a friend because I've always been curious as to the food they served here. We had just eaten at the Joy-Yees nearby, so we weren't hungry.The venue itself was pretty dark. I liked the ambiance though. We came around 1PM and there were only about 4 other people in the restaurant so service was quick. They served us miso soup for free while we looked at the menu. Neither of us liked miso soup in general, so we didn't bother with it. Good thing we didn't cause a fly ending up flying into the bowl.. We notified the waitress and she apologized and took the bowl. It wasn't their fault so it's no big deal.We ended up ordering the shrimp shumai for an appetizer and the UIC sushi roll. Both pictures are attached. :) The shumai was tasty. It was a little more expensive considering the small amount, but it wasn't terribly expensive. The green onions on top worked well with it. The plating was also nice. The UIC sushi roll was okay. The sides of it were thicker than I would have liked though. There is a picture attached to show what I'm talking about. It tasted good though. Once I took out the avocado, it tasted even better. (I'm not a fan of avocado)Overall, it was a nice visit. Kind and quick service, okay food, and nice look. I'll definitely be back again to try their noodles and lunch bentos. :)

51.description: I live right next door to this restaurant, and my roommates and I always order sushi to go from there when we want something light to eat. If you're a UIC student and show your ID while purchasing, a 6 piece California roll is only $4.50! Can't beat that price for fresh sushi. Great atmosphere, prices, and food. Highly recommend.

27.description: My dinner at Kohan was the best meal I had during my visit in Chicago. Let's start with the service.  The hostess/waitress was attentive throughout our dinning experience. She got our orders quickly, and the food came shortly after. The free miso soup was perfect to wet our appetite during the short wait for our dinner. My friend and I ordered Wakame (seaweed) salad, vegetable udon noodles, Mexico City roll, and Young Dragon (eel) roll. The sushi rolls came out beautifully!   The eel roll had a delicate touch of a fresh orchid flower, and the Mexico City roll was plated on top of a green mayo sauce. My eyes were pleased with the presentation, and my belly was satisfied with the taste.   The fish in the Mexico City roll was fresh that it melted in my mouth. I'm not a big fan of eel due to its fishy taste/smell, but the sweet sauce masked it really well.  The vegetable udon had plenty of vegetables making it a very substantial dish.  My friend and I were very pleased with our food and service. We ate everything, and I would definitely come back to Kohan the next time I'm in Chicago!

32.description: Come to Kohan to try out their lunch specials which is from 11:30 am - 4:00 pm from monday-saturday. Quick service.

54.description: I came in expecting a sushi lunch buffet but had to discover they discontinued. No biggie. I went for the bento boxes that rounded to $7. It was pretty good. For the price the portions are doable, don't expect to get a mouth kicking salad and fruits when served. The salad didn't really have enough dressing for my taste. Service changed again due to new waitresses. It was a clumsy experience. I stood by the door waiting a bit just to be seated. The place wasn't even that crowded...

48.description: Kohan is perfect! Their desserts are delicious and their Maki is deliciously flavored. The server was really nice, she even gave us wine suggestions. I am glad we went there and will continue to be a Kohan customer! During lunch, try their lunch special - it is so good! The decor is beautiful too and everyone is so kind!

44.description: Had lunch specials there twice and they were so good! Lots of food for a reasonable price.

24.description: I came here on a Tuesday with one of my friends. We got there 10 minutes before 10pm and it is stated that they close at 11pm. So we were seated and right away the lady that sat us said "order fast" so we order and at 10:20pm they had turned everything off and the owner or manger was just staring at us impatiently. I get that you have to close but it wasn't even close to 11. The food was good but the customer service was horrible!!

7.description: Crab crunch (not on menu)YH makiW3 RollAwesome food my favorite sushi in chicago!

49.description: This was our first time dining at Kohan Japanese Restaurant. It has a menu for Korean food as well as sushi and Japanese cuisine. We decided on having the Love Boat which is a good deal in theory. The chicken was okay, the Kalbi was better, the tempura was nice, the california rolls were typical, and the miso soup were average. I do like how they gave us free hot tea, since they usually charge for hot tea. I thought that was a nice touch. We also had a spider roll which I thought was not bad. It tasted good not too crunchy not too soft.  Overall the restaurant experience was okay.  Since they cater more to a college group, their restaurant is not equipped to cater to couples who have babies. I would go back someday to perhaps try their Korean dishes and more of their sushi rolls. I would not get the love boat again because not everything on there was great and worth the price.

40.description: I have to change my review.  I go here for lunch on a regular basis, and their lunch specials are definitely one of the best in the area.  I don't know where else you can get a sushi bento box or hibachi bento box for under $10!  And seriously... it's A LOT of food.  I'm always stuffed afterwards!If you're in the mood for dessert, you MUST order the Mango Express! BEST. DESSERT. EVER.  It's vanilla ice-cream wrapped in pound cake and mango strips and fried.  Man, just typing this is making me want it!I bring my newborn baby here with me every time and staff is always so courteous and accommodating. It isn't easy lugging around a stroller in Chicago, but Kohan is always so welcoming.  It's definitely one of my favorite lunch spots in University Village and I'll continue to dine there for lunch!

53.description: So we're locals to this sushi restaurant. We've ordered out and dined in. When dining in- they do have a happy hour special which makes their prices more pocket friendly. The service was good when we were there. And when we ordered out, the timing was reasonable as well. Their rolls are good. Nothing to write home about, but we definitely have frequented kohan on more than one occasion.

30.description: Came here a second time and enjoyed it much more. The double dragon and the alaskan roll make this place worth coming back to. My server was friendly and attentive as well.

46.description: Just came out of the restaurant. Didnt catch the waitress's name but she was a thick hispanic girl.. I asked her if the ramen on the menu was japanese ramen or korean ramen, she said japanese so I ordered it.When I got it it was korean ramen... exactly NOT what I wanted.. I have a 5 pack of those I got for 5 bucks at home......  WHY would you tell me something that you didn't even know for sure??!!! You can't just make stuff up about the food you're serving!!

1.description: The rice on the rools come warm! That is so delicious!Got the Volcano, philly Crunch and the W3! Couldnt figure which one was better!Service was also one of the best things here!Gonna come back for sure!

55.description: Late lunch date with the girlfriend on the patio. We had their sushi bento box and couple other sashimis and an yakisoba noodles.Our server was super nice and cheerful. Their food is good and their interior decoration is also very pretty. (it's not your typical Asian in your face kind of deco) which i liked very much.Will come here again.

9.description: My first review, I wasn't too happy with my yakiudon, but the tens of times I've come here after school has been great so far. Their shrimp tempura udon noodle soup is great. The broth is a little spicy. All their nigiri and sushi is always fresh. What i love most is their uic discount and sushi lunch bento. It's affordable and comes with a choice of two rolls (or three preselected nigiri), two cucumber lollipops, fruit, shumai, and salad. Most recently i brought a friend here to let her try sushi for the first time, and she certainly wasn't disappointed.

26.description: First time I came here was with my boyfriend a few years ago for dinner. Sitting outdoors is always nice. And that was probably the only positive about this experience. My boyfriend always orders sashimi, since he's not big on rolls (rice). He felt sick a couple of weeks after this dinner. I'm a veggie, and although I felt fine health wise, the taste was just mediocre. Overall, the food seems over priced.Came here for a second time with a friend a couple of weeks ago late night, last minute. Sat outdoors again, and I guess that option always makes up for a lot of things. One of my sushi rolls were so loose, the rice began to fall apart when the plate was presented in front of me. Taste wise was okay. Nothing has really improved.

25.description: Beyond disappointing.  Went on a weekday and the place is almost empty but had a long wait for our food.  Strange.Now the food...even more strange. They put "mayo-based" sauce on Seabass....yike!  It might have been an attempt to cover the poor quality of the fish. The ramen was ridiculous.  It is "packaged" noodles (49 cents) cooked with leftover Korean BBQ beef and spinach - and they charge $14 for it!  I ordered Japanese Ramen, NOT "instant noodles".  We eat out a lot and this is the worst thus far.

12.description: Last week, my friends and I were at Kohan Japanese Restaurants on Maxwell Street, Chicago for the first time. OMG!!!! The food and the service was excellent. The server recommended Spicy Edamame and Firecracker Shrimp for appetizer.  If you like spicy food, you need to try their  spicy edamame. The Firecracker tiger shrimp was excellent. And their makis were outstanding especially their W3. It came lit on fire to our table and we enjoyed the aroma of the lemon. It was warm, creamy, and so good.I have been to many Japanese restaurants. I think I have found my favorite sushi restaurant in Chicago. Excellent Japanese cuisine!

59.description: I had the lunch buffet. I paid the extra $6 (a total of $13.95) to include the All-You-Can-Eat maki. Here's a quick run-down (before I dive in deeper and do a more substantive review) - choices were small, food was lukewarm, limited maki choices (with too much rice - couldn't really taste the sushi inside).The only redeeming factor about this place is the service - the waitress and waiter were prompt, polite, and attentive. Now the details...Negative:- only 8 choices (udon yaki, veggie fried rice, friend dumpling, chicken teriyaki, bulgogi, fried chicken cutlet, kimchi, egg casserole, pineapple + orange slices). - you get sick of the selection after one round- maki choices were limited...very very limited- the maki's had WAY TOO MUCH rice- the place was sort of deadPositive:- the serviceI suppose at UIC there aren't that many great sushi or Korean BBQ choices. Despite their excellent service,  I was sorely disappointed by Kohan. I'll probably never return - thus the lowly two-star rating. Sorry. =(

21.description: When you order ramen at a Japanese restaurant, you don't expect to get literally instant ramen. I was charged $12 for a small bowl of instant ramen, with a little chicken, and one egg. Ridiculous. Any restaurant willing to scam on instant ramen is a restaurant I am not comfortable supporting.

17.description: Skip this place. Ordered the $25 chef's choice sushi for lunch. Chef chose 2 pieces salmon, 2 pieces of tuna, 2 pieces of escolar, a piece of ika, uni, and egg.I didn't finish my meal. Spit the ika back into a napkin after chewing on it for what seemed like forever. There was something wrong with the tuna so I didn't eat the second piece. The uni I took a bite of and decided not to eat the rest. Overall it was the worst sushi experience I've ever had.

10.description: A pretty good lunch of sushi for just the right price. Fish quality was okay, nigiri were fine but nothing to scream about. I would happily go back.

5.description: This is our go to sushi place in the neighborhood and I am a frequent sushi consumer.  The fish is tasty and fresh every time.  Premium maki rolls are my favorite: Alaskan, Green Ninja Turtle, Chicago, W3 roll, Dragon and Caterpillar.  My kids also like the ramen here as well as the sushi.  They request to eat here every week! Cute and great location on Maxwell Street in our neighborhood.  Great service!

3.description: So we had the Love boat! It was delish!! Such a beautiful presentation! I came here with my 8 yr old 7 yer old and 1 yr old. The staff was sooo welcoming! I felt so comfortable. The miso soup is very warming! The place is cozy and very clean. Great food for a good price our check was $42 and change and I felt it was a great price for all that food! So polite and so understanding of customers with kids!

35.description: Happy New Year's from Kohan Japanese Restaurant!I have mixed emotions about KJR; The service was eager but SO painfully slow. I went with all of my siblings and our respective spouses. Everyone but my painfully caucasian boyfriend ordered sushi- my fish fearing other half ordered a chicken dish. His dish came out a good half hour before the rest of ours.I would understand if they  had understaffed, not expecting a group of 8 to flood their sushi chef with orders on a pretty slow night (it was empty) except that I had reservations from the day before! I forgive their ill-practiced hospitality because the food was oh so delicious. The ambiance was beautiful with softly glowing strung lights and tasteful decor. Will return, albeit with a smaller group!:)

19.description: I have to change my review.  I go here for lunch on a regular basis, and their lunch specials are definitely one of the best in the area.  I don't know where else you can get a sushi bento box or hibachi bento box for under $10!  And seriously... it's A LOT of food.  I'm always stuffed afterwards!If you're in the mood for dessert, you MUST order the Mango Express! BEST. DESSERT. EVER.  It's vanilla ice-cream wrapped in pound cake and mango strips and fried.  Man, just typing this is making me want it!I bring my newborn baby here with me every time and staff is always so courteous and accommodating. It isn't easy lugging around a stroller in Chicago, but Kohan is always so welcoming.  It's definitely one of my favorite lunch spots in University Village and I'll continue to dine there for lunch!

28.description: Ok I might be biased but kohan is my favorite sushi joint in Chicago. I have been a regular for maybe 6 years now... Well until I moved to Florida But even Florida has not stopped me from getting my sushi. I get back to Chicago about every 2 months and kohan is on my list for a late lunch or dinner.  My daughter and her friends 18-19yrs old have been regulars there since they got their drivers licenses at 16 (they still live in Chicago) they have been going with me since they were 13 I only mention my daughter and her friends because they all "hated" sushi until I took them there and now they are sushi snobs. I hate shitcago but I love the food and kohan's While it's been less than 2 weeks I am craving the orange yellowtail.  See you soon.

45.description: Love this place! I've had great service and amazing food on 2 visits. Week day lunch specials are great value. Can't wait to come back again. A little on the pricy side for dinner but it's worth it.

33.description: Went here on a whim, expecting it to be at least decent. We went to the restaurant at around lunchtime and it was empty when we got seated. We were the only two there except for one other person. We were seated fairly quickly and our orders were taken in a prompt manner. The service itself was adequate but the food was not. My girlfriend ordered the Yaki Soba with combo tempura. The noodles were bland and the tempura was very basic. The worst part of the dish was the portion size it was basically 75% plate and 25% noodles. I ordered the Ramen expecting it somewhat be fresh but I LITERALLY got instant Ramen. I saw the crinkles of the noodle cake and everything.

43.description: i've gone here twice with my sister so far, twice for take out and once to dine in. The food at kohan is average i would say and a bit pricy. The premium rolls are good, but on par to what you would get at another sushi place. We also got the california rolls and that was just so-so. Our server was new at the time i think so when he gave us our food it was a bit awkward and confused. We ended up ordering one more of the premium rolls and dessert as well, but they ended us giving us our dessert first which was kinda awkward to eat then eat more sushi but it was okay. The people there are also very nice. The decor is very abstract and culturally modern i love it! As for the food it is so-so.

2.description: Honestly the best place within walking distance of UIC campus I've found for Sushi & Korean! I'm going to be coming back a lot, I can tell. ( ´ o ` )ﾉThey also have a student discount, which is great! The portions are really nice too. The first time I came I didn't think the lunch sushi bento would fill me up, so I ordered an extra roll. I was wrong! I ended up having to take a roll with me to the library. (Best snack ever)

18.description: Ok I might be biased but kohan is my favorite sushi joint in Chicago. I have been a regular for maybe 6 years now... Well until I moved to Florida But even Florida has not stopped me from getting my sushi. I get back to Chicago about every 2 months and kohan is on my list for a late lunch or dinner.  My daughter and her friends 18-19yrs old have been regulars there since they got their drivers licenses at 16 (they still live in Chicago) they have been going with me since they were 13 I only mention my daughter and her friends because they all "hated" sushi until I took them there and now they are sushi snobs. I hate shitcago but I love the food and kohan's While it's been less than 2 weeks I am craving the orange yellowtail.  See you soon.

41.description: Chef Kim really creates a great plate.  I had a variety of nigiri that was all very fresh. You have to try the Tobiko with tuna rice and sesame its wonderful.

52.description: Been here a couple of times, I really like the interior and the ambiance, it's pretty modern and really nicely kept. I don't think they get a lot of business though because every time I've been there, it was nearly empty with only maybe one or two other parties there :( It's also located in UIC's university village, so the prices may be too steep for most college kids :(But as far as food, it's nice, clean, and tasty! :) I've never been disappointed with their food thus far. The owners are Korean, I believe, so they've incorporated a lot of Korean cuisine into the menu, which I can really appreciate. Their lunch buffet is also really great!

50.description: Great foods and good service, been there couple times and they were pretty busy. Recommend their " Lunch Special"

4.description: My coworkers and I play a game where we put down two locations around Maxwell for lunch, and we randomly draw one to go. Being the new kid on the block, naturally mine got chosen and we got to go to Kohan, and overall, it's not bad, but not fantastic either.The restaurant is large with plenty of space (assuming for the students when they return in the Fall). We were seated by the window indoors, which made for a great ambiance while we chatted and enjoyed our meal. There was only one server during lunch hour, but it's no big deal when there isn't a large crowd to oversee.Kohan serves up Japanese and Korean fair. That in itself would be an indication that it doesn't necessarily excel in one or the other. To be fair, our lunch bentous (roughly $10) was not a bad deal either and I'd recommend them for someone coming in on a weekday. You get a small miso soup, salad, vegetable gyozas (the standouts), and two main orders that vary from tempura to sushi. I got a salmon roll along with a shrimp tempura roll, and both were decent enough. The tempura wasn't the crispiest, but I've had worse elsewhere.All in all, Kohan does a good job and delivering basic Japanese and Korean fair. I'd come back to try some of the more elaborate rolls available since they look enormous!So while it's not the greatest sushi you'll find in Chicago, it's a solid choice for UIC students and seafood fanatics.

6.description: This place is frugal with you Benton box and sushi.  Ive gone twice and no one's in there.  Maybe if they didn't skimp on portions, they might get business.  Honestly,  I don't see how they stay open.  All I can say is stingy and over-priced.  Haven't gone back and disappointed.

22.description: I LOVE this place. There's always a table and I've liked all the food we've ordered. The soda is super bland and generic tasting, but that's just another reason to order a beer. They accommodate special requests and are helpful in describing anything you might not be familiar with. A stand-out in the neighborhood.

15.description: Love this place. Has the best sushi ever. A bit on the pricey side, but worth it. Love the yh, caterpillar, mango maki and the calamari and the Jalapeño bomb!Would I come back: every week!

57.description: i'd bet a winning lottery ticket the people that do not like this place are the types of people that 1) hate dolphins, 2) think sashimi, sushi, maki, and tofu are the same thing, and 3) cannot solve an easy sudoku puzzle...ive been to many of "the best" sushi places in Chicago... the trendy Sunda, Japonais, Sushi Samba to name a few... as well as i have dared the "all you can eat sushi" deals which i would typically advise against as a seasoned sushi consumer... i've even explored many neighborhood notables (from lincoln park, to wicker park, to andersonville...) best sushi spots and Kohan is the ONLY sushi place in Chicago i frequent on sometimes a weekly basis (and i don't even live near here anymore)! this is one of few places the restaurant owner recognizes me and my boyfriend... even half of my family nowwinning attributes: the food quality is SUPERB for starters. no matter what you get it is 99% likely to taste amazing. pricing is more than fair. parking is $2 in the garage. service is consistently friendly and relatively quick. HERE i converted my mother, an anti-raw fish/sushi-phobe, into a sushi lover. GUIDEBOOK ON HOW TO DINE HERE: any one here that complains about price doesn't do sushi right... i come here weekly after many of my workouts and get basic maki rolls which are not only guilt-free but cheaper than getting a roll at whole foods and 1000x better. finding the right balance of satiation and compatible budgeting for all audiences will be easier with these guidelines:hungry date on a tight budget: start with miso soup $1.50 and edamame $3, if starving like you have been fasting for 40 days in a desert get a basic maki roll or 2 which ranges from $5-9 (i recommend philedelphia, calamari tempura, or spicy tuna...) or even the veggie maki which is only $4-6... then pick one premium maki to SHARE which ranges from about $8-20... my fav on the economical side is the UIC roll, YH maki, or Osaka Flame each less than $13.... so for 2 people: 2 soups, edamame, 2 basic maki, 1 econ premium maki = roughly $25 before tax... plenty of food... you spend even less if you show your student id to get the discountfor the gluttons: if you are the type of person that feels perpetually hungry even after a few rolls of sushi and wind up going out for a fast food burger to seal the deal try getting the Bibimbap rice dish on the side which comes with miso soup... only $10 and enough to fill 2 people up without any help from any sushihopeless romantics: impress your date with a large house sake...i think it's less than $10... you won't get hungover like normal booze because it doesn't have the sulfates to wreak such havoc... or go on friday and get half price martinis at $5 and try the saketini (id stick with the sakes if you are like me and dont prefer sweet drinks)... the pricier sakes are wonderful if you wanna splurge... if you go for desserts they are not only delicious but beautifully crafted - sure to impress... or ya the premium W3! roll that comes to your table on fire is a show-stopper! (see the pics i posted)sushi fanatics: there really isn't one premium maki i have tried that isnt AMAZING. i have never had a better volcano roll anywhere. many unique creative rolls not typical to a sushi menu like sunflower, mexico city, or ninja turtle are worth the venture. other faves i haven't already discussed include double dragon, maxwell street (this one is a mouthful!), or langosta loca will not dissappoint.other veterans: does any else miss the many Chicago themed maki rolls as much as me?! the cubs v white sox rolls with the blue v black dressings. the bulls rolls. etc. ah i miss these! ps this is a good place to watch the bulls games...

20.description: My wife and I decided on Kohan last minute and we're really glad we did. The owners were extremely hospitable and the service was incredibly fast. The sushi was great and as good as any of the other places I've been in Chicago. They were priced very fairly with the standard rolls being only $6 for 8 pieces and the specialty rolls only ranging from $10-16 for 8. The 5 stars is mostly for the service and great food for a reasonable price .

36.description: Love love love this place! Every time I go back home, it's a must! W3 all day way! With a couple of glasses of Green teanis! All rolls are fantastic! Their fried rice is amazing! Chicken and salmon teriyaki also! Always recommend and bring my out of town friends here! Service is awesome!

14.description: Great lunch specials! I havent tried sushi yet but everything else i ordered was fresh and tasty so far. My favourite is Korean beef. The service is fast, and the ambiant is very calm. Oh and the waitress was really nice and kind.

29.description: I love this kind of little no-frills diner and the old-school charm it exudes.I enjoyed an Eppel's Combo #1 omelette, which came loaded with bacon, sausage, ham, mushrooms, green peppers and onion. The accompanying hash browns were cooked well but bland, nothing a little salt and Cholula couldn't fix. And I loved that they had marble rye toast, perfectly toasted and buttered. It was a lot of food for $9.05, and fortunately I finished it all cos I was headed to a 200-wine trade tasting in the city and needed hearty sustenance.

42.description: Supposedly, this place is been around for 20 yrs, I would have never known until my girlfriend found it on yelp this morning. I was excited and hungry after looking at their menu online and had already decided to order skirt steak skillet with hashbrowns and eggs before I even walked in the place.Service was excellent, we got seated and was offered a beverage rightaway. I ordered coffee which was nothing special. My steak had no taste and neither did my hashbrowns . Only the egs were cooked perfectly. I used tons of tobasco sauce but still didn't enjoy .so I left it after a few bites . My girlfriend pancakes and cornbeef was not good either . So 28 plus 4 dollar tip breakfast was expensive for food that didn't taste good.We didn't like it but maybe you will so go try and be the judge yourself.

23.description: Small, no frills, good breakfast restaurant.  The coffee was delicious and the breakfast was good too.  I had the crepe breakfast with eggs, sausage & crepes.  The eggs were cooked the way I like, the sausage was delicious, if a bit greasy.  The crepes, while they were doused in syrup along with the apples it was good.  I prefer fresh fruit, not the syrupy sweet fruit they offer, but I was shocked how good they were.  The service was attentive, there's parking in the back.  Overall a good breakfast.  Nothing amazing, no frills, but a good local breakfast option.

47.description: It's a diner people.  The food is decent, hot and cheap.  There is one  great exception though... if you love pancakes, and you love bananas, and you are in good enough shape (heart and sugar level wise), then you HAVE TO TRY Eppel's Bananas Fosters pancakes.  They are heavenly delicious, but have to be horribly fattening.  They are drenched in butter, sugar, pecans, bananas, and overall goodness.  It's so sweet, its like a dessert, but its fabulous.  I find the meal version of this to be too much, but you can ask to have your side pancakes "bananas fostered" and they'll do it.   Try it!  I've never had anything like it anywhere else.   I also really enjoy their skillets.   Keep up the good work Eppel's!!

8.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE eppels! We normally go here almost everyday for breakfast. It is a small diner with a great staff. The food is amazing at a great price. You have to try their pancakes which makes you smile.

31.description: Lynn is by far my favorite waitress in the WORLD!!  My husband and I have been going to Eppel's for breakfast with our families for years and she is the reason we continue to go back!  The mini waffles on the side are also an added bonus...along with their attention to getting your order just the way you want it- which seems so simple, but in most breakfast restaurant that do not do that.

34.description: Yum, Yum, Yummy! A great diner, much better than White Castle right down the street. Who needs to be on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives to be awesome? Not this place. Had Pumpkin pancakes that were so delicious they didn't require any butter or syrup, and the Irish Benny- Eggs Benedict with corned beef hash instead of canadian bacon. So delicious. Our server was a cutie and always kept our coffees full, the key to any good diner service!

16.description: I love Eppel's. 4 stars based on portion size, cost, and quickness. Nothing says good diner like it being quick and good and cheap!  I grab lunch from there a lot, as I work nearby, and my food is always ready quickly! And everyone is so nice there. I'm not saying this is like eating and some crazy James Beard award winning place. It's good ole classic diner food and it's yummy in the tummy! I even prefer it over the acclaimed White Palace which is just a block away.

13.description: I went here for the first time today and I absolutely LOVED it!!! Lynn was our waitress and she was amazing and super friendly!  The prices are great and the portions are big! I had the pot roast it was served with carrots and mashed potatoes, it was delicious. The restaurant also has outdoor seating and its located by many stores like Target, Burlington, Victoria secret ect... Definitely will be going back... Thank you Lynn for a great experience!!!

11.description: This is a great little place for breakfast in a good location with plenty of parking!  The photos are accurate.  Everything we ordered was great and service was too.  I will return the next time in Chicago.

39.description: I love having breakfast at Eppel's with family and friends. It's simply a great diner with really good and fresh food. I love taking it slow here (having coffee after my meal).

37.description: I've been here 2 times for breakfast and both times left pretty satisfied. The portions are large and the prices are pretty reasonable. I actually like coming here better than White Palace. It's smaller, quieter, and food is good. They're not open 24 hours but personally I don't really crave breakfast at 2am.Come here for no-nonsense food at affordable prices.

0.description: Many of the "trendy" breakfast places have long lines and high prices.  Eppel's gets the job done - and what else do you need for breakfast, anyway?Great omelets & skillets, and the pancakes are fluffy and filling.And the waitresses are extremely entertaining.  And who doesn't need a smile on their face in the morning?A terrific place.

38.description: I love this place for a few reasons.  The service has always been fantastic.  Every time I go the wait staff makes me feel like a regular (which there are clearly plenty of regulars).  The service alone wins me over, but wait, there's more.The food is good for a greasy spoon.  It isn't a fancy place it is an every town USA diner.  They do the classics well and some twists.  I would recommend going here over White Palace which is just around the corner. Prices here are very reasonable compared to the city average.Plus they always keep your coffee full.

51.description: This place has been here for over 20 years and I never knew it existed, how freakin weird huh? I guess it's because its right between a line of stores and that they close early as hell that's why. Well I came here with my mother one day. I had the Denver omelet, it was a decent size with a lot of ingredients, nice and fluffy too and not very oily. It came with a side of waffles, but it was mini waffles, kinda like the leggo my eggo type of waffles. The coffee was nice and fresh and service was great. The owner was very friendly as well. The check wasn't too pricey either. So I probably would come again.I kept fighting with my mother about when this place was opened. I kept thinking that it was opened recently, but my mom insisted that it's been opened for quite some time. So she asked the owner, and the owner said they've been in business for over 20 years. Boy did I feel stupid.

27.description: Not as good as it used to be. Went in for breakfast and to wait for local store to open. Omelet was dry, overcooked and bland. Mushrooms came out of a can. Eggs tasted like egg beaters on a bad day. Won't come back again...

32.description: Remembering a story about Eppel's on the TV a few months ago, we stopped by this morning.  (It happened to be Father's Day, and they were very busy.)  There is a large choice of food on Eppel's menu, and we had pork chops with 2 eggs, toast, and rice pilaf; and steak with 2 eggs, toast, and hash browns.  Each meal was cooked well and the portions were very generous (on big plates) - each was like two meals in one!  And our waitress, Bernice, was smiling and friendly and cheerful, so we had a good experience.

54.description: Just came back from brunch at Eppel's.  My little brothers live in University Village and one of them is a regular here.  Thought I was Ed Debevic's with the service we got here.  The waitresses don't wear name tags so I can't tell you who to watch out for.  She wanted to practically take our order as soon as we sat down and looked annoyed when we told her we needed more time.  Then she comes back and rushes us through our order,"Come on guys."  And when we asked for hot sauce we never got it and then eventually had to get the bus boy to bring it over.  Other waitresses and wait staff were very friendly and helpful except our middle aged bleach blond excuse for a waitress.  Ok, I'm done.  On to the food...The food is definitely cheap and decent breakfast food.  Had the cornbeef hash which fit the bill, slightly crisp on the outside.  Hashbrowns were big buttery mounds of potatoes that melted in my mouth.

48.description: Our family enjoys Eppel's for breakfast.  You can get a heart healthy breakfast here---egg white omelet that tastes good.Our service has always been OK, but friendly.Skillets are available.It's just diner food, nothing particulary good nor bad.But reliable.

44.description: Go their more than twice, and they know who you are. I love this place. Try to get taken care of by Lynn, waitress extraordinaire. She is truly amazing, and great to talk to. She is, far and away, the best thing about this place, and the reason to come here over and over.

24.description: So it was breakfast time and I wanted it. I was in the neighborhood and thought this would be a great place to eat. I had simple breakfast, how could you go wrong, but I did. The bacon was hard, the grits were hard and the eggs were hard. I think everything is cooked to be hard, Lol. Idk about you guys but I like my food soft and hot not hard and cold. I will not be going back!

7.description: I like the at-home/diner feel of Eppel's. It's been around forever and they keep it simple with a good variety breakfast options. There's nothing fancy on the menu but they do cater to all types of meat eaters with beef, pork, turkey, chicken and liver products and of course the vegetarian. I've tried the bananas foster crepe, French toast, eggs and turkey sausage patties. The crepes were massive. So much food came out I wasn't sure who was going to help me finish my breakfast.
