The bananas, nuts and syrup were like sensory overload BUT it was all delicious. On another visit, I was really pleased with my French toast too. It was light and I could really taste the egg from the batter (I love eggs!). All this food on the cheap is a win for me... and it comes out quickly.There's nothing fancy about the restaurant itself either. There are a bunch of booths, counter space with stools and a few tables. The service is okay. If you order coffee someone is USUALLY around to refill. My first visit I was offered refills perhaps a tad too often and on my second visit I had to hunt my server down. There's parking in the back with a back entrance, so you don't have to worry about paying the city of Chicago for parking or worry about getting a ticket.

49.description: This place is just a plain old diner, which is sometimes (or often) just what you want!  I hadn't even planned on going but was starving after a visit to Home Depot.  I had the tuna club and a cup of soup.  Very standard, very good.  Great service.  I'll be back!

40.description: This place has been around since I could remember and its a great family owned breakfast spot. Parking can  be a bit of a challenge, but the food is worth a little aggravation.

53.description: Honestly I only came in here because I was waiting for a store to open and I hadn't had breakfast yet.  And I'm glad I did.Great Mom n' Pop style breakfast eatery.  No frils, sit down. eat breakfast. Yum Yum. Done.  No standing in line for hours to try the newest whatever whathave you over-priced crap.  Our waitress was awesome.  I asked her how their grits were, and she brought over a little dish. So I told her that's so great and she is so awesome but tell me, how is the bacon here? Har har, lollzzz, but no I didn't get free bacon.

30.description: 5 stars for the Stuffed Bananas Foster Waffle, stuffed=bacon in the batter.As Clark W. Griswold said in Christmas vacation, "Hallelujah! Holy Shit!"

46.description: I like this place a lot. It's basically diner food but for the price, I think the food and service are really great. They have the best buttermilk biscuits I've had in this city, and they serve grits, and there is something really wholesome about the whole experience. I've never had to wait to sit down here. Food is always delivered fast. They have those flavored coffee creamers. Ha! Everyone here is pretty warm and sweet. It reminds me of when I use to go to the Golden Angel in Lincoln Square, but Eppel's has grits.

1.description: This is an iconic diner that has been here through neighborhood changes. The service is friendly and exactly what you'd expect from a diner. They flip tables quickly with barely enough time to wipe it down between guests. In fact, we were seated at a dirty table that was cleaned after we sat down.The menu is HUGE; however, I barely found anything I wanted. Finally, after reading through every page, I settled on the spinach pie... and they didn't have it. So then I got the Greek Salad. The Greek Salad comes with sardines. I like canned sardines so I figured that I'd like them on this salad. NOPE. These were very fishy and crusted with salt. Everything they touched (lettuce, tomatoes, whatever) tasted like them. It was a unique experience for me to dislike a salad SO MUCH.I saw my friends' orders and they didn't entice me either; however, they really enjoyed their food. I don't think that Eppel's has healthy menu options. It's probably not their thing and that's okay; however, given the size of the menu it would have been nice to have something.I'll take a pass on Eppel's the next time my friends want to go out but I think it's good for some folks. If you like old fashioned, diner food then this probably a home run for you.

55.description: Nice, clean and cheap.  I loved my eggs and sausage plate.  Good service.  Yee Haw.

9.description: Love this place! Food portions are very generous, the service is great, in fact if you call in your order ahead they'll have it ready within minutes for sit down service. Love their waffles and their Denver omelet, and their cheeseburgers...so good!!! Parking can be an issue, they have a couple slots in the back but other than that you're at the mercy of street parking. Seating is tight, eat your food and go!

26.description: My favorite little breakfast diner. We come here all the time and service is consistently good. They greet you at the door and seat you right away. The staff works well together and makes you laugh by joking around. The food is excellent and has a wide variety of breakfast selections. I always leave full and happy. My go-to meal there is the country fried steak, scrambled eggs with American cheese, hashbrowns and pancakes. Oh I love this place and will be going there today. Come check it out if you like a local, comfy, good food, good service breakfast joint!

25.description: Can become crowded on weekends, but the staff/servers work quickly and move patrons in and out at a good rate.  The food is good and reasonably priced. I have only eaten from the breakfast menu but  they offer some lunch and dinner items on the menu which is nice.

12.description: Tried this place accidentally and I must say it was for the better. Great coffee , fantastic food and very good customer service!

21.description: One of my favorite diners in the city. Try the skillets, huge portions.

17.description: The best elderly woman served our table with the most enthusiastic attitude. Beats STL's Denny's or Courtesy Diner any day.

10.description: Amazing service here you can feel the love, they are friendly it really feels good to come to this place time after time.

5.description: When I first saw this place from the outside, I was like, "wow, what a dump." Not so much inside. It's nice and cozy inside. We went here for brunch, so we got omelets. They weren't fluffy at all, which was a let down. The portions are huge and the service was good. Prices were very reasonable. Worth swinging by if you need brunch, are in the area, and don't want to wait.

3.description: Came here for breakfast and this charming location is easy to miss. I loved the waffles, pancakes, and more (mini feast). Everything was great, if it was in a more accessible location I would go weekly.

35.description: Great service. Great food. The banana foster pancakes are great,best pancakes I've ever had. Highly recommended.

19.description: Small, no frills, good breakfast restaurant.  The coffee was delicious and the breakfast was good too.  I had the crepe breakfast with eggs, sausage & crepes.  The eggs were cooked the way I like, the sausage was delicious, if a bit greasy.  The crepes, while they were doused in syrup along with the apples it was good.  I prefer fresh fruit, not the syrupy sweet fruit they offer, but I was shocked how good they were.  The service was attentive, there's parking in the back.  Overall a good breakfast.  Nothing amazing, no frills, but a good local breakfast option.

28.description: We go here often, and the staff are very responsive to our requests. We only go there for breakfast, pancakes are very good, and they usually make the eggs they way we like them. Coffee is good as well. Good to go to a place where the waitresses are friendly.

45.description: It's like going to a small town diner  in the center of Chicago.   There's always a booth available.   Their staff make me feel like they know me from the minute that I walk in.....like I'm coming home.   The waitress remembers what I ordered the last time I was there.   ...by the way, I love their scrambled eggs with bits of ham.   Before you're finished with your tea or coffee, the waitress is bringing refills over and over....  It's a comfortable  and friendly oasis in the bustling city.

33.description: I have been coming here for many years and The food and service is always great. My dad even comes here on Sundays for breakfast and he lives in Dekalb, Illinois. I saw them on CHICAGO'S BEST and I was so happy that they were finally getting some television recognition. EVERONE needs to stop in for a meal. I love the creamy chicken soup and ALL of the BREAKFAST foods!!!!!

43.description: I gotta say this is a great unassuming breakfast spot.  Were it not for Yelp, I'd have never had any idea that there was a great diner in this block of stores.  Decent service, decent food, great price.

2.description: I went to this place for brunch and it was great! It is a cozy little diner that is nothing fancy but has great food.  I ordered the New Orleans style shrimp and grits and I have to say it was really good! With my shrimp and grits It also came with eggs, and pancakes too! I couldn't believe I got so much foo for the price! it was great! I will definitely be back.

18.description: I love this place I always get good breakfast and good service I couldn't ask for anything more

41.description: A great little family owned restaurant in the South Loop.Breakfast done the way breakfast should be done. Service is good and one of the owners is usually there to greet you.Fair pricing on all items and the place is always clean.If you go, I recommend the Huevos Chilequiles or any of their omelets.

52.description: So, last week ended up being a pretty bad restaurant week for me. Mediocrity everywhere, and it was capped off with a shitty Sunday breakfast at Eppel's.As mentioned in my previous review, I've been eating at this place for YEARS. Today I take a friend who's never been. I'm raving about this place, right?So we happen to be placed in the section of a server named April. Who "honey" "sugar" and "baby"'ed us to death...and then had the nerve to try to rush us the hell out of there. Rude as hell.Mind you, I'm not a "table squatter." My foodie friends and I are all too sophisticated for that. On a snowy afternoon when it was positively unbusy and NO ONE was waiting for that table, I was absolutely flabbergasted that this server would come over to my dining companion and I and say, "I'm not trying to be rude but..." and ask us to move it a long. Skedaddle. Buh-bye.First, April, yeah. You WERE trying to be rude.Second. Trying to rush us out proves you're inexperienced, classless and tactless.Third, being that rude and bitchy was a guarantee that you killed your tip AND just for that, how about we're gonna stay an extra half-hour and make you serve us coffee the whole time, because you know what? We're.Not.Done.Yet.The owner (who DID recognize me) came over and apologized and told us to stay as long as we wanted. Even he was like, "Hello? We're not even busy today..."In all the years I've been patronizing this place, I've never been treated like that even when it WAS busy. I cannot stand shitty, patronizing service anywhere, let alone what is essentially a cheap diner.I stand by the fact that the food is good -- convenient location, inexpensive, decent, comfort food. I still think you should go.Just don't sit in April's section. In fact, you should ask who April is and where her section is just so that you know NOT to be seated there.

50.description: My husband and I agree, worst meal we ever had in Chicago. We went to the Flea Market this afternoon and followed up with a meal at Eppels. Upon entering, our waitress was in an all-out argument with a man in a suit, supposedly he though his lemonade was a free re-fill... he thought wrong and she let him know it. She was so pissed I thought she was gonna yell at us. I ordered the "cod salad" which arrived at the table not as a salad but as a cod (which wasnt that bad) mashed pot with gravy that was similar to KFC but worse, and the "fresh greens" it was supposed to come with was over watered canned green beans that- tasted like water. He got the fish fry and the fish was so fried it was almost hard to eat. His fries tasted like freezer burn that were fried. We're not high class people, i'd be the first to admit it, but this shit was disgusting. I dont know, maybe the breakfast is their forte, but after this lunch, I wont be going back to try it. And by the way, two dishes at this place costs us $21+ 3.00 tip= Over priced!!!

4.description: This place feels like home ... They waitresses are very friendly and treat u like family ... The food is always on point ... Def one on my favorite breakfast places in Chicago

6.description: Been hearing about this place for a while so I had to try it out I ordered a Philly steak skillet and it was delicious it came with pancakes which were so good with fresh maple syrup. the service was top-notch and the waitress kept coming and checking up on me every 3 to 4 minutes which was great.this place lives up to its reputation and I'll definitely come back!

22.description: I went to Eppel's on a Saturday around 11:30am.  It is a small restaurant and can get crowded, but we got seated pretty quickly.  I really enjoy breakfast food, but unfortunately my veggie omelet  and hash browns had no flavor.  My mother ordered the perch and is smelled and tasted 'fishy"...not a good sign.  Then, just a few feet from us, we witnessed one of the waitresses yelling at another waitress about taking one of her tables, then that waitress flipped the other waitress the bird!  At that point, our restaurant experience was ruined.  I reported our experience to one of the owners and she stated  "I'm sorry, it's our staff" and gave me a bag of Skittles.  This is my second poor experience with this restaurant.  I will not be going back.

15.description: Ok, so my better half brought me here one early morning for breakfast. He used to come here with his dad years ago and we needed a change from our regular breakfast spot. Small diner-like environment, extremely friendly waitresses, and GOOD food. I ordered an omelet. Big portion, came with hash browns, and my choice of toast. However, I could've had French toast or mini waffles without being charged extra. I like having that option of multiple choices. Omelet was loaded with cheese, veggies, and meats and was cooked nicely. Potatoes crisp on the outside, tender on the inside but, needed some salt. My hubby had a skillet that was loaded with ingredients that he enjoyed as well. His mini waffles tasted good, and he loved every bite. The waitresses were attentive and one of them has been working there for about 40 years, and even got her friend a job there too, years ago. It felt like I was at an aunt's house, they were so friendly and funny. Will I be returning? YES, TODAY! Prices are very affordable, and I found out that there's free parking in the rear.This is definitely climbing the list as our favorite go-to place for breakfast. I hear that they can get pretty crowded so, get here early to beat the rush.

20.description: I like the at-home/diner feel of Eppel's. It's been around forever and they keep it simple with a good variety breakfast options. There's nothing fancy on the menu but they do cater to all types of meat eaters with beef, pork, turkey, chicken and liver products and of course the vegetarian. I've tried the bananas foster crepe, French toast, eggs and turkey sausage patties. The crepes were massive. So much food came out I wasn't sure who was going to help me finish my breakfast. The bananas, nuts and syrup were like sensory overload BUT it was all delicious. On another visit, I was really pleased with my French toast too. It was light and I could really taste the egg from the batter (I love eggs!). All this food on the cheap is a win for me... and it comes out quickly.There's nothing fancy about the restaurant itself either. There are a bunch of booths, counter space with stools and a few tables. The service is okay. If you order coffee someone is USUALLY around to refill. My first visit I was offered refills perhaps a tad too often and on my second visit I had to hunt my server down. There's parking in the back with a back entrance, so you don't have to worry about paying the city of Chicago for parking or worry about getting a ticket.

36.description: There are only two streets in Chicago, that I can think of, that end in the suffix "road."  Those are Irving Park and Roosevelt.  One often finds him or herself strolling down Roosevelt (named for the founder of the Bull Moose Party, not FDR) in the pursuit of alligator shoes, two-for-one underwear, or a feather for one's fedora, and thinking about why this is so, or if this is so.  Inevitably all this thinking and shopping creates ravaging hunger.  This is where Eppel's comes in because it is a restaurant.In a section of town that is a mix of classic old shops and soul draining box stores, Eppel's is on the side of the haberdashery over Target.  Expect the standard old-time breakfast sort of place that has more character than average.   It's more of a greek style restaurant than it is diner, like the nearby White Palace, and they are independently owned in contrast to the robber barons buying up the surrounding property.  If you are hungry and in the area, then Eppel's is probably your best option unless you are in the mood for 6 pounds of meat between two half-dollar size pieces of bread, then go around the corner to Manny's.

14.description: Good breakfast spot and good service visit this place pretty often there coffee is good also great portions

3.description: Like other reviews have said. This is the BEST Verizon store in the city. The staff was super friendly. I came in to upgrade and they took care of me very quickly. I wasn't rushed, even through the holiday shopping rush, and got exactly what I wanted. I was even given a bottle of water! (The small things, right?)Jonathan, the manager was super great!! Came and asked how everything was going and went out of his way to help me with all aspects of my Verizon experience. If every store I shopped in was like this I would be really happy and a shopaholic. Thanks for the great experience guys!

1.description: I don't even want to give this a star but I have to say stay away from this store. I logged a complaint with corporate who will be doing an investigation. I went into the store to upgrade my phone and was all ready to go until the sales manager came out and tried to force me into a device payment plan. He was rude, pushy and tried to make me feel stupid. I would never come back to this store and can only hope the manager gets let go.

0.description: I walked into this Verizon store to get an estimate on how much it would cost to upgrade and get a new phone. I had previously gone to another location and they did nothing for me. I was greeted with a smile and a bottle of water( yes the little things are the ones that count). I was given a deal but unfortunately that day I couldn't do the transaction. I didn't feel pressured to do anything I didn't want to do. I returned the next day and I spoke to Chase (same rep as the previous day) and I was so happy with the deal I was able to get. It was better than I thought! I got two iPhone 6's and numerous accessories for my phones for a SUPER economical price. Chase spent all the time necessary to go through every detail and get my wife and I a good deal. Jonathan was also very knowledgeable when it came to wireless home appliances! I will never go to another Verizon store again this location is worth the trip!

2.description: I've gone to this location several times and have been greeted very professional and The staff is very well knowledgeable about there products.  Just went last night and Vincent Smith took very well care of me...

5.description: Kudos to whoever is managing this location. Brand new store, fully stocked, great staff. Met by Cynthia. Took care of my SIM card, my daughters plastic screen protector and did about a ten minute review of my bill to give us a nice monthly savings. Walked us to door and we left completely satisfied!

6.description: Extremely disappointing. I had heard great things about them from a co-worker who had traded his phone in early and went to the edge program. I had sent a chat message and talked to a customer service rep about the program and she said I could go in and get the iPhone 6+. I walked into the store to 4 workers standing around laughing and talking. I had to go up to them to even get any attention. When I told them what the customer service rep said they looked up my account and said that was not true and all I could get was a Droid. I don't want a Droid. I've had an iPhone for years. They said sorry they couldn't help me even after I said I'd just leave Verizon. They didn't offer to call a customer service person or anything. I left and immediately called Verizon and they quickly set me up with a new phone. They also told me that I could have been helped in store. Very disappointing. I'll never go back there!

7.description: What a wonderful experience I had at this Verizon store yesterday. My sales person was awesome!!! She was friendly and very knowledgable. The store manager was also very nice and helpful. They even gave us complimentary water bottles. I would highly recommend this Verizon store to anyone!

8.description: I appreciate good customer service and the people at this store do it very well. Everything with my transaction went very smoothly, everyone was helpful and friendly, and the follow-up text I just received was a nice touch. Great attention to detail. Thumbs-up all the way around.

9.description: Best Verizon store that I have been to in Chicago! The store was beautiful and the staff was very helpful and friendly, they even give out little bottles of water to the customers. I broke my phone this morning and when I called customer service I was told there was nothing they could do and I would have to either pay $150 for a replacement or borrow a backup for two weeks before upgrading my phone and pay $250 for the new phone. So I was so relieved when I went to this store and they were able to help me get a new phone right away! I worked with Kyle who was amazingly helpful during my broken phone crisis and even helped me to set up my new device and link my fitbit. They even validate up to 90 minutes of parking in the garage.  I don't usually write reviews but I had such a great experience in a time of need that I felt the internet should know about it.

10.description: Verizon "smart store" with amazingly smart employees. I came into the store after my daughter lost her phone and I wanted to exchange/upgrade her replacement phone. I spent three days on the phone (off and on of course) trying to decide the most cost effective way to upgrade outside of the upgrade eligibility period. Very long story short Verizon telephone reps gave me the wrong information! I arrived in the store with a well researched plan only to find out the information I received was incorrect. Robert the Manager stepped in to help me develop a new plan that would accomplish my goal. I didn't mention I was on a tight time frame as my daughter was leaving for the airport at 6:30 and I arrived at 4:30! Robert turned me over to Kyle a bright, patient, customer fix focused team member who worked diligently to set up the new phone while Vincent a vivacious, well informed team member helped me with accessories. THIS location will be my home store and the staff changed my opinion about Verizon service levels. Outstanding!! Don't bother going to any other location.

4.description: Best vzw store in Chicago. State of the art store with exceptional staff that are friendly and patient.

58.description: This is a neat little place on Maxwell St. After skimming through more than half the reviews, I ordered the sunny sided beef, ginger chicken, honey grilled pork and some soy sauce wings for me and two other family members. We all agreed that the ginger chicken was the best! The pork was a bit bland and hard to chew. Also, the Thai iced tea was amazing, but they added half a cup of ice though (like a lot of other drink places).Fyi, parking is free for 2.5hrs in the garage next door! I wish they opened a little earlier than 11.

56.description: Great Banh Mi and bubble tea! We had the pork belly and the lemongrass pork banh mi, both are great :)

29.description: I came here because I was told they have tasty smoothies and yes, yes they do. I got the strawberry banana one and it was delicious on a hot Summer day. Haven't tried the food yet, there's other places near by to choose from.

42.description: Business must be booming because prices are ridiculous. They charge for everything and now there's like an upcharge

23.description: In the mood for a little Vietnamese pleasure?  Check this place out.  Order the rib eye pineapple salad.  Called a salad, it's more of meal than the usual iceberg and mealy tomato bombs most restaurants call salads.  Service was great and friendly.  I'll be back next time I'm in the University Village.

47.description: The banh mi's here are delicious and on point. Tastes just like home (cali), however it's expensive as hell. It's 5 bucks for 3 banh mi's in Cali. So if you're missing home this is the place to go.

8.description: Is this the best Banh Mi I've ever had? Probably - although I'll caution that I am not an expert in this area. Certainly this puts every other sub and sandwich shop to shame because their Honey Grilled Pork Banh Mi is one of the tastiest, juiciest, and freshest sandwiches I've had in a very long time. This is a straight forward straight up Banh Mi specialty shop (although they've tried to serve pho at one point) and I can't wait to be back. Parking is quite painful although there is a nearby loading zone that can be used if you call in your order ahead of time. Prices were fair (especially for Chicago - coming from Minnesota). Service was friendly and fast. There wasn't anything I can think of to complain about - they do Banh Mi and they do it very well. The next time I drive through Chicago I'll definitely be stopping by. But can I write a Yelp review about the atrocious Chicago traffic and construction?

31.description: One of my favorite places to eat in the UIC area. I enjoy the veggiecado sandwich and avocado smoothie with tapioca. The smoothie has improved a lot with seemingly more avocado, giving it a creamier texture than I remember.It is so hard to believe that all the decor (furniture, paint included) was handmade by the owner, great job and vision! (This is actually my favorite part of the experience, leaves me in awe every time I see the rustic handiwork.)Service is always excellent and the staff is friendly.Overall, a pleasant, simple (easy) experience.

34.description: My 400th Yelp Review Milestone, and I dedicate this to my favorite restaurant near UIC (thus far)! Can I get a HELL YEA for Lotus being right next to where I live? Thank Buddha for this amazing place to help keep my banh mi and boba cravings in check!Lotus serves up an amazing, modern take on banh mi. Each sandwich costs around $7 and comes with a variety of ingredients that will make you reconsider the peanut butter and jelly sandwich you brought to work.I've ordered the Honey Grilled Pork for my first sandwich, and that was classic! The bun was nicely toasted and portions were great. Ask for extra cilantro on your sandwich! The second time I got the fried tofu banh mi, and that one was just as amazing. Large pieces of tofu with thin sweet potato fries tucked inside. I loved both of them.They also serve up some fantastic vermicelli bowls. You select your type of noodle, sauce, meat, and condiments to create your own bowl. I must say that the chicken here is on point.Let's not forget the quality of their boba too. Chicago seems to love fruit smoothie boba, and the ones at Lotus are all made from fresh fruit! For less than $4, I got myself a mango-avocado smoothie with boba, and I couldn't be happier! The drink was damn refreshing, and the flavors blended so well together. As for the boba pearls themselves, they weren't stale or rubbery, making it easy to drink.So while it's not the most classic style banh mi with the pate, meats, cilantro, and veggies, it still offers a fantastic new American take on one of my favorite kinds of sandwiches out there. Lotus is definitely my go-to spot on Maxwell now, and I can't wait to try their other sandwiches very soon.

16.description: Food is a two but the service is great, hence the 3 stars. We came in and got the Sunny-Side Beef and the Ginger Chicken. Everyone on yelp goes bonkers for the Sunny-Side Beef and I don't get why. The egg we got was cooked too long so the yolk was basically hard boiled. Having a nice runny yolk really could of helped out that sandwich. After coming home and looking at the menu for this review, I asked my wife if our sandwich had sweet potato fries in it, and we weren't sure. If it was in the banh mi, we couldn't even taste it. It still wouldn't have helped out the thin slices of beef. The pickled vegetables and cilantro were great though, as well as the french bread. Pretty quality. That goes for both sandwiches. Our second was the Ginger Chicken. This one was much better than the first, a lot more flavor and the chicken was cooked well. Other than that though, its not like its worthy of 4.5 stars like the reviews suggests. Its an average Banh Mi.That goes for the restaurant as a whole. Average. You can get better Mi's at cheaper prices in this city. So go somewhere else and mi up!

13.description: This is the BEST banh mi sandwich - I cant believe I haven't reviewed them yet.  I am literally here at least twice a month and everytime I have a doctor's appointment, which is conveniently across the street.  Always gives me something to look forward to!!  They also have a delicious noodle salad that I've been getting more often...their pork and ribeye is so flavorful and tender.  Always delicious every.single.time!  And cant forget the shakes - refreshing and not too sweet.  And the viet coffee- strong and sweet.  Definitely one of my favorites - so glad they are in my neighborhood!!

11.description: Ambiance: Very fresh and modern interior although we sat outside since it was beautiful. Staff were alright, nothing that stood out to me.Food: My parents grew up in Vietnam so bahn mi was something we had all the time. That being said, this place hits all the core ingredients including a lighter baguette, pickled daikon + carrots, a meat, liver pate and mayo. What makes this place stand out is the use of gourmet ingredients, the bread was hearty with a lighter crust and the meats were very moist and tender. The pickled veges, while mild, tasted homemade and had a nice crunchy texture.In term of complaints, I did wish they had the traditional pork roll  and cured pork cold cold cuts (cha & thit nguoi) in a sandwich but I understand Americans usually look at them like unappetizing mystery meats. I also wish they used a butter-mayo mix like some of my favorite places as it makes the sandwich slightly more salty-savory.All-in-all I really enjoyed the pork belly and honey grilled pork sandwiches, everything was prepared with a high degree of skill but I liken it to getting a taco with expensive skirt steak, crazy smoked multi-chili salsas, etc which may be delicious but doesn't satisfy that cheap off-the-street authentic flavor you crave. I would gladly come here again but I also won't be setting aside my old stand-bys either.

39.description: June 2015- Delicious! Had then cater lunch for us at work and they brought us a variety of deliciousness! Sandwiches were packaged neatly and clearly marked and we're so fresh! I saved a sandwich for the next day and it was just as good! Can't wait to have more.

37.description: Skip the Garden Spring Rolls, not too much flavor there.  The soy glazed chicken wings are interesting, but only average on taste.  Banh mi really stood out (it's in the name after all).  Ginger chicken is perhaps my favorite of all, just excellent flavor   Honey grilled pork a close second, the sweetness isn't that strong but goes well with the lemongrass and garlic.  Sunny-side beef is a solid choice, depends on how you feel about runny egg.  The Belly Classic has pork belly, which I do not care for since it's a fattier cut of meat, so maybe you might like it.  Veggiecado needed a bit more flavor, although it's quite healthy and vegetarian.Lotus will also cater, and by cater I mean delivery large boxes of banh mi.  If you order enough (like 50), they will even expand their delivery range further south to Hyde Park.

0.description: This is the best banh mi I've ever had and that includes my trip to Vietnam.They have really solid vegetarian and vegan options. I got the mushroom one and it was Soooooooooo Good, the seasoning was amazing. This place is very small but gets very busy with people getting takeout. I would really recommend this place and will definitely be going back every time I go to Chicago

38.description: The sandwiches are quite delicious although I do find them a little bland at times - they all seem to rely on onions and sauce for the complexity instead of maybe some heat or herbs. The spring rolls need traditional herbs as they are too boring. The coffee is great. It's a very nice option for lunch in the area for sure and much better than those chain sandwich shops by a mile.

51.description: So, so, so good!  Light, filling, and fresh to def!

27.description: This was my first time coming here today and it was sooooo good. The inside is really nice and cute. They even have a post you can draw on with chalk. I got the pork shoulder sandwich and the fam got the ginger chicken sandwiches, shrimp spring rolls and Jasmine Tea. My sandwich was on point and the fam really liked theirs too. The people that work there are really nice also. I would come back here again and try something else like their smoothies. I recommend it highly!

32.description: It's been a long time since I had intense cravings for something long after I've had them. The veggiecado sandwich I had here is something that draws me back week after week. Sweet potato fries, avocado, and that sweet tofu are potentially one of the best combinations I've ever known.On top of all of that, this place is always clean, friendly, and swift. When I was over by UIC for plenty of the summer, this was my go to spot. So good.

54.description: I've come here so many times that the menu is always on the back of my mind. Love the vietnamese spring rolls here and the veggicado banh mi sandwich. Amazing!!!  The decor is cool and different. Very nice and clean. They also serve bubba tea here so that's always my dessert/sweet option. This place is inexpensive which is why I always come here and the food is delicious. Must try place if you are near UIC

48.description: This was my first time trying Vietnamese sandwiches. We ordered ginger chicken sandwich and a tofu sandwich. The portion size was good and I must say it was one of the most flavorful sandwiches I have ever had. What i didn't like, there was a little too much cilantro for my taste. A big plus was free and very convenient parking a few steps from the place, although the parking assistant told us, they would start charging back again from July 13th. I will definitely come back to the place to try the spring rolls and smoothies.

44.description: I tired belly classic and sunny side beef. Both are very fresh and tasty! My personal favor---like belly classic more:)))

24.description: I have had banh mi's from all over the place. This was the BEST. Do yourself a favor and get one.

7.description: Just a short walk from home I've had this restaurant bookmarked forever but never made my way over.  I guess I'll be kicking myself for a while because this place is fantastic.  Nice clean establishment.  You walk in and order from a very small simple menu.  The service is fast and friendly.  I ordered a sunny side beef Bahn mi.  It was excellent .  The bread was crispy on the outside soft on the inside.  The beef was cooked medium to medium well and the sandwich was filled with fresh cucumbers, jalapeños, caramelized onions, and a fried egg.  The sandwich was a perfect balance of sweet and spicy.  The portion was great.  The best part is the price.  You can grab a Bahn mi and a drink for less the $9.  I would definitely recommend Lotus Cafe.  It's great for a quick lunch!

49.description: Best banh mi in Chicago.  My favorites are the classic pork belly and the honey grilled pork.  I only wish they were open later.

40.description: Food is a two but the service is great, hence the 3 stars. We came in and got the Sunny-Side Beef and the Ginger Chicken. Everyone on yelp goes bonkers for the Sunny-Side Beef and I don't get why. The egg we got was cooked too long so the yolk was basically hard boiled. Having a nice runny yolk really could of helped out that sandwich. After coming home and looking at the menu for this review, I asked my wife if our sandwich had sweet potato fries in it, and we weren't sure. If it was in the banh mi, we couldn't even taste it. It still wouldn't have helped out the thin slices of beef. The pickled vegetables and cilantro were great though, as well as the french bread. Pretty quality. That goes for both sandwiches. Our second was the Ginger Chicken. This one was much better than the first, a lot more flavor and the chicken was cooked well. Other than that though, its not like its worthy of 4.5 stars like the reviews suggests. Its an average Banh Mi.That goes for the restaurant as a whole. Average. You can get better Mi's at cheaper prices in this city. So go somewhere else and mi up!

53.description: Made a great decision this afternoon and came here! My boyfriend and I ordered the Sunnyside Beef, Classic Belly banh mi, and a cold jasmine milk tea.The Sunnyside beef was amazingly delicious! The beef was tender and flavorful. The Sunnyside egg in it just added to the flavor and made the banh mi incredibly satisfying. I would definitely order this again!The Classic Belly was also delicious! The meat was tender and but not as flavorful after having taken a bite out of the Sunnyside banh mi. All of the banh mi come with cilantro, mayo, and jalapeños, which are some nice touches!The cold Jasmine milk tea was so refreshing and delicious! The milk in it didn't over power and dilute the Jasmine tea flavor. I would order this again in a heart beat as well!

30.description: Delicious, fresh, amazing bah mi sandwiches with perfectly toasted French bread and delicious sauces in an unpretentious atmosphere. Local cops eat there because it's just that good. Sandwiches come loaded with jalapeños, cilantro, and onions. I had the pork belly, but my roommate thoroughly enjoyed his vegan sandwich.

46.description: Loving the warm smiles from the staff, the generous portions of spring rolls, and the chill outdoor seating with my dog. Thxo!

1.description: Blah blah blah.  I've been to a gazillion Viet restaurants, and this one was easily forgettable.  They don't have Pho, which in my book makes this un-Vietnamese.  The day I was there, their hot beverage machine was broken down, meaning, no hot tea, no coffee, etc.  The food was mediocre at best.  For example, the fresh spring rolls were bland and totally uninspired.  The location is good, right in the center of Maxwell Street action.  Unfortunately, this also means that parking can be troublesome.  Also, keep in mind that this is a very small restaurant-- it seemed like most of their business was take-out.

55.description: The Banh Mi sandwiches here were pretty good! I would definitely give them both four stars. I ordered the honey grilled pork, and was thoroughly satisfied, and my girlfriend ordered the veggiecado and seemed pretty happy with her choice. We also got one of the rib-eye pineapple vermicelli, and I thought it was just okay. I thought that the meat was marinated well and cooked well - I would give it 4 stars if it was just this. But the noodles just weren't right for me. I wish they had used thinner, more traditional vermicelli - then it could have been really really good.The place is really cute and has FREE PARKING. Wow what a great thing to have. I read their bio on their website, and apparently, this place was started by former students who noticed a lack of Vietnamese food options - which is true! I liked hearing about their story, and it definitely made me want to support them even more!

9.description: BANH MI MEParking is always a pain in the butt around this neighborhood because of the UIC campus. We had a taste for some Vietnamese sandwiches and planned on doing carry out. When I went to drop my wife off in front, I noticed a sign that said "Free Parking". I was so excited about this offer that I told my wife we were dinning in today. The free parking is a nice feature and it will hopefully help all of the businesses around this area by bringing in customers. The sandwich shop is small on the inside but very clean. I noticed some of those college students hanging around using the wifi. This isn't a Starbucks. As a business owner, it would drive me crazy with one person taking up two table spots. I'm so glad I don't have to deal with such problems. We almost fell victim to not getting a seat because there were many solo eaters surfing the internet at two top tables. While we were waiting for our food, a table in the back opened up and we jumped on it. We almost had to go back to our original plan of going with carry out sandwiches because of the lack of seats. Prior to arriving here we made a plan. We were going to order two sandwiches and then split them. We went with the Honey Grilled Pork Banh Mi with Pork shoulder, lemongrass, honey, garlic, scallions, pickled daikon, carrots, cucumber, cilantro & jalapenos. Our second sandwich was the Sunny-Side Beef Banh Mi with Sautéed beef, caramelized onion, sunny-side up egg, and crispy sweet potato fries. Both sandwiches were really good and full of flavor. If I had the choice I would definitely order the Honey Grilled Pork Banh Mi again. The sandwich had the perfect mix of savory, sweet & spicy. I loved every single bite. I was also glad that I chose to eat this sandwich second because it was amazing. My other half sandwich was the Sunny-Side Beef Banh Mi and it was good. I wish that the beef quality was a little better. There is nothing worse then pulling out inedible fat chunks from your mouth full of food. It just makes eating a sandwich an unpleasant experience. Every sandwich bite becomes a challenge because I'm not sure what I will find in there. It's like eating a fish with bones in it. The fish is good but you eat with caution. Would we come back here? Probably because of the close location and the free parking. If I was a college student I would definitely be in here a lot using the wifi and eating sandwiches. My only suggestion to the solo flying college students is to sit in the window counter. This way you're not taking up two seats. It's better for the business and if they close down then were are you going to get your free wifi from.

26.description: The sandwiches are great - love the variety and the taste. The Sunnyside Beef is really delicious with the egg on top. It's also really nice that they are BYOB. I only wish they stayed open later...

25.description: Lotus is a banh mi counter service restaurant close to the UIC campus. They've got a simple menu, with superb vegetarian options. The restaurant was relatively empty on the Monday night that my friend and I visited, but it seemed like they had a strong amount of delivery and pick up orders.I ordered tofu spring rolls, and I also had half a mushroom lemongrass banh mi and half a veggiecado banh mi. The tofu spring rolls tasted fine, but had an avocado spread on them that could go. Avoid these and spend the money on the banh mi sandwiches. I'll say it: These were the best vegetarian banh mi sandwiches I think I've ever had. Lotus is in a class of its own in the vegetarian banh mi department. The veggiecado banh mi had this excellent combination of tomato, cilantro, fried tofu, and sweet potato. The avocado spread here worked well here. And the mushroom banh mi was fantastic: the grilled mushrooms were seasoned very well. I really didn't taste much lemongrass, but what I did taste was delicious. There was something awesome about the juxtaposition between the crisp freshness of all the other banh mi ingredients with the sautéed mushrooms. Overall, the sandwiches were amazing. It makes you wonder what years of oppression by the French have done to other cuisines.I would definitely return if I were in the area, and would probably order more than one sandwich.

12.description: The Banh Mi sandwiches here were pretty good! I would definitely give them both four stars. I ordered the honey grilled pork, and was thoroughly satisfied, and my girlfriend ordered the veggiecado and seemed pretty happy with her choice. We also got one of the rib-eye pineapple vermicelli, and I thought it was just okay. I thought that the meat was marinated well and cooked well - I would give it 4 stars if it was just this. But the noodles just weren't right for me. I wish they had used thinner, more traditional vermicelli - then it could have been really really good.The place is really cute and has FREE PARKING. Wow what a great thing to have. I read their bio on their website, and apparently, this place was started by former students who noticed a lack of Vietnamese food options - which is true! I liked hearing about their story, and it definitely made me want to support them even more!

59.description: With Ba Le in chinatown closing a few months ago, Lotus (located near UIC) is one of the very few banh mi sandwich shops in the south/central area. While I should have looked at the reviews for this place beforehand to get what everyone was raving about with the sunnyside beef, I got the pineapple ribeye vermicelli salad dish. It wasn't bad at all. I loved the fact with this place being as small as it was that they cooked it as I ordered. They also made my Viet coffee perfectly with the less condensed milk I have requested. P.S. They don't have Pho if that is what you are craving for and their spring rolls come in orders of 3 halves. All items are served in to-go containers.It is located at the very end of that one way Maxwell street to your right. Inside is clean with a few seating tables. You order your food at the counter and they will bring your food to you (kind of like a Del Seoul or I guess a typical cafe spot).

21.description: Ambiance: Very fresh and modern interior although we sat outside since it was beautiful. Staff were alright, nothing that stood out to me.Food: My parents grew up in Vietnam so bahn mi was something we had all the time. That being said, this place hits all the core ingredients including a lighter baguette, pickled daikon + carrots, a meat, liver pate and mayo. What makes this place stand out is the use of gourmet ingredients, the bread was hearty with a lighter crust and the meats were very moist and tender. The pickled veges, while mild, tasted homemade and had a nice crunchy texture.In term of complaints, I did wish they had the traditional pork roll  and cured pork cold cold cuts (cha & thit nguoi) in a sandwich but I understand Americans usually look at them like unappetizing mystery meats. I also wish they used a butter-mayo mix like some of my favorite places as it makes the sandwich slightly more salty-savory.All-in-all I really enjoyed the pork belly and honey grilled pork sandwiches, everything was prepared with a high degree of skill but I liken it to getting a taco with expensive skirt steak, crazy smoked multi-chili salsas, etc which may be delicious but doesn't satisfy that cheap off-the-street authentic flavor you crave. I would gladly come here again but I also won't be setting aside my old stand-bys either.

17.description: Love this place. Honey grilled pork is delish. Shrimp spring rolls are very fresh and the peanut sauce is made just right. I also frequently get their noodle salads. Take out orders are made quickly and special requests have always been fulfilled correctly. The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because it's not authentically Vietnamese. Food is definitely Americanized but that's not to say it's not tasty!

10.description: Lotus is a banh mi counter service restaurant close to the UIC campus. They've got a simple menu, with superb vegetarian options. The restaurant was relatively empty on the Monday night that my friend and I visited, but it seemed like they had a strong amount of delivery and pick up orders.I ordered tofu spring rolls, and I also had half a mushroom lemongrass banh mi and half a veggiecado banh mi. The tofu spring rolls tasted fine, but had an avocado spread on them that could go. Avoid these and spend the money on the banh mi sandwiches. I'll say it: These were the best vegetarian banh mi sandwiches I think I've ever had. Lotus is in a class of its own in the vegetarian banh mi department. The veggiecado banh mi had this excellent combination of tomato, cilantro, fried tofu, and sweet potato. The avocado spread here worked well here. And the mushroom banh mi was fantastic: the grilled mushrooms were seasoned very well. I really didn't taste much lemongrass, but what I did taste was delicious. There was something awesome about the juxtaposition between the crisp freshness of all the other banh mi ingredients with the sautéed mushrooms. Overall, the sandwiches were amazing. It makes you wonder what years of oppression by the French have done to other cuisines.I would definitely return if I were in the area, and would probably order more than one sandwich.

5.description: If you're at UIC, don't miss a chance to try a delicious banh mi from Lotus. I took a 5 week class at UIC and went to Lotus 4 times. I wish I would have tried it the first week and made it in 100% of the time. I only tried the sunnyside beef, but when I find something I like, I stick with it. It had beef and eggs and all of the traditional banh mi toppings. The bread was nice and crunchy. The sandwich offered a perfect balance of flavors that I can just taste in my mouth as I write this review.The prices are fair--about $7 for a sandwich. They also offer smoothies with tapioca, as well as appetizers, chips and pop. I believe they offer delivery too, but I'm not sure on delivery area or charges.The same girl waited on me each time that I came and she was really nice.  If you're dining in, they also have jugs of water out so you don't really need to purchase a drink. Bonus: this is right next to the parking garage on Maxwell, so you can pick up a sandwich before you head back to your car.

3.description: I'm convinced this place has one of the best Banh mi sandwiches in town if not the best. The bread is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The sunny side egg is an awesome addition to any Banh mi sandwich that u can add on.  The vegetables are pickled just eight. A little on the pricey side but well worth it for a sandwich that is made fresh and delicious.

35.description: If you want fresh, quick, delicious food then this is the place to go. We got the shrimp spring rolls and they were so light but so filling, also the peanut sauce was mouth watering!I got the house pork noodle salad and it's really a vermicielli but one that leaves you full after the first few bites. I honestly wanted to get two more to bring home with me!Hubby got the honey grilled pork Banh Mi which was the freshest Banh mi I've ever tasted in my life. If you want a hearty, fresh, filling sandwich with a whole lot of taste this is what to get!Overall, our next vacation to Chicago we'll make sure to come back here!

19.description: Absolutely delicious.  The veggiecado is soooo fresh and delicious.  Really nice to see a family business do so well.  I moved away from Chicago and I make this the first meal I have every. single. time. I visit.

28.description: pretty good portion, much bigger than ba le in the loop. I would say the taste is better too. It is probalby the best Vietnamese spot for people live in the loop

45.description: The honey glazed pork banh mi is the best banh mi I've ever had. That says a lot for someone who lives in an Atlanta suburb of high Vietnamese population. Great atmosphere also!

33.description: My boss has gone here 3 times in the same week and has said nothing but great things about this place. Today I went there with him for lunch and had a great experience.Vibe:The vibe is perfect. There are lots of tables in there and they even have patio seating. The music is at the perfect volume. This place is perfect for lunch with co-workers, lunch dates, and just a quick bite to eat. Customer Service:When I walked inside we were immediately greeted and I felt like they actually cared that I was there. They recognized my boss from him going so often and I thought that was incredible. The gentleman who rang us up at the counter had a great haircut and he even gave me the number to his barber. Food:INCREDIBLE! My boss loves the sandwiches. I am not really into bread so I had the sesame grilled chicken noodle salad. I wish I knew how many calories were in this but either way it was phenomenal. The amount of sauce was perfect. I cannot vouch for the dressing because I never added it to my salad--the reason I didn't add it is because the sauce from the chicken was already the perfect amount to cover the entire salad. I'm at work two hours later and still feeling perfect. Not too full and not hungry. Price:HELLA CHEAP! We paid $15 total for both of our meals. I'll definitely be back here. Thanks for a great 1st experience!

43.description: Good food. Fresh. Made to order. Two thumbs up! I ordered the pork house noodle salad. And their Thai iced tea is perfect

2.description: I'm no expert on banh mi, but every sandwich I've ever had here is always delicious. My favorite is their beef banh mi, which comes with egg inside! The bread slightly crunchy but still soft, and all the ingredients taste fresh. Their honey pork was perhaps not as sweet as I would have liked, but it was still tasty. Their avocado smoothie is actually pretty good too. It's very creamy, and I actually think it's better than the avocado smoothies at Joy Yee's (which is nearby). If you're in the UIC area, this place is definitely great for a quick, tasty, and cheap lunch/dinner!

18.description: Solid Banh Mi Spot!Great food, crusty bread, quick service. Gotta be a good spot for the college kids.

41.description: Did not taste like authentic bahn mi sandwiches. Was excited to try this place based on reviews but was disappointed. Service was friendly.

52.description: I love this place! Let alone being the only clean place around UIC that also offers great food at a reasonable price, Lotus is definitely a go-to place for me to have a Bahn Mi sandwich. I love the extra meet option!

50.description: If you're looking for a satisfying banh-mi near UIC, then look no further. I have been impressed by the quality and consistency with which Lotus makes their sandwiches. I have so far tried the Sunny-side Beef and Honey Pork sandwiches, and both are delicious. I was also impressed by the prices of their sandwiches. Lotus should be commended for their value. It is difficult to find other restaurants in the area that offer the same value in terms of money, taste, and quality.Lotus banh-mi in five words: fresh, satisfying, and fairly priced.

4.description: I LOVE this place. I was obsessed (and who am I kidding, still am) with their rib eye pineapple "salad." It's mostly noodle, but the shredded romaine, sautéed onion, and sliced jalapeños give it salad cred. In fact, all the salads start with the same base, sweet and sour dressing, and spring roll but each protein stands on its own. Both the pork and chicken (dark meat) are winners as well.Can I tempt you to start with shrimp summer rolls? Tasty peanut sauce accompany to Vietnamese classic here. The chicken wings are killer! Super moist, crispy, and covered in a sweet/spicy sauce. Although your salad will come with a fried spring roll, I recommend getting a few more to satisfy you. I find their smoothies a little icy, but I might prefer that over one that is too sweet.Honestly, this place does your standard Vietnamese fare extremely well, and I will never hesitate to patronize this place.

6.description: My 400th Yelp Review Milestone, and I dedicate this to my favorite restaurant near UIC (thus far)! Can I get a HELL YEA for Lotus being right next to where I live? Thank Buddha for this amazing place to help keep my banh mi and boba cravings in check!Lotus serves up an amazing, modern take on banh mi. Each sandwich costs around $7 and comes with a variety of ingredients that will make you reconsider the peanut butter and jelly sandwich you brought to work.I've ordered the Honey Grilled Pork for my first sandwich, and that was classic! The bun was nicely toasted and portions were great. Ask for extra cilantro on your sandwich! The second time I got the fried tofu banh mi, and that one was just as amazing. Large pieces of tofu with thin sweet potato fries tucked inside. I loved both of them.They also serve up some fantastic vermicelli bowls. You select your type of noodle, sauce, meat, and condiments to create your own bowl. I must say that the chicken here is on point.Let's not forget the quality of their boba too. Chicago seems to love fruit smoothie boba, and the ones at Lotus are all made from fresh fruit! For less than $4, I got myself a mango-avocado smoothie with boba, and I couldn't be happier! The drink was damn refreshing, and the flavors blended so well together. As for the boba pearls themselves, they weren't stale or rubbery, making it easy to drink.So while it's not the most classic style banh mi with the pate, meats, cilantro, and veggies, it still offers a fantastic new American take on one of my favorite kinds of sandwiches out there. Lotus is definitely my go-to spot on Maxwell now, and I can't wait to try their other sandwiches very soon.

22.description: Went by for the first time for dinner last night. I got the mushroom sandwich with some garden  spring rolls. Absolutely great! Ordered take out and it was ready when I got there, It's less than a 10 minute walk. My wife is a vegan so I was willing to try the 2 options so we could share. She really liked it also. We'll definitely be going back.

15.description: Skip the Garden Spring Rolls, not too much flavor there.  The soy glazed chicken wings are interesting, but only average on taste.  Banh mi really stood out (it's in the name after all).  Ginger chicken is perhaps my favorite of all, just excellent flavor   Honey grilled pork a close second, the sweetness isn't that strong but goes well with the lemongrass and garlic.  Sunny-side beef is a solid choice, depends on how you feel about runny egg.  The Belly Classic has pork belly, which I do not care for since it's a fattier cut of meat, so maybe you might like it.  Veggiecado needed a bit more flavor, although it's quite healthy and vegetarian.Lotus will also cater, and by cater I mean delivery large boxes of banh mi.  If you order enough (like 50), they will even expand their delivery range further south to Hyde Park.

57.description: I love this place! Been ordering it delivery for the past year or so but didn't really understand how good it was until I popped in there and had it served fresh. Friendly staff, chill vibe, clean but not too sterile looking. The wooden bar looking out the front window is really nice, especially on a sunny day!Veggiecado was awesome, and the spring rolls are always pretty good too.The game changer was the red bean-coconut smoothie though, which I got under their recommendation. Gotta try this if you get in there. Killer combo.

20.description: Just a short walk from home I've had this restaurant bookmarked forever but never made my way over.  I guess I'll be kicking myself for a while because this place is fantastic.  Nice clean establishment.  You walk in and order from a very small simple menu.  The service is fast and friendly.  I ordered a sunny side beef Bahn mi.  It was excellent .  The bread was crispy on the outside soft on the inside.  The beef was cooked medium to medium well and the sandwich was filled with fresh cucumbers, jalapeños, caramelized onions, and a fried egg.  The sandwich was a perfect balance of sweet and spicy.  The portion was great.  The best part is the price.  You can grab a Bahn mi and a drink for less the $9.  I would definitely recommend Lotus Cafe.  It's great for a quick lunch!

36.description: Whenever we're back in the UIC area, my boyfriend and I always make it a point to stop by Lotus! Their bread is always fresh and warm; I usually switch off between the Sunnyside Beef or the Classic Belly. My boyfriend usually gets the Honey Grilled Pork. I love the fact that the Sunnyside Beef comes with an egg on top and delicious sweet potato strings! It really makes a difference. If we're feeling extra hungry that day, we'll also order some shrimp spring rolls, which come in a HUGE box, so it's definitely enough to share. The sweet pineapple dipping sauce that it comes with is seriously soooo good. Smoothies are never a bad choice but I usually always get the iced jasmine milk tea, which always has a strong jasmine tea flavor but is light and refreshing as well. Sometimes it veers a little to the sweet side but it just makes it that much more refreshing. We will always come back to Lotus whenever we're in the area!

14.description: With Ba Le in chinatown closing a few months ago, Lotus (located near UIC) is one of the very few banh mi sandwich shops in the south/central area. While I should have looked at the reviews for this place beforehand to get what everyone was raving about with the sunnyside beef, I got the pineapple ribeye vermicelli salad dish. It wasn't bad at all. I loved the fact with this place being as small as it was that they cooked it as I ordered. They also made my Viet coffee perfectly with the less condensed milk I have requested. P.S. They don't have Pho if that is what you are craving for and their spring rolls come in orders of 3 halves. All items are served in to-go containers.It is located at the very end of that one way Maxwell street to your right. Inside is clean with a few seating tables. You order your food at the counter and they will bring your food to you (kind of like a Del Seoul or I guess a typical cafe spot).

58.description: I am very exquisite with service and cleanliness in restaurants. The first time I visited this place was on Saturday for a birthday party. Great atmosphere, delicious food (Paella negra and red sangria my favorites). Excellent service, very affordable. I have been visiting this restaurant in different occasions with friends for lunch, dinner or to have some appetizers and few Sangrias and all my friends end loving this place as much as I do. Also Chef Enrique is super attentive and sometimes you'll see him walking around the tables. It make me feel appreciated and comfortable.  I highly recommend this place for any occasion (first date, birthday parties or just after work to have some sangrias).  Sometimes they have live music what is a plus :).

56.description: We will never go back here again.  You get one chance to make a good first impression and this place definitely did not impress.  We were so angry after dinner, I had to get up this morning and write this review.  Get the scoop below.We made an 8:30 pm reservation last night for dinner for two.  We arrived early around 8:15pm and the hostess was nowhere to be found for a couple of minutes.  When she came back to the hostess station I told her that we were there for our reservation and then she walked away again to check out tables and to talk with the chef I think.  She eventually came back and did not say anything to us.  At this point I told her that we would order a drink at the bar and wait for our table to which she said "Okay, you can go over there then."  I don't know if she is younger or does not work as a hostess regularly but she seemed lost.  The restaurant was busy and we made our way over  to the bar.From here it took us 10 minutes to order a drink and another 10 to have it set in front of us.  I must say that our drinks were very good and we enjoyed those.  My wife and I had some conversation and then noted that we we had been waiting 40 minutes past our scheduled reservation for a table.  By this time other folks had checked in for their reservations and came to the bar to order drinks.  I had noticed that 3-4 other tables that came in after us were seated prior to us.  The hostess I spoke about before called me by the wrong name twice when asked about  our table.  We were about to get up and leave the restaurant when our table was finally given to us.From there the hostess came to seat us and upon us sitting down she asked if we knew what we wanted to order.   We were so ticked off at this point that we just ordered some things (Mind you not as much as we were originally going to order as we had lost our appetite with the bad service).  We asked the hostess if we could order drinks as well and she told us our waitress would be by.  The minutes ticked by and our waitress arrived to take our drink orders.  She didn't introduce herself or tell us anything about the restaurant or specials.We both sat and waited trying to maintain composure as our date night was already ruined.  Our food started to come out and after we started to eat, our drinks came out.  Bear in mind that I ordered a beer and the wife a sangria.  These should have come out quickly.  Now onto the review of the food dish by dish.  I can't remember the proper names for the dishes, nor will I waste anymore time trying to find the names.Curry Chicken - Not bad but curry was not pronounced.  It was a yellow curry and decent to eat with bread.  The chicken was not spectacular but was cooked fine.Eggplant Stack - INEDIBLE.  Came out cold and way undercooked.  This is a sin when you are Italian.  It's unacceptable.  My wife and I couldn't eat it.Bacon Wrapped Dates - Decent but I've had the same thing a million times before and there was nothing notable about these.Pork Belly - The fat was not rendered down enough and was chewy.  Nuff said.  There are 10,000 more places to get pork belly in this city.  Go to Takashi and have it and then try it here.  You'll weep, and not in a good way.Beef Tip Skewers - Flavor was decent but they weren't very hot.  Seemed like our food was an afterthought and being rushed to the table without being completed.  Our server never asked us how the food was or really seemed to care that much.  This place was busy and I'm not sure they have the skilled employees to handle a rush without crashing and burning.  The wife and I go out quite a bit to eat so we know what to expect.  My wife also runs a high volume food & drink service establishment and knows how to treat customers.  Even though I can normally overlook some things she tends to notice, I could not here.  It was just  BAD.The cherry on top of the evening was that the best and fastest service we received is when we asked for the check.  Our waitress was right there ready to put it on the table so they could turn it for other customers.  There were dirty dishes all over the table and she didn't even think to clear them when she brought the check.  With our date night ruined, I forked over a 10% tip and I'm not even sure that was deserved.Again, you have one chance to gain a new repeat customer or to turn them off and have them tell all their friends about it.  Too bad for this place that the situation was the latter.  We spend A LOT of money going out to eat and bringing our friends with us.  This place won't be seeing us again.  We'll stick with the places we know are good in that area.  Three Aces, County BBQ, Dusek's/Punch House, etc.  Those folks know how to treat a customer and offer a great product.

29.description: I came here with my mom while visiting and we had a pretty good time. It's a great place to go and order a bunch of different things and share among the group. My favorite were the Patatas bravas and some soup who's name I can't remember. It was seafood based and it was absolutely fantastic. I had to stop myself from ordering a second bowl.

42.description: My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate our anniversary.  We have been here before,  but the service was better then.  I ordered a lemonade,  which was too sour. We had to request bread and butter, which was normally given to us as appetizers.  The cheese platter was delicious,  except for the blue cheese,  but they need to add more than three date crackers.  Food was great, second best to Espanola of Berwyn.

23.description: OK food, nothing special. For the price and quantity of food, your belly is better off going elsewhere.

47.description: This place is hit or miss. Sometimes they are very clueless. But other times they are on their game. I have waited 45 minutes for a glass of wine and had cold food and other times had great experiences...hot food, drinks and everything!!! Usually the food is good...patatas bravas, steak skewers, olives, chorizo con queso, all very good.

8.description: Drinks are great and the service is fast. The Margarita Urbana was amazing, My gf had the Lime in the coconut and it was so so I wasn't crazy about it. Overall I think the place has a great vibe with good drinks and fast service. Can't ask for much more

31.description: It's a little pricey out of all the tapa places I been to for dinner. I still enjoyed it though. My favorite is cafe babareeba for tapas.

34.description: We enjoyed their pella and several other items and visited several times. The last time when we were there, the waiter brought a dish that we didn't order.  We told her so, but she got loud and insisted we did. We ended to accept and pay for it because we were not in an arguing mood. But we have never go back again and will never go again in the future... That was not a right attitude to customers.

16.description: So granted we were there because a friend knew the owner and he was ranting and raving about this place. So we went there with a group of about 13 people.Well, it didn't disappoint. The decor was beautiful but given that it was relatively nice out, we had a table outside. I did the sangria flight which gives you taste of different kinds of Sangrias they have. They were all good. El Taberna was my favorite.  Then we ordered lots and lots of tapas- Patatas Bravas, datiles con Tocino, Gambas Al Ajillo, bocadiilo de pancheta de lechon( pork belly, oh, so.....good), bocadiilo and a few more I can't even remember because the Sangria was starting to kick in. ;) But everything was really good. Pork belly was my favorite. Then we ordered the traditional paella and the black paella. They were both very good. It was an even split between the folks at the table on which one was the winner. I liked the traditional one a tiny bit better than the other one but most others liked the black one because the flavors were more bold.They took such good care of us (ok maybe it had to something with our friend knowing the owner) but I can tell this place provides really good service. We tipped the heck out of these guys because they were that attentive. Then the owner gave us a free round of drinks. We were all feeling pretty happy afterwards. ;)I seriously wanted to move upstairs so I can eat here everyday. Ha ha...So luv....this place. Would go there again. Would be a good date spot too.

13.description: The food was good but the service was okay.  It took them a while once we set to come get our order. Also, they never came to refill our drinks/water. We had to wait 15 mins before we got someone's attention to get our waiter to fill our drinks... This is with just us being in the restaurant and maybe couple other customers in the outdoor area.  Must Try: Potato Bravas (Really good spicy creamy sauce!)Good: Vegetarian Paella and the chocolate dessertAverage: Bread/Bruscetta with tomato basil sauce and cheese (pretty typical)

11.description: The sangria was very watered down.   Had better at a frat party back in the day.    However the food is AMAZING.  I would pass on the pork belly that was on ok.  The Ludhiana server is great.    Ask for her; very attentive and accommodating.   Not too crowd for a Friday at 8pm.  So I guess the word about the shitty sangria is getting around.   Don't let that stop you. There is some amazing food that you won't find anywhere in the city.   Well worth your time and hard earned cash.    Just stay away for the sangria!

39.description: Great food, great beer great atmosphere. I'm ordering food from la tavern for over a year.Highly recommending.

37.description: Good food and solid drinks.  Goat cheese in tomato sauce is very delish but some of the other plates can be bland.

0.description: A little on the pricy side for tapas but they are very tasty. The ambience is dim and at times there is a guitarist playing. We had a restaurant.com certificate and they waiter had no issues with the certificate. I had the flight of sangria, highly recommend it.

38.description: I went this Friday and I enjoyed the food and red sangria. The place is cozy and romantic. The only criticism I have was that I had 3 different people take care of my table. I believe the hostess took our order cause the actual waiter forgot about our order. We felt like the place was unorganized but the food was pretty good.

51.description: Very average. Iberico or Ba-Ba-Riba much better

27.description: When we walked in, we fell in love with the atmosphere. There was a great live band playing Latin music which definitely set the mood. I love tapas and this restaurant came highly recommended so I was excited. The Taberna Sangria was excellent and the Mojito was average. We ordered several different tapas dishes and none of them stood out. However, the table loved the chicken skewers. The creme brule dessert was good as well. I was disappointed with the tapas but I will give them another shot because the atmosphere makes me want to love this place.

32.description: Very good dinner and sangría but the price was a little high but overall we had a great experience.

54.description: Came with my girl friend to check out the Spanish Guitar, but really enjoyed the food as well.We had the:- Champinones y caracoles al jerez (sherry glazed mushrooms and escargot)- Berenjena rellena con tres quesos (grilled egg plant topped with fresh mozzarella)- Gambas al ajillo (shrimp sautéed in a garlic and chilli-pepper infused oil)- Punta de res pincho (skewer) beef tips top with caramelizes onions and creamy horseradish sauce- Paella la Taberna (saffron rice, pork, chicken, and more)In regards to the food:It was good.  My favorite was definitely th ePunta de res pincho skewers, but I thought the creamy horseradish sauce could had more horseradish and less cream.The Paella la Taberna was also delicious, and a great portion size. The Grilled Eggplant was not thing special, even though it came highly recommended, and the sauteed shrimp in infused oil was too oily.The atmosphere:Is great, very nice and can  be romantic or not depending on your mood and where you are sitting. The Spanish Guitar player that they had was fantastic!The service:Was great. Friendly and helpful staff, and quick with both getting our order and bringing the food. Good overall experience. Would recommend.

48.description: This restaurant was absolutely terrible --- mostly because of the horrible service. Our waitress disappeared for 45 minutes. We started asking the water boy to take our order. The paella tasted like cheap fried rice at a chinese restaurant. I am never coming back here. If you are considering going to this restaurant for dinner, go to a different spanish tapas restaurant. There are plenty of better ones in Chicago.

44.description: So granted we were there because a friend knew the owner and he was ranting and raving about this place. So we went there with a group of about 13 people.Well, it didn't disappoint. The decor was beautiful but given that it was relatively nice out, we had a table outside. I did the sangria flight which gives you taste of different kinds of Sangrias they have. They were all good. El Taberna was my favorite.  Then we ordered lots and lots of tapas- Patatas Bravas, datiles con Tocino, Gambas Al Ajillo, bocadiilo de pancheta de lechon( pork belly, oh, so.....good), bocadiilo and a few more I can't even remember because the Sangria was starting to kick in. ;) But everything was really good. Pork belly was my favorite. Then we ordered the traditional paella and the black paella. They were both very good. It was an even split between the folks at the table on which one was the winner. I liked the traditional one a tiny bit better than the other one but most others liked the black one because the flavors were more bold.They took such good care of us (ok maybe it had to something with our friend knowing the owner) but I can tell this place provides really good service. We tipped the heck out of these guys because they were that attentive. Then the owner gave us a free round of drinks. We were all feeling pretty happy afterwards. ;)I seriously wanted to move upstairs so I can eat here everyday. Ha ha...So luv....this place. Would go there again. Would be a good date spot too.

24.description: If you're a fan good tapas food and sangria this is the place to eat. With the weather being so nice my gf and I decided to sit outside in the patio area. We asked our server Sam which sangria she recommended she suggested we try the taberna sangria, after drinking some really sangria and browsing the menu we decided to order the shrimp and Spanish sausage skewers, fried calamari and meatballs. All three were delicious and favorable the skewers were soooo good I ordered them twice. The ambience was great, the food was amazing and our server Sam was outstanding! Def made me a regular

7.description: The vibe was amazing. The art on the wall is exquisite. Their ceviche is so tasty. The shrimp was perfect and small inside. The original sangria is addicting

49.description: Very good, it transported us back to Spain in a nano-bite. The patatas bravas, gambas al ajo, and croquettes were fabuloso! The price of each plate is a little high ($9-14), so I would recommend going on Tuesdays when they have a break on tapas prices.

40.description: Great place to dine.   The patio is very cool/romantic especially at night. The decor is very nice and they play lounge music. Makes lunch very relaxing.  The food was good as well.  I have no complaints.  Parking could be tough but there is a garage 1 block away that beats the street parking.  It's 2$ for 2.5 hrs so better than street parking.  I had their lunch special a few times. The waiters are always attentive which helps when u are in a crunch for time.  Will return back.

53.description: Come here every now and then for the great la liga games and decent paella. The combination of those two things along with the proximity to my place is a niche that just can't be serviced elsewhere. Also the fact that they have Estrella dam can't hurt either. Oh how I yearn to walk the streets of espana

30.description: We went there Saturday night and had a good time. The food was good and so were the sangria's. We had a wide verity of tastes in our group of four and there were plenty of items for each. The music and traditional dancer was nice also. We had plenty of food and a several rounds of sangria and it cam to about $50.00 per person, so not so bad. The service was prompt, nice and helpful.
