46.description: Excellent food and service. First time here so I wasn't sure what to expect but I'm glad we stopped in. Not very often you go to eat and have the manager and chef come out and greet you.  Great drinks, great food and great place to dine. Cozy outdoor dining area.  Will most definitely be back. Thanks to Ben and Enrique for making the visit a memorable one.

1.description: Came here on a Friday evening after work. The restaurant is very spacious and dimly lit. When I first walked in, it appeared there was a Holiday party just starting in one side of the restaurant. Not soon after, they were already breaking glasses, haha! The other side, where my bestie and I sat, was still kinda empty as the dinner crowd slowly came in. Service was spot on. Our server greeted us right away and was very friendly. We got the pitcher of their classic Sangria to start off with. It was just ok. A little watered down for my taste, but it wasn't bad. For food we had ordered the olives, gambas al ajillo, patatas bravas, and the charcuteria. Everything was good. I love olives, so they were delicious to me. A few of them were spicy and had a kick to them. The gambas al ajillo was very flavorful and the charcuteria was pretty decent as well. The patatas bravas were really filling. A little too mushy for me, but they were good.Overall, the food was good, definitely not the best, nor anything memorable but everything was flavorful. Service was excellent. I feel like they checked in on us just enough times. The prices weren't too bad. I would say average for tapas. Not sure if they do this every night, but there was a live guitar player which was cool. It added a nice touch to the ambiance. While I wouldn't make a special trip out here, it's a nice option if you're in the area.

55.description: Food and drinks are great.  Great prices.  Good value.

9.description: First and foremost what's with all the spelling errors on their menus? They should grab a student off the street to proofread their menus before handing them to people.... What a shame.It took a good 15  minutes for us to get acknowledged by a waiter/waitress.  When she came finally, we order a pitcher of sangria.... Come on, I know all businesses are cutting costs but that sangria was sewage water... It was sooooooo watered down and disgusting.  We told the waitress and she went back in and "made" a fresh pitcher... She literally added a little red wine to the pitcher.. It was bad... It took a while before she came back to take our food order, it was not busy for being a Friday.The food is ok... I remember the food being better before.  My biggest disappointment was the goat cheese.. The sauce was orange and it looked gross and it was hard to try to find the miserable piece of goat cheese in that orangy colored sauce.... Disgusting.I can go on and on but I guess we get the picture.  Save your money and go to iberico.The ceviche was good.

26.description: I really like this place for the set up, and it's a great place for hosting group events. I went to this place with a social group, and the seating was spacious. Our server was very accomodating, and they made sure we were doing well. We ordered several tapas, and I must say that they were pretty good except for the potatoes. The potatoes tapas really lacked flavoring and could have used a bit more seasoning to it. Would I come back here? Wouldn't be my first choice, but if I was in the neighborhood with some friends who want a quick bite. I would recommend this place.

25.description: Walked in for the third time to this place and sadly there was a snail/worm on the booth, we told the waiter and he removed it with his bare hand and came back like in 6 seconds....don't think he washed his hands. We left.Would I come back: Never

12.description: Instead of the complimentary chips and salsa, they brought out potato bravas which are baked potato bites with a spicy ranch sauce which was absolutely mouthwatering and addictive. Lunch special was a pretty good bite for the buck with two tapa dishes and a dessert for only $12. Good service and nice atmosphere with Latin music. Will definitely be coming back.

59.description: Was here for their $12 daily (weekdays) lunch special which includes patatas bravas, an entree, a main course, and flan.  Great deal!  I got the ceviche for the entree and it was fresh and tasty and the chicken pinchos for the entree which was small but healthy.  Dessert was small too but for $12, it was totally reasonable (plus better for my waistline).  Rounded lunch out with champagne margarita and ended up spending $25 in all for a delicious lunch experience.  Nice ambiance.

21.description: I love this place! I first fell in love with their patata bravas and then their sangrias, but all their dishes are delish.  I recently had a birthday party of about fifteen people and all raved about how amazing the food was.  Even the music was soothing and tasteful.  The food is great but their customer service is amazing.  I planned by birthday dinner with Victor Marin (victor@latabernatapas.com) and he was super awesome.  I would strongly recommend you contact him if you plan on organizing a group event.  Overall, had a great time!!

17.description: I really like this place for the set up, and it's a great place for hosting group events. I went to this place with a social group, and the seating was spacious. Our server was very accomodating, and they made sure we were doing well. We ordered several tapas, and I must say that they were pretty good except for the potatoes. The potatoes tapas really lacked flavoring and could have used a bit more seasoning to it. Would I come back here? Wouldn't be my first choice, but if I was in the neighborhood with some friends who want a quick bite. I would recommend this place.

10.description: Beautiful ambiance! It's dim, romantic, and has live music. Tapas are pretty delicious here!Service here is okay. Not super friendly, not super unfriendly. Sometimes rush you for no reason on slow nights. Some favorites:-patatas bravas-quest de cabra-croquettes de pollo-empanadas de picadillo

5.description: First time here the service was great, the food was delicious.I fell in love with the lime in the coconut margarita.

3.description: This place is definitely a great addition to the neighborhood as there aren't many tapas place in this neighborhood. I have been here 2 times and the food has been decent both times. Dishes we thought were great:Chicken croquetteDates con TocinoPatatas BravasGambas al AjilloBeef EmpanadasCeviche de Lima

35.description: This place is reasonably priced and delicious. I have been here many times and have ordered tapas plates and the paella... not in the same sitting though! The paella is comparable to the paella I've eaten in Spain... very fresh fish and amazingly flavored rice. The tapas plates are just as good and authentic, too. I've had sangria as well as red wine here, too. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

19.description: I came here with my mom while visiting and we had a pretty good time. It's a great place to go and order a bunch of different things and share among the group. My favorite were the Patatas bravas and some soup who's name I can't remember. It was seafood based and it was absolutely fantastic. I had to stop myself from ordering a second bowl.

28.description: I haven't had one bad dish here and I've tried almost everything. Their sangrias are to die for and they're moderately priced to boot. Great for large or small gatherings. Definitely recommend!

45.description: Location is great, parking was a challenge, outdoor patio has a romantic feel, the drinks are amazing, but the food was unimpressive. After a friend recommended this restaurant, I was expecting more from the menu.  I could list all of the tapas we ordered, but I won't...nothing was memorable.  Since this was my first time, I would like to go back, just in case they were having an off night.  Rather than ordering several tapas at one time, I'll order only one...if I like it, I'll order another, then another.

33.description: Favorite tapas restaurant I've found so far. Great atmosphere, amazing food and sangria, perfect service. Each time I've been Adrian has been my server, last time was by request, and he was the best. Can't wait to go back.

43.description: By far the best Tapas restaurant I have ever been to. New on the menu are delicious pork belly tacos that go nicely with their spicy papas. Nice wine selection, amazing sangria and great service. Nicely decorated restaurant with outdoor patio and live entertainment on the weekends. One of my favorite places to dine at a reasonable price.

2.description: Came here for an event... LOVE THE FOOD and great service. THE BAR is terrible service. Super rude, charging people different prices, definitely sensitive about something that the kitchen does not care about.I've come here before on a regular day and we were just talking about coming back until we visited the bar. They really killed any desire we had to come back with their poor service and rude attitudes. The bartenders should be told that they also count when it comes to service

18.description: Very good food and atmosphere. Service is sometimes slow, but when they do show up they take care of you. Drink menu is pretty average. Definitely a good place to go and relax, especially when they have live music.

41.description: My friends and I were here last Friday.  While the food was nothing special,  we had a good time.  So when my company offered a deal via restaurant. com I took it to try the food again.  I wanted a night in so I called for a carryout and expressed that I had the voucher.  I was told that it could only be used to dine in so that they can coax you into spending more money on alcohol and add ons.  First of all, that is very brass to say to a customer.  And second, not everyone drinks.  I have a copy of the certificate which does not say ANYWHERE that it's dine-in only.  I told the manager that I would provide a bad review, his response was "I don't care".  What type of customer service is that.  Will NEVER return to this ridiculous place.  I hope no one else does either.

52.description: I was here to celebrate my new job with my BF on Tue for their Tue special - 7 tapas for $40. It was our second time here and we enjoyed our experience. The first time when we were here (with a big group of friends), there was live music.We sat by the window (I think that's the best spot in the whole restaurant) and ordered Tue special. Our waiter was very nice and the chief/owner even came out to greet people. I think this Tapas place is great! No long line, tasty food in big portion. I highly recommend it! When I saw yelp reviews afterwards, I felt it's unfair to a good restaurant to receive only 3.5 star. For people who have doubles about this restaurant, why don't you give it a try on Tue? You will be impressed!

50.description: Dined here last night and had a great time. Food is pretty good but definitely not the best tapas in the city. I would recommend the ceviche de gambas and the gambas al ajillo but definitely not the calamares a la plancha. Dessert was also good. We had the churros and the empanada de manzana. What did make the night (Saturday night) extra fun was the live flamenco music and dancing.

4.description: This is definitely a go to spot in the UIC area. The service is usually quick and the food is delicious. I haven't had anything I didn't like from their menu, and it's a huge menu! Tip: this place is BYOB, but there is a corking fee of $25.

6.description: I went to Tabanera Tapas last night to celebrate my one year wedding anniversary. After I got married we had a dinner at Tabanera Tapas as well. My husband and I had a wonderful meal and our server was excellent. I had a Sangria flight and my husband ordered Estrella de Galincia which is a Spanish beer. My husband said the beer was smooth and the Sangria was amazing. I love it when places actually put liquor into the Sangria in addition to the wine that's already in there. I had the empanadas de picadillo which were so delicious. They were so small and cute. There were about four empandas on my plate. They were very flavorful and I loved the savory with a little bit of sweet since the empanadas had raisins inside. We also had the albondigas which were two meatballs in a plate of tomato soup with two pieces of bread. The tomato soup and bread was awesome! The meatballs were kind of chewy and had these little white pieces that I had to spit out. My husband also ordered the patatas bravas and chorizo and camarron pinchos. Both of those were excellent and the shrimp had a nice grilled smokiness to it. The potatoes were just the right amount of spicy and were delicious. I had a lamb dish on skewers that I cant remember the name of. The lamb meat was a little tough but very flavorful. Overall I love the ambiance of this place and they have great service. There was a guy singing live while he played the guitar. It was very romantic and I will definately be back. This place is kinda pricey when you put into consideration how small the portions are. But it was a lot of fun because I left full but not stuffed.

22.description: great place, very good tapas, great service with great, warm people and awesome atmosphere.

15.description: My review is based on the service. The food was delicious, though the caipirinha I ordered wasn't prepared properly (they did not muddle the lime, but instead threw whole lime chunks in the drink and there was no mint to speak of--yeah, that's not how this works).Our waiter (initials VM) apparently had better things to do last night and couldn't wait for us to leave. Out celebrating a friend's birthday, we both arrived by 9:15 pm. From the moment I sat down, I felt rushed to leave, though their website states they don't close until 11 pm on Thursday nights. By 9:30 pm he told us the kitchen was being shut down. Really? The place was empty, so, yes, I can understand getting a move on with cleaning up early, etc. I don't begrudge the efficiency, but not at the expense of rushing paying customers out the door. It's a tapas bar. You are supposed to order small plates throughout the evening, not all at once. We could have easily spent more than $100, but he capped us at less than half that because he wanted to go home.And speaking of the door, as soon as we stepped across the threshold onto the sidewalk, he unceremoniously locked the door behind us immediately (it made a really loud clicking sound). Mind you, by this time it was 10:30 pm, a full half hour before closing time.As a restaurant review is as much about the food as the service, I will not be back. The only reason why it is a 2-star review is because I liked the food. If based on service alone it would be zero. (And yes, I did still tip 15%. He's lucky he got that. After the door-locking incident I wish that I would have tipped nothing.)

57.description: I was impressed! Classica Sangria was amazing. The tapas selections we had were great. We had (not the name on the menu) chicken croquettes, bacalao, eggplant w/mozzarella and tomato basil sauce, queso fundido (actual name on menu), empanadas w/picadillo, 2 others I don't recall and 2 types of paella. Thumbs up I'll be back!

20.description: First and foremost what's with all the spelling errors on their menus? They should grab a student off the street to proofread their menus before handing them to people.... What a shame.It took a good 15  minutes for us to get acknowledged by a waiter/waitress.  When she came finally, we order a pitcher of sangria.... Come on, I know all businesses are cutting costs but that sangria was sewage water... It was sooooooo watered down and disgusting.  We told the waitress and she went back in and "made" a fresh pitcher... She literally added a little red wine to the pitcher.. It was bad... It took a while before she came back to take our food order, it was not busy for being a Friday.The food is ok... I remember the food being better before.  My biggest disappointment was the goat cheese.. The sauce was orange and it looked gross and it was hard to try to find the miserable piece of goat cheese in that orangy colored sauce.... Disgusting.I can go on and on but I guess we get the picture.  Save your money and go to iberico.The ceviche was good.

36.description: love this place if you understand about tapas this is a gourmet tapas place love the house sangria is a great ambienceWe brought our friends and they loved it toowill come back any time for more great chef Thanks

14.description: Great place to dine.   The patio is very cool/romantic especially at night. The decor is very nice and they play lounge music. Makes lunch very relaxing.  The food was good as well.  I have no complaints.  Parking could be tough but there is a garage 1 block away that beats the street parking.  It's 2$ for 2.5 hrs so better than street parking.  I had their lunch special a few times. The waiters are always attentive which helps when u are in a crunch for time.  Will return back.

58.description: A girlfriend and I happened upon this quaint amazing restaurant as we were walking down the street. We were lucky because a reservation had canceled so there was one open table for us. Our server was phenomenal. Our baked stuffed artichoke was the best I've ever had. Stuffed artichokes can have a tendency to be bland and under cooked. That was not the case here. Let us move on to the delectable entrees we had. My pasta in alfredo was wonderful. The vegetables were large pieces and the shrimp was very fresh. I also enjoyed that their Alfredo is on the thinner side instead of being over the top creamy which can ruin a dish. It was perfect. Our white chocolate mousse dessert was amazing and I can't wait to go back and take my husband. I would recommend a reservation for anyone who wants to try Rosal's. It is worth the trip to Little Italy.

56.description: So, you live in (or are visiting) Chicago, enjoy Italian food, and have not been to RoSals? Do yourself a favor and go. Unlike several other Italian joints in the city, you feel right at home walking in (with a 90% chance of being greeted by the owner). This is the real deal. Classical dishes with a modern flare and great flavors. The menu will accommodate most (or they will fancy to your liking) and prices are fair. Drinks were generously poured and a nice list of cocktails, beers, and wines. Make it a classy date night or an outing with the friends. The cherry on top: all staff was prompt and professional (not in your face or totally absent). Phil took really good care of us - great guy! We'll be back for sure. Thank you!

29.description: My husband and I had a wonderful experience this past weekend.  The staff was so friendly and accommodating.  The food was delicious, but I think it was the atmosphere that would make me want to go back again.  They made us feel like family...an absolutely pleasant dining experience.

42.description: Recently moved back to Chicago and re-visited an old favorite, RoSal's. I've had many, many of their dishes and have enjoyed each experience. I don't live in the neighborhood any longer so won't go considerably out of my way to re-visit but it feels like home and I have many good associations with RoSal's. We used to be served a complimentary Sambuca at the close of the meal and that didn't happen since they've reopened.....so a bit of the 'family' feel is missing but it's still a safe bet for a good meal! I'll be back...but with slightly revised expectations.

23.description: I don't understand how folks could give this place one star. We went to RoSals on a double date and couldn't have been more satisfied. The service was amongst the best (friendly, knowledgable, personable, unintrusive) we've seen anywhere. The food was exceptional; highly recommend the fried ravioli (the sauce was out of control), the gnocchi was perfect, chicken florentine was out of this world. The environment was very comfortable, not loud, and perfect for conversation; you feel like you are a guest in somebody's home. The owner came and talked to us for a while; very charming man who gave us a few laughs and gave us a little history of his business and his passion (the food).  We highly recommend this place if you're looking for great food and a family experience.

47.description: We loved ou first time experience with the family. We liked the intimate setting of the restaurant quiet, clean, organized and yet private at the same time. From our first drink to paying the bill the staff was out of this world polite, fun, knowledgeable and attentive. The food was amazing frattezell and lunch meat board, chicken with vesuvio potatoes,  nocchi with vodka sauce and rigatoni with sausage chicken asparagus and a light red sauce. Cappuccino to top it off. It was a rainy night and our table was laughing by the time we left. Loved the family decore of pictutes my parents grew up there so it made it that much more memorable. Our bill was more than reasonable with 2 drinks included. We hit Marios Italian Lemonade  after and the drive home was more laughter trying everyones flavors. Than you for a beautiful birthday and anniversary rolled into one. We will definitely be back.

8.description: Best Italian food in Chicago on famous Taylor street!! Amazing service, great owners, and even better food! Gnocchi's, linguine al frutti di mare, and the dessert like are all amazing!!

31.description: Awesome food. Warm friendly service. Loved the chicken cacciatore and the portion size was huge. Tender chicken and delicious veg and potatoes. Sauce was tangy and hearty. WE started with the broccoli salad another winner. Finished with the Lemoncello sorbet which brought me straight back to my time on the amalfi coast.  Full Disclosure: the food was so good and the portions so large I just had my concierge deliver a mini fridge to save the leftovers for lunch.

34.description: Went there on a Monday and was absolutely blown away! Ask for Joe on Monday nights, he'll take real good care of you! It tastes like Grandma is in the back cooking!

16.description: One of Chicagos best. Small neighborhood place serving great food with great service. Six of us at dinner and each dish was great. Fried ravioli app was great as well as the eggplant rolls. Service was friendly and prompt.

13.description: A good friend has been going here for years with his family and highly recommended Rosals. Yelp reviews fully supported his recommendation (solid 4 stars). Rosals just celebrated 25 years in the heart of Chicagos Taylor Street, they must be serving great Italian food, right? Right?!?!Nope.Our server was very friendly and explained we could basically create our dish and made some recommendations.  The caprese lacked any character (and used some really tasteless tomatoes) but we were willing to overlook it. The Rigatoni Arrabiata also lacked any punch (had to supplement with red pepper flakes which I've never used in my life) and the Rigatoni Gambini was a complete disaster--- sauce that resembles watered down milk, same tasteless tomatoes borrowed from the caprese topped with spinach sautéed to minimize flavor. I wanted to send back the Gambini and ask if that's how it's intended to be prepared but, hey, they've been there for 25 years, I guess someone likes how it's made.Stunned it has more than 2 stars on yelp. Almost went to La Scarola the next day to remind ourselves what Italian food can taste like.

11.description: The place was small but nice. Family pictures were the decorations on the wall. Also, Italian music was played throughout our time there. Food was amazing. I loved the fried ravioli and fried shrimp spaghetti. Their sausage and lasagna were great too. We parked on the streets as it wasn't hard to find one. But we realized there was a valet parking too at the restaurant. The wait for the food was about 25 mins. The waitress was really sweet. I'll probably visit again. The price is definitely on the higher end. The portion was quite big though so it's worth the money.

39.description: I really enjoyed this place.  I think bc it was rated highest on yelp I may have had higher expectations than appropriate, but it was still delightful.Still, it was very good.  The Fruta del Mar, Antipasta Board & Gnocchi were my faves.  The fried ravioli and fried spaghetti were both disappointing ( I can see that is a debated topic on this board, since most love the fried ravioli but neither actually seemed fried which is kind of really weird to me.  Great ambiance and a great waitress, Gina, who seemed to handle our craziness very well.And I know I should be shot for saying this about an Italian restaurant, but it looses a star for the garlic level.  It was just a bit too much for me to handle :(

37.description: My wife and I have been dining at Rosal's for years and its such a special treat for us when we make it downtown to this fabulous Taylor St. restaurant.  This time, we took the kids with us after a long day at one of the downtown museums.  We called ahead and got in right away.  The atmosphere is super comfortable...like dining at your grandmother's kitchen!   Lasagne, Linquine with Shrimp in a light cream sauce (this was a special the night we were there and was unbelievable...should be on the permanent menu), Linquine with clams (on the kids menu by the way...it was truly an adult sized portion) and Pasta w/Pesto...everything was excellent as always.  Solid wine selection, great fresh baked bread with EVOO/parmesan.  Tiramisu is excellent.  I've never had a bad dish here.  Its one of my favorite "go to" restaurants in the city.  True "old world" Italian in Chicago.  Oh, and a shout out to our server "Joe", who made the entire experience that much better!

0.description: Went here for a corporate dinner -The minute we walked in I was hooked. It's a quaint little Italian restaurant that is dim lit and cozy. The appetizers were amazing - we ordered calamari which was absolutely delicious. I'm so glad it was fresh and not breaded so you could really get calamaris true flavor. We also had the ravioli which was outstanding. They have duck stuffed ravioli which is on my bucket list to get next time I dine here I'm sure it's outstanding!For dinner I ordered the cod fish which was on top of penne noodles and a light lemon cream sauce, broccoli and capers. It was so delicious! Heads up though! These dishes are family style. Next time I go I definitely know to share with everyone else because your dish alone is for at least 2-3 people. Overall AMAZING!! I highly recommend!

38.description: In true Italian spirit this little establishment delivers an accurate representation of Italy's rich & flavorful culture, from its smooth tasty extra virgin olive oil to its natural wide planked floors & casually strung lighting, this restaurant has become a staple in our rotation for dining out. You must try their famous fried ravioli; be sure to ask for extra bread because you will certainly want to savor every last drop of creamy heavenly sauce the ravioli are nestled in.I have made my way around the menu. Everything off their "family favorites" category is sure to make you want to return for more. Their lasagna al forno is a classic, meaty, sweet, and addicting plate. A perhaps hidden treasure on the menu is their stuffed chicken breast filled with apple breading, bathed in a light cream sauce and broccoli.The atmosphere is very romantic. Ask to be seated on the first level. The second level is nice, but more secluded. The service is casual, which is nice when you are looking to spend time with a loved one and not be rushed out the door. Go for the experience, the food, and the memories you will create.

51.description: Cute little restaurant. I went on a weeknight so was not crowded and did not need a reservation. I feel that both my salad and my dessert were better than the main entrée. The caprese salad had fresh mozzarella and tomatoes. The peanut butter pie was good. Service was friendly and staff reviewed menu options.

27.description: Pros: Good sized portions (if that's your sort of thing).Cons: Indifferent service, food overcooked.Our group of seven went to RoSal's for Mother's Day dinner last night; we won't be going back.Food: The most notable sin at RoSal's was that most of the dishes came out overcooked.  The  biggest problems came with the steaks.  Two out of three were not cooked to temperature.  A filet that was ordered rare came out medium well, and another filet was undercooked and unevenly cooked.  I know what you're thinking "why order steak at an Italian restaurant?" (I agree) but simply put, if a dish is on the menu, a restaurant should have proficiency in properly cooking it.  Generally speaking, the food had good flavor and if I was rating on flavor of the dishes alone, RoSal's would have merited 3 stars.Service: Our waitress was very indifferent and didn't spend much time with our large group.  I did not expect fawning service (I don't like that anyway) but it was only after we had been waiting 20+ minutes for our entrees that she strolled by to say that the delay was because of the steaks we ordered (note: the restaurant was only 2/3 full, and it doesn't take 20 minutes to cook a steak).  When one steak came out VERY overcooked, the waitress whisked it away with nary an apology.  The replacement steak was brought to the table after everyone else had finished eating.  While I don't expect free food, the manager should have at least come to the table to apologize or offered to comp something.  It puts a damper on the dining experience when six people have to wait on someone else to eat due to the kitchen's mishap.Later, we had the following conversation with our waitress:Waitress: Would you like dessert menus?Us: Yes.*Three minutes passes*Waitress: Would you like dessert menus?Us: Yes.Not the end of the world, but typical of our interactions.  When dessert menus came, they were hurriedly passed out upside down.  Certainly not a crime, but indicative of an inattention to detail.Ambiance: The restaurant has a casual, unassuming vibe.  I saw a couple reviews state that it's romantic; it is not.  The restaurant was noticeably cold on our visit; so much so that we had to ask the waitress to turn up the heat.  Her response: "I'll tell them to turn off the air conditioner".  Why the a/c was on when the temperature was in the 50s is a question to which I will never know the answer as I won't be returning to this establishment.

32.description: I can't believe I haven't written a review for Rosal's yet, because I've been there SO many times and have never had a bad experience. It's a small and cozy restaurant and I've never had a dish I haven't liked. They're also willing to make changes too based on your preferences, for example if you want a different sauce. There's a gal who's usually there greeting people who is super nice and always very friendly, and we've had the same waiters many times over who are always nice and do a good job. I've taken a lot of friends and family here too who always enjoy it, and we usually go on Fridays then head over to Beviamo for live music night. I've NEVER had a problem parking nearby, but they do offer valet if you don't want to find your own spot. This is a great little restaurant and it's still my dad's favorite lasagna of all time, and he's probably the only patron who can actually finish the whole plate since it's basically a huge brick of carbs and cheese :) Yum!

54.description: RoSal's is one of the better restaurants on Taylor Street. Their food is very good. I like their appetizers, pasta dishes and meat dishes.

48.description: Excellent food. Plates at the table included: family style salad (basic), grilled calamari, stuffed artichoke, Scallop special (mushroom, broccoli, scallop with oli'oli sauce, veal with a  puttanesca sauce, chicken cacciatore and spinach ravioli. Plenty of food and could definitely share.Good service. Family atmosphere.Small, but good wine list.Will absolutely return.

44.description: I went to RoSal's Italian Cuisine a few times already , last year and this year , including recently , and can't wait to go back to bring another friend with !!  The staff were so welcoming , it's an authenticcccc Italian Restaurant ( I know - because my family grew up with neighbors who are Italian and have their own restaurant still now going on like 20 yrs!! We still go there!!)  At RoSal's, the service was outstanding each time I went , wait staff very attentive,  the menu was so intriguing I always have a hard time deciding what to order cuz there's so many dishes that sound and are delicious , fresh and u feel like you are in Italy!!  :)) The dishes are soooooo flavorful and truly out of this world ! I love their Italian food there !!!!  Needless to say, I highly recommend you bring your family and friends there soon! U will love it!! Call ahead if it's a busy time for a RSVP.  Mmm!!

24.description: Consistently excellent. Friendly host, extensive excellent menu, good wine list. They offer so many things on their menu, I'm not sure how they can always get it out of the kitchen perfectly done. I've had their veal, lasagna, and my guess he had something called Sicilian fried spaghetti. It was really tasty.  It's a small place so make sure you make a reservation!

7.description: Walking in, the atmosphere is great. The owner came over and introduced himself. Food was pretty good but not best I've had in Chicago. Great place for a date though and awesome customer service!

49.description: This place feels like you are eating dinner at someone's house! I can't speak for downstairs, but the upstairs space is like a living room was transformed into a very small dining room with a small bar area. The selections are a bit limited and prices are on the high side, but it's a quaint little place that I would probably come again if I was in the area and looking for Italian food. Street parking here can be tough at times. Right now on yelp there is a free shot (keep the shot glass) coupon too when you check in. I had a salad and antipasto plate. It was good but nothing to get all worked up over. My friend had a pasta dish that she said was pretty good, but again not the best she's ever had. For the price, I would prefer to go to Quartino's, but if you are in the Tri-Taylor area, this place isn't bad. There's a coffee shop close by with good coffee and gelato for after dinner too!

40.description: Where do I start?  When you have a sign that says, "Come as friends and leave as family.", you really wonder if that is going to be true...  There are so many places that promise you something and don't really deliver on it.  This place is the real deal.  When you walk in, you get a waft of the great smells of an Italian kitchen.  The staff is very friendly and it was amazing to see how closely they worked together, taking each others' checks to be run through the POS system, helping with carrying dishes, setting up coffees, etc.  This cooperation doesn't come from a place that only espouses slogans, but rather when the owners walk the talk and sling hash with everyone else.  The food was outstanding.  Everything fresh and cooked to order.  Many of the dishes were standards, but the specials were well conceived and executed perfectly.  I have been a nurse thirty six years and went to culinary school three years ago to start a retirement career in catering.  My passion is to cook like a grandmother (albeit with a few modern interpretations).  It was great to talk with the owner who sat down at our table and find out about his passion for providing top notch food for his guests.  I highly recommend this place and hope that you will enjoy it as much as my wife and I did.

53.description: 3/4 states this is the new best classic Italian restaurant. I agree.  Charming service. Food cooked with love.

30.description: A good friend has been going here for years with his family and highly recommended Rosals. Yelp reviews fully supported his recommendation (solid 4 stars). Rosals just celebrated 25 years in the heart of Chicagos Taylor Street, they must be serving great Italian food, right? Right?!?!Nope.Our server was very friendly and explained we could basically create our dish and made some recommendations.  The caprese lacked any character (and used some really tasteless tomatoes) but we were willing to overlook it. The Rigatoni Arrabiata also lacked any punch (had to supplement with red pepper flakes which I've never used in my life) and the Rigatoni Gambini was a complete disaster--- sauce that resembles watered down milk, same tasteless tomatoes borrowed from the caprese topped with spinach sautéed to minimize flavor. I wanted to send back the Gambini and ask if that's how it's intended to be prepared but, hey, they've been there for 25 years, I guess someone likes how it's made.Stunned it has more than 2 stars on yelp. Almost went to La Scarola the next day to remind ourselves what Italian food can taste like.

46.description: glorious amazing carbs. fried ravioli is unreal. portabellas are equally awesome. Awesome laid back vibe

1.description: The fourth of four evening meals on a recent trip, every one a winner.  Chicago is a great eating town.This is an enlarged hole-in-the-wall Italian.  Nothing unexpected, and also nothing wrong: you'll get exactly the traditional fare you'd predict.  Friendly staff, decent wine list, crowded tables in a storefront setting: perfect low-thought food in large portions.  So the 3* is exactly what the 'A-OK' description should be: not fancy, but reliable, a place to go and meet old friends where the focus will be the conversation rather than the food but you'll leave full and happy.

55.description: This place has a great atmosphere, large tasty portions, friendly service, and fair prices. You can never go wrong with going there for dinner.

9.description: We found RoSal's on the Check Please site and took a chance. The decor is elegant but puts you at ease. The service was very good. As a former waitress, I have very high standards that, frankly, are rarely met. There was nothing to complain about and everything to compliment regarding the service at RoSal's. Now for the food, may I just say-sublime. Down home Sicilian. Go there. We will be back. PS. They have valet.

26.description: Great food! Came here with the 2 pickiest men on the planet. My boyfriend and my son. Both left full and extremely satisfied. The ravioli app is a must! We got the chicken florentino very good but a little too much cheese. We also got the salmon and artichoke heart pasta which was amazing!! Really great portions for the price. You definitely won't leave this place without being full to the max!

25.description: We were in town for NRA 2015.  My husband wanted Italian so we decided  to check RoSal's out. We arrived and were immediately greeted. Our table was located next to the "Family" wall. It was so cool seeing multiple generations on the wall and in person. The food and drinks were great. My husband loved the lasagna and I thoroughly enjoyed the Shrimp Diablo. Considering there so many corporate restaurants, RoSal's was a nice change of pace. Keep doing what you do!

12.description: This place was amazing. It felt like I was eating grandma's Italian cooking. By far one of the best Italian places we have ever been to. Looking forward to returning to Chicago and eating here again. Every thing we ordered was amazing!

59.description: I love Rosal's - my BF and I had some of our first dates there.  It's a small family owned Italian restaurant that has a special place in my heart.  Be that as it may, at the end of the day, it's about the food and service - both of which are great at Rosal's.  Everything I've ever had at Rosal's has been very good.  From the pasta to the chicken - all delicious.  The bread they bring to the table is nice and warm and crusty and is heaven with the oil/cheese.  The last dinner I had was rigatoni with artichokes and sundried tomatoes.  I gotta tell you - the portion was very very generous - I think I got through 1/4 before I had to box it up - it was so much food!  It was so fresh and even though it was pasta, it was surprisingly light.  We also had the ravioli appetizer which was also very good - the cheese sauce, again, did not seem very heavy - it was light and had a really yummy garlicky taste that just drew me in - I ended up spooning the sauce onto my plate and dipping bread into it - wish I had some right now!!Service is very attentive - our glasses were always full, someone always asking us if we were OK.  Place is definitely on the smaller side - very charming, warm and cozy.  If you want a nice relaxing delicious Italian dinner, try Rosal's.

21.description: Quaint neighborhood southern Italian focused menu. Mountain high classic lasagna was outstanding. Fried ravioli starter was a table favorite. Great service knowledgeable waiter made spot on suggestions. Would visit again.

17.description: Great food! Came here with the 2 pickiest men on the planet. My boyfriend and my son. Both left full and extremely satisfied. The ravioli app is a must! We got the chicken florentino very good but a little too much cheese. We also got the salmon and artichoke heart pasta which was amazing!! Really great portions for the price. You definitely won't leave this place without being full to the max!

10.description: As soon as I walked in the owner came up to us and was very friendly. He was humorous and inviting. He walked us upstairs to our seats. It was a very comfortable atmosphere and so old school.Now when I got upstairs to my seats the waiters were very friendly still and attentive. I got moscato that was perfect to taste. I ordered the chicken alla Ramon. It was absolutely  amazing. I couldn't finish it all Because I had so much bread. But my food was very good. It had a lot of flavor, and was spicy. The music was very fitting. It wasn't too loud. It was romantic. It was a perfect night and I would definitely recommend this place.

5.description: As in other reviews the portions are huge so you can split a main course.  Had the Rigatoni Diablo. The pasta was very fresh but the sauce wasn't spicy and not very tasty.My wife had the gluten free pasta which cost a premium and not too good.The restaurant is cute and staff was nice but average food.

3.description: Through and through just an excellent dining experience. My girlfriend and I dined at Rosal's for Valentine's Day. The atmosphere is everything you'd expect from a traditional "red-sauce" establishment in Little Italy. Our host and server was outstanding. Knowledgeable and helpful, but by no means overbearing. We shared the fried raviolis as an appetizer and nearly licked the plate clean it was so good. For dinner my girlfriend had the shrimp Alfredo and I have the Veal Parmigiana. It was one of the best meals I've had in a very long time. They have made lifetime customers after that meal!

35.description: As soon as I walked in the owner came up to us and was very friendly. He was humorous and inviting. He walked us upstairs to our seats. It was a very comfortable atmosphere and so old school.Now when I got upstairs to my seats the waiters were very friendly still and attentive. I got moscato that was perfect to taste. I ordered the chicken alla Ramon. It was absolutely  amazing. I couldn't finish it all Because I had so much bread. But my food was very good. It had a lot of flavor, and was spicy. The music was very fitting. It wasn't too loud. It was romantic. It was a perfect night and I would definitely recommend this place.

19.description: Great food! Great service! Large portions. I was sad we were headed to a show and couldn't take our leftovers with us. The fried ravioli is amazing. Can't wait to come back and try something else.

28.description: Simply an incredible find. Possibly the best Italian dinner in Chicago. What's even better is that it is a fraction of the cost of the overpriced spots in River North. Family run business that just oozes history and family pride. Great specials. Very small dining area. Reservations are the way to go.

45.description: Cant believe Rigatoni Diablo has so many good reviews... it was so shitty for its price. The wine's ok though.

33.description: I hate to give a poor review, but after seeing great reviews and having chosen to eat here based on them, I felt obliged to share my experience.  The decor was minimal which made us think the food would truly be the reason for good reviews.  We had a pretty large group so managed to cover quite a bit of the menu and just about everyone agreed the food was VERY average.  The service was ok, but the food really disappointed all around.  The veal was very flimsy and thin, the limoncello seemed to have no alcohol in it and tasted like a bad lemonade, the red sauce was subpar and the rest of the food was only "meh".  Having spent a lot of money there for very underwhelming food and only decent service left a poor taste in our mouth.  I wish I could give it a good review, but we just couldn't.  I would not recommend going here.

43.description: So we arrive in Chicago and immediately interested in hitting genuine landmarks. One important stop "Little Italy". We end up at RoSals and let me tell you that immediately you know you made a right choice.  The staff was courteous and our waiter "Joey" was knowledgeable and informative about our choice selections!  The food was phenomenal! Actually? They can actually bottle and sell their sauces and completely shut down!  The owner was engaged and actually cared about his customers!  Great service, great food!  Need to say no more!!

2.description: More or less everything you would want out of a white tablecloth but homey Italian American dining room. Staff was friendly, server smiled and chatted with all her guests, and food was generous and delicious. A table of three gets a large warm loaf of crusty bread with oil and cheese to take the edge off hunger. The wine list had a couple of bottles for $30 - we enjoyed a 2012 Merlot from Sicily. I had the chicken marsala - angel hair was al dente, sauce was a aromatic, sweet thin coating around every noodle, mushrooms were meaty and plentiful, and the two pounded chicken breast filets were tender but could have used a touch more seasoning to permeate the meat. Only flat note of the night was that our server did know some customers very well and spent some time at a table near us catching up while we were trying to catch her attention and head to our next destination. Otherwise, RoSal's is an example of why Italian cuisine still rules upper-middle class dining in American cities.

18.description: We chose this little gem of a restaurant because we wanted an authentic, non chain option in little Italy. So happy with our choice! Went with a total of 5 people and all of us got different entrees.  The starter Friend Ravioli and Rolled Eggplant was so delicious! I would have don't an entree of wither of these.  My entree was the Chicken Carbona, and let me say it was the hit of the table. Perfect blend of cheese sauce, the best I've ever had.  Other people had Veal Parm (SO GOOD) one had a Special of the day with Sausage and Chicken (Sausage had the best homemade taste and 2 gnocchi with different sauces, Everyone was so happy with their entrees. We also ordered the Cannolli and the Chocolate Peanut butter Pie (to go!) SO GLAD WE DID!  Atmosphere is that of a small restaurant, we sat upstairs and that is set up like someone's living room.  LOVED IT.  Prices were very reasonable and portions were huge! WE had a great waiter and the owner stopped by 2x to check on our meal.  I cannot wait to go back!

41.description: Eating at RoSal's reminds me of Sunday dinner at my nonna's when I was a kid.  The atmosphere is homey with an old-country decor, and they make me feel welcome.  (Only no one pushes me to clean my plate.) Hadn't been here for at least a year when we visited last week, so wasn't sure what to expect.  Glad to report it hasn't changed much.  I ordered the shells with fresh broccoli and shrimp, sautéed with just the right amount of garlic.  Delicious.   My friend had the 1/2 chicken RoSal's, perfectly seasoned... but his vesuvio potatoes were overcooked.  Our salads were nothing special.  But the scooped-out pineapple filled with homemade sorbet and the tiramisu were both awesome.The waitress was very attentive.  She didn't hurry us, even though it was busy.  Refilled out coffee several times without asking.   The food here is good, but I think it's the service that sets this restaurant apart from most of the others on Taylor.

52.description: I am from out of town and wanted something authentic with charm, this place hit all the marks. 10 tables, very cozy, great wine list, friendly wait staff, scratch made Italian while Frank Sinatra sings in the background ......sigh. what more can you ask for? I ordered shrimp with artichokes in a light creamy sauce with fresh tomatoes served on linguine, it was so hard to decide I wanted some of everything. When the waitress asked if we needed anything else all I could think of was a wheelbarrow! Roll me out.

50.description: I have eaten at RoSal's several times in the past, and booked my husband's graduation dinner there based on our previous experiences.  I was disappointed with the service and the food on this visit, and am not sure if this should be attributed to the fact that I was with a party of 12 or that the feel of the restaurant has changed since the renovation.  I was told that because I did not place my reservation early enough (3 months notice), my group would have to be seated upstairs.  While clean and newly remodeled, the upstairs dining room lacks any kind of character or ambiance.  It also means your meals will be carried upstairs and served in waves.  We ordered three appetizers.  Two came at the same time, and the third came 15 minutes later, at which time we were ready for our entrees.  My mom's meal was served at least 10 minutes after mine.The sausage and peppers were phenomenal!  The fried ravioli appetizer was also very good.  My group's entrees, which we ordered off the menu, seemed to lack flavor.  My rigatoni diablo did not have the faintest bit of spice, despite being advertised as very spicy.  All of the desserts were very good.  On previous visits the owner has stopped by to ask how our meal was or about the occasion being celebrated.  While not necessary, those personal touches were missing on this visit.  I might return with a small group, but would not bring a larger party.

4.description: Ate here on Friday 1/8/16 in a group of 7 and had an exceptional meal. The calamari was perfectly cooked, the mussels were probably the best I've ever had, and the handmade pastas were incredible. Great spot for date-night, great spot for Hawks/Bulls pre-game, and a lot of fun for a bigger group as well. Classic family-style Italian but more authentic and cozier atmosphere than those restaurants that try hard but come up short; we will absolutely go back.

6.description: Pros: Good sized portions (if that's your sort of thing).Cons: Indifferent service, food overcooked.Our group of seven went to RoSal's for Mother's Day dinner last night; we won't be going back.Food: The most notable sin at RoSal's was that most of the dishes came out overcooked.  The  biggest problems came with the steaks.  Two out of three were not cooked to temperature.  A filet that was ordered rare came out medium well, and another filet was undercooked and unevenly cooked.  I know what you're thinking "why order steak at an Italian restaurant?" (I agree) but simply put, if a dish is on the menu, a restaurant should have proficiency in properly cooking it.  Generally speaking, the food had good flavor and if I was rating on flavor of the dishes alone, RoSal's would have merited 3 stars.Service: Our waitress was very indifferent and didn't spend much time with our large group.  I did not expect fawning service (I don't like that anyway) but it was only after we had been waiting 20+ minutes for our entrees that she strolled by to say that the delay was because of the steaks we ordered (note: the restaurant was only 2/3 full, and it doesn't take 20 minutes to cook a steak).  When one steak came out VERY overcooked, the waitress whisked it away with nary an apology.  The replacement steak was brought to the table after everyone else had finished eating.  While I don't expect free food, the manager should have at least come to the table to apologize or offered to comp something.  It puts a damper on the dining experience when six people have to wait on someone else to eat due to the kitchen's mishap.Later, we had the following conversation with our waitress:Waitress: Would you like dessert menus?Us: Yes.*Three minutes passes*Waitress: Would you like dessert menus?Us: Yes.Not the end of the world, but typical of our interactions.  When dessert menus came, they were hurriedly passed out upside down.  Certainly not a crime, but indicative of an inattention to detail.Ambiance: The restaurant has a casual, unassuming vibe.  I saw a couple reviews state that it's romantic; it is not.  The restaurant was noticeably cold on our visit; so much so that we had to ask the waitress to turn up the heat.  Her response: "I'll tell them to turn off the air conditioner".  Why the a/c was on when the temperature was in the 50s is a question to which I will never know the answer as I won't be returning to this establishment.

22.description: This was one of my favorite restaurants during my week of vacation in Chicago. We learned about it while on the Untouchables Tour. It will be at the top of my list next time I go to Chicago!

15.description: RoSal's has exceptional food, exceptional service, and very fair prices. My wife and I wanted to try this place out after a recommendation from a friend and we were so glad we did!  Everything about our experience was stunning. We were greeted by a pleasant hostess, seated immediately, and given fantastic recommendations by our waiter. We tried to fried ravioli for appetizers and were absolutely floored. When we got our main courses (rigatoni diablo and shrimp alla anival), we were even more amazed. The food was piping hot and delicious--and big enough for 2-3 meals! The price was very reasonable and we were extremely happy with how we were treated and how our food turned out. Highly recommended. We can't wait to come back here again!

57.description: Whenever I travel to Chicago, this is a must stop! It ranks as one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the US. The food is authentic, and the service is perfectly typical Italian family style!We booked reservations (you should too! Can be a long wait!) for our carb-load dinner the night before the Chicago marathon... We weren't the only ones- there were runners everywhere!Get anything on the menu- everything is amazing. But my favorite is the ravioli a appetizer- hot damn that's good shit!

20.description: Visiting from out of town.  Decided to check this place out based on yelp.Great little place.  Only about 10 tables in the whole place.  Ordered the fettuccini Alfredo but added broccoli and chicken.  Tasted great!Staff was attentive. And parking was pretty easy.

36.description: My date and I selected this place based on the reviews in our ongoing endeavor to eat at locally owned restaurants in the Chicagoland area that we've never been to before.  Being suburbanites, obviously parking is the first issue. I had read that there was valet parking which we were finally able to discover after we had been around the block four times. There is no one standing out there nor is there any sign or stand announcing the valet and so finally we just pulled up in front to go ask and the guy came out once we stopped. Probably need to make it easier for your customers.... Kudos to the restaurant because we walked in at the time of our reservation and our table was ready. So we were ushered to the upstairs seating area. WARNING: Do not sit upstairs if you want a nice romantic dinner. The acoustics in that room were awful. There were two large parties sitting around us and my date and I could literally not hear each other even though I was sitting next to her at a four top. One of the parties even brought a baby ! So much for the nice quiet romantic Italian dinner. I will say the food was very good. But due to the large parties surrounding us, our server was barely attentive at best and seemed rushed to get us out of the table. Mind you, we ordered two appetizers, two of the more expensive entrées and alcohol so we were not cheap skating it at all. He never offered us a dessert menu and we had to ask him for it which he seemingly begrudgingly brought to us. And threw down on the table, not handing them to us he literally dropped them on the table.... So in closing, I will say the entrées are very good, the pan fried ravioli is a bit overrated, there is valet parking you just have to know that it's there and do not sit upstairs because you will not be able to hear your date. Would I go back again? I would say yes, but I would absolutely require to be seated downstairs.

14.description: Eating at RoSal's reminds me of Sunday dinner at my nonna's when I was a kid.  The atmosphere is homey with an old-country decor, and they make me feel welcome.  (Only no one pushes me to clean my plate.) Hadn't been here for at least a year when we visited last week, so wasn't sure what to expect.  Glad to report it hasn't changed much.  I ordered the shells with fresh broccoli and shrimp, sautéed with just the right amount of garlic.  Delicious.   My friend had the 1/2 chicken RoSal's, perfectly seasoned... but his vesuvio potatoes were overcooked.  Our salads were nothing special.  But the scooped-out pineapple filled with homemade sorbet and the tiramisu were both awesome.The waitress was very attentive.  She didn't hurry us, even though it was busy.  Refilled out coffee several times without asking.   The food here is good, but I think it's the service that sets this restaurant apart from most of the others on Taylor.

0.description: Bring in your printer's spent  ink cartridges and they'll refill them or swap for one on hand that's ready to go at a fraction of what it costs to buy them new.  Noticed that they have locations dotted all over the city.  Not sure about the other ones but this is part of the 'get-all-your-errands-done-at-once-in-under-an-hour' strip mall area at Roosevelt and Canal.  Easy parking equals in and out in a couple minutes.  Another little way to be eco-friendly and the little bit of effort pays big rewards.

58.description: Love their subs specials.

56.description: I ate here multiple times a week for years while I was at UIC.  Get the hot peppers on any sandwich - this place is awesome.

29.description: One word.....exceptional!!!!!!All of their food is exceptional!The turkey sub, the wise guy and every other sandwich on their list. Puts Subway, Jersey Mikes, Jimmy Johns and Potbelly to shame. They make the meatballs fresh. Slice the meats daily. Great place to grab a sub. With a hint of Italian.Badda bing badda bang

42.description: Simply the best subs I've ever had.  Beautifully sliced meats and cheeses served up on fresh gonnella bread... Fuggetabouuddit!  My first time in Fontano's, Neal, one of the owners, came by and introduced himself.  He asked how everything was, and was cool enough to offer my girlfriend and I free sample of the meatballs.  They were phenomenal.  Now my ladyfriend is addicted to the meatball sub.  I personally love the 'Blockbuster', however, the 'Wiseguy' is equally delicious.  The food is awesome, the people who run the joint are classy, and that's a combination that'll keep me coming back as long as Fontano's is in business.Give this place a chance.  You won't regret it.

23.description: Used to get lunch here often when I worked nearby. Now not as often, My son and I hit this place every year after the auto show for roast beef and provolone subs loaded with hot giardinara. So messy but so so good.  My wife loves the spicy Italian when we come down.  Back in the day it was a small grocery store,  now it's pretty much just subs etc. Great place.

47.description: Best corned beef & Swiss sandwich out there - extra giardiniera please!

8.description: I miss Fontano's!!  The thought of their blockbuster with hot peppers and oil makes my mouth water.  There is nothing like that out here in the west.  Also their prices can't be beat, especially for Chicago.

31.description: One of my favorite sandwich places!!!~ If I had to cheat on Potbelly's, I guess it would have to be with Fontano's LOL. It's just different, though. Cold vs. toasted sandwiches...Anyway, the meat quality here is fabulous. I usually get the turkey -- thinly sliced layers of turkey with tomatoes and lettuce on soft, chewy bread. It's phenomenal. Make sure to get some crunchy chips with it to balance out the textures. For those of you who know me, I do love my balanced textures and flavors. You gotta have the crunchy with the soft and chewy, as well as the spicy with the salty, savory. Or whatever else balanced each other out. A lot of my coworkers (I work at UIC down the block) love the meatball sandwich as well. If you're in the mood for a hot sandwich, definitely try that one.

34.description: HANDS DOWN the BEST subs in Chicago. The bread, the cheese, the meat, the giardiniera- ALL amazing.  I've been eating Fontanos for years and I still crave it weekly. My fave is the turkey and provolone but the Italian and meatball subs are to die for as well.

16.description: Wow why would anyone ever go to subway???Authentic, amazing sandwiches, very clean and friendly staff!

13.description: I was told they had better subs that their counter parts ... So I gave them a try ! I placed my order over the phone to avoid waiting , the lady over the phone was very nice . When I walked in the place is small cozy and clean. The sub: Italian sub was good, although I was expecting for their cold cuts to be among the expected but I think no pepperoni was used. A Little too much mayo and hot peppers but overall very better than subway ! I also bought a potato salad which was ok, it hAd a weird distasteful after taste and I'm not sure how to describe it. Price is good for what you get , I will definitely be back .

11.description: This place never disappoints. I wish they were open later sometimes. They should add more cheese choices for the subs too. Everything is delicious.

39.description: I love this place, I am a east coast guy and these are the best subs in the city! The bread is always fresh the meats are top quality and they make the subs big! The owner is a great guy always happy and friendly the staff is always pleasant and accommodating. Keep up the good work guys

37.description: It taste great! I go there at least twice a week. However, believe me you do not want be there afternoon. The young guys work there give you 1/3 less than noon time. They just put meet as they want, there is no standard. It is the third time happened to me.

0.description: After having this place bookmarked a while I finally got around to trying it. Previous reviews here lead me to order a Blockbuster 6 inch sub with hot peppers. It was amazing! Delicious bread, meats, and cheeses with fresh tasting veggies. Came home and warmed it for 30 seconds in the micro. Now I wished I bought a foot long. The dressing can be a bit overwhelming, so especially if you are eating at your desk, have lots of napkins. The atmosphere is very casual. I got in before the beginning of the lunch rush. Service is great and personable. The petite lady working there is very friendly. When I mentioned I found the place on Yelp, she was interested in what I ordered. If it wasn't the Blockbuster it would be the meatball sandwich. Well, it will give me a reason to go back- for the meatball, AND the cannoli that was calling my name from the counter ;) I saw from the menu that they have franchising, yet from what I understand, this location is the original. Highly recommended.

38.description: Great food! The subs are made there and are really fresh. The staff there are wonderful as well! My only issue is that the shop has very limited seating, but it is near UIC which during the spring and summer can be very nice to just sit and eat outside, but during the winter, that could be an issue. (Except the fact that being a student, I can just go to the Library after public hours and still eat there.) In conclusion, I have only been there once, but the food was fantastic and the prices are reasonable. I plan on going back very soon.

51.description: Food Quality: 3 Stars - Food wasn't bad, they had high quality meats. Somewhat limited selection though.Health: 3 Stars - While sandwiches are typically pretty healthy the only bread option was white.Staff: 3 Stars - I was greeted by a little old lady wearing a Fontano jacket so I'm assuming she worked there or owned the place. Beyond that the service was average at best. No smiles, and somewhat difficult to hear and understand. Atmosphere: 2 Stars - Everything seemed to be well organized but tables were dirty and it smelled weird. Location: 4 Stars - I like little Italy, it's a nice, safe area to walk around. Overall: 3 Stars

27.description: Best Meatball sandwich I've EVER had! Great food all around and the owner/workers were so kind! Went there 3 times while on an 8 day business trip, couldn't get that sandwich off my mind! GO THERE NOW! :)

32.description: I have not found a better meatball sub in the city.  I have tried the so called 'best' from other places for $15!?.. I come back here religiously.  Also nothing beats family service.

54.description: My father ate here as a student while attending UICC (yes, with the extra C) in the 1970's and introduce our family from MI to it in the late 1980's. Since moving to Chicago, its been amazing to go back and enjoy this establishment. As my father introduced Fontano's to me, so will I to my son. Great place.

48.description: The Italian sammich is fantastic!

44.description: Fantastic italian subs. Best I've had in Chicago. Great look business - very friendly staff. Make sure to add the oil and vinegar. You'll want to spit on Jersey Mikes after you have a sub here

24.description: So good! The Wiseguy is the oneVery nice staff and quickAnd I'd highly recommend this place to anyone who likes to eat. Italian deli In The winter equals warmth and comfort haha

7.description: Sandwich was everything you hope for when you're looking for something that's  comforting. Tasty sandwich, homey place Fontano's is the place to go when looking for a casual, local place to eat.

49.description: What's not to like? Some of the best subs in the city-the Italian and the American are the go-to choices for my wife and I. Her father started coming here for subs when he was a kid on Taylor St. and it's become a family tradition. The peppers are just right, everything tasting fresh...and if you get distracted those sandwiches will keep in the fridge for a day and still taste great! My wife and I love this place so much we had a lunch ordered and picked up for our attendants the day of our wedding! I hate the fact that it's closed on Sundays' but if it's out of respect for Family over Commerce, I understand. Fontano's...don't ever change!

40.description: This place is awesome . Great bread, awesomely fresh tomatoes and great meat and cheese .Blockbuster is the best sub i have ever had . Get there  before they get taken over by the corporate douche bags and the place ends up like subway or Jimmy Johns .

53.description: Great Subs!!

30.description: I go to UIC and having this place nearby is great! I get the turkey sub with everything on it and am always so stuffed right after. It's a really cool college spot to hang out around with friends or just grab a quick bite. Owners are great and always friendly. They have a business card with a loyalty program on it so you get a free sandwich after a certain amount of visits, of course I keep losing mine but hey great food is what counts!

46.description: I'm not a big fan of meatball subs but they're so good here.  The meat is very well seasoned and the sauce is just perfect.  I had the 8 in and I was only able to eat half. They have a 3ft meatball Sub challenge,  yikes!! No way.

1.description: I can't believe I've been a UIC student for 3.5 years and haven't made a visit to this spot! I've had friends who rave about this place, and decided to give it a try on a whim after classes. I got the blockbuster with everything, and oh my was it good! The bread was perfect for me and oh the meats.. such a good sub sandwich. The only thing I'd do differently is maybe not get the olive oil on top. It made a mess when I was trying to snuff the sandwich down in my class, but other than that I can't wait to go back!

55.description: Fontano's have very good subs. This location is a neighborhood corner store that make the subs at the rear of the store. Their meal deals are worth the price, I had the blockbuster sub, chips, soda, macaroni salad, and a cookie for about 8 bucks. The sandwich, cookie, and macaroni salad were all very good and had me full for the remaining of the day. It was a little crowded but my wife and I were in and out. The guy that made our sandwiches was very friendly, but there's a lil lady on staff that seems to have a attitude problem. I have only one complaint about the subs, the bread is pretty tough, if they would switch the bread I would give 5 stars. But it is a bang for your buck.

9.description: Got the Wise Guys -- no regrets! Amazing! Meats seemed quality, toppings were fresh, service was friendly and fast! Plus, it was national sandwich day so free pop and chips included. I'll be back!

26.description: We were working in town from out of state and found Fontano's near our building.  The Italian sausage sandwich was the best I have ever had.  The service was friendly and fast.  Mr. Fontano was very kind and was happy to show a few folks from California what Chicago style Italian deli was all about.  If I ever get back to the Windy City, I will be heading straight back to Fontano's.

25.description: Wow why would anyone ever go to subway???Authentic, amazing sandwiches, very clean and friendly staff!

12.description: My office started Meatball Sub Friday so we had an excuse to eat all (ok, many) of the meatball subs that Little Italy has to offer. Fontano's is far and away the very best! It's inexpensive, fast, a huge mess and always worth the trip. Definitely get cheese and peppers on your sub - you won't regret it!

59.description: My favorite place by UIC.  Great turkey sub!  The place looks run down inside, and the deli counter has been completely emptied.  That kind of turned off the person I was with, but I talked them into trying Fontano's out anyway.  They wound up loving it.They have a good $7.95 special- 6 in sub, chips, soda, salad, AND cookie.  They really load on the oil, so you might want to ask for easy on the oil.

21.description: Awesome place to get food and hang out! Great service and the food is unbelievable. If you are around uic, go here!

17.description: So good! The Wiseguy is the oneVery nice staff and quickAnd I'd highly recommend this place to anyone who likes to eat. Italian deli In The winter equals warmth and comfort haha

10.description: Took a trip from New Jersey to Chicago and wanted to try this place after reading all of the reviews. I can truly say that it exceeded all expectations. The hot roast beef was without a doubt the best I have ever had. The owner is very attentive and talks to every guest. A little off the beaten path but an absolute must try.

5.description: I love Fontanos! This place has been in the neighborhood for years and years. Great corned beef-- HUGE sandwiches! Just be careful when they ask you if you want oil; they will saturate your sandwich! Outstandingly generous amounts of oil. Literally your face will be coated after lunch if you don't watch their quick hands! The chips they sell... To die!!

3.description: A clean, brightly-lit store with lots of tables for on-site eating. Deli counter staff was energetic and friendly even on a Friday afternoon. The bread was a bit chewier than I would have liked but may have been so due to the hour of the day. Meat was well-sliced though I could have used a few more slices. Tomatoes were standouts - the freshest-tasting tomatoes I have had in a long while. Would go again if I were around UIC.

35.description: The food here was tasty and the service was prompt.  I stopped in here for a quick bite to eat last week and the employees were so friendly and kind.  I recommend Fontano to anyone visiting the UIC area. I would definitely go back!

19.description: Simply the best subs I've ever had.  Beautifully sliced meats and cheeses served up on fresh gonnella bread... Fuggetabouuddit!  My first time in Fontano's, Neal, one of the owners, came by and introduced himself.  He asked how everything was, and was cool enough to offer my girlfriend and I free sample of the meatballs.  They were phenomenal.  Now my ladyfriend is addicted to the meatball sub.  I personally love the 'Blockbuster', however, the 'Wiseguy' is equally delicious.  The food is awesome, the people who run the joint are classy, and that's a combination that'll keep me coming back as long as Fontano's is in business.Give this place a chance.  You won't regret it.

28.description: best subs in Chicago hands down. The meatball sub in particular is amazing. Family owned business that takes a lot of pride in their role in the community. During the winter, they make this amazing Italian wedding soup. must try for anyone coming to Chicago and wanting to see 'where the locals' eat.

45.description: meatball sub with provolone....ridiculously good.  this is a must try for everyone

33.description: I miss this place. Had the pleasure of eating here this week and I savored every bite. A favorite in my college days, now I go here every now and again. My turkey sandwich was outstanding. Made me remember how good cold sandwiches are. In my top 5 best sandwiches in town. Can't wait until my next trip.

43.description: I went here twice in 3 days. That explains a lot. I LOVE THIS PLACE. I've never had such an amazing and fresh sub in my life. I get the Big L with American cheese. The oil and vinegar soaks this sandwich to unexplainable greatness. The meatballs are huge and yummy too. If I lived next to this place, it would be a daily stop.

2.description: Can I give this place a sixth star?! Fontano's is a great restaurant! The staff is very friendly and it's just outside of UIC's east campus. The space is basic but open and offers several jarred and canned condiments that you can take home. Not to mention the potato chips that pretty much can't be found anywhere else in the area to an average student. The homemade cookies are the good kind of greasy and the pudding smooth. Also, the cannoli is the best cannoli I've had in ever!Finally, the subs. They are thick and I've never felt cheated. You can get the subs anywhere between 6 and 14 inches at 2 inch increments. I feel like anything you get will be great!  The bread is the perfect canvas for any sandwich and the deli meat is cut in front of you. It is all well cured and well seasoned. I happily sat through a calculus 2 lecture sweating (I was kinda sick) over a meatball sub with giardiniera and a whole lot of sauce while getting the death stare from the professor.

18.description: It's hard to believe you can find sandwiches this good for this cheap in Chicago.They absolutely pile on the meat and top it with fresh ingredients, made exactly how you want it. The italian beef is probably the best I've had in Chicago so far. The meatball and corned beef are also amazing. I'm very interested in seeing what else they have to offer.

41.description: I'm with Jesse F. on this one, we received great service and the subs were beyond phenomenal. The subs were made with care from good, quality, fresh ingredients. I am indeed the biggest fan EVER of their meatball sub with Swiss cheese and a pickle on the side. Ohhh & their cannoli make for the best dessert ever. I also highly recommend the tuna sub.

52.description: Stopped by Fontano's while doing a project on Little Italy. I was greeted with smiles and friendly people of all ages. I was even lent a book to use while working on my project this week.. I'll definitely be returning with the book, my cell number for the good looking guys working there, and lots of hungry friends!

50.description: The lunch special is amazing and addictive! I love their giardiniera. Absolutely fabulous! Their cookies are always good and the block bluster is so yummy.  It is on the list of  places I feel like I must go to when in Chicago.

4.description: Excellent, flavorful subs. The veggies are always fresh and crunchy. Bread is always fresh. I love the oil/vinegar they put on top, it has Italian seasonings and makes the sub even more flavorful. Their giardiniera (both the hot and mild) is the best I've ever had.

6.description: While I didn't love the chewier sub rolls at Fontano's, I have to admit--these guys make one of the best meatball subs I've ever had.  When you go to a place this old and this legendary, this can be obvious, but they don't lean on reputation here...from the bread to the service to the prices, you need to hit this place if you like a good sammie.Tried the meatball and one of the Italian sausage sandwiches also.  Again, the bread is too thick/chewy for me, but the upside there is when you take a sub to go, and ten minutes later get it home and the bread still holds up.  The casing on the sausage is a bit too chewy for me but the meat was incredible.  For $8.75, I got an 8" meatball, chips, a cookie and cole slow plus a soda.  Yeah, that's as much food as it sounds like, so I left the place in pain.  Fast service and they take CCs as long as you spend more than $5.On the way out, Tom Thibodeau showed up.  I guess like a lot of places in Chicago within striking distance of the United Center, you get a lot of hoops and Hawks guys that just show up like that.  Money.

22.description: While I didn't love the chewier sub rolls at Fontano's, I have to admit--these guys make one of the best meatball subs I've ever had.  When you go to a place this old and this legendary, this can be obvious, but they don't lean on reputation here...from the bread to the service to the prices, you need to hit this place if you like a good sammie.Tried the meatball and one of the Italian sausage sandwiches also.  Again, the bread is too thick/chewy for me, but the upside there is when you take a sub to go, and ten minutes later get it home and the bread still holds up.  The casing on the sausage is a bit too chewy for me but the meat was incredible.  For $8.75, I got an 8" meatball, chips, a cookie and cole slow plus a soda.  Yeah, that's as much food as it sounds like, so I left the place in pain.  Fast service and they take CCs as long as you spend more than $5.On the way out, Tom Thibodeau showed up.  I guess like a lot of places in Chicago within striking distance of the United Center, you get a lot of hoops and Hawks guys that just show up like that.  Money.
