15.description: One of my favorite sandwich places!!!~ If I had to cheat on Potbelly's, I guess it would have to be with Fontano's LOL. It's just different, though. Cold vs. toasted sandwiches...Anyway, the meat quality here is fabulous. I usually get the turkey -- thinly sliced layers of turkey with tomatoes and lettuce on soft, chewy bread. It's phenomenal. Make sure to get some crunchy chips with it to balance out the textures. For those of you who know me, I do love my balanced textures and flavors. You gotta have the crunchy with the soft and chewy, as well as the spicy with the salty, savory. Or whatever else balanced each other out. A lot of my coworkers (I work at UIC down the block) love the meatball sandwich as well. If you're in the mood for a hot sandwich, definitely try that one.

57.description: Love this place! The people are always friendly and talking to the patrons. They have tables inside which help and frozen food to go. Yum. I always get the blockbuster with extra gardinera!!! The best!!!

20.description: I was told they had better subs that their counter parts ... So I gave them a try ! I placed my order over the phone to avoid waiting , the lady over the phone was very nice . When I walked in the place is small cozy and clean. The sub: Italian sub was good, although I was expecting for their cold cuts to be among the expected but I think no pepperoni was used. A Little too much mayo and hot peppers but overall very better than subway ! I also bought a potato salad which was ok, it hAd a weird distasteful after taste and I'm not sure how to describe it. Price is good for what you get , I will definitely be back .

36.description: My favorite sub place ever! I survived college on these subs and still love to go back!

14.description: Great subs. I've been coming here for 15 years now, so they have to be doing something right. In more recent years they have renovated, and it's now a good place to hang out and "dine in". Order subs in the back, pay up front as others have said. On my last trip I had an Italian beef combo, and the sausage was very good and well seasoned. Meatball subs are where it's at though, and the Italian Special is also a good one. Service is quick and friendly. I'll keep coming back indefinitely.

58.description: thanks to yelp, kt m. and i found this gem.more affordable than you can shake a stick at AND huge portions that are outta sight.the pakistani owner cooks all of the food and has cool middle eastern dvds ;playing as you eat.  he comes out to chat, sits down and watches the flicks with ya.food-wise:  i have been eating grape leaves my entire life and these are the BEST.  hands down.  the hand made hummus will destroy you.  kt got the vegetarian couscous extravaganze and it was the size of my face.  and awesome.she tells me that the cabbage was the best ever.my psuedo-gyro-beef-lamb-thingy was outtasite.  it was like eating a pakistani bacon sandwich with sauce of the gods.  for about 4 bucks.no booze, but that don't matter.  swing next door to drum and monkey afterward or before for a pop.if you are in chicago or live here, please frequent this place and hook 'em up.  they MORE than deserve it.

56.description: As soon as you walk into Couscous your mouth waters, the smell is intoxicating. There was a week where I had Couscous three times in one week. It was heavenly, the food is magnificent, as well as the service. The hummus with beef and lamb shawerma is my weakness. The combo comes at a price that you can't find anywhere else, not with the same quality at least. The dolmas are a perfect appetizer, they are savory and lemony. Absolutely love couscous and the people who work there.

29.description: Please go out of business and save the public from your shit food and lies. The name of your restaurant was served to me in big clumps. And you lie about the source of your dolmas.

42.description: ordered chicken tika for dinner and 45 minutes later got served chicken shewarma. when i pointed out that i ordered tika and not shewarma, the cook/server stared me down for a while and then handed me a bottle of sriracha as he told me "you use that and now it's the same as tika." Well played sir, well played.

23.description: My husband loved the Breek. Everything was super fresh. The Turkish coffee was also amazing.

47.description: Mediterranean meals have been a staple for us lately, and we always come back to Couscous. The flavors here are genuine and the ingredients are fresh.Plus, the lunch buffet at Couscous makes the restaurant six stars in my book. As I made my way up to the buffet station for the first time, I realized there were neither steam trays nor Sterno lighters. On the table tucked away in the back, there were only family-sized 9" x 13" baking trays and pasta pots filled with delicious, authentic food you would expect to find in Marrakesh or Istanbul.Cooked in small batches and with a lot of heart, the word "buffet" does not do this meal justice - places like Balsan or Nia or Maggianos can call this "family style dining" - except we are talking about $8.95/pp and lunch.3.5 Stars? Seriously, one of the most underrated restaurants by Yelpers.

8.description: Came in today expecting a lot from how the newly renovated place looked, and I can easily say I made a mistake. First of all the owner was working the front while running to the back to cook which made my friend and I a bit anxious and overwhelmed for him. I ordered the chicken shawarma but instead I received the beef shawarma. Also, the kitchen looked very dirty and when the owner was making our falafels he was not wearing gloves, then dealt with our money. He was a bit rude and seemed like he was very busy and was trying to get us out as quick as possible when we were trying to pay for our food. He asked us if we had any cash to use when we took out our cards which was totally unprofessional. Our sandwiches were soaked in sauce and were way too soggy. Would not recommend this place.

31.description: I ordered the falafal sandwich, and I thought it was delicious.  Unfortunately, they must have swiped my credit card twice, because when I looked at my statement I was charged twice the value on my receipt.

34.description: Very erratic quality and taste to their food.  Once in a while they hit the nail on the head and you go back hoping for the same.  Our (truly) last time there, the Jerusalem Salad had a sour taste and both my wife and I felt the skin on the roof of our mouths feel burned.  Won't be going back.

16.description: While I love this style of food, the quality I experienced here was somewhat disappointing. I only returned once as I was with a friend who really wanted to try the place. Otherwise, I don't return even though it's very convenient to work.A couple other reviewers noted how pleasant the owner(?)/manager/server was. I agree. He was a very nice fellow. One hates to write a less-than-stellar review for such a pleasant man but if you want the truth about the food, it's only "ok".

13.description: Food - we did carry-out chicken kabob plates - the food was lacking flavor - chicken was not seasoned and the rice was not very good.  I would not recommend trying those particular menu items.  We didn't eat at the restaurant but the service appeared to be lacking... Price is pretty reasonable but there are so many better options on Taylor St that I would go to.

11.description: The food was decent; my only issue was that I ordered a Chicken Shawarma and they gave me Steak. (It was still okay.)

39.description: Very, very bad.I ordered a falafel sandwich. It was served on cracker-stale pita bread with chunks of falafel that were room temperature. The sandwich was prepared to order and took 10 minutes to prepare so the falafel was obviously fried the night before and reheated, although not to as high a temperature as the restaurant owner had intended.While I was waiting for my order, by way of making small talk, I asked the two attendants what ethnicity was the cuisine, i.e. Syrian, Lebanese, whatever. They responded, listlessly, "Mediterranean". They had neither enthusiasm nor interest in the restaurant.The owner is not serving fresh food; for that reason he does not have the respect or loyalty of his staff.Patronize this business at your own risk.

37.description: I hate writing negative reviews of small family businesses but the takeout order I got from here recently was memorably awful. It's too bad because I love this kind of food and the location is great. And the restaurant itself is cute. I've been there 2 times before this and the service is always incredibly slow but I can live with that if the food is good which it is not. Take out is also very slow. You walk in and no one acknowledges you and the exchange is awkward. They take credit cards for over $8 I think. I ordered a lentil soup and tabbouleh salad to go. These things should be easy to do well! I waited 15-20 minutes for these 2 items. Then the owner comes out and hands me a super wet bag warning me to hold it from the bottom so it won't break. I figured it maybe just had some water on it and then realized halfway back to work that it was leaking oil all over my hands, coat and shoes. Once I opened it up, it became clear why. The tabbouleh was almost an olive oil soup. Seriously, there must have been at least a cup of olive oil in this small tabbouleh salad. I ate the non-soupy parts which were fine but it was so gross having gotten oil everywhere and the rest of it was non-edible. The lentil soup was odd. Mostly broth and few lentils. Kind of soapy/frothy on the top. Didn't taste right. It was all really gross. I will say that they were setting up a lunch buffet when I got there that looked okay and apparently includes different items each day. But even if you get the lunch buffet it will not be a fast dining experience- just trying to get their attention to order/pay takes a long time. If your'e craving falafel go to Jubrano's- they're faster and friendlier (though only take cash). For lentil soup and other stuff you'll need to leave the neighborhood.

0.description: Nice family owned place. Really good falafels and turkish coffee.

38.description: The epitome of average to mediocre Mediterranean food. I won't say the food was bad because it had a lot of pleasant flavors and spice often not present in this type of cuisine. However, barely any of the food seemed to be fresh and worse yet, had likely been sitting for hours. Some of the items for my vegetarian combo plate actually were taken off the buffet from lunch and this was dinner. The service was typical for middle easterners. Anyone who has been in a restaurant in the middle east knows you are not going to get any service. The owner/manager was sitting at another table talking to a friend and the waitress was nowhere to be found to give refills on water. I may go back because it is cheap but I would not recommend it.

51.description: The interior of the restaurant looks clean and somewhat modern. I went for an early dinner on a Monday night so there weren't too many other customers. More people did arrive as I was leaving though. The service was very friendly. I was happy to see a vegetarian section on the menu. I ordered a falafel sandwich with lentil soup as my way to gauge the cuisine.  The food was ready exceptionally quick. I enjoyed the falafel, it wasn't as crunchy as I'm used but was still tasty. The hummus was my favorite part. The lentil soup was also tasty but I would still chose Sultan's or Middle East Bakery's lentil soup over this one. If you're in the UIC area I'd recommend this establishment. I will definitely be returning to try some of the other dishes.

27.description: I love middle eastern food so have tried many around the city. This place falls in the middle for me. The food is pretty good quality, but I've just found others I enjoy more.

32.description: Had the buffet here. It's reasonably priced for a buffet.Some of the items were really good and some were mediocre. Overall the food was a little on the oily side for me, so I haven't been back because of that.It's worth trying if you haven't been before.

54.description: This used to be one of my favorite places to go with my gf. The very first time we went it was amazing and hit the spot. I ordered the lamb shank special and it was pretty good. The actual lamb shank itself was big and cooked just right. The meat fell right off the bone. They also had some big chunky cuts of vegetables that I thought went pretty well with the lamb and rice. The next half dozen or so times I've been there the lamb shank has been a hit or miss. Every time I order it, it looks different which is somewhat surprising because it's the same cook every time. The cuts of the vegies are different everytime and how the lamb is cooked is always different. Sometimes it's fall of the bone tender, very moist and juicy and other times its just plain dry. It's a hit or miss. The consistency with the place is just so off. Also, if you listen closely you can distinctly hear the microwave being used a lot for a lot of the orders. That in itself wouldn't warrant a rating of one though.This is why I rate it a one. The last time I went there, there had been a remodeling and me and the gf were eager to revisit. We were told that they were out of lamb shank. I decided to try something new and went with the stuffed cabbage. My order came out and it didn't look that bad. I'm not saying it looked good either but it looked edible. I took one bite and wanted to get up and give the cook a piece of my mind. I thought better of it and took another bite to see if it was just that one bite. It was everything, there was this distinct spoiled taste. It was very sour and acidic, I knew right away that it had gone bad. This is the only time in my life that I've committed the cardinal sin of sending back an order. I've eaten a lot of bad food in my life, from finding hairs in my food, to wrong orders, or just straight up undercooked meat but I've never sent food back ever in my life. This was the only time. The cook came out and tried to tell me that it was lemon juice. Who are you trying to kid here? If the stuffed cabbage is bad, just tell the customers that you're out of it. Don't go ahead and serve it. This was such a huge turn off. Was pretty sad to be honest. This used to be one of my favorite spots to eat with the gf. Haven't been back since.

48.description: Pretty good falafel. They're seasoned well, and for $3.50, you can't go wrong. The falafel sandwich is usually a bit dry for me though, so i always ask for extra tahini on the side. I also wish they have a hot sauce with your order. Other than that, the hummus, babaganoush and baklava are also really good. Definitely my go to for a cheap quick dinner

44.description: Most of the pita sandwiches are under $5 and are delicious! I've gotten the shewarma and the lamb shank sandwiches and they were both excellent. They had fresh tomatoes, lettuce, cucumbers, a generous portion of meat, and tahini sauce to top it off. In terms of quality of food and price, this is the best deal I've had in Chicago.

24.description: The stuffed cabbage special was very good, and so was the lamb/beef shawarma sandwich.  The waiter/cook (owner?) was very nice.  The decor is weirdly modern and upscale for what otherwise seems like a storefront restaurant.  There was an arabic language musical comedy on the TV.  My friend and I had a pleasant, low-key dinner.

7.description: I love Couscous! My husband is vegetarian so it's nice to have somewhere with a lot of veg options but also plenty of options for people who aren't vegetarian. I love the chicken schwerma and chicken tikka.  My husband loves the veggie platter. Best falafel I've had in Chicago. There's also fresh lemonade. It's delicious and reasonably priced. The few times I've been there, one guy was doing everything but he's still pretty fast. Be nice to him and pay him cash.

49.description: I love this quaint Mediterranean restaurant! The food is always great (just had falafel, grape leaves, Jerusalem salad, and feta salad). It's never packed and the food is freshly made. Also, very reasonably priced with apps $3-6 and entrees $8-13.

40.description: I love this place. The food is fantastic and I seriously believe its the best Mediterranean I've had. Its cheap for the amount you get too. You won't be disappointed.

53.description: I tried Couscous a few days ago with a coworker. I hadn't had a kabob in so long, I'd nearly forgotten how good they are. Lunchtime was pretty quiet with only three or four other single diners in there. Service was pretty fast and friendly. The menu was well organized and easy to understand. I got the vegetable kabob and my coworker got the cauliflower and potatoes sandwich and we split an order of grape leaves. We had no complaints about any of the food with the exception of there having been so much that I had to get a carry-out box to take the excess with me.I would definitely return.

30.description: The best Middle Eastern food I have EVER had! Freshly prepared with the best ingredients. We enjoyed succulent perfectly baked chicken dish, lamb falling off the bone.  A strict vegetarian was dining with our group  and had plenty of dishes-- we all had the veggies-- couscous, homemade hot pita, eggplant, and more!! also a special cabbage pizza with garlic  and ginger we all loved! and BYOB.

46.description: Great food prepared fresh!The place was recently renovated so it's great to dine in at, but carry out is also fast and delicious.I get the Chicken/Spinah Tajeen with a side of babaganoush, but I've tasted other foods when my friends get them and they all taste fresh and authentic!Great place!

1.description: Loved it.  Best Falafel.  Best Babaganoush ever.  They are very friendly and accommodating.

55.description: I went for dinner here for the first time tonight and I was very happy with both the meal and the price. They could have given me half the portion size at the same price and I would still have been pleased.I had a vegetarian tajine and it was very enjoyable, nicely flavored, and came with a very good salad. I also had a glass of their fresh squeezed grape juice and it was fabulous.I saw that one reviewer wasn't impressed with the decor. I quite like the renovated look. It's modern and bright without being cold or seeming unfriendly.With food this good and these prices this restaurant has made my list of favorites in the city.

9.description: As a person who has had Naf Naf, this is clearly a downgrade. Its very tough to compete with a  restaurant like Naf Naf, but the food here just didn't taste good. I got the chicken schwarma and some hummus with falafel. The falafel/hummus was fine, but the schwarma just lacked the favor and consistency that I've had at other Mediterranean restaurants. And it does not help that this place is a bit more expensive than many other Mediterranean fast causal restaurants.

26.description: The first time I tried Couscous the food was average, at best. The second time, today, it was bad. I had chicken shawarma, and it was dry with too much spice, the hummus wasn't good, and the pita was stale. I ate half and threw the rest away, and grabbed a sandwich from another restaurant. I love Middle Eastern food, and this place is close to work, so I was hoping it'd be a winner. It bums me out to write bad reviews for small businesses. I'll maybe try them again in a year or so, in hopes that things change.

25.description: Had the falafel pita it was amazing!!!!! And only 3.50 !! Bf got the kabob pita and he was also very happy!!!! The owner/ server was polite and fast!! Food was delicious and felt homade! Clearly made to order!! Can't do 5 stars because they use fake like juice for their sauces which is very easy to taste and I actually saw him make the yogurt with artificial bottles lime.

12.description: What a mistake coming here. I was at Rush University for a medical appointment and wanted a quick vegetarian bite to eat so, after reading decent reviews, gave it a shot. I got my food to go and when I opened it up found my tajeen kaftaji (TK) was the most oily thing I'd seen in months. The rice was average and yet basically all I could eat because the TK was so damn salty I couldn't taste any of it. Seriously I felt I was doing a great disservice health wise to myself. It was like poison by salt, of which I got a month's worth in one sitting. I ate only the rice and Jerusalem salad, which was actually decent. So I am left hungry and threw the rest out because I felt I was putting horrible quality food full of salt and oil into myself. Ugh. I do NOT recommend this dish.

59.description: This is often our Sunday night take out dinner.  My boyfriend and I love mediterranean food and for the price you get a lot of food and a wide variety to select from.

21.description: I decided to eat something from "Couscous" during la "festa Italiana". I ordered a chicken cabob with rice. I was waiting patiently at least 20 minutes until it got ready. The price seemed reasonable $7. I sat with my husband to enjoy my meal and after  two minutes the owner came and in a rude way he told me that I had to pay additionally $5 because that was a dinner plate and not the lunch one. I heard him saying exactly the same to the company who was sitting behind me. When I finished my food(which was not something spectacular) I went to the register and I complained telling to the employee that this was not right. Or at least they should have changed the price from $7 to $12 so that the clients wouldn't be surprised. Very disappointing experience. I will definitely not go back.

17.description: Went here for dinner with two friends on a Friday night and the place was empty (unlike everything else around it) which should have been a hint. We got baba ganoush as an appetizer which was fine, but my lentil entree was VERY dry and the owner didn't tell me that they had run out of onions, so it was not a complete dish. My friends had stuffed lamb amd the sampler meat platter which were okay, served with a ton of rice. Prices are reasonable ($8-13) but you can get much tastier food at one of the many other places on Taylor.

10.description: I really enjoyed the food here, great place to stop for lunch, close to UIC west campus. It's a nice little spot that has Zabiha meat, and the portion sizes are great. Would recommend!

5.description: This place is great! Cheap prices and the food is descent. The service is a little slow but there are only 2 people who work there and one of them is a cook who I assume is the owner.I had the vegetarian platter and it was delicious. If you are in the area- check it out!

3.description: Been here once and had the lamb kebab, it was absolutely amazing! Will definitely be going back again :)

35.description: Its a great place, good food, served hot! Nice salads that are fresh and taste great

19.description: The best Middle Eastern food I have EVER had! Freshly prepared with the best ingredients. We enjoyed succulent perfectly baked chicken dish, lamb falling off the bone.  A strict vegetarian was dining with our group  and had plenty of dishes-- we all had the veggies-- couscous, homemade hot pita, eggplant, and more!! also a special cabbage pizza with garlic  and ginger we all loved! and BYOB.

28.description: While I love this style of food, the quality I experienced here was somewhat disappointing. I only returned once as I was with a friend who really wanted to try the place. Otherwise, I don't return even though it's very convenient to work.A couple other reviewers noted how pleasant the owner(?)/manager/server was. I agree. He was a very nice fellow. One hates to write a less-than-stellar review for such a pleasant man but if you want the truth about the food, it's only "ok".

45.description: Went for lunch and tried the buffet. The food was just decent. The owner was okay as well. We were the only ones inside. We were enjoying the Lebanese music and dancing on the TV's and the owner explained how popular this artist was . 5 minutes later he abruptly changed to some newscast in a foreign language, so much for ambiance or consideration. Worst part was the sign that said "included with buffet" under a tray of Baclava. I was charged for the mediocre baclava and asked why. The owner lifted the tray and flipped over  part that said "not"  over "included with buffet". Felt like a comedy skit. He said he was sorry but apparently wasn't sorry enough to remove the charge from my bill. I would've never taken a piece if I knew it was extra. A real shame. I knew I should've gone to potbelly's for lunch.

33.description: One of our favorite Chicago restaurants. We always order Jerusalem salad and Lamb Shank with Vegetable Couscous. Excellent kebabs, grape leaves, and falafels. We always end the meal with Egyptian coffees sweet. Tip: free parking on Taylor Street on Sundays.

43.description: Grabbed a shwarma sandwich for take out and it was delicious.I wish it was filled up a little more since there top of the pita as empty and I wish the lamb and beef was cut a little smaller so I didn't have to split the pieces with my teeth after each bite.Would definitely come back and try the falafel or maybe the lunch buffet.

2.description: This place was a random find while walking around in the area. My friends ordered the chicken shwarma wrap which they enjoyed however it was very messy to eat since it was falling apart. I ordered the spicy chicken kabobs which were delicious and a good amount of spicy. The rice it was served with was extremelyyyy dry. The dish could have been much better if it was served with a sauce. The place is run by an elderly man (who I assume owns the place) and he is the sweetest. He makes you feel at home at the restaurant.

18.description: I love this casual Mediterranean spot. I've never tried a dish I didn't like here but my favorite is the chicken and hummus plate served with pita. I crave it all the time! The prices are also reasonable so there is no strain on my wallet.

41.description: It wasn't good middle eastern food. I didn't like the falafel and I felt their hummus tasted too sour. Not my cup of tea. I was hoping it would be better.

52.description: SERVICE: slow and unfriendly. Had to get our own water and sodas. Had table of 8.FOOD: cheap/ affordableTASTE: hummus was good, everything else was SUPER salty! My experience here was HORRIBLE. There was only 2 other couples besides our table of 8 and service was incredibly frustrating and slow. Some of our friends arrived late and we ask for another table to add to our glass table and she asked "Are they gonna eat?"... UM..DUHH!! anyways, she never gave us the table. We also asked for 2 soda cans and she either forgot or we are suppose to walk up and get our own? We served our own water and drinks the whole night. Had to get our own extra napkins as well. SERVICE SUCKS HERE!! the lady spent a Lot of time wiping down tables that were already clean and when she's not cleaning, she will disappear into the back and forget that she has customers...this place was ridiculous. We ordered 3 hummus dishes and she brought out one basket with 5 slices of pita bread. REALLY?!?? we had 8 pple! We asked for more and she asked "Of what?"...we asked for more bread and she goes to explain that it is all it comes with. We then explain to her that we would like to get more bread because we ordered a lot of hummus and she just stands there and says "I'll see what I can do". In the end, we got charged for a bunch of things labeled "FOOD" on our receipt. The receipt listed everything we ordered as "food" so we couldn't tell if things were added by mistake. The food was salty, it was affordable but I think I would rather pay more for better service and good food. The hummus was delicious but I didn't find anything else we ordered spectacular. In the end, the service ruined our experience there. The owners were slow, rude and disappeared way too often. For a group of 8, we didn't expect such service since they didn't have anyone else in their restaurant but we were ignored just like everyone else.

50.description: My go to place for Middle Eastern food when I cannot make it to the Nile in Hyde Park or Semiarmis up north. Super affordable menu and tons of vegetarian options. Just had their vegetarian kabob on Thursday. The charred/grilled sweet peppers and eggplant were delish! The hummus is very creamy. I added one extra star for the grape leaves because they are very tasty and can be ordered cold or warm. However, I cannot give Couscous 5 stars because I am partial to the Nile's chicken schwarma. Looking forward to continue supporting this mom and pop shop.

4.description: I have had takeout a few time from here as a resident in training and it was always quite filling and satisfyingly different from the usual pizza messes we got or the in-house Au Bon Pain.  I finally stopped by the actual restaurant with a colleague who was visiting.  We were the only ones there so it was nice and quiet for a discussion.   The food was so cheap and filling, basic but satisfying.  The style of service is different that typical "American expectations:" minimal verbiage (I'm not sure anyone actually said a word to us the whole time!), not really well air conditioned on a hot day, a few flies at the window, relatively slow service; but these things are fine for a business/casual lunch.

6.description: Friend and I were craving some Mediterranean food in the medical district and decided on Couscous. Our dinner time was around 5PM on a Tuesday and were the only customers, though a man who I believe is the owner was busy peeling some vegetables at a corner table. My friend frequents this location and knew exactly what he wanted to order before our menus were delivered to us. They had a special leg of lamb as well as meat and rice stuffed eggplants. Normally I never order specials, but I was intrigued and the food sounded tasty.Both dishes were huge and meant to be shared. The leg of lamb was gigantic, almost displacing a ton of the tomato broth it came plated with when our server arrived. Flavor-wise it lacked salt, but the meat was fall off the bone tender. Our second dish, the eggplant, looked like two big logs on a plate, in again, a pretty similar broth. Within the eggplant was a meaty rice mixture that was a nice complement to the lamb. After eating all this, I had a crazy craving for some falafel and ordered a plate that came with vegetables, pita, and fried, sliced potatoes. This dish was the real winner of the night. The falafel was crispy and spiced well, and the potatoes were addictive. Overall it was a solid meal, and I found it funny that my favorite dish was the least expensive and had the most flavor. I think next time I come here, I'll enjoy the classics.

22.description: What a mistake coming here. I was at Rush University for a medical appointment and wanted a quick vegetarian bite to eat so, after reading decent reviews, gave it a shot. I got my food to go and when I opened it up found my tajeen kaftaji (TK) was the most oily thing I'd seen in months. The rice was average and yet basically all I could eat because the TK was so damn salty I couldn't taste any of it. Seriously I felt I was doing a great disservice health wise to myself. It was like poison by salt, of which I got a month's worth in one sitting. I ate only the rice and Jerusalem salad, which was actually decent. So I am left hungry and threw the rest out because I felt I was putting horrible quality food full of salt and oil into myself. Ugh. I do NOT recommend this dish.

15.description: I really wish I could find something positive to say about Couscous other than that we had a nice server. Unfortunately, I can't.The biggest culprit in our disappointing visit to Couscous was the surprisingly dry meat.  For a restaurant that should treat the tenderness of its meat with the utmost care, Couscous really fell short of our expectations.  When I say "dry," I mean that no amount of dipping the meat in sauce could salvage the dish.  Aside from the meat, I was disappointed by the flavorless soup that I got with my shwarma plate.  The falafel was also unremarkable. There was also a mildly off putting smell coming from the vent we were seated next to. Needless to say, that didn't make our dinner any better.

57.description: I admit it.  I AM sad that they spent too much money at IKEA and  changed the decor...  but, It is still my favorite place to get some Middle Eastern.  TOO GOOD.

20.description: Friend and I were craving some Mediterranean food in the medical district and decided on Couscous. Our dinner time was around 5PM on a Tuesday and were the only customers, though a man who I believe is the owner was busy peeling some vegetables at a corner table. My friend frequents this location and knew exactly what he wanted to order before our menus were delivered to us. They had a special leg of lamb as well as meat and rice stuffed eggplants. Normally I never order specials, but I was intrigued and the food sounded tasty.Both dishes were huge and meant to be shared. The leg of lamb was gigantic, almost displacing a ton of the tomato broth it came plated with when our server arrived. Flavor-wise it lacked salt, but the meat was fall off the bone tender. Our second dish, the eggplant, looked like two big logs on a plate, in again, a pretty similar broth. Within the eggplant was a meaty rice mixture that was a nice complement to the lamb. After eating all this, I had a crazy craving for some falafel and ordered a plate that came with vegetables, pita, and fried, sliced potatoes. This dish was the real winner of the night. The falafel was crispy and spiced well, and the potatoes were addictive. Overall it was a solid meal, and I found it funny that my favorite dish was the least expensive and had the most flavor. I think next time I come here, I'll enjoy the classics.

36.description: I really wish I could find something positive to say about Couscous other than that we had a nice server. Unfortunately, I can't.The biggest culprit in our disappointing visit to Couscous was the surprisingly dry meat.  For a restaurant that should treat the tenderness of its meat with the utmost care, Couscous really fell short of our expectations.  When I say "dry," I mean that no amount of dipping the meat in sauce could salvage the dish.  Aside from the meat, I was disappointed by the flavorless soup that I got with my shwarma plate.  The falafel was also unremarkable. There was also a mildly off putting smell coming from the vent we were seated next to. Needless to say, that didn't make our dinner any better.

14.description: Nice little place near UIC west campus. The food is good and portions are huge. At first the restaurant has a weird smell to it (kind of like a sewer) but then you get used to it. I'm not sure if that was just a one time thing. I would definitely go here again!

28.description: Very poor service. The staff is rude and unapologetic about it. I've had bad service here before but decided to give them another try. The nail tech cursed at me needless to say, I left without getting anything done. They deserve zero stars.

1.description: This place deserves zero stars! They are very disrespectful especially to the African Americans in the community and it is filthy! I am filing a complaint with with state in hopes something will be done before someone is infected with some sort of fungus or disease from this dirty place!

9.description: This place is extremely mediocre with horrific service and employees who don't care about their customers. My friend had recommended I go here and she had gotten a full acrylic nail set the previous day. So I decided to check it out. I came with my friend and sister and when we walked into the place all you could see were tons and tons of working stations and employees. The place looked mildly unsanitary and the receptionist had us take a post-it number. (yes, a post-it). The wait was about a half an hour, but I didn't mind that. The bulk of my negative experience centers around  the service. When they finally called my number, the nail technician, who might I say was very unfriendly and nonchalant, and for a full acrylic set, only somewhat prepped my nails. . When the lady applied the nail tip, she asked my how long I wanted my nails, and I showed her and informed her that I wanted an almond shape. I even showed a picture for clarification. After she cuts my nails, she switches with a man who is going to do the rest of the job. He is also very stand-offish. After he shaped my nails, he sends me to wash my hands and I see that my nails look HORRIBLE. They are completely crooked, they don't fit my finger shape, the acrylic is super thick, and the nail looks lifted near then end of the fingertip. So I politely tell him that my nails are crooked and I ask him to fix them. Instead of just fixing them and apologizing, because I AM PAYING FOR THIS, he just barely buffs them, and with a condescending tone asks where my mother is - which was extremely rude. So I tell I am paying for this and he needs to fix it. So after my nails are polished thy still look bad. I show my friends and they also agree that they look terrible. So I go to the front and I ask for the manager. Because I'm only 18, they try to brush me off and ignore me by just talking in another language to each other and rolling their eyes. When I repeatedly say I need to speak with the manager, they send the first nail technician instead. At this point I'm so over this place. When the lady comes up she is very condescending, rude, and irritating. When I show her what's wrong with my nails, she starts to blame me, telling me that its my fault my nails look wrong because I chose the length She starts arguing with me, and in my opinion, I should not have to negotiate about something that I'm paying for. If I don't like the product, they need to just fix it and apologize because the customer is always right. She then grabs my fingers and starts filing my nails. Keep in mind, I couldn't get my money back because I had to pay before they were finished. The nail technician only somewhat fixed them. After I left my mom went to the store and told them off for being disrespectful. Long story short, this place has terrible service, are rude, don't care about their customers, and can't do nails.

29.description: I have frequented this so-called nail shop on many, many occasions out of the convenience of location.  They are very unprofessional and get very irritated and angry when you are dissatisfied with their sub-standard services.  I hate to put race into play but they could careless that their primary customer ethnicity is African American and they DO NOT APPRECIATE our money.  My most recent disappointed was when I went on a Sunday to get a pedicure and manicure with no-chip and by Tuesday the no chip was coming off.  I returned only to have my hands snatched, yanked, and practically dislocated from my arm.  But, I prayed, stayed, and left.  Today, Saturday, the totally low quality no chip is coming all the way off.  I am a dishwasher that uses gloves ALWAYS.To top it off, the owner has a very condescending disposition.  She has no interest in pleasing her customers wholeheartedly.  She gives off like she cares for you only for you return to be subjected to their "NO NAME-NO CHIP".  If it isn't Opi or Gelish....leave that mess where it is.The attitudes of EVERYONE is deplorable.  The men are as nasty as the women and have a serious attitude problem.  When delivering spa services you need the personality to go with it.  These are some of the personal and sensitive induced services that people receive.  Check your attitude or don't show up to work.I will NEVER return there again.

23.description: Poor service. This place should  be shut down. Place is not clean.  Technician cut me while  doing my pedicure.  Old nail polish also don't sterilize their tools   close this shop down. Also, they tend to have negative comments about you among themselves. Extremely rude. And always try to upsell you on services can I please give them a 0 star don't even deserve a 1 star

5.description: Revolting. Filthy. I have already placed a complaint w the Illinois Board of Health & the Illinois Licensing Board. The store was disgustingly dirty. The chairs were filthy. I watched people put their feet in UNWASHED/unsanitized pedicure bowls. Nothing in the shop appeared sanitary. The older, chatty woman next to me was complaining to her nail tech that she was happy she didn't get her "usual guy" because he ALWAYS MAKES HER FEET BLEED!!Everyone working there was rude. I was only acknowledged after I complained MULTIPLE times that the person who left my fingers to soak in acetone had left. I sat there with my fingers soaking for 35 minutes before I was rudely helped. I wasn't even having acrylics removed so I'm not sure why my fingers were bathing in acetone. Once I was approached the woman used the drill file. I asked her not to b/c of bacterial concerns AND because it hurts and does a poor job with shaping the nail beds. I was told I didn't have a choice. She too randomly got up from the manicure table & walked away for approx 10 minutes while staff who appeared to be unhygienic milled around while customers LITERALLY screamed at the staff asking "where's my damn lady," "when the hell you gonna do this," etc. It was, w/o a doubt not only my worst manicure experience (and obviously the most poorly done manicure) but a disturbing experience as a whole. I am genuinely concerned for the well being of all who go there: please know I never write yelp reviews. I'm not a disgruntled customer w a bone to pick. I'm hoping to offer a public service announcement of sorts.

25.description: Basic nail salon. No frills or anything special, but the techs do a decent job. Biggest con, in my opinion, is the loud conversations they have with each other from opposite sides of the room.

12.description: This nail salon was great! It took me a little bit longer than expected to get in the chair but once I was in the chair the nail technician accommodated me to the best! They are great! With great pricing!!

21.description: This nail salon was great! It took me a little bit longer than expected to get in the chair but once I was in the chair the nail technician accommodated me to the best! They are great! With great pricing!!

16.description: I wish I could give them zero stars because that's what they deserve. Horrible customer service! They don't even greet you when you come in. I sat there for 20 minutes just for a brow arch. No one acknowledged me, then I finally asked how long it would be after she did another lady's brows, which only took a few minutes but instead if doing me she decided to do individual lashes. AND the place is filthy. Never AGAIN!

17.description: The nail tech here are very rude...they have no customer service skills..will not be returning. If they didn't have customers, then they would be out of business. My tech this day was Jennie.

10.description: This place was filled with women when I walked in, I had to sign up and take a number. My number got called and I went to sit down at the nail station only to be told to "hold on until I come back." I thought the wait would be short- I ended up waiting at least 30 minutes for some other person to do my nails, while the guy that was supposed to work on me was working on other women. SO, after those 30 minutes he started working on my nails, 30 min was not worth the wait- he was ok, but everything was too rushed, uncared for, and my nails could of been done better. I suggest to go some where else if you prefer better one on one service.

11.description: The wait is never very long,  even on weekends.  The staff is nice.  Paging is easy in the lot connected to Jewel,  note this is in a strip mall in the west side.

26.description: Wonderful and fast service. Always a thrilled customer. They do the most natural eyelashes. People always notice something different..you look naturally pretty without eyelashes taking over your face. I get brown and ask for the natural look if you're interested.

27.description: Unfortunately the bad reviews are true. I paid for a no chip manicure & the female nail tech did not do a great job. She messed up 1 of my nails during the gel coat and just added more gel, which led to me having a raised bump on my nail. I would not recommend this place & it's unorganized in the nail shop.

0.description: The place was pretty packed, however there are many nail techs. El & ConCo both worked on my fill in. They switched seats 3 times. I didn't have a problem because they were both very funny. I enjoyed my time there even though it took a while.

20.description: This place is a total clusterf**k. The techs are rude, the atmosphere is extremely chaotic, the salon and instruments are dirty, and the actual manicure was terrible, and the tech made me bleed twice. Nightmare. I will never go back. I really wish there was a solid nail salon near UIC. Sigh.

19.description: Unfortunately the bad reviews are true. I paid for a no chip manicure & the female nail tech did not do a great job. She messed up 1 of my nails during the gel coat and just added more gel, which led to me having a raised bump on my nail. I would not recommend this place & it's unorganized in the nail shop.

2.description: This place is the worst!!! Horrible customer service. I walked in and the lady at the desk look at me and rolled her eyes I called her back she said What? I asked another lady she was rude as well then I asked for the manager he refused to speak. They have no selection on nail colors. I'm so confused as to why people spend their money here!! Horrible!!!!!

18.description: I just moved here and needed my nails done for my bday we walked in and were given a post it note... DAFAQU my fiancee asked how long they ignored him. I looked around and this place is a fungus waiting to happen with a side of hep C. I told him I would fly back to MD before I let these people touch my nails. Absolutely not safe or clean I appreciate a discount but NO NO NO NO NO.... oh and did I say NO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

13.description: The wait was long, but when I finally got into into my chair service was timely,   Professional, and price was reasonable. I will come back here for the matte gel nail polish. I recommend you bring a book or a charged phone so wait will be less boring.

4.description: This one's disappointing. It's a great location and it sees a lot of traffic. They accommodate the constant traffic flow by sacrificing the sanitation of essential tools. Unacceptable. I've experienced techs be rude to others but have never been on the receiving end. I've actually only had nice technicians who ask about how my sister or boyfriend are doing. They do bring in a lot of new workers who may be new to doing nails. I went in for a quick polish change and got paired with a new girl. No problem. My 5yo cousin has painted my nails better. I now travel to the suburbs to get my nails done. Disappointing but necessary.

24.description: The wait is never very long,  even on weekends.  The staff is nice.  Paging is easy in the lot connected to Jewel,  note this is in a strip mall in the west side.

6.description: DO NOT bothering going to this nail salon. Not clean at all and it's worth the time or money. I was going there for years before I learned of the cheap acrylic they use. I also was not aware of the harm caused by drills. Definitely educate yourself on that industry and what we are really doing to our nails. I continued to get a pedicure there until I noticed they were not cleaning the bowels. They would rinse off after each client. But not sanitizing the bowels AT ALL. There is so much bacteria located in there it isn't worth the long term damage. There was another client that asked them to please clean the bowel out for her. She was refused because they did not want to waste water. That was when I finally walked out and will never return again. I will look for another salon that it is focused on sanitation instead of a quick dollar.

22.description: wow. I just left bw nails. I use different places so not sure where I picked this up from but now after what happened to me just now I'm sure it was.here. I got a fungal infection on one finger nail under the fill in. I always avoided getting pedis here because it just didn't look sanitary. and today proved it. I decided to get a pedicure here the way they "clean" the tubs (and I use the term clean loosely) is by spraying it down with alcohol which DOES NOT kill all.bacteria or fungus. Alcohol only kills the weakest of bacteria while letting the stronger ones survive and multiply. I stuck my feet in the water reluctantly (my feet are still wet) then I watched the lady bring her dirty tools from the previous person before me. I told her I wanted clean tools. she said ok. but she was actually going to use those dirty tools on me. Then she walks into the back and comes back with the same tools, not sterilized and sprays alcohol on them. that is not you are supposed.to.clean the tools!!!!!! they are supposed to be put into the machine that heats up to 500 degrees and kills off everything then put into sterilized packages that are opened in front of the customer. wtf!! I have seen toe fungus before from nail salons and it makes your entire nail fall off!! I can't believe she was going to use that dirty crap on me!! I jumped out of that seat so fast and ran out of the door while I hear her behind me saying, "but I use alcohol! I use alcohol!" omg. I am horrified and paranoid now that since I did stick my feet into the water that I will get a fungal infection anyways!

15.description: Basic nail salon. No frills or anything special, but the techs do a decent job. Biggest con, in my opinion, is the loud conversations they have with each other from opposite sides of the room.

7.description: Very utilitarian- my technician was quick and did a perfect job on my stiletto nails. The people watching is great.

8.description: I wish I could give this place 0 stars, I will never go back! they are rude, ignorant & treat their biggest clientele like trash ( African Americans).I asked for a specific type of nail and when I asked the male nail tech not to cut too much off he was rude and snotty, they don't talk to you in the first place they just snatch your hand and do what they want.. they gave me someone else but they all talked  and laughed about me the whole time I was there. I wanted to get up and leave but all I had were nail tips on. the woman that is very loud and boisterous kept telling every co-worker she could tell about me because I wanted to switch to a less rude nail tech she and I exchanged words in English and she was just very rude and nasty the whole time. done deal me and my $$ will never step foot into this hell hole again!

30.description: This nail salon is simply okay. One thing I really don't like when I get my nails done would have to be when the technician doesn't even talk to you. Hello... I'm paying you to do my nails but a little conversation wouldn't hurt either. The place looks pretty nice inside. I generally get a No Chip Mani here and they do a decent job. They tend not to always put the paint near the nail bed so it kind of ends up looking like the nail has already grown out. Here are the pros & cons.Pro:*Convenient if you want to get your nails don't on you lunch break*Television *Free travel bottle of Caress body wash with No ChipCon:*Not very friendly*Tend to rush when they are with you*Lack of conversation with you, only with the other employees*Barely ever toilet paper in the restroom*They wax eyebrows in the open instead of in a roomI wouldn't recommend this place if you're looking for true quality or spa quality.

3.description: I love this place. They are always busy, and its a large nail shop, but when you do get into their chair, they are doing their very best. I have not had a bad experience with this place and will continue to go. Their prices are reasonable as well. Its in a shopping center so the location works.

14.description: Was treated horribly after showing them that my Polish changed from pink to white and it is not a mood no chip. They said I waited too long to come back and put the polish sloppily on top of the old Polish. Will never go to this shop again and no one else should either.

58.description: Visiting from Cali, just realizing how much I've missed all these years living without Italian Beef.  Though I'm not claiming to be an Italian Beef expert, I sure managed to stuff as much of it in my mouth during my week stay in Chicago.  Al's, in my humble opinion, ranked very low on my list of Italian Beef restaurants.  And here's why:First, it was the most expensive place I went to.  Got it dipped (of course), added some fries and a coke, and was shocked at how much the total came to.  Kinda made me think it would be that much better... sadly however, this wasn't true.  The Italian Beef, the peppers, the bread, everything about it just fell short of great and landed somewhere around decent.  Fries were terrible.  Now I went well out of my way to make it to this place, and lets just say I was pretty disappointed when I left.  Other complaints: CASH ONLY, (get with the times, even food trucks take credit cards, stop being lazy), no seating in the place and they seem to be proud of it... for what I paid for that sandwich I want some dang padded seats... too much to ask I guess.

56.description: Yeah, its not bad. But a little overpriced for a beef sandwich. Fries were bland and kind of soggy.

29.description: Al's beef is a Chicago classic beef spot! I typically order the Beef with provolone and hot peppers. Although there food is quite satisfying, the prices seem to be a bit pricey for the portion size, and the service at this location is alright. Every time I have been here, the workers don't seem to have any people skills, and come off rude. Overall, if you want a good beef this is the place, if you are looking for an alternative I'd say go with Jay's or Portillo's!

42.description: Honest review:ok better then portillos the problem is sometimes the foods not fresh or that hot. Then sometimes it doesnt taste good. Its expensive and i dont think its kinda worth the price. Eating here is a pain because theres never any seats and its dirty i wish they would update this place food wise and ambiance if u come make sure u get an italian beef with sauce and gardineraIf anybody knows a better Italian beef place tell me!

23.description: Had the famous big Italian beef sandwich, it really met expectations, service was quick, ate at the counter and did the "stance" it was a good meal and I would recommend it to people.

47.description: Al's Italian beef sandwich dipped in its sauces with sweet and hot peppers .... Just delicious !!!

8.description: Hands down this is a true taste of Chicago!Love the giardinera and the beef dipped, nothing else like it!You will need plenty of napkins,a sloppy delicious mess! LolAnybody visiting Chicago MUST come to Al's! If you don't you've truly missed out on one the city's reliable gems!

31.description: Used to go here back in the day, and boasted about it to friends.  Was a good sized beef,  with all the trimmings.  Now it's $9.10 for a "big? " beef. Which in comparison to other beef places, is a small.Things have certainly changed. So if, you want a place that rips you off, with less food for more money,  and gives you incomplete orders (missing things you asked for) takes cash Only, and no washroom, really makes this place SUCK!!! Never going back again...don't get burned

34.description: This place has gone down! I ordered a combo sandwich which is a sausage with very little meat(beef) sprinkled on top. Normally I wouldn't care but for $11.00+ for a sandwich with no fries, and quality has gone down.They have lost my business for sure.

16.description: I've been coming to Al's Beef for decades. This location is the very 1st original standing Al's, as they now have franchised out overtime. Ehh which is totally fine! I don't care! BUT just to note: IF you are a true native Chicagoian, born & raised, if your family has lived on Taylor & May OR maybe not... you know your pizza, a few other dozen things in the middle there (ex: the little Italian Lemonade stand across the street that does not even need to be named because you KNOW!) , AND you know Al's Beef... oh and you know old Augie the barber (RIP). Whose barber shop (no longer there) decades ago was always filled w/gentlemen, who only went to him! My point, in Chicago we like what we like & sometimes that means the old school ways & Taylor st ways also means a nostalgic form of loyalty that gets passed down generation after generation. So you know what'cha ya know!Soooo with that being said, it kills me to give this review because I really do love Al's Beef.... or at least the OLD Al's that I'm use to. I was very disappointed during my recent visit to Al's a couple of weeks ago.1)Upon walking in & looking up @the menu, I was shocked @how much their price$ have even MORE gone up!! However that still didn't bother me because I "knew" good old Al's. Plus like we all say & know to be true respectively, "in this day & age its hard to keep a business afloat w/o raising prices!" I will continue my list  as my fiancé & I cont'd to order...2)The woman behind the counter... couldn't have been more rude & arrogant if she tried! She had a horrible attitude! We all work lady... GET OVER YOURSELF & get use to it! 3)We ended up ordering 2 beefs dry, both w/hot peppers, 1 order of fries &1 drink. Note: This would be our "typical order" for the old Al's quality beef that I've come to know & love. Those giant huge portions of beef piled high inside crispy Italian bread, not really needing to be dipped, because the beef is so flavorful that even ordering it dry, the beefs juices would run down your hand. Always knowing to split an order of fries because 1 order was more than enough for 2 people. Ugh AND the peppers! They NEVER charged extra for sweet or hot!! 4)So, what did we get for our $???We got ridiculously skimpy portions of beef sandwiches, that def needed to be dipped (beef was ridiculously dry), the amount of fries in ONE order was not enough for 2 people AND the peppers.... well that should DEFINITELY NOT be an extra charge! It's a topping that's to be an expected inclusion w/your Italian beef sandwich!! * I'm kindly leaving my comments out about the bread because what we chewed on... "Italian Bread" I personally find it insulting*5)So in conclusion, throw in the rude woman behind the counter (that's really gotta go), AND NOW what I'm calling ridiculous price$ for what they skimped us out on, that I NOW have HUGE problem & REGRET that I proceed to order that night and PAY those price$ for the "New Al's Beef" way. That I SO stupidly & admittedly expected, mouth watering, couldn't wait for it, out of anticipation and excitement, Al's Beef#1-  or whatever other #'s you got out there. It didn't matter because your name WAS everything, quality- top notch, taste- amazing!!, service- impeccable that your theatrical "lady" behind the counter wouldn't have mattered!6)Wow! HUGE disappointment that Al's Beef was! I'm going to give the other Al's "#'s" the benefit of the doubt though & MAYBE possibly consider going to a different location. Which just the thought of not going to Al's on Taylor sounds odd. I personally have had it w/this location & defending their "price$" to friends who won't go, as if I benefit for "Marketing" for them because... "yea the price$ are high guys, but it's all in the quality & what you get!" Never saying that again!!!*1 star- if I were to rate this place purely their business & food. **2 stars - ONLY because it is the originally Al's on Taylor. Whose counter I use to sit on as a kid because I always wanted to "see, see, see"! I have great memories, worth decades to me, from my pop & beyond. It was a routine...  Al's Beef, Mario's, & walking hand in hand w/my dad into Augie's barber shop & waiting patiently in a high chair w/my feet dangling as my dad got his haircut & a shave. Nostalgia & good old Chicago Taylor st native loyalty... restating what I said at the begging of this review.Plus, LASTLY (FINALLY) 2stars, since Al's Beef does have other locations that I may find myself in some day & maybe that other location could be better. THE END....

13.description: Honest review:ok better then portillos the problem is sometimes the foods not fresh or that hot. Then sometimes it doesnt taste good. Its expensive and i dont think its kinda worth the price. Eating here is a pain because theres never any seats and its dirty i wish they would update this place food wise and ambiance if u come make sure u get an italian beef with sauce and gardineraIf anybody knows a better Italian beef place tell me!

11.description: Huge fan of Philly cheesesteaks and not so much a fan of French dips so wasn't sure what to expect at Als. But the big beef sandwich was amazing- meat was full of spices, and not overly chewy. The best part was the gravy and hot peppers. Place is a dive but that's part of the allure. Service is rude but what else would you expect.

39.description: Horrible customer service.  And no cup holders, not only did I spend 52 dollars for 4 meals no cup holders wow!!! Looks real bad oh and I forgot to mention that now I have to walk to my car with a big bag off food but 4 cups that of coarse I dropped one. I can not stand all these beef places in chicago that have the worst service and customer service as well.

37.description: I visited this location again, unfortunately there is nothing big about their big beef sandwich and is the same as the regular I used to have long time ago and you get charged 8+ dollars for it. The taste is good and the fries are awesome... Still I think other joints started to surpass this legendary location....

0.description: Saw this on one of the food network shows (adam richman?) and husband decided it was non-negotiable on our trip to chitown. He said it was one of the best things he's ever had. They dip the whole sandwich in the jardiniere! That's not really my thing - but the cheese fries were awesome and the hot dog was good too. I liked the divey atmosphere. Being from Pittsburgh, I kinda feel like Al's is the equivalent of primanti brothers for us. Good times!

38.description: The best Italian beef sandwiches ever.  I like mine dipped in juice topped with hot peppers.

51.description: The best in Chicago and you have to go to this location, the original location, to appreciate the experience! No tables, no chairs, just counter space to eat your italian beef sandwich. Be careful of their gardiniera, it's got some heat to it! And if it's your first time there, learn the correct eating stance so you don't get any juice on your clothing.

27.description: Not fancy. Just good. Stop over at Mario's for some itatlian ice for dessert.

32.description: I don't write reviews for restaurants, good or bad, but I feel I had to say something about  my terrible experience at Als Italian  beef on taylor st. After fighting rush hour traffic to get there I found that the food was both overrated, and over priced! The beef sandwich was ok at best, the fries looked and tasted like greasy crumpled up cigarette butts! This for close to 60 bucks? Not worth it! Looks like Als Italian beef on Taylor st has lost its mystique on being the best and original beef sandwich in Chicago.

54.description: Love Al's Beef and above all the fries are amazing! Get a beef dipped with Sweet and you will not be left wanting!

48.description: One of the best things I've ever tasted.  The thinly-sliced, juicy, delicious beef with hot peppers will satisfy your carnivorous urges while the perfectly seasoned au jus sets your taste buds ablaze.  It was worth a trip in the sub-zero windchill.

44.description: Excellent beef sandwich. But.... The staff are completely rude and dirty looking. Ordered two big beefs (which is equal to a standard size anywhere else) and two fries with provolone and hot peppers $27.88!!! Charge for peppers $1.20 charge for cheese $2.40!!! Are you kidding!?!?! And on top of everything they still don't accept credit cards unlike their other locations!! They don't accept any of the Al's Beef coupons or promotions. Nothing like taking advantage of people. The place is a complete dive with all kinds of hand written signs warning customers not to do this or to do that. Like the food but to pay almost thirty dollars for two sandwiches and fries is crazy.

24.description: the employees at the other Al's locations making or touching food use plastic gloves.  at this Al's no one was using plastic gloves so their naked hands went from their shirt to their hair to the food to opening the plastic of paper goods and food coverings back to the food.  disgusting!  that is against sanitation codes!!!!  not eating there again.  yuk!  the gal i was standing next to, also in the food service business, noticed it too and we shared our thoughts on it together so it wasn't just me who noticed.  the gal next to me had waited quite a long time for her food and was going to be late getting back to work due to that and so was going to be unable to eat her food prior to her shift because the timing of food at Al's was so slow.  the employee said she was sorry and the other customer responded to her that it was not her fault - it was the manager's for either not staffing properly or not training properly.  also manager was not on the floor with a back log of people and the manager also seems completely unaware that proper sanitation procedures are not being used.  it always starts at the top.

7.description: The Italian beef is still one of the best, though they've suddenly gotten very pricy:Me: Gimme a large combo, hot peppers, fries & a Coke.Al's order guy: That'll be $18.00Me: (silence) Are you serious?Order guy: YepMe: (frantically rifling through my wallet) Do you take credit cards?Order guy: Nope.Me: (defeated) OK, skip the fries, make it a small beef & Coke.Order guy: $10.50Me: Arrrrrrrrgh.

49.description: The famed original Al's on Taylor Street in Chicago still makes an excellent Italian beef, but it's not quite as good as their franchise locations.  Yes, you read that correctly.  Why?  The original Al's on Taylor Street hot giardiniera recipe uses too much anise and lemon flavoring.  It's too strong, and it can be somewhat oft putting to many people that grew up on Italian beef at other places in Chicago.  Similarly, if you don't like anise and lemon in your hot giardiniera in general, then you're going to be overwhelmed by how strong they both come across from your tastebuds to your hands after you get done eating.  In addition, the heavy anise and lemon flavoring detracts from Al's famous cinnamon and/or nutmeg gravy.  It's still a great sandwich, but it's not as good as the franchise Al's everywhere else.  Thankfully, the franchise Al's (especially the suburban Park Ridge and Niles locations)  feature only a hint of the anise and lemon flavoring in their hot giardiniera recipe.  The franchise Al's use of less anise and lemon flavoring in their hot giardiniera perfectly compliments Al's signature cinnamon and/or nutmeg gravy, which results in a much more balanced Italian beef sandwich.  As a result, you can taste every distinct flavor of an Al's Italian beef that has made Al's the most recognizable sandwich in the history of Chicago- the cinnamon and/or nutmeg gravy, the celery, capers, oil, other Italian seasonings, and the dried red pepper flakes in the hot giardiniera.  And of course, just the right amount of anise and lemon flavoring in the hot giardiniera.  Al's fresh cut fries, and their Vienna Beef hot dogs are excellent, too.  If you're planning on making the trip to Al's from the suburbs or your from out of town, go during off time hours.  There's a small parking lot next to the restaurant where you can park for free, but it's only for a limited time (i.e. possibly only 30 minutes).  Otherwise, you have to park on the street and pay the box.  It's standing room only inside, and they still have their children's stand that's much shorter than the adult standing area. There's only 2 or 3 tables outside- that's it.  Otherwise, you'll be standing like the rest of us, or you'll have to eat in your car.  And make sure you go during the summertime, so that you can walk across the street to Mario's for Italian ice.  BOTTOM LINE:  The original Al's on Taylor Street still makes a good Italian beef, but they use too much anise and lemon in their hot giardiniera, which overpowers and detracts from everything else that makes an Al's Italian beef sandwich great like the cinnamon and/or nutmeg gravy.  If you want the perfect Al's Italian beef, then go to one of their franchise locations (especially the suburban Park Ridge or Niles locations)  because the franchise locations use less anise and lemon in their hot giardiniera.  This makes for a more balanced sandwich, whereby you can taste every aspect of what makes an Al's Italian beef the best sandwich in Chicago.  And ALWAYS get your beef dipped and hot so you can enjoy Al's famous cinnamon and/or nutmeg gravy.  It's messy, but it's worth it, and it's the ONLY way to eat Italian beef in Chicago.

40.description: Ordered the original beef.  Got it dipped.  I think next time I prob wouldn't get it dipped....threw off the texture of the bread.  Reason for 3 stars is prices and no credit card...

53.description: Good but not great. Maybe it's me, coming from Philly, but the hot roast beefs in Philly are much better. Al's rolls aren't firm/crusty enough to hold up to the wet beef sandwich. The meat is good but it's kinda greasy.

BUT just to note: IF you are a true native Chicagoian, born & raised, if your family has lived on Taylor & May OR maybe not... you know your pizza, a few other dozen things in the middle there (ex: the little Italian Lemonade stand across the street that does not even need to be named because you KNOW!) , AND you know Al's Beef... oh and you know old Augie the barber (RIP). THE END....

46.description: I grew up in Philly, so I know a good sandwich, and Al's is top notch... One reviewer wrote "Get a beef dipped with hot peppers, fries, and you're golden." and I couldn't agree more.  Great experience

1.description: My wife and I stopped in here after visiting UIC. We each got a regular Italian beef with fries, and I got a soda. I forget the exact price but it was in the neighborhood of $26. Way more than it should have been, especially given the quality. Glad we tried this Chicago institution, likely won't be doing so again.Pros:Peppers were goodLots of fries (enough for at least 2, we should have stuck to 1 order)Cons:Expensive!!Even not getting it dipped the grease ran everywhereBeef was OKNot enough peppersNo refills on soda

55.description: Absolutely great Italian beefs. I live in the area and come here quite often. If I have people come in from out of town this is usually a first choice to show Chicago food. It's not super inexpensive, and is cash only. But a dipped big beef with hot and sweet peppers is always worth it!

9.description: Had to try the original Al's and it was worth the trek. Beef was superb you must get it dipped and with peppers. You can stand at the counter area to eat or take it to go but it's much better fresh. A must try when in the area!

26.description: The people working there are unfriendly. And if your going to make a Chicago style hot dog do it right and have all the ingredients on it, if not don't offer it at all. My hot dog only had relish,onion,mustard,peppers and no tomato or pickle. Also, you can't just order the hot-dog you have to get the fries with it and it's not many wrapped in with the hot dog. Not worth coming here might as well just go to Jim's Original close by.

25.description: So this place was very surprising.  Italian beef combo is not a combo it's a sandwich with peppers, mind you peppers are 1.50 extra.  Fries are extra they are super soggy and greasy.  Hot dogs are so tiny I barely tasted them.  Spending 20 dollars on a hot dog, Italian beef, 2 fries and drinks, it's not worth it.  It's is 2015 and cash only, really, come on now.  I heard a lot about it and was super disappointed first time.

12.description: Eh, not really a fan.  12 bucks for this sandwich and fries.  Next time I will pass.  Not that the sandwich was bad,  it just wasn't my cup of tea.  Not sure why.  I love roast beef, like french dips. For some reason the seasoning just wasn't my fav. Compared to my favorite sandwich of all time in South Florida this doesn't come close.  Give it a try you might like it. Just wasn't for me.

59.description: This place is the best for quality.  It is not as pretty as Portillo's but it is a better sandwich.

21.description: The BIG BEEF is a regular size in comparison to other good beef joynts. It cost $10 and it's NOT a big sandwich. I am a native who recently moved back to town. I gave Al's a try and feel misled. When I got to my car, I looked in the bag and thought they made a mistake...went back in and they said...That's a Big Beef.  BTW...The beef is good, NOT GREAT. I have had way better for $6-$7. You got me for $10, but you will never make another penny off me or my family.

17.description: Wow! Dipped or Soaked beef sandwiches are delicious. No one can visit Chi-town and not come to Mike Ditka's favorite Italian sandwich shoppe!

10.description: I used to love Al's a couple years back, especially this location. I was excited to take my boyfriend because he never had it, but now I regret taking him. Note that this place is CASH ONLY. Al's beef is very overpriced for okay food. The Italian beef sandwich I expected to be dripping with juice was very dry - even when dipped. They used to really pile the meat up, but this time I had to open it up to take a picture so you could see what was actually inside. The reason I came was for those famous greasy fries! I remember Al's fries being greasy, soggy, and fresh. I WAS HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED. When they came out, the fries were way overcooked to the point of crisping and they weren't even warm - suggesting that they weren't fresh. I had noticed prices had gone up since the last time I came as well. My unsatisfying meal cost me $16. The line wasn't too long, but the small restaurant was still a little crowded because of the people standing and eating. Ordering our food was fast and the wait wasn't long either. The man taking our order was neither friendly nor rude, he was simply doing his job. The place was small and kind of shabby - not somewhere I really wanted to be eating inside. If you're going to Al's Beef, you're betting off getting take-out than dining there. Seats are extremely limited. There's a counter where you can stand and eat inside but those are usually taken. There's seating outside you have to rush to, but there are only three tables. There was no place to sit so we ended up walking down the road and asking the burger place if we could sit in their outdoor seating area. Maybe I'll give Al's fries another chance, but everything else was just okay. With prices being so darn expensive for a subpar meal, you probably won't see me coming back.

5.description: Move over Philly- I think I just found a new dipped sandwich that tops even those cheese steak monsters.Out for lunch and into Taylor, my friend and I decided to try out Al's. Neither of us had eaten it before, so we decided it was time to knock off another one of the "must-eats" in town. Who would've thought that the original Al's Beef sipped sandwiches would be right here next to UIC? (well yes, there IS Little Italy)We each ordered an Al's Big Beef sandwich; mine came with sweet peppers, and each of ours was dipped. OMG... the sandwich was messy beyond reason, but damn it was good! The beef inside was cut thinly and resembles what you'd find in gyudon (totally making a Japanese comparison here). The bread was beyond tasty given it's wet texture. Then there are the BIG portions... wow, I was only able to eat half of mine before throwing in the towel.Limited seating is available. You can stand inside or sit outside on a nice day. Pair this up with a visit to Mario's across the street and you've got yourself a fantastic meal.CASH ONLY so make sure you have some greens on you. I don't think dancing can be used as a form of payment if all you got is the plastic.

3.description: Still good.  The gravy makes the beef.  The beef is not sliced anymore.  More like CRUSHED into bits.

35.description: Took our family to Chicago and had to try this place everyone was raving about. It lives up to its hype! Make sure you ask for your beef sandwich to be"dipped" it'll change your life!

19.description: I grew up in Philly, so I know a good sandwich, and Al's is top notch... One reviewer wrote "Get a beef dipped with hot peppers, fries, and you're golden." and I couldn't agree more.  Great experience

28.description: No no and no!  Although this place has been featured on TV doesn't make it a good eat.  We were in the area checking out the little restaurants in the area and my mom wanted an italian beef combo and so we went here.  Here's my issue with the "Chicago staple "...they do not accept debit cards...cash only. I rarely carry cash because far as i knew everywhere takes a debit or credit.  Should have left then.  Although the food was hot, the fries were refried and greasy and chewy, even the cheese sauce i ordered with it couldnt save them.  Hell the cheese sauce itself needed saving too cause it tasted like melted american and welfare cheese from the 70s...just gross.  So i ordered the combo and at first i thought they forgot to put the sausage in it but it was buried inside the Italian beef...it was so small it should be called stumpy.  I've been to places where the sausage hangs out the bun.  People save your time and money cause this place sucks.  Overpriced, over greased and over and out. Lol. Go to Pops, Portillos or Mr. Beef instead.

45.description: Disgrace to Taylor street.   Almost $11 for 2 dog and a diet.    The dog couldn't have been no thinker  than a tiperillo cigar.  Shame.  Never going back.   To top it off. While I waited they have a lottery vending machine in there.  So a grab a quick $1 one.  And I win $20 bucks.  Take it to the counter and the guy speak no English so the another one tells me they don't pay out here they just sell them.   What the Heck.

33.description: I have been eating Al's since I was a little kid. I traveled over to Taylor just for this Combo. I was very surprised at the price, it has gone up like crazy and the sandwich has gotten smaller. As to expect in the world economy as we live in. I tried to stay loyal to the original but now it's open season to eat at the franchises. It may not be as good as the original but neither is the original. There is an extra charge for peppers..REALLY?! On a $10 Combo it should be built into the price. This place is not a shell of what was once a glorious spot. I don't have a problem spending money on a good meal. Don't nickel and dime your customers. Every burger place in the world has gone to value packages. Come on AL, update the menu for a value package. Remember MySpace was once on top, don't be like MySpace.
