You can go form the top to the bottom very quickly, remember customers made you who you are today.

43.description: Simply the best. A classic for any Chicagoan. Their beef with the hot peppers are unlike any other. I think it's the peppers and the juices that really set it off. If you haven't gone in, please do. You won't regret it. Not the most glamorous place or biggest either, but you're coming for the food- nothing else. I've had it since I was young and still do to this day.

2.description: ..  I would say ManVsFood over-rated it! Pros: The beef was nice, the peppers were good, Fries were GREAT, BUT ...Cons: - the soaked break wasn't as good as it looked like- No Service at all- no seating  - expensive (in comparison)Worth the visit? YES, but a 1 time thing. Maybe the next time I'll try it DRY!

18.description: Show Me Da Beef!If you're lookin' for da best Italian beef sammie in Chicago, you have to give The Original Al's #1 Italian Beef a try. If you're lookin' for the fanciest Italian beef place keep lookin'! Don't go here expectin' a lotta frills, thrills or a fancy meal. In fact, Al uses the KISS method aka "Keep It Simple Stupid" & it seems to be workin' out! Al doesn't give you much: no tables or chairs to dine at (limited counter space/standing room only); limited menu (no salads or healthy options offered at The Original); no plastic accepted & no ATM on site aka no dinero, no beef; no booze; and no public bathroom available here, but big Al delivers on da beef!It's the quintessential, hole in the wall Chicago beef stand & it happens to be The Original Al's Beef on Taylor Street in Chicago, IL. It's been frequented by many travel shows & celebs & endorsed by the likes of Adam Richman. Sure, it can be considered a tourist trap but Al does serve up legit, hella good Italian beef & great, fresh cut french fries.FYI: You gotta order your beef the right wayaka the "Chicago Way": dipped with hot & sweet peppers." It's the only way to order your beef for maximum taste & if you forget just look for Ditka, he will remind ya! My most recent visit to Al's was another gemlicious one. My beef was thinly sliced, piled high & very juicy/flavorful! My fries were soft, greasy (a lil too greasy but yummy) & piping hot! A perfect pre-Bears game meal!If you've never experienced an authentic, Chicago Italian beef, I highly recommend going to The Original Al's #1 Italian Beef on Taylor Street in Chicago, IL, a Gem fave & Chicago icon! You won't get red carpet treatment at Al's, but you will get to sava the flava of arguably one of da best Italian beefs in Chi-town!

41.description: The Italian beef sandwich is amazing! What I loved is the customer service, they're very friendly and attentive! Would definitely come back

52.description: Loved this place, first time in Chicago and my friend took me here. Was definitely one of the best foods I had, the bread got a little soggy but what do you expect from that much juice! So good! The sausage was also very good!!!

50.description: Juicy. Meaty. Drippy. That's all I'm looking for when I'm hunting down ITAI beef. This place had got it.

4.description: I love Chicago's Italian beef, and I had high hopes for Al's as I had heard this place was legendary. The service was rude, the order taker literally asked me "What do you want?" with a bad attitude. Definitely no hospitality here, and it seems like the workers are proud of it. The beef sandwich was okay, definitely nothing special, and was very heavy on the cinnamon. Peppers were scant and not very spicy. Truthfully, I prefer Fat Dan's back in Indy over this place. I won't be back, and I don't recommend you go here.

6.description: Recently moved in this area and decided to give them another try. Better than what I remembered from before. Service was quick and welcome on a bitter cold winter's day. I detected some seasonings I don't remember, but with hot and sweet peppers and dipped, it was great. I'm sure I'll be back now that I live closer. Fries were good too!

22.description: Move over Philly- I think I just found a new dipped sandwich that tops even those cheese steak monsters.Out for lunch and into Taylor, my friend and I decided to try out Al's. Neither of us had eaten it before, so we decided it was time to knock off another one of the "must-eats" in town. Who would've thought that the original Al's Beef sipped sandwiches would be right here next to UIC? (well yes, there IS Little Italy)We each ordered an Al's Big Beef sandwich; mine came with sweet peppers, and each of ours was dipped. OMG... the sandwich was messy beyond reason, but damn it was good! The beef inside was cut thinly and resembles what you'd find in gyudon (totally making a Japanese comparison here). The bread was beyond tasty given it's wet texture. Then there are the BIG portions... wow, I was only able to eat half of mine before throwing in the towel.Limited seating is available. You can stand inside or sit outside on a nice day. Pair this up with a visit to Mario's across the street and you've got yourself a fantastic meal.CASH ONLY so make sure you have some greens on you. I don't think dancing can be used as a form of payment if all you got is the plastic.

15.description: You gonna go get some local Chicago eats?? Al's Italian Beef is a must go to place!!! You might have to overlook the place and forget if it doesn't look like a bright clean subway... But it's definitely a must try. This location that I went to in little Italy while I was on vacation in Chicago is small and didn't have chairs to sit on... So I stood while I scarfed down my first Al's. I got the combo sub dipped!! So the combo comes with Italian beef and Italian sausage. You can have peppers or no peppers so I went with peppers. And you can have the bread dipped or not dipped. Dipped is when they dip the bread in the sauce the beef was cooked in. I really really enjoyed all the flavors and the tenderness of the beef. I'm normally not a big sausage fan (food wise haha) but this Italian sausage and beef was so good together with all the flavors blending together and the sweet peppers just solidify how good this place really is. Only getting 4stars coz the lack of seating, I can't in my right judgement of rating give this place 5stars but just based on food alone it's pretty bomb and def deserves 4stars no doubt!Luckily there's one location here in Vegas so I feel definitely be going back for the beef!!! If it's your first going... Should go combo dipped all the way!! Happy eating

57.description: Show Me Da Beef!If you're lookin' for da best Italian beef sammie in Chicago, you have to give The Original Al's #1 Italian Beef a try. If you're lookin' for the fanciest Italian beef place keep lookin'! Don't go here expectin' a lotta frills, thrills or a fancy meal. In fact, Al uses the KISS method aka "Keep It Simple Stupid" & it seems to be workin' out! Al doesn't give you much: no tables or chairs to dine at (limited counter space/standing room only); limited menu (no salads or healthy options offered at The Original); no plastic accepted & no ATM on site aka no dinero, no beef; no booze; and no public bathroom available here, but big Al delivers on da beef!It's the quintessential, hole in the wall Chicago beef stand & it happens to be The Original Al's Beef on Taylor Street in Chicago, IL. It's been frequented by many travel shows & celebs & endorsed by the likes of Adam Richman. Sure, it can be considered a tourist trap but Al does serve up legit, hella good Italian beef & great, fresh cut french fries.FYI: You gotta order your beef the right wayaka the "Chicago Way": dipped with hot & sweet peppers." It's the only way to order your beef for maximum taste & if you forget just look for Ditka, he will remind ya! My most recent visit to Al's was another gemlicious one. My beef was thinly sliced, piled high & very juicy/flavorful! My fries were soft, greasy (a lil too greasy but yummy) & piping hot! A perfect pre-Bears game meal!If you've never experienced an authentic, Chicago Italian beef, I highly recommend going to The Original Al's #1 Italian Beef on Taylor Street in Chicago, IL, a Gem fave & Chicago icon! You won't get red carpet treatment at Al's, but you will get to sava the flava of arguably one of da best Italian beefs in Chi-town!

20.description: I used to love Al's a couple years back, especially this location. I was excited to take my boyfriend because he never had it, but now I regret taking him. Note that this place is CASH ONLY. Al's beef is very overpriced for okay food. The Italian beef sandwich I expected to be dripping with juice was very dry - even when dipped. They used to really pile the meat up, but this time I had to open it up to take a picture so you could see what was actually inside. The reason I came was for those famous greasy fries! I remember Al's fries being greasy, soggy, and fresh. I WAS HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED. When they came out, the fries were way overcooked to the point of crisping and they weren't even warm - suggesting that they weren't fresh. I had noticed prices had gone up since the last time I came as well. My unsatisfying meal cost me $16. The line wasn't too long, but the small restaurant was still a little crowded because of the people standing and eating. Ordering our food was fast and the wait wasn't long either. The man taking our order was neither friendly nor rude, he was simply doing his job. The place was small and kind of shabby - not somewhere I really wanted to be eating inside. If you're going to Al's Beef, you're betting off getting take-out than dining there. Seats are extremely limited. There's a counter where you can stand and eat inside but those are usually taken. There's seating outside you have to rush to, but there are only three tables. There was no place to sit so we ended up walking down the road and asking the burger place if we could sit in their outdoor seating area. Maybe I'll give Al's fries another chance, but everything else was just okay. With prices being so darn expensive for a subpar meal, you probably won't see me coming back.

36.description: I found the food to be good, not great. The beef was sliced too thin for my taste, resulting in kind of odd little strips. However I thought the gravy was great, so definitely go for dipped. The hot dog with everything was a little puny and not too interesting. However, the fries were abundant and actually tasty and distinctive. I'd probably try beef from another location next time.

14.description: Al's has gotten a ton of publicity from the Food Network, Travel Channel, etc and it is definitely solid. I'm not a huge Italian Beef fan. Have had them several times before and they just don't completely do it for me (I'm the same way with Philly Cheesesteaks). That being said, Al's is probably the best Italian Beef I've had. It is pretty flavorful and the sweet and hot peppers really add to the sandwich. Also I love Al's fries. Definitely a solid choice, especially if you like Italian Beef.

3.description: Great food and good service!! Will definitely be returning. This restaurant is a welcome addition to the neighborhood.

1.description: Five stars plus! What a charming little place. The staff was accommodating and attentive. The owner was there greeting every guest in his building and was very friendly. The service alone is five star worthy! The atmosphere is cozy, clean, and laid back. Great energy in there! To start I had the lentil soup- AMAZING! The chicken in the kebab platter I got was perfectly smoked, juicy and tender. I really enjoyed the wide variety of greens used in the salad also! To finish the meal we got Turkish coffee and the owner kindly gave us complimentary dessert. I don't remember the exact name, it was almond something, but it was absolutely divine!! Do yourself a favor and go here!

2.description: My husband and I have spent a significant amount of time in Turkey, and we were stoked when we saw that Galata was opening in our neighborhood.  Just stopped in for the first time and it was a feeding frenzy.  We ordered ezme (red pepper dish), piyaz (white bean salad), mercimek (lentil soup), borek, the kofte platter.  It was all perfect.  Authentic, fresh and delicious Turkish food.  We threw in an order of french fries for our boys, and they were even extra tasty.  Go to Galata and enjoy!

9.description: Love having a new Mediterranean/Turkish restaurant in the neighborhood. We went tonight with the whole family. Food was fresh, authentic and delicious. The owner, Zafer, was courteous, kind & generous as he even gave us a sample platter of Turkish Tapas and dessert. Thanks so much. Can't wait till next time.

10.description: I went here yesterday and the customer service was great, (i was the only one there) they were very kind. I had this soup while I waited for my order and it was very yummy. I don't like beans but this was very tasty and the beans were basically pureed. For lunch I had Beef/Lamb shawarma wrap with rice and Hummas. The shawarma wrap was good I am not a lamb person but I still tried it and I liked it the yogurt sauce was a great topper too. Hummas was very good but I had it with warm bread which was nice but next time I am going to ask for pita. I will eat hear again and again 4.8 lipsticks up for me!!!

4.description: Great Mediterranean food and great service! I had lunch here yesterday and had beef shawarma wrap with green salad, eggplant salad and hummus. All of them were delicious!! They have great salad options and various Turkish tapas which I will try next. I am very excited to have a new destination for Mediterranean/Turkish food. Galata neighborhood is one of my favorite places to go in Istanbul so an extra star for the name ;)

6.description: Amazing!!! Fresh food and staff was extremely friendly!! Definitely coming back for more.

12.description: Great doner sandwiches ! Prices are great, so you can try a bunch of food. Cozy and laid back atmosphere.

5.description: I came here for the first time tonight and I was impressed. The falafel was delicious. The service was very attentive. I am glad to see a healthier option and affordable one come to this area. I will definitely be coming back.

13.description: My family and I stopped in for dinner tonight. And it was so good. Between us, we had the borek (delicious), the mized meze platter (oh, that hummus! and that bread!), and all of the wraps except the chicken kebab wrap.There wasn't a missed note in the bunch of food. It was delicious, neither too strong nor too timid. My kids discovered that tzaziki doesn't just belong on wraps--it works on bread, on fries, or even on its own.Outside of the food itself, the service was impeccable, and the minimalist decor is perfect, not too distracting, but interesting enough to enjoy. And everything is tremendously reasonably priced. This place is certainly worth checking out, and worth returning to.

11.description: Was a little skeptical at first - they're brand new and it was empty (but on a weekday evening). I was very happily surprised. Service was attentive and the food was really very good. The hummus  was one of the best I've had - kind of surprising since I live near greektown.  Look forward to going back!

8.description: I love Turkish food and this is a great place. Besides good food they have nice prices, good ambiance (the music is pleasant and not too loud), TV's and pleasant staff. The owner is a really nice guy who took time to chat with us. definitely will be back!

0.description: I was delighted to dabble in a variety of dishes from Galata.  The hummos was gresh, the grape leaves delicious, and the roasted red pepper dish fantastic.  The meat was tender in the sandwiches.Please Go and enjoy

7.description: Generous portions and tasty food. Would definitely go back for dinner or after we visit the closeby bars. Looking forward to them getting their liquor license.

1.description: A lifetime ago I was an adjunct instructor here, and two lifetimes ago I was a student and then a graduate student here.  Currently my Chief of Staff is a gradual student and adjunct so I occasionally find myself hanging around in old haunts I barely recognize.  This area was once a student cafeteria, with surly full time unionized workers who hate students, serving surly food that also hated students.  The food service has since been privatized, this area is split between a convenience mart and Au Bon Pain, both are marginally better in terms of food quality, the customer service in Morgan Street Station is a marked improvement.  My guess is the young lady working today is actually a student, but at any rate, she was pleasant and helpful.  There are cafes all over campus now, but they only are open during peak student periods, so often this is the only place open for coffee.  The coffee is not great, and they won't let you put it in your own cup (apparently they haven't yet heard about this protect-the-environment movement), but right now, Friday summer afternoon, it's the only game in town.  A little tangential irony, the last time I was getting some work done here, I was a Sociology instructor and Curtis Granderson was one of my students.  Now, the new baseball stadium is named after him for his generous donation.  Lots of important people graduated from what used to be University of Illinois Circle Campus, but he was probably the greatest athlete.  I'm a bit surprised he had a major league career after eating at the cafeteria down here, but maybe, sometimes, what doesn't kill you does make you stronger.

0.description: Does anyone really care about one of the many little convenient stores on the UIC campus?  Probably not.  However, I have a very important story to tell about this one.  For it was at this location that I encountered the coffee I COULD NOT BEAT.I pride myself on my coffee drinking abilities.  I love coffee and I'm unapologetic about it.  It's my life source.  I've never met a cup of coffee I couldn't consume.  You name it I've had it.  Plain coffee to coffee flavored gum.  Love it.  One day during break from one of my classes I realized I needed a cup of coffee.  I was falling asleep all over my desk again.  Oh Hell, even if I wasn't falling asleep I'd still need my caffeine goodness.  So I hippity hop to the little convenience mart across the street to get my fix.  I put 5 Mini-Moo creams in my medium sized cup.  Those Moos didn't make a dent.  The coffee barely turned a dark caramel.  "Ahhh...The coffee that refuses to be tamed," I thought.  No matter.  I've never met a cup I couldn't beat.  I'll spare everyone the gory details.  This cup kicked my ass.  It burned a hole through my stomach.  I spent half my day in the bathroom nursing my wounded pride and cowering in shame (and pain).So that's that.  This convenient mart also has shit loads of candy, chips, soups, sushi, muffins, cup cakes, gum, and whatever else depraved college minds may desire.  Including, the Unbeatable Cup.

58.description: I love Vintage every time we go we get excellent service and the prices are good. On Saturdays we always go for the Sangria and chips they are addictive. On Tuesdays 5 dollar burgers and they are delicious. Music is always good :)

56.description: -Kind of a cross between Hawkeye's and the Old Illinois Bar and grill.-Music varies from Rock to Rap.-Defintely not a hipster joint-Not the greatest beer selection-Solid bar food-Overall a nice neighhorhood joint to grab a beer, some food and a game.

29.description: Great place for sporting events, Nice new outdoor patio....was a great place to watch the Stanley Cup!

42.description: I have been through here a few times with coworkers for various going away after-work drinks or celebrations, it is a short walk from the hospitals.   Service is slightly slow and the wait staff seem typically a little strained or rushed, which I don't blame them for in a busy noisy bar.  Later in the night it can get pretty loud and screamy college-crowdy which is not really my scene.   Decor is more minimal with big open spaces and a nice solid central bar.   Bar food menu, I have just had appetizers.  A good place to stop by quickly for drinks after work now and then!

23.description: Nice bar with good deals in the evenings. They have a nice selection on tap and some nice appetizers. Plenty of space and not too loud for a conversation while drinking a pint or sipping on vino.

47.description: Stopped by to have a drink while we were waiting for a table at Davanti Enoteca.  We were seated at a nice little table overlooking the street.  Our server was pretty nice, and there were some drink specials despite it being a Saturday evening (I think it was because a UFC fight was going on?).  My drink was really weak, though, probably because it was a drink special.  I don't think I'd choose to come back here (would like to try the wine bar next time), but this was a nice way to spend my time waiting to be seated at the restaurant.

8.description: We were one of the only tables so one would think we would receive excellent service which couldn't have been further from the case. There are lots of other choices in the area, Rosebud, Hawkes, I suggest try those instead.

31.description: Horrible Service reviews are not en exaggeration. We visited this bar during the Stanley Cup Playoffs and it took over 2 hours to get really bad food.  In the 2 hours that we waited for an appetizer, we filled up on drinks, only to have food sent to our table with one person's dish coming out first before the appetizer or other dish.  It was pure chaos, and the server was probably working for the first time ever serving 20 tables or so.  The "manager" came up to us while drinking a beer, and comped one thing on the bill, which was pretty sad, considering the whole food aspect of the night was horrible and should have been removed, although we didn't feel like arguing.  Poor management and really horrible food.  I would not suggest this place for anything other than drinks.For good food head down Taylor in the opposite direction to Three Aces --- YUM!

34.description: Have been to Vintage for many different occasions.......stopping in for a drink after work, lunch to watch a sporting event or just drinks and dancing on the weekends.  I have always had a great time and the wait staff, especially Sarah, have been nothing but phenomenal!!  I am especially loving the new and improved menu!  Cajun popcorn, humus, chicken wings, the old chicago burger, patty melt and the prosciutto flatbread, to name a few, have been outstanding!  Looking forward to spending some time in the newly opened patio, which I've heard will have some great sunday funday specials!

16.description: I really wish that I could give this place -2 stars on this review. Oh the humanity! Oh the bad "wings", service, burgers, fries and tatters! Why oh why???My friend and I walked into this place around 4:30 pm and the place was deserted. I figured it was kind of a weird feeling and sign that no one was around the dine at this time. We wondered how the seating arrangement was at this restaurant as we waited to be given instructions the waitstaff were way to busy looking at their phones, not paying any attention to the real world. My friend and I decided to find our own seat then. Finally, the waitress got off her phone and asked what we wanted. We ordered some BBQ Wings with Blue Cheese dressing, two Blue Collar Burgers, and my friend ordered tatter tots and I ordered steak fries. When the out BBQ Wings came up, the food runner just plotted them on the table without any word. I realized the Blue Cheese was missing...we waited 5 minutes and saw that waitress was too busy talking and laughing and eating while on the job. I decided to go up to her and ask her for Blue Cheese.  "Oh, you want like double dressing," was what she said when I asked her for dressing. I told her that the Blue Cheese never came. After 2 minutes, she brought the dressing. When I began to eat the wings...it was more like burn buns and dehydrated deep fried chicken meat, what a sad day.We decided to wait for our meal instead of wasting our energy of chewing through such a hard rubber and tough piece of fried me. When the waitress came back I had told her that the chicken wings were inedible and tough, she simply responded, "oh, what's it tough? I never eat chicken wings." Oh, I'm sorry, I hope that she looks up the word in a dictionary to know the word tough'a meaning. The hamburgers were not thrilling, the fries were rubbery and unflavorful and the tots were gosh darn to salty!  I ordered a medium burger and my friend ordered well-done. The burger I had was well-done as was hers. Oh the torture of not having a good hamburger to your liking!We're certainly no coming back here ever. Cintya P. T_T

13.description: The owners of this place are complete egotistical morons. They let their middle age friends sit at the bar and sexually harass the young college girls. This place is a joke. The food is crap and the prices are outrageous. Never again.

11.description: Good drinks, Nice staff,Love the ability to watch all the football games on great tvs, with great game food deals.  $1 brats are an amazing Sunday afternoon football watching deal.  I have always been treated to good service.Best place to watch a game on Taylor Street.

39.description: I work fairly close to Taylor Street, and my colleagues and I decided we would try a new place for lunch. To be honest, we won't be back. The service was painfully slow. There were four of us eating, and we all ordered burgers, it took THIRTY minutes just to get our food, and it wasn't busy at all. When we finally received our food, the order was wrong! The waitress had to be asked to get us simple things like refills, and the checks. So we waited about 10 minutes for our checks, when we see out waitress standing at the bar counting her tips. We were not pleased. We finally went to the bar because we has been there at this point for an hour and a half, and needed to get back to work. We talked to the manager about our experience, and he seemed to care less. It's a shame because the location is great, and it's rather nice inside. But all in all poor customer service and the food was meh. Would not return.

37.description: The owner/manager is very helpful.  The neighborhood needed a place like this.  For dining, the table could use some rearrangements for more seating.  Their bartenders are always cool peeps.  Addendum(1/23/16):  Apparently, there's some new staff here.  I was recently here to watch a Bulls game with a buddy.  I didn't like the vibe. There were as many staff as patrons. I am all of 40, and we  were  id'd coming in. My buddy's beard has a lot of grey. That's fine, but it was 7pm and very few folk there.  The two female bartenders weren't as attentive nor cordial and got upset when we summoned the bar help guy who was always there even though business was slow at the moment.  Security was way too uptight, standing around staring at the patrons all of whom were professional looking people.   I was there for 3 hours, and as I was readying to leave in seconds, the new shift security dude comes to me to ask me to take off my Calvin Klein skullcap.  I never did as it's 23 degrees outside and we were sitting just 5 feet from the entrance.  I had to take one star off because I didn't feel wanted at this establishment, even though I'm a clean cut and quiet business man.   Nothing boils my blood more than a lackluster chick bartender. But I still tipped well, because as some black folk do we tend to over tip.  The one guy bartender who had just started his shift as we were leaving saved the day just by having a personality towards us. I hope he got the tip and not the chick who was busy on social media and talking with all the over staffed coworkers there.  This is my neighborhood, and I don't like an uptight vibe.

0.description: This place never dissapoint me. Always a great spot to relax. Eat some good food and have some cold drinks. It's gorgeous in here. Been a fan since day one and I always bring friends and family here. The staff has always been so nice even when I have children in our group. Thanks Vintage

38.description: Horrible service.  The bartenders seemed to have never served before.  I waited a good 30 mins at the bar for a few beers and shots and since I was being ignored, left and went to another bar down the street.

51.description: I give it a 3 because of how fun the dance floor gets.. other than that, I always have to wait a little while at the bar...  The food is good, the music is probably their best asset. It is a bit pricey.

27.description: Pretty pissed off about the service we received last night, Saturday 8/31.  The bartender was ignoring customers so he could take shots with girls. Screw that, I closed the tab and spent my money elsewhere. Also the doorman was literally reading a magazine outside.  Went to approach him to show ids but he was more interested in reading.  Then when we reach out to open the door he catches an attitude and asks us for ids like we were trying to sneak in.  Wtf? Experiences like that leave a bad taste in your mouth.  I live very close and come here  a lot.  Now I'll think twice before walking in.

32.description: Stumbled upon this place while coming back from dinner in Little Italy. My date and I decided to check it out; had a cool laid back vibe. Definitely not your typical sports bar atmosphere. They have a very cool lounge area off to the side which looks great for hosting a party, plus a outdoor beer garden with big screens. Came back to watch game 2 of the Stanley Cup finals so the place was packed. Service was a little off but I'm attributing that to the crowd and the chaos. One of the manager's came up to us and apologized and ended up coming our bill for the night. Having been in the hospitality industry I completely understand that sometimes you just have one of those nights. Overall the staff was friendly and accommodating. We will definitely make a return trip on a not so crazy night to assess again.

54.description: Not bad for a Friday night. Not great either. We came in for a co-worker's 35th birthday party. The waitress never checked on us, took my order, or even looked at me over the course of two hours. Blech.The DJ was playing standard top-40s, so I would have been fine with it, but there really weren't many people in the bar so no one was dancing. As a side note, the bar seemed fine with letting the party bring in food and birthday cake and I do appreciate that when we're with a big group for a birthday.

48.description: Wasn't really a big thing for me in a sense that it was a sports bar with some rambunctious guys who were pretending to be cool while playing pool in the corner. The bartender was an amiable fellow who offered me a VERY good beer: Matilda from Goose Island. Absolutely loved it! Again, nothing too special about this place. Going with a good group of your friends is probably a great idea.

44.description: A nice taylor street lounge. Really impressive look. The service was great and they have one of nicer looking pool tables in a bar. Just the right number of televisions along with a great back lounge area and good looking furniture makes this a great place.

24.description: Service is mehhh but food and martinis are great here!We were the ONLY table in the place and our order was messed up twice.. Our appetizer was brought with our meal and one meal was even completely forgotten... BUT when the food came, it was all very yummy. I suggest the peach or pear martinis and the flat bread appetizer :)

7.description: The Martinis were 5 bucks when I went that day and let me say they tasted delicious and were strong enough to get you a good buzz even just with one! The mango and lemon drop martinis are the way to go! But gals this is a casual spot to hang out with friends...

49.description: Came here on Saturday afternoon. Not too big of a crowd. Thought there would be a few more people for opening day of college football. A friend from FL was in town visiting and the waitress graciously put the Gator game on for us. Potato skins were very cheesy and delicious. Fried ravioli was good. Spinach dips was ok, I've had better - the chips were way too salty. Decent draft prices. Would come back and enjoy again on an afternoon. Not sure the late night dance scene would be my thing though.

40.description: Went here on a Thursday and it got pretty packed throughout the night. There was a pretty good crowd and a good variety of music. Liked:- Drink specials- Crowd - Music- No cover (at least when we got there) Not sure if there is a cover during the rest of the nightDisliked:- Bartenders ignored me even after I gave them my order TWICE. Continued to serve everyone else around me and I never got my drink RUDE- Wish they had more drink specialsOverall, an OK place. Would go back if people with me wanted to go there but would not go out of the way to go there otherwise. Nothing particularly special or horrendous about this place.

53.description: I've been here a handful of times over the past year or two, with large and small groups. Regardless of party size, service is always extremely slow, and not very friendly.  The drinks are just OK, I've gotten a few of their martinis and mojitos, none were too great.  They don't have particularly good specials. The decor is nice and they have lots of space, but not worth it given the service.

30.description: Let me preface this review with the fact that I've never written a negative review ever. No establishment has ever left me so frustrated that I felt inclined to warn the world against ever visiting it. That streak is over. I watched game 2 and game 5 of the stanley cup finals here and both experiences were pretty bad. Game 2 the place was over crowded and under served. The experience was saved by an apologetic waitress who comped us a pitcher of beer for no reason. Overall, not a terrible experience.Game 5 was completely different. There were three people at our table. We all ordered food and drinks. The drinks came out in a relatively timely manner. Diner #1 at our table received his food 1 hour after it was ordered. Diner #2 received her food 1.5 hours after it was ordered. Diner #3 (me) never received any food. We asked about it at least 5 times and every time our server was very apologetic, but the food never came!!!! Finally, after 2 hours (the game was over and I ordered in the first period) we left. Our server offered us a round of free drinks but I was so fed up I just paid and walked out. There are so many places in the city where this does not happen that I will never waste my time again here.

46.description: "Would you like steak fries or tater tots with that?" Now, if this is how the question is asked, wouldn't you assume that the fries or tots come with your burger? After much dining and many rounds of watered-down cocktails, the bill comes with a $15 tab for five orders of fries. Apparently, they cost $3 each. The fries are good but the staff very sneaky... and then the waitress says -- that's the first time anybody has complained about the fries -- making one feel like a cheap f**ck. Nope. Not coming back. Been treated better elsewhere.

1.description: With a happy hour suited to a undergraduate budget, I should have known what to expect.The cocktails are not strong during happy hour (duh) and while the food is easily filling, it's potatoes. Potatoes, and potatoes, and maybe some cheese. The spinach and artichoke dip was incredibly generous, but it was much too creamy and had zero artichokes. The servers were fantastic - great pacing with no pushiness - ya'll rock! Ambiance is cool too, and there are plenty of televisions to watch a game from.

55.description: Went here a few weeks ago for a friends birthday. We had good service overall. They had a pizza special that was surprisingly very flavorful and only $6! The drinks were ok, but were bit more expensive than I was expecting. The one shot I did have that night tastes like a sherbert punch with a drop of Malibu and it wasn't worth it. If I were to go back, it would be only for their specials.

9.description: The burgers are fantastic! The atmosphere is relaxing. They have good drink special offers daily.  Will come again.

26.description: This place is strange.  It's a beautiful spacious room.  I love the mahogany  bar and the ceiling fan fans.  The overall aesthetic of the place reads Brandy and Cigars.  But the servers...girls in tank tops, the beer...domestic, the theme nights... frat house.  I just don't get it. However the wings were good. The servers the night we went were awesome, like really really nice ladies.  I love that patio and cant wait to come back during nicer weather.

25.description: I really liked the wings I got here. I felt they were better than Buffalo Wild Wings. I also got a chocolate Martini and even though I don't like Vodka it was pretty good. And there selection of beer is pretty big!

12.description: Pretty pissed off about the service we received last night, Saturday 8/31.  The bartender was ignoring customers so he could take shots with girls. Screw that, I closed the tab and spent my money elsewhere. Also the doorman was literally reading a magazine outside.  Went to approach him to show ids but he was more interested in reading.  Then when we reach out to open the door he catches an attitude and asks us for ids like we were trying to sneak in.  Wtf? Experiences like that leave a bad taste in your mouth.  I live very close and come here  a lot.  Now I'll think twice before walking in.

59.description: Of course this place did well when it first opened, but even last time I went, the place was crowded & a lot of people dance every time I go; that's always a good thing for me. It may be a bit hard to get through the crowd at times, so a martini would be good if you get lounge seating, although I believe you have to order bottle service for that. The food is reeeally good. Our waitresses have always been helpful & attentive. There are some pretty good drink deals, even on the weekends. The djs are always pretty good & get everyone in the mood to dance. Everyone seems to have a great time when I go, not just the group I'm in. There is a pool table in back, but they rope it off after a certain time, maybe to make more room for the crowd. There are extra washrooms in the lower level, clean washrooms at that. I love the decor of this bar & it isn't too small like some of the bars on Taylor Street. The only thing that is a bit of a bummer is that parties require a minimum of 20 people and a 50% deposit needs to be put down before the party. They also apply 20% gratuity to beverage packages. It would be a lot more convenient to pay for the wristbands the night of the party. I guess this isn't too bad, but it's unrealistic for young people like me who don't have the money to pay up front and this area is a prime spot for college students. They also charge an additional 50% of the total amount if less than 75% of the guests do not show up, so make sure you have definite RSVPs for a party here! I do really like this bar, though and recommend arriving earlier than 9 or 10 to find decent street parking, as there is no lot. Also, no cover as far as I know.

21.description: I've been here twice now. The food has been good, the drinks good, but the service has been awful. Went for lunch today, waited over an hour for GRILLED CHEESE. It does not take that long to make grilled cheese. Our waitress basically ignored us. She did apologize for our wait....fifty minutes into it. Without any explanation or attempt to make it better. Unacceptable.

17.description: I went on a Sunday at the tail end of a Bears game.  Wasn't very crowded (but the Bears were losing pretty good by that point).  It was seat yourself, and there were plenty of empty seats.Though I grabbed a seat near a few other patrons.  Despite their waitress coming by several times, no one said a word to me.  I wasn't offered water, not so much as an "I'll be right with you".  I have no idea who my server was.After 15 minutes I left.  I've never been ignored at a restaurant before, and I have no intention to repeat it.

10.description: My night was awesome until it ended..the bartender or whatever he was was soo rude and cursed me out to get out of the bar! I've never been disrespected so harshly in my life. Seriously, this place would be nice if the staff wasn't so up there asses..some are nice but the ones that are ass hole staff fuck it up for everyone seriously! Terrible I won't be going back here.

5.description: I came here for drinks on a Saturday night. They have $5 margarita specials with a variety of flavors. It's a good location to watch sports... there are large screens everywhere. The Blackhawks game was on most and a few had college football too. In the back, there's a good lounge area with couches that you can reserve or it's first come, first served. Overall, the prices were decent but they ran out of Honey Jack! I was just getting started. Ugh. So I wasn't happy that I had to switch it up halfway through.I think it was around 11, they moved the tables and a DJ started playing. That was my cue to leave. LOL. They had a strobe light. WHAT!?!?

3.description: Burger was good, drinks good and strong but service was slow. Overall would recommend.  Like the small menu; a little something for everyone, paleo and vegan alike!

35.description: Had so much fun here for the BLACKHAWKS game last Wednesday - Food was great - excellent chicken tacos for the Wednesday night special - bar was packed and still had great service! Stayed after the game and bartenders made us specials shots!! Will definitely be back this week for the both games!

19.description: This place is amazing I went there with about 12 people and we had all the appetizers and we tried all the different martinis everything I ate was out of this world I felt like I was at one of a Michelin stars restaurant and the drinks were so good .  And the service was out of this world everything we needed we got we didn't  have to wait for anything. We are  already planning to go back next month and I think we might go back sooner because they also have a wonderful New Year's eve party my friend went to it last year and had a great time.

28.description: Vintage, I go only for the Happy hour. The price is pretty decent during happy hours. I also go here for convenience. Not something  I would drive hours for though.  It is probably one of my favorite happy hour place due to location and the half-off appetizers on Friday.  Still trying to find good happy hour appetizer or food deals.

45.description: Hit or miss atmosphere. There have been times were we have a great time and the music is popping and others when the music seems to be making people leave. Drinks can get expensive here as I know we've paid $8 for domestic beer on a Friday night.

33.description: Watching games here is great, especially with the huge flat screen TVs they have. Their menu has also expanded, and what I've had so far is delicious. I've heard great things about the Acapulco flatbread, and you can't go wrong with their daily specials ($5 pizzas on Thursdays are the best). I have a soft spot in my heart for pretzels, and you get a huge order of 4 pretzels for $8, with honey mustard and cheese sauce. The pretzels are soft on the inside, crunchy on the outside, and are buttery with tons of salt. The food may be a tad bit pricey, but you get a good amount of it to make up for the cost.

43.description: I returned to this place for the second time last night. The first time was during the Pay-Per-View Manny Pacquiao fight -- when the bar was absolutely slam packed and movement was barely possible (let alone getting drinks in the desired amount of time). Last night was considerably less crowded, and a more enjoyable atmosphere.However, there were many little things that took place that could have made this experience more than barely adequate. For one, it took at least 10-15 minutes to be greeted by our server after being seated. That was a good indication of the service we'd have the rest of the night. We ordered as soon as she came over. It was $5 martini night so I asked for a manhattan. The server said it wasn't on the menu, but she could probably bring a variation of one (whiskey+grenadine) that used to be on their menu. I said sure. And off she disappeared again. We waited so long for our drinks (something she attributed to the bartenders being busy), one of the other servers checked in to see if we'd been served. The food runner brought us our food a good five minutes before the drinks came out. When does that ever happen??I had the blue collar burger and it was pretty phenomenal. Black angus, pretzel bun... really hit the spot. Just wish I'd been able to get some liquids down before the meal. When the drink did come, it was pretty heavy on the grenadine (looked like a cosmo), but not bad tasting. A second round (ordered as soon as the first came due to speed of service) came out more promptly, but at least a full drink short. After finishing the burger and drinks, we headed to the bar for one more drink. I decided to stick with the manhattan, and ended up wishing I'd never asked for one in the first place. The bartender told me I was "really making her brush up on her bartending skills" and that she needed me to remind her of the ingredients. I told her whiskey and sweet vermouth and she made the drink. You probably already guessed -- the drink was completely overpowered by vermouth. She must have poured it 1:1 (or worse). Noticing my reaction to the terrible taste, she asked if it was wrong. I told her there was way too much vermouth - that she should just give it a splash. She tried again but it ended up pretty much the exact same way. At the prompting of the female patron sitting next to me (who had interjected with her own instructions to the bartender about how to make it correctly), she tried a third time. Poison. Again. I really don't know what was going on. She must have had no clue how to pour count. When she rang us up, and struggled to do so -- she told us a now obvious truth; she was new.Either way, I appreciated her efforts to make something off the menu for me, and really didn't want to see all of that whiskey (bourbon actually, as she told me she used Makers Mark) go to waste, so I drank it anyway. By that point, I felt like I had no choice. I was too uncomfortable with the patron next to me instructing her on how to make it (thus complicating this issue further), and generally feeling like I was being an unappreciative pain in the ass. I felt bad - sensing that I had embarrassed and/or frustrated the bartender. But why should I have to feel that way? Why can't Vintage hire qualified bartenders? Or at least bartenders who know how to ask a more knowledgeable bartender (or a smart phone) for the recipe so the onus isn't put on the customer? Lastly, I might not have bothered to post this review if it wasn't for the questionable behavior of one of the bouncers. While we were eating, we sat behind a four-top occupied by employees and their shit (at a time when customers would have definitely benefited from it's availability). On several occasions, we watched this particularly enormous bouncer stand up and throw things at people across the bar. I'm pretty sure they were little pieces of chalkboard chalk. However juvenile this behavior appeared, I assumed he was only doing it to mess with his friends and/or co-workers. But after moving to the bar, I was hit by two thrown pieces of whatever it was he was throwing. I ignored it, not bothering to look at what was thrown and choosing to believe he'd been targeting somebody else. But seriously, bro? The poor service and rude treatment from these employees really killed what was otherwise an enjoyable atmosphere. And if I go back again, I definitely won't be ordering manhattans.

2.description: I came here once to watch the second half of the Bulls game. They have two projectors side by side inside with some TVs here and there and then they also have a TV in the backyard. It is a perfect set up to watch sports and the outdoor experience is actually pretty nice. I would have enjoyed it if the service was better. We ordered a couple pizzas and my friends ordered pop while I got water. The pizzas were delicious but $8 is too expensive for the size and if you eat a lot, you might end up chomping down on the whole thing. I split with my buddy and I was definitely not full after eating half of their pizza. Here is where the service got crappy, we didn't get plates for the pizza, nor was my water or my friends pop brought to us. Heck, even we missed there weren't plates on the table because no one expects to get plates after they get their food. We eventually got the drinks, but my friends got diet coke instead of coke. When we finally got the waiter, we were done with our pizzas. The waiter said she would bring out our coke but I told her there was no need because we were already done with out food. So she brought out our bill and still charged us for the pop?!?! I went right back to her and told her:Me: We were still charged for the pop Waiter: Yes because you got it Me: You gave us diet coke instead of coke and we didn't even touch it. Waiter: So.... you want me to take it off?Me: yes She gave us a new receipt, we paid and we were out. The pizza tasted great but small for $8. The service is 0/5. I did however, enjoy my time watching the game outside with everyone cheering together.

18.description: Mediocre  food but very good drinks and a fun ambiance. We went there for my cousin's  birthday and it did get crowded so be prepared to show up early if you want a seat.

41.description: Good lounge with a nice atmosphere. Service was good, Got there a little late so no tables were available. Music was good.

52.description: Well hello $5 martinis on Friday. I've been here on a Friday and Saturday and both times were ok. Friday was a mix of business and college people. Saturday was mostly college people. Drinks were $6 for a vodka soda. I was not a fan of the music. It was all top 40 when I went. I would like some variety, but no all top 40. I haven't tried any of their food, but it looked good from what I saw. I wouldn't drive out of my way to come here, but if I wanted some drinks and was nearby I would give it another shot.

50.description: Turkey burger I on point, mojitos are refreshing and they make you feel right at home! All I need from them is an available outlet and stable wifi and im posting up weekly!

4.description: I had a great time here! We grabbed a high table right next to the open window, so it was almost like sitting outdoors without the wetness of the rain on the chairs.The tater tots and fried jalapenos went perfectly with our drinks. I'd like to try this place again soon. Maybe for dinner or something.

6.description: Cool atmosphere, but service is very slow and I was very turned off by the food. You can tell they don't have separate fryers for their seafood items because our tator tots and Mac and cheese bites tasted very fishy. Will not be going back for food.

22.description: I had a great time here! We grabbed a high table right next to the open window, so it was almost like sitting outdoors without the wetness of the rain on the chairs.The tater tots and fried jalapenos went perfectly with our drinks. I'd like to try this place again soon. Maybe for dinner or something.

15.description: I've been to Vintage one other time but only for drinks. I went out with some classmates after a long day of grad school classes to be so disappointed. Vintage had poor drink selection, cold food, expensive food and mediocre service. The waitress was apologetic but still didn't make up for it. Taking myself somewhere else on Taylor Street next time!

57.description: I recently went here after work with a few of my co-workers, the place is not bad. It wa a Friday nite, around 5:30 or so and they have $5 martini's, how can you beat that. I had the Purple Rain martini was on the sweet side, but the Lemon Drop martini was good and strong, both were really good. The chicken nachos were delicious as well. The doughnut dippers were fantastic. Nice ambiane very attentive waitstaff, I will definitely be back!

20.description: Drinks are whatev but they have a good beer selection! Love the little patio out back. Don't know why but while we were there they turned the speakers on the tv out back off and switched to music. You can't do that to espn!!!! Lol oh and the pretzels are awesome!

36.description: I really wish that I could give this place -2 stars on this review. Oh the humanity! Oh the bad "wings", service, burgers, fries and tatters! Why oh why???My friend and I walked into this place around 4:30 pm and the place was deserted. I figured it was kind of a weird feeling and sign that no one was around the dine at this time. We wondered how the seating arrangement was at this restaurant as we waited to be given instructions the waitstaff were way to busy looking at their phones, not paying any attention to the real world. My friend and I decided to find our own seat then. Finally, the waitress got off her phone and asked what we wanted. We ordered some BBQ Wings with Blue Cheese dressing, two Blue Collar Burgers, and my friend ordered tatter tots and I ordered steak fries. When the out BBQ Wings came up, the food runner just plotted them on the table without any word. I realized the Blue Cheese was missing...we waited 5 minutes and saw that waitress was too busy talking and laughing and eating while on the job. I decided to go up to her and ask her for Blue Cheese.  "Oh, you want like double dressing," was what she said when I asked her for dressing. I told her that the Blue Cheese never came. After 2 minutes, she brought the dressing. When I began to eat the wings...it was more like burn buns and dehydrated deep fried chicken meat, what a sad day.We decided to wait for our meal instead of wasting our energy of chewing through such a hard rubber and tough piece of fried me. When the waitress came back I had told her that the chicken wings were inedible and tough, she simply responded, "oh, what's it tough? I never eat chicken wings." Oh, I'm sorry, I hope that she looks up the word in a dictionary to know the word tough'a meaning. The hamburgers were not thrilling, the fries were rubbery and unflavorful and the tots were gosh darn to salty!  I ordered a medium burger and my friend ordered well-done. The burger I had was well-done as was hers. Oh the torture of not having a good hamburger to your liking!We're certainly no coming back here ever. Cintya P. T_T

14.description: An underrated and underutilized bar/restaurant in Little Italy. I have always had good food here (minus one really bad pizza) and good drinks. Rarely is it as busy as (in my opinion) the crappy Drum and Monkey down the street. Good place to watch sports, hang with friends, or party. Great service and Frank, the big burly looking manager, is awesome. I love summer too when they open up the front.

3.description: I'm fed up with this. Move this joint one block south to the Taylor St., it'd die within half a year. Why?1. Tiny pizza slice, big price, frozen pizza-esque flavor;2. Amateurish pasta. You can reach the same level by yourself, seriously;3. Hot dog = sucky bun+grocery store-grade sausage+lousy pickle;4. Burger = sucky bun+grocery store-grade beef patty+dispensable veggie;5. Fries = ... well, just potato, deep-fried.Needless to say any more. Feeling bored reading this? You'll feel very similarly when eating their stuff. This place survives due to its location.

1.description: The two dogs I got from the hot dog place were not good at all, like day old microwaved hot dogs, fries were pretty good though.  Sbarro pizza wasn't bad but those hot dogs uhhhgh

2.description: this place is right off the Polk Pink line station and houses Franks n' Fries together with a Sbarro.  I don't think anyone should expect anything on the menu to scream WOW like on a five star dining level!  Franks n' Fries is convenient, fast food - definitely way better than McDonalds/Burger King (yuk).  They have some decent priced combo deals (hot dogs & fries, burgers & fries, chicken sandwiches & fries - you get the picture), they serve a huge amount of crinkle cut fries with their sandwiches (at least by my standards), offer fountain drinks and sell mozzarella sticks (YUM!!).  Although I don't go too often, anytime I've been to Franks N' Fries I've liked the food.  The Sbarro serves different types of pizzas (thin, thick crust, and stuffed - at least I think it's stuffed) they also have pasta dishes, sausage & peppers, garlic bread, and other italian dishes.  Their menu varies as do their specials.  They also have different salads and some really yummy desserts...I love their cakes, especially their carrot cake...oh boy do I love that carrot cake.  In addition to the fountain drinks, they offer bottled juices/water.  The Sbarro side is also open early for breakfast... standard breakfast fare (eggs/sausage/bacon, etc) ...... but I really dig their breakfast potatoes -- so tasty!!!  But soo filling that I don't indulge in them very often...yes, it can get busy during lunch - but most places in this area get busy during this time probably because there so few choices.  They have a nice outdoor patio during the summer...but it also gets pretty packed.  They take credit cards, but also have an ATM inside.

5.description: Running late for the Polk pink line and missed lunch? Run out of money on your CTA card and cursing the machine not taking your plastic credit cards? Run into On the Mall for hot slice of sub-par Za, sloppy calzone, or a greasy Boli from Sbarro or grab a cheap dog n fries at the next door kiosk. The best part is the Bank of America atm inside and people watching or rather gaping at the small TV playing right wing political propaganda. The hours are not great (see UIC student hours), but OTM has its times of glory.

6.description: This review is for Franks n Fries... I love the cheese fries here! The service can be hit or miss, but the food is greasy and hits the spot .  I usually just order fries here when I forget to pack lunch... also this building houses a Bank of America ATM, the closest one in the area unless you want to make the trek to Ashland/Roosevelt.  And trust me, during Chicago winters, that could be a very, very long trek.

7.description: The Frank N' Fries location at On The Mall is generally quick, if you order hot dogs.  They're not the best hot dogs you'll ever eat, but are certainly respectable.  I recommend the two hot dog combo, with everything.

8.description: This is a really convenient place for lunch if you go to school or work on the west campus of UIC.  They have Sbarro which is like my favorite pizza!  They've also got decent coffee and drinks and its right next to the Polk St Blue line stop so its easy to pop in on your way to work or your way home!

0.description: Super-convenient location, gotta say. But the little hot dog stand in the corner seems to make everything fresh, which is good on one hand, but always means a long wait. It's quicker to grab pizza from Sbarro.

4.description: Not bad.. Walking pass this place on a monthly basis, I decided to finally give it a try. The two things that drew my attention were the Chicago style dog and the fries in a brown paper bag.  Overall, it was good.  Nothing like Maxwell Street but hit the spot in a pinch.  I might try the polish next time I am there.  We shall see.

58.description: Panera (aka St. Louis Bread Co.) is a so-so sandwich/soup joint. The food is decent to so-so, depending on the day you visit (i.e. not super consistent).  This location fails because the dining room is consistently filthy.  While I appreciate the wi-fi, you have to be prepared to deal with the loitering crowd since Chicago has no comfortable coffee shop type environments with wifi for anyone to go.

56.description: Panera bread will always have a special place in my heart.Because of my silly mom.See - when she came to visit from France two summers ago she fell in love with the concept. She couldn't get enough of the hazelnut coffee (weird I know), the cinnamon crunch bagel and muffins. 'Cause we do have a lot of yummy things over there but not quite anything like that. Which makes me think that I would definitely get rich if I were to open something along the lines of Panera, or a brunch place in my hometown...But I digress.The only reason I am reviewing Panera (I chose this one because it's the one I frequent the most) is because of the new calorie information clearly displayed on their menu. LOVE IT. I was about to order an 'innocent' sounding tomato-basil-greens-mozzarella salad  when I saw an heart-stopping 750 calories attached to it....when you love your cheese....well....you pay for it. I switched to the Asian Chicken. Still did the job, with half the calories.Sad day for dairy....but good day for my hips!UPDATE:Apparently the calorie information is not available in all restaurants.....which makes me really sad. And angry, And frustrated.; )

29.description: I come here for lunch once in a while for years now, so I decided its finally time to write a review. The location is in a busy South Loop plaza where it can be a hassle to park in the lot and then get your ticket validated for free parking. You can always park outside in the street where there are tons of spots, but you will have to pay meter. Anyway, the food here is pretty decent and this is always a good spot to come for lunch if you are in the area. The Chipotle Chicken is really good and it is probably my favorite thing to get here. I always get this with the cream of broccoli soup on the side, which is delicious. Another plus is they have soup in a bread bowl.Southwest Flatbread is the latest thing I have tried and worth commenting about. It is good and I tried this with a side of BBQ Chicken Salad, which is really good too. I normally don't eat salad or crave salad, but I must say this one is worth eating.The only thing bad I have to say about this place is that the tables are always dirty and the utensils are always dirty, so I would have to ask for plastic fork or spoon.

42.description: Panera is a great place for lunch, this location on canal has easy parking free when validated.  excellent for tracking your diet:  half bacon turkey bravo  400 calories  :)

23.description: Ordered the vegetarian sandwich and the tomato soup here. I've come here 3 times and never have i been let down. This time i sat outside and it was great. Their ingredients seemed fresh and their soup was nice and warm. Can't go wrong with these items at panera.

47.description: As always, a pleasant space inside. Usual selection of reliable, quality sandwiches and soups. Great French onion soup!Fast service and has the feel of somewhere that people hang out on laptops Yelping...oh that's where I am now...

8.description: I love this location because they have the kiosks to make a quick order. You don't have to deal with someone misunderstanding your order or forgetting your drink. The cups are right there and I love that they have the lemonade and iced green tea out so you can get a free refill. Other locations I've been to keep them behind the counter and make you pay for more. This location has always been clean and employees are always good with collecting garbage and bringing orders out quickly.

31.description: Another one of my "hot spots" when I want to be productive on my laptop & get some extra-curricular work done. Oh, and get a tasty sandwich.

34.description: I went with the Mediterranean egg white breakfast sandwich; whites, white cheddar, tomatoes, spinach & pesto.  I was expecting the flavors to be a little more bold, but it was pretty bland...bummer.  My mango ginger mint tea made up for the lack of flavor.  It's sweet, spicy and refreshing all in one.

16.description: Suuuuuuuper loooooooooong hair in my greek salad. I was friggin starving too:(. Yuck!! GET HAIR NETS!!! Disgusting:(. If I weren't so tired, I would have brought it back for a refund. Hair in food is unacceptable Panera! Not paying $10 for a pick 2 just to throw it in the trash smh.

13.description: Tomato soup is great and the staff is really friendly when they deliver the food to your table.

11.description: Horrible employees and service. By far one of the worst panera bread locations Ive gone to.

39.description: Great spot in the loop area to stop for lunch.

37.description: I spend time here all the time the soup, sandwiches and breads are really great. They have a friendly staff and the service is quick and fast...

0.description: I am such a fan of this Panera branch! First I have to mention that the customer service here is like no other! Kudos to Management and the attention paid towards training its staff! When it comes to fast food you have to be prepared for fast - robotic - get in get out - service! Thankfully that is not the case for this Panera! And as busy as this location can get, it's never a mad house, there is always a sense of order! Given the dining experience and the amount of traffic, Lunch / Dinner, many people fail to have the patience and respect for the level of work put into maintaining structure and the overall assurance towards your positive dining experiences. Tables are always cleared and cleaned, staff often offers to take used plates / trash to it's appropriate stations with NO Tips and little to NO Thank You(s)??? Are all Paneras like this... from experience, I don't think so!The staff here is extremely attentive and more importantly beyond welcoming! A good majority of the staff walking around serving the food are pretty young! The respect and time they put into what they are doing, you can't deny it, you see it in the way they interact with the guests! It's a shame most reviewers can't seem to look passed their personal issues that are obviously blown waaay out of proportion! Be respectful!The food is what it is. It's fast Food! I find it funny that people walk in and expect to be treated like royalty... Get a grip! I've seen the staff at this branch go above and beyond expectations of a fast food restaurants, with little to no respect given to them and that takes a lot of work to deal with the countless ruthless customers! Mistakes happen and that's ok, I've only had 2 - 3 occasions where I've gotten something wrong and only 1 disappointed occasion where I learned that soup is served after a certain hour in the morning, not big deal! They have always been nice to take things back and fix it! You really can't complain and it's never ruined my life the way some reviewers describe. My boyfriend's office is conveniently very close to this Panera and we often dine in for lunch and occasionally meet for dinner before he hits the gym after work... It is safe to say that we are somewhat regulars at this Panera. I do admire the fact that the staff is always on point, regardless of the time and or day of your visit. I for one have no idea what it's like working for the food industry; it is very clear to me that the staff works very hard here and I respect that! Thank You and keep it up! I will be back for more!

38.description: This place is pretty awesome considering they have a variety of soup and bread. I can't complain about the service either. Occasionally you will see tables filled with bread crumbs or drink marks when service isn't moving fast enough. This is expected, just bring your own towel to clean...

51.description: My first time at this particular Panera location today. I'm coming back! GREAT service (there was a chick at every register! and there are 5!) and GREAT seating options. My only complaint would be that the A/C... well, I don't feel it. But the wifi is great (as evidenced by this review). P.S. This is wayy better than the other Paneras in Chicago. :)

27.description: This is my local Panera. I'm a regular in the mornings after a work out. Not sure why there are so many negative reviews about the hygiene of the place but everytime I'm here it's always clean. My breakfast is always promptly made and the staff are always cheerful and polite.

32.description: There is not much new to say about Panera.  Everything there is delicious and worth every calorie you consume!  I do like this location a lot! Parking is free for the first 90 minutes with a validated card.  After 90 minutes it is still really cheap to park there too.  Gotta love the south loop! =) I would love to give this Panera 5 stars but I can't.  =(  I have been here multiple times and always had great customer service,  However, my last experience was not so great.  They messed up my order and when I went back to pick up the items that they had failed to put in my bag I didn't even get so much as a "sorry for the inconvenience."   This knocked them down to 4 stars in my book.

54.description: I too used to love Panera until I became borderline vegetarian.  Also, my friend owns a deli and I know what it is like to get a real sandwich priced within reason (and not because he is my friend.)  Panera order #1:  Tuna Salad on wheat $7.99.  Sooo much mayo. Gag! Gag! Dripping and squishing into my bread.  More mayo than tuna.  My deli friend tastes it and says "Oh I've bought this before for the deli.  It's premade in Canada.  Comes in a jug.  I don't use it."  And... he doesn't.  Watched him make his tuna salad from a giant can of tuna, mayo, dill weed, green onion.  Super yum and so not drippy!Panera order #2:  Asiago Beef on wheat $7.99.  Lame.  Sad.  What?  3 pieces of roast beef.  Just 3?!  Yep:-(  Smoked cheddar (1 pc.), lettuce (1 pc.),  tomato (2 pc.), red onions & horseradish sauce.  This was a flat, sad, forlorn looking sandwich.I was a bit embarrassed because I had recommended Panera while we were running errands.  I think we'll get a snack next time and then go back to his deli when we really want to eat a hearty sandwich without breaking my bank at least.Kudos to Panera for excellent customer service and a clean store!

48.description: It's your run o' the mill Panera.  Nothing fancy.  Nothing new.  Nothing outstanding.  It is a little small, always packed, and a little messy because it's always packed.The location is pretty good.  You can park in the structure for 90 minutes without paying (get the ticket validated). *PSA* DO NOT park in the Whole Foods only lot; you WILL get towed *end PSA* There is pay-box street parking too.  There are a number of stores in this little mall-like structure.  Felling crafty? Head to Michael's (just don't use your credit card: beaconnews.suntimes.com/…).  Want some expensive organic and eccentric products? Check out Whole Paycheck, er, Foods.  Need some glasses, rugs, knick-knacks, and other tchotchkes for a not-so good-price since the store used to be called Cost Plus? Go to World Market.  Need a quick change of clothes for a pretty good price and then some shoes to match your new duds? Marshall's and DSW are there for your convenience!So, the location outweighs the actual place, but it can make for a pretty good study spot if you can find the room.

44.description: I'm not much of a fan of chain retaurants, but I needed an open coffee place on a Saturday night to do GRE work and all the locals are closed by 5...Coffee was good, french onion soup was everything I like about french onion soup.I only felt compelled to write this because one of the employees was really nice. I left my keys on the floor after I moved tables and some guy, I think his name was Carrington, returned them!You rock, Carrington!!!

24.description: Over the past few years its been going downhill. I often receive the wrong order or an incomplete order, and because I'm usually in a rush to get to the places I need to be, I never realize until I'm home. The only reason k even save any stars is because they do have some of the nicest staff I've been around. Having said that, I would have to think that these mixups are a failure on the part of the management for providing poor training to their employees. I will still come back because the food is quick and good (when you get what you order) and because its the only panera anywhere close to me.

7.description: The rapid ordering system is great. Place the order and if it's not busy it only is about 10 mins. I can't really give it more stars for the pickups. The place seems clean and the staff is fairy friendly. I like Panera.

49.description: Yelp is asking me to write a review about Panera so here goes. Mmm...bread bowl soup. Umm...it's a Panera, it's good, no complaints. Busy at times, but it's to be expected. Mmm...bread bowl soup. The pastries/desserts are good too. Did I mention the bread bowl soup?

40.description: What a cute location! Again, I work in luxurious Cicero, IL so we are always trying to find ways to escape and find alternative eats that are healthier than fattening Mexican fare (not that I'm judging -it's delicious -but you can only eat it so much before you pop a button on your work pants!)This location is located in an adorable little mall type building. Lots of glass windows to let the natural light in. Line moved fast. -And only a quick commute down the 290 east for us. Plenty of cheap (metered) street parking right there on Canal.It was our little escape from work. Nice to be in a different scene and, as always with Panera, good food!

53.description: love. this. place. i come here study sometimes and i always manage to get a lot of work done. service is great. food is great. it can get a bit crowded but you always manage to find somewhere to sit. the spinach and bacon egg souffle and a chai tea latte was a great way to start my morning. the pick 2 option with a soup and half sandwich is also yummy too...my fav is the french onion soup with half chicken bacon dijon panini. =)

30.description: This place is awful. Out of the 10 or 15 times I've been here, I've never seen it clean. This place is filthy and stays busy, which is fine, but that means there should be staff cleaning off the table sweeping the floors. Especially since they are so expensive and the food is not that tasty. FYI, a meal for two people including two drinks was $30. I could have gone to White Palace or the Bongo Room for those prices. Lower your prices or clean up. And the internet is always super slow too. Go to Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts or Whole Foods as these are better options (and cheaper too!).

46.description: I had a great experience here! I came after a weekend morning workout, so I asked the cashier to help me order a healthy half-salad, half-soup combo. She was very friendly and helped me pick out the Strawberry Poppyseed Salad and Black Bean Soup, and they were both super yummy! Even though it was busy, my food was ready in less than 5 minutes. Plus they validate for an hour and a half for the parking garage. Love this location!

1.description: Customer service is key and when you don't get it why waist your time especially when there are other places around that can give you at min the same thing with better service. skipping to the point. I called in an order on line and started with, "I would like a you pick two with a tortellini Alfredo Pasta and a turkey Bravo."  I get to the location and the person helping me was not as friendly as I would have expected, i chucked it up to a rough morning which everyone has, I read my receipt and notice I was charged for a full pasta and a 1/2 sandwich....I asked and the cashier said we only have one size, the manager who was next to her said well that is a pick one we only have one size so when you say you want a you pick to that's how we take it. We can refund you and fix this (plus or minus some.) Manager should have said I apologies for the misunderstanding we should have never assumed what you wanted. I am going to solve your problem or remedy your inconvenience by..... why she felt the need to push the blame on me I don't know especially being that there is nothing that says that on the PDF menu that I read while placing my orders. Next time I am going to go to other places in the area that are so much friendlier and attentive.Now the food is normal Panera Bread tasting. I just wish that they would have spread the sauce on my bacon turkey bravo across the whole piece of bread instead of putting a small amount of sauce in the middle of the sandwich. I guess I wouldn't have been so unhappy if they would have given me enough to spread myself but hey that is life. I see why I haven't came here in over a year!!

55.description: I used to love Panera. I had some great times when i lived with my mom back in HS in the burbs where they provided good service, cozy and warm, and my mom n i would hang out n talk over a "You pick two" soup and half sandwich....but the panera's in the city r just too busy, service is too slow...sandwiches are smaller, most seats would be taken by students that sit alone in a 4 top booth for long hours. but that's not Panera's fault. Their staff is usually friendly, but i'd get half of my food first then another half for the other person way later n by the time we'd wanna eat together my soup's kinda cold.Sorry panera..although i'll give them 2 stars for their french onion soup. its not so bad.

9.description: i ordered 3 fontega chicken sandwiches for pick up over the phone and needed some sweet treats as well. My disappointment knew no bounds when i saw a fly circling around the treats. Can''t they cover up? keep the place clean?? we are paying good money for some quality food not to see this! I complained to the store manager Laurel and she said sorry but didnt make an attempt to go and check or make amends.  Really???

26.description: Service was pretty lame and they got my order wrong. Once corrected I walked away with a chicken caesar salad which was good but had more of those crisp lettuce ends than I prefer. (I like more leaf) The croutons were a little stale but the chicken was good enough. I ended up putting the salad in my bread that came as a side and dipping that in the dressing (which was really good). My own concoction was satisfying and made me interested in trying one of their sandwiches now. I give 2 stars based on service and pricing. My salad was $8...cheap but not cheap enough for what I ate. I'll try the $6.99 1/2 and 1/2 meal next time and will update my rating if I'm pleasantly surprised.

25.description: Came in for a quick lunch on Tuesday and the line was out the door. Took about 10 minutes to get to the register. Service was friendly and I received my order in about 5 minutes. However, the cashier never asked me what I wanted as a side to the salad I ordered. It seemed like he was too rushed and I ended up getting the side I did not order. Major bummer.

12.description: Love the turkey club sandwich with an apple. French onion soup and a cookie! Delish !

59.description: I certainly come here more for the free WiFi than for the food.  The food is fine - overpriced for what it is, but I do really enjoy their tuna salad sandwich.  Soups are hit or miss.I have to issues with this Panera, though.  First: there are not enough outlets!!!  Second: if you're there during lunch hours (I think 12-2, but maybe more), WIFI is limited to 30 minutes.  Which isn't so terrible in itself, I understand they want to move tables, but more that sometimes the place is empty and you still can't get back online.  That is annoying.
