21.description: On the way to the airport, we stopped in to grab some coffee and breakfast sandwiches.  There was a huge long line of people, and someone cut in front of everyone and the cashier still served them and didn't ask them to wait in line.  It was extremely frustrating to many other customers.  They ran out of egg just as I got to the counter to wait for my food, and so my order took extra, extra long.  So much for being in a hurry!  I've been to many Paneras over the years, and this one was really lacking in the customer service department.

17.description: On the way to the airport, we stopped in to grab some coffee and breakfast sandwiches.  There was a huge long line of people, and someone cut in front of everyone and the cashier still served them and didn't ask them to wait in line.  It was extremely frustrating to many other customers.  They ran out of egg just as I got to the counter to wait for my food, and so my order took extra, extra long.  So much for being in a hurry!  I've been to many Paneras over the years, and this one was really lacking in the customer service department.

10.description: AMAZING PIZZA!!!!!!!!!  Friendly Staff, great bread and pastries. Can't get enough!

5.description: Great location, staff is friendly and helpful and always has my rapid order packed and ready

3.description: This is a pretty standard Panera. It has all the usual suspects - soup, salad, sandwiches, and baked goods. The staff here has never been particularly impressive, but they get the job done. Sometimes I feel like they're just going through the motions. For example, on a couple of occasions my sandwiches and salads looked like they were kind of recklessly put together. Other times, everything is up to par. But regardless everything always tastes like standard Panera fare, which is yummy. This particular Panera has a decent amount of seating, so you can eat in relatively easily. Parking at this location is kind of annoying during peak hours.  There is street parking out front, but this area is normally packed. If there's no street parking you can park in the garage and get your parking validated. If you're in a hurry, try ordering on the Panera app or the in-store kiosks.

35.description: Had their sausage and egg sandwich for breakfast. It was probably one of the WORST breakfast sandwiches I've ever eaten! It was WAY too salty and peppery that some parts of the sandwich were completely inedible! What a waste of $4, an egg McMuffin from McDonalds would have tasted 100 times better at a lesser price.The only good thing about this particular Panera Bread is the plentiful seating and convenient south loop location.

19.description: This Panera is the best ! I loved everything and everyone was extremely nice  I would recommend anything on the menu.

28.description: My wallet was stolen right out of my purse while I dined here this afternoon. I strongly suspect the teenagers that management was allowing to solicit the paying customers. They took my wallet and immediately went to DSW.I will never go here again.

45.description: Love the food, the breads, and the pastries. Have never ordered anything I didn't like and I'm a foodie (very picky).

33.description: Fantastic and quick service, exactly what you want when you are hungry.  I walked in on a Monday evening and placed my order right away.  The associate that was ringing up my order, Aubrey, was very helpful when she gave me a tip to order the bigger soup size because it's only a dollar difference.  She was even kind enough to get both the cup sizes so I could compare and make my choice!  I am a huge fan of Panera Bread, even though I get the same thing every time because I'm obsessed with it (Tomato and Mozzarella Panini).  I will definitely go back when I get another craving.  Even though I live down the street so driving isn't my main mode of transportation to get here, if you purchase something from Panera, or any of the stores in this little mall, make sure you get your parking ticket validated!

43.description: This is one of my favorite lunch spots to visit with my son.The restaurant is clean, employees are happy and food is good. The only downside is that many students come and buy a coffee or a small item and sit to use the free wifi for hours, holding up a table that could otherwise be used by others. However, I do understand how student life is, so I really try to be patient with that aspect.During the 11am-1pm timeframe, this restaurant can be crowded on week days, so plan accordingly.Maybe it was just my son's kids meal, but it was pretty meager. (hence the missing star) I wanted to get him mac and cheese but they said it would be a 20+ minute wait and he was hungry, so I got him the pbj. It was a small sandwich, which is ok because its for a child. But there was only a tube of yogurt and small sandwich on this large plate. No drink, no little garnish or napkin or anything. Next time, i'll be ordering him a soup. I can make a small pbj at home, it was silly of me to order one in a restaurant when he's not a picky kid.That being said, I still love panera and i'm happy to have one in the south loop!

2.description: I'm so irritated with this Panera. They are close to my home but are religiously out of things. I stopped by at 4:30 pm and per usual, they had no dinner rolls. I wish they would get better at preparing enough food and "bread" to last the day.

18.description: Met here a few times with a study group. We push a few tables together in a corner and  work away. Tonight the manger came over and asked if he could do anything to accommodate us, but we were just fine. Later, he brought over a huge pastry with plates, forks and napkins. So sweet! The food is always quick and accurate, not to mention tasty. Service is quick, and above and beyond what I've ever received at a corporate establishment. Great job Panera!

41.description: Their sandwiches tasted OK, but didn't justify the high prices. Portions were generally insufficient. What's more, Panera isn't as healthy as it seems. So I'll give it a pass next time.

52.description: I normally LOVE Panera, however, when this store opened up I went and got a take out salad and when I got home I found a HAIR in the salad.  I emailed the corporate office complaining and got NO response.  I guess they must be so busy they can afford to lose customers.I have gotten feedback from some other people about this location saying that it's dirty.Yuk.

50.description: This used to be one of my favorite staples until I found other bread/sandwich places that serve better food for cheaper.

4.description: Worst Panera Bread ever! My food had hair in it, and they kept messing up my order. The customer service was very disorganized and uncoordinated. Food was below par as well, not like the other Panera Bread locations.

6.description: Good place, clean and fast.Love the quick-order kiosk, can't imagine why anyone would stand in line to order.Free wifi and they validate your parking on the way out.

22.description: Go at your own risk!!! My wallet was stolen right out of my purse while having lunch there yesterday afternoon. Apparently this  happens often there!! Management was not very helpful. They should at least post a sign as a warning.

15.description: I come here for lunch once in a while for years now, so I decided its finally time to write a review. The location is in a busy South Loop plaza where it can be a hassle to park in the lot and then get your ticket validated for free parking. You can always park outside in the street where there are tons of spots, but you will have to pay meter. Anyway, the food here is pretty decent and this is always a good spot to come for lunch if you are in the area. The Chipotle Chicken is really good and it is probably my favorite thing to get here. I always get this with the cream of broccoli soup on the side, which is delicious. Another plus is they have soup in a bread bowl.Southwest Flatbread is the latest thing I have tried and worth commenting about. It is good and I tried this with a side of BBQ Chicken Salad, which is really good too. I normally don't eat salad or crave salad, but I must say this one is worth eating.The only thing bad I have to say about this place is that the tables are always dirty and the utensils are always dirty, so I would have to ask for plastic fork or spoon.

57.description: I come to this particular location on Sunday afternoons.  Anytime between 1030 and 1200 is fairly crowded, so I make my way there between 2 - 5pm.  I think people give Panera a hard time because they don't realize the particular niche that it serves.  It's NOT a coffee shop.  It's NOT really a sit-down restaurant.  It's a bastardization of the two, the "Target" of the eating world.  The wifi at this location is consistent, and I do agree with people that the outlets are scarce and sort of ill-placed.  However, since I am rarely there for more than 1.5 hours (free validated parking time), I don't have an issue.  The food could be better, sure.  I've found that the most consistent thing on their menu is the grilled cheese sandwich on country miche.  The soups are ok - I get the French onion if I do happen to order soup, and it's usually on the overly salted side, so I get it in the bread bowl.  They changed their trays/baskets a few months ago for dine-in customers.  All entrees now come on these green-ish large plates that stack up well on one another.  It's nice in the fact that it eliminated the need for a sheet of parchment paper.  Less waste isn't bad, you know?They did raise prices in the last calendar year, though most restaurants have done so as well.  This location is convenient and you can do your shopping at whole foods, work out, get some glasses, go to world market, and even get shoes from DSW all in the same trip.  If you know not expect 5 star service or 5 star food, then you won't be disappointed.

20.description: Had the chicken noodle soup and it was disgustingly frozen soup. Hot a ham and gouda sandwich that was not toasted and everything is bread. Dislike this place...

36.description: I am usually a fan of this panera bread.  However, I visited on Saturday afternoon and it was very disappointing.  After we got our food we could not find a clean table in the place!  Yes, there were plenty of empty tables but they were all dirty!!!  We stood for awhile to see if someone would come and clean a table and eventually cleaned our own table.  Most of the condiments were not filled.  We had to ask for butter and then wait 10 minutes for it.  Very disappointing.

14.description: $7.00 for a cold turkey sandwich sitting in pickle juice where the turkey is slimy, the lettuce is wilted and the bread is beginning to get hard. This place really is horribly managed.  Avoid this place if you can.

3.description: I think this is a great place to look for some books that may be to your usefulness but you don't wanna pay the full price.  Due to the nature of the used book store, they may not have what you want.  For example, I went there trying to find some cooking recipe books, and ended up buying a couple from William and Sonoma and Food Network.  So if you don't have a specific target but want to explore for your liking, this place is perfect.  We ended up buying a paperback novel, a little picture book and two 150-page sized cook books with hard covers.  Paid about 20 bucks.  Not a bad deal I should say.

1.description: They have multiple posting of their store hours. I sold my books back to them two weeks ago and have attempted to visit their store 3 times to pick up my money and they are never open. Wishing I would have choose another establishment to sell my books back to at this point.

2.description: These guys have a corner next to the Italian Ice mecca, and the savvy owners put up a sign that says: "browse our store while you enjoy your Italian Ice" or something to that effect.  So we did!   I have been by this place a few times but it confused me with the term "market fresh" in the title, you don't process that it is a bookstore right away.  But as far as used bookstores go, the items are quality: none of that dusty, stockpiled, greasy, war-torn book business here.   Items are good quality: I picked up 2 that were published in the 1950s-60s and although used the pages were crisp and pristine, an unusual thing!

5.description: Good place to browse and they have a good selection of books BUT, THEY ARE NEVER OPEN WHEN THEY SAY THEY WILL BE.  Walked there this am. Sign on door says open today at 10. 11 o'clock and the place is dark. Happens all the time. Call first if u go.

0.description: Wow. I need to not allow myself to just "check out" this store when I'm in the area. I end up with around thirteen books that way.But when the total comes out to $33 for thirteen books, I don't mind it so much.Wonderfully cheap used books here - many of the books are only $1. They charge you by weight, and it's so easy to come out with way more than you intended. The guy working there was super helpful and knowledgeable. I love when the people working at bookstores also seem to be big bookworms! The selection is pretty good, although I wish they had more in terms of non-fiction and foreign language. It's a good alternative to Powell's if you want something a little more small and used bookstore-y with cheaper items.

4.description: this place is bae I just wanna make love with all these books too bad we invented television lmao jk I love used books I read 70 pages in and get tired ROFL LMAO ayyy ramadan mubarak

58.description: I visited this place with a couple of co-workers.  I travel a lot and love the local mom and pops.  Their cashew chicken was delicious.  My favorite part of ordering was being asked if I wanted mild, med, or spicy.  The med is spicy compared to most.  We all ordered different menu items and everyone agreed their dish was very good.  The prices are very reasonable.  Don't expect white table cloths or fancy decor, just a neighborly proprietor who waves a passers by during lulls.

56.description: Im a great fan of Thai food and I judge a Thai restaurant by its Panang Curry. I have eaten this curry in every Thai restaurant on Taylor and this place has the best Panang curry I have ever had. I love their Indian curry fried rice and of course, their Thai Iced Tea is really good. Its not as coconut-ty and low on calories as well! Yes, you read it right. I was of the impression that Thai iced tea has coconut milk and condensed milk which makes it high on calories. But the person who was serving us told me that they use soy milk instead which gives is a lighter texture and its really yummy, without being too sweet.Great food, inexpensive prices and good services makes this my favorite Thai restaurant..

29.description: Mind blowing Chicken Red Curry (Spicy), Indian Curry Fried Rice and Crab Rangoon.. Would recommend it anyDAY.. But a bit to expensive for students.

42.description: No, don't go to Thai Bowl (too Americanized for the sake of UIC students). Go to Golden Thai if you are to eat some thai food on Taylor.

23.description: My first visit and can't wait for the next! Super friendly service and delicious food, thanks Golden Thai.

47.description: how does Golden Thai stay in business when Yummy Thai is like two blocks away?Been to Golden Thai twice. First, got some really greasy pad-kee-mao for dinner. The food was okay, not great. The second time I looked at their menu online and ordered Tom Yum Noodles with no bean sprouts for take out. Got there 15 mins later... and got Tom Yum Noodles with bean sprouts. Minor misunderstand, that's fine. They removed the bean sprouts and then rang up the bill.. which came out to be about $9. When I told them that their online menu lists the tom yum noodles for $6.95 (which is what Yummy Thai current charges), he said that that website is ancient and the price has been raised to $8.25. hell, how was i supposed to know. got home, and my tom yum noodles was worse than yummy thai. that extra dollar something did add anything to the price.. which brought up the question: how does golden thai stay in business?Yummy Thai...is cheaper (and also doesn't have a $10 credit card minimum)has better service from what I've experiencedhas a much more pleasing dining areahas comparable/better foodis only two blocks awayNeedless again, I won't make the same mistake again.

8.description: Solid tasty thai food! My go-to place when I want something spicy. Prices are good, but service could be better. They definitely aren't very friendly, but that's weirdly part of its charm.

31.description: Very good the first time i sat there to eat my lunch. the tom yum soup was savory and tofu pad thai was exquisite. but then i orderd take-out one night and it was quite bad. the soup was diluted with few ingredients and the noodles were tasteless. when they're good, though, it's amazing. plan to stop by later on...

34.description: Tried this place for the first time a couple of weeks ago. I got the garlic chicken noodles and it was really good. Went back today and got the same thing and it was soooo sweet. Plus the cashier screwed up my order and I didn't realize it until I got to my car. I ordered chicken noodles again and got a container full of just meat. I only took the container back in (not because I wanted to keep the rice but I was just being lazy and didn't feel like repackaging everything lol) the cashier said she would fix it and told me to go get the rice and bring it back and I'm pretty sure she didn't throw it away. Pretty unsanitary.

16.description: I went to this restaurant last week with my family. One of my family members is a regular here, and they recommended the place.The restaurant looks like a hole in the wall place, and there is just a little bit of room for people to sit. The decor needs some updating because I even noticed an outdated air conditioning device from the 1950s or something.We were seated quickly and we gave our order. The waitress was very polite, friendly and quick with our food.We ordered crab rangoon, spring rolls, miso soup spring dumplings, pepper beef, pad bamee, spicy shrimp, and tofu fried rice.The crab rangoon was delicious! It came with a sweet and sour dipping sauce. We did not want crab in the rangoon, so we asked them to exchange the crab with imitation crab. They were nice enough to fulfill our request. We also liked the shrimp dumpling and the soy dipping sauce.The spring rolls were just okay. They were cold wrapped, and full of half cooked chopped vegetables.The miso soup was delicious, and one order came in a large bowl. So a few of us shared the soup.All four of rated our food as okay. The food is good, but you wouldn't go out of your way to come to this restaurant for the food. If you are in the area and your are craving thai food, that you should come here. However, if you have a favorite thai place you should just go there rather than come here.

13.description: Golden Thai is very good.  I have ordered their various curry options, among other items, and have not been disappointed.  Generous portions at an affordable price.  I don't eat out a lot, but I go back to Golden Thai time and time again.

11.description: I love Asian food a whole lot. From delicious Pakistani biryani, to savory Chinese noodles, you'll find me drooling outside of an Asian restaurant always. I ordered the chili paste fried rice with shrimp and a side of crab rangoons as take-out, even though I was about 12 minutes walking distance away (it was finals week, okay! Don't judge me.) About 20 minutes after making my order, I started to regret not walking and ordering (I could've burned off some calories before inhaling those delicious carbs), because the delivery time was 45 minutes. Even though I was a 4 minute drive away. Four minutes. Four. 45 minutes. 45. After getting my food, I ran to the nearest table and ate the food so quickly because I was so hungry. The food was warm and tasted so fresh. The flavors were like little ballerinas dancing on my tongue. I loved it! I finished the chili paste fried rice and was completely satisfied. The crab rangoons...don't get me started. I died. And then reincarnated. THEY WERE SO GOOD. And the dipping sauce was unreal as well. Overall, the food was amazing, and I will be DEFINITELY going here again. I'll probably order two orders of crab rangoons next time because guess what? I LOVE LIVING LIFE. All in all, go to Golden Thai, but don't order take-out, unless you're super patient.

39.description: I love it! So good. I have done both delivery and had great experiences with each. They were super accommodating with a couple of substitutions that we asked for. I highly recommend the first: adding BBQ pork to the Golden Thai fried rice. The meat is delicious and so is the rice. Also the basil fried rice is great, though I think the only difference is pineapples. So good. We got the Pad See Yew both with plain noodles, and with the crispy noodles. It's hard to say which I like better. The plain wide noodles here are thin and soft and delicious. The crispy ones are fried. Mmmm. They also use regular broccoli, vs Chinese. This works for me. Green curry was amazing, cashew chicken was out of control good - and something I don't normally get. Bonus points for having variety on the menu, while still nailing the fan favorites. Egg rolls and potstickers also tasty. Oh, and the Tom Khar soup! I really love this place, can't wait to order from here again!!

37.description: In a cluster of thai places, all very good, Golden Thai stands out for two things : taste and price. The owners recognized my accent and asked me if I wanted to get my food "spicy". It didn't burn my tongue off in an acid like feel (which most places in this country consider "spicy". Spice is flavor, bold and subtle and varied all together. Not acid burn hot) Thai iced coffee is excellent. Recommend the seafood as it is fresh and infused with the fresh spices. Also Indian Curry rice. The staff is excellent, friendly, courteous and quick.

0.description: Again to those who are more picky than I, to establishments that don't overcharge I usually award 5 stars unless something out of the ordinary happens, or something tastes especially bad. Golden Thai has a large menu and the food is usually outstanding. The highly recommend the Green curry. You get a choice of meet but I usually get beef (it was the server's recommendation). Thai Currys are complicated because they are supposed to balance sweetness, saltiness, spiciness and acidity. I thought it was done perfectly. Food is served quick, portions are massive and flavors are outstanding. I highly recommend this place.

38.description: My favorite Thai place. Food made fresh when you order. Produce ingredients and garnishes are always fresh and crunchy. When you order Pad Thai, I am happy to report that you are asked whether you'd like it mild, medium or spicy! Pad Thai is great, basil chicken is flavorful, and the egg drop soup is light and refreshing. Overall a great lunch and dinner place.

51.description: nice portions for the prize. food not overly sauced or seasoned, but at the same time it didn't lack flavor. service was ok. we had the crab rangoon, the shrimp fried rice and the thin rice noodles with beef. it was clean, the chairs can be a little more comfortable. and i assume this place has more pick-up business than dine in since during our visit we were the only table but lots of people came in and picked up food

27.description: I go here for lunch every Tuesday and every time the food has been a 5/5. I'd highly recommend the meat noodle soup (all are good) the basil chicken and the ginger chicken. Service is quick, food is more than affordable for the quality and quantity.

32.description: Amazing Pad Thai. Great flavor and I love that it's a hole in the wall. Enough said! The Thai iced tea is spot on as well. Great spicy foods such ad the curries and soups but you can get them spicy to order. Food is usually quick but fresh. My husband loves the rice rolls which comes with a sweet chili sauce. Prices are reasonable and then owner is very sweet.

54.description: One of my favorite lunch spots and the best thai on Taylor st. The pad ped catfish is a highlight.  The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that the food and service are sometimes inconsistent.

48.description: Tasty noodles with fresh vegetables for a low price. Nice people working there. You will have to convince them that you really do want it spicy if you want it spicy, though.

44.description: Best crab rangoon that I've ever had, but everything on the menu is amazing.  Good service, good prices and great Thai food!

24.description: I love Golden Thai. I am picky about Thai restaurants. The beef paradise is out of this world and so was the curry fish cake. This is my go to Thai place when Im at work. And they deliver freaky fast!!

7.description: I ordered pickup for a large tom yum soup with beef. The order was ready for me within 15 mins. At first I was disappointed to see that it was in a smaller than usual container for a large soup order but when I start consuming it, I noticed that there was a generous amount of beef. Plus they included additional hot sauce on the side. This is not the best tom yum I tasted. Kind of a bit too salty for me but it was good enough to satisfy my craving for it.

49.description: I really love Thai food. I was very impressed with the Thai food that I got from this restaurant. I'm very happy that they tailor to my dietary restrictions. The service was excellent and the food was very fast. I will definitely recommend this restaurant to all my friends.

40.description: First visit to Golden Thai tonight.  Overall I was very pleased with the food and service.  We were out doing some shopping and heading home so we decided to try something new in the neighborhood we've never been to.  Once I turned on to Taylor I took the very first parking spot I saw.  Let's be honest Saturday night can get pretty crazy on Taylor.  We jumped out of the car and walked into the first place we saw.  There was only one other diner so that may have had something to do with the quick personalized service we received.  None the less our service was prompt and attentive.  We tried the chicken satay for an appetizer.  The chicken was served hot and was very well seasoned.  The peanut sauce it came with really set it off.  For our meals we had Singapore noodles which contained shrimp, pork, bean sprouts, and very then noodles.  The dish was also served very hot and was flavorful.  The portion was very large and filling.  We also tried the yellow curry.  The dish again was served very hot and was bursting with flavor.  The only thing to critique would be the thickness of the sauce was on the thin side so it wasn't the heartiest version of this dish I've tried.  The meal was $25 or a lot of food for a good price.  I would most likely try this place again and suggest it to friends looking for Thai.

53.description: So, they messed up our order. We received pad see ewe instead of cashew chicken. Too bad we got our food to go and we're already home with it.Luckily, the food we did get was good! As was the the pad kee maw with chicken. Also, we asked for it spicy and it actually came spicy (which shouldn't surprise me, but is often not the case). The pad Thai was mediocre, not bad but I've had much better. The chicken fried rice was also ok. It tasted like chicken fried rice anywhere, which is fine, just not special. The service was nice and the food was quick. We will be back to try it again as it was close and some of order was great. We will try a few other things before giving up. As long as they give us the right order next time, we will be happy.

30.description: A friend wanted to go to Thai Bowl but we decided to check out Golden Thai to change things up.  We had the red curry with beef and chicken pad thai.  The curry was very flavorful (requested spicy) but there was not enough beef in it to justify the $9 price tag.  Same with the pad thai - great flavor but not enough protein in it either.  I think the freshness and quality is a step above Thai Bowl (as is the atmosphere), just not a very good value considering all the competition on Taylor.

46.description: This is our go-to place for Thai food. Best pad see ew I have ever had. Good pad thai. Excellent singapore noodles. Golden Thai rolls, yum. Rob is fun and knows us so we chat whenever we dine in. Have been eating here for over 15 years, since back when it was Siam Pot. Still solid, good, fresh food. About to order again right now...

1.description: There's plenty of options for thai food on taylor st, and I think Golden Thai's been my go to just cause it's a bit closer to the medical district than yummy thai and thai bowl, and luckily the food here is quite good and a solid spot for take out.I've had their Golden Thai Fried Rice which comes packed with basil and pineapple, making a flavorful dish.Their fried Tofu Panang Curry is nice, peanutty and has a pretty good amount of tofu in it. Only knock against the place is that their pad see ewe was overly sweet and the noodles a little too soft for my liking.In the end, Golden Thai knows how to cater to its customers with heavy flavors and decent portion sizes. A huge plus is that nothing is too expensive considering most of the people that dine here are probably students. Reasonable prices + tasty food is a win.

55.description: Ok so I am from NYC and I loooove lovve love  Thai food.. This is by far the best Basil fried rice that I have ever eaten.. It was the beef basil fried rice...  I will be eating here any time I have to eat thai....

9.description: yesterday would of been my second time here.. I forgot my first experience here since it was a long time ago.. just remember it was decent hahaanyways.. I ordered the indian curry fried rice with beef, pad see ewe with chicken.. and baby egg rolls..Baby Egg Roll has Shrimp and chicken, glass noodles wrapped with egg roll skin served with sweet & sour sauce... it comes with 6 of them in a order.. I thought it was just ehh.. they aint lying when they said baby egg rolls haha.. its really small... but i didn't really like it... tasted bland and tasted like frozen egg rolls from the store even tho it is probably not..Indian Curry Fried Rice has stir-fried with jasmine rice, onions, tomatoes, Egg and Indian curry powder with your choice of meat in which I picked beef..  I love curry and I love fried rice and when you combine them... it is full of awesomeness! it was good.. it wasn't overwhelmed with curry flavor.. just enough to taste it..Pad See Ewe has wide rice noodles, choice of meat which I chose chicken, broccoli, and egg.. stir fried with their sweet soy sauce...it was good.. not too oily.. everything was just cooked right..I must say.. they do skimp out on the meat a little.. other then that.. I think it's a pretty good place to get thai food..

26.description: Pad thai taste is very inconsistent. I order this dish 2-3 times a month as i live in a close by apartment. I should say you will get a 50% chance of getting a great pad thai when noodles are perfectly cooked with their delicious sauce. If youre unlucky, you will get a reheated pad thai with dry noodles without much sauce, or just simply without taste. I dont know how they do quality control but it seems like they have a different chef every single time. Good luck for getting a good pad thai.

25.description: I went to this restaurant last week with my family. One of my family members is a regular here, and they recommended the place.The restaurant looks like a hole in the wall place, and there is just a little bit of room for people to sit. The decor needs some updating because I even noticed an outdated air conditioning device from the 1950s or something.We were seated quickly and we gave our order. The waitress was very polite, friendly and quick with our food.We ordered crab rangoon, spring rolls, miso soup spring dumplings, pepper beef, pad bamee, spicy shrimp, and tofu fried rice.The crab rangoon was delicious! It came with a sweet and sour dipping sauce. We did not want crab in the rangoon, so we asked them to exchange the crab with imitation crab. They were nice enough to fulfill our request. We also liked the shrimp dumpling and the soy dipping sauce.The spring rolls were just okay. They were cold wrapped, and full of half cooked chopped vegetables.The miso soup was delicious, and one order came in a large bowl. So a few of us shared the soup.All four of rated our food as okay. The food is good, but you wouldn't go out of your way to come to this restaurant for the food. If you are in the area and your are craving thai food, that you should come here. However, if you have a favorite thai place you should just go there rather than come here.

12.description: I had the Thai noodles. They're very delicious. This place is going to be my new go to Thai restaurant.

59.description: This place is a never fail place. I love their Singapore noodles and pad Thai. The food comes pretty fast and decently priced. It's a small place, almost hidden in Taylor St but once you find it, you will feel like going back again and again!

21.description: I went to Golden Thai with a friend for lunch early on Friday, they seated us quickly and got the food out pretty fast. The food is very good, I loved their Red Curry and Thai Iced Tea. I am giving an OK review because just the food was good, our server was rude. Also this place charges a random 18% service charge, even if you are a party of two. After this, they still expect a tip, which I wouldn't mind giving if they did not force customers to pay service charge for smaller parties.

17.description: Listen....you are my new favorite thai food place.  Your food is outrageously good and incredibly affordable.  This review is coming from someone who has been to Thailand many several times. Bangkok,  phuket, chiang mai and pataya beach.  Love Thailand and thai food.  Your taste is authentic, your presentation on point, portion sizes are much appreciated.  I am super stingy with my 5 star reviews. You earned every star.  Gone are the days of me trekking up north or being on an unending search for great thai food.  You are my new happy place and i love you.  Now...carry on or more fittingly, sawatdee!

10.description: I had been to this restaurant couples times, they offer decent Thai food. However, the reason that I gave them ONE star because they charged TIPS on a Compulsory base. It happened every time when I went there. There is a 15% compulsory tips charge on my bill. I just thought tips pay base on customer service and I don't see restaurant can make it a fixed charge to their customers. Since it happen many times to me and there is so many Thai restaurants around this area, I guess I will never come back again.

5.description: We had come here on a wednesday night for dinner. This place is a small and can probably fit about 20 people inside. The service was good. We had got crab rangoons which were good - yummy. I got pad thai with chicken (medium) and my friend got drunken noodles (mild) which chicken, both were good. I liked my pad thai better - it had bearable amount of spice :D.

3.description: My pad see ew and my husband's garlic chicken were both delicious. It was our first visit but won't be our last! The food is delicuous, waitress friendly and attentive despite being busy, and the prices are reasonable.

35.description: Amazing food. Big portions. Really cozy place. Perfect for a weekday lunch or dinner. Service takes a long time though.

19.description: I love it! So good. I have done both delivery and had great experiences with each. They were super accommodating with a couple of substitutions that we asked for. I highly recommend the first: adding BBQ pork to the Golden Thai fried rice. The meat is delicious and so is the rice. Also the basil fried rice is great, though I think the only difference is pineapples. So good. We got the Pad See Yew both with plain noodles, and with the crispy noodles. It's hard to say which I like better. The plain wide noodles here are thin and soft and delicious. The crispy ones are fried. Mmmm. They also use regular broccoli, vs Chinese. This works for me. Green curry was amazing, cashew chicken was out of control good - and something I don't normally get. Bonus points for having variety on the menu, while still nailing the fan favorites. Egg rolls and potstickers also tasty. Oh, and the Tom Khar soup! I really love this place, can't wait to order from here again!!

28.description: Pros:+Good Location for the Little Italy strip+Good Food+FastCons:-This place is always freezing/boiling-They could add a second door to keep the elements out-Bathroom is literally a tiny closet-Smaller than usual portionsThis place has excellent food and rarely disappoints as I've eaten here with friends multiple times, it's the experience that ruins it. Every time someone enters or exists, the door which leaks, allows for a gust of air to come in. When I ate here in the summer it was raining and the scent coming in from outside was not so good, in the winter I had to keep my winter gear on as I ate. What's the deal with the rice??? The portion size is TINY and they offer no refills or additional rice,  literally the rice is 1/6th the size of the curry bowl. Please management if you're reading this, stop leaving the galangal(relative to ginger) in the soup, it's impossible to not have pieces in your mouth because you chop it so small.  Also if you inform them the curry is too spicy, although you ordered a mild, you'll have your curry diluted by adding additional chicken broth killing the flavor. I recommend the Tom Yum Soup(get the large size it's the equivalent of 6 or so of the regular size), Pad Thai and Red Curry(probably the best I've had in Chicago)

45.description: A good place to go if you want some Thailand food.  The location is great and parking is not that difficult to find. The fried rice was very great. with Shrimp and chicken was my favorite. Dong Yum Soup is a must order for me.  It is a little bit sweet, though. I guess it is a little bit Americanized Thailand food. The service is always great.  I usually go there when I am not in the mood to cook and it never disappointed me.

33.description: Good tasty food!! I love the Indian curry fried rice here. The best thing i like about this place is the hospitality.

43.description: My husband and I were craving curry so we got take-out from Golden Thai this weekend. The food was excellent overall - the flavors were great, the prices were fair and the service was friendly. However, the food has FAR too much sodium. They could cut it by half and it would be equivalent to other restaurant food. If they cut back on the sodium (green curry, red curry, and especially the Tom Kar Soup), I would be a frequent customer.

2.description: I wanted a quick carry out option on my way home from work and decided to try out Golden Thai based on the reviews. I called and ordered drunken noodles with chicken (spicy) and massaman curry w/ beef. They told me the order would be ready in 15 minutes for my pick up. I arrived probably a little less than 15 minutes later, but my order was ready. They had prompt service and I was on my way home w/ my Thai delicacies in no time. The drunken noodles were delicious. Even though we asked for spicy, they definitely were not that hot. If you like your food very spicy I would ask for extra, extra spice. The sauce was flavorful and there were lots of fresh veggies cooked with the chicken. The massaman was also very tasty. The sauce was thinner than what I typically think of for massaman curry, but I didn't mind because the flavor was so spot-on. The beef wasn't great quality, but when you're paying $8.75 for a dish, what can you expect? Price was very reasonable- for both dishes it was ~$20. They served decent portions- with two of us sharing we had plenty of leftovers. Overall, when I'm craving Thai food I would order from Golden Thai again. Worth checking out if you're in the area!

18.description: This is one of the best places to order thai food from. I frequent this place for catering for business meetings and their food is amazing! The customer service is also fantastic! For the cost the amount of food you get is crazy, I would think they would charge a lot more, especially for catering.We will definitely continue to order from here for future purchases.

41.description: This is my second visit and love their shrimp tempura. Their green curry is nice too. Casual place with nice good. The staff are friendly and nice.

52.description: Quick, easy, cheap, and consistent.  I will be coming back here more!

50.description: The good news is that everything is under $10 but the paradox is there is a $10 minimum on the card which is inconvenient unless you are really hungry, high, or on a date (in which case your date doesn't need to know how cheap this place is).The food is okay but the service was fine, probably one of the best I've experienced in an Asian restaurant but something that would be considered just okay in the customer based economy we live in.I enjoyed the pad thai and it looks like their curries would be nice. They are also generous with giving out fortune cookies if you are into that...

4.description: I wish that Yelp had a 3.5 star option. I got take out on a Thursday afternoon. I got beef pad thai and chicken yellow curry. The staff were really nice and the service was pretty fast. The pad thai was tasty but the noodles were a little soft. The beef was pretty good, though. The yellow curry was also pretty good and was flavorful. I've always thought Thai food is generally pretty expensive and I thought I would've gotten more for $9 per dish. This place is not bad at all, and I'd consider trying other things on their menu.

6.description: Tried this place out for the first time tonight. The egg rolls were the tiniest egg rolls I've ever ate, they were crispy and tasty I enjoyed them. I ordered the red curry chicken, it was okay a little too watery, I've had it at a couple of places and at each it was differnt. I also had the Thai Ice Tea it was really good but would have liked the size to be a little bigger or at least less ice. Overall a decent experience, I'll probably stick to my regular Thai place but this place is worth a try!

22.description: I don't know about all their other items, but this place has the BEST RED CURRY. It is SO good, I order it at least once a month. I've probably had it at least 12 times now, and it has been delicious. every. time. I tried it with tofu once and it was really good, but it is perfect with chicken. Another loved item on the menu is the pad see ew. My husband and I always order chicken red curry and beef pad see ew together, it's kind of our monthly guilty pleasure meal. :) I will say I've tried some random chicken or beef dish that came with rice and it was less memorable, and I personally don't like their noodles for their pad thai (it's similar to pho noodles, very thin, but maybe they would change the noodle type if you asked? Not sure). Lastly, I recommended red curry to a friend, but she was afraid it'd be spicy (although I don't find it spicy at all), so she ordered yellow curry instead, and tasted kinda funky - it was a bit too sweet.I'm not sure if this all warrants an average of less than 5 stars, maybe the restaurant as a whole might be less, but because of the amazing red curry and delicious pad see ew, I'm sticking with the 5. You go, Golden Thai!

15.description: Oh my goodness, the curries... Red curry, yellow curry, and my favorite, panang curry. Everything on the menu is good but these are outstanding. It's a takeout staple in our home.

57.description: Just ordered delivery from this place for dinner today. First off, they were over 30 minutes late. The food did not come with any eating utensils like a fork or chopsticks. Food was cold and overly salted. The quality of the food was horrible.  My girlfriend and I both got a stomach ache from eating here. I should have chose to go to yummy thai instead but wanted to try this place since I already tried the other two thai places on taylor.

20.description: Amazing crab rangoon. Amazing salads. Great curry chicken. So, so pad thai. Good delivery service, they take credit cards. Not very attemptive service when dining in. Would I come back? Hail yes!

36.description: The food is just good enough for two stars. The place is not so clean. Ordered Pad Thai and Golden Thai fried rice.

14.description: Such nice people and really quick service.

3.description: I go here a lot since it's around the corner, the lamb is beautiful, and the price is right.  But if you want a bit of entertainment, order a boneless leg of lamb, and watch the master butcher at work.  It is quite a show -- talk about skills! 3 minutes and a few cuts and the whole thing is ready to go -- amazing show!  Love the owner and his staff, they are all swell guys who know their lamb.They will send you home with the bones -- do NOT throw them away -- they make the greatest broth.

1.description: I purchased a leg of lamb from Nea Agora yesterday, and the results of my fresh lamb stew speak to the quality and freshness of the meat sold from this shop.I had a great time talking with the owner, Eddie about the neighborhood and restaurants we've eaten at lately.  There were some other people hanging out who added to the conversation and experience as well.I'm going to incorporate more lamb into my diet just so I can visit this shop more often.  ..Great experience and delicious lamb!

2.description: If you want some lamb, this is the right place to go!The store is well organized. You will see the fresh whole goats was taken of the trunk and hung in the store storage area.  The customer service area is very clean, with bright windows of street view, interesting pics on the wall and nice green plants around.All the staff there are very friendly.We had a whole leg this morning and cooked it for lunch. Very good lamb. Definitely recommend to our friends and will be come back for sure!

9.description: BOUN PASCHA!I went to this place to buy a lamb for my family for easter, and seriously, it was like stepping into the movie Moonstruck. Cash only, a few chairs, a refrigerator, a saw, and a cutting board. That's it. When I was there a bunch of old (old!) italian guys were sitting around ordering their lambs for easter. They all knew each other, and all greeted each other with Boun Pascha!I got 2 large legs of lamb, about 20 lamb chops, and some innards for under $70. Great deal, great meat!

10.description: Despite living in the area for almost 2 years, I've seen but never been in Nea Agora.  Well, I needed a rack of lamb recently and decided to check it out.  Now I'm wondering why I never went earlier-- service is superb and the staff are super friendly.  I'd never gotten lamb from a butcher before and I'm sure it showed, but they treated me like I was a great customer and asked all sorts of additional questions about how I wanted it cut and such.  Highly recommended.

4.description: Nea Agora located at 1056 W. Taylor Street in Little Italy is my place to get the best lamb chops.Ed's shop is very clean and the quality of lamb could not be better; simply EXCELLENT!I love Grecian Style lamb chops and I am getting hungry as I write this.Bill AltierRealtor who knows Little Italy and I support this merchant because he is good for our neighborhood.

6.description: Very disappointing. I was looking forward to coming here-but my meat smells and tastes like mutton-not the clean smell of young lamb.The owner directed the butcher which lamb to bring out to cut for me--maybe he thought I wouldn't know the difference...lamb is lamb, not mutton. Disappointed and will not be filling up my freezer here. Not coming back-off to the butchers at Fulton market for me.

11.description: If you need a lamb, this is the place to go.

5.description: There is never a reason to buy lamb anywhere other than Nea Agra.  Ever.Excellent quality, excellent service, locally owned, family operated, everything custom cut to order, and it hasn't changed a bit in over 50 years...  you'll love the food and the experience.

7.description: I have been going to Nea Agora for the past 20 years..... I love going to Taylor St, seeing that is where my family's roots are from  ....  The owner, I believe his name is John,  just makes all his customers feel so welcome and takes his time with each person, no matter how crowded.... Yes, it feels like you are in the movie Moonstruck with all the Italian men ,talking and enjoying the season, and wishing each other ' Buon Pasqua'... At easter time his mother comes in to help him out, she is the sweetest lady , always smiling ... It is truely a good family business , yet has a personal touch ....Don;t miss out ...Take the ride into the city for your Lamb Buon Pasqua

8.description: Stokes, Zachary and Pappas know.

0.description: this is the ONLY place to get lamb - deliveries on Wednesdays and Fridays if you want it still kicking

58.description: So I went to hawkeyes on Sunday, ordered the carribean salmon and I substituted my sides for sautéed spinach. I went back to Hawkeyes on Tuesday (today) and tried to order the same meal and they are trying to tell me that they don't sell sautéed spinach. I told them that I was just there 2 days ago and I ordered it right off the menu. They told me again "we don't sell sautéed spinach, maybe you had sautéed mushrooms." and they can only give me the spinach raw. First off, I don't eat mushrooms. Secondly, I know what I ordered and I know what I ate. I know I'm not going crazy so I got home and looked up the menu online and what do I find??? SAUTEED SPINACH!! It wash't in the section labeled "sides," it was listed under the mediterranean chicken breast.mail.google.com/mail/u/0…

56.description: I came here on a date and have to say that while the date itself didn't go great (it was a fix up... let's be honest those things never go great) the food was incredible.  This place truly has a neighborhood bar feel, and stepping in I felt like a regular.  We ordered the burgers which came out on a nice big pretzel bun.  There's nothing like a pretzel bun on a burger, especially a place that does it right.  And Hawkeyes does it justice.Coming in you have to know that it's bar food, but definitely we were surprised with the quality of the burgers.  Not sure I'd get anything else to be honest with you.  This would be a fun place to come and watch a game, it seems like a big Blackhawks bar if you like the blackhawks (I'm from Detroit.... go wings!).Anyways, try this place out on a thursday, friday ,or saturday night- you'll have some fun.

29.description: Stopped by for St.Patrick's day, way under staffed. Food took 2hrs. for the appetizer and still didn't receive. Ordered chicken strips.

42.description: An ok bar, cheap drinks, cheap food.. I went as a student, but wouldn't return as a grad.  Better options on Taylor Street.

23.description: Love their steak sandwiches!!!! The wings aren't so great, but edible if drinking. Lol Service is always good, they're very attentive. Good place 2 meet up & hang & catch a quick meal & drink .

47.description: Absolutely NEVER going here again! Horrible service. Very poor management. Highly disappointed.

8.description: DO NOT eat here!!!! I've gotten sick now twice on two separate occasions separated from each other by about 3 months! They are not a clean place whatsoever and I personally witnessed one of the employees rolling up a joint on the L train; I'm not making this up!

31.description: This is a solid neighborhood bar. Tons of televisions so a great place to watch any sports game. Good selection of alcohol and not that outrageously priced. Their food isn't too great and it is rather pricey. I go often on Tuesday nights for trivia. It is fun team trivia that is quite difficult, but the winners get gift cards. Their daily deals are rather lame: Monday is wing night, but the wings are so small it is basically a bone dipped in bbq sauce. Tuesday's are dollar burger night. This dollar fluctuates anywhere between $1-2 though. It is not worth the money though. Never cooked appropriately and it tastes like it was left outside for days. But for beer and sports, Hawkeyes is the place to be.

34.description: Pros:+Hours+Location+Food+Drink PricingCons:-Food PricingThis is your average bar and restaurant, families eat here and it kind of reminds me of TGI Friday's. The food is surprisingly good and they have specials depending on the day of the week, although it's kind of pricey for what you get. The drinks are reasonably priced and they offer drink specials as well. They accommodate large groups very well.

16.description: My friends and I went here Monday to watch a Bulls playoff game.  We had to sit in the basement which is kind of a weird atmosphere. They have $.40 wings on Monday, The wings are pretty good but they are very very small.  I did enjoy the cheese fries but they are very overpriced ($6). We also ordered a couple mixed drinks which were nine dollars each and honestly tasted like juice I did not taste any alcohol at all...

13.description: Really enjoy this place.  Free parking lot is always a plus in a busy area. Very nice staff and really good food. Went there for lunch with friends.

11.description: Just ok. It's really just average bar food that, in my opinion, was a little bit expensive for what it was. If I'm going to pay $13 for a skirt steak sandwich, I expect a pretty significant piece of meat and I don't expect to pay $.50 for BBQ sauce. That nickel and dime stuff drives me nuts. Chili felt very out of a can. $13 for frozen fish and chips is not acceptable. I could see popping in for a few drinks and maybe to take advantage of their numerous specials or trivia night (Tuesdays), but if it's just a meal you seek there are better options in the area.

39.description: This is supposed to be a Blackhawks bar! Unfortunately they turned off the Hawks on the big screen after the first period to go back to the Bulks game. The sound was on the Blackhawks game, but the big screen was Bulls. Really, Hawkeyes, really??? They even sound a horn when the Blackhawks score, yet I can only watch it on a tiny TV!?!? The manager, who looked like a 12-year-old with greased back, slick hair, didn't even care when we left & told him why. Very poorly managed bar! I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 because it would be a good place to watch the game.

37.description: If you order a Stella, make sure you ask for it in a regular glass. They use the 33 cl glass which is fine for a 11.2 oz bottle of Stella. Most bars use the 40cl glass which will hold a pint if they don't put too much head on it. They charge like they use the 40cl glass however so they should use it.Hawkeye's is a nice bar but the food is just not very good. They are the nicest sports bar around there and could dominate if they'd work on their food.

0.description: Great locally owned neighborhood bar.  Crowd is a diverse mix of UIC students and older locals, including a lot of professionals.  Great for games / concerts, as they have a big screen, a parking lot, and a UC shuttle.

38.description: It's average.  The food is average---The drinks are average---The service is average---The ambiance is average----Bathroom in basement is below average---They have not updated this place since 1993.  (Maybe some of the tv's are circa 2007)In an ever changing world glad to be able to find average Hawkeyes unchanging--- an average place to hang out.

51.description: Wow. Whoever was the blond waitress who served us the burgers today at 12 30......just wow.

27.description: This is my friends' and my go-to place for trivia night (on Tuesdays). The atmosphere is awesome bc most of the bar is playing too. Unfortunately, it does get packed real quick, especially if there's a game on that night as well. In all honesty, I could say its your 'average sports bar' and rate it 3 stars as the menu is vast but nothing special and the service can be slow at times- but as its in Chicago, I gave it a bonus star for its awesome daily specials and free parking lot my friends from the burbs are super thankful for. Shout out to broke students everywhere! Overall, chill spot to come for some food/drinks, watch a game, and hang with friends.

32.description: I went here before a show at the UIC Pavilion. I've never really hung out around the UIC campus and heard this is one of the popular bars. We just ate here and grabbed a few drinks while watching the Bulls game. It wasn't too crowded and we got a table near the front.For appetizers we got the tater tots and the onion strings. Usually when I think of appetizers it's something on the smaller side that everyone shares just to get a couple bites. But when they brought out the onion strings, it was the size of a damn brick haha. I'm not one to complain about getting TOO MUCH food though haha. The tots also came in a huge basket. The first couple of bites of both appetizers were really good. But after a while you realize how greezy everything is and the oil just starts to build up in your stomach. I felt like I needed a shower to wash all the grease off my hands and face.Then I ordered the build your own burger. I liked how they had a lot of good sauce options like chipotle mayo and spicy ranch. The burger itself was pretty tasty and I definitely saved off some onion strings from that brick to put on top of the burger. Overall, it's a decent bar to catch and game and grab some good old fashioned greasy bar food if you're hungry.

54.description: I like Hawkeye's. Their food is good and it's a nice place to go to if you want to watch a game on TV.

48.description: Went to HawkEyes for a late night dinner. Server was good, it was trivia night so kinda noisy. Well I ordered the Turkey Burger.  I'm the type of person that checks out all my food before I eat it. Yes, I investigate every inch of me food. Lucky me because my turkey burger bun had mold on it. So my advice to everyone is check or investigate your food before you eat it if you're dining at HawkEyes. Of course the manager took my turkey burger off the bill but that was all, nothing else.

44.description: We have come here several times while on lunch and have always had some good food and drink. Donna is our favorite waitress and is usually working the lunch shift. All the food I have tried has been delicious and they have tater tots -so what can be better? A cool sports bar vibe that happens to have some really good food. Plus, in the summer, OUTDOOR SEATING. It's a winning combo, just like the Blackhawks.

24.description: Every time I come here the food tastes like it came premade or was microwaved. Avoid the guac. Burger was probably the only thing worth getting but only to help wash down the beer.

7.description: Worst service I've ever had!! From the moment my sister and I walked through the door to make a carry out order the host actually rolled her eyes at us. Really? Then when our orders were taken they were taken with an attitude. We asked for a manager to see why our order for 3 salads was taking so long and to let her know about our horrible service and we were actually given the excuse of she is new for the host. Where is being new an excuse for being rude! How dare you. To top it all off, I get home and my salad not only is missing ingredients, but it is swimming in water!!! I hope this place goes out of business!!! Terrible!!!  If I could give 0 damn starts I would!!!!

49.description: It's a local bar near the UIC Hospital and medical district (Tri-Taylor). I've had a drink here before, but this was my first time getting a meal. I would say it's your typical bar with a lot of TV's, pretty typical bar food, and some beer deals for college kids, grads, and medical folk.We were able to snag one of the seats outside, which was blocked by a school bus. That bus left halfway through our meal, which was a much welcomed removal, since it really helped with the views. Not that they have fabulous views in the first place. It was just an improvement from the yellow school bus right in the way.OK, let's move on to what we ordered! It was $1 beef taco night, so we ordered two of them. It's $0.50 per additional topping and we were feeling a little stingy, so we only ordered salsa on the side LOL. We also ordered the southwest salad with jerk chicken. I'm so glad they give the dressing on the side, because you really don't need all that dressing that they give you. But overall, it was pretty tasty. I would order that again.

40.description: My first time here was a long time ago and now i know why.  Service was not too bad but the food was horrible.  Wings were over cooked and when they were cooked right they still were not that good. I ordered jalapeño poppers for 7 dollars and  i got five little nuggets. FYI poppers are only cream not cheese.  Overall disappointed, will never come back for food thats for sure.

53.description: A serviceable, decent joint near UIC Hospital, and hence a popular watering hole for me and my colleagues.  I've had a chance to catch quite a few World Cup matches here lately and they do have daily lunch specials and decent deals during the week for drinks.  Just standard pub fare in terms of food, but nothing to balk at. They have an impressive amount of  Midwest craft stuff on draught , which is a plus.  Definitely would come here over drum and monkey in the summer because I appreciate that the outdoor seating is streetside, providing ample opportunity for people watching.  In short, this is a no-frills, casual neighborhood bar--and ain't nothing wrong with that.

30.description: Hawkeyes, great place to go be it after work or even for lunch, been there for both often, have always loved the service and the servers are great, was there tonight and have to say that the server (who I've never seen before), we had tonight really SUKED the big one, it was like trying to pull teeth trying to get an order in, when the last person of our party showed up while she was there just walked away as he sat down, didn't ask if he wanted anything, then when he asked for a beverage it seemed to have bother her, not the least be friendly, then at the end of the evening she over-billed us by more than $20.00, but after I caught it, she claims was a "mistake"...yes the manager rectified the bill, but what if I had not caught it, I don't know her name since she wasn't even friendly enough to say what it was, but was the girl with all the tattoos on her arm, hands, chest, overall, we as a group will not stop going there but will make sure she isn't our server next time.

46.description: Regret to write my 1st negative review but had no choice.  Upon just having taken my daughter back to UIC this past Friday the 22nd, we were looking for a dinner spot.  She wanted to go to "Little Italy" so we found a parking spot and preceded to walk around the cute neighborhood,  checking out all the restaurants along the way. Being indecisive as usual,  we finally were hungry enough to try anything, so we hopped into Hawkeye's. The bar side was busy,  we were greeted right away by the hostess and asked whether we'd like to sit in the bar or dining room.  We chose dining room because it would be quieter.  There were only 2 tables occupied with dueces so basically dead in the dining room.  We sat there for over 10 minutes without anyone coming into the dining room.  When the waitress finally came in to check on one table, she was 8 feet away and didn't recognize that we were trying to get some attention.  We never did. Being a CIA grad,  and chef for over 30 years,  I knew immediately something didn't feel right.  My daughter wanted me to give them more time,  but I was ready to walk. I told her OK,  but just watch,  no one will be coming over anytime soon,  and we'd start the stop watch for fun.   5 minutes later my daughter starts thinking maybe she can stare down a server from across the room to move avail.  Then she literally started waving both arms over her head and still nothing.  Finally,  she got so upset she started shaking and finally said,  let's go Dad.  I'm pissed off.  She took the menu's to the server station and asked them where she could put the menus. Still no one seemed to care.  Even the nice hostess didn't ask us why we were leaving when we passed her on the way out. Didn't see a manager anywhere.Horrible service.  I wouldn't go back there if my life depended on it.  So we walked out,  walked directly across the street to the RoseBud, and dropped $120 bones on a beautiful meal with tip. Look for my review on the RoseBud.

1.description: YIKES!!! What the hell happened here!? I've been coming here for a while and have always been a returning satisfied customer... Came in on a Saturday for a late lunch and our experience this time around was so disappointing! My Boyfriend and I came in and decided to keep things simple. We ordered pretty basic food, nothing complicated. My Boyfriend ordered a plain cheeseburger - no lettuce, no tomato, just the patty and cheese - At no point did my Boyfriend have the opportunity to tell the waitress how he wanted it cooked... she never asked! Needless to say, the burger was overcooked! He couldn't finish it.. He's 6'2" and eats well, you know something is wrong when there's food left on his plate!Now my order was kindof the last straw! I kept it really simple, seriously, with an order of Nachos & an order of French Fries. First, EVERYTHING came out COLD... The Fries tasted like they sat out for an entire day, they were soggy, some were tough, what the hell!? Now the Nachos, you'd think... how the hell can someone screw that up?! This dish also came out cold as hell. And it wasn't cooked all the way through-- the fact that the dish looked like chips with cold beans and SHREDDED cheese on top-- YES the cheese was still shredded,  the cheese was never melted. What the hell kind of Nachos is this -- a cold mess!! Take Note, According to GOOGLE: Nachos -- a small crisp piece of a tortilla, typically topped with "melted" cheese and spices.I would have complained and sent it back but I can't even imagine the kind of DNA I'd be ingesting after having an issue with an order... As a longtime paying customer this shouldn't even be an issue.One last thing, my Boyfriend and I were there for about an hour... I can't even begin to describe how hard it was to get a refill on our drinks! It was pretty obvious that our waitress didn't want to be there, the service was awkward, cold, and below the standard of what we have experienced before. It's a shame and totally apparent, as of 1/31/2016 Hawkeyes only has 3 Stars and I can see why! I understand a lot of customers are college students -- I'd suggest you pay attention to your standards & quality and keep in mind that local long time customers can tell when things are falling short! College students come and go, please get it together for the Local's sake!If this review was based on previous experiences it would've been better than 1 star... It's a shame, hoping this place picks itself up!

55.description: When I found this place near campus, I really wanted to like it...but I can't say one good thing about the food. It's just straight up horrible. And expensive for complete crap. I got a veggie burger.  It was extremely greasy and didn't have any good flavor to it.  Skip this place and go to three aces or 10 doors. Or potbelly's even...at least it's not an extra $1.00 to get cheese on your sandwich there!But they get two stars because at least the beer list was good...although still not as good as three aces.

9.description: I have to say, I'm that customer who is willing to pay $20 for a so-so cocktail and appetizer if the customer service is great. I also ALWAYS tip 30% no matter the size bill. Yesterdays experience at good-ol Hawkeyes proved my point.Years back i was a regular at Hawkeyes, watching Sox games, having 1/2 pizza on Wednesdays and staying until "Closing Time" blared on the speakers at 2am.Nowadays, there are TONS of better bars to visit.  Where the food is great and the service is WAY above par. For those of you who come here often, Hawkeyes hasnt changed much. That being said, what keeps us coming back? WHO KNOWS!They have TERRIBLE drink specials.$6 for a small basket of tater tots andthe WORST WAITRESS OF ALL TIME ***CAROLYN***.Yes, Carolyn, this ones for you.You approached me, all the while looking away. Did not ask me how my day was. Did not smile. I came in to try your spot again. You're place of employment. And i saw $1 beer and said, well i may as well have that! WHY NOT?i made a mistake and asked for miller lite when the special was miller high life, SO I GIGGLED. You very rudely corrected me with a blank stare. Again, no smile.I then placed an order for tots, which you brought to my table without saying a word. I then asked for a glass of water which you then slammed on the table, without saying a word.**YOUR SERVICE WAS SO BAD, I FELT UNCOMFORTABLE AND HAD TO LEAVE". We planned on eating dinner there. I hope you can see why your tip was so small.So Carolyn and Hawkeyes Owner/Manager: It doesnt matter how good or lousy your food and drink specials are, if the customer service isnt there, neither are your loyal customers. You may not like to wait on people, Carolyn, but if its your job BE PROUD OF IT. OWN IT. If not, stop killing business. If you dont care about your boss/owner, then do us all a favor and LEAVE. Thanks! :)

26.description: Last night my 3 colleagues and I dined in your established, We were anticipating a night filled with fun and laughter. Initially this was the case as the night progressed, things took a turn for the worst. We participated in your weekly bar trivia game. We finished the first half of the game and the DJ for the evening began to announce team standings. While listening to the team names and eagerly waiting to hear our team's ranking, there was a team who was named, "Colored People Time Crew". Upon hearing this we immediately became utterly offended. Taking a look around, we noticed, other than ourselves, there were no other people of color. Considering we are currently living in a time where racial inequality seems to be at the forefront of the American public, to make remarks to this magnitude; even in a joking fashion, is completely unacceptable! Furthermore, no one in the building; aside from ourselves seemed to be offended in anyway. In fact, there seemed to be a shared sense of hilarity through this remark. As a result of these deplorable remarks, we were unable to finish the game and felt it best that we take our food and leave. I can't say we will visit your establishment again or recommend our colleagues to visit either. Furthermore, we will be sure to include this experience as part of your Yelp review so that others may understand the type of behavior that is condoned in this establishment. Please be aware that I will also be reporting this incident to the Better Business Bureau.An Outraged Patron.

25.description: My friends and I went here Monday to watch a Bulls playoff game.  We had to sit in the basement which is kind of a weird atmosphere. They have $.40 wings on Monday, The wings are pretty good but they are very very small.  I did enjoy the cheese fries but they are very overpriced ($6). We also ordered a couple mixed drinks which were nine dollars each and honestly tasted like juice I did not taste any alcohol at all...

12.description: This place has good bar food and it gets really packed on thursdays and weekend. I feel a little weird coming in my scrubs after a hard shift, but no one notices and dont make you feel awkward. I love coming to bars where people dont look down on others and where its a community bar, mostly young 20 n 30s. Its in UIC village so dont expect a fancy bar or fancy dinner. This is a cool bar and as long as its clean, service is good, what more could you ask for? I do sometimes see suits in there, there is no dress code and usually ppl come in jeans n baseball caps. Its just a chill bar, but their food is good so I can def see why a lot of our medical community/suits come here for a quick bite and a drink. I love coming here and know that you will too!MY Favorites: Warm pretzels with mustard!!! Build your own burger and must have it on a toasted pretzel bun and you got me at HELLO?!?! :)Cold heinken....sorry I dont do cheap miller or any tap beers. Hand me a Heinken or a tequila shot or sometimes ill tell the bartender how to do a "Paloma".....tequila, squirt or if they dont have it, a light color soda with lime juice n salt n ice. Most of the time, the bartenders make it good and tell me theyre going to try that drink ;).Come down and if you see a nurse in scrubs at night, buy her a drink, she is probably there becuz of her chaotic day lol.

59.description: So many choices! I'm indecisive about pretty much everything in life...but decisions like "tater tots or chips" and "cajun, grilled, or blackened chicken" are  the type I don't mind making! There were options with everything on the menu, and our server knew every single option that was listed, and then had other questions to ask.I wouldn't say the food was that much different than other bar food, but honestly with all the options they give you -- like choosing from three different "lettuces" for a salad -- this place did go a step above! They also had Abita Strawberry, my favorite seasonal beer, so I might be a little biased. Oh, and there's a nice patio with plenty of tables. Gotta take advantage of the beautiful Chicago weather while you can!

21.description: Today at Hawkeye's was one of the worse experience I ever had.  After waiting for it food patiently for 45minutes for was terrible.  Nobody wanted to talk to us about the good or wait time. Another guest that was sitting across from us also waited on there for as long as we did.  No manager came to neither of our table not one time.

17.description: I stop in here with a buddy a couple times a month.  The service is spotty but the bartenders are usually friendly and helpful.  The burgers and tater tots are not bad but nothing special.  The problem I had yesterday was with the unprofessional conduct of the bar host.I politely asked the bartender if they could turn the Cubs game on the one TV that I was facing from our table.  Before asking I checked to make sure that no one else was looking at that TV and it appeared I was the only one.  She asked the host and then I waited patiently.  Nothing happened for a while so I checked and then the host said they had the Cubs game on other TV's and so he wasn't going to change it.  I asked if he was seriously refusing to change the channel and he was.  He then spent the next hour alternating from hitting on some girls sitting at the bar and leaning on the "Wait to be seated" sign while watching the Sox game on the one TV I asked them to change, while occasionally glaring in my direction.  Apparently it was more important for him to kill time by watching the Sox lose 16-0 than comply with a customer request.  The website says, "Watch Your Favorite MLB team on one of our Hi-Def Televisions!"  Apparently, they will determine which team you get to watch.  But then the unprofessionalism went to another level as the host started horse-playing with the girls at the bar and grabbed one girl from behind, putting his one hand over her mouth as if he was kidnapping her.  I don't care if they know each other or not that is totally unacceptable in a place of business!  And, yes I have the photos to prove it.  Someone needs to train this boy or fire him because that whole experience was absurd.  Horrible customer service!!

10.description: It's a local bar near the UIC Hospital and medical district (Tri-Taylor). I've had a drink here before, but this was my first time getting a meal. I would say it's your typical bar with a lot of TV's, pretty typical bar food, and some beer deals for college kids, grads, and medical folk.We were able to snag one of the seats outside, which was blocked by a school bus. That bus left halfway through our meal, which was a much welcomed removal, since it really helped with the views. Not that they have fabulous views in the first place. It was just an improvement from the yellow school bus right in the way.OK, let's move on to what we ordered! It was $1 beef taco night, so we ordered two of them. It's $0.50 per additional topping and we were feeling a little stingy, so we only ordered salsa on the side LOL. We also ordered the southwest salad with jerk chicken. I'm so glad they give the dressing on the side, because you really don't need all that dressing that they give you. But overall, it was pretty tasty. I would order that again.

5.description: We stopped at Hawkeye's for drinks and dinner a few weeks ago before a concert because friends of ours swear by their food.  I ordered one of my favorite meals of salmon and veggies. It tasted fine and looked fine and smelled fine. However, less than one half hour after eating I started to feel ill and queasy.  Luckily, I made a run for the door before I embarrassed myself getting sick all over the bar.  I spent most of the night getting sick and wasn't able to enjoy the concert that night or eat much other than toast, tea, soup, and crackers for about five days.  A friend in the restaurant business later said it sounded like food poisoning from something sitting out at room temp for too long.  Who knows for sure but I do know for sure I have never experienced that ever before after eating grilled seasoned salmon.  I love salmon so I hope I won't be turned off of eating it in the future.  Just thought people should be warned.

3.description: It's a pretty average sports bar. I love reubens  so I am a fan of the Reuben eggrolls The drinks are pretty weak in my opinion. You will spend close to $10 for Coke and a splash of jack. No thanks.

35.description: Wings on Monday are 35cent, very good!, however the drinks are WATERED DOWN!!! I'm not a drinker and I had 3 drinks with NO BUZZ OR ANYTHING!!! 100$ later I'm out the door and on my way to another bar??? At least I'm full, stick to the beer

19.description: Came here on NYE and it was great! Everyone was friendly and drinks were reasonably priced!  Would definitely come back.

28.description: I used to come here all the time as a student. that was about 8 years ago. In March of 2014 I had a salad and got violently ill later that night. Tonight I went again, by request, and ordered the macaroni and cheese. It tasted a little weird. I am writing this review while sitting on the toilet exploding.It took 10 minutes for the check to show up after it was requested and the room was practically empty. I will not be returning.Also, as much as I like System of a Down, it's odd music for the dining room... so was Brittney's "Hit Me Baby One More Time"

45.description: The food is terrible and the service is non-existent. I live in the neighborhood and have tried this place several times, in the hopes that it may be "different" this year! I'm done with it! Also, being a neighborhood bar means nothing to them as they do not support their community. I live across the street from their parking lot and this morning, at 8am, saw their tow trucks towing away cars of parents that were just running their kids over to STEM Magnet Academy.
