I saw mothers with other young children returning for their car, that they had just left several minutes ago, only to find it gone! Leaving them stranded, some with babies in their arms and it was raining!! The lot is empty!! The business doesn't open until later in the day, so why be so non-supportive of your local school?? Go to one of the other bars/restaurants on Taylor that actually support the community.

33.description: Don't let the name of this joint located just west of central Little Italy on Taylor St. deceive you! Hawkeyes Bar & Grill is the real deal, with more than an everyday bar menu. I had a Greek Salad with grilled salmon for lunch that was absolutely delectable!!!! My colleague on the other hand opted for the "bar food," and built his own  1/2 pound burger with mayo, jalapeños, pepper jack cheese (as if it wasn't spicy enough with the peepers), lettuce, tomatoes, raw onions, etc. You get the picture--a diverse menu with something for everyone. Kudos! I'll be back soon.

43.description: I have been here a few times due to convenience since I work at U.I.C but the service is just ok, food is okay and they do have some specials on their drinks. Bar food, great tater tots!

2.description: A week or so ago I decided I would try Hawkeye's over the weekend. It is a block away from my apartment and seemed somewhat popular. This was my experience On Friday afternoon around 5PM I sat down at the bar to grab a drink. Over 15mins past without a "Hi or Be right with you" from the bartender. Since I wasn't planning on waiting around all night I decided to leave.On Saturday night at 7PM I decided I would give them another shot, I was greeted at door the with a request for a $20 cover to watch "the fight" Needless to say I brought my business else where on Taylor Street to eat dinnerOn Sunday morning I gave them another shot with breakfast. I wish I had not. Everything about this meal was below average. I order the breakfast burrito off of the brunch menu and was made a soggy, tasteless burrito. I ordered a $8.00 Bloody Mary that you could not taste a drop of vodka in. All in all I will not be going back.

18.description: Stopped by for St.Patrick's day, way under staffed. Food took 2hrs. for the appetizer and still didn't receive. Ordered chicken strips.

41.description: Nice place, friendly people. The croud ranges from college students to lawyers doctors nurses and blue collared. The food was good and daily specials were a decent price. Plus they have free parking a block south and a free shuttle to the bulls game!

52.description: Hawkeye's is the neighborhood watering hole lives up to expectation.  Simple menu, good drinks and plenty of TVs to catch the team.

50.description: I stop in here with a buddy a couple times a month.  The service is spotty but the bartenders are usually friendly and helpful.  The burgers and tater tots are not bad but nothing special.  The problem I had yesterday was with the unprofessional conduct of the bar host.I politely asked the bartender if they could turn the Cubs game on the one TV that I was facing from our table.  Before asking I checked to make sure that no one else was looking at that TV and it appeared I was the only one.  She asked the host and then I waited patiently.  Nothing happened for a while so I checked and then the host said they had the Cubs game on other TV's and so he wasn't going to change it.  I asked if he was seriously refusing to change the channel and he was.  He then spent the next hour alternating from hitting on some girls sitting at the bar and leaning on the "Wait to be seated" sign while watching the Sox game on the one TV I asked them to change, while occasionally glaring in my direction.  Apparently it was more important for him to kill time by watching the Sox lose 16-0 than comply with a customer request.  The website says, "Watch Your Favorite MLB team on one of our Hi-Def Televisions!"  Apparently, they will determine which team you get to watch.  But then the unprofessionalism went to another level as the host started horse-playing with the girls at the bar and grabbed one girl from behind, putting his one hand over her mouth as if he was kidnapping her.  I don't care if they know each other or not that is totally unacceptable in a place of business!  And, yes I have the photos to prove it.  Someone needs to train this boy or fire him because that whole experience was absurd.  Horrible customer service!!

4.description: I went here before a show at the UIC Pavilion. I've never really hung out around the UIC campus and heard this is one of the popular bars. We just ate here and grabbed a few drinks while watching the Bulls game. It wasn't too crowded and we got a table near the front.For appetizers we got the tater tots and the onion strings. Usually when I think of appetizers it's something on the smaller side that everyone shares just to get a couple bites. But when they brought out the onion strings, it was the size of a damn brick haha. I'm not one to complain about getting TOO MUCH food though haha. The tots also came in a huge basket. The first couple of bites of both appetizers were really good. But after a while you realize how greezy everything is and the oil just starts to build up in your stomach. I felt like I needed a shower to wash all the grease off my hands and face.Then I ordered the build your own burger. I liked how they had a lot of good sauce options like chipotle mayo and spicy ranch. The burger itself was pretty tasty and I definitely saved off some onion strings from that brick to put on top of the burger. Overall, it's a decent bar to catch and game and grab some good old fashioned greasy bar food if you're hungry.

6.description: All around, very average.Ambience:  Very sports bar-y, which is nice since they'll always have the game you're looking for.Beer selection: Average, not too many craft beersFood: Average bar food, although, I will admit that I am a big fan of the Reuben Eggrolls and the Build Your Own Burgers. Can't go wrong there!

22.description: This place has good bar food and it gets really packed on thursdays and weekend. I feel a little weird coming in my scrubs after a hard shift, but no one notices and dont make you feel awkward. I love coming to bars where people dont look down on others and where its a community bar, mostly young 20 n 30s. Its in UIC village so dont expect a fancy bar or fancy dinner. This is a cool bar and as long as its clean, service is good, what more could you ask for? I do sometimes see suits in there, there is no dress code and usually ppl come in jeans n baseball caps. Its just a chill bar, but their food is good so I can def see why a lot of our medical community/suits come here for a quick bite and a drink. I love coming here and know that you will too!MY Favorites: Warm pretzels with mustard!!! Build your own burger and must have it on a toasted pretzel bun and you got me at HELLO?!?! :)Cold heinken....sorry I dont do cheap miller or any tap beers. Hand me a Heinken or a tequila shot or sometimes ill tell the bartender how to do a "Paloma".....tequila, squirt or if they dont have it, a light color soda with lime juice n salt n ice. Most of the time, the bartenders make it good and tell me theyre going to try that drink ;).Come down and if you see a nurse in scrubs at night, buy her a drink, she is probably there becuz of her chaotic day lol.

15.description: Love their steak sandwiches!!!! The wings aren't so great, but edible if drinking. Lol Service is always good, they're very attentive. Good place 2 meet up & hang & catch a quick meal & drink .

57.description: WOOF. First complaint, service was extremely slow. After ordering our first round of drinks, our waitress disappeared for a solid 30 minutes. I ended up having to go to the bar and order our second round. Second complaint, the food was lukewarm and extremely greasy. I honestly think my beer was warmer than the burger I ordered. With that being said I will not be returning to Hawkeye's. So many better bar/food options on Taylor.

20.description: Meh. This place is just ok. Service is blah. I've gotten sliders off their lunch menu and the buns were cold, as if they were just pulled out of the fridge. The last time I went I had a burger, which was good, and fries were good too. I believe they charge for extra sauces which is really silly. They usually have decent drink specials. Overall I prefer not to go here, but since it's close to school and convenient, it's where we often end up.

36.description: I do not recommend coming here for the food. My friend ordered the chicken salad and waited fir the chicken!! The nachos were just thrown together.  Just had a bad experience. Its fine for having drinks.  Fun place before a hawks game or concert.

14.description: Good for watching any sport, cheap drinks, lots of room and fantastic food. Nothing to complain about. Can't believe I live next door.

28.description: Not the best fro-yo but very good. They have a good selection of yogurt and toppings, including hot caramel. Try the cherry or French toast!

1.description: I understand that people like free samples when walking in, and lots of times that employees don't mind handing out sample cups to customers.  I, however, tend to go straight to the machines and just dispense whatever I feel like at that moment.  In other words, I'm pretty adventurous when it comes to froyo if you haven't figured that out.  I usually like the fruity flavors, so I chose the honey green tea and mango, with raspberries, pineapples, and mochi (never finishing my froyo without mochi...my rule of thumb)!  I'm assuming the honey green tea flavor is seasonal, but I liked it a lot and hope they will have it constantly from now on.  We used the $10 groupon deal, so we only paid a little more than $2 since I have already purchased the groupon for $6.  By the way, they charge $0.49/ounce, which is believed to be the standard rate in many of the Forever Yogurt locations in the city of Chicago.  This location is more spacious than the one near the CTA Belmont Red/Brown/Purple Line station.  There are two (2) floors with a plenty of seating.  Froyo is one of my favorite things to eat, so you will definitely see me at one of the froyo places in town.

9.description: Not the best fro-yo but very good. They have a good selection of yogurt and toppings, including hot caramel. Try the cherry or French toast!

29.description: Great atmosphere! Employees are super welcoming and helpful. My new favorite location. Aside from the delicious flavors I also love the basement, it's great for hanging out or studying. This is a location that's definitely worth visiting! :)

23.description: I love forever yogurt!! The staff here is so friendly and the yogurt is delicious! There are always great toppings to choose from :)

5.description: Great place like the other forever yogurts. I found the peanut butter cup and french toast flavored yogurts to be absolute gems. Not all the toppings here are to be scooped; they have some cereal style chambers where you can douse your yogurt in x topping which I thought was pretty cool. Additionally, the service here was friendly and I was offered sample cups immediately upon entering which was very nice. I chose to get a tart fro yo with assorted fruits that all tasted pretty fresh. Had to take away a star though cause the kiwi I bit into had something ridiculously hard in it. The crunch from my teeth hurt a bit, but I can't really blame it on poor cutting since I probably would've missed it if I were chopping fruits too. Actually, that isn't saying much.

31.description: This place is simply amazing! Great service, AMAZING froyo, and free wifi! It gets better, there's a downstairs area where it's easy to get some quiet time to study! Highly Recommended!

25.description: Love this place- amazing hot chocolate for the winter, friendly service, and delicious froyo flavors with a wide selection of toppings!!!Currently there is a 10% off deal if you post a message on twitter, or write a review for them. With or without this deal, I go to forever yogurt whenever I can because I absolutely love it so much. They have a room in the basement that they offer if you would like to have a party. Favorite flavors: pomegranate, pistachio with sliced almonds on top, mango, euro tart with cinnamon or sea salt on top.

12.description: The store is SO CLEAN and the temperature is great. They have a huge variety of yogurt and toppings to choose from. The staff is friendly and are willing to explain how to make your creation if you have never been before.The price is very reasonable, especially since you are in control of how much yogurt and toppings you get (it's weighed by the ounce).All the toppings look fresh, and they always replenish the toppings.I would recommend for anyone looking to cool off with a sweet treat.*They're also open really late!*

21.description: Really glad that Forever Yogurt has come to Little Italy. Sometimes they are out of flavors, but they usually have the basic ones, which I gravitate toward anyway. The staff is really friendly, and always cutting up fresh fruit.

16.description: i may be spoiled by the yogurtland back in california, where i always pay only $3 for a regular normal size cup. i paid over $6 here for the same thing....! and the yogurt here are way too soft, (like liquid)... too expensive for a watery yogurt!!! but the plus is they have many choices of nuts.

17.description: A great spot to stop in when ur in the area. So yummy! The place is always clean and the employees are all super nice. My daughter loves coming here just because she gets to make her yogurt just the way she likes with all her favorite toppings!

10.description: It really breaks my heart to give this one such a low review because I LOVE me some Forever Yogurt however this place is my least favorite.  The froyo machines are never at full capacity and they are always a person short. The toppings are however always fresh.... Unless you want some hot fudge or Ghirardelli White Chocolate, in which case you get a spoon to scoop the awkwardly shaped substance. Eeeekk.

11.description: Came in with an expired Groupon and had no problems. Loaded up with two cups of Forever Yogurt and walked away with my wife very happy. Location was clean and big and staff was friendly.

26.description: Great place like the other forever yogurts. I found the peanut butter cup and french toast flavored yogurts to be absolute gems. Not all the toppings here are to be scooped; they have some cereal style chambers where you can douse your yogurt in x topping which I thought was pretty cool. Additionally, the service here was friendly and I was offered sample cups immediately upon entering which was very nice. I chose to get a tart fro yo with assorted fruits that all tasted pretty fresh. Had to take away a star though cause the kiwi I bit into had something ridiculously hard in it. The crunch from my teeth hurt a bit, but I can't really blame it on poor cutting since I probably would've missed it if I were chopping fruits too. Actually, that isn't saying much.

27.description: The best frozen yogurt that I've ever had! I absolutely love the fact that they have so many different toppings to go along with the delicious yogurt. I felt like a kid in a candy store. I also love the atmosphere and the staff are very nice as well. Highly Recommended! You won't be disappointed.

0.description: Buyer Beware!!! You are in for a treat, don't be like my Boyfriend and I - we completely lose control over the fact of serving ourselves and always end up spending a billion dollar$$$$$$ each visit and never learn!! How fortunate am I that my boyfriend totally supports my crazy cravings and gets in on it each time.I love this location, the atmosphere is always welcoming - expect to see college students hanging out, the serving stations are always well kept and maintained, and the toppings are always fresh! One complaint, we came in one time with a Groupon that was clearly listed for the Taylor Street branch but the cashier at the time wouldn't take it. Her response was that she couldn't take it. I was under the impression she didn't really know what she was doing - I could be wrong. Aside from that, I have no complaints.

20.description: If you mark less than five stars, you only have yourself to blame.  Do not make the rookie mistake of putting too many random toppings on your froyo.  Seriously though this is a new location, very clean, very friendly, and lots fun especially for dates and/or kids.  Upon arrival we were greeted enthusiastically and given sample cups without asking to try the various flavors of yogurt.  I went with the mamas cake batter flavor and topped it off with sprinkles and reese's cups.  It was delicious.  If you are craving a cold sweet treat and your in Little Italy give it a try.

19.description: Delicious and nice staff! I purchased a groupon for another location by mistake so they gave me discount on my purchase!:)

2.description: Visited for the first time tonight and had the tiramisu, cookie and cream, and the original tart. Let me put it out there that I've had frozen yogurt at other FY locations before, not a froyo by any means.With that said, their froyo tasted like half ice slush and full disappointment. Especially the tart flavor, tasted like real spoil dairy. I get that yogurt traditionally has live cultures. Let me say my cup of as live alright.Went up to the counter and spoke with the guy named "L.P." Never had such customer service anywhere. With an attitude, he said that's not their first time having that complaint and it could be a Batch issue... I kindly asked for my receipt just in case.If you want bad froyo served with a bad attitude, this is the place to be.Won't be returning here. I guess the poor quality froyo is enough to fool the college population in the area.

32.description: Love this place. Their yogurt is delicious and the staff is always friendly. The basement part of the shop offers a nice place for college students to study and jump onto some free wifi. Would highly recommend!

18.description: This place is wonderful. I probably come here to buy yogurt once a week. The staff is very friendly and always give tasting cups - even though I've probably tasted 90% of the flavors by now. The toppings are plentiful and always fresh.

13.description: Everything is very clean and generally works properly. The yogurt is delicious and I've always had a welcoming experience with the staff! Great for any age ranging from gummy worms and cereals for kids (or adults) to fruit and chocolate goods, all around great!

4.description: This is a great frozen yogurt place in the UIC/tri taylor area. It is right next to the 7 eleven. For comparison, I would say this is like pinkberry, and it is better than Red Mango.There are about ten different flavors and each one is unique. For example there is red velvet, tart, salted caramel, milk chocolate, strawberry, coconut.The cups come in three different sizes, and you can fill it up. The price depend on how much your cup weighs. I like that the topping come in self service containers like in the candy store Dylan's Candy Bar. The toppings are diverse like the frozen yogurt flavors. There are peanut butter chips,  dark chocolate chucks, oreo pieces, sprinkles among other things. At the front of the store there are even more toppings. You can add things like cheesecake bites, truffles, or reeses peanut butter cups.The three of us filled up our cups and the total was about 16 dollars. So each cup was about 5 dollars a person. However, I think they have a groupon, and that is a way to come here and save some money.I recommend this place! It is one of the best frozen yogurt places I have been to!

24.description: Friendly employees, greeted and given sample cups right away. Great selection. Fruit toppings look fresh and not old like other  establishments. Cereal toppings-yum! Definitely going back!

6.description: The place filthy inside.  The toppings were all over the trays and floor. Half of the yogurt machines were not working and the other half were coming out melted. Every yogurt machine tray was filled with melted yogurt, and when you went to dispense any it would spill out of the top of the handle getting your hand all messy. More than likely it is because the attendant was on her cell phone throughout the entire visit. She didn't even hang up when we were paying.

22.description: This place is wonderful. I probably come here to buy yogurt once a week. The staff is very friendly and always give tasting cups - even though I've probably tasted 90% of the flavors by now. The toppings are plentiful and always fresh.

15.description: Forever Yogurt is great. It's one of the best places to get yogurt in Chicago. All their flavors are really good.

7.description: If you mark less than five stars, you only have yourself to blame.  Do not make the rookie mistake of putting too many random toppings on your froyo.  Seriously though this is a new location, very clean, very friendly, and lots fun especially for dates and/or kids.  Upon arrival we were greeted enthusiastically and given sample cups without asking to try the various flavors of yogurt.  I went with the mamas cake batter flavor and topped it off with sprinkles and reese's cups.  It was delicious.  If you are craving a cold sweet treat and your in Little Italy give it a try.

8.description: Love this place- amazing hot chocolate for the winter, friendly service, and delicious froyo flavors with a wide selection of toppings!!!Currently there is a 10% off deal if you post a message on twitter, or write a review for them. With or without this deal, I go to forever yogurt whenever I can because I absolutely love it so much. They have a room in the basement that they offer if you would like to have a party. Favorite flavors: pomegranate, pistachio with sliced almonds on top, mango, euro tart with cinnamon or sea salt on top.

30.description: What an awesome treat after a nice dinner!   I met up with my Sons and girlfriends for dinner (Love Little Italy!!!)  On a cold blustery evening was warmed up a by fun an inviting atmosphere and delicious yogurt with some awesome flavors. The candy and fruit toppings were endless... My girlfriend actually didn't even have yogurt she had a bowl full of candy!!! This will be our desert stop over on every trip to Little Italy!!!

3.description: Thank god this place has opened up in Little Italy. HONESTLY, little Italy has nothing going for it. I have lived here for four years and once I move out, I dont think Ill ever be back. haha. Frozen yogurt is a great addition to the plenty of thai, indian, food chains and crappy sushi joints. Little Italy doesnt even have any  more than 3 authentic italian joints. Anyway, enough hating on little Italy, i just... hate it. Forever yogurt has a great selection. They are always switching up their flavors and I really enjoy the mixes they put up. Just ask for a sample cup and go to town. I am impressed with their plain yogurt flavor. It is very balance in sweetness and flavor. Not too overpowering. Good for a health nut, supposedly it only has like 110 calories in 52 grams. haha whatever that means. Big rookie mistakes: do not over do the toppings. Do not mix more than three flavors. Do not smoke substances beforehand and think you are all of a sudden creative. youre not.Did I mention, they have a punch card?! get it. :-)

14.description: Awesome.. I loveed this place.. Yoghurt was delicious - Dutch Chocolate was soo yummy. You can mix any number of flavours - so I put half swirl of chocolate, reese peanut butter, cake batter, caramel popcorn and chocolate again. Then mixed it with vanilla wafers, brownie bites, cheesecake bites, reese peanut butter (crushed) and added in hot fudge, caramel sauce. It was delicious.. You should go here. YUMMY. :)

3.description: They have a good selection of products for the hair, skin and nails and a discount card that can save you money off of your next purchase. One thing that I really like about this place is that they don't follow you around when you shop! Yes, I've noticed that most small business owners lose their minds when someone walks in with a large purse or bag. This store treats their customers with respect after all if you have security cameras do you need to pace up and down to rows to watch me too?

1.description: Pretty good selection of hair and the like. I really liked how they had a reward card, although I haven't been back since. Its a weird place to park your car so its better to walk. The employees had a good knowledge of black hair, so when I told them of the style I wanted to achieve, they were able to point me in the right direction. I bought braiding hair but if I ever get a chance, I'd like to check out their wigs.

2.description: I went to this place today and waited, and waited and waited to be serviced. There was only one person to assist and she was busy with another customer. She never acknowledged me. I walked around the store for a little while and got tired of being followed by security. I left and will not be back. Taking my business elsewhere.

5.description: LOVE THIS PLACE. I am a hair stylist and I do Hair Extentions. Now When it come to buying hair you don't want cheap stuff that will tangle and look a mess in a week. I will only do Extentions if you have remy hair.... Now the best remy hair that you can buy in Beauty supplys is Bohyme. It comes in all types of textures and colors. I have a very diverse clientel that ranges from, white, asian, black and mid-eastern.... and yes they all want extentions and this hair comes in all thoses textures!! Beauty one on roosevelt has them all!! The staff is friendly and knows me by name!! Even on days that I am too busy to go with my clients all I have to do is call and tell them what I need and they will have it waiting at the counter for my client!! So if you want  long lasting hair without paying online hair prices beauty one is your store.... And if you want it put in Hair By Danyel is your girl!! I am also located in the south loop 1518 S. Wabash 312-404-0853 or just pick up one of my cards at Beatuy One!!

6.description: Staff is generally neutral or friendly. Wide range of wig/hair, hair styling, hair accessorizing, nail polish/care, and skin moisturizing products. Prices are very affordable.

0.description: After receiving horrible service at 2 other beauty supply places, we stumbled across this one. They have a nice collection of wigs and hair products. The sales staff is very knowledgeable, friendly and go out of their way to find wigs that are suited to you.  A sign says that you can only try on 3 wigs for each wig cap you purchase but they'll waive that if you show you're a serious shopper.  I had only intended to buy 1 wig but came out with 3 plus some hair products!  They have a discount club after your first purchase that will give you 5% off future purchases.  Though I easily found street parking, I'm told that there is a parking lot in the rear of the store.I highly recommend this place!

4.description: This place is excellent. There is a great selection of hair extensions and products. The prices are reasonable, the staff is very friendly! I'm so glad this place is in the South Loop!

12.description: Received my "repaired" phone back from this store and within minutes it was acting up. When I brought the phone back, I was told that the screen was damaged. Considering that the phone had done nothing while it was with me but sit untouched on a flat surface, I would have to believe that if the screen was damaged, it is because it was damaged in the factory or during repair. Ubreakifix refused to fix the mistake, instead insisting that I pay another $150 so that they can again put in a bad screen. No thank you.

7.description: Wow! This place is great.  Wonderful customer service.  Honest and trustworthy owners and workers.They fix anything with a power button.  IPods, IPhone, IPads and computers.  They will give you an estimate for free.  I had my grandson's IPod fixed - same day service.Also free parking.  Fast and great service.

3.description: I read nothing but good things about this place so I decided to go check it out. My phone had been wet and I figured it was worth a try to get it checked out before replacing. I took it in the morning and called in after to work to check the status. When I called they said that it was being wrapped up and to swing on by to check it out. I asked if it was working to which the guy seemed to be busy so I said I would just go in prior to him answering. I go in and they tell me that it was unable to be fixed and that they are sorry - they tried EVERYTHING. The way they were acting seemed sketchy so on my way home I stopped at a local phone fixing shop, they said they would open it up and check it while I was there. Sure enough, they open it and notice that there a cable that had been, in their words, ripped off. They change the battery and the phone turns on. They say that they will sell me the battery and replace the cable that had been replaced but I would have to leave it over night so they could get the piece. The guy says if it was working prior to you getting it wet, then the last place you took it (uBreakiFix) must have ripped the cable and said that there was nothing they could do so they would not have to replace it for you. That cable is responsible for getting wifi/signal (look up iphone 5 wifi antenna). So I ended up writing to ubreakifix and am waiting to hear back. I hope they can amend this because I had to pay more due to their mistake.

1.description: A much better store than the oak lawn one, which should be closed. Justin was very professional or was it based on my complaining about the issue I had at oak lawn. Although the they were unable to repair my MacBook Pro with water damage. They were detailed with properly diagnosing it and given me a referral for repair. The theme that strikes me after visiting 2 of these stores is they are probably best at phones and tablets.

2.description: Took 2 1/2 weeks to get phone repaired properly.  Severed home button while repairing screen on phone.,  Took multiple times to finally get home button order correct.Poor customer service, does not follow up on orders, does not have products for repairs in stock.  Makes you pay for a new screen when screen pops open after their repair.Overall extremely frustrating experience, would not recommend to anyone I know (or don't know).

9.description: Hands down the best customer service I've ever received. We all know the high stress that ensues when you break your device...that's not the case at all at this store. The personnel at UBreakIFix are incredibly understanding, speedy and of course skilled. I had a shattered screen and was able to be in and out in under 18 minutes. I highly recommend checking them out if you find yourself in a bind with your device. Totally worth the money!

10.description: I dropped and completely shattered the screen of my iPhone 6. Made an appointment online so quick and easy and was in & out in less than 30 minutes same day! No hassles or hidden charges

13.description: Were amazing as service and very good quality work. Just wanna thank those guys again.

16.description: Excellent work.  Very courteous, knowledgeable and friendly.  Took my iPad 2 with broken glass in at 10 am.  They expertly fixed the corners, replaced glass and added screen protector by noon.  VERY REASONABLE PRICE!!!

17.description: Fantastic!! My iPad screen was shattered. I really thought it was beyond repair. That is when I discovered ubreakifix. I cannot believe they were able to fix my iPad. Not only was turnaround quick, but the prices were reasonable. My favorite part was their customer service. Justin was terrific. He communicated with me throughout the process and calmed my fears. Justin made the experience so painless and easy. I highly recommend.

15.description: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!! I was running late this morning and in a rush accidentally dropped my phone and cracked the screen. I work in marketing and my phone is a necessity. I went to my service provider and they told me it would cost $150 to replace the screen and it would take them a day to do it and would mail it to me tomorrow which is ridiculous. Two stores down was uBreakiFix. I went in and they gave me a way better price. The sales rep/technician Justin went above and beyond to help me out. He fixed my phone in 10-15minutes and helped me out with other questions I had about working my phone. These guys are professionals and give excellent customer services.

0.description: Excellent service and low cost alternative to replacing the whole phone. The new screen is perfect and the technician tested everything in front of me. They tell you it'll take an hour but mine was fixed in 45mins. Great location with plenty of parking and nearby places to wait it out.

5.description: After accidentally putting my iPhone through the wash, I thought it was done for.  On a whim, I took it into uBreakiFix - within 24 hours, it was as good as new.  The microphone was also damaged from a previous incident (I was forced to use speakerphone always) - they noticed this, and said they could fix it that for only a few dollars.  Great customer service and a great value!

11.description: The manager of the store helped me personally. I bought a refurbished phone off  eBay, it had so many problems and I wasn't able to get a refund. Ubreakifix saved me from a lemon purchase the manager was able to replace a few things for very cheap and the phone worked as if it was brand new. I am now tempted to start buying all my electronics broken so that I can keep these bargains going.

8.description: Junior fixed my phone 2 weeks ago - badly cracked screen.  It was perfect - done in about 25 minutes for about $100!  He was friendly, explained what the process was and it was awesome.  I highly recommend the South Loop location! Thank you, Junior!

4.description: I had my phone screen and camera replaced in San Diego and when they returned it to me, the flash stopped working. After I had the flash fixed my camera, home button, and power button were all not working properly so I came to the location in Chicago to have the warranty fix it. The owner/manager told me the power button was livable and that I don't have to have it fully click and functional to have a working phone, and he then continued to argue with me. This has been by far the worst phone repair experience I've ever had. I've spent a total of 6 hours waiting to talk to people and get my phone fixed.

14.description: Great guys and awesome service. It's been 8 months since I accidentally Ray Riced my iPhone 5c and had a cracked screen. Today the right side of the screen decided to clock out and not responding to any gesture. Went into the shop- had a quick quote- very friendly staff did a pretty thorough check- an hour later picked up an brand new looking for a pretty reasonable price including a 3 months warranty.

6.description: Great service and communication. I broke the screen on my ipad2 and took it to them right awayThey had the part I needed on hand and was able to replace it even though there was a slight possibility I had damaged the lcd as wellIn and out lickity split and not nearly as expensive as mailing it off to Apple to get them to replace it.

28.description: Noone is ever available to help the shopper here.  Good selection if you can find the stuff.Produce is only fair.I never shop here for meats.I try to avoid the place because I like produce---and the quality of produce here is not good.I wish it were better---it's really close to where I live.

1.description: It seems as though every visit to this Jewel I always end up leaving with the most ridiculous stories to share. The only reason I come here is convenience. The shopping experience at this jewel is unlike any other; it surprises me that this branch isn't any more chaotic based on it's poor staffing. Rules do not apply at this Jewel, the staff obviously have no control! And it's sad to say that it comes with the territory. I've seen it far too often:- people eating chicken as they shop, leaving bones in the most disrespectful places- half eaten potato chip bags, candy, deli foods, etc. - empty shelves- messy aisles - unhelpful staff( I can go on! )Tonight, my boyfriend and I were followed and harassed by a homeless man!?! Seriously, followed us with no shame and demanding money / food / help! When he was done with us he spotted a woman shopping alone in a frozen aisle and cornered her! Suh-KurRr-Rity?!!!?! When you are ready to check out there is usually 1-3 open cashiers... During rush hours? I often feel like the staff choose to ignore its customers and I don't blame them! Seriously, if you're looking to be in and out in less than 5 mins... Chances are it ain't gonna happen! ... Try your luck at Pete's or even Target!

39.description: Nice looking store.  I went there cuz they have a TCF bank, and I needed to make a deposit.  Instead of continuing on to Dominick's on Roosevelt I stayed and shopped here.  No good.  I can't tell you how many times people either walked right into me or just plain pushed me outta the way.  Selection was better than most Jewels I've been to, but I won't be coming back.  Jewel needs to get serious about stocking more healthy food items.  I guess this store isn't about that though.

9.description: I come here once a year hoping it will get better, and yet it only gets worse: more moldy produce, loosely stocked produce shelves, sketchy meat selections, (no free range chicken options) and loud employees. Why couldn't have Dominick's bought Jewel out and not the other way around?!!!?!

29.description: Some of the fruit had mold on it!Everything I picked up expiration date was like two days away from going bad!Staff was no help at all!Lines were ridiculous!I was only in the area figure I would pick up a few things however it was very difficult because it didn't seem they had much of anything Next time I will just keep driving to Dominick's!

23.description: Remember that scene from Police Academy 2 where Bobcat Goldthwait and his gang rob that grocery store, and the whole time the grocery store workers just stand and stare at them, apparently unable to react to external stimuli?  Yep, that's what it's like shopping here.As others have mentioned, the produce section is gross, with regular moldy and overripe fruit and veggies.  Lots of meat with current-day expiry dates... lots of unstocked shelves in the grocery.  But after you find what you came for (or at least a reasonable non-moldy substitute) you have to go and try to check out.  And there is where this Jewel goes from poor-leaning mediocrity to a soul-consuming hellfire of atrociousness.  No matter what time you are here, there is a wait of no less than 20 minutes.  Bring a book, or grab a magazine off the rack, because even though there might only be 3 carts in front of you, you'll still be waiting a third of an hour.  Thinking of heading over to the self checkout lanes?  Such innocence.  Things are only worse over there.  Two of the machines consistently break, and the two "working" machines are so slow and freeze up so often the line usually ends up snaking halfway down the pasta aisle.  Now, I'll admit, 20 minutes is probably fair waiting time for the standard grocery-store rush no matter where you are... 5-6ish in the evening, or a saturday or sunday afternoon, but "rush" times at this jewel apparently do not warrant more than the standard 2 registers operating and your wait time simply climbs into the 30-40 minute range.  One time the guy in front of me started a stopwatch on his phone and then showed it to the cashier when he got to her showing 35 minutes to which her response was "Do you have a Jewel plus card?"  What I'm saying is that if the tollway started operating like this Jewel's checkout then we wouldn't have to worry about giving Metra any more money.I really wanted to like this Jewel.  I did.  It's got a lot going for it.  It's nice and sizeable, with a pretty big parking lot.  It's in a decent shopping center with some other useful stores nearby.  The deli and butcher counters are bigger than the paltry 5 feet a lot of other Jewels in the city offer.  There is an adequate liquor section.  It's very close to my house.  So much promise, yet such a failure on so many levels.

5.description: I never thought Jewel would be that place I stopped after work to grab a six pack. But it totally is. They have a decent enough craft beer selection to where you should find something you'll be happy with drinking. And at an okay price. Lagunitas bombers on sale for 2.99 is hard to beat. Like any Jewel, I only come here out of convenience, laziness and Redbox. And sometimes chicken wings. I'm not above Jewel chicken wings. Them shits is good. The worst thing about this Jewel is it costs me a few bucks sometimes to pay the bums in the parking lot to go away and leave me alone, because Chicago. Bum tax adds up over time.F%#king Rahm.

31.description: I really like this Jewel, but I have experienced a lot of the same problems as the other reviewers.  Maybe a part of me likes this Jewel because this used to be the only grocery store within reasonable distance of UIC's campus (you can walk from West Campus or take the Roosevelt bus from East).  None of those stores at Canal and Roosevelt existed when I lived at UIC, so this place was my go-to for all things groceries (and I know tons of students still shop here).I agree that the parking lot can be totally insane.  However, I've had the opposite problem of other reviewers: everyone is insanely slow.  I feel like every time I come in here all of the idiot drivers in Illinois have congregated in this parking lot just to drift around slowly.  It's as if no one understands where they're going or what is happening so it's impossible to get into a parking lane.  The staff are OK - I've had completely polar experiences here so I'm not really sure how to feel about the employees overall.  Some are totally rude and some are totally awesome, so it's really hit or miss.  In general, I never need to talk to anyone, so I can avoid the people who are in a bad mood.  The baggers in this store are awesome, mostly because a lot of them are my former students, so that's awesome.  I know all of those guys are nice and polite, so that's a plus.The store itself is quite large - bigger than a lot of other Jewels in the area.  There's tons of stuff in here and their produce generally seems to be in order.  Every time I come in, someone is arranging, stocking or clearing out produce so I get the impression that they're on top of everything.  There's also a large selection of take-and-go products for lunch, in case that's how you roll.  The Osco selection is awesome, especially for seasonal stuff.  This Osco has more seasonal selections than others in the area and that always makes me happy.  Oh, and a huge $1 (or 10 for $10) section - yay!And it's in a giant strip mall complete with some food and some not-so-classy clothing stores.  Who doesn't like grabbing a bite to eat after all of that grocery shopping?  Don't forget to go to the Dunkin Donuts and get some ice cream.... yum.

25.description: So this is my new spot for groceries since my roommate and her vehicle moved to LA. It's close enough for me to take the bus to when carrying sacks of food. But the convienence is the only reason to go there really. The produce is not very good and everytime I go there it seems to be picked over. Moreover, this store is ALWAYS crowded! I have shopped at some odd hours and it never seems to die down. Going there is usually a chore and I can't even wait until the rumored Pete's Fresh Market opens on Western.

12.description: This place is such a bummer!!! I don't drive so it's really my only choice for those nights where I just need to stop after work for a few items. This is really my own fault; if I planned ahead 100% I would have been like "Jewel Who?!" .... but I don't :( I always need those last minute things...a birthday card, chap stick, something with sugar in it, the usual last minute things. Let me say that not all of the employees are callus, crazy people. There are some really sweet people who work there. But every time I go in, there are "undercover" security guys who work loss prevention stationed at every door and even in front of every other check out lane. They glare at you and hover. I really want to tell them that even though I was thoroughly tempted to steal cans of fancy feast cat food, tampons, and frozen yogurt (not really), they really should be checking out the group of 7 teenage boys who just came in hooping and hollering. I know it's their job but it gets intimidating and very old after a while. Cons: - Pharmacy is super understaffed. I've waited for a prescription that I had called in the day before for 35 minutes- Lines are always very slow- People use the self checkout stations for huge amounts of stuff and nobody stops them (it's 12 items OR LESS, PEOPLE)- Pretty ghetto. I've been sexually harassed twice in the parking lot and there are always people outside selling candy bars or DVDs. There are always big Escalades in the parking lot BLARING music. I've seen people just dump trash out their windows too. Pros:- Pretty good wine/beet/liquor selection- Dunkin Donuts is right next door -yum!- Close to the 12 bus and UIC

37.description: Yay! I love Jewel! I wish we had one in Michigan. The Jewel brand cereals are the best. I was disapointed with the reusable grocery bags, mine broke! Oh well, it was only a dollar. But the totes at Meijer are a lot better.

21.description: This is really close to our home, so I come here often for big-time shopping. They often are out of some usual stuff that I need, but here is why I am a big fan (having lived in Chicago for a long time and having dealt with some bad customer service): I went to see if there was any rotissorie (spelling sorry) chickens available and there were none sitting out. Then I did my usually grocery shopping and this lovely woman approached me from the store and asked if I needed any help. I hesitated but asked about the chickens. She brought me back over by the deli and scored me one right there (at 11am on Sunday morning). Often times at this store I am quite surprised (only from dealing with other stores) about how helpful they are and how many associates are around, willing to answer questions.This experience was a while back - and I owed them a good review then - so hopefully this lady is still around!

16.description: I really like this Jewel, but I have experienced a lot of the same problems as the other reviewers.  Maybe a part of me likes this Jewel because this used to be the only grocery store within reasonable distance of UIC's campus (you can walk from West Campus or take the Roosevelt bus from East).  None of those stores at Canal and Roosevelt existed when I lived at UIC, so this place was my go-to for all things groceries (and I know tons of students still shop here).I agree that the parking lot can be totally insane.  However, I've had the opposite problem of other reviewers: everyone is insanely slow.  I feel like every time I come in here all of the idiot drivers in Illinois have congregated in this parking lot just to drift around slowly.  It's as if no one understands where they're going or what is happening so it's impossible to get into a parking lane.  The staff are OK - I've had completely polar experiences here so I'm not really sure how to feel about the employees overall.  Some are totally rude and some are totally awesome, so it's really hit or miss.  In general, I never need to talk to anyone, so I can avoid the people who are in a bad mood.  The baggers in this store are awesome, mostly because a lot of them are my former students, so that's awesome.  I know all of those guys are nice and polite, so that's a plus.The store itself is quite large - bigger than a lot of other Jewels in the area.  There's tons of stuff in here and their produce generally seems to be in order.  Every time I come in, someone is arranging, stocking or clearing out produce so I get the impression that they're on top of everything.  There's also a large selection of take-and-go products for lunch, in case that's how you roll.  The Osco selection is awesome, especially for seasonal stuff.  This Osco has more seasonal selections than others in the area and that always makes me happy.  Oh, and a huge $1 (or 10 for $10) section - yay!And it's in a giant strip mall complete with some food and some not-so-classy clothing stores.  Who doesn't like grabbing a bite to eat after all of that grocery shopping?  Don't forget to go to the Dunkin Donuts and get some ice cream.... yum.

17.description: I love this Jewel.  We recently moved here and we struggled to find a good one stop grocery store for a long time.  And then I found this.  I never have any trouble with the staff- most of them I find to be friendly and engaging.  I also have never been there and seen obnoxious lines.  It's like every other place I go to.  I love the huge selection of basically everything and the liquor loft.  Everything is always stocked full and easy to see.  We have had issues with the other customers being rude and obnoxious but not the staff.

10.description: I just had a terrible experience at this location.Today I borrowed my friend's car to shop for a party I am hosting tomorrow. After about an hour of shopping I checked out with a healthy amount of groceries. The cashier told me my credit card was declining. This was very confusing to me since I was more than a grand under my limit and have never experienced issues with my card. I then handed the cashier my debit card and it was also declined. The only option I had was to have my girlfriend use her card, and it was also declined! Three cards were declined (from multiple banks and card companies) and the cashier and shift manager stated (and stood by the fact that) it was our cards and not their system that was malfunctioning. Since Jewel wasn't taking our cards, I drove home quickly to grab my checkbook. Upon returning and writing the check, the shift manager told me they don't accept out-of-state checks! He could have told me this BEFORE I drove home? Nah, too logical. I ended up spending the surcharge at the store's ATM machine to withdraw the cash needed to pay the check. Kind of funny that my declining card was able to withdraw a cash amount greater than the price of my groceries (when it was my card that was malfunctioning and not Jewel's system), am I right?tldr; Jewel didn't take my multiple credit cards. Blamed it on my cards and not their system. My card worked fine withdrawing cash from their ATM. Employees and management are rude and incompetent.

11.description: WoW, lotsa hate for this Jewel.  I guess since I don't do my main shopping here I may not be privy to all of the dirty little secrets.  This is my "close to work" Jewel.  I go here to pick up a few odds and ends I may need for dinner - if they are on sale.  Or if I want a salad for lunch, they have a decent pre-packaged FRESH salad selection that I get.  Maybe I need a last minute birthday or gift card - I hit up this Jewel-Osco.  One thing I will echo - the lines are really slow here, no matter what time of day.  Not sure why? I try to get to the self-check out lines, but sometimes those are a nightmare as well - but usually I am just so giddy to be out of the office for a little while, it doesn't really bother me - until it bothers me....

26.description: A really mediocre place. Skip the fruit, veggie and fish section 'cause you can never find fresh stuff over there. Go straight for the price-cut items. If you're not very faithful to certain brands, you probably can get a good bang for your bucks. They have an OK pastry section but batch variation does exist. The pharmacy has nothing special; waiting time is usually around half an hour.

27.description: Why do i put myself through this ? I continue to go here knowing that I'm going to have a headache afterwards. Things have improved a tad bit however you typically get Strange attitudes from the cashiers.. as if they don't want to be there ! well one day Katgirl got fed up after spending my $160 of cold hard cash there. The Cashier didn't speak and didn't even bother giving me my total so I requested a manager after I had paid and everything was bagged up. When I told the manager what my problem was with 10 people in line behind me. I politely told them to take everything out of the bags and give me a refund as I'd rather go elsewhere! so needless to say. I'm always greeted and even told to have a nice  day when I leave.. sometimes people will just take you there and you go right along with them! ..

35.description: This Jewel used to be a lot better, but it's really gone down in quality lately.  I'm guessing it's because they can't afford to pay enough people to man the registers.  The lines for check-out look like the lines for Space Mountain pre-Fast Pass era.  The meat selection isn't as good as Dominick's, but the rest of their selections are ok.  There always seems to be someone passing out booze samples which is excellent because I pretty much need five drinks to make it through the check-out line.  Yesterday it was mojitos.  Mmm...mojitos.  I come here because it's by my house, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

8.description: Pros:+Good Hours+Ample Free ParkingCons:-Staff-Pricing-Expired Goods-Rotting ProduceI really wanted to like you Jewel Osco, I really did. This particular Jewel Osco is particularly horrible. My goodness, if people where more accustomed to shopping at the ethnic food stores or Aldi down the street in Pilsen this place would have tanked. The staff just DOES NOT want to be there AT ALL. Why is it that one of the U-Scan kiosks is always off? It's always out of order. There are NEVER enough bags in the bag dispensers in the U-Scan either, usually only one set of bags ever. Why do I have to interrupt the U-Scan Cashier's conversation to ask for help? The pricing here is outlandish compared to everywhere else in the area. Would it be so hard to add a button for salad bar? Do the people who stock items know how to look for expired canned goods or rotting produce? Whole Foods pricing for terrible quality and experience.  I recommend only coming here if you need something very specific or nowhere else is open.Also PLEASE patrol your parking lot, I hate being asked for change every time I go in there, sometimes its the same exact people who come and ask.

0.description: Jewels, because it's technically south of Roosevelt and generalizations would indicate only meatballs live south of Roosevelt.  "Hon I'm gonna run to da Jewels for some of dem sahsages."  MEATBALL!After years of being a grocery store loyalist to ANY store except for Jewel...I've found myself here more times in one year than I had been in 8 years combined.  The Jewel battle is one I've come to terms with only because they have a RedBox and a surprisingly decent, albeit small, craft beer selection.  Holla!The good things stop there.  Could someone explain to me the importance of hot links and Black History Month?  I must have missed that section in my American Studies class, yet someone came home with "buy 1, get 1" hot links because the sign in the case said "in honor of Black History Month".  Really?  I mean, really??  Whatever, those were some surprisingly good grocery store hot links and I may or may not be hoping that sale rolls around again come February, because it sure didn't come around this summer!On a serious note though, the employees here kind of really dislike customers, and customer service, and moving at a pace faster than molasses (unless of course you have a question, then it's a race to get to them).  I went to purchase some balloons and after the girl rolled her eyes and gave me enough attitude, she thanked me for being "an easy customer" and not one of the customers she "has to keep from fighting."  I could see wanting to clock a customer if you're behind the service desk, but in the floral department?  Balloons are happy items, not fighting items.  This seems to be the general attitude of pretty much anyone who works here though, except the guys in the meat department.  They're actually really nice.  Everyone else?  They suck.  I don't even require smiles and actual pleasantries because I understand the awfulness that is people.  I really just want to be able to find an employee for help when needed without them walking away before I can even approach them.  That reminds me, the security guard that patrols the front is kind of hilarious.  He told one guy he had to move from the fire lane until he said "ah, I don't wanna park this car tho, feel me?" because it had rims and a nice paint job and the security man apparently felt him because he let him stay.  Meanwhile, he makes little old men move while they are waiting for their little old wives to come out with their cane and their cart.This Jewel is back assward, but it's really close to home and carries the stuff the Mexican grocers usually don't have, which is why I keep coming back.  Good luck if you're coming for the RedBox though.

38.description: This is one of the better Jewel stores I have been to in this city. The main reason being it is never crowded when I go. I usually go after work to pick up groceries for dinner and it is never crowded.It is also one of the cleanest Jewels I've seen. May be it is because it is not crowded. Service is typical Jewel style, non-existent. You do not always find what you are looking for. But, I go there because I can shop at peace.

20.description: I like the few organic choices.  They really need to become a little more education on sustainable and fair trade merchandise if they expect to stay afloat.  They need to make major changes.  They have the history and resources to do such things.

19.description: Convenient for me BUT one of the worst damn Jewel-Osco in Chicago (The one 75th is the worst).I have taken spoiled fish, chicken and steak back to the customer service desk several times. The lines are always long as hell. The keep ONLY two registers open very damn day. If you go here make sure your meat and fish ain't spoiled. The lady who looks like Tupac in the deli gave me major tude. This Jewel is a damn hot mess.

33.description: This is the worst Jewel on planet Earth.  If you make it out alive and have all of your groceries then you have accomplished an amazing feat.  I have been to that Jewel exactly 4 times and exactly 4 times I have been approached by someone with a Link Card (Welfare), asking if they could purchase my groceries with their card and I would just give them the cash.  I did not realize it at the time but I researched that the Link Card is electronically controlled for the purchase of certain items only like, you know, diapers and bread not alcohol and cigarettes.  Anyways this one time I saw a lady dumb enough to pay for her groceries with this guys Link Card.  The guy got the cash from the lady and then took the ladies groceries and all the manager saw was the fact that the groceries were purchased with the guys Link Card so they are, in effect, his.  What a sinking ship this place is.

2.description: Less than average experience but very convenient location. The produce section is so slow. It's a struggle finding someone to service you. Because I generally come here for fresh produce, I'm less than impressed. I will say they are usually clean. They could stand to hire more people. Management relies too heavily on the self checkout. I'm often stuck in long lines because only one lane is open.

34.description: Welcome to what I call the "Time Distortion Jewel".  Bear with me please.  I'm not a physicist.  The parking lot is out of control.  Always.  It's like an obstacle course minus the fun.  At high speeds I might add.  Be extraordinarily careful and make sure your, ahem, car insurance is in order.  Just in case.  Enter Jewel.  Tiiiiiiiiiiiiiimmmmmmmmmme sloooooooooooooooooooows dooooooooooooooooowwwwnnnnn. It's really weird.  The parking lot is like one of those super fast forward videos but the inside...not so much.  Inside the store time has slowed.  At least it appears that way.  I checked my heart beat once and it seemed to be beating at normal speed.  But would I really be aware of that if I've entered a time distortion?  I bet Guinan from Star Trek would know.  This jewel is always packed.  Always.  I know some of the reviews say it's empty but it's always packed these days.  And that sucks.  Crowds in the store moving veeerrry slooowwwwly.  I'm trying to navigate my way through the store and people just graze.  I hate it.  Why do people do that?  The check out lines usually go all the way to the back of the store.  Just kidding.  Maybe.   Nobody cares.  There's never enough cashiers here.  I feel like a nuerotic on speed when I'm here.  I think people think I'm crazy.  The cashiers are surly.  And slow.  Surly and slow.  Super fantastic.  Ok, enough whining about the slowness.  Other than that, it's a decent enough Jewel.   Drug store dept., booze section, good selection of cereals (including my fav - Jewel instant oatmeal - love it!).  Jewel sometimes has good deals on Lean Cuisines and other boxed meals.  I never buy my meats, baked goods, or veggies at Jewel.  Those items aren't very good and I can get better deals elsewhere.In conclusion, it's important to remember that what you may experience here is an illusion.  Time isn't going any faster in the parking lot or any slower in the store.   The seconds and minutes of your life are still fading away, however, never to return.

32.description: I came here often when I was over by the UIC campus and I swear this seems to be the place where hoodrats from the neighboring housing projects seem to congregate. Not to mention they have the nastiest a** bathrooms on the west side of Chicago. The washrooms would either have no toilet paper or soap and the hand dryer would be broken and it would smell bad in there. Not only did I complain about this to store management on numerous occassions this was something that never seemed to be on their high list of priorities. It's to the point I am going to issue a letter to corporate office about the standards since they're good at cleaning the floors, but not the bathrooms which looked like something I would typically see at  a local park. I've seen cleaner bathrooms than what I saw at this location and ones that smell better too. They have a great selection of items, but it seems like they don't have a great track record for presentation and customer satisfaction.

18.description: Noone is ever available to help the shopper here.  Good selection if you can find the stuff.Produce is only fair.I never shop here for meats.I try to avoid the place because I like produce---and the quality of produce here is not good.I wish it were better---it's really close to where I live.

13.description: They have a great selection of processed foods... Other than that, why is that every time I want to buy bread, their bread is either about to expire that day or the day after? The bacon selection is awful and does not look like good meat. They have good sales, but I would really like to see fresher foods and an updated store.

4.description: I go to the Jewel-Osco when:A) I've forgotten something I needed at a better grocery store that can't be purchased at the Mexican corner storeB) I need liquor and happen to be driving down Ashland/RooseveltOther than that, I find Jewel-Osco to have a really underwhelming yet overpriced selection of everything, and for some reason, there always seems to be 1000 people each buying a dozen things in every checkout aisle. It's like no one does ALL their grocery shopping there, just wants to clog up every checkout lane being just over the limit of items for the ten items or less express lane. And don't even get me started on the ridiculous stamp program, that would earn you a free cooking pot (retail value: $9.99, if that) once you've collected about $10000 worth of little "stamp saver" stamps that convert to 1 stamp per $10 spent. Howabout I just buy 50 cooking pots when I need them and skip the 50 cents you've added onto every item in the store paying for this program. I don't even find the RedBox here to be that great, or have much more that you couldn't find on Netflix/Amazon Prime. This Jewel is a store-of-last-resort!

24.description: Pros: open 24 hours, liquor samplesCons: trashy, gross, overpriced, long lines, bitchy cashiers, etc

6.description: I try to buy fresh produce elsewhere, when possible, but this grocery store has just about everything you need in a pinch--I usually end up going here out of convenience or when I don't have enough time to make it to a higher-end store. That being said, the people who work here have been nothing but friendly and helpful. I was shopping early one morning and looking for one item that wasn't out for the day yet; the man who worked there stopped what he was doing to go to the back and get it for me, which was nice. This place is great for any non-perishable items (canned goods, birthday cards, laundry detergent) and is reasonably priced; I've just had a bad experience with mold a time or two, so just give any produce you may be buying a good look over before you get to the register!

22.description: It's a Jewel-Osco, not the best neighborhood, but close for University Village residents. I do not enjoy this place, however, the liquor store across the street called Lucky's is a landmark for loitering and otherwise ill and shady stuff. Produce - Poor to Decent (negligible in winter)Bakery/Deli - Non-mentionableSelection in aisles - reasonable yet missing many of my brandsSpecialty Items - PoorEthnic fare - Very poorLiquor (Osco) - Mediocre and standard

15.description: I have given up on this Jewel for Pete's Market! First of all the several times I have been there the Customer Service is lacking at the Registers.  Last night was my final visit here.  The cashier must not know what the word thank you means! I had to thank her for taking my money.There is a good selection of items here, but the store is very cramped and it is missing something.  It appears to be messy all the time and just not a good experience at all. Sorry Jewel, I grew up with you guys, but this location has left a lot to be desired for.  Pete's Market will be first on my list.

7.description: If I could put negative a million stars I would. Holy crap does anybody have past a preschool education working here??? I can't. Produce is always low, and crappy. They didn't know how to work the register and I spent 20 minutes as they re ran every single thing on my list. Seriously what is with this place?? It's the only close grocery store to me so I have no other option. But it is just the absolute WORST

36.description: I love me the Jewel-Osco but this place is the pits for sure.Huge store, amazing selection but it is perpetually understaffed.  I shopped here consistently for 6 months and was never able to run in and out because lines are always very long.  The only plus side?  They are the only place in town where I've found Leinenkugel's Creamy Dark.  That right there is worth one star.  That beer is epic.

30.description: Words for the wise:1. There is never any produce here worth buying. Ever. Don't be fooled. Drive the extra two miles and go to Pete's on Cermak and Western-ish.2. Don't go here on the 1st of the month. Ever. There is not any food left on the shelves. This is not me hating on people who depend on the government to eat (I work in a free clinic after all), this is me hating on the Jewel-Osco for not purchasing/replenishing even though they know the majority of purchases in their store occurs on the 1st.3. Don't go here on a Sunday. Ever. There are never any lanes open for buying your groceries, but there is about 50 people trying to check out at the same time.4. The only thing worth buying at this location is beer and liquor. They just renovated their booze section and it is flossy to the max. Prices are cheap too (it is Jewel after all) and now that the doors close on the beer coolers, the beer is actually chilled too - what a bonus!5. If you want deli food, especially just before dinner, expect a 20 minute wait. And don't get crabby about it, you've now been warned.To recap: for produce go to Pete's, for groceries avoid this place on the 1st and Sundays (don't even get me started about when Sunday and the 1st are the same day... omg torturous), and if you need booze this is now the place to go in town (Lucky's bulletproof glass is there for a reason kids, its ok to not feel safe).

3.description: Nasty! I have been in this Jewel a couple times the past few weeks and every single time I've been in there the bathrooms have been absolutely disgusting. Thave smelled like pee and poop and most of them don't even have toilet paper. Obviously they don't have anyone who attends the bathrooms and they are so disgusting, you gag when you step in. My second complaint would be make sure you pay attention to the fruit because they have a lot of bugs inside the containers. Gross!

14.description: This Jewel sucks, but I'm too lazy to drive an additional 5 blocks to a different grocery store. About 90% of their employees are rude, and they're always understaffed (I'm sure there's some sort of causal relationship there). The selection in the store is fine enough and it's usually not insanely busy like other Jewel stores in the city can be. Also, the liquor section is at the front of the store, near the cigarette counter cashier, which is nice if you just want to run in, grab some beer and get out quickly. Generally, it does the job for groceries, but it's never an especially pleasant experience.

3.description: If you are looking for cheap holiday decorations, or fun arts and crafts projects, this is a great place to go! While a lot of related stores seem empty, dirty, and out of date, this location presents a refreshing change. Maybe it is because of the city-based location, but the store is bright, clean, full of merchandise, and always a good way to spend an afternoon creating projects.*Helpful Hint: Before buying anything, do a quick Google search for coupons or sign up for their Monthly Newsletter. You will almost certainty find a coupon for an extra 20% off of your total purchase.

1.description: I found what I needed - for cheap - to complete my DIY Halloween costume! My only complaint/surprise was that while their selection of fabric SEEMED robust and I EVENTUALLY found what I needed, the prices varied so greatly. In most cases I couldn't understand why a yard of simple cotton fabric was nearly the same price as fleece or flannel. All the random stuff was on sale which is fine but plain ole' cotton... expensivo! Good thing I needed the random cheap stuff!got asked once for help, to which we declined, and were gladly left alone for the rest of our visit hunting down my fabric. The lady cutting the yard was quiet and didn't say much other than "how much do you need?" Also fine. The lady at the register was friendly and polite.

0.description: I love this Jo-Ann Fabric & Craft store; it's my go-to for all my Pinterest dreams and Etsy recreations come to life. The store is always bright and clean when I visit, shelves stocked well, and items are easy to find. Not to mention Jo-Ann mails and e-mails great coupons - I've currently got 3 for 40%, 50%, and 60% off any regularly priced items, plus one for 20% off the total purchase (I don't think you can combine them, but all still great deals!). If you forget to bring them and you get a nice cashier, sometimes the staff will even scan coupons lying around the register for you. Jo-Ann lives up to its name with lots of fun fabric materials, a large seasonal section in the front of the store, and sections for knitting, crocheting & sewing, baking, jewelry making, wood, paper & photo crafts, foam, paint, glitter, etc. and all the supplies you need to work with them. Staff are visible around the store and approachable, and I'm usually asked if I need help finding anything as I browse around without having to seek anyone out. This location also has in-store classes for things like knitting, sewing, and more. I come here whenever I have a creative project I'm working on.

2.description: I was at JoAnn's yesterday to pick somethings for my Halloween costume. After getting my fabric and other various things I proceeded to checkout. I was helped by Rosemary, she is awesome! On top of helping me out she also had to deal with answering the phone and helping other customers with their issues. She was very apologetic and I was patient as I have worked retail so I know how hectic things can be. She also figured out why some of my items weren't coming up as the correct price and walked me through my receipt item by item. Even though I was there for over 20 mins, Rosemary maintained to utmost amount of customer service I've seen in a very long time! The only thing I would say, considering it was the day before Halloween I felt there should have been more people working as there were only 2 cashiers and the line continued to get longer.

5.description: One of the very best retail experiences I have ever had.  When I was walking into the store I met Claire.  All I needed was a special zipper to take to a tailor and she took her time to show me the right thing purchase.  Very positive attitude and very knowledgeable putting the customers needs as a priority.  I recommend Clair to be the national trainer for Jo-Ann Fabric. Amazing person and fantastic experience.

6.description: I am writing this as I am waiting in line to check out on a Saturday afternoon. There are at least 10 customers waiting in line to check out with only one cash register open. The wait is unacceptable. This store definitely needs better staffing. It is ridiculous to wait more than 30 minutes to check out. Will be taking my business elsewhere.

7.description: I have always had a good experience at other Jo Ann fabric stores so I saw no problem going to this one. That was not the case this time however. I was VERY unimpressed with this stores customer service. When asked where a certain fabric was the employee answered by saying the back wall, not pointing in any certain direction and also walking away as she answered. After searching and finally finding the fabric I went to the counter to get the fabric cut there was not an employee to be found. When the employee came to help I showed her how much I needed and she said "you need to tell me an exact amount. It's my job to measure it" in a very snarky tone. I will not be returning to this store because of the lack of help and the lack of respect that I received from the employees.

8.description: This is a great store. I planned my daughter's 6th birthday party here and got the dates mixed up and planned the party for the weekend before I was supposed to. I called Gaby at the store in a panic a few hours before my party was to start explaining and saying all our guests were about to arrive there in a few hours, could they help me and host the party there anyway that day? I told her I did not even care if I did not have an instructor and I would do the clean up and mop the floors, whatever. She got it together for me and found an instructor and everything! The instructor was also super nice, doing whatever it took to make sure the kids did not feel rushed or anything. Above and beyond the duty! The end result was my daughter's birthday party was saved and everyone had a great time! I would highly recommend. We always love these types of crafts stores anyway, but now we are customers here for life. We have always had great service here but now, this is just about as good as it gets!

9.description: I don't understand the negative reviews. Maybe it was just hopefully that particular incident or when they first opened .But my experiences have been great. I love crafting: crocheting, knitting, cross stitching & sewing so I frequent this location. The customer service is very friendly each time I visit. Rude to assume most associates don't know what they are talking about. Ask any way, if they don't know an answer they'll ask someone who might. I don't expect every associate to know every field of crafting. I've asked about sewing & crocheting & they knew the answer. Ironically I did ask a glue question & they truthfully told me they were not familiar or have ever tried those 2 particular glues (spray adhesives) Most are,I'm sure trying & learning as they go, even if they were "just hired anyway".  That's what I hope happens when people are in need of jobs. I used to work in retail myself & understand how rude customers can be. & I've overheard plenty of unpleasant ones at this location  alone. The place is nice and organized, could be fully staffed most days but I'm sure that's a managerial issue. They have fun dollar deals & candy at check out that get me every time.

10.description: If you are a crafter it is hard to exscape the lure of Jo-Anns and its oh so tempting coupons and sales. I do try and limit my purchases to notions and craft supplies. There is a perfectly good fabric store (there are actually 3) right in that area that I don't want to see go out of business because they put a Jo-Anns (in my opinion) way to close. This store is nice because it is South of the City and never seems overly crowded (unlike the nightmare on Elston).  I frequent Jo-Anns (I might have a slight problem). On my most recent trip to the store. The woman who was working the cutting counter was very nice. She actually sewed and was very chatty. I was very impressed because I don't normally find the associates working in the store to be chatty or very interested in your project. Then I got to the cash wrap and that is where it all went down hill.  I have two mailers the most current and the previous. I am in on a week where one is about to end and the other one is about to start. Now, I am here because I have a coupon. I have multiple coupons one of them should work.  Her attitude was the thing that gave me the most annoyance. Normally, the check out process is pretty painless and the associates are well versed on how to scan a coupon because most people shop their because of the coupons. She clearly was not and did not seem to want to help not sure what better thing she had to do since she was assigned to be the cashier and we were the only people in line.  Anyway, I guess she thought just because she was throwing attitude that would make me not use a coupon.  Sorry, young Miss the coupon and sales are what keep me coming back definitely not the service.  I will say this was the first time I found someone working in the store to be borderline rude.  I guess we all have moments where the day is not going well so I am hoping this was an isolated incident. Otherwise, I rather brave the crowds at the Elston store for better checkout service.

4.description: This place is awesome. The employees are nice and polite. They are not annoying and don't keep bothering you with offers or deals they have going on that day every so often.
