They politely ask if I need help. They help when I do and let me be when I don't. They have everything neatly stocked which makes what I'm shopping for very easy.

3.description: I love the new Burlington Coat Factor on canal street. I like that there is an indoor parking garage too. The store is new so it's organized and clean. I like shopping their for the deals on dresses and so far I bought a nice scarf and some throw pillows. I'm looking forward to find some excuse to shop around here.

1.description: Horrible customer service. Not even a nod or grunt when checking out. Silence. I'm sorry that I was so polite to you, dear cashiers. Is it too much to expect?

2.description: Love shopping here, love their layaway program, love the cheap deals and discounts, and sales. Working here is definitely different. Management could have done a better job with making their employees feel valuable and important and not like a resource.

5.description: Went in here yesterday to do some shopping and unfortunately I didn't find anything I liked and wanted to have my ticket validated. I was told that they don't validate tickets unless you make a purchase and that no other stores would do it either.....wait a minute, since when do I have to purchase something to have my ticket validated??  I am being forced to buy something, anything, just to  validate my ticket? Thankfully, the guys over at Dick's validated it without a problem. Guess what Burlington, you didn't get my business that time and you're not getting it ever!

6.description: I've been raving about this location since it opened recommending everyone to go...  was happy all three visits. Today I attempted to return a scarf that I bought for my boss as a gift, she hated it :-) got to love honesty! My two stars are for the handling of the attempted return. After my honesty was questioned I was so aggravated I asked them to throw the damn thing away. The first two people I encountered we're attempting to be helpful. I was fairly certain I gave my phone number in case of a return as I had the two previous visits. I assume this expedites in a flawless return.

0.description: Similarly, I've forsaken Burlington Coat Factory some time ago even though I consider myself a discount-thrift-store client.  Today, I must announce that this prodigal son has come back to my arms.  This Burlington Coat Factory location is so bright, clean, and spacious!  I couldn't believe that I walked into a Burlington.  Initially, I had to make sure I wasn't at the wrong place from the get-go, yet I confirmed that I was indeed at a Burlington.  It was a pleasurable shopping experience at this specific location.  I now can no longer go back to the one on the State St.  However, just like other Burlington locations, their women's accessory department didn't seem to have a lot to offer.  Their prices on this category were competitive, but they were too generic and qualities weren't superior.  If you're a fan of Betsey Johnson merchandize, they always have a lot of past-season BJ items at reasonable prices.  I used to LOVE Betsey, but I grew out of her stuff and have now moved on to like more subdued, sophisticated designers.  Disclaimer: I still think highly about Betsey.  I've never lost my respect to her and always appreciated her contributions to the fashion industry worldwide. Ironically, the outerwear section of this Burlington location wasn't that exciting, as far as I could see.  Why did they call themselves a "coat factory" when they lack the "coat" selections the most out of all categories?  I would say if you've, at some point, lost faith in Burlington Coat Factory when you constantly, absolutely find nothing in there, come check this new location out to re-gain some of your trust on this retailer.

4.description: I am a serious discount shopper who had given up on Burlington coat factory years ago. But the new BCF on Canal in the south loop has brought me back as a regular. The store is clean, spacious and bright. The merchandise is orderly and organized. There is plenty of space to zoom around and look at items. Since opening, I have found so many great deals that this is now my go to place when all other places fail me.   Burlington comes to the rescue for me time and again.  I have found some killer clothes and household items. Every aisle is a new adventure. I recently found several items at Burlington coat factory that were identical to items I found at the Bloomingdales outlet in Rosemont , except the BCF price was about 75% less. Don't take my word for it, see it for yourself. You will not be sorry.

3.description: Discovered this place while visiting Chicago for work and while I've only been here a little over a week I've been there three times and actually on my way there as soon as I get done with this review!  It's fantastic!  I get the pastrami/Corned beef 50/50 on club bread. If you call it a french roll they'll crack wise and break your stones a bit!  The guys behind the counter are a little cantankerous but I really think that's part of this places charm.  They like to bust balls a little bit so it's all in good fun.  Great sandwich, awesome mustard, I'd avoid their potato pancake, it's greasy.  14.95 is a bit pricey for a sandwich but they load it up and your stuffed leaving. So 15 bucks isn't that much when you consider you'll waddle out of their with a belly full of goodness .  Enough of this review.. I MUST AWAY!

1.description: I don't know what has happened to this place. I was there Tuesday am. ( 9-9) The corned beef wasn't warm and it had a funny taste. Like the quality has fallen. I took some home and my wife are a few slices. The rest we threw out. The potato pancakes were room temperature. Very mediocre. How does a famous corned beef cafeteria all of a sudden serve mediocre food? Even the color of the meat was off. An all around mediocre meal. I may try another special there but I've given up on the corned beef.

2.description: I placed a decently sized order through Grubhub today, as I have an apartment full of the flu, and we could use some matzo ball soup. I decided to stock up on soups, bagels, and ginger ale for the weekend, in the hopes we'd all be better by the end of the weekend. Unfortunately, 3 hours later, the order had not arrived. When I called, I was informed that the order was delivered at 3...which is impossible given I placed the order at 2:45p, and I don't live in the neighborhood. They said it would be another hour if I still wanted the order. I decided that I still wanted the order, even though it would be four hours late. I was a bit surprised, however, because they seemed to be convinced they'd delivered it. Had I not called, I never would have gotten the order, and I would have lost all of that money.Speaking of all of that money, this place is so overpriced! I decided to surprise my boyfriend with his favorite, cheesecake, for taking care of me and exposing himself to the flu. For $5, I expected a sizable piece of cake - not so. This cheesecake slice was SO TINY! On top of that, they brought less cans of ginger ale than I had paid for, because "they were out of it"......okay...so then don't charge me for it! The fact that it cost me $52 to have one large soup, a few bagels/creamcheese, two (charged for three) cans of soda, and a slice of tiny cheesecake is ridiculous. All things considered, I probably won't order again, nor will I visit again, which is too bad, since there aren't really other authentic deli options available (that I have found).

5.description: I have been a customer at MANNY'S on Jefferson for some 20 years now. I know nothubg about this "food court" location, so I would suggest staying away from it based on other comments. The ONLY place to go is the real deli on Jefferson. This is the favorite deli of O'BAMA and BILL CLINTON when they are in town, as well as many city hall parties. That being said, I can assure you that this is the last bastion in Chicago for real corned beef and Pastrami. To say nothing about the gigantic sandwiches they serve. Briskets are home made not commercial. They also serve some outstanding hot dishes which vary depending upon the day of the week. And great MATZO AND KREPLACK soup. You would have to go to New York to find a deli that outdid them. I remember once upon a time that there were great Jewish deli's all up and down Clark and Broadway, but they are all gone now, together with most of the Jewish residents. At any rate, if you go to the Jefferson location, you won't be dissappointed. I have taken dozens of friends and family to MANNY'S over the years and they all loved it. Many ask me all the time, "when are we going to MANNY'S". I come in from Wheeling and I have to get my MANNY'S "fix" at least once a month. And don't expect fancy surroundings. This is a DELI and goes back to the '30's. It is always clean however.lance0955

6.description: "Home of the signature corned beef, peppery pastrami and original crisp potato pancakes" located in the food court in Grand Concourse.Couldn't decide between corned beef or pastrami so I did the 50/50 option with the potato pancake.  The sandwich was $14.95 which seems really pricey for a sandwich, but then again you are at the McCormick Convention center.  Pastrami was tasty I prefer it over their corned beef.  Beef was on the dry side and had a lot of fat on it.  Potato pancake wasn't crispy enough and seemed greasy.  Probably cuz the food was sitting at the deli for some good time before I purchased it.  Probably better at the real place on Jefferson.

7.description: Unbelievable pastrami!  I love this place.  Friendly, delicious, and like walking back in time.

8.description: Ordered a spinach salad using an online order. Salad had lettuce instead.

0.description: Went to Manny's for the first time today after hearing great things about the restaurant from family and friends. I ordered the Breakfast Reuben and it was delicious.They put the corned beef, swiss, sauerkraut on an onion roll. It also is topped with two over-easy eggs. You also have the option of a potato pancake or hash browns on the side. For $8.95 it was very filling and was a great taste.The reason I gave Manny's four stars is because of my expectations. I actually have a couple spots where I get Reubens and other deli sandwiches (i.e. the Brown Sack, Bryn Mawr Deli) that I enjoyed a little better. Manny's was great though, definitely worth the experience.

4.description: Not the worst, but not the best. There were only two choices of meats when I visited the ever-so dingy Plate Room Food Court embedded within McCormick Place. I selected the corned beef, which wasn't horrible for something that was just mass produced and sitting under a heat lamp. The rye bread was reasonable, although the mustard could have been a bit hotter. They also served a potato pancake/square, which was deep fried to the point of oblivion. A better choice for food is to have a brunch before visiting McCormick in the downtown area or off Michigan Mile.

36.description: Yow. Every bit as good as my (previous) favorite authentic Thai in the city (Sticky Rice). Filling a fantastic void in my south side existence of quick fantastic Thai food. (T)working are way through the menu in its entirety, and favorites so far include: papaya salad, Sai-Krok E Isaan, and green curry. or if you need some classic fast food delights Egg rolls and Rangoon made in house.

29.description: Taste: 3.5Location: 4Cleanliness: 4Ambience: 3Value: 3.5Service: 3.5OVERALL = 3.58* Out of a 5-point scaleMy friends and I decided to check this place out and to give it a try after seeing the 5-star rating from just about 16 reviews. This place used to be Thai Wok, which honestly I liked. Too bad they had to close the business down. I think Khaosan & Taylor took over this place pretty recently.Honestly I wasn't really hungry so I only ordered 1 dish - the Thai Fried Rice with Beef. I liked how it had Kai-Lan (Chinese Kale/Broccoli) in the fried rice. It was decent, although it wasn't exceptional either.My friend ordered the Khao-Moo-Dang (Thai-style BBQ Pork) and told me that the BBQ Pork was pretty good. Although he was a bit disappointed because the menu clearly says that it comes with Hainanese Rice but instead he only got regular white rice. And the rice was kinda cold as well. Another friend ordered the Penang Curry and he seemed to enjoy it.This is not a comprehensive review in any way and I will update it again once I give this place another shot and try their other more authentic/unique dishes. The place has a cute patio with hanging light bulbs and pretty flowers by the windows.I've tried so many Thai Restaurants in Chicago and so I know which ones are good and which ones are okay. I will give this restaurant a 2nd shot and hopefully they can impress me this time. But so far, based on this first visit, there's still a lot of work to be done if they really want to compete with the plethora of Thai Restaurants in Chicago.

42.description: I wish I could give 4.5 stars. This place has only been open about a month and I've already been here a few times. The service is excellent. While I can't rate authenticity, I will say all the food has tasted very fresh and flavorful. It's also pretty inexpensive for a very generous portion. I will definitely be returning.

23.description: Was craving stir fried vegetables and this place fit the bill at the moment. I got the pad cashew and I'm very pleased. The menu wasn't clear if I can get meat with this but the waiter did ask if I wanted a meat but I asked for more vegetables. I love Thai food. Service was pretty good.

31.description: Best Thai food I have had outside of Thailand. The green curry was as fantastic as it gets. The Pad Ped Catfish was also great!

34.description: This hidden gem has the best Thai food on Taylor Street! I've lived in the neighborhood for 10 years and have tried every Thai place, this place is by far the best. The service was excellent and they have a few outdoor tables too. I had Chicken Pad Thai and Crab Rangoon and I would highly recommend it.

16.description: So delicious! My absolute favorite is the papaya salad-crunchy, tangy, and spicy. We order it every time. Never disappoints. Tonight we also ordered the curry noodle soup which tasted a bit like khao soi and was just so tasty. Oh and for dessert we got the fried banana and it was heavenly. I can't wait to try everything on the menu.

11.description: Great food! We've eaten in a lot of Thai places, and trust us this is one of the best. The food was spicy and authentically tasty. The ambiance and staff was also very nice as well. The catfish and Tom kha Kai were delicious! Would have given 5 stars, however the wait is slightly long. If you have some time, and want a great meal this better than the other Thai places in Taylor street

39.description: Gosh was this food amazing!!! Hadn't had such high quality Thai in a while!and the prices are great too.new restaurants tend to start off stong and get mediocre with time.Hope that doesn't happent to Khaosan & Taylor! Keep it up!

37.description: Everything made from scratch. We like to do family style and sample everything. Green curry with shrimp, drunken noodles and basil chicken were awesome. Chicken satay was tender - the peanut sauce makes it. Been to plenty of Thai joints and this is the one where I've liked everything we ordered. Service was great. BYOB with no cork fee is a plus too.

0.description: There are a few Thai places on Taylor street and khaosanandtaylor is the best of all! There's no comparison. Prices are very reasonable and the food is great!! Service is great too and it's BYOB! Don't bother with the others, trust me, go here!I ordered pad se ew, pad Thai, red curry with pork, green curry with chicken, another beef dish and some egg rolls! Everything was pretty good. Pad Thai is the best I've had in a long while. Husband loved the curry in green sauce. Bought the red bc of the reviews but I think I'd agree with my husband that the green was a bit tastier. Think it just depends how spicy you like it. Red is definitely more spicy. Looking forward to going back!

38.description: This place was delicious! My babe and I were trying something new and came across this place, it's cute and simple. The food was fresh and flavorful we had the teriyaki salmon and basil fried rice. The customer service was great! We will definitely be back!

27.description: -- Delivery 1 hour and 5 minutes late.-- when delivery person arrived and I said he was an hour and 5 minutes late, he replied "oh" and then laughed. (The correct response was "I'm so sorry.") -- call to restaurant for update on delivery unanswered-- beef dish inedible. Thrown out. Pure fat.1 star because zero stars not an option.

32.description: I ordered the noodle soup with beef. The beef is yummy and savory. Great garlic flavor and the noodles were lovely. Will go here again!

13.description: Amazing food! We ordered delivery and expected it in about an hour, but it came about half hour late. (They did call us at the hour mark and told us they were leaving soon, which was nice.) We got the panang curry with vegetables at spice level one which was AMAZING (but still had quite a kick) and the drunken noodles with tofu (which was FANTASTIC.) My husband complained that the portions were small; they were probably "normal sized" and were satisfying, but there were definitely no leftovers. (Well, who's to know if that's because of the portion size or the tastiness of the food) Will definitely order again!

24.description: Big important tip: if you are sensitive to spicy, tell them and they will be honest about what kind of punch it packs. Everything we got was delicious. Highly recommend the moo ping, pad see ew was amazing, my green curry was too spicy for my taste but they happily traded it for something based on my tastes (Tom khai khai) and it was delicious. Top notch service and great food, I will be back.

7.description: Taste: 3.5Location: 4Cleanliness: 4Ambience: 3Value: 3.5Service: 3.5OVERALL = 3.58* Out of a 5-point scaleMy friends and I decided to check this place out and to give it a try after seeing the 5-star rating from just about 16 reviews. This place used to be Thai Wok, which honestly I liked. Too bad they had to close the business down. I think Khaosan & Taylor took over this place pretty recently.Honestly I wasn't really hungry so I only ordered 1 dish - the Thai Fried Rice with Beef. I liked how it had Kai-Lan (Chinese Kale/Broccoli) in the fried rice. It was decent, although it wasn't exceptional either.My friend ordered the Khao-Moo-Dang (Thai-style BBQ Pork) and told me that the BBQ Pork was pretty good. Although he was a bit disappointed because the menu clearly says that it comes with Hainanese Rice but instead he only got regular white rice. And the rice was kinda cold as well. Another friend ordered the Penang Curry and he seemed to enjoy it.This is not a comprehensive review in any way and I will update it again once I give this place another shot and try their other more authentic/unique dishes. The place has a cute patio with hanging light bulbs and pretty flowers by the windows.I've tried so many Thai Restaurants in Chicago and so I know which ones are good and which ones are okay. I will give this restaurant a 2nd shot and hopefully they can impress me this time. But so far, based on this first visit, there's still a lot of work to be done if they really want to compete with the plethora of Thai Restaurants in Chicago.

40.description: Service: Excellent - fast and attentive.Good dishes: Som Tum was delicious. I also liked the steamed fish in coconut. Ok dishes:  Pad Thai was meh. Laab could have used more acidity, spice and tasted rice. Tips: Portions are generous and the restaurant is BYOB.Prices: Extremely cheap!

30.description: I happen to love thai food and it is really hard finding a good thai place that I love. I crave and want thai food at least once a week and this has turned into my go-to thai delivery place. I've eaten the red curry and it is beyond legit. It is spicy and coconut milky just the way it should be. A lot of places make it watery but this place doesn't jip you on the milk. I've also had their Pad see ew and fried rice and both are great.I've never been to the actual restaurant but I'm sure it's good there as well.Seriously, guys this place is awesome!

1.description: Update: customer service is great.  I called to let them know specifically about the basil fried rice not having any basil, and they sent their delivery person back to refund the cost of that dish. I still can't recommend their food at all, but service definitely deserves credit here.

9.description: Big important tip: if you are sensitive to spicy, tell them and they will be honest about what kind of punch it packs. Everything we got was delicious. Highly recommend the moo ping, pad see ew was amazing, my green curry was too spicy for my taste but they happily traded it for something based on my tastes (Tom khai khai) and it was delicious. Top notch service and great food, I will be back.

26.description: My boyfriend and I happened upon this place while apartment hunting in the area. It is seriously so delicious. I'm from NYC and am somewhat of a Thai food snob, so I was a bit skeptical of the great reviews other yelpers gave this place - and of the tiny restaurant's fairly dingy interior, but the food is soooooo good. I ordered the pad see ew, a safe standby, and I think it's up there with the best noodles I've ever had. They were light and fluffy, not dense and sticky, and perfectly seasoned. My boyfriend had the green curry, extra spicy, which was actually spicy enough and had fresh jalapeños. We would definitely go out of our way to come back here again. I think this place mostly does take out, but in the summer there's a little outside patio which was very pleasant to sit in.

25.description: Whatever you're doing right now, stop it and go get Thai food instead. This is easily the best Thai food place I've been to in the city or suburbs. And it's BYOB. Tom Kha (sp?) soup: chicken, spicy, creamy, amazing. Normally I don't eat any of the soup when my wife orders it. I almost finished her bowl for her. Very filling too. Spicy Papaya Salad: other than the fact that it came with those creepy little itty bitty shrimp this was fantastic. Perfect blend of spicy and sweet and refreshing on a summer day. Pad See Ew: I ate until it hurt. And I will do so again in the future. Drunken Noodle: nice savory flavor. Good veggies. Chicken cooked to perfection. Summary: I just finished my meal and I want more. A+

12.description: Service: Excellent - fast and attentive.Good dishes: Som Tum was delicious. I also liked the steamed fish in coconut. Ok dishes:  Pad Thai was meh. Laab could have used more acidity, spice and tasted rice. Tips: Portions are generous and the restaurant is BYOB.Prices: Extremely cheap!

21.description: Decor is way better than Thai Bowl. Upon arrival, I noticed a 15% off student discount and I was glad that I had my UIC ID on me and was able to receive that deal on my carry out, which is another plus compared to Thai Bowl because it was dine in only and I think they took that option away too. Had the Thai iced tea and it was AMAZING. Some might think it's a little bit on the sweet side but I would prefer it that way. Also had the pad kee mao with beef and medium and spicy my too bad. I just wished the veggies were softer. Can't wait to try other things on the menu.

17.description: Fresher food than Thai bowl, but our food was 20 minutes late, the phone was busy when I tried to called, and the food we asked for not spicy is hot and the spicy food is bland. The pad see eiw was not cooked together or something - crunchy non sauced broccoli, bland tofu but sauce on the noodles. Guess we'll go back to Ma and I or Opart Thai. Disappointed since we are 4 blocks away.

10.description: Great, clean decor... And none of the heavy food smell that lingers on your clothes after you leave. Service was prompt and courteous and answered all of our questions. Loved that the music was set at a decent volume that you can talk over.

5.description: I have done a huge injustice telling many people that the best Thai restaurant on Taylor (in Little Italy) is Golden Thai. This place opened a couple months ago and I had never heard of it. I went and it was the best Thai Food I've had in years - and by far the best in Chicago. The red curry was incredible. The plating, presentation, ambience and atmosphere was lovely. Do try this place out!

35.description: Newest thai food hot spot!!! The food here is done right and service is on point. thai is a staple in my diet and ive eaten at plenty of thai restaurants in chicago but this one really stands out for authenticity and quality. Papaya salad is amazing and the massaman curry dish was so good, that ive been ordering it at all of my other go to thai spots, but it just doesnt compare to khaosan. Give this place a try you will NOT be dissapointed. WUTANG!

19.description: Excellent food and service. Can't go wrong with anything you order- best Thai on Taylor street- by far!

28.description: Ordered a pad see yew, first time at the place. It was better than thai bowl. Flavor on point! And college discount was a bigger bonus!

3.description: The first time I went to this restaurant, I enjoyed it. They made a dish for me that wasn't on the menu and the waiter/owner (I believe a mother and son own the restaurant) was attentive. The second time, it was the opposite. My friend asked for a dish that was on the menu but to make a substitution of something. He said she should get something else instead, but that he would make it hot, because she wanted it spicy. Anyway, the only heat to the dish was the massive amount of black pepper on the top. The service was also horrible. We waited a long time for each thing - appetizer, meal, and then the check. We asked for the check several times, and it was to the point that I was going to walk out an not pay because we were needed to leave at that point and he wouldn't bring us our check. I also had to stay on top of him to run our credit card. And so, we won't be back.

33.description: A true gem! Great food, superb service, very clean and with reasonable prices. It's a regular stop for us.

43.description: I really enjoyed my meal. The restaurant is relatively new. Service was excellent. I ordered the papaya salad. The flavor is legit and the portion is ginormous. The papaya salad was tossed with green beans. It was topped with a generous scattering of peanuts and two huge, plump shrimp. I'm not Thai and I'm no Thai food connoisseur but I think it may have been Isaan-style. The dish tasted savory, pungent, and kickass. It's the kind of dish that grows on you while you're eating it. The server told me they may start assembling the papaya salad tableside. I also ordered a green curry with extra vegetables. It was delicious and hit the spot. I wish I lived in Chicago so that I could visit again!

2.description: Worst delivery ever. Why do people think that 45-60 minutes actually means 90+ minutes? Plus the food sucked. People giving this place good reviews should be ashamed of themselves. Pathetic.

18.description: Whatever you're doing right now, stop it and go get Thai food instead. This is easily the best Thai food place I've been to in the city or suburbs. And it's BYOB. Tom Kha (sp?) soup: chicken, spicy, creamy, amazing. Normally I don't eat any of the soup when my wife orders it. I almost finished her bowl for her. Very filling too. Spicy Papaya Salad: other than the fact that it came with those creepy little itty bitty shrimp this was fantastic. Perfect blend of spicy and sweet and refreshing on a summer day. Pad See Ew: I ate until it hurt. And I will do so again in the future. Drunken Noodle: nice savory flavor. Good veggies. Chicken cooked to perfection. Summary: I just finished my meal and I want more. A+

41.description: My new go-to Thai place. The decor is much nicer than the other Thai places on Taylor; it is also much cleaner and "modern." However, the best part is the food. The crispy pad see ew was actually crispy, and extremely flavorful. The meat was tender, the vegetables fresh, and the chili sauce actually spicy! Not to mention the food was prepared quite quickly! The service was great- the waitress was extremely friendly and energetic, and also prompt when it came to refills of water and food delivery. Great new Thai place on Taylor.

4.description: I'm really on the hunt for good Thai food in Chicago - curry that tastes better than diluted paste. The portions here were really large! My fiancé got the seafood soup and could barely eat half and I got the green curry and same story. I had requested mine mild but it was still very spicy. We could see they were preparing everything fresh to order - that was the highlight! I'd want to try a curry without killing my taste buds before I can comment on the flavors. It was good enough for me to want to return!

6.description: Decor is way better than Thai Bowl. Upon arrival, I noticed a 15% off student discount and I was glad that I had my UIC ID on me and was able to receive that deal on my carry out, which is another plus compared to Thai Bowl because it was dine in only and I think they took that option away too. Had the Thai iced tea and it was AMAZING. Some might think it's a little bit on the sweet side but I would prefer it that way. Also had the pad kee mao with beef and medium and spicy my too bad. I just wished the veggies were softer. Can't wait to try other things on the menu.

22.description: The food is amazing. The flavors are bold and clean. This will definitely become one of my go to places.

15.description: -- Delivery 1 hour and 5 minutes late.-- when delivery person arrived and I said he was an hour and 5 minutes late, he replied "oh" and then laughed. (The correct response was "I'm so sorry.") -- call to restaurant for update on delivery unanswered-- beef dish inedible. Thrown out. Pure fat.1 star because zero stars not an option.

20.description: Probably the worst experience I've had in a Thai restaurant.   I ordered veggie spring rolls and a Penang curry.   I asked for the rolls to be totally vegan...was specific about what that meant...and they still had egg. I sent them back and the new iteration had shrimp.  The curry took almost 90 minutes to arrive...I asked for brown rice and they brought white.  I asked for lots of veggies and they gave only bell peppers.   On the positive side, they owner came over, apologized profusely and gave me a 30% discount, and didn't charge me for the rolls.   In the end, it was all kind of comical.   They were certainly very nice, and the curry had a nice flavor.   It seemed like they were overwhelmed with Grub Hub orders, which could have had something to do with it.  Still, over an hour wait for a series of mis-orders can't merit more than one star (if that).

8.description: I really enjoyed my meal. The restaurant is relatively new. Service was excellent. I ordered the papaya salad. The flavor is legit and the portion is ginormous. The papaya salad was tossed with green beans. It was topped with a generous scattering of peanuts and two huge, plump shrimp. I'm not Thai and I'm no Thai food connoisseur but I think it may have been Isaan-style. The dish tasted savory, pungent, and kickass. It's the kind of dish that grows on you while you're eating it. The server told me they may start assembling the papaya salad tableside. I also ordered a green curry with extra vegetables. It was delicious and hit the spot. I wish I lived in Chicago so that I could visit again!

14.description: Delicious Thai food. So glad I found this place. Very fresh and flavorful. I will order from here again.

3.description: In my experience, Nikki is the best there is at cutting, coloring, and styling hair. On top of that, she's a great person. I started going to her because she is near my work and I could go during lunch break. She has never let me down. Every haircut has been to my satisfaction and I am incredibly particular about haircuts. She also got my highlights exactly as I wanted them and she did my hair for my wedding and it looked amazing. She didn't have availability on my wedding day but she rearranged her schedule to fit me in. That's just the kind of gal she is. Over time, my work hours changed and I had a couple kids and it became difficult for me to get to her salon. So I tried a few other places and came to the conclusion that finding someone who can fill her shoes is more difficult than finding a way to fit a visit to her into my schedule. I went back to her and plan to keep going back.

1.description: Just moved to Chicago and needed to find a reliable place to cut and style my hair. I am glad to say I have found the place! Nikki is amazing; very professional, skilled, and friendly. She gave me a consultation, personalized attention, and did a fabulous job with my hair (even improving the look of my bangs). I felt great about my whole experience here. This is definitely a place you can trust, reasonably-priced for excellent work. Make sure to make an appointment, and cash only.

2.description: Nicki does my grandma's hair regularly, and she did my wedding updo (more like a low-do, it was a loose and low bun with little curls, but I digress).  Moderately priced, friendly, sometimes you catch a whiff of smoke because I think most of the employees do it.  Basically tell her what you want and she'll do it for you, 'nuff said.I'm not sure about the appointment thing.  Seeing as I was coming in for a wedding updo she did make an appointment for me since its the kind of thing one does not leave up to chance.  So I think if you emphasize that you're gonna need it done at a certain time for a reason, they will make an appointment.  BRING CASH - that's the only brow-furrowing point for me.

5.description: Nikki is awesome. She listens, and she keeps good records so she knows what she did last time you came in. Fair prices. Highly recommended!

6.description: Great place for a do... the prices are moderate, not as bad as mario tricoci but not as cheap as supercuts.. they dont' take appointments so you have to try your luck but if you don't have an urgent hair need its worth popping in periodically to see if they're free!

7.description: I have been going  to this salon for almost 10 years now.  I randomly came across it as a student in the late 90's and have been a consistent customer since.  There were times when I couldn't get an appointment and I would take a chance and go somewhere else.  I regretted it every single time.  Now, as a physician, my schedule is even more chaotic.  But, somehow Nikki always finds a way to squeeze me in whenever she can.  If you want a great haircut from a place you can trust, this is the place to go to.

0.description: Have been going here for a number of years.  Nikki is great!  She gives very personalized attention to her regular customers, and goes out of her way to accommodate new walk-in customers (from what I've seen during my twice-a-month two-hour appointments).  True, she does not accept credit cards (the fee for a small business drives the price pretty high, so I don't blame her), but I don't mind going to the ATM so I can continue to go to her to get my hair looking great, which I did not have before going to her.  BTW, I live on the Gold Coast now, with lots of hotsy-totsy salons, but I still love the experience I get going to Taylor Trimmers, and for a lot less bucks.  Hubby says if he ever loses his barber, he will go here also.  This place is a gem and a real keeper!!

4.description: I love Taylor Trimmers and Nikki. Whenever I need to come in for a cut or color...she squeezes me in. I love how she cuts my hair and I always get many compliments on my hair. I hope she will be around forever.

3.description: They need to salt the ramps to the second floor.  I almost slide backwards today.  This seems like a basic thing to do in the winter.

1.description: VALIDATE METhis is a shopping mall that has several stores. They have 3 levels of parking which is free for 1.5 hours along as you get validated and 2 hours for LA Fitness. They also have an early bird special if you need to park all day.The Whole Foods here has two free lots but make sure you don't walk away from the lot to another business or you might get towed.This location has a Marshall's, Vision works, Panera Bread, LA Fitness, Michael's Arts & Crafts, World Market, DSW and a Whole Foods to name a few of the bigger anchors here.I would recommend staying away from here on the weekends because this place is a madhouse. The parking lot to exit is just crazy. I think some of the traffic on Sundays must come from the Maxwell street crowd. Just be aware to give yourself enough time to exit or you might be paying the overtime fee. Don't lose your ticket either. A friend of mine lost his and got charged the full day rate of $25 for only working out for a few hours. That is never fun. Free parking to go shopping or to workout is worth it. The entrance to the parking lot is in the back and accessible from the North and the South. So depending on your needs this place had a little bit of everything from shopping, eating and working out. Just do it!

0.description: Where's the fire? Southgate Market is hot stuff!  The first time I was here, (to the basement, Michael's), I was not too impressed, but this place has grown on me:1. Variety of stores. From Whole foods to Cost a Plus to Starbucks to Michael's & Marshall's & LA Fitness. 2. Location. It's located nearby a lot of other businesses like Jewel, Binny's, Home Depot, Best Buy, & Bed, Bath Beyond, as well as the new Dick's & Pier I (coming soon) across the street... & eateries nearby: Chipotle, White Palace, Manny's, Dunkin Donuts, Noodles & Co...3.  Parking - both garage and street. I like to hunt a street spot before the garage. Do watch your garage times & note that Whole Foods/B of A has an uncovered separate lot too. 4.  Firemen! (Indeed, I'm not single nor am I 23; I appreciate the uniform.). Every time I'm here, I've caught some activity on the street outside. Lights, sirens, horns and the fine men and women of the CFD - busting a training move outside the market and in the shadow of the Sears (yes, I know) Tower give this place some good city energy. Caveat: "Market" is a misnomer; it's more a mall with its stark concrete floors, multi-levels & escalators running up the center. And it's not too aesthetically pleasing at that. "Dark" is fairly accurate, but the place gets the job done.

2.description: Ya got'cher DSW Shoes, ya got'cher LA Shiznit (Fitness), ya got'cher Whole Food$, ya got'cher validated parking. What be's not to likes?

5.description: Between the loud music and the soft spoken cashier I had a bad experience today at this particular location.  I tried to exchange some shoes and find out where a different size shoe was located but I couldn't understand the soft spoken cashier who would not speak up or enunciate her words.  I then tried making a phone call to confirm if the person I was getting the shoes for wanted a different pair or not and explain what other options were available at the location I was at  but couldn't hear b/c of the music.  I didn't like the layout of the store it was hard to see where to find the checkout line and get around to the various styles of shoes.

6.description: Watergate.Whitewatergate.Travelgate.Nipplegate.  Southgate.Is it ever good to have a "gate" attached to your name?Save the Whole World Foods and Disco Shoe Warehouse are about the only living specimens remaining inside the mini mall which is Southgate.  Disco Shoe Warehouse is relatively cheap, if you can find anything, but don't expect friend prices at Save the Whole World Foods.Southgate also has a World Market, a Panera, a Marshall's and a pet store.  All of the other stores have pretty much closed.  This ain't touristy Michigan Avenue at the weekend, Vince.  This is a buyer's market - Save the Whole World Foods notwithstanding - but the buyers aren't buying.Southgate is frigging dead as...dead.  And it's not coming back in a big frigging way.Alright, gimme two ounces of the Italian Roast and a NuGrape.  If it's as good as you say it is I'll come back and buy a 24-ounce bag and a six-pack, respectively.Thank you.Thank you.Mi meurto mini-mall, su meurto mini-mall.Muchos gracias.

7.description: The parking is an adventure; but Southgate Market has just about everything you could need. I mean, I bought the very glasses resting on my nose at this very moment from Visionworks in Southgate. I usually sneak in & out of Southgate simply to visit Whole Foods; but occasionally I will find the need for a little shopping. Found a very nice handbag at DSW at 70% off. Touchdown!There is even a pet store on the lower level... I have not ventured down there or I might have brought home a Beta fish by now... or worse, a hamster. (Ok, animal soft-spot confession here with a no-pet lifestyle!)

8.description: This place sucks! It is dark & confusing.  There is NO security anywhere. I am glad I came shopping with my family. Never again nor am I allowing my wife to come to this place ever again without me. Managers should be ashamed of how the parking areas smell like urine and the homeless panhandling throughout the parking area.

9.description: Blah is all I can say.  Tiny mall ever since Office Depot moved out its been empty.  The only two big stores Dsw and Whole Foods are there now Marshalls as well keep it alive.  There is no color to the mall nor any decor.  Not even a fake play wattttt???? I still like the mall overall.  Hopefully more stores will open soon. :D

10.description: I was pleased with this mall which is a part of a growing South Loop.  When I was in college at nearby Columbia, the Target opening was part of it and the Ikon Theatre added further to the area.  Now, the mall which includes Whole Foods, DSW, World Market, Starbucks among others. With validation (which they gave me for free), your first 90 minutes are free.  I utilized that time to pick up a bottle of Argentian wine and dine at White Palace Grill of Diners Drive Ins and Dives fame which is right down the road.  Not too shabby.

4.description: I didn't realize these shopping centers existed in the city proper. The few shops I went through were clean and nice. Southgate is within walking distance from the Roosevelt El stop and along the path of plenty of buses so it is easy to get to.

58.description: My mom and i loved this place! The food was so amazing that i ordered the same thing to go. The service was great and our waitress gave great wine pairing recommendations. My mom and i have been talking about the place ever since.

56.description: My friend chose this place for our monthly dinner club and it was an ok dining experience. I was put off right at first because there was some issue with my friend not confirming the reservation and they put it on me (since I arrived quite early) to find out exactly how many people were going to be seated because it was a large party and they did not want to put so many tables together if they didn't have to. Apparently, we would have lost the tables had there been no confirmation and I saved the day.Once we all arrived and were seated, the service was attentive and friendly, but we were quite cramped by the kitchen because the seating arrangement was quite last minute, which I did not appreciate. The bread and olive oil were nice, as were our appetizers, which were plentiful for the group. For my entree, I chose the shrimp linguini and I was very disappointed. This is a pricey meal and I received five shrimp and some oily pasta. I probably should have ordered something different, but the flavor of the pasta alone should have been worth the price if the lack of shrimp didn't make up for it. My dessert, which was an explosion of all things bad for you and hit all my cravings at one time was the best thing there, but it wasn't necessarily a "fancy restaurant" dessert and seemed like something you'd get at a diner. I've definitely had better.

29.description: I have been eating at Francesca's on Taylor for about 15 years, and have always left extremely pleased and satisfied.

42.description: Their Conchiglie alla Papalina is amazing!

23.description: Came here about a week ago.    I had peppers and sausage as my appetizer.   That was very good.  But I just love Italian sausage though.  I got a chicken dish with mozzarella and spinach.   Sounded very good in principle, but just average to me.   I think the meal had too much lemon juice for my taste.

47.description: I haven't been here in about 3 years because the last time I went, I was underwhelmed by the food.  I still feel the same.  The best part of the meal was the bread and olive oil.  We had grilled calamari, which was chewy and then I had Chicken Milanese, which had far too much Panko crust on it.  I also tasted my friend's rigatoni with Puttanesca sauce and found it both too spicy and salty.  The food isn't awful, it's just not stand-out delicious.   I will say the red sangria was delicious.  With so many options on Taylor St, I don't see myself coming back here any time soon.

8.description: Ah Francesca, my love! Somewhat of a Chicago tradition - quaint old-timey décor, incredible food, good portion sizes, amazing wine selections, live music (some nights I think), incredible fresh-out-of-the-oven bread basket, sweet service. Favorite Italian place in the city. Period.

31.description: awesome food and great service by Nicole. luv going there and being treated with warmth!!!

34.description: Only reason it has a star is because it atleast has to have a star! Horrible service !!!!! I know its Valentines day but when you make reservation for a certain time and it still take them like 45 mins to seat you down then take an hr to take your order like really get your stuff together !!!! Very dissapointed never going there again!

16.description: Great menu and good food.  I ordered the Salmone alla Fresca, which was great!  I typically prefer Francesca's on Chestnut, but this location is a neighborhood gem.

13.description: I have  been to this restaurant several times and I have to say that I have been happy time and time again, but this last time fell short for me. I wanted to share this place with my family members because it's always been a go to restaurant for me. Our experience started with our waiter that was not as attentive as I normally like. I don't know if he was short handed, but we could not even get a busboy to come around our table. I can't stand crying children when dining out and this particular night we had around 3 tables with them. Not the restaurants fault, but it takes away from enjoying your evening. We started our evening with the mussels, calamari, and caprese salad. The mussels were not as good as the last several times I had it. Normally they have the muscles marinating in the sauce and we can dip our bread in it, but this time they were really dry and most of them were empty. The calamari was kind of sad. Seemed as if our table received the small leftover crumbs from everyone else. The caprese was ok. No waiter or busboy around to offer fresh ground pepper and impossible to get them to our table to even ask for balsamic vinegar. For the main course, I ordered their special cod dish. There was nothing special about it. It was really bland. My parents each ordered the tilapia and that seemed to be ok, and my sister ordered their salmon which was good. My brother ordered one of the pasta dishes with spinach and cheese and ended up being sick afterwards. Not sure if it had something to do with the food he ate here. Kind of disappointed with this visit. My family was not impressed one bit. I'm not going to write it off my list. Will visit again and give it another try.

11.description: Came here about a week ago.    I had peppers and sausage as my appetizer.   That was very good.  But I just love Italian sausage though.  I got a chicken dish with mozzarella and spinach.   Sounded very good in principle, but just average to me.   I think the meal had too much lemon juice for my taste.

39.description: Fabulous dining experience in Little Italy! Service was impeccable, drinks were delicious, and the food was divine! I'm almost embarrassed to say what all we tried! -Appetizers: calamari with dipping sauce and the bruschetta with fresh mozzarella! (The calamari was my favorite.)-Entrees: I had the rigatoni con pollo- it was so rich I couldn't eat much of it- my boyfriend had the salmone pagliacci which was served with vegetables in a white wine sauce that was to die for! -Dessert: tiramisu- the best I've ever had! -Drinks: I had Riesling with dinner, and my boyfriend tried their Goose Island seasonal beer. I also tried their sparkling Riesling with dessert- it was fantastic! We will definitely revisit this place!

37.description: This is one of my favorite restaurants. It's a nice cozy dining experience with attentive wait staff who know when to not interrupt. The dinner salad is delectable. The vegetables are fresh and crunchy, I really need to know where they are getting their produce from.  I thoroughly enjoy the Frutti di Mare, the pasta is just right, the sauce is savory and the seafood is tender and full of flavor. When I'm not in the mood for pasta I'll have salmon on tilapia. The portions are perfect and each of the various preparations are done well. They have a great wine list too. While I enjoy dining in, I will occasionally pick-up for a great meal at home. Valet and street parking available. My children enjoy Francesca's too.

0.description: My wife and I went here with family and friend to celebrate my younger twin brothers 34th birthday. One made reservations for a Saturday evening. The majority arrived on time and was immediately seated by the friendly staff.The environment is very cozy and warm, very inviting. We had pretty good vibes. There was mixture of people with Hawks jerseys, to dresses to men in jeans as well slacks. Again, very inviting.Our server was very knowledgeable of the menu and wine/drink items. We started with Bruschette con Rucola e Caprino which was DELICIOUS!... Eyes were like ROUND SAUCERS.... My brother order the Calamari fritti; which I heard was also great. I had the dinner salad which was huge and tasted VERY WELL. I didn't think I would be able to finish my food, which was content with. My wife had the Insalata Caprese which she was said was also GREAT!... At this point we bof (yes B.O.F.) felt that the food was DEFINITELY ON POINT thus far. For the dinner my wife had the Lampuga con Fagioli which was a mahi mahi dish that was surrounded by a layer of tasty sun-dried tomato pesto.... I only had a taste of it and man-oh-man I was FANTASTIC!... I had the Tilapia della Casa which (shaking my head) was UNBELIEVABLLY GREAT!.. From the first bite I could not believe it was tilapia. I ate more like thick pieces of cod rather than tilapia. The sauce made with garlic, roasted peppers, red onions and white wine complimented the dish with flavorful bust of citrus.  The finish it off we (my wife and I) shared the Pasta Aglio e Olio.... Oh My..... (shaking my head again).... Was UNBELIEVABLE by itself. When we mixed it with our own dishes it took the entire dish to a "whole-nutha-level"!... My wife had a Riesling wine and I had simple lemonade and EVEN the lemonade was FANASTIC!.. We bof (yes B.O.F.) looked at one another said, "How in the hell is EVERYTHING good, from beginning to end?"... WOW-WOW-WOW!... Some people at our table finished with after dinner drinks, regular drinks and dessert. My wife had a dessert and she thought it was great as well. We bof (yes B.O.F.) were VERY satisfied with the entire meal (especially finishing everything and not feeling like we had glutton ourselves).... We will DEFINITELY be back!. Our home church is literally right down the street and around the corner from this place and we have NEVER been here. Now THAT my friend is a shame. This  place has been here forever and I can certainly see why it is a neighborhood and fan favorite!. Keep up the GREAT work!. . . . .

38.description: The service was impeccable and the food was incredible.  The gnocchi was such a generous portion size that I couldn't finish it, and the cream of mushroom soup had a pleasing texture and was very flavorful.  As we were preparing to leave, our waitress had the valet get us a cab and had us wait inside until it arrived (it was freezing out).  Highly recommend for delicious Italian food and warm hospitality.

51.description: I love their olive oil (what you have with the bread they bring out). I think the pasta dishes were a hit-or-miss with me. Their dinner menu is much better than the lunch menu. It would be nice if they have the same menu for both, but offer "lunch portions" or something to that extent (at least if they did this for their pastas, that would be better).

27.description: I've been here a handful of times and sometimes I need more than one visit to write a decent review. I've been to Francesca's at the Promenade and it was subpar although the interior was much more upscale and "Fancy" If you will as apposed to this one on Taylor being much more cozy which I'm not such a fan of. I like open space and I don't like touching backs with strangers while I'm eating or being constantly interrupted by finicky children. They should either find a different way to have the floor plan or take out a table or two. I've worked at a Spanish restaurant in the past and no way in hell did our manager let us stand in one corner and do nothing. Well that's what these servers and bussers do. I was there for a good 2 hours the few times I've gone at different times throughout the day/night and it's always the same. I know. It sounds like if I hate this place. But in all honesty I think that if they step their game up here and there they will be an outstanding place to dine at. The food is amazing. Just the atmosphere is a bit of a drag, not a lot of movement. I will say that all the servers I've had, had been nice to me and all had knowledge of the menu and I always like making them choose any plate of their choice and they haven't let me down. They know what people like and they nail it. The Pesto linguini with scallops and shrimp is to die for as well as their risotto which is so rich and savory. Their salads are pretty amazing as well. Their lunch menu is mainly what I go for and I don't remember what I've had in the evenings. But I'm sure it wasn't bad. Everything I've had is great. But like I said. A little sprucing up won't hurt and will actually benefit the place.

32.description: We came here with a large group so we had a preset menu so I can only attest how delicious that was. The service was great, we had a nice guy, sadly I can't remember his name. The pasta was divine!!! II'd love to go back for a more personal experience so that I can really look over the menu but I'd be back for sure!

54.description: One of the Taylor St. staples.  Consistently great food and service.  Pizzas and pastas are my favorites here.  This place definitely delivers value.

48.description: Before coming to Chicago for the weekend, I reached out to a friend for a restaurant recommendation. She immediately wrote back with "Francesca's On Taylor...you will not be disappointed". And she was right ! My boyfriend and I shared a calamari appetizer, veal served with a topped mixed green salad, and a rigatoni with homemade sausage dish. All were very tastey.  Serving sizings were large as well. Noticed most people left the restaurant with a bag of leftovers. Our waitress was great, very attentive and friendly. Liked the decor too. Will definitely return.

44.description: This is a family favorite.I've been here a few times, and it has always been amazing!Recently, I went here for a business dinner, where they served everything family style.  I'd have to say I didn't have a single bad bite.  They were even able to accommodate two gluten-free diners with a separate course that matched every regular course brought to the table, including salads, appetizers, pasta, meat, and dessert!The service is always fantastic.  I don't think my drink (or plate) was ever empty. I definitely cannot wait to take my husband here!

24.description: Service and meal were excellent. Started with Bruschetta, and a nice bottle of Italian wine. Followed by a cheese stuffed ravioli with a parmesan garlic sauce, my girlfriend got a Ziti, Mushroom, Sausage dish. Both plates were clean! Atmosphere is a little tight inside, and you will need a reservation but it was well worth it.

7.description: My party of 3 secured a reservation through open table.  When we arrived 4 minutes early we were greeted by the manager.  He was so friendly and seemed genuinely happy that we were dining at his establishment.  We were then seated immediately and once again thanked for choosing Francesca's.  The lighting was low and there candles on the table.  The decor was a classic wood with a modern/contemporary underscore.  The music was indie/alt rock at a very reasonable volume.  The ambiance was overall very nice.  Our server was friendly as could be although he was a little slow at times.  This would be the only negative part of our experience.  I ordered the tortellini al funghetto.  The dish contained mushroom stuffed tortellini in a aromatic white wine cream sauce covered in mushrooms and garnished with Parmigiano Reggiano.  The meal had a beautiful smokey and woodsie flavor.  It was really unexpected but very well done.  I will definitely be back sometime and I will suggest Francesca's to my friends on the hunt for some yummy Italian or vegetarian meals!

49.description: With Francesca's ever-changing menu, dining here is always a delicious surprise. Great craft beers on tap at this location is an added treat. Our recent server, Elaine, was delightful and made us feel at home.  The space is cozy and on a corner allowing for many windows/an open feel. We dined on calamari, salmon with mussels, and ravioli. Simply put, it was awesome.

40.description: Nice spot on Taylor st., a quality restaurant without the expense of Rosebud or the eccentricity of Davanti Enoteca across the street. However, the menu is limited, and the food/service leaves something to be desired. It was not busy when I ate here, but they sat us at this tiny table right by the kitchen! Then the waitress didn't come by for the order for awhile, and when I asked her for advice, she said "I don't like sausage," which was not very insightful to say the least!The food was quite tasty, and the portions were large. Between two of us, we ordered the linguine and shrimp dish and some chicken alfredo pasta. It was pretty expensive though, and if you are looking for a nice meal on Taylor street, you can do better.

53.description: I love love this place! Best Italian restaurant on Taylor!!! I've never been disappointed!

30.description: I have  been to this restaurant several times and I have to say that I have been happy time and time again, but this last time fell short for me. I wanted to share this place with my family members because it's always been a go to restaurant for me. Our experience started with our waiter that was not as attentive as I normally like. I don't know if he was short handed, but we could not even get a busboy to come around our table. I can't stand crying children when dining out and this particular night we had around 3 tables with them. Not the restaurants fault, but it takes away from enjoying your evening. We started our evening with the mussels, calamari, and caprese salad. The mussels were not as good as the last several times I had it. Normally they have the muscles marinating in the sauce and we can dip our bread in it, but this time they were really dry and most of them were empty. The calamari was kind of sad. Seemed as if our table received the small leftover crumbs from everyone else. The caprese was ok. No waiter or busboy around to offer fresh ground pepper and impossible to get them to our table to even ask for balsamic vinegar. For the main course, I ordered their special cod dish. There was nothing special about it. It was really bland. My parents each ordered the tilapia and that seemed to be ok, and my sister ordered their salmon which was good. My brother ordered one of the pasta dishes with spinach and cheese and ended up being sick afterwards. Not sure if it had something to do with the food he ate here. Kind of disappointed with this visit. My family was not impressed one bit. I'm not going to write it off my list. Will visit again and give it another try.

46.description: Had their Italian salad. I love salami & meat but this was a heaping wet salad on top of a pinwheel of cured meat. If they went just a bit easy on the dressing & roasted red: yellow peppers it'd make all the difference. This experience won't stop me from coming back though! Their pastas are delicious.

1.description: We had a wonderful wedding anniversary dinner. Any took excellent care of us and the food, as always, was terrific.Francesca's was hopping with festivities including a wedding reception encompassing both of the back rooms.Happy Holidays to our Francesca's on Taylor family.I highly recommend Francesca's on Taylor!

55.description: Always a great place from our arrival to our departure the host greeted us promptly,the waitress was great (redhead I think) from Chicago but lived in Pittsburgh ,food was amazing as the Clark street location your water glass was never empty and the manager walked to every table n asked if everything was ok . And yes it was A OK!It was so busy, guessing it was a hockeygame since almost everyone had a team jersey or jacket on, but even with all those people everyone still did an amazing Job. The olive oil was infused with herbs and went perfect with the perfectly warmed bread, the chicken paradelle was outstanding n came with Vesuvio potatoes Which were done to perfection, I almostLicked the plate.if you are I'm chicago and want to have great dining experience then this is the place you want!!

9.description: Francesca's is awesome. I have eaten here over 50 times in the last 10 years and there simply is not a bad item on their menu. The staff is great, the food is even better.

26.description: Was here for an MS information presentation over lunch, and I loved it. Having to wave down the waitress for a refill, as she  kept refilling everyone else was not something I liked, buy so be it.Good food, good atmosphere. Worth a return some day.

25.description: We made reservations for 14 a month ago. All of our meals came out at the same time and were impeccable. Kudos to everyone that made this night special.

12.description: Fabulous dining experience in Little Italy! Service was impeccable, drinks were delicious, and the food was divine! I'm almost embarrassed to say what all we tried! -Appetizers: calamari with dipping sauce and the bruschetta with fresh mozzarella! (The calamari was my favorite.)-Entrees: I had the rigatoni con pollo- it was so rich I couldn't eat much of it- my boyfriend had the salmone pagliacci which was served with vegetables in a white wine sauce that was to die for! -Dessert: tiramisu- the best I've ever had! -Drinks: I had Riesling with dinner, and my boyfriend tried their Goose Island seasonal beer. I also tried their sparkling Riesling with dessert- it was fantastic! We will definitely revisit this place!

59.description: Food very good!Service even better!Prices very reasonable and great for all types of groups

21.description: We held the Rehearsal Dinner for our wedding at Francesca's this summer, and we were very satisfied with the experience.  The waitstaff was very professional. The family style dinners were perfect for fostering the kind of social bonding we wanted for the dinner.  And, most importantly, everything was delicious.  My parents are still raving about the wonderful food at our reception dinner.  Highly recommended for your Rehearsal Dinner or just for dinner.

17.description: Great food, good service.  Phyllis, the hostess, has greeted us for many years. Katrina was cheerful and professional. Our only complaint is the music!  Apparently the corporate office is not aware that this is an Italian restaurant! Some Puccini would be more appropriate or at least Frank and Tony.  The music they have now takes away from the otherwise great dining experience. Please play appropriate music for an Italian restaurant!As the lady friend of the above writer and as a food and music lover, I have to say the music they have now is ennough to send me looking for another restaurant.

10.description: Now that I have had their delivery, and been disappointed with their delivery, I am going to lower them by a star. Great food, should always be great food. Not sub-par in one instance and good in another.

5.description: Good food, not blow me away awesome but a nice Italian meal I don't mind paying for.  I love this neighborhood though, lots of students and locals strolling past.  There is nothing uppity about Taylor Street and I love that.

3.description: We met a dear friend here for a long, leisurely lunch on a recent trip to Chicago.  For our reservation, we got a great window table.  Our server, Natalia, I believe was new to the business and I expect she will improve over time.I ordered the Penne del Pastor, a spicy pasta that was very tasty.  I thought the sauce might have been a bit too thick for my personal taste but it was tasty and well cooked.  My husband ordered the Pollo alla Salvia, a chicken breast in light tomato sauce.  We both enjoyed our dishes as well as the wine we chose, a Consentino cabernet savignon.Nice place, established tradition, good food, satisfactory service.

35.description: Just walked into Francesca's with an 8:15 reservation. I was told that I would be seated in 30-45min. Really? Get your house in order because being disorganized on Valentine's Day is amateur.We ended up turning around and leaving for Piccolo Sogno where we were seated promptly. Oh....and we still had to pay $10 for valet.

19.description: I've been here a handful of times and sometimes I need more than one visit to write a decent review. I've been to Francesca's at the Promenade and it was subpar although the interior was much more upscale and "Fancy" If you will as apposed to this one on Taylor being much more cozy which I'm not such a fan of. I like open space and I don't like touching backs with strangers while I'm eating or being constantly interrupted by finicky children. They should either find a different way to have the floor plan or take out a table or two. I've worked at a Spanish restaurant in the past and no way in hell did our manager let us stand in one corner and do nothing. Well that's what these servers and bussers do. I was there for a good 2 hours the few times I've gone at different times throughout the day/night and it's always the same. I know. It sounds like if I hate this place. But in all honesty I think that if they step their game up here and there they will be an outstanding place to dine at. The food is amazing. Just the atmosphere is a bit of a drag, not a lot of movement. I will say that all the servers I've had, had been nice to me and all had knowledge of the menu and I always like making them choose any plate of their choice and they haven't let me down. They know what people like and they nail it. The Pesto linguini with scallops and shrimp is to die for as well as their risotto which is so rich and savory. Their salads are pretty amazing as well. Their lunch menu is mainly what I go for and I don't remember what I've had in the evenings. But I'm sure it wasn't bad. Everything I've had is great. But like I said. A little sprucing up won't hurt and will actually benefit the place.

28.description: This is the best Italian restaurant to go to! Their food is amazing, especially their chicken parmesan. Their service is wonderful!

45.description: Went with another couple and loved all of our food. Started with fried calamari and then 3 out of 4 people got the same dish - pesto cavatelli - delish! Great service and looking forward to coming here once we have our baby as it is very family friendly. Only downside is parking can get tough.

33.description: Disclaimer: W=went here with a very large group, around 30 people, so I had the present menu, which probably by nature is worse than the normal menu.Three courses. The first was pizza, which tasted a-okay. Nothing special, not much flavor. Secondly we had pasta, and the penne was a little stiff. Again, sauces were nothing special. The third course dessert, Tiramisu, was good.It's a decent place for large groups because they have tons of seating and a large back room that fit all of us. The service was great, clean bathrooms, good set up. Not quite sure if I would recommend this place though, but again, might have been just a poor preset menu experience.

43.description: A friend and I stopped in here at around 3:30pm on a Saturday.  When arriving we thought we just sit at the bar for a couple of drinks and maybe an appetizer. We were there during their shift change and they only had one guy working the front end. Because of this there was no one working the bar, so we decided to take a table because of this. However service was still pretty decent knowing that there was only one server on the floor at the time.After ordering drinks we also place an entree order.   This is where my review starts:I had the special, spinach and kale ravioli, and even though they were good. I was not pleased with the portions.  Almost like I was served the lunch serving and charged the dinner price.  My other complaint is they ran out of the beer we were drinking, which itself isn't the problem. Waiting for them to send a girl down the street to "barrow" some from another place took time, but the server did come to the table with two other beers, already open, for a substitute.   We already knew what was going on because we over heard the girl being told to go fetch some beer down the street. When I got the bill they weren't shy of charging full price for a beer we didn't order but decided it was OK to substitute after waiting. I left disappointed and hungry. PS. $6.00 for an 11.2 oz. Stella Artois beer is a bit high. I don't pay that eating at a nice place in the Loop.

2.description: The minestrone and bruschetta appetizers warm up my appetite. The salmon was sautéed with tomato purée sprinkled with zesty lemon wedge. The spinach was perfectly prepared sealed with a thin film of moisture. Desserts were my favorites. Didn't expect much from the profiterole, but it turned out to be quite an interesting piece. The outer shell was crunchy filled with vanilla bean gelato. We lucked out to dine in an empty dining room all to ourselves. Photographs turned out wonderful as we sat next to the window. The brightly lit ambience makes for a wonderful Christmas Eve lunch.

18.description: I am use to going to Francesca's in Frankfort.  We thought we would go to dinner before the theater. We had horrible service. We ordered Filet and told the waiter we wanted them brown inside. He said order them Medium well and then if they were not brown he would take them back.  They were pink well lets say red and he never came back to the table for 5 minutes!  1 filet was less red so we each ate that one. We cut the other one and set it in the middle of the table the waiter did not even look.  We asked for potatoes without shallots. They offered french fries??? When I got my noodles  with no sauce I wanted Parmesan on it. the guy did not ask me he did one turn of the Parmesan grater and left the table.  No waiter no busser no manager around.   So then it came to desert.  I asked " do you have regular decaf tea they said yes and  brought be mint tea.  I said I will just have hot water and honey. Can you bring honey?  5 minutes later the waiter finally came and and I asked him for honey. He looked at me for a second and moved to the next table.  Weird. What append to this restaurant?  If the waiter insists that you order your filet medium well and he insist he will bring it back to have it cooked and does not come back ?????? So 2 dinners for $60.00  I would have rather went to the Signature room and had a wonderful dinner than partially raw meet with a brandy ( there was no brandy) cream sauce. There was butter and cream sauce that was separating.  So who do you tell. The manager was running around never came to the tables. The guys who were helping did not pay attention they dropped the food asked a question and never came back. Waste of time and money. When my guest said wow the waiter did not even stop and listen ?? how weird??  Refund yes they should have. Manager walking the floor to ask how things are yes he should have.  Waiter that paid attention and bussers that could speak English and follow through yes. Waste of time, money yes!  They had a wedding in back and that was their priority. What a total disappointment.  Francesca's in Frankfort is worth the drive. Taylor street go if you want ot be ignored, get raw food and have no manager contact.

41.description: My parents are forcing me to write a review of Francesca's. They're old and cranky and not happy with a waiter named Sam. What I can piece together from this somewhat incoherent babbling is that "Sam" was inattentive and had the audacity to fill my mother's wine glass a quarter full while the other members of their party received a full glass. We're sitting at the dinner table bickering about whether or not their grievances are petty and I've finally caved into writing a review because I can't stand listening to this any longer.  If you go to Francesca's and you're over the age of 60, make sure "sam" isn't serving you.

52.description: My party of 3 secured a reservation through open table.  When we arrived 4 minutes early we were greeted by the manager.  He was so friendly and seemed genuinely happy that we were dining at his establishment.  We were then seated immediately and once again thanked for choosing Francesca's.  The lighting was low and there candles on the table.  The decor was a classic wood with a modern/contemporary underscore.  The music was indie/alt rock at a very reasonable volume.  The ambiance was overall very nice.  Our server was friendly as could be although he was a little slow at times.  This would be the only negative part of our experience.  I ordered the tortellini al funghetto.  The dish contained mushroom stuffed tortellini in a aromatic white wine cream sauce covered in mushrooms and garnished with Parmigiano Reggiano.  The meal had a beautiful smokey and woodsie flavor.  It was really unexpected but very well done.  I will definitely be back sometime and I will suggest Francesca's to my friends on the hunt for some yummy Italian or vegetarian meals!

50.description: truly exceptional service.  they went out of their way to accommodate my vegan needs. i had dinner with friends i hadn't seen in 27 years and we were never pressured to leave.  in fact, we stayed past the closing time.  i want to recognize felipe, our server.  this is why they get 4 stars from me.  however, the portions are too big -- a violation of italian cuisine guidelines.  my plate of spaghetti would serve 3 people.  i couldn't finish it.  i recommend cutting the portion size in half.   also, the wine list is overpriced, averaging $60 a bottle.

4.description: Great! !! Ambiance is great. It's children friendly, Italian  Food great,  drinks great,  Amy our server is WONDERFUL!!!! The manager ( don't know his name) VERY ACCOMMODATING.  Second one I've been to and they're both great.

6.description: The service was wonderful, the food was flavorful and everyone was super accommodating with all of our requests. Kudos to management for a job well done. I recommend the Ravioli. I will definitely return to this establishment the next time that I am visiting Chicago.

22.description: Great food, good service.  Phyllis, the hostess, has greeted us for many years. Katrina was cheerful and professional. Our only complaint is the music!  Apparently the corporate office is not aware that this is an Italian restaurant! Some Puccini would be more appropriate or at least Frank and Tony.  The music they have now takes away from the otherwise great dining experience. Please play appropriate music for an Italian restaurant!As the lady friend of the above writer and as a food and music lover, I have to say the music they have now is ennough to send me looking for another restaurant.

15.description: This place never disappoints...service is always great!  The flavors of their pasta dishes are amazing as well....ordered takeout and brought dinner home....it was just as good as if I were sitting in the dining room.

57.description: No. I've given this place multiple times to impress me but alas the food just isn't all that good. I'd say it's mediocre at best. My favorite part of the meal is always the complimentary bread with olive oil. That's about it, everything else is blah.

20.description: We met a dear friend here for a long, leisurely lunch on a recent trip to Chicago.  For our reservation, we got a great window table.  Our server, Natalia, I believe was new to the business and I expect she will improve over time.I ordered the Penne del Pastor, a spicy pasta that was very tasty.  I thought the sauce might have been a bit too thick for my personal taste but it was tasty and well cooked.  My husband ordered the Pollo alla Salvia, a chicken breast in light tomato sauce.  We both enjoyed our dishes as well as the wine we chose, a Consentino cabernet savignon.Nice place, established tradition, good food, satisfactory service.

36.description: Had dinner with my wife, son, and his wife.  Excellent food all around... Especially enjoyed the bruschetta with fresh mozzarella.  Nice blend of flavors and an excellent tomato taste in the middle of January.  Seafood linguine had perfectly cooked seafood and the pasta and sauce complemented everything well.  Everyone else heartily enjoyed their meal.  My wife was very complimentary regarding the linguine con funghetti.  Service was attentive without being intrusive.  The waiter did a good job of being there when we needed him.  Would heartily recommend.

14.description: Service was excellent! Portion size of the pasta was large. Very tasty Italian restaurant located in a cute area - little Italy. Definetly give it a try. Price is also very reasonable. I recommend the appetizer mussel or fried calamari. For entree, their seafood pasta was delicious!

3.description: I like the fruit at Edible Arrangements. It's always delicious and fresh. The chocolate-covered fruit in their arrangements is great as well.

1.description: I've purchased arrangements from Edible Arrangements and have always been happy with them (both the product AND the customer service).  But what I like even more is that I can walk in and get a yummy fruit salad at a great price.  They keep them stocked in the little fridge in the store - or if they don't have any, they will make you a fresh one lickety split!Now yes, it's true, I SHOULD buy my own fruit and cut it into tiny pieces - but why when Edible Arrangements can do it for me?
