Not to mention, their fruit is always so fresh and sweet and yummy! So I will continue to be an EA customer until I find the time, or gadget to make cutting all that fruit less tedious.  :)

2.description: Hi my name is Maureen . I've never tried an edible before and I had trouble deciding what to get my aunt. I called the store and the staff was a great help the manager jessica was a great help ! She was very knowledgeable of all the arrangments and very professional on the phone. Her positive attitude really made my day and my first experience a memorable one. She assured me that everything will be delivered on time and I won't be disappointed with the decision I made. And she was right ! My aunt loved it and kudos to a great manager and the great staff. If you want fresh fruit and great service ask for JessicaFive stars!!!!

9.description: I sent my mother an edible arrangement, she was not home so they called her to arrange a time, after she failed to answer they called me to let me know and informed me it would be delivered first thing tomorrow. Indeed it was. They are reliable, service was pleasant, and the fruit was delightful and fresh. WOOHOOO

10.description: What a horrible experience. For Valentines day my boyfriend decided to surprise me with a beautiful edible arrangement. This was my first time receiving one and I was so happy he was more creative than buying me a bouquet of flowers. However, he mentioned his disappointment that there were no white chocolate covered strawberries as he requested. He knows I do not like dark chocolate and that's all I got. I did not express my dismay because I was enthralled with the gesture, but the next day he called the woman who did the arrangement to let her know his request was not fulfilled. Instead of apologizing for making a mistake, the woman proceeded to argue and blame my boyfriend for not putting it on the online order. The lady failed to acknowledge that he went into the store in person to request white chocolate and was assured it would be taken care of. WRONG. Not only was it not to his liking, but the lady had the audacity to yell at him!? I am really disappointed with their methods of service recovery and hope they can get it together, it's just fruit people.

4.description: I ate one of their tacky creations and it went bad fast if you didn't comsume everything quickly..... peeled fruit does not last long if you do not plan on eating it immediately.  The other Yelper who boasted that flowers die fast should rethink that if all the manipulated fruit isn't consumed quickly as it was in my case....I was very disappointed.

6.description: Well when I first heard of Edible Arrangements I thought it was a very unique gift for any occasion instead of the usual flowers and balloons. Well I ordered the Hello Kitty Edible Arrangement online for pick up which was around 80 dollars. Yeah a little pricey but worth it. When I went to pick it up the place was smaller than I expected but it's nothing to complain about. The employees were friendly but I realized that they had made a mistake with my order so I told them and they quickly fixed it. The arrangement looked amazing and I was impressed with it. The experience overall was satisfying and I would definitely buy another arrangement for the right occasion.

12.description: This is great!  A healthy, snazzy looking treat, in the form of a gift!  This location just opened in the retail area of Little Itlay.  They sent us over a few baskets and all I can say is yum, yum, yum.  If you like fruit, this is it.  A great idea as a get well, a thank you, a welcome to the neighborhood.  Always fresh, always makes your mouth water, and always available.

5.description: Great Service very professional fast service simply a great experience will definitely come back again.

11.description: I absolutely LOVE the fruit bouquets. They are reasonably priced as opposed to traditional bouquets of which the flowers are going to inevitably wither away and die, at least we get to have some fun and eat this delicious fruit.  I got one as a present and have also ordered one for someone else.  I am happy with the service at this location as my order was ready at the promised time for pick up. Thank you!

8.description: This was my first time trying Edible Arrangements as a gift idea and have ordered 4 more since then! I bought one for my sister for her birthday who was ecstatic- she loved the fruit and also feels flowers are a waste of money. GREAT IDEA! Much better then flowers since they are edible and just as pretty. Would reccommend any Edible Arrangements for anyone looking to try a great, delicious product.

0.description: Walked in for a small arrangement for a friend recovering from surgery.  Walked out 20 minutes later with a simple small arrangement and was able to hand deliver it to my friend within 15 minutes!  No one can beat that service!The fruit was fresh, attractively arranged, properly packaged for carry out, and arrived still looking great.Pricey, but worth it.The staff is friendly despite the shop being very busy.I've gotten arrangement delivered to me from this shop that were sent by friends.  They do an excellent job all around!

7.description: It's not cheap but what an awesome way to cheer someone up or thank them for a job well done. Edible Arrangements are always fresh and delicous. The fruit is downright pretty. But it for someone you love!

58.description: I used to order here more often when I was at work because they delivered. Other than that, I have only been here a few times. I would consider the burgers here average and nothing more. I normally get the Busy Burger with Cheese. Although it is not bad, it definitely does not stand out and you could probably order a cheeseburger from most places in Chicago and it would taste the same. I like the Pizza Puff more than the burger, which doesn't make sense because this is a burger joint.

56.description: Good for a fix, but nothing special.

29.description: Great time with friends. Burgers were excellent! I would strongly recommend because you will enjoy your food.

42.description: I went to this place for the first time and thought of ordering the "Busy Burger". It was one of the best burger's i've ever had. The place is also cool. They are kind to offer 15% discount for students. So that also works well. But all in all, I would totally recommend. Not I can't wait to try different burgers there.

23.description: Overpriced for poor quality food. Tastes more like fast food than a gourmet burger joint.

47.description: Went there for the first time. I had read alot about their turkey burger so I ordered a double patty.  The patty was hard and burned did not have that juicy taste that you expect from a burger.  Really disappointed.

8.description: I always end up going here because bae absolutely LOVES this place. I like their beef burgers, they're fine, and their portobello mushroom sandwich is good, but I never had an "oh my god" moment until I tried their turkey burger, which I think should be their shining star. It is moist, flavorful, and perfectly seasoned; their turkey burger definitely needs some recognition. I now definitely know what I want to get when I go next time! Side note- management, PLEASE do something about your fries. They are dry, flavorless, and hard. I think this place would be outstanding if the fries weren't so gross.

31.description: I had the stuffed burger and found it fantastic.  It had a nice kick with the spicy mayo and had so much infused flavor with the cheese and the bacon.  Highly recommended and a nice twist on the modern burger joint.

34.description: Great food for relatively cheap prices. The best deal is definitely the Chicago style dog which comes with a side of fries for only $2.99. I also love the Spotted Cow milkshake

16.description: Probably the best Turkey burger I've ever had!  The stuffed burger was so flavorful.  It was also huge, big enough for two meals.  It would be great if they had Turkey bacon for the stuffed burgers.

13.description: Best burger joint in the area, hands down. Its not a fancy restaurant with 20$ burgers, but a legit burger joint. Everything there is awesome and reasonably priced. I do not eat tofu or soy BS, but their turkey burger is beyond amazing and it tastes just like a hamburger. Even their salad is good. Only thing is the fries tend to get soggy, so eat them quick and if you got some calories to spare, try the blob version. : )

11.description: Don't come here if you want your food made to order. I ordered a burger with pepper jack cheese and bbq sauce, no pickle, tomato, or lettuce and I got handed a burger WITH pickle, tomato, and lettuce. When I said I just got onions, pepper jack cheese, and bbq sauce I was told no, this was my burger. Be prepared to pick food off your burger if you come

39.description: My first experience at Busy Burger was great.  I tried the Stuffed Burger with beef and I have to say it was delicious.  it was huge, cooked perfectly, nice and juicy. It's been remodeled from the older space into a lovely modern, high tech restaurant with large menus.  Extremely reminiscent of Shake Shack but at the college-area level.

37.description: Fabulous and delicious!! Only giving a 4 because of the spicy sauce  if you don't like ask to leave it off. Stuffed burger was AMAZING!! Shake was better than homemade and I finished it before my food was ready because it was soooo great!

0.description: Never disappoints.Best burger place in town.I find myself full for many many hours after visiting.

38.description: This was our first time at the burger joint and the burgers were perfect. We got the tofu burger and portobello burger and were very satisfied with it. The quantity of fries were impressive in the combo and the onion rings were perfection.  Very satisfied with our dinner and definitely will visit again.

51.description: I love this local spot. Perfect for a cheap delicious bite to eat.Their hotdogs are the best chicago style in the area and are also super cheap at $2.50 each.Their burgers are under 5 and are cooked to order with all the classic toppings and their busy sauce which is some kind of tangy spicy mayo that goes really well with it.I've also tried their turkey burger and chicken sandwich and both were good.I think the turkey burger is just as good as the regular one (but probably healthier) and most people probably couldn't tell the difference.

27.description: The burgers here are flavorful and portioned well. The fries are really good too! Next time I'm definitely trying the portobello burger ... I keep saying I will try it "next time", but every time the "next time" comes around I just want another busy burger again!

32.description: I've gotten their busy burger and it was delicious. The spicy mayo and their sauce is amazing. I'd definitely like to try more of their food. I don't know about dining in though. I ordered online and went to go pick it up. They had trouble finding my order (when it was literally right in front of them) and were completely unprofessional in front of customers. Not cool.

54.description: Great portabello burger. Great fries.I'm not sure if they don't have air conditioning or if the day I came the air was out, but it was somewhat hot in the place. Maybe come at night if you're not a fan of the heat.

48.description: Be still my heart. Busy Burger is one of my favorite places to eat. It's your prototypical hole in the wall place that serves up typical diner food. I love the burgers. They're not trying to be fancy and something they're not (like at kumas). They taste like a grill and are delicious. But my favorite thing ever there is the busy dippin rings. Onion rings and spicy mayo. The spicy mayo is one of the most delicious things I've ever tasted, but beware because it packs a punch! Yes, Busy Burger is dingy and hot but oh so worth it.

44.description: Not that good. Overpriced too.Burger was kind of plain and dry. Not much flavor. Meat was kind of thin and a little overcooked. Didn't see like they put on much toppings either.

24.description: I have to admit, despite the amount of grease Busy Burger has some damn good burgers and a tasty spotted cow shake. Down-sides still exists. It's very tight quarters and definitely not handicap accessible. I still believe the food doesn't match the decorations. Then again, if you don't care about the extra stuff, the spicy mayo will delight you very much.

7.description: Wow, this place serves up a delicious burger. I had never heard of Busy Burger before, and we stopped by on a whim to get a mini burger and onion rings to tide us over for the afternoon. I'm pleased to report that the burger was fantastic! Delicious, hot, grilled to perfection, with fantastic grilled onions with the right amount of carmelization on them. And the bun was great too--on the spectrum of breads, it was somewhere near the "pretzel roll" end of things, and it was a fantastic complement to the burger contents. The onion rings were also fantastic too--served piping hot with a delicious coating that was not too heavy.All this was served up in a cute, shiny, clean location right near the University. Stop on by, you won't be disappointed.

49.description: The outside of the restaurant makes it seem more hip but once you're inside you realize it's a greasy spoon. I ordered the busy burger with cheese and was surprised that it wasn't overly greasy and I loved the spicy mayo. The fries were even better, fresh cut and yummy! Would visit again if looking for something quick, easy and cheap.

40.description: I am really impressed with their burgers. Meat is cooked just like I like it , this was an online order and all the ingredients were in my burger as I requested ! (I orderEd their busy burger) the  spicy mayo was very good, not too spicy it's down just right! I also liked the way that they neatly put my burger together. The mayo wasn't globbed  on and the burger was not falling apart! I also ordered hand cut rings which were also good. Only two things with my order, my food wasn't cold but it wasn't sizzling either  when i picked it up & the size of onion rings was disproportioned to the price .( literally about 4-5 rings ,edible ones at least a few were way burnt ). I definitely will be back !

53.description: It was late. I was starving and my judgment was clouded with hunger (you know, like those Snicker's "hangry" commercials?).I hastily searched for some place to send me a burger on Grubhub and found Busy Burger. I got a double cheese with spicy mayo for me, fries, plus hot dogs for hubs.When our food arrived, my burger was hard, like a hockey puck. It was warm and cooked through but definitely not a consistency that was appetizing. Even in my state of starvation I didn't finish it. It wasn't inedible, and it didn't taste funny, but it wasn't good. The fries were OK though, so I gobbled those up. Hubs said the buns for his dogs were stale.Busy Burger, you may have stopped me from going all Hulk on my 'hood, but I won't be needing your services again.

30.description: This has become one of my favorite go to places. I love the chicken BLT. I would highly recommend.

46.description: Apparently you can't order regular mayo on the burger- even asking not just once but twice!   2nd time visit and that will be it!  It was a to go order so they could care less and mr attitude taking the order couldn't be bothered less.  He couldn't even say hello when we walked in and then ignored another customer completely,  she basically had to scream at him to take her cash for a pick up order.  Why would you work in a service position with a rude like that, and why does the owner allow that??  To bad as being the only vegetarian in my family it is hard to find a place we can all eat together.

1.description: Came in during the Weekday Lunch Hour with my Boyfriend. The place is very tight in the front, I can't imagine what it'd be like with a rush of customers. Thankfully we didn't experience any kind of traffic jams and ordering was actually quick and easy! The atmosphere is modern and tight, it's a fast food joint. The staff seemed pretty hectic and unengaging and again I kind of understand considering it's fast food.No complaints, the food was good. Nothing spectacular, I will say that the sauce was definitely a game changer! See for yourself! My favorite from this visit was my Strawberry Shake, it was pretty great but I do wish it was a little bigger! Yeah, I'd probably be back ;)

55.description: I walked by Busy Burger and saw their catchy shirts and signs raving about their burger, so I raised my expectations quite a bit coming in. What I had was pretty much the definition of a mediocre burger. For context, I would rate Shake Shack and Five Guys well above this in taste and they're the same price. The burger was overcooked and fairly dry. They had a special sauce which was interesting. I might come back here if I'm craving a quick bite to eat, but I would never go out of my way.

9.description: My boyfriend suggested this place and it was absolutely great, the burger was freshly cook to order which is always a plus!!! The fries were also a hit., I'll definitely be coming back in the near future

26.description: The portobello burger was really good and so were there French fries. I will be back to try the onion rings. Overall exceeded my expectations, though the space is a little cramped. They accept cards now, or at least six when I was there.

25.description: I really like this place. Great neighborhood spot for some quick food. I stop here on a weekly basis and it's been really consistent. The burgers are really good and the last time I ordered here, I got a polish that was yummy. I am a big fan of fries, and they do it well.

12.description: Tasty burgers with lots of fixings to make it even tastier! Good fries, great onion rings and a great Pina Colada shake.

59.description: Best burger in Chicago. Hands down.

21.description: I finally got to try Busy Burger! I must say, I was definitely surprised by how good the burger was. My classmates and I agreed that the bun was really good and the sauce they put on the burger is different and very good. It has a little punch to it and compliments the meat and bun really well. They have indoor seating as well as outdoor seating. The menu has options to satisfy different palates/diets. For a local burger place next to a university, they are kind of expensive. They do offer a discount for students, but it is still kind of on the upper side for a burger. I didn't even get fries. (Broke college student problems...) Other than price, the service was good, food prepared well and tasted awesome, and they didn't take forever to make your order.Don't forget your student ID for discounts!

17.description: The burgers here are flavorful and portioned well. The fries are really good too! Next time I'm definitely trying the portobello burger ... I keep saying I will try it "next time", but every time the "next time" comes around I just want another busy burger again!

10.description: I wanted to get a quick bite to eat THE DAY AFTER.... Thanksgiving.. I took my wife and one of my children. Busy Burger fit the bill. Served a delicious burger ,AND the Fries were VERY good!!!.. Awesome the "Day After"!!.. I had a Stuffed Turkey Burger.. IT WAS quite tasty!!!..As a matter of fact, my wife and daughter had one too!!. They BOTH said the same thing!! It was fresh, Hot, and very tasty. The service was a little slow, and "lacking" but the food overshadowed the short coming of the service. It was that good!! I was completely satisfied, and will got there again I'd suggest anyone try one of the stuffed burgers.

5.description: I finally got to try Busy Burger! I must say, I was definitely surprised by how good the burger was. My classmates and I agreed that the bun was really good and the sauce they put on the burger is different and very good. It has a little punch to it and compliments the meat and bun really well. They have indoor seating as well as outdoor seating. The menu has options to satisfy different palates/diets. For a local burger place next to a university, they are kind of expensive. They do offer a discount for students, but it is still kind of on the upper side for a burger. I didn't even get fries. (Broke college student problems...) Other than price, the service was good, food prepared well and tasted awesome, and they didn't take forever to make your order.Don't forget your student ID for discounts!

3.description: Stopped in on a weeknight for a quick dinner. Regular burger with fries & a soda for 2 people came to about $25, not the cheapest option you could find, and I've had better for less. Food was decent but the burger was lacking the real flame-grilled taste. Ordering was difficult as the only menu in the place is the one large-printed on the wall two feet from the register, so everyone is bottlenecked into the narrow front of store while deciding and ordering. Quick service, staff was ok, but wouldn't come back.

35.description: I'm only giving this place one star because I can't give it any less. I seriously don't understand how they are still open. Don't waste your money or time. Took my co-worker here to find out that the burgers are basically burnt hockey pucks the burger had no flavor the fries again nothing special. We actually both tossed our food. If burnt burgers is your thing and no flavor then you have a place to eat but if it's flavor town keep walking

19.description: The hot dog was good. Nothing spectacular. Just the typical Chicago style hot dog. The guy that ranged my order up was not welcoming at all. He acted like he did not want to be there and I was a bother to him. If you do not like dealing with customers, seek other employment that does not require you working with the public.

28.description: This place was absolutely delicious! I had the Busy Burger with the Cheddar fries! To die for!! That spicy mayo in the burger is what really made it top notch. Definitely buying from here again!

45.description: If the U.S. military declares martial law and you are in Little Italy with no other place to eat and you're famished, head over to Busy Burger.  The place is clean, the staff is friendly...but it all comes down to the food.  This restaurant's namesake is the cheeseburger.  Let me be straight forward with you, the burgers here taste like the frozen patties you get from Costco.  Point blank!  And the price is deserving of my 2-star rating.  $11 got me the double cheeseburger, fries, and a drink.  "That's not bad!" you might be thinking.  Well, that same price gets you a real Chicago meal from Al's Beef.  I don't think I'll be returning any time soon but that's just my two cents.

33.description: My first time eating busy burger. Although the fries were cold & so was the delivery man. There burger with the special tangy sauce made up for it. I'm in love with them an will be back soon.

43.description: I love their burgers! Way more affordable than some other burger places in Chicago and I don't think I'm sacrificing anything for the cost. There's always a pretty decent wait time for my food even if I'm the only one in there, so it's best to order ahead if possible.

2.description: The reason I gave them 1 star, because they have very rude customers service. I order from them at least one or twice a week for delivery . Long story short. Everytime I ordered milkshake or soda they always forgot about it. I know maybe its on different section, but every single time its not acceptable. I tried to explain to the young guy on the register, but he told me that I was laying about that, because it happened so many time. I paid for it and I deserved it. Even the driver didn't want me to tip him, because he feels bad for me. The reason I gave 1 start, because they had good food, my ordered came in 20 minutes (speedy)and delivery guys were polite and professional he even said to order next and it won't happen again. Food: 5 star (cook perfection)Cleanness: 4 star (clean and looks new)Delivery:  5 star (speedy)Customers service: 1 star (I'll put 0 if I could )Ps: the owner should fired the guy on the register, because he didn't know how to handle problems instead scream at customers.

18.description: Not that good. Overpriced too.Burger was kind of plain and dry. Not much flavor. Meat was kind of thin and a little overcooked. Didn't see like they put on much toppings either.

41.description: You got to try the tofu sandwich. I've never liked any American burgers before and this one totally blows my mind. I also ordered avocado and kimchi for sides. You also receive 15% off discount with your student card.

52.description: Pretty basic Chicago food. See char burger, eat char burger.. The burgers are good and the fries are solid. I haven't tried anything else but I will soon. Good service in a vibrant area. College students and medical staff frequent. Outdoor seating area is good when not too sunny.

50.description: I'll try to make this short and sweet as I have a burger on the way coming from Jimmy Green's since a place with "burger" in their name seemingly couldn't handle this great task.  I ordered on GrubHub, one for my husband, one for me. His had "stuff" on it, mine was to be plain.  I didn't add any toppings on mine which is how they do it on the menu of BB. In the comments, I wrote "no pickle", as a reminder. So many places automatically put a pickle spear in- for reasons unknown to me. So, I guess as the intelligent lady on the phone told me, "they were confused" but rather than call to clarify, they just slapped a bunch of crap on it and sent it out the door.  This isn't about my nasty incorrect burger order or even about my husband's dried up burger it's about the rudeness and lack of professionalism they displayed when I called to try to get my dinner fixed. (I don't normally consider a burger "dinner", but I had been craving one allllll day long.  Anyway, she told me she was confused and then also said she wouldn't even know how to credit my order to begin with.  Her tone was rude, they obviously don't really care if you get what you order, however, GrubHub did take care of the situation in a professional manner.  So my Jimmy Greens just arrived and for someone's sake- I better not have any f'n pickles on my burger!

4.description: Yum!!! Perfect burger (I get the turkey), fresh produce, delicious buns and generous portions. And the busy sauce is soon good. Fries are perfect. Onion rings are good, but not as crispy as I prefer (I generally like panko-crusted the best). Overall, this is my favorite burger spot for simple, well-made, fresh burgers.

6.description: Visited this restaurant for the first time.  The hot dog with everything seemed to lack relish and onions, but still good.  The single patty Busy Burger is unique due to the spicy kick which accompanies the charbroiled taste.  The spicy sauce dominates the burger significantly diminishing the charbroiled taste.  My third bite into the burger gave me two different tastes.  My first two bites satisfied my palate with the delicious charbroiled taste.  The third bite and beyond had me reaching for my beverage to subdue the spiciness of the burger.  The burger bun is fresh and tasty as well.  I'd stay away from their shakes.  They are made clumpy and thick which makes it difficult to sip through a straw.

22.description: [ September, 2015 ]A pretty good burger with a nice spicy mayo. The onion ring portion was a bit small, but they were tasty. The highlight of Busy Burger are the shakes! The chocolate shake is one of the best I've ever had, and almost is a meal in itself!

15.description: The stuffed burger is delicious! With fries it comes out to be ten dollars. Very well priced for quality.

57.description: I order a hot dog & chicken sandwich it was nothing special about it. The chicken sandwich was dry with only spicy mustard. i asked for everything which is only lettuce and tomatoes. The hot dog was horrible... expected more considering the reviews and what i had heard about the place. I don't understand the cash only policy when you're located on Taylor street. REALLY!!!  That was my last visit!!!

20.description: While at Chase I smelled something delicious coming from Busy Burger across the street. I did not know how popular this place is. My burger was pretty good, but what I most appreciated was the service. Service is very important, couple good service with good food and you have a winner.

36.description: First time here. I loved a burger and fries was good as well. Also you get  %15 discount with student ID. There seats outside which I would recommend if weather is nice.

14.description: [ September, 2015 ]A pretty good burger with a nice spicy mayo. The onion ring portion was a bit small, but they were tasty. The highlight of Busy Burger are the shakes! The chocolate shake is one of the best I've ever had, and almost is a meal in itself!

28.description: It's sometimes on my way home. I discovered it by accident as I was desperate for some junk food. And really wanted fish for some reason. I was pleasantly suprised how delicious the fish tasted. 4 large breaded Tilapia filets tasted fresh and yummy. With Dinner you get fries, bread and cole slaw. I have to agree, fries had magical properties. Soo good. and so bad for you.We also had their wings. The skin wasn't as crispy as I liked it but the sauce was nice and hot and of course, it came with fries. We didn't know and got more fries. There were no fries left. People are generally friendly. It is located across from the projects and is in a mini strip mall with Jewel. And the floors can  be so slippery they'll kill you. But if you survive all that, you will enjoy some delicious deep fried fish!

1.description: Hubby and I intended to use the groupon for the froyo place on Taylor, so we decided to fill our stomaches first at Captain Hook's Fish & Chicken.  It's located approximately ten (10)-minute walking distance from the CTA Polk Pink Line station.  Once getting out of the station, walk toward Ashland and stay on Ashland southbound until passing Roosevelt.  It's within the shopping plaza where Jewel-Osco and other retailers are.  It's not exactly hole-in-the-wall, but nothing was extraordinary to look at inside the kitchen and the dining room.  Although they proclaim that they serve mainly fish and chicken, their menu is extensive and eclectic like crazy!  I saw hotdogs, all kinds of burgers, tacos, and other miscellaneous items.  Hubby and I kept it simple and ordered a small order of ocean perch dinner and a small order of salmon dinner.  The dinner doesn't include a fountain pop.  In fact, I don't think they serve fountain drinks.  On the previous paragraph I mentioned the huge menu options, well, their beverage menu is as simple as it can be; the options are water (charge $1 for it), mystic, and can sodas.  I would say their fish alone was a five (5)-star quality.  The size of my perches were large and were crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.  Their hot sauce was also pretty on point.  The dinner also came with fries and cold slaw; however, they were both average and there were not much to them in comparison to the yummy fish.  We dined in because the Bachelor was on.  I was used to be obsessed to that show for some reason.  Well, I guess I'm not addicted to the Bachelor or the Bachelorette anymore.  I like this place; it's somewhat disappointing for not offering a fountain drink as an option while other similar joints might have one of the self-service fountain soda machines for customers.  Once again, it's just an disappointment, yet it's not at all detrimental to how I think of the taste and quality of fish they offer here.

9.description: I used to go here all of the time. Loved the Honey BBQ wings. Still do. But one late night I ordered a cheeseburger. The taste overall was just all right. But the reason I'm giving two stars is because when I received the burger I opened the buns and saw that only the edge of a tomato and one small leaf of lettuce was on it. If the cook is going to cut corners with this is he cutting corners with the food I ordered in the past but just didn't realize it? Or the cleanliness of the kitchen?

29.description: Housed in the newer strip mall built here, the place is still on the very clean side, which is always a good first impression.  It is a good idea to call ahead and place your order first, because sometimes the wait for an order can be a little on the long side.  But the food is rather good, and the hot sauce on their chicken wings is tangy, but not scalding.  They do also offer delivery, but whenever I have called for it, they have told me it may be around a two hour wait.  All in all, a pretty good choice for lunch- and the prices are pretty fair.

23.description: While I totally agree with the Firehouse end of this place.. the fish is the best.  I have tried the burgers and steak sammies, but its a waste of money.  The lemonade is good.. desserts are good... any and all fish is good. Sides are standard and hot sauce is just hot sauce.. Servers were ok.. nothing to write home about, but I didn't expect much either. It was a little busy on a Sunday afternoon and I waited about 10 minutes for fish, burgers and sides.. pretty average. I didn't have the energy to drive all over looking for another place so there ya go.It tastes WAY better then Pete the Greek across the street

5.description: Terrible experience, but i will NEVER   Order from   Them Again food was delivered cold and like it had been sitting out for hours

25.description: From the outside Captain Hook's appears to be a separate restaurant from Firehouse Steak & Lemonade. Not until you walk in the same door do you realize its the same business. Sort of a 2-in-1 restaurant deal that now wants to attacked the grilled sandwiches market. Who am I to judge get money get paid, its your business. Now this is where the business owner bites off more then he can chew and starts offering  too many food items and his employees go crazy because this fried fish joint just turned into a sandwich shop too.I ordered an "Original Philly Steak" Sandwich. The menu indicated it comes with sweet peppers, onions, mushrooms, provolone cheese & mayo. Sounds great! But wait here comes the drama.The cashier had me waiting 4 minutes before she took my order. There was only one other customer in the restaurant. I literally counted 5 female front counter help, 2 female delivery drivers and 6 guys on the grill and prep station. Why did it take soooooo long?!? Okay, I am over that.After placing the order for a simple philly steak sandwich I waited 17 minutes, by then the lunch crowd started coming in and they were getting their order before me. I notice they were cooking all the Captain Hooks fried fish orders first and the Firehouse Steak sandwiches orders were not even being prepared.  I am about to ask for a refund when my order was up and I decided to eat it there. I opened the bag and there is lettuce on my sandwich. The menu did not indicate served with lettuce...VERY DISAPPOINTING!!!! Placing lettuce in a philly cheese steak is like putting ketchup on a Chicago Style Hot Dog. Neither their carryout menu or wall menu says lettuce on all philly steaks.Oh it gets worse, only half the sandwich had steak in it. By then the only thing going for me was the 7-up bottle at least that tasted great.I just have to let you in on the horrible service, this place should have just stayed a Captain Hook's since there is more positive reviews for that side of the business.

12.description: Not a savvy yelper but this needed to be done!Talk about cheap! And I'm not talking about price!My co-workers and I order here several times and I decided to change it up and order a chicken sandwich, $7 dollar combo. Boy, was I disappointed, I would describe it as "1cm of actual chicken meat", I can get a bigger portion with a McChicken and we all know how much that costs.Also, try not to be so picky with what you don't want on your sandwich because they will forget anyways and put everything on it.Many times we have our food delivered, ordering several people over the phone, good luck with that. They seem to hate several orders over the phone. Also, make sure everyone gives cash because they will charge for delivery per card. I am not a picky eater and have given this place the benefit of the doubt but I am getting restless of how these orders are managed. Good luck with your orders!

21.description: Good wings. Quick service. Fair prices.

16.description: I have been trying to find good fried fish for a while now, and this place finally fit the bill. They serve fresh fried catfish and tilapia fillets with lots of meat on them. There's no fishy aftertaste at all. Ordering the small fish dinner is still very filling. They also give you fries and a huge piece of bread to eat with the fish. Love dipping the fish into their hot sauce as well. Yummy! Next time I will try their hush puppies.

17.description: Okay perhaps this is premature but I'm headed to CHF&C right now.  10 mins Erica said my order will be ready.  If the food is anything close to her patience and help it will be worth the calories!Erica was great about helping me get the combo I wanted for the amount of food I wanted -- 10 shrimp was just TOO MUCH!  I feel the blood in my arteries coagulating but hopefully it will be worth it!  Thank you!

10.description: I drive by here almost everyday and I can't believe I just recently tried this place for the first time! I had a very strong craving for fried catfish and fries, nothing else would suffice.  I check my handy dandy yelp app for "Fish and Chips" in the West Loop, and lo and behold, 4-star rated Captain Hook's Fish & Chicken came up!It's located in the Jewel Shopping Center on Roosevelt and Ashland, so parking is a breeze. They have a plentiful amount of $5 meals, ranging from fried catfish, to chicken nuggets, to shrimp and all are served with fries.  I got two HUMONGOUS pieces of catfish fillets with fries for only $5! Portions are quite generous and I could barely finish one fillet!The breading is light, not too heavy at all and it's served with hot sauce (mild if requested).  I thoroughly enjoyed my cheap yet delicious meal. If I had one small tiny complaint, it might be that the breading and fries are a tad too salty for my taste, but that didn't stop me from devouring my meal.  And for only $5, it was more than worth it.  I'm definitely coming back!

11.description: One of the best deals around on seafood and chicken.  Shrimp dinners, Fish dinners, Chicken dinners, all at reasonable prices for the amount of food you get.  I usually go with the pIck 2 items for 9.00 (medium shrimp and leg & thigh).  The breading here is that perfect greasy deliciousness...if I weren't health-conscious, I'd be eating here every day.  As it is, I usually have leftovers when I order the Pick 2.  They have $6 deals too...all plates (dinner included) come w/bread, coleslaw, fries and a can of soda.My husband's fave are the chicken gizzards.  The wings are good too, and the fried okra here tops our favorites lists...even the kids like it.  I love the medium shrimp, perfectly mix of breading to shrimp with that lemon pepper seasoning.  My stomach's grumbling thinking about it.Lately, my 4 year old's been into a fried chicken phase.  He liked Captain Hooks so much that literally our last visit last Friday, he sat in his seat, wordlessly (almost mechanically) shoving it down non-stop...like he was afraid it'd disappear if it he didn't finish it right away.  The pieces aren't huge, but a good medium size.They have daily specials, and the Firehouse menu has tons of sandwich and wing options as well, but we always stick with the Capt Hooks side of the menu.We usually eat in.  I'd recommend eating it on the spot, though, on occasion that we've carried out, it's still good (and so are the leftovers).  Served in white paper bags contained in paper boats, it holds the heat pretty well.  Good sized, comfortable dining area, chairs and booths.  Televisions in each corner.Walk up counter service.  They're always friendly to us and we usually don't have to wait longer than 15-20 minutes (for 4 meals).  They're good about giving us time estimate and if it's longer than that, we stop into the Foot Locker next door to browse around til the food's ready.Plenty of parking in the lot. Good stuff.

26.description: I usually get their 20 pc jumbo shrimp and fries and share it with 2 other people.  Between the 3 of us, we sometimes have problems finishing this.  However, we sometimes will also get hushpuppies or a 10 pc wing, depending on how hungry we are.  Their shrimp is truly jumbo and juicy and their breading is light. I really like the lemon pepper seasoning they put on. The wing sauce is really good; the hot sauce is a bit buttery and reminds me of the hooters wings sauce - it's not so hot as to burn your taste buds, but hot enough to have a kick.

27.description: I love it!  This is a little shop located in a strip mall, with ample parking for the size of the place.  It's small- mostly carry out, but they do have booths set up and I do usually see people dining in there.You go to the counter & order, and then its usually 5-15 minutes for your order (at least on weekends when I've gone.)  They have fried seafood, yummy sandwiches, ribs, catfish, hush puppies, rings, and it's all so goooood!!!  They have call ahead carry out, walk-in carry out, dine in and deliver (for business orders only.)Seems family owned, very clean, good prices.  I recommend the hush puppies!!

0.description: I come here all the time for lunch I like there's 2 for 1199 special where I can get. Entrees together

20.description: Well I don't live in this area but I had a restaurant.com certificate and went there. I ordered the jumbo shrimp and 6 wing dinner. It smelled so good while driving home that I decided to just taste a little and OMG I fell in love. The shrimp were to die for! Fresh out of the grease. I was trying to drive and eat these shrimp and I just could not get home fast enough. I have found a new place. Love it!!!

19.description: From the outside Captain Hook's appears to be a separate restaurant from Firehouse Steak & Lemonade. Not until you walk in the same door do you realize its the same business. Sort of a 2-in-1 restaurant deal that now wants to attacked the grilled sandwiches market. Who am I to judge get money get paid, its your business. Now this is where the business owner bites off more then he can chew and starts offering  too many food items and his employees go crazy because this fried fish joint just turned into a sandwich shop too.I ordered an "Original Philly Steak" Sandwich. The menu indicated it comes with sweet peppers, onions, mushrooms, provolone cheese & mayo. Sounds great! But wait here comes the drama.The cashier had me waiting 4 minutes before she took my order. There was only one other customer in the restaurant. I literally counted 5 female front counter help, 2 female delivery drivers and 6 guys on the grill and prep station. Why did it take soooooo long?!? Okay, I am over that.After placing the order for a simple philly steak sandwich I waited 17 minutes, by then the lunch crowd started coming in and they were getting their order before me. I notice they were cooking all the Captain Hooks fried fish orders first and the Firehouse Steak sandwiches orders were not even being prepared.  I am about to ask for a refund when my order was up and I decided to eat it there. I opened the bag and there is lettuce on my sandwich. The menu did not indicate served with lettuce...VERY DISAPPOINTING!!!! Placing lettuce in a philly cheese steak is like putting ketchup on a Chicago Style Hot Dog. Neither their carryout menu or wall menu says lettuce on all philly steaks.Oh it gets worse, only half the sandwich had steak in it. By then the only thing going for me was the 7-up bottle at least that tasted great.I just have to let you in on the horrible service, this place should have just stayed a Captain Hook's since there is more positive reviews for that side of the business.

2.description: Garbage food AAAAAND cashier lady was extremely rude!! She went as far to call me crazy!! I wanted to take it further and ask to speak to the manager but most likely they will not do anything about it. Overall,,place sucks!!

18.description: Great place to get some chicken wings for a great price..

13.description: Very professional ordered 50 wings for a music video that needed catering  ordered them the day before for 1130am asked do i need to pay in advanced  lady said no sir you can pay when you pick them up thumbs up for that alone so 1130 am came along got a call from captain hooks said your wings are ready sent my sister to pick them up since she was in the area  got 50 jumbo wings not  the little buffalo wings JUMBO! another thumbs up came with 2 mild sauce cups and the best part that under the wings layed a bed of fresh French Fries wow all for $29.95 now thats a deal thanks again guys @ C.H .... Will be doing more bussiness in the future

4.description: I would give them a five but..let's just say as long as the food stays fresh and ready I can accept the lack luster from the employees and random panhandlers..

24.description: I'm a huge fan of this place!  Love the sandwiches and love the fried shrimp.  They put lemon pepper on their fries and seafood which adds an extra zing.  Only taking one star away because sometimes the fries aren't too fresh.

6.description: This review is only for their chicken wings, I haven't tried anything else on their menu. My friends and I ordered 50 wings, and we didn't come close to finishing them all. The 50 wings for $25.99 may seem like a deal, but when you see the size of the wings you'll understand why. Also, the fried batter on the wings was really interesting, and not in a good way. After eating the wings, we decided that we could probably get better wings at the Jewel next door, at the same if not better price.

22.description: I have been trying to find good fried fish for a while now, and this place finally fit the bill. They serve fresh fried catfish and tilapia fillets with lots of meat on them. There's no fishy aftertaste at all. Ordering the small fish dinner is still very filling. They also give you fries and a huge piece of bread to eat with the fish. Love dipping the fish into their hot sauce as well. Yummy! Next time I will try their hush puppies.

15.description: my friend brought me here because we was craving for fried food and he suggested this place. its your typical fast food joint service here and the food comes out pretty quick. the place is kind of dirty but bearable to eat at.we ordered fried chicken wings, fish & chips, and onion rings. the chicken wings was pretty decent , it would of been great if the skin is more crispy. the fish taste fresh and the breading was light which is good! the fries and onion rings was just OK.. nothing special about it.will come back to try their jumbo shrimp and hush puppies that other people here is talking about! cant wait!

7.description: Drove by a certain unnamed chicken establishment tonight around 6 p.m. intending to go in and order for takeout. It was found to be closed. In a pinch, my coworkers and I turned to Firehouse Steak and Lemonade for our chicken fix. I called to order at 6:50 p.m. The employee on the other line was quick but both helpful and sharp. We ordered two separate 10-wing dinners with mild sauce and another large chicken tender dinner with mild sauce. I was disappointed to find that it costs an extra $2.00 to have them put the sauce right on the wings. So, we got it on the side.At 7:45, the food arrived. It was delicious. The wing sizes were medium-small and fright in a light, crunchy batter. Of particular note was the seasoning of the batter, very present and pleasant while not in your face. The fries are seasoned as well, awesome. Cole slaw and bread slice included too. The mild sauce is different than most I have had, but definitely still good. In this case, just innocently different. Pros: Inexpensive, tasty, quick delivery, takes cash or card, good serviceCons: The weird extra charge for sauce on the wings, small wing size.Still a five star experience

8.description: Their chicken is soooo good! It is expertly seasoned and incredibly cheap. My friends love buying a huge tray to eat during a Bears game Sunday. Their fries are nice and greasy too. Perfect lunch.

30.description: This is actually a pretty decent place!  Its cheap for lunch and its smoke free!

3.description: Good parking , area is a little ghetto but so am I so fits me well .... Foot locker is next door so every time I order food I go window shopping and that's fun I guess .... Food kinda drags but if ur mad about that then ur probably a boring person regardless or just really hungry and u should've went to mcds.... I call this place firehouse I've never said captain hooks but same shit different toilet .... U can catch me in "firehouse" at least 1 every two weeks or so .... Ps if u wanna be skinny and all model type don't eat here ...

14.description: If yelp would allow me to do 0 stars I would.  Unfortunately I can't review the food because of the disorganization of the people who work there.  I went at lunch time.  It seemed quiet. Only 2 people placing an order in front of me.  Place my order.  Unfortunately they had received a lot of carry out/delivery orders which they never told me about.  After 15 minutes no food and when I asked how long it would be- they had not even started my order and apparently had 2 orders in front of me (the people who had ordered in the store ahead of me had already received their food.  Since I needed to get back to work I had to get a refund.  So now I am at my desk starving thanks to Firehouse and their lack of telling me there were several orders ahead of me.

28.description: I automatically love any shop that opens in the South Gate Shopping center...so with that...Happy Grand Opening Marshalls South Loop.  I went on grand opening day and everything was sparkly and clean. Nice employees filled a pretty huge store stuffed with inexpensive clothing and accessories.  This is a great place to go for tops and shoes (skip it if you're looking for dresses).  Lots of $9.99 tops and sweaters and the shoe section, oh my!  It's huge!  Love it.

1.description: I think most people have some degrees of familiarity with major discount store chains, such as Marshall's, T.J. Maxx, and other brands that can afford to do catchy national commercials.  This Marshall's for me is a hit or miss.  I occasionally can find a shirt or a light sweater that adheres the dress code of the company I work for.  However, 6 times of 10 I am just browsing through since this Marshall's shares the same building with DSW and is diagonally across the road from Nordstrom Rack.  It still doesn't hurt to give someone a Marshall's gift card, since the very same card can be used at any T.J. Maxx or a Home Goods store location.  We were here to purchase a replacement shower curtain rod.  Since we didn't want to pay for parking, and any store in Southgate Plaza can provide validation for the first ninety (90) minutes with any purchase, we took the rod home for $11 after tax.  Just FYI: our first stop was the Nordstrom Rack.  If you're doing any shopping at the "Nordstrom Rack" side of stores, park your vehicle at the Maxwell St. parking lot (validation available for first 90 minutes with a purchase).  We assumed parking for Southgate Plaza was for all the stores on Canal.  The answer was actually negative.

9.description: I'm what I believe to be a reasonably stylish woman.  I know (most) of my designers.  I understand that denim is to be purchased mainly at Norstrom.  I know that Christian Louboutin is the go-to for the sexiest shoes around.  I get a secret rush out of poking through the designer duds in the boutiques around town.I get it. Needless to say, though, I LOVE me a good bargain on clothes, shoes and accessories.  And in my experience there are few stores in our great city that truly offer ridiculously good deals on a consistent basis.  Marshalls is just one of those places.Now, normally I have to be in the zone to really 'do' Marshalls.  There's a lot of pawing through racks of fugly clothes to find your diamond in the rough.  There's never a good selection of sizes.  Things are really disorganized.  It's a total headache.This Marshalls, though, is an anomaly.  All the apparel was in correct size order and there was a huge selection of sizes to boot.  Speaking of boots, this Marshalls boasts a sizable shoe selection.  Perfect for this gal!  Racks of purses, tons of intimates, lots of hosiery... my God.  I was in heaven.My booty at the end of the shopping run?  I nabbed a pair of black, patent leather heels, three shirts, two pairs of undies and three pairs of trouser socks for just a hair over $100.C'mon now.  You can't beat that.

29.description: Finally- South Loopers have an apparel option other than Target!Marshalls just opened up in the former Linens N Things location on the main level of the Southgate Market across from Whole Foods.The employees were extremely friendly and try to be helpful (the store just opened so I will cut them some slack).  The fitting rooms are a good size and instead of single hooks, have a large wire grate with plenty of hang space.The shoe department is predominately boots (tis the season) but offers a decent selection.  The women's/contemporary apparel selection seems larger than the Mag Mile counterpart.What was missing?  The high-end designers.I've been spoiled by the Mag Mile location so I was disappointed that there was no Kate Spade, Stuart Weitzman, etc.Overall, this has all of the makings of a good store.  It is too early to tell if the quality will sustain beyond the initial grand opening, but here is to hoping!

23.description: This new Marshalls has a very good collection.Visited it over the weekend they just opened.The staff is very friendly.

5.description: This is a very good Marshall's. I have to admit, I have found a few gems here in a pinch. Of the discount stores in the area, I probably have been here the least. For some reason, I gravitate to the Burlington and TJ Maxx across the street.This store does not have layaway which is not a deal breaker but something to note. I have found some very nice items here. I

25.description: Hello new Marshalls! This place is conveniently located immediately upstairs from my gym. I'm happy that there is a Marshalls close by my house now.

12.description: I love to shop here.  It feels like I am getting a deal because the tags tell me so.  What does that mean?  Am I a sucker?  Do I believe everything I read?  Well, anyway, I still like to shop at Marshalls.  My students like the clothes I buy from there, so that means a lot to me.

21.description: I love to shop here.  It feels like I am getting a deal because the tags tell me so.  What does that mean?  Am I a sucker?  Do I believe everything I read?  Well, anyway, I still like to shop at Marshalls.  My students like the clothes I buy from there, so that means a lot to me.

16.description: Location: 4 out of 5For those living in the south loop area of Chicago, this particular location is quite convenient.  It's in Southgate Market, and parking for up to 90 minutes is free in the garage with store validation.Overall Selection of Men's Clothing: 2.5 out of 5This store is smaller than the one off Michigan Avenue, and much smaller than the one in Skokie.  I can't speak to the selection and variety of women's clothing, home furnishings, or shoes, but the men's clothing selection seemed disproportionately smaller when evaluating the overall space, i.e., even though this is a smaller store than the others I've mentioned, there still should have been a larger selection of men's clothing than what they currently offer.  Two quick examples:   a)the dress shirts that come in plastic wrap occupy one side of an approximately 25 feet long by 6 feet high shelving unit, whereas at other locations, the dress shirts take up double, if not triple, this amount; and b)men's dress pants with a waist size of 34 in - 36  in only occupies about 10 total feet of rack space.  Organization of Men's Clothing: 2.5 out of 5I was optimistic when I read a previous reviewer's statement that everything in this store was organized by size.  Alas, that is only partly true for men's clothing.  The dress pants were organized fairly well by waist size (sometimes there would be a size 40 waist in the 36 section), and the casual/somewhat dressy clothes on hangers were for the most part, sorted by the correct size.  The dress shirts in plastic, however - that was a real crapshoot.  I was able to find shirts in my size in the bin area labeled 14.5 x 32, I was able to find shirts in my size in the bin labeled 17.5 x 34, and everywhere in between.  Perhaps this was the one draw of having less selection to choose from:  going through each individual bin to find the size I needed took less time because there were less shirts to choose from in the starting pool.  Cost/Benefit Ratio of Men's Clothing: 4 out of 5As with other Marshalls stores, the cost to benefit ratio is quite high.  As a reference, Haggar and Perry Ellis Portfolio dress pants were 15 - 20 dollars a pair, Polo Ralph Lauren dress shirts in plastic were 35, Van Heusen/Geoffrey Beene/Donald Trump Collection dress shirts in plastic were about 20, Van Heusen Studio Collection shirts were 15 - 20, and Chaps long sleeve semi-dress shirts ranged between 15 - 20.  Truly, I don't mind that I'm technically wearing "last season's collection" in any of the brands, because I tend to treat my clothes well anyway, and I have one Van Heusen dress shirt from 1999 that I still wear on a regular basis.  Customer Service: 2.5 out of 5I didn't get to experience the two ladies that were talking amongst themselves about ugly bunny slippers, and I didn't get to experience any outright ignorance either.  Thankfully, my expectations of the cashiers were completely met, as I had no real expectations for any of them.  They knew when to push the button that would light up their register, they seemed to be somewhat adept at wrapping up vases and glass bowls for other customers, and because of modern technology, they were able to ring up customers for the right total amounts.  However, and maybe it's because they sell by volume more women's clothes, I watched as my cashier struggled monumentally to remove the plastic collar support and hanger from each of the free hanging dress shirts I got.  She didn't have a problem taken the pants off of the hangers, but she did experience more obstacles when taking off the antitheft devices; specifically, it took her on average about 3 or 4 tries to get that little bugger off per article of clothing I got.  I wasn't really greeted with a friendly hello, per se, but I was greeted with at least an acknowledgement, and a perfunctory, "Hello, how are you?"  I've seen happier employees at a Taco Bell out in Idaho (true story, check out the review), but I am at least sympathetic to the the fact that the cashiers who work there probably had to work the week of Christmas too, and we all know how everyone (read: consumers) is on their absolute "best" behavior during that week.  So would I have liked to be treated with a little more cheer?  Sure.  But given the perfect storm that is sometimes Marshalls (particularly after a holiday), can I blame the ladies there for being surly?  Absolutely not.  I do need to point out that a bilingual man, who had some semblance of being a store manager, was quite efficient at helping a Spanish speaking family with their purchase.  Overall: 3 out of 5 (germane to men's clothing)The monetary value of Marshalls can't be beat, but take into account the legwork and physical labor of going through shirts or pants one by one before nonchalantly committing to efficiently and quickly make all of your purchases here.  Still A-OK, with a few minor caveats.

17.description: The store is very well kept, lots of friendly staff, but this location does not contain as many designers as their downtown's counterparts. There is a parking lot in the back of the store and street parking, however it is hard to find parking / leave parking lot.

10.description: Their website says they have a mens big and tall section, it was one rack, and most items on it were the same.It was a waste of time. I will avoid it next time.

11.description: Store Review:Sweet deals! I often shop at the busy marshall's in streeterville so it was a treat stopping by this new marshall's that has been open for a while now. The store itself is clean and well organized. The store itself is smaller than others however there are lot of good items on sale. From clothes to shoes to small gifts to kitchen ware, this is a one stop shop for deals. I found the chasier were a lot friendlier than the other locations.Pros- great sale racks, friendly staffCons- far from streetervilleHidden deals- Sign up for a marshall's credit card if you are planning to make a large purchase to save even more money

26.description: It is no secret to anyone who knows me that I love this chain but I feel compelled to write a review of this location because it is SO nice. Perhaps because it is new, perhaps because they've learned a lot from other stores... regardless, I really liked this one. The layout is nice and organized and the staff was super friendly. Now if we can only get a Trader Joe's in SL (better yet, Hyde Park!) my (shopping) life would be SET!

27.description: Bargain hunters, rack sifters, label hounds: the University Village Marshalls is open for business. Sadly, being Marshalls and being where it is, this location while only open for a week looked like it had been attacked from all sides for the last 10 years by fierce Huns and angry tribes. 37 people in line (I counted) and eight cashiers = 7 minutes to check out. Not bad considering how daunting it all looked at first. And hey, this sweet new Bears t-shirt cost me only $10.

0.description: I love these type of stores. I feel like they offer people good clothes for a reasonable price. The one thing I find enjoyable is searching through the racks of clothes and the shelves of shoes. Once in a while, you will find a hidden gem and it is the best feeling. You feel like all that searching was worth it. The store is organized and easy to navigate. You won't be diving into clothing piles. It's spacious and not crowded. I really like this Marshall's.

20.description: I might have caught them at a bad time, but have heard others rave about this Marshalls. For me? Just, okay. Very ok. The shoe selection was nice, and the home decor... Clothing, not better than other Marshalls. If you are looking for basics, fine. But don't expect miracles.

19.description: This new Marshalls has a very good collection.Visited it over the weekend they just opened.The staff is very friendly.

2.description: I'm definitely a little bitter from yesterday. Called 3 times to ask if they had any more of the dog gates that I purchased at the beginning of the summer. Each time was left on hold for about a half hour before hanging up. I finally got someone and they said that they had them. Drove down there and they definitely did not have them so total time wasted was about 2 hours. I was pretty pissed, but one extra star cause I can pick up Calvin Cline undies for less.

18.description: I automatically love any shop that opens in the South Gate Shopping center...so with that...Happy Grand Opening Marshalls South Loop.  I went on grand opening day and everything was sparkly and clean. Nice employees filled a pretty huge store stuffed with inexpensive clothing and accessories.  This is a great place to go for tops and shoes (skip it if you're looking for dresses).  Lots of $9.99 tops and sweaters and the shoe section, oh my!  It's huge!  Love it.

13.description: I like Marshall's. I can always find a great deal no matter which one I go to. This most recent time I went I bought 2 pairs of sandals and a cute dress. I also like to go there to buy sheets, blankets, and kitchen stuff. Oh and I really like how cheap pantyhose/stockings/hosiery are here. Like WAAAAY cheaper than department stores. What's the deal with that? I can get 3 or 4 pairs here vs. 1 there. Free parking with validation or if I'm feeling especially motivated, I can walk here. Very convenient.

4.description: Wow so let's start with the Manager Petora Jackson. I bought a pair of jeans a month ago, I liked them, they ripped at the crotch. I went back and wanted to exchange them for the exact same pair. I didn't have my receipt, but me thinking that this is America and an even exchange at a retail store would be appropriate, I was wrong. Not only was she unashamedly rude but she even accused me of stealing the pair of jeans. I showed her the bank statement on my phone with the exact retail price for the item  and she still wouldn't take it. She embarrassed me in front of my son and wife who were with me and I think I'll probably never shop at a Marahalls or TJ Max again, due to Petora Jackson and her lack of professionalism. Places like these are big and they offer cheap prices for things but we shouldn't be forced to give them money at the expense of our dignity.

24.description: Glad that this location is here, I can sneak in before my Core Power Yoga . For this marshalls to be brand new, I was surprised that they had  a decent selection. The staff was nice minus the employee popping her gum in my ears the entire time I was in the houseware department. I will return

6.description: Need some cheap name brand shirts?  Pants?  Tank Tops? Sports Apperal?  Tons of stuff for the guys! Racks and racks of stuff for the ladies too!  Dig Deep and pick out some winners!  I LOVE Marshalls!  Always find something I can wear or need at a great price!Do try!  Do try!

22.description: New Marshall's!! New Marshall's!! Sweet Ginger Brown. Once in a while I can escape work to go pick up "lunch," and by lunch I mean shop at Marshall's. Some Marshall's are really junky, and maybe this one is nice because it's still new, but who cares? It's pretty organized, and the stock seems to replenish frequently. That line moves like a well oiled machine and they always have plenty of cashiers. They have a great home section in the back that always has cheap Le Creuset. Score. I'm a little hindered with my clothing shopping currently because I'm sporting a basketball with a baby in it across my mid-section, but the men's department is nice and not too euro-trashy, and the shampoo and girly hair stuff? Forget about it! So awesome. Yes, I would like this ginormous bottle of Rusk for ten bucks. Thanks, Marshall's.

15.description: I love all Marshalls stores but the employees here are so unfriendly. At least there's free one hour parking.

7.description: They've expanded their shoe section, which is a great plus for girls!Overall, the store is pretty organized. The fitting rooms are clean and bright, with hooks labeled "maybe" and "definitely" I think.I like looking for bargains and as a matter of fact, I got a Nine West dress for $50! Originally $200. SAH-WEEET.Plus, great location. You can snack at Panera or Whole Foods! Plus, FREE parking for 90 minutes with validation at any of the stores! Even if you don't purchase something.

8.description: A nice, clean Marshalls in a big shopping area. They really did not have any sheets (what I came looking for) but they seemed to have everything else you could possibly need.

3.description: If you don't mind searching through racks for something that you like or wearing last year's style, you can get some incredibly good deals. Usually, this is where I get my running clothes. Why would I pay top dollar for something that's going to get destroyed anyways? The only catch is that the colors or styles are usually the less popular, but I should be running too fast for people to notice anyways.

14.description: This place is pretty organized. One of the con is the service here... there's a snake line to pay for things at the cashier. I stood in line waiting for a good 20 minutes and noticed people who waited off the side and just paid! Seemed to be the case they knew the clerk at the register. The people at the long line just stood gawking. I'm not sure if I would like to experience this again at a different Marshall's... or this one alone.

3.description: Another really cheapy clothing store, its hit or miss but perfect if you need a cute shirt in a hurry or just for one night... this location can get a little crowded and messy because there's a lot of traffic in the area but if you're willing to spend some time searching you can walk away with a lot of cheap, cute stuff!

1.description: I have made some pretty good finds here.  Some clothes are more cheaply made than others, but I haven't had a problem so far..  I surprisingly found some good work trousers that fit like a gem( they have a particular line fitted for curvy body frames).

2.description: With a Christmas bonus in my pocket, which meant money to burn, and a couple of hours before I had to be at work, I hit the stores.  I had never been in here before, and it was kind of cool.  A little on the messy side, and very crowded.  They has a good selection of cute clothes, even in my size.  But I could tell that the quality is not top.  But for the prices, the clothes could not be beat.  I walked out with a bagful of stuff that I would have paid at least $200 for at a department store.  It only cost me about $45.  So I won''t be that disappointed if it falls apart after the first washing.

0.description: I love Dots...I found a winter coat that was $90 went back to the store when they had a sale and got it for $3. The cashier kept scanning it because she couldn't believe the final price.

28.description: My favorite taco place in Chicago. Tried some of the different places around it, it is NOT the same. I LOVE this place. Fresh made tortilla. It makes  me feel like i'm getting homemade tacos.

1.description: Street tacos from the heavens! Rubi's knows how to deliver the best of the best here on Maxwell.Having been around for so many years, it's no surprise that this small shack consistenly draws in big crowds. On Sunday's during Maxwell's Street Market, they open up shop to the local community and sell their bomb tacos and quesadillas. For $3+, you get what I call the Chicago KING/QUEEN of Street Tacos.They produce, pound, and bake their own tortilla here, and watching them make it is also a spectacle. The selection of meats, veggies, and sauces here outweigh other taco stands in the same area. They are GENEROUS with the queso, so I do recommend ordering a quesadilla over the taco just to get this. I myself got one drowning in chile and chicharrón, and it was nothing short of spectacular.I definitely see myself coming back here again for more tacos. None of the other stands have it as great as Rubi's. It is worth every minute in line.

9.description: These are the best tacos/quesadillas I've ever eaten by faaaaaar.  I like everything I've tried, but steak is my favorite.  The meat is grilled and well seasoned.  The tortillas are homemade.  The cheese is melted. The green sauce is so good.  The tacos/quesadilla are huge and priced well.  There's nothing left to say, except "get you some ASAP."  You're welcome!

29.description: Delicious. Long line in hot sun.  They make their own tortillas right there. We had al pastor (pork) our favorite.  $3.00-$3.50 per but these are fairly large tacos.

23.description: Rubi's has finally opened after the long and terrible winter of Chicago. The best remains the best. As usual, I had two steak tacos and one taco al pastor. As always, the steak was juicy and well-seasoned. The pastor was very flavorful and seasoned. What sets these tacos apart as number one apart from other taco restaurants is how the meat is prepared and served. The meats are well-seasoned, not overpowering or not bland. The meats are chopped coarsely for bigger chunks, locking the juices within the meat as well as preserving the natural chewiness and resiliency you find in each bite of well-grilled meat. Tacos from other restaurants lack this because the meats are chopped finely. I rarely add any salsa onto these tacos because I like them as they are. Their corn tortillas are pressed and prepped right in front of you. The grilled onions served on the side were sweet and crunchy - a nice palate cleanser for the next flavorful taco. I am still amazed at the freshness and taste of their tacos.As always, there was a line and it was cold outside; but, it was still well worth it since I waited so long for Rubi's to reopen. Luckily, there were 4-5 people before me - not much of a wait. However, there were more people lining up after I got my food. Despite it being cold outside, these freshly made tacos, straight off from the grill, warms me up. I still have difficulty choosing how many steak tacos and tacos al pastor I want. Maybe I should get four tacos rather than three to make it even. Nothing beats Rubi's!

5.description: I've been excited and intrigued for authentic street food at the Maxwell Street market and to Rubi's cause I've seen way too many reruns of Rick Bayless rejoicing the awesomeness of freshly made tacos. Wait was about 40 minutes.As the wait was so long, I put in a big order, thinking I'm not going to stand in line again, and plus Mr. Bayless said these were his favorite. Al Pastor - my typical standby for a taco stand.Lengua - the misunderstood meat,  and my tie breaker if this place is either awesome or not good.Asado Quesadilla - pretty much like a taco, but with the griddled mild cheese. (This ended being my favorite of the three).It was a lot of food. I barely finished the 2nd one and took one for the road ... mainly because my friend got us a tamale to eat while standing in line.The truth was, they were just okay. The taco shells are quite chewy, doughy and sits heavy. The lengua had an off smell and too soft and overall just kinda gross. And I usually like lengua for the record. And for the al pastor, didn't do it for me. Honestly, all it was mostly "bready" taco...  I feel bad, but I'm giving it the extra star because I haven't been to anywhere else like this to compare. It's a unique to Chicago, I'll give it that!

31.description: I must have eaten here when they were having an off day, because the tacos my boyfriend and I got were extremely bland.  We'd heard nothing but good things about Rubi's (and it's obviously popular as there was a huge line), so naturally we were disappointed.  We split an al pastor quesadilla, a steak and peppers taco, a steak and cactus taco, and the huitlacoche (corn mushroom) taco.  All of them seemed to lack seasoning except for the al pastor, but even of that, I've had better.  You have the option of getting free grilled whole green onions with your food.  While nice in theory, it actually added to the blandness of the tacos and I took them out.  I will say though that the tortilla was probably the best part of the taco.  They make it right there at their stand, and it's a great mixture of soft and crispy.  The vegetables were also very fresh.Despite the unsatisfying experience, I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that they just happened to underseason the food that day; however, I don't see myself ever going back.

25.description: OMGOMGOMGOMGOMGOMGOMGOMGOMG! #SOFREAKINGGOODThis is the best taco stand in Maxwell Street Market...no lieYes, you will wait in a ridiculous line.Yes, they make their tortillas right thereYes, it is CHEAP!Yes, it will change your Mexican life foreverNo, do not think that every stand is the same here...Rubi's is by far the best.  Manolo's another good one, but still not as good.

12.description: "Keep Calm and Have a Taco" ... Don't mind if I do! There's a lot of great food on Maxwell Street Sundays, but Rubi's is my go-to favorite. Nothing real fancy, just a real good authentic taco served by some real friendly people. If you're in the area on a Sunday, do yourself a favor and stroll up and down the market and enjoy a great lunch.

21.description: I came here on Sunday at about 12:15.  The line to wait for food was quite long, but not unusually long, the big line is common place here but you usually get through in 20-30 min at this time from what I was told by my brother.  Well today was the day of dumb asses.  As I waited forever and ever, 45 minutes to be exact.  I kept wondering what was causing this damn line not to move.  I was thinking are they slow at serving people?  Is their methodology of serving everyone way off?  Well, once I reached the point to order my food at 1:00 P.M. They asked what I wanted, they started making it right away, and rang me up in no time, and my food was ready quite fast.  So no it was not the staff at all, they are highly efficient, friendly, and have their bearings about them.  The slow line was caused by dumb ass people that did not know what they wanted, how rude to not know what you want and hold up a line when you have all the time in the world to figure it out and the menu is posted right there for everyone to see!  Anyway, they have their raw corn meal for making tortillas on the spot right there.  The woman will grab a hunk then press it and make it into the shape it is supposed to be, then she hands it to the man doing the griddle, he then will shave the Al Pastor off of the spit that you can see rotating then voila!  There is your Al Pastor taco!  I only mentioned Al Pastor because that is what they are known for and all you really should be ordering.  I recommend getting the Quesadilla with cheese then getting Al Pastor stuffed into it.  The cheese is really good that it being Chihuahua cheese.  They take a big hunk of it and put it in the fresh tortilla then get it on that griddle, such oooey goooey delicious cheese!  The Al Pastor is amazing and made perfect, with the perfect balance of the pine apple, this is the best you can get in Chicago.  They open at 10.  If you do not want to deal with a line come at 10 or anywhere during the 10 am hour.  At 1130-12 the line starts to pick up.  Then after 12 it is harsh until 1.  This Sunday was terrible during the noon hour with the line, mainly because it was not moving due to moronic customers.People please decide exactly what you want when you approach the stand.  Because you have tons of time to figure it out and it is downright rude the hang out and ask 5,000 questions and be disorganized up in the front.  Try to think about the many hungrey people patiently waiting behind you, do not be selfish.

16.description: Most of the time, long lines for food when there are numerous options at a festival or in this case a market don't lie. We tried tacos at another stand and they just didn't stack up to Rubi's. Their tortillas are made fresh on the spot. I recommend getting quesadillas. They aren't your standard quesadilla. Instead it's a taco with a brick of quest melter into it. Phenomenal! Their Al pastor and Asada with cactus were the big winners. The food tastes fresh and is plentiful. The price is awesome too for the quality. We came out of the suburbs just to try Rubi's and have no regrets. A great find in the City. Too bad they are open only once a week...
