This was my favorite dish.Salad: hen of the woods + cipollini onions + baby greens + ricotta salata + limoncello vinaigrette - was simple and good.Giant stuffed ravioli - this was the favorite dish of the wives, though I thought the pasta itself could have been betterThe special pasta was a linguini with either lamb or boar and was fantastic as well.Dessert - I had a pudding with apples and marshmallow. It was okay but not necessary when the main fair is so good.

47.description: Ducked in for dinner w coworkers last night. I've always loved this place, and last night delivered again. If you don't know, it's basically Italian style tapas. We had the ricotta and honey comb spread for an appetizer, which was really tasty; crushing the honeycomb into the cheese added a delicious sweet kick. We had the prosciutto and arugula pizza, and that was a major highlight; the others really enjoyed the Polpo con rafano (octopus), but I'm not super into that stuff so I can't rate it fairly. I insisted we get the polenta and ragu (it was pork shoulder) and all 3 of us eagerly scraped it off the board they bring it on. Dessert we had some sort of donut w ice cream that was good, but the sauce was literally a glass of espresso, which was a bit much for me.Wednesdays was 25% off bottles of wine which would have been nice, but with only 2 wine drinkers we opted for by-the-glass instead. With one app and three courses, we had enough for 3 people.Note: it can get kind of loud here. Bring friends with loud voices.

8.description: They recommend that the table shares the dishes bc they are small... for 2 people, about 2 to 4 dishes. The recommendation was right on point. We got the bruschetta, polpo, linguini with crab and sea urchin, and polenta with ragu. Highly recommend the polenta with Ragu and the sea urchin and crab linguini. The polpo was unique as it had all types of ingredients on it but it was just a little salty for me.This place would be great for date nights and birthdays!

31.description: The food and service here are wonderful.  My husband and I intend to try everything on the menu because everything we have tried is delicious!  However every time we go we must eat the mascarpone polenta with the Ragu of the day!!!   OMG this polenta is hands down the best polenta anywhere. So creamy and satisfying.  The Cacio e Pepe pasta is soooo yummy.  It is a very simple pasta dish of pasta, cheeses, and freshly ground pepper.  It is simply divine!  I have been thinking about this dish ever since I ate it weeks ago.  There pizzas are very good and the salads.  Yesterday we went for Sunday brunch and both of our dishes were spectacular!  We have come to the conclusion of all the restaurants in Chicago to try and investigate we intend to keep Davanti at the top of the list and eat there on a regular basis.  We love being greeted with warm friendly smiles from the staff when we walk in the door.  We are keeping Davanti on our regular dining out rotation.

34.description: Small little Italian place in Little Italy.  Really good! Server was surprised we came out from downtown Chicago to eat there, but if your're going to eat Italian, might as well eat it at Little Italy right?  We had the pork belly, and although they were thick cuts of meat, it was cooked through, crispy on the outside and still soft and moist on the inside.  The pappardelle was really good and the regatoni was also delicious.  Definitely try it!

16.description: The food and staff were great!  Ron was amazing and we'll go back just because he was fun and we had such amazing service. Thanks for a wonderful night.

13.description: Possibly one of the best restaurants I have been to in Chicago ! I was blown away by the superb taste and the richness of all the little dishes.First of all, the dishes are small. And they are quite expensive but the taste is divine and the dishes are surprisingly filling. My brother and I ordered two cheeses and the prosciutto. They came in a lovely display accompanied by crackers, apple slices, and two adorable tiny jars of jam and mustard.I don't remember which cheeses we ordered but the waiter was extremely helpful in our decision. The cheeses were amazing and extremely filling.Next we ordered the linguine and spaghetti+ pecorino. They are very different from each other as the linguini was wrapped in a savory seafood fragrance and the spaghetti was creamy and smooth. Both were extraordinary.I highly recommend coming to this place. It's fancy and quaint and it will leave you full and satisfied. Definitely coming back!

11.description: So yum!! This place encourages sharing so the 6 of us had the mozz & basil pizza, spaghetti, ravioli, steak, some amazing wine (cade cab 2011), the kids had some root beer, some delicious desserts - the donut, the "ground up" candy bar, and the gelato. I'm not using the official names but if you go with any of those you can't go wrong. It was so so good. We are from SC so was a great place to come for visiting Chicago. And our waiter (Ron) was fantastic and so helpful in choosing menu items, especially with the wine. (He even brought us some delicious limoncello for after dessert. YUM.) This place rocks!!!!

39.description: As much as I LOVE Spiaggia and Piccolo Sogno, my favorite pasta in Chicago is Davanti's riccio di mare e granchio (linguini with sea urchin and crab). Well, usually...  My husband and I have been eating at Davanti for years.  After a a little hiatus, we returned and...  total disappointment.  The pasta was barely al dente.  Worse...  it was completely bland.  No unctuous uni butter coating the pasta and only a few measly flecks of crab.  The polenta was a little underseasoned and the pork ragu was stringy and fatty.  The prosciutto pizza was fine as was the seared octopus. The only highlight of the night was the brown butter blondie... dense, rich, not overly sweet with different layers of butterscotch-caramel-brown-sugar flavors. Thank goodness our server talked us into it!As for the sub-par pasta and polenta...  hopefully it was just an off night.  Perhaps the b-team works on Sunday evenings?

37.description: Very impressive for a hotel restaurant and bar. We didn't eat much- just a few nibbles as we were at the hotel for a wedding. But what we did have was tasty, and everything we saw looked great. Others in the wedding party loved their breakfast. We loved the Bloody Mary bar they had in the mornings. Awesome selection of hot sauces, seasonings, and goodies. The bacon was to die for. The service was hit or miss depending on the bartender. We found a few to be awesome, usually at night, and a few to be crabby, the daytime staff. The general manager hung out with us one night and he was a super cool dude. Nice and friendly and made us feel welcome. He even knows Obama. The only reason I say 4 stars is one bartender was very bad... And I mean very bad. Aside from her- 5 stars!

0.description: I want to start by saying that Dina and the rest of the staff at Davanti Enoteca were absolutely wonderful this past weekend. I called a few weeks ago and asked if they took reservations for large groups, to which they said yes but suggested we go with a pre-set menu for our group of 12. I worried that this might not sit well with the rest of my group, since it was also a set price, and that the quality of the food might be jeopardized, but I could not have been more wrong. BEST suggestion ever. And here's why: 1)We went with their cheapest per person menu and were given SO much food, even the guys in our group were happily stuffed by the end of the meal. 2) The food was ready as soon as we sat down at our table. I'm not kidding--as soon as we sat down, they brought out the appetizers. And each course after that was ready to go as soon as we were ready for it, too.3) EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS. From the starters to the dessert, everything was absolutely incredible. We started with bruschetta, which was made with seasonal vegetables instead of your generic tomato mix, and it was so good. We also had the mason jar of ricotta with honey--YUM.  For the second course, I chose the prosciutto pizza and it was absolutely lovely. And for our entrees, I chose the spaghetti carbonara, rigatoni wth Italian sausage, and pork shoulder polenta. OMG THE PORK SHOULDER POLENTA!!! I will remember it forever. And last but not least, a plate of their reputable Blondie bars--to die for. 4) From our wonderful waitress, to the very nice and considerate gentlemen who helped her, and last but not least Dina, everyone who worked with us at Davanti Enoteca was kind and so considerate. After sitting and enjoying our meal for 2.5 hours (maybe more), Dina came over and asked if we wouldn't mind moving to the bar. She felt SO bad about having to move us (there were other people waiting for our table) that she sent us off with a free bottle of wine. Totally not necessary, since we were paid and motivating to leave anyway, but just exemplified the consideration they have there for their guests.Five stars all around and hope to be back soon!!

38.description: With having friends in from out of town Sunday, we were highly interested in bringing them to share in such a unique experience as we have heard nothing but great things about Davanti's (and wanted to show them the old neighborhood.) From the minute we walked in to the minute we walked out, it was exactly that...the warm and welcoming host, the cozy atmosphere, the very informative waitress Carla, the perfect wine recommendation, and the delicious food! My fiance and I love tapas, but Italian style...it doesn't get much better than this! We were then approached by the manager Lisa who made us feel right at home and just topped off our night. But please do not leave this place without having the best dessert on this planet...The Blondie. Words cannot even explain this. SERIOUSLY!!!! Obviously, we will be returning, and a very special thanks to the crew..Carla, Lisa, and Jose. Mikey B and Tiffany

51.description: I'm a little ashamed that it's taken me this long to write a review because I've dined at Davanti Enoteca so many times.   Running a restaurant has to be one of the most challenging undertakings out there, especially in a city that has so many offerings as Chicago.  I love introducing friends to Davanti because they are blown away by the food.  The dishes are simple, elegant and well executed consistently.  The favors are balanced and the dishes are arranged in a thoughtful manner.   Sometimes when I go with friends, we wind up doing a number of small plates but I always insist on the polenta + ragu, ricotta and honey comb.  The pork chop is perfectly cooked, flavorful and beautiful.  The risotto is al dente, and flavorful with a gorgeous presentation.   You can't go wrong with any of the pizzas, or pastas. Just yesterday, I discovered their (Saturday/Sunday) Bloody Mary bar which is " DIY" and genius.  Davanti is always one of my top pics.

27.description: I've been several more times and stand by my review.  In addition to the items above, add the blonde dessert and flank steak.  Only item we've gotten and not enjoyed was the octopus, over cooked. I enjoy the location inutile Italy, tho both have great food.

32.description: My best friend and I are visiting from out of town, and stopped here for dinner as a recommendation of our host... All I can say is WOW!! Im so glad we took her suggestion!We made a reservation online before we left the house and were seated immediately upon arrival. The atmosphere was great (bustling but not crowded, warm and all around inviting), the service was prompt (empty plates were almost immediately removed and waters were refilled well before we even noticed they were getting low), Carla was our server and she was so great! Knowledgeable of the menu, made great suggestions, and was so sweet and friendly! (I'm a server myself and I give her an A++) And I haven't even started talking about the food! It was OUT OF THIS WORLD GOOD! We ate more than two hours ago and we're still talking about it! It wouldn't be an exaggeration to say this was the best food we've ever had! The only thing I'm sad about is that I can't take this restaurant with me when I go home. If you haven't eaten here yet, you need to go! It's as simple as that.

54.description: This is the original Davanti and the only 2 drawbacks I found on this visit is no outdoor seating, and both the weather and location was begging for that on a gorgeous summer day. The other was service. Although our server tried to be there in a timely manner, he could not simply because he was the only server on a Thursday afternoon lunch. He was knowledgable and had suggestions but certainly harried. On to the food that we shared:Fontina and egg toast with asparagus was delectable. Beet salad which I always go with was average, the burger was huge and flavorful, also split 3 ways with shoestring potatoes, the chop grilled with peaches was rather fatty, with no more than 3 thin slices of clean meat. A shared order of pasta with sausage that was also flavorful. Also a side of corn with mushrooms, which I thought the corn on its own would be better, and I like mushrooms. We shared the strawberry tart along with chocolate pistachio cake, which was more like a hard fudge. I wouldn't recommend either and just go with gelato next time. It was a mixed bag this time, and usually they're better. Great place for sharing and not your typical Italian. I have been here before and had better luck with other items, and more prompt service. It wasn't for lack of trying, more for lack of help in regards to the service. Even the hostess helped the one server.

48.description: We were here In Chicago and wanted Italian food. Found this place on Yelp and were not disappointed. The food was old style Italion and the service was fantastic! I can't wait to come back to Chicago to eat here again!

44.description: Great restaurant, relaxed atmosphere, beautiful decor, good wine, delicious food! Great place to go with friends or for date night. The dishes are purposefully small and made for sharing, which makes the experience really fun. Can't go wrong with any pizza, pasta, or flatbread-the ones I've tried have all been delicious. I wish our server on our last visit hadn't been so pushy though, kept recommending the most expensive food/drink on the menu.Other than that I've had overall great experiences here. Definitely recommend making reservations because they're always busy. Even with a reservation we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table to open up.

24.description: I came here on a business trip to Chicago and liked it so much I came back the next day. The entire menu is fantastic and you really can't order wrong. We tried a fair amount of the menu and loved it all. The flavors are vibrant and unique! Everything is handmade, and you can taste it. The noodles are perfectly al dente. Fantastic wine list. All good! Also, Christina is a FANTASTIC server - if you can request her, you should. So happy with her service and recommendations. Thank you for a good work trip!

7.description: Love this place . Small plates to share , delicious food ! Excellent selection of  pizza, pasta . My favorite pasta is black pepper pasta , super simple but extremely flavorful . Excellent selection of wines . Great location right in the heart of little Italy. Great place to visit to enjoy excellent Italian food and great wine !

49.description: In love!!!  I was so impressed by this place.  I had a completely different vision before I walked in so I was blown away.  My boyfriend and I went for dinner. Atmosphere:  The space is beautiful.  We sat at a table in the bar.  The decor was gorgeous with brick archways, walls made of old wine cases, rustic lighting.... I could go on for hours about it.Service:  Our waiter (who I believe to also be the bartender) could not have been more hospitable.  He promptly brought us waters and menus (one of my biggest pet peeves is sitting and waiting to be greeted upon being seated).  He guided us through the menu, wine lists and daily specials and made a couple recommendations.  He was quick to change plates, fill water and wine, bring entrees and remove items no longer needed.  He was also social and funny.  Felt like we were being served by a friend (and this goes for everyone that helped during service and seating).Food:  I had been craving good pasta and this hit the spot.  We tried the bruchetta special ($5 on Sunday) which included squash.  I hadn't had anything like it and it was a refreshing spin on standard bruchetta.  It was served atop 4 pieces of bread.  Next we tried the warm kale salad (Kale, Guanciale, Orange, Pecans, Pecorino).  This was my least favorite dish as it was a little salty from the Guanciale and I didn't care for the temperature of it but it was still very enjoyable.  We ordered 3 pasta dishes (the raviolo, rigatoni and cacio e pepe).  We asked that all the dishes be served "al dente" which our server was a little confused by (surprising) but they still hit it on the head.  The Raviolo is stuffed with spinach and covered in parm and olive oil.  This is only one piece but large enough to split between two people (although you won't want to).  This was my favorite dish of the night.  Next, the cacio e pepe was a little over cooked to our liking but the pecorino was perfectly melted and creamy.  If the pasta was cooked a little less this would have been my favorite dish.  The Rigatoni was a last minute addition since I was craving some red sauce and I'm so glad we did!  The pasta was cooked to perfection and the sausage was very flavorful.  We added parm to the top and I ate it in minutes.  The sauce was simple and was just enough.  Wine:  They offer 5 and 8 oz pours and bottles.  Their wine list is expansive and everything is reasonably priced.  We enjoyed a bottle of the Asti.  We intended to enjoy a little and take the rest home, but it was so good we finished it all at dinner.  Unfortunately we were too stuffed for dessert but we were given free limoncello which was some of the best I've had.  Usually I leave this behind because it's too tart or strong but this, to me, was the perfect amount of tart, sweet and liqueur.

40.description: Just got home from one of the most wonderful meals i've had.  Similar to tapas you share plates but the portions are larger.  Started with the ricotta and honeycomb on toasted bread.  Delicious!!! Then had the marscapone polenta with pork ragu.  This was so good.  The pieces of meat you get just melted in your mouth.  Had the veal meatball.  It was ok but the kale that it sat upon was very good.  Also had the brussel sprouts.  They were a cacaphony of flavors.  But they were delicious.  The last dish we had was the ravioli stuffed with ricotta and spinach with brown butter.  Didn't care for this as all i tasted was hard pasta.  Ron, our server was excellent.  If it weren't for him we would have been lost.  I didn't know what kind of wine I wanted so he gave me a splash of a couple until I was satisfied.  We will definately go back.  If your a foodie you'll love it.  If your not well just try something you've never had before.  I will definately have the ricotta and honeycomb and the polenta with ragu.

53.description: Terrible! Portions are unbelievably small and I felt like I had a kids meal for $16.00? 5 rigatoni on a plate. Seriously?! And no bread! Inexcusable and I'm still hungry....

30.description: I thought the food here was very solid.  The wild Boar pappardelle was very good.  The noise level was a bit much as it made it hard to have a conversation with my date. While the service was good- -it was a bit annoying.  I felt very rushed to order, the waiter kept coming over literally every two-three minutes to see "if we were ready."  It was a Saturday night, but it wasn't like we were lingering forever not making up our mind, we simply wanted to enjoy a glass of wine for a bit before we ordered.  (And we had already ordered an appetizer).Also the bus boy (and waiter)  kept refilling the water which sat on the table (and wine also on the table) every time we took sips.  My boyfriend finally asked them to stop doing that and he would keep things filled. Good food, but won't go back.

46.description: My dad and I visited Davanti Enoteca over Labor Day Weekend. The food was astonishingly delicious, boarder-line orgasmic. I had plenty of choices as a vegetarian. We both had the famous truffle egg toast (delicious!), the arugula salad with a 5-yr balsamic vinegar dressing (very sophisticated taste), and the Pizza of Earth which is basically a decked out mushroom pizza full of flavor. I also got the raviolo with brown butter sauce- the only fault I find is that it's a singular, and not a plurality/plethora of ravioli...this dish literally blew my mind. And since the Merriam-Webster dictionary defines "literally" to mean "actually" as well as "virtually", you will have no idea if my mind is actually or figuratively blown and if I'm just a mindless reviewer.

1.description: Sunday morning brunch, my wife and 2 kids. We got the pork shoulder/polenta "board", the mushroom/truffle oil pizza, kid's burger, a pile of toast & jam, and the burrata/toasted cherry tomato app.The toast and jam was reported by our kid as being excellent, and, as it was a rustic italian loaf dusted with potato flower, it was very good. Kid #2's burger and seasoned fries were also good, and our daughter called the fries the "best fries ever".My wife and I agreed that the food was good. The pork shoulder/polenta was actually served on a cutting board, and was good, but under-seasoned (needed salt). My wife's thin-crust pizza was very good. The burrata/tomato app was also good, but also needed seasoning - again, salt.Service was good. All thought the restaurant was cold, temperature-wise. At $100 (my wife had 2 glasses of wine as well), it was pricey for brunch, and better is certainly available around the city, but it is a pretty-good choice if you're in the neighborhood.

55.description: I have to admit, we were surprised.  We had read the reviews on line and wanted to try Davanti.  When we arrived, we were a little shaken to see that the restaurant is nestled into the lobby of the Marriott.  We are staunchly opposed to hotel restaurant food so we balked.  Happily, however, we went in.  While I don't love the decor -- I would have given 5 stars but for the decor which is a bit phony -- the food was outstanding.  Everything we ordered tasted real and delicious.  We began with the tuna carpaccio, a summer squash salad and an arugula salad.  It was all fabulous all real tasting, like from some great cook's home.  We followed with the rigatoni with sausage and tomato which was just perfect.  We were so delighted, and our server was so solicitous and wonderful.  It was the right beginning to a lovely Chicago summer evening.  So so so glad that we went here - we will be back and we recommend highly to everyone.  Ignore the Marriott sign!

9.description: Great service and tasty food!! I ordered the traditional breakfast and it was a huge portion. The bacon and potatoes are out of this world!!! I would definitely come back here!

26.description: A bit pricey but worth it! Our waiter helped us decide what to order and we were not disappointed.

25.description: Food is ok but their service stinks and the online menu doesn't match what's currently offered. How hard is that to do? I generally find it to be too expensive and full of themselves. It's Taylor Street, people.

12.description: Very good food good menu selections and nice cozy place.Even my European colleague thought this place was great!

59.description: Was told Davanti was the best Italian restaurant in Chicago so I had been waiting to try it for over a year before going last Friday.My girlfriend and I had reservations for 7. We were seated right away and it looks like there were still empty tables available at that time. The restaurant itself is really cute, exactly what I would expect from a highly acclaimed Italian restaurant in Little Italy. We had a server in-training, so service was a bit slow throughout the meal. We started with a glass of wine and a Peroni. The wine by the glass menu was a bit expensive for us (recent college grads) so we stuck with the cheapest options.Davanti does small plates, so keep that in mind when you order. My gf and I did the gnocchi, the tagliatelle and the Pizza D.O.C. (a margarita pizza). The pizza came first and it was the perfect dish to start with. Warm and fresh with a crisp, thin crust. When we finished that the gnocchi came out. It was SO good but the dish was SO small. It might have been the best gnocchi dish I've ever had but we probably paid $2/gnocchi. That's a bit much in my mind. The tagliatelle was a slightly bigger dish and was also very good.This is a great restaurant! I can't give it 5 stars this time around because the service was a bit slow and the dishes are really expensive for being so small. If you get an experienced server and price isn't an issue this will be one of the best Italian experiences you can get in Chicago!

21.description: I was so very impressed not only the food but the exceptional staff! From the smiling valet to the hostess were so friendly. Our waiter was more like my personal waiter who attended to my every need even with my group of 6 and a toddler. I had asked him what he recommended and he told me the octopus which I never ate before and it was awesome. Every time I wanted something like more champagne, Ron was there before I lifted up my head. He had a beautiful smile and you can tell he enjoys in what he does. Also the other waitstaff was so attentive. Thank you

17.description: I think we got the wrong stuff, because it was good but nothing really jumped out at us. Ricotta cheese, arugula salad, and white mushroom pizza were all just ok. Rigatoni and octopus were good. I'm willing to give this another try, but we will order different items.

10.description: This is easily my favorite Italian restaurant in America. Something about it just drives me wild. I always get the ragu and polenta. Other than that I try to mix it up. I have yet to be disappointed. Service is great too.

5.description: Great Italian food good drinks and tasty desserts My second time back was even better than the first we where a party of four and had chose to eat different things on the menus and share. What a taste to me tastebuds

3.description: Came here twice on Saturday morning for brunch. I loved their food and service. The waiter recommendation is awesome. My favorite dish was definitely the pork belly :) The onions were crunchy and tasty with the crispy pork. Loved every bite of it. The blondie for dessert was also delectable and ended the meal well. Also, don't forget to try the bruschetta (unless you're lactose intolerant). They also have something special here (forgot the name, but only remember bloody mary) and I will definitely try to come back to try that here when I get a chance :DI ordered the truffle toast and it was delicious, but it felt incomplete. I guess it's because I love truffle oil so much that I just wanted more?

35.description: This place is just all around great. My party was sent there by a recommendation from the staff at the museum of broadcasting. The food and prices were really welcome. Ironically the best part of our meal was a side dish, not to demean the entrees. Their cauliflower was really,really good. We could've double downed on that alone and it would have been a good meal. Also the service was sparkling. Definitely a good locale!

19.description: I came here on a business trip to Chicago and liked it so much I came back the next day. The entire menu is fantastic and you really can't order wrong. We tried a fair amount of the menu and loved it all. The flavors are vibrant and unique! Everything is handmade, and you can taste it. The noodles are perfectly al dente. Fantastic wine list. All good! Also, Christina is a FANTASTIC server - if you can request her, you should. So happy with her service and recommendations. Thank you for a good work trip!

28.description: Excellent atmosphere and servers. Great wine selection  and amazing food. There was one rude hostess though.

45.description: Great Food.  Really good location!  Try the honeycomb ricotta.  They do Italian right!

33.description: So delicious and such a nice ambiance to bring a family. We came with a pretty big group including three littles and had a fantastic meal and great service. Plenty of classic Italian to please half pints, including the standard cheese pizza. And plenty of more interesting dishes for the mature palates - the honey comb is a great starter. The salads were sizable and tasty and the broccoli side is so good. Nice wine and beer list too.

43.description: I've held a small birthday dinner reservation at Davanti Enoteca several weeks ago. It was a Friday night and the place was packed and super loud with music and chatter - not as intimate and quiet as I'd anticipated. The food was delicious and thoroughly enjoyable. I only wish the service was a little more prompt and friendly. Our waitress barely checked on us and when she did she seemed a tad unhappy and annoyed. There was a mix-up with an order we didn't place, but which the staff did not want to take back even though we had not touched it. The manager attempted to convince us to take it "to-go" and pay for it anyway since, as he explained, "they cannot re-sell it to another customer", but after refusing several times they subsequently took it back to the kitchen and off of our tab. For the rest of the night our waitress did not check on us and some other members of the staff took care to settle our bill.

2.description: A weeknight dinner for two. Great atmosphere, courteous service in a small plate/sharing format.After reading the reviews, I felt compelled to try the linguine with crab and urchin.  I can't say I saw any urchin, but it had a nice saltiness.The wine list was are above average and reasonably priced (for the city).I wish I could the place is "special" but just didn't get that Taylor street, neighborhood vibe.There's better Italian food available at some other Taylor street venues. A bit of the chain/franchise feel- still a good choice for rustic Italian fare.Meh.

18.description: I originally had reservations at the Davanti Enoteca in River North, but my friend who I was meeting up for dinner insisted that the Taylor street location had better consistency when it came to the food. When we got there, parking seemed to be way easier and generally the area wasn't as busy, which was good. Atmosphere: This place had a real rustic feel to it. It seemed cozier than some of the trendier Italian spots in the city and had kind of a wooden decor theme going on. I liked it.  Food: I've never been to any of their locations before, so I just let her take the lead on the ordering.Polenta / ragu of the day - This dish was pretty cool because they assemble it in front of you at the table. Our server brought out a wooden board and then spread the polenta on it. Then he layered the ragu on top of it. The ragu of the day when we went was veal meatball. I thought it was pretty good. The polenta added a nice creamy texture and served as good base for each bite. The ragu had plenty of meat but I couldn't really taste a huge difference with veal meatballs over regular beef ones. I heard the pork shoulder ragu was even better. Crispy pork belly - Basically massive strips of gourmet bacon. These were thick cut and had an awesome crispy outside. Every bite started with a nice crunch and then you just hit a layer of melt in your mouth fattiness. I just wished it was a bigger serving. I could've eaten plates and plates of that stuff. Uni pasta - Apparently this is main reason she even chose this place for dinner...it's pretty much her go to dish. I was a little skeptical since I'm honestly not even a huge fan of seafood to begin with but damn it was pretty delicious. It's actually a really simple dish. It just looked like a plate of noodles at first, but once I took a bite I was surprised at the flavors that jumped out at me. The noodles were very al dente and from a texture standpoint it wasn't very saucy at all. But that sea urchin sauce that cooked into the noodles was both rich and bold, without having an overwhelming fishy taste. I'd definitely order this again. Overall, I enjoyed the dinner at Davanti. The food was really good and the atmosphere is the perfect setting for a date. The menu is pretty big so there's a lot more stuff I still wanna try.

41.description: Terrible service. Very uninviting. Was seated for 20 min no waiter appeared. We literally walked out and no one acknowledged us.

52.description: I think we got the wrong stuff, because it was good but nothing really jumped out at us. Ricotta cheese, arugula salad, and white mushroom pizza were all just ok. Rigatoni and octopus were good. I'm willing to give this another try, but we will order different items.

50.description: The food is great, as well as environment and ambiance of the restaurant. The reason why I'm giving this place a 3 star rating is because the staff was incredibly rude. For it being my first time there I anticipated being walked through the menu and given tips as to go about ordering for the best experience. This waiter acted as though he was annoyed by the fact that I was even there and seemed inconvenienced when I had questions about the menu. Aside from the rude staff, the portions were incredibly small. For the amount I paid for my meal I should have had more than a thimble full of food, even if it did taste amazing, I'm gonna have to order a pizza in about an hour. I left unsatisfied, aggravated and hungry. I'm definitely crossing this place off my list to revisit.

4.description: A perennial favorite that hits all the right notes. Great service, casual and fun atmosphere, and delicious, simply-prepared food that will knock your socks off. Although we didn't have it today because of a friend's corn allergy, the mascarpone polenta with ragu is one of the best things we have eaten since moving to Chicago a few years ago. Today's brunch including delicious focaccia with honey comb, Tuscan toast with ricotta, egg white omelet, the best corned beef hash we've ever eaten, and more, was simply fantastic. Thanks  to chef Jeremy Branshaw for making our meals so special.

6.description: Went here as a group and enjoyed a lot. Appetizers, salads & meals were all delicious. They have a nice wine & drink selection. We all enjoyed the food & the service was good. We will be back.

22.description: I just had the most fabulous lunch with my family there. We ended an epic day of taking my dad out on the town and ended with a classic Italian meal. Being Italian now living in California I miss real Italian food and this hit the spot :) The service was also spot on all due to our server Ron. Couldn't of asked for a better experience... Good food, good wine, and good service :)

15.description: We have now been 6 times and still love it as much as the first. This might have been our favorite. Crispy pork belly, new giant ravioli (you must like brown butter), and our regulars of the daily  polenta, baked focaccia and ricotta vasi were all great.

57.description: Love the food and the service here! Will absolutely tell my friends about this place :D

20.description: Food: Good! Service: Horrible!We have been here before and liked the food, so we decided to host our family there for a post-wedding get together. We had a party of 9 and ordered over $300 worth of food. We got the focaccia, pork belly, risotto, beet salad, black and pepper spaghetti, seafood linguini, the half chicken, mushroom truffle oil pizza etc, etc. Food, overall was pretty good. My favorite was the focaccia with local honey and mushroom truffle oil pizza. However, our service was so bad, it left a sour taste in our mouth. The waiter took a while to even get our initial order, probably about 15-20 minutes after sitting down. We never got our swordfish until we had to ask for it. We asked to see a dessert menu, and never got the menu. We literally went up to the waiter and had to ask for the check even after asking once previously.  This was after 20 minutes of waiting. We paid our bill and I complained to the manager. Not sure if the food was worth this bad service.

36.description: Brought my wife in for our anniversary and had a great night!  They definitely made us feel special and the service was great.  The atmosphere is cozy and a great place to bring a date.  The kale salad was delicious, I can eat that everyday of the week.  Pasta was good and the focaccia melts in your mouth.  The Davanti burger was one of the best burgers I've ever eaten.  That says a lot because there are some great burger places in Chicago.Thanks a lot, can't wait to come back!

14.description: This is the original Davanti and the only 2 drawbacks I found on this visit is no outdoor seating, and both the weather and location was begging for that on a gorgeous summer day. The other was service. Although our server tried to be there in a timely manner, he could not simply because he was the only server on a Thursday afternoon lunch. He was knowledgable and had suggestions but certainly harried. On to the food that we shared:Fontina and egg toast with asparagus was delectable. Beet salad which I always go with was average, the burger was huge and flavorful, also split 3 ways with shoestring potatoes, the chop grilled with peaches was rather fatty, with no more than 3 thin slices of clean meat. A shared order of pasta with sausage that was also flavorful. Also a side of corn with mushrooms, which I thought the corn on its own would be better, and I like mushrooms. We shared the strawberry tart along with chocolate pistachio cake, which was more like a hard fudge. I wouldn't recommend either and just go with gelato next time. It was a mixed bag this time, and usually they're better. Great place for sharing and not your typical Italian. I have been here before and had better luck with other items, and more prompt service. It wasn't for lack of trying, more for lack of help in regards to the service. Even the hostess helped the one server.

3.description: The socks from this location bring on a veritable footgasm. They're softer than a baby's bottom and incredibly absorbent. I would cloth my children in these readily!

1.description: a heads up first - tomorrow 12/24 they close early - 3pmI shopped here sunday and bought the usual wheelbarrel loadful of socks.  It's a modern mystery why anyone in this greater metropolitan area chooses to buy their socks anywhere else but I Weinberg.  On sunday I parked free on the streets south of roosevelt rd (roosevelt itself is the southern border of paid downtown street parking on sundays, so just drive a few feet south of there and you can do Weinberg plus the Maxwell St flea mrkt on foot in one free fell swoop)

2.description: I stopped in here to get some new socks because the current pair I was wearing was on it's last leg because it had more holes than swiss cheese. I came here before, but it's been a while. My only issue is that some of the socks that are sold don't have the size marked on them. People should be able to come in and buy the size they need for themselves and those they're buying socks. You can also buy underwear as well, but I don't wear the stuff they have and it would help to have a broader selection in underwear since not every woman wears boy short panties and under wire bras. Keep in mind that if you pay at the front it's cash only. There's a register in the middle of the room where you can pay as well. You have to ask if they accept credit card as payment. They also sell dishcloths and face towels which is helpful since many people are paying too much for face towels and dish rags. I tell people all the time that this is the place to get some inexpensive socks, t-shirts, face and dish towels. You would be better off not driving since it's in an area where parking can be a problem but it's worth it if you want some good priced socks. I'll come back for socks anytime I need some since it's cost friendly and you can get a deal on packs of socks. Definitely check this place out!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

0.description: What does it say about my life when I'm borderline ecstatic about finding a place where you can get three pairs of mismatched/slightly imperfect socks for a dollar.Ugh.

3.description: If you want a good brazilian wax, go elsewhere. I spent $29 on a Living Social deal and this wax was pretty much as bad as one that I got for free. I have had laser hair removal on my bikini line, so I dont have a ton of hair on the sides... but Bridgett only waxed the areas where she could obviously see hair and clearly did not go over the sides and did not do the back. I had so many stray hairs. Very disappointing. Not to mention its basically a folding table in a not-so-clean tiny room. Of course I cannot speak for any other service, but just... dont waste your time or money on bikini waxing here.

1.description: To Van, I can see your professionalism or your lack thereof..."get a life" - yeah, that's speaks a world of your customer service.  Listen, I don't have a reason to lie or make things up.  I am stating what happened to me this past Saturday at 10 am.  I am repeating EXACTLY what your technician said to me...and again, I know that I don't like my brazilian to be double-dipped.  Maybe you should make sure that all of your staff follows that same protocol.  And lastly, I am not some competition as the guy said to me when I asked about the previous postings on yelp upon making my appointment.  He said that the negative comments were posted by his competition to make you look bad - I don't believe that.  No worries, I will take my money else where knowing that I will be treated with respect and cleanliness/sterility is at the top of the priorty list.You know Van, its not worth commenting on your response.  If I am obese, than I am...if your place of business is not where I want to go - than I don't have to...this page was created so that people can comment...either positively or negatively so that others can get an idea of what to expect from a business...You are doing such a GREAT job of marketing and getting new clients with your comments and backlash.  I hope that you get all the business that you deserve - NONE!

2.description: I purchased a livingsocial deal for this place for my brazilian. When I called to make an appointment., I was not impressed by how long I had to wait to get it done. Perhaps I am spoiled by my regular gal, but I have never had to wait two weeks to get in. However, I do realize that they ran this livingsocial deal and were probably backed up since it is a small salon. So I was ok with it.I arrived for my appointment about 20 mins. early. So I did expect to wait. What I didn't expect was to still be waiting almost a half hour after I was scheduled to go in. Noone informed me that the gal was running late, even though the gentleman who ran the front came in, and sat at the desk 10ft away from me. You would think that since he didn't know I had checked in and he saw me just hanging out for almost a half hour, he would have asked if he could help me.So I ask to reschedule. Have to wait ANOTHER week or so because Bella is still so booked up. The only excuse I was offered is that they had a girl come in who was new to waxing and made all of the appointments late the rest of the day. Wouldn't you call these clients or at least advise them of this when they came in?So then I come back to get my wax. The lady did wear gloves, howver, they did double dip most of the time. I think maybe 3 or 4 sticks were used for my brazilian. And wow I have never had a brazilian take so long! It was over an hour. Now I get many waxes and I must say I have never had it take that long. And as a regular waxer, let's just say it's not horribly difficult to navigate the area.However, she was nice and she was thorough. I didn't have a lot of strays. That I will say. But overall, not at all impressed.

9.description: I went here for the first time today and gina was great. she was thorough in her threading and it didn't pain as much, so i was happy. she also put good effort in massaging while applying cream post threading to soothe out everything. over all job well done and ill def be back.!

10.description: I purchased a LivingSocial coupon for a brazilian wax, and although I was able to quickly set up an appointment this was hands down the worst wax I have ever had. The esthetician took over an hour to wax me and in the end I had to ask her to stop because the discomfort was unbearable. I am a frequent waxer and have never felt such pain. I am certain she is not qualified to do any waxing. It got to the point where I had to remind her that she had put hard wax on certain areas so that she could remove it and in the end I ended up removing a strip of hard wax myself. I walked out of there in pain and half waxed. I had to go elsewhere to complete my wax. I warn anyone interested in getting a wax to PLEASE go somewhere else!And I truly hope that Bella Spa and Salon's owner does something about this esthetician.

4.description: I specifically got on yelp to critique Bella salon. Since we live in a large city with several options, I would explore those other options. Do not waste your time nor money at Bella.  The owner, who I assume is Van, is noted with his statement to be far from apologetic to his customers.  Give your business to an establishment that actually cares.

6.description: I purchased a Living Social deal for this place for a Brazilian before my wedding. Bear in mind that I've been getting professionally waxed for years now. I also really don't like being mean and certainly try to find good things to say about places I review. I can't find anything in this case. People need to know to avoid this establishment. The lady who did my waxing was older, and did not speak English. She used the SAME STICK the entire time, which made me want to get up and throw my clothes on and leave. Very unsanitary. She also did not pull the skin taut before ripping the cloth off and she also pulled in the SAME direction as the hair growth instead of the opposite. As you know, this does not remove the hair and is also extremely painful. At the end there were a bunch of small hairs left and she picked up a tweezer to fix it, but as she said, "MY EYES ARE BAD AND I CAN'T SEE," she couldn't get them out and actually drew blood from pinching my skin. At this point I just took the tweezers myself and starting cleaning things up and she said, "Oh you have such good eyes." NOT something you want to be hearing from your waxer. =\I was also dabbing the blood from where she pinched my skin off and I was done with this place. I somehow communicated to the lady that I wanted to speak to the manager so she called him. He maintained that the lady was his Auntie, and a "good waxer who has been doing this for 15 years." I told him I was bleeding down there, that he needed to get some training for his Auntie and he was shocked and said to call Living Social for a refund. I did. Living Social was really professional and nice about it and refunded my money right away. Please stay away. I ended up with a bleeding vagina from this place. I've had some strange experiences waxing, but never as bad as this one, I'm sorry to say. You should not hire family members just because they are family if they don't know what they're doing. Everyone suffers! =(

12.description: I have had my eyebrows threaded here a few times.  Service is always fast and inexpensive.

5.description: Ive been going to Bella spa and salon for about 3 years now and LOVE their threading, manicures, and wax services!!!I was hesitant about getting a brazilian wax after hearing about all the painful stories, but I was going on a trip and wanted to wear my bikini so I decided to try it! I was txting while she was doing it and didnt feel pain at all! You just have to relax and not think about it so much and it wont hurt!Gina does a great job at my eyebrows and im VERY picky about people doing my eyebrows! The management is very nice and makes you feel welcomed! its inexpensive and even though I live 20 minutes away and have many spas by my house I def loving going to Bella for their great services!!!

13.description: Definitely met my criteria of great salon. Excellent service, variety offered, fun and personable. Top notch pedicure and threading! Will return for sure

11.description: Kinda gentle and professional waxing service.

8.description: I admit, I don't get manicures much because I have two kids in diapers and am a germaphobe so I wash my hands constantly. So I'm lucky if a traditional manicure lasts a day. I decided to give the no-chip manicure a go the day before Thanksgiving. Did I mention I was cooking Thanksgiving dinner and using my china that has to be hand washed? A normal manicure would have lasted 24 hours under these conditions, but here I am 6 days later and it's still going pretty strong!The salon is clean and the management is friendly. I'll definitely be going back and I am hooked on the no-chip. Great for moms and serious handwashers!

0.description: I first went to this salon (also known as D'Bellagio) in March because I had two Groupons for a mani/pedi for myself and a friend. We arrived about 30 minutes late to our appointment due to inclement weather and the staff was very nice about it. We were there well past their closing hours and they were nothing but nice and polite. We asked if we could upgrade our manicures to the shellac, and that was also not a problem at all for them, even though it was going to take longer. The mani/pedis we received were great, and neither of us had any complaints.I went back to this salon a second time for a shellac/no chip manicure because of how satisfied I was the first time. Again, I received great service and an excellent manicure.I bought the livingsocial for the Brazilian Wax and I was a little skeptical to go in after reading reviews. However I ended up going to redeem it with a friend who had purchased the Groupon and I was very pleased. Jessica was the girl who waxed me and she was extremely nice and careful. She certainly did NOT double dip at all (I was watching as well) and she was very gentle. I did not have any bleedingIt only took about 20 minutes, and it was not awkward at all.Would I go back here full price? For sure. This salon is only about 15 minutes away from my apartment and I have been pleased with 3 of their services so far. They also often have specials or percentages off for Yelp Checkins or Groupon NOWs. I definitely recommend it.

7.description: Got the Livingsocial deal for $29.00 for a Brazilian wax. I called and got a next day appointment. Ok, the guy on the phone wasn't the most pleasant person. Don't get me wrong, he wasn't unfriendly or unprofessional, just not was I am used too I guess.Anyway, I walked in with a lot of fear (see previous reviews) and very little expectation. Well, I was pleasantly surprised. Jessie took care of me and was very nice. No small talk, fine by me, that's not what I'm here for. She got the job done in about 20mins and the pain wasn't too bad. Would I pay full price for the service? Not sure. Probably not because the place is pretty far from my house. But if I find a good deal again, I'll buy it and ask for Jessie.Also, to all, there was NO double dipping. And trust me, I really paid attention to what she was doing!

12.description: Woohoo! Finally an affordable and clean tanning salon has opened near my place, just in time to get tanned up for my friends wedding in July. I became a member back in May, the prices are great and the staff are nice.Unfortunately the Level 2 stand up bed has been broken for weeks, and I was just told by an employee last night that all this time I could have used the Level 4 stand up in the meantime without extra charge [since the level 4 is not part of my membership package]. Would have been nice to know that sooner so I could have gotten to work on those white circles that have developed on my shoulder blades! Oh well.

7.description: I cant speak highly enough on the cleanliness, equipment and very nice staff this place has. Whenever they have specials going on, I never leave without buying one that suits what I want because the prices are so great! No hassle parking is definitely a plus.

19.description: I really wish I could write a good review about this place - I really want to! The staff is friendly and the beds are nice but when I and my fiance signed up for a monthly package for our wedding in September that's when things headed south. I had to pay two months due to the payment method which was completely fine, I understood that, not a problem. But when we both cancelled WAY ahead of the cancel due date...the next time I went in I asked for a confirmation of our cancellations and I was told my membership had not been canceled! My fiance's showed as canceled but not mine. Since they DO NOT give the customer a copy of their cancellation (you just initial and sign a piece of printed out paper and then it goes into the abyss) it now becomes my word against theirs...really not looking forward to battling this one out. My advice - nice to tan a few times individually, but DO NOT sign up for a package, its really not worth the stress. A shame too because I really want to return. This reminds me of the bad gym memberships in the early 90's...

1.description: I never had a spray tan before, I went to Unlimited Tan to get some information because I was so white from this winter. I was very impressed with how I was greeted. Kylie was so kind and informative, I got a spray tan on the spot and bought some awesome  products which helped my spray tan last longer. I was very impressed how clean and professional Unlimited Tan presented their business.

2.description: I won't be shy in saying that I was very apprehensive about getting a spray tan. i'm naturally olive skinned so haven't tanned in a long time. I had a special event I needed to go and was feeling a bit pasty since our winter was a bit long and drawn out. I purchased a Yelp deal and it was great.The gentlemen that helped me was informative and very helpful. He wasn't pushy and gave great info on how to use the machine and how to ensure an even tan would be accomplished.Highly recommended. Thanks for making my skin look sexy :)

9.description: The staff is very friendly and easy-going. They quickly know who you are and maintain a very relaxed, yet professional atmosphere

6.description: UPDATE: Unlimited recently got the Versa Spa spray tanning system, which is AMAZING!!! Cannot say enough good things about this new booth - bronze or clear solution options, WONDERFUL results (no streaks or orange hands/feet, sprays your entire body at four different angles/positions), dries you completely with HEATED air, open air concept unit (not at all claustrophobic). They have also gained some new, friendlier employees! Definitely RECOMMEND Unlimited Tan South Loop!!

18.description: I have never had the level of service I had at this location!!! I suspected after reading all the reviews that my experience would be positive. But positive is an understatement.  All my questions and concerns were addressed professionall and courteously. (And I had a lot of em!!) The salon is meticulously maintained by a super friendly staff. ( a young Latino named Ramiro helped me that day) I suspect the negative review posted isfalse as the experience I had that day has made me a customer for life!!!

10.description: The level 5-7 beds are MUCH better than comparable beds at other tanning salons in the area. What usually takes 4-5 tanning sessions is accomplished in one. They definitely keep up with their bulb replacement. I will never  go anywhere else!Staff is very friendly every time I go in. I really like that they aren't pushy with upselling packages, lotion, etc. I hated being harassed to by something every time I visited other places in the neighborhood. I also appreciate that they are very honest with their business practices... i.e. they are upfront with the cancellation dates, and they don't make you send a certified letter to their corporate office which may or may not be processed by next year.Wish they had more options for people who don't want to do monthly (but not as expensive as a single tan... $40??? Yikes!) I was lucky enough to get a 4 for $50 deal online which was totally worth it since I only tan 2-3 times per month. So I hope they run another promo once my tans run out. Overall A+ I recommend this place to everyone.

13.description: Great Location!  Super nice people, especially Ramiro, Lauren and Holly!  Definitely recommend this location!

16.description: I've been a member here for a little over a year and I have been to a few different locations. I have to say, everyone at EVERY unlimited tan is extremely knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. However, of all the ones I've been to, the SOUTH LOOP is the one to go to. They have the newest and by far the best beds. All are good, but south loop is definitely my ultimate favorite! thanks guys!!!! keep up the great work!!!

17.description: This place is great.  I never used a tanning salon before, but have been a member for the last year.  Place and equipment is very clean.  The staff is very friendly and professional.  Camille is very knowledgable and helpful.  Parking is free with validation.

15.description: Since my last review, I was contacted by the owner, Eric who was super helpful and looked into the issues I was having with the staff and electronic debits. Thanks so much for finally providing the true meaning of customer service!

0.description: This was my first spray tanning experience and I couldn't be happier! I bought the Groupon to test the place out and had no problems redeeming it, and ended up signing up for a monthly spray tanning membership on the spot. Awesome customer service, clean facilities, great prices and a natural looking tan. Everything I wanted. I am so looking forward to coming back!

5.description: This is a hidden tanning gem in the South Loop.  Even though I live in Wicker Park, Unlimited Tan is my bronze destination. The facility is spotless and I never question the cleanliness of the beds.  I'm Norwegian which means I burn and freckle easily, however the manager (Blair) hooked me up with a higher level bed (I think 7).  While it is more expensive than the basic bed I never burn and have got a lot of compliments on my new tan.  I have not noticed any additional freckles and I've been tanning often for the past month.  They always seem to have a deal so you can load up on the higher quality beds.Blair is extremely knowledgeable about both beds and lotions to suit your skin.  I know he has worked really hard to maintain bulb replacement, etc.  The rest of team is friendly too.  Not too pushy with sales, but they do know what you are talking about.  If Blair and his team can find a solution for my fair, freckled skin, he can find one for you too!I've tanned at other salons (Unlimited Exposure, Palm Beach, LA Tan) and Unlimited is far superior to those salons in their beds.  Lastly, street (meter) parking is available, but they do validate if you park in the garage.

11.description: After months of searching for "my place" to tan, I've finally found a winner. I first came to Unlimited Tan with a Groupon I'd purchased for a month of unlimited tanning. As with many Groupon purchases I was expecting an up-sale from the staff, but aside from offering me a $20 upgrade to use all of their beds (great deal!) they didn't pressure me to buy anything else.The location is new & very clean, and I can't tell you how nice it is to find a tanning place that has free (covered) parking. No more circling the block hoping for a spot to open up! It was a little difficult for me to find Unlimited Tan the first time I went to Southgate since it's only accessible from the outside, but they do validate parking. I don't have a lot of experience with tanning aside from the basic base tan beds but I've fallen in love with their Level 7 here! It's the big one located in the front window, but don't worry, they have a blind that comes down when you use that room so passersby aren't watching you tan. The bed uses solar panels and there's a huge difference in the appearance of your tan afterwards. Instead of the sometimes dark pink look some beds give you (at least my fair skin) this one gives you a beautiful bronze color that lasts. You really only need to go once a week to maintain your color, but I find myself here almost every other day craving my vitamin D fix. My month of tanning is up next week and I fully plan on purchasing a membership. (they do month-to-month memberships instead of locking you in with a 6 or 12 month commitment).New and clean location with free covered parking, friendly non-pushy staff, affordable prices & only month-to-month contracts AND the best bed I've ever tanned in.My search is finally over... Chicago, I've found my tanning bliss!

8.description: Clean place, helpful staff, great location. They have a special for new clients: free UV tan or spray tan. Students get $5 tans or $15 spray tans every day: perfect for us students on a budget. My only complaint is the parking situation. That lot is a nightmare to get in and out of so it adds a good 10-15 minutes onto your visit. Not ideal if you're looking to go there regularly for quick tans. Other than that, this place is great!

3.description: Words can't express my love for this place.  The prices are the best around and the staff is always very nice and helpful. I wish they would build one in Rogers Park or Evanston, because the drive is long, but I refuse to go any other place while I'm still living in the city.

14.description: Since my last review, I was contacted by the owner and finally decided to try them again.  Practically a year later and this place has made a complete turn around.  Great Job Unlimited Tan!  The new staff is not only reliable but also friendly.  I especially enjoy when Rimarro is working.  He always remembers my name and keeps me informed about promotions and is fun to talk to.  Anyone who lives or works in the area should give them a try.  You can park in the garage and get validation from U.T. for 90 minutes.  It doesn't get easier than that!

4.description: I am not a regular tanner,  however I came here several times last spring because I was going to vacation to Barbados. Was surprised at how clean and state of the art all the equipment was. Unlimited tan had a special running on spray tans so I decided to try to that. Having done mystics, etc and professional spray tans done dozens of times--- (this is the way I like to get my bronze on) I can honestly say that this place has the BEST spray tan booth around! Versa spa all the way! I compare the quality of the tan to getting a professional spray tan done. Which at $25 instead of $50+,  I Will  be coming back for sure!Also-- this place has some of the nicest staff around! I can't remember anyones name but Gina! But helpful, friendly people all around!

12.description: My partner was in the hospital at Rush for a few days so I became really a consumer of Au Bon Pain. This location is the only food in the main building and that is open late. No matter, I headed down here for my morning coffee. Depending what you order and when, things cost differently. For example: if you buy a coffee with a sandwich, there's a bundle. It's a secret bundle, but a bundle. Otherwise, say, a coffee will cost $2 instead of 99¢ (save for the super-fine print).The food quality and the people are good, though. For being a captive location they don't take it for granted and prices are from corporate. Everyone's super friendly. Getting an espresso drink involves flagging someone down. Usually they have someone there, but I reckon it's not too popular with drip coffees on tap and self-serve.

7.description: I really want to like Au Bon Pain, but I've never had a really good experience.  If it wasn't for the staff, I'd give this place two stars.  The food is average at best, doesn't seem that fresh and is rather bland.  Granted I did only order baked goods and a coffee.  However, the coffee was pretty decent but I admit I'm not the most picky coffee drinker.  I was hungry however decided to avoid the sandwiches as they did not seem very appetizing.  Will not go back unless have hospital business.

3.description: Nice place to grab something to eat, a bit pricey though. The croissants were delish.

1.description: Solid food and service if you plan to be at the hospital for any length of time.    Not sure what the cheapos are complaining about price.    The food is high quality and this is the ONLY place open with 5 blocks at 2am...

2.description: Hate that this is the only place to get food at Rush. Hate that I'm at this hospital with family members more often than I'd like. Hate that the people who work here, while nice, are slow. Hate that there was one person working at the sandwich counter with about 7 people in line and three people bringing out various pots of soups. Hate that they don't always have their awesome shortbread cookies. But they get an extra star for the shortbread cookies.

9.description: Its more expensive than other options around Rush but, totally worth it!I've been frequenting ABP for the last 3 years and I must say that I really enjoy most of their soups, wraps and sandwiches. Some of my favorites are the tomato basil bisque, curried rice and lentil soup, caprese sandwich and the Mediterranean wrap. Their baked goodies are delectable too. Even though its a little expensive, I don't mind the price as its apparent that they use good quality ingredients.

10.description: I have sampled through almost all the signature sandwiches:Roast beef - 4.5/5Caprese - 4/5Black bean burger - 4.5/5Turkey club - 4/5

13.description: Granted it is inside of RUSH Hospital, but they do carry a wide assortment of goodies. Been there twice and I just prefer to do the yogurt and granola when I go. The cups are pretty good size and are moderately priced at $3 and some change. I do have to say thought that twice I had the yogurt and twice the blueberries are not to par. They are chewy and you can never quite swallow. But its still a good eat, just not a complete good eat. I think next time I will try one of their hot dishes to see why people stick around and eat here. It is a busy location but fun with a view of the city.

16.description: I came here for a volunteer orientation, and was diasppointed to find that au bon pain was the only restaurant in the close vicinity of the hospitalI had the cheese croissant and the baja turkey sandwhich, and they were both spectacularly good. I would recommend this place, though the prices were a little high.

17.description: Au bon Pain, how do I hate thee, let me count the ways:  1.  You were the only choice outside vending machines for the entire freaking hospital 2.  Your food costs twice as much as its really worth 3.  Your faux-cheery atmosphere makes me want to vomit in your blended veggie stew 4.  Your cheesy as hell manager is one of the most annoying people on the planet  5.  I cut my lip on your rock hard sandwich bread and bled during a presentation 6.  Your food mockingly looks healthy but look at the calorie count: wow 7.  What kind of devilish deal did you cut with the CEO of Rush to be the only source of food overnight?  8. Minimal food choices at night  9.  Slowest sandwich bar in history.   Nuff said.

15.description: I had the worst food poisoning ever from their salad bar. Don't ever eat here.

0.description: So today when I went to get one of my fave Au Bon Pain sammies (#23 the Caprese) two wonderful things happened:1. the nice sandwich prep ladies informed me that the recipe was altered and they no longer put mayo on their Caprese sandwiches - THANK GOD!!  The Au Bon Pain big wigs listened to the masses!!   and..2. when I went to pay, the nice cashier lady gave me a Frequent Sandwich Buyer Card - I don't know if technically that is what it is called...but you get what I mean...you purchase 5 sandwiches, the sixth is FREE!  This is loooong overdue Au Bon Pain!  I will be getting my free sandwich very very soon!  :-)

5.description: The food is good at ABP, but it is too overpriced to be in a medical center. A lot of the patients that come to the hospital can't really afford $5 - $6 for soup that they could buy else where much cheaper. If you get a sandwich, chips, and a drink, that would cost you about $11. That may not seem like a lot, but if your loved one has a long stay and you have to eat there after the cafeteria closes every evening, you will be out of a nice amount of money. I would suggest the cafeteria instead. But if you are just there for a one time visit, I'd say go for it. The food won't disappoint. I especially like the variety of soups, salads, and make your own sandwiches. I find them quite tasty.

11.description: Someone has major negotiating mojo.... Au Bon Pain seems to have a contract with many of the major hospitals in Chicago- U of C, Rush, as well as others.  It could be worse- but it also could be better!On my latest visit here, we attempted to treat ourselves to breakfast.  We thought it would be quick.  Oh, the disappointments that an optimist sets themselves up for!  Um- we were way wrong.  Coffee- that was quick, the breakfast sandwich- that should have taken about 5 minutes took approximately 15 minutes- and they had no ingredients left- at 9 am. My modified (by necessity) egg, bacon and cheese on a croissant sandwich tasted good going down.  Unfortunately- I lost it about 5 minutes later.  THANKFULLY- ABP has a ladies bathroom that is very close by.  Don't know if it was nerves due to the lovely procedure that I was about to have (think audition, when they guy gets needles under his eye- slightly different- but close) or the egg, but it did not sit well.  The fantastic friend who drove me seemed to enjoy their sandwich and was also thankful for the proximity of the bathroom.  At least she was not too put off, we have traveled together for years- and gotten ill many times (got to love colleagues that become friends).She drank her coffee- I pitched mine.  All in all- I wish I could say I will not be back.  However, seeing as this is one of the only choices here, I cannot.  Hopefully next time I at least will keep it down for more than 5 minutes!

8.description: The sandwiches and wraps are made with love. The bakery goods are awesome and are even discounted at certain times at night. I only go here when I forget my lunch or need a sweet treat because the prices are sky high and they do not discount employees...not cool.

4.description: I like the phrase "overpriced cafeteria food". The food is fine. Nothing spectacular. I do like the coffee which they do a pretty good job of keeping up with (changing it out, keeping it full). Some of the staff is nice... some...meh.I once found a hair in my sandwich (vomit).24/7 which is good to have that option in a hospital. Pretty clean for how busy it always is.

14.description: This place is in rush hospital. I got the salad bar big container. With the salad you get free bread and you get to choose it. The salad was yummy made by me. As other reviewers had said this place is pricey but wanted to check it out for myself and it is. They have a good size seating area and its pretty nice on the eyes inside.

6.description: The good thing about ABP- it's open 24 hours in the hospital.The bad thing about ABP- it's the only thing open for 24 hours in the hospital.I will give you that some of the soups are tasty (but please don't tell me the calorie count), that I really appreciate the variety for the salad bad (unfortunately it's not open when I work nights), or that I can refill my coffee cup for just over a dollar. However, for a place that is supposed to be know for its sandwiches, baked goods, and premade salads, they're lacking. The sandwiches seem to have lukewarm ingredients (I'd rather have cold chicken than chicken heated for 30 seconds in the microwave) and I feel like the baked goods are always a bit dried out.Maybe it's just because this location is located in a hospital, but I've had pretty good hospital Einstein's or Panera!

28.description: Hands down, this is my favorite place for Chinese takeout in the West Loop. Their food is consistently hot and delicious. It's the first Chinese restaurant where you actually get the chili peppers in your spicy schezwan chicken. When I order from here, I tend to get the spicy schezwan chicken or shrimp. The shrimp is fresh and tasty. I also prefer their crab rangoon which is also super tasty. I love getting takeout here because I know that it will good and not gag worthy like some takeout that I've experienced.

1.description: I really like this place. Come here a lot. I am a fan of sweet and sour chicken but went vegetable chop suey today. Very good Chinese.

9.description: The food is okay, the price is cheap, and the service is good.China Night Cafe is not by anyone's standard fine dining but for the price of the food and how much you get it is hard to complain.  They have a few veggie options and a couple that make it to the lunch special list, which are a steal.  Some are better then others with my go-to being the Veggie Chop Suey.  They give you a mound of food, an egg roll (veggie), and a drink for less then McD's.  If it was say 2-3 dollars more for a meal then it would drop down a star or two but at that price it is the best in the area.  I am sure that the food is loaded with oil and MSG but when you are hungry fast and cheap sometimes wins. The service is excellent, bringing the food out so fast is is scary.  Everyone that works at CNC means business, they are very friendly and but are ready to take your order as you walk in the door.  The place is self is just okay playing the Maury Show (or whatever clone of it happens to be on) and is decorated is a very random style, but it is a place to sit and scarf your food down.One year ago I would rate this place a 2 Star since the food was almost too oily to eat but they have grown on me (or maybe they cut down on the oil) and I have bumped them up to a 3 Star.  Come hungry and with a couple of bucks and leave full and sleepy.

29.description: Good food. Super fast delivery!  Portions are good size for the price.  Overall, have had positive experiences and continue to go back.

23.description: For those of you who actually think this place has good food, you must be from Midwest farm towns! This is the worst crap Chinese I have ever had! I am born and raised here and thought I would try this. I think the chicken is cat! I should've known when I saw they have small and large portions. No good Chinese place offers small portions.

5.description: Boiled Fish in Szechuan Sauce hot and spicy. Chicken with Preserved Vegetables savory.Plentiful portions.Simple establishment with prompt service.

31.description: Decent and cheap!  Has all the ambiance of a morgue though.

25.description: Back from Chicago and China Night is still da Bomb!

12.description: When I lived nearby alone, for more than one year, I went to China Night Cafe to eat or bought carry out there about 10 times a week.What I like most here is the atmosphere, the kindness of staff, and the price (especially lunch special)To be honest, the food is far less good (I'm not saying 'worse') than authentic Chinese food that raised me for more than 20 years, especially when some dishes only be popular or even only exist in North America, I can't say they taste great and familiar to me. Only when comparing with other Chinese restaurants near UIC, it becomes one of the best.However, there are some newly-added dishes that are really good and very authentic.Last but definitely not the least, I like the iced tea and plum juice! Both are almost as good as what I had in China. Brought to me a lot of good memory of childhood. Especially the plum juice! I don't even know if it is called 'plum juice' in English, but it is the only juice there that is made of plum. I think it is only available in last spring and summer but I'm not sure. You should ask the owner.

21.description: Nice place for take away Chinese food. The food is nice and cheap but don't expect excellent service if you happen to eat in there.But good food at a good price.

16.description: Good place for a quick lunch. very big portions

17.description: Typical Americanized Chinese food joint. The food is cheap and their specials are nice. Don't expect too much out of them and you wont be upset. It's supposed to be kind of sh**ty.Also, I love how their chairs are the older, much better chairs from Joy Yees.

10.description: Some of their stuff may be alright, I don't know.. but their orange chicken is not one of those items. Do not get it. My roommate always orders it, and although sometimes it's better than other times it's almost always gross. Soggy, mushy chicken - not the least hint of a crisp, and a seriously goopy, oily and flavorless (we're talking about orange chicken here!) sauce.   You might have some on a "good day" but don't test your luck to gamble on that chicken's bad day..

11.description: Very warm family owned restaurant. Their Crab rangoon is the best in Chicago. I have tried so many different rangoons. Also they have a lot of traditional chinese food now. Also very yummy.But only not good is the decor of this place. A little too old.

26.description: This one week we ordered too many times from this place, and then we took a break... ohhhh I could never live without one of the lunch specials. Thank you for sending the right hot sauce =D

27.description: Even though it kind of paints me as whatever the Chinese equivalent to Gringo is, orange chicken is honestly my favorite member of the Chinese food family.It sucks at this place.  A lot.  Sometimes I forget that and order it anyway.  Joke's on me.That said, everything else is usually decent.  My standby dish is the China Night Delight, which packs in (I believe) chicken, beef, shrimp, waterchest nuts, pea pods, carrots, mushrooms, and some other crap I can't remember in sufficient enough quantity that it usually stretches out to at least three meals.This review sucks.  I'm bored and tired.

0.description: I am not big on Chinese food. Since this location was open on New Years day, my wife and I decided to try it out. Food was on the cheap end, but geeze did they give a lot of food. The rice, egg roll and veggies didn't taste too different from anywhere else. So what do I judge them on? Their orange chicken.Personally, not my favorite, it had a bit of a plastic texture and taste. The orange chicken also tasted a bit too orangy, but still had some tang. I did finish it all btw. The food took maybe 15 minutes to finish and the staff at the front seemed friendly. Not my favorite, but I would definitely recommend to someone in the area.In terms of the atmosphere...probably you're typical family-owned Chinese restaurant. Several pictures, plants, and statues around. It almost felt like I was in someones home.
