20.description: The food at China Night Cafe is pretty terrible.  As the shrimp in its shrimp fried rice is good, it gets one star.  I won't bother trying the food from here a second time.  This is not good Chinese food.

19.description: Food is cheap and ok. I would only go here if I'm low on money and want a lot of food.

33.description: Quiet restaurant. Never a crowd. Great place to have some chowmein, review some business reports, and catch up with a friend.

2.description: Typical Chinese food spot, good prices and portions. For this spot in the city it's not a bad place, also not exactly your gourmet place to eat. I get the lunch special of fried rice with a side of chicken and a pop for only 7$ so it's really not bad. Good place to get a quick and filling lunch without having to overpay

32.description: Good cheap Chinese food place. My favorite dish is the crab rangoon. Lunch combo meals are $5 and the delivery is pretty fast too. Just dont let the looks of the place turn you away.

18.description: Any place that makes effective use of black bean sauce is a-okay.  CNC is what it is, basically carry-out Chinese ... cheap, fast, and huge portions.  Great stuff for when you get the craving for MSG.

13.description: I think that some of the entrees are worth 3 stars and some are 4 stars...that being said, I give this place a 3 star rating because the menu is hit or miss. I live right down the street so I come here about 2 nights a week - Yes, its making me fat :) The takeout is really fast, usually about 10 minutes. The inside is a bit tacky but I like it that way. The place can be a bit noisy if there are other people eating inside because the place is quit small but its kind of charming. I personally enjoy the chicken fried rice, egg rolls, and the Mongolian beef, just to name a few.

4.description: This place looks shabby but the food has the quality of chinatown.  I'm Chinese myself so when it comes to chinese food I am credible to give feedbacks. I ordered sesame chicken and it was delicious!  The food was freshly served and the spices are on point. 8 dollars meal is pretty fair since we are near UIC but nonetheless it is well worth it.Would definitely recommend.

24.description: This is a pretty good chinese place. They make the food really fast and deliver really quick too! I usually stick with the lunch special, they have pretty much all the key dishes available in that. Also, they give you free egg rolls is you spend over $15 (you dont even have to remind them or show them the coupon!) Great friendly service! They also have great Sariachi sauce available for sale here, and bamboo plants, and chop sticks, etc for sale.

6.description: Great place for a quick lunch. It's affordable, and there are lots of options to choose from. Their lunch special is the best deal (shrimp fried rice, egg roll, a side of your choice, and a drink). It's kind of like a fast food place. You pay upfront, and they bring you the food on a tray. No one checks on you or refills your water, so don't go there expecting great restaurant service. Good food, low prices, fast service.

22.description: Like many fast food chinese restaurants, China Night Cafe definitely takes the 'three sauces for everything' approach.  Whether it's the orange chicken, mongolian beef, or the shrimp in lobster sauce you'll notice that everything tastes similar.  However, their three sauces taste great and they do just enough to differentiate each dish.  The staff is friendly, and the atmosphere is welcoming enough to dine-in.  A full serving of dish, rice, and an egg roll for $6ish makes it a great value.

15.description: Even though it kind of paints me as whatever the Chinese equivalent to Gringo is, orange chicken is honestly my favorite member of the Chinese food family.It sucks at this place.  A lot.  Sometimes I forget that and order it anyway.  Joke's on me.That said, everything else is usually decent.  My standby dish is the China Night Delight, which packs in (I believe) chicken, beef, shrimp, waterchest nuts, pea pods, carrots, mushrooms, and some other crap I can't remember in sufficient enough quantity that it usually stretches out to at least three meals.This review sucks.  I'm bored and tired.

7.description: We weren't in the mood to go out into the snowy and cold streets of Chicago and venture into Chinatown but we contemplated it quite a bit. What we did know was that we wanted Chinese, nothing Pan Asian fusion mix but just good ol' Chinese.  Living near Taylor street and having never been to China Night,  we quickly looked them up on Yelp and were happy to see good and honest reviews. Good enough for us!   Phone call to request delivery was good, they understood our order, repeated it back to us, gave us our total and our food was delivered within 30 min. We placed our order at about 6:30 on a Friday night. I ordered the sweet and sour chicken special #8, good value when you get the chicken, shrimp fried rice and an egg roll for about $8. I also ordered the Pork Pot Stickers, oh my tasty and huge!!! You get 6 or 8 of them and it's a meal in itself. Husband ordered the Spicy beef, it's a pepper steak, plenty of food, his dish spilled over his plate and we scrambled for napkins. Egg rolls are tasty. We also received free Crab Rangoon with our order! Those were very good. They don't skimp out on the Soy, sweet & sour and hot Sauce packets. Our total was about $28 for a Friday night dinner. Very niiiiice. We will be ordering from here again, no doubt .

8.description: Consistently good all around - good food, good atmosphere, great service, good price.  Generous portions and tasty, food's cooked to order.  Our faves include the General Tso's chicken (perfect mix of sweet/spicy) and Shrimp w/Lobster Sauce (black bean grown gravy).  It's a bit on the greasy side, but that's to be expected with any fast take-out Chinese food, and you can get menu items without the MSG, or spice. We dined in recently, pre-Hawks/Bruins Game 5.  Flat screen TV in the dining area and they let us change the channel so that we could catch pre-game activities.  Service is quick and the staff are friendly and polite.Dining area is decent, the Joy Yees chairs throw me off and while Joy Yees is good in its own right, I prefer China Night.

30.description: eeeewwwwwww.i was drunk, starving.took a taste of one little piece of chicken, tried another. and threw the whole thing into garbage.to me, the reason its never crowded, and quiet is coz IT SUCKS. BIG TIME.the worst chinese food ever.a disgrace.

3.description: Don't be dissuaded by the faded awning this place is a gem. Good Chinese food, nice people, fast service and a great value. I'm a Chinese food addict and I come here at least once a week to get my fix. The food is hot, fresh, an delicious. A lunch special comes with fried rice, an egg roll, and a drink for $7.25. Plus I don't think I've ever waited more than 5 minutes for my food to come out. Perfect for a quick lunch.

14.description: When I went to UIC, I used to order from China Night several times a month.  I recall large portions (enough for at least 2 servings) and good food.  I used to order the sweet and sour chicken or shrimp.  I always enjoyed their fried rice as well.  I recall they delivered and never had an issue with their delivery services.  I miss their food.  Good ol' times.  If you're a fan of China Night and you're near UIC, you should also try See Through Chinese Kitchen on Roosevelt.... they are also very good.

28.description: 3 stars because..... Ambiance great, bar manager great, service .... Hopefully cuz new, it will get better. It was slow so I would hate to be there if they were busy.  Also had the quesadilla , it was burnt, didn't send back because the place is new.  I'm sure, knowing the bar Louie family, it should get better. Give it a chance.

1.description: I was completely disappointed with my experience here, especially because I had been looking forward to it for so long. The first uncomfortable thing that should be noted is the small pathway near the bar. The tables are too close to the bar and it gets even more packed with everyone just standing around. My sister, her gf and I finally saw an open spot at the bar; there were two empty seats. The bartender, Jose, came up to my sister and her gf and said that the seats were taken. My sister said okay, that's fine. So they got off the seats and just stood up while looking at the menu. About 2 minutes later, the bartender comes up to them again and says, "There are people sitting there already." My sister told him we'd all move out of the way once they got back to their seats (whoever they were, they never came back). Jose comes back a third time, looking ready to take our order. My sister lets out about two words before he says "Oh I'm leaving right now. I'm off the clock."So he tells the other bartender to take our order. Jose then stays at the bar for another hour or so, taking other people's drink orders. So rude, and so unprofessional! Despite the shitty service, the drinks weren't good either. I ordered a Pineapple Express, and I didn't drink it. It was ridiculously sweet. So I gave it to my sister in law and she managed to drink 1/4 of it. My boyfriend ordered a Mojito, and it was disgusting. Again, too sweet. It was not refreshing at all. A friend nearby came over to the bar and told us her Mojito was too strong. These bartenders need to get it together. The only good thing about Bar Louie is their music, the DJ was great. And the bouncers were really friendly. But I would definitely not come here again.I finished my beer (something a bartender couldn't possibly mess up) and we all went to Lalo's next door.

9.description: 1/2 priced appetizers on a non-busy Monday night, but service was still antagonizing slow. My boyfriend ordered the cheese and chicken quesadillas, which come with guacamole and sour cream. He chewed on a little, hard, black (never determined what it was "thing") and spit it out. It was hard to get anyone's attention. The bartender/food runner finally noticed I had my hand up and instead of walking over, he yelled "yeah? What's up?" while mid-entering the kitchen. I never want to yell while I'm paying to eat and be served so I had him come over. My boyfriend showed him the little black "seed," and he told us he would get us a new quesadilla. When he came out, he said it was a seed from the avocado. Do avocados have seeds? They have 1 giant pit. Unless BL makes tiny seeds out of the big pit to keep the guacamole fresh. Food was good, but this was another disappointing visit.

29.description: Hubby and I used to go to Morgan's and wanted to see how it looked now that it's Bar Louie's . I was pleasantly surprised that it looks better now! Very clean and as we walked in were greeted and seated right away by a young lady with a warm smile.  The server was very friendly and was great at engaging us in a quick conversation. The entire staff was very courteous and professional. We had the Trio chips for our appetizer and loved the salsa.  We shared a chicken verde flatbread and was very satisfying . Loved the light crispy texture! I know it sounds crazy, but I actually didn't give it 5 stars because our drinks were too heavy on the alcohol. I ordered a mango margarita and my first sip, all I tasted was the alcohol. Then I tried my husband's drink and his mojito was even stronger than my Margarita.  I love alcohol, but when you can't even taste your drink, it's not a good thing. On the bright side, we did complain and they tried to fix our drinks.  I still caught a good buzz with only one drink, maybe I should be happy cuz I didn't spend too much and got a good buzz!

23.description: We went here for lunch yesterday. It was pretty quiet around 12:30pm. Our server was very friendly and refilled my soda quite regularly. I ordered the chicken tacos for around $13.00. I thought that was a little high for tacos, especially since Lalo's next door is much more reasonably priced. However, there were several taco shells, lots of chicken, guacamole, pico de gallo, rice, and beans. It was tasty and filling! I can't wait to head back during Happy Hour and try out some of their drinks.

5.description: So the place is resurrected from Morgan's.  The place looks great but the service is still the same ...bad too bad I was looking forward to it, been here three times and each time same slow service. The guy/bar help w/ beard black hair (skinny slick black hair feminine looking) sucks ...his attitude belongs at some high fashion women's hair salon.

31.description: Great replacement for what used to be Morgan's. Drink and food specials are on point and the flatbread was really good. The burger was ok, kind of heavy on the pepper, but nothing to write home about. Come for the happy hour/specials and don't expect too much. Comfy atmosphere, solid specials, and tasty flatbreads will keep us coming back.

25.description: Pretty poor service ....sat at the bar for 15 minutes before being helped. The food could be better but I guess what do you expect, it's bar food

12.description: Really glad that this place replaced Morgan's. It's so convenient from us and has great specials. I don't believe they have done any grand advertisement here yet but it is definitely open! Hopefully the service and food quality stay on point!

21.description: Hoping I can come back and change my review once the location has had some time to work out it's "just opened" kinks. That being said with a large name such as Bar Louie I would have though they would have spend a lot of time training their new employees... guess they might have missed a few pages in the handbook.Receiving any stars at all for the atmosphere - wonderful remodel! And the food was good as always.I have been there twice recently and both were very underwhelming experiences. First was during happy hour. It took at least 15 minutes to get four beers poured when there were only a handful of other guests, even longer for food. The waitress (whose name I forget) was nice and consciences about checking in with us which leads me to believe that perhaps it was the bar which was slow. Which would make sense when... The second time I sat at a bar and waited 10 minutes before someone looked at us an another 5 before they came over. He seemed a little short and disinterested, again it was not busy. He (known only as "B-Rad") then became very rude when we inquired about the $1.20 beer special at the other location and said we had to get a full bucket which we were not interested in. From that point on he was unkind and showed us no attention... while his fellow co-workers who were off the clock drinking at a table seemed to be getting a lot of his attention.Overall it seems they hire the "douchey 90's grunge" type for behind the bar.

16.description: Went here last weekend. Food and service was great. We shall return. I think bar Louie should have more Porters and stout selections in the near future

17.description: Terrible service, onion skin (paper) in my husbands entree and it was burned... I wouldn't come back.

10.description: I placed a wing take out order with a side of fries. My food was ready as promised within 15 mins. This was my first time in this location. TV's everywhere, clean bar/dining area & beautiful ladies at the bar. So why the 2 star rating? The wings were trash. ..Bar Louie is known to have above average wings. I refuse to step foot in the Hyde Park location because of the terrible service & sticky tables. It's been years so, I'm not sure if the wings have changed at all locations. The wings were a nice size, but soggy. I wasn't a fan of the bbq or buffalo sauces. Not sure if I'll be back with so many bar options in the area.

11.description: Yay, nah... I'm good. I came on a Friday night and it was full, yes, but not so packed that you couldn't get a seat at the bar or a table. I was at a table and the server was nice. He checked in on us frequently, rarely bearing gifts, i.e. drinks, but rather offering his apologies for the slow service. I wasn't eating but even if I was starving I would have been better off ordering from some place down the block, which would have been quicker. I figured it would be best to not order anything complicated. Glass of prosecco please. Yeah... still took forever, both times. On the plus side, it was filled to the brim.

26.description: Greeted by hostess, instructed to sit wherever (somewhat off putting as a hostess typically seats guests?)We chose the bar, greeted by one bar tender (I believe Heather) she was quiet and seemed shy. Another bar tender came by (Malessa), she was lively, knowledgeable on the menu and was curious to hear from us. We inquired on a flavor of a beer and she offered a sample. Suggested food options and we ordered. While waiting for food, she asked on the area, community and was very nice over all. Our food arrived within 15 minutes (we barely noticed the time as we were having good conversation). I got the BLTT sandwich and he got the Southwest Burger, both were very tasty and served as we ordered. After we received our food, Malessa gave us some time to eat and checked in on us 3 times afterwards between checking out. Never had an empty glass of water and was pleased with the service. It's a new restaurant and of course there will be some kinks to work out. Their specials are great and hopefully will attract the College kids to come out but also not have too much of the past Morgan clientele. I also hope with a "brand" name like Bar Louie, others will also come this way and continue to explore Maxwell st.

27.description: Went on Christmas Eve so it was pretty slow.  Great environment, def an upgrade over Morgan's (though it shall be missed).  The Louie Burger was delicious!  I'll be a customer; although, service was a slow.  The entire staff was friendly and luckily I was not in a rush.  All in all good place for a good neighborhood.

0.description: Five stars JUST for the happy hour, but I felt like it really needed to get shared with the world.$3.25 for a pint of Matilda? Come on now, where else in Chicago do you get this deal? Pretty insane selection of beers on draft for happy hour.Happy hour beers. Trust me.

20.description: So I waited until I visited this place twice to write this review. All in all, I have mixed feelings. It is a new addition to University Village and has replaced Maxwell's.First visit:  I went there last Friday to grab a drink with a friend. We were seated immediately at the bar and asked asked for our order. The bartender was very courteous and prompt in taking our orders. I had the Effin' Good, my friend had the S'mores martini along with the spinach and artichoke dip. My drink was refreshing with a kick, and her drink tasted like a dessert, which I really liked.  The food was very forgettable, and overpriced for the portion it had. The service, however was very sporadic. The bartender checked on us once maybe after our food arrived, and took a while to get our check. Which is fine. It was a busy night. On this experience alone, I would've given this a 4 stars. Second visit: I went there today with another friend for their Happy Hour and Tuesday Burger special. Everything was good as usual. The server seated us promptly, the waitress, Liz, introduced herself and told her The Diva was her favorite martini. She came back maybe after 10 minutes to get our order. I had the mango martini (90 miles to FL), and my friend had the Diva. Both drinks were delicious. For the burger, I ordered the Blue Louie, and my friend the Fried Louie. Liz double-checked to see if I got the Blue Louie. Food came, and I had the "Louie" with giardiniera, not "Blue Louie" blue cheese and bacon. It looked good, and I didn't wanna send food back, so I happily ate my burger without any complaints. Giardiniera is not the best topping for the burger I learned, as it overpowers the whole flavor of the patty. So I'll avoid that when I come here. In the middle of my meal, I spill my drink while trying to grab my napkin (talk about greasy food and glasses not mixing), and was trying to clean it up when Liz comes. I told her I had a little accident with my drink, and she flat out, with a straight face, asks me: "Are you drunk?" That ticked me off a bit more than it should've. I could understand if she was joking, but she wasn't laughing, and neither was I. I said no, very politely. I mean I'm sure she dealt with accidents, and the table next to mine had 4 rounds of martinis while I was still on one cocktail. But she walks away, and that's that.And that just left a sour note on my whole evening here. Sure, I'll be back at this location to try another burger, their apps and other martinis during their happy hour (it's a great deal for any college students , any maybe I'll have a better experience!

19.description: The service was not good. The waitress, multiple times, was nowhere to be found for long period of time. I ordered the Voodoo Chicken and there were two thin medallions and two thin sliced pieces of sausage. It was not enough for an entree. I'm very disappointed. Won't be returning.

2.description: Since basically everything in Pilsen and University Village is closed on Mondays, I decided to at least take a look in the new Bar Louie after work when I saw the TVs were on and the bar was empty. My fiance and I were welcomed and told to sit anywhere, and chose a couple of spots at the bar. It was pretty empty around quarter to 5, but we were very happy to discover Happy Hour is weekdays from 4-7, with some great deals: $3.25 for a 14oz draft, $4 wine, and $5.25 signature martinis, plus several 1/2 price appetizers including flatbreads, calamari, spinach dip, and wings. They have a decent draft list with a few craft options; hubs had a Matilda this evening. I like ciders, but your choices here are Woodchuck and Angry Orchard, nothing special, so I went with a S'mores martini for the extra $2. The martini tasted just like a dessert and even had mini marshmallows; I enjoyed it. We also split the spinach and artichoke dip served with crunchy tortilla chips; it was tasty enough for us to eat it all. With the HH pricing, our 2 drinks and app came to less than $15; it's hard to beat that deal in Chicago, and that's worth a 4th star. Outside of HH prices, I can't say I'd be drawn here for the regular burger/bar food or drinks specifically and it would probably be 3-star, but 3 hours a day, 5 days a week Happy Hour is a pretty big range to grab an affordable snack and a few drinks. Thursdays are also ladies day for $5.25 martinis all day long. Bar Louie definitely has my endorsement for Happy Hour, though I'd probably head elsewhere for dinner.

18.description: Great replacement for what used to be Morgan's. Drink and food specials are on point and the flatbread was really good. The burger was ok, kind of heavy on the pepper, but nothing to write home about. Come for the happy hour/specials and don't expect too much. Comfy atmosphere, solid specials, and tasty flatbreads will keep us coming back.

13.description: This is my second time going here and to say the least I was super angry with the bartender. When I walked up to the bar Jose proceeded to tell me someone was sitting where I was standing. I told him that was no problem that I was going to order a drink. He raises his voice and tells me again that someone is sitting there. I responded that all I wanted was to order a drink and not sit there. He then tells me his off the clock and no longer serving and walks away. Not even two minutes later he turns around and starts taking people's orders!!! Like seriously aside from the fact that he acted like a total dick, now his refusing to serve us! I really hope management takes action and disciplines him, people like this do not deserve to be serving people! If you hate your job buddy than quit!

4.description: So I waited until I visited this place twice to write this review. All in all, I have mixed feelings. It is a new addition to University Village and has replaced Maxwell's.First visit:  I went there last Friday to grab a drink with a friend. We were seated immediately at the bar and asked asked for our order. The bartender was very courteous and prompt in taking our orders. The service, however was very sporadic. The bartender checked on us once maybe after our food arrived, and took a while to get our check. Which is fine. It was a busy night. On this experience alone, I would've given this a 4 stars. Second visit: I went there today with another friend for their Happy Hour and Tuesday Burger special. Everything was good as usual. The server seated us promptly, the waitress, Liz, introduced herself and told her The Diva was her favorite martini. She came back maybe after 10 minutes to get our order. Liz double-checked to see if I got the Blue Louie. Food came, and I had the "Louie" with giardiniera, not "Blue Louie" blue cheese and bacon. I could understand if she was joking, but she wasn't laughing, and neither was I. I said no, very politely. I mean I'm sure she dealt with accidents, and the table next to mine had 4 rounds of martinis while I was still on one cocktail. But she walks away, and that's that.And that just left a sour note on my whole evening here. Sure, I'll be back at this location to try another burger, their apps and other martinis during their happy hour (it's a great deal for any college students , any maybe I'll have a better experience!

24.description: Really glad that this place replaced Morgan's. It's so convenient from us and has great specials. I don't believe they have done any grand advertisement here yet but it is definitely open! Hopefully the service and food quality stay on point!

6.description: This Bar Louie is great. It just opened recently and friends and I decided to stop for drinks. The atmosphere is very nice and welcoming. The staff and service was great. They have a large selection of drinks to pick from. The good menu looks good too, we didn't order food.They have great happy hour special everyday day.We plan to come back again for happy hour.

22.description: So, we're do I start! The service overall was terrible. I'm talking beyond horrible. You can tell the place needs some management structure. I came on the advice of my friend who by the way was double charged on a incident in mid December. Nonetheless, we still came. The manager on duty solution to the issue was "Sorry the only one who can refund you your money is the GM Andy, but unfortunately he's on vacation in Mexico at the time". Ok fair enough. It was the holidays. So, it's now mid January and no word from the GM or Bar Louie. I can see the trend of service on my visit. Sad! Considering they did a good job remodeling the place.

15.description: Ordered calamari, lettuce wraps, and a fried Louie. All dishes arrived at the same time, only the lettuce wraps were hot. Obliviously they let the other dishes sit while waiting for the wraps. The wraps were barely edible, way too saucy and barely any meat. This dish should not even be on the menu! Calamari was luke warm and chewy. Burger came and it was the Louie not the fried, waitress acted like it was my fault and said that is what she heard. If the waitress paid more attention to her job then constantly walking around talking to her employee/friends she would have gotten it right. I don't write many reviews, big disappointment. Bars at this location seem to always have bad service. It's a shame they don't have their act together, area needs a good bar.

7.description: My experience was AVERAGE at best-completely due to the service. This was my first time at any Bar Louie, and when this one opened up in University Village, I was initially excited to try it! My friend and I went for happy hour ($5 burgers on Tuesdays and $5 martinis every day from 4-7 pm!). Upon walking in, we were greeted with enthusiasm from a group of hostesses. The restaurant itself was moderately busy. Liz promptly sat us at a high top table by the front doors...little did we know she would be the problem. After briefly looking over a menu that reminded me of a glorified TGI Fridays, my friend and I ordered martinis (Diva, as per Liz's suggestion, and 90 miles to Florida). Both were delicious! However, the table was so small that I spilled some of my martini by accident, but my poor friend spilled almost half of hers. Upon encouraging her to request a new one and motioning to Liz, we explained the situation (and ended up ONLY asked for napkins). The idiot had the audacity to ask us, "So...Are you guys drunk?" Not jokingly either. Serious. With a look of disdain. We stared back at her dumbfounded. HOW. DARE. SHE? We were not falling over or sloppy in the least bit. We had ordered ONE DRINK. WE WERE NOT DRUNK. Never before have I encountered such rude service.We ordered the Blue Louie and the Fried Louie. (Saint Liz messed up our order and gave her the Louie instead, after asking her explicitly if she wanted the Blue Louie. Smart girl, right? HA!) The Fried Louie was absolutely delicious: bacon, cheddar cheese, and fried egg perfection. The meat patty was well-done, but not charred. For anyone who dislikes onion on their burger, this one doesn't come with any! I was so pleased.When we asked for separate checks, I wanted to pay with cash and Liz oddly waited as I counted it and obviously eyed me for a decent tip. I tipped a standard 20% because I'm not inhuman, but I was less than impressed with the service. I advise coming for the delicious bar food, but watch out for Liz!

8.description: Greeted by hostess, instructed to sit wherever (somewhat off putting as a hostess typically seats guests?)We chose the bar, greeted by one bar tender (I believe Heather) she was quiet and seemed shy. Another bar tender came by (Malessa), she was lively, knowledgeable on the menu and was curious to hear from us. We inquired on a flavor of a beer and she offered a sample. Suggested food options and we ordered. While waiting for food, she asked on the area, community and was very nice over all. Our food arrived within 15 minutes (we barely noticed the time as we were having good conversation). I got the BLTT sandwich and he got the Southwest Burger, both were very tasty and served as we ordered. After we received our food, Malessa gave us some time to eat and checked in on us 3 times afterwards between checking out. Never had an empty glass of water and was pleased with the service. It's a new restaurant and of course there will be some kinks to work out. Their specials are great and hopefully will attract the College kids to come out but also not have too much of the past Morgan clientele. I also hope with a "brand" name like Bar Louie, others will also come this way and continue to explore Maxwell st.

30.description: Was sitting around at home doing nothing on Christmas Eve and decided to visit a friend of mine who works here.  Great atmosphere, very clean and it seems from the naked eye that they've worked out all the kinks that come with a new restaurant opening.  Ordered my usual, plain cheese burger with fries and was pleasantly surprised that it tasted much better than the ones in use to at the Bar Louie that's closer to my house in Oak Park.  Wait staff was friendly and made sure I was doing ok without smothering me with attention.  For sure will be back another night for food, and next time I'll make sure to bring friends along to enjoy the restaurant with (was flying solo tonight).

3.description: RIP Morgans or whatever used to be here. Now you enter a popular chain bar that makes you ask the obvious... "who's Louie?"If you aren't able to find him, then at least settle down for a nice Happy Hour or lunch deal. Since it opened a few weeks ago, it's turned into a popular spot for myself and my coworkers.Our first time here was during lunch, and the food was okay. My burger was pretty average for the most part, and service was good. However, nothing about the experience really stood out for me.Recently, we came here for a work happy hour. We were greeted at the front by a very energetic hostess and was served by a nice-guy waiter who made sure that the drinks kept coming. HH deals are half-off appetizers and $5 select drinks, which is practically the entire menu. The Strawberry Bellini seemed to be a hit amongst the sweet tooth's out there.Food wise- the bruschetta was definitely high up on the list. Laid out on some large, fancy cocktail glasses, you get plenty of fresh tomatoes and lettuce to top off your garlic bread. The buffalo wings here were decent as well. However, I'd pass on the calamari and meatballs. They got the job done, but was simply average.Overall, great place to go for a good HH deal, but don't expect the food to blow you away. With the affordable drinks, large dining space, and large TV screens everywhere, this will likely be a keeper here around University Village for many years to come.

14.description: First time at this Bar Louie location and I must say that my experience was grand. Service was very prompt & consistent with making sure I was satisfied. Didn't know Louie sound taco but they were sooooooooo juicy & tender.

12.description: This review is for this BB&B location specifically, not BB&B in general.I've always been a big fan of BB&B since they always have a ton of great stuff and a great variety, but for some reason I've been struggling to find the things I'm looking for at the store on Roosevelt. They've got a pretty limited selection of plates, glasses, silverware, etc, and they don't have a huge variety of kitchen or home appliances (read: only one type of vacuum or juicer or blender or whatever available).The staff is quite pleasant, there's free parking (which is saying A LOT in the near-downtown area), and they've been pretty good at working with me, I think I'm just a little frustrated and disappointed that I can't seem to find the variety I'm looking for here. I admit I'm slightly picky and hard to please when it comes to home stuff (especially anything and everything dealing with the kitchen!), but I just feel like the BB&B from my hometown had a much better selection.But, at the end of the day, you can always order stuff online!

7.description: Did I complain about them being a little too helpful? Yes, I did and it's time to eat my words. Today I stopped in to look at the new offerings in one cup coffee makers. I had one of the earlier s which really didn't make a strong enough cup of coffee, I didn't get around to returning it and I thought too much time had gone by so I gave it away.Needing another coffee maker for my office I bought one of a more traditional type with a grinder. I used it one time when I had a client come in, it was a PITA to clean, and to boot we each had one cup of coffee. So I went in too take a look. I first was approached by a overly helpful person on the floor (j/k) then got to talking about what was wrong with my first Keurig, and she explained the newer one that came out, then another overly helpful person joined us, (j/k) and showed me another not as fancy model of the same thing. I decided that I might give this a try, and he said why not if it doesn't work bring it back, we have a liberal return policy. I then asked how liberal because I had bought (showing him) this one a while ago and only used it once, and I don't have the box any more. He replied, "bring it back" so I did buy the newest Kurig, and it did make a stronger cup of coffee, so I packed up the other on and brought it back. They managed to look up the old sale and credit my card back. So I guess they worked out the disappearing part, and kept the being too helpful part, which I have to say I won't complain about any more. Lesson learned.

3.description: I have to admit, I was the bride who NEVER wanted to register at B,B,&B...just too trendy. However, after discussions with some friends about their experience with the B3, especially the return policy, my fiance and I decided to jump on board and set up a wedding registry. We met with Dan, a wedding consultant, at the Roosevelt location and he was absolutely AMAZING! What an experience. Dan sat down with us to discuss our personalities, our wedding, our guests, our wants/needs and then he walked around the entire store with us to discuss products and answer any questions we had. He offered suggestions, provided opinions on products he uses from the store, and pointed out "wedding MUST haves." Along those same lines of quality of customer service, he even looked over our registry to make sure our quantities all matched up (so we didn't order 12 plates but only 10 flatware settings, didn't have red towels when everything else was beige, etc.). Dan had a great personality and made the whole process really fun.While I started wedding planning anti big chain stores, my experience at this particular Bed, Bath, and Beyond has now made me a promoter to all the other brides-to-be. I highly suggest working with Dan.

1.description: This is the closest Bed Bath and Beyond in our area and I love it. It always has what I am looking for the staff has always been friendly and attentive. I enjoy doing my shopping there and I like how they take expired coupons.

2.description: There's free parking and the people who work here seem nice.  That said, this store is ridiculously cramped, even by Bed Bath and Beyond standards (completely unacceptable by any other standard).  The main aisles are barely wide enough for a single cart to pass, and it's very difficult to find anything.

9.description: What really stands out to me at Bed Bath & Beyond is the extremely FRIENDLY staff.  Every time I shop here, there is always someone willing to help me out with my purchases. Most recently, we went to purchase a few items from a wedding registry. I really like that they print it out for you and only give you the items that have not yet been purchased.  As my hubby and I went on our scavenger hunt, we were approached by two different sales associates asking if we needed any assistance.  Further, because I am the worst gift wrapper ever, it is nice that they do complimentary gift wrapping too!  Overall it is a pleasant shopping experience...and yes, they also have a lot neat things for the home!

18.description: For some reason the parking is a pain in the ass...  Not sure why there are two gate arms and a giant hole in the ramp up but that is how it is here...  Maybe trying to carry over the rough pothole filled streets of Chicago to the typically smooth and trouble free parking garage.  I don't know but I don't like it whatever it is...  And for the validation - what if the store does not carry what you are looking for?  Do you get stuck with paying for 5 minutes of parking to visit a store that does not carry what you were looking for to begin with???I went here looking for a hamper and a laundry basket.  I asked the staff where they were located.  The woman who helped me was very nice and courteous.  This review is in no way meant to be a negative reflection on her whatsoever.  Once she showed me the one laundry basket they carried I asked if there were others.  She said no. Granted this is a laundry basket we are talking about.  But Bed Bath and Beyond wanted $7 or so for it...  It did not do anything special.  It did not talk.  It did not walk.  It did not fold your clothes.  It sat on the floor or wherever else you put it and held your laundry within its confines.  The woman stated that because this was an urban store that their selection was extremely limited on many things and that if I wanted more options I should visit a location in the suburbs.  I will be doing that since I work in the suburbs.  I am willing to bet their parking arrangement is not a pain in the ass as well...  I then went to Target and purchased a laundry basket for $3.  It does the EXACT same thing that the $7 laundry basket would have done.  Just in case you were wondering...

10.description: Quite inconsistent service when I come to this location. Today I went in and two employees were chatting away. One said hello but then went back to chatting . I purposely walked nearby cluelessly and lost. Talk about tunnel vision or not being able to read body language - they kept chatting for another 10 minutes. Finally one of the girls came over to help and of course they didn't have what I had seen online.Other times I've been here the staff is quick to assist and not just say hello.

13.description: I bought 2 items and had 2 of those 20% discount cards, the total was under $20. What's not to like?! I'll be back after the holidays for bigger savings. One reviewer mentioned the difficulty in parking, we had no problem but maybe it was because the time of the day.

16.description: I like this place it has a lot of great things. Very helpful employees I'm glad I choose this place.

17.description: i go in here for things that i get all at once... and sometimes i go in for just keurig coffee cups.. and the staff is always asking if we are doing ok and also if we need help.. always! but yest Tomas was a great amount of help and made it easy for our descisions.. very nice guy and all around nice employees. this place has everything you want.. and free parking! yay

15.description: Normal Bed Bath and Beyond, staff is super helpful when looking for things you may need.  Great place to have a wedding registry !

0.description: This is a great store. The staff have always been helpful. This place has some great products and great deals some times. I love the 20% off coupon that they send every month. As soon as one expires, they send another one right away...of course you have to sing up for the coupons. We have bought a few things from this store and had a great experience. Some things seem pricey but that's not because of the store but because that's just how much they are worth. So all in all, can't complain. Great store! Great staff!

5.description: I get my sodastream CO2 refills here, so it's really handy that they send out so many of those $5 off coupons.  Despite having an expiration date, those coupons don't ever expire.  The $15 minimum purchase is perfect for swapping out canisters.There's a free parking garage, though the signs all confusingly say to take a ticket and get it validated.  Hint: there's no ticket, and definitely no validation needed.

11.description: Easy returns and exchanges.  Staff was friendly and helped me find a lot of what I was looking for. Free parking at this location is definitely a plus.

8.description: This location is on the smaller side in comparison to other stores. As a result the company did a good job with making the most out of the limited space available to them. Positives of this store are the 20% off coupons, the free parking in the garage, the very helpful staff that may feel like they are stalking you because they are everywhere you turn. Negatives about this store are the check out lanes or should I say lane, plus due to the limited space its hard to find some items or you feel like you are standing in places you should not be allowed with unpaid merchandise. The employees attempt to ease the check out lane frustration by utilizing the registers at the customer service desk.  No matter this store is an ideal place to explore if you are looking to create space saving techniques and cooking made easier, plus it has more than enough options for the nearby college students to make the dorms or apartments feel more homey.

4.description: I came in with an annoying and complicated return and Stephanie helped me out. She processed it with minimal inconvenience and even applied a coupon to a reorder that I didn't know about it. Thanks and nice work.

14.description: I can stay in this place for hours!  Everything is organized quite well. Nice merchandise, sometimes out of the ordinary.  Staff is great.

6.description: Very helpful staff.Huge selection of merchandise.FREE parking!!!!!!!!!!Convenient location.I highly recommend this place.

58.description: I am surprised by this little place a bit out of the way. A little hard to find but still incredibly good and with prices that border on this side of ridiculous. Papaya salad, which I haven't had in a while caught my eye. The salad was spicy but not too spicy, which was okay but still really tasty. My dining partner is just starting to appreciate spicy food it was enough for her and still had enough heat for me. Tasty though and good enough to order again. The Green curry was okay, tasty but I did ask for hot and it was medium at best.The Thai iced tea was pretty good, I ordered it late into the meal but it was worth it. Sweet but the tea was strong enough where I got to taste the tea. Worth a repeat visit.

56.description: Ordered take out. Prompt delivery w/ in 30 minutes. One of the few places open until 10 pm so we were left with little choice.We ordered the: spicy beef rad nar- bad cuts of beef. Small take out portion. Did not have much flavor other than it was spicy. Watery sauce.Pineapple fried rice- tasted like cheap Chinese fried rice with 3 pieces of pineappleMasuman beef- had a heavy heavy coconut flavor, again cheap cuts of beef, cubes of potatoes (why?!?!) that was hard, and a few pieces of pineapple (???) the dish had more onions & potatoes than it did beef.Thai tea- was the only refreshing thing out of the order. The cup was of course filled mainly with ice and not worth the $3.50 charged. Over all the small portioned, over priced, and hardly satisfying meal cost $32. I would not order from them again. Delivery charge is additional $3.-

29.description: Pleasant, casual family owned Pan-Asian restaurant on Taylor just east of Ashland. It is by far the best restaurant of its type on Taylor Street.  There are many classic Thai dishes on the menu, and you can always specify spiciness. If you order a noodle soup be prepared for a huge portion of noodles, or request a half portion. The owners aim to please. Lemongrass does a brisk delivery and take-out Business.The owners have two well-behaved little boys and the restaurant is child friendly. It's a good addition to the neighborhood.

42.description: Great food at a great price! Ill be back!

23.description: Worst Thai food we ever had compared to other Thai restaurants. I ordered a roasted duck on rice, it's just five pieces of thin duck meat on top of a huge mountain of rice and the juice cannot even soak all the rice, I definitely don't want to pay $9 for this - $2 a piece of thin duck meat. My friend had cashew chicken, the cashews were burned and they put starch in the juice and my friend shook his head on the first bite. This would be the last time we walk into this place.

47.description: Like the previous poster said, this place recently reopened. I didn't try it before, so I'm referring to its new ownership.1. These owners are super friendly and know who I am now even though I've only been a few times so far. They let us come and eat in once even though there was about 20 minutes till close.2. Most of the apps are delicious. The rangoons are better than the other places on Taylor and there's a nice fusion selection overall. The green samosas are Indian-like, cute, green-colored and tasty.3. The panang curry is my favorite and they always make it anyway you want w/ any meat or veggie, it's always good.As of now, it's my favorite Thai place on Taylor/Little Italy area.

8.description: This place is great! The food is delicious and not soaked in oil like other places on Taylor. I'm taking off one star because it seems they don't like to pay for heating during the winter. I literally had to wear my coats and hat inside. They have space heaters and point them at you, but even the owners (and their kids who are playing off to the side) are wearing their coats.

31.description: Stumbled upon this place when wandering around getting acclimated to the UIC campus...sizing it up of course compared to my Grad studies at Depaul.  It being a Sunday night at 9:45 (Engineering/design classes on a Sunday are no joke and ran really late!) nothing was open....n-o-t-h-i-n-g.  I ducked in here and while the owner told me they were closed, she served me up, hot and fresh, and I was soooo impressed! Could be my new favorite Thai!!  In case you are wondering what I am comparing to.... Joys, Penny's, Cozy, Butterfly...

34.description: I have never been dissappointed eating here, everything is flavorful.

16.description: Regular pan asian food.Their menu was a little large in my opinion. A large menu makes me lose trust for the chef's abilities.I had no problems with the food or service but nothing impressed me. Their menu includes a few asian items that you can't get anywhere else on taylor street but most of the items on their menu can be found at better locations for the same price at restaurants that are one specific asian type instead of multiple.

13.description: Such a wonderful family-owned restaurant. Their soups are amazing, especially if you are feeling under the weather. My personal favorite is the chicken rice soup, it's soul-warming. I would definitely recommend Lemongrass if you are looking for a quick eat!

11.description: I will have to take a grade down for this place even though it aches me a little bit (I like this place overall).We once ordered their sort of signature soup (the soup with their restaurant name on it), and it exactly tasted like a instant korean ramen soup.  We couldn't believe what we tasted so we had to do it over and over.  Having eaten Korean ramen all my life, I had to go to the conclusion that the ramen soup paste somehow contributed to the soup we ordered.  I mean, it is not even thai anymore is it?However sad this maybe, I will have reservation ordering certain food from this place because of this experience.

39.description: Service is wonderful!  The food isn't the best Thai food I've had, but it's satisfying.  Their food tends to be a little greasy, but I think most Thai restaurants make their food greasy anyway so I've come to accept that.  I really like their soups.  Their egg drop soup and Tom Yum noodle soup are amazing and warm you right up!I think the place is family-owned, and the people I've met there are very nice.  Sometimes the couple's children are hanging out by the register, but they're calm and well-behaved.  One kid even offered me a gummy bear while I was waiting for my take-out - so cute!

37.description: Delivery Review:Everything was cold - I blame this on the delivery driver more than the restaurant, but it's still a knock.Lumpia - these are really hard to mess up; I'd much rather order the Lumpia from Butterfly Sushi.  Perhaps it was because they were soggy and cold and the order included 6 very small lumpia.Pancit - another Filipino dish, and it just missed the mark.  While the bbq pork was good in it, the rest was bland, noodles weren't cooked property, and just lacked any sort of cohesive flavor.Yellow Curry - this was actually pretty good yellow curry, but it was the smallest portion of curry I've ever seen.  It was a half pint container that was filled primarily with liquid, and very few chunks of chicken and potato.  Complete ripoff.

0.description: I love their food, and service!!! The pad kee mow is the best!!! Even better than drunken noodles!!! The food is not pricy, highly recommend!!!

38.description: good food, cute family owned, and clean!! tofu crispy pad see ew soooo goooddd. a little on the sweeter side for me but still love it.  love their viet hot coffee and thai ice teas.

51.description: There was only one other table seated.  I realized the kitchen may be busy with delivery and take out, but they gave my friend beef massaman when she ordered chicken yellow curry, so this was a front-of-house issue!  Then the lady gave my dining companion a whole lot of attitude when my friend politely and hesitatingly noted the discrepancy.Also, the spring roll was the wrong temperature (the whole thing was hot?) and the edamame was not salted properly.  Also, I got attitude when I asked if they had sriracha.  Also, there is Golden Thai right there on the other side of the sidewalk.  My recommendation, humbly, is that you go there instead.

27.description: Good place to eat. Great price. Great location and good customer service. Sue and her husband are so nice. I usually order the basil fried rice which I highly recommend you try.

32.description: Tried Lemongrass through grubhub.  Lobster rangoons were awesome. Otherwise it was your typical run of the mill place.

54.description: Not sure what to think.  I ordered carryout from here earlier this summer, and have only tried it once, so I would like to think it was just an off day.  The bad thing is, with all of the other above average Thai places in the area, it'll be hard for me to give it a second try... The pad thai and pad kee mao comes in chinese carryout looking cartons.  The pad thai was pretty bland, and the noodles were a little thicker than typical.  That's pretty much all I can say about the pad thai.  The pad kee mao was not much better, and it only contained a few types of veggies in it.  It was also pretty bland.  I had some trouble finding the place for the carryout, because they only have a little material sign on the front.  I mentioned to the lady at the counter that they should probably get a nice big sign so people know that they exist, but she just kind of laughed it off, but I wasn't kidding... There were zero customers in the place at the time and it was late dinner time.How about it Lemongrass?  How about stepping up?  You guys have a great location near UIC with tons of foot traffic.  All you need to do is re-invent some of your sauces with some personality! And then promote your place a little better, maybe a new sign? Some new carryout containers?  Do it and I promise I'll come back, and I'll bring some friends also.(Cut to Babu in the background shaking his finger and saying, "You're a very bad man, Jerry Seinfeld! Very, very bad!")I tried.

48.description: Since I've eaten at nearly every other thai place within delivery range, I decided to take my friend to lunch at this one and see how it was. The service was fine, the atmosphere nice (though slightly quiet and stark), but the food was the problem. I got the panang curry, one of my favorite thai dishes. I was in the mood for it because it comes with "mixed vegetables" and I really wanted more than just some bamboo shoots. Taking my first bite, it was obvious the dish was over-salted. I decided not to complain, but as I continued eating, i started wondering where the veggies were. I dug down a little bit to find there were about three slices of green pepper, a few slices of red pepper and plenty of basil leaves. I was so disappointed that not only was my dish salty, but I'm forcing it down without the enjoyment of all the veggies that I had so been looking forward to.Come on guys at Lemongrass, read these Yelp reviews and save your business. Get a new cook, new management, something! Until then, you'll find me at Golden Thai.

44.description: So sad.  They changed owners and no longer serve the yummy salad at lunch and the soup is not good.  There are frozen carrots in it.  Yuck. They had the best soup when it was the old owners.

24.description: Went with some classmates for lunch. Service was fast and friendly. I had the Yaki Soba with tofu and it was very good. Everyone else in my party seemed satisfied with their dishes. I'd like to try more of their menu.

7.description: Crab rangoons were great! Not too crabby.Big fried triangles. I ordered the massaman curry which has the only real veggie listed as potatoesWhen I got the dish they had replaced potatoes with red & green peppers and I said "This has no potatoes." to the server and he said ok and returned to the kitchen.He came back and asked me If I wanted another veggie because there were no potatoes ready and I said no but this was long after I began eating my meal. He offered no discount or apology. I have had better Thai almost everywhere with better service. Must survive on college student  influx.Also was SUB ZERO inside and uncomfortable

49.description: This review is from May-but writing it now--We noticed this place went up on Taylor and decided to give it a shot. We got here around 8:30pm on a Sunday night, so it was pretty empty. Atmosphere was clean, fresh, modern and relaxing. They brought us complimentary endamame while we decided on our order. We ordered veggie potstickers (6 came to an order) and they were definitely tasty, fried-non-greasy and a cucumber/vinegarette salad for appetizers. My bf had the terriyaki beef which was fabulous and very fresh. I ordered the pad thai (tofu) which was beautifully presented. (Unfortunately I was too inpatient to grab the camera out of my purse....so no pics) My only gripe-the entree portions were a little on the smaller side. Not super small, but just not very big. We both brought small doggy bags home-but it wasn't much.We'll definitely be coming back! We had a great time!

40.description: I came here for lunch 3 weeks ago with some new friends and thought it was decent for lunch. Big pluses were that it was a short walk from my workplace and they had cheap lunch specials for just under $7. They do accept credit cards. My friends had the Panang Curry and Tom Yum noodle soup, and I had a beef dish with basil and rice. They both liked their dishes. I liked that there was a large amount of basil in my dish. The sweet and sour soup and egg roll that came with the lunch specials were nothing special though. The tables were mostly full around noon. I would come again for a quick, cheap Thai lunch.

53.description: This little family run place is one of my favorites on Taylor. Consistently good, fresh thai food at reasonable prices. Good service.  We go at least once a week. The lunch special comes with free soup and some cabbage/cucumber salad. I recommend the pad see eu, pad woon sen, or chicken noodle soup, personally.

30.description: I had the lunch special with chicken penang curry, and it was delicious! I also got miso soup and an egg roll all for only $7.50. I really don't know why this place is getting such low reviews because the food is as good if not better than the other two Thai places on Taylor. The restaurant was clean and simply designed and the waitress was attentive. The only minus was that I had to walk through the kitchen to get to the bathroom, which isn't even a real criticism of a restaurant.

46.description: Agree w the other reviewers on the Pad Thai (overly tangy and really not all that great) and Egg Roll (srsly inedible, two bites. done.).  I asked my server if it had cream cheese in it bc it tasted like it and it had this white cream cheese looking layer on the inside of the dough, it was  pretty nasty.The one good thing was the chicken soup which was very tasty and set me up for unrealistic expectations.

1.description: I always order the Chicken Pad Thai. Spicy Please! It was good, its either a hit or miss with the flavor. Today was a good experience, I would choose their Pad Thai over their competitors. Very friendly staff, and what makes them different is their chocolate fortune cookies.

55.description: We just ordered from here-our first time I had the pad thai which was okay-kind of bland, the catfish curry was good, the beef paradise was like beef jerky, no paradise eating beef paradise, do NOT order it!!!! ewwwwww we just threw it out!Also this place was totally empty but on our way there did see a bunch of places I would consider checking out!

9.description: Awesome food! Very courteous delivery, too. They were slightly late (less than 5 minutes off the estimate) and were so apologetic. Busy night with the Bears game, so not a problem at all in my book. Pho was delicious- hit the spot! Sad I didn't order enough for leftovers.

26.description: Really good pad thai.  Ok Spring rolls.  The server was very very nice.   I think the food is slightly pricey, but overall good.

25.description: This is the place for green curry, peeps! For me, it's undoubtedly the best Thai restaurant among the 5 on Taylor street. One night, they gave us our order to go even after their closing time!

12.description: This place is pretty awful. The service is slow, the waiters are often rude, and the quality of food is awful. I came here couple days ago because Golden thai had a long wait to be seated. The people I was with got pad thai, pho, and green curry. None of the dishes were good. I used to go here for their lunch specials, where they throw in a soup and eggroll with the reduced lunch hour price. But when I asked about the lunch specials, the waiter rudely told me they stopped doing that "like 3 years ago". I definitely got the lunch special last year so I don't know what he's talking about.... but yea, now that the lunch special is gone, i DEFINITELY WILL NOT BE GOING BACK. I don't even know how this place is still in business. You can get some quality thai food right across the street at Golden Thai.

59.description: Decent take out. Tried the Tom Yum soup, drunken noodles, panang curry and of course Thai ice tee.The tea left something to be desired. Most Thai tea tastes the same to me, but this one seemed off. It was sweet but it had a sort of grainy after taste. Hard to explain.The soup came really hot. Like temperature hot. I burned my tongue a little on the first spoon. That really meant two things. One the were fast for delivery. And two they used some good packaging.The drunken noodles were the of the thin noodle variety. I'm a fan of the thicker almost sheet like noodles. Still it had good flavor to it.The panang curry was probably the best thing in the meal. I really enjoyed it.All in all I'd say probably my last delivery take out venture, but it was cheap fast and hit the spot.

21.description: The combo fried rice is the best one I have ever had. One of my best places on Taylor street.

17.description: I had the lunch special with chicken penang curry, and it was delicious! I also got miso soup and an egg roll all for only $7.50. I really don't know why this place is getting such low reviews because the food is as good if not better than the other two Thai places on Taylor. The restaurant was clean and simply designed and the waitress was attentive. The only minus was that I had to walk through the kitchen to get to the bathroom, which isn't even a real criticism of a restaurant.

10.description: I've tried my fair share of Thai food in Chicago and lemon grass has the best pad Thai I've had thus far in this Windy City. Definitely will be coming back. :)

5.description: I live by Taylor St. and Lemongrass is my go-to online delivery Asian restaurant.  Good quantity of food for what you pay.Their Mongolian Beef is excellent and spicier than average, giving it extra flavor. My favorite item on the menu is their Sweet and Sticky Rice with Thai Custard - it looks visually gross, but it is the best dessert I have ever had, and I always get it when I can.  Eggrolls are better than average eggrolls. Pad Thai is hit or miss.  Some people on this site love it, while we tried it once and it didn't hit with much flavor.  Will give them the benefit of the doubt on this one.Delivery from grub hub usually arrives about 10 minutes earlier than anticipated and the food has always been warm/hot upon delivery. This is your family-owned restaurant with a big heart, and I love supporting them as they make  consistently good Asian food and it appears that their lives revolve around the restaurant.  Their restaurant dining room is cute in that one section of it has been taken over by the children, who are always roller-blading around the restaurant or working on homework, nothing ever distracting or inappropriate.  I haven't ever dined in the restaurant, and have always picked up takeout or had online delivery.

3.description: Ordered online from their website.  After an hour I called to make sure they had the order.  The man on the phone asked what company I ordered from, Grubhub etc.  I informed him that I ordered off of his own website at which point he told me that doesn't work anymore.  Well great, maybe you should take that option off your website then? Just a thought or common sense really.  Can't say anything about the food because we didn't have the chance to try it. Oh well, other good Asian food restaurants out there.

35.description: The best Thai restaurant in University Village!  I am a vegetarian and LOVE Thai food.  I have been trying the various places in the area, as I work close by, and ordered from Lemongrass after seeing great reviews on grub hub.  I phoned in delivery and the women I spoke to was incredibly kind and helpful.  When the sweet delivery driver arrived, it turned out she used to work at my favorite Thai Place in Hyde Park, small world!  The food was delicious, we had Pad Se Ew that was very flavorful.  I soon came back again, and tried the Pad Woon Sen, which was also delicious.  Exceptional service and yummy food, I can't wait to try more items!

19.description: Some of the best Asian food in the city in my opinion. Not only is the food great but it's reasonably priced and the ingredients are fresh. There is also free parking which is a huge plus.

28.description: I like this place!At first, my friend took me here.After that, I took my family here.I think the owner really know how to cook.I am Asian, so I have been familiar with Thai food for a long time.The taste is as a whole quite good when compared with other Thai restaurants.The owner is also welcoming.

45.description: I admire Lemongrass for setting up shop across the street from Golden Thai, down the street from Yummy Thai, and also competing with Thai Bowl, all Thai restaurants within a 1 mile radius that are pretty well situated and have established regular clients.I've always liked Lemongrass, although it doesn't really hit the spot when I am craving greasy Thai food.  I usually order the crab rangoon and tofu pad see ew.  The crab rangoon is baked, not fried.  I look forward to a greasy crunch when I bite in, and found it was more like a pita chip (dry heart-healthy crunch)... so disappointing.  The filling itself was a bit bland.  As for the tofu pad see ew, I think it's one of the better pad see ew's I've had in Chicago.  The problem is that the portions are on the smaller size, and people aren't going to pay for the same taste as a smaller portion, even if it's healthier or better quality when they could just continue to eat at their regular Yummy Thai or Golden Thai, etc. They do however always make a cute carrot flower shaving and place it on your plate alongside your entree, definitely far better presentation than the other Taylor street Thai restaurants...I forgot to mention that this place is BYOB which is a definite plus! A friend of mine had her birthday dinner here and it was fantastic and cheap.This place is always DEAD inside.  I was scared to try it any earlier.  Their carry-out business is pretty busy, however there aren't many people dining in so don't let that scare you from stepping in.  The wait staff is very friendly - usually it's one woman who is also manning the phones, taking care of tables, and communicating with the cook in the kitchen.Good luck Lemongrass... I usually prefer Butterfly sushi now that they have opened a Madison street location, but may you live long and prosper.

33.description: Came in for lunch and ordered pad thai. It was a little too saucy for my liking but it was quick and delicious! Service was friendly and prices were great.

43.description: I just got delivery from there and let me tell you, I enjoy this place a lot.I am really a fan of the "side dishes" more than the main dish. My pad siew was mighty tasty, but I'm also a fan of the slight sweetness. I also got some vegetable samosas, the veggie egg rolls (they give you for free if you do an order of $10 or more on GrubHub) , and the vegetable dumplings. The samosas surprised me with their flavor, very true to what I would get in an Indian restaurant but in smaller form. The egg rolls and the dumplings were average Thai fare, nothing to call home about but still pretty good. I plan on ordering again (I seem to be that person who seems to enjoy their food in a not-so-greatly reviewed place. And I'm a food snob).

2.description: Ordered take out from here once, on my way home from work. Got the Japanese gyoza, a noodle bowl and 2 curry dishes. The Curry dishes were good and comparable to other Thai take-out I've had. I could live without the noodle bowl though. It was an easy, quick dinner that I would try again.

18.description: Really good pad thai.  Ok Spring rolls.  The server was very very nice.   I think the food is slightly pricey, but overall good.

41.description: Got a very salty dish from them recently, almost not edible. For a restaurant having a super low turnover, that is absolutely not acceptable.

52.description: I should have looked at the reviews before coming here. Never again.At first I was so excited to see curry puffs listed on the appetizers, since I had them once in MN, but haven't been able to find them again. Apparently there was no effort to make them authentic since they were just 2 slices of wheat bread that clearly came out of a pressed sandwich toaster.  Ick!  I also had the Tom Yum soup.  I absolutely agree with the other review saying how hot (temperature) the soup was, as  I also burned my mouth. When I could finally eat it, I noticed it was a poor excuse for Tom Yum. Chopped bell peppers and mushrooms, with NO LEMONGRASS! How can a place called Lemongrass not even put lemongrass in Tom Yum?!  And almost $11 for this awful meal!  Not worth it at all!Overall it just seemed like the kitchen was just throwing whatever scraps they had into what they thought would pass for a meal.  FAIL!

50.description: This place has just reopened under new ownership.  A husband and wife team that really know the ropes.  First of all, the place is clean.  Secondly, friendly and welcoming.  Last but not least, the food I had for lunch was awesome.  Let me clarify, I had the Lad Na.  The food was steaming hot, not kind of warm (which I can't stand).  The broccoli was crispy, cooked well and still had that pretty green color.  The wide noodles had just the right amount of crispiness.  The tofu had the perfect texture, size and doneness.  The gravy was wonderful with just the right amount of garlic.  I wish I could make this dish as well as the Lemongrass cook.  I had the Thai iced coffee, yummy treat.  Really refreshing during these warmer months.Lemongrass does not use MSG, which I know is important to many consumers.

4.description: FOOD: 3 stars - They were unable to make the Thai Spring Roll appetizer for some unknown reason. The chicken pad thai had very little chicken and was somewhat underwhelming but decent portion size. The roasted thai duck was cooked well with good flavor but the portion was on the small side and the watery sauce with small serving dishes made it somewhat challenging to eat without making a mess.  SERVICE: 3 stars - Server spoke limited English and couldn't give us any recommendations. He never asked us if we even wanted anything to drink besides room temp tap water with no ice. Friendly service but definitely lacking anything above the minimum. ENVIRONMENT: 3 stars - Bench seating by the window was off balanced so we moved ourselves to a different seat. There were no other patrons in the place, just two little kids that were cute but being kinda annoying bickering with each other unattended.

6.description: Everything I've had has been awesome, the staff is super friendly and they always have suggestions for when I'm feeling adventurous, Thai iced tea is something I wish I discovered years ago, and who knows what I'll find next at lemongrass!!!

22.description: Extremely friendly service but arguably worst pho I have ever had.

15.description: Great Food!I had the Curry Chicken. It was slightly different compared to other Curry Chicken I have had, but it was still excellent. Nice amount of spice, not bland at all. My cousin dining with me had a sweet noodle dish and she said it was tasty as well. There is a lost of a star due to the ambiance. My visit was on mid-Winter, so of course it was cold outside, but it was also cold in the restaurant; my cousin and I had to keep our coats and scarves on while dining. Though the food was not bland the atmosphere was; no decor and the seating was uncomfortable. And I'd like to end this on a good note that the server was friendly. :)

57.description: This is a wonderful little place to grab a quick, tasty and cheap lunch. I had hot tea, soup, salad, and a noodle dish, all for 8.50! Everything was fresh, flavorful and, perfect for a mild-mouthed white kid like me, not spicy! I chose the Pad Woon Sen ("A silvery tangle of bean-thread vermicelli with chicken in garlicky yellow bean sauce, bean sprouts, eggs, scallions and black mushrooms." according to their menu), and as part of the lunch menu, it came with soup and salad. The soup was chicken broth containing steamed rice, ginger and scallions. The salad was a nice mix of shredded cabbages, carrots, bell peppers, onions, basil and as a nice touch, beets. The dressing was a sweet and sour type dressing tasting of ginger and lime, a great accent for the mixture of veggies especially the beets. The hostess/waitress was very nice and helpful with the menu, she kept my teapot full while I read my book awaiting my next appointment at the UIC School of Dentistry. Highly recommended, If I lived anywhere close, I'd be sampling the rest of the menu in quick order. My four star rating comes mainly from the price of the lunch specials with great support coming from the fresh taste of the food.

20.description: I will have to take a grade down for this place even though it aches me a little bit (I like this place overall).We once ordered their sort of signature soup (the soup with their restaurant name on it), and it exactly tasted like a instant korean ramen soup.  We couldn't believe what we tasted so we had to do it over and over.  Having eaten Korean ramen all my life, I had to go to the conclusion that the ramen soup paste somehow contributed to the soup we ordered.  I mean, it is not even thai anymore is it?However sad this maybe, I will have reservation ordering certain food from this place because of this experience.

36.description: Regular pan asian food.Their menu was a little large in my opinion. A large menu makes me lose trust for the chef's abilities.I had no problems with the food or service but nothing impressed me. Their menu includes a few asian items that you can't get anywhere else on taylor street but most of the items on their menu can be found at better locations for the same price at restaurants that are one specific asian type instead of multiple.

14.description: Maybe I am just a Thai Food Snob, or maybe I live in Chicago where there is a good Thai restaurant on every other block. There are so many that we really like. Opart Thai on North Western Ave, Thai Classic on N. Clark, the worlds fastest delivery from Joy Noodle up on North Broadway, but this place in not on the list. Our two favorites are Bodhi Thai on West Roosevelt in Berwyn or D-Thai on Ogden at Harlem Ave. So here is my review of Lemongrass Pan Asian. The portions were very small. This place wasn't super expensive, but when we got home the food containers were only 1/2 filled with food. This is Chicago. We do Big Portions, at least almost fill the containers. I could see this being a lunch special portion, but not a dinner portion. We ordered Pad Se-eu, some Basil Beef and Panang Curry, along with some Tom Kha soup. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't exceptional. My suggestion would be hit this place if you have to, but if not, try one of the other thousands of Thai places in the city.

58.description: Checked it out this pass Sunday since it was such a nice day. It was nice to just walk around and check out what was available. We stopped to try Rubi's. I had the al pastor and thought it was good. Definitely bigger and the tortillas are thicker than a regular taco so $2 is a good deal. It gets crowded and hard to get a seat if you are in a large group.Churro Factory was good for a snack. Nice and hot!My mom got a box of peaches for $5, but she couldn't inspect the ones on the bottom. She told us the guy said no touching.....lol! Luckily only one was going bad....whew!Parking wasn't too hard to find. Unless you lucky, you most likely be parking closer to Canal that way.Would like to go back and definitely take my time next time and try some other places for tacos. Also, no Rick Bayless spotting....Boo! That was not a star deduction....but probably would be a 5 star if I did meet him. Anyways.....

56.description: AH HAHAHAHA!!!!  I love this GEM!Its hilarious....this "market" has everything you want....tires, clothes, shoes, condoms, aspirin, jewelry, old nintendo, gum, candy, fruits and veggies...etc. etc. etc.  I think that one table was full of old TV remotes...HAHAHA!  GREAT!  I love it.The list goes on and on!  I love this random fest.  I went just to check it out and fell in love with it.  Not to mention the FABULOUS food here!  I obvi checked it out on Yelp before making the trek there and ended up at Rubi's....PHENOMENAL tacos!  Seriously, I think the best I have had...plus, it comes with a grilled jalapeno!!!  I also tried the tacos at the place kiddy corner to Rubi's...they were good...but Rubi's just blew them out of the water.  Plus, you can get FUNNEL CAKES here!  Yep...anyway you can slice and dice them....whip cream, ice cream, caramel, strawberries, sugar, etc, etc, etc....AH-MA-ZING!!!!!!If you havent checked out this place, go and see.  If you are pretentious and are only used to going to the Old Town Art Fair...this may not be your scene.  If you like finding the flair in hidden gems....definitely go here.

29.description: It's about a $10 cab ride (including tip) from downtown.  I went there specifically to eat at a taco from Rubi's so that was worth it.  The rest of the street market is a typical flea market so there was nothing special to see.
