I don't remember exactly - but it's some German company that makes the best hearing aids.  We didn't go with the Costco brand, because my father liked something else better. But it was great to see them offering the highest quality products at great prices and great service.  Hope this helps someone searching for hearing aids.

3.description: This is the Costco nearest Chinatown, Little Italy, and Pilsen. That means Chinese people come here to get ramen noodles and sesame oil in bulk, Italians come to get pasta and sausages in bulk, and Mexicans come to get giant tubes of Tajín and 24 packs of Modelo. I used to make fun of my brother many moons ago for always declaring his love for Costco. Maybe it's age or simply becoming a member a couple years back, but now, I get it. Costco is awesome. I don't even have a big family. I just come to buy things I eat a lot. And toilet paper. Because I poop a lot. I also get gas here a lot. Pun Intended.

35.description: In terms of proximity, it's a great location for those living in the loop (especially West Loop).  But it seems like a smaller location that the other Costcos and there were a few items I could not find at this location that I normally find at other ones.  Besides that, it's just like any other Costco.  Pretty good customer service and the lines move fairly fast.  Really ideal if you want to do some moderate shopping or need bulk items for an event.  But if you really doing a lot of shopping, I'd head elsewhere.

19.description: Usually I get a quick and attentive service. I went to the store on Thu 9/3/15 and checked out at 4:27 PM with long lines. The name of the cashier was Taketa and she was chit-chatting with another employee while I was holding my membership card on my hand, I had to bring to her attention so she could scan my card. She was slow scanning my products and she started putting the item in the cart slowly. I had to tell her that I wanted a box and again, very slowly went to look for one. I end up putting my items in the box. I don't mind helping them, when I see that they are really working and putting the effort.

28.description: Great staff, amazing samples, clean floors and neat shelves. The only issues that I've experienced is the pushy-ness off upgrading my membership. Oh- and the food court is always a great choice.. and you don't need a membership to get a slice of pizza!

45.description: This costco is amazing!!! The best part about it is that it's located in a non suburban/residential area meaning that trying to find pantry essentials doesn't mean banging your cart into other droves of other people just to get to the next food aisle. There's also a lot children running around. Yay!There's really nothing not to love about this place. It offers all the desired things that other costcos have to offer. I always find myself snooping around in the bakery section seeing what new tasty desserts and breads this place has to offer. I like the fact that Costco is done with the whole coupon clipping thing. Today, I saw large signs designating which items were actually on sale. Before that I felt like I was trying to find waldo looking for the on sale meats and such.Anyways this costco is great, well staffed, and not as crazy busy as other costcos which is why it gets 5 stars from me.

33.description: I love this Costco. Every department provides excellent services, products, and advice!The staff are all helpful, knowledgeable, efficient, patient, and SMILING. It's a pleasure to see the teamwork and experience the results of their positive work environment.The coupons sent monthly save additional of specific items for a limited time. Be sure to bring your book with you every trip until it expires. You do NOT have to blip the coupons, they will scan the book's code and give you the discount as your selections are rung up!The fresh seafood and meat offerings are great! They carry organic as well as conventional produce and have excellent prices and a nice variety!Dairy, frozen, and pantry food items are very high quality and excellent pricing!Cleaning, paper, plastic and detergents, laundry products are well priced.Clothing and seasonal items as well as household goods and appliance, automotive needs, pharmacy, optometry, and electronics are available and well priced.Members also can shop on the Internet for different merchandise than that offered in the warehouse.They have a very liberal return policy, just do not abuse it!Cars, travel, house maintenance and remodel services/products are available.Customer service is excellent.The food court has limited value priced items!Gasoline at economy prices also is sold!I love Costco and I love this Costco in particular!!!!

43.description: I like this Costco it has several days of the week in which it isn't too busy. Sunday evenings and Weekday afternoons. They are pretty clean. Although their strawberries tend to have at least one with mold on it which I don't like but I guess it's hard to keep strawberries from molding. Although I do believe in keeping strawberries refrigerated instead of keeping them outside in a warmer temperature. But that's just me.I like their customer service and it is pretty organized.  It is the Costco closest to where we live so we go there a lot simply because it's closer than other Costcos.  The one on Clybourn never has anything I am looking for so I'm glad the Ashland location is beter stocked.

2.description: Still a place I can't live without, I've been buying their packaged hard boiled eggs. My first thought was who needs 24 hard boiled eggs? I guess I do, from a quick snack to egg salad, love the little sealed packages of 6 for freshness.Who thinks ups this stuff? How did they know I needed it before I did?

18.description: I love costco and I am so glad this is my costco. This Costco has a gas station, wine section, and tire shop. II've been to lots of costcos but this one has has plenty of parking and a gas line that is never very crowded.Love it.

41.description: Can't get enough of COSTCO.  I tried Sams before but I didn't like it.  Of course I was a family of 2 back then ....Now we are 4 so bulk makes more sense.  Anyway this place is never too crowded but I rarely shop here on the weekend.  I come during the week.  The place has everything I need.  We go through everything we buy here.  It's close by and the employees are helpful.  Totes worth it.

52.description: Zach at the tire center is awesome. Very polite and cheerful, gave a courteous and timely quote over the phone, and then got our car done thirty minutes earlier than promised. Excellent service. And epic beard.The store in general seems a bit nicer than the others we visit (Niles and Lincoln Park).

50.description: Best Costco in the city. Not super crowded even on the weekend. Plenty of parking. Same stuff as all the other ones.

4.description: My cashier was super rude then tossed my card back at me when she was done, if I wanted to be treated like crap I could go to Aldis for free.

6.description: It is what it is...a cavernous warehouse that has very good deals on some items and pretty meh deals on others.  Why 2 stars?- Wine selection not as strong as other stores- Customer service people have attitudes and will lie- Line waits can be very long

22.description: What makes this Costco different? It has kimchi, dried seaweed, Chinese sausage, and other asian-friendly items. There's a Korean pork jerky (bbq style) near the front that you absolutely must try.If that hasn't drawn you in, then you have to become a member just for the cheap gas.

15.description: I heart Costco. Back when it used to be called Price Club, I was already a fan. (Yup, I'm takin' it back to the ole skewl). The gas is cheap (score!), there are usually free samples of food handed out, and best of all...you can get a hot dog and fountain drink for only $1.50. That price has not changed since I can remember. I mean...who does that??!!~ COSTCO! That's who!!!Costco is consistent with the high quality of their products. If I see something on sale, or if I see a product from a brand I've never seen...I'm still confident that if I purchase it and try it out, it will be a great buy. Not only do we save money by shopping here, but it's such a great bargain for great quality products.When in doubt, just buy the Kirkland brand if there's a choice between that or another more well-known brand name. You really can't go wrong with it.

57.description: Shhhhh.This is a magical, magical Costco. No one knows about it. I mean, I don't know why I'm reviewing it because I'm shooting myself in the foot.On a Saturday afternoon, there was no line for check out. No banging into other people in carts. And still everything (if not more) that they stock at the Lincoln Park location. So don't come here. Because it's awesome and I want it all to myself. Ok, maybe you can because I want it to stay in business at least.

20.description: I've been to this location 3 times, and 2 of the times something got screwed up. The first time I went, I bought gift cards, and it wasn't until some days later that I realized I was given the incorrect ones (lesson learned - if you buy gift card there, which can be a great value, check the envelope before walking away from the poorly staffed customer service desk). Tonight when I was leaving, they discovered one of the items in my cart hadn't been scanned and so I had to go back to have it properly rung up. I realize mistakes happen, but having been inconvenienced two out of the three times I've been here...I plan to avoid this location. The reason I didn't give it one star is that parking is more convenient than the other Chicago location.

36.description: I've been a member of Costco for almost 10 years and normally I love their stores, but this one has definitely changed my impression of the company. I purchased a laptop computer from this Costco only to discover that it already had an account on it. I called Costco and told me the computer was "probably" a display because they did not have anymore in stock (e.g., they "could not confirm it" it was display but they said they usually "wipe the computers clean and restore them to factory setting." I was SHOCKED that Costco would SELL A CUSTOMER A USED COMPUTER WITHOUT THEIR KNOWLEDGE). I called several Costco's (including the corporate office) and they were unhelpful. After being on the phone for over an hour, I discovered that the computer was not a display but a RETURN. To know that Costco knowingly sold me a return as if it was a new computer is very disturbing (e.g., I took a picture of sign and no where does it state that the computer was a return). Before you buy a computer from Costco, I urge you to CONFIRM THAT YOU ARE GETTING A NEW COMPUTER. I'm not sure if this Costco is dishonest or if the company as a whole has this problem, but I am definitely going to consider patronizing another warehouse. This experience is very unfortunate because Costco has a great business model and a fantastic return policy, but dishonesty is dishonesty and something I'm not willing to tolerate. I guess this is what happens when small companies become part of big corporate. :(

14.description: Got my membership for this Costco when I moved here over the summer and I think, even though I maybe only go once a month or so, I've already earned back my membership's cost in savings. Between the great deals on gas, savings on products bought in bulk, and, of course, the delicious pizza and hotdogs at the food court, my experiences here have been nothing but good. Of course, it's a pain that there aren't any bags and you have to pay with a debit or check if you don't have an American Express card, but it's part of corporate deal, I guess. The free samples make up for it, if you get there early enough to grab 'em!

58.description: This new location is huge and bright, with an entire room in the back just for clearance.  The staff seemed friendly and eager to help us find something; no less than four employees approached us during the 15-20 minutes we were there.

56.description: This store is at a new huge development called Southgate Market in the south Loop near Roosevelt. I loved this DSW compare to the other one up North in the city due to the easy parking in the huge parking garage. And it isn't crowded at all. I thought this store was huge and spacious. There did seem to be line at the checkout though, so they need to step up their cashier staff. I love DSW's for their lower priced name brand shoes.

29.description: They have a ridiculous selection of shoes here: boots, heels, flats - everything!  I can almost never walk out w/o getting something - which is why I try to go ONLY when I NEED something.  However, my definition of 'NEED' may differ than those of others...sigh.Nonetheless, it's one of the better ones and I'm glad it's down the street from me.  And they should be too...lol.

42.description: Pretty decent clearance shoes. Good selection of purses and socks and what-not. Bar shoes are really not my thing and they are heavy in this department. It would be a better shoe store for me if they had a more balanced selection.

23.description: My love for DSW knows no bounds. I never thought I was a "shoe" person, until DSW came into my life. So DSW, as whole, gets 5++++ stars.This particular location, however, makes me hyperventilate a bit. So. many. people. Clearance section so claustrophobic. Parking garage = accident waiting to happen. The store is quite large and well-organized. As a big-footed woman (size 10), I've never really had issues finding my shoe size, but damn--I strike out ALL THE TIME here. Plenty of smaller sizes--6s, 7s, but every cute shoe I saw was devoid of larger sizes. Is this were all the big-footed women shop or something!?The store is about 75-80% women's shoes. Sorry boys. And the clearance section is rather small (at least, again, for the larger sizes). They will validate your parking for up to 90-mins. While that's nice, my shoe-shopping trips rarely take less than 2 hours. And the extremely long check-out lines here don't help. So DSW, while I love you and can't bear to give you less than 3 stars, this location is not one of my favorites.

47.description: OK so first it took me a little bit to figure out how to go into the parking for DSW, but maybe I'm slow.  I'm used to going to the parking for Whole Foods and PetSmart off of Canal, and for DSW parking you go past that to an up-ramp on the right that looks like it's headed somewhere like a freeway but it really goes to a paid garage.  You get validation but I took so long I had to pay $2 anyway.  I was looking for clearance sneakers, and didn't have a lot of luck.  Per the reviews I went to the clearance section all the way in the back.  I'm a women's 10 and I was looking for a real bargain.  Maybe on a different week I would have had more luck.  I did like how they had purse displays all over, though some of the purse prices made me think "No way."

8.description: Being on State street (a main shopping area) I should've known building space is limited (right next to the target which is also a bit cramped).I'm not complaining too much, but cramming a bunch of shoppers in there could get really suffocating. They had a good selection but not as many as other locations (due to location/size). I would go to get something quick, but not spend hours shopping at this particular location.One good thing is the fact that there is a DSW in the area. The closest one by the downtown shopping area is by the Union.

31.description: I live in Las Vegas & I've always passed by the DSW stores, but this was my very first time in a DSW store. And this store is huge! My friend that took me here said that this store was average size compared to the other ones in Chicago. Well, I came here to find some heels for a wedding I was going to that weekend (Sept 18th).They had a great selection of shoes, but they didn't have my size! I'm a 5- 5.5, so it was harder for me to find the color/style I wanted. In the sale section I found more than enough shoes that I would buy for Vegas, but since I was in Chicago specifically for the wedding, I had to watch what I was spending :P They did have plenty of simple & cute black shoes, but I was looking for a different/funkier color. I didn't catch the employees name, but she gave me amazing service & even went to the back to double check for my sizes. I walked out buying a pair of socks for my boyfriend & signed up for the rewards program, so I'll definitely be back to check out the ones in Vegas!

34.description: This DSW is alright. I find the selections are better at the larger Schaumburg and Oak Brook locations. I can't even say  that the selections are hit or miss. The store is always clean and the staff is great, it's just I can rarely  find anything here that stops me dead in my tracks. I sometimes find some good deals on my beloved Puma gear though...I know the odds are slim but I always go back to look for that truly awesome find. I'll more than likely keep at it.

16.description: It's wedding/bachelorette party season for me.  And I'm clearly notorious for procrastinating in packing, buying dresses, shoes, etc.  So, thank the Lord for DSW!  I was worried about the dress I bought for a friend's wedding.  After all, it was black..and my mom always yelled at me when I wanted to wear black to a wedding.  She'd ask if I was going to a funeral.  Yup.  WIth her words in mind, I set off to DSW after work, in hopes of finding an amazing pair of non-black shoes.  Even though the sale section isn't as big as the one on Clark or even in Glenview, this store is waaaaay less crowded than the other two so you don't have to fight your way through people.  Plus, there's tons of mirrors so you can model the shoes at every possible angle you can think of - without feeling bad that you're hogging the mirror.  After looking for about 20 min, I finally found a pair of red, t-strapped heels.  Beautiful.  And would perfectly complement the dress, I thought.  At 40% off, the shoes came out to only be 45 bucks!  Steal!  FYI ya'll - This DSW is located in the same complex as Whole Foods, World Market, LA Fitness...so you can get your parking validated (first 90 min free!)  Entering off Taylor is alot easier than fighting the traffic on Roosevelt.  Ahhh, love South Loop.

13.description: I may need a DSW 12-step program. The prices are so low, you can easily spend a few hours here self debating and asking yourself... Do I really need to buy six pairs of shoes today?There is such a wide range of shoes here - mostly brands you might find at Macy's. I bought a really cute pair of espadrilles in February. Win. I would pass on their bags and accessories as you can smell the pleather from across the store.

11.description: They have a large selection at the beginning of the season.  Just be ready to take some time looking, large store.  The good thing is, all of the merchandise is well organized.

39.description: This location is much better than others I have been too. Free parking is also a huge bonus. It's never crazy crowded, as in people elbowing you to get closer to their desired shoe. It's a shoe, people, not a bar of gold. Like all DSWs, the prices are inexpensive for what you get. The staff is friendly, and there is always someone walking around to answer questions. Selection for women can be overwhelming, taking up most of the store. I came here the last time to get a pair of men's shoes, and I was a little disappointed. But hey, I'm a woman, so I can't complain to much that we take up most of the store. We are their biggest customers!

37.description: I wouldn't love shoe shopping as much if it weren't for DSW. The boots are my fave and I have a $40/off coupon in my wallet now that whispers "redeem me" every single day. I better get over there soon before it expires! I always seem to want the boots that they don't have in my size and have to call around the city looking my size and color. But so far my crazy quests have never gone unwarranted!  I even went so far once as to call a store in San Antonio where my parents live to get a pair of Zigo Soho boots I wanted so desperately. Ended up costing me almost $200 bucks to get them but hey I got em'!! $150 for the boots, $30 for the damn wire to send the money to my mom! The lengths I will go in order to get what I want...I'm spoiled, so shoot me already...

0.description: SHOE IN DEALThis place has great deals. I love my Kenneth Cole shoes but hate paying $300 for a pair. I can always find a pair of KC shoes here between $95 and $135. Kenneth Cole shoes rock. It is the only pair of shoe I can buy, wear them at a trade show for 16 hours and my feet don't hurt. I have no idea what KC does but his shoes fit me perfectly. I do get a lot of use out of these shoes. My old Greek shoemaker is always fixing things after they break. Once he rebuilt the whole sole and heel for $25. It was like getting a new pair of KC shoes again. He rocks!The back wall at DSW has great sales. So I recommend you check it out. There are some bad shoes here and may be worth a good laugh but every once in a while I find that hidden gem for an additional 40% off original price. DSW has a huge selection of shoes for me. I love how everything is on the floor. Go to Nordstroms and you ask for one shoe and the sales guy is trained to bring out 4 different similar pairs. It's annoying. They call it "4 on the floor" and it's a ploy to get you to spend more money. At DSW I only have to try on the shoes I want. If there is no size 12, I just move on to the next shoe I like. Self service has its advantages. The Men's selection is huge and the Women's is even larger but I don't have to shop over on that side. I will have to approve a few selections if my wife finds something she likes. Make sure you join the club here for coupons or extra discounts. They have validated free parking, so do not forget to bring your ticket in. You will get 1.5 hours for free, so that is plenty of time to try on shoes. So Shoe up my friend because there are deals to be had in the aisles here!

38.description: I feel like shoe shopping is an entirely different experience for a man. I went to this DSW on a whim, after looking around for a new pair of everyday shoes. I walked in and was psyched because the store is big, and the men's section wasn't just shoved off in the corner. Although there is a very large quantity of men's shoes, don't be fooled into thinking you will find a good variety. There was a good spread of dress shoes, but if you are looking for a more practical or comfortable shoe, I would suggest going to a different store, even a different DSW. A lot of the shoes I tried on from popular brands (New Balance, Puma, Saucony, etc) were cheap, flimsy, and overpriced. For most of the other brands, I did not see any size over 11 1/2 stocked. Though I might be a freak for having big feet, I expect a store that calls itself a shoe warehouse to carry larger sizes. The clearance/sale aisle didn't have much to offer either. A few gaudy looking shoes with not much of a markdown. I was bummed because this store didn't have one pair of shoes that I was interested in, or could even fit in. For dudes with a size 12 and up looking for a comfortable shoe, don't bother coming here. I am not trying to get down on DSW on the whole, I went to a DSW while I was out in the suburbs and had a completely different time. I found a great pair of size 13 shoes, marked down 40%, withing 5 minutes of walking in.

51.description: Uh-oh.  So a Whole Foods, World Market and DSW are all located within walking distance of my new apartment and in the same complex?  I'm in trouble.  I haven't been to a DSW for a while, but I'm a fan because of there good selection of cute non-leather shoe options.  Past few years I've been ordering shoes online, which has been hit or miss.  Trouble is when I see the shoes in person I want them more!

27.description: So here's the thing: the last time I was in here, I felt like a bit of an asshole because I kept boots (Brown Boot Search 2010) a little too long after the receipt expired.  They were awesome in letting me return the boots and giving me a merchandise credit for the price paid (woo!).  Awesome customer service.Now the bad news... wait, there is no bad news.  You're surrounded by shoes, glorious shoes.  (That crying sound you hear is my wallet.)Oh, and the music always kicks ass.

32.description: It's wedding/bachelorette party season for me.  And I'm clearly notorious for procrastinating in packing, buying dresses, shoes, etc.  So, thank the Lord for DSW!  I was worried about the dress I bought for a friend's wedding.  After all, it was black..and my mom always yelled at me when I wanted to wear black to a wedding.  She'd ask if I was going to a funeral.  Yup.  WIth her words in mind, I set off to DSW after work, in hopes of finding an amazing pair of non-black shoes.  Even though the sale section isn't as big as the one on Clark or even in Glenview, this store is waaaaay less crowded than the other two so you don't have to fight your way through people.  Plus, there's tons of mirrors so you can model the shoes at every possible angle you can think of - without feeling bad that you're hogging the mirror.  After looking for about 20 min, I finally found a pair of red, t-strapped heels.  Beautiful.  And would perfectly complement the dress, I thought.  At 40% off, the shoes came out to only be 45 bucks!  Steal!  FYI ya'll - This DSW is located in the same complex as Whole Foods, World Market, LA Fitness...so you can get your parking validated (first 90 min free!)  Entering off Taylor is alot easier than fighting the traffic on Roosevelt.  Ahhh, love South Loop.

54.description: I had a few problems finding the store, but once I did I loved it. The store is huge and has an amazing selection of boots, which is what I was looking for. Just for kicks, I decided to look at the clearance racks, and I was walking to the back of the store, I noticed there weren't a bunch of racks bunched together. It appeared to be in a back room, which isn't uncommon. Except their back room is about half the size of the main area and they have an amazing selection. Love it!

48.description: I'm a huge DSW fan but the crowds at the Lakeview location really get to me. It's difficult navigating through the aisles and just never the most pleasant of shopping experiences. I was on a boot mission so I thought I'd give the Canal St. location a try. Even though I didn't find what I was looking for, I actually ENJOYED browsing the merchandise. It's sort of hard to explain, but the orientation of the aisles is different than the Lakeview DSW: they're horizontal, so you sort of leisurely snake your way to the back of the store (and clearance room)... as opposed to the vertical aisles in Lakeview where you have to walk to the back of the store, then to the front, then to the back, over and over, if you are browsing. Obviously the design is based on space efficiency but I'll tell ya, it makes a huge difference. In terms of quantity/selection, Canal St. has a much wider range than other DSW locations. It's a large space, and you won't feel like other shoppers are breathing down your back. And it's located in a mall (Southgate Market) with a Whole Foods, World Market, Office Depot, Panera, so you can run a few errands and grab a snack while you're there. Suburbia lite!

44.description: This store is okay.  I really like DSW as a chain, but this one is not as easy to navigate as the one on the north side.I love the DSW rewards program though!  And I can find really nice shoes for a fraction of their normal price.  I just get frustrated being in this particular store for too long.

24.description: I may need a DSW 12-step program. The prices are so low, you can easily spend a few hours here self debating and asking yourself... Do I really need to buy six pairs of shoes today?There is such a wide range of shoes here - mostly brands you might find at Macy's. I bought a really cute pair of espadrilles in February. Win. I would pass on their bags and accessories as you can smell the pleather from across the store.

7.description: ~ Football Field Full O' Footwear ~Walking into this DSW is like walking onto Soldier Field or, say, the pitch at Old Trafford and finding rows and rows of shoes for your shopping perusal.  You'll walk up one aisle looking one way and then down the same aisle looking the other way checking out the discounted kicks.  Meanwhile, the dance music will be pretty much blaring, and you'll have to dodge the people boogeying to the beat in the aisles.  Disco Shoe Warehouse.  Like others have indicated, DSW is mostly for women, but they do have approximately, from my estimate, 250 different shoes available for men, ranging from athletic to casual to dress to those gross things wherein your toes are exposed that will remain unnamed.  Ew.  I've stopped in a few times to shop at this DSW.  The first time I was able to buy a pair of shoes to wear over at the Gulag - think ugly but functional.  Those shoes will be enshrined in the Gulag Hall of Fame when I'm cast off into exile in the next few weeks.  The second time I was looking for some casuals and athletic shoes but came up empty.  I remember liking three or four pairs of shoes at my first visit, but I couldn't find a thing at my second visit.  Picky boy.  If you're not as picky as I am, you'll probably make out alright and find something.Disco Shoe Warehouse: it's great for exercise, good for getting down and dangerous on the dance floor and just okay for picking up a new pair of shoes.  Three stars.

49.description: When you enter a shoe warehouse there are a couple things you have to give yourself over to.  Mind-numbing rows of shoes you can't really afford, annoying shoppers that walk alongside you at the exact same pace, shopping in a "warehouse."  This DSW...no different.I usually shop at the one in Lakeview because of convenience but I went to this store to see if they had more selection because I needed a specific size...nope.  STRUCK. OUT.  And after I put all my hope in these other reviews that talked about better selection.  Who knew that the Lakeview and Canal St. stores stock completely different shoes.  Good to know for next time...not helpful this time.Service was okay.  Location is bustling.  I did appreciate the validated parking.  THAT was a nice surprise.I'll stay in Lakeview for now...nothing super spectacular to see here.

40.description: Okay, lets start out by admitting that I HATE shopping for shoes because I have square feet.  Yes, just like Fred Flintstone, squares, as wide as they are long.  Shopping for shoes is the bane of my existence and if shoes weren't required for me to function in society, well, they would not be part of my existence, because, I have square feet.Aside from feeling tortured from the moment I walk in, I take comfort knowing that DSW carries most of the brands that cater to people like me.  They certainly have the most up to date styles and certainly at really good prices, but alas, I essentially have to comb every style in every aisle to find that elusive W width size.  The upside is that I often find several pairs that actually fit, the downside is that I find thousands that don't.  I wish they would just have a wide width section so I don't have to feel all self conscious and dejected each time I see awesome shoes the likes of me can never wear.This store is elusive as well, located on the top floor of an oddly located mall, it took me two or three trips to actually locate said store!  Thank god for Maggie R and Penny S for setting me straight so I could locate.The store is really clean and well organized.  Maybe too organized?  I spent two hours on my search for a few pairs and set them down on the bench behind me while I tried on some gorgeous suede boots only to have them swooped up by the overzealous shoe organizing clerk.  Damn her.  When she offered to help me several minutes later she couldn't understand my fury.  "Oh, just go grab them back from where you got them".....really, its been seven or eight aisles since then.  I am tired and I am now defeated.There is free parking with validation and there is plentiful parking at this location.  Their sale section is bigger than most shoe departments.  I would highly recommend this to anyone who has regular shaped feet.  Anyone needing a W, kindly avoid.  Those are mine!

53.description: This is by far the best DSW I have ever been to.  Maybe it was just a good shopping day, but all I know is that I got the cutest pair of Betsey Johnson shoes for $38.00.  Yep - crazy - I'm still in shock.The clearance room in the back is huge, and I'm loving all the sales and deals - I even like the layout of the store, and the employees were all very friendly.Compared to the DSW on Clark, this is the place to be - it is so much better, less crowded and they have more sizes -  this is my new shoe shopping destination.

30.description: Someone please save me from myself.

46.description: It amazes me when I visit a place and they remember me. I have purchased many pairs of shoes from here at incredible prices! Finding a great deal can be a hit or miss, but if you have the time look carefully and always check out the clearance isle where all the shoes are organized by shoe size ( I have a small foot and I think my section consists of 1 rack) The staff is extremely helpful and courteous. Make sure to visit THIS DSW not the one on Halsted  and Clark, because it's bigger and  easier to browse through.

1.description: I consistently have pretty good luck with this location.  Today, we scored a pair of burgundy Puma Sneakers for hubby...originally was $60...paid $34.92 after tax!

55.description: Eff the one around where I live (up north). This one is so much better. My reasoning behind this is simple: the Lakeview DSW attracts a very fashion-savvy clientele who, to me, are actually the equivalent of clearance rack VULTURES. Yeah, I said it!While the Lakeview DSW men's clearance racks are loaded with Rocket Dogs and ugly-as-sin Diesel shoes (not to mention every white trash teenager's favorite, SKETCHERS!) the DSW in Southcenter is completely different!First of all, the selection isn't shitty; I was able to purchase two nice looking, well-fitting pairs of shoes from two of my favorite brands at a price that I felt super good about (it felt like a 2-for-1 deal). Secondly, the staff IS indeed competent. One more thing to mention is how the store had probably the best selection of any DSW that I've been to....Canal Street DSW, you're out of the way, but it was totally worth it.

9.description: I like this dsw. Staffs here are very nice and helpful and this place has a lot of shoe selections. Love their clearance rack, I can always score good deals. Make sure to sign up for their rewards program it's free but you can get coupons when you first sign up and build points when you purchase. It's great!

26.description: There's a ton of shoes 2 choose from in this fabulous store! My gf dragged me in here 2 look 4 specific shoes. However, she didnt find them in her size but still got a pair of shoes & 2 cluth purses. Great deals on shoes, especially the clearance ones!

25.description: I'd give it 5 stars, but frankly, this place is dangerous. Well, since it's my own lack of self control that's a problem,  I guess I have to give it 5 stars anyway. What can I say? I am not even a shoe girl. I hate heels and I'd rather be barefoot, but how is it that I always walk out of here with 3 boxes. DSW has an awesome selection. They totally make me wish I could tolerate heels. I am smokin' in heels. I would wear heels if I could convince my feet to not hurt after 3 minutes. Anyway, I digress. DSW. Still tons of cute shoes for non-heeled people like me. They have an adorable selection of flats and a kickass discount section. I am an 8.5 which can be a total bummer as it seems to be the first size to sell out, but just like bad dating, on to the next one!  DSW rocks the seasonal selection. I got 2 pairs of great boots this winter. (actually the same pair in two colors). In the summer, they go crazy with sandals and flip flops. If you need something in particular, chances are, they will have a shoe that works here.PS. They validate parking for 90 minutes.

12.description: DSW is great in the bricks-and-mortar sales, but beware the online site!  My credit card was charged twice for a pair of shoes--I had ordered only one pair!   I wrote to their Customer Service Dept, but I did not receive a response.  So I called the Cust. Svc. phone number and they said that I was charged twice b/c the shoes were (1) ordered and (2) coming from a separate location.  One of the charges is supposed to be cancelled...let's see when that happens.  I shouldn't have to chase a vendor and keep checking up on them like this.Order online at DSW?  Only if you want to spend more time checking than shopping.

21.description: It beats running around to multiple smaller shoe stores. My only complaint is that there are so many heels..stock some loafers please!! Nice patent leather loafers. Lots of people but good prices and easy parking.

17.description: I love DSW as a business, but this location... not so much. The Lakeview location is a lot better, even if it is a little crowded.Pros:HUGESpacious aislesLarge clearance sectionParking validation!Cons:Sales Associates hard to find and unfriendlyClearance section is a bit picked over

10.description: I am a huge shoe lover with a vast collection of shoes.  All my fellow show lovers always recommend DSW. So I bit the bullet and stopped at the Roosevelt and Canal location. I can't buy into the DSW hype.  Does this location have aisles and aisles of shoes? Yes, but that isn't necessarily a good thing. There is not a huge selection of high end shoes.  Moreover, DSW carries a very small selection of specialty sized shoes i.e. narrow widths. I will pass for now.

5.description: I love DSW's Clearance  selection it is nice. It's where I go when I need to buy shoes in the city area. I have to say if the shoes aren't on clearance you pay a pretty penny for them. The employees are nice and I like how it's a huge store you walk and take your time to browse. You gotta understand what type of store they are and not to expect some department store service for shoes.

3.description: Just can't go four stars, but close. DSW is known for carrying a large selection, however much of it seems repetitive. I was looking for some boots, boots that would keep my feet warm, dry and would be easy to get in and out of. With one little other detail, some style. Just because I want practical doesn't mean I want old lady boots. Well the pair I got are all the things I want, but they lean towards that old lady vibe.The shopping experience here is decent, the staff is friendly and for the size of the place it's surprising that on each of my visits I do get asked if I need assistance. I will admit, I'm not into the music they play here, it wouldn't be an issue if they didn't blast it. The other thing on my wish list is that they don't enforce people to wear socks when they try on footwear, not a problem this time of year, but in summer people are trying on shoes barefoot, ick! They do put out the nylon socks that you can slip on, but I've never seen staff point them out to people.Lots of shoes and boots, many with the same theme. Only two pairs of boots that fit the easy waterproof criteria, I wish they had better selection. I know I'm being repetitive, sorry. Anyhow, with the weather being what it is, as I said I bought a pair thinking something is better than nothing. However, I will spend some time looking online to see if I can find something else.

35.description: POOR FEET!  I have been having foot problems and finding it extremely difficult to find shoes I both like and can wear right now.  I HATE SHOE SHOPPING.  first, you tell the salesperson what you want and in what size, then.....you wait.....Oh Shoesalesperson, Shoesalesperson, has anyone seen my shoesalesperson?  Oh there (s)he is, waiting on 6 other people too....I am not patient enough to sit and wait for him/her to return with different shoes than the ones I asked for ("we didn't have your size but I know you will love these......").  I do not have the temperament to politely wait while someone goes to look for my shoes, especially now that so few shoes actually work on my currently compromised feet.  That's why I LOVE DSW.  I see something I like, I look to see if my size is there, and if so, I grab 'em and try 'em on.  And if I like them, I buy them, ALWAYS great prices, much better  prices than on most Internet discount sites (and buying shoes on the Internet NEVER works out). The staff seems helpful enough and no Shoesealesperson to bug you or make you wait or try to talk you into something you don't want.  YAY DSW!

19.description: So here's the thing: the last time I was in here, I felt like a bit of an asshole because I kept boots (Brown Boot Search 2010) a little too long after the receipt expired.  They were awesome in letting me return the boots and giving me a merchandise credit for the price paid (woo!).  Awesome customer service.Now the bad news... wait, there is no bad news.  You're surrounded by shoes, glorious shoes.  (That crying sound you hear is my wallet.)Oh, and the music always kicks ass.

28.description: Love this place for cheap affordable shoes in a gigantic selection.

45.description: I want to love DSW - I really do.  But as a woman with very small feet (size 5 on a good day), this store is impossible.  let me tell you how not fun it is to walk through the aisles looking at the sizes on the boxes instead of at the shoes on top, because I just get disappointed when I look at the shoes on top since they aren't likely to have them in my size.  The only place I ever have any luck is in the clearance room in the back. I've also shopped for my boyfriend's shoes here and their men's department is TINY!  The women's shoes take up at least 75% of the store.

33.description: I love shoes.  My closet is a shrine to my collection....It's a problem, I know.  Fortunately, DSW has great shoes and low prices.The clearance section at this location is gigantic.  At one point, it was separated from the rest of the store by a partial wall.  This used to make it more of a well kept secret but now that it is more open, they have room for more shoes. This location seems to get more big designers and I was impressed to see last seasons Uggs, Kate Spade pumps, and a pair of Stuart Weitzman boots for 80% off of the clearance price.God- is this heaven?!

43.description: Oh how I love shoes!  They are my most favorite items to purchase!  Everytime I walk into this store it's like the clouds open and God sheds his light down upon me granting me a great shopping experience.  This store however, NEVER HAS MY SIZE!!!!!!  sure i am glad that i can now purchase shoes online and get free shipping but it's not like I am big foot.  A size 10 is a perfecly normal size shoe.  Apparently this particular DSW discriminates against me yet I continue to go there for the torture!!!

2.description: When I go to DSW, I go straight for the clearance sale because that's in my price range. The other shoes are discounted compared to fancy boutique, but they are still expensive. This particular DSW clearance selection is smaller than the one in my hometown, so it's difficult to find exactly what you like and what fits you. I did one pair not on sale because I needed it for a wedding and it was cutting close to the date. They didn't have my size in store dithery shipped the shoes to my house without the shipping fees. I appreciated that complementary service.

18.description: I bought a pair of rain boots that had a pretty zipper in the back but when I went to zip them up for a second time it broke. I brought them back and showed them to Becca the manager she told me to pick whatever boots I wanted and she would take care of the cost since they have been getting a ton of returns on that particular boot. None of the ones I liked had my size except for the Tretorn brand and it was 25.00 bucks more. Becca took care of the additional cost for me and I took home some boots to slosh around in this Chicago weather...talk about customer service.

41.description: DSW can be such a tease, can't she? The mighty siren draws you in, promising surprises and delights for the eyes and wallet... but... sometimes, she also crashes you on the rocks and leaves you cranky.Women, there are so many shoes that if you don't know what you're there for, you could easily spend a day sifting. Men, you get about 10% of the store space devoted to you, so don't get your hopes up. I found exactly what I wanted however, as did my willing companion, and in fact made a note to go back for the same pair in a different color. The shopping complex itself is a nice way to kill an afternoon, but the DSW needs to broaden its selection for some more middle-range heels. It seems all they have are ballet flats and 3-inchers. Pass completely on the accessories. They were more like Payless castoffs, ifyouknowwhatImean.

52.description: ME: "I just wore the cutest shoes around the store for 20 and my feet are killing me! Now I can't decide whether I want to buy the shoes or not. But they're SO cute!"COUNTER KID: "You should always buy shoes for comfort."ME: (What the *&%#@!!) "No, fine sir. You must sacrifice for fashion! Now ring up the shoes!"How in the hell did this kid get a job at a shoe store with that kind of attitude?!Besides him, I mostly liked this new-to-me DSW. It's huge so there are gobs of options, just make sure you block out 2 hours of your time to make it all the way through the store. BEWARE: You only get 90 minutes of parking for free in the garage, so shop fast, ladies! I thought I was going to faint when I saw that the clearance items have their very own room. I felt right at home. Unfortunately they did not have enough of the coded percentage conversion charts in this room or throughout the entire store. I found myself having to wander away from my purse all the time to find this chart. And there are clearance items all over the store, for heaven's sake! And the colors here are different than the colors on Clark Street. Confusing! How many times can I be asked if I am finding everything ok? Enough already!! Leave me alone to shop my shoe therapy in peace. I still love the selection and prices at DSW, so four stars for that.

50.description: I love you DSW and love helping people with normal size feet find shoes here....but alas, you don't carry any size 5's.  :(  Love the new plaza complex you are in though.  It brings a bit of the burbs to the corner of Canal and Roosevelt.

4.description: This place was having MEGA sales when we stopped in here.I really wasnt in the mode to buy anything, but I couldnt resist with all of the selection and sales!They had a TON of shoes...sandals, boots, athletic, heels, wild, etc...everything you could possible need, want or not need but still get.I got something that was originally $70, on sale for $35, on extra sale for $18, had a coupon for $10 off on my account...walked out with it for $8.16!  WHAAAAAA???  Heck yes, I love a good deal!

6.description: My favorite DSW....Big and spacious...the way I like itBy the way, I am a guy that likes to buy shoes

22.description: It's like hit or miss with me at this DSW.  Sometimes I walk the aisles three to four times and find absolutely nothing.  However, there have been "cha-ching" moments.   Just the other day I found a cute pair of leather boot sandals for just $20!  (they had the purple tag--translation--70% off.... I do not like to buy shoes full price because I love shoes and I can't break the bank, so this was definitely a "cha-ching" moment.  On a side note - The only time I pay full price is for my gym shoes from Feet Fleet, however, I found my Brooks (from last season) for half the price at DSW.

15.description: This location is always a mess! I've been completely ignored the couple of times that I've been here. There have been times when an employee has asked if I needed anything and then disappeared. While I was by the register looking at items, an employee asked me if I had a birthday coming up soon. I said yes and they had me sign up for a birthday coupon (They told me it would be a $10 coupon. I never received anything.). They didn't explain that it was the rewards program or how it worked. Now I'm stuck getting all the mail and email that I didn't even want.

57.description: The new location is so great!  I found three pairs of awesome (and cheap) shoes in about 25 minutes.  The clearance section is absolutely huge and i actually ended up buying a pair from that section which RARELY happens.  The staff was actually pretty competent as well.  We'll see if that lasts.  :)The only thing that could eventually be a drawback is the parking may stop being free at this complex.  I saw the pay gates installed and the ticket machines ready to be activated....so go quickly before you have to pay!

20.description: I've been in this store a million times, and every time I leave satisfied. However, the last visit was the day of my bachelorette party and I was a wreck. I had no shoes, but an idea of which dress I wanted to wear. As usual, a saleswoman came up to me and asked if she could help. I actually said yes for once, and Doris, this sweet short gorgeous woman went up to the task. Funny, found lots of options, knew the budget. I couldn't beleive it I got my own personal shopper that day. She was just amazing and I really wanted to make sure DSW knows they have a winner! I told her my heel limits, and she went above and beyond. I really couldn't have left happier. Thank yoU!

36.description: Though I literally just wrote a review for DSW a few days ago, I was there again last night and am compelled to knock it down a notch to 3 stars.  There always seems to be too few people working the registers.  Last night's out of control line reminded me of the one thing about this place that I don't like...  You'll find great shoes at great prices, but be prepared to wait in a long line...

14.description: My love for DSW knows no bounds. I never thought I was a "shoe" person, until DSW came into my life. So DSW, as whole, gets 5++++ stars.This particular location, however, makes me hyperventilate a bit. So. many. people. Clearance section so claustrophobic. Parking garage = accident waiting to happen. The store is quite large and well-organized. As a big-footed woman (size 10), I've never really had issues finding my shoe size, but damn--I strike out ALL THE TIME here. Plenty of smaller sizes--6s, 7s, but every cute shoe I saw was devoid of larger sizes. Is this were all the big-footed women shop or something!?The store is about 75-80% women's shoes. Sorry boys. And the clearance section is rather small (at least, again, for the larger sizes). They will validate your parking for up to 90-mins. While that's nice, my shoe-shopping trips rarely take less than 2 hours. And the extremely long check-out lines here don't help. So DSW, while I love you and can't bear to give you less than 3 stars, this location is not one of my favorites.

58.description: Nice and clean for as old and busy as this place is. Enjoyed a stuffed cabbage with steamed spinach and boiled potato on the side. I went "old school" instead of a corned beef sandwich which looked delicious BTW.If you can find on the street parking it is definitely worth the visit.  And bring a good appetite because the portions are generous!

56.description: Great sandwiches!Anything you can think of for lunch they have it all! Corn beef and potato pancake is a must!!

29.description: I just had the knish, as well as pastrami and corned beef.  All I can say is EXCELLENT!!!!!!!!

42.description: One of the best Corned beef sandwiches in the city. I would order a half sandwich next time. The portions are huge!

23.description: There is only GOOD that can be said about Manny's. Food, service, staff, atmosphere...it's part of Chicago at it finest. Corned beef, pastrami, potato pancakes, soups...Oh Hell, the list goes on and on. I could eat there seven days a week and maybe someday I will.

47.description: The food at Mannys is good. Not very good not great or fantastic but good. However, if you do go there be make sure you have at least two $20 is your pocket because you will easily put both of them to use. I've been here several times but will never go back. Their prices are offensive

8.description: Greatest Deli 5 star Soup to CornedBeef Cut as you wish & Best Potato cakes in history . This place is Hugh & the food is Hugh & the Flavor is Hugh.   Highly Recommended !

31.description: This was the first place we dined in after our first day in our new city! The service was fantastic. The gentlemen allowed us to try a couple of meats before choosing our sandwiches. They were informative, funny and very customer friendly. The food was so freaking good and large portions that we packed two halves for dinner. Totally worth the money!!!

34.description: Love the location. And the corn beef sandwiches. It was enough beef on the sandwich for two people. Went in the week thought it was going to be crowbars but it's big enough I still found a sit. It has parking in the back but I feel it's not big enough for parking then the inside of the restaurant...need bigger parking lot to match the size of the restaurant

16.description: Huge portions and tender corn beef! If you are a first timer, it is cafeteria style. Grab a tray and ask for what you want. The lady will ring up your order, give you a receipt and you pay in the front after you eat.

13.description: Seriously, the best darned corned beef around.  The pastrami is fantastic too - and the potato pancake... yum (especially with applesauce!).  Kugel is really great, and a tasty knish as well.  Can't go wrong with all the Jewish classics here!Gino is the perfect example of service with a smile, and Manny's is always my first stop after flying into Chicago.  Apple slice is a slice of perfection too. ;)

11.description: We came here on the way home from a visit to the Museum of Science and Industry with the family after years of wanting to visit (and never quite making it!).  The star of the show was the beef and potato knish...but also loved the potato pancake and turkey sandwich.  My matzo ball soup was a bit bland.Plus, they had a magician roaming around, which was a nice treat for the whole family.Easy parking.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Will return!

39.description: Great diner and food. The type of place you run into people you know. Love that there is parking out back!

37.description: Delicious! The portions are huge so I did the half sandwich half soup and was thankful I did. I got the roast beef sandwich on an onion roll and a matzo ball soup. Thank roast beef was incredible. I wish I had taken a bunch to go to have later. The soup had a giant soft matzo ball and was amazing too. The group I went with all had a mix between the beef stew, pastrami sandwich and the corned beef sandwich. All raving about each of their choices. This is a great place groups and kids too! Cant wait to come back!

0.description: First time walking in this place and we were greeted by a friendly welcoming smile and a huge selection of delicious looking food.  The prices were reasonable and the food was fresh. The setting is very traditional looking, cafeteria style which was cool.My girlfriend and I shared a pastrami sandwich, potato pancake, and a knish. Everything was delicious except by personal preference the pastrami is a little too fatty for my taste but I understand this is how it's supposed to be. I did get a small sample of the beef brisket and it was very good, definitely on my list for next time along with some beef stew, which looked amazing. On a side note, a person there who appeared to have been part of management/ownership made us feel rather awkward as he promptly walked up to the front counter when he heard us talking to the gentlemen who take the orders and just stood there watching and then once we were at the exit paying, he  rushed to the register - he gave the impression that he was verifying we paid full price?  Other than that awkwardness caused by the gentleman, we enjoyed Manny's and plan on returning soon. If he reads my review, he may learn that body language can tell you a lot about a person.

38.description: Best pastrami sandwich in town! Make sure you get the potato pancake and pickle, makes for a great combo!

51.description: I'm sitting in California 2000 miles from Manny's and am salivating! Got a trip to Chicago planned later this year and Pizzaria Due and Manny's are the only two eateries on my short list. Working in outside sales many years ago in my youth, I fit these two fine eating establishments into my schedule just as often as I could.  Haven't been to Manny's in several years and visiting their website gave me hunger pangs for a Reuben and pickle. Only plan on one lunch there and a dinner at Uno's then will be eating salads for the rest of the stay. Damn! Gotta keep my doc happy (satisfied) with the cholesterol count. One meal at either Manny's or Uno's is a week's worth of fat and calories but worth all subsequent sacrafice.

27.description: So we ventured to Mannys to give it a go. We expected overpriced.  What we hoped for was an "experience" as well. Atmosphere:  dingy. dismal. drab.  This place clearly turns a profit at these price points  in a building located where it is and yet they can't replace water stained ceiling tiles? Condiments on the table were icky to touch... It's just an unattractive setting period.  Nothing retro or cozy or cool about this place imho. But you'll easily pay $45 for 2 whole sandwiches and 2 drinks. Service:  What service?  Unless the guys behind the counter repeating the same question to you in terse tone (because apparently you are not moving fast enough for them)  they throw together a couple slices of bread and stack of cooked meat and give you a plastic side of thousand island dressing and a pickle all so you can put it together yourself.I didn't feel like tried to be helpful at all..  It's all about the turn and burn here. Food:  They are getting 2 stars for the corned beef and the pastrami.  (the meat itself) Yes,  they give you decent portions. But a sandwich I have to assemble for $15+ better be piping hot cheese melted on it.. (it wasn't)  and put together, evenly toasted. (because it was a Reuben sandwich after all.. ( no sauerkraut either)  Nope, no time for that here. Neither the potato pancake nor the matzo ball soup were anything  special to me. I've had better of both  in just about every deli I've ever gone to.  I would not say that these deli type meats are any better here than any other decent deli. The desserts?  I was thinking they would have some pretty cool pies, and lots of choices.. boy was I wrong.  Sad sad desserts they just looked unappealing.. I decided against ordering any. So we "tic'd" that box  never again. Can't remotely recommend.

32.description: Hmmm . . . where'd my previous review go?? I was eating my corned beef sandwich for two days. Great place! A bit expensive, but worth it. Generous portions. I will be back!

54.description: Ok. I did not have a typical deli sandwich, although the pastrami looked delicious. I really wanted some bread pudding so I had that and a BLT. For the newbies, they have free valet and free parking in the rear. You walk in order your food,  get a ticket, eat, then pay.The BLT was not near to average for a deli. I think they use miracle whip and called it mayo. It was too sweet. The lettuce had a taste, even though it was from the head. Maybe the head was a little aged. The bacon was good, very crisp. The bread pudding was underwhelming. It was served cold and very eggy. You can play the lotto inside.

48.description: If you want a HUGE sandwich this is the place.  We make the long drive every few weeks just for their corned beef.  When you get what you pay for it's all worth it. Take a look at the pictures on their website it will show you how gigantic these sandwiches really are.

44.description: I was first blessed by this establishment in 2001 when I first moved to Evanston to attend college. It has been my favorite deli since then.Pastrami and corned beef on an onion roll with a potato latke and side of applesauce is where its at!This has been my only sandwich choice since 2001. I have always wanted to try other menu items but my god that sandwich is so damned good I just cannot bring myself to eating anything else. I did in the last year branch out to a side of mac n cheese and it too is amazing. Creamy, cheesy hot and delicious!Lets talk about portions because this plate is expensive compared to what you can get elsewhere but again lets think about what your getting and the quality is second to none!Picture a 9 inch dinner plate that is smothered in food. The sandwich and meat falling off the bun nearly covers the whole plate. Unless your stomach is a bottomless pit like mine many people will get 2 meals out of one purchase. I myself on the other hand if I could afford it would sit there and eat until I looked like the guy from the movie Se7en that ate himself to death on spaghetti. Manny's sandwiches triggers the most sinfully gluttonous response deep within my soul. I can simply never eat enough.If I were sitting on death row I would order 10 of these sandwiches and save the state the cost of the injetction and gladly eat myself to death.

24.description: Best corned beef in Chicago. Heck, the best this side of NYC. And I dream about their latkes.

7.description: A classic place with a classic reputation!Let me just say if you like both pastrami and corned beef, get the half and half sandwich. The pastrami has the most flavor, but the corned beef is really good. The guys that work here can give you recommendations on the best sandwiches. I tried the german chocolate cake and it was decent..the chocolate cake looked much better though...next time LOL! Definitely an awesome deli which lots of space if you decide to dine in...there is even an event space for huge parties. There is also a parking lot in back if you're driving over.

49.description: Great spot for Saturday morning breakfast. Moved into the neighborhood almost a month ago and started looking for spots to try. Manny's is a winner all the way around. Staff is just friendly as hell. Looks like they've been there for a while. Wish they were open on Sunday's too. Easy to order your food. Lots of seating. Pay the nice cashier on your way out. Gotta stop by for lunch during the week. I'm sure it's great.

40.description: Huge portions and tender corn beef! If you are a first timer, it is cafeteria style. Grab a tray and ask for what you want. The lady will ring up your order, give you a receipt and you pay in the front after you eat.

53.description: What's not to like about Manny's. It's your classic Jewish deli.Corned Beef, Pastrami and Matzo Ball Soup along with a latke.You can't go wrong.

30.description: A classic place with a classic reputation!Let me just say if you like both pastrami and corned beef, get the half and half sandwich. The pastrami has the most flavor, but the corned beef is really good. The guys that work here can give you recommendations on the best sandwiches. I tried the german chocolate cake and it was decent..the chocolate cake looked much better though...next time LOL! Definitely an awesome deli which lots of space if you decide to dine in...there is even an event space for huge parties. There is also a parking lot in back if you're driving over.

46.description: My husband and I went to Manny's for dinner Friday evening.  This is a classic Chicago style dinner.  We ordered the famous corned beef on seedless rye bread, potatoe pancake, and a pickle.  The gentlemen serving the corned beef gave us so much corned beef, we shared the huge sandwich.  The corned beef was hot, fresh, not salty & delicious!!   The service is excellent!!Free parking too, yes FREE parking & this restaurant is downtown.  They also have delicious baked goods, pies, bread & cake.  The huge corned beef sandwich for two & what I mentioned above (the sides) was only $16.00.   Reasonably priced!!I wish I could give more stars!!!

1.description: I love cafeteria style diners and Manny's does to perfection. The best - my boss used to take us here every Thursday in 2008. I quit that job and had forgotten the name. Today we were trying to decide where to go for lunch I told the story of how my boss had taken us to a Jewish cafeteria but just could not remember the name - my Mother-in-Law knew the name but had never been! We will surely be back!Her quote "A magnificent corned beef sandwich. It is hard to believe that I've lived in Chicago most of my life and never been to Manny's. A mistake I will not make again."Manny's is where it's at!

55.description: Maybe I missed it or it was just too hyped but this place was just ok.  I had the pastrami sandwich and soup.  There was nothing special about the pastrami and the soup tastes like miss Grass.  Plus it was $14 for a half sandwich and soup.  Way overpriced.  With so many good offerings in Chicago, skip this place.

9.description: Let's face it. Any establishment in Chicago that has been in business over 20 years and has a steady flow of patrons is an institution. Manny's is on the list and is a great place to get corned beef, hot plates, pastrami,  potato pancakes and Ely's cheesecake. Upon entering, grab a tray and utensils. If you want a sandwich or deli meat, bypass the hot meals which are first. After sliding past the deli items, you will find salad options, fruit, beverages and then dessert. After you have selected items, collect your tab and find an empty table. Once you settle at your table, remove your food items from the tray and a busboy will scoop up your tray. After you are finished eating, grab your check and head to the line to pay your bill. As a side note, this is deli style dining but there is a bit of a premium to enjoy the experience. Most items are a la carte. For example, hot meals like beef stew ($15.95) are not served with rice. Rice is $2.50 extra or $7.95 for a bowl. Pastrami is $14.95 but seriously worth every single penny. You will not find anything better in the area. If you do, message me the info. Enjoy!

26.description: I would eat at Manny's everyday if I could. Best Chicago Deli I have been to in the past 3 years. To top it off, a magician stopped by our table and delighted us with his balloon animal skills. They also had free parking! This restaurant wins from the beginning of the experience to the end.

25.description: Don't get to go often but when I do, I'm never disappointed! From my corned beef sandwich overwhelmed with more meat then I can handle, to the side of potato pancake. It all brings me back to my childhood when my mom and dad brought it home to us. Definitely a place to try if you've never been, well worth the money :)

12.description: Having seen an episode of Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee with Jerry Seinfeld and Steve Harvey, I was very anxious to try this place. Well, it did not disappoint in any way. It's truly an old-school style delicatessen. You walk in, grab a try, and make your way down the line. The corned beef sandwich on rye was out of this world. Piled on high and full of flavor. One unique thing about this place.... you pay on the way out. You get to the end of the food line, cashier gives you a reciept. You go, sit down, eat your food, and then pay on the way out. Interesting to say the least. I'm a fan - and I'll be back soon hopefully!

59.description: Wasn't a very big fan, myself. The food was overpriced and not very good, in my opinion. Some of the friends that I went with loved it! I had a turkey reuben, and it was just okay.

21.description: Mannys is the BEST by far! The Pastrami is the best on the planet! Great food, great service, friendly atmosphere!

17.description: We get this catered at our work quite often and I have also been here multiple times. I have had the pastrami, corned beef, roast beef and tongue sandwich and they are all great.  I think my favorite was actually a half half pastrami/corned beef on rye.  The soups are also very tasty, especially the kreplach soup. My favorite deli sandwich is a hot pastrami and although this one is great,  I have definitely had better.  Overall this is a great place to go to and the free valet is a huge plus.

10.description: If you need a home cooked belly warming meal while your here in the city this is place to come! Relatively unchanged for years and years this place is an institution! A staple in the fabric of this city! Who knows how many political deals were made over a corned beef and pastrami sandwich! Manny's don't ever change!

5.description: This place is one of my favorite places. Love it!

3.description: Manny's is a landmark n Chicago that I've come to admire as one of my personal favorite delis. Renowned for their corned beef, Reuben sandwiches, and generous portions, I always looking forward to coming here most when I return to the Windy City. It had been a while, but I was satisfied to see that nothing had changed. Still the same cafeteria set up and same dining room. This place can get crazy packed when the lunch hour hits, so just be prepared. The range of essential deli food is what gets my attention. You can't order Liver & Onions, Fried Smelts or Tongue & Mushrooms many places these days, and they also serve great unique delicatessen items like latkes or chicken soup with kreplachs. Overall, I would say the food selection, portion sizes, and quick service are what make this place special. The waiters are very professional and attentive, which is unusual for these venues. The only downer was the cost. I didn't recall Manny's being such a pricey eating joint, but over the years, it has gained quite a bit of popularity, so why not take advantage of it? For the appetite that I bring, it's still worth the money.

35.description: Let's face it. Any establishment in Chicago that has been in business over 20 years and has a steady flow of patrons is an institution. Manny's is on the list and is a great place to get corned beef, hot plates, pastrami,  potato pancakes and Ely's cheesecake. Upon entering, grab a tray and utensils. If you want a sandwich or deli meat, bypass the hot meals which are first. After sliding past the deli items, you will find salad options, fruit, beverages and then dessert. After you have selected items, collect your tab and find an empty table. Once you settle at your table, remove your food items from the tray and a busboy will scoop up your tray. After you are finished eating, grab your check and head to the line to pay your bill. As a side note, this is deli style dining but there is a bit of a premium to enjoy the experience. Most items are a la carte. For example, hot meals like beef stew ($15.95) are not served with rice. Rice is $2.50 extra or $7.95 for a bowl. Pastrami is $14.95 but seriously worth every single penny. You will not find anything better in the area. If you do, message me the info. Enjoy!

19.description: Hmmm . . . where'd my previous review go?? I was eating my corned beef sandwich for two days. Great place! A bit expensive, but worth it. Generous portions. I will be back!

28.description: Every time I go back to Chicago, I make it a point to come back here! One of my favorites places and although everything looks so good, I always get the same thing. 1/2 pastrami on challah (who wants rye when you can have challah!), matzo ball soup and a potato pancake. It can be a little overwhelming the first time but grab a tray/utensils, go to the area of food that you want and then you pay at the end with the receipt they give you. This place is an institution so EAT HERE!

45.description: This place is classic. If you're a regular, you don't need to read this review. If you're a first-timer, here's how it works: Manny's is really 3 restaurants in one plus a bakery, set up cafeteria style. First, stop on your way in to read the sign showing the day's specials, then pick up tray and utensils and join the line. The first station is a steam table with entrees and sides. Beyond that is the deli--so if you're hankering for a foot-tall sandwich, skip the front and move half-way down to the deli station. Your sandwich will be hand made, and adorned with pickle or potato pancake if you wish. In between, you can pick up soup--from matzoh ball (highly recommended) to borscht (ditto) to navy bean, they are all delicious. Beyond the deli is the never busy salad section (too healthy for most), where someone will make your salad, or you can pick up sides like cole slaw or bean salad. Want a scoop of chopped liver (and who doesn't?), get it here. At the very end of the line, beverages, and after the 90 degree left turn, desserts. Don't reach for your wallet now--the mock cashier will give you a check, but you don't pay until you are ready to leave, in front. There you will find packaged baked goods to take home and continue noshing. Got all that? What could be simpler. The food can be pretty good. To eat well, order smart. Some items dry out on a steam table, like chicken or fish, others get better as they continue to slowly cook, like stews or beef short ribs. Order the latter. Can't go wrong with the deli, and even the turkey pastrami has its place in your sandwich. The sweet noodle kugel is the best ever! I am NOT a fan of the potato pancakes--the ones here are gummy hockey pucks. I prefer latkes that are light, crispy and just fried; the ones here are lukewarm, heavy, and ancient. For dessert I often indulge in a frosted apple slice--where can you get those anymore?I'll make a long story short: Long live Manny's!

33.description: I had the BBQ Beef and OMG it was delicious. Had the meat with Mashed Potato and Gravy. It hit the spot. I usually come here for the Corned Beef Sandwich with potato pancakes. You can never go wrong with this place.

43.description: Manny's, Manny's, Manny's is a Chicago staple, and the food is great!! I get a Pastrami sandwich everytime. There are other things that I get, like the a Sweet Macaroni!! I don't know how they do that!!!... But it is AWESOME!!! I look forward to Manny's EVERYTIME I sit down to dine. Kinda get the feeling like I'm sitting down at a relatives dining area everytime I go there.

2.description: I don't know about Barack and Michelle, but when Harry met Sally, I'm sure she was screaming hardcore over some of the food at their deli. Obama loves this place, and I have to agree- it's got downright personality and good food to really make you feel like you're a true Chicago local.My friend and I came here after having to work a holiday to get our minds back on vacation mode. The setup was overwhelming at first- with all the food lying out and tons of cafeteria trays waiting for you to grab. It felt so much like a dining hall here, which wasn't particularly my cup of tea. But hey, it's all about the food right?She ordered the corned beef on rye with potato pancake. I got the white fish with scalloped potatoes and veggies. We both ordered the matzo ball soup, which was everything we wanted and more. My fish was on the bland side, probably because it was sitting out there for so long. However, the soup made everything worthwhile. I would come back just to order this!Corned beef is always a plus, so make like my friend and make sure you get their staple. Service here was friendly and fun, and I am interested to come back to see this so-called magic show. Who knows. Maybe Obama will be back the next time I visit!

18.description: First visit (don't know how that could be) will absolutely not be my last.  Hot Pastrami, potato pancake, beef and potato knish .... wholly goodness.  Went on a Saturday and caught the magician, my kids loved that.

41.description: Happiness.  Total happiness. Sometimes when I am cornered by meat in all directions, I have to evaluate how I got myself into that situation. Not here. It was a euphoric  sandwich/soup/ coleslaw/ potato pancake/pickle experience.  Food: Yum yum tasty.  Atmosphere: Comfortable,  great people watching.*I noticed there was a magician making rounds at tables. I just wish he would have made it to ours.  I love tricks.

52.description: Manny's is the real deal!!!!  The potato pancakes are great, so is the corned beef, etc., etc...  I've been going there for close to 30 years.  Some things have changed, and it is for the better.  They're open until 8pm now, they take credit card and they serve beer!  (O:  If you go during the week there's a good chance you'll see various Chicago "political royalty" while you're in there...... so you may need to take a shower to clean the slime off after lunch!  :O)

50.description: Solid Diner Food, helpful waitstaff. Classic diner ambiance.

4.description: Manny's! Oh boy. Everything inside of me really wanted to enjoy this historic Chicago deli. I mean, they've been around since 1942, a true Chicago family doing their thing.  Yellow lighting and an erie buzzing sound fill the room. You're instantly reminded of your Chicago Public School cafeteria in the most disturbing ways possible. All food in this harsh manufactured lighting looks rather distasteful.  I guess it's nice that they pile on 5 pounds of roast beef per sandwich, but it doesn't quite pair well with their Costco-level rye bread. 5 stars based strictly on the history/famiy business aspect.

6.description: Every time I go back to Chicago, I make it a point to come back here! One of my favorites places and although everything looks so good, I always get the same thing. 1/2 pastrami on challah (who wants rye when you can have challah!), matzo ball soup and a potato pancake. It can be a little overwhelming the first time but grab a tray/utensils, go to the area of food that you want and then you pay at the end with the receipt they give you. This place is an institution so EAT HERE!

22.description: Greatest Deli 5 star Soup to CornedBeef Cut as you wish & Best Potato cakes in history . This place is Hugh & the food is Hugh & the Flavor is Hugh.   Highly Recommended !

15.description: Happiness.  Total happiness. Sometimes when I am cornered by meat in all directions, I have to evaluate how I got myself into that situation. Not here. It was a euphoric  sandwich/soup/ coleslaw/ potato pancake/pickle experience.  Food: Yum yum tasty.  Atmosphere: Comfortable,  great people watching.*I noticed there was a magician making rounds at tables. I just wish he would have made it to ours.  I love tricks.

57.description: My 'go to' spot, for sure ! The best old school comfort food I know of. A true, classic, deli. Headed up by my man Gino Gamboretta, resident corn beef slicer extrordinare. A meat emporium of favor/taste. Enormous portions. Ironically, for a decidedly 1940's decor, a place to see and be seen, particularly for the political set (Think Presidents, Governors, Mayors & well connected/known deal makers). Not for your diet, although the salads are awesome.

20.description: As someone who gave up meat for 6 years, the corned beef was greatly missed!  There are plenty of choices for the vegetarian or carnivorous taste but do not pass on the potato pancake!
