I've been visiting Gino with my family since I was a little girl and I love that he still remembers me each time!

36.description: This place is ok if you like large portions of bland food.  My dad and I agreed that are meals were bland.  He had beef stew and I had spaghetti and meatballs.  This cost 42 dollars.  I think they double charged us.  Watch your bill carefully.

14.description: This place is classic. If you're a regular, you don't need to read this review. If you're a first-timer, here's how it works: Manny's is really 3 restaurants in one plus a bakery, set up cafeteria style. First, stop on your way in to read the sign showing the day's specials, then pick up tray and utensils and join the line. The first station is a steam table with entrees and sides. Beyond that is the deli--so if you're hankering for a foot-tall sandwich, skip the front and move half-way down to the deli station. Your sandwich will be hand made, and adorned with pickle or potato pancake if you wish. In between, you can pick up soup--from matzoh ball (highly recommended) to borscht (ditto) to navy bean, they are all delicious. Beyond the deli is the never busy salad section (too healthy for most), where someone will make your salad, or you can pick up sides like cole slaw or bean salad. Want a scoop of chopped liver (and who doesn't?), get it here. At the very end of the line, beverages, and after the 90 degree left turn, desserts. Don't reach for your wallet now--the mock cashier will give you a check, but you don't pay until you are ready to leave, in front. There you will find packaged baked goods to take home and continue noshing. Got all that? What could be simpler. The food can be pretty good. To eat well, order smart. Some items dry out on a steam table, like chicken or fish, others get better as they continue to slowly cook, like stews or beef short ribs. Order the latter. Can't go wrong with the deli, and even the turkey pastrami has its place in your sandwich. The sweet noodle kugel is the best ever! I am NOT a fan of the potato pancakes--the ones here are gummy hockey pucks. I prefer latkes that are light, crispy and just fried; the ones here are lukewarm, heavy, and ancient. For dessert I often indulge in a frosted apple slice--where can you get those anymore?I'll make a long story short: Long live Manny's!

58.description: I stopped in to get the Tufano special salad for carry out so I could eat it in class.For $5 you can't get a better salad. It is huge and packed full of artichoke hearts, grilled red peppers, salami, lettuce, and more.I generally don't feel very full if I eat a salad as my main meal unless it has a lot of meat in it but this salad did the trick.It is not a vegetarian salad since they throw a few cold cuts at the bottom but I'm sure you can order it without them and it would definitely still be filling.

56.description: Meh, this place was just ok. I appreciate the charm. There is no sign for this place and it is pretty difficult to locate. Definitely trying to be a "local gem." However, the food wasn't all that great; just ok. The sausage and peppers were awesome as our appetizer, but my entree, the linguini and clams with white sauce, was too salty. I'm aware clams are salty by nature, but this was a bit overwhelming. I had to order extra Peroni beer to help me deal with it.Further, the service leaves you with something to be desired. They make you pay $5 for valet parking, or else you'll get a $70 parking ticket in the neighborhood's permited streets. Our server was absent throughout most of our meal. When I asked for a menu, she rolled her eyes and told me to look at the chalkboard. I didn't bring my glasses, so it was a pain in the ass for me to read across the room. Once we had ordered, getting the waitress's attention for more beer, extra olive oil, and the bill was nearly impossible. When we stood up and waved to get her attention, surprise surprise: another eye roll! Sorry I'm making you do your job... The place shuts down at 10:30 p.m. Yelp says 11 p.m. They might want to update their Yelp listing, because we began being shooed out and had no clue as to why. Lots of people often consult Yelp for these sorts of matters... I will most likely not return, as there are plenty of better Italian options in the enormous city of Chicago.

29.description: Great family style Italian. Came on vacation and was recommended by a local  Highly recommend.

42.description: Waitress was awesome-food was spectacular....eggplant parm was perfect.  We went in with 5 adults 6 kids, found us a table with plenty of room and relaxes atmosphere.  Calamari app is a must!Great prices for food & wine.The $5 valet was well worth it-no place to park just made it so much easier.

23.description: I had an excellent lunch with my wife and son at Tufanos the other day. All food was great. The filling in the shells were light and not heavy, great for a summer day. The Lemon Chicken was one of the best chicken dishes I have had at any restaurant.I left my Samsung tablet at the table when we left. The waitress turned it in and since I did not come back for it, the staff contacted me about it. That is over and above customer service. Tufanos gets 5 stars for food and customer service.

47.description: Just a great old school Chicago Italian place.  Wonderful food.  Great staff.  The place has been there forever.There are knuckleheads here giving the place one star and complaining about parking and the menu on a chalkboard.  The restaurant is in a RESIDENTIAL NEIGHBORHOOD.  They have VALET PARKING.  Tufano's has ALWAYS been there.  The lack of parking is nothing new.Is looking at the chalkboard so damned difficult?  Do you really need a menu?  Are people incapable of asking the wait staff questions?If you really need a parking lot and a menu, go to an Olive Garden in a mall.

8.description: The ideal family style Italian restaurant in the City. Wonderful food, great service and a reasonable price. Lots of daily specials and everyday favorites. Highly recommended.

31.description: I don't understand the high praise for this place. Food was incredibly mediocre. I ordered the grilled calamari and it came out rubbery with zero flavor (not to mention there was a piece of plastic that had been mixed in the dish). That being said, my family and I sat across from a table of 5 people. One of the people had a neck tattoo of a hebrew word. Us being a bunch of jews, immediately zoned in on the tat to see what it said. We were all totally shocked because it looked like the word for prostitute. Maybe 30 minutes later when the woman stood up, my mom tapped her shoulder and asked what her tattoo meant (thinking there was no way in hell a girl would have 'prostitute' branded on her neck). The girl responded that it meant audacious. We all went 'ohhhhhh' and told her that for a second one of the letters made it look like the word 'prostitute.' Her husband was laughing saying "uh oh did I marry a prostitute" and the rest of her table was joking. We paid and left the restaurant only to return 20 minutes later after I realized I forgot my purse. Our waitress, comes outside and starts yelling at us. "WHAT YOU DID WAS UNFORGIVABLE TO THAT GIRL..SHAME ON YOU, YOU AND YOU...SHE WAS AN OUT OF TOWNER..YOU SHOULD HE ASHAMED OF YOURSELVES!! ASHAMED!!" We were all taken a back as the waitress is yelling at us. Long story short: if you want overpriced crappy food and wait staff with sh*ty attitudes..come here.

34.description: Let me be honest. I grew up coming to this place. Before Hawks or Bulls games at the UC my dad and I loved this little hole in the wall. Just good home made Italian food. I took my boyfriend there this past Sunday after a long absence, excited to show him the joint but was so very disappointed. He ordered the fettuccine alfredo with chicken. It was horrible. The sauce had no taste and the pasta was way overcooked. Not saying I'm the best chef or anything but I know my way around the kitchen and especially around Italian food. But fine it was one dish, we told our server, they took it off the bill and remedied the situation. He happily finished my linguini with clams which tasted pretty good. Until later that night. It's been two days after the night we went and I have yet to eat anything other than crackers and ginger ale. He has the same issues. Sad to say we probably won't be going back.

16.description: I never knew this place was so close to UIC! Being a student there we decided to go as a group to see what's it about. The menu is a chalkboard and a bit pricey for my taste. I just opted for the lemon chicken while my friends got some pasta dish. The lemon chicken was delicious! I think it was a half chicken, which was more than enough for me. The lemons were all around and I could add them to my chicken for my liking. The chicken was tender and I liked the potatoes that came on the side as well. Overall, I would go back just for that dish -- as the pasta my friends got didn't look too appealing.

13.description: Great Local place. Bring cash!

11.description: Chicago Institution.  Get the Lemon Chicken.  Get the eggplant.  Bring cash.  One thing I wish they would do is brine their chicken, or get some pastured chicken.  At all Italian restaurants, chicken can be a little dry.

39.description: The kind of place that makes Chicago, Chicago! Authentic, unpretentious staff and food!

37.description: Been eating here over 45 years. Food is great, plain and simple. Homemade Italian at it's best. No frills, just a nice family owned business and great food.

0.description: Excellent Italian food. We went here for a work dinner last month and had appetizers, entrees, and dessert. Everything was wonderful. The service was friendly and made you feel like you're a part of the family. I still daydream about their tiramisu...I was a little surprised by some of the reviews especially saying it was over priced and overly simple. Real Italian food is based on simple flavors from fresh ingredients. As for price, their serving sizes are generous and, in my opinion, worth every penny. Especially for a Chicago restaurant, the prices are more than fair. This isn't the Olive Garden, if you're looking for subpar fake "Italian" food with bottomless bowls, you probably will think the prices are high. If you want a great meal, friendly service, and the best tiramisu in Chicago, check out Tufano's!

38.description: Tufano's is an amazing Chicago find. Just a short trip from the downtown area, it is easy to get to by bus or cab. There is valet parking for $5 if you drive there. If anyone has ever tried to park in downtown Chicago, you know that this is an amazing deal. Normal valet parking costs downtown are about $10-12, and street parking is. Not. Real. (Residential streets require permits to park. This is not a new concept.) There is sometimes a wait if you go for dinner on the weekend, but we have always been seated fairly quickly. Service is always great. The staff are friendly and helpful, and we have never been short on water, drinks, and bread. The menu is written on chalkboards throughout the restaurant, but you don't really need it-- just ask the server or read some of the reviews!Mussels with red sauce- The best thing ever! Forget the mussels, it's all about that sauce. Just spoon up that delicious, garlicky goodness, soak your bread into it, and enter heaven. (Once, they were out of mussels and we nearly cried. We asked for just the sauce and they kindly, wonderfully obliged our odd request. Bless you, Tufano's!)Other things that were good: pasta with vodka sauce, chicken/veal parmesan,  chicken/veal picante, spaghetti with olive oil and garlic, tortellini alfredo. The marinara sauce is a bit on the sweet side for me, but I bet kids would like that.

51.description: Tufano's is awesome! I've been a million times and I appreciate it more and more every time. It's a family owned business hidden near UIC/Little Italy. If you're not paying attention, you'll drive right past it. The servers are very endearing and energetic. Most people know it for the lemon chicken, which is alright, but the best thing to get is the linguine and clams with the red sauce. The ambiance is very charming, especially on warm nights when you can sit out by the fountain. They don't accept anything but cash, but there is an ATM right inside.Additionally, the antipasto salad is fantastic! I'd recommend this place to anyone. It's also a bargain compared to many similar places in Chicago.

27.description: I have been coming her my whole life. It is my favorite restaurant in the city; it just reminds me of my childhood.It is cash only, so be prepared.As for apps, you gotta try the Calamari and the Tufano's Salad. They are classics. The lemon chicken is legendary and worth eating with your hands on your first date good.The eggplant parm is tender just like grandma used to make; I would recommend getting a side of pasta with it.

32.description: Perfect fried calamari, crisp generously sized house salad, excellent service, good wine selection, efficient valet service, sawdust roasted lemon chicken. So overall, pretty good, but as I told our attentive and helpful waitress, I would not serve this bone dry tough bird to guests in my home.  She did offer a substitute, but I couldn't come up with anything I wanted more.  Think my disappointment was magnified because I had roasted lemon chicken just a week ago at Greek Islands on Halsted. Juices pouring out of each piece. Flavor in every bite. A real delight and a tough act to follow.Realistically, every restaurant has an occasional kitchen misstep, so having said that, I'll be back anyway.

54.description: Came by with three friends after the Bears game,  about 4:00 or so. Seated quickly,  service all was fine. Fried calamari was good, and a huge portion. House salad for two was a good suggestion from server as it was plenty for four people. Chicken parmigian was good but not great. Energy in this old-school place was just fine.Two suggestions.  Menu on wall on chalkboard seriously inconvenient.  Having to walk over to it to try to figure out what to eat is not charming. Better notification of the cash only policy is also needed. Hadn't been there in years and had completely forgotten about that.

48.description: I never knew this place was so close to UIC! Being a student there we decided to go as a group to see what's it about. The menu is a chalkboard and a bit pricey for my taste. I just opted for the lemon chicken while my friends got some pasta dish. The lemon chicken was delicious! I think it was a half chicken, which was more than enough for me. The lemons were all around and I could add them to my chicken for my liking. The chicken was tender and I liked the potatoes that came on the side as well. Overall, I would go back just for that dish -- as the pasta my friends got didn't look too appealing.

44.description: Best 'Old Chicago' Italian joint you will find in this town with unbeatable prices. Lovely staff who treat me and my guests like royalty every visit. Meatballs are a must try for the first timer. Five stars all day!!

24.description: So we start with calamari,It was great,then for entrée We ordered the "joes" chicken,and clams linguini in white sauce. Linguini was good but nothing special, and "joes chicken"? Men I can cook that myself! Service was great,ambiance was good and valet parking only for $5 which is not bad at all.Downside was cash n check only.

7.description: Been eating here off and on for over ten years. Consistent quality, always great service. A nice family atmosphere. Yesterday re-visited the Lemon Chicken with Potatoes. It was good, a tad over done, but great flavor. My friend loves the pasta and from what I have had there I think that is where they shine. Valet parking which is nice. Reasonable prices.

49.description: Nice low key, family style, great food.  Have visited many times.  However, they don't have a grip on parking.  So frustrating.  The street is zoned, but they offer "valet parking", but these guys don't know what they are doing..Cars triple parked down the street, dangerous getting in and out of your car.. Road rage for drivers going either way, trying to get through.  Puts a damper on an otherwise nice time.

40.description: Went as an out of town guest for graduation party to this Zagat Rated institution. The veal limon and eggplant parm were fantastic. The groups' fish and pasta dishes were also enjoyed by all. The atmosphere big city which I like. The only negatives were the antipasto salad (dressing) and cannoli (filling) which did not taste like homemade.

53.description: We went here recently and were really impressed with the hospitality. It's very obvious that this is a family run place and it has a very homey, festive feel.  That said, there are no menus-- everything is posted on chalkboards. Even though the place seems cozy, it's actually pretty big and there were still a lot of people eating at 8 p.m. on a Thursday. We were seated in the porch area, which also had a large group who stayed long after they had finished eating. They were pretty loud and the volume was enhanced by the room somehow, which made it kind of hard to hear...anything. Anyway, the chalkboard also lists wines by the glass. The food is mostly pastas with some chicken entrees-- pretty basic. I got the special shrimp, broccoli and shells. My husband had angel hair and meatballs. Mine was served in a big, plastic bowl, which was disappointing. The sauce was supposed to be olive oil and garlic but it was pretty much water. The pasta did not seem to be homemade, although I think the sauces were. Our side salad was big enough to split and the dressing was decent but the greens were iceberg lettuce. We skipped dessert and paid before having a drink at the bar. Tufano's does not take credit cards but they do take personal checks or cash and have an ATM in the bar, which you will probably need when you tip the valet. The bar area is very cool- sort of art deco and, we were told, 83 years old! Overall, I would say that most of the food are dishes you could easily cook at home but if you want an old school Little Italy experience at a place that is a bit off the beaten path, Tufano's is a fun place to try.

30.description: What a great place. A neighborhood joint with great Italian food. Regulars hang in the bar and they should. It's their neighborhood. Great Lemon Chicken and Eggplant Parmesan. Great simple Italian Salad instead of kale and baby greens. Let's hope restaurants like this hang around. Too many phony places in the West Loop.

46.description: Great food, Great people and Great location!A warm, inviting and friendly location for a fabulous Italian dinner.We were promptly greeted by the valet and were warmly greeted by the staff of Tufano's upon entering.  We were seated quickly despite it being a "Hawks" home game night.  The serving staff was prompt, helpful and friendly.  We loved the chalkboard menu but advise to ask the servers about the evening specials as they are always fabulous.  You must try the chicken soup!!!!! We even took some home with us!Tufano's is quality food at an extremely reasonable price.  It is dining with a neighborhood feel and very inviting.  Food is delicious and prompt if you have somewhere to be following your meal.Most impressive was the gratitude we felt by the staff for stopping in and the courtesy of the Valet greeting us on our way out to get our car.  Even the Valet hoped we enjoyed our meal and visit.  Tufano's is wonderful and we highly recommend it!Eileen H.

1.description: This is a 4 star restaurant brought down by 2-star service.  Everything was nice, the Chicken was tender, the salad was fresh and the staff was friendly.  We seemed to get the only server more concerned with talking on her cell phone at the bar than serving us.  We watched the other servers working their tables with excellence, we just got a bad seat.The cash only policy was a bit of a surprise, normally we don't carry that much $$ around so be prepared.   NOTED: If I was a thief, I'd know where to find my next victim.

55.description: Was there on 11/16/14 at 520 pm with my 5 friends we had planned to order dinner(because food looked amazing) at the bar after our second round of drinks we ask if we could order dinner when the male bartender with the shaved head told us to wait then went to the waitress and said " these douche bags want to order food" we promptly left the this establishment and are never returning. I wish yelp gave negative stars!!

9.description: It was 30 years ago when I was a wide eye southsider, working a night shift making gum and putting my time in on classes at UIC. Took an extra job working the parking lot, wouldn't ya know it, had the sat afternoon shift for a gospel convention.  Man did it pour.After a long day, got invited in for a bowl of minestrone and some bread. Been going back ever since.Great food and service.  Pork chops are top notch.  Mussels and angel hair my personal favorite.  Had the shells broccoli and shrimp yesterday. Wow. Wicked good.  My date had the chicken picante.  Very, very good.The house chianti is top notch and they have perhaps the best fried calamari I ever had.  Take advantage of the valet. Well worth it.

26.description: Excellent food / very reasonable prices /free valet.  My wife was here over 20 yrs ago and remembered it being very good and wanted to take my daughter and I. I had the eggplant plate and it was the best I ever had. The food was better than high priced fancy places that I  actually hate wasting money on. I live 40 minutes west into the suburbs from the restaurant and I would go back in a heart beat just to run out for dinner.  4 of us and we didn't  hold back on ordering food ,was well  under $100.00 with tip. If you like Italian food you must at least try it. Oh yeah,  service was a little slow but friendly.  Don't go there when your in a hurry. Just saying. :)

25.description: Chicago Institution.  Get the Lemon Chicken.  Get the eggplant.  Bring cash.  One thing I wish they would do is brine their chicken, or get some pastured chicken.  At all Italian restaurants, chicken can be a little dry.

12.description: Been coming here for years!!  Nothing fancy but the best authentic food around.  The calamari is to die for!  The cavatelli is delicious.  Never left here disappointed.

59.description: This place sits in the out-skirts of Little Italy, where only an authentic family-owned-for-generations Italian restaurant gem like this should be. The neighborhood is all residential and then there is this restaurant perfectly blended in to the no frills architecture of the bed-rock working class homes that surround it.  Inside you enter into the bar with the TV's being the only thing upgraded amidst the charm and warmth of the late 60"s early 70's decor that survives pristine.  There since 1930 this place rocks plain walls covered in black and white photos of celebrity visitors in some parts, chalk board menus on the walls of the dining area, formica tables, simple chairs, with an obvious addition to the dining room totally consistent in character but with its own charm.  They have an out door area for seating just as simple, delicately lit and adjacent to an open area where kids run and play while waiting for their food or letting you have your coffee.  That brings me to the patrons, they are you and me and our parents, and our grandparents, and be they 80 years old in wheel chairs or 6 month olds in a car seat, the staff makes it work and the place bustles with all of us like a big family dinner, often times with Chicago Police officers at the table next to you in full uniform.  The menu is Italian standards, plentiful.  It brings the same pure simplicity of great red gravy sauce, meat sauces, pasta incarnations, pork chops and peppers, chicken any way, and veal and fish all fresh to order as it has for decades.  Packed with tang, oregano and garlic in the unmatched perfection of a true Italian kitchen, Chicago-style, like the good ole days of what used to line Taylor Street and it rightfully survives today.  Come any time and there will be table or one soon to be and chill in the charm of the simple tavern-like bright bar area while you wait and enjoy a feeling you will only get here and it is one that you will want over and over.

21.description: Too much hype... Service was slow and red sauce pretty blah. Idk maybe I got the wrong thing

17.description: Tufano's is an amazing Chicago find. Just a short trip from the downtown area, it is easy to get to by bus or cab. There is valet parking for $5 if you drive there. If anyone has ever tried to park in downtown Chicago, you know that this is an amazing deal. Normal valet parking costs downtown are about $10-12, and street parking is. Not. Real. (Residential streets require permits to park. This is not a new concept.) There is sometimes a wait if you go for dinner on the weekend, but we have always been seated fairly quickly. Service is always great. The staff are friendly and helpful, and we have never been short on water, drinks, and bread. The menu is written on chalkboards throughout the restaurant, but you don't really need it-- just ask the server or read some of the reviews!Mussels with red sauce- The best thing ever! Forget the mussels, it's all about that sauce. Just spoon up that delicious, garlicky goodness, soak your bread into it, and enter heaven. (Once, they were out of mussels and we nearly cried. We asked for just the sauce and they kindly, wonderfully obliged our odd request. Bless you, Tufano's!)Other things that were good: pasta with vodka sauce, chicken/veal parmesan,  chicken/veal picante, spaghetti with olive oil and garlic, tortellini alfredo. The marinara sauce is a bit on the sweet side for me, but I bet kids would like that.

10.description: When I saw the name of this place, I assumed that it was a Chicago location of a restaurant in the suburb of Vernon Park. I guess I don't get out enough, because there is no suburb called Vernon Park. In fact, there's no park named Vernon Park in Chicago. There is, however, a Vernon Park Street that runs into UIC. Maybe there had been a park before the university eminent domained the place? Enough speculating; let's eat.Six of us arrived without a reservation on a Saturday night, after having another place misplace our reservation. Joann jumped into action, finding us a nice round table (perfect for everyone to converse with everyone--the Chinese are onto this; I'm glad Tufano's is too). We waited less than ten minutes, probably closer to five, and she came back a few times to make sure we felt taken care of. It turns out that Joann is a part of the family that has owned this place for 85 years. How wonderful that the second (or third?) generation still hustles to make sure their guests are having a good time at the party.Soon after we sat down, Bobbie was there for a drink order. Since this place has that old-school, Frank Sinatra type of vibe, I went for a tasty dry martini, which came in the appropriate iconic, conical glass. She also set us up with the recommended salad: the Tufano for four, plenty for 6. Funny how a few slices of salami and some cheese can make a salad that much tastier. Warm, crusty bread was soon on the table, with both packets of whipped butter and a cruet of olive oil. Nothing extraordinary about the bread, except that its warmth and crustiness made it delicious.Two of us had one of the house specials, the eggplant parmesan. It was a Viennese torte of savory goodness: stacked high with fluffy layers, with the right amount of cheese, tasty tomato sauce and no oily mess like many places. One of the best I've had, and I do like my eggplant parmesan. Like my beloved chile rellenos, a lot of people make them, but only a few achieve excellence.   Others in our group got lemon chicken, one whose lips, between smacks, wished he had gotten a whole instead of a half.Six spoons and my friends' traditional passing of the desserts ended the evening: lemon sorbet, cannoli and tiramisu, all very tasty. I also had an espresso, which was the only weak part of the meal. Just strong coffee with no crema.Normally I would dock a star because they only take cash--it's 2015, people! But then again, I'm not going to admonish an 85-year-old for being set in his ways. Especially when he still lives on a quiet street and hasn't abandoned a neighborhood in which most of the Italians have moved away.I happened to chat for a few minutes with Joann on the way out. Very personable, even at the end of the evening. It was like being in someone's kitchen, rather than a restaurant from which she was looking forward to getting home.

5.description: Free valet parking! Yay! Saturday night and did not have to wait for our table for two! Woo hoo! Water without requesting it! Bread and butter, a nice olive oil and cheese on the table. Wait staff was attentive but not pesty. Michelle provided answers to my questions, allowed time for us to decide, and gave good descriptions of the dishes. We had some Chianti, dry, as it should be, and served in a juice glass. : ) Tufano's special salad did not live up to its description, just a couple of slices of very tasty salami, good cheeses, artichoke hearts, veggies on a bed of iceberg. Hubby had the chicken limone, pretty good. I had the eggplant, a good portion of dredged and sautéed eggplant thinly sliced and layered with cheese. Excellent! We ended our meal with a couple of cappuccinos and spumoni. We left full but not stuffed, very satisfied with a wonderful meal.

3.description: This restaurant is my family's favorite place to eat. The food is great.  I used to get the Stuffed Shells and Shells and Broccoli, as well as Chicken Picante and Chicken Limone. I have been going to Tufanos' since a very young age, but I developed allergies in my 20s. The chefs always make me something wonderful - chicken with vegetables. The seasoning is wonderful and the chicken is tender. It's exactly what I crave and I am so thankful to the staff for accommodating my allergies.  I love that there's nothing exceptionally fancy about the place. You would never know it existed by just driving by, as it's unmarked and on a residential street. It's the type of place you go to if you're a local. You run into people you know. The vibe is truly Italian; loud, noisy, with a lot of laughs. It feels like I'm right at home. Joe always greets our family and knows my father by name.

Very personable, even at the end of the evening. It was like being in someone's kitchen, rather than a restaurant from which she was looking forward to getting home.

19.description: Family favorite! I've been coming here with my family ever since I was a kid. Great Italian food and great service! This place has a family vibe and we always leave satisfied.

28.description: Have enjoyed in the past, but most recent visit just okay. Two in our group ordered the fettuccine Alfredo and both agreed it tasted like watery noodles. My 16 yo son thought the Italian sausage he ordered tasted "funny" so I took a bite...of sawdust. Yuck!! My cavatelli with vodka sauce & a meatball were great! But remember extra charge for vodka sauce ($3.50) and extra charge for meatball ($3.50). My $12 pasta dish is suddenly 20 bux!! Service was lacking for a Sunday late afternoon meal with only 2 tables taken al fresco; Ceara seemed grumpy and put out by our requests ("More water please" & "Can I get a box for that?"), as well as missing throughout most of our meal. We've been here a few times and knew it was $$$ only, but after a busy, fun day it totally slipped our minds. As Ceara hands us the check, she smirks and says "Cash only" and saunters away. We scrambled and between us had the $100+ to cover dinner, but a gentle reminder, as we sat down, would have been appreciated. I really like the place, so I'll be back for more...but one more visit with lackluster service and food and I'll go to one of the many, many other quality Italian restaurants Chicago has to offer.

45.description: Tufano's is the best I love their food, they make you feel like your at home, my family and friends love it too.

33.description: Oh, so good!!  Enjoyed a fantastic lunch with the Bishop, today.  Started with one Tufano's Special Salad.  Was more than enough for two.  Filled with enough salami & cheese to make a sandwich with the D'Amato's bread. My friend ordered the Veal Parmigiana.  It was done to perfection. A thick slab of veal, breaded and drowning in marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese.  I had the Lemon Chicken.  8 Pieces of baked then broiled, chicken swimming in olive oil, crushed garlic, olive oil and lemon juice.  Loved It!!l

43.description: The best waitresses ever esp The OLD ones. Younguns are good too. Terese  the bartender is a pleasure

2.description: I have two words for you: lemon chicken.I remember tasting this delightful dish about 25 years ago, when my college girlfriend was a student at UIC.  We came here for dinner a lot, and I vividly remember the dish.  It is, hands down, one of the best chicken dishes you can get in the City of Chicago at any given time.  I get the whole chicken- because I like to take it home and it tastes just as good the next day.  The potatoes that come with it are addictive- think thick cut potato chips.What else?  Salads are awesome.  They only take cash or check (yeah, checks!), but there's an ATM right nearby.  Parking in Little Italy can be a nightmare, so plan to valet.This place is a Chicago classic.  If you haven't been, you must go.

18.description: Very friendly old school Italian place. So old school it's cash only. Reasonably priced drinks and food. We were there at a very busy time before a Blackhawks game and still had no complaints about service. Staff was really nice and helpful. My husband and I shared the Tufano's salad and it was great! Full of cheeses, salami and artichokes, and veggies! Warm crispy bread was served on all tables. My husband had one if their specialties, sausage and peppers. He said it's the best he's ever had! I had the chicken Parmesan which was good except for the pasta and marinara. I was really on the fence with my meal, but I'm definitely going to go back!

41.description: I had occasion to be in the city waiting for the Bills game to end. Decided to go to dinner at Vernon Park Tap. I had heard about it from a couple of sources. Maybe this is one of those places where you really shouldn't have dinner alone. While the good was pretty good, I could easily get the same or better in the burbs for about 30% less. The chicken picante was tender and moist, but somewhat bland. The calamari were tender and well cooked but I found the sauce a little too sweet. For $31.00 not including top, this should have been better.

52.description: 1. Parking There is plenty of parking but it's permit only or valet only .I had to park couple blocks away .2. Interior Looks like old fashion place nothing special about it . Really loud inside .3.the menuThey don't give the menu it's only written on the board . Really hard to read . Especially in a not really bright room .So ordered something that I could read on a board . Really don't understand why they can't print the menu . Stupid .4.Food and service It took a long time to wait for food and waitress to write down out order.When they brought my and my girlfriends food first thing flashes across my mind . I can make it at home ( I don't cook ). Pasta from the box , tomato sauce from the can and see food from the can.Their customers should PM me I can supply them with this stuff for half of the price lol . 5.Payment Don't accept credit cards . They don't have a sign anywhere . I tried to be really honest writing this review  . And I will not come back .

50.description: It was a cold night in Chitown.  Chicago Bears were playing.  Wandered into this restaurant.  Ordered a bunch of food (veal picante, tufano's lemon chicken, sausage and peppers, tortellini alfredo, and meat ravioli) and shared family style.  Food was decent.  The staff was great to speak with.  Learned about the history of the area/restaurant.  This is what I had in my mind as a Chicago restaurant (coming from LA).

4.description: Delicious neighborhood gem.  If you aren't looking for frills, bring a few singles for the valet and drive over here.  This place is easy to miss, but you shouldn't.  We all had pasta; large portions and plenty of flavor.  Though intimately sized, it is still kid friendly as well.  Our waitress was a sweetheart and so attentive.  Next time I'll go for Chicken Vesuvio or Veal (shhhh) Marsala.  The people next to us had some meaty deliciousness and it looked really good.

6.description: Tufano's is a Chicago must. Classic, authentic and smack dab right in the heart of little Italy. The place has literally not changed in years...and let's be happy it didn't. From the chalk board menus to the cash only protocol, Tufano's ambiance is Old school Italian at its finest. The fiancé and I, (I just love saying that) strolled up here one lazy afternoon for lunch. It was quiet and romantic. We chose to sit outside to enjoy the beautiful day and also the serene sounds of the fountain right next to the restaurant. We were greeted with a delightful waitress who couldn't be any sweeter. She even informed us the paper menus were the same as the ones inside and the only difference was a couple of quarters:) we decided on the tomato mozzarella salad for an appetizer. It was perfect for the two of us to share... And the warm bread accompanied it nicely. For my main I chose the cavatelli with sausage, and my boo went with the stuffed shells and a meatball. Both dishes were delicious. Despite being very generous portions, we finished everything. Sadly no leftovers for us to take home! There is an ample dessert menu but we didn't leave room to try it unfortunately. Tufano's is a no muss no fuss kinda joint that serves up seriously solid Italian food. It's perfect before or after a game at the UC...or even a regular night out, just don't forget to make a wish in the fountain before you leave;)

22.description: Also known as Vernon street tap this place rocks! If you want good simple food you are in the right place. The place reminds me of eating at my nana's house in a lot in both the food and atmosphere. Stuffed shells are my favorite!

15.description: Just a great old school Chicago Italian place.  Wonderful food.  Great staff.  The place has been there forever.There are knuckleheads here giving the place one star and complaining about parking and the menu on a chalkboard.  The restaurant is in a RESIDENTIAL NEIGHBORHOOD.  They have VALET PARKING.  Tufano's has ALWAYS been there.  The lack of parking is nothing new.Is looking at the chalkboard so damned difficult?  Do you really need a menu?  Are people incapable of asking the wait staff questions?If you really need a parking lot and a menu, go to an Olive Garden in a mall.

57.description: Guy Fieri's endorsement aside, the lemon chicken is great.  Unpretentious and a friendly staff.  (Just know that you'll be ordering from a chalkboard.)

20.description: Tufano's is a Chicago must. Classic, authentic and smack dab right in the heart of little Italy. The place has literally not changed in years...and let's be happy it didn't. From the chalk board menus to the cash only protocol, Tufano's ambiance is Old school Italian at its finest. The fiancé and I, (I just love saying that) strolled up here one lazy afternoon for lunch. It's perfect before or after a game at the UC...or even a regular night out, just don't forget to make a wish in the fountain before you leave;)

36.description: Tufano's is a lovely old school gem. The menu is pure Chicago Italian. The Tufano salad is delish. If you are expecting white tablecloths, this is not for you. Excellent pasta and chicken dishes. The lemon chicken is yummy bruschetta is tasty. Shrimp in garlic and oil was a crowd pleaser.. Definately be back. I must try the eggplant parm. Oh, and it's cash only.

14.description: Excellent food / very reasonable prices /free valet.  My wife was here over 20 yrs ago and remembered it being very good and wanted to take my daughter and I. I had the eggplant plate and it was the best I ever had. The food was better than high priced fancy places that I  actually hate wasting money on. I live 40 minutes west into the suburbs from the restaurant and I would go back in a heart beat just to run out for dinner.  4 of us and we didn't  hold back on ordering food ,was well  under $100.00 with tip. If you like Italian food you must at least try it. Oh yeah,  service was a little slow but friendly.  Don't go there when your in a hurry. Just saying. :)

12.description: Top notch service, price is very reasonable.

3.description: 12 bucks, Maria is super friendly and listens to exactly what you want. She even puts up a handheld mirror to show you what she's done and asks you if it's satisfactory or if you want any adjustments. Cash only, but no big deal. No shampoo/wash, but for 12 dollars what can you expect. I generally take a shower after a haircut anyways (those little hairs always get onto my neck and back and itch). Definitely in a nondescript location, but friendly service and quality haircut for the cheapest price around.

1.description: Absolutely worth the money. Maria listens very patiently to what style you want and cuts accordingly. Would definitely go back again!

2.description: I went in hours before an interview, and I had not gotten a haircut in over a month. I told her roughly what I wanted done and she nailed it. She also gave me recommendations on other styling I should try. She was extremely friendly and at the price of $12, you can't beat it anywhere else in the area. The only issue is that it's cash only but that just follows the trend of many barbers in the area.

9.description: To summarize my review: Maria is amazing!I've been searching for the perfect barber (low price, high skill, nice person, doesn't talk too much, doesn't talk too little) and I found it with Maria. She is simply fantastic. She has a high level of communication, always checking in with you before she does something. And $12 for a haircut is a very decent price! On top of it all, she is really, really good at what she does. She always cuts my hair perfectly.  Usually there isn't a wait, but I do recommend calling ahead to get a reservation.  She does three cuts an hour - at the top of the hour, 20 minutes after and twenty minutes to.  Also, because she's located on the UIC West Campus, her downtown is when school is not in session, so if it's the winter break or summer break, etc. it's best to call ahead to make sure she's in.  They have four chairs set up, but I have only seen Maria cutting hair there - and to be honest, if someone else came in, I'm not sure I'd abandon Maria. Sure the shop itself doesn't have the most modern decor. In fact, it looks kind of run-down.  And the fact that you have to find it in the basement makes it kind of an adventure.  But these negatives aside, she's worth it.  Also, bring cash - she doesn't take credit cards.  My search for a barber is over and I'm so glad I found out about Maria.

10.description: I've been here twice, both times left with a solid haircut.  I agree with James E. on all accounts.  Maria takes her time, actually listens to what you want, and will happily take feedback.  Only one complaint- her taper is more of a square cut in the back.I tried out the barbers on UIC East Campus once, and Maria wins.  The shop is nothing special, but the quality haircut makes up for that...and its hard to beat $12!

4.description: Came not knowing anything about cutting hair or what I wanted and she still did an amazing job. One of the best I've had so far

6.description: Excellent and attentive service. Maria has been here over 17 years and I will for sure be coming back for more. If you are not part of the UIC community, you would have no clue that there was a barber shop in the basement. For the price of $12, you really can't do much better.

0.description: Maria is great.  She always listens to exactly what I want, is really friendly, quick, etc.  Last time I was there she trimmed my beard for free and gave me some tips for when I do it myself.Reasonably priced, too!

5.description: I've been in chicago for a couple of months and this the best place to get your hair cut for 12$.  It's a small shop in the uic student center basement run by the same woman for over 20 years, so when give it a try you shouldn't be disappointed and quick tip they accept cash only.

13.description: Poor quality, poor scheduling and wasted an hour of my time waiting and then had to search for an atm since they dont take credit

11.description: Reliable, consistent, attentive, skilled haircuts, and only $12.  I wish I knew about Maria and her coworker earlier.  This is a 2 person, humble barber shop, staffed with two ladies who know their trade.  Maria tells me she's been running the shop for many years and it shows. She has a reliable, consistent following of customers, and is always able to squeeze in a few more.  What's nice is Maria listens before cutting and asks for feedback along the way.  She has a gentle, fun personality too.  Try it out, and IMO remember to give a nice tip if you're happy with the cut.  For $12 I don't know how they pay the bills!

8.description: I've been coming here for years.  Maria's simply the best.  The medical school bookstore is a few yards away from the barber shop, so you can browse before or after your haircut.  The Damen bus or Polk Pink Line brings you to this shop in the basement of the student union.  All kinds of good restaurants and coffee shops just a few blocks from here on Taylor, east of Ashland, for lunch after your cut.

14.description: Maria is awesome!  Here attention to detail is unmatched.  She will simply redo a haircut immediately if she isn't happy with it!  Most days she can get you in, but much of her schedule is packed with regulars.  12 dollars is a total steal.

7.description: This is probably the best place in Chicago to get a good haircut.  I'm not a student at UIC but come down to get a high and tight, no where else in the city can figure out how to give a military style cut.  If you haven't shaved that day they will normally throw in a straight shave for free.  Best 12 dollar haircut in Chicago.  Cash only.

0.description: Yay for soul vegan. Can't get enough of the soy salad. I could live on it.staff is so friendly. More veg options please. A stellar view of the parking structure

28.description: We have been customers of Chiarugi Hardware, for 35 years. Helpful advice, kind service, and extra care are traditions that get polished by Paul every visit. We depend on Paul to make our extra keys. Sometimes our old lock rebels against a new key, Paul will do his magic on the grinder so the key works more easily.  This is a small store, so Paul may have to check with his warehouse for an item, and he does! I don't recall using a credit card ever, so join me in paying the old fashioned way.In these days of personal data collection, paying by cash sounds refreshing!

1.description: The owner (Paul) is honest, helpful, and friendly. Not to mention his craftsmanship- he made 2 copies of 5 different keys quicker than I've ever seen, and they all worked perfectly. What put me over the top though, was that after I realized I didn't have money to pay, he trusted me to run back to my house, try all the keys, grab the money, then return and pay him. I'm bringing all my questions and business to him. The world needs more store owners like him.

39.description: The BEST neighborhood hardware store I have ever been to.  The owner, Paul Rinaldi, is the nicest guy you'll ever meet and extremely helpful. In addition to hardware they carry wine-making supplies and make keys.  They recently moved to 1512 West Taylor Street.

9.description: It's rare to find family owned quality businesses anymore. I go here for all my little hardware needs. Paul, the owner, helps me every time I come in and with his extensive knowledge and experience takes the time to teach me how to use the products and even answers questions I didn't know I should be asking.Great place in the heart of Little Italy. I went here to make several copies of keys once and the prices can't be beat. I've gotten a few tools and vacuum bags, etc. over time and I'm always able to explain what I need things for and am always pointed in the right direction.The home feel and the one-on-one help from Paul is something I just can't and don't expect from a large corporation.This is the place for your hardware needs!

29.description: This the best hardware store in the city. in fact, the best hardware store I have ever been to. Paul, the owner, is extremely knowledge and friendly and genuinely wants his customers to be successful in fixing things in their homes. His prices are a bit higher than at the big box stores but since he gives very helpful advice on how to solve home repair problems, you end up saving money and time by avoiding mistakes and unnecessary purchases.Chiarugi Hardware should always be your first stop for hardware store items.

23.description: Fantastic local business in Little Italy.  99% of the time they have what you are looking for.  They are always helpful!  Prices are on par with big box stores.  As a urban planner these are the kind of shops that there should be more of.  They really help diversify neighborhoods and keep big box stores away while providing the services locals need.  Great for getting keys made....

5.description: Super nice owner.  Made a few keys for me that Home Depot wouldn't.  Solid little shop.

31.description: Fantastic service.They weren't able to help us, but took the time to listen to our problem and refer us to another business that could help us.Wow!  That's great service.

25.description: He is great! GIves great deals. Wife and him are so nice. He knows what he is talking about too. Great prices

12.description: Fantastic local business in Little Italy.  99% of the time they have what you are looking for.  They are always helpful!  Prices are on par with big box stores.  As a urban planner these are the kind of shops that there should be more of.  They really help diversify neighborhoods and keep big box stores away while providing the services locals need.  Great for getting keys made....

37.description: Chiarugi Hardware has a serious past and still maintains a presence in Little Italy, centrally located on Taylor St. This little gem used to be a mainstay of LI when it was located where the present day Vintage Lounge stands, but unfortunately, Home Depot and large housewares conglomerates have nearly decimated what still remains of the small privately owned hardware stores. One thing that can't be taken away, the friendly smiles and great customer care imparted every time you walk through the door. True, I pay more for everyday items, but they carry at least one of most things I need around the house without the drive and parking to a the local chain (with the satisfaction of helping the little guy). In addition, they are the only local shop in LI that carries home wine/beer making supplies. Whenever I need an on the spot  carboy bung, grain bag, air spigot, etc., Chiarugi always has me covered without the long drive to brew & grow. Can't wait for tonights brew session! Oh snap, I need an airlock, Chiarugi to the rescue.

21.description: Such hospitable service.   Made several hardware requests that were met with swift and expert professionalism. Paul and his wife are great.

16.description: I had to write about my service at Chiarugi.  Went in yesterday to get two keys made and also to inquire about options for locking a bifold closet door.  They gave me all my options and I ended up not buying anything as I wanted to think about the options.  I than went to pay for the keys with a credit card and he either didn't take them or maybe the amount wasn't big enough (sorry didn't clarify this) but than said to take the keys and come back with cash.  He kept saying don't worry about it....I will make sure I go back and pay and keep going there for with my business.  As other people have said, this is the kind of business we need to keep in our neighborhoods.

17.description: Great family run hardware store! Super fast service and wonderful staff. Chiarugi is the kind of local business that brings neighborhood personability and reasonable prices that no big box store can compete with. Support your local businesses and check out Chiarugi the next time for your hardware needs!

10.description: Family owned store - the owners sit outside of the shop (when the weather is nice) and say hello to everyone in the neighborhood. I stopped in the other day (after not coming to the neighborhood for about 2 years) and they remembered me! Chiarugi is as good as it gets. He runs the type of place that you tell him your problem - and he knows exactly what you need to fix it. He even offered to come to my apartment and help me fix my kitchen sink! That's the type of service that will keep me coming back.

11.description: Got some keys duplicated for 2.50/ piece. The man did it really fast and told me to return to the store if the keys didn't work. The man there was incredibly nice and even ran out of the store to give me a key ring for my new set of keys. Would come here again. This store also carries packing tape if that is needed

26.description: Great friendly, neighborhood hardware store with fantastic customer service.  Love Paul the owner and his wife.  Great people & Great service.  Wouldn't go anywhere else for my supplies.  Highly recommended.

27.description: One of the best costumer experiences I have ever had.  Paul the owner is fantastic, friendly and extremely knowledgeable and helpful.  I trust him like family.  Never steering me in the wrong direction.  This place is a hidden gem in Little Italy.  Has pretty much anything you need at reasonable prices.  Highly recommended over the big chains!

35.description: This isn't a very big shop, but the owner, Mr. Rinaldi, provides wonderful service. You can explain what you're trying to do and he'll find the exact tools and materials you'll need. He'll show you how to use them, too, which is wonderful for an unhandy guy like myself. Am I paying more than at the local big box hardware store? Probably, but the service and convenience is more than worth a few extra pennies. I think you'll agree.

8.description: Very nice guy. Went to copy my key, got 2 copies and it took him no more than 2 minutes and it was only $3 each. I would trust this hardware shop first before going someplace else.

0.description: Was there about a week ago to get some keys made. Nice place, nice people. Will be back. All the other reviews spot on. Unfortunately after I told the owner how nice he was and look for this great review, my internet went out for a week. Selection is spotty, but I am a renter now instead of home owner, so I'm sure they will have most all of what I need, or if they don't they know where to send me.A friendly place.

38.description: Local hardware store with many hard to find items.  They are smiling  and willing to give you advice. If something is not working they do not hesitate to try different options.Quick service with key cutting.  They can also do glass repair, although I never had to use this service.

20.description: Family owned store - the owners sit outside of the shop (when the weather is nice) and say hello to everyone in the neighborhood. I stopped in the other day (after not coming to the neighborhood for about 2 years) and they remembered me! Chiarugi is as good as it gets. He runs the type of place that you tell him your problem - and he knows exactly what you need to fix it. He even offered to come to my apartment and help me fix my kitchen sink! That's the type of service that will keep me coming back.

19.description: Fantastic service.They weren't able to help us, but took the time to listen to our problem and refer us to another business that could help us.Wow!  That's great service.

33.description: A WONDERFUL place!  I just came from this store, and I will definitely go back again.   The owner was so nice, I needed something so simple and he went above and beyond.  I definitely recommend this place!

2.description: Great place, great customer service. I've been here a few times, and they've always been the best.

34.description: The few cents more you may pay compared to the big box is more than returned to you in the time you'll save and the actionable advice and service you will get from Chiarugi Hardware.I've been coming here for five years or so -- I'm not sure why I have never Yelped about it, but shame on me because the place is a gem for those of us who maybe aren't so handy, and who don't have endless time to spend on home repair.  One specific story I'll share:  I came in after the wood split on a dining room chair back, and Pauly explained to me how I could fix it myself with just some really inexpensive and easy-to-use materials.  Following his simple instructions, I  fixed it myself, and the repair is still holding five years later and is almost invisible, too.Over the years he's clued me in to a number of products and fixes, and he's been there for me when I was in the middle of something and just had to buy something quick.  It is hard to beat street parking right in front, no lines, and the owner right there to point you to exactly what it is you are looking for right now, or who can order it for you and have it for you in a day or two -- Home Depot doesn't stand a chance.What prompted me to write now is that I found myself with a raft of work that really required a handyman, and my old one was no longer available.  I'd had a new one come by, highly recommended in Angie's List but I don't know why since half the things on my list he said he couldn't do.  After I'd sent him packing, I picked up the phone and called my old friend Chiarugi Hardware and within a minute my problems were solved, and quite spectacularly!  I won't tell you how, you will just have to become his customer to find out how his "loyalty program" really pays off.  I love you Chiarugi Hardware!!!!!!

32.description: I went to Chiarugi's by chance, and I'm so glad I did!  The owner, Pauly, was very helpful and friendly.  He helped me find what I was looking for and insisted I come back if I had any problems or needed any additional help (with putting up some blinds).  The extension I bought for the screwdriver ended up being the wrong fit for the drill, so I went back to see if I could exchange it, and he gave me a second one at no charge.  I think he felt bad I had to come back, but there was no way he could've known it was the wrong size.  Unlike any other store, he holds himself responsible for what he sells to his customers.  He treats everyone he walks into his store very well, and I intend to go there for tools, light bulbs, cleaning products- all of it.  They have my business for sure.

18.description: Great family-owned hardware store in Little Italy! Paul helped me select exactly what I needed for installing some towel hooks in my bathroom. Very helpful and friendly throughout the process. Will be coming back for all my hardware needs.

13.description: SUPPORT LOCAL SMALL BUSINESSES!!!  Go here for all your hardware needs, they couldn't be happier and more grateful to have customers and will do anything they can to help you.  Best customer service!!!

4.description: I have been going to Paul for my household upkeep since moving to the neighborhood in 2010! He is extremely knowledgeable, efficient and really does care that you get the product you need and that any problem you have is solved. Recently, I needed a few keys made after mine had snapped in the cold. I brought my roommates key, and Paul was able to match it and get them cut very quickly. The keys work perfectly! On top of the keys, he also provided suggestions for cleaning out my locks to keep them working smoothly. This place is just a really great small business.

24.description: What a great hardware store! They helped me get my keys copied fast after I just moved in to the neighborhood. Looks like they only take cash right now. A lot of brick and mortar shops like this have a hard time dealing with high processing fees for credit and debit cards. This makes it harder for businesses like this to compete with corporate run stores. I recommended bitcoin as an alternative and the owner told me another customer expressed interest in paying with bitcoins as well. If this owner reads this I would like to recommend bitpay.com or Coinbase.com for cheap bitcoin payment processing. Great customer service! Glad they were open on Christmas Eve!

6.description: Super nice owner. This is my 2nd time making keys here, and I will definitely come back here if I need to make more keys.

22.description: A great neighborhood hardware store! I'm a student that lives in the area and always visit this store for all my home improvement/hardware needs.  The owner is very kind and helpful and the prices are unbeatable!

15.description: Chiarugi hardware is a gem in Little Italy. Te prices are affordable and they provide excellent. Customer service. I called on my home one evening and they stayed open late so I could pick up a snow shovel. You can find pretty much anything you need for any small projects around the house.

40.description: Great hardware store.. they've got those hard to find things and the staff is very knowledgable

7.description: The best. The owners will always above and beyond to get you what you need and help you solve your problem. They will talk you through your needs and give you their number so they can help you in the future! I will be bringing ALL my hardware business here in the future and referring all my friends & family in the area to them.This is the way you want to run a business!!

36.description: All of my hardware purchases will now be made at Chiarugi - period.Paul, one of the owners, and the other owner (I regrettably did not ask for her name), greeted me at the front door with genuine smiles! I asked Paul if he had painters tape, and he replied with such sincere enthusiasm, "Oh yes, of course, right here young lady." He led me into the store, and I immediately hit with this sweet refreshing aroma - definitely not like other hardware stores! He keeps air fresheners in the ducts! Then, when I brought the tape to the counter, I wasn't able to use my card. Shame on me, I should have realized that this classic mom and pop shop doesn't take cards. They used to, but some corporate jerk must be giving him a hard time. Shame on THAT guy then! Anyway, so when I realized I couldn't use my card, I said that I would come back with cash. Here's the MOST AMAZING PART: he let me leave the store WITH MY TAPE, trusting me to come back! What a sweet, sweet, generous man! Unfortunately, I wasn't able to return myself (I sent my student employee to deliver the money). I wish I had, though, b/c I rarely run into good people like Paul nowadays. Great prices. Wonderful smells. Friendly people!  =)

30.description: I've been going to Home Depot to get keys made at my own peril. 85% of the time, the keys are unusable or they catch in the lock and are nearly impossible to use. Paul at Chiarugi Hardware to the rescue!Paul was very friendly and from the looks of it, he uses an older machine that takes a skilled person to operate. He attentively made 6 keys for me which I came home to test. The price was also very reasonable - cheaper than Home Depot. Because of my Home Depot experiences, I expected some to not work - what a relief that 100% of my keys worked flawlessly! Maybe even better than the mediocre key they were made from! Wow. I've got more keys to make (my partner habitually loses keys - arg!) and I'm definitely coming back to Chiarugi to get them made. While waiting for the keys, I browsed around. Everything was very neat. Turns out they have wine and beer making equipment so if I ever take the plunge to brew my own beer, I'll be coming to Paul to get started with expert guidance. Side note - this place is also one of the last remnants of the once vibrant Little Italy community that Daley mercilessly destroyed when planning/building UIC. You can find old pictures of the community protests and rallys at the time at the library or history museum. It's really a shame. Come buy your Little Italy memorabilia here too. They also seem to be dog friendly - while I was there, a woman from the neighborhood came in with her little beagle and she chatted with another woman who was working.

3.description: My wife came here to make keys and was short about $10. We really needed the keys made that day and the owner let her take the keys and asked that she would just stop by with the rest of the money the next day. This is what a Ma and pop store is all about. The keys work great unlike Home Depot. I know there are a lot of college renters in the area and they should all go here. Great customer service and great quality.

14.description: I've been going to Home Depot to get keys made at my own peril. 85% of the time, the keys are unusable or they catch in the lock and are nearly impossible to use. Paul at Chiarugi Hardware to the rescue!Paul was very friendly and from the looks of it, he uses an older machine that takes a skilled person to operate. He attentively made 6 keys for me which I came home to test. The price was also very reasonable - cheaper than Home Depot. Because of my Home Depot experiences, I expected some to not work - what a relief that 100% of my keys worked flawlessly! Maybe even better than the mediocre key they were made from! Wow. I've got more keys to make (my partner habitually loses keys - arg!) and I'm definitely coming back to Chiarugi to get them made. While waiting for the keys, I browsed around. Everything was very neat. Turns out they have wine and beer making equipment so if I ever take the plunge to brew my own beer, I'll be coming to Paul to get started with expert guidance. Side note - this place is also one of the last remnants of the once vibrant Little Italy community that Daley mercilessly destroyed when planning/building UIC. You can find old pictures of the community protests and rallys at the time at the library or history museum. It's really a shame. Come buy your Little Italy memorabilia here too. They also seem to be dog friendly - while I was there, a woman from the neighborhood came in with her little beagle and she chatted with another woman who was working.

0.description: Rick is amazing, smart, warming, very hands on. My husband does business with Rick and he is a perfectionist.  His furniture is amazing he did our daughter's bed, re did my father in laws chair after he passed and it's gorgeous.  Rick take dedicated work to his designs!

3.description: I had Paula do make up for my friend and I when we were going out for a long night out with our boyfriends.  We both are completely different people with different ideas of what we wanted done but we knew we wanted our make up to look just as good at the end of the night as it did at the beginning .  After asking us how we wanted our make up to look and if there was anywhere we wanted to emphasize Paula got to work.  It all didn't take very long and she was done!  I looked in the mirror and couldn't believe how happy I was and so was my friend. Also my make up looked so good all night long.  I am so used to going to the bathroom to keep touching up my make up but that night i didnt have to worry about that, it stayed on all night!! Not only did Paula do our make up but she also helped us with our hair and clothes because she had come to our house!  She was so helpful and sweet and fun that I would definitely recommend her to anybody!   Thanks Paula!!!

1.description: Paula is an AMAZING makeup artist, she's a wonderful, talented person to be around and she is very professional in her demeanor. She has high grade makeup products, she stands by her products and her company, she arrived early to her appointment and is eager to make you happy on your special day! I would definitely recommend City Lights to anyone, she get's it done the right way; seriously you will be impressed!

2.description: I really enjoyed working with Paula and City Lights Makeup. She arrived on time and ready for the job, with a professional attitude and good spirits. She's very talented in her work and I would recommend her and her business to anyone.

0.description: Paula is fabulous.  I haven't looked this amazing..well...ever! She showed up on time and gave me the exact look I wanted and more. I came in town for a wedding and wanted to make heads turn and she helped me do just that. I got compliments every 5 minutes while at my event! She did both my hair and make up. The products she used were top notch. My skin hasn't felt that amazing and soft in a while.

4.description: Paula was so amazing on my wedding day! All my girls and I looked incredible! She is so easy to work with and so talented! I am so happy with how everything turned out. I highly recommend Paula for any occasion!

12.description: Lower star rating because of the rude and less than helpful cashier named Sheree. I had a coupon but she wouldn't honor it because the barcode was "too blurry" and wouldn't scan. I ended up returning my entire purchase of six sports bras and four pairs of Nike cropped pants because of her. I actually got the same items at Nordstrom Rack for about 30% less. Sheree, do the world a favor get a new job if you can't stand working there. Also bad selection on sizes. Mostly smalls and mediums in stock and hardly any larges.

7.description: It's so nice to have a Dick's in the city finally. They really rolled out the red carpet for the opening weekend. Well staffed with a plenty of friendly people to help you shop. I was able to get some new sportswear for the same price I would pay anywhere else (I wasn't expecting clearance items the first day it was open) but was kind of disappointed by their women's outdoor gear. They had plenty of men's Columbia gear but really nothing for women.Anyway, the store itself is massive, clean, and comprehensive. If you are shopping in the area or don't want to drive to the burbs to reach a Dick's, this is your place!

3.description: It's huge!It really is. I like it. Very professional customer service. First associate I asked was able to lead me directly to the item of my interest. Located in a brand new structure, (across from Southgate) it's also aesthetically pleasing. If they don't have an item in stock...free shipping if they order it for you. There are some grand opening specials that continue in through mid-July, so check out their weekly ad.

1.description: Sometimes some stores go overboard in their greetings, some even employ greeters, have to say never thought that would be a job, and others just flat out don't seem to even know you walked in. This Dick's falls in the last category. Not one person said hello, and no one inquired if I needed assistance either.This location is definitely geared towards clothing and accessories, there wasn't much in equipment. I was looking for an exercise bike and they do have many online, I wanted to see them. When it comes to certain items, I'm more of a touchy/feely must see it type. I wanted to check sizing and comfort. Let me save you the trip here if you're looking to compare, they only had one on display, and judging by the sale price when they move that one out, I doubt that they'll bring in any more, but then again there was no one to ask. This location left me uninspired. Too bad, because it's close to home.

2.description: What a well put together sporting store. I'm at this store shopping for a football for my son. I have to say my eyes were just lit up. It was just so many football's  to choose from It wasn't long that this nice looking and very nice guy said Hi.. His name and then  he said can I help you Well Gary was a great help to meI got a new basketball and football I did get a chance to walk around this store and it's loaded with all kinds of good stuff all kinds of sporting gear and champing gear.Whatever you want for a outfit at the gym.Trust me you will find what you need and moreDon't forget to sign up for your rewards cardYou can get special emails on sale items  through out the storeWelcome to south loop

9.description: I ordered a few things on line and needed to return a few.  The young person at the cash register was not big into customer service.  I had planned to replace the things I returned and get a bunch more.  The flat customer service was a turn off, I'll go elsewhere.  Too bad, it is convenient.

10.description: This store itself is brand new, clean, huge, and has an aesthetically pleasing layout to it...  ... my problem is that my preferences apparently don't overlap with the buyer's at all.  I've been here a few times looking for items that shouldn't have been that hard to find: a normal, long-sleeved t-shirt (all they had were the skin tight compression ones); Bears gear the weekend before the season opener (their entire men's selection was navy Cutler, Forte, and Allen jerseys... for a sporting goods store a mile from Soldier Field, I was expecting a much bigger section of Bears stuff than that); running pants; and Callaway golf balls.  Each time, I've left empty handed and disappointed.    Said differently?  This store is basically exactly the opposite of the Sports Authority on LaSalle: that store has the right merchandise in a terrible physical store.  Dick's on Canal seemingly has none of the right merchandise in a beautiful physical store.  An overhaul of their clothing section/strategy and I'd frequent this place!

13.description: I been buying all my kids and family things here. It's easier and closer but I asked Candice for help on my son bike . And received an attitude like I was wasting her time. I explained  I bought my son bike about 2 yrs ago but wasn't sure. I purchased  a warranty and I wast sure when it expired. She said she couldn't  help me and put me on hold and one of the managers got on the phone and gave me a number to call. I called 1866 no sweat warranty  they claim and talk to Gio and he said he could look up my information  for my son bike that I spent $500  .  This will be the last time I will ever go to this store . SERVICE SUCKS  when you need help your on your own . Very disappointed  I will take my business  some where else that can answer my questions without attitudes.

16.description: This store hadn't been open for a week when I stopped by with an extensive list of very specific items. The clerk that helped me, I think his name was Abid, was able to locate everything I asked him about with ease and gave me direction on the things I wasn't so knowledgeable about. Wonderful. The prices were great, the store was clean and organized. The cashier was also a personable, chatty girl that told me about opportunities to save and attractions in the newly developed neighborhood that I might enjoy. This relieved my headache from Sports Authority. This Dick's location has put together a really great team and I commend them and the manager who selected such great staff.

17.description: Great store and selection.. unless you are looking for anything fishing, then its super mediocre. I remember every Dicks I have ever been to has had a massive fishing selection. What do I have to drive to Niles for anything relevant now? Considering there is basically nowhere to shop for lake michigan fishing this is a huge let down.

15.description: Nice interior and shopping experience. Staff was approachable and helpful. Clean and in a near other major retailers.

0.description: Gotta be one of the biggest Dick's I've ever seen! Seriously, one could get lost in this stadium sized sporting goods store. They've got everything you could imagine from shoes to equipment to apparel and then some. The only criticism I have is that the staff doesn't seem to cover all the corners of the massive place. I probably searched for some assistance for about 10 minutes before I was able to find someone to get me a different size. They did just open though so I'm sure they'll iron out the kinks and earn that extra star.

5.description: We ordered golf shoes online and went to this location to pick it up as it would have been convenient..... Huge mistake, RUDE workers at customer service desk!  Unhappy, rude, don't want to be there kind of workers......They didn't have our order because we didn't pick it up on time?! It was supposedly delivered and was held for 2 days. And because we didn't pick the up shoes in time, they either sent them back or sold them.....unclear on their explanation.... If we could give them no stars, we would give them NO STARS! Save yourself the aggravation and go somewhere else.

11.description: Ginormous! Its a welcome addition to the growing shopping in the loop. I bought a pair of sneakers as a gift and had to return because it was the wrong size, it was a hassle free experience. Hope they get enough business and stay.

8.description: It's Dicks. It's a giant warehouse sports store. They have a bunch of sporting goods. I bought binoculars here. The staff is very helpful. The binoculars section is kind of hidden. I asked the lady in the shoes section where the binoculars were and she pointed to lodging. This place is enormous but I just blindly said "ah okay" and just walked towards where I thought lodging might be. I should've asked for clarification because about halfway towards "lodging" I realized I had no idea where I was going. It was too early and I was too lazy to turn back so just committed and kept moseying towards lodging; wherever that may be. I hate Xmas shopping but I guess it's an adventure. I guess.The one guy at lodging seemed disinterested in helping but I usually read the reviews of a product on my phone anyway. I don't blame him either. It's Dicks. Who gives a shitEither way I was in and out rather quickly. Everyone was super nice and I found what I was looking for; kind of a metaphor for life.

4.description: Great customer service. Haven't had many bad experience except when I returned about $200 worth of except use equipment that went faulty on me. Had to explain why it went faulty which isn't my job to do. Got my money back! So it all worked out, other Han that I'm always buying items here.

14.description: They took 10 days to restring and regrip two rackets. They did not call me when they were done. When I went to pick them up I saw the grips were not done properly. They offered to redo them but it would take another day or two, and I wasn't willing to wait any longer. I complained about the poor quality of work, how long it took, and that they didn't call me when finished. They just shrugged their shoulders and said,"Yeah, we're not very good with this stuff." So I'll give them 1 star for honesty.

6.description: Its huge, clean, so new it almost has that new car smell. Staff was pretty friendly. Huge selection on clothing,  which is separated into sections by brand. I liked that all the team gear was also separated into their own sections. I don't usually like having to ask people to open a dressing room for me, but  hey at least it was a very clean and roomy dressing room!
