3.description: I would have to admit that the Cafeteria at Northwestern Is so much better. I was stuck at Rush all day one day and the only option was to go here. I got a turkey burger that looked like it had been sitting in water for who knows how long it was not very tasty at all. Bu the bottled water was really good and I like the fact that they post the calorie count right there in front of the food. So I am giving them 3 stars.

1.description: Rush Cafeteria's MUCH improved! The last time I was here it was tiny, few choices with a bank of microwaves. Now, spacious seating, wide array of food choices. But ONE microwave.The single line corridor could be problematic when busy. The prices and choices are much better than Au bon pain on 4th floor.If you are hungry and at the hospital the cafeteria will give you the biggest bang for your buck.

2.description: Lets see how I can frame the lesser of two evil dining options at Rush in a fair light....this place has all the expected features of a hospital cafeteria: (shall we say) less than enthusiastic servers, stacks of big plastic containers filled with cheap generic ingredients, generous use of styrofoam and hot heavy porcelain plates, and gutloads of greasy, fried, cheesy crap.  Bigger negatives include cattle-feed style lines that are poorly designed and managed (there is only a one person-length little space against wall for people to go BOTH ways along the crowd), and the fact they got rid of their best asset:  the yogurt machine!  Pluses:  the cashier that always calls me "baby" and the "healthy" food line, which has good but grossly underestimated calorie counted fare.   What can I say, I'm stuck with it, otherwise its ABP (see earlier review).

5.description: I eat here because I go to school at Rush and am on campus pretty frequently. It's fine, it's a hospital cafeteria. I like that they have a small salad bar that isn't extremely expensive and a few other options, but I think it could be bigger and open more hours than they are (they close at 3:30pm during the week and are not open on the weekend, leaving one with the only choice but to eat at the more expensive Au Bon Pain in the main hospital, unless you leave the premises). Despite the fact that I've worked at hospitals and been going to school at one now, I am still surprised at how unhealthy most of the options are in a typical hospital cafeteria. Sure, they do offer some "lighter fare" as they call it, have a soup and salad bar and such. Still, the options could be better - at other hospitals where I've worked, the layout was far better, it was open much longer hours and catered more to those visiting patients (I assume that since the cafeteria isn't in the main hospital, it's not really seen as a priority). The layout is also pretty bad - you enter into a long corridor of food options, which is pretty narrow and makes it difficult during peak hours to get around with your tray and see what's actually being offered. I often have to wrestle my way around long lines of people, what they are waiting for I can't tell for sure because I can't see what's in front of them. I'm sure the new hospital will have some fancy-schmancy cafeteria to cater to those with more sophisticated tastes (and a price tag to match); for now it would be nice to have some better options.

6.description: Surprisingly easy to eat poorly in a hospital, and surprisingly difficult to find tasty healthful choices.  Also, pretty expensive considering the volume they push through.  The hours are terrible.  They're closed after 3pm and all weekend, as if there aren't hungry people in a hospital 24x7.  Eat here only if you have to.

0.description: Now they have Soul Veg vegan cuisine in the to-go fridge-- YAY Rush!

4.description: I love the cafeteria at Rush!  They have plenty of healthy options and post the calorie content on all of their food.  Personally I am a fan of the salad bar and their Rush burger and fries are absolutely to die for.  Oh, and did I mention the homemade rice krispie treats?!  I go to school at Rush and eat here almost everyday and I've never grown tired of it.

3.description: I've been buying hats from Sids for years now.  The last time I stopped by to pick up a summer hat, two salespeople just badgered the shit out of me.  I informed them that I know my price range and the style I have in mind, I'd just prefer to pick it out from the displayed hats at hand, but every few minutes I'd get pestered again.The hat I chose cost a decent amount of money, and has began to fray and wear prematurely (2 days after I bought it).  Upon calling the shop to request a replacement, I was told that it was my fault.  I'll be going elsewhere, which is a shame because I always liked this joint.

1.description: This is actually my second time shopping online with Sid's Clothing. I was EXTREMELY SATISFIED with the service on my recent order. I am from and I live 5 hours away in Detroit, Michigan; I placed my order for two hats in the morning on Monday Feb. 17, and the next day (not even a full 24 hours later) I received my hats on my front doorstep. I was so pleased that I had to send the owner, Howard Blair, an email- and that's rare because at times I can be a difficult customer to please. I have shopped many places online but this by far has to be the absolute best....the delivery, promptness, and product condition was impeccable. Heck, even the UPS delivery man was smiling! Sid's Clothing has definitely gained a customer for life. No more Henry the Hatter (popular Detroit hat store) for me.....thank you Sid's!

2.description: This place reminds me of an old blues duet, "Tramp,"where Carla Thomas calls Otis Redding a tramp, because he doesn't "wear continental clothes or a Stetson hat." He replies, "It makes me feel good to know one thing. I'm a lover. My mama was, my papa too." Well, you can buy a Stetson here. I haven't yet, but I've walked out with a Bailey, a Dobb's & a Kangol. A gentleman just looks proper in a fine hat. Yes, the sales guys can be a little too cloying (can you give a brother 6 or 7 feet and not look over my shoulder, either?!?). But they can be helpful once you need to try things on. Besides, the hats are exceptional and the place is old school.

5.description: This place does take credit cards, contrary to the listing. Full-service shop with knowledgable staff selling quality caps and hats. Mostly for men, but a couple for women and many women treat caps as unisex anyway. These guys will advise on what's 'in' and what looks good on you. We're lucky to have a place like Sid's in the city!

6.description: There is a mystical energy that some people exude when they slide on a hat...it's defined as "hatitude"...and, I, my fellow Yelper's, exude this style-ific energy from my pores.  Not that I am gloating (but, really I am)...it's just that some women find hats too masculine and therefore they don't feel confident in anything other than a winter ski cap. But, hats have been a part of the female wardrobe since, well, damn, I am not sure, but some fine examples are L'il House on the Prairie bonnets, Grace Kelly pill box hats, and any damn Sunday morning church-goer hat, which may come to mind.  For me, just as much as I like to be girlie and wear a fuzzy pink cashmere skull cap, I also like to embrace my masculine side and flop on a newsboy hat or a finely made Kangool.  I think hats are mysterious and sexy, and if you exude "hatitude" then dammit put'a'lid on it!Sids Hats is unsuspecting and you probably would never knew it existed unless you had "hatitude" or you were stuck in traffic while waiting to get on the Roosevelt Ave. entrance to the 90/94. For such an unsuspecting place, this place has some freakin' incredible hats! Whether you are looking for a gift for the person who possesses "hatitude" in your life, or you are a jazz musician, a business(wo)man, or a funky bitch who loves to sport a cool ass Kangool on a Saturday night, you have to check this place out.   Fun factor: I would suggest this spot as an unusual date spot.  The guys who own the store are pretty cool with letting you try on hats and more often than not we all wear a few different hats in life, so why not have fun with it.

7.description: I've never really been a hat guy.  This place being so close might change that.  Was almost forced to spend way more than I'd intended because of some of the specials they were running.  Located in the old Joffco Square strip on Roosevelt Rd.  Just west of the giant new hulking Joffco Square development.

0.description: Love Sids. Very happy with my new Wigens (casual) and Bailey (weekday) hats for the fall and winter.  Good quality and good service. It was also nice chatting with the owner Howard Blair.

4.description: This place is the best. If you need a hat - any kind of hat - you will find it here. The sales people actually know what they're talking about, which is a rarity at stores these days. They don't badger you - they just try to help you find what you want and get you a good price. Be nice to them and good things will come your way. They run great deals and there is parking in the back. Definitely worth a trip - even if it's slightly out of your way and not in a mall. No other place like this in the city. If you need a hat - or two or three-, go here. Oh, side note - they also have a nice selection of men's clothing - pants, coats etc. Not JUST a hat store.

3.description: Terrible ordering system! 1. We were told 1.5 hours for delivery2. Late over 30 minutes3. Nobody called to let us know about late order4. When we called, the Asian lady on the phone had just nasty attitude - basically deal with it5. I will never order from this place again!

1.description: This Popeye's is clean and the staff is fairly friendly. The chicken is delicious. Yes it's probably the same recipe as all Popeye's. It is not greasy. It's crunchy and the white meat was not dry.

2.description: It's 12:37 right now as I write this review and on yelp it says this restaurant is open until 2 in the morning. I came all this way to come and find out that it's closed. If this restaurant will not be open until the time it says it will, than change the fucking time so people won't waste theirs!

5.description: Got my chicken super fast, almost no wait. Had every option available, no waiting for spicy! Chicken was very fresh and hot.

6.description: Definitely the CLEANEST Popeye's I've ever seen in my life, not that I've been to many Popeye's.  It's right smack in the middle of University Village, and with the cheap prices, I'm sure it'll be a popular lunch spot with the UIC students.  Fast staff, decent fried chicken... I think it'll do well.  I'm knocking off a star because their "spicy" is definitely NOT spicy.

7.description: Popeyes chicken Halsted/Roosevelt

8.description: My second Popeye's review.  I love their fried chicken and Cajun style fries.  I am so happy they opened this place up that is only about 5-10 minutes walking distance.  It didn't seem like they would have any seating space in this location so I decided to walk over with my wife and our dog for pick-up.  It wasn't busy in there at all, but it was about a week before UIC starts so I am sure it'll get more business.  The staff was friendly and quick.  That's all you ask for in a fast-food joint.  Their menu, however, seem to have less family options though.

9.description: TERRIBLE! Driver swore he was on my block but  I was standing outside my house door on a cold night with only me and parked cars. Then the driver,  clearly Hispanic by his accent, started making racist comments and cursing at me because he obviously didn't have a GPS or  simply couldn't understand directions.  Never again.

0.description: I live really close to another Popeye's but their service is abysmal. I thought I'd venture out and travel a little bit further to find friendly service, and I'm so glad I did! This Popeye's is located around the UIC campus. It was clean, had a couple of seats in the place, and had a generally good vibe. They have deals on different days of the week, sadly I forgot to take pictures :( But, the people were nice and the service was fast. I am SO happy I have found my go-to Popeye's.

4.description: Compare to other Popeyes locations, this one is definitely the cleanest Popeyes! Tried to go to the downtown (near Harold college) and yuck! the table was sticky!The taste is the same as other Popeyes! I do think this location offer a varieties of affordable meal, probably because its on college spot?Tried their delivery once, and it was fast. Supposed to get here by 7.45, but the food got delivered 30 minutes early. Saw the previous comment where it stated that the driver was making racist comment, well it didn't happen to me! The driver (definitely not Hispanic because i saw him!) was nice and polite on the phone and in person!

1.description: Nothing special. Small sandwich shop offering basic subs and stock deli food. Prices are reasonable. If you're looking for a quick bite to eat, this place works, but don't expect anything fancy...

9.description: Conte Di Savoia West is a life saver. I recently moved in the area and boy it's not that easy to find a good meal for under $5 anymore...I come here specifically for their turkey pastrami sandwich with everything including peppers. When I'm working non-stop at home, it's definitely worth the few blocks I walk to pick one on these sub up!

23.description: This deli didn't do it for me. The first thing that struck me was that they had perdue brand meats in the display counter. the prosciutto sandwich i got just wasn't that good. super soggy and there were mustard smears on the bread from another sandwich.  the bread wasn't anywhere near the best spots in town. upsides. the prices are good and my boss said her roasted vegetable soup was incredible so i would go back for that. overall though, i would go back to graziano's, vinnie's, bari or fontano for their subs and continue my search for other joints.

5.description: Was in the area and saw this place. The front of the store had little fanfare and would be easy to pass by if not looking.  This little sandwich place is small with about 8 small tables for seating.  The staff was straight forward and matter of fact as out was during lunch and they had a consistent line which moved along quickly. This is a sandwich place. You pretty much order by the type of meat your want,the combo sandwich is Italian. I ordered' the Frank' sandwich- a toasted Italian with cheese and balsamic vinegar. It was delicious. There was ample meat and a nice portion of fresh mozzarella.  All for about $7for the 8inch version.  If you don't want to eat inside, there's a couple benches across the street to enjoy the outdoors. They also have some salads,soup, and chili. They offer canned and bottled drinks but no bottle water. They will give you tap water on request. A nice place to grab a sandwich with plenty of street parking in the area. Well, that is until this place becomes really popular

25.description: Picture this: your child's been arrested (probably charged with disorderly conduct for freaking out at the Rockwell Grill), so you have to go down to juvenile court. You're sitting in court, listening to the prosecutor wax poetic on the atrocities committed by little junior upon the fair citizens of Chicago. Then it hits you, "Boy, I could really go for a sandwich." Does the following scenario apply to you? Well fear not, there is an amazing deli right across the street! It's called Conte di Savoia, and they make the meanest Italian sub this side of the Atlantic ocean. Sandwiches come in the 6 or 8 inch variety, and I believe the Italian was nominated as one of the best Italian subs in the city (citation needed). For the record, I've also consumed the turkey as well as the meatball sub, although I try to refrain from eating the meatball too often, unless I want to do an angioplasty doctor search on Yelp. Not only are the sandwiches top notch, but they create some tasty soups, too. While not quite as good as my beloved Soupbox, they still are quite impressive, and vary every day. My favorites are the chicken and wild rice, Italian chili, and chicken and dumplings. Add a vast array of bottled beverages, and you have yourself a hearty meal to satisfy even the most sophisticated palate.However, a bit of advice: if you enjoy soup as much as I do, I would recommend arriving before noon. From the noon to one o'clock hour, there is inevitably a woman in line who decides to order 75 gallons of soup for her entire office, thus leaving chronic lunch procrastinators such as myself soupless and thus, quite sad.

12.description: Wow rudest employee I have ever dealt with anywhere! I called regarding an event for a local college and had to deal with the same person over the phone two days in a row-yesterday and today. They kept hanging up on me without even asking what I needed. They refused to let me speak to a manager or give me any contact information for anyone else or a time to reach a manager. They refused to provide me with their name. Not the way to do business.

21.description: Ditto my review for the original Conte Di Savoia, two words: Italian Sub!

16.description: small, dingy, not the cleanest.  The sammiches are ok but they pale in comparison to the original location.  I'd drive there and leave this dingy place alone...

17.description: Good food, helpful ladies working behind the counter, and the prices are extremely reasonable for how much food you actually get. It looks a little bare bones inside and kind of feels more like a deli than a sandwich shop, but I think that's all part of the charm.

10.description: I stopped in after work last week to grab a cold sandwich on a hot day. I was pleased to find that they have a $2.99 Italian Sub special after 2pm. The sandwich was good (a cut above Subway IMHO) and a great deal. Aside from that, it's a pretty standard lunchtime sandwich shop with "no frills". I will definitely be back.

11.description: great place for subs! prices not bad at all.

26.description: This is the little brother of the main restaurant further east on Taylor Street but both places make the best subs in the area.  They use great tasting, hearty fresh bread and top notch italian meats.  My faves are the proscuitto sub which comes with fresh mozzerella and the italian sub.

27.description: At my job we get Italian subs caterred from here fairly regularly.  They are great and come in almost all meat varieties as well as vegetarian.  Its a great place for the individual as well.  Its a great, freshly cut, sandwich place as well as stocking other Italian foods.

0.description: More of a 3.5 but I won't bog down the ratings for a decent place. I work nearby, and stop in more often in the winter for the changing daily soups - chicken rice, cheddar broccoli, chili, all pretty good. Small bowl with crackers for $2.99. Definitely a no muss, no fuss place, with a small, non-flashy storefront and half a dozen tables and a few drink coolers inside. Long, quick-moving line at lunch rush hour but also has sandwich discounts after 2 p.m. Pretty standard Italian sub/panini deli menu, and reasonably priced. I wouldn't travel far and wide to eat here, but it's a top choice for a quick, tasty lunch break in the area.

20.description: Not a huge sub eater, I often moan about the lack of variety of options in the Tri-Taylor area.  But Conte's won out. Conte's chicken salad is a win in my book.  I'm a chicken salad snob and usually don't like anyone's chicken salad other than my Mom's (and mine--but of course, I got my recipe from her.)  I was pleasantly surprised to see that they [Conte's] made their chicken salad VERY similar to mine. Their panini(s) are also delish. The lines can be a little crazy during lunchtime.  But service is usually fairly speedy.

19.description: Fresh sandwiches and great service!   I love the soups, and they are always good about letting me know the soups when I ask, despite how annoying I probably am about always asking.

2.description: Great tasting subs!  The menu doesn't indicate you can request a custom made sub.  I asked and they said you can.  My roast beef, pastrami, & prosciutto sub was excellent.  My only draw back from this establishment are their dirty dining room tables.  Every available table was dirty with bread crumbs and other things.  They need to have someone constantly wiping the tables as soon as patrons exit.  Someone did come out to wipe the tables.  However, it was after everyone had left except for me.  Next time, my order will be to go!

18.description: Not a huge sub eater, I often moan about the lack of variety of options in the Tri-Taylor area.  But Conte's won out. Conte's chicken salad is a win in my book.  I'm a chicken salad snob and usually don't like anyone's chicken salad other than my Mom's (and mine--but of course, I got my recipe from her.)  I was pleasantly surprised to see that they [Conte's] made their chicken salad VERY similar to mine. Their panini(s) are also delish. The lines can be a little crazy during lunchtime.  But service is usually fairly speedy.

13.description: Subs are ok, nothing special. Sides were not very good. Decor was pretty dingy and felt dirty. I could eat here again but why would you when there are so many better options.

4.description: Italian sub was great.  After two it's cheaper

24.description: I love everything about this place. The subs are awesome & the bread is nice & soft. Not like the rock hard bread at Bari subs.

6.description: Probably my favorite Italian restaurant sub in Chicago.  I've made a better one, but not many people are going to liberally add imported prosciutto, which would make tree bark taste better.Their lunch special is unbeatable.  I took a friend here who ordered something else, and I just stared at her blankly.  The bread is crispy, the meats are soft, the seasonings tangy and peppery... it's a fine, fine meal for under $5.You get in, you order, you get your food, you eat, and it's good.  An unusually short review for me, but that's what Conte Di Savioia is.  Good food, great deal, served fast.

22.description: A nice italian deli, will fix up a nice sandwich for you.  There is usally a long line here for lunch which is a good sign.  The bread they use here is good.  There is a nice variety of meats available here, which does well to distinguish this place among its many sub shop, neighbors and competitors.  Place feels more like a little deli that makes sandwiches than a sandwich shop, if that makes any sense.

15.description: Nuff Zedd. Soup is probably the only item I would get, BUT, they always run out so I just stopped trying!

7.description: Not your average sub sandwich menu, lots of rich traditional Italian meats and some I've never heard of like capocollo and mortadella.  I stuck with something I sorta knew, turkey pastrami.  The meat and cheese were cut to order for my sandwich.  I went with a 6", which was plenty for me.  They also have an 8".  But compared to other sub shops like Subway, it's a small 6".   What Conte Di Savoia lacks in girth, it makes up in meaty flavor.The turkey pastrami takes my favorite deli meat to a whole 'nother level; a nice flavorful peppery rind, thin sliced but still juicy, piled on a fresh and soft but tough crusted bread.  There was some cheese, lettuce, tomato and a little mayo in there too that just enhanced the rich flavors of the meat.4 stars, strictly based on food...Conte Di Savoia has much better flavor in their subs without having to add all kinds of special/secret sauces that prematurely leak out while your trying to eat.  This appears to be a case where size doesn't matter because the flavor is so big.*Most 6" subs are around $4.50, 8" subs are about $5.25...depending on which meat you choose.

8.description: I work nearby, and really like this place for lunch. All of their soups are very good, and I always get the turkey pastrami sandwich, which I love. Sandwiches are made quickly and the staff is friendly! Easy parking on the street.

3.description: Super fast, inexpensive and delicious. I love the prosciutto sub and the prosciutto panini, but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

14.description: Hello, FOOD SNOB here.Living in Northwest Indiana and working in Gary In. its hard to find a good Pannini Sandwich.   Well with the help of Yelp and a business venture into the city, this is where I stopped.   A Pannini with Grilled Eggplant, Artichoke and Roasted Peppers has got to be good.  And it was.  This place lives up to its tradition.    And a taste of my friends Italian Sub.  I would go back anytime.They had 4 differnt kinds of Soups.  They did not taste homemade but my chicken and dumpling did hit the spot.I also liked the variety of upscale soft drinks and most of all the choice of Potatoe Chips.  Thats right, like Salt & Vinigar, Blue Cheese, and Buffaloe wing flavor along with some others.

1.description: Insurance scam artists here.??   the vision "expert" wanted to charge the insurance company $500 for a $95 pair that I selected.  I get that it cost $48 a lens to make them turn dark in the sun.  However with my present plan I get $80 towards glasses every 2 years.  So my addition $95 + 96 = 191 - 80 = 111.  He quoted $192 plus they'd be charging the insurance the balance of $300. I'll never recommend VisionWorks to anyoneThat's just my opinion

9.description: This place is awful. AWFUL.I purchased a pair of glasses. Came back to pick them up, and they got the prescription wrong. After reading some of the other reviews of this location, I am shocked that MULTIPLE people have mentioned that the technicians have gotten their prescription wrong. Ridiculous. They told me to come back, yet again, to pick up my glasses with the correct prescription. I was annoyed, but what else could I do? However, I had a family emergency and ended up having to go out of town. With all that was going on, I forgot about the glasses.Fast forward a few months, and I went back to pick up the glasses. They said they didn't have them because I waited too long to pick them up. To some extent, I understood that. I had my receipts and everything, so I asked for a refund. They said they couldn't issue one because in the time that had passed, store management had changed. They told me to call Visionworks corporate to get a refund processed.I hounded these people on the phone to no avail. I ended up paying for glasses that I NEVER RECEIVED AND NEVER GOT A REFUND. These people are crooks. I will never give them my business again.

12.description: Really disappointing.  Went in search of prescription sunglasses and the guy working was less than interested in helping me.  They also advertise a pair of glasses for $49.95 but all of their sunglasses were priced $149 and above.  Not worth a visit at all.

21.description: If you schedule an appointment for an eye exam try to meet with Dr Papavich (sp?).  Dr Patel has no personality and comes off very stand-off-ish.  She acts as though she has better things to do than give you an eye exam.  It's too bad she actually has to interact with other humans.  These are the only two doctors that can administer an eye exam.  Overall, the rest staff is somewhat attentive.  If you are looking a large variety of frames this may not be the store for you.  They only carry a variation of roughly 20 styles.  Too bad there are not many other choices for glasses in the south loop.

16.description: Don't take for granted that their testing equipment gives you the correct prescription.  Go to your own optometrist or opthalmologist for your prescription.  They made 3 bad pairs of glasses, telling me that the prescription they prescribed was correct (they even used the machine to double check).  I finally decided to go to my regular opthalmologist for my prescription and this prescription was perfect.  I was so fed up with going there and not getting the correct lenses.  I must admit, though, that the people there try hard, especially Jordan.  He spent a lot of time with me and even told me initially that my old glasses which were perfect for my eyes (and identical to my new correct script from my opthalmologist) was not the same as the script they kept making for me, which the other techs said were identical.   Total waste of many weeks of living with a horrible pair of glasses until l finally brought the script from my opthalmologist.  Never again will I have them examine my eyes.

17.description: For a national chain, this isn't that bad of an experience - provided that you have some idea of what you need.  I can't speak from a standpoint of a consumer who is just starting to need vision correction, as I've been wearing contacts and glasses for a very long time now.  Location: 4 out of 5Close for me.  It's in the shopping complex with Whole Foods, Panera, Marshalls, and DSW.  Public transportation is a breeze, and they do have validated parking in case you need it.Scheduling: 5 out of 5Pretty easy to schedule.  I was able to get an appointment when I wanted.  I did NOT get a reminder call, but that was fine.Amenities: 3 out of 5The main store is actually quite spacious and clean; there is a smaller waiting room in the back where you can sit and wait on the optometrists before your appointment.  The waiting room isn't exactly large, or well-lit, or interesting, but it serves its purpose.  The actual areas of treatment or pre-screening are well-maintained and clean.  As others have said, the machines look a little outdated, but they work.  The color-blindness assessment book is literally falling apart.  Maybe they could look into getting a new one.  They also have an in-house lab that can make the lenses.  Neat!Retail Employee Customer Service: 4 out of 5I had a young lady help me during my entire visit; I can't remember her name, but it may have been Juliette.  She was very friendly and courteous.  Perhaps not as fast or as efficient as I've ever experienced, but she was careful and didn't make any mistakes with entering my orders, taking care of insurance stuff, etc.  She also does your prescreening with the glaucoma test, one set of automated machines, and the color-blindness assessment book.  Dr. Popovic Customer Service: 5 out of 5Dr. Popovic was everything I needed an optometrist to be.  Contrary to what an earlier poster had said, she actually did use the flip lens machine for me, but that's because I needed spectacles as well as contact lenses.  I mean, if you think about it - you can't get an accurate prescription for contact lenses using glass lenses that are placed farther away, right?  RIGHT?  Case in point, my contact lens prescription is actually about 1.5 points less myopic than my spectacle lens Rx.  I appreciated the fact that Dr. Popovic allowed me to choose my prescription for spectacles within reason.  One setting allowed me to see a little better, but another still looked good (not quite as sharp) but put less strain on my eyes.  The rest of the eye exam was nondescript, but I thought she did a very nice and thorough job without being pushy or condescending.  Dr. Popovic actually has a very dry, almost "nerdy" sense of humor in a nice way.  While she was looking through the contact book, she said, "Hey, Target has their own brand...what if we made our own brand and called them the V Dub brand?"  Ahhh...actually - most of the blue tinted 55 lenses are made by Cooper Vision; each retailer just orders their own variation in packaging.  But they are all the same.  Pricing: 3 out of 5Insurance covered the exam and gave an allowance that allowed me to get a years worth of contacts (actually, more because even though the contacts are advertised as 2 week lenses, I can stretch mine out to about 2 months with proper cleaning and care).  Since I am almost as blind as a bat, I need high index spectacle lenses, which get pricey.  Luckily, insurance paid for half of that.  Selection of Items: 4 out of 5I mean...since they can order contacts of many varieties, contact lenses shouldn't be a problem.  Spectacle frames, as others have said - are 'limited', in the same way that CarMax doesn't usually carry Ferraris.  If you want boutique frames, you can always just take your Rx to a place that has them.  For me, and because I wear my glasses only at night, the 69$ frames were just fine.Overall: 4 out of 5No real complaints here.  Understand that because of the location, you'll get self-aggrandizing people in the store once in awhile, as well as others who think and act as slowly as molasses.  Since my appointment was early on a Friday, I didn't have any issues.  As Laxal S. said, Dr. Popovic is probably the better optometrist to see.  I didn't interact with Dr. Patel directly, but from the few moments I watched her coming in to the store, I did notice that seemingly (in her mind), she has "better things to do" and "better things to talk about" than say, patient care or checking on the schedule, or making sure that the store is up and running correctly.  And that's fine if you want to talk during a break time or when there are no people in the waiting room, but as with any commodity or retail environment, a certain degree of discretion should be exercised when there are clients or customers around.

10.description: I've come in to this location a few times now and I just won't be coming back to purchase anything.BUT if you need to get your eyes checked, the optometrist that works there is really sweet and amazing! She really took the time to listen to my concerns and to answer my questions. Just beware of the staff when they charge you for your appointment!Otherwise, the staff here is slow to help and are not friendly. Even though I had vision insurance, they charged me for the full eye exam, and when I brought this up at a later time, they said they could not give me my money back b/c they can't "refund" me for an exam. Their solution was for me to figure it out on my own and have my insurance refund me instead! With this kind of customer service, I will not be back.

5.description: The doctors here are both really great, attentive, and there hasn't been any turnover in the several years I have been going there,  The staff is not as stellar, however, which is frustrating. They often don't know know what is going on when you come for an appointment or call on the phone.  It is too bad because the doctors are very competent and the prices are pretty good.  Just be prepared to waste time explaining who you are and what you want to the staff each time you come for an appointment or call on the phone.

11.description: It's been awhile since I'd been to an eye doctor.  It was time.  I read a ton of reviews for offices and doctors and decided this would be a good fit for me.  I easily scheduled my appointment with the Dr. who has many many good reviews.However....two days before my appointment, I thought I "lost" a contact lens in my eye.  I was freaked out enough after trying to get the lens out that I called Visionworks to see if I could move my appointment to that day.  I had hoped the Dr. I scheduled an appointment with would be available but unfortunately she was not.  I crossed my fingers and hoped I wouldn't end up with the Dr. others have said has a "cold" demeanor.  Guess what!!! I was seen by another Dr. that was FANTASTIC.  Marielle Serenda OD.  What makes Dr. Serenda so great?1.  She didn't lecture me about my bad contact lens wearing habits.  We did talk about the ramifications I could face if I continued doing what I was doing (sleeping, EVERY night in my contacts ... FOR MONTHS).2.  She was SO VERY pleasant3.  She took her time and I never felt rushed AT ALL !!!4.  She answered ALL of the questions that I asked5.  Twice she asked if I had any additional questions6.  She was extremely thorough7.  Did I mention that she is extremely pleasantIf Dr. Serenda relocates, I might just follow her to her new office/location.I also appreciated that I felt NO, ZERO, ZILTCH, NADA pressure from the staff to purchase glasses &/or contact lenses.  Even when I came back for a contact lens check (1 week after my appointment), I wasn't pressured AT ALL.  Oh, about the 'lost' contact....it must have popped out in the shower, silly me :)

22.description: The staff here is pleasant to work with. They do not try to rush you they let you take time to pick the frames you like and are comfortable with. They will also take the time to make sure that you are selecting the best frame based on your needs. Dr Popovich gives a very through exam she takes her time and does not try an rush you to finish the exam more quickly. She also explains things to use in a straight forward manner. Overall I had a very positive experience at this location.

0.description: I went to Visionworks for an eye exam and was so impressed that I had to review it.  Two things that made it stand out to me: 1) the optometrist was a great teacher--as she analyzed my photos, she walked me through the process of what she was looking for, so I could see what she was seeing in the photos; she helped me to understand the elements that maintain moisture in eyes and the reason why my eyes got watery because they were dry; she even explained why it's totally normal that my 4 month old has grey circles on the whites of his eyes. I walked away better informed about eye health. 2) the gentleman supporting me around fittings, etc. was conscious of my costs--he let me opt into the tests I wanted and explained why I might/ might not need them and what the costs were (typically--outside of dilating my eyes--I don't get asked which procedures I want to go through);  He helped me choose glasses and--rather than pressuring me to buy the pair I chose--he wrote down the information and encouraged me to look around for the best price since Visionworks is outside of network for VSP.  I appreciated this and--after shopping around--will be returning to get my glasses there to take advantage of the 50% discount on a frames + lens package that they offer for anyone with BCBSIL medical insurance.  I highly recommend-- I am usually pretty ambivalent about where I get my eyes examined/ glasses, but I will definitely be returning here.

20.description: For a national chain, this isn't that bad of an experience - provided that you have some idea of what you need.  I can't speak from a standpoint of a consumer who is just starting to need vision correction, as I've been wearing contacts and glasses for a very long time now.  Location: 4 out of 5Close for me.  It's in the shopping complex with Whole Foods, Panera, Marshalls, and DSW.  Public transportation is a breeze, and they do have validated parking in case you need it.Scheduling: 5 out of 5Pretty easy to schedule.  I was able to get an appointment when I wanted.  I did NOT get a reminder call, but that was fine.Amenities: 3 out of 5The main store is actually quite spacious and clean; there is a smaller waiting room in the back where you can sit and wait on the optometrists before your appointment.  The waiting room isn't exactly large, or well-lit, or interesting, but it serves its purpose.  The actual areas of treatment or pre-screening are well-maintained and clean.  As others have said, the machines look a little outdated, but they work.  The color-blindness assessment book is literally falling apart.  Maybe they could look into getting a new one.  They also have an in-house lab that can make the lenses.  Neat!Retail Employee Customer Service: 4 out of 5I had a young lady help me during my entire visit; I can't remember her name, but it may have been Juliette.  She was very friendly and courteous.  Perhaps not as fast or as efficient as I've ever experienced, but she was careful and didn't make any mistakes with entering my orders, taking care of insurance stuff, etc.  She also does your prescreening with the glaucoma test, one set of automated machines, and the color-blindness assessment book.  Dr. Popovic Customer Service: 5 out of 5Dr. Popovic was everything I needed an optometrist to be.  Contrary to what an earlier poster had said, she actually did use the flip lens machine for me, but that's because I needed spectacles as well as contact lenses.  I mean, if you think about it - you can't get an accurate prescription for contact lenses using glass lenses that are placed farther away, right?  RIGHT?  Case in point, my contact lens prescription is actually about 1.5 points less myopic than my spectacle lens Rx.  I appreciated the fact that Dr. Popovic allowed me to choose my prescription for spectacles within reason.  One setting allowed me to see a little better, but another still looked good (not quite as sharp) but put less strain on my eyes.  The rest of the eye exam was nondescript, but I thought she did a very nice and thorough job without being pushy or condescending.  Dr. Popovic actually has a very dry, almost "nerdy" sense of humor in a nice way.  While she was looking through the contact book, she said, "Hey, Target has their own brand...what if we made our own brand and called them the V Dub brand?"  Ahhh...actually - most of the blue tinted 55 lenses are made by Cooper Vision; each retailer just orders their own variation in packaging.  But they are all the same.  Pricing: 3 out of 5Insurance covered the exam and gave an allowance that allowed me to get a years worth of contacts (actually, more because even though the contacts are advertised as 2 week lenses, I can stretch mine out to about 2 months with proper cleaning and care).  Since I am almost as blind as a bat, I need high index spectacle lenses, which get pricey.  Luckily, insurance paid for half of that.  Selection of Items: 4 out of 5I mean...since they can order contacts of many varieties, contact lenses shouldn't be a problem.  Spectacle frames, as others have said - are 'limited', in the same way that CarMax doesn't usually carry Ferraris.  If you want boutique frames, you can always just take your Rx to a place that has them.  For me, and because I wear my glasses only at night, the 69$ frames were just fine.Overall: 4 out of 5No real complaints here.  Understand that because of the location, you'll get self-aggrandizing people in the store once in awhile, as well as others who think and act as slowly as molasses.  Since my appointment was early on a Friday, I didn't have any issues.  As Laxal S. said, Dr. Popovic is probably the better optometrist to see.  I didn't interact with Dr. Patel directly, but from the few moments I watched her coming in to the store, I did notice that seemingly (in her mind), she has "better things to do" and "better things to talk about" than say, patient care or checking on the schedule, or making sure that the store is up and running correctly.  And that's fine if you want to talk during a break time or when there are no people in the waiting room, but as with any commodity or retail environment, a certain degree of discretion should be exercised when there are clients or customers around.

19.description: I had a terrible experience at this place. I passed this place on Saturday, on my way to pick up art supplies. I'm a bit overdue to update my prescription as I never seem to find the time. I had a bit of time, so I figured I would pop in and see if they accepted walk-ins. They did, and they had frames I liked, so I agreed to wait until the doctor was finished with the previous appointment. I went into the waiting area, which is really more of a hallway with some chairs. It was a bit dingy and uncomfortable, and there were some rambunctious teenagers sitting right next to me, so I was eager to walk back to the main area to turn in my preliminary forms. The retail clerk ordered me to sit back in the waiting room and that someone would collect my forms, so I did. I had a woman take me for the two preliminary exams. I made a bit of a joke, which she promptly ignored. She then informed me she would be giving me a glaucoma test. I didn't want the puffs in my eyes, and I told her that I thought I had opted out (there were a number of tests to opt out of). She told me, "You CAN'T opt out of it." I explained that, if that was the case, that I didn't want the test, since I didn't want any tests that would put anything into my eyes. So, she wrote a note on her sheet, and made me sign that I was opting out. Then, Dr. Patel saw me. I found her to not only be standoffish, but downright rude. First, she tested my peripheral vision. She took off my glasses and told me to look at her nose and not her fingers, as she ran her fingers in front of my eyes from side to side. I've worn glasses for over thirty years, and my vision is terrible, so unfortunately, her nose was quite blurry. No matter how hard I tried, I would accidentally focus on her fingers, since it was the most prominent object in front of me. Every time, she'd snap, "look at my nose and not my fingers." I attempted, in a humorous and light-hearted way, to explain that I was doing my best, but that her fingers were "a rapidly moving object in a sea of blurriness." She decided not to test my peripheral vision after that. She did a variety of tests with the machine, asking me to pick which lens was better. She went very quickly and so I had to keep asking her to show me the lenses again. She seemed very annoyed and impatient, but while she would agree to show them to me, at no point did she take the hint and slow down the pacing. Afterwards, she pointed out that I had declined the glaucoma test. When I explained I didn't want it that day, she gave me a long speech about it, saying, "you're in your forties now, you aren't in your twenties anymore" in a rather chastising tone more suitable to an older relative than a professional.  (This was especially odd coming from someone who looked and behaved as if she had only been out of school for a few years herself.) However, at no point, did she provide me with any factual information whatsoever, but rather just preached a bit. When I went home, I was curious, so I looked up information online and found that 40 is the age after which you become at risk. I just turned 40 this year. Had she provided even that much information, she would have been considerably more persuasive. After reprimanding me for not taking the test, she made me sign in two additional places (besides the one place I had already signed with the previous woman). I then selected my glasses. The retail sales clerk looked at the glasses I had chosen and then said, "I see you've chosen these frames. I know you want to be fashionable, but your vision is really bad, may I suggest these instead?" and pulled out a pair of wire frames. I dislike wire frames and the frames I picked are actually quite similar to the frames I have now. My husband and I both tried to explain that to him. He kept trying to sell me on the wire frames until I had to very firmly explain that the frames I picked are the frames I wanted to buy.Today, I went to pick up my frames. Aesthetically, they looked just fine, but when I put them on, I instantly became aware that they were the wrong prescription. I compared them to my other frames several times to make sure it wasn't just an issue of adjusting to a new prescription. I then noticed a sign hanging from the store ceiling, so I read it with both glasses. I could actually read the sign better with my old prescription! So, I insisted that I get my money back, under their 30-day money-back guarantee. First, I was told that I had to wait for the manager to get back from lunch. The manager kept trying to persuade me to take another exam to correct the prescription. After about 30 minutes, they finally processed my refund and I left, never to return.

2.description: Doc gave me the wrong prescriptions for contacts. Then when I picked up glasses they gave me wrong ones. Never offered an apology. Finally offered a re-exam but took another few weeks to obtain glasses. Horrible experience and committed malpractice.

18.description: I have a few experiences with this Vision Works.  I have gone there a couple of times to fix the screws on my sunglasses.  I was merely looking for a kit that included screws so I could fix them.  Instead, they fixed them for me on the spot and cleaned my sunglasses.  I didn't purchase them from the store nor were they prescription glasses.  The representative did tell me that they are not liable if they broke my sunglasses.  I was fine with that.  They were doing more than I expected in the first place.I started getting headaches while I was at work.  Someone mentioned they had a similar problem from eye strain and that I should get my eyes checked.  I didn't get my glasses the same day as my appointment.  Juliette answered a slew of questions for me when I went in for my eye exam as this was the first time I needed to purchase glasses and told me what my insurance offered for me.  When I went to purchase my glasses, Adolph was a joy and wonderful!  He made the experience fun, and with him, I probably didn't need to bring someone else to help me find glasses that work with my face!  He and my boyfriend spent about 45 minutes with me to make sure I didn't look ridiculous.  To top it off, his and Ray's customer service was fantastic!  When Juliette and I spoke the first time, she said if you are in by 3pm, you can get them the same day if lenses are in stock.  I went in on Tuesday 8/28 around 6pm just hoping I would be able to pick up the glasses on Wednesday.  Ray agreed to stay a little later for me so he could get my glasses done by the end of the day.  Now I have my glasses and, hopefully, my headaches while at the computer will stop.  Just fantastic customer service.  It has been quite a while since I had this sort of customer service.

13.description: So my boyfriend and I went here twice in two weeks..... We both needed an eye exam and he need glasses.  So here we go we went last Sunday.  We were da first ones in there when they opened at noon.  The bitchy manager said we do take walk ins but people who have appointments take priority so we were like ok.  So around 1230 I was called in for my pre exam.  Then shortly after the doctor did da exam.  So time goes by its like 145 by this point. I go out to the front desk and ask when will my BF be seen.  The manager said I thought I made it clear to you that whoever has appointments take priority.  By this time it was 2pm so we were there two hours at this point.  Then the manager checks and said my BF is next.  So its almost 230 now and the doctor comes back out and calls somebody else and not my BF.  So we got up and went back to the desk and said I just wanted to pay for the eye exams.  The manager came back up and changed his who attitude and said she didn't take you oh im sorry let me give you a free eye exam and get you an appointment so we made it for today a week later.Now back to today on Sunday we get there early as usual 10 min to 12 then 12 comes by and its almost 1215 all da staff is waiting outside da store.  Then the manager same guy as last weeks comes and says oh sorry.  So we get and and my BF was first he sees da doctor.  He got his prescription.  We go out front and he looks at glasses. We waited another 30 min to get help.  Almost two hours we were done and a week later my BF ordered his glasses.  So my advice to his place and da manager doesn't matter if somebody as an appointment or not.  CUSTOMER SERVICE is da key word here.

4.description: I recently had an eye exam here from Dr. Patel as my current contact lens prescription was about to expire.    She got the prescription correct but insisted that I change my brand of lenses to a much more expense type of disposable brand.  I've been using the current brand by Bausch and Lomb for ten years without incident.  She would not give me the prescription so I got up and left, $100 lighter as my exam fee would not be refunded.She refused to write a prescription for Bausch and Lomb saying that was not a current brand but happened to have a large supply of the more expensive brand in stock.  Go figure. (I've since been to other eye care providers who disagree and will not hassle me).  Dr. Patel's customer service personality is very poor, almost as if she didn't like working with people.  Very cold person, probably more suited to technical work in a lab, away from customers.  I will never go back to Visionworks and I tell as many of my friends that I can that this place is to be avoided.   There are better places to get an eye exam in the city, such as Dean Optical.

6.description: Is it possible to give a negative star review? I can't even get into how awful this place is without wanting to hurl my iPad across the room, so just never go

15.description: Working behind a computer all day for a living, my previously perfect 20/20 vision has degraded over the last couple of years to a post-work day squinting & head ache.I have been wearing glasses (for work only... my "computer glasses") as a result for a little over a year now, and recently I noticed the symptoms return... head aches, sore eyes, an over-worked frontal lobe...Fast-forward to my quickly scheduled appointment at Visionworks. I took with me my current pair of glasses & went through the usual eye exam.Upon seeing the Optometrist, she was insightful, professional & even personal. She made a point to listen to my concerns, share a laugh here & there & when all was said & done... I am now the proud owner of an excellent pair of new "computer glasses" that are helping me write this very review. I was pleased with their $99 deal that allowed for 2 pairs of glasses plus the eye exam. Worth it.

7.description: I had a very good experience here. I thought I would add my two cents since there aren't many recent reviews:1. Dr P. was wonderful. I have never worn eyeglasses before, but after having some eye strain I decided to come in for an annual exam (I hadn't had one in years). I am 23 and know nothing about how glasses work. Dr. P sat me down, explained everything to me in simple terms, and tweaked the autorefractor prescription based on what I saw in the lenses she showed me. Afterwards, she put in trial lenses and gave me them to me to look around. (MIRACLE! How did I get through those big college lectures without 20/20 vision?)2. Dr. P spent time talking with me about my recent move to Chicago, and wrote a bunch of cool places to go/eat on the back of her business card. She wasn't rushing me at all. She let me know her hours and and told me to call any time if I had questions.3. Since this is my first pair of glasses, I was completely lost when it came to choosing frames/lenses. The staff there took tons of time helping me and being completely honest. She even went out of her way to get the price down as much as she could, and compared the store pricing with my insurance to make sure I was getting the cheapest deal. (Turns out, the store deal was $30 less than if I used my insurance!)4. Parking was okay. There is a parking garage but you must pay.5. I haven't picked them up yet, so I suppose this review is tentative, but my experience so far with the exam + picking out glasses + ordering them went very smooth. Would recommend again.

8.description: Very good experience. I don't wear glasses, but after feeling quite a bit of eyestrain after work, I decided to get my eyes examined for the first time since 1996. Dr. Castro was very pleasant and on-time for my appointment. Went through all of the tests, and determined that my eyes were just slightly less than perfect. Told me that she would write the lowest power prescription for me, but that it was my option to fill it because it was unlikely that it would provide me any noticeable benefit. I really appreciated this candor, which meant one less sale for the store.When I pressed her on the cause for the eyestrain, she told me that I simply need to rest my eyes more often during the day. If only I could have figured that out on my own...

3.description: I visited this location last week because I was overdue to have my yearly exam for my contact prescription.  I called on a Monday, and they were able to easily work me in on Wednesday.  I did not purchase any glasses or any contacts (I have been ordering mine online for years).  So this review is based on my interaction with the staff members.  The front staff and the assistant to the doctor were all professional and friendly, but the true shining star in this office is the doctor that was working that day, Dr. Popovic.  Dr. P is a very personable doctor who immediately puts you at ease.  She took her time, and made sure I was very comfortable with the change in my prescription (she even took me out to the front office to so I could really look around and test out the new lenses).  Also, she didn't try to talk me into any unnecessary testing.    I'll admit, I was hesitant to go try this office initially because of some of the negative Yelp reviews, but I would definitely go back - based solely on my interaction with Dr. Popovic.

14.description: So my boyfriend and I went here twice in two weeks..... We both needed an eye exam and I need glasses.  So here we go we went last Sunday.  We were da first ones in there when they opened at noon.  The bitchy manager said we do take walk ins but people who have appointments take priority so we were like ok.  So around 1230 my bf was called in for his  pre exam.  Then shortly after the doctor did his exam.  So time goes by its like 145 by this point my bf goes out to the front desk and asked when will my BF  be seen.  The manager said I thought I made it clear to you that whoever has appointments take priority.  By this time it was 2pm so we were there two hours at this point.  Then the manager checks and said my I was next.  So its almost 230 now and the doctor comes back out and calls somebody else and not me.  So we got up and went back to the desk and my bf and I said we just want to pay for the eye exams.  The manager came back up and changed his attitude and said she didn't take you oh im sorry let me give you a free eye exam and get you an appointment so we made it for today a week later.Now back to today on Sunday we get there early as usual 10 min to 12 then 12 comes by and its almost 1215 all da staff is waiting outside da store.  Then the manager same guy as last weeks comes and says oh sorry.  So we get in and I was first to see the doctor.  I got my prescription.  We go out front and I look at glasses. We waited another 30 min to get help.  Almost two hours we were done and a week later I ordered my glasses.  So my advice to his place and da manager doesn't matter if somebody as an appointment or not.  CUSTOMER SERVICE is da key word here.

58.description: I am a very picky person. I am basically every salon's worst nightmare. I loved this place. The decoration isn't that fancy, but the customer service and the work they do make up for it. I have gotten my eyebrows done twice. The last time was by Nikki and I loved her. She did a great job threading my eyebrows and was relatively painless. She put on hand sanitizer before I asked (this is rare for all the different threading places I've been). She was friendly and fast and remembered to put aloe on my skin. Eyebrows are sisters, not twins, but mine look great. Will definitely return to Nikki.

56.description: Really disappointed...I usually go to the burbs to get my threading done but I was in a pinch so tried this place. I've been before and it was okay which is the only reason I didn't give them 1 star. After a 35 minute wait, I had my turn. This was the MOST PAINFUL  threading I've ever experienced (and I've been threading since I was 14). The lady cut my lip so bad and when I told her, she justified it saying she had to get close to my skin. After I showed her the bleeding Kleenex and she denied that it was still bleeding. Really?!? I didn't even get an apology... I can understand a few small cuts because I know it happens with threading but this is really bad. I can say I won't be going back. Overall- long wait- not courteous to customers- did an okay job with my eyebrows - rough / painful threading

29.description: Ask for Lubna, She is really good and oh so sweet! I have gotten a  full body wax and threading done from here and have always been happy.

42.description: The Threading Salon is fantastic! Where do I even begin...All of employees are super friendly and greet you the moment you enter. Neelu, the owner, is the nicest person you will ever meet, and does such an exceptional job at threading. She is precise and truly listens to what the client wants. I am someone who is very particular about my eyebrows and I truly trust her. She goes above and beyond to accommodate the client. She never disappoints! Nikki is equally amazing, both at eyebrows and waxing. She makes you feel at ease when you are with her pays attention to detail. She is so sweet and professional. I would ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND this place! They have GREAT prices and so many different services! I am grateful that The Threading Salon has come to Taylor Street and I cannot imagine going anywhere else.

23.description: Not sure why I keep cheating on the ladies of The Threading Salon with these awful places on Madison and in Lakeview. All of the ladies in this salon are truly phenomenal at what they do and are hands down the best in the area; hell they are the best outside of the area! It's worth the trek to Taylor Street to be blessed by the eyebrow goddesses. Except the mean older one with the glasses that always has an attitude. She's not that great, but everyone else is very skilled and pleasant. Price is right, get there early to avoid the lines.

47.description: I had a great experience here when I came in on this past friday. The place was busy, and there were five people ahead of me. The wait wasn't too bad, because within 20 to 25 minutes it was my turn. The threading for eyebrows only cost seven dollars which is cheap for Chicago. When I did my research, it seems that most places charge ten dollars and the cost can go up to 25 dollars at some salons.Anyway, It was my first time visiting this place in a long time, but I gave the eyebrow lady my usual specific instructions. At most place I have been to, I feel like the eyebrows lady doesn't follow my instructions. The end result is never what I ordered. A lot of the times I end up with eyebrows that are too thin, arched, or my skin has cuts, or I am missing hair.But this was not the case here! The lady here did an amazing job with my eyebrows! She gave me exactly what I wanted! I was so happy with the result. She also completed the eyebrow within about five minutes!I recommend this place for threading! Totally worth it!

8.description: Can be a bit crowded but waiting for Lubna is worth it she does an amazing job. Also been there for other services, they offer underarm lighting it works great and they use a natural bleach with no irritation.

31.description: I've been coming to this spot for three years. All the ladies do a good job but Lubna is my favorite. She makes me feel valued and welcomes me like family every two weeks. The wait can be long so I recommend getting there as soon as they open. The wait wouldn't be as bad if there was a bigger waiting area and parking can be hit or miss. But Lubna keeps me loyal and for $7 it is well worth it.

34.description: Nikki is by far the best at what she does! She always polite, courteous, attentive, talented, and loves what she does as it is demonstrated through her work! I've been loyal to this salon for over 3 years and will continue to go there as long as Nikki is there. For the amount that you pay you would think you were at a prestigious salon, but Nikki makes you feel as though you are! The best salon and service than any other salon in Chicago, definitely 5+ stars!

16.description: I had a great experience here when I came in on this past friday. The place was busy, and there were five people ahead of me. The wait wasn't too bad, because within 20 to 25 minutes it was my turn. The threading for eyebrows only cost seven dollars which is cheap for Chicago. When I did my research, it seems that most places charge ten dollars and the cost can go up to 25 dollars at some salons.Anyway, It was my first time visiting this place in a long time, but I gave the eyebrow lady my usual specific instructions. At most place I have been to, I feel like the eyebrows lady doesn't follow my instructions. The end result is never what I ordered. A lot of the times I end up with eyebrows that are too thin, arched, or my skin has cuts, or I am missing hair.But this was not the case here! The lady here did an amazing job with my eyebrows! She gave me exactly what I wanted! I was so happy with the result. She also completed the eyebrow within about five minutes!I recommend this place for threading! Totally worth it!

13.description: I don't trust the threading places in DSM (if there are any) so I decided to take a quick 10 min stop during my trip in Chicago to get my eyebrows threaded. They were getting too bushy!The place seemed pretty clean and there were about 2 people waiting ahead of me. I still got in and out in like 15 minutes though. The ladies were pretty chill. Cost me $7 + tip. I'd come again!

11.description: I love the ladies here. I used to get my eyebrows threaded by Nikki. One day Nikki wasn't in and I had the choice of coming back another day or letting another lady take over my brows. I was hesitant but I  decided to try it out. Since then I learned that all of the three ladies are great at what they do. They are all detail oriented and very caring. The lines get ridiculous here at times but It's. So. Worth. It. Keep up the great work ladies!

39.description: Meghavi is great at brow threading and body waxing. She's very friendly and professional. I'm only bringing my review down by one star because it's often crowded without enough seating. If you're getting body waxing, call for an appointment with Meghavi, so you don't have to wait.

37.description: Nikki is the best.. She is excellent with eyebrows!!Always a long line but they work quickly. Come early and expect to wait. Trust me it will be worth the wait.

0.description: The third time is the charm as they say, one more testimony for the hard workers in the salon. I have seldom see them take breaks and even struggle to make some time to grab a quick bite to eat..... its the dedication and sincere effort toward providing a five-star service! I had the opportunity to work with Saheeda this time around whose been consistently progressing in her hair removal skills. I also appreciated the genuine facial which was certainly relaxing during and rewarding later. Thank you!Yet again a fantastic experience! Saheeda was quick and very thorough at her work. And I got her name wrong previously, however very thrilled with her work again.

38.description: I was very disappointed when I made it just a few minutes after closing and literally begged for them to let me in and they just stood inside and shook their head no. There were other customers in there finishing up and one of the ladies was free and could have easily taken me. I come here regularly and was just shocked by this experience. I work late and never get the cha

51.description: let me start with saying this place is great....meghavi always takes care of me she does a great great amazing job, her work is super clean she takes her time with you and is super friendly  no pain at all!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! very satisfied highly recommend her!!!

27.description: I've been going here for about a year and was surprised at how good the ladies were. I had Shazia and she did my eyebrows and waxed my underarms (eek!). The prices are reasonable and if you go on an "off" day like Monday or Tuesday, you can get in and out in under 15 minutes.

32.description: So terrified for my first bikini wax, did my research and the reviews are so right! Nikki is simply the best!!  How many people can say they hardly felt their waxing? Because I barely noticed it. Plus Nikki is super professional and treats you like a longtime VIP client even when it's your first time. I would recommend making an appointment because, like other reviews say, it's a super popular place and there are lines even at noon on a Wednesday.Definitely highly recommend!

54.description: I am very picky about people doing my eyebrows because I have had horrible experience with my eyebrows but ever since I have discovered this place I don't trust or go anywhere else! Niki and Mimi are great!! Also, get your waxes done with Niki, she is fast and very nice!

48.description: Two years ago I would say this place was great.  Nikki does a great job.  It took 2 months for Nikki to fix my eyebrows after the other 2 had made them too thin.  I specifically voiced that today the person working because Nikki wasn't around.  And the same thing occurred - she thinned them and tried to tell me they were done when they were uneven. It will take me another 2 months to grow them out.  I have been going here for 3 years, today they lost my business.

44.description: Meghavi is an eyebrow genius!!! She knows what she's doing. She's sweet and funny makes you feel extremely comfortable working with her. Don't waste your time anywhere else! She da bomb!

24.description: After reading some of the reviews, I'm glad I give it a try! I got here as soon as they open on a Monday , and people were already waiting for service. The lady who did my eyebrows did an amazing job, she was really nice too. Parking is a pain, if you driving try to be here early, otherwise good luck finding parking.

7.description: The usual lady I go to was busy with waxing so I decided to go to this new lady that i have not seen before since I come monthly, but obviously going to her was a bad idea because a chunk of my brow was missing... She was very rough also because her fingers were basically stabbing my eye as she threads my other eye's eyebrow.

49.description: I absolutely love this salon!!! Shazia has been doing my eyebrows for almost a year, she is very precise and does an amazing job. I can't see going anywhere else.

40.description: I I love this place. Meghavi and Nikki are awesome. They always greet me with a warm hello :) Meghavi usually does my eyebrows and she does a great job. It gets really busy during after work hours but it's worth the wait! It's the best place I've been to in the area!

53.description: I have been going to this place for threading for a while now. It's not too tricky to shape my eyebrows, I would still say they do a great job, see for yourself the reviews :) . The wait can be longer after 5pm and finding parking on narrow Taylor street can be a pain sometimes. Look out for permit and no parking signs! But it's convenient to take the bus. They have now closed the stamp card (free eyebrow after 7th one) but I still think the prices are very decent .

30.description: I went for a wax with Shazia right before spring break near the end of March. It was my first time at this place, and she was so professional and at each step, asked to make sure I was comfortable. She was a friendly person also and really nice!! Her days are Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Saturday. You need to make an appointment for waxing fyi

46.description: I have been coming in for three years and I absolutely love it! Nikki and Lubna are amazing! They go out of there way to make you feel welcome and always do the best job. I don't trust anyone else with my eyebrows because I'm very picky and I have never had a problem with them. Very clean and the wait is never very long. $7 for eyebrows! Super cheap and the best job ever.

1.description: Well the only person i trusted here was Nikki who was gentle and friendly. I walked in one day and they told me nikki moved...some long dramatic story... well that's weird, she's still on facebook in chicago. And looks pretty happy...that to me is so unbelievably unprofessional.  is it difficult to just say "she's no longer here".well the newer ladies, suck.  thanks for all the cuts on my face and the lack of sympathy.nikki was really the sole reason i came here consistently. And then i learn that they ask customers to actually give them a better review?! yikes, is that necessary?i wont be back....this place is too cramped, too busy and not that great of service for me..movin' on

55.description: I asked her for a clean up but instead she made them too thin and one side is much more arched than the other! Boooo. In addition, I had to ask her to clean certain spots that had hair. Overall, it's so cheap, it's hard not to come back.. Just gotta be vocal with what you want!

9.description: I can't recommend this place because Nikki isn't there anymore.  I have been serviced by other people there and when i was threaded, i was once left with my eyebrows that had many cuts on them and took over a week to heal.  i also got waxed by someone else here once, and they weren't friendly and didn't do a thorough job.

26.description: Got perfect eyebrows and upper lip done! I am also extremely satisfied with waxing Mrs. Shazia does. It's almost as painless as it can get, very neat and she is very considerate. I always visit them to get threading or waxing done!

25.description: Great job! I asked "What is better, wax or threading?" She told me threading because it is cheaper and it doesn't pull on your skin as much. I think it is great that she recommended the cheaper option when she really could've told me anything. In addition to that, my eyebrows look better than they have in years!! Thank you!

12.description: This is a great place. Totally affordable and all the girls are so thorough and amazing. Definitely will be coming back!

59.description: This is my spot!!!!! No more malls for me! Although I stopped going to those years ago. I don't have a particular person, I wait for whoever. But I have never had a bad job by any of the women who threaded my eyebrows. And $7 for gorgeous eyebrows? Can't beat that. Parking is ridiculous though, and make sure you pay for parking on the street. A $50 ticket for $2 parking and $7 eyebrows does not make sense!

21.description: I've been here twice now and will keep coming back. They are busy, so you will likely have to wait; but they are also efficient, so you probably won't wait long. Great work and great price.

17.description: Horrible! I came to place l because of the location and my experience was horrible. The lady who did my eyebrows and upper lip completely hurt me. She did it so roughly I hated it. I understand there's other customers to get to but cutting my lip isn't going to make things faster. My eyebrows came out looking worse with what I came in with. I completely hate them. I never make reviews but I left this place crying and I would never recommend this place to anyone!

10.description: I've gone here twice already. The first time I had my eyebrows threaded. I wasn't too thrilled with that because I noticed my hair was growing back faster than normal, which really means that the threading was just cutting my hair instead of pulling it. I recently went again for a full face wax. The main reason I came back was because it was only $30 compared to $40+ in other salons. I was not the biggest fan of the woman who did both my eyebrows and the wax. She works so slow that the threading hurts more than it should. With the wax, she didn't pull my skin taut to help with the pain. My skin is very sensitive, so it would have helped if she would have done certain things to prevent the wax from hurting. I've done wax enough times to know that the way she does it is not helping at all. Only reason to go back is to save money, but I will not be going back as often. I can thread my own eyebrows, so I won't go back unless it's absolutely necessary.

5.description: I will never come to this place again moving forward. I generally just come here when I'm not able to see my regular threading technician. Today I had the worst experience ever. I came in to thread my upper and lower lip as I usually do. However, one of the ladies here was so rough with my when she was doing this that I left with cuts in both sides of my mouth and she didn't even apologize or say anything to me. Are you kidding me?! You clearly saw that I was bleeding and didn't even acknowledge it when I was checking out. I could tell that she was being rough because while I was sitting there the string kept getting caught on different parts of my face. I'd recommend telling them to take it easy and slow if not they might just rush to get you out of there and hurt you in the process.

3.description: I've been coming here since my freshman year in college. It's my most trusted place to get my eyebrows done. Can get a little packed during the afternoons, but worth all the wait (no more than 20 mins). They always do a fabulous job, yet also make you feel right at home. These ladies are the best!

35.description: Shazia is my eyebrow tech and she literally gets them perfect every time. She's kind and respectful. The wait is long but you get every good service so it's worth it. The price is great and you get more than what you pay for. Permanent customer

19.description: After reading some of the reviews, I'm glad I give it a try! I got here as soon as they open on a Monday , and people were already waiting for service. The lady who did my eyebrows did an amazing job, she was really nice too. Parking is a pain, if you driving try to be here early, otherwise good luck finding parking.

28.description: Great value- for only $7 they did the best job on my brows!  There were a few people ahead of me but with multiple women working they are fast so it was only a short wait.  I found my new threading place.  :)

45.description: Meghavi is your go to eyebrow girl!!! She leaves my eyebrows in perfect shape every time. Funny, personable and professional at all times. Love her!

33.description: Niki is the only person I trust with my eyebrows and my wax. The best place for threading and waxing!

43.description: So let's be honest, the only reason this place has good reviews is because it's really the only one around. Being from Los Angeles, threading salons respect your time, appointments and value you as a customer. Unfortunately I can't say the same for this place. I've been here 4 times and there has always been a problem, whether it was my eyebrows, leg waxing or arm waxing. Just because you're the only threading salon around doesn't mean you do mediocre work just because you can get away with it!

2.description: Took to long to write this piece. Should've written long ago. Crew here understands what you need. I have experienced almost every lady working here. And I've never been disappointed. They probably know better for you than you do. Always courteous and welcoming. I would avoid Friday and Saturdays. They're busy. Extremely busy. Every Monday or Tuesday that I've visited-has been quick 10 minute in and out.

18.description: Luna is awesome... Tames and arches my brows quickly...and perfectly each time. Also does bikini wax.. Superb job. Excellent prices great services...despite the crowd they are quick, efficient, and worth the wait.

41.description: They get my eyebrows done how I like it all the time! Best place ever. It just sucks how far it is and street parking is a pain.
