52.description: Everything you need and request is on point.  I went in to get a full facial and face bleach, and threading done, the women: Shazia who did my facial also did the eyebrow threading.  I can say she did an amazing job as she ask skin combination I am, I guess to make it more specific to those who have dry, oily or combination.  All the products feels wonderful on the face, including the face, neck and partial shoulder massage.  I left a good tip as I was please with the service I got.  It more better than the other facial treatments I had previously from expensive salons.   So glad is close to home.  Can't wait to return back.  Very affordable for those not looking to spend too much on threading.  Armel L

50.description: I love the ladies here. I used to get my eyebrows threaded by Nikki. One day Nikki wasn't in and I had the choice of coming back another day or letting another lady take over my brows. I was hesitant but I  decided to try it out. Since then I learned that all of the three ladies are great at what they do. They are all detail oriented and very caring. The lines get ridiculous here at times but It's. So. Worth. It. Keep up the great work ladies!

4.description: I have been coming here for over a year and love their friendliness and the way they build great relationships with their clients! Very sweet, understanding and patient. I really love how the owner will assist thebstaff if they are too busy. She is a sweetheart! They don't rush just to get the next client, but take their time to ensure you are satisfied. I have been going to Shazia who has been doing my waxing and she is great!

6.description: Nikki is the best.. She is excellent with eyebrows!!Always a long line but they work quickly. Come early and expect to wait. Trust me it will be worth the wait.

22.description: I really like this place! I always come here to get my eyebrows done. There's usually a wait (like 5min) because they have a ton of clients (which can only be a good sign) but they work to get you out pretty quickly. Finding parking sucks but totally worth it.

15.description: Really disappointed...I usually go to the burbs to get my threading done but I was in a pinch so tried this place. I've been before and it was okay which is the only reason I didn't give them 1 star. After a 35 minute wait, I had my turn. This was the MOST PAINFUL  threading I've ever experienced (and I've been threading since I was 14). The lady cut my lip so bad and when I told her, she justified it saying she had to get close to my skin. After I showed her the bleeding Kleenex and she denied that it was still bleeding. Really?!? I didn't even get an apology... I can understand a few small cuts because I know it happens with threading but this is really bad. I can say I won't be going back. Overall- long wait- not courteous to customers- did an okay job with my eyebrows - rough / painful threading

57.description: Everything is on-point about this salon. I have never had such a friendly woman thread my eyebrows. My boyfriend and I were made to feel so welcome, it was incredible. We paid $7 each to get our eyebrows threaded, and they looked amazing afterwards!The woman who threaded our brows mentioned that she has been doing this for 20+ years, so this is definitely a salon you can trust.My boyfriend also mentioned that this was the first time he's never felt any pain after an eyebrow threading. I personally have very sensitive, pale skin, and it was only reddish for 2 hours at the most. Other times, I've had it be red all day. My boyfriend had no red at all around his brows.Oh, and she was SUPER fast!Go here, you won't regret it.

20.description: Luna is awesome... Tames and arches my brows quickly...and perfectly each time. Also does bikini wax.. Superb job. Excellent prices great services...despite the crowd they are quick, efficient, and worth the wait.

36.description: decent threading place in the city

14.description: So terrified for my first bikini wax, did my research and the reviews are so right! Nikki is simply the best!!  How many people can say they hardly felt their waxing? Because I barely noticed it. Plus Nikki is super professional and treats you like a longtime VIP client even when it's your first time. I would recommend making an appointment because, like other reviews say, it's a super popular place and there are lines even at noon on a Wednesday.Definitely highly recommend!

58.description: Had high hopes from this place when I visited Chicago last weekend. Very disappointed at the quality of their hash browns they were bland. The turkey club was good but not amazing. This was an average over priced restaurant.

56.description: Staff are extremely nice and very on their game. The food is amazing. They must cook their bacon in love because it makes me so happy. Their hash browns are really good, they have a sweet potatoe option if you're into that kind of thing.  I need to come back for lunch some day.

29.description: Their rosemary hashbrown is soo delicious.  It is always busy when we go there but you dont have to wait too long to be seated.  They are always friendly and helpful and I have never been disappointed. My favorite breakfast spot!

42.description: Hashbrowns is my favorite breakfast place.  Their loaded French toast tastes amazing. Their duck bacon is really good too, but it's pricey. The workers are friendly and the service is great.

23.description: I first tried this place a couple years ago and felt it was just ok. With two very good breakfast spots closer to me, I hadn't been back till today. I ordered a salad and after a few bites, I found a 3" piece of hard shriveled plastic wrap mixed in with my lettuce. The waiter was apologetic and had a new one made for me. The avocado in the replacement salad was rock hard and not edible. I didn't mention it to the waiter since they already were comping my check due to the plastic in the initial salad plus I don't like sending food back. If the waiter hadn't been so nice I would've only given one star.

47.description: Service was great. Food was amazing! They had sweet potato hash browns. The place was a little tight but so worth it!

8.description: Everything was dry even the coffee. But no seriously. Service was kinda bad and the good wasn't great at all

31.description: Breakfast/brunch is my favorite meal for which to dine out. This place has been recommended to me numerous times. I found myself in the UIC neighborhood on a Saturday morning so gave it a try for breakfast. It was disappointly mediocre. The service while friendly was almost non-existent. Had to flag the gentleman with coffee for every refill. The server didn't return after delivering my order until it was time to clear my plate and deliver the bill. My 18th Street omelet  (added Chihuahua cheese) was quite good but the famous hashbrowns were soggy and cold. Too bad.

34.description: Hashbrowns was alright. Not the worst breakfast but definitely not the worst. They do need to work on their service. I understand at a busy restaurant it's hard to keep track of all your guest but if I see someone just standing around while my glass of water is empty, it's kind of frustrating. Had the egg Benedict with sweet potato hashbrowns. I thought the sweet hashbrowns were way too sweet and it mine was a bit oily too. The egg benedict was nothing out of the ordinary but the ham was a bit too salty for me.

16.description: I love love love hashbrowns (the food), but the restaurant a like.  They have a good breakfast and brunch selection and the food was all good, but nothing amazing.  I find the sweet potato hash browns to be too soft, but I suppose there is not much that can be done to make sweet potatoes crispy.  The omelettes are good, but nothing amazing and to be honest everything I have ordered from here is good.  The restaurant is cute, but small and a bit crowded.  they have a few outdoor tables for a sunny summer day.  Overall a good choice for breakfast, however, there is often a line on weekends, so be prepared to wait.

13.description: Fast, courteous service.  Always hits the spot for hearty omelettes and coffee.

11.description: A friend and I came here for brunch on a Saturday morning and the wait time was only 5 mins and the service was great. We got the table we requested from the host/greeter. The cons from my experience was that the food was not worth the price. The food was dry and hard. It did not taste fresh and that was not all, the table didn't have utensils so we waited long after to even start our food. The pros was that the water was refilled frequently and we got decent service. Would I recommend this place, not all because the food was not good to say the Least.

39.description: The place was crowded with people but the wait time was very short. The service was good and got you everything you needed quickly and efficiently. I got the eggs Benedict double trouble and my boyfriend got a burger. The eggs Benedict was good but the meat inside was a little on the salty side. My boyfriend said his burger was really good and it's what they are known for!

37.description: When they opened up around 2006 or 2007, the food and service were excellent. My favorite of the hashbrown types was the Killer Hashbrowns. The first time I tried them, I was in love. I was very happy with the generous size of the eggs offered in the Just Eggs and the sausage has always been cooked to perfection. But over the last year, both the service and the food have declined in quality. Over the last six-to-eight months I have gone to Hashbrowns twice. The first time during that period I was shocked at the decline in service and food. I made a comment about it on their FB page and they messaged me and asked for my phone number so they could follow up with me. The follow up never happened. Hoping that was an anomaly, I went back again. The eggs were still generous and were cooked well, but the Killer Hasbrowns were burned and the sausage was over-cooked and dry. I would have sent back both, but the server did not bother to come ask me how things were until after twenty minutes. But then I was hungry, so I dug in. When she finally did ask me how my meal was, she caught me at a moment when there was food in my mouth. I am not only disappointed, but heartbroken that this once lovely brunch place has declined so badly in both service and food. I don't need to be burned a third time to figure out that I may have to cross this one off my list of favorite brunch places.

0.description: Oh how I love me some Hashbrowns! Anyone who knows me knows that I'm a huge lover of potatoes. I've been coming here for quite some time over the years and the customer service is always great and friendly. And the combo Hashbrowns are even better. Unfortunately this is one of the places where you've figured out what you like on the menu and never steer off of the usual. For me, it's the French toast with the homemade vanilla sauce which is amazing and the combo Hashbrowns which is a combination of regular and sweet potato Hashbrowns with cheese and onions and I believe garlic. Today I decided to give the north sider omelette a try which I am very picky about omelettes and it was just okay. I'll be sticking to my usual which they've won me over with.

38.description: My go to place for bfast. The burgers are good as well. Like how they have a healthier alternative to fries and hash browns by using sweet potatoes.

51.description: Tried to have a group of 7 adults and 3 children, they accepted the reservation but once we got there they tried to jam us twice in spaces that barely fit 4 people. The manager did it on purpose and out of spite since we did mot agree with her choice of space the first time (which did not fit us anyway). Business run by idiots.

27.description: I have visited this restaurant in the past and have been much more fond of their food and service. I am not sure whether my mistake this time, was placing an order for delivery. It took approximately 2 hours for my food to arrive (and I live less than 2 miles from the restaurant) and never did I receive a call explaining that there would be a significant delay. When the food arrived, it was cold and not the best in flavor. I also paid $2.75 for a side of avocado -- an avocado that was not ripe and I received the equivalent size of one slice. I also paid for a side of sour cream, and there was a piece of plastic and paper inside the actual cream! Their lack of quality in food and service is disappointing.

32.description: We had a wonderful brunch,  I had a taste for Chicken and waffles so I ordered kids chicken tender meal which came with hash browns and the mini waffles.  Perfect!  The place was busy, so the service was slow. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars but the waitress was awesome and made the experience a good one. We weren't in a hurry so it was fine, but we were very hungry.  We ate outside the food was delicious, everything was perfectly made.

54.description: I was not at all impressed with the prices, the service or my meal. I opted to try sweet potato hashbrowns and I felt like it was drenched in oil. The eggs were not scrambled but more of a hard boiled and smashed consistency. My server was not rude but rather lacked attention and speed. Please note that I was one of maybe 4 or so guest on a weekday. I couldn't even say I enjoyed my toast.

48.description: Very cozy little place on Maxwell. Went on a Sunday for brunch. Its a popular place so we had to wait a while. I wanted to try the sweet potato hashbrowns and so did my husband. He also wanted to try the duck bacon. Unfortunately they did not have any of the bacon but plenty of the hashbrowns. They are worth the visit. I would suggest going during the week so you dont have to wait long. The waiting area is directly next to someones eating space.

44.description: I have lived in this neighborhood since Hashbrowns first opened.  I used to like this restaurant, but over the years they have started to nickel & dime EVERYTHING.  They have gotten so out of control with their "up charges".  My wife tried to substitute a plain English muffin instead of her toast and...upcharge.  My wife ordered one of the standard items (eggs, sausage, toast) and... upcharge of $2 just to have only egg whites (if you get 3 regular eggs or 3 egg-white it doesn't require any more eggs; you , you simply remove the yolk, so why up-charge $2??)   Substitute a fruit cup instead of the standard side..up-charge $4.EVERY SINGLE TIME we used to go to this restaurant we had about $4-$7 in up charges so we quit going altogether.  After 12 months we decided to try it again this morning and.... yep, up-charges to the point my friends that went with us were very frustrated when they saw the up-charges for their minor changes.  My entire courtyard of neighbors has stopped visiting this restaurant for the same reason.On another note, they serve coffee out of such large coffee cups that your coffee gets cold within 3 minutes so you never have hot coffee.Sorry to be so negative.  This is my neighborhood and I REALLY want this restaurant to be successful, but I wish they would try to make their money by just having good food and good service.  In this case you would get continuous repeat business (and not just on Saturday & Sundays) instead of trying to make your money by up-charging everything possible.

24.description: I had the Blueberry buttermilk pancakes and the Killer hashbrowns, both were delicious! Huge portions, I couldn't finish them.

7.description: We decided to pop into this restaurant since our car was already parked in the free parking lot (free for the first 2.5 hours), and I was craving a delicious turkey burger. Even though the hostess wasn't at the front as we were entering, we were greeted with a welcoming smile and two menus as soon as we walked through the second door leading into the restaurant. The staff moves quickly and I observed the same friendly treatment to everyone who came in. We were there for lunch on a Monday. The restaurant was about half full. I imagine it gets pretty packed on a weekend, especially since it offers breakfast and lunch all day, anytime. The tables are close together, especially if you have a party of only 2. The kitchen is "open" so you can see what's going on depending on where your table's located. The food was delivered quickly and was good, nothing special but not bad. We had the Marty turkey burger (comes with the standard LTO, but you have to ask for cheese), with very bland and flavorless sweet potato fries; and the chicken breast sandwich (the first burger listed on the menu) with tasty hash browns. This restaurant offers call-in, take out orders and I saw a sign that it delivers.  The breakfast items I saw being delivered to other tables looked divine! I'd certainly come again!

49.description: We were in the neighborhood on a Saturday looking for a place to have a late brunch. Spotted Hashbrowns and decided to give it a chance. It was quite crowded - which I think is always a good sign. The service was good, friendly and helpful. I ordered the veggie sandwich and hubby ordered the 4 mini waffles dish. We were very pleasantly surprised that our server had split both of orders neatly into two dishes and served them separately. We were gonna share anyway, so it was very nice of her to do that. The veggie sandwich came with the hashbrown and we opted for half regular potato and half sweet potato hash. Considering the name of the place, I was expecting more from their hashbrowns. It basically was shredded potato, not too much seasoning, not too much flavor and no other additions. Color me disappointed. The sandwich was fresh, hot and appetizing. It was good, but i had to salt, and pepper it. I am not a person who likes too much salt in my food, but the sandwich was very very low on seasoning. After i made the additions, I enjoyed the sandwich. The waffles were standard - fluffy, warm and eggy. Came with two dipping sauces and maple syrup on the side. We quite enjoyed the mini-waffles, and they were the right portion size as well.

40.description: We decided to pop into this restaurant since our car was already parked in the free parking lot (free for the first 2.5 hours), and I was craving a delicious turkey burger. Even though the hostess wasn't at the front as we were entering, we were greeted with a welcoming smile and two menus as soon as we walked through the second door leading into the restaurant. The staff moves quickly and I observed the same friendly treatment to everyone who came in. We were there for lunch on a Monday. The restaurant was about half full. I imagine it gets pretty packed on a weekend, especially since it offers breakfast and lunch all day, anytime. The tables are close together, especially if you have a party of only 2. The kitchen is "open" so you can see what's going on depending on where your table's located. The food was delivered quickly and was good, nothing special but not bad. We had the Marty turkey burger (comes with the standard LTO, but you have to ask for cheese), with very bland and flavorless sweet potato fries; and the chicken breast sandwich (the first burger listed on the menu) with tasty hash browns. This restaurant offers call-in, take out orders and I saw a sign that it delivers.  The breakfast items I saw being delivered to other tables looked divine! I'd certainly come again!

53.description: The reason I gave this place three stars was due to the lack of flavor. Of a six person group, we all ordered different breakfast meals. Everyone agreed that their food was well prepared and more than enough presentable. But when it came to actually savoring the meal, there wasn't much to savor. The food lacked the "zing" that you would come to expect from a $12 omelette.Apart from the food itself, the restaurant is in a prime location and the service was good. It's very homey with a positive atmosphere. Their dinner options are still up for debate and I will consider returning due to their hospitality and location.

30.description: Charming place for breakfast.  Everybody here is so nice and efficient.  But this place is a little small.  There s usually a wait:(

46.description: I've been to Hashbrowns couple of times in the past 6 months and the times i went, i thought the food was good and consistent. Pricing is reasonable and service was good. I enjoyed the egg white omelet with rosemary potatoes and side of Canadian bacon. all good choices. Their eggs Benedict is tasty and creamy.  I recommend this place if you want good quality food and service, not mention place looks clean as well. Nice outside seating during the summer months.

1.description: This place is so loud, you can barely hear the person you are with.The server only came to take our order and to bring the bill. Also, the food was not very good.

55.description: This place is awesome, coffee is good, the food is even better. Best cream of mushroom I've ever had. Great service and atmosphere. Have been here a couple times and many more to come.

9.description: This place was adorable and a great spot for breakfast at lunch time.  The sweet potato hashbrowns were delicious as were both the omelet's we ordered.  Nice service and great ambiance.  I would go back =)

26.description: Waiter came to the table after a 10-minute wait.Food arrived a good 25 minutes after that, for a order of grilled chicken with soup and an omeletteFood:Soup smelled so heavily of the bleach of unfiltered tap water I could not finish it (despite not wanting to waste food).Chicken breast was too dried out to get a knife through it. Struggled to attract attention of waiter and when I eventually managed to sent it back (even though it meant more wasted food). Came back a second time equally dry. I am guessing it was not all the chef's fault - cheap frozen chicken is probably what s/he was working with. Ate a few bites of the charred, bland, bitter meat and set the rest aside (surely going to hell for wasting food).Very oily side of sauteed vegetables came with no salt (and nothing else flavor-wise, if you were wondering).North Sider omelette (wive's) arrived a cold, leaden, unseasoned mass. Sweet potato hash browns were in equal portions burnt and uncooked, the whole thing a soggy oily mess. Not so hard to figure how that happened.And the bread is perfectly unremarkable. If you cannot cook eggs or grill chicken, if your signature dish is so badly prepared (the place is named Hash Brown for Pete's sake), if your ingredients are cheap and if you are using some kind of bleach-stinking tap water to make your soup and you don't even cook it enough to get rid of the smell, you deserve the fate of many area restaurants - you need to shut shop. Your very poor service is the last of your problems.And all this for $27.00 (sans tip). This is the textbook description of a bad restaurant.Tried posting this without any stars - "Eeks! Methinks not" is altogether too kind.

25.description: Yikes. Neighbors had a horrible experience here today- sat for 20 minutes without service, and had a one year old kid with them. Then, when a server finally came, she served all the other tables before even approaching them. Then, they got up to leave, and the manager (who should be involved in RESOLVING disputes) asked if they were okay and when they said they hadn't had service in 20 minutes with a screeching toddler who simply wanted a glass of milk, he said "goodbye- we don't have any servers" in a snide and aggressive manner. One star- I've served tables before, and even when you're low-staffed and stressed, taking a simple drink order isn't rocket science and can appease your customers even if the wait is longer than normal. On top of that, a manager should...you know...."manage"...one star only because I can't give zero.

12.description: Their service was fast and their food was tasty! ! I had the duck bacon with sweet potato hashbrowns and two over medium eggs. I never had sweet potatoes with my eggs, so I tried it. They were good, but I'd much rather have the regular potato HashBrowns with my eggs. Duck Bacon was good. If you ask for coffee they bring you a "cup". It's really a small soup bowl!! Lol! Which I thought was just the right size :-) I'd recommend this place to anyone. They also make espressos and capps. House coffee is usually all I need. Their food was good, but not amazing which is why 4 stars. I should mention their pancakes are definitely huuuuge! They look like you could snuggle with them and be happy. Lol!

59.description: The food at Hashbrowns isn't bad. Some of their breakfast and lunch items are pretty good.

21.description: I always knew I liked hash browns, especially the cheap ones from McDonalds. You know, all that grease. But my love for the flattened potato pancakes have grown with these amazing sweet potato versions! YUM!Hashbrowns is a great place to grab breakfast or lunch (so... brunch!) during work or on a weekend. They offer a great selection of all American food with huge portions. Mostly for the sides, which you should always go for the sweet potato hash browns that they are known for.I've ordered take-out twice now, and both times have been very pleased with the quality of the food. First time was a mushroom burger, medium rare that was just the right amount of juicy before getting too oily. The second time, I ordered the Greek omelette and added some sausage for only $1 more. THAT was the best no doubt. I was barely able to finish everything. The toast however was burnt and forgettable.Since it's so close by to my apartment, I'll be back again soon. I definitely think it's a good spot to drop by if you're around for some all American goodness.

17.description: Great local go to. Consistently good tasting and quality food. We've had pancakes, eggs, bacon, hash browns, & coffee. Been there many times and will return.

10.description: We pretty much only come here (twice a year max) because it's within walking distance. The service is so-so and it is incredibly loud inside. If you order the egg nachos, ask for a side of salsa. What's nachos without salsa? Dry. The bacon tasted like greasy fries and actually had a fry in the serving dish. Not a fan of deep fried bacon. The waitress forgot my side of hash browns and didn't come back until we were almost finished since we could barely flag her down. This is pretty standard for every visit. Coffee is good though.

5.description: Horrible food horrible service. They delivered the wrong food via seamless to me and when I called to inform them the manager was super rude. Not only was the food not what I ordered but it was a disgusting, soggy warm turkey sandwich. He finally agreed to refund me and a week later I checked my credit card statements and there was no refund. I called seamless and they told me no one ever called them to refund the order. All around worst service ever.

3.description: Being a UIC student and living a block away from this place and being a fan of brunch, I've visited this place about 4 times so far. Honestly it was due to the location convenience of this place, as the food is not that special. Typical brunch items can be found here. Last time I went, I got the Chicken BLT, and although it wasn't a breakfast item, I enjoyed that sandwich a lot! But for the price (13$) I'm not sure if it was worth it. If you like brunch, do give this place a try as it's a pretty good place :)

35.description: Saw this place and decided to give it a try and was pretty good overall. pricing was reasonable considering the portions were large. The egg nachos and chocolate chip pancakes were excellent. Didn't have to wait too long during busy morning/noon. There are better brunch places but overall not bad.

19.description: Pretty good chicken chipotle burrito, but I was a bit disappointed with the sweet hash browns. The toast was great.

28.description: Good food, good atmosphere. (I don't have a picture though). I had brunch with my friend. Their food comes in a big plate. The parking lot is right at the end of Maxwell. I came on a Thursday morning and left before 12pm and parking was free.

45.description: I went here for brunch with my girlfriends on a Saturday morning. The atmosphere was good with a pack crowd in the restaurant. The service was alright and the waitress was somewhat attentive. The food I must say was okay with reasonable prices. I must say I had better brunch food elsewhere. I don't think I would go back to this place even though I love the area which is university village where it is up and coming.

33.description: Let me start off by saying the food was amazing! I currently go to UIC and I've never really been to many of the restaurant in the Maxwell Market, there is a variety of places to go in the area this possible seemed like the most breakfast place to go. They have really strict hours only open from 7-3 you have free parking for 2 1/2 if you can find a park. Let's get to the actual restaurant... The staff was very friendly and attentive, they have someone walking around with water for anyone who's cup is low which is really good because most places you go you have to ask for more water. This place is great for a fast breakfast it's no fine dining but they definitely put care and pride into the food they put out on your plate. I didn't really care for the style of the menu the different names they had for omelettes was really cute. This place has a rustic cultural community feel to it draws to a variety of consumers. It was actually quite busy when we went but we did not have to wait to be seated the food came out pretty fast. I got the COCO which was like a chocolate bacon Belgium waffle and it came with two sauces a raspberry(didn't like) and an amazing vanilla sauce topped with more bacon chocolate chips and whip cream. If you use the sauce they give you, you don't even need syrup it is a very sweet breakfast however it is very light. The waffle was light and fluffy not heavy or oily like any other breakfast places I've been to. My boyfriend got sweet potato and signature hash browns turkey sausage and over medium eggs nothing a breakfast spot should mess up. I was underwhelmed by the sweet potato hash brows they didn't taste great but mixed with the classic ones they were a good pairing. I recommend this place the only thing I would change is the menu selection because besides egg specials everything else was sold separately.

43.description: Ordered the grilled chicken salad ... I like my salads cold not warm , room temp or any other temp . The salad could have been great but they placed the chicken on top of the salad while still hot which gave the entire salad a different taste . Next time i will let them know to place chicken aside

2.description: I always knew I liked hash browns, especially the cheap ones from McDonalds. You know, all that grease. But my love for the flattened potato pancakes have grown with these amazing sweet potato versions! YUM!Hashbrowns is a great place to grab breakfast or lunch (so... brunch!) during work or on a weekend. They offer a great selection of all American food with huge portions. Mostly for the sides, which you should always go for the sweet potato hash browns that they are known for.I've ordered take-out twice now, and both times have been very pleased with the quality of the food. First time was a mushroom burger, medium rare that was just the right amount of juicy before getting too oily. The second time, I ordered the Greek omelette and added some sausage for only $1 more. THAT was the best no doubt. I was barely able to finish everything. The toast however was burnt and forgettable.Since it's so close by to my apartment, I'll be back again soon. I definitely think it's a good spot to drop by if you're around for some all American goodness.

18.description: I had the Blueberry buttermilk pancakes and the Killer hashbrowns, both were delicious! Huge portions, I couldn't finish them.

41.description: This place has really gone downhill from the time it first opened. We came on a Saturday morning at about 10am. THE WAIT: The service and the quality of the food has really gone downhill. The hostess initially told us the wait would be 10-15 minutes. As many parties waited for a table outside, we observed at least 3 tables waiting to be cleaned up. It took at least another 10 minutes for a table to be cleaned. When we were finally seated, about 30 min later, our table was very wet, DISGUSTING!!!!! The busboy wiped our table with a sopping wet towel and it would not dry. I had to take our napkins and wipe the table. THE FOOD: Our server came 5 minutes later and took our order. My husband ordered a burger and asked to substitute the sweet potato fries with sweet potato Hashbrowns. I ordered pancakes and coffee. Our waiter said he would be "right back" with our coffee. He apparently forgot so I had to flag down a busboy convince a busboy to bring me coffee 15 minutes after our order was taken. Another server brought our food and my husband pointed out that his fries were not substituted with sweet potato Hashbrowns. Instead offering to bring us Hashbrowns as he ordered, she told him "try the fries anyway, they are good." I asked her to let our server know and he did bring us a bowl of mushy, cold, Hashbrowns. My order was equally disappointing. My chocolate chip pancakes were dry and only had chocolate chips in the very center of the pancake. Your server never comes back to check on you after your food is served. THE CHECK: When I could not stand another bite, I had to flag down our server for a box and the check. It took another 10 minutes for him to return with this. On the way out, I observed many parties waiting to sit down. If this place was more efficiently run, there wouldn't be such long delays. This is was definitely my LAST visit to Hashbrowns. I am scratching them off my breakfast places list.

52.description: I was excited to try out a new breakfast place close to my house. Then my excitement subsided once I sat down. Being in the service industry I'm usually very patient with fellow servers. Our waitress took 10 minutes to greet us and immediately asked what we wanted to order. Once I got my 18th street breakfast burrito I was very disappointed. It was very bland and I had to dig to find any chorizo. My water cup stayed empty during the entire meal. The only time our waitress checked on us was to ask for to go boxes. It was then that I kindly asked for a water refill. The sweet potato hashbrowns were amazing though!! Otherwise I was very disappointed!

50.description: I had the Just Eggs, and the eggs were fluffy and good.  The hash browns were extremely tasty, and the bacon was crispy enough, but not overly so.  People just can't go wrong either eating here or at their other location in Old Town.  The portions are generous, so people will be good and full afterwards!

4.description: I've been to this location a couple of times as well as one other location, but this experience has ruined all the other experiences I've had. My last visit to Hashbrowns was terrible. It was my friend's birthday so we decided to eat here. We told our waitress about it and she said that she'd bring something out. She never did. She completely forgot. The place was loud and crowded, but my group really didn't mind that. All of the seats were really close together. We had been seated in twenty minutes as promised and my group ordered right away since we'd been looking at the menu while we were waiting. We waited FOREVER for our food. I've never waited this long anywhere. If we hadn't already ordered, we would've walked out. It was horrible because my friend had work and was running late. Brunch that should've taken half an hour turned into almost two hours! Not only that, but our waitress was RUDE. When we got there, we were as friendly as could be and ordered politely. We waited patiently to be seated and we waited super patiently for our food to arrive. Never once did our waitress check up on us and when we looked at her, she had this snarky look on her face like we were inconveniencing her or something! One of my friends finally raised her hand and asked why our food was taking long and the waitress told us the kitchen was backed up - we would've never known this if we hadn't asked. The two parties seated next to us were seated after us, and they received their food before us! One group even was seated, received their food, and left before our food even came out! As soon as our food came out, our waitress didn't even hand it to us in a nice manner - she practically just dropped our food in front of us. My friend had his utensils in the way, the waitress asked her to move it and before my friend could lift up her hand to move it, the waitress rudely just grabbed it and put it aside. She never even cracked a smile or asked how everything was. As soon as we saw her again, we asked for our check. It took us 1/5 of the time waiting for the food to actually eat it. The food is delicious as always. They make the best eggs benedicts I've ever had. I always get the Eggs Benedict Double Trouble. The Killer hashbrowns didn't really do it for me this time, but they were still good. The only other thing is that it's unreasonable expensive for beverages. A small glass of orange juice is $4. The food is what saved this experience for me. Other than that, I'd never come back to this location! I really want to remember the name of our waitress because I've never received such terrible service!

6.description: The place was crowded with people but the wait time was very short. The service was good and got you everything you needed quickly and efficiently. I got the eggs Benedict double trouble and my boyfriend got a burger. The eggs Benedict was good but the meat inside was a little on the salty side. My boyfriend said his burger was really good and it's what they are known for!

22.description: I've been to this location a couple of times as well as one other location, but this experience has ruined all the other experiences I've had. My last visit to Hashbrowns was terrible. It was my friend's birthday so we decided to eat here. We told our waitress about it and she said that she'd bring something out. She never did. She completely forgot. The place was loud and crowded, but my group really didn't mind that. All of the seats were really close together. We had been seated in twenty minutes as promised and my group ordered right away since we'd been looking at the menu while we were waiting. We waited FOREVER for our food. I've never waited this long anywhere. If we hadn't already ordered, we would've walked out. It was horrible because my friend had work and was running late. Brunch that should've taken half an hour turned into almost two hours! Not only that, but our waitress was RUDE. When we got there, we were as friendly as could be and ordered politely. We waited patiently to be seated and we waited super patiently for our food to arrive. Never once did our waitress check up on us and when we looked at her, she had this snarky look on her face like we were inconveniencing her or something! One of my friends finally raised her hand and asked why our food was taking long and the waitress told us the kitchen was backed up - we would've never known this if we hadn't asked. My friend had his utensils in the way, the waitress asked her to move it and before my friend could lift up her hand to move it, the waitress rudely just grabbed it and put it aside. She never even cracked a smile or asked how everything was. As soon as we saw her again, we asked for our check. It took us 1/5 of the time waiting for the food to actually eat it. The food is delicious as always. They make the best eggs benedicts I've ever had. I always get the Eggs Benedict Double Trouble. The Killer hashbrowns didn't really do it for me this time, but they were still good. The only other thing is that it's unreasonable expensive for beverages. A small glass of orange juice is $4. The food is what saved this experience for me. Other than that, I'd never come back to this location! I really want to remember the name of our waitress because I've never received such terrible service!

15.description: I was unimpressed and the sweet potato hash browns were mushy and gooey.  I haven't had any desire to go back.

57.description: This is the breakfast spot for me! The staff was great and the choices for breakfast will fit anyone tastes. Of course with a name like hash browns, there is a lot riding on their spuds. They do live up to the hype...I recommend the sampler. Great outdoor patio on the street that's perfect for a weekend brunch!

20.description: We received horrendous service. We ordered take it and it took well over two hours and no one seemed to know what was going on when we inquired about it. The manager also did not help until we said we would refuse to pay because it took too long. We did eventually get our meal for free which is the only reason they get two stars.

36.description: On the plus side the food was good and portions were large. I tried the Oak Park omlette with rosemary hashbrowns and it was excellent. The toast is enormous also. Additionally, the tables were clean and the employees were friendly.Onto the negatives... Hope you don't like personal space or room to breathe. Granted, we came on a Sunday but it was absolutely packed and the tables were ontop of each other. Also... And this is a little picky... But they spelled an item on their menu incorrectly... Unless these turkeys are Boilermakers from West Lafayette, Indiana... I'm pretty sure it should have been "Perdue Turkey" not "Purdue turkey".  The food was good but I won't be back, way too crowded for my taste.

14.description: Hashbrowns was alright. Not the worst breakfast but definitely not the worst. They do need to work on their service. I understand at a busy restaurant it's hard to keep track of all your guest but if I see someone just standing around while my glass of water is empty, it's kind of frustrating. Had the egg Benedict with sweet potato hashbrowns. I thought the sweet hashbrowns were way too sweet and it mine was a bit oily too. The egg benedict was nothing out of the ordinary but the ham was a bit too salty for me.

3.description: Living Doll is relatively cheap and everything seems very clean. Older lady is very good with the threading and more friendly. Besides, it is never crowded and you dont need an appointment. I would never try to have a Brazilian but it is definitely good place for the basic threading and small area waxing.

1.description: This place is a hit or miss.  I come here for eyebrow threading sometimes.  Sometimes they look great and other times I have to go home and fix them myself or fill them in with an eyebrow pencil.  If you're willing to take your chances it only costs $6 for threading.

2.description: Don't go here when the younger girl is working. I give this place two stars only because the lady who owns the place does a good job for the price but her assistant (younger girl) when she is not there is terrible. I mean terrible. Not only is she rude and unprofessional, she pretty much sucks at threading. While she is talking to her friends she manages to over thread your eyebrows and miss chunks since she is too busy doing other things besides her job. I even have chunks of skin missing this go around. They may be one of the cheaper threading salons in the area but not worth the botched job when she's running the joint.

0.description: My daughter and I had our eyebrows done here. I've been twice. They have a discount for students so it's $6 for threading. I do not like the chairs. They feel a little unstable. Other than that, I was fine with my eyebrows.

4.description: I found my new threading salon. I'm do glad they opened this place down the block from where I used to go so much better

58.description: Twice I have been here and both times I left because lack of service the first time I sat around for about 15mins and no one came to our table so we just got up and left .This past Sunday showed up at half time the place was not packed seated right away we got our order in right away. The only thing that was ever brought out was the appetizer after the game finished I noticed everyone around us had their wings and we were still sitting here without ours. This is well over an hour after we ordered I find the women manager in the blue shirt and ask her what is going on she says she will check about 5 mins pass and nothing i find my waitress ask to just pay for the onion rings and the soda I had because this is ridiculous. They actually asked me if I didn't want the rings as they were about to put the order in. Save yourself the grief of bad management and an owner that does not care about service go anywhere else. Read any review on here bad service overall! There is to much good food in Chicago to put up with mediocre wings and bad service.

56.description: I love Bww, but my first trip to new location was a letdown. We were thrilled to have a Bww in our neighborhood and counted down the days. Our waitress was a sweetheart, but our wings were overcooked, dry and hard. Ugh. My request for extra sauce also was not fulfilled.  We were given free beers to make up for the wings which was a nice gesture.  I hope the wings will be better on my next trip.

29.description: This place deserve one star but I'll be nice and give two stars. It deserves one star because first we order our food around 7:50. Our friend was running late so she said she will be here around 8:20-8:30. By the time she got her we JUST got one of our appetizers and couple minutes later we got our food. So around 8:35 is the time we start eating. I admit the server was nice but she was a bit slow. We asked for our drinks first and it took her 10 minutes to get it for us. I'm disappointed.

42.description: came here on a Tuesday night in December at 10 PM. We entered and got seated right away, however, it took us a while for the waitress to ask us what we wanted to eat, BWW wasn't crowded at all. From the time we sat down to the we got our food was probably about 45 minutes. The food came out and it was okay, it wasn't hot and didn't seem fresh. After receiving our food, we weren't asked if we needed or wanted anything else, no refills, no drinks, nada. There isn't a late night happy hour at this location (which is the reason why we came here in the first place). Wouldn't be coming back to this location again.

23.description: Came in there wirh few of my co workers. We were told to sit anywhere. Took 15 min for the 6 reps to figure whos table is it to get service. After ordering apps and wings, wings came in 20 min later. We had to  look for servers to help. Good 40 mins into waiting I asked for a manager. offered slight discount and coupons for next visit. Why would I want to come back?

47.description: We were excited for a Buffalo Wild Wings to come to the South Loop! Unfortunately, the general theme of most of the other yelp reviews, slow service, plagued our visit as well. Prior to getting a table, we sat at the bar. Here it was quick and easy to get drinks and also easy to get TVs changed. We probably just should have stayed at the bar, because once we were seated at a table in the dining room, it was all downhill from there. Our server checked in very infrequently and we spent most of our meal with completely empty glasses. The service seemed completely disorganized, as three others tables food was sent to our table and our food was sent to a different table. Even paying the bill took significantly longer than it should have. Terrible service, but if you have a wing craving there is a Buffalo Wild Wings in town now!

8.description: B-Dubs has finally arrived to Downtown Chicago, and better yet- near UIC! (Go Flames!)Its been weeks, months, and a little over a year since B-Dubs made its debut signage that read "opening soon." I just arrived to Chicago a few months ago, so the wait for me wasn't very long. Fortunately, my friend and I managed to snag some sampling tickets courtesy of the great workers at B-Dubs, and got to try out some of the great selection before Opening Day!This restaurant is HUGE! We were seated in a nice patio area that felt very personal (and got to witness a guy beating the spicy wing challenge. Buddha have mercy on his stomach tonight!). With two floors of nearly spotless furniture and giant TV screens, this place demands attention, and it certainly got it!The sampling tonight included a complimentary appetizer, wings, and a main. Our servers were really nice, although as the night dragged on, were a bit difficult to call on since it was so busy. The kitchen staff worked furiously to get our orders out quick, but for many customers, the trial and error day was at its peak.B-Dubs is the same for most spots, but this one will be a nice addition to the Maxwell community. They even have games you can play on the tables against each other... totally felt like an airplane.I'm sure we'll be back once it opens up in a few days for the good stuff.

31.description: I think it's probably best for me to preface this review by saying this is not in comparison to other BWW's but to other wing focused establishments in general.The good:This is a GIANT space with a ridiculous amount of tv's and ample parking. This would definitely be a good spot to catch a big game.The bad (mostly all the rest of it):I've never been a fan of the B-Dubs. I just don't understand all the hype. As far as chain wing joints go, this one is definitely at the bottom of the barrel for me.We ordered boneless wings in medium and garlic parm, mini corn dogs, and fries with a side of cheese. The boneless wing itself was fine. Nothing spectacular but definitely met expectations. The sauces though ... wtf? The medium sauce was definitely at least a hot on every other wing scale I've had. It had a good taste but was way hotter than advertised. I normally get "hot" other places but went for medium to please the hubs who I was sharing with. The face was on fire a bit and I like to pride myself as someone that can handle a decent amount of heat. The garlic parmesan barely tasted like garlic or parmesan. What it tasted like was butter and TONS  of oregano. Why so much oregano? In general the flavors were just confusing. I do not get it.Mini corn dogs were just ok but the order literally had 10 tiny little corn dogs in it. It was served in a basket that dwarfed the serving size and just made it look even more depressing. To be fair, the dipping sauce was super good. Not your typical honey mustard that you'd expect but very good. Fries. Meh. Boring. The cheese sauce was pretty good but it also was not as advertised. It was more of a chili cheese sauce than anything. It was decent actually but also pretty confusing. In general, I'd probably go back to have a beer or something to watch a game or take a break during all the shopping I'm usually doing in the south loop these days. I also will definitely never seek out a BWW for a good meal as I'm pretty sure it can't be had.

34.description: Probably the worst BWW I've ever been to. First we walked into the place greeted by 10 workers at the front desk who were on their phones. Next we were seated upstairs to finally get out drink orders after 10 minutes. We were ready to order by then and we wanted an appetizer as well besides our main order. You would think some chips and salsa would be only 5 minutes, but it took 20 minutes for it to come out. It was given to us 1 minute before our meals. We were one of the first 10 people in the restaurant that day. Who does that? I had to move around the food so we could fit everything. Also, as we were waiting for our food we noticed all the workers standing around doing nothing but talking to each other.  The manager didn't seem to keep them busy. The food was good but the service was terrible. On a last note, for some reason the floors were extremely slippery. If I were a person with a gait disability I would not enter this establishment. This is my first low review so I'm not a person who just gives bad reviews either.

16.description: Slowest service ever & this is my SECOND time here.Took them 20 minutes to bring us our water. People behind us complained saying they have been at Bdubs for the past 2 & a half hours because of how slow they are.Didn't even have ranch for the wings.

13.description: Slow service, unfriendly hosts and mediocre food.  If that's what you like - this place is for you.

11.description: Meh.... I was torn between an 2 or 3 star review on this place due to how expensive it is but the service was decent and food.... Well lets just say it's really overpriced relative to the other BW3's I have been to. While it is great they finally opened a location close to me, they are also making those wing specials on Tuesday and Thursday look like a great bargain relatively speaking. Heck... the Happy Hour Beer special was $6.75 a glass! What kind of happy hour price is that? I mean if I was in River North I could understand but this is a Buffalo Wild Wings that shares the same building as Marshall's. Oh well, at least the finally opened and I got a chance to get my fill.

39.description: I could write a long review to describe the terrible experience here but let me save you the time, simply - don't come here.

37.description: Came with coworkers during lunch hour. Just with most of the other reviews, very slow and waited forever for our food to come out when they were not busy. Every employee looks pissed off and our waitress disappeared as soon as the food finally came out.

0.description: I want to love this place.  I really do.  It's 2 blocks from my job.  It's connected to the parking garage where I park.  It has a happy hour. And the servers are very nice.  The problem is, the food is just ok. The wings are ok.  Chicago Wings around the world has way better sauces and wings.  There isn't anything that stands out except the beer.  I come for the tall $6 beer during happy hour.  The chili con queso is ok but salty.  The street tacos are good but not better than an El milagro.  The fried pickles are hit or miss, the batter is either fried to a golden perfection or slightly soggy.  And 7/10 times there isn't a hostess when you walk in and when there is, the hostess seems super confused about the entire seating process.I will continue to frequent this place but only for beer during happy hour.

38.description: How difficult is it to seat a table of 2? Very unprofessional to put guests on 15 minute wait when there are 8+ open tables. I will gladly take my business elsewhere since BWW cannot handle it.

51.description: poor staff and service, they do not do their job at all they act like they're busy and working while they just stand and talk without any care about their supervisor.

27.description: Wow the service here is terrible!! Staff is very rude.... None of staff has obviously been trained correctly or know anything about customer service. Nice area, nice restaurant, terrible staff.

32.description: 4 stars for food-- spinach artichoke was a little salty but still very good. -2 stars for service. Service was kinda bad. Our server forgot about us many times. It was packed because of 70¢ wing Tuesday, but it was weird because there would be 3 waiters/tresses and a manager just chit chatting on the side, instead of helping out. I recommend ending it with cheesecake bites caramel

54.description: Remember as a kid you waited all month to open Christmas presents, and when the moment came, you got a sweater.  Well this buffalo wild wings is no different.  The music abruptly stopped on this much anticipated BBWs location once the service started.The bar/restaurant layout is great; several TVs and cool bar layout on the first and second floor.  I ended up going on a Thursday night around 7, the place was about 65% packed with more than enough servers on staff to handle the crowd.  Unfortunately the staff was more likely to mingle amongst themselves than provide service.This place has great potential, but the hiring manager has a lot of work to do.

48.description: Poor service. Drinks were never refilled. All of our food was cold. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

44.description: For a such a fancy well put together place you would think the service would match the ambiance. Worst and slowest service in this area. Looks like many of the employees need a corporate boot camp or something..

24.description: This is the worst Buffalo Wild Wings I have ever been to. I was so excited when I found out one was coming to the area too..it's a shame.We went the first week they were open and the service was TERRIBLE; I figured it was because they just opened and were figuring things out still. The bartender kept getting my drink wrong and brought me the wrong beer several times and wasn't really paying attention to us at all. We had to ask the bar back each time to get her. I would understand if it was busy but it was very slow in there and there was no reason for this. The second time we went in a few weeks later the service was still awful. We were placed at a table upstairs and a server didn't come up to us for 15 minutes. We ordered everything at once and didn't see her again until she came to bring us the check. We both say with empty drinks before our food even came, we weren't asked how everything was, etc. The workers are all so unfriendly and act like they hate their lives. At least fake a smile and try to be nice; it's your job!!! I was very disappointed with this location and their service and most likely will go out of my way to go to another Buffalo Wild Wings than return to this location.

7.description: Worst Experience in Chicago!!!Went here and the place was about half full.  Took 10 minutes to get drinks ordered, another 10 to get drinks, 45 minutes for food, and another 25 after asking for bill to get the bill.  Friend and I were sitting at the bar, and it wasn't that busy.  I will NOT be coming back. On top of that, when I got my order of boneless wings, they were room temperature.  Would have sent them back, but didn't want to wait another 45 minutes...

49.description: The food is great! Stay away from the extra wet with a spicy sauce. Fries came to the table cold. The staff is disorganized and lacking experience.

40.description: Pretty good wings here. You can read other reviews for how the wings are. I personally really like the curry, parmesan garlic, and buffalo. 4 stars for food because they are tasty and not too pricey.One star for poor service. I've dined in before and gotten take out as well. My one dine-in experience, our waitress disappeared for over 30 minutes. We postulated that she went on break with no one to cover her. Poor management of the staff.On to my take-out experience. Waiting for my food, I noticed that they would open each and every box of wings to show the customers the order. I thought that was silly; the wings would get cold! It was snowing out too so that wouldn't help. My order came and I told the waitress "hey I don't want my wings to get cold, just confirm my order is correct" so she did and off I go. When I get home, I noticed I was missing 10 out of 40 wings. I called immediately, spoke to a manager whose immediate reaction was so backwards, I was in disbelief. Here's how the conversation went down:Manager: "Did our staff show you your order so you knew it was correct?"Me: "No, I didn't want my food to get cold."Manager: "Well that's why we ask them to do that, so these kinds of situations won't happen."Me: "............. are you kidding? The problem is that your kitchen and staff didn't get the order right."She said she understood but then made a snide remark about how it still saves everyone the hassle of an angry call like this. What in the world... WHOOSH, completely missed my point. It is NOT my responsibility to make sure the restaurant I am paying money to for food is doing THEIR job. She dismissed me again, saying I could come right away to pick up the missing wings but I wasn't going out in the wet, snowy conditions after getting home already. I asked for an IOU like most places would do. She said they don't do that but she could send me a gift certificate for the amount of food I was missing (10 wings). I agreed, gave her my information. She said it would take about 2 weeks to process and get it out to me. It's been a month now. Ridiculous.

53.description: Looking at the reviews here it is clear my experience is the norm rather than an exception and our friends that we went with seemed to know and be able to tell us prior to the weaknesses of the establishment. This is a shame. My husband and I, for whatever reason, we're so excited to get a Bww in our neighborhood. I we've all been to other Bww's many times before and have never had experiences anywhere near this bad. The basic issue in my opinion  (loads of prior service experience ) is really bad management that hired and allows for very LAZY and unhappy employees. I've never seen so many servers standing around doing nothing with empty tables filled with garbage all around. The host staff has no idea how to do their job and we went up and down stairs to try to find a table because they were unorganized and didn't communicate well (and again lots of empty tables not bussed) the serving staff did the minimum at best. There is a serious work ethic and maybe poor training issue there. Seriously bring me in- I will fix this place up and hire people who want to work for their money!The only reason not one star is because my fried pickles were amazing and our server was somewhat nice.

30.description: Horrible service from Luis. First he doesn't even look at us and automatically calls us gentlemen. Hello! Look up and don't dismiss or assume your customers. When I pointed out I was female he just looked at me and shrugged his shoulders with a look of disgust. Then he couldn't even look at me and ask what I wanted to drink, he looked rather confused. Now, we were on a lunch break, in uniform (CFD) I might add )so that may be part of the gender issue but it's no excuse) and have portable radios on us. It's quite obvious we are on duty which would give some indication that we don't have a lot of time. We both order the same thing from their FAST BREAK menu - means rapid service and food right? NOPE!!! Took over 20mins to get our food and that was after I asked the waiter - Luis - about the length of time. He replied "that's only if you order off the fast break menu."  Um...we did!!!! He looked totally confused when I pointed that out. We literally got our food and had less than 10mins to eat it. So I pay our bill. He brings back the bills but doesn't bring back the change. How presumptuous. I honestly thought about not leaving any type of a tip. But he did bring us our water and iced tea so there was that. When we did get our food (brought out by someone else while he stood there and looked) our boneless chicken wings temperature were cool at best which sucked and because his service sucked so bad that we had to remind him that we ordered there wasn't enough time to complain and get hot ones. Redeeming factor for food is that my French fries were hot - so that is why I give it one star instead of none.

46.description: Ok, so the food was good... however, the service was horrible. Took forever to bring the drinks and food. Will definitley not be back... sad to say since this is the closest one to my area and I really expected a premium service for the location it is situated in. I had heard complaints about the service several times and this just confirmed it even more... Management should really invest some time in training their servers

1.description: Yelp really needs a ZERO star option! I have never once in my life felt the need to leave a restaurant until tonight... Came in with my Boyfriend who has been to this branch for lunch with his colleagues a dozen times and tonight would've been my first -- Thankfully I had enough sense to avoid sitting down! Before putting the car into park I took the initiative to yelp the place - being no stranger to the Buffalo WIld Wings chain - I was shocked to see that as of 03/04/2016 this particular branch only holds 2 Stars... What a turn off - Right?! I figured I'd ignore the reviews since it's a fairly new branch and it wasn't long before I realized how much of a mistake I was about to make!First, I understand that it is a Friday night and you're busy...but why should I be treated less than those who arrived before me? Seriously, the front hostesses really need to get their attitudes checked. Sarcastic remarks, Zero Eye Contact, and the inability to hold a conversation let alone answer a question... At least have the Balls to say whatever you said under your breath to my face! These girls are young and obviously misguided. Someone train them to have some respect to potential customers.Moving on, we were told the wait would be 30-40 minutes long for a table for two. Since the waiting area was packed elbow to elbow my boyfriend and I immediately decided to seat ourselves at the bar. I thought it couldn't get any worse and to my surprise it got worse! The bar area, which is fairly large, was practically empty??? Unoccupied seats, plenty of available places to dine in, oh and complimentary waste left behind by previous customers...So now I've got the rude hostesses down, the unsanitary dine in conditions, and finally the all time lack of service! Not a single, relaxed / cell phone surfing / chitchatting, bartender greeted us. My boyfriend and I were pretty much ignored and stared at with confusion. Really?? Don't these girls rely on tips???Note: We have not yet sat down!!! That said, I made the decision to walk out.And we're not done yet! As my boyfriend and I were walking out, I'm sure we weren't the first ones to do it, the hostesses had to chime in all loudly with their sarcastic remarks... seriously?Shame on the Management for allowing such terrible staff behavior!!!

55.description: I love BWW and been here couple times. But I am very turned off by all the servers attitudes.  They dont seems to care we are waiting to eat, actually seems like they don't even want to be there.  Even a smile is rare.  I have been to plenty of other BWW hundreds of times and never seen this poor of service.  I don't know if its because they just opened but I hope they see I'm not the only one complaining about this on Yelp.  I do love their wings and will probably be back but they are far from 5 stars.

9.description: We were excited for a Buffalo Wild Wings to come to the South Loop! Unfortunately, the general theme of most of the other yelp reviews, slow service, plagued our visit as well. Prior to getting a table, we sat at the bar. Here it was quick and easy to get drinks and also easy to get TVs changed. We probably just should have stayed at the bar, because once we were seated at a table in the dining room, it was all downhill from there. Our server checked in very infrequently and we spent most of our meal with completely empty glasses. The service seemed completely disorganized, as three others tables food was sent to our table and our food was sent to a different table. Even paying the bill took significantly longer than it should have. Terrible service, but if you have a wing craving there is a Buffalo Wild Wings in town now!

26.description: Could the lights be any brighter?!?...my word, I feel like I'm in a hospital in this place, turn them down a notch so people don't feel like they're eating on a surgical table. We used to go quite a bit to one up in Minnesota which was really good, but this one is just the opposite. They're franchises and maybe since the headquarters are up in MN they just run them better up there?...anyway was really looking forward to this opening since it's close to where we live, but the wings taste like previously frozen rubber. You can't screw up the sauce though so one star for that.

25.description: giving two stars is being nice.  I dont know why I keep ordering from this place.  Getting a take out order seems to take longer than dinning in.  Everytime I call, im on hold for 10 min then odering it takes the cashier another 10 min.  Then 25 min to pick up.  The food is better then the service but that doesnt say much.  I hope they get a good staff and bumb up the customer service in this place.

12.description: Second time here to dine in. If you think I'm a glutton for punishment you're right. first time I was here service was slow and the order wasn't put in right. Moved to the upstairs bar, different service different ambience. Much bettah. Back to reality, service was mediocre at best due to high volume and low, unsupported staff. Bartender Bea did her best to tend to 30+ customers while manager Bill did all, huff and puff lest blow the house down, "where is the bartender"? Little did he know she was tending to our order that hadn't arrived, 20 minutes later. Now who's the big bad wolf? Had management done a bettah job at staffing/scheduling, minuscule things like fresh wedges or another round of drinks, wouldn't be such a tedious task. I applaud the bartender and the waitstaff at doing the best they could with which they were equipped for but was that really their limit?bdubs, you're so much better than that. I see glimpses of your potential but the path you're on, you're no better, if not worse than the imposter on 35th n Halsted that shall remain nameless. I say good day sir! Good day...

59.description: So despite the horrible reviews of this new spot we decided to go anyways because it's so close to where we live. We went on a Sunday when the Bears was playing so there was a good amount of customers. Food actually came out fast and service was decent. The manager came up twice to ask if everything was alright. I think they definitely took the bad reviews and customers' complaints into consideration and revamped their approach to providing better service. And yes, we went to Dicks and left Bdubs within the 90 parking validation time frame.

21.description: Came here with my fiancée. We sat at the bar and watched Nba. Our server was Nate he was real cool and laid back. I had the Big Jack Daddy Burger. It was amazing! Burger was cooked perfectly pilled high with pulled pork,cheese,bbq sauce and lettuce and tomato. It also came with fries. Well worth $11.29. The burger is big. Their buffalo tender burger is also delicious. It has two big tenders on top. This atmosphere is cool, we will be back!

17.description: Very nice location, roomy, and lots of TV's not to mention awesome service  two thumbs up

10.description: 4 stars for food-- spinach artichoke was a little salty but still very good. -2 stars for service. Service was kinda bad. Our server forgot about us many times. It was packed because of 70¢ wing Tuesday, but it was weird because there would be 3 waiters/tresses and a manager just chit chatting on the side, instead of helping out. I recommend ending it with cheesecake bites caramel

5.description: I think it's probably best for me to preface this review by saying this is not in comparison to other BWW's but to other wing focused establishments in general.The good:This is a GIANT space with a ridiculous amount of tv's and ample parking. This would definitely be a good spot to catch a big game.The bad (mostly all the rest of it):I've never been a fan of the B-Dubs. I just don't understand all the hype. As far as chain wing joints go, this one is definitely at the bottom of the barrel for me.We ordered boneless wings in medium and garlic parm, mini corn dogs, and fries with a side of cheese. The boneless wing itself was fine. Nothing spectacular but definitely met expectations. The sauces though ... wtf? The medium sauce was definitely at least a hot on every other wing scale I've had. It had a good taste but was way hotter than advertised. I normally get "hot" other places but went for medium to please the hubs who I was sharing with. The face was on fire a bit and I like to pride myself as someone that can handle a decent amount of heat. The garlic parmesan barely tasted like garlic or parmesan. What it tasted like was butter and TONS  of oregano. Why so much oregano? In general the flavors were just confusing. I do not get it.Mini corn dogs were just ok but the order literally had 10 tiny little corn dogs in it. It was served in a basket that dwarfed the serving size and just made it look even more depressing. To be fair, the dipping sauce was super good. Not your typical honey mustard that you'd expect but very good. Fries. Meh. Boring. The cheese sauce was pretty good but it also was not as advertised. It was more of a chili cheese sauce than anything. It was decent actually but also pretty confusing. In general, I'd probably go back to have a beer or something to watch a game or take a break during all the shopping I'm usually doing in the south loop these days. I also will definitely never seek out a BWW for a good meal as I'm pretty sure it can't be had.

3.description: This place is horrible!!! Came here with my mom and I have to say I have never seen such bad customer service and employees ever!!! The employees were talking among themselves, talking unprofessionally and a former employee walked in, their child was behind the hostess counter. They need to worry about the waiting area full of customers instead of their personal business! Then i see the employee going behind the stairs texting instead of serving the people waiting! This place is sad and ridiculous! The food was mediocre, wings were not the best. I have been to better bdubs! Would not go back to this place and I will be contacting corporate!

35.description: Second time here to dine in. If you think I'm a glutton for punishment you're right. first time I was here service was slow and the order wasn't put in right. Moved to the upstairs bar, different service different ambience. Much bettah. Back to reality, service was mediocre at best due to high volume and low, unsupported staff. Bartender Bea did her best to tend to 30+ customers while manager Bill did all, huff and puff lest blow the house down, "where is the bartender"? Little did he know she was tending to our order that hadn't arrived, 20 minutes later. Now who's the big bad wolf? Had management done a bettah job at staffing/scheduling, minuscule things like fresh wedges or another round of drinks, wouldn't be such a tedious task. I applaud the bartender and the waitstaff at doing the best they could with which they were equipped for but was that really their limit?bdubs, you're so much better than that. I see glimpses of your potential but the path you're on, you're no better, if not worse than the imposter on 35th n Halsted that shall remain nameless. I say good day sir! Good day...

19.description: Worst place to work at !!! I've never worked at a place that was so dirty like this place! I tried to set up a cleaning system but a person can only do so much ! It's sad that it's in such perfect location but it's in the hands of the wrong management! I recently read that this location got fined an absurd amount $$ for lack of cleanness, which I don't doubt! I had to walk out from my shift!!

28.description: Waitresses have no urgency, food was cold, and had an empty drink for 5 minutes. I don't expect much from chain restaurants but these things are the basics. Get it together.

45.description: building looks nice but service is terrible.  waited almost an hour for my food and they still forgot parts of my order.  won't come back here again

33.description: Worst Experience in Chicago!!!Went here and the place was about half full.  Took 10 minutes to get drinks ordered, another 10 to get drinks, 45 minutes for food, and another 25 after asking for bill to get the bill.  Friend and I were sitting at the bar, and it wasn't that busy.  I will NOT be coming back. On top of that, when I got my order of boneless wings, they were room temperature.  Would have sent them back, but didn't want to wait another 45 minutes...

43.description: I love buffalo wild wings, and am so glad that one opened up in the south loop! I only ever come here on Wing Tuesdays, so I assume they are busier than usual when I go. But from what I've seen, compared with other BWW locations, they have a hard time handling all the orders in a timely manner. I always get my order to-go and try to order well in advance because it's always a coin toss whether they will have my order ready when I get there or not. They also only have like two people manning the to-go orders by phone, so you have to call like 10x and/or wait on hold for ~5min before you get someone to take your order. But for me this is all worth it, because I love BWW, the staff are friendly and the food still tastes good.

2.description: From the second I walked in to find no hostess, I knew this experience wasn't going to be best. Thankfully, the food wasn't that bad. The wings were pretty good and their fries were adequate at best. The setup BWW had at this location was nice, definitely seemed like the spot to go to for a game with all the TV's consuming my vision at every square inch. The service was ok. Everything that isn't wings seems a bit pricey considering it's practically bar food but I imagine people don't come here to binge- at least I hope they don't.

18.description: ive been here 3-4 times. Every time I go here I experience THEE WORST SERVICE ever. The food is good, cant really go wrong with beer and wings in my opinion. It's the workers that mess everything up. They're just horrible!

41.description: Slowest service ever & this is my SECOND time here.Took them 20 minutes to bring us our water. People behind us complained saying they have been at Bdubs for the past 2 & a half hours because of how slow they are.Didn't even have ranch for the wings.

52.description: I understand it's new place but service sucks whoever did the hiring did a horrible job .... The person seating is down was confused and the waitress tried to avoid eye contact the whole time and it wasn't even packed .... But the wings are always on point ... Step up the customer service ... And there was armed cops in front for some reason that was weird .... I'd rather go to hooters

50.description: It has now been fifty minutes waiting for my check. Been here there times once was two other people in the entire restaurant and still took thirty minutes to get one order of fries. Tons of employees standing around doing nothing.

4.description: Is it sad to say that the Buffalo Wild Wings at the airports are better than this facility? Maybe it is the fact that we ordered online and were about five minutes late to pick up the order resulting in a very sad, soggy boneless chicken wing. Or maybe it was the fact that I had to wait a good seven minutes before anyone even acknowledged my presence while waiting to pick-up an order. The wings leave much to be desired but at least their decor is clean and nice.

6.description: Came here with my fiancée. We sat at the bar and watched Nba. Our server was Nate he was real cool and laid back. I had the Big Jack Daddy Burger. It was amazing! Burger was cooked perfectly pilled high with pulled pork,cheese,bbq sauce and lettuce and tomato. It also came with fries. Well worth $11.29. The burger is big. Their buffalo tender burger is also delicious. It has two big tenders on top. This atmosphere is cool, we will be back!
