22.description: Slow service, unfriendly hosts and mediocre food.  If that's what you like - this place is for you.

15.description: We came here for lunch one Saturday and have an enjoyable time.Decor: It's a B-Dubs, so no surprises. There are TONS of TVs... seriously, they are EVERYWHERE! But that's a good thing b/c it's a sports bar.Bathroom: Again, standard for B-Dubs: clean, well lit, inviting.Staff: The greeting staff was friendly and we did not have to wait tall all to be seated, which was great! Our waitress was nice as well. She wasn't SUPER speedy, but she was doing a fine job and was very friendly. I think she was new... of course, all the staff is new as this location just opened!Food/Drink: The food was, on par for B-Dubs. It was the highlight of the visit as it was hot and fresh and the sauce-to-wing ratio was fine - mine could have used a little less dunking in the sauce but my wife's were perfect.Value: I didn't really notice anything outrageous. They also claim to do the Wing Tuesdays and Thursdays but will have to verify at a later date.We love B-Dubs and will certainly come back for more wings or to catch a game.

57.description: We ordered some spinach dip as an appetizer and some wings. The wings came out and the waitress was surprised we didn't want our appetizer anymore. She gave us some attitude but took it off the bill. Didn't get any refills and service was slow. The waitress let us know that at that particular BWW, the wings come out first and then the appetizer... This is the third time we've gone and we've had similar experiences. I really wanted to like this place because it's so close but I don't think I can drag my boyfriend here again without him yelling at everyone

20.description: Who does the hiring here? Everyone is freely cursing while in uniform. Read all the reviews. They state exactly the atmosphere here. Just take the extra 10 mins and go to the bbw on clybourn. We came at 10:40 literally was empty for a Tuesday night; our 2 orders of wings arrived at 11:30. They close at 12.... Terrible ! Slow service. Everyone needs a refresher or additional training. From the hostess to the cook who obviously can't prepare wings!

36.description: Bad. Just bad. It's not even just this location. I'm constantly going to Buffalo Wild Wings thinking, "oh, they aren't that bad. It'll be okay. Let's go" and every time, I'm leaving fuming. These people that work here don't know the first thing about the Service Industry, and I'm seriously never going back here. I hate it.

14.description: Pretty good wings here. You can read other reviews for how the wings are. I personally really like the curry, parmesan garlic, and buffalo. 4 stars for food because they are tasty and not too pricey.One star for poor service. I've dined in before and gotten take out as well. My one dine-in experience, our waitress disappeared for over 30 minutes. We postulated that she went on break with no one to cover her. Poor management of the staff.On to my take-out experience. Waiting for my food, I noticed that they would open each and every box of wings to show the customers the order. I thought that was silly; the wings would get cold! It was snowing out too so that wouldn't help. My order came and I told the waitress "hey I don't want my wings to get cold, just confirm my order is correct" so she did and off I go. When I get home, I noticed I was missing 10 out of 40 wings. I called immediately, spoke to a manager whose immediate reaction was so backwards, I was in disbelief. Here's how the conversation went down:Manager: "Did our staff show you your order so you knew it was correct?"Me: "No, I didn't want my food to get cold."Manager: "Well that's why we ask them to do that, so these kinds of situations won't happen."Me: "............. are you kidding? The problem is that your kitchen and staff didn't get the order right."She said she understood but then made a snide remark about how it still saves everyone the hassle of an angry call like this. What in the world... WHOOSH, completely missed my point. It is NOT my responsibility to make sure the restaurant I am paying money to for food is doing THEIR job. She dismissed me again, saying I could come right away to pick up the missing wings but I wasn't going out in the wet, snowy conditions after getting home already. I asked for an IOU like most places would do. She said they don't do that but she could send me a gift certificate for the amount of food I was missing (10 wings). I agreed, gave her my information. She said it would take about 2 weeks to process and get it out to me. It's been a month now. Ridiculous.

3.description: It's a nice place to shop. I found a black T-shirt their for about $5 and pair of Nike sandals for mens for $16.97 score! I love it.  It's organized and clean which is super nice. I shall be back.

1.description: The male employees who worked on he first floor had a great time looking at my wife's buttocks. Very inappropriate and they constantly did it and smiled until I caught them and stared them down. Two losers they were. Shoes were everywhere on the floor. My wife almost tripped a couple times. To be located on Chicago Abe you'd junk they'd take better care of it.

2.description: Currently, all Nordstrom rack locations are having the "clear-the-rack" sale; all red-tag clearance items will receive an additional 25% off the lowest-ticket prices.  I wasn't aware of this promotion before walking in, but it makes sense because they usually have this sale during holidays (Valentine'Day and President's Day).  I typically have more fun shopping at a Nordstrom Rack when they marked down the soon "off-season" merchandize.  I saw some puffer coats and cold-winter accessories at great prices.  Some were marked all the way down to 80% off!  I must have an excellent self-control in order to not go crazy in here.  I'm always impressed by their selections on women's and men's shoes.  I just need to wear out all my shoes in order to purchase more, even though this will take awhile since I'm such a shoe-whore!  I believe I've mentioned in my other Nordstrom Rack reviews, but let me say this one more time.  If you're a man with large feet, Nordstrom Rack is the best place to shop for ultra-large shoes.  My hubby wears a size 13, and he can easily find something he likes (the other great location is DSW).  This particular location appears to have garage parking, but the buses are accessible nearby.  The CTA 16th./18th. bus drops off at Canal and Clinton.  On the other hand, the CTA 157 (Streeterville/Taylor) during AM and PM rush hours services as well (get off at Canal/Taylor stop).  If the El trains are better options for you, the CTA Roosevelt Red/Green/Orange line station is a ten (10) minute-walk east from this Nordstrom Rack and the rest of South Loop shopping zone.

5.description: The whole is worth less than the sum of the parts. Ordinarily, if you look at the words "Nordstrom Rack" and then separate them and judge them individually you're thinking cheery thoughts and five stars apiece. So when you initially see the words "Nordstrom Rack" conjoined on the marquee outside of their store you get all titillated and excited about the prospect of double the fun.And then you go in, you find nothing and you realize, once again, you've stepped into yet another Soderstrom Rack and the whole is, indeed, worth less than the sum of the parts. Stick with Nordy's proper.

6.description: First to review here because I added this place into the yelp database. The guy at the door gave me all the information. Great customer service. This place was newly opened 9-9-14. My wife has been waiting ever since she saw the build sign go up.  One of her favorite stores. This place is absolutely spotless, fully staffed, and the merchandise is spot on. Thanks so much for opening a quality clothing store for my wife. She will absolutely love the great deals. Nordstrom rack is nicely tucked between a Dick's Sporting goods for sportster and next to a Starbucks and whole foods for the hipster. You can definitely make and afternoon or evening in this area.

7.description: Came here during the grand opening weekend. Obviously it was insane, but the deals were worth it. I'm typically not a fan of racks and racks as far as the eye can see, but I found myself in here for a good hour and a half. Great deals, easy parking (ramp free for 1.5 hours), and fairly quick lines (obviously depends on when you come).

8.description: This place is pretty amazing. I think it's the second best Rack in the city. North Ave is the best. It's well laid out and the staff is professional and helpful. The only issue is there's so much demand and interest for the place I wish it was bigger. I bought an amazing Tumi backpack that was normally $300 for like $90. I look chic and professional with my backpack. They also have really high end brands for a fraction of the price. Tory Burch flats, paper denim, Tumi luggage, Bliss Spa products, and much more. I wish they had a larger selection, but they have plenty of parking and other shops right next door and across the street. You won't be disappointed.

9.description: Very clean and organized store. Free valedated parking for 90 min or less. Location is perfect. Minutes from 90/290 and lake shore drive. Across from whole foods, perfect for retail theropy and groceries!

0.description: Each different Nordstrom Rack location holds different items, which is what some people might not know. This location has some of the best stuff of all of the Racks I've been to. I went this past Sunday (2/28/16) and there are some great sales going on! Take advantage!Some of my favorite things to get from Nordstrom Rack are designer shoes and bags. They also have a great selection of jeans as well.

4.description: Overall I really like the new location.  I've had a couple of great finds so far in my 3 visits.  1) a full size TUMI suitcase for $398 (frequent fliers, I don't have to tell you how good a deal this is.)2) a nice pair of John Varvatos Chukka boots for $120 (size 14 which is the number one reason I love Nordstrom to begin with)3) and some 14th and Union leather drivers for $60The store itself is very clean and organized which is to be expected since it has just recently opened.  Overall a lot of cool merchandise but you have to look hard to find the right stuff for the right price.  Another great thing is they seem to have a really large selection of men's professional attire.  Occasionally you can make the Men's Warehouse next door even look bad with some of the prices.  My only negative thus far is that 2 out of the 3 times the checkout lines have moved at an alarmingly slow rate.  A lot of racks have handhelds and can check you out anywhere in the store.  I just haven't seen it here yet?!One more great thing free parking for 90 minutes with validation!

58.description: It has low delivery charge, fast delivery and great food. I even turned my co-worker into this place. She would order in the afternoon and take it home. LOL!  Anyways, I love their pineapple fried rice, lemongrass chicken and korean short ribs.

56.description: NIGHTMARE. DO NOT GET DELIVERY ON A SATURDAY. 2+ hr to get food delivered less than a mile away. Called to check the status of the order an hour and a half in and was told the delivery driver was going to be there any minute. After 45min I gave up and apologized to my guests and threw a frozen pizza in the oven. Delivery driver finally shows up and asks me if I have a pen so I can sign my credit card receipt. He then calls TWICE within a half hour of leaving asking if he left his glove in front of my house. Guess what. I DON'T CARE! STOP CALLING ME. Disaster. Maybe this was just an off night or the staff decided to drop acid.

29.description: My wife and I just moved to the University Village neighborhood. We were looking for an area where we could walk around. Joy Yee was the first spot we walked to after we moved in and we've been back several times since. Service is great and the food is consistent. I don't know what they do to that shrimp and scallop fried rice but it's delicious!

42.description: This place is always a solid good.. broccoli and beef and sesame chicken are my favs.. I always mix in other things like crab rangoon, soups, string beans, egg rolls, etc and they are all good. Service is fast and friendly. Fruit smoothies are very good also if you are into that kind of thing. This location is nice in summer since the UIC kids are gone so it is much easier to find parking.

23.description: I recently visited this location based on the "great" Yelp reviews. When I arrived, one person walked us to our table without a single word and left without providing a greeting or menus. Twenty minutes go by and we've still yet to be greeted by anyone, so we got up and grabbed our own menus. Another 15 minutes go by, and we finally get greeted (hi, what you want) and put in our drink orders. When the drinks arrive, we attempt to get our waitress to explain the 400 item menu and to show us where items are that we typically eat, but she barely speaks English and is clearly in no mood to actually help us. We should have left at this point, but regrettably we didn't. Another 10 minute go by and we get our food orders in. After waiting all this time, it shocked us when our food came out in mere minutes and was piping hot. The person bringing the food sat it down and immediately walked away without asking if we needed anything. We both ordered chicken type dishes and with one bite, it was clear that our food had been microwaved based on the rubbery chicken, unnaturally hot food, and the quickness that the food came out. I eat Asian food multiple times per week, and this was clearly not fresh in any way and impossible to cook these dishes that fast. One of the dishes had an odd taste so my wife had literally one bite and stopped eating. The chicken in my meal was so rubbery that I decided to just pick through the noodles because I was quite hungry at this point. Twenty or so minutes past and someone walks over, sees that my wife is clearly not eating, and takes her plate. How do you see a plate of food that hasn't been touched and not ask if something was wrong? These people clearly do not care. We consider talking to the manager, but she is out on the floor having what appears to be an argument with another customer. Needless to say, I will not be going back and neither should you. I find it interesting that every negative review on this place is "not recommended". How is this possible Yelp!? After my terrible experience, I read through several of those and these people have the same bad experiences that I did but no one will ever know because they are all "not recommended". Get it together Yelp and show people what's going on in this restaurant.

47.description: every time i'm in chinatown, i always have to stop by and get joy yee's bubble tea! i've never eaten their actual food but always had their bubble tea. they use fresh fruit and veggies. i've never been disappointed with any of the bubble teas. i love that you can get them with mixed fruit, bobba, or popping pearls which i absolutely love all of it. a few of my favorites from here is their strawberry kiwi, lychee, and taro! they make the best taro in the midwest!

8.description: I actually have yet to eat here so am commenting on only the smoothie/drink side but AMAZING. All of their bubble tea and freeze options are amazing. Best combo I've tried so far is mango and passion fruit freeze with strawberry and lychee POPPING BOBA. Don't get me wrong, the original tapioca is great too...but adding the popping boba in is little bursts of fruit surprise. Only downside is a credit card minimum of $10, but get some friend or get bubble tea for a friend as well

31.description: This place is the best. Whenever I come to Chicago I always crave joy yees. The menu is huge and everything (food and drinks) are average to above average!  It's authentic Asian food, and definitely satisfies the craving.  The variety offered here can make a big group happy. The food menu is very extensive, with in color pictures, of dishes ranging from Chinese to Thai to Vietnamese to Korean. This place has it all and it's delicious. My favorite dishes are the tomato beef cubes, the beef chow noodles, and cong xing Cai. The dishes are huge portions and shareable.  Perfect place to go for family style meals. The drinks menu is like heaven. Anything you could possibly want!  There's milk tea, smoothies, freezes, slushies, etc. You can even adjust the sugar level. My favorite is the avocado smoothie and matcha milk green tea. Go here and check out everything!

34.description: The customer service was bad. It was a busy time but I expected the service to at least be okay. The waiter was hard with her tone like she was annoyed. The food did come out fast, but it wasn't anything special. It was just regular. No water refills at all, they forgot our soups and we had to ask 2 time to get them. After the bill came the service fee was added automatically even though there was only 5 people in our group and they state 6 people for that automatic fee. I asked for the fee to be taken off and the waitress said she could remove the service fee but we had to leave a tip on the table. I said I didn't feel like leaving a tip because I felt the service wasn't good. The waitress went on to argue with me about how they don't make any wages and only make money from the tips so we have to leave a tip. Last time I checked I though tipping was reserved for good service and was OPTIONAL. I did however end up leaving a tip but told myself I will never return.

16.description: Great food, I got the seafood udon which was alright. I think I should've tried the tom yum noodle soup! My S/O got a shrimp and beef vermicelli salad which I enjoyed taking small bites of! Definitely will be back!

13.description: This is right in my neighborhood so we order from here regularly.  My kids LOVE it.  They have a wide variety of Asian food on their menu.  The problem is, the dishes are a little greasy and you have to remind them to go LIGHT on the oil.  This especially true of any noodle or fried rice dish.  The red curry chicken, green curry beef and combination pineapple fried rice are some of our favorites!

11.description: Ordered Mongolian beef, Chicken pad thai noodle and crab rangoon for dinner. The beef was very tender and tasty. We really like their food.

39.description: Be prepared to go on a journey, a journey that will take your tastebuds to places they've never imagined before, Frodo-style. Minus the old wizard with the pointy hat/long beard and the life threatening task of destroying the most powerful sorcerer of all time.That aside, this place wow'ed me even upon opening the menu. One of the perks is that everything (EVERYTHING) comes with a picture, so you know exactly what you're getting. Of course, there is the classic beef cubes, tender little cutlets steeped in a mouth-watering sauce, so delectable that sweet little cherubims will come and serenade you with each bite. However, another suggestion of mine is the Pork and Sugar Cane Shrimp. It comes with noodles, pork, sauce, and a shrimp patty skewered by a real sugar cane. The shrimp is P-A-C-K-E-D with flavor, and the whole symphony of flavors come together when you pour the sauce over it.Also, if you came and didn't get the bubble tea (or any other kind of specialty drink), I'm sorry, but turn around and go back because you didn't actually get a Joy Yee's experience. It's amazing. All for an affordable price.

37.description: Two stars---service is terrible! Went there at 3pm to get a smoothie and fruit cup fix. The girl at the cashier seemed new and seemed to be frazzled with every question I asked about the smoothie and the person assisting her seemed most disinterested in helping and was on her phone the entire time. Needless to say it wasn't so pleasant to order---but I ignored that.What really put me off was that they gave me a hard time for sitting down and wanting to drink my smoothie and eat my fruit. There were over 6 tables open---and there seemed to be a bouncer that was very reluctant to let me sit down to enjoy what I purchased from them. When I ignored them and sat down they came up to my friend and I and had said that we need to get up and give up our table if it gets too full. Seriously between the two of us we had about 15 dollars worth of smoothies and fruit from them so it's not like we were trying to free-load on them at all. That's probably how much we would have spent if we had eaten their lunch anyways.Needless to say I didn't leave a tip because even water was not offered to me while at the table.

0.description: Good location, large seating area, super fast service, and very clean and modern feel to the restaurant. Really liked the food we ordered, which included the fan favorite beef cubes over tomato rice. The dish has one of the best flavor combinations I have tried in a while and the sauce that comes with the beef cubes is absolutely delicious. The drink I ordered was one of the specials (because there were almost too many choices!) and was super duper good. Who knew that coconut milk could really work as a base of a boba drink - plus the grass jelly, green tea pearls, and fruit on top really rounded out the flavors. Now onto the not so good stuff, the rice was somewhat undercooked for both dishes the gf and I ordered. Also the Korean spicy seafood soup only came with tofu and shrimp...no fish, no squid, no mussels, not even imitation crab. The lack of seafood was quite disappointing, but I was too busy enjoying the beef cubes to notice much. The next time I'm in town, I'll definitely be back to try more of their extensive menu.

38.description: I went to UIC for undergrad and this was practically on the campus. It was a very popular location because it was great food for a great price, not to mention the huge portion sizes. For $10-15 you basically get two meals! The food was always great and the service wasn't bad either. The bubble tea is really good too! The fruit is definitely fresh in all of their smoothies. The only bad thing I have to say is that the menu is way TOO large and can be intimidating. I've tried to venture out before but I find myself overwhelmed with the number of options. That usually leads me right back to square one where I either order my orange chicken extra spicy with fresh jalapenos or spicy basil chicken (also extra spicy). I have had more entrees than just those two, but those were my most common. I went here for 4 years and due to my somewhat short-term memory I cannot recall the names or distinctive flavors of those dishes. I do suggest trying the spicy basil chicken!!! If any other fellow yelpers have suggestions on new entrees to try, do share!

51.description: Love coming to this place for their smoothies. They use real fruit so it always tastes fresh and never artificial! I love getting fruit on top and some sort of jelly in my smoothies as well. The tapioca (boba) can be a hit or miss, sometimes it's a bit too chewy or hard otherwise it's usually okay.  The food is generally okay as well. I find that they drown their dishes in sauce, making the noodles or vegetables or whatever extremely soggy after a few bites. They have a huge selection of both food and drinks in their menu. I don't think you can go wrong with any of the smoothie combos. As for food, just don't expect the best.

27.description: The service was ok. They came often but sorta unfriendly. They didn't smile or anything. They did their job and that was it. The food is good. Great portions for the price. It's like family style. You order and entree and can share it with everybody. Got the sesame chicken. It was really good. I liked how they had a lot of sauce. The fried batter on the chicken was nice and crispy but not too crispy. I don't like mine when it's all soggy.Also had the honey peppered steak. You must get this one! It's really good. The meat is cooked right and the sauce is just great.You can get one of their soups that say it serves 2-4 but really it can serve an entire village. It's huge!The ambience is good. Nice and clean.Would come back.

32.description: I have an extreme love-hate relationship with Joy Yee.On one end, you got a vast selection of Asian dishes to pick from. Most of it would be Chinese American, but if you're feeling Thai, Viet, or Singaporean, there is likely to be some rendition of their national dish here for you to eat. However, with so many options, you know Joy Yee probably won't be specializing in anything particularly amazing.First experience, I ordered some brisket noodle soup for lunch. The brisket was awfully chewy, hard, and overall not good. The soup came with thick rice noodles instead of thin egg noodles, which was disappointing. Plus a lack of vegetables in the soup made it nearly inedible.Second time, I just got a $4.50 boba, a strawberry-mint concoction. Given it was a hot day and it's large portion, I was extremely satisfied with the drink. Chock full of sugar, yes. But it was still a treat and decent quality boba in the UIC area.Third time, I was craving for some calamari so I ordered their Thai Fried rendition off the seafood menu. At $15, it was rather steep, but the take out included a very large helping of squid. However, it was pretty bland, with little to no real salt-pepper seasoning that I expected. I also ordered a small Wonton Chicken Soup, which I have to say was probably the best thing I've gotten from Joy Yee.So I've had some terrible experiences, and some decent ones. Overall, I think my love for Asian food helped push Joy Yee over to the 3 star side, but rest assure, a lot of their food is pretty unimaginative and lacks flavor. Despite the few gems here and there, make sure you are ready for basic quality Asian food and decent potion sizes.

54.description: Bland..absolutely Bland, Oily, 90% rice 10% meat and veggies. The seafood fried rice was terrible with chewy uncooked scallops and squid. Beef cubes over tomato rice was okay but the meat and rice were not at all proportionate..Easy pass for the next time. Do not go with the appetizing pictures.

48.description: Best tapioca freezes in the city. Made with fresh fruit and so yummy!!

44.description: Service was incredibly fast! Most of our food was served about 10 minutes after ordering and we had a large group of 20! Smoothies were fresh and delicious! The variety of asian dishes is great to choose from.  The decor is fresh and modern. Love the bright yellow chairs!

24.description: The food is great but the service sucks.I went to have a nice dinner before studying for finals. Just ordered orange chicken with rice, the way they serve their tables is a bit different from other restaurants. Someone comes to initially take your order, someone else brings it to you, then another person asks if you need anything else, another person brings you the check and so on.The lady who initially took my order only did just that, and picked up the check. When I didn't leave a tip because all of the servers were rude and didn't stop by for 5 minutes (I had to go refill my own water cup) she hounded me saying if you're not going to tip you should order out. Why won't you leave me a tip? The wages suck here and we live off of tips. The couple that sat next to me was utterly shocked at her attitude towards me. I understand how servers get their money, I'm no idiot. However, just because you get a shitty wage doesn't mean I have to pick up the restaurants slack and pay you out of pocket. ESPECIALLY, if the service sucked as well as my experience. I'm a firm believer in working for your money. Had she been courteous and attentive I would of tipped her what she deserved. Not for taking my order and giving me the check. I should have not paid for my food at all and walked out. I regret not doing that, never the less I would have felt terrible and reluctantly paid anyway.

7.description: Disappointing.  We go to one or another Joy Yee's all the time, but probably won't return to this one any time soon.  Long story short: employees playing around rather than paying attention to customers.  Shouting at one another adding to the noise problem in the place.  One guy took our order, somebody else delivered it and we never saw either one of them again.  By this time there were two people working in the dining room - only one of whom, as far as we could tell, could understand English (at least he didn't seem to understand about our missing order, or didn't care).  The other guy came around finally, but by then we had finished our dinner and didn't want the missing item.  We heard two other tables complaining to him about missing dishes, they had the same missing servers (who were probably in the back playing around with the other workers.  Management: pay attention.

49.description: I love Joy Yee's don't get me wrong but as a college student it is too expensive for me. I would suggest going to Thai Bowl on taylor street as a cheaper option. But i love Joy Yee's. Love all the options just wished it was reasonably priced.

40.description: They have very good drinks like smoothies, milk tea, huge selections of drinks, large cups and decent prices , their food is ok but not impressive, I think food price is a little bit high, and it's so authentic Chinese, more like mixture of different counties in asian, I recommend try out their drinks^^

53.description: I really wanted to like this place, after so many times that I have been. The last few experiences have been below par and I am so upset I wasted my time and money on these people. I called in a phone order, for a spicy chicken pad thai. When I picked it up and began to eat it a few problems. First, it was NOT spicy as I had requested. Second it wasn't the lunch special either, and last there was a weird odor coming from the food. An odor that would leave me to believe the chicken was spoiled. I am done with this place! Never again, they have sacrificed their quality for quantity. Do not go out of your way to dine here.

30.description: If I could do no stars I would. I had the worst experience I've ever had at this restaurant. First it took forever for a waiter to take our order. Then it took more than 30 minutes to get our food and we were getting them one by one. The third dish we had to cancel because it was ridiculous. The service was just absolutely atrocious. This was just the biggest waste of my time and the food I ordered wasn't what I expected it to be. I ordered the Thai spicy shrimp salad that wasn't even spicy. I will never return here ever again!

46.description: Love this place! They have so many bubble teas to choose from. You must get a bubble tea even if you're so full you have to get it to go! They're the best! Love their basil chicken and pineapple fried rice. Mix the Siracha with the sweet hoisin sauce and add to anything for a sweet heat.

1.description: No matter how full you are, you have to get a bubble tea. My favorite was always the almond milk boba tea! The cup sizes are huge (they always lasted me atleast 2 days). If you're looking for a freeze, the mango lychee is an absolute MUST.Also, if you're a UIC student, show your ID card and get a discount!

55.description: Food has been diminishing in quality over the years. Lousy service, manager has a rude, un-inviting, zero friendly attitude. No way I will give them my business again. There are so many better options in the city. This place just lost its B list ranking in my book. After 2 bites, I said I didn't want the Pad Thai because it too fishy. She responds, thats how we make it. Nothing wrong w food, u pay. I said fine, U just lost a customer & won't be coming back... She walks away.

9.description: Pro: Great for large groups as there are many tables inside and there are many types of Asian dishes so it accommodates everyone.Pro: My favorite thing about here is that they make FRESH fruit smoothies.Personal rant: The only problem I have with this place is the amount of food items in the menu. It's too huge for me and I become very indecisive. Like over 50 different type of dishes type of deal here, no joke. I feel like when the menu is that huge, those businesses don't have signature dishes that everyone should go for. As a result, everything taste mediocre.

26.description: Poor service. Food was so below average that neither I or my date finished our food. I ate pieces of three wings from a 10 wing order. The tea however was pretty good.

25.description: It was fairly empty when I came so service was pretty immediate. The portions here are huge, plenty to share. We were a party of 4 and ordered only 3 entrees and even that we couldn't finish. Two thumbs up for the prices!! So cheap!! We ordered the Thai basil chow fun, beef cubes, and orange chicken. Everything was good and food came out fast which was a good thing since we were hungry. Side note: the orange chicken is really orangy- if you're expecting Panda Express orange chicken you're in for a bit of a disappointment.I would give 5 stars for the smoothies here. I'm from CA and I am so sad we don't have a JY here. Her smoothies are fresh and you can see all the fruit they use. It doesn't taste like the powdery smoothies you might come across. Best smoothies I've ever had.

12.description: Terrible Service! I never felt so disappointed at the service in a restaurant. I ordered the red bean with coconut milk, which is one of my favorite drinks. However, they brought me a cup of drink in brown. It didn't look like the coconut milk with red bean I ever drinked. After having a taste, I asked the waiter if they made a mistake because I can tell the difference and it didn't have the coconut milk flavor at all. Then the waiter took it back to the drink kitchen and got back soon saying "Nothing is wrong. This is red bean with coconut milk." I tried to convince myself that it could be the correct one while it didn't taste like that at all. Then one of my friend decided to order another cup of red bean with coconut milk just to check if it would be the same. It turned out to be a different one just as it usually looked like. Then I asked the waiter again by showing the difference of the two ones. To my surprise, the waiter said the same thing once again in a terrible attitude. When he came back for the check, I said "I am sure this is not the drink I ordered" while he replied "The kitchen is closed, we can make it for you next time you come and order it." This is so irritating. He didn't even apologize for their mistake. What if I am allergic to the unknown one they served me? As I had made the payment which automatically included the 18% service fee, I didn't say anything more. But I still feel so irritated at such terrible service. I should not have paid for the wrong drink which I didn't really drink. I regret not doing that and not talking to the manager. By the way, the waiter is the tall Asian man.In the photo below, the one on the left was the "Red bean with coconut milk" they served me, and the one on the right was the Red bean with coconut milk they served my friend. I guess anyone can tell the difference.

59.description: Out of all the Joy Yee's locations across Chicago, this has been my go-to for the past couple years. I don't get to frequent it much since I'm currently in school in Southwest Michigan, but I thoroughly enjoy it when I do get the chance. I particularly enjoy their large menu, but the best part of the Joy Yee's experience has to be their bubble tea!Atmosphere & Comfort:Probably the biggest knock about this place is the atmosphere. Although plenty spacious, the restaurant is often crowded and loud. Moreover, their chairs are terribly uncomfortable. They're literally pieces of scrap metal from the junkyard welded together in vague resemblance of a chair. What makes it even worse is that it's sometimes cold inside the restaurant so I can imagine how cold the chairs must be to the skin. Overall, not the most comfortable spot to eat at.Food:My personal favorite is the Beef Cubes! Perfectly sized cubes of cooked steak over delicious tomato rice in a HUGE bowl! A very rich, savory, and filling meal much thanks to the incredible portion size. I'm craving some now just writing about it haha.Bubble Tea:My two favorite are the Mango Lychee and Thai Iced Tea. When it comes to fruit smoothie bubble tea, this place is the best I've ever had! The fruit is always fresh and the boba doesn't taste funky or old like some other places might serve them. Super refreshing and a great if you just want to pop in to grab a bubble tea!Service:The service here isn't spectacular. I've had some so-so experiences where the waitress was rude, but with a lot of Asian workers, it's not about being the most polite--it's about getting the job done and they definitely meet my expectations when it comes to timeliness and attention. That isn't to say that they are outright terrible, they just do their job.Overall:In retrospect, I almost always leave Joy Yee's with a good to great restaurant experience. The food is delicious as long as you get the right things (Beef Cubes!) and you can't leave without grabbing yourself a bubble tea! Great option for a casual lunch or dinner with friends/date.

21.description: This is the goto place in the UIC area if you like Asian food. The service and ambiance is ok but the food tells the story. I'm never disappointed. There are well over 50 dishes on the menu and I keep going back to the tropical curry fish. It flavorful with sweet and spicy hints of urban flavor.

17.description: They have very good drinks like smoothies, milk tea, huge selections of drinks, large cups and decent prices , their food is ok but not impressive, I think food price is a little bit high, and it's so authentic Chinese, more like mixture of different counties in asian, I recommend try out their drinks^^

10.description: The service was ok. They came often but sorta unfriendly. They didn't smile or anything. They did their job and that was it. The food is good. Great portions for the price. It's like family style. You order and entree and can share it with everybody. Got the sesame chicken. It was really good. I liked how they had a lot of sauce. The fried batter on the chicken was nice and crispy but not too crispy. I don't like mine when it's all soggy.Also had the honey peppered steak. You must get this one! It's really good. The meat is cooked right and the sauce is just great.You can get one of their soups that say it serves 2-4 but really it can serve an entire village. It's huge!The ambience is good. Nice and clean.Would come back.

5.description: Since I came back from China I have a new perspective on food and the art and effort they put into it. Joy Yee has some really intricate dishes and amazing smoothies/bubble teas. They do have simple generic stuff on the menu like the 'beef and broccoli' and 'orange chicken'  but, this is a place to venture.So many noodles, so many meats cooked many ways, so many rice dishes, the options are overwhelming but look into it. The prices are beyond reasonable, and a great place to go with friends where everyone picks something and you all get some small plates and have an experience. Cons: There seems to be a language barrier with a lot of the staff. (Which I personally do not see as a con.) I am listing it because I know how frustrating it can be when ordering. This place is always busy and the staff is doing their best. So, be patient these people are working hard.Also, the house hot tea is terrible. Which is irrelevant because they have like 150 smoothies and bubble teas and they are not worried about the hot leaf water kind. (Which I am not mad at them at all. I was just salty since I had a sore throat drinking that swamp tea while my boyfriend is looking through the lavish fruit options and different tapioca options)

3.description: Been to 3 different Joy Yee locations, Chinatown, Naperville and now UIC area and one thing for sure is that the food is consistently good at all restaurants. Portions are huge and one entree can easily feed 2 to 3 people. Best to come with a group and eat family style so you can try a bunch of stuff. Menu is also huge (literally) with pages and pages of pictures. My favorite is the butter shrimp, crispy fried served with sweet and sour sauce and the chap chae. The bubble tea smoothies are the best!  Real fruit and fresh ingredients. Even if you are dining in, ask for to go cup for smoothies cuz you won't be able to finish.

35.description: Great food choices! And pretty good service overall. I especially love their mango smoothies.

19.description: I wanted to love this place but I think my experience was just like the reviews - hit or miss.Love the drinks! Two stars just for the drinks! Got my favorite - taro with boba. This is the first place I've been to in the city that has good boba. Most places don't cook it right but here it was the perfect texture & taste (trust me, there's a difference).The food was just ok. I had the beef vermicelli bowl with egg roll. The egg roll was doughy & not light or crispy whatsoever. The beef was seasoned with a thick sauce. The sauce for the bowl was not your typical fish sauce vermicelli noodle bowl sauce. Very strange.My friend had a dish that was titled "lemongrass" something. She said it had no lemongrass flavor at all. My other friend loved his dish so again, hit or miss.The waiter was impatient with us when we had questions about the menu. It was pretty slow yet they had 4-5 waiters just standing at the register doing nothing. The most irritating thing - when they dropped the check off they lingered around waiting for us to pull our cards out. Chill out buddy it's not like you need the table.I'll definitely be back for the drinks thou it might take some convincing to stay for the food.

28.description: Since I came back from China I have a new perspective on food and the art and effort they put into it. Joy Yee has some really intricate dishes and amazing smoothies/bubble teas. They do have simple generic stuff on the menu like the 'beef and broccoli' and 'orange chicken'  but, this is a place to venture.So many noodles, so many meats cooked many ways, so many rice dishes, the options are overwhelming but look into it. The prices are beyond reasonable, and a great place to go with friends where everyone picks something and you all get some small plates and have an experience. Cons: There seems to be a language barrier with a lot of the staff. (Which I personally do not see as a con.) I am listing it because I know how frustrating it can be when ordering. This place is always busy and the staff is doing their best. So, be patient these people are working hard.Also, the house hot tea is terrible. Which is irrelevant because they have like 150 smoothies and bubble teas and they are not worried about the hot leaf water kind. (Which I am not mad at them at all. I was just salty since I had a sore throat drinking that swamp tea while my boyfriend is looking through the lavish fruit options and different tapioca options)

45.description: Pro: Great for large groups as there are many tables inside and there are many types of Asian dishes so it accommodates everyone.Pro: My favorite thing about here is that they make FRESH fruit smoothies.Personal rant: The only problem I have with this place is the amount of food items in the menu. It's too huge for me and I become very indecisive. Like over 50 different type of dishes type of deal here, no joke. I feel like when the menu is that huge, those businesses don't have signature dishes that everyone should go for. As a result, everything taste mediocre.

33.description: Best fruit smoothies ever.  I am a huge fan of their jackfruit and durian freezes.  They offer mango jelly as well as tapioca.  Food is fusion, I'm more of an authentic person, but they are fast with the smoothies.

43.description: I usually go to the Joy Yee in Chinatown but it's always packed. Decided to give this one a try. The food is comparable to the other location (delicious!) and the portions are big, which is appreciated!

2.description: Anytime I go to any Joy Yee's, I usually get the same thing so this may not be the best of food reviews. Anyway, came here on New Years day at 11am after a night of partying and obviously my group was the only one here. The workers were just sitting out in the main dining room cutting up veggies for the day which was nice to see, since now you know it's all fresh.Anyway, like all my Filipino friends that go here, we all would recommend getting beef cubes with tomato rice. I'm not even really sure what they do to it, might just be the sauce or something, but it's delicious. For the last few years it's usually all I ever order. Throw on some crab ragoons which are alright, not the best but doable. The menu is just way too big that you'll probably never try everything.Obviously get a bubble tea before you leave. You see all the fresh fruit behind the counter so you know it's not the powder that some other places use.

18.description: Huge portions and tasty items! Their service could use some help though. I have seen people here on their phones while waiting on a table. Ordering over the phone can be somewhat difficult at times as it is usually very loud there and sometimes I have a very difficult time understanding them. sorry :/Do get the beef cubes with tomato, delicious!   I do really appreciate that they confirm the location calling. There is another location not far from here, so when placing an order for pick up they will state their address and it's happened before that I called the wrong location.

41.description: Joy Yee is a great eat! The food was so good and the smoothies. Big portions of food to share and tgen some! The peice is reasonable as well. Overall I would definitely recommend this restaurant and I will be back for more!

52.description: So it was my first time coming here and I was so disappointed because I had heard so many good things about the smoothies. So I come in with my friend and some sweaty worker comes up to us and doesn't walk us to our table, instead he says "over there!" And points all the way across the restaurant. And then later while we were waiting for our food, another waiter comes and asks if we order the dish he's holding, um no? Shouldn't you know who orders what? And then finally while we're still eating, the first waiter went to 2 different tables asking "is this your credit card?"I was in so much shock. This place is very unprofessional, the food was half decent,  and I won't be eating here anymore. If you go here, I suggest you don't pay with credit card!

50.description: OK so they have the best smoothies eeeeeeeeever ...... I know cause i had to suffer to consequences of drink two large ones and going straight after on a flight to Europe.But food wise they are ok. The portions are huge so be ware you need to be extra hungry to finish them. As it is stated most of the plates are noodles with some additional options to start up.Service wise they were dreadful though it took them 40 min to get us one of the order in which time we were forced to take it with us back home. The waiters were constantly running around but it seemed difficult to get their attention

4.description: I have an extreme love-hate relationship with Joy Yee.On one end, you got a vast selection of Asian dishes to pick from. Most of it would be Chinese American, but if you're feeling Thai, Viet, or Singaporean, there is likely to be some rendition of their national dish here for you to eat. However, with so many options, you know Joy Yee probably won't be specializing in anything particularly amazing.First experience, I ordered some brisket noodle soup for lunch. The brisket was awfully chewy, hard, and overall not good. The soup came with thick rice noodles instead of thin egg noodles, which was disappointing. Plus a lack of vegetables in the soup made it nearly inedible.Second time, I just got a $4.50 boba, a strawberry-mint concoction. Given it was a hot day and it's large portion, I was extremely satisfied with the drink. Chock full of sugar, yes. But it was still a treat and decent quality boba in the UIC area.Third time, I was craving for some calamari so I ordered their Thai Fried rendition off the seafood menu. At $15, it was rather steep, but the take out included a very large helping of squid. However, it was pretty bland, with little to no real salt-pepper seasoning that I expected. I also ordered a small Wonton Chicken Soup, which I have to say was probably the best thing I've gotten from Joy Yee.So I've had some terrible experiences, and some decent ones. Overall, I think my love for Asian food helped push Joy Yee over to the 3 star side, but rest assure, a lot of their food is pretty unimaginative and lacks flavor. Despite the few gems here and there, make sure you are ready for basic quality Asian food and decent potion sizes.

6.description: Be prepared to go on a journey, a journey that will take your tastebuds to places they've never imagined before, Frodo-style. Minus the old wizard with the pointy hat/long beard and the life threatening task of destroying the most powerful sorcerer of all time.That aside, this place wow'ed me even upon opening the menu. One of the perks is that everything (EVERYTHING) comes with a picture, so you know exactly what you're getting. Of course, there is the classic beef cubes, tender little cutlets steeped in a mouth-watering sauce, so delectable that sweet little cherubims will come and serenade you with each bite. However, another suggestion of mine is the Pork and Sugar Cane Shrimp. It comes with noodles, pork, sauce, and a shrimp patty skewered by a real sugar cane. The shrimp is P-A-C-K-E-D with flavor, and the whole symphony of flavors come together when you pour the sauce over it.Also, if you came and didn't get the bubble tea (or any other kind of specialty drink), I'm sorry, but turn around and go back because you didn't actually get a Joy Yee's experience. It's amazing. All for an affordable price.

22.description: The food is really good! There are million options on the menu! Everyone can find something to eat, but at the same time it is a bit confusing to narrow it down.  They are known for their Smoothies. You can pick all the fruits you like and have them add in boba or jelly.  My favorite is Pineapple, mango, coconut with strawberry and mango boba!  There are lots of options for vegetarians! the portions are also pretty big! My favorite things are Spicy Orange Tofu, Wide noodles with Vegetables + Pineapple, and vegetable fried rice. You can also ask them to give to Chili Oil on the side. The only reason I give is 4 stars is because of the service.  It is not stellar, but the food is well worth going to.

15.description: I went to UIC for undergrad and this was practically on the campus. It was a very popular location because it was great food for a great price, not to mention the huge portion sizes. For $10-15 you basically get two meals! The food was always great and the service wasn't bad either. The bubble tea is really good too! The fruit is definitely fresh in all of their smoothies. The only bad thing I have to say is that the menu is way TOO large and can be intimidating. I've tried to venture out before but I find myself overwhelmed with the number of options. That usually leads me right back to square one where I either order my orange chicken extra spicy with fresh jalapenos or spicy basil chicken (also extra spicy). I have had more entrees than just those two, but those were my most common. I went here for 4 years and due to my somewhat short-term memory I cannot recall the names or distinctive flavors of those dishes. I do suggest trying the spicy basil chicken!!! If any other fellow yelpers have suggestions on new entrees to try, do share!

57.description: had the soft shell crab here and I wasn't impressed with it. there was too much dough around it & I think it changed the taste of the actual crab. but the lettuce wraps were delicious. we also had thai basil fried rice which was flavorful. I usually don't go to this location but it was empty this nite so so problems at all with the service.

20.description: The service is Terrible! Brought in 6 friends. Ordered 2 large soups, 6 entrees, and smoothies. Food was serve by another person who did not take our order 1 or 2 at a time.  He brought a dish to the table we realize after passing around to the group was not one of the items we ordered.   There was still plenty of the dish on the plate.  When he came back to bring a couple more of entries ordered,  I told him the dish was not ordered.   He rolled his eyes and insisted it was ordered.  He walked away.   Our next table had ordered ahead of us and there was 3 of them.  We notice 2 had gotten there food and 1 was still waiting.   So my friend asked what she ordered.   It was the dish on our table.   So server comes back again and bring another entree.  I repeated it's not ours and mentioned it was the table beside us.  He said "no, this is yours,  and still cooking the other table".  The waitress who took our order came in and insisted we had placed the order and said they can pull the camera.  I said go ahead,  let's us pull the camera.  They never came back to refresh our water and check after that.   We had to ask them for the check so we could leave.   The table next door finally got its order after the 2 in their group had finished eating. So beware!   The smoothies were great and the food was good,  3.5 out of 5.  But Joyee will make you pay for a mistake they made and try to spin a tale so you feel obligated to pay... Our bill was over $150 for 7.  They added an 18% service fee $22 and cents for terrible service. We don't mind paying gratuity when deserved and  the message here is really about servers attempt to force an extra order on us to the point they made up a story.Too bad service is so lousy .

36.description: I wanted to love this place but I think my experience was just like the reviews - hit or miss.Love the drinks! Two stars just for the drinks! Got my favorite - taro with boba. This is the first place I've been to in the city that has good boba. Most places don't cook it right but here it was the perfect texture & taste (trust me, there's a difference).The food was just ok. I had the beef vermicelli bowl with egg roll. The egg roll was doughy & not light or crispy whatsoever. The beef was seasoned with a thick sauce. The sauce for the bowl was not your typical fish sauce vermicelli noodle bowl sauce. Very strange.My friend had a dish that was titled "lemongrass" something. She said it had no lemongrass flavor at all. My other friend loved his dish so again, hit or miss.The waiter was impatient with us when we had questions about the menu. It was pretty slow yet they had 4-5 waiters just standing at the register doing nothing. The most irritating thing - when they dropped the check off they lingered around waiting for us to pull our cards out. Chill out buddy it's not like you need the table.I'll definitely be back for the drinks thou it might take some convincing to stay for the food.

14.description: I had some good and some bad food from joy yee. I do not recommend the beef brisket curry. The beef brisket is so hard, it's impossible to chew. It's really depends on what you order that really defines your experience to this restaurant. Service is excellent like usual.

29.description: Don't bother going here if you're looking for knitting or crocheting supplies.  The needle section is a joke, the yarn is deplorable, and the service is some of the worst I've ever experienced.I received a $25 gift card for Michael's for Christmas, and have been there several times now with friends, and still haven't found a single thing worth spending even the gift card on.

42.description: I'm SO excited that the south loop finally has a big craft store.  Michaels is fantastic with their huge selection, frequent 40-50% off coupons, and helpful sales staff.  I got tons of stickers for scrapbooking....there's like 3 full aisles of them and even more for paper!  They carry a decent selection of wedding goods too as well as the Martha Stewart craft lines.  It's good to see the Southgate Shopping Center filling up!

23.description: I was surprised to see all of the bad reviews on here for Michael's. I've shopped at various Michael's stores all over the country since about 1995, from Tucson to Austin to here. I recently moved back to Chicago after having (among other things) spent the past four years in Milwaukee for graduate school. After settling in, I decided to check this one out. I was really impressed by the selection. At the store in Milwaukee, I typically had to shop at two different places for my puppetry supplies and my painting supplies. I'd go to Michael's for puppetry stuff and Utrecht for my painting supplies. Not only could I get both at this particular Michael's store, but I was able to find puppet supplies that I couldn't find at the Michael's back in Milwaukee. I actually was so amazed by the selection that I spent a lot more than I originally intended. In terms of staff, they seemed fine to me. Pleasant, but no hard hustle and not overbearingly social. At the same time, when I checked out, the cashier was friendly and amiable. Honestly, when you're shopping somewhere that pays maybe $8/hr with (I'm assuming) no chance for commission, that's probably the most you should be expecting. As far as the parking goes, it is a little bit of a maze, but since Michael's is part of a rather extensive shopping plaza, that's probably more the fault of the people who designed the plaza than the people that run Michael's (who likely have no say over it). Fortunately, we were able to find street parking right across the street (we were there on a Thursday evening around 6 pm) so we didn't have to deal with it.

8.description: This is a great store for teachers , babysitters, collectors, event planners, bakers, Susie home makers, etc. they have some pretty cool items. The store is in a basement it's very dusty. If you have allergies take your medication before going.  They have several knick knacks I mean there is stuff galore. Things you would not expect to find you find. They have good sakes and everything is on sale so the weekly coupon of a discount is a waste of ink. The customer service is poor. I wish they would hire more people and just train everyone on appropriate interactions. Customer service can give you a loyal customer..... They will learn.

31.description: never thought i'd praise a craft store...i've lived at michael's recently due to my part-time "job" as party planner :)  michael's goes beyond arts and crafts.  it has been a LIFEsaver for giveaways/prizes for showers and such.  their dollar bins are full of fun wine gifts, quirky travel gadgets, cute stationery and trendy magnets.  guests will actually go home with something useful! also, michael's has inexpensive frames - both stand-up and wall.  when decorating our home, we went to michael's for all of our photo and poster needs!

34.description: Such a terrific craft store - and with validated parking, it's a crafter's dream right in the South Loop.If you are thinking about coming down to the Michael's in the South Loop, come for the Martha's Stewart Crafts line of craft supplies. They are simply perfect. Every once in a while they go on sale for 25% off - watch the ads for a sale. Or you can use the 40% off one regular priced item coupon that is in most Sunday papers. The layout is nice and there are a ton of stock items here. I love Michael's!

16.description: I've been here a number of times when I'm feeling crafty.  Everything from scrapbook supplies to crochet/knitting and random crafting.  I've been helped by the same associate too.  A super friendly older gentleman that walks around assisting doe-eyed customers lost in the ailes attempting to find random odds and ends craft supplies.  Tool, jingle bells, seqenze, pom pom balls...etc.  It's not a super Michael's, they don't have a HUGE variety but it gets the job done.

13.description: Convenient location with 90 minute free parking with validation. The store's location in on the ground/ water level if you take the elevator down. If you are coming from the street take the escalator to the lower level below Whole Foods and across LA Fitness. The store is set up in an efficient manner  and the staff is knowledgeable and happy to help if they can.  This location appears to be more organized than some locations I've been to

11.description: This is where I go for all my arts and crafts needs.It's a pretty big store and has most of the stuff you would ever need for any type of arts and crafts project and then some. They also have a framing service inside the store. The only thing bad about this place is that due to its size it makes it hard to find help in the store.The parking garage allows for 90 minutes of free parking with validation at any of the stores.

39.description: I was never a very talented person with my hands (nothing naughty on your mind here, please)Too lazy, too scared, too shy - whatever the excuse was -  I just wasn't.Until my wedding that is! Man does it change your life!!Obsessed by the fact that I wanted:1 - to save as much cash as possible2 - to give people something meaningful as favors and such (God knows why)I started visiting what people call "craft stores". Whoo....scary... At first I was totally overwhelmed by the amount of stuff in these Ali Baba caverns. I had no idea how to use half of the things in there or even how to call them. But I braved myself, started to look,  touch and sometimes smell and big ta-da!! I did all my party favors and decorations myself!!!! I am hooked now and Michael's is super convenient for me. And unlike the other store in the city (the arch enemy on Elston) it's never too busy so you don't have to wait in line for hours thinking of sweets you shouldn't eat anyway. You don't - but there is a Panera and a Whole Foods just above so it doesn't really help.............Anyway - these places that were totally out of my radar four months ago are great!! And when I see how successful they are I am considering quitting my stupid dissertation and opening one myself who would be the love-child of Michael and JoAnn........any name idea?

37.description: I love crafter's paradises especially when they're in the Loop. In the midst of wedding planning, my mom has been stalking the craft stores for DIY invitation kits. Since I've only heard about them, I figured that I would check them out for myself. Our tastes vary so I wanted to be sure that there would something to my liking. After watching a few hours of 17 Kids and Counting, I headed over here.I love this little shopping mall where Michael's is located because it has a number of my vices all in one place: organic food, import wine, and crafts. The Michael's is located on the lower level. Like a typical Michael's, the store is divided nicely. I first checked out some picture frames to frame my proposal picture and memento. I didn't find anything that great, but it was a decent selection. The wedding and baking aisles converged onto each other. The wedding aisles was about an aisle and a half big. They had nice invitation kits, but nothing to my liking. The kits ranged from too busy to too cheestastic. I did manage to find a gift log for my best friend come wedding shower time.The baking/Wilton aisle is also nicely stocked. I picked up some pink and mint cocoa candy melts for future cake balls. Persuing the other aisles, the store seemed a little dark and small. The yarn aisle and a half seemed tiny. They had an average selection of yarn and lots of Pound of Loves and other bulk yarn. I had hoped for something a little better. The scrapbooking aisle seemed like the biggest in the store laid out in the middle. I checked out the rubber stamps in hopes of finding a cute one for the escort cards. I managed to find something handmade/knitting related, but otherwise the selection was okay. This is a decent Michael's which has a good sampling of anyone's crafting needs. I'll stop by when I run out of Lion Brand Pound of Loves or in need of some baby yarn. It's good to have a Michael's in the city. It's just not the crafting superstore I'd hoped for.

0.description: This location had a lot of great Halloween stuff on clearancebut finding that section was just crazy. Because this place has a large selection of stuff crammed in a small area, you just may miss what you are really looking for just like some of the other stores in this building, they try to make as most of the little space they got.So you will probably need to ask an employee regarding where it is (location) of what you are looking for in the store.

38.description: I love Michaels! Love, love, love it!  It is my oasis! I could get lost in here for days on end.So much to choose from and so much to do. I usually go in with an idea of what I want and come out with 3 or 4 more other ideas as well. I always spent a lot of money here even if I don't mean to but with all the coupons they give out it's really not so bad.I'm taking away 1 star because it's so far from my place. The South Loop is not necessarily convenient to East Lakeview but hey at least I have a Michaels now.

27.description: When I moved into my new place, I needed to get a bunch of new stuff framed.  Luckily, I found a 60% off (!!!!!!!!!!!) coupon for this place called Michael's.  Since framing is about as expensive as several dental procedures, I decided to give Michael's and it's 60% off coupon a whirl.  They may not have ALL the frame/matting selection that a bigger arts and crafts stores offer, but what I did get was excellent service, low prices, and some frames that make my concert screen prints look pretty damn cool.  I'd recommend this for anyone who needs some framing done at a reasonable price.  Can't really comment on the rest of the store though..

32.description: Yeah, no. This is most definitely a Michael's LIGHT. I was all excited to indulge my super inner craft-nerd, and left sorely disappointed. Me: Hi, is this the whole store? (looks up at ceiling)Salesgirl: Oh, yep this is it. Me: Really? Where is all the....stuff? Salesgirl: Oh, it's around. Me: blank stare. Salesgirl: blank stare. A craft store without fabric is like a bar without beer! What the hell? Nevermind the alien-like parking structure and the fact it took me at least 20 minutes to even FIND this little weenie version of a craft store.  Beyond that its ridiculously overpriced (ie; bought vases for my friend's wedding for $1 at Joann, they were $6 at Michael's).  Bollocks, stick with Joann on Elston. Atleast home girl's got fabric, and a parking lot that doesn't require training for the f'in Bourne Identity movies. Skip it!

44.description: Art students, crafters and artsy people rejoice!  Michael's Arts and Crafts has finally found its way to the city of Chicago.  Tucked away in the basement of the Southgate Mall in the South Loop is this new treasure.No more trips to North Riverside Mall and the small little Michael's with crowded aisles and little inventory.  This store is bright and shiny and new (and smells like cinnamon).   What a wonderful surprise to find this new store as I trekked to Whole Foods and World Market.  It's filled to the brim with scrapbooking, floral, framing and art supplies.  Woo hoo!!

24.description: So I go to an arts/crafts store to buy some string. I ask for it. I get semi laughed at. They don't have it. So I ask for fishing line. They had that.Huuuuuuuuuuuuuuuhhhhhh????

7.description: Celebrated my daughters B'day, its small but the party room is free. We have to buy the supplies and bring the food. Everyone had a good time . I requested one of the store staff to help with the crafts and they obliged. Great finds always for kids goody bags.So glad to have this in the loop after many years of driving north for craft needs.

40.description: My first trip to Michael's was here, with Maggie R., of course.  I was totally uncrafty when I entered, but so totally crafty when I left.  When we got home, I drank some vodka, and crafted for my very first time.  We drove by the other day, and I waved while excitedly exclaiming, "Hi Michael's!"  I am in love.  In fact, when my bf's mother asked him what she should get me for xmas, he told her a Michael's gift certificate.  Holla!  I love me some crafting, and I love me some Michael's!

30.description: I came in today for silk flowers for my wedding bouquet and ended up browsing the whole store. Nice craft selection.It didn't have everything I was looking for- I was looking for subtle (non feathery) alternatives to greenery- but I can't fault the flower selection itself.The reason this isn't a four star review is due to the service. More precisely, the non-service. Now usually in stores I adore minimally invasive service because I want to browse without disturbance. And they provided that. However, they have a flower arrangement service desk and I stood around there for quite awhile with alot different stems trying to find the best looking arrangement and generally killing time until a staff member came along to help me and give me their advice.But no one came. So I walked around the store and couldn't find a staff member to help. 35 long minutes later I came up with my own arrangement and went to pay.But at least the price was nice and despite the service, I left relatively happy.

1.description: I've been carrying a print from the SF MOMA for the past five years or so.  Now that I recently landed Chicago, I thought its time to give it a proper home.  Trying to save a little bit of money (remember I'm broke from moving here across the country lol), I brought a coupon with me to get it framed.   It seems that every time I turn around there's a Michael's coupon floating around in the mail, a pop up on the computer or basically someone handing them out on street corners.  I brought the print in about two months ago and was helped by a very nice girl Jamesy.  I basically told her my price range and was type of frame I thought would suit it best over my marble kitchen table.  She was able to pull the print up by scanning it and then giving me the options very clearly (oh technology) on her computer screen and what is would look like exactly with or without colorful mats.  Of course the best option with the double mats, foam backing, frame, etc. was like a million bucks.  We reconfigured and took a mat away, and opted for a frame rustic green barnwood.  Only half a million.  Doable. She was extremely helpful, and although it's probably in her best interest to upwell the products, she was patient and worked with me on something that wouldn't break the piggy bank.  I finally went in today to pick it up.  She came out from the back, and remembered me and what I did for a living, and was very personable.  She not only does great work, but also knowing a little something abut your customer is extraordinary, besides asking me about my day, etc. (remember, I hadn't been there in two months).  Not the cheapest route to go, but I'm happy, and her customer service was way more than expected for a Michael's.  A+ Jamesy.

9.description: It's a pretty large store, so it's easy to get lost in all of the little things that they have.Pros-Wide variety of things-Free parking for 90 minutes with store validationCons-NO CELL SERVICE whatsoever. I have to walk out of the store and towards the escalators to get any type of service. -Average customer service. No greeting or anything.

26.description: I don't visit Michael's all that often, but when I do I know I'll inevitably standing in line for a long time.  It never fails, they always seem to be short-staffed and/or the person working at the register is so new that they shouldn't be ringing...  Case in point - when I was there a few weeks ago, I was returning something that I didn't have my receipt for but I just wanted whatever kind of credit they could give me.  The woman who did my transaction literally had to ask the cashier at the next register over every single step of the process.  Then she kept apologizing saying that she didn't work there that often.  Another time I was there and had two separate coupons and wanted to make two separate purchases since you can only save on one item per coupon.  The cashier told me she couldn't do it, that she could only ring up one of the transactions but that I'd have to go to the other register to purchase the other item.  What?  How does that make any difference whatsoever?  And P.S. - I am spending money at your store so you should probably just be happy for the sales...Aside from the seemingly incompetent staff, the selection of products is really lackluster.  Their prices, specifically on framing, also seem to be a bit high, even when you have one of their 60% off coupons that seem to be in the newspaper every single day.

25.description: Very helpful knowledgeable staff, smaller store that doesn't have a wide inventoryI did lots of shopping here over the holidaysThe location is terrific

12.description: I was searching for the best place to have my undergraduate and graduate diplomas and tassels framed.  I refused to pay $200 for a frame, even though I had spent roughly $160,000 on my degrees!  Michael's happened to be offering one of their awesome deals of 50% off framing orders.  I jumped on it and came to this Canal location, versus the congested Lakeview location.  I worked with Jeremy on customizing my framing order.  Who knew so much thought went into it?!  Frame, matte, placement, colors...  Jeremy was sure to show my all my options and gave his expert opinion when asked.  I even had them frame my four awesome Ryan Kapp "4 Seasons in Chicago" prints.  Then the waiting and trouble began...Michael's called me on my cell phone in a week letting me know my order being completed and ready for pickup (thankfully they validate parking).  I came in to the store and my Chicago prints looked perfectly done.  However, whoever placed the tassels next to my diplomas had them placed diagonally versus one on top of the other as I had originally requested.  It just looked silly so I asked that they rearrange the tassels.  While they did this without a fuss or cost, the staples that held the tassels in place tore up the matting, requiring a new mat.  They said they would call me when they received the new premium matting and it was done, but I never received a call...  Note: It doesn't help that the Framing Department never answers their phone, so I press "0" for the main line when calling, and ask for a Framing representative.  Two weeks later, I called again and my diplomas with tassels were ready.  All in all, I am happy with the job on my two framing projects, but could have done without the little hiccups and lack of communication.

21.description: My first time in a Michaels believe it or not (I usually patron the Joann's that's in the neighborhood).This place has a larger variety of crafty stuff and is much cheaper to boot. I didn't get a chance to check to see if they had fabrics I can use but I will be back for other supplies so time will tell (I know I didn't use this saying correctly).

17.description: I am a frequent patron of craft stores, fabric stores, etc, and for downtown Chicago, this is the best we have.  This Michael's is rather small, and the lines take forever, even when they are short.  They have good sales, but beware because they frequently have sale signs up with items that are similar but are NOT the sale items. It is in the basement of a small shopping center, is not usually crowded, and they have most basic crafty items except fabric.  Not super friendly or super clean but it serves its purpose.

10.description: Dreadful. I'd like to love this place, and normally do love a craft store but the supplies are lacking, it feels like you're in a dungeon but worst of all, are the rude and unhelpful staff that works there. Seriously try smiling or at least make an effort to be moderately helpful. Crap place! go to Joanne's across the street!

5.description: Michael's it a toy land for me. I love shopping for the cake supplies. I get my coupon every week and so when I shop there I save about 40% on one item some time 25% entire purchase. It has all the crafts and fun activities you want to do with the kids. You can also decorate your home buying some baskets and home decorated dyi items there. I always have fun shopping at Michael's I could probably be in there for at least two hours checking out everything.

35.description: I love Michaels... especially this one. Friendly staff, but -1 star for the staff never being at the registers.They have a better selection than the Skokie store.(And there is a Cost Plus - World Market in the same building. Yay!)

19.description: My experience here was for framing an important gift of a quality poster. I had a helpful salesman who found the items we requested. That was the end of the good experience. No on ever called to tell me my order was ready. I called several times to no avail. Perhaps they don't have a phone in that department. I called the main nmber & asked them to have the framing dept call me.. Two days - nothing. I called the main number and asked for a supervisor. He had the framing dept call me and the order was ready for pick up. At pick up I checked the finished product carefully. I was using a 50% off coupon and chose a simple fram. The cost was $358! They said they were competing with Artists Frame Service. That's who I've used many times in the past when we lived in Lincoln Park. Now iving in the West Loop so I thought I would try them. When I returned home with much better lighting I could see the damage. The museum grade poster was now wrinkled in two places. Plus the poster was wavy. And there was a thumbprint on the inside of the glass. When I called about the issues I was treated cavalierly by the saleswoman. She said if the waves were to be eliminated the poster would have to be permanently glued to a foam core. This was not suggested at the time I placed my order. She said I should investigate this process before I brought the poster back. At that point I decided if the wrinklees could be taken out and the waves could be flattened it would be smart to just go back to Artists Frame Service. Not only are the prices comparable, without a coupon, the customer service and quality would assure the finished product would be professional. Yep! They said attempting to repair the wrinkles could have a more negative result. We should order a new poster from the museum, have it sent to them and they would glue it to foam, clean the glass, keep the framed poster there and they would call upon completion. Take my advice, use Artists Frame Service on Clybourn. Without spending any more money, you will get exactly what you were expecting and great customer service.

28.description: I took cake decorating classes here and thought the instruction, Denise, pleasant & information. I highly recommend her classes. She is very patient and skillful.However, the store itself is not pleasant. There is ALWAYS a line at check out (at least 10 minute wait) and the employees seems clueless. There is definitely a gross misunderstanding of company coupon policy. I asked the same question to 3 cashiers, and received 3 different answers.
