3.description: Meditation works for some people.  And so does a glass of Merlot.  But when I'm stressed, nothing evens me out like an hour of crafting.  It demands concentration... let my mind wander too much, and I end up with a mess.  I discovered this about five years ago when my family decided that everyone had to make a handmade gift for a Christmas exchange. Last year I set a goal of six handmade ornaments I could gift to friends.  I went on Pinterest for inspiration (okay I copied someone else's ideas).   My friends loved everything, or maybe they were just being kind.  But there really is something special about getting a gift someone has taken the time to make just for you.I buy most of my supplies at this Michaels store because it's the most convenient one.  It has an awesome selection of decorations, baskets, wrapping paper, ribbon, boxes and silk flowers.  Be prepared to wade through a lot of really schlocky stuff to find the gems.  But this Michaels store also has a lot of issues.  First, it's not as clean as most of their other stores,  lots of dust in the air.  The people who work here aren't very friendly. And the store is really understaffed.  I can never find anyone to help me locate things.  Plus, the line at the check-out is always backed up on weekends. This store is in the basement of a shopping complex.   Forget about using your mobile, even for texting.  Zero signal.  But you can park free for 90 minutes... it's $4/hour on the street.  There's a Marshalls here too, and a giant Whole Foods.  Don't shop at any Michaels without first checking for coupons online and in the Sunday paper.  Some are up to 50% off a single item, and 40% off your entire purchase.... but they can only be used on non-sale items.

33.description: It took me a while, but I finally made it over to Michael's. This is heaven for people who are into arts and crafts.... as they have EVERYTHING here. I was looking for a very specific type of ribbon, and ended up buying a bunch of things I probably don't need. I love their various die cuts, beads, baking molds and dessert decorating items. This is the type of store where you can walk around for hours looking at things. I'm going to buy a glue gun next week. Watch out!

43.description: One of my first disappointments after moving to the city was not finding my beloved Michael's or Hobby Lobby anywhere without a nasty commute out the suburbs where the stores are over crowded and sub-par.  While out shopping yesterday, there is was, one the side of the Southgate Market Shopping Center, I saw the beautiful red sign for Michael's.  I was ecstatic, I screamed a bit in my car, and almost hit someone trying to parallel park on Canal St.  Although, I did not have much time to browse the new store, simply the glimpse of peeking in and seeing all of the glorious wonderment that I will so heavily pursue, was enough to put a smile on my face for the rest of the day.

2.description: Custom framing here is a total rip-off.Project: 17 x 17 basic flat black inch wide frame, one white mat, basic glass.  (I already have the image and so planned to assemble myself).Their price: $127.  That's AFTER the so-called 60% discount!On Art.com or Allposter I can get the above, PLUS the image, PLUS assembly for $65 to $70.Hmmm, what to do, what to do?

18.description: Very helpful knowledgeable staff, smaller store that doesn't have a wide inventoryI did lots of shopping here over the holidaysThe location is terrific

41.description: The location of this Michael's - the ground floor of a fancy complex just a mile south of the Sears Tower - is perfect.  Michael's carries things that are just hard to find anywhere else, and now that this is here, you don't have to, gob forbid, get in a car and drive to the blasted suburbs.  The best part of shopping here is how friendly/accommodating the staff is.  This is basically how it went down:"Hi""Oh hey""Can I help you find anything blah blah etc""No but look how ridiculous this [particular seasonal item] is lolllll!!!""omg lolz! i didn't notice that!"Yes, go for the hard to find bits and pieces, stay for the staff.

4.description: Awful experience at the store, made not that much better by a few employees unable/unwilling to help. First, Chicago has a no plastic bag policy... That's just fine. Every single retail shop has made accommodations with paper bags or heavy duty reusable bags... Not Michaels, nope. Every small businesses has, but the staff claims it's too expensive. They don't even have the funky for purchase bags, so whatever you do, DO NOT FORGET your bags. Even more fun when we asked for a matt to be cut for a picture. Three day turn around does not help when you need it that day. The employee response to our inquiry if we could have it that day even for an up charge was a rude and sarcastic "no." And his comment to us saying we would have to go elsewhere was "oh, we're the cheapest so you might as will have it done here."Just awful service.

6.description: 3 1/2 stars is probably the most accurate assessment of this Michael's location. I went for four stars based on the large selection and updated store. They have much better variety and stock of items here than the Belmont location, and the store is pretty clean and well organized too!My main annoyance is that there is ALWAYS a line to checkout here, I swear. Said line is often long, and often slow/time consuming.  Good luck getting a second cashier up front!

22.description: I've been here a number of times when I'm feeling crafty.  Everything from scrapbook supplies to crochet/knitting and random crafting.  I've been helped by the same associate too.  A super friendly older gentleman that walks around assisting doe-eyed customers lost in the ailes attempting to find random odds and ends craft supplies.  Tool, jingle bells, seqenze, pom pom balls...etc.  It's not a super Michael's, they don't have a HUGE variety but it gets the job done.

15.description: This Michael's is my backup store in Chicago. When there is a sale or I have a coupon, I go here after church. They have everything I would expect them to have, but I will say the sore feels a bit smaller than when you find them in their own buildings. I usually find what I need here. I do agree with others that help is few in between here, but the cashiers are very friendly and helpful. The one area I really think lacks here is the flower area. Not really good selection for real touch flowers. But this location has always met my needs when I am in the area.

20.description: Sometimes my dad and I spend hours in here just looking at all the crap they have! We have purchased anywhere from, kids crafts making to jewelery making to candles to frames to pumpkin carving kids.  Nice variety and usually inspires your crafty side.  They validate parking and often have sale racks.

36.description: Its okay for what it is--a crafts store.  Lots of fake flowers and bins of stuff that has little use.  I feel like whenever I go here they are out of what I'm looking for (e.g. ornament hooks in December), its impossible to find and the staff doesn't know either (metallic paint pen), or its twice as much as Dick Blick (Micron pens).  So in a nutshell, its an expensive, disorganized, randomly stocked crafts emporium.That said, they sometimes have killer deals on things like pillar candles.

14.description: This review is for the framing folks, who were awesome in helping me do a cost effective and quick frame for a poster that I got as a gift for a friend. The girl was very pleasant and when I told her it was a gift and what I had in mind, she very helpfully suggested that I buy a regular basic frame (on sale for 50% off) and then have them put it together with the wire and paper backing. It was perfect. I really like when stores have no problem helping customers save money and this was a huge cost savings for a great looking frame perfect for the poster.We also put together a craft project while we were there. Thankfully the AC was fixed between my first and second visit. The nonstop singing halloween decorations (in July) can be really grating and stuff can be somewhat hard to find. But we were eventually successful in making some fun stuff.

58.description: I am sorry to put this review, but the food we ordered just wasn't good.  We ordered spicy pork and chicken wings.  Neither of them was up to our expectation.  Espeically for the spicy pork, we seriously thought that we might be able to cook a better dish ourselves.  I had no issues with their service.  The people I talked to were nice.  I really hope this place do well, but I personally think there needs to be some improvement with the quality of food.  I think the price is reasonable.

56.description: One of the few korean restaurants near me. Cute spot. Friendly staff. We came in on a Sunday afternoon so it was quiet plus there was a Bears game too (there's a tv on their wall so we could watch the game too!).I ordered the kalbi - yum.A friend had the kimchi and porkbelly which was delicious! There's also a nice kick to it. Another friend had kimchi fried rice which she enjoyed.For some reason, there was a cold draft and it wasn't even from the front door - we think they must have kept the back door in the kitchen open... the draft made my food cold real fast :(

29.description: Decent food and cute decor but the banchan is on the sparse side. If you need a quick Korean fix while in the medical district it will do but Tozi in Wicker Park is waaay better

42.description: I ordered for delivery.  Food was pretty late, but grub hub made up for it with free grub. My boyfriend thought his food was pretty good, but I did not enjoy mine very much. Bi bim bop was the best thing we tried.

23.description: I go here time to time when I'm craving asian food or when I have time. It's pretty decent, the place is nice and clean, the walls are decorated nicely, and the food is decent too. I only order one thing whenever I get there, the kimchi ssamgypusaal something. But I like it! The price is decent, and it's a nice place to go once in a while when you want to try korean foods.

47.description: I went here for lunch with my cousin today, and I haven't had the opportunity to try different Korean places before. I stuck to what I knew - the bulgogi. I ordered the bulgogi lunchbox and it did not disappoint. For less than $8 dollars, our server brought out my tray. The side dishes for today were the potato salad, kimchi, beans and rice. I wasn't a big fan of kimchi before coming in, but after tasting theirs, I'm a believer!The amount of food they give you is ridiculous. Half way through, I was stuffed. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good affordable Korean food!  Plus, who can resist the super kawaii decals on their walls!? ^_^

8.description: Closest non-fast food Korean restaurant to downtown (River North).Items ordered:1.  Korean potstickers - this came from a frozen bag that was probably bought from H-Mart.  It was ok, who can screw up frying a pot sticker?2.  Giant size Korean BBQ wings - it was good.3.  Korean seafood pancake - disappointed, was very doughy / starchy.  They used the frozen mixed seafood (squid, calamari).  I think if they flatten out the pancake and used imitation crab meet, it would of tasted better.4.  Soon Dubu soup - I had better and I had worse, it was ok and satisfactory.5.  Kalbi lunch box - the meat was very good, pan fried perfectly, no fat.6.  Mackerel lunch box - didn't get to eat it because I was already full at that point.  It did look good however.I really wanted to give this place 3.5 stars, but considering I got all that food above for $62 plus tip, and it was byob, and I had a coupon (before the $62) and they were fast with the food..... I'll round up to 4 and I'll be coming back.

31.description: Best Korean restaurant in metro area!! fast, clean, very tasty, healthy and inexpensive! Come here every week.

34.description: I had heard about this place since it opened a while back, but never got to make it out there. Based on the existence of this review, I'm sure that you, as the astute reader that you are, have figured out that I was able to make it to Dosirak to give it a try. First things first, the food: kimchi samgyupsal bokkeum (kimchi and pork belly stir-fry) and soondoobu (spicy soft-tofu stew). Both were around $8, and both were more than enough to fill us up. They both came on steel lunchbox trays (my friend referred to them as prison food trays...I can't disagree) with 3 banchan each, which were different on each tray. Both dishes were spicy like they should be, and they both tasted like you'd expect - no surprises here. The decor inside is fun and comfortable. Bathrooms are clean. Staff are friendly. Will visit again.

16.description: Their soups here are fantastic. The S1 was so so tasty and good. The S3 was quite spicy and enjoyable as well. The soups were very reasonably priced and came with two sides and lots of well-cooked white rice. The food always comes out very quickly and the soups are literally still boiling in their stone bowls. The only thing I would skip on is the bibimbap. This was the only thing I ordered as to go but it was just regular white rice with some sites on top. It is definitely a no frills place but I will continue coming here as the staff are very attentive and the food reminds me of the food I ate in my childhood.

13.description: Can't go wrong with R4 (kimchi bokkeum bap). It's a bit spicy and comes with free side dishes, and a fried egg on top!

11.description: Authentic and cheap. I love it! Bimbimbap is the best.  All fresh ingredients makes dishes really tasty.

39.description: I really like this place. and the staff are so kind. I would like to try all of the food here If I can:-) But I think It will be better to have sauce of bibimbab which is original korean red pepper sauce..

37.description: Wow my friend brought me here.  I love it!! Small restaurant but the food is amazing. One of my favorite places to come and eat Korean food. It's hard to find decent Korean food in the city but this place has some good kimchi and bulgolgi ^ ^

0.description: Food well executed. Had the bulgogi dog and jajyung myun. The shoe string fries were fried nicely with it having a crispy and crunchy texture. Drizzling hot sesame oil over the fries gave it a really nice kick to them. The bulgogi dog was pretty nice and I really wished I ordered the kimchi topping. The juice from the bulgogi carried the flavor into the bun that ties everything together. The jajyung myun was good. Splashing some sesame oil, hot and not, gives this dish some depth. Had I worked down the street or attending the school, this would absolutely be on my list of go to places!

38.description: I've definitely experienced better Korean food than this.  My son and I were in there this afternoon for lunch and I order JaJiang Myun and bbq chicken.  My Jiajang myun was literally horrible.  It was as if the black bean paste was thrown in there and the noodles were over cooked.  BBQ chicken was okay.  It wasn't a true Korean marinade.  It tasted like teriyaki sauce from the bottle.  How do you say I would know all this, because I'm Korean and I make these kinds of food all the time.  Sorry, my experience there was not great!!!! Next time, I will make the trip north to get real Korean food.  :-(

51.description: I was on the hunt for a Korean spot closer to me and came across this little spot. I was craving something sweet and spicy and opted for the Bokkeum Bop. I figured I was eating too much red meat as of late and opted for the pork belly. This was a pretty good alternative. I did wish that there were more vegetables and I think it could be a little bit spicier. You get a little kimchi on the side, which was actually pretty good. I feel like I should have tried the more popular food items, and so I might come back and give something else a try here. The prices were decent and the service was quick.

27.description: Kalbi was good. Their popular soups were just okay. Delivery guy never brings the food up. He calls before 2-3mins he arrives and expecting me to go down and let me wait him. Not good service!

32.description: I have ordered delivery from this place a few times. The food is just ok.  The options are just so limited when you are craving for Korean and want it delivered. I placed a delivery order tonight, waited for over 2 hours, and it never came. What a joke! I will never order from this place again. Now just hope I get my money back...

54.description: It's nice to have a quick fix Korean option on the South Side of Chicago. What's not nice is the jjangjjang noodles. Something's off with the sauce. The soondooboo (soft tofu) soup was great and the side of rice was perfection, if such a word can be used to describe rice. The pajeon was fantastic - my favorite part of the order. I almost gave this place two stars because the kimchi was horrid.

48.description: I live by Chinatown so my only option of nearby Korean food is Ahjoomah's Apron. However, one of my friends suggested we go to Dosirak for lunch which isn't too far by car. It was nice to see that the prices were decent and they had lunch specials. However, I had a craving for budae jigae so I settled for soonduboo jigae. The food was pretty good and a good amount of spicy. It was difficult to eat too because it stayed very hot (temperature) the entire time being in the stone bowl.3 stars because it took a longer time than expected for the food to come out and the food could be a little tastier if not cheaper. I would definitely come back when I get a chance to try some of the other dishes out.

44.description: This is my first time ordered from dosirak.I ordered the grilled mackarel and the soy bean paste stew something.Both food were okay. I'm not going to complain. Its so difficult to get a proper Korean foods around this area. If I have to choose between Dosirak and ..... apron (forgot the name, its in chinatown), I'm gonna choose Dosirak. Price is not that expensive. Its affordable especially for UIC students.Will go back again for the mackarel.

24.description: Average Korean Fast Food.Dosirak occupies the first floor space of a three flat that is setback for a nice front porch area on a main artery in the Illinois Medical District. Perfect spot for the health professions passerbys and or the UIC students living in the area. The no frills interior was a bit of a downer. Despite the sparse design, I was happy hear another Korean restaurant opened up in the city.As I walked in for an early supper to go order, I was confronted by the owner who happened to be Chinese. Hmmm. His wife was Korean. Ok. Tried their KimChi Stew and Spicy Pork Belly dish. The stew is a common and traditional dish. It was unfortunately subpar. The Pork was good but very oily. This place should be an encouragement to those young entrepreneurs too afraid to try. If Dosirak can make it,...

7.description: This is a nearby Korean place without having to trek up north. The dol sot bim bap was fresh and had a good meat/veggie ratio. Most importantly, the rice was super crispy on the sides!!!! Also came with a good serving of kimchee and seaweed salad. I tasted my bf's seafood tofu soon dubu and the flavor was good with a slight kick. Not much seafood though. Would not order the mandoo next time, seems like frozen bag/was mushy in the middle. They also have restaurant.com certificates online! Will be back!

49.description: Pro: Dosirak has great food with okay pricing. The staff and owner are really nice.Con: Not enough meat in the dishes

40.description: Ordered their food via grubhub and it was inedible.  The jajangmyun lacked enough sauce to coat the noodles, the black bean sauce was bland, and the Korean sauce on the wings was chunky and overly vinegary making it impossible to eat.  Never again.

53.description: Granted the only thing I really eat is the Bibimbap because it's delicious and I'm not adventurous, I really like this place. They're always really friendly and food is served quickly. Worth a try and prices are reasonable.

30.description: Got a takeout order recently. Good kimchi, but there was only enough in the serving for literally 3 bites. The bulgogi was too sweet and didn't have that melding of good seasonings and umami that even average Korean places routinely turn out. Not recommended, unless you are really very hungry for Koreanish food and confined to the area.(I see that another reviewer wrote, "Best Korean restaurant in metro area!!"-- lololThey must have left out a "not" in that sentence!)

46.description: This is a place to get your Korean food crave fixed but not necessarily the best Korean food in town. The prices are decent. I tried the jaja myun noodles. It was soggy and way too beany. I could not finish it. It was definitely not my cup of tea, well..food. Anyways, you can't go wrong with the jap chae noodles and the pajeon, the Korean omelette. This is the closest Korean food to me, so I do stop by occasionally.

1.description: So first let me say cheers for using the Eat24 online ordering system through Yelp! It's the first time I've ever used that and it was a breeze! So, thank you, Dosirak, for making my food ordering such an easy task! Also, the food was ready so quick-- also appreciated!The food was equally satisfying as my experience above! I ordered the mandu dumplings and the curry rice. The mandu dumplings were good! They were served with a black dipping sauce, which was a great addition to the flavor. They were fried (I prefer steamed, but that's just personal preference), and loaded with good flavors inside, which included various vegetables, and I believe beef. The curry rice was a mixture of beef, carrots, potatoes, onions, and of course curry rice! The flavor of the curry was good-- not too strong, but still very apparent. Oh, and the side of kimchi was AMAZING!Overall, the food was good! No complaints! Also, if you are ordering ahead, try out the online ordering-- it's so convenient! It's almost as easy as picking up the phone and ordering that way! Ha!

55.description: Great stuff. Had a bulgogi/kimchi hot dog (3.95$ for a single, 5.95$ for two) and Umma's Korean style Fried Chicken. Great sauce, good chicken, cooked to order. I'll be back!

9.description: Loved it!!! I'm so happy I finally find a Korean restaurant in the southside! I loved the food! I usually go to Chicago Foods but that's too far away. The flavor is great, small place but it's busy all the time because the food is good. I'm definitely coming back!

26.description: I am pretty new to eating Korean food so when I can across this place on Eat24 I was excited to try it. Originally, I ordered the Bibim Bap and the Bulgogi.  The delivery driver arrived and I begin to eat my food.  About 30 minutes later, I received a call from the delivery driver (with broken English and a thick accent) inquiring about if my order was correct.  I told her that it was my first time eating it so I thought it was ok but I'm not sure.  She responded something I didn't understand and then hung up.  30 minutes after that, another rep from the restaurant called inquiring about my food.  His name was Nick and he informed me that I had the wrong food and asked me if I had started eating; mind you, its been about an hour since my food had been delivered.  I told him that I had.  He explained that he would send the other party the correct food but if I was okay with it he would not charge me my food.  I agreed to this and continued to watch my PayPal account to monitor my refund. This all happened on the 18th and today, the 22nd no refund still had not gone thru.  I called the restaurant and spoke with Nick.  He remembered the situation but refused to refund me.  He states that he told me that he would not charge me the extra amount for the FOOD I DIDN'T ORDER.  Now how could he charge me more when everything went thru PayPal so I know that's a lie.  Policy with all restaurants that I have gone thru; whenever there is a order error, you either get the food you order or you get a credit for future orders.  Nick was EXTREMELY rude and eventually hung up on me.  I was told that the manager will be in on Friday and I will have to call then to speak with him/her.  I did enjoy the food but I will not order again. I am truly disappointed about this experience.  Customer service is important for small businesses and the customer service in which I received was not satisfactory.  I will let everyone I know not to patronize this place until my situation is rectified.

25.description: I agree with Aris' review below.The bulgogi was too sweet and too salty. Not sure how else to describe it. The Kimchi was average.  The thing about eating bulgogi is that the kimchi and bulgogi mix so well. So when the bulgogi is off or the kimchi is off, it just makes for an average meal. I really wished I would have liked this place more!

12.description: This place is just 'eh'. Nothing too exciting and nothing too special in my opinion. I'm new to the Chicago area, and I was desperate for some korean food. I ordered the Dolsot Bibimbap and Haemul Pajeon. They were pretty average looking.. but then the gochujang was really sweet for whatever reason. The service was chaos. It was probably just an especially busy time, but regardless they failed to impress. 2 stars is all I will give. I probably would not go there again unless someone gives me a really good reason to do so.

59.description: Yay for discovering this place! Got an order of dolsot bibimbap & an order of galbi. Most things on the menu are almost K-american home cooking. Hence the kimchi stew, spam, & golden curry style rice.This place is decently priced and menu kept small. I would definitely return here for a quick lunch/dinner. Thumbs up for having kimchi (cabbage, radish, & cucumber style!)

21.description: So first let me say cheers for using the Eat24 online ordering system through Yelp! It's the first time I've ever used that and it was a breeze! So, thank you, Dosirak, for making my food ordering such an easy task! Also, the food was ready so quick-- also appreciated!The food was equally satisfying as my experience above! I ordered the mandu dumplings and the curry rice. The mandu dumplings were good! They were served with a black dipping sauce, which was a great addition to the flavor. They were fried (I prefer steamed, but that's just personal preference), and loaded with good flavors inside, which included various vegetables, and I believe beef. The curry rice was a mixture of beef, carrots, potatoes, onions, and of course curry rice! The flavor of the curry was good-- not too strong, but still very apparent. Oh, and the side of kimchi was AMAZING!Overall, the food was good! No complaints! Also, if you are ordering ahead, try out the online ordering-- it's so convenient! It's almost as easy as picking up the phone and ordering that way! Ha!

17.description: Got a takeout order recently. Good kimchi, but there was only enough in the serving for literally 3 bites. The bulgogi was too sweet and didn't have that melding of good seasonings and umami that even average Korean places routinely turn out. Not recommended, unless you are really very hungry for Koreanish food and confined to the area.(I see that another reviewer wrote, "Best Korean restaurant in metro area!!"-- lololThey must have left out a "not" in that sentence!)

10.description: Average Korean Fast Food.Dosirak occupies the first floor space of a three flat that is setback for a nice front porch area on a main artery in the Illinois Medical District. Perfect spot for the health professions passerbys and or the UIC students living in the area. The no frills interior was a bit of a downer. Despite the sparse design, I was happy hear another Korean restaurant opened up in the city.As I walked in for an early supper to go order, I was confronted by the owner who happened to be Chinese. Hmmm. His wife was Korean. Ok. Tried their KimChi Stew and Spicy Pork Belly dish. The stew is a common and traditional dish. It was unfortunately subpar. The Pork was good but very oily. This place should be an encouragement to those young entrepreneurs too afraid to try. If Dosirak can make it,...

5.description: Love the food ! Not overpriced, cute restaurant. Loved the kalbi, bulgogi & kimchi:) but the jajangmyeon didn't taste Korean enough.

3.description: First time there, enjoyed it.

35.description: These are not exactly same korean food as you might expect. Overall, food is okay, but maybe too salty and spicy for some.

19.description: Claypot (Dolsot) Bibimbap hearty and ample. Chicken wings decent.Good value.

28.description: I love this place! But please take into account the fact that when I had it (only had it once) I haven't had good Asian food for a rather long time. The portions are not bad, food is relatively authentic, and it's a cozy little spot if you want to eat quickly. What I appreciated was the cheap eats. We had the kimchi fried rice and tofu hot pot. Not bad at all if you're craving Korean food.

45.description: I've only ordered delivery from here a couple times (thanks GrubHub!) and have been pleased each time. Delivery can be a little slow, but the food is worth the wait. The portions are on the smaller end, but I have ordered the Kalbi (beef short ribs), and Sam Gyup Sal Kimchi Bokkeum (pork belly) mainly. These are my favorite dishes. They also have boba (aka tapioca bubble freeze)! $3 delivery charge.

33.description: Another great food option on Taylor street, for both eat-in and take-out. My favorite is the spicy sesame chicken, but the other meat dishes are great too. And they give you a ton of sides. I have no idea what any of them are called, but some of them are pretty tasty. It's pretty affordable too for the portions they give.

43.description: Thanks for being in my neighborhood! I have been here twice by now for lunch and it's so good! Dolsat bibimbap and Spicy seafood tofu soup were total winners. Sizzling rice and literally boiling soup made my day... Also, totally inexpensive for that quality and quantity- one could easily charge double the amount. It may not be the best Korean place but I seriously don't get why it has gotten 1 and 2 stars!

2.description: Been here a couple of times. Nothing out of the ordinary for some Korean bites. There's basically only one person working in the front but he does cater to the guest needs so no problem there. Food is ordinary so I would come back a couple times just to get my Korean cravings satisfied. The LA Kalbi is a little pricey in my opinion but the taste is good. We also had the chicken wings as appetizer and personally I felt that they were a bit to flavorful and I needed to eat it with rice to calm the flavors down. The bibimbop was pretty good especially the one that came in the stone bowl. For some people like me, the bottom of the rice is crispy so I enjoy eating that part. It's cute how they give you little sides as well. However, I'm pretty sure that we got overcharged for our meal but of course we didn't realize that until we left. Nonetheless it is an okay place to eat.

18.description: I love their bulgogi and dolsot bibimpap. I also love their kimchi, fish cake side dishes. The resto is clean. The service is the fast and the price is also reasonable. Will definitely visit this place again. :)

41.description: I want to like Dosirak. Being Korean and black, I am always on the hunt for good Korean food anywhere south of Kimball. So I was excited when I found this spot, just blocks from where I work. I've been twice now, but I've been mostly disappointed by the food so far. I don't expect it to be like mom's, since no place is; but I need a little more Korean in my Korean food. Much of what's on the menu appears to be adapted to the American palate, and particularly that of the young college student variety. There is lots of sugar, in everything. The first time I went, I ordered the samgyupsal bokkeum dosirak. It was not what I was used to. It was ruined by the sugary gochujang-based sauce which drowned the flavors of the kimchi and the pork belly. There was so much sloppy sauce on the plate that you could slurp it. Today I ordered kimchi jigae, figuring it was safe. Like the bokkeum, it was sugary sweet. I tasted no garlic, no dashida, and no kimchi. It tasted like the cook just chopped up some raw napa and threw it into the soup. It didn't taste like any jigae I've ever had in my life (and I'm in my 40s). My friend ordered Jap Chae and it was fine. The banchan has been so-so. I will still give it another try. I'm hoping the restaurant's owners and staff will use these reviews to improve the business and its offerings.

52.description: Whoa.  This may be a case of dine in/pick up is better than delivery.  But I ordered Japchae and it was ridiculously bland.  Like, eating white rice alone bland.  Which brings me to the Bibimbap.  Look, I've been to Seoul and understand its a mac-n-cheese of Korea  not meant to blow your socks off, but that stuff was actually kinda gross.  I wanted to love it, but didn't at all. Womp womp. :-(

50.description: I've only had this one time but I liked it! I ordered the bulgogi and the bibimbop. I really enjoyed both. The portions were fairly generous for the prices and I have enough leftover for one or two more meals, depending on how hungry again when I eat them. I ordered through seamless and my food was ready about 25 minutes after I ordered. The check out girl was polite and friendly. Overall a good first time experience!

4.description: This place is cozy, seats around 20. There is 1 table for 2, 1 table for 6, 1 table for 8 and 1 table for 4. It is geared towards a Korean Snack type feel/selection. So if you've had the typical Korean rice cakes (Dukbokgee), fish cakes (odang), etc this is the place to go. They have many typical Korean type dishes and the one I got was the bulgogi dish for about 8 dollars. The dish itself was standard in selection, good Korean type rice, ripe radish kimchi, good cucumber sidedish but the regular cabbage kimchi was more fresh, not as ripened. I personally prefer the ripened type but didn't bother me that much. Overall a great (relatively cheaper) Korean place to get a quick bite to eat. In the future I'd probably utilize the takeout instead of the sit down.I'll be back.

6.description: I went for the first time earlier this week, and I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and portion of food given for the price. I ordered the soondubu jigae, and the LA Kalbi. Both were served quickly and came with their own banchan. I'm going back there tomorrow after work!

22.description: Def a good place for Bimbimpop, Chap Chae, and LA kalbi. The soups aren't that great but the other stuff is really good and for the price ! =D Nice management as well! I am def a fan and for UIC students it's so close!

15.description: I was extremely hungry and so I was going to order on Grubhub for delivery but they didn't deliver to my house. I had to resort to pick up and it took ~15 minutes for my order. It was empty when I went to get my food but the cashier was nice. I got the Pajeon, Sam Gyup Sal Kimchi Bokkeum, Dduk Boki Noodles, and 1 Bulgogi hot dog. The Pajeon was tasty but the hot dog was a let down. The bulgogi on the hot dog was sort of dry and there wasn't any sauce to tie it all together. The fries that came with the hot dog was very soggy ): The Sam Gyup Sal Kimchi Bokkeum and Dduk Boki Noodles were a tad bit too salty for me but had a good spice to it. The pork belly wasn't too chewy and was good. They don't give any side dishes other than kimchi which makes me sad because I love the side dishes.

57.description: Below average food!!Tried their delivery, so not sure if things are any better in the restaurant. Bulgogi - dripping with oil, the beef slices looked more like Italian beef shavings. Kimchi tasted weird. Mango Smoothie - tasted bland and diluted. Tapioca balls were gross.

20.description: I have put in my delivery at 11:04am, it is now 1:30pm and my food has still not arrived. That is almost 2 and a half hours of waiting. Called the establishment multiple times and did not even receive an apology, just a "they will be there in 10  minutes." It's been 45 minutes- then they finally call, I go down to get my food, the delivery man isn't even at the door. Will never order from here again.

36.description: I had planned a Lunar New Year celebration for my co-workers, so I decided to order in Korean for the team.  We needed the order to be delivered by noon on 1/31/2014, but the restaurant doesn't open until 11, so I called them the day before to make sure they could deliver it. They were so nice and asked that we fax the order the day before, which we did.  The delivery was a tad late, but no problem.  Anyhoo, the food itself It was a hit! Everyone really enjoyed what they ordered. This was the first time that some folks had Korean food, so I'm happy to say it was a good experience for them.  Also, the restaurant was so thoughtful to include a small bowl of traditional rice cake soup (dduk kuk) for everyone to celebrate the New Year. All in all everyone, including me, enjoyed the food and we'll definitely be ordering from Dosirak again! Thanks DOSIRAK!

14.description: I have put in my delivery at 11:04am, it is now 1:30pm and my food has still not arrived. That is almost 2 and a half hours of waiting. Called the establishment multiple times and did not even receive an apology, just a "they will be there in 10  minutes." It's been 45 minutes- then they finally call, I go down to get my food, the delivery man isn't even at the door. Will never order from here again.

58.description: Overall the service here is excellent. The front desk is attentive, knowledgeable, and helpful - they make the experience pleasant. They have tea, coffee and water for their clients, and they update you about any changes in your services or wait times. I had my haircut done here, and yes they tried to sell me a conditioning treatment and other types of services but they weren't too pushy. The lady that cut my hair did an excellent job taking a look at what I wanted and how that matched with what she felt she could do to optimize my haircut for everyday ease of styling. She asked questions about what I do to my hair daily, other things that factor in like products I use and what I want with my haircut. Then, I went ahead and got a manicure done. It was average. The color selection of nailpolishes was excellent, and then the tools they used were impeccably clean: sterile packed tools that are opened fresh for each client. I would say it is always important though to express the types of things you want/don't want in your manicure: nail cutting or filing only, what shape, and any other issues you have with your nails. I did not say anything and one of the cuticles was cut off to far and the nailpolish painting job was only average - there were sides of the nails missing polish and that was annoying because that is the final and most important part of the whole experience. Anyway, I would go back because they are so clean and I got a yelp deal ($75 for $50 towards any services).

56.description: I went for a mani pedi months ago, but I for sure wanted to leave a review. My experience wasn't pleasant. I had the last appointment so they really rushed my mani pedi. The girl who did my nails was named Tanya, and she hardly spoke it was so awkward. I almost felt like she was upset that she had to do my nails since I was the last one in there kinda like "ugh can I just go home now?" she did this weird thing with my polish where she didn't paint all the way to the start of the nail so each nail had a big gap at the bottom. It looked horrible I wanted to scream, but she seemed so hurried that I just felt like I had to get out of there. I actually went home and painted in the gaps myself!!! Seriously? Clearly, I'm never going back again.

29.description: ALWAYS ASK FOR CLAIR!!!! I only tried this place because of a Groupon deal & was so in love with my 1st no chip manicure that I bought a 2nd deal, but this time for 2 no chips.  I made the mistake of not requesting her the 2nd time I went & walked out wanting to CRY!  I finally had free edge by the 2nd appointment thanks to the amazing job Clair did... (Lasted well over 3 weeks!) But Angelica filed them down to stubs again!!! :'( (sad day for a nail biter)   On top of that she put like 6 layers of polish (minimum) on each nail & 8 layers on the ones with glitter!! They looked chunky & uneven! I tried hard not to judge her when I found out how recently she began doing nails but I've never been so disappointed over a no chip manicure.Lesson learned: ASK FOR CLAIR!  I went back for the 3rd Groupon no chip with Clair and fell in love with my nails all over again!! Both times she found the perfect combinations of color & glitter & they look perfect! She has over 10 years of experience & the difference is clear!!

42.description: Your experience here is a matter of having the right person to do it. Once i had an older Polish lady for no chip meni pedi and it was awesome. She was so kind and did a great job. My meni survived almost a month. Then i had a young lady with dark hair for meni pedi who didnt even care a bit and finished me up in 10 min because she was so distracted talking to another coworker non stop in Spanish. She colored my nails as well as the skin around it, it just doesnt make sense for her to work there if she has no drive, no talent, no focus at all. It is so annoying to pay for something and got the absolute worst service in return just because she doesnt care. My recent experience was for eyebrows with another lady which was not very pleasent. Normally, I am not really picky about the service i got, but she just did a really bad job, after she was done, my eyebrows were really thin, which i have warned her just before we start and two sides has an obvious different shapes (i wish i could remember the names). It is a shame to have such bad experiences two in a row because i really liked the atmosphere and it was always very easy to make an appointment. Because of these two bad experiences i dont think i will be going back.

23.description: I got a Brazilian from Gosia and I couldn't have been happier with getting her. She is so easy going and professional. She explained everything before she did it and was quick. I can't get over how wonderful she made, what would have been a painful experience.A true waxing ninja! She does facials too and I look forward to becoming a regular. Very cute and warm feel to the shop. Decent parking (pay to park) available. I went at 4:30 and found many spots available right in front. Appointment availability was great, easy to get  appointment. Staff looked very friendly. And so many services are offered.  Ask about their monthly discounts.

47.description: So I've been getting my eyebrows done here for about two years. I go to school at uic so it's super convenient. Im also a guy so I'm picky who I let touch my eyebrows. Unfortunately I will have to find another salon to go to. I called two weeks in a roll to find out that they now only do threading/waxing on the weekends. I accepted that. So I called on the morning of a Friday or Saturday just to find out that their booked. The actually threading was perfect. The cost was about $10 which i didn't mind paying at all. Congrats to those who got a appointment. The staff is very friendly.

8.description: I LOVE Bella Pelle. I've been a loyal customer for about a year and a half. Clare always does my nails, I love her work. My no chips always last minimum 2 weeks, they never chip! She is efficient but takes care in what she does, and always has a great color suggestion.I recently started getting my brows waxed by Anna, and she does a great job as well.  She even suggested different eyebrow makeup, because mine had been getting a little dry.  Now I don't use powder in them. Thanks for the tip Anna!

31.description: I used to be a regular and always loved the way Marlena threaded my eyebrows and cut my hair. Apparently she isn't working there anymore though. The new girl who threaded my eyebrows absolutely destroyed them. I have thick eyebrows and a good arch that I literally love and cherish like a small child. I asked her not to touch the shape but just clean up around them and she completely thinned them out to near nothing (think Britney Spears during her break down) and took the end parts that curve down from the arch completely off.They refunded my money and apologized but let's just say this was a sad, sad day and money can't make my eyebrows grow back.

34.description: I absolutely love Anna she is amazing very quick efficient and make a Brazilian as painless as it can be considering. I also received  a facial from her for the first time on black friday and my skin feltgreat for days. I like that she educates me on everything she does so im well informed and an can maintain when im at home.

16.description: Loved it...!! My first time at the Salon...&... I had the best experience... The staff is so friendly and Clair is awesome.. Makes you feel at ease.. Is super warm.. Got my no chip removed and French manicure done..!! I am highly satisfied with the job!! Thank you Clair..!! I will see you again sometime soon :D..

13.description: Today was my first time here and overall, I had a wonderful experience. I desperately needed a pedicure. When I first walked in, with no appointment, I was told that everyone is booked. However, Claire was very nice enough to help me. Claire is very professional, energetic, spunky, and a great nail technician. She really took her time with my feet and nails, commented on nice my feet were () and even gave me a tip on how to make sure my feet don't get ruined from putting my shoes back on to leave. My service with Claire was a great one and I wouldn't hesitate to come back. Now on to customer service issues. The receptionist we polite when I walked in, however, throughout my service, I overheard conversations. First of all, it's not very professional to speak about customers to coworkers, especially in front of other customers. I understand, you're going to have rude customers. But you should never talk bad about them in front of your clients. Also, just be careful with the attitude. Sometimes you've gotta "kill them with kindness", even if a customer is rude to you. Overall this place is very chic, welcoming, and clean. I will definitely be coming back!

11.description: I really wanted to go back to this salon. It has a nice atmosphere, it was clean, & everyone seemed to be friendly when I arrived. My tech seemed to be  either new or shy. She was kind of unengaging and that was ok until she had to reapply the polish 4x's because it kept crinkling whenever it dried. I opted to try another polish but since my appt was going into the next appt, they suggested I come back later for the other polish. At this point the hour long appt has now turned into over an hour & I had to go and refeed the meter. I felt as if  I was blamed and penalized for the defective polish since they made me come back instead of finishing my appt. Mind you I was extremely patient & cooperative with the entire ordeal but It seemed as though everyone changed when I wanted to completely change the color, even though it was defective. So, I won't be going back. It was a nice salon & maybe other people's experience was better but mine wasn't.

39.description: I had a facial with Gosia - amazing! I will recommend this place to everybody! I love the European school of cosmetology, and this is exactly their approach here. I like my facials to be firm, with steam and good quality cosmetics - and I got it at Bella Pelle Salon. They have affordable prices and outstanding customer service.

37.description: Just had another fantastic facial with Anna!  The first one (a deep cleansing facial) cleared up my skin within three days. This time, I got the hydrating facial. Very relaxing! I always get good services at this location.

0.description: I have been coming to this salon for over 2 years. After moving back from LA, I needed a place to get my Brazilian. I was nervous seeing someone new because I used my lady in LA for many years. But when in doubt, refer to yelp for a reference! Luckily, I found the salon and Anna. I'm so thankful for her! She understood my hesitation in seeing someone new. She explained what she would be doing ahead of time and couldn't have been any more professional. She takes her time and is very aware of a woman's concern for such a personal area. I haven't gone anywhere else in over 2 years. I go back to LA bi-monthly and could easily see my old girl during those trips but Anna is my new go-to! I've referred her to many friends and family and we've all had the same experience. If you have any doubt, just see her once! You'll be hooked!

38.description: Although staff very nice, multiple people running behind. Also they lost my appointment and didn't apologize : /

51.description: I had a regular bikini wax with Gosia. That woman is at the top of her game.

27.description: My nails look great- reason for 3 stars is they charge $10 to remove no chip when you are getting a no chip manicure. Seems really silly to me.

32.description: I got a no chip French style today and absolutely loved it! Angelica did an excellent job again! :)

54.description: I had a really great experience.  I did not have to wait long and my wax with Gosha (sp) was wonderful.The Yelp deal was super sweet and hopefully Wax on Wax Off Salon will have others in the future.Aside from the Yelp deal, the prices are more modest than most spas.  I definitely think I will be going back

48.description: I have been coming here for eyebrow threading for years, since it was in the previous location.  I like the salon anf the services they provide.  This place is so poorly managed and I have had a lot of bad experiences scheduling and keeping appointments.  It is too bad.  They provide a good service.

44.description: This is my favorite place to get my eyebrows waxed! I always feel so pampered and taken care of. I don't think I've ever had someone pay such close attention to my eyebrows. Definitely the most relaxing waxing experience I've ever had.

24.description: Gave them another shot since the business replied to my dissatisfaction on yelp. I showed up for my appointment and was taken right back after being offered a drink. My waxing specialist was helpful and directed to some product to prevent and heal my in grown hairs. I will be back!

7.description: I have to retract my previous review due to the deterioration of service.  I went to this salon last week and got the exact same service I requested in the past.  The no-chip manicure lasted a couple of days before it started chipping off.  I called to inform the salon (the next week since this happened over the weekend).  I was told to come in and they would fix my nails.  When I got there I was told that I had 3 days to call and tell them something.  I was not told this over the phone and my nails looked like garbage!  I was NOT about to pay for something that was their fault.  The technician eventually agreed to redo the polish.  The "fixed" version of this no-chip manicure was the absolute worst nail polish job I have ever received in my life.  The lines are crooked, the "french manicure" is translucent and you can see straight through it.  My nails look like a child did them.  It's unfortunate because this place used to be good.  I would not advise anyone to go here and after today I'm sure they know that I wouldn't return either.  Not worth the hassle.

49.description: Called in this week for a last minute Brazilian wax. It had been awhile so I was incredibly anxious all day awaiting the painful experience! They were able to get me the same day and had a few options for me for times which was nice. When I arrived I couldn't find the place (they haven't changed their new address on Google apparently and I was on the wrong side of the street. A nice man asked me if I was looking for a nail salon across the street and I was back on track). Minus half star there. The inside is really cute, trendy chic and was clean and nice smelling. I went on back for my appointment and got undressed. I'm used to getting a wipe or two to clean myself before. One wasn't available but not a big deal. The woman that was to do my wax came back in and immediately propped my legs into place, slapped on some wax within a couple of seconds and had the first one ripped off before I even knew what was happening. Same for the next one. In the end it took her probably less than 10 minutes for the entire wax. No small talk, no gently putting on wax and then rubbing the pad for 30 seconds or cooling the inflamed skin after each tug. I was little disoriented at first when she started but I mean less 10 minutes!!! Yes please! I am in love with this woman!! Now minus the other half star because a few spots already feel a bit like she didn't get them quite all the way (this could also be because it's my first one in long time), but over all she did a great job, and i mean, again, less than 10 minutes. So fast you'll want to kiss her afterward!

40.description: I love this place. They honestly are the best at eyebrow threading and waxing and the people who work here are so nice. I've been coming here for years and there's no other better, cleaner and nicer place.

53.description: Scheduled a deep cleaning facial using a Groupon and was pleasantly surprised by the level of service received.  This was my first time there.  The shop was easy to find and street parking (metered) was readily available.  The shop was neat and clean with NO sensual attacks of acetone, polish or hair products; it was, in fact, very nice.  My wait was short and coffee, tea and water were offered.  As to the facial itself,  with Gosia, probably one of the better ones I have ever had.  Will be returning in the future.

30.description: I came in for the first time to get a haircut and highlights. Veronica did a fantastic job on it, the color and cut look amazing. I've gotten a ton of compliments on it and I will be coming back in the future.

46.description: I went to WOWO Salon & Spa for the first time today and tried out their gel manicure service for $35. Pro: 1. The nail tech (her name was Ivana) was really nice2. They take walk-in, which is really convenient. 3. The monthly specials are great deals.Cons. 1. There was no soaking prior to trimming. I've never had a $35 manicure with no soaking. It was just straight up filing, cutting the cuticles (read more below), roughing up nail plates, polishing, and a 10 sec lotion massage.2. Two of my fingers bled during cuticle trimming. The nail tech said it's because my cuticles are too dry and "very long". You can see from the picture that there was a cut wound beyond my cuticle. She put anti-septic on the wounds, but she keeps rubbing against the wound with her fingers like she wants to smear them off. I am really worried about getting infections.3. Granted i have short nails, so it's probably difficult to do a great manicure job. However, when the manicure session was done, I saw that the gel nail polish doesn't cover all the way to several nail tips. The nail tech said this is due to the shrinking of gel polish, and because my nails are short so there's not too much nail for the polish to "grab on". However, I've never experienced this before when I got gel polish in other places. The nail tech tried to fix the nail tip for me, and I really appreciated her effort, but the end result is a nail with super-thick top coat overflowing to the flesh area. 4. One thing I cannot stand is that when there is excess polish getting beyond the nail boundary due to over-painting, the nail tech keeps using a USED wooden stick/pick to scrap it off. I can tell the wooden stick has been used because it already has nail polish stains (same color as the nail tech's polish), probably from scraping off excess polish from her own fingers. All the other nail places I've been to use acetone/polish remover on a cotton ball to remove the excessive polish. This will be my last visit to this salon.

1.description: The $19 deal (instead of the usual $35) on Groupon is what drew me in.Their hours posted on their website and Yelp say they open at 10:00am. But, I got there around 9:55am, hoping someone would let me in at 10:00am because my appointment was at 10:15am with Claire (and it was freezing outside!). I didn't get inside until closer to 10:10am, which was unprofessional.Claire cleaned my cuticles up nicely, but I found it strange that she didn't soak them in warm water and soap before cutting them. A day after my manicure, I have noticed tiny chipping in my nails (1st time this has happened to me!) and the coats look chunky. This was a nice try, but I'll stick to my usual lady in the suburbs.

55.description: I've gotten my nails done and hair cut & colored here a few times over the past 6 months. The service is always friendly, yet efficient and to-the-point. My nails always turn out flawless and I enjoyed that one of the owners/stylists who cut & colored my hair took the time to give me a lot of great cut suggestions and styling tips that would work well for me personally, without me needing to ask.

9.description: ALWAYS ASK FOR CLAIR!!!! I only tried this place because of a Groupon deal & was so in love with my 1st no chip manicure that I bought a 2nd deal, but this time for 2 no chips.  I made the mistake of not requesting her the 2nd time I went & walked out wanting to CRY!  I finally had free edge by the 2nd appointment thanks to the amazing job Clair did... (Lasted well over 3 weeks!) But Angelica filed them down to stubs again!!! :'( (sad day for a nail biter)   On top of that she put like 6 layers of polish (minimum) on each nail & 8 layers on the ones with glitter!! They looked chunky & uneven! I tried hard not to judge her when I found out how recently she began doing nails but I've never been so disappointed over a no chip manicure.Lesson learned: ASK FOR CLAIR!  I went back for the 3rd Groupon no chip with Clair and fell in love with my nails all over again!! Both times she found the perfect combinations of color & glitter & they look perfect! She has over 10 years of experience & the difference is clear!!

26.description: I would give this place 0/5, but the minimum I could give is one. I went into this place, already iffy of the prices, but it looked nice and it's near my apartment so I thought I would give it a try. I walked in around 11am, no one was there, but the technician was too busy talking with a guy to welcome me. Once she did welcome me, I asked for a refill. She looked at me like I was stupid. I asked for an acrylic refill and she went on a speech about how they don't do that and that it's only regular manicures and no-chip. I'm alright with a business not doing certain services, BUT if your website says you have said service and 20 others that you actually don't have, THEN they shouldn't be listed on your website. I will never give this place a chance again. My advice: find a place that actually does the services they say they do and have friendly employees.

25.description: I was a regular threading client at this salon when it was Wax on Wax Off. Marlena always did a great job and I went there regularly. Knowing that it was also a hair salon, this time last year I made the mistake of asking her to do a touch up on my ombre which she willingly agreed to do. Long story short she completely destroyed my hair, bleach blonded it (using absolutely no toner) and tried to convince me it looked fine. When I refused to pay for my yellow hair she accused me of coming into the salon planning not to pay for the service and proceeded to talk about me with the other staff in Polish right in front of me. Needless to say I won't be returning, new name, no Marlena or not. Don't advertise services you can't adequately provide. Seems like a great nail, wax, and threading salon, definitely not hair.

12.description: I have been a very loyal client here but unfortunately this is likely my last time coming here. I had to rebook because they made me wait saying there was a person coming right after and I couldn't wait. Also, I usually booked with one person, and although they are really good at confirming appointments they didn't call to tell me my person wasn't here. I showed up and of course am introduced to an unfamiliar face. In addition, 4.5 months later, I'm being told that I'm being charged for something that they didn't charge me and they're asking me if I recall the service and that I owe them. The people inside gave attitude, all speaking to me in all different directions. It's unfortunate but I gotta be comfortable in my own skin right?!?

59.description: This salon does not care about keeping their loyal customers. I purchased a groupon for 3 brazilians back in October. It was redeemed during my first use and was told it would be in their system. I came in two days ago for my third one only to be told it was expired and that I should "read the policy". I know how to read. Since it was redeemed and I was never told that the groupon was about to expire, although I go there to wax my eyebrows every couple of weeks, I forgot. I told them I wouldn't be going there anymore.Tiffany and Anna are great. Anna does like to lecture you, but I would still only see her when I needed to get anything waxed. They are friendly and do their job well, it's pretty much everyone else that I have dealt with who are condescending and rude.

21.description: I had the best manicure of my life at Bella Pelle. Veronica did a beautiful job and this bad boy has not chipped (at all!) in 7 days! The salon is clean and the staff is friendly. They fit me in with only 1 day notice, and their prices are reasonable enough to make a manicure less of a "special occasion splurge" and more of a regular treat for me. They also have a wide range of services: nails, hair, tanning, waxing.....  A+ for Bella Pelle Salon & Spa! I'll definitely be back.

17.description: I am updating my review because I've come back here multiple times in the past month and my experience has been amazing!I've been getting no-chip manicures and a pedicure from Claire and they have been wonderful. Claire is so smart and so experienced and so funny! I have a great time with her while getting my nails done. She is always willing to help me when I have questions about taking care of my nails and my feet and they look beautiful and healthy!!I have also gone to Gosia for waxing and she is extremely kind and great at what she does! We ended up talking for a while about how to take care of skin and whatnot, and she is a really sweet and down to earth person. They both offer me hot tea and water while I am here, and that is hospitality I've never had at a salon before. The Vanilla Chai is pretty amazing.I definitely recommend going to them! I've had a wonderful experience here with Gosia and Claire!

10.description: I got a Brazilian from Gosia and I couldn't have been happier with getting her. She is so easy going and professional. She explained everything before she did it and was quick. I can't get over how wonderful she made, what would have been a painful experience.A true waxing ninja! She does facials too and I look forward to becoming a regular. Very cute and warm feel to the shop. Decent parking (pay to park) available. I went at 4:30 and found many spots available right in front. Appointment availability was great, easy to get  appointment. Staff looked very friendly. And so many services are offered.  Ask about their monthly discounts.

5.description: UPDATE: my review isn't fake... Bella Pelle has me in their system as a frequent customer. I really want to see my manicurist back here, so I can continue my service with them. Nevertheless, I appreciate someone taking the time to read my review. I am a UIC student, and I LOVED coming here towards the end of the week with Claire. Toward the end of midterms and exams, I would make an appointment with Claire. She was VERY friendly, professional, and caring. I've gotten my nails done MANY times, and I've never experienced the warmth that is Claire. She would tell me how to take care of my cuticles on a daily basis, color that suits my lifestyle (I'm a business major, so I can't have crazy looking nails), and just make me feel welcomed EVERY single time I came. I remember the first time I came here, I was very shy and nervous (new place to get your nails done, and it was unfamiliar at the time), Claire immediately greeted me and was SO SWEET. I'm really disappointed in management's decision that lead to Claire no longer working there. I will not be going any longer to this establishment due to this. I've had many friends join me with my appointments, and they have expressed how much of a pleasure Claire is! The place is nice and clean, but the atmosphere is still new. You need to make your customers feel close and develop relationships with them. Unfortunately, I only established that with Claire, and I have no inclination to continue going here. I pay for the experience and the service. #BringClaireBack

3.description: I'm giving this place one star only because I actually enjoyed my first no chip with Rose. They looked great but they did begin to chip after 8days or so. I called over a week ago for another appointment with Rose and it was all set. Then today I was running late but did get a voicemail stating that my no chip with Natasha was at 1:30! I never requested Natasha. The service is poor, the receptionist has an attitude. When I was there last she was getting her own nails done while having to get up and answer the phone or greet customers as they walked in. They talk about guys from neighboring businesses like a piece of meat. It's actually disturbing. I remember when the original owners had that place running without any problems. I loved Monica and her sister. Bottom line, I won't be back!

35.description: Went after Christmas and it was super cute because my boyfriend got a man manicure by Lizette and all the girls were wonderful. I gave it four stars this time because I wasn't as pleased with my no-chip with this manicurist.!I felt the polish was not as evenly done and usually my no-chip last 3-4weeks but this time my nail polish already chipped after 2.  I think I will stick with my usual person.

19.description: 2 out of 3 times I've been here for Brazilian wax have been great, except for my most recent one. First 2 times were from a Groupon deal, I believe 2 for $40, which was such a bargain.  Then, they actually offered me on my 3rd wax a $29 deal, still pretty good for a Brazilian! But this time, my lady, Anna, was unfortunately...aggressive with her waxing method. She applied the wax on very large area, by that I mean the whole area, which was scary to me because I just knew it would be so painful! And I am one who takes pride in having awesome pain tolerance! Not in this case, she didn't really take her time to see the direction of hair growth at all, and also didn't apply pressure after ripping the strips, since I found that a lot of people do this at other places, immediately relieving the pain for a few seconds. Anna really took me by surprise because she reminded me of my first wax ever in Chicago, which also took place at this place, when it was still Wax On Wax Off, and it was horrifying! It was quick but the pain wasn't worth it and I didn't feel like she was attentive to my area? Usually at other places, the ladies, in additional to using the wax, go in with tweezers to get some leftover hair, which I really appreciate, but wasn't the case here with Anna...So I wouldn't recommend her, but other people I had before were alright!

28.description: Great service for a man and ofcourse a woman. They don't make you feel uncomfortable and make you feel welcome. Claire and Marian do an awesome job at pedicures and service. Also gives you great laughs!

45.description: I will definitely be coming back here! Even though I was terribly late they still made time for me. Anna did a fabulous job on my eyebrows. Many have tried but failed to get my eyebrow arches to match (I know, they're sister not identical twins) but she did. I also got a full leg wax (1st time too) the space where this is done is so relaxing. She is there for the customers to provide the best possible service. The peoplr behind the front desk were friendly also well. Love this place!

33.description: Clean. Consistent. Costly.I have not gotten my hair done there but I regular get waxed by Anna: eyebrows, underarms, and...the love below! She does nice facials and is a wealth of body care information. I have had great pedicures there too.ACCEPT: when they come to you and open a nail clipper set in front of you it's  not new persat it sanitized in the back. Be prepared to pay A LA CARTE though. They DO incentivize regular customers by scheduling your next appointment you get a discount on the service.  APPRECIATE: If you want to leave a tip (and you will) bring cash for the tiny envelope on the front counter. They serve tea :)EXCEPT: I typically like going with a girlfriend for some but it's hard to sync up appointments to sit next to each other while getting manis.

43.description: I've been to Anna for a Brazilian 4 times now and she is fantastic! Of course, it's no less painful than any other place but Anna is super fast, really thorough, and gives great advice on skincare. She is very pleasant and makes you feel really comfortable along with all the other staff. Highly recommend Anna!

2.description: I love this place! I'm a student at UIC and I live on campus. I come here every 2/3 weeks for an eyebrow wax. I have never specifically requested Gosia but nearly every time she takes care of me. I love her. She is precise, quick, and comforting. After getting waxed, she often gives me a mini 'facial massage' where she soothes my skin for a few minutes. I absolutely love it. While I wait in the lobby, there is tea and coffee and magazines to read. The reason I am taking a star away is because the salon itself is pretty expensive. But I've just been so pleased with the results that I will gladly pay a few extra bucks to get great service.

18.description: I got a no chip French style today and absolutely loved it! Angelica did an excellent job again! :)

41.description: Gosia gave me a facial.  My skin is glowing.  The place was relaxing and quiet.I will definitely go back next month.  Thank you!

52.description: I was so appreciative that they were able to work around my schedule since I had to call and change dates. My nail technician seemed really knowledgeable and gave me tips on how to take better care of my extremities. She helped me understand how to pick out the no chip colors. I was offered water and wine which I partook in both. It was definitely a great way to relax and unwind. I loved my color that I chose, and she did an excellent job! My nails have lasted for over 2 weeks, which is pretty crazy and am loving the durability of the no-chip! Regular price is kind of pricey for me is the only thing. I redeemed a livingsocial deal and would certainly do it again if I could.

50.description: Went here on Saturday for a pedicure. I called to schedule an appointment for that afternoon and to ask about the difference between and express pedicure and a classic. I was told that the express was just cuticle clean up, nail shaping, and polish and that the classic pedicure was all of that plus the scrub, callus removal, and massage. I decided to spend the extra $10 for the classic. I arrived for my appointment and they took me right away which was a plus. The technician began working on my feet and everything was going fine. However, she finished with the cuticles and started with the scrub. This was about a minute. Just enough time to put it on and wash it off. There was no callus removal. Then, the massage. There was none. She put lotion on my legs and feet and barely rubbed it in. There was still streaks of lotion on my legs when she started painting my nails. Afterwards, at the counter, I asked the receptionist taking my payment if I was scheduled for the express pedicure or classic. She told me that it was the classic and asked me if something was missing. I told her about my experience and she asked me to wait a minute. She returned and let me know that the technician had spent extra time on cuticle care and therefore cut the rest of the pedicure short. If I had wanted just cuticle care, I would have scheduled an express pedicure. The receptionist half-heartedly offered to charge me for an express but I told her I would pay for the services I was scheduled for and apparently received and so she charged me the $35. I would consider giving Wax On Wax Off a second chance mostly because of the location and the salon is clean. I wouldn't recommend them to a friend however based on my first impression and because I left disappointed. (+): actual salon is clean and well maintained, multiple services (hair, nails, waxing), 10% off first service(-): Left with calluses, no massage, paid extra for extra services that weren't provided

4.description: omg I love this place! I'm a student at UIC and I live on campus so it's perfect! I had a No Chip done by Rose this morning and SHE WAS AMAZING. Everyone is welcoming the receptionist offered me something to drink the minute i walked in (even though i was running a few minutes behind). I haven't been to a salon that energetic! I usually don't write reviews but I thought i would take the time to write one since i had such a great experience. They have the No Chip for $29 Mon-Wed I would definitely be back!

6.description: I have been here for waxing and a no chip.  Waxing was great!  ALMOST pain free, no chip was good unfortunately it only lasted about 4 days before it began to chip.

22.description: I am updating my review because I've come back here multiple times in the past month and my experience has been amazing!I've been getting no-chip manicures and a pedicure from Claire and they have been wonderful. Claire is so smart and so experienced and so funny! I have a great time with her while getting my nails done. She is always willing to help me when I have questions about taking care of my nails and my feet and they look beautiful and healthy!!I have also gone to Gosia for waxing and she is extremely kind and great at what she does! We ended up talking for a while about how to take care of skin and whatnot, and she is a really sweet and down to earth person. They both offer me hot tea and water while I am here, and that is hospitality I've never had at a salon before. The Vanilla Chai is pretty amazing.I definitely recommend going to them! I've had a wonderful experience here with Gosia and Claire!

15.description: Although staff very nice, multiple people running behind. Also they lost my appointment and didn't apologize : /

57.description: I'm very surprised to see mixed reviews for WOWOSS.  Perhaps its the recent change in ownership and staff (that I just found out right now), or maybe they are really listening to their customers and reviews found online, but I've had nothing but an excellent experience here.I've been coming to WOWOSS since December 2013 after a friend told me about this place and her great experience for the waxing service.  After spending the past yr traveling for my job @ West and NE coasts, I had to do constant yelping, so I said, why not? I'm so glad I did.The ambience here is beautiful (hello, lobby area?!), yet comfortable and relaxing.  The majority of my brazilians, lip, eyebrow and underarms have been with Gosia and she is at the top of her game! She is clean, attentive, quick yet cautious.  She applies a pre and post aloe lotion so you never have to worry about infections or swollen areas.  And I must emphasize on how clean Gosia is - she uses a new spatula/stick every single time she applies hot wax. SOLD. She also tells you how to care for your waxed area before coming in 4-6 weeks after.  I've seen great results since coming here so I'm extremely pleased.  Price is reasonable (if you're paying cheap for waxing service, you should question it), and when you make an appt. before leaving, you get 10% off for your next scheduled service.  Hollllla!I must add I've had one waxing service with Anna and I prefer Gosia.  Previous reviews praise Anna and that's fine and all, but I just prefer Gosia. She knows all things waxing.Overall, this salon is great.  I've had no bad reactions to their waxing service, their customer service is great.  And since I'm a regular now, Gosia remembers me every time and so does the girl who rings me out (I'm assuming Joanna?).  I'm pleased with the waxing services that I'll soon be venturing into their mani/pedi, haircut and hair color services soon.Why 4 out of 5 if I'm raving: Location.  Yes, it's great for being in the west side and in University Village, but parking is a b*tch! & Waiting time.  Thankfully, I've haven't had to wait 23 minutes to get serviced even when I make appointments beforehand, but I still have to wait a few minutes.  It doesn't bother me too much, but it can be improved.

20.description: Veronica is an amazing hair stylist! Not only did she step up when I needed my hair done for my wedding but she also does great coloring and cuts. I recommend her and this salon to anyone who wants great service and great hair!

36.description: Horrible customer service!!! Woman on the phone was very rude and sassy. I bought a Groupon deal for two manicures and they did not want to honor it. The manager started making up restrictions saying that I could not use the two manicures for my daughter and myself. The sassy woman said it was too much of a deal for two people. Once I heard this I cancelled my order on Groupon and there is NO WAY I would EVER enter a place like this. Customer service is always number one priority people. DO NOT EXPECT LESS! If they can't give good customer service then there whole service is no good! You are a paying customer even if you get a deal on Groupon. If you don't want to give out deals then don't post on Groupon, simple as that but don't lie and treat customers bad. So glad I never went there and neither should you! There are other great places out there! Go elsewhere not here!!! I gave one rating only because I had too. HORRIBLE PLACE! HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!

14.description: I had a groupon for a Brazilian and decided to go. Anna seemed professional, but her waxing didnt. She said she'd been doing it for 10 years so I felt comfortable, but my results were beyond horrible! The first time I got a Brazilian I went to Painless Waxing Botique and the lady took her time and noticed my hair grew in different directions so she took her time with me and I absolutely loved the way I look weeks after I had it. But Anna ripped off a lot of my hair at once! Not only was it painful, but it was HOT and I always wax myself and I never need to cool it down bc I can handle the heat, but I had to tell her after a while bc it was just waaay to hot, and even when I did, she kept doing it! I felt as though she was NOT considerate of my pain tolerance and didn't care if the wax burned me or if she had taken off too much hair at once.
