Not to mention that after 1 week it still hurts and feels irritated. I have so many ingrown hairs now it's ridiculous, do not go to Anna. I hate the way I feel! It looks like I shaved and doesn't look like I waxed. She literally ripped my hair off! I'm too embarrassed to be with my boyfriend because of how badly she left me, by friend got it with me and hers is the same way. please save your money and take it elsewhere.

3.description: I used this Men's Wearhouse for my wedding. The staff was very accommodating and was helpful in every way. They helped our bridal party look sharp and were very professional in all aspects of the planning. I highly recommend this location for all of your fine clothing needs!

1.description: I just went to Men's Warehouse today. My husband needed a replacement button on his tuxedo. It was the typical tuxedo button, since it is more matte. The sales associate was very pleasant and helpful. He never even asked if I bought the tuxedo there, but found me two buttons that closely resembled the original ones, didn't charge me for them, and he even had them sewn on. The store also had nice merchandise and is in a good location. 5 stars!

2.description: A new store occupied by the Men's Wearhouse group. I've been frequenting more often due to the uptick in friends tying the knot. I've been in for a rental and a custom suit on two occasions. There might be validated parking but I resorted to the meters in front of the store. Usually no problem getting a spot. Hard to estimate how long you'll actually be in the store. They have helpful associates, some of which are very new, and a couple others there are there to get the new location up and running. They have a ton of formal threads in stock in addition to casual attire.Never seems to fail that rental suits don't fit quite right. They are actually pretty horrible fitting to begin with (e.g. very wide pant legs). I had to come in, try on the suit, and ultimately get a size adjustment to come pick up later. The original measurements were right but whatever they shipped to the store was very far off. If they could just get it right the first time I would be impressed.The custom suit was tailored to my needs. If it's not in stock, they order, and you come in for a fitting. Measurements taken, they tailor the garments in-house, and you arrive for pick-up. I have to say the price for the tailoring was pretty decent at $47 to alter the pants and jacket. Not bad. When I picked up post-alterations it was fine but the waist was a bit snug even after letting it out and the legs were too long. I brought them back in and they made adjustments free of charge.This location is pretty nice and a good location if you live near the Loop. A Nordstrom Rack just opened up next door too. A recent merger with Jos. A. Bank should result in weekly sales with the ever-so-temping buy 1 suit get the whole store free deal.

5.description: Wow! I had such an easy-breezy experience here and I am excited to share how happy it made me to rent my fiance's tuxes for our wedding here. We are new to Chicago, but are familiar enough with the area, and since this store was open the latest, we decided it was our best bet to make an appointment at this location due to their later hours.Immediately, we were greeted by Rohan (I really hope that's how you spell it - sorry if it's not!). He recognized that he had an appointment and greeted us and got right to business and asked us both what we wanted (so as not to assume that my fiance wasn't really in charge - haha). This made me feel very comfortable and respected. Once I told him that I was actually going to be the final decision-maker, he asked me what I wanted to see and he knew EXACTLY what I was asking to see. You know how difficult it is when you're planning a wedding to describe something to someone and get exactly what you described? Next to impossible. I was so grateful to have someone working with us who knew exactly what we wanted.These types of processes can be overwhelming, but Rohan made us feel like we were on top of things and we had it together - it made me feel like wedding planning was a breeze. I'm not joking here - what I anticipated would be a difficult process was the easiest (and one of the most fun) aspect of wedding planning. We enjoyed our time and we also (this is important) greatly appreciated not being taken advantage of with our price point. Rohan didn't show us things that were outrageous and not possible for us. My point here is that the customer service was at the supreme level of paying attention and not making assumptions. We felt like Rohan (and clearly the rest of this Men's Warehouse facility) truly cared about our wants and needs. We would return to this location in a heartbeat!!

6.description: I went here on Columbus day and it was busy. The staffs were friendly and helpful. So why four stars? Well, at first when I entered, I was greeted right away but was offered no helped. Maybe because I was younger and didn't look like a potential customer. But the gentleman who entered after me was greeted and helped right away. They took him directly to what he was looking for while I'm left wandering around the store.  This bothered me but in the end, I was helped and I ended up with two suits, dress shirts, ties, and others. I would recommend this store due to the friendly staffs.

7.description: I had visited the Bolingbrook store for a tuxedo fitting for a wedding and fell in love with this tie, but it was full price. A few weeks later there was a buy one tie get two free sale. I visited this location because it is much closer to my house. Unfortunately they did not have the tie in stock and none of the sales people recognized it so they probably never had it. Tony was the best. I had taken a picture of the tie and he had me forward it to him. He said he'd find the tie no matter what. He called numerous locations over a couple of days until he found a store that had the tie. I got it a few days after that. His customer service was amazing. He went above and beyond my expectations.

8.description: This review is for Tonya M only, through everyone else we met there was super friendly as well.Tonya was extremely helpful and friendly. We finally settled on some jeans and she informed us they were buy one get one free. The wash my honey liked wasn't in stock in his size, but Tonya offered to order it. So a week goes by and we pick up the pants. Holy floods! They were way too short. When we measured the inseam, sure enough they certainly weren't 30 x 30 and were mislabeled by the manufacturer. So Tonya offered to reorder them and send them to our home. We were skeptical as we were pretty sure this mislabeling thing wasn't a 1 time error. Sure enough.Tonya was pretty nice about it and we decided to order a 32 long and just take it to our tailor. FYI - 2 for 1 Buffalo jean's are probably that cheap for a reason  lol

9.description: My fiance and I came here to start the process of looking for wedding tuxes.  We looked around a bit and then were hesitantly greeted by a salesperson that didn't look very happy to help us.  We told him that we wanted to look at tux options for me.  He asked me my size and since  I was unsure I took a guess at what it might be.  He gave me only two jacket options and they were a bit big.  He then stated I thought you were a smaller size but you were so ADAMANT about the size you gave me.  I thought that was a bit rude.  If anything I said I hadn't worn a tux in a while and I was giving a guess with the size.After that awkward and completely non helpful experience we wandered over to rentals and were greeted by Rohan.  This store should be run by this guy!  He was professional, funny and helped us figure out all of our rental needs.  He even worked it out so I would get a huge discount when I came in to purchase my tux.We had to come back to take care of the tuxes for my fiance's nephews (They don't let you add to your order online).  We walked in and nobody greeted us. They looked at us and obviously deemed that we weren't going to purchase anything (I didn't know you had to come dressed in your finest attire to be offered customer service).  We went to the rental section in the hopes of finding Rohan but he wasn't there.  We stood there for about five minutes and then a salesperson stated that he would be right back to help us and went into a back room.  Several minutes later another salesperson that was attending to a customer asked if we were being helped.  We told him that someone headed to the back and said they would come out to assist us.  Two other salespeople walked right by us and didn't ask if we were being helped or needed assistance.  One salesperson went behind the rental desk within feet of us and wouldn't even make eye contact.  We took a note of the time and gave the salesperson that had disappeared into the back room a few more minutes before we walked out.  He came out of the back room as we were ready to walk away and didn't even acknowledge us.  No offer to assist us or apology for the wait.  ABSOLUTELY NOTHING.  The only person who apparently works there that asked us if we were being helped before noticed we were leaving and asked if something was wrong.  When we walked out we ran into the salesperson from our first visit (the salesperson that was completely unhelpful and rude) and stated how awful the customer service was.  He seemed completely unbothered by our dissatisfaction and didn't make an attempt to help the situation.   We walked into the store at 3:55 p.m. and left at 4:10 pm without being helped by one salesperson, and it wasn't like we were browsing and roaming the store. We stood in one location the entire time and that was in front of the rental department.  We will be contacting Men's Wearhouse corporate office and you will lose the revenue from 7 tux rentals and 1 tux purchase.  As well as any future business from us.

0.description: I don't usually write yelp reviews that often but I really wanted to give this place a great review. I had one of my best experience at a men's clothing store at this Men's Wearhouse location.Rohan was the consultant who helped me. He is very friendly, professional and knowledgable. He want through every step with so much attention to detail and was very helpful and pleasant and hooked me up with a great suit, shirt, belt and suggested the best ties and socks to go with the suit i needed for my interview. Special thanks to Rohan and the entire staff for this great experience. I would recommend everyone to shop at this location.

4.description: For the money paid to rent the tuxedo, you would think we wouldn't have to wait 40 minutes to try on one suit.  Ridiculous.  They had only one employee working tuxedo rental & sales area during prom weekend.   Absolutely ridiculous.

0.description: Oh gosh, how is it that I have worked here in the area for so many years and didn't know this was a hidden Starbucks inside the Jesse Brown VA Medical Center? Seriously I should be put away and slapped hard! WOW! I had to go inside for some cash at the CHASE ATM and noticed the Sea Mermaid Logo and said  to myself "NNNNOOOOOOOO waYYYYYY"! What! Are you kidding me? There she was, a small kiosk section of the Jesse Brown VA Medical Center with all her glory looking at me like, come get a coffee. Hello, I jumped so fast you would swear I was a virgin waiting in line for an all male prison play! Oh the joy of now knowing I could get a Starbucks at 7 AM and have a great day right away vs. waiting! Although they really can't create my usual Burnt Marshmallow Macchiato (Order a Doppio or Solo Espresso Macchiato, add 2 pumps of white mocha sauce and add caramel drizzle) because I think it made the barista a little nervous that someone was actually asking for an original drink vs. on the beaten path of the sign. But I digress , a regular Venti coffee of the day will suffice (for now). But stop playing with me I will return and have my list of original drinks so that they can be awesome like most Starbuck's in Chicago.  They don't have tons of selections as most other SB's have, but that's okay since I am just happy to get a sip of a real SB's vs. just "sipping" others. This is a plus for sure and I know now that more and more people will be ordering from this location. Kudos! I asked the young lady how long they have been there and she said they have been at this location for a while. Don't know what that exactly means but hey its a Starbucks! So come by and order, but have a seat in their mini dining room.

28.description: The new version of Takoz has some great dishes if you are willing to stray from the ordinary.  The tostada's are delicious and inexpensive, they will make you up a Chiliquiles or Chorizo con Heuvos for about seven bucks if you ask (they are not on the menu).  I like the large quesadilla on the skillet made corn tortilla.  Everything is cooked well, its a great lunch option, the owners are very nice and try hard to please as well.

1.description: Another trial in my efforts to explore Taylor west of Damen, a little foodie world I didn't know existed.  I came in for the lunch period and ordered a taco salad, which was quite cheap and filling.  The ingredients were standard and simple, as was the decor and design of the place.  The service was very friendly and they bring you chips and extra salsa (spicy but not too much) if you eat in.  Great place to relax for lunch!

9.description: The best Mexican food in the area! I walked almost two miles from campus just to go here through the snow and it was worth it. I got a steak burrito and chicken and pork tacos and they were all delicious. And the staff was so friendly they asked me multiple times if the food was good and if I  needed anything.

29.description: My fellow Yelpers, if you're ever in Little Italy or the Illinois Medical District, this is THE Mexican place for you.  The chicken burritos, tacos and steak tortas are fantastic.  The ingredients are fresh and there are some nice gourmet touches as well...they squeeze fresh lime on their steak, the chicken is well marinated and flavorful, the salsas are made on site, the guacamole is fresh and top notch and they have homeade tortillas!  ***NOTE*** please don't confuse Takoz with the taco joint a few doors down...the place down the street is not as good.

23.description: ok.. so i may not have the most refined taste buds, but the food at this place is SO GOOD.  I regularly crave for their chicken/steak tacos and their homemade quesadillas.  OMG, they are to die for!!! and I have to get some at least a few times a week.  The owner is very friendly and considerate.  And the price?  I think it's a steal! GO TRY THIS PLACE if you haven't already.

5.description: This is by far the best Mexican food place in the Tri-Taylor neighborhoodI love the steak gordita amd the chicken taco bowlEverything is fresh and of quality.The lady at the counter is super sweet, always personable and never fails at making me smile.

31.description: They are back and stronger than ever. The old Takoz from Taylor street has been reborn in a new location and a new taste of flavor. I believe you are really going to love the prices at the new location as well as the flavorful morsels of Mexican fare. The spices in food that we all missed for almost a year has returned to take it spot amongst the ever rivaling Mexican cuisine that has landed on Taylor street in the last few years. With the closing of Joe's and other spots, it is a very good landing in its new renovated spot. I think this time the restaurant has given itself a new life and a new outlook on what it considers to be REALLY GREAT MEXICAN FOOD,just how an abuela (grandma) would do in her own kitchen in off road site some-were in Mexico. Thank you for coming back and giving us probably the best Nachos with cheese and meat Taylor Street has witnessed. Burritos of charbroiled skirt steak rival the best ones on 26th street or in Pilsen. This time, the resurrection of a staple on Taylor is staying, and we are SO happy it has become the Phoenix in Little Italy.

25.description: A gorgeous shy young teen asked the owner if she could sit at my table, the owner came over and asked if she could sit with me. Of course, this cutie can sit with me :-)

12.description: They are back and stronger than ever. The old Takoz from Taylor street has been reborn in a new location and a new taste of flavor. I believe you are really going to love the prices at the new location as well as the flavorful morsels of Mexican fare. The spices in food that we all missed for almost a year has returned to take it spot amongst the ever rivaling Mexican cuisine that has landed on Taylor street in the last few years. With the closing of Joe's and other spots, it is a very good landing in its new renovated spot. I think this time the restaurant has given itself a new life and a new outlook on what it considers to be REALLY GREAT MEXICAN FOOD,just how an abuela (grandma) would do in her own kitchen in off road site some-were in Mexico. Thank you for coming back and giving us probably the best Nachos with cheese and meat Taylor Street has witnessed. Burritos of charbroiled skirt steak rival the best ones on 26th street or in Pilsen. This time, the resurrection of a staple on Taylor is staying, and we are SO happy it has become the Phoenix in Little Italy.

21.description: My co-workers and myself try to get out of work at least once a week to either go to or get carry out from TaKoz.Adore their vegetarian taco salad! Unlike anything else on Taylor Street.Great prices!The employees are always nice and know "my usual". Gotta love it!

16.description: The four stars are based on the continuum of small Mexican restaurants. The place is clean, the tacos are fresh and the prices are decent. They might have the best shrimp tacos in town.

17.description: This is a nice little place with decent prices. They stay busy. The food is good and not covered in Greece like most taco places around here. The workers are very nice.

10.description: It's all about consistency - I still love their tacos.  So delicious and still a great value for what you get.  Make sure you ask for items not listed on the menu.  Currently they have fish tacos, sopa de fideo de pollo (chicken soup) and tamales - not on the menu - but available and super YUMMY!!  Be in the know!Love TaKoz!

11.description: Not the best place for "authentic" tacos. flavorless meat, rice and beans. Don't think i would go back to try something different.

26.description: This place has the recipe down for great quality mexican fast food.  The portions are pretty large for the price, and like the other reviewers I would agree, it can definitely champion against the other more established meixdcan fast food joints anywhere in the city.  Considering it has just recently opened, it has managed to get any rough patches free and clear.  Tortas are the best, and the guac is pretty damn good without jipping you on portions.  Definitely a do over again and again!  Thanks for being in the taylor area Takoz, you can expect my repeat business!

27.description: I ordered delivery today. I got 3 tacos-1 chicken, 1 beef, and 1 pork. They were all really, really good. I also got a side of rice, which is good, too. Tomorrow I'm gonna try their chicken burrito. I guess I'll just steer clear of anything with "cheese" on it.

0.description: Food was amazing, fast, inexpensive, and the staff was amazingly attentive. My partner is lactose intolerant and forgot to mention it; one of the staff noticed him taking the cheese off of his refried beans and, even though we let her know that it was our fault for not specifying no cheese, she brought us soup on the house to "make up for it."

20.description: This place is great! They have very nice and helpful people working there and the food is just great. I tried the other tacos places that have opened just down the block from them just because they were closer and that was a big mistake. TaKoz definitely has amazing steak tacos and their rice and beans are always delicious as well

19.description: Regular chairs and tables have been added so you aren't sitting on those high bar stools anymore.  Food seems better than ever.  Highly recommend the following STEAK taco custom made:  Steak with beans, onions (or no onions if you prefer), cilantro and avocado only.  I think Rick Bayless is hiding in the back somewhere.

2.description: I was super pumped to go to this place based on the reviews but left somewhat disappointed. I wound up ordering two steak tacos, 1 shrimp taco, and rice and beans. Now, I chose to eat in the car because I wanted to continue to listen to THE SERIAL in my car. This made me even more excited to eat my meal. I first dipped into a steak taco and was expecting magic. I got a slightly better than average steak taco. They weren't stingy on the ingredients but it just wasn't a great taco. The shrimp taco was sloppy and disgusting. Do not order this. A family member under the age of 3 can make a better shrimp taco. The rice and beans were the highlight. I probably would have enjoyed my meal with just that. But that's pretty tragic. I would give this place another try though. The people working were working very hard (another hand could help) and they were very nice.

18.description: Nice little place. Very simple & straightforward menu, the two tacos I got were excellent & def had some flavor in them I could not put my finger on. I got the al pastor & the chicken. They come with 2 salsas, green & red. The red is tangy and nice but the green is mg favorite it had a nice hint of lime that is often overpowered in other green salsas. I always walked by this place & today I thought, what better way to compliment a salad than with 2 tacos? There was some minor confusion, after I placed my order & was waiting a second employee came out & asked what I ordered & if I paid yet. Bear in mind I was the only patron at the time. Not a big deal but it makes me question their processes.They have a good number of Mexican sodas including coca cola Mexican edition with real sugar. They also have a lot of pre packaged tamarind & horchata drinks. I need to eat here a few more times before I can be totally sold but so far so good.

13.description: So I go to school within a five minute walk of this place and I'm so glad I found it because student center west has dull overpriced blah to eat... Like subway. Any way, so right away the staff here is so  friendly. I literally felt like I was at my house. There's a lot of regulars who come here and there's good reason to. We had vegetarian tacos which were huge and had ACTUAL avocado slices in them!! I don't care if I'm a nutrition major... Thursdays when I'm here from 9am-9pm this is gonna be a regular spot for me. The lady who works there treats me like a daughter and I met her once. Love it. Feels right

4.description: Best quesadillas that I have ever eaten.  I had the quesadillas with flour tortillas and ground beef.  Just superbe!

24.description: I was sad when Takoz on Taylor Street closed but then they re-opened a few doors down.  I go there a lot because it's inexpensive, the meat is tender and flavorful, everything is fresh, the owner is very friendly and takes pride in quality, and it's less than a block away from me.  The char grilled steak is phenomenol!  It's my favorite place in the city for steak tacos.  The homemade quesadillas are sooooo good with guacamole, lettuce, tomato inside.  The chorizo is delicious, the flavor of the chicken is fantastic but the chicken is a little dry.  Everything else on the menu is delicious and it's cheap.

6.description: O.M.G. these steak tacos are delicious! I placed a big group order for work and everyone is raving!

22.description: Nice little place. Very simple & straightforward menu, the two tacos I got were excellent & def had some flavor in them I could not put my finger on. I got the al pastor & the chicken. They come with 2 salsas, green & red. The red is tangy and nice but the green is mg favorite it had a nice hint of lime that is often overpowered in other green salsas. I always walked by this place & today I thought, what better way to compliment a salad than with 2 tacos? There was some minor confusion, after I placed my order & was waiting a second employee came out & asked what I ordered & if I paid yet. Bear in mind I was the only patron at the time. Not a big deal but it makes me question their processes.They have a good number of Mexican sodas including coca cola Mexican edition with real sugar. They also have a lot of pre packaged tamarind & horchata drinks. I need to eat here a few more times before I can be totally sold but so far so good.

15.description: I think its cute the way they spelled tacos into ta koz. The spot is definitely hella small, its hella dark inside, they prefer natural lighting to light bulbs. The prices are reasonable. The tacos nothing to rave about, but its not the worst, my friends rave about the skirt steak taco and to me, its oky. Nothing fancy. So if ur in the tri taylor area and want a quick bite, stop in.

7.description: Love this place! Very popular for lunch crowd. Fast, accurate orders, and nice employees. Their guacamole is delicious!

8.description: This place is right next to where I live and they offer amazing Mexican food. I would say that there burritos are better than Chipotle. Everything is homemade, quesadillas gorditos tacos are to die for. Friendly staff.  They have this drink called tamarindo which is a really nice pop with a taste of tamarind.

30.description: The guac is really good, just enough heat.  The steak has never been chewy or fatty, unlike orther Mexican places near by.  Corn tortillas are served unless you request flour.  Burritos are WAY better than De Pasada.

3.description: After waiting for hours over at the Jesse Brown VA without eating.  One of the nurses recommended this place and OMG!!! This place has some good tasting authentic food.  The homemade Quesadilla was different looking but good. It reminded me of Taco Bell soft bread taco.  I took a bite of my sisters taco and it was equally hearty and good!!! Oh beware of the fees of the lettuce, tomato & cheese.... They ask if you would like it but fail to state it is extra.Raul is wonderful and very nice.

14.description: My co-workers and myself try to get out of work at least once a week to either go to or get carry out from TaKoz.Adore their vegetarian taco salad! Unlike anything else on Taylor Street.Great prices!The employees are always nice and know "my usual". Gotta love it!

58.description: We've ordered take out here a few times and it's decent. I wish the naan was thicker and chewier on the inside. The chicken tikka has good flavor but the sauce could be thicker.

56.description: Terrible. The "new management" advertised on yelp does mot imply a good thing. Completely different food and chef. Chic tikka masala was extremely oily. Chicken low quality. Raita thin and runny. Bad list of changes compared to prior food  goes on and on. All prices were raised. Too bad too... this used to be a nice convenient location for my family in the west loop:(

29.description: The depth of flavors that I am used to in Indian was lacking. We had three dishes- samosa chat, butter masala and korma and the dominating flavors were sour, spicy tomato, and creamy, respectively. The korma being the best of the three. The naan looked and tasted like it was store bought frozen. I wanted to like this place as it seems to be a quaint family owned business. Perhaps the meat dishes are better.

42.description: Please do NOT put yourself through agony. I am not that picky but I know good food. I also know good Indian food. As a 34 YO white man who works in finance I can honestly say I will out cook this place any day. Where do I begin... 1) I ordered take out and had to wait at the restaurant for 30 minutes after their initial 35 min window. Yes double the quoted time. 2) the food was so salty I had to gulp water between every bite and still feeling dehydrated. 3) the aloo gobo was the worst I've ever had!!! Salty, over cooked, soggy cauliflower with minimal taste at best. 4) sag paneer was the best but it was sub par compared to literally every other Indian place in Chicago.  5) if you call that naan then you've never had real naan. I'm saddened by anyone who disagrees.  6) I know food color is used in restaurants and especially Indian foods to give that pop, but the chicken tikka masala had so much red 17 you can taste it!  Oh and the dish was flat out in edible. Do NOT be cheap and eat here. You will be so sorry and only contributing to the madness. Run, I repeat run from this place as fast as possible. You are very welcome in advance!

23.description: I eat here regularly (at least a few times a month) and each time is amazing. I love the vindaloo and the tikka masala.  The vegetarian samosas are amazing.  The restaurant does a lot of takeout and delivery business, so I can always find a table. It is BYOB but there is a nice wine store across the street that has anything you might need.

47.description: I'll begin with the good things. Good customer service, chicken was not dry and flavor was good; we ordered the chicken Tika Masala. Not-so-good were the naan. The butter naan was a bit over cooked and dry and the regular naan was as hard as a frisbee. In fact I believe I threw it across the room after dinner to work-out a bit. The sauce in the Tika was so red, the dye stained my fingers and it wasn't thick either. I give them three stars, one for tender chicken, another for customer service and lastly for good taste. Don't think I'll return. :(

8.description: This place just reinforces the idea that food being delivered sucks!My friend and I ordered a few days ago through Eat24. We ordered chicken tikka masala, chicken 65, and a side of garlic naan. Shortly after, I was informed they were out of chicken 65. Fine, maybe they had already shut down the deep fryer and said "eff it" or maybe they were truly out of the chicken. Who knows? I asked for the chicken biryani instead and since it's the same price, it shouldn't affect the total.When the food arrived, my friend went downstairs to pay. He told me the total only came out to $19 instead of $30 so I instantly knew something was wrong. All we received was the tikka masala and naan. Not even any paper plates, napkins, or utensils as requested. You guys are freakin awesome :/By the time I got a hold of someone to try and correct the problem, the place had already closed. Sure, it's fine that they didn't charge for the chicken biryani, but why the hell would I pay a $5 delivery charge for ONE freakin dish?! That is beyond ridiculous! Didn't any of you catch that one dish plus naan only equaled $12 which was under your requirement of a $20 minimum?The food wasn't great enough for me to even consider dining in. The naan was rubbery and the chicken tikka masala was too tomatoey without enough of any other spices.Just avoid this place to prevent yourself a headache.

31.description: Just moved to the neighborhood and I'm looking for my local Indian joint. Taj Mahal won't be it. I don't know if I ordered on an off night or what, but I can definitely make better curry at home. And my curry sucks.So for starters, I ordered chana masala, dal makhani, samosas, rice, and aloo paratha. My order arrived on time. Woo! I started unpacking all the food and noticed the aloo paratha was missing. Huge bummer. Since I'm not in the market to pay for food I didn't receive, I called the restaurant. Honestly, I just wanted them to take it off my bill, since, if they had gone all the way back to their restaurant, it was going to take them probably 15-30 minutes to drive back with it in Saturday night traffic. The guy at the restaurant said he'd contact his driver and call me right back. I started eating.The food was smoky, soft, and watery. I was not impressed by any means with any of the flavor. The filling in the samosas was chunky and not soft. Very little spice or flavor to any of the food. Everything was very overcooked. I was starting to wish I had the aloo paratha so I had some bread to soak it all up with.Anyway. I ate a little bit and noticed the time. 30 minutes later and I hadn't gotten a call back from the restaurant. Whatever. I'm not gonna mess around with the restaurant. I just called GrubHub and let them deal with the rest. They refunded me $5 from my meal and gave me a $5 coupon for future use. Then my aloo paratha showed up 90 minutes after my food initially came.Definitely won't be ordering from here again. Not an impressive first showing!

34.description: I had just moved into the hood and needed a new go-to Indian place. Taj Mahal will NOT be it.Chose to get delivery, which was insanely slow. Order the chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and daal tadka. Naan was okay- I've had much better. The chicken tikka masala was the worst I've ever had, as I expected before even opening the container. The color was off and I thought maybe they had given me yellow lentils by mistake. Nope, there was chicken in it and it kind of tasted like tikka masala, but the flavor was really off, like they had spilled something else into my container when they were serving it up.  Overall, bad experience and will not be trying this place again. I would recommend Mughal Indian or Jaipur instead. Much better food for about the same price.

16.description: Just moved to the neighborhood and I'm looking for my local Indian joint. Taj Mahal won't be it. I don't know if I ordered on an off night or what, but I can definitely make better curry at home. And my curry sucks.So for starters, I ordered chana masala, dal makhani, samosas, rice, and aloo paratha. My order arrived on time. Woo! I started unpacking all the food and noticed the aloo paratha was missing. Huge bummer. Since I'm not in the market to pay for food I didn't receive, I called the restaurant. Honestly, I just wanted them to take it off my bill, since, if they had gone all the way back to their restaurant, it was going to take them probably 15-30 minutes to drive back with it in Saturday night traffic. The guy at the restaurant said he'd contact his driver and call me right back. I started eating.The food was smoky, soft, and watery. I was not impressed by any means with any of the flavor. The filling in the samosas was chunky and not soft. Very little spice or flavor to any of the food. Everything was very overcooked. I was starting to wish I had the aloo paratha so I had some bread to soak it all up with.Anyway. I ate a little bit and noticed the time. 30 minutes later and I hadn't gotten a call back from the restaurant. Whatever. I'm not gonna mess around with the restaurant. I just called GrubHub and let them deal with the rest. They refunded me $5 from my meal and gave me a $5 coupon for future use. Then my aloo paratha showed up 90 minutes after my food initially came.Definitely won't be ordering from here again. Not an impressive first showing!

13.description: Can i pls give it zero stars? Bcos i ordered naan(i would rather swallow a rubber sheet),butter chicken(you may want to dip your naan in tomato puree instead) and chicken biryani(read as hard uncooked chicken in light brown tasteless rice).

11.description: I probably won't order takeout after hearing about everyone's bad experiences, but dining in was pleasant and the food hit the spot. The place definitely has a "hole in the wall" feel but many Indians were eating there so they must be doing something right, and our server was really nice. We had samosas, garlic nan, 2 meat dishes, a mango lassi and a chai tea. Everything was delicious (the mango lassi and the nan excellent). They topped up our rice for free and we left with a box full of leftovers. I do like higher end indian places like Cumin, but for the value I think this place is well worth it.

39.description: It really hurts me to write this about this restaurant because it use to be one of my favorites when I lived in the city a few years ago. My friends and I met up there for dinner tonight and were thoroughly disappointed. The service was poor, the dishes weren't very clean, the water was warm, and the food was not good. The butter chicken was good, but the tikka malsala was so red and spicy it wasn't edible, the other dishes ordered were downed with spice but had no flavor. The naan was burnt and hard as a rock. We didn't even finish the meal we were so upset. The servers never even bothered to try to remedy the situation and we're watching YouTube videos behind the register.  We left no tip and will not be returning.

37.description: Slow service and bad food. The restaurant took almost 45 minutes to serve food. The food was not good. The naan was hard and uneatable. The curry was bad in taste. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. Not certainly during lunch time, when you want to have a quick lunch. Be ready to spend more than an hour here for a food that is not good.

0.description: This place used to be good and  now when I go the bread is drenched in oil and kinda rubbery tasting and they always seem to forget something I order. I loove this food sooo much!  It's like comfort food for me, but one things I've always disliked about this place is the service and that in the end can really ruin a place. Prices are defintely reasonable and I like how it's never busy when I go in.

38.description: This place is pretty good. I had it a few times with my old roommates. My roommate came home one day and brought me their vegetarian biryani which was so good. Normally, i don't like rice or biryani. But this time wasn't so bad. Then my 2nd time trying it I also went with my old roommate we actually went there to go eat and I order the exact same thing again and was hot and fresh. It's been 3 years since I was there I can still remember the taste. Yummy I would def go back again!! Yum yum in my tummy

51.description: Indian food consists of several different, very distinct cuisines such as Gujarati, Punjabi, Sindhi, Hyderabadi, Bengali, etc. This restaurant dabbles its hands in quite a few of them, inevitably resulting in some unauthentic dishes.  The management of this restaurant appears to have recently changed hands from Hyderabadi to Punjabi while the menu remained unchanged.  As a result, the Chicken Chettinad, a South Indian dish, looks and tastes nothing like the traditional chettinad, which is supposed to be a very spicy dish of meat cooked in a thick sauce consisting of cracked black pepper, red chili flakes and coconut.  The chettinad here has a yellow hue and a runny, soupy consistency.  Despite the lack of authenticity, I must acknowledge that it was tasty.  In other words, it did not taste like chettinad, but it did taste very good!  The sauce in the Chicken Hariyaali (which is supposed to be green) also looks yellow and thin, but has the kick of fresh green chillies, and tastes very good.  I have also had the Biryani here and liked it, but that was before the change in management, so not sure if it is still as good.  The Shami Kabab (minced beef patties) are very good and I really like the aloo paratha (layered flat bread stuffed with spiced potatoes).

27.description: We used to order from this restaurant all the time over the many years we've lived in the neighborhood, and the food was always delicious.  We hadn't ordered for quite some time though, when we recently decided to order for delivery.  We ordered our favorite dishes, Butter Chicken and Daal Makhani.  I knew something was wrong the minute we opened the containers and smelled the food.  The Daal Makhani smelled and tasted like it was prepared with spoiled cream, and was very thick with an unappealing pink/orange color.  The  Butter Chicken was so salty that it was largely inedible, and the rich flavor from the past was missing.  We wondered what had happened, and now I see from the reviews that the management and staff has changed.  While we had no problems with the delivery service, the new take-out menu that was just delivered to us is completely full of misspelled words (even some of the Indian ones), and incorrect grammar, the worst I've ever seen on a menu.   I wouldn't think it would be too difficult to quickly run it by a native English speaker prior to going to print.  We will not be ordering from here again, especially now that I've seen the information regarding health violations.  Very disappointing to lose a long-time favorite restaurant.

32.description: This place is no good anymore! Used to be one of my favorite! These "new"(almost 2 years) owners ruined it.

54.description: Really good Indian food! Everything we ordered was fantastic! We had #19 and 24 and they were so delicious with naan bread! Yummmmm. Definitely recommend

48.description: Naan was dry and uneventful. It was FREEZING inside! Very uncomfortably cold.   Food was not impressing. Very salty and sad.

44.description: Delicious samosas and great service. Was nervous to try the food but I enjoyed it definitely worth it! Will  be going back!

24.description: Service was great the food was excellent little long wait for the food but well worth

7.description: I've had better Indian food at other restaurants but honestly, for the prices, you can't beat the deal. Portion sizes are fair and only about $10 per entree. I'm used to paying almost twice as much for the same amount of food. We ordered the samosas, butter chicken, chicken saag, garlic naan, and a mango lassi. Though not the best, the butter chicken and chicken saag still hit the spot. The mango lassi was a little watered down for my liking, but still tasty and the garlic naan was crispy and very garlicky. The real star for me though were the samosas. The order came with two huge and piping hot samosas, crunchy and full of vegetables and potatoey goodness. Everything came out to be less than $40 and we still had plenty of leftovers (we underestimated the samosas and didn't have as much stomach room left as we thought we would). Even though there wasn't much left, I asked our server to pack up our rice as well (can't eat leftover Indian food without basmati rice!) and he was nice enough  A to fill up our container with more rice from the back. The restaurant is very small and casual so if you're looking for more upscale, you might want to try someplace else. I'm from out of state but the location is close to UIC so it'd be ideal for college students looking for more affordable and authentic Indian food.

49.description: This used to be our go to Indian restaurant for take out when we lived in the area. However, we stopped in today for lunch and were very underwhelmed. Upon ordering, we were told they were out of the appetizer we wanted so we told them to go ahead and cancel it and ordered Naan instead. Much to our surprise, the appetizer appeared on our table 10 minutes later, as did our entree and the naan. We asked for the appetizer to be removed, but instead they removed the naan which was $8 less! The food here is not that good and the portions are pretty small for $10 each.

40.description: This place used to be pretty solid, but on my last trip it had really gone down hill.  It wasn't very clean.  The wine glasses they gave us were dusty.  The water didn't work properly in the bathroom.  The food was not that great and just not very flavorful.  The naan was crispy.  The AC was broken and it was sweltering.  All in all pretty underwhelming.  Don't think I'll go back sadly as it's the only Indian anywhere nearby.

53.description: Delicious!

30.description: Absolutely disgusting - don't waste your money. We ordered the following:1. Chicken Pakora - harder than our hardwood floors and zero flavor2. Butter Chicken - mediocre at best3. Daal Makhani - should be renamed as Daal Yuckni! This was the grossest thing I have ever eaten and though I may not be able to cook well, I can certainly do better than this...yuck! I can at least get the color right!Also, they don't have a website and the prices quoted on third party vendors is outdated. Their prices are definitely higher....but save your money and go to Curry House if you're in southloop and you need a fix.Your fellow desi!

46.description: A little over priced for quality and quantity of food.Butter chicken: taste is good, but quantity is the same as Ghareeb Nawaz which is half the price....and yes, maybe it tastes a little better but I don't think it's worth double the price. They also give white rice with this, however it would be nice if they were willing to substitute naan for the rice instead. Chicken biryani: mediocre, wouldn't get again.Naan: goodService and cleanliness of the restaurant is good, but price, portions, and overall taste is why I don't frequent it. If I go back it'll be when I don't have the energy to just make butter chicken at home.

1.description: BAD CHOICE STAY AWAYBad service and bad Indian food. No flavor. On top of that they sent me the food to my hotel with no spoons or forks. I know I love Indian food but not to the extent that I will use my hands!Chana Masala was so watery and with no flavor and chickpeas were hard like stonesShrimp Masala tasted wired and shrimps were not fresh In General food from this place had a wired energy. Was a waste of $35Terrible!!

55.description: First review on yelp. For Indian food I had try for 3 places, this is the one make for my stomach. Mild spicy I ask and just perfect taste. But I prefer the garlic naan from the place in Evanston. nice servers by the way.

9.description: The smell as soon as you get inside the restaurant was horrible. Hence, we just came out and did not eat there.

26.description: I've had better Indian food at other restaurants but honestly, for the prices, you can't beat the deal. Portion sizes are fair and only about $10 per entree. I'm used to paying almost twice as much for the same amount of food. We ordered the samosas, butter chicken, chicken saag, garlic naan, and a mango lassi. Though not the best, the butter chicken and chicken saag still hit the spot. The mango lassi was a little watered down for my liking, but still tasty and the garlic naan was crispy and very garlicky. The real star for me though were the samosas. The order came with two huge and piping hot samosas, crunchy and full of vegetables and potatoey goodness. Everything came out to be less than $40 and we still had plenty of leftovers (we underestimated the samosas and didn't have as much stomach room left as we thought we would). Even though there wasn't much left, I asked our server to pack up our rice as well (can't eat leftover Indian food without basmati rice!) and he was nice enough  A to fill up our container with more rice from the back. The restaurant is very small and casual so if you're looking for more upscale, you might want to try someplace else. I'm from out of state but the location is close to UIC so it'd be ideal for college students looking for more affordable and authentic Indian food.

25.description: Love their food, hate their delivery service. It's taken 126 minutes & COUNTING. I realize it's winter time in Chicago but its not snowing and roads are clear. Smoke that doobie on the way BACK to work, bro.

12.description: I had just moved into the hood and needed a new go-to Indian place. Taj Mahal will NOT be it.Chose to get delivery, which was insanely slow. Order the chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and daal tadka. Naan was okay- I've had much better. The chicken tikka masala was the worst I've ever had, as I expected before even opening the container. The color was off and I thought maybe they had given me yellow lentils by mistake. Nope, there was chicken in it and it kind of tasted like tikka masala, but the flavor was really off, like they had spilled something else into my container when they were serving it up.  Overall, bad experience and will not be trying this place again. I would recommend Mughal Indian or Jaipur instead. Much better food for about the same price.

59.description: This use to be our go-to place for our quick Indian fix. The food was over the top good! Unfortunately, the manager and staff changed a few months back and the food has never been the same. We continued to go back a total of three times after management changed and each time, the food/service got progressively worse. Third times the charm! The very last time we dined there, we carried out food from here because the restaurant decor made it look and feel like a fast food joint and no longer appealing for date night. We ordered garlic naan, lamb curry, and the bhendi. The lamb curry was watered down and there was a total of six pieces of lamb. Bhendi was a cooked in oil and no curry added - heart attack! Naan was surprisingly still somewhat the same but overall, the experience last time did it for me. I will never be dinning here ever again. Wish I could take back my $4 takeout tip. Smh.

21.description: Amazinggg food!! Authentic and fresh!! Had chicken biryani and butter chicken!  Great service and equally amazing chef!! Must try if you love indian/Pakistani cuisine!!

17.description: Before I used to go eat there because I lived at a walking distance, then moved about ten blocks south, I had no problem getting their food delivered up until recently. This is really really strange since I've been ordering from them for over a year.Here's how it went, I ordered and the service was denied arguing they didn't deliver as far as where I live, got upset and hung the phone, then called back and ordered for pick up (assorted breaded veggies, paneer butter masala, two chicken bryani and naan), he said it'd be ready in 45 mins. When I showed up to pick up my food the guy said; "We don't have your order, the phone didn't ring at all for the past hour". The one group of people dining in just stared at me with a look of surprise in their eyes, I got very upset and obviously left arguing I'll never be back.And now I recommend you to call ahead and find out if the person on the phone is in a good mood to do his job, or to not go at all to this retsaurant.

10.description: The food was really bad. Although the korma sauce was nice, I'm pretty sure it was made with canned veggies (I'm vegetarian). The mutter was all around bad, it tasted like canned tomato soup with canned peas. I feel bad leaving a bad review... The delivery guy was very nice, but delivery took over an hour on a Monday night...

5.description: I ordered the butter chicken entree and two sides of rice with plain naan. If you're uncomfortable with spicy, stick with 1 or 2. I ordered 2 and I would probably order 3 next time because I love spicy food. The food came in plastic and styrofoam containers inside a stapled shut plastic bag, which preserved the heat well. Definitely best delivery service I've had so far in my time living in Chicago.

3.description: Unfortunately I was not allowed to give 0 stars but I could not recommend this place whatsoever. The buffet was cold...not just one dish! All of them. So we ended up ordering a butter chicken hoping for something warm. To our surprise the butter chicken was completely liquid- no thickness to it at all. I hope they turn things around! It was a quite disappointing experience. It was a complete waste of my lunch and time.

35.description: Dismal. Ordered from Grub Hub for delivery, and after our plans changed switched to pick up.  We were missing one of our appetizers, the veggie samosas (we ordered 2 orders of them). The Chicken tikka masala came bright red, when in the past it had been a more orangey cream colored, which is how we've had it at other places.  Also, no rice accompanied the meal. It's come with our meal before so we ate the over salted tikka like soup. Great times. The garlic naan was good. I called the restaurant about a credit for our missing appetizer while it was still open and the phone just rang and rang and then it sounded like someone picked up the receiver and hung it up. I guess I'm out $3.50. This is not the first problem we've had here and now after this we will not be ordering again. I'm sure there are better places.

19.description: Indian food consists of several different, very distinct cuisines such as Gujarati, Punjabi, Sindhi, Hyderabadi, Bengali, etc. This restaurant dabbles its hands in quite a few of them, inevitably resulting in some unauthentic dishes.  The management of this restaurant appears to have recently changed hands from Hyderabadi to Punjabi while the menu remained unchanged.  As a result, the Chicken Chettinad, a South Indian dish, looks and tastes nothing like the traditional chettinad, which is supposed to be a very spicy dish of meat cooked in a thick sauce consisting of cracked black pepper, red chili flakes and coconut.  The chettinad here has a yellow hue and a runny, soupy consistency.  Despite the lack of authenticity, I must acknowledge that it was tasty.  In other words, it did not taste like chettinad, but it did taste very good!  The sauce in the Chicken Hariyaali (which is supposed to be green) also looks yellow and thin, but has the kick of fresh green chillies, and tastes very good.  I have also had the Biryani here and liked it, but that was before the change in management, so not sure if it is still as good.  The Shami Kabab (minced beef patties) are very good and I really like the aloo paratha (layered flat bread stuffed with spiced potatoes).

28.description: This is one of the restaurants that was named most failed health inspections in chicago for 2014...I think that's enough advice right there.

45.description: Try the mango chicken! Yum!!!! And samosas!!!! The chicken vindaloo is hella spicy but very delicious if you can handle it! :)

33.description: I may be a little impartial since I'm originally from Miami and Miami is an Indian food desert, but I really liked this place! Prices were very reasonable and great portions. Food was also very tasty. I checked a few days ago and it was closed due to city health violations but they're open again so that did worry me a bit but I will probably go back

43.description: Taj Mahal, in my opinion, was the best restaurant near our building. I live in the medical district  and I usually order food three times a week from Taj Mahal. The first time I was there the interior design was very beautiful, it had lot of Indian artifact and paintings. Although I wasn't good at ordering Indian food the staff was kind enough to help me with my order. I ordered a medium heat butter chicken with butter naan, Vegetarian Samosa, and a Vegetable Biryani.  The food was very good. The butter chicken was finger-licking good, It had a mild heat and it was full of flavor that complements the chicken, the sauce was perfect creamy, the consistency was not too thick or too thin and it was perfectly salted. The Vegetable Biryani was colorful dish with an amazing cocked vegetable aroma and the rice was perfect not too soft or hard, it was delicious. The butter naan was good with a strong butter flavor, however, I didn't like the Vegetarian Samosa, it had a very weak taste of potato with no salt, it was like tasteless mush. Although the food was good the prices were a bit high for the portions that they gave. For our meal we paid about 40 dealers.  Unfortunately the past week or so the quality of Taj Mahal food and serves was drastically decreased due to the management and staff change. The last time I was in there, I barely recognize the restaurant. The restaurant had a new look, the entire artifacts and the paintings were removed, it looked like a cheap restaurant not like the Family restaurant Taj Mahal That I knew, and maybe they didn't finish their design when I was there but it looked way worse than before We waited for our order about thirty minutes, and when they eventually came they gave us the wrong order, and they insisted that our butter chicken that we ordered was actually Lamb Curry, after a long argument, we had to wait another thirty minutes so they can figure out what went wrong.When they gave us the correct order we were very disappointed with the quality of food that they gave. The food was cold, the chicken was dry and the souse was week and full of oil. However, the manger apologizes for their mistake and they explained that the staff was new and with fifty present off from our order we forgave them.I really hope that Taj Mahal will get better, and get his old glory back. However until they get their problems fixed, Taj Mahal will be a plan b for eating out days.

2.description: I'm new to Chicago and LOVE Indian food, especially good Indian delivery. Taj Mahal had such polarizing reviews...  but it is really close to where I work, so I thought I would figure out for myself if it deserves a 1 or a 5. Pros: -It's relatively inexpensive.  the veg entrees are $8-9, and the meat options are $10-$12. -The delivery was prompt and the service was friendlyCons: - The food was really so-so. I'm giving it two stars because quality-wise, this place is lacking. The paneer masala tasted mostly like a mildly spicy tomato soup. We ordered the butter chicken because other reviewers raved about it, but again, the flavor lacked depth. Also, there wasn't very much chicken in the dish (I guess you get what you pay for...). The best part was the Aloo Gobi, which was ok, but not good enough to redeem the rest of the meal. Overall, I will try other Indian delivery options before I re-visit Taj Mahal. I really wanted to side with all of the other 5-star reviews, but the food here just isn't that great.

18.description: Food is great, but place is very small and not cozy..

41.description: Taj Mahal was my fast food Indian place at UIC.  The food is getting better!  It is good enough to satisfy the Indian food craving!  The samosas are decent here.

52.description: I been eating here for years...price for lamb curry, chana, and powbagi unbeatable.  Lamb always cook tender...Update:  they got rid of powbagi!!!!  Making this place 4 stars instead of 5....

50.description: The only 2 things great about this place are the location and price. Boyfriend and I got Butter Chicken and 2 naans for carry out for dinner and it was about $13. It came with rice and def enough food for one more person. As for the food, it wasn't that great. The butter chicken lacked the sweetness that makes the curry so great. We asked to make it a little spicy and my mouth was completely on fire. All I could really taste was the spiciness. Boyfriend enjoyed it though. The naan weren't the authentic naan I'm used to. They were thicker and chewier. I'm a huge naan fan but I def enjoyed the rice more.Overall, probably wouldn't get the butter chicken again. But because its so close and so cheap I'd probably try something else.

4.description: Let me start off by saying that this place has an unnecessarily bad wrap on yelp. I had been wanting to come here for a long time and today we finally came in...so glad we did!!!We started with an order of samosas (2 per order) they were amazing, perfectly crisp and flavorful.. Served with two of the best and most complimentary sauces I've ever tried.For the main course. Get the GARLIC NAAN omg wow this was the best!!! We ordered the chicken tikka masala and the lamb khorma... The lamb was my favorite, it was tender and flavorful, we ordered it medium spicy and it was perfect. In addition to the calm and pleasant atmosphere the service was perfect, very attentive and fast service.Also, this place is BYOB- beer and wine

6.description: i love indian food! i usually go to Ghareeb Nawaz Express for my quick fix since its not too far for me.. but one day i was driving around taylor street looking for a new random place to eat.. i stumbled across Taj Mahal.. stopped.. looked at a few pics on yelp.. then decide to give it a go..i ordered garlic naan, lamb biryani, and chicken pakoras... i wanted chicken biryani but they said they ran out for the day and told me that they can still make it but it was not taste the same or as good.. he told me to try lamb biryani instead so whatever.. im down to try something new.. no biggie.. also they said they dont have anymore chicken 65... dam they dont have 2 out of 3 dishes i want.. haha.. so i settled with chicken pakoras since the pictures look pretty good on yelp..garlic naan - was kind of burnt and rubbery... chicken pakoras - very bland!! no onions or anything on it.. seems like they just cut up pieces of chicken and dip it in flour and fry it without any seasoning or salt..lamb biryani - also very bland.. and they didnt use the long rice.. they used normal rice like chinese restaurants.. i looked at the yelp pics again to see did others get normal rice and they didnt.. maybe cause im chinese and they think i only eat regular rice? lmaooo just kidding!!  i dont know.... the rice was very moist so it made it mushy and also there wasnt enough pieces of lamb in there..it also took a long time for my food to ready.... i will not be coming back here again..

22.description: If you like eating sub par Indian food in a frozen tundra, then this is the place for you! I went there yesterday for lunch with a friend, and honestly, I don't know why we didn't leave immediately. It was FREEZING cold in there, and even after the waiter brought us a space heater, it didn't really help. The fact that he even had a space heater immediately available indicates that it is cold in there all the time. The space heater measured the inside temperature of the restaurant as being 50 degrees! When it's freezing cold in Chicago, as it was yesterday, you don't want to freeze inside as well! And by the way, twice while we were there, the electricity went out, which of course meant that our space heater didn't work for those long minutes till it came back on!As far as the food ... well, I have had better Indian food pretty much EVERYWHERE else I have been. We ordered a dal, which was a mushy tasteless glop of stuff. We also ordered a spinach mushroom masala thing, which actually had a fairly nice taste to it, but was so spicy I couldn't eat it at all (we did ask for mild, so either the waiter forgot to tell the cook, or else that WAS mild for their palate). I have to say, the veggie pakora and the garlic naan were ok, and that's all I ate. Afterwards my friend and I walked to the Starbucks 2 blocks away, and as soon as we walked in, we were hit with the wonderful warmth of heating. And as we stood there, finally warming up, we were wondering at our stupidity in staying at Taj Mahal!!Overall, a bad experience. Will never go there again.

15.description: Great restaurant, great service and great food.  Definitely a gem that I will continuously frequent.

57.description: Hate to make my first Yelp review a negative one after using Yelp for a couple of years with good results. Promise to do positive reviews in the future. I had eaten here a couple of times in the past when I had been in town. It was pretty solid food even if it was a bit expensive. This trip was not so good. The Dal was pretty much a few tiny flecks of lentils in a pot of yellow liquid/soup. Not very flavorful either. The Samosas came after the Dal and were large, but bland. The sauces that came with them seemed really watered down and bland as well. The mango lassi was good at least. Looked at Yelp after and saw that there is new management. Too bad since it really isn't the same place now.

20.description: Great restaurant, great service and great food.  Definitely a gem that I will continuously frequent.

36.description: It's been a while since I went to Taj Mahal.My friend and I shared Butter Chicken & Lamb Bhuna (spicy) with a side of rice and an order of naan.The Food:Both dishes were really good (though a bit overpriced IMO). My favorite was the butter chicken. The naan was different from the last time I was there. I'm guessing they changed their recipe. I liked the old thinner naan compared to their new gyro sized naan.The Service:The service was ok, it could have been better. We walked in and sat down before being greeted. The server brought out water that has been sitting in the cooler and tasted like melted ice. We had to ask for fresh water. Other than that he took our order, made recommendation, served the food and just sat behind the counter until we asked for the check.Tip: One side of rice is more than enough for 2 people.

14.description: Looks like there was a chef change or management change recently. We ordered take out and it was clearly the worst food ever.  Existing purely due to previous establishments' legacy and location.

58.description: Had a white chocolate coconut cream, and it was divine!!! Fiancé had a latte and said its the best he's had. Minus one star because they didn't have much in terms of pastries. Very cute little place! Saw many enjoying their cup of joe with friends or laptops. Will definitely be back for more coffee!

56.description: Nice hidden little coffee shop. Plenty of room to sit and study or just enjoy your drink or meal.They have a small lunch menu for sandwiches and salads. Nice little coffee and tea drinks too!

29.description: Great atmosphere, very friendly owners, amazing coffee!!!

42.description: Great vibes and environment for students to study. Also appreciate the fact that it's within walking distance from UIC campus.

23.description: Walked in on a lazy Sunday afternoon with my gf after finding the nearby popular cafe full to the brink. Greeted with a smile by the owner and orders were taken promptly. Counter person was helpful with suggestions. Ordered a hot chocolate and mocha alongside ham/egg/cheese croissant and a "Taylor sandwich". I gotta say the mocha tastes better than Starbucks (I am a Starbucks regular). The drinks were prepared within 5 minutes which is expected in a standard cafe. The food would be rated at 3.5/5. Plus points for fresh taste and well made dishes. Minus points as no condiments were offered by the side. It's quiet, quaint and not too crowded. My kinda place! Perfect to exchange a few good words with your loved one or just hang out with a good book plus a cuppa.

47.description: I found this gem by chance, driving by one day with a friend. As a coffee addict, I knew I'd have to come back and try it out. So today, I did.The inside is perfect. The feel of the place, from the brick floor to the art on the walls, is cozy and welcoming. It's not huge, but a decent size for a coffee shop. I got a hazelnut iced coffee and a Chicago Fire panini. Both were delicious. I'm not a fan of coffee without some sort of milk or cream, so when mine arrived, I was initially dismayed. One sip, however, proved me wrong. Turns out I love coffee without cream if it's GOOD coffee, and this was. The panini was made to order and was perfectly toasted on the outside. They definitely aren't greedy with the ingredients and I could fully taste every flavor. The owner was super nice and didn't mind chatting and asked if I liked my food. He also took time to wipe down the tables, which I,on behalf of anyone that's ever put their hands on a sticky table, can fully appreciate. He mentioned that I should try the gelato, and there's a goat cheese flavor that's calling my name, but I'm saving that for next time. There will be a next time. And a time after that. I whole heartedly recommend this place.

8.description: Great place to study -- lots of seating. Feels homey with the exposed drink. Lots of unique drinks. Dirty chai latte was tasty. On a fun street if you want to explore the area afterwards!

31.description: I'm a student at UIC, and sometimes I just need a change of location when I'm trying to do some studying. So I found this place on here, and I figured I would give it a try.I ordered an americano, and it was definitely decent. Not the best coffee I've had, but could've been worse. Tasted kind of burnt to be honest.However, the atmosphere is great. I went there early on a sunday morning and stayed for a few hours. It was nice a quiet and they had a really good music playlist. The free wifi was definitely a plus!Overall, not too bad. I'll be going back since its so close to UIC, but if I want great coffee I'm gonna go somewhere else. (Dollop Coffee Co anyone?)

34.description: The staff is super nice and friendly. Tried their special- Nachos with Chicken and japanese green tea!!! Definitely going again!!

16.description: Great, homey coffee shop in university village. Quick coffee, kind customer service and pleasant atmosphere. You can get work done here without too many distractions, along with a nice cup of coffee. Iced coffee is nice. Hot appuccino is silky and frothy. Definitely recommend this place for UIC students, graduates and university village locals.

13.description: Definitely the best coffee shop in the UIC area. The owners are always there, they are always friendly. They take the time to say hello to everyone. Plus, it is a nice setting with relaxing music, exposed brick walls, definitely the coffee shop you want to go to on a rainy, autumn day. I suggest getting the peanut butter mocha, and the croissant breakfast sandwiches!

11.description: In the neighborhood... Just ok. Would opt to go to Starbucks down the street, or make the trek out to wormhole or star lounge if you want a real coffee fix

39.description: This is my new hangout. The Coffee Alley has such a warm and unique ambience. I love that is family owned-they got it right! And they have live music some evenings!! Way more than just a coffee shop.

37.description: A great small coffee house that has a variety of flavors and is locally owned and a better alternative to same old corporate places that areaall the same. A great choice of beverages and a interesting place to be around

0.description: I love The Coffee Alley. The owner is super nice and the Hispanic woman that's always there is a sweetheart. The coffee is good and so is the food. I like to stop in on my way to class because they're quick and the prices are decent. They have many menu options for both drinks, hot and cold, as well as sandwiches. They even have specials of a drink and sandwich. There is also a sweets selection for those with sweet tooths. The space itself is very cozy, having many tables and a loungy area for those wanting to hang with friends or study/do work. They have free wifi. The bathroom is always clean and so is the rest of the place. Service is always good and prompt. They even had Cafe Bustelo there for a pop up cafe. What a great marketing idea on behalf of both them and Cafe Bustelo!

38.description: My first visit to this coffee shop was yesterday and I'll definitely be coming back! Forget Starbucks. I ordered a mocha and it was one of the best I've ever had. The staff is extremely friendly and lives up to "a home away from home". Perfect place to sit down for a drink and be productive.

51.description: This was my favorite place to go study when I was still in school. Nice atmosphere, very friendly employees, plenty of outlets, and they play really good music. The drinks are and food are pretty good too, I've never had any complaints about it.  Well once I ordered the lavender milk tea, and I didn't really like it. But that could just be me.I miss this place now that I'm out of school!

27.description: Great little place on Taylor street with tasty latte and sandwich combos. I recommend the coconut chai tea as top pick. Friendly staff which is always a plus.

32.description: Coffee Alley is approximately a 30 second walk from my house. I love it here. I was so excited when I was a student that a new coffee shop opened up in my neighborhood. The Starbucks down on Taylor street is always crowded. My friends and I liked to study anatomy and physiology together, discussing muscles, cadavers and trying not to cry in public whilst feeling overwhelmed. ANYWAYS, I've tried their peanut butter latte... oh. my. gawd. I am salivating just typing about it. They blend actual peanut butter into their latte, and it tastes like a liquid resses chocolate. Their food and regular coffee are really good as well. However, I give it a four stars because I wish they offered free refills on coffee. I know this may sound a little odd, but at traditional restaurants they do. Their serving size of a medium size coffee is quite small, and I think if a waiter walked around refilling coffee now and then to those who ordered a plain coffee would really set this shop apart from Starbucks. After all, Demitasse down the street does that.

54.description: I've been here three times and had great experiences twice. The first was definitely a five-star experience: I ordered the large mocha without whip. The barista was nice, and the mocha was wonderful- perfectly foamed and with just the right amount of chocolate. Not super sweet, so the espresso definitely came through well, and it's good espresso. One of the best mochas I've ever had. The second time I ordered a firehouse panini and, again, a mocha- this time a small with whip. Also great, and I thought the panini was really great too- a bit salty, but I think you should expect that with prosciutto, and the tomatoes were really fresh. The third time, though,  I ordered the mocha (I was in love with it by this point) with no whip, the firehouse, and a scone. The scone was just okay (I'm kinda picky about scones though), and thr sandwich was only a little light on the pesto, but the mocha was awful. Really poorly frothed (no microfoam, just huge bubbles), shots seemed bitter, and I tasted almost no mocha. On top of that the barista was rude. I'm gonna assume that maybe the barista was new, though, and chalk it up to that- seemed like the kind of thing someone would do at a new job if they were flustered.TLDR: great place to chill out with lots of seating, wifi, and music that isn't too loud. Fabulous mocha.

48.description: The Coffee Alley is a good neighborhood coffee shop. I like their coffee, tea, and pastries.

44.description: Love the ambiance of this cafe. I'm a sucker for any cafe that's not Starbucks, so I'm happy they're in the neighborhood. The coffee is good, but what I like to come here for is the GELATO. The Mexican hot chocolate gelato is so amazing. But beware--it's very spicy!

24.description: I would come here all the time to study. Great place to study. Not much seating was an issue and not many options for vegans was another issue. Also, it's pretty dark and it made it harder to study. But otherwise, great place to hang out.

7.description: Pretty good Mocha here.It's very soft and well blended.Hazelnut coffee might be little bit sweet for somebody but pretty enjoyable :)Interior design was very warm and cozy, and liked the pictures on the wall.People are nice and welcoming,and I would recommend here to all my friends.Enjoy!

49.description: Nice coffee shop to take a break on. Music is a little bit loud to focus and study but the environment is comfortable.

40.description: I'm not going to beat around the bush on this one... I think they're reusing coffee grinds for their coffee. There's no reason for this, even if it's 8pm on a Sunday.

53.description: This is my favorite place to study and relax. I can't go a day without stopping in here for coffee, especially on the way to class. The young guy that makes my coffee every morning is so sweet and remembers my drink every morning. He also knows I'm always in a rush so he works fast whenever I walk in the door. Definitely a good feelings having someone to chat and smile with in the morning. Best caramel latte in town! Thank you for everything coffee alley! :) can't wait to come back tomorrow.

30.description: Great coffee, nice atmosphere. Bad sandwiches, Turkey taste like prepackaged cold cuts. If you are hungry, go to Al's. If u want to study and have coffee, come here

46.description: I've been here twice in the last few weeks. It's a small, locally run shop, so the prices reflect that (translation = expensive.) With that said, the drinks are good and the gelato is standard/fine. The mexican hot chocolate gelato has a good kick and I like that! Paired it with a scoop of coconut and the flavors really went well together. I haven't tried the food yet, but it's fairly close to my office so I am sure I will at some point. Parking can be a hassle in this neighborhood, but you can generally find a street spot within a few blocks.

1.description: Talk about Good coffee, Talk about beautiful interiors, Talk about value for money, Talk about a hot spot...a lot of people who visit coffee shops for work or studying will agree to the fact that when it comes to a connect, there is always an instant connect with a place when you visit it the first time...Reason could be anything, maybe you like the music, maybe the servers remember you, maybe its the whole environment...Well guess what, this place is all of it...we discovered coffee alley while visiting Chicago, we ended up making relationships for life... beautiful people serving coffee from the heart and for the heart...the baristas are professional and very friendly, the music is stylish and upbeat(yet lets you focus on whatever you are doing), the whole interior is so beautifully designed, you feel you are sitting in the medieval midwest sipping a fine brew...The best part are the hosts, I can go on and on but i will sum this up by congratulating Bill and Sara for sharing this beautiful space with us all, for letting their creative out and for inspiring people of all age groups flocking to this beautiful coffee alleyCan't wait to visit ChiTown again, Can't wait to start the next visit with coffee alley...Enjoy!!

55.description: I went there almost every morning I had class at UIC. Their coffee is amazing and their donuts are also delicious. Definitely recommend this place!

9.description: Classy joint. So many bricks. So many undergrads. Cool architectural details everywhere. High quality coffee. Tip: you can get a refill of coffee for only $1.15!

26.description: I had a lovely chicken pot pie and have had numerous mochas and lattes here and the service and decor is lovely. I love to sit at the window dreamily before or after class.

25.description: Wow! Talk about friendly. I have never been to a more welcoming place. The owner and his wife truly care about their customers and it really shows. This is am ideal spot for students or anyone working from a cafe. The coffee is awesome and the food is tasty... I am excited to come back!

12.description: cozy place and service was friendly enough, but overpriced subpar food. English muffin breakfast sandwich was pretty sad looking, deflated and the consistency of something out of the microwave.

59.description: Little tiny coffee shop in Little Italy. Great relaxing ambience and the staff is wonderful. I am addicted to caffeine and asked for a suggestion and a nice worker suggested the red eye which contained high amounts of caffeine. I will go back in a heartbeat.

21.description: Pretty good Mocha here.It's very soft and well blended.Hazelnut coffee might be little bit sweet for somebody but pretty enjoyable :)Interior design was very warm and cozy, and liked the pictures on the wall.People are nice and welcoming,and I would recommend here to all my friends.Enjoy!

17.description: Sometimes I go places and I say to myself, "I don't NEEEEED that 1,000 extra calories" and normally it stops me from indulging...but not at The Coffee Alley.
