The drinks there are so rich but soooo freaking good. In particular, the goat cheese caramel latte. It sounds intimidating, but it's probably one of the best lattes I've ever had. The gelato there is also all sorts of delicious, although I've successfully fought the urge to taste more than a small sample. I have only had one of their sandwiches and wasn't that impressed by it, but that doesn't deter me from giving The Coffee Alley 5 stars. The people that work there are also wonderful :)UIC students: please continue to flock to Starbucks...I don't want to have to fight for a table Also, the wifi is a little weird, so just ask someone if you have a hard time figuring it out. There's a network called "The Coffee Alley" but that's not actually the one you want to use

10.description: I have been here several times now since I've moved to the area. The Coffee Alley is a great place to study because most people are here studying. The staff is friendly and helpful. The place is clean tooSometimes the music is a little loud for real concentration or peoples conversation gets loud but that's anywhere you go.The iced coffee and iced lattes are great. I had a sausage egg and cheese sandwich on English muffin one day and it was superb.At the end of the night, if there is old coffee left, it is given away. Always a nice perk of staying late.There is also a printer here if you would need to print something while working. You just attach it to the email and pay through that. Great idea!

5.description: Really nice people and good service. The sandwiches are yummy and the coffee is great too. A nice place to come and study or meet up with friends.

3.description: The place is spacious, exposed brick building with very good lighting.  I always get the Cuban Colada, it's delicious espresso.  Their focaccia sticks are yummy as well.  The staff is friendly, I look forward to coming back to this coffee place.

35.description: It's really not that bad, I wanted something a little more authentic italian wise in the neighborhood, but I think i was too late in the afternoon for that.  Oh well, it's my day off, I have no schedule, but anyway...I had a Cuban Colada which was not too shabby at all, 2 shots of espresso with melted brown sugar in coffee.  The decor is a mish mash of different motifs, so I sat for a few minutes and looked around at the college students studying, the different pictures on the wall, and the flooring and tables/chairs.  All in all not a bad joint honestly, I kind of had my heart set on something more traditional.

19.description: Really friendly staff in a cute cafe. The ambiance is great. Brick floors and brick walls. The cafe au lait is fantastic! I haven't had any of their food there, but my boyfriend had a chocolate cake of some sort and he loved it! Definitely my favorite cafe in Chicago so far. It's really down to earth and cozy. For example, I'm sitting next to a Christmas tree. All they need is a fireplace :P

28.description: Decided to give this place a second try. The coffee was still awful. The baristas need some training about how to pull an espresso. I can see how a drink with mostly sugar syrups would mask the flavor of an espresso shot that's been pulled bad, but if you drink mostly espresso drinks without the sweets then you can really tell. Alas, I tried their sandwiches and god damn! AMAZING! Tried the Chicago Fire and mmmmm. Although the coffee is not great, the atmosphere, the employees, and the sandwiches make up for this.

45.description: Definitely a fan.However, would appreciate longer hours (ie closing at 10pm instead of 9pm)....

33.description: Really friendly staff in a cute cafe. The ambiance is great. Brick floors and brick walls. The cafe au lait is fantastic! I haven't had any of their food there, but my boyfriend had a chocolate cake of some sort and he loved it! Definitely my favorite cafe in Chicago so far. It's really down to earth and cozy. For example, I'm sitting next to a Christmas tree. All they need is a fireplace :P

43.description: Sometimes I go places and I say to myself, "I don't NEEEEED that 1,000 extra calories" and normally it stops me from indulging...but not at The Coffee Alley. The drinks there are so rich but soooo freaking good. In particular, the goat cheese caramel latte. It sounds intimidating, but it's probably one of the best lattes I've ever had. The gelato there is also all sorts of delicious, although I've successfully fought the urge to taste more than a small sample. I have only had one of their sandwiches and wasn't that impressed by it, but that doesn't deter me from giving The Coffee Alley 5 stars. The people that work there are also wonderful :)UIC students: please continue to flock to Starbucks...I don't want to have to fight for a table Also, the wifi is a little weird, so just ask someone if you have a hard time figuring it out. There's a network called "The Coffee Alley" but that's not actually the one you want to use

2.description: Tons of food options! Not a great place for groups but great for a study session or a one on one with your buddy!Service: Always friendly :)Food: Underwhelmed with flavors and somewhat filling. Chai Latte (hot or iced) is good!Value: Average

18.description: My go-to cafe for some peace and quiet. Great to set up shop and work for a few hours. They not only have wifi and a work table but also have a printer. Admittedly, I haven't really explored their menu but their coffee tastes decent. And I have to try their ice cream one of these days because they look so so good!

41.description: Great, homey coffee shop in university village. Quick coffee, kind customer service and pleasant atmosphere. You can get work done here without too many distractions, along with a nice cup of coffee. Iced coffee is nice. Hot appuccino is silky and frothy. Definitely recommend this place for UIC students, graduates and university village locals.

52.description: Wow, LOVE this place!I initially went to Starbucks this morning, armed with a heavy load of textbooks, hoping to study.. But immediately left due to the noise level.The Coffee Alley is everything a coffee shop should be. Fresh, homemade pastries, smooth rich coffee, and friendly, personal service. I chatted with the owner for a couple minutes and he was so kind. He even gave me a friend's business card when he learned I'd be a marketing graduate soon, trying to help me network. Don't get that at the 'Bucks!Coffee is served fresh and steaming in a ceramic mug. I also got a cheese Danish that was soft and flaky. Oh my lawd. I will return!

50.description: I'v stopped into the Coffee Alley multiple times since its opening on Taylor street.  I'm in the area frequently and have deemed it my new favorite hang out.  The atmosphere is warm, cozy, and inviting.  My favorite part is the coffee bar seating area.  There are multiple outlets which is perfect to plug a laptop into and get work done while enjoying a cup of coffee.  This place is unique and filled with character from the brick walls and floor, to the local artist work they have on display. Coffee Alley by no doubt has my stamp of approval!  (not to mention my favorite dink here is the chai latte :) fantastic!)

4.description: Cute little coffee shop. I had their coconut chai latte and it was Amazing! Unfortunately that is all I got so I cant review on more but their coconut chai latte is a MUST to try! Delish!

6.description: Stopped in for a coffee and ended up with a coconut chai tea which was delish!  Really nice gentleman at the counter too.

22.description: I'm a student at UIC and recently started coming to Coffee Alley to get homework done and enjoy a relaxing environment to do so. I prefer this setting over Starbucks as it is more of a home feeling to the ambiance. The Chai Latte's are amazing! I'm now a weekly customer. The owner and workers are very friendly and accommodating as well. All around great experience!

15.description: I'm a student at UIC, and sometimes I just need a change of location when I'm trying to do some studying. So I found this place on here, and I figured I would give it a try.I ordered an americano, and it was definitely decent. Not the best coffee I've had, but could've been worse. Tasted kind of burnt to be honest.However, the atmosphere is great. I went there early on a sunday morning and stayed for a few hours. It was nice a quiet and they had a really good music playlist. The free wifi was definitely a plus!Overall, not too bad. I'll be going back since its so close to UIC, but if I want great coffee I'm gonna go somewhere else. (Dollop Coffee Co anyone?)

57.description: I love the feel, I love small little cafes, and awesome music was played. I typically put on headphones whenever I go to cafes to study/ work, but the music they were playing was on point.Kudos to whoever picks the music! Oh yeah, I got a soy chai latte. It was okay, not as rich/creamy as I would have liked it to be. But seriously, the music and the overall ambiance is what I would come back to. Basically feels like I'm at a friends house. I love it

20.description: I've come to this shop often to work and can definitely say their sandwiches and specialty coffee drinks are truly phenomenal.I'd recommend their Pilsen sandwich and a coconut chai latte (I prefer it cold but you can get any drink hot). The staff is always kind and smiling and they're always playing great music! Definitely going to be my go to spot instead of Starbucks from this point forward !

36.description: Nice place to study and have a cup of coffee. Take off 1 star because the music playing and strong sugar/dessert smell.

14.description: Great little place on Taylor street with tasty latte and sandwich combos. I recommend the coconut chai tea as top pick. Friendly staff which is always a plus.

3.description: i didn't get my hair cut. the sign on the door says open Wednesdays 9-6 but no one was there and a neighbor of the shop told me they'd be back tomorrow. i think the hours posted on their sign are wrong.. they're open Thur-Sat, no Wednesdays.

1.description: This guy ruined my hair. He didn't cut it like I asked for and insisted that he was right after he ruined it. He also took a long time (more than 30 minutes). His shop smelled grungey and had a bad/dirty vibe with nude pinups everywhere. Even if it were an ok haircut, $18 is still pretty steep. I will never come here again. Gabby's barber shop up north on Clark street was way better. They were quick, friendly, clean, professional, and cheap ($14): everything that The Hair's End was not.

2.description: Sign says they are open 9:30-6 on Wednesdays through Fridays. I went there Wednesday at 5:30. Closed. I went there Thursday morning at 9:45. Closed. The sign even says "we are open." Went and grabbed some food and came back about 20 minutes later. Closed.Ridiculous, pathetic, enraging, and laughable are the words that come to mind. Thanks for wasting my time. Please go out of business and make room for someone who sucks less. It's called progress.

5.description: Great place for a men's haircut. I dropped in here after reading the few reviews here on yelp. I was very happy with the cut and the experience. I'll be back here!Barber took his time and really gave me a quality cut. It's only 18 bucks!! Go here!!!

6.description: I used to get my hair cut at The Hair's End. The barber, Bart, was pretty good when I was younger. But as I got older, the quality of his haircuts slowly began to decline. I stopped going there about three years ago and I've been going to Family Barber Shop on Madison Street ever since. Family Barber Shop is a much better place to get a haircut. The prices are nearly the same as The Hair's End and the haircuts they've given me are much better than Bart's.

7.description: Went to the Hair's End today for the first time, and I had a great haircut!  I've been looking for a good barber shop in the city - cheap, no frills, and a quality haircut.  This place is it!  Bart's son cut my hair, and it looks great!  For $18, I'll be back soon!

8.description: This is the best barber in Chicago, possibly Chicago land. I am surprised that there aren't other reviews on this place. Bart, the owner and the only barber in the place is great. You get a great quality cut the old fashioned way, scissors first, limited buzzer after. The only reason that there aren't other reviews is probably the majority of the customers are a bit too old for yelp, Some have been going to Bart for 45+ years. He is always busy, so make an appointment a few days ahead of time. Cuts are $17 and they are always top notch.

0.description: Ok, dis is Lil' Italy.  You welcome.  You need ta' know a few dings...Bart (and his son) is a fixture here in Little Italy.  Bart's been cutting hair for, well, long 'nough to know how ta' cut yours just fine.  Plus Bart's got a spot or two out back for parking so you don't pay $60 to good ol' Rahmmiee for a stupid parking ticket.  Great atmosphere across from the Italian American Hall of Fame (don't be a wise guy and ask why it is only 3 stories...), with a lobby fully of barbershop appropriate reading material.  You will learn more about Little Italy during one shave and haircut than anywhere else.  Plus you'll look (and smell) a lot better than you do now.  Seriously, respect yourself a bit more and get a haircut.$18 for a haircut is tough to beat.  Traditional shave with a straight razor is something everyone should try.  Even if you only do it to brag to your friends that you had someone put a razor to your neck while you were hanging out in Little Italy (and you, tough guy, survived)...Oh, call ahead if you want both a shave and haircut...and remember if you bring the little guys along for a hair cut, too, that some of the, ah, reading material focuses on the beauty of the feminine form.

4.description: Best value in all of Chicago for a hair cut,  an update on the latest worldly events (of course from the center of the universe, aka, Bari, Italy).  It is also a great place to get up to speed on what is going on in next center of the world, Little Italy Chicago.   Great neighborhood, good cuts, straight razor shaves and old school charm, familiarity and atmosphere.  A

58.description: It's a pretty straightforward Irish Pub w. not a lot  frills.  The bar area seemed to sport a bit of character (read: distressed and worn, but in a good way).  They do serve Matilda on tap which was nice.  They have really good deals on both food and drink so be sure to check them out (a ton of $3 daily deals and also $3 apps from around 2p-6P .  We had the chicken fingers and chimichanga (beef), both were tasty.  We were there early so it wasn't packed but defo a college kid sort of establishment from what i could tell.

56.description: free shuffleboard and pretty good drink specials....  Helps that I can walk here.  The food is just ok, but the fried pickle is a pretty good thing to try.

29.description: I came here last month with a bunch of friends. It definitely comes across as a college bar. Why not since UIC is right there. I didn't really have any of their drinks, but I did play some shuffleboard! I have never played it before, so it was a lot of fun. The music wasn't anything special. We got the occasional odd stares because it was a bunch of Asians together.

42.description: Good beer, decent food, good music and shuffle board.

23.description: Update: went back because a friend is moving, and the group wanted to go. First beer: Lagunitas IPA (a personal favorite) tasted terrible, and the reason? Not cold! The tap was pouring too warm of beers. Maybe some people can find that acceptable when  they are drinking cheap beer, but the flavor profile of craft beer changes when they are served anywhere above 55. Not wanting to risk another warm pour, I ditched the idea of a draft, and went for a can they had displayed on the shelf, Revolution's Anti-Hero. Bartender didn't think they had it, and then checked the fridge. She said she thought it was $6 (really, for a 12 oz can? whatever) so i paid and took my beer back to my seat. This beer was ALSO warm. Why have fridges under the bar if they don't keep your drinks cold?later i went to pay for my gf's vodka and soda and their credit card machine was not working. wtf? this night was not a busy night there, yet service still disappointing.Since no one cared to assure me that my last visit (and review) was a fluke, i'll take  that to mean this is business as usual.Disappointing. Drum: LOST MY BUSINESS!

47.description: 3 things:great pours.awesome tunes (heard band of horses, beck, muse, biggie while there).great deals.what more do you want in a bar?

8.description: Drum is my favorite bar in the area. 5 dollar rum and coke is my drink, and they make drinks well and strong. There is one bar, shuffleboard, and plenty of tables. If you're a smoker, there is a back patio where you can bring your drinks instead of leaving them with someone. The bartenders are all very nice, will make a basic drink really quick, and don't mind making something more complicated if you ask.

31.description: Fun neighborhood bar. Great appetizers and bartenders can make any drink.

34.description: Loud-ass bar.  The DJ was hit or miss, the drinks were too expensive and the bouncers were assholes at the end of the night.

16.description: I give it one star since I don't think I can give zero. Stood by the bar for 15 minutes ad the blonde bartender made eye contact several times before walking away and serving others. No amount of hand waving or screaming "excuse me!" seemed to do the trick. Pre-gamimg from now on, since I don't want to give this place any of my money

13.description: Great spot for late night drinks and DJ music. We ha our wedding after party there since it's right next to the Grand Piazza.

11.description: I honestly don't remember what exactly we ordered unless I look at my foodie photos.  Non-memorable dinner experience I guess.I had a salad with avocado, bacon, onion, egg, goat cheese and balsamic dressing.  It was alright.  The bacon and lettuce were fresh and so crisp.  This is the salad you'd order if you had a craving for something crunchy.  The hubby ordered a burger, something with jalapeno's on it.  It was a massive burger served on Texas toast.  He said he was a little worried it would be too hot, but it was just the right amount of heat.We were just having dinner, using a Groupon NOW.  There wasn't exactly a waitress, so the bartender doubled as our server.  They came only to take our order and bring our drinks, the kitchen brought out our food.  We had to flag down our check when we were done.  We were never checked on for refills or asked if we needed anything else.  Glad we didn't pay full price for that kind of dining experience.  I would never come here for dinner again, drinks maybe (and that's a big MAYBE).

39.description: Great place to stop in and catch a game on a hot weekend. During the heatwave when the central air crapped out in my place this was heaven. Excellent pours. Good selection of beers. The bartenders are extremely friendly. I have no complaints but I've never tried the food. With Davanti right down the street it's hard to eat anywhere else! This is a fun place to get a drink before dinner.

37.description: Decent bar with food that can be hit or miss when it comes to environment. We had the lovely experience of enjoying obnoxiously loud brobags and a lady harnessing a newborn.Either way, they have $2 Hamm's cans daily and their food is really good. Their burgers are served on texas toast and you have the choice of tots or fries. I ordered the Western with tots, but would get fries next time. They are those tasty seasoned fries like Checker's used to have.

0.description: This place was like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day. We were looking for a fun bar for blocks and had no luck. Until we came across this gem. The beers were reasonably priced. The atmosphere was friendly and the bartender (Mike) was amazing. We had a few hours to spare mid day and he entertained us the entire time. Wanted to stay and continue the fun but had to leave. Next time I'm in Chicago in definitely going back to this bar.

38.description: Good food, chill atmosphere, great beer deals and awesome staff. Love the "Irish" food and the bartender had us cracking up. Sit outside if you can, either way it's a great cheap bar to just chill at and have lunch.

51.description: Slightly better-than-average college bar menu (albeit not particularly Irish); college bar prices. The bartender did an excellent job of timing the Guinness pours so that no one went thirsty while waiting for settling. Friendly and perfectly pleasant for lunch, but likely not the scene for anyone 25+ after dark.

27.description: Best bar on Taylor street on a Friday or Saturday night, period! Been here several times and keep finding myself coming back.  The new DJ is awesome on both nights.  My friends and I loved the selection of music!  You get to hear all the new Top 40, old school, dance & hip hop.  Free shuffle board at the back of the bar.  Drink prices were fantastic and they were healthy drinks.  If you like the 25-35 age group.  This is the place to be.  Tons of TVs for the Hawks & Bulls games.  Definite hidden gem on Taylor street!

32.description: Finding myself going here more and more often.  This is a hidden gem - their burgers are truly legit, not to mention they have one of my favorite salads.  Hope the word doesn't get out - this is getting to be one of my fave lunch spots, not just for the great food, but their friendly staff.

54.description: Great place. Went there on a whim while strolling Taylor St. ALMOST went to Hawkeyes, but D&M's menu looked more appealing.It was very quiet there at 4pm so my wife and I were able to enjoy a beer and some great service. Bartender/Waiter was awesome! $3 Food Specials 4-6pm and drink specials every day.We had Fried Ravioli, Fried pickles, Irish Nachos, Veggie burger. Everything was very good, came out quick & hot! Nice little outdoor patio as well. VERY CITY-Like!5 Stars is very tough in my book! You can bet a 4 Star from me is a place worth going to! I'm not in that area often, but would most definitely go there again.

48.description: Quite possibly the best karaoke spot. Ever. Great draft selection. Full bar with formidable whiskey and scotch selection. $3 specials - drafts, shots, food. Decent flour chips and fish tacos with a spicy pico de gallo. Two giant books of songs. At some point, I realized that there was no need to read through the books - they had everything. Was expecting a dive bar and was pleasantly surprised to enter a freshly renovated space with cute, friendly bartenders along with a fun, friendly crowd. I honed my vocal/theatrical stylings in private rooms at Korean karaoke establishments, but think I've found my new stage.

44.description: I have come here twice, the service is not the greatest.  It seems like they are severely understaffed, especially during a Hawks Game.  The food is okay, frankly I'm not sure what all the hype is about over the tator-tots.  The sour cream and cheese tasted bland and the tots were so greasy.  I would come again, but for the atmosphere more than the food.

24.description: The Drum and Monkey is a lucky charm tucked in among upscale Italian restaurants on Taylor. The stains from exuberant geysers after the Blackhawks took the Stanley cup are still proudly decorating the 20-foot ceiling. The ambience is solid blue collar casual, with rustic public house style wooden tables, conversation nooks, an expansive, comfortable bar and fireplaces. Celeste, the perfectly gregarious and warm barmaid, turned us on to the buffalo chicken wontons, a brilliant in-house culinary treat served piping hot with rich ranch dressing. The D and M is obviously a Jameson's bar (i.e. local, loud, friendly) and is one of the best Irish pubs in Chi-town.

7.description: Place is still rockin, but the fries are different than they used to be and I'm sad.

49.description: Reminds of the Cheers bar- where everybody knows your name.  Drum is unpretentious with great food and drink specials.  The owner really tries to get to know his patrons.  Wish they could figure out a way to enlarge the bathroom though.  Otherwise, love the Drum.

40.description: Came here for lunch on a random weekday. There were maybe 3 other people in the bar. The bar appears tiny but maybe there was more to it. Menu was good, beer selection was decent. No complaints. I'd go here again.

53.description: GREAT deals!!!  As my friend said, college bar = college prices.  Way better then any other bar on this block.  Divey, laid back, $3 Oberons on Tuesday, $1.50 tacos on Tuesday, you seriously can't beat. it. I left full and buzzed and my tab was $14.  Gotta love it.

30.description: if your 18-24 then this is a place you might like. Otherwise it is a student dive bar in a world class city. Nice old backgammon type table in back. it deserves to be in a better place. This place was smelly and dirty and there was a dog in the bar when I went. the young crowd was really over served and loud. Surprising to see a college town bar in a city. Bad place for most.

46.description: Your pick of the litter Chicago pub. Nice atmopshere but nothing special. Went here for lunch and the food was pretty bad. I had the buffalo calamari and the breading couldnt stay on the rings, it couldnt make it from the fork to my mouth without falling all over. The chicken sandwhich was pretty flavorless. Nice place to grab a drink, but don't eat here.

1.description: We came in late after a concert. It was perfect. Do you remember that TV show about a bar where everyone knows your name? By George, this is it! While we were talking and people-watching, there were clearly regulars who knew the bartender, who knew what they liked because he pulled down a bottle, lined up the shot glasses and filled up the pint glasses. It was dark and kind of a hodgepodge in decor but that really is what it should be. I saw a sign saying there was free shuffle board but I didn't venture downstairs to check it out. I ordered the Disco Tots. These are tator tots smothered in nacho cheese, sour cream, jalapeños, tomatoes. Basically, think typical nacho roping in tots. Brilliant as it was yummy. It billed as an appetizer but I'm a selfish and greedy woman and refused to shared with my mate after he got his one free sample. Mr. ordered a BBQ-type cheeseburger. It came in at above your standard 1/4 pounder. It looked like a fresh, hand-formed patty covered with cheese, bacon and BBQ sauce and was served with a side fries. He had no complaints and left little or no evidence of his meal. The beer, spirits and cocktail menus were great. Hamm's beer in a can for two bucks. Macallen's 12 year scotch. I had a cocktail of some sort cocktail whose name completely escapes me but I remember it was awesome. We were there on a Wednesday night after 10 PM and the crowd was not a crowd. But the music was great (not too loud that we couldn't talk to each other.) The high top tables along the wall and seats at the bar had hooks for purses (bonus!). It was really a great end to a great evening that left us wishing we could make it our own neighborhood hang-out.

55.description: Good Irish bar near the UIC campus.The prices are decent, but compared to other bars on Taylor street, the prices are pretty good.  They have an above average booze selection.  The food is pretty good and the decor is okay.  What makes the Drum a good bar is the ppl.  Everyone from the kitchen staff, door staff, bartenders and owners are pretty friendly.  I regularly sit at the bar and see how the staff interacts with their guests.  They are consistent.The Drum is easily one of the better bars on Taylor street.Hawkeyes can kiss my hairy a$$.

9.description: Clearly a college bar. Cheap drinks and interesting people.

26.description: Watching The Blackhawks in The Windy City, quite the experience!  You know "when in Rome..." Go Hawks!  AWESOME bar too!Could not of picked a better choice than The Drum & Monkey.  I have been back since and just a great place to go.  Great neighborhood.  The staff is awesome!!  very accommodating!  The atmosphere is great, the specials are fantastic, the drinks are generous, the food...delicious!!!  We had a beef sandwich with mozzarella and tater tots.

25.description: The best bar on Taylor street.  Awesome food & wide selection of beer/liquors.  DJ is on Friday & Saturday plays a wide variety of great hits.  Everything from the Latest top 40 to the Old school throw back.  Fantastic atmosphere for 25-35 year old crowd.

12.description: Decent bar food.  A neighborhood place that sometimes is drowning in over served college kids.  But exactly what somebody would expect from a bar next to a university.

59.description: Drum & Monkey you've never failed me... -Thank you

21.description: My coworkers regularly come here on Tuesday nights after our weekly meeting. It's a divey bar, with good beer, a shuffleboard table (always fun with a group), a small outdoor seating area in the back, and really friendly staff. The food is...OK. It's bar food, so nothing spectacular, but pretty cheap so you get what you pay for. This is just a really great place to hang out with friends or coworkers in a relaxed environment while drinking beer.

17.description: Western burger, onion ring 8 oz burger, and thick! Now this is what i'm talking about as far as burgers go. When someone ask's you to go get a real burger, maybe you need to mozzie on down to this location. Their fries were actually really good shoe string style and they have vinegar on the tables so that you can pick it up a notch. The place looks like an old brothel with its brick walls and vintage look so this for me is always a good sign. Truly a gem nestled inside of Taylor Street and a hidden gem amongst burger joints. We came for lunch so of course we couldn't taste their large selection of beers, but next time I will if I am not working.

10.description: I have never been in love with this place. It is a crappy Irish pub. It is very cramped and difficult to get a drink. Their drinks are overpriced compared to everywhere else on Taylor Street. I wish my friends did not keep dragging me here! I do enjoy the shuffle board in the back though and their music is entertaining. Tuesday is karaoke night and can be fun but is really hit or miss. Too few TVs to watch sports as well.

5.description: Great place.  Went there after another friend (back in Wisconsin) saw were were in Chicago and he recommended it.  Bartenders were fast and very friendly.  Warmed right up to us and made us welcome.  Tim and I think the gal was Alissa but unsure.  We did not eat but saw others eating and food looked and smelled good.  A quaint place with a nice feel and older look.  Great selection of beers and liquors with a good drink menu.  Nice selection of Irish whiskeys.  Be sure to try the Irish Mule.  Nice twist on the Moscow mule.  Prices were cheapest we found in Chicago. Also has a nice little spot out back for us smokers so we don't have to stand out front right where non smokers walking in and out and on the sidewalk.  Nice clean joint. Only reason we left is cause it was St Patricks weekend and we needed to get to our hotel and check in.  Will be back for sure next trip

3.description: Great irish bar where I can come chill and de-stress after work. Bar food is actually pretty good for it being at a bar. I love how the bartenders make you feel as if your VIP even if you dont come here often. Friday nights is awesome. You see people of every walk of life and I LOVE THAT. None of that pretentious shit going on here. Everyone is treated the same and with respect. I have been here twice and both times, I came in scrub pants, since I was just coming out of work. There were people with ties, tshirts, heck I saw a man with a green/purple mohawk that let me touch his mohawk (thanks scott!!) This is a great neighborhood bar.Parking is hard to find especially when you come in after 10pm.

35.description: I really like this place. It's close to my work so I sometimes come here for lunch. Their pulled pork sandwich delicious. and their tots...... probably the best I've ever had. They also have a good selection of booze and the staff is always friendly. Definitely worth trying.

19.description: This is my favorite bar. I've rarely seen a more consistently welcoming staff. Always a fun time.

28.description: I'm afraid to rank this place 5 stars because I don't want it to get so crowded that we can't get a table!  Great drink specials and fantastic food.  We come here on Saturdays to watch football games and stay all day and leave with a reasonable tab.  We've celebrated St. Paddy's here and have had a birthday party at Drum & Monkey. Absolutely the best bar around.Their appetizers are great.  Who doesn't love tator tots- but to add bacon, ranch, and cheese to them? Yum!  They have fantastic twists other favorites. Check out their new "egg rolls"-- great twist!

45.description: I honestly don't remember what exactly we ordered unless I look at my foodie photos.  Non-memorable dinner experience I guess.I had a salad with avocado, bacon, onion, egg, goat cheese and balsamic dressing.  It was alright.  The bacon and lettuce were fresh and so crisp.  This is the salad you'd order if you had a craving for something crunchy.  The hubby ordered a burger, something with jalapeno's on it.  It was a massive burger served on Texas toast.  He said he was a little worried it would be too hot, but it was just the right amount of heat.We were just having dinner, using a Groupon NOW.  There wasn't exactly a waitress, so the bartender doubled as our server.  They came only to take our order and bring our drinks, the kitchen brought out our food.  We had to flag down our check when we were done.  We were never checked on for refills or asked if we needed anything else.  Glad we didn't pay full price for that kind of dining experience.  I would never come here for dinner again, drinks maybe (and that's a big MAYBE).

33.description: Western burger, onion ring 8 oz burger, and thick! Now this is what i'm talking about as far as burgers go. When someone ask's you to go get a real burger, maybe you need to mozzie on down to this location. Their fries were actually really good shoe string style and they have vinegar on the tables so that you can pick it up a notch. The place looks like an old brothel with its brick walls and vintage look so this for me is always a good sign. Truly a gem nestled inside of Taylor Street and a hidden gem amongst burger joints. We came for lunch so of course we couldn't taste their large selection of beers, but next time I will if I am not working.

43.description: I have now been to Drum & Monkey a couple times, mostly because it's near school, but I have yet to have an amazing experience. The first time I went, I could hardly handle the music (blaring + bad taste), but when I last visited, it was actually ok. It got a little louder as the evening progressed, although there was pretty much no one in the bar, but I'll let that pass. What most annoyed me about D&M was the waitress. She was really nice at first, but then she started ignoring our table. She seemed only interested in serving half of the table at a time, which, despite her brilliant application of eyeshadow, made me think she wasn't too quick. Overall, I'm not going to avoid Drum & Monkey, but it certainly isn't going to be my first choice going forward.

2.description: Quaint little Irish pub with plenty of seats. Good beer selection & friendly bartender. We didn't try the food this time but if we return I'll update the review.

18.description: Finding myself going here more and more often.  This is a hidden gem - their burgers are truly legit, not to mention they have one of my favorite salads.  Hope the word doesn't get out - this is getting to be one of my fave lunch spots, not just for the great food, but their friendly staff.

41.description: You know the bar is good when you wake up with a goose nest hairdo, a missing liver and a bottle of bacon vodka. It all started when we made friends with the owners at Baconfest 2012. That's the drunkest my group of Russian/American friends and I have been in the last 10 years. Laid back bar, plenty of cozy seating and good music. Note to self: makes it difficult to walk out of the bar when you open the umbrella inside.

52.description: Great place, good prices.  and good for an after sport place if you play on the southside.  Parking can be quite tough.  Prices are average, but they do have a daily special.  I have only been there during the week, so couldnt tell you how the weekend is.  Owner and bartenders have always been attentive.

50.description: I might find myself at the D&M on a Thursday night which is the busiest night for them, having myself a PBR. The crowd is usually college kids and locals. I love the Bartenders because they are honest and generous with the alcohol serving. They have a nice Lil back alley type area to drink and smoke if you choose. this place is alright with me

4.description: Went there just for drinks. Good selection and cool environment. The music was awesome all night. Drink prices weren't the best but a good time.

6.description: This bar was pretty empty on a warm early Saturday evening when I met up with some friends. The bartender was very attentive with drink orders, refills and food. The food was alright. Standard bar fare. I got fried mac and cheese which was good, though I'm not sure if it was completely fried. Sometimes I'd bite into it and it would feel cool. I still ate it, because I was hungry. The tater tots that the table ordered were delicious. The cider selection isn't as great (Vandermill Peach Ginger and Magner's), but everything else seemed reasonable.

22.description: The overall experience was pretty great. We wanted to find a place to eat and enjoy the game in a not too loud environment and was able to do just that here. The staff was so friendly and their specials are pretty good too! It was pretty cool that they would switch the games during commercial time.

15.description: I came here last month with a bunch of friends. It definitely comes across as a college bar. Why not since UIC is right there. I didn't really have any of their drinks, but I did play some shuffleboard! I have never played it before, so it was a lot of fun. The music wasn't anything special. We got the occasional odd stares because it was a bunch of Asians together.

57.description: Ive been Drum and Monkey'd three times total, once on a Monday at 5PM for dollar mini sandwiches, once on a Thursday at 1PM for lunch, and the third time on a Wednesday evening around 5:30PM for the burger and sierra nevada for 7 bucks special. The beer selection is decent and one of the better on the block.Monday: tried one of each, all were mediocre and not worth mentioning. The bartender/waiter forgot the buffalo chicken mini twice and it was very cold at arrival (yes, the little sandwiches actually came out individually for some reason).  This bartender (the guy will appear again) appeared to be drinking with his patrons, which didnt really bother me aside from his terribly slow and forgetful service. Thursday: The same bartender is working (wonderful), but he seems much more alert or at least energetic than previously at entrance. I ordered some of the wings thinking it would be fast and couldnt be bad. I was right about that, the wings were quite tasty and very meaty with a few sauce selections. i liked the sesame terryaki best. I would definietly go back for a decent wing special if they have one???Of note: it took our pal the bartender about 25 minutes and three asks to finally bring the check (during luch hour). There were 3 other people in the bar (sitting at stools ) and would you believe it, drinking with our buddy. Isnt he swell. When we paid it was pretty clear Cheech had been taking a "smokey" break. Wednesday: The burger was good, a standard beef patty with fixings. Of course I enjoyed the Sierra Nevada, thats  a given. What was also a given, long wait in an empty bar for mediocre food and slightly overpriced drafts served from a special bartender.  Food Not for me, but the free shuffleboard is awesome and I could see it being a decent place for sporting events.

20.description: Awesome food. Seriously.  And the mac n cheese balls are amazeballs!!!!Will b back again.

36.description: Went back here one night because it was in the area and I looked at their website and it said they had 2 dollar beers. Asked the bartender and he said that the website hadn't been updated in 5 years and that none of those specials exist in a tone that made it seem like it was my fault or I'm an idiot for believing their website was accurate.The bartender was not helpful at all after that point and had a 'buy full priced drinks or get out' kind of attitude.

14.description: I love it. Free Jameson shots from regular patrons. Good looking bartenders with nice boobies. A black guy playing amazing Irish Music, what the hell else do you need? Good times and good vibes.

12.description: Food is barely edible. (I thew most of mine away). Delivery drivers cool.  Food tastes as though it were made by a 5 year old.

7.description: pass by here a lot.. the sign says" best philly stop" with tons of flashy lights at night..  i wanted a philly cheese steak one day while driving pass here... so i came in to give it a try.. it was a little little store with cashier near the back.. i ordered the philly cheese steak and chicken briyani..philly cheese steak- i didnt like it.. there was very little meat and cheese in there.. and it tasted really salty..chicken briyani- it wasnt bad.. i think they use the wrong kind of rice for this tho? normally at order places they use long rice and over here they use regular rice..they dont have the best philly...the restaurant  name lied to me =(

3.description: I went here a few days ago when I was in the area. The restaurant looks likes a rundown convenience store. The place is full of pictures, articles, and other material all over the place. It gives the appearance of being very disorganized and scattered.This place is low quality. I picked up a gyros and fries combination. The gyros were dry, flavorless, and looked stale. It was like they had been sitting on the rotisserie all day. Or maybe they use a wrong cut of meat or a cheap cut of meat.  Either way the gyros were terrible.The fries tasted better, but they were too oily. Each bite was a taste of crispy potato, and hot oil. I didn't like that they hadn't even strained the fries of their oil. I think I will not be coming back here again.

1.description: When you walk in, you'll think you're at a convenient store (a very disorganized one). Then, you'll notice a bunch of tables with some ugly chairs. Look past all that, you will see the restaurant portion. When you give your order, you'll notice the owner or the cook take the money from your hand, put it in the register, and then walk over and start cooking your food without washing his hands or wearing gloves... yikes. They used be good back in 2012 when they opened up. Since then, there have been multiple owner changes and I guess the old owner took his recipes with him. After he left, the food went downhill. I've got a stomach ache after I came here once. I thought it was a one time thing so I came back again and it was the same experience. I'm thinking it's from how oily my food was, I didn't get food poisoning or anything. Ever since Ghareeb Nawaz opened up in University Village, I stopped coming here.TFM sells Lamb Biryani for $13.99, Ghareeb sells it for $5TFM seels Chilli Chicken for $10, Ghareeb sells it for $5 TFM sells raita/dehi for $1, Ghareeb gives it for freeA milk gallon here is $4.99?!?!?!?

2.description: This place is very odd. Went there last night for the first time. First if all it was 80 degrees outside and in Chicago that's pretty hot, you would expect them to have some sort of air conditioning on, but it was like 90 degrees inside and felt disgusting. Anyways, the place is a weird kind of convenient store and a fast food place. It all just looked dirty to me and I just didn't feel safe or comfortable eating there or their food. We got some food because it was the only place open at 12AM, the food is the definition of would call "drunk food". It was ok and would do good for the rest of the night, but you'll probably regret it in the morning.

9.description: Best spicy gyros I've ever had! 2 for ten bucks!If you're on Taylor street check it out.

18.description: Super tasty chicken biryani and other veggie dishes !! Very tasty and delicious

10.description: Pros:+Hours+StaffCons:-Food Quality-Facility Ordered Butter Chicken from here due to a late night craving and nothing else being open. The pricing is all over the place, online is different from the pricing wall, different from the register. The food tasted very strange, like they poured a pound of Garam Masala in a gallon of tomato sauce,  and the chicken reheated. They gave me extra rice for free I guess that's a bonus. The Samosa's are the kind that come in little bags from the frozen section, they also sell frozen food and canned groceries. The staff needs to stop watching tv and pay attention to the state of the restaurant.

13.description: A friend recommended Best Philly Stop/Taylor Food Mart & Restaurant as a late night option for the best fries after midnight. I ended up ordering the chana masala which was great. Roti was good as well. Chana was spiced just right. Place has alot of potential. Reasonable prices and huge portions. Will be trying more of the Indo/Pak menu selections.  Staff is friendly  and accommodating. Btw, the masala chai was delicious.I will be going back.

16.description: ordered for delivery over the phone, food took over an hour to arrive. Can't remember the last time I was this sick for this long after a meal. If you value your intestines, think twice.

17.description: We loved the chicken masala, chicken biryani, samosas, and even the cheesecake. Affordable and very tasty.

15.description: I think the new official name is Best Philly Stop. At least that's what is on the new menus.Still not everything on the new menus and the Taylor halal food student special are not available everyday. Might be better to just ask what they have.Our first visit with the new menu, we got four veggie samosas (4 for $2), a chicken boti and chicken seekh kabab roll (2 rolls/ $5), and a chicken biryani for $5. The rolls are like large tacos in size and form. Lettuce and tomatoes as the veggie accents probably aren't ideal but they'll do to meet cost. Tasty and the chicken wasn't dry - onions and spices add the taste. Getting two for $5...you could share with someone and order other things to finish out your lunch. Otherwise the two are plenty for most appetites. They are flexible to mix and match...at least the day we were there. May differ when things get busier and the fall semester starts again at this UIC neighborhood business.I'd say stop in and give their rolls a try - you can also get a beef boti as well as vegi kabob roll but I haven't tried them yet.

0.description: I visit this place quite regularly , mutton masala is my choice every time , nice good Khulfi is best

5.description: I came in on Easter Sunday and didn't know what to expect but saw in the back to order food. The owner was there and suggested a chicken gyros for me to be on the healthy side and my husband had the chicken cheese steak. Both were hearty sandwiches served with cajun style fries and a pop for only $7.99. While we were eating he was preparing Pineapple Chicken Fried rice for a catering dinner for his family and I got to taste! It was very good, with chick peas, pineapple, chunks of chicken and hint of curry in the rice. I will definitely come back and order the less traditional more Asian type dishes to try.

11.description: Went in to try the Indian food. It's very affordable that is ideal for students like me. However the Indian food was average. There seemed to be a perennial pickle taste in it. I'm a vegetarian and so I don't really know about the gyros that everybody seems to be talking about but the Indian food is strictly average if not below average.

8.description: The manager of this restaurant is a pretty nice guy. The food on the other hand is a hit or miss. I feel like sometimes what you'll order may have an extra tablespoon of oil added on to it. But keeping within expectations, the place provides decent fried and fast-food

4.description: really awesome special combo plator! we tried fish curry, chicken masala, chicken makhani. u won't believe guys it's really awesome and worth the penny. one must try the fish combo. it's awesome

14.description: the actual sign says philly stop, just incase you're looking.the place is bare bones empty with a grill in the back. late night philly was pretty good and the cook added some indian spicing for a little kick. it did give me heartburn later, but i think that was the greasiness. apparently you can also get indian food, although it isn't really advertised on the signs.love, juston

6.description: Hits the spot for a quick snack.

58.description: Ok I have to be honest...this review this review is for the drinks and the salsa dancing! lol So every Wednesday Lalos has Salsa dancing lessons and then a DJ that plays Salsa music for open dance. I really like to dance so that is why I go. Also those drinks are super strong...I mean one Margaretta and I am done lol. So  bring on the dancing and the drinks...but if you are looking for really good mexican food then I would say choose another place.

56.description: Very disappointed party of 11 celebrating anniversary told waitress we were planning on staying all night. Our  bill over 370.00 and eventhough we were still  ordering drinks and we were asked to leave after dinner even after an hour and a half wait we were at table for about two hours and waitress told us we were there for Four hours.  Music was terrible tonight and will definitely not come back had came here before and had a good experience but this was definitely not a good time. Better places in Chicago.

29.description: I have been here plenty of times, weekends and weekdays....Now for those that come here for a Wednesday/Friday/Saturday night dinner may be a bit confused and alarmed when they hear there is an hour+ wait. Let's review...the place is open until 3am on Saturday and Friday/Wednesday until 2am...with a DJ/band, it pretty much turns into a club. For me, that is not my typical night, so I make sure to go either earlier or not on those nights. Plus there are some other great restaurants in this area now (literally go across the street, great BBQ food).Getting back to food and drinks, both are delicious. I really like the margarita's here and they have Milagro tequila, which is a favorite for me. Their mojitos are just as good and perfect on a Summer day/night The fajitas are a good size portion and juicy meats plus some great veggies. I am never disappointed with a selection here. They also have catering and I have used this numerous times (birthday parties, family events, large party) and again never been disappointed. Any and all guests rave about the food and love love love the salsa. I usually have either just the right amount of food or a small amount of left overs, in which everyone wants to take some home. :) Overall, double check the night you go for what is going on and plan accordingly. This is a place to go to for great food, drinks annnnd dancing. If large crowds are a bother, make adjustments and visit on a different night. Plus there are some other great restaurants in this area.

42.description: Not sure why this place isn't rated higher. Good food, service, and atmosphere. A little noisy, but some like that. Recommended.

23.description: After attending an outdoor event while visiting Chicago we stopped by to have dinner. We were told that because we had shorts on we could not be allowed in. When Did Lalo's Become So Upscale? I am very disappointed in a place that I always visited when I come home to Chicago.

47.description: I have gone here for years, all my friends and I come here to celebrate our birthdays and other celebrations. Last night I came in for a birthday and the bouncers scanners kept reading my OVER 21 ID as underage. he took it to the manager-- who was partying it up, he looked at my ID and with exaggerated hands and disgust said no. MIND YOU IF THIS UNPROFESSIONAL MAN knew how to tell a fake from a real ID I would have gotten in. He was incredibly disrespectful and would not speak to us as he was too busy partying. His bouncers-- very nice, but they were not trained whatsoever to know an ID. They were only reading their scanner rather than even looking at the photo ID. Now, I know there was something wrong with their scanner as another gentleman who was clearly over 21 was scanned as underage, and later 4 of my other friends were scanned underage THE SAME NIGHT. so Lalo's, upgrade your scanner or be normal and become able to tell a fake from a real one and make sure your damn managers are actually professional and are managing the place. You've lost a great deal of money.

8.description: we go here once in a bluemoon mostly cos the kids can be themselves(loud). Today, having skipped lunch due to a busy work day went in hungry with the kiddos after school. We ordered chicken enchiladas and chicken quesdillas. I didnt like my chicken enchilada as hungry as i was...The kids had a few bites and there were enough leftovers for my husband. Its not really the kind of standard i expect from a fancy mexican restaurant.

31.description: This Lalo's is vibrant and LOUD. Went on a Friday night about 7. There's a loud band playing all your Mexican faves from La Bamba to Tequila! You can't hear yourself think, let alone hear the person at your table. The food  is bland, average, service is average, drinks are big, slightly overpriced.  Overall, it's just an average place,  but don't go of you're looking for a quiet evening.People in the lobby are spilling all over the place waiting on your table. There's no waiting area. It's just a walk7ng aisle by the bar full of drunk people waiting on your table.

34.description: Atmosphere is great, servers were very kind and attentive to the table. Only thing I disliked was the quality of food wasn't that great. Looks good on the plate that's about it.

16.description: So we had a doctors appointment a couple doors down and decided to go here. I have never written a review in my life but I had to for this place. It was fantastic!! From the free chips and salsa to the Margaritas and the Guac appetizer, it was a fantastic start!! I had the steak fajitas and the steak sliced like butter. Laying on top of a bed of grilled onions, tri color bell peppers and jalapeños, with refried beans, rice, pico and sour cream. It was seasoned to perfection!! I hate guacamole, but my sister talked me into trying it and I couldn't believe how creamy and smooth it was. Like no guac I've ever seen before. We have decided that this is our new place for our ladies nights!! We have already planned on going back Monday and taking our Mom!!

13.description: A drinks place than food.  Share a dish + 1 drink = $15.  Need flavor on food.Steak Fajitas ($14.95) -- filler galore!  I dare you to count the number of steak strips on the sizzling platter.  The order comes in 2 plates -- sizzling plate + sides.  My first Mexican place in Chicago that mixes corn and flour tortillas.  More filler.  LOLMexican Mojito ($7) -- unbalanced drink.  Decent portion.  Does bitter taste = more booze?  Supposed to be Silver Milagro Tequila.  I am suspecting shelf drink.  Like the price, not the drink.Regular Margarita ($11.95) -- a generous portion.  Good price again.Mango Fruteria Wrap -- I like that its mango.  Not much of a taste.  Whipped cream plays an important role.  Stay with Flan amigos(as).Chips and Salsa -- gratis.  Plentiful.Service -- perfect timing.  Charming.  Quick to clean.Entertainment -- present and on time as published.Cheers!

11.description: Dance the night away while sipping on their loverly gigantic fruity margs (think Kerry Washington on Scandal's wine glass that holds an entire bottle of wine) with the perfect salt, a nice mix of dance-able (even if you don't know the steps) salsa and bachata, and hip hop thrown in for good measure (and us 'heads!) It can get a little loud but that's the name of the game. A good place to blow off steam on Friday, but be sure you're sleeping in and have coffee and aspirin on hand Saturday! The doormen are v. sweet. Also: if you are lucky enough that they play the Juke Slide 2, GET INTO IT!

39.description: Food is eh. Margaritas are good, but the manager definitely needs some customer satisfaction 101!! He was very rude and seemed like he just wanted to brush us off when we tried to explain our issue.

37.description: Lalo's has some of the best Margaritas ever!! Their food is also wonderful. It is definitely a cool place to hit up especially on a Friday or Saturday night. They also have a full bar, flat screen TV's, DJ's that play good mostly good mixes as well as a dance floor. It is definitely worth trying and I highly recommend checking it out with family, friends or significant other.

0.description: Chain, Mexican restaurant in south loop. The good - spacious place, good for families and larger groups. Seasoned wait staff that know how to juggle multiple tables. Large portions so a good spot for students as you're likely to have leftovers. Of the food, I enjoyed the complimentary soup that they served in the beginning - it tasted like chicken noodle soup with a mexican twist - would definitely order a  larger portion of it as an appetizer or entree. The drinks were also yummy and strong - the mojito was not syrupy at all, and actually had a decent amount of kick to it.The meh - the food isn't revolutionary or drool worthy. It's good old reliable mexican food, but nothing innovative. My fish tacos were mostly breading, and very little fish. My tamales were similarly not memorable, with a dryness to it that I did not know was possible with tamales.Overall, a good student or budget dining spot.

38.description: Overall the restaurant was just ok. The good: The service. The waiters are always on time and rarely make mistakes! The atmosphere is really nice too ( the music and decor) The bad: The food. The dishes are really hit or miss depending when you go. My first time here the food was great, but this time the meat had no flavor at all and was extra oily. Their horchata wasn't the kind you'd expect (it was thick and left a bad aftertaste)

51.description: The food here is decent, the chips and salsa is probably the best. The guacamole was the worst thing I have ever had, better off going to chipotle for guac than here. The service is terrible too, takes forever taking your order. No one checks up on you or how the food is.

27.description: The food is definitely Tex Mex.  The ambiance is ok.  Location is great because parking in the city is such a premium, there s parking available here!  Watch out, weekends here can be loud.  Overall, it s a wonderful experience.  The wait staff is flexible.

32.description: Came today to Lalos with hubby. 1 st mistake: brought me way wrong order. The meat was wrong in enchiladas, wrong sauce, and no cheese on top as mentioned in menu. They took their time bringing my correct dish. When correct dish came still no cheese sprinkled on top. The waiter asked if I wanted him to bring some out. I said yes since the menu said it comes with it. Hubby pays bill and later tells me they charged me for the cheese!!!And, food was ooookayy. Nothing great.

54.description: Very disappointed. We arrived at 930pm on a Wednesday night. Which is salsa night, apparently you have to get there super early if you want a table. The host said it was an hour wait, we headed to the bar for a drink. Hour passed, still nothing. The place was so crowded, when we went back to find out how much longer the host was extremely rude saying it was still gonna be another hour and didn't even look to check our name. We talked to the manager and got the same response. There's nothing we can do. We are packed, well then why did you tell me it was an hour wait? They finally called us at midnight that our table was ready. really?? Thanks but no thanks. Won't be coming back! The music and margaritas were great but the customer service really turned us off. I'll stick to cesars killer margaritas.

48.description: I love this place because this is the place where I developed a crush on my boyfriend. It holds fond memories for me. So you can't show up in sneakers to this place. You need to dress up a little or else the bouncer won't let you in. Tuesday night is karaoke and Wednesday night is salsa. They have a host that facilitates pretty much salsa lessons, and then he let's you loose and you dance the night away. The drinks were strong and pretty much you end up too buzzed to care that you can't dance for nothing. Good times.

44.description: First of all, you guys are thieves. I went last night to have a "good time" with my husband and the waiter charged phantom drinks. Need less to say when the manager came, she had no idea on how to explain our tab. So guess what we did, we warned the tables next to us on how needy Lalos restaurant was..... Oh, did I forgot to mention that when I told the manager that I was going to file the complaint, she said, go ahead and called the police. Guess who is not going there anymore.

24.description: This place is decent. It is a fresh and fun place to go with your girlfriends without all the guys humping at you. The DJ is great. The only 2 cons I have is one it took FOREVER (30MINS) to get drinks at the bar. And the security is ridiculous!  They kept shoving everybody in the corner when the place is so packed. And they kept yelling at people to move away. I get what they are doing but I am not going to shove myself in a corner with all the sweaty people around me... they either need a bigger place or figure out the best way to accommodate the people dancing and dining. But Wednesday Salsa night is amazing! There are people who are phenomenal dance partners and some mediocre. Thier drinks are also really good.. just takes awhile. And if you are planning on eating, MAKE A RESERVATION, wait time was 1.5hrs. Plus they send if you are not ordering or if you leave your table even for 5 minutes they will take it away. LADIES! BRING A SMALL PURSE BECAUSE YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO PUT IT DOWN ANYWHERE!

7.description: I've been to Lalos on several occasions and it never impresses me. Their food is expensive and so so . I don't mind paying a good amount for food, as long as the quality is there . Alas, at Lalos that doesn't happen. Their margaritas are heavy on the liquor but almost to the point you can't enjoy it . Last night I was there . We were seated enjoying our time and the server was so pushy to get us out of the table it was extremely rude and annoying . We were eating and drinking and getting up to dance and she basically tried to kick us out of the table . She told us we needed to give up the table (after maybe an hr) and that we could go sit at the bar . Excuse me?! Lalos is so full of it I can't take the place any longer . I will be taking my business elsewhere !

49.description: This place is very small. The food was just alright. The margaritas are yummy! I drank 3 and felt nice. I recall having a lovely conversation with a waitress. Anyway, that night they opened the dance floor which was nice. I wouldn't recommend going to this location if you have a large group gathering. I did just that and we felt tight on space.

40.description: I went here to celebrate Cinco De Mayo with my friends though I had a great time and the food was great, I must mention a few things I noticed.  But first.. the good stuff.. the food! The place was absolutely packed and we had to wait nearly 1.5 hours to be seated, however, the bartenders were working overtime to ensure they were able to provide the requested services! We ordered drinks plus Guacamole and i must say both were AMAZING!  Despite it being crazy in their the food nore drinks did not take very long at all to come to us! After being seated we ordered and the despite the place being crazy packed, our food arrived fast and it was AMAZING as well!  I ordered Enchiladas, and my friends ordered Flautas and Fajitas.. all AMAZING!  The server was great and very friendly.Now to mention the negatives.  As I mentioned it was packed.  I noticed several times where people had been there for a long period of time, they may have paid their check when a group of friends walked in, pulled up chairs and sat down.  The servers proceeded to take their orders!! This was very frustrating!  Apparently a DJ was paid to be there.  Each time he would play anything at all, the Manager ran over yelled and made him stop.  I understand the crowd was hectic to dancing was not the best thing to be doing, however, there is a way to handle everything and aggressive yelling with a noticeably angry demeanor, was not the way.  Despite that, overall... the food was amazing, the ambiance was great, I will be back!

53.description: Food and margaritas were mediocre. Waiter said they didn't have a dessert menu but told us what they had. I asked him how much the caramel cake was and he said $6. When we got the bill it listed the cake as being $7.I asked to speak to the manager and he said "We don't know what the prices are, but the computer knows. It's about $6.95". I reiterated that the waiter said $6 and we received a discount reducing the price to 6.My friend told me that Lalo's did separate checks the last time she came, but suddenly they aren't doing separate checks. I feel like that's something that should be posted upon entering the restaurant or on the website. Very disappointed and won't be returning.

30.description: Since I just love, love , love Mexican food guess where I chose to have my birthday dinner,....Lalo's Mexican restaurant.  This place is fantastic!! Great atmosphere and live music. You can dine inside or out (depending on the weather).  The food is always so good and the drinks are great,...all you'll need is one.  It's a great place to be.

46.description: This place is great for a hot mess kind of night. They have a dance floor in the middle of the restaurant on the weekends. The food is pretty decent, I had the chicken mole enchiladas and I was stuffed afterwards. I'm a chips and salsa fanatic and while I have to comment on the fact that they weren't all that- they do keep them flowing while you're there so why that works! The flavored margaritas are the way to go. In my opinion the flavored was much better than the traditional.Good environment for large parties, big long bar if your solo or with a buddy. I'm giving them three stars because I've had better mexican food but I'm also giving them three stars because of the location and the vibe.

1.description: WORST PLACE EVER.WORSTWORSTWORSTWORSTUGH WORST If I could give this place -1,000 stars I would. Their "top shelf" is sauza AT BEST. at worst they use Patron which everyone with a brain knows is shit, fake tequila.I'm also offended by the pat downs? What the? Is this the military? Chill out guys. Literally the most unnecessary behaviors ever. So many gross, ratchet people. I'm offended that this place is still in business. Gross. Literally eat sewer shit and drink rat piss first.It was incredibly stereotypically done. They only did pat downs for Latin-American and African-American men. No mind to anyone Caucasian. It was so racist it blew my mind. My boyfriend is the nicest most man in the world and was patted down for his appearance... I was so repulsed by this establishment. Their existence is not only offensive to society but takes us 100 years back. It's an insult both to any progress and to our ancestors. Lalos on Maxwell is a joke and I feel sorry for their owners and any ignorant human that thinks it's okay to frequent this racist shit hole.

55.description: I was there with my boyfriend yesterday for our anniversary. Our server stopped by at our table with no hi or hello or even a smile.. the first thing she asked was are you ready to order drinks when we just sat down? The entire time she looked so stressed and rushed us to order. I don't think it's her fault its the management's responsibility to train servers. I ordered a margarita and my bf ordered a paloma. The drinks were so bad. Then we ordered guacamole and a la diabla. The guac was ok but a diabla was really good. So the two stars for the diabla. :) and ya enjoyed salsa dancing too..

9.description: 3.5 I have seen quite a few not so great reviews of this place. I've been here twice in the past month and I haven't experienced anything horrific to the point it gets a bad review. First off, both times I've been here Lalo's has been packed. One time was on a Friday and one time was on a Wednesday. They always seem to have some kind of band going on. Food is contemporary Mexican food and it is just a more upscale restaurant compared to hole in the wall taco joints in Pilsen. Although I prefer hole in the wall Mexican joints in Pilsen, sometimes you just want Mexican food with some drinks and be able to chill and enjoy. I think this place is a place for that. Well okay, there was an incident on that Friday I went that disrupted my dinner time at Lalo's. It seems like there's a lot of large group parties at Lalo's (bachelorette, birthdays, etc). As the mariachi band was playing, there was a lady who was "turnt up" was yelling, shrieking, dancing, and screaming of joy and fun the ENTIRE time. I thought I was in a jungle. I don't usually converse with other customers at a restaurant but the tables around us all felt the same way and was just shocked at the annoying noise produced by this woman. Now my rating on Yelp and our waitress' tips weren't a reflection based on this incident because I have worked in the food industry for almost a decade before and know the awkwardness of the situation. However, I should mention it because management could have done something about it. Having your customers hear someone scream at the top of her lungs every five minutes isn't fair to us and our experience there. We didn't sign up for that.

26.description: Great humongous margaritas that will give you a brain freeze. Great service and great food. Would I come back: yes

25.description: I am a 2 time Grammy Award winning artist from Chicago, I've traveled the world with the likes of Kanye West, John Legend, Common & worked with several notable artist from Kendrick Lamar to Wiz. Never once in my life have I've ever been told I couldn't enter a Mexican restaurant @ 11pm after calling to ask when the kitchen closes & they told me 2am.  Upon walking up, a lame security officer walks in front of me as to cut me off & made me feel really disrespected. He told me I couldn't enter with gym shoes on. I asked if he was serious & he said yes in a sarcastic way. For this reason, I will never set foot in Lalos, located in University village off of 13th & Halsted, in Chicago.

12.description: Besides the dj being great on a Saturday night the staff was disrespectful and rude wanted a table for 8 and the hostess kept asking me if everyone in our group was eating I told her yes we were all there to order food she rudely told me twice if I understood that everyone had to order and then when we got seated told again that all of us had to order . Then two people in our group were accused of stealing a coat when the first time they asked to to check our seats and chairs we gladly stood up and looked and there was no coat then we were again approached 3x while we were trying to enjoy our food and drinks . Coat ended up being on the booth the person was originally sitting in and 4 of our guest ended up leaving because they felt they were being harassed worst staff ever never going back

59.description: My friend and I went to Lalo's for her birthday dinner.  After we finished our meal and paid the bill, we talked for awhile catching up (20 minutes top).  In that short time span, the table was completely cleaned in front of us and the manager asked us to leave and go to the bar.  He said there were a lot of people waiting for a table.  Mind you neither one of us drinks!  I did not know there was a time limit for sitting at a table.  It was amazing to me that we were being asked to leave when there were tables of 20 or more people just chilling at the restaurant.  Doing the math....getting them to leave before us would have helped!  SO RUDE!

21.description: Eh. We came here for dinner and the chips and salsa that they gave us were pretty good. Horchata was also pretty good but it's hard to mess up horchata. To be honest, I don't even really remember the food because it really wasn't very memorable. Lalo's was decent but nothing I would go out of the way to come back to, or maybe nothing to even come back to at all. There are better Mexican restaurants around, especially since you're so close to Pilsen!

17.description: The place has the freshest margaritas. We had a  great server who was very attentive and great with menu suggestions. The chips and salsa were tasty, I really liked that their chips and no need to add salt. We all did tacos, which came with 2 tacos, rice and beans.

10.description: This Lalo's is vibrant and LOUD. Went on a Friday night about 7. There's a loud band playing all your Mexican faves from La Bamba to Tequila! You can't hear yourself think, let alone hear the person at your table. The food  is bland, average, service is average, drinks are big, slightly overpriced.  Overall, it's just an average place,  but don't go of you're looking for a quiet evening.People in the lobby are spilling all over the place waiting on your table. There's no waiting area. It's just a walk7ng aisle by the bar full of drunk people waiting on your table.

5.description: I can here with my sisters and cousins and were waited a while to get seated because it's so packed on Saturday nights. When we were seated we all got margaritas they were pretty big and had a good amount of alcohol. Definitely worth the price. I got a strawberry and mango one. Loved it! I also had the burrito dinner which came with beams and rice. I like the rice but it could use a touch more flavor. The burrito was good it had this guac on top that favor it a new life service was held pretty good considering how busy it was. The price is okay not too bad. I like coming here but I would have to sit so close to the live music. Although it sound great it's just too loud. I can barely hear the people at my table. Overall I like it here.

3.description: I came here for my best friends birthday dinner. The food was ok. The drinks were good. I had a nice time.

35.description: The place has the freshest margaritas. We had a  great server who was very attentive and great with menu suggestions. The chips and salsa were tasty, I really liked that their chips and no need to add salt. We all did tacos, which came with 2 tacos, rice and beans.

19.description: This place is decent. It is a fresh and fun place to go with your girlfriends without all the guys humping at you. The DJ is great. The only 2 cons I have is one it took FOREVER (30MINS) to get drinks at the bar. And the security is ridiculous!  They kept shoving everybody in the corner when the place is so packed. And they kept yelling at people to move away. I get what they are doing but I am not going to shove myself in a corner with all the sweaty people around me... they either need a bigger place or figure out the best way to accommodate the people dancing and dining. But Wednesday Salsa night is amazing! There are people who are phenomenal dance partners and some mediocre. Thier drinks are also really good.. just takes awhile. And if you are planning on eating, MAKE A RESERVATION, wait time was 1.5hrs. Plus they send if you are not ordering or if you leave your table even for 5 minutes they will take it away. LADIES! BRING A SMALL PURSE BECAUSE YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO PUT IT DOWN ANYWHERE!

28.description: I go here often with friends and co-workers. I have never had any problems here. They are awesome from customer service to the food. The food is even more delicious than the Mexican Cuisine near my place (and I already thought THEY were the stuff)!!!Area: Nice. Near UIC. Have outside and inside seating.Food: Great lunch and dinner.Space: Casual and down-wear and can even pass as an intimate/romantic setting (given the dim lighting/spacing in the back).Staff: Very sweet and provide great service.Highly recommended! ;-)

45.description: I went there for a Bday party and that's the only reason I went there. The waitress was helpful and I guess if yiur going there for the ambiance the go ahead but if your going there for the food just save your money go around there corner have a polish with fries and then go back to have the over priced drinks and so so music. I ordered a carne Asada burrito and let's just say Chipotle has a better burrito and again Maxwell Polish around the corner or a taco stand in the street. Everyone that ordered food left most of it. A Mexican restaurant in my eyes skip the food and the ambiance with the dance floor makes up for the over priced drinks. I personally would not go there again or recommend anyone to go there but would recommend Maxwell, polishes

33.description: we go here once in a bluemoon mostly cos the kids can be themselves(loud). Today, having skipped lunch due to a busy work day went in hungry with the kiddos after school. We ordered chicken enchiladas and chicken quesdillas. I didnt like my chicken enchilada as hungry as i was...The kids had a few bites and there were enough leftovers for my husband. Its not really the kind of standard i expect from a fancy mexican restaurant.

43.description: I'm giving them 1 star because I am being obligated to rate a 1 star.  How can I even begin to explain how horrible my experience was at this location. I have never in my life met a manager who was so unprofessional/rude ever. He is clearly not capable of having such duties. Now the hostess was also bad her timing was really bad she had told us a 1 hour and 30 wait but we had to wait 2 hours before we decided that we had had enough. To start I had been calling the restaurant for about a week asking if they took reservations and was clearly told they didn't so I decide to give them a warning saying I was going in with a party of 15 but it was as in they didn't even care. As we began to wait we decided to have some drinks at the bar as we waited the bartender didn't even know what he was making but we made sure he got our drinks right. As time passed I kept checking on our table and the hostess kept saying that we were almost there and that it wouldn't be log before we got seated. We continued to wait up until our time was done I kept going to check and so I got fed up and asked for the manager. The manager was beyond disrespectful he was rude and unprofessional!!! I had told him the situation and it was as if he didn't care! He said at the end he wasn't going to seat my party together and that he was going to separate it!
