I told him if he had mentioned that at the beginning when I made the reservation I would have understood And NOT waited for that long but neither the hostess ever mentioned that to me at all! So I continued to ask him what was the wait then he said another 2 hours but the thing was that the manager never even apologized for exceeding the wait time that was given and said he wasn't going to do anything to help because he was just not going to seat us together he had a grim on his face of that as if he didn't care at that point I was beyond furious I couldn't believe that a manager would not even try and satisfy his customers!! He said he cared about customer satisfaction but he couldn't do anything to help me with my situation!! I AM CLEARLY NEVER GOING THERE AGAIN!!! I don't recommend it if you have a larger party they lie about the wait and is simply not worth it!!!!

2.description: After a couple of decent visits here, I had a couple of experiences that make me not want to return.  Perhaps the place is just headed downhill - fast!  On two of the last three visits, no one came to our booth until I walked across the restaurant and asked if someone would take our order.  On both occasions, I waited over five minutes before going to that extent to get some service.  Not even water or chips and salsa came until they were asked for.  I asked the waitress why we didn't get the complimentary soup that we always received when we walked in.  She said it only comes with dinners and we didn't order dinners.  I told her that that was not the case on previous visits.  When my friend ordered a burrito and I ordered three tacos without beans/rice (a la carte) because I don't like dry rice as a side dish, I got the complimentary soup every time.  This waitress refused to bring it.  And WORST of all was the visit on Dec. 22 - I believe it was - when I paid to park in the neighborhood, went for a walk, and showed up at Lalos at 10:40.  We were turned away because the grill was already shut down.  But wait!  The time on the window says closing time in 11:00 PM.  Restaurants that close early - especially when you have to pay to park to go to them - are the worst!  Very dissatisfied with this place on the last three visits.  Very!

18.description: Picked this place for my sister birthday. She had a great time. We all enjoyed the live music.  The Margarita's was so good. We had such a good time laughing we was not rushed to order our food. But when we did it was good. So everything was very nice. And will be going back4 stars for the drinks. Ready to have another 1 lol

41.description: Disappointed with the drinks. The margaritas have cheap alcohol and pre-mix .  The drinks and food upset my stomach . There a dance floor, but it's Too small to have a dance floor. It's very crowed that it's uncomfortable .

52.description: Amazing food, great margaritas!! Good service!!!! Love the soup to start!! I love this place! I brought my friends from Mexico here and they loved it very authentic! If you like real Mexican food not Taco Bell it's great don't listen to the reviews!

50.description: I really liked the ambiance of this place. It wasn't an authentic Mexican feel, but it was the right mix of classy and casual. The food was good, I shared the fiesta platter which was definitely enough for two people. Customer service was decent; our waiter came sporadically and was often unable to answer our questions without first asking someone else. The margaritas were good, just not very strong. Overall, a nice place; nothing really stands out, though.

4.description: Everyone here seems to be giving mixed opinions about the nightlife surrounding Lalo's huh? From the hot messes to those that couldn't even get past this hardass of a bouncer, you either love it or hate it here.Well, don't mind me for not having had a margarita or Corona here yet, but for lunch with the coworkers. I can't complain. This place delivers on its promise of Mexican (or rather Tex-Mex) to my hungry stomach, and that's all I can ask for.The restaurant is huge, so you shouldn't have a problem getting a table if you are coming during the lunch hours. Right as you're seated, the free chips and salsa come right out (YES!) Nothing to rave about, but the chips definitely kept pouring into our baskets, so heeyyyy.And what's this? A free bowl of soup?! Again, Chicago you and your free stuff right when you get in to a restaurant is most appreciated.I ordered the carne asada burrito and couldn't even finish it! Portions were quite generous especially after you've had so many chips and salsa consumed in your belly. The burrito did hit the spot, but nothing about it stood out. It was a safe enough bet that I took, and it did its job.I'll probably come back to Lalo's to experience it's trashy side one day. For now, I'll stick with what's good on the menu before the margaritas hit.

6.description: This place is great for a hot mess kind of night. They have a dance floor in the middle of the restaurant on the weekends. The food is pretty decent, I had the chicken mole enchiladas and I was stuffed afterwards. I'm a chips and salsa fanatic and while I have to comment on the fact that they weren't all that- they do keep them flowing while you're there so why that works! The flavored margaritas are the way to go. In my opinion the flavored was much better than the traditional.Good environment for large parties, big long bar if your solo or with a buddy. I'm giving them three stars because I've had better mexican food but I'm also giving them three stars because of the location and the vibe.

22.description: Everyone here seems to be giving mixed opinions about the nightlife surrounding Lalo's huh? From the hot messes to those that couldn't even get past this hardass of a bouncer, you either love it or hate it here.Well, don't mind me for not having had a margarita or Corona here yet, but for lunch with the coworkers. I can't complain. This place delivers on its promise of Mexican (or rather Tex-Mex) to my hungry stomach, and that's all I can ask for.The restaurant is huge, so you shouldn't have a problem getting a table if you are coming during the lunch hours. Right as you're seated, the free chips and salsa come right out (YES!) Nothing to rave about, but the chips definitely kept pouring into our baskets, so heeyyyy.And what's this? A free bowl of soup?! Again, Chicago you and your free stuff right when you get in to a restaurant is most appreciated.I ordered the carne asada burrito and couldn't even finish it! Portions were quite generous especially after you've had so many chips and salsa consumed in your belly. The burrito did hit the spot, but nothing about it stood out. It was a safe enough bet that I took, and it did its job.I'll probably come back to Lalo's to experience it's trashy side one day. For now, I'll stick with what's good on the menu before the margaritas hit.

15.description: Went here for salsa night (Wednesday) and I will not be coming back. Before we even sat down at 9:30 pm for a bite, the wait staff informed us to get up from the table and go to the bar once we were done eating. Then took away my water glass once we were done and said no more free water because we weren't eating anymore. We had a $30 pitcher of margarita and drinks all night but I guess they forgot. Service here sucks.

57.description: Great food and drinks! Very busy on the weekends. Make a reservation or come early for a table or seat at the bar.

20.description: Lalo's is a very nice place whether you come during the day or at night. The margaritas are out of this world, big and strong. The food is awesome and service is great.

36.description: You deserve no damn stars. Shitty ass customer service. the bald manager with glasses doesn't know anything about dealing with customers. The waiters threw out my Full and new margarita and they said it was my fault. My purse was literally by the drink. the manager literally said "giver her the drink because I don't want to deal with her". I woke up the next day with horrible stomach pain. Never taking my group of friends there. Until I never see that manager again

14.description: I have been here plenty of times, weekends and weekdays....Now for those that come here for a Wednesday/Friday/Saturday night dinner may be a bit confused and alarmed when they hear there is an hour+ wait. Let's review...the place is open until 3am on Saturday and Friday/Wednesday until 2am...with a DJ/band, it pretty much turns into a club. For me, that is not my typical night, so I make sure to go either earlier or not on those nights. Plus there are some other great restaurants in this area now (literally go across the street, great BBQ food).Getting back to food and drinks, both are delicious. I really like the margarita's here and they have Milagro tequila, which is a favorite for me. Their mojitos are just as good and perfect on a Summer day/night The fajitas are a good size portion and juicy meats plus some great veggies. I am never disappointed with a selection here. They also have catering and I have used this numerous times (birthday parties, family events, large party) and again never been disappointed. Any and all guests rave about the food and love love love the salsa. I usually have either just the right amount of food or a small amount of left overs, in which everyone wants to take some home. :) Overall, double check the night you go for what is going on and plan accordingly. This is a place to go to for great food, drinks annnnd dancing. If large crowds are a bother, make adjustments and visit on a different night. Plus there are some other great restaurants in this area.

58.description: My friend and I stopped here on a late night!! The late night menu was great! The burgers was tasty, the Parmesan popcorn was everything and the "Not your fathers root beer gave us a nice buzz after a glass" this would definitely be our new late night spot!!

56.description: Hey party people's! I'm here at Three Aces again, just enjoying my bolognese fries and Ace Burger. I know you're wondering why I don't just get something different but it's hard for me to do because sometimes I just crave the stuff. Too bad i can't just shoot the bolognese sauce straight into my veins lol.

29.description: Amazing food! Came to dinner on a Friday night and every one I was with had something different to eat we all tried everyone's food and it was all amazing, the only bad thing was that the beer we had was not cold, and I didn't could not drink it =( but will definitely be back!

42.description: I have reviewed this place before and gave them raving reviews. Nothing has changed. I love this place. The reason for this second review is a shout-out/condemnation of the horrible person who doesn't know how to control themselves while out in public. Why did you let yourself get so drunk that you broke the men's room sink? What are you, a child? I mean come on... Who does that? What where you doing that caused you to break out a giant chunk from the inside of the sink?Maybe you should reevaluate your life. Was your team winning? Were you getting turned on by the vintage bikers that show-up on occasion? Do you realize that you even broke the sink? This is terrible because now the owners have to go out and buy a new sink. Those things aren't cheap. Have you priced one lately? No? Because your parents are still supporting you?Please, just stay home next time and trash your own apartment. We don't need you here. If you feel like you need to trash a place while you are out drinking, go to some sports bar instead.

23.description: Should I ever end up on death row, the bolognese fries here would be part of my last meal. My fiance, a friend, and I stopped in here during the Festa Italiana to take a break from the sun and find something other than a Peroni to drink. The 3 Aces stand on the street was serving up fest-size portions of fries and pouring hot, meaty bolognese sauce onto them from what I can only assume was Strega Nona's endless spaghetti pot, so we instantly decided on those as a bar appetizer. It wasn't very crowded during the afternoon, with everyone outside fest-ing, so we sat at the bar, licked the bowl of bolognese fries clean (inside price was the same as outside, but more fries, suckerrrrrs), and enjoyed some cold drinks. I had two of the strawberry lavender lemonade (spiked with vodka), which was really refreshing and tasted dangerously absent of alcohol. The best part, though, was that Three Aces was playing a DVD of the best of WWF wrestling; we were in the midst of 1993-1994 while I was there, and the group next to us also enjoyed cheering for The Macho Man, (SNAP INTO A SLIM JIM, O YEAA), catching a glimpse of the late Owen Hart (RIP!), and admiring the many fantastical mullets of early 90's pro wrestling; (Best:see Shawn Michaels). PURE GLORY. Buzzing from nostalgia and vodka, we left Three Aces in good spirits, stopped immediately outside for a to-go portion of bolognese fries from the festival booth, and enjoyed the rest of the afternoon. I'll definitely be back to Three Aces in the future.

47.description: Venue was cool, food overall was pretty good. However my burger came out a little dry and overcooked for my taste.

8.description: This place was amazing. I walked in once and wasn't feeling the menu so when I began to leave the owner made me try his pasta sauce for me to come back. It was alright but he was such a cool guy I came back for him. I had the burgers with fries, and the cheese&smear sauce on top. My waist line may hate me but my mouth and tummy loved every bit of it!! Also we tried all three specialty drinks and they are all very different but equally great and strong. Great late night bar. They do play the music to loud but the staff and food and just great.

31.description: I am starting off this review with one thing... I am addicted to those damn Duck Fat Chips. I don't know what it is about them, but I love those things. In addition to decent bar snacks, the pizzas are pretty good but not your typical Chicago style but more on the skinny NY style. I greatly enjoy the pesto pizza but did not find the burger as amazing as everyone else has. Honestly, it was overcooked when I last ordered it but was hungry and did not care at that point. Booze wise, this place has quite a bit of everything.... and by everything I mean it's more of a hippster type booze collection. Ie. No Jack Daniels but George Dickel instead. Lots of local brews which is always good and smaller microbrews as well. Service is decent but nothing that blows me away.

34.description: Consistently good service, a great patio, and good food make Three Aces a good choice no matter what.  The prices are a little high for what is (or should be) a neighborhood pub, but they're worth it, for brunch, lunch, or dinner.  Although I haven't been here on a Fri or Sat night during the school year, I've never had a problem getting a seat.  The inside is nice, but I particularly recommend that you sit outside and people-watch and beer-drink.

16.description: Bourbon bar, meet Italian, meet burger.Great place for dining outside and drinking with friends.  Came on a Sunday for Father's day.  You could tell this place has a distinct south-side feel to it as there were many White Sox fans fresh form the game that afternoon.  Al fresco dining on an early summer day?  Check.   We were able to make reservations and were pleasantly surprised at the outdoor seating.  This restaurant had been on my list for quite a while - as I've been wanting to dive into one of their burgers for some time.  Without question this place was bar first.  They have an extensive menu of whiskies and bourbon, not my forte so pass on that - my senses were teased with tantalizing key words on the menu like "short rib" and "lamb".  I always seem to fall for these words despite the better of me saying that I need to just try what this place is known for...Something I've never seen before...bolognese fries  - hey I've gotta try that...this place is in little Italy...So on to ordering - I had the short rib pizza and the lamb burger with a side of above said fries.Impressions:  Fries - crispy, as expected for fries.  Sauce was good, I could definitely taste the carrot and the celery in it.  Clearly it was cooked as if an Italian grandmother was chained up to the heavy pot of stewing sauce.  My thought is that it could have used a little more spice and a sharpness.  But good nonetheless.  On to the burger...Medium rare as always- done right.  However, I'm comparing all burgers now to my favorite lamb burger of all time, and this one just does not kick it...it was dried.  Texture was rough and just resembled ground meat (I know...its a burger...but I've been spoiled by my past experience with the lamb burger).  Short rib pizza was disappointing as the short rib was without flavor...I would not be surprised if it was just seared then boiled, then reheated as it cooked in the oven on the pizza.  I thought the size of the pizzetta was acceptable - it would be filling.  And I"m not a fan of feta cheese which was also on the pizza, but that's my problem.  My fault for this experience as I clearly should have ordered their namesake the Three Aces burger.  And I didn't.  Perhaps next time I'm around I should consider that option instead.  However my measure stick for burgers is perhaps too high now for Three Aces to turn around.  I suggest go for the Three Aces and the fries with Bolognese sauce - its different and I think you'd appreciate it!Not a kid friendly place (duh...its a bar).  Definitely come for the bocce ball and the outdoor seating.

13.description: Definitely one of my go-to bars in Chicago (partially due to the proximity). Drinks are well crafted & the pool table is almost always open to play! It's dimly lit, never too crowded and the bartenders are there to make what you wanna drink! It's also great for Saturday/Sunday brunches when you've failed to make a reservation for other places or the wait is too long at Sweet Maples. The Benedict, Ace burger and Poutine are both unhealthy, yet delicious weekend morning pleasures! I'm still wary of the bolognese fries... Just not my thing, but my boyfriend is all about them

11.description: Two stars on Yelp means "Meh, I've experienced better" and that would be accurate here.  The decor is dark in Three Aces and the seating, both outdoor and indoor, is not too impressive.  The food can be good, I enjoyed the "gourmet-style" burger and fries. The short rib pizzetta was good as well. The sweet corn pizzetta was an unexciting, literally, corn on flatbread. The service  was mediocre, our lady server was not too engaging. She seem inappropriately annoyed when I asked for water with no ice. Overall Three Aces could work harder to improve the diner experience.

39.description: Good food, nice selection of beer, friendly staff, usual not hard to get a seat though weekends during the school year can be bad. Wish they changed up the food menu more. Overall a good place for sure.

its different and I think you'd appreciate it!Not a kid friendly place (duh...its a bar).  Definitely come for the bocce ball and the outdoor seating.

0.description: We live just a few blocks from this place and this is our go to place for drinks in the area. The selection is huge and the atmosphere is great for relaxed drinks with friends.The burgers are huge and can be a bit much for me, but my boyfriend loves them. I love the pizza and the bar snacks.

38.description: Great casual place to grab some beers and get a bite to eat. You have to get the bolognese fries, they were amazing. We also had the caprese pizza which was delicious and had a bit of spice to it. It got pretty loud inside, but that wasn't an issue.

51.description: I've been a consistent customer of Three Aces since they opened and just reading some of the recent reviews with people complaining about not being able to wear "backwards baseball caps" or the TVs not showing Sports.  To you I say this, get over it and grow up. First, I was raised to remove my hat whenever going indoors, might seem old fashioned but whatever.  The backward hat policy is not so much to deter a "certain type of black person" but to deter the College Jocks who order Heineken and don't know when to stop drinking.Which brings me to the second point, Three Aces is not a sports bar.  Got it? It's a Gastro Pub, there's a difference.  You go to a gastropub to order CRAFT BEER and CRAFT COCKTAILS, not Miller Lite brah..I will say that in the beginning, the Ace Burger was excellent.  I don't know if something has changed, but for some reason I feel that it has gotten smaller.  I still recommend Three Aces to any fellow Burger Afficionados but there have been lots of new places opening around Chicago that are just as good and maybe better, but that is to be expected.  Three Aces opened when there was probably 1 or 2 go-to places for great burgers, things have changed yet I still go consistently because I love the patio and the servers with tattoos are easy on the eyes.

27.description: Hubby and I were looking for a place for our dinner date. We saw this restaurant on open table listed as Italian dining. But, to our dismay, it wasn't what we expected. I was expecting fine dining. This place is NOT an Italian restaurant. So they describe their business as "where Italy meets the farm house". The inside decor consists of old planks of wood and the wooden tables look old. They were a little sticky too for my taste. But I am giving this place 4 stars because our server was pleasant AND the food did not disappoint! I ordered the pot belly pizza and hubby ordered the Ace burger. They were both delicious! I would have given them 5 stars if not for the shortcoming in the ambience.

32.description: Friend who is in town from Miami and I visited here on Thursday evening around 830.The hostess was cheerful and the waitress whose name I don't recall was efficient and knowledgeable.We had a few interesting bottled beers and the short rib pizza and burger. The food was delicious.It is kind of dark inside. The place was comfortably busy not packed not dead just somewhere in between. The music that they were playing was high-energy and have a good volume so that experience was fun overall and very enjoyable.I plan on returning at some point to sample some other of the menu items.

54.description: This was very delicious and has an awesome outside sitting area. Definitely a summer hotspot

48.description: Went to watch the Bulls game, only a couple tiny TVs.  Not their fault, just thought it was more of a sports bar atmosphere.  Great food though.  All of our tap beers were warm though.  I mentioned it to the bartender, he seemed pretty indifferent.

44.description: Definitely one of my go-to bars in Chicago (partially due to the proximity). Drinks are well crafted & the pool table is almost always open to play! It's dimly lit, never too crowded and the bartenders are there to make what you wanna drink! It's also great for Saturday/Sunday brunches when you've failed to make a reservation for other places or the wait is too long at Sweet Maples. The Benedict, Ace burger and Poutine are both unhealthy, yet delicious weekend morning pleasures! I'm still wary of the bolognese fries... Just not my thing, but my boyfriend is all about them

24.description: Excellent double burger if you can get your mouth around it....cooked correctly and fresh.70's back and gold bar decor is is done very well without being too campy.Great outdoor patio.Noisy in a hip way. Dark...in a hip way...

7.description: I know a lot of people are fans of the Duck Fat Chips, but the Bolognese Fries are seriourly ridiculous.   A rich, meaty sauce over hand cut blanched fries.   A meal unto itself.Burgers are good as well, and two other appetizers, the baked olives and popcorn were great.Good beer selection-served a little warm in one instance-and very laid back atmosphere.

49.description: I was in the neighborhood and in search of a restaurant for dinner. My friend's been wanting to check this place out and since it had positive reviews, we decided to go. My friend and I shared a salad, burger and fries. Drinks:I asked my server what she suggested and she recommended the Lounge Lizard - George Dickel 12 whiskey, jasmine, apricot and fresh lime. I love whiskey and thought this drink was great - not too strong and really well balanced. I definitely recommend it for those who enjoy whiskey.Food:Spring Greens Salad - pea shoots, mint, radish, ricotta salata, lemon-tarragon vinaigretteI usually like ordering salads with ingredients that I don't normally buy. This salad was really fresh and beautiful. I liked that it was different than other salads I've had before. The size was big enough to share with others.  Ace Burger - aged cheddar, trimmings, bacon jam, aioli, garlic I wasn't expecting to like this burger, but it was delicious! The meat was juicy and perfectly cooked. I really liked the bacon jam. It came with a pickle and fries. We added bolognese to the fries since it looked like their specialty. It was a little weird at first since I'm used to a bolognese sauce with pasta, but I liked it. It was like a fancy chili fries.If I'm ever in the area again, I'd come back here for delicious food and drinks.

40.description: Will be back for the ace burger and spacious patio!  I did not go inside but this was a perfect date spot on a nice sunday evening.  The patio is very open and has a bocce ball court.  The burger was cooked perfectly and came with fries and a side of aoli, my favorite.  Drinks are a bit pricey but the dark and stormy was delicious.  The service was not super friendly but the food and drinks came out in great timing. I'm not sure if this is a place where I would explore other menu options because their burger seems to be their speciality but i'd be interested to see what else is good!

53.description: What kind of establishment wants to have a motorcycle type shtick but requests that patrons remove their baseball caps upon entering?  No free refills?  Really!!! Server can't give you change for a $20? Please...Oh! And there is no reason why "Point Break" should be on all TVs in ypur eatabliahment when a Chicago sports team's playoff game is being broadcast at thw same time!!!

30.description: Came here for dinner, got a few drinks at the bar (great tap selection) before we were seated in the patio. Varied and fulfilling menu selection between bar food, appetizers, and some great pizzas. Might have been the beautiful weather, could have been about 4 Hell Or High Watermelons, or it could have been a hell of a delicious uncured pepperoni pizza, but whatever it was I left completely satisfied.

46.description: Let me start off by saying I did not have any food only drinks.  Had some friends in town and we were looking for somewhere chill to grab a late night drink.  Three Aces has a cool store front with an inviting patio on the side of the building.  The ambience is a cool laid back atmosphere, dimly lit with cool jams at a decent volume.  The interior is mostly distressed wood looking tables and chairs with some random things about, like a pinball machine.  The drinks were ok, average pricing.  The service was really slow.  Only about 12 people in the entire store so I'm not sure what the issue was.  Overall it was a mostly forgetful experience but Yelpers seem to approve and friends have told me the food is good. I'm not going to recommend yet, but I will give the food a try and give it another go around.

1.description: This bar is a good option for drinks if you are in this area, but it isn't a place I would necessarily go out of my way to go to. The bar tender was not the most approachable and the vibe in general just seemed a little too chill if you know what I mean? Not to say that a laid back place is bad, but just that there was a weird vibe where it felt like nothing was happening here yet there were people here drinking and eating? Just kind of strange. But it is a pretty big bar with lots of space and they take reservations too, and it is clear that for this area there are not many options around, so the fact that this is a full bar with a decent selection of beer is good. I got a bloody mary since they said they make their own mix, but it tasted like mix from a bottle, so not sure that was really worth the price tag, but oh well. You live and you learn!

55.description: Loved the place as soon as we walked in - classy, comfortable, dim lit, exposed brick, leather booths and bar stools. The waitress was super friendly, and I'm a fan of being able to choose any seat we want when the restaurant is empty.  It filled up quickly but never felt loud or crowded.  The Bolognese Fries and Calabrese Pizzetta were both delicious.  Only complaint is that the chocolate cake was nothing special and tasted dry.  Definitely a cool atmosphere and great food and drinks.

9.description: I am starting off this review with one thing... I am addicted to those damn Duck Fat Chips. I don't know what it is about them, but I love those things. In addition to decent bar snacks, the pizzas are pretty good but not your typical Chicago style but more on the skinny NY style. I greatly enjoy the pesto pizza but did not find the burger as amazing as everyone else has. Honestly, it was overcooked when I last ordered it but was hungry and did not care at that point. Booze wise, this place has quite a bit of everything.... and by everything I mean it's more of a hippster type booze collection. Ie. No Jack Daniels but George Dickel instead. Lots of local brews which is always good and smaller microbrews as well. Service is decent but nothing that blows me away.

25.description: What a nice place- big space, nice patio and the burgers are worth the trip to the south side- the waitress was a bit over whelmed with customers but she handled us all very well!!

12.description: Let me start off by saying I did not have any food only drinks.  Had some friends in town and we were looking for somewhere chill to grab a late night drink.  Three Aces has a cool store front with an inviting patio on the side of the building.  The ambience is a cool laid back atmosphere, dimly lit with cool jams at a decent volume.  The interior is mostly distressed wood looking tables and chairs with some random things about, like a pinball machine.  The drinks were ok, average pricing.  The service was really slow.  Only about 12 people in the entire store so I'm not sure what the issue was.  Overall it was a mostly forgetful experience but Yelpers seem to approve and friends have told me the food is good. I'm not going to recommend yet, but I will give the food a try and give it another go around.

59.description: This place was amazing. I walked in once and wasn't feeling the menu so when I began to leave the owner made me try his pasta sauce for me to come back. It was alright but he was such a cool guy I came back for him. I had the burgers with fries, and the cheese&smear sauce on top. My waist line may hate me but my mouth and tummy loved every bit of it!! Also we tried all three specialty drinks and they are all very different but equally great and strong. Great late night bar. They do play the music to loud but the staff and food and just great.

21.description: Food is good. Drinks are OK. Service is inconsistent. I want to love this place because it's local and I love the biker/rockabilly feel. But some days the service just turns me off. I'm not looking for someone to feed me, but having to ask and wait for plates and silverware AFTER our food was brought out was a little bit annoying. Other little things happened making the dinner longer than expected and we got tired waiting on the staff before we even headed out for the night. The server may have just had a bad night, so I don't really hold it against her. Some days here are just better than others. Even when they are busy the staff is still friendly. Even with that said the food is definitely worth it. I would suggest any of the pizzas and the Ace burger. And you're always safe with the local brews. I've also been here for brunch and the salads are good. But if you really want to enjoy the experience and have a comfortable meal go on the off hours.

17.description: Gastropub or American tapas... I'd say the latter, mainly because a gastropub is defined as having "good" food and drink and since I can't claim to having any good drink here, it's got to be American tapas.  (Okay so actually the definition is a place with great food and great beers.  Great selection of beers at a good price they have.  But decently poured cocktails.... Not so much.)  So the other night, I'd decided to try their house infused Tito's vodka with soda water.  Three cocktails IN and nary a buzz to speak of, which, had there been one it could have elevated my taste sensations to new heights.The menu is simple and if you've heard the good word or memorized the reviews with good detail, well, I'll help you in the direction of flavor.  Bringing some friends to share food with is a good way to taste it all.  And last, don't skimp.  Musts:  Popcorn.  Definitely.Bolognese fries.  Just good, hearty, loaded fries.  Arancini.  Fried risotto balls, if you've had them before at an Italian restaurant, you'll dig it but not a necessity.Mushroom risotto.  Tasty.Short rib pizza.  This was great the first time and even better the 2x with double dough!  It's a definite winner.Definitely peruse reviews and figure out which dishes are best to get.  Picking aimlessly had served fruitless for some.

10.description: This place  surreptitiously houses the best burger in Chicago. There are many ways to weigh the validity of a tasty burger, and this one stands out based on the flavor of the meat. It's not about the toppings as they are simple. The burger itself contains a myriad of delicious flavors that make it stand out above the competition. Why the lost star you ask? While the ambiance is dark and moody in a good way, and the cocktails are craft and inventive, the staff is a bit pretentious. This has been the case for each trip we have made.  Every time we go I feel as though I'm made to feel out of place. That vibe though would never keep us away from this burger. You gotta choose your battles.

5.description: Should I ever end up on death row, the bolognese fries here would be part of my last meal. My fiance, a friend, and I stopped in here during the Festa Italiana to take a break from the sun and find something other than a Peroni to drink. PURE GLORY. Buzzing from nostalgia and vodka, we left Three Aces in good spirits, stopped immediately outside for a to-go portion of bolognese fries from the festival booth, and enjoyed the rest of the afternoon. I'll definitely be back to Three Aces in the future.

My friend and I shared a salad, burger and fries. Drinks:I asked my server what she suggested and she recommended the Lounge Lizard - George Dickel 12 whiskey, jasmine, apricot and fresh lime. I love whiskey and thought this drink was great - not too strong and really well balanced. The size was big enough to share with others.  Ace Burger - aged cheddar, trimmings, bacon jam, aioli, garlic I wasn't expecting to like this burger, but it was delicious! The meat was juicy and perfectly cooked. I really liked the bacon jam. It came with a pickle and fries. We added bolognese to the fries since it looked like their specialty. It was a little weird at first since I'm used to a bolognese sauce with pasta, but I liked it. It was like a fancy chili fries.If I'm ever in the area again, I'd come back here for delicious food and drinks.

35.description: This place is great!! I came here with a group of people from work. The staff was all super helpful and accommodating. The craft beer was awesome and the food was fabulous!! They have a great outdoor space too. Can't wait to go back again.

19.description: I've been a consistent customer of Three Aces since they opened and just reading some of the recent reviews with people complaining about not being able to wear "backwards baseball caps" or the TVs not showing Sports.  To you I say this, get over it and grow up. First, I was raised to remove my hat whenever going indoors, might seem old fashioned but whatever.  The backward hat policy is not so much to deter a "certain type of black person" but to deter the College Jocks who order Heineken and don't know when to stop drinking.Which brings me to the second point, Three Aces is not a sports bar.  Got it? It's a Gastro Pub, there's a difference.  You go to a gastropub to order CRAFT BEER and CRAFT COCKTAILS, not Miller Lite brah..I will say that in the beginning, the Ace Burger was excellent.  I don't know if something has changed, but for some reason I feel that it has gotten smaller.  I still recommend Three Aces to any fellow Burger Afficionados but there have been lots of new places opening around Chicago that are just as good and maybe better, but that is to be expected.  Three Aces opened when there was probably 1 or 2 go-to places for great burgers, things have changed yet I still go consistently because I love the patio and the servers with tattoos are easy on the eyes.

28.description: Disturbingly bad service. Went here before the world's largest block party and definitely will not go back. Took about 20 minutes for the waitress to come by another 15 to order a drink. When our friends joined us it was the same issue. We ordered a pizza, 45 minutes later we flagged our waitress down to check on the status and order more drinks, before we could order drinks she darted off to the kitchen. She came back and said 'um, I guess I forgot to put your pizza in.' We told her to forget about it and asked for the check. Never again!

45.description: We landed on the moon, and then Three Aces brought us bolognese fries-two most important events in history.  You will never have a bad meal at Three Aces.  Pizza is a sleeper for best neopolitan pie in chicago.  All the pastas are absurdly good, ace burger can never stop shoveling into my face fast enough.  Amazing restaurant run by great restaurateurs.

33.description: A favorite and frequent hang out spotFood: 4.5/5. Try the burger... It's one of the few perfect burgers in this city.Beer: 4/5 a more than average collection of beers. I don't see frequent updates or a lot of experimenting. But they would generally have what you need.Ambience: 4/5. A typical American bar deco, I like the lighting, provides adequate privacy even in a crowded bar but not annoyingly dark. Generally good rock music.Service: 4.5/5 this is where they excel. U r seated within 2-3 mins. Staff are courteous and polite. Service is reasonably fast. Tipped extra generously all the time (that's 20-30% of the bill). Overall: if you live 2 blocks from here, like me, this is the place for you. Message me any evening and I would gladly join you for a beer and my fav burger here.

43.description: One of my favorite neihborhood hang outs.Lovely beergarden in summer.Huge beer list.

2.description: What can I say about this place. IMO, they're trying a little too hard. The atmosphere is really nice, I'll admit. And I did happen to go there on one of the most beautiful possible days of the year. The food, however, was a little "meh.Ace Burger tasted fine, nothing to rave about. Quite possibly the thickest beef patty I've seen on a regular burger, but that doesn't improve taste.Breakfast Poutine was overloaded with gravy. Yummy, but you can't eat more than like two fries without clogging every possible artery in your body. They load that sucker with everything: Fries, gravy, scallions, bacon, sausage, sunnyside up  fried egg. I just gained 5 lbs. writing all that out. Bread Pudding Dessert was as my co-diner explained, "bottom of the barrel." For a simple-to-make-dessert, it was a miss. Dry, lacking flavor and drizzled with a plum sauce of some kind that added a level of sour to the whole dish that only made things worse.Oh, and if you happen to sit outside, be prepared to share your meal with the local bees. Just saying. (To be frank, this isn't necessarily a bad thing considering the rapidly diminishing bee population in the world. I don't mind doing my part and sharing a little grub with the buggers).The staff is kind of awesome. There's no denying that. I'd say, go for the staff. ...And the drinks. Not the food. Really. Not the food.

18.description: Great food! It's a fantastic place in a great neighborhood. I was coming back from doing a JitFit class at the Chicago School of Grappling down Racine and this place looked good. Price- Not bad at all. We got 2 pizzas and a burger for about $40Quality- Great. The short rib pizza is sooooo excellentQuantity- Good portions of foodAtmosphere- Very low key, but casual. Loved the outdoor seatingStaff- Friendly and engaging. We were celebrating a birthday for my buddy's 29th and we asked the server how old she thought he was. She said "31" and my friend was upset...I loved it.Get some short rib pizza

41.description: Burger was good, but bolognese fries were awesome

52.description: I've tried to give this place a chance, but it's still a gross cliche. Were it possible, the Smithsonian Institute would bottle it up and archive it as a prime example of early 21st Century pretense, a place where conformist douchebaggery and the worst kind of off-the-rack hipsterism intersect in an improbable but perfectly execrable blend of fakeness, mediocrity and unpleasantness.Sure, that easily describes many places that self-identify as "gastropubs" in this era, but there are also many (particularly in Chicago) that, despite the painfully contrived affectations, actually deliver on their boast, cooking up creative food backed with strong drink lists and served by interesting and nice people.  Three Aces has an acceptable drink list, and it earns its two stars for that alone.  The food might be worth going out of the way for in a lesser city, but in Chicago it's nothing special (including the burger, which seems to end up on many lazy food writers' best-of lists, but is beat by at least 30 other places in town). Staff is slow, stuck up and surly.  Clientele is  a mix of fake bikers, fake punkers and 100% genuine cargo shorts bros.So yeah, in other words it's basically Fountainhead with tattoos and fat middle-aged guys on expensive Harleys.

50.description: The ambiance and character of this place is unique and something my wife and I enjoy.  Unfortunately my the good feeling the vibe gave us was outweighed by the pretentious bartender who robotically made drinks rather than easily adjusted them to his clients tastes..no requests were over the top or out of the ordinary but this guy's had a smug attitude to boot...lose the attitude and listen to your clients and this place would be better

4.description: Solid bar. Solid upscale bar food. Cool tunes. Oh and easy parking on Taylor St. What more could ya want? The beau and I decided to come here for dinner tonight knowing we could get a good drink, and delicious (better than) bar food. Three Aces' vibe is very dark and stormy. It's rock and roll, meets metal, meets foodie heaven. We were seated promptly at the bar and were lucky to have come in when we did because the joint quickly started to fill up at about 7. Our server, albeit very hip and dressed in all black like Johnny Cash, was very friendly and eager to help us. Drinks were first, as always...me, A Little Crazy (Revolution)..and the beau, a classic old fashioned. The beer list is quite robust and actually has, on average, three beers each from many local (and surrounding state) breweries. Getting back to my beer... my bf said he didn't need to order 'a little crazy' because he gets that everyday with me. *sigh*not funny*Anyhoo on to the food. We ordered the special of the night, which was a house made sausage pizza with giardiniera, mozz and sauce. I was a little skeptical because I'm not the biggest giard fan...but being the good gf I am, I said let's order it because the beau is nuts over the stuff. Well, I'm sure glad we went with it because it was bomb! The sausage was awesome and you could tell definitely homemade. We also ordered the chicken thigh sausage which was served on a bed of polenta and other fanciness. This was equally as good! The polenta was so creamy and a good nod to farina back in the day...I may be dating myself here but it really brought me back.In short, Three Aces offers a solid, quality product from their food and drinks to their cool ambiance. Not my first time here and most definitely won't be my last :)

6.description: We happened upon Three Aces during the Festa Italiana for a brief repast. My friends had previously recommended Three Aces to other diners, so when we passed by it was easy to justify a drink. The combination bar and restaurant is somewhat iconic in the area with a young vibe and a nice outdoor porch.Our order of some draughts and an Old Style can for me was filled slowly on a very packed Saturday night as expected. It is hard to evaluate a bar on their specialty drinks when the bar is hopping; just order some simple stuff and move quickly. The outdoor patio was crowded but much quieter. We settled on a bench watching drunk people play a very good game of bocce and chatted about our evening before heading out.Three Aces fits the bill as a nice watering hole with plenty of good people and cold drinks. That combination has worked well for centuries and is probably responsible for a good number of Yelpers being conceived! Enjoy your night at the Aces.

22.description: Good food and decent atmosphere. I ordered the ace burger and got the bolognese sauce on the fries. The burger was great and the fries were pretty good as well. I paired my meal with a tasty PBR which is a great blue ribbon meal to wash down your meal. They have a good beer selection and some other drinks but we did not order any. If the weather is good I would advise sitting outside. In all good place for a date or group.

15.description: This is one of my favorite places in little Italy! The bartenders are very kind and serve amazing drinks. During the summer the patio is the place to be. This place has a great ambiance an fun vibe. I've tried everything on the menu and I can't say anything but good things. Love this place.

57.description: The short rib pizza is AMAZING

20.description: This place was good, I had the double double burger with fries and it was amazing. The only down fall was our waiter was rude and any question we asked he acted like he didn't have time to answer. I'll probably stick to sitting at the bar, probably the only nice people within the wait staff.

36.description: This was a pretty decent brunch. I got the ACE's Benedict. The poached eggs were probably the most perfectly poached eggs I've had. However the flavor overall was just decent.

14.description: Three Aces exceeded my expectations. The food was outstanding. Im not usually a Margherita pizza fan but here it tasted sooo fresh and flavorful. It comes on a circular wooden block and was quite thin. The sauce is jam packed with flavor with quite a basil kick.Their Poutine, just look at the picture, the presentation is a work of art, especially at a gastropub.  Fries, gravy, cheese curds and a fried egg (nice touch) how can you go wrong. I do not pretend to be a Poutine connoisseur but damn that tasted pretty good to me.Three Aces has a beautiful and spacious outdoor patio, perfect for an early fall Friday afternoon. The only problem was the bees, they were all ovee. It looked like I had Tourettes Syndrom fighting off the bees. The staff basically said thats the way it is.. Errrr!Anywho it had outstanding food and a nice outdoor space minus the bees. ill be back for that pizza.

58.description: I am coming out of hibernation just to write this review.I have been to a lot of breakfast places and I haven't written a review in years, but today I feel compelled to come out of retirement and warn people about this place.PROS-The place is clean and has a nice atmosphere.-The egg tacos turned out to be pretty solid.CONS-Pricey!!  It cost 40 dollars for my friend and I to eat food that likely cost them 2 dollars tops!-I've received better service at IHOP.  They had you food and they hand you the bill.  That is it.-Water was TERRIBLE.  It had the right out of the sink after taste and was not even cold.  The water comes out of these chic glass bottles they leave at your table(so staff has even less reason to visit your table) and its not cold and takes like crap.  How do you mess this up?-We got served our pancake waffle before our meal...ok so 99% of the world eats sweets at the end of a meal.  So we had to eat our waffle/pancake nice and cold, just how we like it!  (Come on guys, why would you serve pancake/waffle first?)Now for the worst part, the food!!!!!I ordered the egg tacos and lumberjack skillet.  I have a massive appetite and so I usually order two entrees.Let me tell you about the lumberjack skillet first.It costs $14, and it consists of 3 eggs, and a whole potato chopped up, with a slice of cheese and a TINY amount of meat.  WTF!?!The egg tacos were actually decent I can't hate on these, but then half the plate is another potato.Honestly I am not picky.  I'm the guy who eats plane eggs, cheerios, etc for breakfast because they are easy to calculate macros for.So when I FINALLY decide to go out and eat something I get this basura!Seriously, at the start of the meal ask for EXTRA KETCHUP, you will need it to slug this meal down.Ultimately I would recommend this place to anyone with a serious starch deficiency because you will eat a lot of potatoes!I gave it two stars, because despite being VERY ANGRY right now, the place is not a 1 star place.  It is decent, but I put it as 2 stars because I will never return.To all my fellow meatheads out there, NOT WORTH YOUR MACROS, just go to Chipotle for the 100th time!I would have GLADLY told my waitress this in person, but we did not even receive a simple "how was everything?" I was here 7am 5/25/2015.

56.description: Great food .. great service.  The butter pecan waffles were fantastic. The egg skillet was very good.

29.description: Best brunch ever!! I am a HUGE fan if brunch and I can honestly say that the side of mini waffles I got were the best waffles I've ever had. They have a distinct taste of cinnamon and they are served hot and crispy. I got the Taylor Street Fritata as my meal and it was delicious. Very filling, I only ate half of it, but took the other half home. The coffee was great, and my server Lauren was super nice and friendly. I went there solo which was the best idea because the place was naturally packed on a Sunday morning, and I was seated right away at the bar where you get to watch the food being cooked. Such a lovely urban brunch atmosphere, and the mugs were so cute that at checkout I bought one. Absolutely going back for those waffles.

42.description: Awesome food. Free side of pancakes if you check in with Yelp. The banana and peanut butter pancakes are my favorite and the coffee is amazing

23.description: Worst hostess ever. Overpriced bland breakfast.Insane wait time, for piss poor quality.Dont come here!I don't really feel the need to wait a while before I write a yelp review but I did for this one. The fact that I still remember the negative experience, is a strong indicator of the long-lasting impact of bad service - and fair warning to choose the other nearby breakfast options over this one. The hostess called our name and we didn't hear it. When we told her that we were overlooked and had been waiting already for twenty minutes, she barked at us and said "Well, you could wait longer then!" and proceeded to call two more groups of two before us. The managers need to train their hostesses better, or get pagers like the rest of the brunch world. Either way, I'm never going back and take it from me, neither should you.

47.description: Very decent food with timely, polite service. Great spur of the moment idea if you're a little village dweller. Will definitely come again since I live close.

8.description: My favorite breakfast place in the neighborhood. The food is consistent and there's a nice variety on the menu. Beware that Saturday and Sunday brunch have a 30ish minute wait. The menu has a great balance of typical diner fair and some more interesting options.

31.description: This place is really cute and has some good food!! The menu has a lot to offer but the layout of it is not good! It's hard to read so I suggest looking at a menu before going. In love with the steak and eggs!

34.description: I was surprised when I saw this place had been recognized by Michelin rating. Well, it was worth the recognition! My friend had the breakfast tacos and I had the open face bacon jam and egg sandwich. Both very good! We also got a free pancake when I checked-in using Yelp...not a bad idea! The only concern I had was that it did take some time to get our food. I WILL BE GOING AGAIN to try more things on the menu. The place was also packed which is usually a good sign.

16.description: Worst hostess ever. Overpriced bland breakfast.Insane wait time, for piss poor quality.Dont come here!I don't really feel the need to wait a while before I write a yelp review but I did for this one. The fact that I still remember the negative experience, is a strong indicator of the long-lasting impact of bad service - and fair warning to choose the other nearby breakfast options over this one. The hostess called our name and we didn't hear it. When we told her that we were overlooked and had been waiting already for twenty minutes, she barked at us and said "Well, you could wait longer then!" and proceeded to call two more groups of two before us. The managers need to train their hostesses better, or get pagers like the rest of the brunch world. Either way, I'm never going back and take it from me, neither should you.

13.description: We met a friend here for breakfast and it was fine, but not exactly mind-blowing.  We were seated after a brief wait, and coffee (Intelligentsia, no less) came out quickly.  However, the poached eggs on my Benedict were bit overdone, and if I hadn't been with friends, I definitely would have sent it back.  The English muffin toast on the bottom was overwhelmingly large -- a theme of their bread items -- and made it tricky to eat, and I could have used more Hollandaise. The potatoes needed a little salt, but were otherwise good.  I didn't love it and I didn't hate it.  I'm unlikely to ever be back in this neighborhood, and definitely wouldn't return just for the Stax Cafe.

11.description: Pretty good food!

39.description: Ordered the Brisket Benedict.Over all not bad. The eggs were over cooked, the brisket was dry, and the potatoes were under seasoned. The coffee was decent.I was excepting much more from the food.Service is exceptional and we got seated quickly.

37.description: Came in this morning. First time. Food was excellent and the service was great. Thanks Grant! (Server). He was the bomb! Definitely coming back soon.

0.description: I can't believe I'm just NOW reviewing my beloved Stax Cafe. My coworkers and I had lunch here this week. I, of course, have eaten here numerous times, but some of my cohorts were new to try it....I was more than happy to offer my suggestions:)First off, they serve Intelligencia coffee, so that's amazing. Also, they have a full juice bar if that's your thing. The menu is rather large with offering both breakfast and lunch options. I've tried many items to include the chiliquiles, fried chicken sandwhich, tuna sliders, mini egg sandwiches, the turkey club, the chicken salad, I mean I could go on....Honestly these dishes are nothing short of delicious. But the absolute best is most definitely the breakfast wrap. It's my "go to" for sure! I highly recommend this dish for anyone who loves bomb food...and cheese! ;)The customer service is always on point. There is sometimes a wait, but that's only because this place is the real deal. It's worth the wait I promise. I have to say, one of the best diners in Chicago! See you real soon Stax!

38.description: I love going to Stax for breakfast! They have some peanut butter chocolate pancakes that are amazing!. This sugar rush you get from these pancakes will last all day. All their food is pretty great and their service is awesome as well. Cool atmosphere and very nice restaurant for breakfast. Definitely recommend trying it out when your in the area.

51.description: Stacks on stacks on stacks at Stax! Yum, pancakes!This cute little breakfast place located near UIC offers up some delicious breakfast options in their cozy building. I love that it's so clean inside and really modern like in design. The menu is on a single sheet and easy to read. From platters, to benedicts, to omelettes, pancakes and french toast, you're sure to find a breakfast treat for you. When I hear "stax" I immediately think of a stack of pancakes. So naturally, I decided that I wanted pancakes. I decided to go with the Healthy Start Pancakes because of the blueberry compote. I love blueberries and was drawn into the blueberry and greek yogurt with honey combination! I was so surprised by the portion size of these pancakes. There were 3 giant pancakes filled with blueberries and on top, a dollop of greek yogurt, blueberry compote, granola all drizzled in honey. The pancakes are made out of oat so it gave an interesting texture and flavor. I really liked it though, being an oat fan that I am. The blueberries bursted in the pancakes and the greek yogurt was tart and refreshing. I could have eaten it without maple syrup, but maple syrup never hurt anyone! I barely got through half of the stack before my stomach caved in. My friend got the Starving Student platter which comes with eggs, bacons, potatoes/veggies and either mini pancakes or waffles. It was a big meal, definitely fit for a hungry student. And trust me, after finishing that plate, you'll leave as a satisfied student! My other friend decided to go with the carnivore omelette. He is a huge meat lover and said that the omelette had so much meat that it was almost too much (can you ever have too much meat?!). I could see all the different pieces of meat throughout his giant omelette. It also came with potatoes and HUGE pieces of toast. I've never seen toast that big ever. This is a hefty portion so be prepared!The pricing is really fair for the big portion sizes. Each menu item is about $10-15 depending on what you are getting. Service here was pretty good. Our server was a little hard to understand but we made it by. She checked up on us here and there and our water was refilled promptly. Breakfast food is comfort food, and Stax embraces comfort.

27.description: I've been in the Pilsen neighborhood for 3 years and have wanted to come here for quite some time.  The wife and I finally made it in and we've been missing out!  I'm a big fan of the space, the wait staff were professionals, and the food was really good.Honestly I wanted to come back here a week later, but we're still in the explore phase of all the local brunch joints at the moment.  Stax is now, for sure, a personal favorite.  I'll be back.

32.description: Breakfast and brunch can be a task in Chicago unless you get to the restaurant early. So, I opted to go to Stax Cafe early on Sunday morning. Fantastic!I ordered banana French toast with dulce de leche, eggs scrambled well with cream cheese, and house potatoes.The French toast made my day. The fact that they didn't require any syrup was all the better. I love the fact that they actually scrambled my eggs with cream cheese rather than sending out a plate of scrambled eggs with dollops of cream cheese. The home potatoes were also good, seasoned with onions, red peppers, and green peppers.Having gotten to the restaurant early, the service was good. Given the area, I imagine the restaurant gets crowded, so I recommend going early enough to enjoy your breakfast, brunch, or lunch without complaint. I'll definitely have to return to see what else is on the menu worthy of gobbling.

54.description: Not bad. Eggs benedict was decent. Waffles were decent.

48.description: Loved the brunch at Stax. The service is great and the food is pretty good (there is a good selection for vegetarians as well). I would gladly go back every weekend :)

44.description: We went to eat there today and  felt nausea and ill because your restaurant had such awful paint fumes/stain fumes. So much formaldehyde going through your restaurant. Even your hostess was ill.

24.description: I just fell in love for the food and the customer service. It's a clean, cool and really nice place to have breakfast or brunch.

7.description: Stacks on stacks on stacks at Stax! Yum, pancakes!This cute little breakfast place located near UIC offers up some delicious breakfast options in their cozy building. I love that it's so clean inside and really modern like in design. The menu is on a single sheet and easy to read. From platters, to benedicts, to omelettes, pancakes and french toast, you're sure to find a breakfast treat for you. When I hear "stax" I immediately think of a stack of pancakes. So naturally, I decided that I wanted pancakes. I decided to go with the Healthy Start Pancakes because of the blueberry compote. I love blueberries and was drawn into the blueberry and greek yogurt with honey combination! I was so surprised by the portion size of these pancakes. There were 3 giant pancakes filled with blueberries and on top, a dollop of greek yogurt, blueberry compote, granola all drizzled in honey. The pancakes are made out of oat so it gave an interesting texture and flavor. I really liked it though, being an oat fan that I am. The blueberries bursted in the pancakes and the greek yogurt was tart and refreshing. I could have eaten it without maple syrup, but maple syrup never hurt anyone! I barely got through half of the stack before my stomach caved in. My friend got the Starving Student platter which comes with eggs, bacons, potatoes/veggies and either mini pancakes or waffles. It was a big meal, definitely fit for a hungry student. And trust me, after finishing that plate, you'll leave as a satisfied student! My other friend decided to go with the carnivore omelette. He is a huge meat lover and said that the omelette had so much meat that it was almost too much (can you ever have too much meat?!). This is a hefty portion so be prepared!The pricing is really fair for the big portion sizes. Each menu item is about $10-15 depending on what you are getting. Service here was pretty good. Our server was a little hard to understand but we made it by. She checked up on us here and there and our water was refilled promptly. Breakfast food is comfort food, and Stax embraces comfort.

49.description: No wait if you go before 10am! Otherwise Stax gets pretty busy really quickly. Free mini waffles or pancakes with yelp check-in (you can even ask for blueberry pancakes!) = super super awesome.Their giant slices of whole wheat toast studded with sunflower seeds + over easy eggs was perfect for a post-4th of July brunch. It's all I wanted, so I ordered the starving student (which you can sub the bacon for pork sausage for no extra charge! if you want turkey sausage it's $1 extra). My bf got the beef brisket and really enjoyed it. He loved the mini waffles even more, of course. It's their specialty We've tried their Taylor Street Frittata before and it's always a good choice. Their potatoes are better than other places since they some add onions and bell peppers!

40.description: The lumberjack skillet and mini waffles were great. We waited a little bit. We did notice the manager tell the hostess we have been waiting and to get us seated. The hospitality was appreciated. The food came out in a timely manner. However, he asked if my friend was finished and she said no. We were talking a few minutes later and he just took her plate and my empty plate away without asking... she was not even done. He returned with the bill. We felt pushed out.

53.description: Good breakfast food! It's a bit of new school and old school favorites. It can be very crowded on Sundays. I've been there twice. A bit pricey...

30.description: My new weekend breakfast spot. My wife and I were looking to buy a house in the area so I wanted to check out what it had to offer. I really enjoy the restaurants in the Little Italy neighborhood but I never checked out a spot for early morning dining until Stax. I've been there several times. Even before we bought our house nearby. The staff is great. Very friendly. The food is always very good. I'm trying to order something different every time I go but there are a couple of items that I just love to get. The Salmon Benedict on a bagel is delicious and quite filling. The omelets and skillets are great. Overall, a great place for weekend breakfast. i like to go early before it gets too busy.

46.description: A great place for brunch. The interior is bright and cheerful, and the wait staff are friendly. The oatmeal pancakes and breakfast chilaquiles are delicious. Portion sizes are large, so you could definitely split a plate between two people (maybe add a side). Prices are average, between $9-13 a dish.

1.description: Brunch is something I don't usually do, but this place sounded good and has a lot of high reviews on Yelp.The place looks nice, it's like a rustic feel like your at home. The food is on the higher price of things, that maybe because only fancy people and divorce moms who are on a reality tv show go out for brunch. The waitress we had was really good and she knew what she was doing. That's always a good thing to have. All in all, this place was alright.

55.description: IF YOU DON'T WANT THE TRUTH THEN DON'T ASK..... So the manager or hostess asks me on my way out, how was the meal?  I replied "It was ok, I've had better.  But not enough to get my repeat business".  She then gave me the sour candy face and proceeded to tell me that they were recommended by Michelin....Ok, really...I think she meant to say Zagat but I'll give her a pass on that one.  Let me tell you what was good and what wasn't so good.  The potatoes had a fishy aftertaste - Not goodThe Banana French Toast - Ok but badly presented.  Instead of making it look like baby food, cut the bananas and pour the caramel over it. My suggestion.The Omelet - Normal - Nothing out of this worldThe clear winner here were the MINI WAFFLES - Very goodIn closing I told her that it wasn't bad, but many do it better.  This is Chi-town girl.  You got to come with it!  Chicago is second to none and these restaurants need to up their game.

9.description: Stax Cafe is a great little spot for brunch. Service is sometimes spotty. I've been here a hand full of times and it seems like they are understaffed. The food and friendly service make up for the waiting time. Good sized portions and great soy lattes. I will continue to come back.

26.description: I looked this place on yelp before going and the reviews appeared great at first. interesting that the bad reviews are hidden under "not recommended" and probably this one will go there, too. had the simplist breakfast on earth; 2 eggs over easy, potatoes, bacon and toast. the eggs were cooked perfectly but had a man's hair in them. the toast was fine but the potatoes were oily and lukewarm like they were under a warmer at a hotel buffet. the bacon was soooooooo enticing but after eating some my mouth was burning from the salt. it was like chewing sea salt. seriously, I've never had this experience and I eat my weight in bacon annually. maybe the pancakes are amazing....but I won't be going back.

25.description: My first time visiting this place was kool. The atmosphere was laid back & roomy, and The waitress we had was nice & helpful. I tried the vegetarian skillet, with mini waffles on the side, with some oj. I can say this will be 1 of my main picks.

12.description: I've now been to Stax Cafe on Taylor three times.  Each time I have tried something new and I can say that the food is consistently good.  Normally I dine at Stax on a Saturday or Sunday which is probably their peek business days I'm sure.  The wait list seems to move very quickly using the "under promise; over deliver" technique for quoting wait times.  The restaurant is a decent size in comparison to other restaurants on Taylor St.  However the lobby or foyer area tends to get quite a bit crowded as patrons waiting for tables and customers paying their bills merge.  The service can be a touch slow at time, not sure if servers have table limits or what the deal is but I've had to flag a server down at least twice for a coffee refill and I am by no means sucking them down at a accelerated pace.  The food is quite delicious though.  I've had the brisket bennies, raspberry and white chocolate chip pancakes, and the falafel sliders.  All of which are great.  They also do run specials but I have not indulged on any to report yet.  Overall Stax is a really good brunch spot, I would recommend for sure.

59.description: Breakfast brunch place wasn't too crowded. Everything fresh. Had an apple juice that was squeezed (crushed) very good! I had the angus burger with tomato jam which was interesting. It was alright. The bacon was fantastic. The one thing I didn't care for was the coffee. Which is pretty big for me. Disappointed. The waitstaff was really great. Food alright. Coffee blah.

21.description: We love stax! Big portions and it includes pancakes if you so choose. Always willing to recommend their favorite.I don't like their coffee much, but all food is delicious! Kiddos love it too!

17.description: I literally come here like once a week , everything on the menu is delicious ! Service is great , just suggest to go early because there is a wait sometimes.

10.description: I've been here plenty of times, stax is one of my favorite brunch spots in Chicago. I totally recommend this place for breakfast and lunch. They have a little bit of everything on the menu. The lattes are amazing. Also, they have a juice bar. The customer service is great but sometimes there is a wait but the food is totally worth it!

5.description: My boyfriend and I had the healthy start pancakes and the skirt steak with egg. Their pancakes are incredible! If you are a pancake lover then I highly recommend you to try out their pancakes! And also the steak that my boyfriend had its really tender and the mini waffle that comes with the steak was also fabulous! I love both the waffle and the pancake. I can't choose which one is better!

3.description: I went with a group of friends to Stax Café after seeing it reviewed on Chicago Best's television show. We got there around 12:30 on a Sunday and it was about a 20 minute wait, which isn't bad compared to most places. Parking was easy to find on Taylor street and better yet free since it was a Sunday. The ambiance of the restaurant wasn't anything fancy, but it was quite cozy. If you check in on yelp you get either two free mini pancakes or two free mini waffles. Most of the meals also come with two free pancakes or waffles. To mix it up I went with a side of two mini white chocolate banana pancakes (a little dry). I also went with two mini chocolate chip waffles and those were very good!For my main meal I had the Spanish omelet and it came with potatoes on the side. They don't have the siracha (sp) sauce sitting on the table, but ask for it! After putting some of that sauce over my omelet my meal was delicious and complete. Prices were reasonable and it'll definitely be on my list of places to come back to for brunch. I don't visit this area often, so I plan on venturing around the next time I'm here.For more pics follow me on Instagram @chiataglance

35.description: We met a friend here for breakfast and it was fine, but not exactly mind-blowing.  We were seated after a brief wait, and coffee (Intelligentsia, no less) came out quickly.  However, the poached eggs on my Benedict were bit overdone, and if I hadn't been with friends, I definitely would have sent it back.  The English muffin toast on the bottom was overwhelmingly large -- a theme of their bread items -- and made it tricky to eat, and I could have used more Hollandaise. The potatoes needed a little salt, but were otherwise good.  I didn't love it and I didn't hate it.  I'm unlikely to ever be back in this neighborhood, and definitely wouldn't return just for the Stax Cafe.

19.description: Breakfast brunch place wasn't too crowded. Everything fresh. Had an apple juice that was squeezed (crushed) very good! I had the angus burger with tomato jam which was interesting. It was alright. The bacon was fantastic. The one thing I didn't care for was the coffee. Which is pretty big for me. Disappointed. The waitstaff was really great. Food alright. Coffee blah.

28.description: It's awesome knowing that Taylor street has some solid choices for brunching with Stax and Sweet Maple Cafe only a block or two down the road. Stax is a more modern brunch spot with a bright, hardwood interior and neat rows of tables. For the busy student or healthcare worker, Stax is a nice to place to get your brunch fix, feel good about it, and leave when you have to.My friend wanted to try this place out because they apparently offer amazing hot cocoa. I can't really comment on how good it was because tbh i've never really had bad cocoa, but she seemed to be enjoying the chocolate and the mountain of whipped cream that came with it. For food, I had the veggie frittata (an open omelette) that came with broccoli, mushroom, roasted pepper and onion. On top was a slice of melted swiss. The vegetables were bright and well cooked but the swiss was a little overpowering, especially since there was no meat in the dish--cheddar would have been a better option. The real star here are the potatoes which are gold, crispy, and fried with peppers and onions. They are so flavorful and I could probably eat them for days and days. You also get a side of waffles, toast, or pancakes and it's quite a bit of food.Service here is excellent! Our waitress was attentive and made sure we had everything we needed/checked up on us regularly. I also like that you pay at the register instead of waiting for a server to pick up a bill which goes with the theme of get in and get out. I'll be back!

45.description: Came here in the afternoon I had the veggie skillet, it was asparagus mushroom spinach, tomato and Swiss cheese, I asked for cheddar instead.. What I liked about it was that the egg was not mixed with the potatoes and vegetables it was served over it ... I asked for scramble but you can get it over easy etc... The skillet was served with two mini waffles (or you can choose toast or pancakes) The potatoes are cubed and served in big portions , and the vegetables were not over sautéed - I took half of my portion home and was still able to reheat it .., The other thing I liked was that my food was not very greasy or salty , it was cooked with care and not just thrown together .. Our server was very friendly and attentive.. I would definitely bring a friend or two .It was pricey $14 and $2.50 for an iced coffee - but considering other breakfast places that's still a deal .

33.description: I had the eggs Benedict when I went- it was great, but not revolutionary. I think that Stax is such a popular breakfast place because it is slightly more unconventional than the average brunch place. The eggs were the perfect amount of runny-but rich, and the hollandaise was perfectly seasoned. I think that it's a little bit pricey for what you get, but overall still a great place!

43.description: A bit pricey for breakfast but the food is pretty good. I really like their fried chicken sandwich. It comes on an onion roll. The fries that come with it are meh. Next time I'll try to substitute the fries for a different side.

2.description: Really Nice place for a sit down, with GREAT food. However, I cant give this pace 5 stars.When trying to order takeout around lunch hour, they literally WONT answer the phone. Also, if you sit at the bar you can see the the cooks do their thing, which is not good. They dont use gloves and the rag they have hanging off their shoulders they use to clean off things, wipe their hands AND dry off your bacon... :(

18.description: Stax was the first restaurant I ever ordered an eggs benedict, and I've been looking for a benedict to match since. Stax has perfected a dairy-free eggs benedict, and their potatoes on the side are cooked to perfection. Without the use of butter and any other dairy products (after I ask, of course), stax has made the best eggs benedict I've had yet. For several weeks, I would go spinning and then come straight to stax for a filling and satisfying brunch.The menu is short; with limited options and not a lot of variety, I have not been too eager to try anything else. I always enjoyed trying my friends' plates, but I've only enjoyed the eggs.The environment is friendly, and the restaurant is slightly tight, but you can still move around. I haven't always appreciated the staff; I understand that brunch gets very busy on weekends, but I found the service almost negligent sometimes. I also found the hostess slightly rude and combative, and my newcomer friend wanted to immediately go somewhere else because of the attitude. However, I am always willing to come back for the food, and I'm always willing to wait.Overall, I love this restaurant. The servers are competent about the food and are always nice. This place is my go to every time I'm in the area.

41.description: I went with a group of friends to Stax Café after seeing it reviewed on Chicago Best's television show. We got there around 12:30 on a Sunday and it was about a 20 minute wait, which isn't bad compared to most places. Parking was easy to find on Taylor street and better yet free since it was a Sunday. The ambiance of the restaurant wasn't anything fancy, but it was quite cozy. If you check in on yelp you get either two free mini pancakes or two free mini waffles. Most of the meals also come with two free pancakes or waffles. To mix it up I went with a side of two mini white chocolate banana pancakes (a little dry). I also went with two mini chocolate chip waffles and those were very good!For my main meal I had the Spanish omelet and it came with potatoes on the side. They don't have the siracha (sp) sauce sitting on the table, but ask for it! After putting some of that sauce over my omelet my meal was delicious and complete. Prices were reasonable and it'll definitely be on my list of places to come back to for brunch. I don't visit this area often, so I plan on venturing around the next time I'm here.For more pics follow me on Instagram @chiataglance

52.description: Excellent waitress and food! Terrible hostess service! Was keeping 5$ from our awesome waitress's tip! Definitely not the same good service as 6 months back! Just leaving now at 9:30 Am on 06/27/15.

50.description: Stax oh stax, I love you very much! Stax has been giving me an outstanding brunch experience. Yes, the line is always long and you cannot make a reservation, but they are worth waiting for. The foods are always great, especially the skillets. Nom. Nom. Nom. And their fresh squeeze juice is so good. Their service is awesome, too. The waitress is attentive and kind. I will highly recommend stax to everyone!
