4.description: It's awesome knowing that Taylor street has some solid choices for brunching with Stax and Sweet Maple Cafe only a block or two down the road. Stax is a more modern brunch spot with a bright, hardwood interior and neat rows of tables. For the busy student or healthcare worker, Stax is a nice to place to get your brunch fix, feel good about it, and leave when you have to.My friend wanted to try this place out because they apparently offer amazing hot cocoa. I can't really comment on how good it was because tbh i've never really had bad cocoa, but she seemed to be enjoying the chocolate and the mountain of whipped cream that came with it. For food, I had the veggie frittata (an open omelette) that came with broccoli, mushroom, roasted pepper and onion. On top was a slice of melted swiss. The vegetables were bright and well cooked but the swiss was a little overpowering, especially since there was no meat in the dish--cheddar would have been a better option. The real star here are the potatoes which are gold, crispy, and fried with peppers and onions. They are so flavorful and I could probably eat them for days and days. You also get a side of waffles, toast, or pancakes and it's quite a bit of food.Service here is excellent! Our waitress was attentive and made sure we had everything we needed/checked up on us regularly. I also like that you pay at the register instead of waiting for a server to pick up a bill which goes with the theme of get in and get out. I'll be back!

6.description: Breakfast and brunch can be a task in Chicago unless you get to the restaurant early. So, I opted to go to Stax Cafe early on Sunday morning. Fantastic!I ordered banana French toast with dulce de leche, eggs scrambled well with cream cheese, and house potatoes.The French toast made my day. The fact that they didn't require any syrup was all the better. I love the fact that they actually scrambled my eggs with cream cheese rather than sending out a plate of scrambled eggs with dollops of cream cheese. The home potatoes were also good, seasoned with onions, red peppers, and green peppers.Having gotten to the restaurant early, the service was good. Given the area, I imagine the restaurant gets crowded, so I recommend going early enough to enjoy your breakfast, brunch, or lunch without complaint. I'll definitely have to return to see what else is on the menu worthy of gobbling.

22.description: Great breakfast. Do the Yelp checkin to try a new pancake or waffle. I can't wait to try everything on the menu.

15.description: My fiance and I happened to be driving down Taylor St. after an early morning doctor's appointment this past Saturday and decided to stop and grab breakfast at a little place that caught our eye called Stax. We were greeted and sat immediately by a friendly host, as it was only about 8 a.m. and the brunch rush hadn't started yet. As usual when everything looks good and I get nervously indecisive, my fiance and I opted to order one sweet and one savory breakfast and share. I hemmed and hawed over whether to order the mixed berry crepes or the butter pecan waffles, but decided on the crepe, you know, to be "healthy." By crepe, they meant three crepes stuffed with and topped with strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries, with a raspberry and cream coulis and whipped cream. No skimping on any ingredients here! Once I thought I had decided, I pulled out my phone to check in on Yelp, and was delighted to find a check-in would get you a free order of mini-waffles, and yes, these mini-waffles COULD be butter pecan. You can have it ALL at Stax! The waffles were hot, fluffy, crisp, sweet, and had whole pecans IN and ON the waffles, lots of waffle-y goodness, with whipped cream. My fiance went with the tender beef brisket hash with potatoes and an egg, which also came with mini pancakes. Well seasoned, well cooked. SO MUCH FOOD! Add a hot chocolate with whipped cream and a coffee and we still hadn't even spent $30. Our server was also great  - Merissa, genuine smile, appeared to offer a coffee refill without being flagged down and to check in at the right times, efficient; joked about my whipped cream overdosing, definitely the person you want to deal with before 9 a.m.  We packed up at least half of our meal to go and got Sunday breakfast out of it too, supplemented with an egg or two of our own. With such great food and great service, I imagine it gets pretty busy later in the mornings, but I definitely would recommend Stax to anyone and have added this to my own list of great breakfast spots!

57.description: I was here hours ago and I'm still super full, so that's a plus. My friend ordered the 'starving student" and that looked really good and she said it was delicious, so you should take that into consideration if you plan on dining here. Over all, this place was exactly a-ok for me, I had the dulce de leche french toast and the dulce de leche wasn't mixed in the french toast, it just replaces the syrup. For those uncertain of what to order, order a juice and something from their "eggs and bennies" portion of the menu because that's what they're well known for. It even comes with a cute little portion control sized waffle or pancakes to put an end to the sweet tooth craving that many, including myself, walk in here with.

20.description: This is a good place to have brunch, but they don't' offer mush potato or the real steak, and the burger is not very big. Is not cheap for a brunch.

36.description: I've now been to Stax Cafe on Taylor three times.  Each time I have tried something new and I can say that the food is consistently good.  Normally I dine at Stax on a Saturday or Sunday which is probably their peek business days I'm sure.  The wait list seems to move very quickly using the "under promise; over deliver" technique for quoting wait times.  The restaurant is a decent size in comparison to other restaurants on Taylor St.  However the lobby or foyer area tends to get quite a bit crowded as patrons waiting for tables and customers paying their bills merge.  The service can be a touch slow at time, not sure if servers have table limits or what the deal is but I've had to flag a server down at least twice for a coffee refill and I am by no means sucking them down at a accelerated pace.  The food is quite delicious though.  I've had the brisket bennies, raspberry and white chocolate chip pancakes, and the falafel sliders.  All of which are great.  They also do run specials but I have not indulged on any to report yet.  Overall Stax is a really good brunch spot, I would recommend for sure.

14.description: What a cute, hip little spot! We waited for an hour and a half to get a table for 3, but it was so worth it. The atmosphere is incredible and very enjoyable. The wait was only long because of the hot chocolate 5k going on that morning. We called ahead and got our name on the list so we were able to wait at home and then head over. I ordered the stuffed pepper soup of the day and it was absolutely delicious. It was simple enough that I am hoping I can recreate it at home, that's how great it was. I also ordered the mini egg and ham sandwiches. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the rolls they served them on are really yummy. I wasn't a huge fan of the potatoes that come on the side, but luckily I was full from the soup so it didn't really matter. My friends ordered the breakfast tacos and one of the eggs benedicts. Both of the dishes were presented nicely and tasted as good as they looked.

58.description: This is our go-to spot for burgers. They really don't get much better and we've tried to entertain the big names and long waits, but what's the point? I love the divey feel. Everyone is welcome here. It's just easy at Polk Street and we appreciate that. Easy to park, easy service, and easy to expect consistently good pub food. The onion rings are awesome, fries equally as good, and the soups are homemade. Not a huge fan of their wings but only because of personal preference. Steak sandwiches are great too.  Thanks for keeping it real here. No need for another gimmicky burger spot in Chicago. It's overplayed.

56.description: I'm glad this place is not close to where I live. I kind of wish it was my neighborhood bar. It's this small dive, but it's so awesome. The bar food is really good. My burger was DE-licious! It was so unexpected because the guacamole and the seasoning in the burger was such a great combination of flavors. The wings were also good, not overly sour or on the saltier side. My firecracker salad was also spectacular the next day, and the portions are to my liking. It's a great spot to watch games and anything on tv basically. The staff is so friendly and accommodating and let you watch what you want from shows on tv to requested sports games. They have specials as well. I would love to come back. I keep thinking about this burger and  wings...

29.description: The quality and quantity of food was beyond expectations.  A dozen of us ordered items from across the menu to be delivered to our work place on a Sunday night at midnight.  The order arrived within an hour, with no order discrepancies.  Everyone's meal that was to be delivered hot, arrived hot.  Deserts and salsas were delivered packaged separately, just the way it's suppose to.  Everyone enjoyed their meal and are looking forward to another order soon.On the other hand, Eat24, Yelp's online ordering system has a great deal of room for improving a multiple party order.  I would suggest that the "group boss" be able to set minimum tip amounts and include delivery charges in each persons transaction.  At the very least be able to view specific tip amounts paid by each individual.  This system has potential, but it requires to much attention by the person organizing the order.

42.description: This is a really fun dive bar with some great drink specials and really delicious food!!! My car broke down on our way into the city, so we were able to get it to the Midas nearby and had about an hour to kill while they worked on it. This bar was in walking distance so we figured it'd be a nice place to check out.I was slightly intimidated when we first entered because there were posters everywhere stating "Official Blackhawks bar" and Mike and I were decked out in our Minnesota Wild attire, matching hats & all! We sat at the bar and the bartenders were super friendly and nice. We both got a $3 domestic beer, great price! You could tell that they get a lot of locals at this bar and I think that's what makes it so neat and the atmosphere is very comfortable. The sampler platter that we decided to split had chicken tenders, wings, potato skins, a chicken roll and an irish roll. We were also given chips & salsa to start with; I really like that they delivered those to us first so we could munch on them while the rest of our food was being made. Everything was delicious! The salsa was just the right amount of spicy & perfectly chunky. The chips were crisp and baked. The chicken tenders were lightly breaded and crispy, while the wings were spicy & tender. My favorite item on the platter was probably the Irish roll. It's really cheesy and unique. We left completely stuffed and unable to even finish our entire platter. Great atmosphere, fabulous service, affordable prices, and mouth watering food- YUM! I am entirely satisfied with the experience I had here & I'm very sad I can't be a local there!!!! If only this pub were in my backyard!

23.description: Great local bar!!!  Friendly people and good food!!  Awesome lil bar with great specials daily!

47.description: Ordered delivery.  Got a text saying it left the restaurant at 4:30, and it arrived at 5:15.  NOT a good sign.  Wings were ice cold, the extra dressing I ordered (and paid for ) was not there, and there were precisely 12 tots in my soggy, cold, $4 order.  But HERE is where the real problem comes in.  I called and spoke to the manager, and the food manager, and neither of them gave a single damn and neither apologized a single time.  Even when I said "the bad food is annoying, but the fact that no one has apologized a single time is a real concern."  Still nothing.  Over it.

8.description: Friendly environment, Nice staffs, and delicious burgers :D Specially the "southwestern" ;)

31.description: If you are not going to open on time, at least pick up the phone or just open the door and let us know.  I can see you in there.

34.description: Have ordered through GH several times. The first 7-10 times I got outstanding food very quickly. The last 2 times I ordered, and the reason for only 3 stars, is that they delivered about 10 minutes outside their already long window of 1.25 hours (I ordered at 8p, they said it'd get there at 9:15p, it got there 9:30p) and when it arrived, it was cold as ice. Not sure if that's on GH or on Polk Street, but either way, uncool.That said... best burger in town in my opinion. Ask for the fries "crispy"!

16.description: I like this place a lot.  I gave it a try a while back while attending UIC and keep going back.  The burgers are good, the drinks are good, and I like to watch the bears while eating.  I like the place because it's cozy, dim atmosphere with friendly people.

13.description: Ordered delivery last night and everything was good. The kids ate all their bbq wings and said the cheese sticks were good. I had a burger and chips which was great and the boyfriend had fish and chips which looked yummy.

11.description: OMG!! The burgers we ordered were outstanding! I had the Blackjack and my husband the Pastoral... The only reason I am giving them a 4 star review is bc they took FOREVER to deliver... Will order/eat here again!!

39.description: I love this place, even if I haven't been here in ages. I used to meet a friend of mine here all the time because it was a halfway meet. The bartenders are friendly, although the beers kind of expensive for a dive bar. I've had burgers, nachos, and salads here. The salads are meh, but the burgers and nachos are banging. It's a cool crowd and you see some interesting douches come in from the strip joint next door. I say...try it if you're in the area.

37.description: Not sure how they got so many stars unless they are padding the reviews. the stew was OK.  Prices are a little high for a "dive bar" type of place and small cup sized bowl. The bar tender was really nice or I probably would have done 1-star. When they open the door to the basement, a moldy/stale beer smell comes blowing into the bar.My Guinness tasted like the taps were a bit dirty. I did not finish it or complain. Just decided to pay my bill and leave.

0.description: I always write and base my reviews first and foremost relative to the type of place I am going to. With that being said, Polk Street Pub is a top notch hole in the wall, and somewhere you'd never expect to actually get a decent meal at. Their burgers are delicious, obviously hand packed and very fresh. Salads are also great, call me crazy but they'll serve you the best damn ranch you've ever had in your life. Wings are hit or miss for me, sometimes they're just not cooked enough in my opinion - flabby chicken skin just isn't my thing. Daily specials are always a steal, and the service is always great. They do a good dive.

38.description: It was past midnight & we were hungry up in our hotel room, what to do, what to do? After calling several places for delivery only to find out they were all open but no longer delivering, my boyfriend found this place online. We called to ask if they would deliver to our hotel and the man on the phone nicely said he would check and call us back, which he did, and said that they do not normally service our hotel a couple miles away by Michigan Ave, but they would still come anyways. Awesome! We ended up ordering the B(e)LT Meal with fries, the small order of buffalo wings, and some customized fries (philly cheesesteak, Nacho cheese chili , and bacon). After completing our order, we were told that they usually do cash only but they accepted our card over the phone because we were a little short on physical money (who carries that now a days anyways?) lol. We were so happy that we found this place. The service was so awesome from being so patient and making an exception for two hungry visitors from California. The man was very nice to us over the phone so I thank him for extreme great customer service.wait time for delivery was 40 minutes. When we received our food it was actually past closing time, at 2:15am. Once again I thank this place for servicing us even though it was actually past their operating hours. Moving on to the FOOD the bacon egg lettuce tomato was hearty and they did not skimp on the bacon or give us a puny egg. It was packed, although on mine it didn't include any actual lettuce. They might have left it out to make sure it didn't wilt from the heat in the box though, no biggie. The fries- I was a little disappointed because they were a bit soggy, but once again, there was so much condensation in the box from enclosing a freshly cooked food item it was understandable. However, I think everyone should request crispy fries, just in case. The buffalo wings were yummy with delicious tasty sauce and ranch on the side. We didn't know if they were boneless or not, but that was our fault we didn't clarify that they were not boneless. The customized fries were very good, tasteful meat and a good amount of toppings. The bacon is REAL and not McDonald's fake so that's awesome. Once again fries could have been way crispier. Overall we were very pleased with this place for going out of the way for us! Be made clear, this is in no way a 5 star restaurant, it is a pub, and it serves yummy late night finger licking good food for people who are either drunk or late night munchers like we are. So, if you are looking for a late night eat with good value and service to enjoy in your home, hotel, or at the actual pub, I highly suggest this place! :)

51.description: I'm downgrading my review.  Stopped in over the weekend.  The Guinness wasn't poured correctly.  I can understand if the bar is slammed, but there was probably 5 others in there.  And the bartender has done it correctly on previous trips.  Pour it right!

27.description: Really amazing food at great prices. They also have some amazingDaily Specials.  We had the Western burger and a grilled cheese adorn with  5 cheeses, bacon, and tomato. My Bloody Mary and Jagerbomb both tasted strange. The Jagerbomb tasted as If it was mixed with club soda and the bloody mary tasted off.  So, the five stars is soley for the food alone. I cant really downgrade for the quality of drinks because they were rather cheap. If I go again I'm sticking with beer.

32.description: The food was decent. Unfortunately the waitress had trouble hearing and messed up the order twice. The service was not too great since we have to go look for the waitress...

54.description: I feel like all of the positive reviews are from made up profiles giving fake review.  Avoid this place, this was my first terrible experience from positive yelp review.

48.description: FOOD: 5 stars - Southwestern Burger with natural cut fries. 1/2lb burger with cheese, chorizo and guacamole. Fish and homemade chips. Everything was good, especially the burger and homemade chips. Husband said the fish tasted like the fish and chips he's had in the UK. Everything tasted and looked homemade. Portion size for price was also good. DRINK: 3 stars - Bloody Mary and Margarita. Both were good but not great. The $5 price each was great though. SERVICE: 4 stars - Our server seemed new but she was very friendly, fun and attentive. ENVIRONMENT: 3 stars - The inside seemed very dark so we sat on the back patio which was very quaint and quite beautiful. The neighborhood seemed a bit rough around the edges.

44.description: Very good burger & cider. Cool back patio.

24.description: loved this place. had a groupon so we tried it for dinner/Bulls game & will go back! great beer selection. the girls working were AH-mazing. the bbq rootbeer wings are not to be missed. great menu with lots to offer, cant wait to go back for a burger & mashed potatoes!

7.description: Surprisingly great bar given that you'd never know it's there unless you're looking for it. Fantastic beer list and excellent burgers. Reminds me of the small-town dive bars I grew up in.

49.description: Phenomenal service,  phenomenal wings. First time here and had a great time.  Headed to the Pink Monkey!

40.description: This place is so much fun, the bartender Kristen made us feel at home the whole time we were here the food is excellent the drinks are good the bartenders are good .haveo much fun this is a real nice place to come to make sure you ask for Kristin she knocks me out..

53.description: The ultimate dive bar where everyone kinda knows your name.  Plenty of TVs to watch the game (although sometimes you'll have to request them to change the channel from jeopardy to the big game).  The bartenders are all super nice & friendly.  The wings are fantastic. Great place to grab a brew after work and catch the game.

30.description: This is now literally my favorite bar in Chicago! The staff here are so friendly and generous and make you feel like home and welcome. love this place to death!!

46.description: Great little out of the way bar. Yes it is next door to a strip club but nothing else for 5/6blocks from there. Dark (good) beer cold (good)  wings monday 50cents (good). Great place where nothing else is close to it. Marki great bartender always happy.  TVs for all your sport watching needs Hawks Bears Sox Cubs. Had to put cubs last

1.description: I used groupons here 3 times this summer  I had bought for $5 for $30 worth of food, well I bought 2 and my lady bought 1.  So with deals like that I couldn't pass trying this place out!!!!  The first time I went with my lady for lunch and I got  a burger with grilled onions, bacon, avocado and Swiss cheese with a side of mash potatoes.  My lady had a veggie burger w/Swiss cheese and avocado and tater tots on the side,  we also had chicken nachos for appetizers. On that visit food was good service was decent.The second time I took my son for dinner it was about 5 or 6pm.  It wasn't crowded, I ordered the same burger I had the first time w/ the mashed potatoes and he ordered the bacon cheeseburger with onion rings, we also ordered loaded steak fries for appetizers.  Once again food was good service was decent.The final time I went there was with my lady for dinner and we got the same thing we had the first time except she got fries instead of tater tots .  Now here's where the service went to shit!!!!  My order was cool but her order, there was a mix up.  She ordered the veggie burger w/ swiss cheese and avocado, the waitress brought back a beef Berger.  Accidents happen,  so we didn't tripp over it but the problem occurred when we could not get the attention of our waitress because she was at the bar socializing with her coworkers neglecting us then she went to the back and disappeared for about 10minutes so we had to get the attention of another employee to to explain  that there was a mistake with her order. Our waitress  finally returned to retake her order but she returned with a very unpleasant attitude and my lady  felt like she  was being a bother to her when she retook her order.  Due to the fact that there was an mistake with her order, the fries they brought out with her original order got cold so she wanted some more hot fries with her new sandwich and said that to our waitress and she looked at her like this "mofo" here!!!! When she  brought back her food we asked for carry outs and left with no tip which I only do when service is terrible!!!Summing this up, I give this place 3*'s be the food is decent and the service is decent for the most part.  My personal opinion is the waitresses don't really pay attention to those they know don't drink because they feel they get less tips which is not true because I tip well for good service.

55.description: I finally found my wing spot.  I'm not a fancy wing person, so if you're like me, this is your spot.  Don't be fooled by the exterior.  Can we say, slightly sketchy.  But the service is awesome and I definitely recommend the wings and chicken fingers.  Some of the best bar chicken fingers.  I will definitely be back.  They also have daily specials which are great.

9.description: Small place off the beaten path. We found this using a groupon coupon. The place may not have looked the best from the outside but inside was a small hidden treasure. The prices were very reasonable the food was delicious. The service was good. We had wings, burgers, nachos, chili, and chili fries. Everyone left happy and full. We had leftover amount on our groupon so the adults enjoyed a glass of wine. We even had an Appetizer for about $60 plus tip. Would recommend.

26.description: This place is disgusting behind the bar. Men are constantly using the female bathrooms. The waitress/bartenders attitudes are awful and rude. Never coming there again!

25.description: Good food.  Good service.  Good prices.  Music a bit too loud! Nice pub atmosphere. Easy street side parking.  Liked the beer selection too. Philly cheese steak and Blt good choice.

12.description: This was an awful experience. I got here and it took like fifteen minutes before somebody actually addressed me. I was so ready to leave but too bad I was really hungry. A blonde haired lady walked back and forth socializing before she finally took my order. When she took my order, she gave me such a horrible attitude like I was HUGELY inconveniencing her. I didn't even do anything all I asked was for my food! I don't know what her problem is but she only gave attitude to me and was smiley and happy towards her other patrons. Finally after 25 minutes the food came. I ate half and asked for the rest to go because the way she was looking at me was so unappetizing. Again she acted like I was bothering her so much for a freaking carryout box. Don't come here unless you want to deal with this type of fucking bullshit. I would rather jump into a sinkhole than come back.

59.description: Wings...check...beer...check...great service..checkNothing excites me more than a place with cheap wings and cheap beer...well maybe free money!The boyfriend and I stumbled upon this gem of a place while looking for a place to watch the Blackhawks during the playoffs. At first we were kinda like umm this area looks kinda deserted and maybe we shouldn't go here since 5 squad cars of cops pulled up to the front of the door. Lo and behold the cops just wanted to eat and watch the game too. I guess we found the safest bar in Chicago then. The wings were tasty and only .40 cents a wing with 4 dollar ciders. It was a no brainer we would be coming back here again! There are several tvs all around the bar, so need to worry about missing any of the action. To be honest, this place was a lot better than we expected. Who knew great wings would be found next door to the Pink Monkey!

21.description: Try the dirty olive special!!!!! It's delicious and you won't regret it.  All you have to do is ask the bartender. They know the deal!!!  Do the right thing!!!!

17.description: What a fun local bar! We went there for lunch (with a groupon) and got the southwestern burger, poutine, and the meatloaf dish. Food was good. There was plenty to eat and the quality was good. It seemed like there was a lot of regulars there and the bartender was very friendly. She refilled our beers and gave everyone a shot of the apple flavored crown royle without any cost!  Though she was also drinking and when entering my groupon code, dropped my phone; I forgave her and tipped generously as she gave us free alcohol. It was a fun little discovery and I'll surely be back for drinks there.

10.description: We ordered from Polk Street Pub late-night delivery.  First off the mac-n-cheese bites were just terrible...it was like elbows with almost no cheese deep fried.  The burger was good and the Sheppards pie had almost no ground beef.  I also thought it usually contained corn.  The gave us bread that could have been used as a weapon.  Sorry Polk Street, but we paid a lot (and tipped well) for a lousy meal.  Giving you 2 stars out of kindness.

5.description: I discovered the bar too late, the same week I moved out of the city!  It's fairly near where I used to work, but out of my normal commute routine.  I wish I had gone out of my way many, many times to attend this hidden pub.  Don't make the same mistake I did!  Cheap drinks, chill vibe, good food, and great bartenders make this spot worth the walk, no matter where you're coming from.

3.description: Placed a delivery order for supreme nachos and a Caesar salad. The food took over an hour to arrive...I wouldn't have cared as much if the food was worth it, but it wasn't.The guacamole on the nachos looked and tasted as if it sat out all day, honestly the entire thing just tasted like it sat out all day. The Caesar salad was honestly a waste of money, definitely not worth $8. Anybody can cut up romaine lettuce, sprinkle cheap parmesan on top, throw in some burnt croutons, and add a weird salad dressing.  (This is exactly what they did) I've learned my lesson and will make sure I do groceries earlier in the day, so that I can avoid placing late night orders at mediocre establishments such as this.

35.description: I ordered food from Polk Street Pub on Grubhub because I heard the food was good. Everything came cold. Not a single thing was warm. I don't even live that far from Polk Street pub. I ordered Buffalo Wings which were good. They forgot my drink all together. The Philly Cheese steak was the worst sandwich I have ever had. 1. They forgot to put the cheese in the cheese steak. 2. The sandwich was cold. 3. The steak was gross. Hard to bite into, no flavor. I threw it out after the second bite. I usually don't give bad reviews, but this was terrible. I do not recommend this.

19.description: I want to like this place so bad....they have great food. However the terrible service isn't worth it. I am writing this review as I'm being ignored by the bartenders in an empty bar. I definitely recommend ordering online on grub hub to avoid the horrible service at this place. I'm a Chef and this is unacceptable. I would've fired this crew long time ago because I have never gotten excellent service here. So to anyone wanting to enjoy a night at the bar, you won't enjoy yourself here. If you want to try the food, (which I highly recommend) order online. I've seen the bad reviews on the food, but I haven't had anything bad here yet.

28.description: What a fun local bar! We went there for lunch (with a groupon) and got the southwestern burger, poutine, and the meatloaf dish. Food was good. There was plenty to eat and the quality was good. It seemed like there was a lot of regulars there and the bartender was very friendly. She refilled our beers and gave everyone a shot of the apple flavored crown royle without any cost!  Though she was also drinking and when entering my groupon code, dropped my phone; I forgave her and tipped generously as she gave us free alcohol. It was a fun little discovery and I'll surely be back for drinks there.

45.description: Never actually step inside this joint. This review is solely based on their delivery service and their food.I love love love their Fire Cobb Salad. They put so much love into the salad. Who doesn't want bacon and chicken strips in their salad? *sigh* I'm craving for this salad just by writing this review!My kids love their appetizer, jumbo chicken strips with teriyaki sauce. My husband loves everything from this place. We have tried almost everything from the menu. yes, we are frequent delivery customer!Their delivery also fast, although i did have one bad experience but it was solely a bad service from grubhub. I placed an order through grubhub and 15 minutes later i realized that i forgot to order something for my kids. So i called the restaurant right away and they said they haven't received any order from me! I was extremely mad. Later i found out that grubhub have a delayed order system. Basically, when you place the order online, grubhub didn't send the order to the restaurant right away. And in my case, i guess grubhub probably forgot.Long story cut into short, since that grubhub accident, i usually call the restaurant to place the order. Or ask my husband to stop by to grab dinner for us. Will definitely go back here again, maybe twice a week now?

33.description: Just ordered delivery:This is the SADDEST, most DEPRESSING burger I've ever seen!  :(And the fries are soggy and lifeless.  :'(I am sooooooooooooooo disappointed.  :(

43.description: After a Monday Night Bears game at Soldier Field a friend and I were looking for some place to grab some appetizers.  Obviously everything closes super early in the loop and since it was already 10:30 at night our options were limited.  She mentioned that Polk Street is near where we parked and after looking it up I saw they were open until 2am.  Walking in I could tell it was definitely a place for locals.  The bartenders knew most the customers by name.  We sat at the bar and ordered Cheese Fries and Chicken Tenders.  The cheese fries were made with fresh potatoes and were a thicker cut.  They were perfectly salted and the cheese was very delicious.  It was liquid cheese not shredded melted cheese.  The portion was huge for $5!!  The chicken tenders were very good as well and you can choose from BBQ, Buffalo, or Teriyaki; we got BBQ.  It was sweet like a honey bbq and I am a BWW fan and these def gave them a run for their money.  I was obviously still in my Bears gear and the people were super friendly.  The guy next to me at the bar asked about the game, etc.  It had a small-town feel which is great for being in such a big city, especially since we were basically in the loop, (or just outside).  The cheese fries will definitely bring me back to this pub if I am in the area.  Music selection was great! TV's over bar area were very convenience too.

2.description: I've lived down the block from this place for the last 10 years and I finally decided to give it a shot after I got over the fact that it is right next to a strip club. They have pretty good specials every day of the week. I came for their 50 cent wing special on a Saturday. The wings were made fresh, the meat was juicy and there was plenty of buffalo sauce. The ranch dressing was watered down, but I kind of like it that way. The couple sticks of carrots and celery also seemed freshly sliced. FYI, there is a one drink minimum with this special and there is a decent selection of beers. You can order the wings in any amount. The dressing was extra, but the few sticks of veggies were complimentary. They have a hidden patio in the back, which is nice. The tables are a little sticky and it kinda smelled like garbage.. meh. I once tried to come by on a Friday after work and the place was surprisingly packed. We ended up just leaving after no one came to take our order after 10 minutes. On this particular Saturday evening it was pretty empty, probably because there isn't the added foot traffic from the work week.I'll be back when I'm in the mood for decent wings and to maybe try out their other specials.

18.description: FOOD: 5 stars - Southwestern Burger with natural cut fries. 1/2lb burger with cheese, chorizo and guacamole. Fish and homemade chips. Everything was good, especially the burger and homemade chips. Husband said the fish tasted like the fish and chips he's had in the UK. Everything tasted and looked homemade. Portion size for price was also good. DRINK: 3 stars - Bloody Mary and Margarita. Both were good but not great. The $5 price each was great though. SERVICE: 4 stars - Our server seemed new but she was very friendly, fun and attentive. ENVIRONMENT: 3 stars - The inside seemed very dark so we sat on the back patio which was very quaint and quite beautiful. The neighborhood seemed a bit rough around the edges.

41.description: This place is fantastic!! The burgers are huge and juicy. The Irish spring rolls are to die for. The staff is friendly and attentive. And they deliver. What more could you ask for??

52.description: Ordered food from here online.  Food never showed.  No call, nothing.  Ridiculous.  Don't take online orders if you can't even deliver the food.  You don't get to do one and not the other.

50.description: This is my second review for Polk St. Pub but I believe it's warranted after 2 years. It's one of my favorite "divey" bars (that's a compliment!) and the staff is top-notch, accommodating and just fun to interact with. The menu has been stepped up and they offer a lot more than they did a few years back. I still love the wings but the burgers, sliders and home made potato chips have recently been added to my list of favs. All that and affordable prices, great daily specials and a back patio! It's a hidden gem and I'm glad it's a part of my neighborhood. And, if it's not in YOUR neighborhood, well, it's worth the trip!

4.description: It was a "meh" day in Chicago: cloudy and cold (50 degrees on the last day of May!?!). I hadn't partaken in Yelp Burger Binge Week. It was now or "No binge-burger for you!" I saddled up a Divvy and practically froze my ears with the wind chill created by the ride.I'm used to seeing tumbleweeds when I'm in the saddle, and this area of Clinton and Polk is desolate enough on a Sunday evening that I half-expected to see some. As others have mentioned, it's next door to the Pink Monkey. Wow, a strip club? I'd passed by it many times, and I'd always thought that it must be some wanna-be-hip ad agency or start-up with an oh-so-clever name.Walking in, the pub seemed very cool--an old-school wooden bar with bottles stacked on old racks behind it. No pretensions; just be yourself here. Unless you're pretentious. Then don't come. I took my stool.Lauren came over with a dance in her step to take my order. She's like a very cool younger sister; fun, energetic and helpful. I got a Jack on the rocks, and I went with the Polk Burger: grilled onions, jack cheese and an onion ring on top. Medium, please. Lauren recommended the fries.When it came, it was pure deliciousness. It was perfectly pink on the inside, crispy around the edges, with a perfectly-toasted bun to match. The two, big, fat onion rings looked so good that they needed to be eaten alone. They were, and I did. The fries were indeed good. And with attentive Lauren and the kitchen near the end of the bar, the food was very hot when I got it. I washed it all down with a $2 PBR.I left with a smile on my face, and a satisfied tongue & stomach and saddled up my Divvy for a ride into the... OK, there was no sunset, because it was still a "meh" environment outside. Maybe next time I'll ask Lauren to play "I Spy" like we're in the back seat of a station wagon on a trip to Disney World.

6.description: This place is surprisingly good! From the outside, this place doesn't look special. However, looks can be deceiving. This pub is a great place for relaxing, especially after a hard day of work!Although they don't have a drink menu, they do have a very large collection of alcohol. I ordered tonic water with grape fruit juice, which was good. We also ordered the Black Jack Burger, Pastoral Burger, and Garlic Parmesan and BBQ chicken wings... Burgers are HUGE!! All the food is very delicious. Will come back again.

22.description: It was a "meh" day in Chicago: cloudy and cold (50 degrees on the last day of May!?!). I hadn't partaken in Yelp Burger Binge Week. It was now or "No binge-burger for you!" I saddled up a Divvy and practically froze my ears with the wind chill created by the ride.I'm used to seeing tumbleweeds when I'm in the saddle, and this area of Clinton and Polk is desolate enough on a Sunday evening that I half-expected to see some. As others have mentioned, it's next door to the Pink Monkey. Wow, a strip club? I'd passed by it many times, and I'd always thought that it must be some wanna-be-hip ad agency or start-up with an oh-so-clever name.Walking in, the pub seemed very cool--an old-school wooden bar with bottles stacked on old racks behind it. No pretensions; just be yourself here. Unless you're pretentious. Then don't come. I took my stool.Lauren came over with a dance in her step to take my order. She's like a very cool younger sister; fun, energetic and helpful. I got a Jack on the rocks, and I went with the Polk Burger: grilled onions, jack cheese and an onion ring on top. Medium, please. Lauren recommended the fries.When it came, it was pure deliciousness. It was perfectly pink on the inside, crispy around the edges, with a perfectly-toasted bun to match. The two, big, fat onion rings looked so good that they needed to be eaten alone. They were, and I did. The fries were indeed good. And with attentive Lauren and the kitchen near the end of the bar, the food was very hot when I got it. I washed it all down with a $2 PBR.I left with a smile on my face, and a satisfied tongue & stomach and saddled up my Divvy for a ride into the... OK, there was no sunset, because it was still a "meh" environment outside. Maybe next time I'll ask Lauren to play "I Spy" like we're in the back seat of a station wagon on a trip to Disney World.

15.description: After today's food and service ! Was the worst I ever had, still trying to figure out how I got charged 18 for a fry between two people. The wings came out undercooked, my wings and my friends. Weren't crispy or cooked like how it usually is.. They were pink and bleeding . It was hard to get the waitress attention cause she was busy flirting with the regulars ! Also , when we ordered the wings the waitress told us the price of them?? Ok we are looking at the menu- how insulting ! Will not be back ever, I used to really enjoy this place.

57.description: Good value.  We will definitely come back.  I like the low-key relaxed atmosphere for a neighborhood pub.  Sat down at 7:30 on a Friday night, no problem.The only reason for the sub-par review is that the $9 fish fry was pretty soft.  I think it was haddock, which is just not great, in my opinion (I prefer a firm cod).  However, breading was tasty and well done, and fries were above average; kind of the natural cut kind.Beers are reasonable ($4 for a 312) and an above-average selection of bottles.  I expect to write more 3-4 star reviews in the future for this place, but want to make the stars mean something.  I can't wait to try a burger here that I am reading from other reviews.

20.description: Came here for the Black Hawks game with my bo. We had a groupon and didn't know what to expect. Service was friendly and natural. Ordered two beers and jalepeno poppers as our app-delicious! They actually put a good amount of cream cheese in the poppers and they were served with a spicy cream dip as well. We also ordered the Irish burger, which comes topped with swiss cheese, sauerkraut, and corned beef, and the me gusta burger, which came with pepperjack, bacon, hot peppers, and sriracha sauce. The pub was very busy for the game and had a lot of take out orders as well. When we asked for the eta on our burgers, our waitress apologized and gave us two beers on the house! Our burgers showed up right after, and they were delicious! Great fries, both sweet potato and regular. I saved the spicy dip from our poppers for dipping. Burgers were juicy and full of delicious toppings. Waitress was very friendly and warm. Atmosphere is of a hole-in-the-wall pub but with amazing service and food.We'll definitely be back :]

36.description: We came to Chicago early for the Michigan State- U of   M outdoor hockey game.  Found this bar on Yelp and since it was kinda close to the Hilton hotel,  we decided to walk. Note,  they have free parking in the back,  I wish we would have drove! (it's cold here!)  Anyways,  GREAT BAR FOOD and great service (thank you  Lilia !)  I had the Polk St. Sampler... Very good.  My wife had the corn beef sandwich with the homemade chips-excellent!  Good beer specials, great atmosphere,  you can't go wrong coming here.  We will be back!

14.description: Really amazing food at great prices. They also have some amazingDaily Specials.  We had the Western burger and a grilled cheese adorn with  5 cheeses, bacon, and tomato. My Bloody Mary and Jagerbomb both tasted strange. The Jagerbomb tasted as If it was mixed with club soda and the bloody mary tasted off.  So, the five stars is soley for the food alone. I cant really downgrade for the quality of drinks because they were rather cheap. If I go again I'm sticking with beer.

3.description: I have been going to Sears Optical for almost ten years and I have nothing but great things to say about Dr Gonzalez and his staff. Dr Gonzalez is super attentive. He takes the time to get to know you and to answer all of your questions. The support staff is attentive and highly professional. When it came time to pick out glasses their input was greatly appreciated. It's nice to go into a business where the staff is so professional and friendly.

1.description: Excellent service and his staff are both friendly and professional. I never felt as if products were being pushed on me at all. I originally only schedule an appointment for myself because Macy's Optical closed and I needed contacts ASAP. However, Dr. Gonzalez was able to see my son for an annual exam the same day.Lastly, while I was waiting before and after my appointment I was able to observe how he and his staff interacted with various clients...great personality, friendly, patient and helpful.

2.description: I've been seeing Dr. Miguel Gonzalez and his team at Sears Optical ever since I moved to Chicago. Even though I only see him once a year, he somehow always remembers details about me & my family. Dr. Gonzalez takes his time during my appointments and is incredibly thorough. He'a also super accommodating: I was overdue for my annual eye exam and called the office for a last minute, same-day appointment. Even though his office closed at 5pm that day, he stayed after just to see me (so I wouldn't run out of contacts)!His staff is friendly and professional, and I never have to worry about their follow-up with me. Great office :)

5.description: I took my son to Dr. Gonzalez.  He was professional and very nice.  Dr. Gonzalez explained all of my questions in layman terms.  Although, they do not have a huge selection of frames but I would recommand Dr. Gonzalez to friends and family.

6.description: I have been there twice:The first time, the experience was marginal: I was up-sold some glasses without any explanations from the clerk; also, the doctor seemed too busy to answer any of my questions; maybe he thought I was too stupid to understand.I returned for a second time about a year and half later for another visit due to logistic reasons at the time. The second time around, the experience was simply horrible. I succumbed under intense up-selling pressure from a young man to buy a year's supply of disposable contacts. I have used them uncomfortably on only 1 occasion since. He didn't even bother to understand my circumstances and was dismissive of my questions.  Again, the doctor acted like I was too stupid to be explained to. If I weren't under time pressure, I would have just left.Saving graces:The lady who showed me how to fit on the contacts was pretty patient.Hence: 2 stars instead of 1.

0.description: I am VERY late in writing this but I just found the card from this office.  Over Labor Day week-end I was staying downtown for 4 days (I live in the burbs) and woke up after the first night and realized that I did not bring any contacts.  I could have drove home (1.5 hours) and picked them up but decided to call the Sear office near me to see if I could buy a couple pairs.  I talked with Chauna Toney and she said - NO PROBLEM!  It being a holiday and all they were a bit crazy - but when I stopped in she gave me three pairs and said - NO CHARGE - just make sure to visit Sears again.I WILL CERTAINLY DO THAT!!  I was so happy on how she took care of me that I will always be a Sears customer!!

4.description: I came in as a walking which was great for my schedule. Dr Gonzalez was awesome. Answered all my silly questions about the eye and was very personable. When I went to pick up my contacts the following week, my eye was bothering me a the time and he took the time to look at it on the spot despite him being booked with appointments. Thats what doctor patient relationship is all about. I will go back!

28.description: Delivered me a diet coke canned in oct 2013 in mar 2015Just saying- check the dates. That doesnt happen on accident.

1.description: The good - unlimited sushi, rolls, some appetizers, etc. for $14.95 (lunch price). Fast, efficient service. Clean dining accommodations. The bad - No sashimi option for the bottomless sushi. If you're like me and consider just ordering sushi, and not eating the rice, then you're going to be disappointed to find out that they've already thought of that and will charge you another $1 for each leftover piece of rice. -__- The rolls are not very authentic - a lot of them have cream cheese and/or are fried.If you're a college student, this is a good deal due to the price point. Otherwise, recommend skipping it, or ordering the items you really want to eat a la carte.

39.description: Be sure to come in with time to spare. This is one of the lengthy dining experience due to the slow service (one waiter) and about two people behind the sushi bar. This dining experience started at 2:15pm and it is currently 4pm. A round of sushi took 30 minutes to arrive. The second took 40 minutes. I have the picture of the stopwatch for this dining experience.The quality of the sushi is not bad. It is fresh and time is definitely spent on ensuring perfection. They're really apologetic and I did not hear anything less than very sorry for each table of guests. Good luck with this place!

9.description: I wanted to try something  new and usually don't consume at places with less than 4 stars but because this was so close to me I said well how bad can it be. Well I dislike writing bad reviews because I believe that everyone puts hard work and effort into making something good. Well this place disappointed as I should have known per the rating of this place. I ordered crab Rangoon  and the Chicago Roll. As soon as I opened the container of the Crab Rangoon it looked highly under cooked and as I bit into it my eyes were very right. Then I tried the Chicago Roll and that has way too much mayo and it was fried and the roll was warm which is fine had this had at least some taste to it. Overall, very disappointed never again will a choose a place for convenience, I will definitely go out of my way for a place with good flavor.

29.description: Extremely disappointing. Ordered a sushi roll and tempura udon soup. The udon comes out and the broth is the darkest shade of black. I take a sip and it's unbearably salty. It's like they dumped half a bottle of soy sauce into it. I'm not one to complain about food and in my entire life I've probably only asked for food to be taken away one other time, but I had to say something.Told our waitress that the soup was way too salty, that I didn't want it, and that I would rather have chicken katsu instead. She misunderstands me for telling her she brought out the wrong thing, gets pissy and flops the menu in her hands angrily and stomps away. The manager comes and explains to me that I ordered tempura udon soup. I'm like, dude I know. I'm telling you I don't want it because it's too salty. As I speak, people around us stare, not because I'm being a dick, but because they are having bad service as well. I look around the room and everyone looks frustrated and hungry.Anyway. The katsu was mediocre and my sushi roll one of the blandest I've ever had. It's just not good, very low quality food.They have some serious problems with their kitchen and their service and I do not believe they will be open much longer.Their menus look beautiful I guess though, so that's one thing they got going for them.

23.description: I ordered delivery from this restaurant and I have to say it was nothing special. Very bland.. I ordered the rainbow roll, firecracker roll, volcano fried rice, and crab rangoon. The rolls were just ok. It's as if I purchased the sushi from the freezer at a Walgreens. I can't say that I was able to tell the difference between the fish; tuna from salmon, or yellowtail. :( The fried rice was just too salty. I ordered the fried rice with the shrimp, and I think they just poured some canned shrimp on top of the rice and mixed it up. There is nothing more disappointing than bad fried rice. The crab rangoon was ok. Did I eat it? Yes.. I was starving, but there was a bit of disappointment.

5.description: Two things pain me:- Why do I continue trying AYCE sushi restaurants near UIC? and...- Why did it happen to be a hot day and Volcano was closer than Ichiban to East campus?The later is just me being lazy and wanting an excuse to Yelp another restaurant (it's who I am okay). Volcano attracted my friends and I on the way to Ichiban because it looked like another standard AYCE joint on Taylor. After walking in and getting seated, we realized that this is essentially Ichiban 2.0, but without the claim to being "number one."Volcano was definitely a... dare I say it, even more basic version of Ichiban. At a $15 AYCE price for lunch, I shouldn't expect top quality sushi. However, there were some things that made me really unsettling while eating here:1. Service was hella slow. We were the only group inside and we had to wait a good while for our food to come out. Towards the end, when we all paid for our checks, we waited nearly 10+ minutes for the server to bring back our tabs.2. The food here was not even up to par with Ichiban. The rice was hard and it made it a complete chore to finish. My Ichiban roll's piece of tempura was terrible. Stale, limp, and NOT what you'd want out of fried seafood. I wasn't even able to finish all the rice from my sad nigiri. I also tried my friend's yakiudon, and it did not have that stir-fried taste that tells you it was made with care.3. My friend and I both agreed that we kept getting stares from the sushi chefs as we were eating. I'm not sure why, but every time I turned my head towards the direction of the chefs, they would give us these cold stares which made me feel uncomfortable eating. I felt like we were being judged, especially when I wasn't putting the entire piece in my mouth and scrapping for the ingredients. Seriously, the rice was not good here, and that's nearly half of the piece of sushi.I won't give this place just 1-star because some of the appetizers were decent, the fish quality wasn't terrible, and they didn't charge us extra even when some of us had extra food lying around. However, unless they kick it up by a few notches, I definitely don't think this is worth it. You are much better off going to Ichiban or just not getting AYCE and ordering rolls elsewhere.Parking is available on the street, but don't forget to pay! Chicago traffic po po will get you otherwise.

31.description: With a cherry on top??This place has been open a few months so I'm hoping next time I go it will have worked out some of the problems that I experienced.  This is the closest sushi place in this area and the sushi itself was not bad, and the menu looked fun. My biggest problem with them is the fact that they garnish their entree dishes with a maraschino cherry, yes, that's right. I thought they were playing a joke on me and my best friend who I went with because he is punky and has crazy hair but when I asked the waiter he said they use this as a garnish for a lot of dishes. whaaattt??. We ordered sushi carpaccio and some role and both were garnished with a cherry,  it blew my mind!We ordered a few smoothies and they were terrible, how you mess up a banana smoothie I don't know.  I'm coming back to this place and I hope they loose the cherry garnish, flower a darn radish if you want some color on the plate.

25.description: We came in at 1:30p on a Saturday for lunch and were seated right away. The waitress was slow on getting back to us after bring our waters out. Food came out relatively quickly after we placed our orders. The rolls were pretty good, although my salmon sushi pieces didn't taste the freshest. Everything else was delicious though. For $14.95 AYCE, can't complain! The girl waitress was pretty rude the last time I was here a month ago but she's gotten better. The guy waiter is awesome! Superb attentive and considerate.

12.description: Unlimited appetizers, sushi and rolls all for $14.95 is a great deal. Just don't leave any leftovers or they'll charge you. I always order the gyoza, shrimp tempura and smoked salmon and I'm never disappointed. I took my friend here to try sushi and she fell in love instantly. I have recommended this place to many friends and family and I always heard positive responses from all of them.I'm surprised by the negative amount of reviews because the food is tasty. Of course it's not going to be top notch quality food since it's unlimited, but you won't be disappointed. Yes, customer service can be improved especially for the male waiter who lacks emotion and doesn't even welcome you inside. I'm part Chinese and many Asian people in customer service seem to lack emotion for an odd reason.

37.description: Started off slow, but the maki and sashimi that came out were great and plentiful! BYOB - wish we had known ahead of time! Apps came out during the meal but again, delicious!

21.description: This place was renovated and good thing it finally was, the carpets were disgusting! We decided to try Volcano because it's close and we were picking up a few rolls and calling it an early night in. The food just wasn't very good... The rolls were different but somehow all seemed to have the same flavorless, bland and warm taste. I won't be back. I'd rather not have sushi unless I'm willing to drive to my favorite place.

16.description: This place was renovated and good thing it finally was, the carpets were disgusting! We decided to try Volcano because it's close and we were picking up a few rolls and calling it an early night in. The food just wasn't very good... The rolls were different but somehow all seemed to have the same flavorless, bland and warm taste. I won't be back. I'd rather not have sushi unless I'm willing to drive to my favorite place.

17.description: I ordered delivery from this restaurant and I have to say it was nothing special. Very bland.. I ordered the rainbow roll, firecracker roll, volcano fried rice, and crab rangoon. The rolls were just ok. It's as if I purchased the sushi from the freezer at a Walgreens. I can't say that I was able to tell the difference between the fish; tuna from salmon, or yellowtail. :( The fried rice was just too salty. I ordered the fried rice with the shrimp, and I think they just poured some canned shrimp on top of the rice and mixed it up. There is nothing more disappointing than bad fried rice. The crab rangoon was ok. Did I eat it? Yes.. I was starving, but there was a bit of disappointment.

10.description: Be sure to come in with time to spare. This is one of the lengthy dining experience due to the slow service (one waiter) and about two people behind the sushi bar. This dining experience started at 2:15pm and it is currently 4pm. A round of sushi took 30 minutes to arrive. The second took 40 minutes. I have the picture of the stopwatch for this dining experience.The quality of the sushi is not bad. It is fresh and time is definitely spent on ensuring perfection. They're really apologetic and I did not hear anything less than very sorry for each table of guests. Good luck with this place!

11.description: For the AYCE sushi buffet there's a limit on how many pieces you can order each time and that's three roll and five pieces of nigiri. I came here for the nigiri and had to wait 25+minute each times...Yea anything own by Ichiban is getting on my nerves. Never coming back again...

26.description: For my first time here it isn't as bad as some reviews make it out to be. Service did run a bit slow but nothing that would warrant a complaint. Maybe it was just because it was two of us. The sushi wasn't terrible either, I've definitely has better. But for the price your paying for the all you can eat sushi it's good, definitely got my money's worth.

27.description: Literally the worst food ever. They delivered it and everything was cold. Then the salmon was so hard and overcooked you couldn't even chew it. I called the restaurant and no one picked up. So tried again in the morning and told the manager. I even saved all the food to show them it was bad. He then told me there was nothing he could do. Sorry if a restaurant cannot stand behind what they serve they need to be shut down. Please boycott this restaurant. They do not care about their customers. Save your money.

35.description: Disappointing delivery alternative to Tatsu. While the actual delivery and service was good unfortunately the food was not. Bento Box - Chicken Yaki Soba: Blech. Greasy mess and the noodles was more like fettuccine than soba or ramen noodles. Crab Rangoon looked like someone drove over it with Fred Flintstone's buggy car. Flat, grease-soaked and dough not cooked all the way through. The tempura was ok given it does not travel well with the exception of the shrimp which for some reason they used panko vs tempura batter. The dipping sauce was very funky and not in a good way.California rolls/crunchy tempura rolls - unattractive and dull. Some of the avocado was brown. The rice was a bit overlooked. No soy sauce. Edible but definitely not something I would recommend by any stretch.Miso soup - inedible. Watery and the tofu had a medicinal taste to it.This place is a sad shadow of the former place, Tatsu. Not saying it was the greatest place but compared to Volcano Sushi it makes Tatsu seem like Alinea. This place will be closed in no-time if they don't fix the food sad to say. Generous two stars as hate to see any business fail in my neighborhood.

8.description: Some of these other reviewer are crazy.  First of all, Tatsu wasn't good either, so stop comparing.  If they were, they'd still be in business.  I'm not sure what people are expecting when they pay $15 for AYCE sushi, but I know this place doesn't warrant one star.  One guy gave this place one star for waiting "10+ minutes" for sushi.  Are you kidding me?!  I'm happy if I get my Pilsen McDonald order in 10 minutes, let along sushi.   I've been here three times since it's opened and they've gotten better with their service, speed, and preparation.  The food is decent and I'm really not complaining since I go for lunch and it cost me $15.  I enjoy both the gyoza and seaweed salad for appetizers.  The other apps are just okay.  Sushi and maki's are a personal choice.  Anyways, this place is solid.  It's nothing spectacular but given the price, it warrants a four star 'Yay! I'm a fan.'  I've had enjoyable experiences each time I've been there.  I'll be back.

0.description: Despite having the same owner as Ichiban, they're definitely better as far as freshness, speed, and organization. If you're going to do the all you can eat, i recommend eating it there.I did the to-go and the ayce limit still applied and appetizers weren't included.

38.description: For the AYCE sushi buffet there's a limit on how many pieces you can order each time and that's three roll and five pieces of nigiri. I came here for the nigiri and had to wait 25+minute each times...Yea anything own by Ichiban is getting on my nerves. Never coming back again...

20.description: Miso is tasteless, tofu in the miso soup is bland, their seaweed is crunchy! Ewwww! Portion is what you would of expect for a sushi buffet but the rice is unbearable to eat. Tasted like off the counter crap without any care in the world as for preping. Hey at least their water on tap is good because its filtered; besides that nothing else is even good.

19.description: Extremely disappointing. Ordered a sushi roll and tempura udon soup. The udon comes out and the broth is the darkest shade of black. I take a sip and it's unbearably salty. It's like they dumped half a bottle of soy sauce into it. I'm not one to complain about food and in my entire life I've probably only asked for food to be taken away one other time, but I had to say something.Told our waitress that the soup was way too salty, that I didn't want it, and that I would rather have chicken katsu instead. She misunderstands me for telling her she brought out the wrong thing, gets pissy and flops the menu in her hands angrily and stomps away. The manager comes and explains to me that I ordered tempura udon soup. I'm like, dude I know. I'm telling you I don't want it because it's too salty. As I speak, people around us stare, not because I'm being a dick, but because they are having bad service as well. I look around the room and everyone looks frustrated and hungry.Anyway. The katsu was mediocre and my sushi roll one of the blandest I've ever had. It's just not good, very low quality food.They have some serious problems with their kitchen and their service and I do not believe they will be open much longer.Their menus look beautiful I guess though, so that's one thing they got going for them.

33.description: I came here last week expecting a quick Tatsu lunch but was surprised to see that it was replaced by a AYCE sushi place. When we came in, I immediately recognized the same waiter from Ichiban who greeted us. We decided to go for the AYCE sushi. I was really hungry so the wait felt like an eternity at the moment. The service was quite slow but their dining room was packed that day and only 1 server. The server was very apologetic each time he walked by and assured us that our food will be out here soon. The sushi overall was typical of AYCE sushi and wasn't bad for the price ($14.95 for lunch). The 3 sushi chefs there take a little while to make the sushi but they do come out quite nicely. While we were, a couple next to us left because they had waited a long time and only got their smoothies. When we got our bill, the server actually gave us a discount too. Overall, the food was alright but this place can definitely improve if they hire extra servers!

2.description: If you're a picky eater craving Japanese but are just looking to get full on a budget... Volcano will work.My boyfriend and I get the $14.95 all you can eat sushi deal not because we really want AYCE, but because it would cost us more to order individual things that we want off of the menu. Weird how that works out.We're pretty hesitant about sashimi, so we mostly grab miso soup, edamame, and pretty much anything that would come out hot (like eel). We eventually ordered some sashimi...which were...edible.The problem for us was that so many of their rolls have cream cheese in them. SUSHI AND CREAM CHEESE? No. This wipes out about 3/4 of the rolls that we could order.They often forgot to bring our orders to us, but we were in no hurry and didn't mind reordering them if we had to. The service is kind of like that of... a Chinese take out place. Did they mess up? Yes. Do they care? No. Anyways, there's a 20% off discount if you are a student, just make sure you ask them when you get the bill. Ah, and if you get AYCE, you can't order a bunch and NOT eat it - they'll charge you for rice that's left on your plate!Let's pretend it's them being environmentally friendly.

34.description: Can I also say that most of the negative reviews here are from people who "loved" Tatsu? Can we get some impartial reviews up in here that didn't have one of their favorite restaurants taken away from them?Their wait times for each order of sushi are about average in terms of most AYCE sushi places and their maki is DELICIOUS. Plus, BYOB without corking fee? Win!This is not a planted post, just one from someone who's frustrated with unwarranted bad reviews that wish a business to fail before they give it a chance to become something.*Stepping off soapbox now*

32.description: This is why I have trust issues. We saw this new place and decided to try it. The food was good and the atmosphere enjoyable (other than the strange feeling of country music in a sushi joint). But my problem lied with the service. We understood there was one waiter but we had to fight for any attention. Even when we were one of 3 tables. I don't mind having to spend 3 hours eating but check in on me. It is called all I can eat sushi not give me a plate and leave sushi.

18.description: Placed an order online, got a confirmation email, my card was charged but after waiting about an hour no delivery. After calling restaurant the guy agrees to send it to me apparently it was some sort of glitch & never received my order. The delivery driver shows up about 20 minutes later with an attitude. Sushi wasn't the best either, not sure if it was prepared quickly or if it was in the delivery truck for a while but tasted dry and was falling apart when I would pick it up. Probably won't be ordering from here again.

41.description: very lousy service. we waited for at least 45 mins for our first order.overall this place is nice and it's newly opened so the service might improve.This place gives a 10% discount on all you can eat order for UIC students, so keep your ids with you.

13.description: Went here with bae on a Wednesday night, and they weren't too busy. We got the sushi buffet, with our 20% off UIC discount. The rolls weren't the best, but they also were not the worst. The fish was decent quality, but the rice had an odd consistency- truthfully, it seemed kind of old and hard. The gyoza were undercooked, as were the fried wontons. The agedashi were soft, barely breaded, and definitely were not creamy and crispy like they should have been. The cream cheese seemed to be of weird, warm temperature, and did not taste fresh. I've had ichiban before, which is supposed to be the mama to this place, and I thought that ichiban was essentially inedible when I went there two years ago. Volcano I think, is a little bit better, but still not the best. It's "okay" sushi. You might as well make the trip to Wicker Park to grab Sushi Para, for the same price. The gold dragon was the best roll of the night.The service is terrible, bae and I sat for a good twenty minutes before they picked up our AYCE sheet, and waited way too long. The waitress barely interacted with us and the service was not good. A girl at the table next to us waited TWENTY minutes for her edamame. Ridiculous.

4.description: $14.95 for all you can eat sushi?!If you're really craving for some sushi & don't want to spend the bigger bucks this place is it.ALSO, if you don't care about slow service. You can also get student discount so it's pretty awesome. Came her with my boyfriend on a sushi crave but didn't wanna go too far / spend too much.I wouldn't recommend getting anything FRESH, like their sashimi or anything but everything else is okay. I'd definitely come back just because it isn't too expensive. Alsoooo, included in the all you can eat you can pick appetizers as well like a chicken kabob, crab ragoons, miso soup, etc. (UNLIMITED!!!)

24.description: I was excited to see an AYCE sushi restaurant open close to where I live. I usually go to Sushi Para M on Milwaukee. My boyfriend and I decided to try it and we have decided we will not be coming back even though it is so close to our apartment. We ordered a miso soup, vegetable tempura and crab ragoon for appetizers. The miso was okay. It was mainly broth with a few pieces of tofu floating around and no seaweed. The crag ragoon was literally one lonely crab ragoon on a plate. The vegetable tempura was good. We ordered 7 rolls total (not all at once) and a few sushi pieces. We were surprised at how thin the sushi pieces were cut. They were as close as paper thin as it can probably get. So, the sushi pieces were disappointing. The presentation of the rolls was decent, but only 4/7 rolls were good. The other 3 tasted a bit off. They had a gamey/bad fishy taste. We thought the food was average/slightly below average at best. In the end, our bill came to $45 for 2 people. The service was fine considering that we were the only ones at the restaurant. We did notice that out second order didn't come with wasabi or ginger as they usually do. Overall,  I'd say the food is okay, but in my opinion if I'm going to pay for sushi, it'd better be worth it. This experience was not worth it.

6.description: I tried this place for the first time. Had great service- the waiter had a positive attitude, very polite as well... I wanted to try something different, which is why I ordered the ichiban roll- and let me tell you, this was not disappointing.. If you are interested in trying different flavors and textures- this is the place for you! I also ended up getting the golden nugget roll and it wasn't bad for a fried roll.. The environment is very calm and soothing... I went alone but next time I would probably bring a friend... The only thing that was odd was how the sushi chefs would look over at me once in awhile while I ate- which honestly did not make me uncomfortable at all but it did make me laugh...

22.description: Some of these other reviewer are crazy.  First of all, Tatsu wasn't good either, so stop comparing.  If they were, they'd still be in business.  I'm not sure what people are expecting when they pay $15 for AYCE sushi, but I know this place doesn't warrant one star.  One guy gave this place one star for waiting "10+ minutes" for sushi.  Are you kidding me?!  I'm happy if I get my Pilsen McDonald order in 10 minutes, let along sushi.   I've been here three times since it's opened and they've gotten better with their service, speed, and preparation.  The food is decent and I'm really not complaining since I go for lunch and it cost me $15.  I enjoy both the gyoza and seaweed salad for appetizers.  The other apps are just okay.  Sushi and maki's are a personal choice.  Anyways, this place is solid.  It's nothing spectacular but given the price, it warrants a four star 'Yay! I'm a fan.'  I've had enjoyable experiences each time I've been there.  I'll be back.

15.description: First off, if you're here for sushi that tastes good, then you're fine. If you want good service, then you're out of luck.I think the waiting staff is just the worst. None of us got a refill on our water without asking! Even when we did ask, it was given on a very untimely manner.That being said, the chefs did a good job with all the plates they prepared and I was pleased with the meal. Everything tastes and felt like how it should. Nothing special. It's an okay deal if you get your money's worth.They had some special rolls that were basic but nothing extravagant.

40.description: Came here with a group of friends for lunch ayce. Service is absolutely terrible. 3 sushi chefs but seems like only one is making sushi. Waited for an hour for our first order. The sushi is not worth the wait. Don't waste your time here. The sushi is mediocre at best.Edit:This service is seriously atrocious. Just saw a couple leave because they've been waiting too long. Why is there only 1 server?Edit:Never had such bland rolls. Everything tastes the same. Save your time and money and go elsewhere. You get full after your first round because you wait so long. The service is ridiculous.

7.description: Came here yesterday on a whim.  $15 for all you can eat sushi is a really good deal.  I had a number of different sushi.  Crab Ragoon, spicy tuna, spicy salmon, golden nugget roll, shrimp tempura roll.  I was a fan of all of them.  I also had a few rolls which had green apples in them, which was an interesting taste.   They have a white tuna roll (escolar) which was really good as well.  I didn't think I could get full from sushi, but it certainly happened.  I'd certainly come back again.

36.description: Soooo... tatsu is no longer & has been replaced with an all you can eat style Buffett. I loved tatsu, so, I just thought they were going a different direction. They aren't. This is indeed a NEW place with NEW owners. So, as much as I wanted to give this place a better rating, I just couldn't. I'm going to blame it on poor management skills and inability to properly access the supply and demand of your product. Waiting 10 -20mins or longer for your round of sushi is a bit much. Then, having to specific the number of pieces of crab Rangoon, I wanted was silly. (You mean one order means , 1piece? Oh,okay..... )Maybe they're new to the "restaurant ownership business".  Who knows but they need to get their stuff together. Ambience is not the same as TATSU. They added a ton ofLights and it allows you to see their brown wooden (not beautifully distressed walls or anything ) walls. No one greats you at the door anymore. They only had two servers on a Saturday night... Who does that? Then, what should have been a peaceful relaxed night filled with conversation and fun times was orchestrated by a constant beating noise from the kitchen. I have no clue what it could have been but every other minute you heard this loud thumping. I believe they may also need to get a new dishwasher. I had to ask for champagne glasses, two separate times before we got clean glasses. We also took the the  "bowls" for soy sauce, off of other tables since ours had a film on them. Ok ok ok. Let's talk about what was good about this place. I did give them two states. They offer a BYOB option without a corking fee. SCORE!!!!!  Now on to what is important, the food. Well, the sushi was pretty DAMN GOOD!!!! I prefer maki and they delivered each time!!!I had the Godzilla, golden nugget, and DDT. My cousin has the crunchy shrimp tempura and the other golden choice.  The sushi was so good, I had to order it twice. Since, the food was so good, I will give it another try in the next couple of weeks and give you an update.  Happy sushi hunting.

30.description: I know a lot of my friends complained about this place having really crappy service. Luckily I didn't have a problem with service at all- although I did come on a Sunday early afternoon when it wasn't busy at all. The servers weren't extremely friendly, but they did what they were supposed to: refilled water when necessary, gave the check promptly when asked, cleared plates, etc. I also luckily did not have to wait forever to get my sushi, it came in a timely manner.I wouldn't order anything from the appetizers again, except for edamame (because it's hard to mess that up). But everything else, from the tempura to the gyoza, was average to slightly bad. The gyoza was practically deep fried with a really crunchy exterior with insides that tasted like the frozen kind I get at the Asian supermarket. Not exactly what I expected nor wanted. I ordered shrimp tempura twice which I never received. But I didn't like the vegetable tempura enough to really make an effort in getting the shrimp. Sushi is average. I enjoyed my salmon nigiri but none of the rolls really stuck out to me. There is a limit of 5 nigiri and 3 rolls per person per round, but I didn't think that limit was too bad. I might come here again for lunch AYCE since its nearby. But besides the convenience, I'd look for better AYCE sushi elsewhere!
