3.description: Lunch time here with my bf. Salmon sushi and rolls are good . Others just okay. Wait for like thirty minutes since ordered. Can't really eat up all we ordered. too full.

14.description: This place was pretty quiet when we were eating on the patio, despite a lot of foot traffic on Taylor Street. The menu was pretty extensive; however only a portion of the stated rolls were available under the all you can eat option. I ultimately went with the all you can eat. The price was pretty decent for the amount of sushi I ate. That said, I'd be careful If you go that route because they'll charge one dollar for every piece uneaten. Overall I'd recommend this place if your in the area, but unsure it's worth a trip out if your way.

12.description: It's great to have a CVS close to home where you can go and get your FLU shoots and all of your pharmacy needs taken care of. Plus the store is always fully stocked with merchandise and the customer service from the entire staff is excellent.

3.description: First visit to this CVS location with a prescription.Also the last.Arrived at 4PM with a prescription.  Was told "at least 40 minutes to an hour".  Pharmacy area looked totally understaffed and there are prescription trays stacked everywhere.  Every pickup requires the clerk to look through stacks of trays - nothing in even alphabetical order.Decided to come back after the evening rush, at 7PM.  Used the drive-thru but the clerk kept asking me for the same information over and over again.  Told them I would come inside - where I found even more chaos then in the afternoon.  Turned out the clerk didn't even put my prescription into the computer.  The paperwork was sitting on a counter in a pile of other un-processed prescriptions.  The pharmacist hunted around for my prescription, then spent 10 minutes tapping at the computer like she'd never used one before.I've never understood why prescriptions take so long - all they do is paste a label on a marked, sealed box or bottle. But that's another rant.Makes me nervous when something so important is being run by morons.  I won't be going back.

1.description: The pharmacy here is ridiculously slow and unorganized. Stopped in to pick up a Rx at least an hour after it had been called in by my doctor, and was told I'd have to wait another 30 minutes. So I said I'd come back. Husband went back two hours later and it still wasn't ready and he waited another 45+ minutes. Not sure what the problem is but I'll be sending my prescriptions to Target from now on.

2.description: The Pharmacy is the WORST.I'm not commenting on the rest of the store, as it seems just fine, but after being a loyal CVS customer for twenty years at other CVS locations, most recently Logan Square, I have to say this is the worst CVS I've ever used for filling prescriptions.I've had to request prescriptions that need doctor authorization (because refills are out) three or four times before any action occurs. I've been put on hold for five to fifteen minutes every time I've ever called (I've called there a total of seven times in the past five months) and have been on hold for over ten minutes, then disconnected twice. Every time I try to take care of something on the phone, so I don't hold up the line while I'm there, I'm put off: for things I can take care of over the phone, I'm told to come in. I definitely don't like being "that girl" - the one who holds up the line due to issues - but I can't help it! You simply can't get anyone to do anything for your over the phone in advance!If there was a (safe) CVS near where I live now, I'd definitely dump this location for good.

9.description: Everyone who works here is unbelievably helpful and friendly.  It's a well stocked store and when I'm too lazy to drive to Target I get everything I need here.  I also get weekly coupons so I've gotten some good deals. They have a cash station inside and a red box outside if you need one.  Good CVS to shop at.  I've never seen any punks harrassing anyone as another reviewer stated but that's just me.  I have been here about 30 times.

10.description: The pharmacy staff is so friendly and quick. They know you and are so conversational.  They answer all your questions and give you realistic times for wait times. It is not the biggest CVS but it is a great place to get last minute things you need.

4.description: This review concerns the pharmacy; I will save remarks about the store as whole for a later time.Let's see... My boyfriend works as a paramedic for the Chicago Fire Department and was injured on duty. As such, he is medically laid up. My boyfriend sustained a back injury working a patient in cardiac arrest. When it happened, he was barely capable of walking and in excruciating pain. After medical assessment at the hospital, he was found to have a bulging disc and strained muscle. He was given 3 prescriptions: A steroid for anti inflammatory purposes, a muscle relaxant to help ease the muscle in his back and an opioid for pain relief. He went straight to this CVS after being released from the hospital to fill his medications, as instructed. The members at the pharmacy were, for lack of better words, completely disrespectful,  rude, condescending, and uncooperative. He felt as though he was being treated as a narcotic addict. He was in uniform. They refused to fill his prescriptions. YES. We fully understand the classification and control of these two particular medications. But NO. No, CVS. You are dead wrong for refusing to fill these medications. Just plain ignorance. After explaining multiple times how they were in the wrong, he finally gave up and decided to go to Walgreens. His medication was available in 10 minutes. I am absolutely disgusted and enraged at how CVS treated him and will not be returning to the pharmacy, nor store.

6.description: This might be the worst CVS pharmacy in the city - their customer service is horrible and wait times are ridiculous.  I went to this location to pick up OTC medication and it took me almost 20 minutes to pay for it despite 5 employees working behind the counter.  A total clown show!

0.description: I've been coming to this store since soon after it opened because I live nearby and want businesses in the neighborhood to succeed.  The general cashier services in the front of the store were initially uniformly completely horrible.  They have improved to the point that they are now just bad to not good.  The pharmacy services were initially very good, then deteriorated to bad, and now have become spotty and generally just ok.  The general employees should be better trained and more closely supervised.  The pharmacy staff should be held to a higher standard than it currently is.

5.description: Worst ever! Got jumped in parking lot on a Sunday afternoon. Manager didn't even ask me if I'm OK.  I was told that they are not responsible because they take the proper precautions.  They fired the guard. The cameras have blind spots. (Guess where I for jumped? )First he first tried to get my 94 yr old mom to open the door. Then jumped me and stole my phone.  All the while people stood and watched.  One was an employee. This incident cost me $1000. That i don't have.  They SUCK. Thanks for caring CVS

13.description: I have visited this place a few times and honestly I only come here because it is down the street from my apartment.  The employees are so slow, it's pretty obvious that they don't want to be working there.  The thing that upset me today is that the security guard asked me to leave my bag up in front with him, I understand that they want to cut down loss but I shouldn't have to leave my stuff for them to do their job.  And when I was standing in line, the security guard brought my stuff out and instead of handing them to me, he decided to act smart and put it on the ground about 3 feet away from me and said, "I'm not your boyfriend!"  I didn't say anything or do anything for him to act up like that.  All I did was extend my had to take my things that HE wanted me to leave with him.  That was just plain rude and honestly it still upsets me right now and it's been about 2 hours since I came home.  I'm going to avoid this crummy CVS and go somewhere else, the rudeness is not something I will tolerate.  The only reason I give this place one star is because of it's location, other than that, this places stinks.  Please avoid it, i've warned you.

11.description: Not really sure how to write a review in light of the previous two reviews.  Yes, this is a new CVS in a transitioning neighborhood.  It is near one of the best high schools in the state and adjacent to public housing.  To the north of this CVS is Little Italy and to the south is Little Village.  So yes, they have a security guard.  But you need not avoid this place after dark because they took care of that nasty vampire problem long ago.As for the clerks, they are awfully slow and unhelpful.  There is ALWAYS a long line at the front and no one seems to be able to move faster than your typical governmental employee.  The pharmacy, however, is a clear gem.  The pharmacists and technicians are very helpful and do yoeman's work helping all customers.  I've waited in line while one technician helped explain a blood glucose meter to a new-ish diabetic.  I often see customers greeted by first name.So, my fellow Yelpers, this is a clean, safe, decent store that we locals should support.  If you have a problem, especially if an employee curses at you, ask for a manager.  Otherwise that employee will still be on her cell phone (and cursing at you) the next time you come here to shop.

8.description: I have been going to this pharmacy for the last 4 years or so and I now feel compelled to write a review after yesterday's experience. There is always an issue. ALWAYS. I started going to this pharmacy when I lived in Boston and was told that it would be an easy transition to this Chicago location. This was not the case. For about 6 months every time I came to pick up a prescription they would not give it to me because they did not have my new Chicago address...basically I wasn't in the system even though I was coming twice a month to this location and had been updating my profile and insurance information each visit. I finally talked to a manager and she told me that I had 2 profiles and that it would be taken care of. Now 3 years later they still have my 2nd profile on file and I have given up on updating my phone number. They continue to call a number that I had 4 years ago so I never know if my prescription is ready. There have also been times when they have lost prescriptions that have been called in. After the third time that this happened I really was upset and I wasn't very friendly or understanding. The manager at the time told me that she had nothing to do with my past experiences (she had been there for a month) and that she had every right to refuse to give me my medication if I wasn't going to be calm and professional with her. She then asked me to verify my address so I did and she told me that the address that I had given her was not on file. I explained yet again about how no one had updated my profiles. Because she didn't feel like I was being calm ( I was not yelling but I my tone was not friendly) she told me that I had to wait in the parking lot and that when she felt ready she would come to a decision to give me my medication or not. She actually said "I have your meds right here but because I don't like your attitude I don't have to give it to you" The only reason why I waited is because I was leaving to France that same day and I didn't have time to get my doctor to call the prescription into another pharmacy. Most recently, on 3/25/15 I went to pick up a prescription that my doctor had called into the pharmacy 8 hours before I had showed up and when I got there they told me that they couldn't give it to me because they needed clarification from my doctor even though this is a medication that I have been taking for the last 4 years and she personally called it in and sent over the script. The first pharmacist that I spoke to told me that they did have anything for me. Since I am used to hearing this I asked her if she could as the other pharmacists on duty just to verify and another pharmacist told me that they had called my doctor hours ago and she hadn't called them back so there was nothing they could do. When I got to the parking lot I called my doctor and found out that no one had ever paged her. Then while I was talking to her she got a call from CVS.... they lied to me. They need more training and new leadership.

14.description: This is a pretty clean store. Most of the time there will be a line and you have to wait to checkout. There is also a security guard at this store, probably because this store is surrounded by public housing. I don't come here at night.

7.description: This pharmacy continues to screw up every single time I call in. I think their corporate offices need to look into furthering their training or bringing in new leadership. Today the manager told me that I "supposedly" dropped off prescriptions. Really I "supposedly" did it - no I know I did it. You guys clearly lost it. How do you lose prescriptions?? Extremely unprofessional. I will never go back to this location again. Every single time I've called they've screwed up on a prescription. It's not that difficult.

1.description: Constantly changing inventory of used women's accessories, coats, cocktail dresses, business dresses, and shoes being offered on consignment.Some very lovely evening bags, and a few items of jewelry caught my attention, but did not entice me into opening my wallet.This might be a good place for someone who enjoys vintage or used clothing to shop. You may be able to find a gift. The beaded evening bags were priced in the high thirties.I doubt I will revisit, but I can recommend frequent visits to scrutinize the changing inventory if you enjoy shopping vintage or used items, and to sell your gently used higher end items when you are through using them.

2.description: Great little shop just off of Taylor Street in Little Italy!  Debbie the owner so really nice and helpful and she has a wonderful mixture of vintage clothes and new clothes.  Some really cute hats and purses.  Great for any woman looking for a unique find.  Check it out!

0.description: This Consignment boutique is such a gem in the neighborhood. The store carries, clothing, accessories, shoes, and purses to name a few things. I am glad I stopped in during the summer  and to date I have purchased 3-4 great bags. Cole Haan, a leather Coach wallet, Ann Taylor Loft summer clutch and  a signature red Dooney & Burke. They carry MK, Prada and other high end names. will be in need of a summer bag, so I will be back to take a look and see what's new.Owner is very nice and helpful with your purchase.  They also accept consignment but I have yet to bring anything in to sell.

28.description: Got a meatball sandwich, chocolate milk, and a chocolate cookie. The meatball sandwich and chocolate cookie were alright, but the chocolate milk was bad since it was pretty much just plain milk with a tint of brown. Not that a BEVERAGE would ruin my view of a place, but the sandwich and cookie were just "A-OK". I'd recommend to others

1.description: Potbelly's Uptown Salad, you must be tired, because you have been running through my mind all day. This salad just became one of my top salads. I just ate it yesterday, and am seriously tempted to get it today too.

39.description: i havent eaten any type of red meat in 4-5 months. this place broke my streak. i felt extremely guilty ordering a meatball sandwich, but oh each bite was more orgasmic than the next. in total, there are 8 or so sandwiches on the menu and all are equally priced at $3.89. that alone is an irresistible deal. enormous pickles are 99 cents each (wowowowow) and soft-baked, oatmeal cookies are $1.29 each. the location is right by my sister's apartment, so if we cant decide what to eat, potbelly's is there to suffice our cravings.i gave this particular location a 3 because the service wasn't all too great. the cashier was busy talking to her friend before and during our transaction. the service was a little slow too. oh yeah, i asked for extra peppers on the side and got none. now that really hurt.

9.description: Ok so I am not a big fan of sandwhiches, and this spot didnt have a crazy menu, but i know that whatever you order they will make. What they do have is awesome salads with even better dressings. I ordered the mediterranean salad with low fat vinigerette. It was fabulous. Even though the girl behind the counter was shocked that I would order such a salad, I guess its too exotic for her. But it was great. I will be back to order it again. I also ordered a cookies and cream smoothie, (droolinggggggggggg). It was absolutely delicious. I think this experience has definately changed my mind about potbelly's.The staff is friendly, the location is good and the place is clean.

29.description: I really, really love Potbelly's.  It is sooo yummy!  Even though its my whole day's worth of sodium, sometimes you just have to go to Potbelly's.  I went in yesterday for dinner and really enjoyed my sandwich.  I got the turkey on wheat with mayo, mustard, oil, italian seasoning, onion, pickle, and lettuce.  The sandwich was exactly what I had wanted.  I also realized another reason I love Potbelly's so much, the onions are diced so you get a little bit in each bite (it's not overpowering).  This location isn't that convenient for me, but I would definitely be back if I were in the area.

23.description: It's just like any other potbelly's you may encounter.I just happen to go here because it's the closest to me.The sandwiches taste the exact same as the ones I get anywhere else in Chicago and the staff is generally friendly, never had bad service.

5.description: Always a solid and economically friendly lunch spot! The serve the best chips in the whole world - Zapps - made in New Orleans! I wish they would expand their Zapps flavors selection though! They're missing all the best ones!

31.description: trays are always sticky!

25.description: ask about the shadow menu.

12.description: I give it five star coz this potbelly is specially for me. I lived on Taylor street for one year and this place has so many memories about me and my friends from UIC. We always went there and ordered meatball sandwich. Sometimes we had soups and salad as well. Those are very tasty. Also, I have had lunch once with my parents who came to Chicago for my graduation ceremony. They liked the food too.

37.description: I like Potbelly's sandwiches. They are well prepared and are more tasty than Subways. This location is absolutely excellent! Its right on the corner of Taylor and Laflin with "ticket in car window" parking. You can really run in and out in no time. This location is not just for students, but also for workers in the many healthcare facilities in the Medical District.  The staff at this location is very efficient and friendly. There is a bus route and University shuttle on Taylor Street that is accessible for this location. This location does indeed carry S-A-L-A-D-S!!! I was just there yesterday!  Unfortunately this particular store is not wheelchair accessible which can be a concern especially located in a medical center.  Otherwise, that is my only complaint, but if staff is hospitable enough to accomodate those unable to climb the steps, then that would be great.

21.description: An Ode to Potbelly'sHow much do I love thee, O Big A WreckMake sure to add extra hot peppers, pleaseYou want to share? What the heck!I cannot share this wonderful sandwich with cheeseDon't forget the shake, mac salad and chipsIt's the best combination, hands downI would have it everyday if I could!My mouth is watering now. Yes, I am smacking my lips.When I am enjoying this, you will never see a frown.This California girl cannot believe how it's SOOOO good!

16.description: Normal food quality for the chain. Very dirty restaurant both behind the food counter, drink station and at the seating. I'm surprised they haven't gotten written up lately by the city's food and sanitation inspection agency.

17.description: Love Potbelly and I think I've tried it all over the years, sandwiches, shakes, salads.  Pretty much all Potbellys are consistent with their menu items.  Lately I've been on a Hammie kick so we've been to this particular one about 4 times in the last month and just again tonight for dinner.  Love this location but parking on Taylor can be difficult since this is a busy area. Usually order the Hammie with just mustard, or the mushroom melt.  I'm not crazy about tuna, but I do really like the tuna sandwich here ('here' meaning all Potbellys, Taylor location included)...and the Wreck salad is also great.  Zapp's potato chips also available.Plenty of eating space inside, choice of booths or tables.  Good corner store location with lots of windows.  Since it's on UIC campus, we notice a lot of students coming in to eat and study.Staff is friendly and service is pretty quick, sometimes the line can go slow depending on what people have ordered, but it seems the staff does its best to move people through.

10.description: I've ordered Potbelly's sandwiches many times before and they're normally great. Today was the extreme exception. While chomping down on my Italian sandwich I bit into something super hard that turned out to be 2 little rocks. That's right, I bit into rocks! Besides being painful it was really gross.I called Potbelly and spoke to the manager who was very nonchalant about it and he never apologized, he just asked me to send him a picture of the rocks. My next step was to call corporate, the woman that I spoke to was much nicer and apologized profusely. She did tell me some disturbing things though. She said that it has happened before! She said that she thinks it probably came from the lettuce or probably bakes into the bread. Needless to say my jaw dropped when she was describing to me how sometime the rocks can be baked into the bread by accident and how there even was a time that a stone was found in the berries... yes, she actually said that! She then asked for my address to send me complimentary coupons for sandwiches which I do appreciate but after all this I don't know if I wanted to eat there in fear of losing a tooth!! Since it seems like this happens frequently, I'm shocked they don't take measures to try to fix this huge problem.

11.description: Try the Mediterranean sandwich. It's mouthwatering.

26.description: Good foodGood serviceDelivery, carry out, eat inNow they've branched out into salads, more sizes of sandwich, etc. their prices have risen noticeably.Still a tasty grilled sandwich.I prefer the turkey hold the mayo and oil with hot peppers and all other ingredients on whole wheat skinny.Their new Mediterranean sandwich on whole wheat is very tasty!

27.description: I've been to this location a few times and I have yet to be disappointed.  Food is really good, service is awesome, place is clean. What more can you all for for a quick cheap lunch? I had an oreo shake at the most recent visit and it was delicious, i'm craving one right now actually.

35.description: It's Potbelly's, the food is pretty much standard from location to location.  I always get the roast beef with no mayo because for whatever reason I have deemed most white condiments to be the work of Satan.  Possibly because I am insane.  I don't go to Potbelly's a whole lot, but I noticed at this one they actually have a soup of the day.  At the one on Damen, every time I've been there they've had the same two soups.  So yay for this location.  They were quick and friendly and have never fucked up my order by putting dreaded white condiments on it.  I'm glad that they got people through the line today because if the line was long or moving slowly I would have answered the siren song of the portly Italian ladies and their Italian beef at Patio at the expense of most likely over 500 calories more.  So, Potbelly's my own little belly thanks you for your speed.

8.description: An Ode to Potbelly'sHow much do I love thee, O Big A WreckMake sure to add extra hot peppers, pleaseYou want to share? What the heck!I cannot share this wonderful sandwich with cheeseDon't forget the shake, mac salad and chipsIt's the best combination, hands downI would have it everyday if I could!My mouth is watering now. Yes, I am smacking my lips.When I am enjoying this, you will never see a frown.This California girl cannot believe how it's SOOOO good!

0.description: This place never disappoints. I always get the wreck on wheat with no tomatoes and my wife gets either the chicken salad salad or chicken salad sandwich. The staff are always polite and we sometimes call our order in beforehand and they have it waiting for us when we go to pick it up. Kudos to the work you guys do, keep it up!

38.description: Great little Potbelly's location located across the street from RoseBud and Hawkeyes Bar & Grill in Little Italy on Taylor St.  When I have time to walk over from campus I will go here for lunch compared to eating the over priced healthy food & the fast food provided on campus.  If you are a UIC student and haven't checked this out, please do so before you graduate!  There aren't many seats so go on off lunch hours and they can be slow at times or lack a full stock of chips after the lunch rush.  Bathrooms are confusing to find at first, in a back hallway, but are always very clean and neat and look like new each time I've visted!  Most Taylor st places give students a discount (not sure if potbellys does) but if they do no better reason not to try them at this location! :D

20.description: Great atmosphere. Good delivery and order in. Employees are generally friendly. If you've been to any Potbelly, this one is the same as others.

19.description: I love coming into this location especially because I live right down the street. Staff is always friendly and are quick to make your food. I went in the other day and the computers froze on the lady working the register but she was extremely apologetic and was super nice.

33.description: Soooo frustrated.  I should wait until I'm not this frustrated to write this review, but I'm consistently frustrated with this location.  The lines are slow and the order takers are always doing that thing where they try to yell over six people to get your order so they can get the orders in and wander off while everything else gets backed up.I love the bike delivery guy idea but, seriously, how much are they paying these poor souls?  Hire a couple more.  Two hours is an absurd delivery time for a place down the street.   I think I'm finally going to give up on this game.  There are other places in the area.  Thanks for playing.

2.description: Absolute WORST.  Was to have an order delivered between 2:45-3 pm.  Waited until 2:57 to call to tell me that the order is not in the delivery area.New manager - learn your delivery area so you can rectify issues BEFORE the delivery time.WILL NEVER ORDER FROM HERE AGAIN!!!  Even for pickup as it seems you don't deliver to my area.THANKS FOR NOTHING!

34.description: If you're in this neighborhood with literally dozens of locally owned food choices why are you going into a chain?

32.description: You can probably see on my reviews that I go to a lot of Potbelly restaurants and this is the one that is closest to my new job. I have not had any complaints about the speed of service. i am usually in and out of line within a couple of minutes. Everyone needs to remember that it is the toaster that makes the line slow!The pop machine does have cherry coke (a plus for me) and their peppers on the side are free. The only bad thing is that street parking is pretty terrible if you go at lunchtime.

18.description: Terrible experience. Ordered lunch delivery today. Supposed to arrive between 1:15 - 1:30. It's 2:05 and delivery just arrived, after two phone calls to the store. And, the driver just called and refuses to park outside of the office, or pay a quarter in the meter, and instead wants us to come downstairs. The driver was very rude, and kept complained that she doesn't normally do deliveries and that her shop should have stopped taking orders. They also forgot the potato chips. This is ridiculous and I will never order from here again.

13.description: It's just like any other potbelly's you may encounter.I just happen to go here because it's the closest to me.The sandwiches taste the exact same as the ones I get anywhere else in Chicago and the staff is generally friendly, never had bad service.

4.description: The workers were so kind! I made a mistake on my sandwich order and the woman kindly remade it ! The woman also came out and made sure our food was okay, which I didn't expect but really appreciated. Knowing the service was this good I would happily come back to this location

24.description: It's fast, it's cheap, it's delicious. I absolutely love their veggie sandwich (mushroom melt) with everything on it and extra hot peppers.

6.description: I tried their new Mac n Cheese and it gave me the runs. Don't go here, I feel like this location is unclean compared to other locations. I also always feel sick and heavy after eating here. Don't know why...

22.description: Great sandwiches...just like all of the other Potbelly chain stores.

15.description: Good foodGood serviceDelivery, carry out, eat inNow they've branched out into salads, more sizes of sandwich, etc. their prices have risen noticeably.Still a tasty grilled sandwich.I prefer the turkey hold the mayo and oil with hot peppers and all other ingredients on whole wheat skinny.Their new Mediterranean sandwich on whole wheat is very tasty!

40.description: Although I absolutely love Potbelly's this location is not my favorite.. they don't have salads and they always have live music.  Sometimes the live music is good but other times it just sucks and its not what you want to be listening to while you eat

7.description: A wreck salad was what I wanted and this is what I got. I absolutely recommend it since it has everything and than some when it comes down to a truly good salad.  It was really filling also in that it is filled with the best things that a salad cab have. This location of course is the one I come to at lunch time, but if you are going to swing by at lunch time be prepared for a small wait. Which of course is not the biggest problem this location has, parking is a headache but if you swirl around you may be lucky and find a free spot, but don't count your chickens before they hatch since most of this area is crammed with meters to accommodate the Mayor's vision of us not being able to park for free, but look around you may find one spot open. I was disappointed that I didn't see the PB&J sandwich any longer. Or maybe its just this location. I really hope they didn't discontinue it because that is the one comfort food that Potbelly had that really always made me smile. So go ahead and check them out.

36.description: Great Potbelly Sandwich works.Only gripe is the .50 cent cheese on the chilli.Staff excellent, product perfect, and location is awesome.Nice and roomy and cosy.Great for a meal under $10.00Ren H they do have salads I saw two being made tonite!

30.description: I've reviewed two potbelly total on the yelp, I think this the third and really why? since they are all the same.  Well, that's precisely why....to declare  the outstanding consistency of this former "one of a kind" sandwich shop. I moved to Chicago in '97, went to the original Lincoln location shortly thereafter and quickly became a fan.  I can honestly say that the sandwiches they put out at every Potbelly i've been to since (and that's a ton) are pretty much exactly as I remember well over a decade ago.  The Wreck, Tuna and Turkey are my go to's and never leave anything other than totes satisfied.Imagine that, *another* chain that got it right.doh!

3.description: This location is the worst.  Don't order delivery unless you don't mind waiting 90 minutes past the promised time.

14.description: Don't order online. It won't be ready on time, and they'll mess up the order. Otherwise, this Potbelly is pretty good. Friendly staff usually.

1.description: What a great addition to the area. I was like a kid full of candy walking around this store.  So many home Decor ideas Love how the store was very well organized and neat. I like the great customer service I'm a candle person so I had a great time placing candles in my cart. Now I'm off to the lamps and pictures Beautiful and very unique. I found stuff from every department that I like. If you are having guests over and you just won't to put some jazzy Jaz to your place come shopping at this place.You will score big and won't break the bank. I left this store saying I'll be back to spend more of my money. And a very happy shopper.

0.description: Finally a Pier 1 in the South Loop! This one is small, but stuffed with goodies. The employees are friendly and there's a big clearance section. Looking for pillows, glasses, or a hostess gift? This is the place to go!PS - Free parking garage around the other side of the building.

58.description: Gosh I feel like crap for giving this a bad review... the girl who did my hair was so nice but I could tell she was inexperienced... I did not get the haircut I wanted - in fact I got an even worse haircut than I had before.I wanted bangs that framed my face - I said that like three times. I think if the student had done it it would have been better but her boss tried to show her how to cut them. she did not do them right and cut them way too short the first time around and I did NOT want them blunt - guess what I got? blunt bangs. -sigh-. I asked the girl if she could curl and style my hair - her boss comes over and said "well do you want it like mine? because thats a special style." I said sure. Tonight is a special night and I wanted to look good. the "special" style is just curling my hair... there is nothing special about it. I saw her teach the student. On top of that she told me it was her first time doing it that way! :( I wish the student would have just done it her way I think they would have come out good. I told her to keep using hair spray because my hair is super thick... when i came home it was like I never even got my hair cut - sans the blunt bangs I didn't want... My hair literally drooped down and right now as we speak I am looking at it and its horrible. its just hard and i can't even comb it out... its not even curled but it looks like dreadlocks... I'm on the verge of tears because I wanted to look great tonight and now im going to look even worse than I started... I am willing to give it another go because I really liked the girl doing my hair if it wasn't for her teacher who kept telling her to do it the way I didn't want! :(  i'll update this later....

56.description: I have one word for this experience - awful.I wanted to update my color. Because of the 'Great Recession' I have been using box products. I get it - it is not ideal. Because of my inexperience my hair kept getting darker and darker brown, which is not flattering to my light complexion. I decided to go to Paul Mitchell for two reasons: 1. Price and 2. a professional consultations.The woman assigned to me a, a Phase II student, didn't have great listening skills and didn't seem to have a passion for hair at all. I was told Phase II students have tested in and been accepted by Paul Mitchell. I was very disappointed. My goal was to lighten my overall look. Daisy suggested highlights. We looked at light blonde/brown and red and Daisy had no firm recommendation either way. I went with red thinking the look would be more subtle.The price factor: the advertised price was $32.00, I walked out paying $98.00. Guess what? Highlights are extra and I needed 3 extra bowls of color, which I signed off for each time. Since my lawyer wasn't with me, I just took the plunge and initialed and signed. My hair is cut in a bob - just one inch below my ear, it does not hang to my waist, FYI. I can just imagine how many bowls of color people with waist length hair require. When the instructor asked how I liked my color, I explained it was too dark and the highlights looked like red stripes on my head. My hair is the darkest its ever been. My friends are teasingly calling me "Morticia".The instructor asked how I would like to fix it? "highlights? an over all color?" I explained, again, I don't know their business. I was looking for a consultation and a recommendation. I was looking to lighten the look - not darken it. The school did offer to do a color correction for free. I said I'd like someone else than Daisy. They replied "we want her to learn". Fair enough.Even though this 'color fix' would've been free, I've canceled my appointment. I'm going to go to a pro and pay the same price, and walk out with something I'm sure will be right for me.I hope Daisy is grateful and not angry with the feedback and I hope she switches schools and studies accounting. She doesn't have a gift or a passion for hair.

29.description: I should have listened to my instincts.   Everyone that I talked to said they had a great haircut with a lvl 2, so I said what the heck.   Mind you I had very long hair to the middle of my back and almost all one length.  I just wanted 2 inches off the bottom and shaped around my face in the front. Easy Peasy that's why I went to the school.  Not totally.  He just kept cutting and cutting on the side until I'm like "whoa"... Like I was getting a boy haircut on the top.  Then I had two other superiors trying to fix it.  End result, I can't even put it in a ponytail.  I refused to pay for it.  I've been crying all day.  BIG MISTAKE going there. Tina Turner from the 80s is all I could say.

42.description: I want to give this salon  4-5 stars. I really don't consider this a school because I get better quality service here than I do at normal hair places. I have been coming here more than a year and never had bad hair cuts. They have two phases. Phase II students are picked by careful selection and audition whereas as any student can give you a haircut in Phase I. Phase II services are more expensive. Normally I use Phase II but recently, I tried Phase I for the first time.It is as good as- maybe even better than Phase II. I have to share my positive experience. I went in for a shampoo and blow dry. The Phase I student hair stylist was confident and tackled my really long hair without any complaints. I have hair until my mid back and other hair salons (not Paul Mitchell) usually make comments on how hard it will be or how long it will take. I don't need to hear comments such as that especially because I usually end up tipping them double the cost of the blow dry service. However, the student stylist at Paul Mitchell never complained and did my hair by herself. It was only when I nicely told her I was in a hurry that she asked one of the other girls to help her. Even by herself, the student assigned to me was very quick and would have finished my hair in less time than I normally spend at Phase II. She did an awesome job- even added curls with the blow dryer to the ends of my hair. I also noticed that she didn't skimp on the products she put in my hair. My blow dried hair stayed beautiful for 4 days. Later on I found out that she was a novice but honestly if she hadn't told me that, I would have gone on thinking that she was close to graduation (she was that good!). Bottom Line: Try out Paul Mitchell. Based on my recent experience at Paul Mitchell, I feel that Phase I and Phase II students are equally as good but Phase I might be a little better because it is cheaper. The students really listen to your requests and do their absolute best to follow through. They all have an instructor with whom they discuss the plan of action as well as an evaluation when the hair service is finished. At the end of the day, both Phases have a great knowledge of hair and each phase have students with varying degrees of experiences doing hair.  TIP: Everyone must try Paul Mitchell for cheap but 5 star salon worthy hair services. Phase I and Phase II are both awesome.

23.description: Horrible place, my hair is still falling out after my coloring.  Don't waste your money.

47.description: Ask for Dominique!

8.description: I am a current student at this school and I DO NOT reccomend it to other people considering a career in cosmetology. You'll find that this school is money hungry for themselves and they really do not work with you to better your skills. MOST of the teachers have NO salon experience and have just recently graduated from the institution. Very strict, unorganized, anxiety inducing, and just plain unpleasant. Wish I could've gotten out while I had the chance.

31.description: I was definitely a bit skeptical about coming here, but I'm so happy I did. I didn't have time to make an appointment, so just walked in and told reception I needed a quick cut. The only available person was in Phase Two, which is the more advanced students from what I could tell. It is $6 more, but I didn't mind. I was put with Alyssa (199 I believe) and she did the most amazing job. I can't even believe how cheap her service was! I would have paid triple that just to get her to cut my hair again. She gave me an awesome bob and kept the conversation flowing the whole time. I can tell she genuinely cares about her clients and was beyond impressed with her skills. I will be coming back to Paul Mitchell to see her!!

34.description: If you're going there, you know you like it cheap cheap. Every time you go, you have to sign your life away so they know you won't sue them. They just want to make sure you understand that students are working on your hair, so don't expect too much. I do like going there and I have been there several times. However, I stopped going because I could never find the time to go. If you go, be prepared to spend an eternity there. The students have to get their teacher's approval before they start to work on you. Waiting on the teacher to approve takes the longest time. And they have to get a dozen approvals, not just one. I usually go get a cut and a dye job. I have dark black hair. In order to dye it red (fire-engine red), they need to bleach my hair first. I usually have to stay there for 5-6 hours. I'm always the last customer to leave. If you dislike your cut/color, they will offer you a free redo. I had a redo twice. I'm always happy the second time around.  I always had a Phase One student, and it's fine. I try to get the same girl, but for some reason the ones I like are gone by my next appointment. The environment is nice. It's clean and comfortable. Everyone is friendly there.Every time I wanted my bangs to be trimmed, one of the teachers do it. I have never seen a Phase One student do it, so that might be a good thing. Be patient if you decide to go there. They are still learning and they try to do their best.

16.description: If you're going there, you know you like it cheap cheap. Every time you go, you have to sign your life away so they know you won't sue them. They just want to make sure you understand that students are working on your hair, so don't expect too much. I do like going there and I have been there several times. However, I stopped going because I could never find the time to go. If you go, be prepared to spend an eternity there. The students have to get their teacher's approval before they start to work on you. Waiting on the teacher to approve takes the longest time. And they have to get a dozen approvals, not just one. I usually go get a cut and a dye job. I have dark black hair. In order to dye it red (fire-engine red), they need to bleach my hair first. I usually have to stay there for 5-6 hours. I'm always the last customer to leave. If you dislike your cut/color, they will offer you a free redo. I had a redo twice. I'm always happy the second time around.  I always had a Phase One student, and it's fine. I try to get the same girl, but for some reason the ones I like are gone by my next appointment. The environment is nice. It's clean and comfortable. Everyone is friendly there.Every time I wanted my bangs to be trimmed, one of the teachers do it. I have never seen a Phase One student do it, so that might be a good thing. Be patient if you decide to go there. They are still learning and they try to do their best.

13.description: Wow! What a fun and great experience!  After reading the reviews I was a little scared to walk in the door, but I am so glad I did!  Ebony cut and styled my hair today, and from the start she was so professional and personable! Her and the instructor communicated with me throughout the appointment to ensure understanding of what I wanted done.  She didn't just start over confidently hacking hair of leaving in a crying mess later that day.  The instructors were very attentive and engaged throughout the whole haircut.  Thank you Ebony, stylist #82.

11.description: Nate is amazing!!! (Ask for him) Kelly is always so sweet. The facials are so relaxing. My hair always feels great when I leave. Love this place

39.description: They used to be good.  The leaders were watchful and would step in when they saw that their students need assistance.  Those days are gone.  I received one of the worst  haircuts of my life earlier today.  I don't blame the student, I blame her leader for being neglectful and then for trying to placate me at the end. Yes, because the 1 hour and 45 minutes of my wasted time aren't enough now you want to try to fix something that you should have been watching out for and have me waste more of my time when I clearly should just leave and go somewhere where people actually care about their work ethic.I've been going here on and off for years.  I used to recommend it to friends and co-workers.  Never again. Just stay away and save yourself the tears.  I have to go pay +$120 to have my hair fixed.  It's not that you get what you pay for, it's just pure ineptitude on the part of the leaders. How can the students be great if they don't have the guidance they need?  Just saying.

37.description: $15 for a good haircut - wash and blow dry also included! The school is very conveniently located in UIC's campus, so it was perfect to be able to get a haircut in between classes. They are very professional and make everything pretty straightforward. You can schedule appointments online, the prices are great, they have a nice open space with lots of products to buy in the front of the shop. My stylist was great! They go through a step by step process and that includes talking everything through so the stylist knows what you want and they in turn tell you how they're going to give you what you want. Before they cut, after they cut and at the end other stylists (I'm assuming they're master stylists or managers) check in with you and your stylist, ask you questions, make sure you're happy. I felt super important! But they just insured that I was satisfied with everything - which I was! I would definitely recommend going here if you're on a budget, or even if you're not - the students here know what they're doing!

0.description: I went here for a trim and am happy with the result. The reason I'm not perfectly happy is because I asked them to trim a lot shorter than they did. I asked for three inches to really clean out the split ends (I have long hair and it gets stuck everywhere) but she did maybe one. Emphasis on maybe. My phase 1 person still managed to really clean up my hair so I didn't say anything AND she was really great at remembering what I asked for and repeated it to every teacher that came to help her. The downsides were that she used cold water to shampoo my hair and didn't wash the back of my head. While in the chair, she managed to get the comb, the brush and her fingers in my eyes more than once. Still, I really liked her because she tried and she was really focused. She didn't mess anything up, didn't chop off half my hair and didn't chat my ears off. Big plus! It would be a smart idea to have some kind of evaluation system after the service so that the teachers can see what clients really think.

38.description: This place is HORRIBLE. I am an avid fan of the Aveda School and highly recommend them. I got a full highlight here. They kept nickel-and-diming me the entire time on my short hair: "We need to mix another bowl. It'll be an extra $40. is that ok?" I mean, WHAT AM I SUPPOSED TO SAY? I can't just leave at that point!My full highlight came out brassy and was left on way too long since the student was taking forever. for.ev.er. Like, 4 hours for hair just below my chin.  Not only that, the foils were not wrapped properly so they slipped down.  Absolutely NO supervision by the "instructors". They were all standing around and chatting. Never again! I had to go to a real salon and pay $180 to have my hair fixed the next day.

51.description: I understand that this is a school, and that learning from mistakes is part of the process. That being said, the results of my highlighting--done by a Phase 2 student who is graduating in April--leaves a lot to be desired. The fact that the student put five different products in my hair before blowdrying made it so that I did not get a good look at the results. It was only the day after that I was able to actually see the result of my highlight, which was a few stripes of blonde, not even to the root, making it look like I have 3 weeks of grow out. It is a scary thought to me that Paul Mitchell allows students with questionable skill to get this far in the program. Maybe it speaks more to the learning leaders. In any case, I wish I had read the reviews here before my appointment. I thought I was doing myself a service by asking for an appointment with a Phase 2 student, but evidently that is not the case. Be wary of skill level, and try to schedule with a student from a personal recommendation.

27.description: First thing to acknowledge here is: you are going to a school. They are TRAINING to be professionals. They are NOT YET professionals - don't get mad at the students. If there is a problem the teachers/senior stylist are there to fix any bad hair situation.I went here a number of times and had the same hairdresser. She was good for a student. This last time I got a new stylist. She was fine too for a student. I am not supper fussy about my hair and I experiment. I also acknowledge I am going to get my hair done by a student so-you get what you pay for. I left satisfied with my new hair each time. My complaint isn't about the students its about the customer service.My last time I went there I submitted a review to get a discount and for one reason or another they denied me my coupon for product. That was the last straw after the day or poor customer service. Here it goes. On my way there my phone rang and I let it go to voicemail. It turned out the school called and told me my girl was gone for the day. "Thats fine, so who's going to do my hair" I asked, "We'll have to reschedule" the service rep said. That was not an option for me. There were a few times I've had bad customer service there before - but they didn't have to push me out by brushing me off.

32.description: I just went in yesterday. I had the best experience ever with Jasmin and Claudia! They were so patient with me and so pleasant. My hair is goegeous! No one could have done a better job. This is not my first visit here. I have been here 5 times. Every time tops the last. Thanks Paul Mitchell! Try the awwapuhi products....they are AMAZING!

54.description: I love this place! All the students are so professional and make such knowledgeable suggestions for your hair. It makes you feel like the teachers are doing such a great job educating their students. I'm writing this review with my student stylist, Steven, in mind. HE WAS AMAZING! He made me feel like a million bux, gave the BEST shampoo of my life, and did such a great job with my trim and deep condition. I actually went in just for a trim, but after looking at my hair and asking me questions about it, he suggested the deep condition. What I liked about his suggestions were that they were not pushy at all, but he just explained the benefits of it. I don't remember the type of deep condition it was, but it really did improve the look and texture of my hair. Steven was so enthusiastic and also gave me a fantastic blow dry (I made myself go out that night, I just looked too cute not to :P ). Although it does take  longer than a regular salon experience, it is still worth it. Everyone here is so nice and very hospitable. The front desk girls are really good at accommodating you and your schedule. I'm going back this weekend, after a long awaited appointment with Steven (I think word got around about how talented he is), for a cut and color and I can't wait to see what he does with my hair this time!

48.description: I am a licensed professional who takes hair classes exclusive to cosmetologists. I signed up to take the 3 day mens course at their academy. the cost is $860.00. I signed up months before the class, went to the school the week before to clarify and ask questions about the tools needed. got all ready and excited. I came prepared and ready to boost my hair skills.okay, heres what happened!I followed the instructions very specifically arriving to the school 30 minutes early. but when I got to the school the door was locked. I was baffled why the door would be locked when people are expected to show up. I noticed only by observing from affare a side door, apparently they have a side door for professionals, so I went in by following another attendee. the second and third day, they kept the professional entrance locked and both times I had to knock hard for their assistants to hear me and let me in. I found it "not smart" to ask people to attend and keep the door locked on the attendants. well that was a small issue.During the morning of the 1st day of this hair class, I got a bad impression. I did not personally like the teachers' manner and style of teaching but I took that as a personal opinion and decided whether or not I like him personally does not reflect his knowledge, ability to teach or the content and value of the class. so my gut was telling me something was up, but I made excuse's to myself because I really wanted to like this class.one of the major parts of hair classes and this class is doing technical practice on mannequin heads. during the same morning the teacher asked the assistants to find the male mannequin heads. they looked in boxes and all around. then we went to break. well it turns out, I know this from over hearing the teacher in the hall yell at his assistant and question on of the co workers, the school did not order or have mannequin heads for the class. this is a major aspect of the class the school was supposed to provide for and the completely flopped on it. the first day we used women heads, the 2nd and 3rd day we head male heads.another feature of the class was supposed to be working on models. I was promised by an email from a representative for the advance academy that I would do at least one model, one real person to do hair on and I did. one of their students. infact, the whole class got hair school students for the models, which really means no people from outside came in and they rushed to the class rooms and grabbed all the males they could find to provide us. the teacher expected us to work on models the next day but on the 3rd day during the morning he announced we wouldn't be working on models because no one came in.thats the whole point of my dissatisfaction. they had months to prepare for the class, just as I did preparing. I checked my tool list a week before the class. they never checked if they had the mannequin heads, they didn't even know until the actual class. and they had weeks to book men to come in for that monday and tuesday, to get a free cut by licensed professionals polishing their skills. but with all those weeks and day, they never booked models for the class. and how could they possibly believe that by chance over 11 or 12 men would randomly walk in, exactly ar 10:00am on the monday and tuesday and magically by chance, the models would provide themselves? thats impossible to assume. you need to book people to ensure there men for the hair class! how else and where else will they come from!?!? and I can make this criticism because I have taken courses at other academies and other hair academies manage to prebook all their models for every day of their course for every student. every student is ensured they will work on a model and the school gets peoples names down who agree to come in at their appointed time for their free haircut. so its not impossible, other schools are doing it, why cant Paul Mitchell???and in my personal opinion and professional one as a working hairdresser, the content of the course was hair school basics. I already work on mens hair. this is an advance course to up-notch my skills, not give me basic skills like im a newbie.compared to other hair courses I have taken on cutting mens hair, this did not match the quality and professionalism other academies are preforming at. I did not ask for my money back. I did write down these issues on a survey of our experience. but I am a big spender on hair classes and by fudging this one, they lost thousands of dollars I would've spent in the future if I were satisfied. I WILL NOT come back to their academy. YOU CANNOT MAKE MISTAKES WHEN YOU ARE CHARGING NEARLY ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS, ESPECIALLY TO PEOPLE WHO ARE ALREADY LICENSED PROFESSIONALS. they were supposed to exemplify what professionals should live up to, they didn't.

44.description: I wanted the Paul Mitchell experience but received a sticker shock.  The positive side, the student was very professional. The negative side was the prices, any hair process started at a certain price. I was shocked when the student asked me if I wanted my hair blow dry and style for an additional cost of $12. I left with my hair wet. This is first time I was ever told that I had pay extra for styling. If you go there bring a lot of money.

24.description: I wish I could review their work, but I can't.  When I made the appointment for the morning, using their website, the website confirmed a 9:30am haircut.  According to the receptionist, their haircuts don't start until 9:45 at the EARLIEST, although there were plenty of people around me not only getting haircuts, but at the end of the process.  Apparently, in a room full of stylists who were all cutting and applying hair dye, their stylists don't come to work until 9:30 and they need time to set up so it would be at least 15 minutes.  So sad, because I have been to the one in Tinley, which is much better, although I work in the area of the University Village.  They desperately need work on their professionalism.  If they don't have appointments until 9:45, then their website should not allow people to book for 9:30.  Due to her condescending attitude and that it seemed like she did not want me to get my haircut there, I left.

7.description: Left looking like a Bridgeport bingo lady.All I wanted was a razor taken to my short hair and feathered a little.My request and my short hair should have been the easiest peasiestcit  for the shop that day,I believe the Level 2 stylist didn't even know how to use a razor andtried to distract from that fact.No I do not want to hear about your personal life!!!!I don't care to hear about some violent ( prob drug) situation the father of you child got into..That was the last straw of many last chances for PM for me.I go way back here and in years past have had some great cuts and colors.The last year or so i have had one bad cut after another.Appalling . Many students  don't even know  a basic bang cut!Now it seems even students in LEVEL 2 don;t even know the basics?Years past  the supervisors  of the student stylists were far more attentive.Now they just pretend they are supervising the student,.Years past the supervisor would ask each student stylist after you sat in their chair" What are we looking for today?"Pretend , pretend, I won't be back.Had my hair  fixed at a nearby shop hours later.

49.description: I was being seen by Tracy a couple of years ago (3-4 times) until she graduated. I took a hiatus from Paul Mitchell, but recently went in for a cut and color (ombre) and was worked on by Symyra. I have VERY long/thick/straight hair and always go into PM with the mindset that if anything goes wrong I can 1. always have it fixed and 2. my hair will grow back in 5 minutes anyway (I swear it grows like weeds). With that being said, I generally don't have much anxiety about being worked on by students (phase 1 or 2). I asked for lots of layers and movement and that was the cut Symyra gave me. I asked for a subtle ombre and that's also what I got. I will say though, that I did contemplate going back to have her lighten the ends some more, but that is essentially my fault anyway considering I asked for "subtle." All in all, I would recommend Paul Mitchell if you have the patience/time and aren't going to have a heart attack if something doesn't go exactly the way you envisioned. This is, afterall, a SCHOOL and you get what you pay for (which is peanuts in comparison to a "real" salon).

40.description: I decided to try Paul Mitchell for 2 reasons: 1) Price 2) Expertise.A friend of mine went to cosmetology school through Paul Mitchell a few years back and I was very impressed with her training, so I thought Paul Mitchell students had to be as good as it got. And $16 for haircut? I'll take that.I requested a Phase II student (I'll spring $4 for a more advanced student). Unfortunately, I do not remember the name of the stylist I received. She was very friendly and conversational. I could tell she was nervous, but I don't blame her for that. I had an appointment at 1:30 and it was about 2:00 when she came and got me. A little frustrating, but, again I understand. Life happens. I didn't walk out of there until 4:30. And I was just getting a cut and style. I can't imagine how long it takes when you're getting color. Again, I understand that they are students, but 3 hours? My poor husband was waiting in the car for what we thought would be an hour-long haircut, tops. I also wasn't pleased with the style. I requested a long bob with lots of layering for my naturally curly hair. I showed her a picture. My hair is past my shoulders (I told her I wanted it at my collarbone, and she kept touching my collarbone as she cut to check, and it was still too long. The layering is virtually nonexistent, and she barely cut any bangs at all. The instructor came over, and she even had another stylist help her blow dry my hair (which I will admit is thick), and it still took 3 hours. She asked me what I thought, but by that point I was ready to be done. I will now have to lose this $16, and save up another $40 to go have my hair done correctly. I'm all about budget, but this isn't worth it.Again, I don't blame my stylist, but I will not be returning.

53.description: VERY DISAPPOINTED! I went to the school in December for a basic all over color a I have been using box color work a long time since I'm just out of college and not making a lot of money. But with the holidays I decided to get it done right. I've gone to the school in normal IL for coloring and cuts many times and always loved it. So I figured the Chicago one would be the same. They said it starts at $29 and each extra bowl is $8 which I always need, no problem. They said it would take 2-3 hours   And it ended up taking 6 HOURS!!! Plus $15 in parking. They washed and blow dried my hair a total of 5 times and refused to use conditioner so my hair would not brush through and felt like straw it was awful. They said they needed to do all these other things to my hair since I had been using box color. I took off work that day to get my hair done and then finish pre Christmas errands and ended up spending my whole day and 3x as much money at the Paul Mitchell school. I'm now going to a normal salon spending the same amount if money to get my hair dyed in 1/3 of the time. Don't waist your time, money, and sanity on this place. Never again will I go there!

30.description: An avoidable bad experience! Let me just start by saying my hair is such a touchy thing for me. Im a girly girl and love it lol. Ive been going to PM even after a bad experience i figured we all make mistakes. Its been over 3 or 4 years ive been coming here and yes ive got the hang of things by now BUT today was bad. I went in for a PM shine and haircut and was there 5 1/2 hours.. thats crazyyyyy to begin. Then what really pissed me off was not only the timing but the fact that no learning leader was supervising the student so who knows if i got a proper haircut. I got up with a sore azz because the thing that took the longest wasn't the color but the haircut and blow dry with 2 students blow drying go figure. I get up off my chair upset with a horrid face trimming and I didn't get checked or asked once by a learning leader if all was well or to make sure it was all done properly smh. I expressed my dissapointment being a regular to staff and all i got was an I'm sorry. REALLY BLOWS the way they handled it all. Its hair i cant get it back it could've been avoided by a simple supervision.

46.description: Went here to get seven inches cut off my hair and a bit of a new style. My stylist, Crystal, had super fabulous hair (always something to look out for when someone's doing your hair). Every step of the way an instructor came by to consult and make sure she was on track, which made me feel good. For a wash, cut, dry and iron it was $21. Hard to beat that. And she did a good job. Like, probably identical to what I would've gotten anywhere else.I dock a star because it took forever. The website said to allot 1.5 hours since they are students. OK, that's fine. But by the time I got out of there, it had been about 2 hours, 20 minutes. I had to cancel my plans for afterward, which kind of sucked. In the end, it wasn't a big deal, but plan to be here for a while.

1.description: I've came here twice in the past to cut my hair and left happy. However, my last visit was very unfortunate. I had not cut my hair in two years, it's pretty damn long. All I wanted was layers (I even showed some pictures) I thought it would be pretty simple... THINK AGAIN...THREE hours later, all that basically happened to my hair was an inch cut from the bottom. I left with absolutely NO layers at all. I felt really stupid afterward when I attended a party and was literally told, " your hair is so long girl, time for a cut!" This was not even an hour after I left Paul Mitchell. I'm giving one star because I expect more from this school. These instructors are teaching their students how to style and cut hair for a powerful name. If these student graduate without being able to cut layers, that scares me for the future of the industry. Just sayin...I won't be coming here again.  :(

55.description: If you care about your hair at all, do not go here.I have been here three times and I strongly do not recommend. The first time was a few years ago. I got a few highlights. My hair looked okay. I decided to go back this month to get my hair lightened and trimmed. I figured that these students are watched very closely so there is no way they could ruin your hair too badly... LOL.Before I went to this salon I had long, beautiful hair. Everyone would compliment me and people thought I had hair extensions because my hair was so long and beautiful. My hair fell down to my butt cheeks. Took me several years to get it that way. For some reason I felt really adventurous and decided it would be cool to lighten my hair. When I went in I asked if it would be possible to lighten my hair and if it would be extremely damaging. The stylists told me I would need to get a couple inches trimmed off after the lightening process but that I would still have incredibly long hair, so I went for it.The first session I had a few weeks ago went so poorly that they ended up giving me a free redo session and they overcharged me. My bill was $178 total. I was in shock. They billed me for ELEVEN bowls of extra color even though I only signed off on six... each extra bowl costs $8 on top of the base fee of $32. AND my hair was yellow because they took so long doing a 'double process' (a process the students wanted to try because they had never tried it on a human head before...honestly, who would say that to a customer?) that the salon closed before the toner could sit on my head long enough. My hair was yellow. The next day I complained and they gave me my next service complimentary. I should have cancelled my appointment or demanded my money back but I went in again. Before they started the color they offered a complimentary hair cut because they did not do this last time even though I was billed for it. The learning leader advised me to cut about 3-4 inches from the bottom to get rid of any damage. I agreed. My hair was so long that 3-4 inches really was nothing. I would have still had waist length hair. The learning leader advised the student whose name was Moriah to do the cut and left. Well, Moriah must be really bad at math because she ended up cutting TWELVE INCHES off. I didn't realize what was happening until she swung my chair around and started on the front. I was in shock. I had heard of stories like this where you go in for a trim and they cut a ton off... but a whole FOOT of hair? Moriah stopped in the middle of my cut and ran off and then her learning leader came over and told me she had gotten ill and had to be sent home. Someone else took over, did a terrible job finishing the hack job and I left.I seriously cried for hours when I got home. My hair now barely falls past my shoulders. That still sounds long, but it used to be down to my ass. And the haircut they gave me is terrible. They cut straight across... no face framing, layers. My hair is one length and falls very awkwardly. I had to fix a few strands once I got home. There where random pieces that were two inches longer than the rest. Just awful. I need to go somewhere else now and get a real hair cut, which means my hair will have to be even shorter. Do not go here. Really terrible and the prices that are listed are base prices. You will end up paying almost $200 for some shit student to chop your hair off. :( The students who did my hair (there were at least 3 working on me) seemed really nice, but then after the first 30 minutes started to talk crap about everyone in the salon including other clients... as they were doing my hair. So professional.OOPS! I forgot one more detail, the cherry on top: not only did I leave here crying, but I also left looking like a total idiot because they did not wash or wipe all of the dye they got on my face off. They left a halo of toner on my scalp even though they shampooed it and didn't even bother to wipe my cheeks. Thanks, guys!!

9.description: $15 for a good haircut - wash and blow dry also included! The school is very conveniently located in UIC's campus, so it was perfect to be able to get a haircut in between classes. They are very professional and make everything pretty straightforward. You can schedule appointments online, the prices are great, they have a nice open space with lots of products to buy in the front of the shop. My stylist was great! They go through a step by step process and that includes talking everything through so the stylist knows what you want and they in turn tell you how they're going to give you what you want. Before they cut, after they cut and at the end other stylists (I'm assuming they're master stylists or managers) check in with you and your stylist, ask you questions, make sure you're happy. I felt super important! But they just insured that I was satisfied with everything - which I was! I would definitely recommend going here if you're on a budget, or even if you're not - the students here know what they're doing!

26.description: Genesis did a really good job on my haircut. And at $15, I can't complain in the least. The only thing I would change is how long the process took (but that's mostly forgivable because of how incredibly thick my hair is). I'll definitely be coming back, especially because it's only a short bus ride away.

25.description: I come here for a fun do!  Better to bring a photo for a new look with an impact.  Otherwise, cut/color has minimal impact.  Be prepared for a "fluid" look -- end cut/color is different from magazine photo, BUT still flattering with the right vibe.Be prepared to spend 5-6 hours.  Time flies when you are catching up on current magazine readings -- US, Allure, Elle.Be prepared to have 2-3 individuals working on your hair.For Bright Hair Colors -- request Heat added to foil, otherwise color doesn't stay.Worst case scenario...bad cut/color only stays for a month.  You get a new do before you know it.Products -- you get points and rewards now for purchases.  Special Pricing concurrent with other stores.Promotions -- via email, e.g., $5 off next appt, free cut with paid color, 10% off next appt.Staff -- amazingly nice!Shout Out to Jim, Erica and Rhi!  Hello Skyler.

12.description: I felt embarrassed to go outside after wasting 6 hours and lots of money on a hair color that i did not even ask for. It was especially redicoulous because the leader said it was MY fault that my hair was messed up because my "hair was red and i was not clear about what I wanted." That was funny for them to say because I had shown them a picture of exactly what I wanted from the very beginning... & I understand my hair color was red and that it takes a lot to lift the color, but when someone asks for a brown/dirty-blond ombre/balayage I think it's a little ridiculous end up with a head that's half black, half orange. When i asked the supervisor if he would be satisfied with his hair stylist if she had done the same thing to him, he even said he would not. The supervisor said that he was sorry, but told me it was my fault that it turned out that way and if i wanted it fixed I would have to come back tomorrow and pay them again. Don't waste your time and money going here. Terrible customer service and hair styling quality.

59.description: Pleasantly surprised! I called day of for an appointment and they were able to schedule me that very night for 8:30, which was a very nice way to start the experience. They put me with Joshua who was extremely friendly, knowledgeable and confident (but not overly confident).  I like that in a stylist.  I wanted bangs (a very clean, somewhat edgy, Cleopatra look).  This was a huge change for me since I normally don't wear them.  I brought a picture with me so that there was no chance of miscommunication.  He washed my hair with warm water.  That was nice, instead of the usual cold that I had been getting recently,  Throughout the process, Joshua communicated well with me and stayed chatty.  He informed me of what I could do to take better care of my hair but at the same time was very complimentary of it.  He trimmed the bottom and kept my long layers that I wanted.  When it was time to give me bangs, he was a little unsure as to where to place them and where to start cutting.  At that point, he called over his instructor for advice.  Instead of hastily chopping away, he was careful and asked.  I really appreciated this!  This ended up being one of the best, cheapest haircuts I've ever received (and I've gone to a lot of professional places).  After 1.15 hrs, I walked out of the school with a haircut I was extremely happy with, hair healthier and styled.  I already scheduled my next appointment.

21.description: Great cuts buuuut $15 and 2 hrs later for a male haircut is waaaay too lng. You can find cheaper and equal quality elsewhere.Probably good for women

17.description: I was being seen by Tracy a couple of years ago (3-4 times) until she graduated. I took a hiatus from Paul Mitchell, but recently went in for a cut and color (ombre) and was worked on by Symyra. I have VERY long/thick/straight hair and always go into PM with the mindset that if anything goes wrong I can 1. always have it fixed and 2. my hair will grow back in 5 minutes anyway (I swear it grows like weeds). With that being said, I generally don't have much anxiety about being worked on by students (phase 1 or 2). I asked for lots of layers and movement and that was the cut Symyra gave me. I asked for a subtle ombre and that's also what I got. I will say though, that I did contemplate going back to have her lighten the ends some more, but that is essentially my fault anyway considering I asked for "subtle." All in all, I would recommend Paul Mitchell if you have the patience/time and aren't going to have a heart attack if something doesn't go exactly the way you envisioned. This is, afterall, a SCHOOL and you get what you pay for (which is peanuts in comparison to a "real" salon).

10.description: Great cuts buuuut $15 and 2 hrs later for a male haircut is waaaay too lng. You can find cheaper and equal quality elsewhere.Probably good for women

5.description: I come here for a fun do!  Better to bring a photo for a new look with an impact.  Otherwise, cut/color has minimal impact.  Be prepared for a "fluid" look -- end cut/color is different from magazine photo, BUT still flattering with the right vibe.Be prepared to spend 5-6 hours.  Time flies when you are catching up on current magazine readings -- US, Allure, Elle.Be prepared to have 2-3 individuals working on your hair.For Bright Hair Colors -- request Heat added to foil, otherwise color doesn't stay.Worst case scenario...bad cut/color only stays for a month.  You get a new do before you know it.Products -- you get points and rewards now for purchases.  Special Pricing concurrent with other stores.Promotions -- via email, e.g., $5 off next appt, free cut with paid color, 10% off next appt.Staff -- amazingly nice!Shout Out to Jim, Erica and Rhi!  Hello Skyler.

3.description: I have came to PM several times for a touch up on my hair color and the results seem to be getting better and better! Staci (Phase 1 student) made my hair blonder than it has ever been before -- making her an absolute godsend. Both her & her instructor were very sweet, knowledgable, and made the experience fun and fly by! I guarantee, especially in the city, the bang that you get for your buck is unmatched. I already have another appointment with Staci and I'm excited to see her again, the talent at this school is amazing! Just be sure to carve out about 3-4 hours if you're getting color done, it's worth the time commitment.

35.description: I had been wanting to try Paul Mitchell The School because I have had such great experiences at the Aveda School on Clark Street. On a whim this past Saturday I called and was able to get an appointment the same day. When you walk in the place is very clean and there is a great vibe. The front desk staff could not have been better; offering me water, letting me know where the restroom is locating and offering me a magazine to read while I waited.
