Kelly gets an A+ for professionalism and kindness. I wish I remember the woman's name at the front desk as she was also kind and and professional. The front desk staff gets 5 stars. I had the Keriplex Treatment ($30) and a Cut and Blowout.I understand this is a school and the students are learning, so I allowed 2 hours, thinking that would be more than enough time, I was wrong.The student, was so soft spoken I could barely understand her when she introduced herself, after the introduction I don't think she said three words to me.When it was time to wash my hair she walked so fast and far in front of me I lost sight of her.Other reviewers speak of the great scalp massage that is included with the wash - didn't get one.When the wash was complete she did not tell me what she was doing and/or applying as most stylists do. While I was under the dryer she just stood there looking at me, which was a bit nerve racking.Once the Keriplex treatment was complete and I was back for another wash, same experience as the first.I explained to her what I was looking for, a trim (no more than 1/4 of an inch) for my layers and my bangs. I also asked for my part to be down the middle. After two attempts I had to part my own hair as she was not able to determine where the middle of my head is. While this was going on the leader/teacher stood and watched me part my own hair.Nearly 2 hours later she was still attempting to cut my hair. Once the cut was completed she would take a section of hair and apply 5 products then attempt to use a round brush to complete the blowout. I know that she used mousse but not clear what else she was putting on my hair.When I reached the 3 hour and 15 minute point, I flat out told her to just rough dry my hair, cut my bangs and get me out of there. She continued to take a section, apply way too much product and attempt to dry my hair. A second time I asked her to just stop what she is doing as I do not need my hair dried. Keep in mind my hair is chin length - not long by any means. At this point she told me that I need to realize she is not a professional, only a student. Yes, I realize this, but it seemed as if she never held a dryer, brush or pair of scissors in her hand prior to this encounter.Eventually the leader/teacher looked at my hair, and the student explained that I needed to leave. I asked again to have my bangs trimmed as they still were not done. At least three times I was told by the leader/teacher she would get to my "fringe" in a moment. All in all the haircut was just okay, I am finding uneven layers, but my bangs, aka "fringe" are way too short. I did tip the student because I felt bad for her, she was obviously in over her head (no pun intended). When I was checking out and was asked about the experience I was honest and they did not charge me for the haircut, which was a nice gesture.Would I go back, not certain. If I did it would be only with a Phase 2 student as I believe this was the first time this girl touched another persons hair. The front desk staff did not charge me for the hair cut, which I thought was a nice gesture.

19.description: I had a great time at Paul Mitchell The School.  I came in on a Monday at noon for a simple trim.  I got paired up with Macee and she did an awesome job!  Asked for about an inch off because I'm trying to grow my hair long and it needed some life. She cut it perfectly and now it looks amazingly even.  Not only that but she used some beautifully scented products to give my hair some shine.  She also has a fun personality and easy to talk to!  Everyone there is extremely helpful and quick.  Great for students, I payed about $20 for a cut and that included the tip ($15 regularly).  Great experience overall!

28.description: New favorite place for getting a haircut. Staff is always nice, and the products are amazing.

45.description: When you're a girl with curls and trying a new salon, what a comfort it is to be greeted by a stylist with curls! Taylor, the "future professional" who cut my hair, was actually at phase 1, but her teacher guided her before she started each section of my hair. I brought a picture of the style I got last summer and just asked for that. The teacher would cut a little, and then Taylor continued on her own.In true teacher fashion, the teacher would ask Taylor what kind of cut or product she should use on my hair, and then corrected her if she guessed wrong. :PNote that this is a school, so the students work more slowly than professionals. But do you really want a student stylist to tear through your hair quickly? I arrived early for my appointment and left 1 hour 40 minutes later. I made my appointment first thing in the morning.In the end, my hair looked almost exactly like the style I got last summer. It was just a tad shorter than I wanted, but the shape was the same. And it was only a fraction of the price!Of course, Taylor had to go through the spiel and advertise the Paul Mitchell products, but I'm happy with my current regimen. Most shampoos and conditioners dry my hair the day I use them, and then my hair is soft and curl-tastic the next day. Well, Paul's stuff dried out my hair too. Will have to see tomorrow if the curls are soft again...So although I say nay to the products for dry, curly hair, I still highly recommend Paul Mitchell the School for an inexpensive, quality haircut.

33.description: Can't go wrong with Paul Mitchell products !!! I received a wash , blow dry , iron work for less than $30 from a phase 1 stylist Taylor #84 and she did a great job

43.description: Incompetent leadership who do not have the knowledge to truly lead their students in cutting/coloring/styling the hair.  I can't really blame the student for a hair disaster, as they are just learning.  But if the learning leader tells me it's going to take 2 bottles to color my hair, and then end up saying I need 4 bottles, and then tell me I need this product and that product in addition... that's straight up LYING.  Stop trying to get more money out of me and learn how to do your job.

2.description: Omg! I understand this is a school which is why I'm giving them 2 stars but this place was incredibly unprofessional!I was seated 45 minutes late for my appointment & the girl did not touch my hair until an hour after my scheduled appointment. My updo really looked nothing like the photos I showed her. I was very clear with my stylist multiple times that I had to leave by a certain time & was almost late to my cousin's wedding because she either did not manage her time well or didn't respect what I told her :( I would give them another try but allow more time I guess.....

18.description: I had jackie. Overall it was good and relaxing. You shouldn't expect perfection when coming to a school where students are still learning. BUT I feel the teachers could have kept a closer eye. I got a hair cut and color. The color was nice but not exactly what I wanted. Also it looks like she missed a spot. And for my haircut she only cut my length but didn't do my layers. I had to remind her at the end. I feel if the teacher stuck around she would have noticed. I also feel like my hair cut wasn't complete. They didn't trim my bangs which I thought was weird. If you ask for a trim isn't it obvious you want it on your entire head of hair? Otherwise it was not disastrous just a few things I might change.

41.description: SO! I came here because my friend works here. I must say, I definitely had a wonderful experience here! First off, the receptionist was very kind and he made me feel very welcome. A plus for him!I am VERY picky with my hair and I need to have it the way I want. I trimmed 2 inches off, a v-cut with layers. My friend did a wonderful job! Before she did anything she would always ask her instructor for permission with proceeding to the next step which made me feel very comfortable. The hair products there are DEFINITELY a plus! The awapuhi stuff are AMAZING! In support of my friend I bought the tea tree oil products and they are amazing! I have a very coarse, damaged hair and the thing that made me fall in love with this place is that the instructor explained to me why my hair tangled so much when my hair almost NEVER tangles. She instructed my friend how to give me layers but at the same time cut off the damaged hair as well. My hair barely tangles now and it's awesome!For those people who got coarse hair or who is wanting a stylist who is outgoing, request my friend, Ronnie! :)

52.description: I heard from a friend that the school is priced reasonably and that they did a nice job. I decided to come in to add some lowlights to my blonde hair for winter. Although it takes a longer time it was definitely worth it, and the girl I had was super bubbly and friendly. The staff was also extremely friendly and make sure everything is explained to the client. I liked Lexi so much, that I rescheduled with her and she gave me an ombré the following time which turned out great. I'd recommend this to anyone who's on a low budget, but still wants to have their hair professionally done.

50.description: Wow!!  This place is HUGE!!  It serves as both a "salon" and "school" for the stylists.  These students are busting their humps in this place.  I saw so many beautiful hairstyles coming out of here.  The prices are incredibly decent and they use all Paul Mitchell products.  If you are looking for a nice quiet salon experience, this is not your place.  It's not supposed to be that.  These stylists are out on the floor learning and don't expect to be in and out of there either.  They must confer with their teachers while doing your hair (that's why it's called a school and you are getting a great deal).  I would definitely suggest checking it out.  And just because they are students and you got a great deal on your services, it doesn't mean that you don't have to tip them!!  Be courteous.

4.description: Always a hit or miss. Today was a severe miss. Well, I guess it's my own fault to think an unlicensed stylist could do a simple blow out. You know what they say, close only counts in horseshoes, hand grenades, and atomic bombs. Atomic bomb is right considering the mess on my head Diamond left. I think the more upsetting part is the fact that she didn't care. Her name was diamond and she wasn't a gem. I thought people should have pride in their work and she didn't. My hair looked awful and I can't believe Paul Mitchell can honestly send a customer away looking their worst with no guilt. I guess integrity is overrated.

6.description: Made an appointment for an updo and makeup application for a formal holiday party and was very happy with the result. Did it take a little bit longer than a normal salon appointment might? Sure, but if you're going to a school environment, you should adjust your timing and quality expectations accordingly; I had no issues with being late by giving myself a several hour window for services. My student stylist, Nick, was a great young guy who immediately admitted he'd be calling for backup on the makeup part. Know what you don't know, I say. I showed him a photo of the hairstyle I was hoping for, and after checking in with his learning leader, it was off for shampooing, blowdry, and curls. The actual pinning and final style was taken over by the learning leader, and I ended up with a gorgeous sideswept messy bun of curls. The style held without being too loose or looking like a helmet, just enough product. At the end of the night, I was pleasantly surprised to find only a couple dozen bobby pins in the whole style; I had expected to be pulling pins out of my head for days afterwards, definitely a plus to know when enough is enough! My makeup application was done by Chaquilla (sorry if I butchered that!), and I had to double check the mirror when she was done to make sure it was really me! I had a photo of the dress I was wearing to the holiday party, and after chatting about whether I wanted to look natural or "red carpet" or had anything particular in mind, she was able to give me an awesome dramatic looking gold eye makeup that really popped with the dress. Other students in between clients came over to take a peek and comment that I looked runway ready, and I agreed. BEAUTIFUL JOB! The makeup lasted through the night, with just a touch up to my lips after eating and drinking. From start to finish, I would say I spent about 3 to 3 1/2 hours at the school for updo and makeup, and was charged $37, minus tip. Can't beat that bargain! The hair and makeup must have looked really great, because my boyfriend proposed that evening. Thank you Paul Mitchell School for helping me look my best for an unknowingly important night!

22.description: I took my daughter to get her hair done for her birthday yesterday. Even though it took close to 6 hours to get her highlights, blown out and ironed, we left extremely satisfied.  Initially,  I was frustrated about the length of time it took, but I realized that this was a first year student and my daughter's hair is naturally curly and needed extra time to blow out. I am glad that she took the time needed to get it right. My daughter is a very happy camper and so am I. We will be going back.

15.description: Sam did such a great job on my hair makeover! She was very professional and sweet. The color came out just perfect.  I got so many compliments the next day at work ... Thanks Sam!

57.description: Despite the mixed reviews, I decided to give them a shot. Its not far from my house and my regular stylist was booked. I'm generally risk averse so I'm not going to go to a "school" with super high expectations. Just wash my hair thoroughly, condition it, flat iron it, and I'm out the door. I saw Kevana and she did a good job. There are teachers on the floor directing and supervising all of the students so I never felt uncomfortable. Again, I'm not into taking lots of risks especially when it comes to my hair so I would only see professionals when it comes to cut and color. I might throw caution to the wind and get a single process color (it can't be worse than what I do to myself out of the box at home) but never for anything complicated like highlights. For this reason, I think some of the negative reviews are a little unfair. Granted, no one should ever have to experience a hair nightmare but if you want to guarantee that your highlights and layered haircuts are super tight, then suck it up and pay for a stylist who's been doing hair for more than 6 months. I mean, these are students! Why the heck do you think you're paying 1/3 of the cost than a regular salon?!?! I don't know if this would ever be my regular spot since I heart my go-to stylist but its totally fine for 20 bucks and much better than what I can manage on my own at home.

20.description: Made an appointment for an updo and makeup application for a formal holiday party and was very happy with the result. Did it take a little bit longer than a normal salon appointment might? Sure, but if you're going to a school environment, you should adjust your timing and quality expectations accordingly; I had no issues with being late by giving myself a several hour window for services. My student stylist, Nick, was a great young guy who immediately admitted he'd be calling for backup on the makeup part. Know what you don't know, I say. I showed him a photo of the hairstyle I was hoping for, and after checking in with his learning leader, it was off for shampooing, blowdry, and curls. The actual pinning and final style was taken over by the learning leader, and I ended up with a gorgeous sideswept messy bun of curls. The style held without being too loose or looking like a helmet, just enough product. At the end of the night, I was pleasantly surprised to find only a couple dozen bobby pins in the whole style; I had expected to be pulling pins out of my head for days afterwards, definitely a plus to know when enough is enough! My makeup application was done by Chaquilla (sorry if I butchered that!), and I had to double check the mirror when she was done to make sure it was really me! I had a photo of the dress I was wearing to the holiday party, and after chatting about whether I wanted to look natural or "red carpet" or had anything particular in mind, she was able to give me an awesome dramatic looking gold eye makeup that really popped with the dress. Other students in between clients came over to take a peek and comment that I looked runway ready, and I agreed. BEAUTIFUL JOB! The makeup lasted through the night, with just a touch up to my lips after eating and drinking. From start to finish, I would say I spent about 3 to 3 1/2 hours at the school for updo and makeup, and was charged $37, minus tip. Can't beat that bargain! The hair and makeup must have looked really great, because my boyfriend proposed that evening. Thank you Paul Mitchell School for helping me look my best for an unknowingly important night!

36.description: this review is coming from a future professional of paul Mitchell. I would never recommend this place to anyone to receive services or someone looking to become a successful hair stylist! Not only do they get over on the guest that come to receive services based on the prices that they hike up and give the most incompetent students there the most technical tasks that they know these students are not prepared to execute on a guest. But the sad part is how they treat the students there I read all these post and 75% negative. Please understand it is not the students fault but the schools, who policy is to put a student on the salon floor taking guest after only being in a class setting for 8 weeks learning the basics. And yes there are learning leaders on the floor to assist a student that needs help but how much help can they be when it is 12+ to one learning leader. someone suffers and unfortunately it is the guest that is there giving their time and money for a service to be completed in a timely manner that they will be satisfied with. And the students who's spirits have been broken because they know they have did a effed up job! But Paul Mitchell the School Chicago benefits because they are still paid at the end of the day. That is there main focus make money no matter what! Give u an example they have this educational experience called "CAPER" that they hype up dedicate a full school day to pump up this event that takes place in Vegas. Now to qualify to go to caper you have to sell 45  "product bags"  that start at 29.95 and go all the way up to 160.00! someone sold 40 bags and jus couldn't get those last 5 off and one of their fellow classmates were willing to give them the five bags they had sold so that at least one of them could experience "CAPER" the school said no. Now how fair it that basically Paul Mitchell just pocketed over $1000 from product sales and neither one of the students benefit anything. They have absolutely horrid policy's that makes it much harder on the student to complete their education properly. If you're late to class by one minute you must clock out and go home for the day. How fair is that to the people that travel hours just to make it to school and have to turn back around and go home. its just not a good choice and I hope this will help you make a decision if your are interested in coming to Paul Mitchell the School for services or school

14.description: I gave this place 2 shots and needless to say, I'll never be back.Both times were for color. I have grays that need covering, the ONLY reason I dye my hair. I stress that every time I sit in a stylist's chair. For some reason, none of the students can grasp how to cover grays on a brunette's head. Both times, I left with an OK color, but you can still see my grays (they're more highlighted - happened both times). Not only that, but my hair is SO dry from having dye in it for nearly 2 hours, I'm forced to see my real stylist for a $60 cut. The time it takes to get your hair done is seriously not worth saving the extra $35 you'd have to pay to get it done by professionals - especially when the finished product isn't the best. I expected a little more from the Paul Mitchell School, but you live and you learn. They are students, which I understand, but they shouldn't have free range to ruin your hair. Best of luck to anyone who wants a gamble cut/dye/style.

1.description: Staff is committed to customer service. Although I didn't buy anything my last trip there I'll definitely be back.

0.description: The staff immediately greeted me when I walked in. I'm not an avid golfer but the staff was very patient with me and answered all of my questions completely. It is clear the staff is very knowledgeable about their products. I recommend this store to anyone who plays golf, both avid golfers and novices such as myself. I'll definitely be returning here for all of my golf stuff. Great service and great prices!

3.description: This place is great. My wait was under 15 min and the waiting area is quiet and comfortable. The staff there is very nice and patient. Far more pleasant than typical drug store pharmacies. On top of all that, my prescription was free with my student insurance! If you're affiliated with UIC or even if not, send your prescriptions here - you'll be glad you did.

1.description: Great experience.  They were friendly, very patient with questions, thorough in their explanations and I got my prescription filled right away.  I was in and out in less than 10 minutes.  Couldn't ask for more.  Thank you!

2.description: The women working there are always nice, helpful, and patient. My prescription is always ready in a timely manner and when I need a prescription represcribed by my doctor they're understanding and they do their best to make that happen. I've been going to this pharmacy regularly for the past four years and I have no complaints.

5.description: Even though I'm less than enthusiastic about the Family Medicine Center that is housed in the same building, I love this pharmacy!  They will fill prescriptions right when you walk in (new or returning customer) and you usually only have to wait about 20 minutes.  They have a small selection of over-the-counter goods for sale as well as any prescription.  They will order prescriptions (either same day or next morning) if they do not have what you need and if you call ahead, everything will be waiting for you when you pick up and there's almost never a line.  The waiting area is nice if you find yourself waiting for your prescription - there's comfy chairs, reading material and pharmacy information.  There's also a blood pressure monitor in case you need to check that.  I guess all pharmacies have those, right?  I find the staff to always be friendly and if you're a regular they even recognize you and say hi!  I like that in a pharmacy - it makes me feel more comfortable that someone knows me and remembers what I take.  The pharmacist is always ready and willing to answer questions, no matter how inane (I always ask 1,000 questions about taking vitamins plus prescription allergy medication - believe me, there's rules!) and she's always available and friendly.  The pharmacy takes UIC prescriptions as well as outside prescriptions.  I recommend this pharmacy even if you do not go to the UIC Family Medicine Centers but live in or around the University Village.  There's convenient parking in the garage across the street (and the first 20 minutes are free so I never pay to park there when I get prescriptions) as well as on Halsted St. at any of the meters.

6.description: The staff is very nice and you never have to wait long. A++

0.description: I come here once in a while to get some of dem good ol' drugs and I am glad I do. This pharmacy has great employees, quick service, and knowledgeable pharmacists. Once in a while you willl get that one pharmacist mentioned in the other reviews -  the one who appears to be in a never-ending menstrual cycle - but I can live with that.

4.description: The service at this pharmacy varies widely depending upon the pharmacist. Mostly, i have good experiences here. Unfortunately, the "lead" pharmacist violated my privacy not on one occasion but two, revealing to everyone the medication that i was there to pick up. She was also extraordinarily condescending both times. Good luck!

28.description: Awesome food & Great Service. Can't wait to try everything on the menu. Unlike other places they offer authentic Chicken Shawarma!! Freshness is key and this place delivers on that aspect--And they actually do offer delivery--that is very convenient. I would def recommend this place to everyone!

1.description: Got the lunch special and the chicken schwarma plate as carry out. Food was completely unseasoned. I had to add salt and black pepper. Portions are small. Rice and pita were stale and boring.  Contrary to a couple posts, food did NOT appear fresh. Strongly advise against going as there are a ton of better places not too far from this one.

9.description: Excellent place tasty delicious chicken and falafel and rice and salads. Amazing service and great soups. Neat and clean the place is and tremendous location. Reasonable priced for delicious food. I like the fact that they are halal and all the meats are well taken care of. God Bless you guys.

29.description: Ordered through grubhub since this is my first time placing an order here. The place is huge and clean. When I came here, it was empty, no customer, probably because I came around 2pm ish.For entree, i ordered the combo platter and the chicken shawarma salad bowl. The taste was good. The beef gyro slices were yummy. The falafel was good. My husband was pretty much happy with his food. I was pretty upset with my salad because there wasn't enough dressing in the salad. It made the salad tasted blah. The chicken was pretty tasty though.I also got the lentil soup and the baklava. Both were yummy. I will definitely go back to this restaurant. Although next time I will make sure they put enough dressing.

23.description: My girlfriend and I were thrilled to find a brand new Mediterranean restaurant in the South Loop area, as this food genre is definitely lacking decent choices.I am a huge fan of all things Mediterranean food and I frequent numerous Lebanese, Israeli, Palestinian, Persian, Syrian restaurants...etc.  A few of my favorites are Semiramis, Babylon, Pita Inn, Cedar Grill, Naf Naf Grill, 1000 Knights (now defunct....oh do I miss thee Muhammad the cook/owner as well as the previous owner, Nabil.), Falafel and Grill, Noon-O-Kabob...Zaki opened several weeks ago, so I will definitely give it a try again in the near future.  Anyway, I found the food to be of 'fast food' quality and needed some refinement.   The prices were great, maybe a bit too low in my opinion.  The rice and few of the sides were a bit amateurish and slightly greasy and the lentil soup was so salty that we had to discard it all.  A few of the sides remind me of Roti' Mediterranean Grill, but not quite as good as theirs.  The Shawerma was ok.  My favorite was the spicy potatoes and the soup, that is, if it had like 1/3 of the salt.Overall, the prices are great and the space is super clean.  However, I think Zaki needs improvement.

5.description: Ordered through grubhub since this is my first time placing an order here. The place is huge and clean. When I came here, it was empty, no customer, probably because I came around 2pm ish.For entree, i ordered the combo platter and the chicken shawarma salad bowl. The taste was good. The beef gyro slices were yummy. The falafel was good. My husband was pretty much happy with his food. I was pretty upset with my salad because there wasn't enough dressing in the salad. It made the salad tasted blah. The chicken was pretty tasty though.I also got the lentil soup and the baklava. Both were yummy. I will definitely go back to this restaurant. Although next time I will make sure they put enough dressing.

25.description: I ordered a salad from Zaki today and it was delicious! The aroma makes you want to keep eating even after you're full! I would definitely come here again. Yum!

12.description: I ordered a salad from Zaki today and it was delicious! The aroma makes you want to keep eating even after you're full! I would definitely come here again. Yum!

21.description: Second time trying them. Sooooo good..everything is fresh, fresh, fresh. Friendly staff and really good prices. The platters are huge, enough to feed two people in my opinion - at lunch time :)FYI the trees kind of block the sign and if driving East on Roosevelt it's on the North side of the street, easy enough to drive around the block on the next street, took about 2 minutes. I haven't ordered dessert, but they have the most amazing looking lemon cake. Might just get that next time  by itself.

16.description: Zaki means tasty in Arabic, and this place Didint disappoint. Really good food and reasonably priced. Will come back.

17.description: It says open from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. I am here and it is 10:05 and the man refuses to open up the door for service. I guess I won't know how the place is

10.description: DON'T GO HERE. What the total f**k. This place is horrible. I ordered food for take out. The food was completely dry. I got the combination platter. The gyro meat was super dry, the kufta was a tiny dry thing, the falafel tiny and dry, and chicken shwarma had no flavour and super dry. So mad I paid $12 for this garbage.

11.description: If a place says they open at certain time they should be open by that time. I wasted half of my lunch walking over here and when I get to the door it's still locked. 20 minutes after they were suppose to be open. I also tried calling ahead of time to place an order but they wouldn't pick up their phone either.

26.description: Delicious fresh Mediterranean. I'm a tabbouleh fan, and their's is top notch. Hummus good too. Seems like a very new restaurant. I think the menu could we tweaked to include an offering of just sides (my favorite part).

27.description: Awesome food, great service! Glad to find a nice fresh new place for Mediterranean food! The chicken shawarma was great and so was the gyros!

0.description: Finally tried zakis, this new zabiya halal Mediterranean grill in our neighborhood. I enjoyed the food quite a bit. We carried out an order for dinner. The food was prepared quickly and with all the extra instructions done accurately.I ordered the chicken shwarma wrap and my wife ordered the gyro sandwich. Both were very good. Chatting with the owner while waiting for the food. He was very friendly. Really good quick, easy, and cheap place for lunch or dinner. I will definitely be back.

20.description: So delicious middle eastern food, and super nice friendly stuff. Loved the special lunch that's offer from 11 to 3 pm I will visit often since I live around the Resturant.

19.description: Delicious fresh Mediterranean. I'm a tabbouleh fan, and their's is top notch. Hummus good too. Seems like a very new restaurant. I think the menu could we tweaked to include an offering of just sides (my favorite part).

2.description: This is a nice restaurant for lunch or dinner which serves Zabiha Halal meats.  They have specials and everything is delicious.

18.description: Very nice place and nice food People who work There are Mediterranean And they know there business food are delicious and fresh I recommend Falafel it was amazing  I will pass by them whenever I am close to UIC

13.description: Disappointing.  The food is not fresh and is mediocre. There are too many other great options for Mediterranean food. Service is poor. We will not return.

4.description: I can't recall ever having bad Mediterranean, however, this place was pretty terrible.   The veggie platter is terrible.  It's a mush pile of vegetables in a lake of water and oil. The garlic sauce and tahini were inedible, at best. The falafel are mini sized, which is probably a benefit for a falafel sandwich, but a disclaimer would have been nice. Nothing stood out as being good. Very little was edible. Although I dislike wasting food, most of the order ended up in the trash :(

24.description: First time coming here!  Very very good if you are around the UIC area and want Mediterranean food!  We went towards closing, but they were very accommodating to us and very nice!  We ate at the restaurant and they gave us pitcher of water so we did not have to get up from the table while we were eating, and gave us more sauces to try.  They were also all GOOD!  Got the Kufta Kabob Basmati Plate (Sides: Hummus & Cucumber Salad), and a side of Falafel.  Generous portions, everything tasted amazing!  Fresh, and the meat was not dry!  They cook it when you order it!  Baklava was very very good too! Highly recommend!

6.description: I was hapoy with the lunch time combo platter but I got a sense they just heated up my food that sat cold till someone walked in.  Nice concept just bad location.

22.description: It says open from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. I am here and it is 10:05 and the man refuses to open up the door for service. I guess I won't know how the place is

15.description: Their lunch special was really good and filling for one person. The rice was perfectly moist. Very good service.

7.description: Great food, clean place, excellent music.This place added a lot to our visit to Chicago.!

8.description: Second time trying them. Sooooo good..everything is fresh, fresh, fresh. Friendly staff and really good prices. The platters are huge, enough to feed two people in my opinion - at lunch time :)FYI the trees kind of block the sign and if driving East on Roosevelt it's on the North side of the street, easy enough to drive around the block on the next street, took about 2 minutes. I haven't ordered dessert, but they have the most amazing looking lemon cake. Might just get that next time  by itself.

3.description: Full disclosure. I have never written a review before, but this experience was worthy of my first-ever review. The food and the service were excellent. Very good in every respect. Thanks!

14.description: Decent gyros, place didn't really blow me away. Might go again, Ill have to order something else.

58.description: I love the chicken tostadas, steak tacos, and veggie quesadilla. Chicken is always most, steak is surprisingly good quality for the price, and veggies always taste fresh. Super cheap, fast, and always yummy. The staff is super friendly too!

56.description: We stopped by to try some tacos at De Pasada and ordered it for take out. I tried their super tacos baraboca ( soft beef tacos) It was very soft the meat tasted good. But the topping on the taco like the tomatoes and cheese and guacamole was bland. I liked their horchata it was milky and sweet. I felt their service was friendly and fast. I only ordered two tacos at $2.99 each and I couldn't finish it because it was bland. I really love small tacos usually but not this time around. I give three stars for friendly fast service with a smile and like I said the meat was tasty the rest of the topping was bland so I hope they improve the flavors because I would like to try their food again.

29.description: for i shall eat you again

42.description: Best Mexican food I've ever had hands down I am an EMT and hold the area the staff is always friendly and I've never had anything here I didn't like

23.description: Didn't care much for the Carne Asada taco. But the steak super taco was really yummy.

47.description: De Pasada.... Let's call this MicroWave Pasada. The food here was much better in the past. I have seen burritos made before me. Now, when I stop in, I see a lot of microwave action going on and it's unsettling. I come here because I want yummy, greasy, flavorful Mexican food, but leave dissatisfied and I didn't know that was possible. Flavorless meat with microwaved nachos is awkward.   This is almost not even drunk-worthy.

8.description: This place is ridiculously awesome. The carne asada (steak) Super Burrito is to die for. The quality and freshness of the meat is unmatched. I travel several miles out of my way, sometimes several times per week, just to have that Steak Super Burrito. If you dine in, you get free chips and dip. It's a family owned restaurant, and let me tell you, they work hard. They remember their customers and have always treated me like family. This is definitely a jewel of Chicago cuisine. The place also has a small lift at the entrance making it handicap accessible.

31.description: Best nachos in Chicago.  They are tiny meals of guac, beans, cheese and sour cream packed individually onto homemade chips.  The staff here has been taking care of my friends and me for years--this place is amazing.  You also can get Mexican Coca Cola and Jarritos here!!

34.description: Great foodGreat staffGreat prices Great place!!!If you have not gone, you will like it!!Great family place too.

16.description: I have never had any bad experiences with this place. I come here often so the cashiers know me (if it's your first time you need to bring an ID if you're paying with a card and you also need to order a minimum of $8 to use your card). Food here is made quite fast especially if you are doing take out. They usually have the food ready within 5-10 minutes.  I usually get tacos and rice and beans. The chips and salsa are great, the rice and beans are phenomenal. I am usually picky with my rice and beans and I like that it's flavorful here and that they melt a bit of chihuahua cheese on top of the beans. The carne asada, ground beef and lengua are all delicious. Never bad but it's not the best Mexican food compared to those in Pilsen or other more authentic spots. The horchata is also great but sometimes they run out which is a bummer. I live in the area and this is the only place I can get decent authentic Mexican food. Thumbs up.

13.description: i love this place. They have a perfect size menu. very friendly staff.  I recommend the steak(grade A) or chicken(seasoned and pulled)super burrito. horchata is great not watery or too milky.

11.description: Ordered tacos and nachos. Tacos tasted blah. Nachos - LOTS of cheese melted over few chips. Service? Not sure if they know what that is..Would not go back or recommend this place.

39.description: I would just like to say that my boyfriend and I hate cooking. HATE IT. So, like most adults who don't cook, we order in. A lot. If we both died in our apartment, Grubhub would be the first to know. I'm sure after a couple of week nights without an order from us, they would send over the police.As such, we have had the opportunity to order in from a lot of restaurants with mostly positive results. I only ever get on my yelp soapbox where I feel I would be able to help others avoid a truly horrific experience.That is exactly what I have just had.We placed an order with De Pasada (through Grubhub) at around 7:30 this evening. All seemed well, we received our order confirmations and Grubhub app was tracking our order. All was well and we were expecting our food by 8:30 - 8:40 pm, per our updated tracking information.Come 8:57pm, we decide to give Grubhub a call; they're always really helpful. Grubhub calls the restaurant, and texts us back that they spoke with the restaurant and De Pasada promises our order would be delivered by 9:06pm; a total of 96 minutes after our order was placed. Fine. At 9:17pm, our food still had not arrived. Again, we call Grubhub who then calls the restaurant. Grubhub calls us back to let us know that De Pasada would be giving us a call to give us a discount and (presumably) to apologize for our food disappearance. We get the call from the restaurant who asks us what was wrong with our order. You know, the order we still had not received. Anyway, after letting them know we still had not received our food, De Pasada tells us that they will have to call us back.It is now, 9:55pm, no food. We did get a call back from De Pasada. They made sure to tell us that their cooks remember making the food. The driver remembers taking our food somewhere. But the manager doesn't know where our food went. No apologies. No discounts. No offers of remaking our food on the house. No nothing.Save yourself. No one deserves to starve.Plus, let's all face it, their food is mediocre at best. I abide by the rule that any taco is a good taco; but that only counts if you get to eat the taco.

37.description: I've ordered from here multiple times and have only had their super burritos. Always de carne asada (skirt steak). It's "super" because they add the rice and beans. Decent burritos. No complaints. Their salsa is great. I've always had it delivered. Be patient with the young ladies on the phone. I think they are super busy and always rush to get me off the phone. They've had to call me back twice because they took down my card number wrong.

0.description: I've been eating pretty healthy so far this year. Shockingly enough I've been able to will myself away from high cal stuff, but god do I miss burritos. I haven't had one yet in 2016 so perhaps I'll just write about them whenever I get a craving. You may see ALOT of burrito reviews from me. Anywayas, I had De Pasada before the break and they're good. No, they're damn good. The super is huge and filled with your choice of meat rice, beans, lettuce, tomato, sour cream and guac. No crazy tweaks or twists. Just a big ass tasty burrito for about $10. They give you free chips and salsa if you dine in which is always a plus, and your food comes out ultra fast. Alright that's enough thinking about them for one day or I'm gonna cave.

38.description: I have a weird obsession with Mexican food, particularly shredded chicken tacos. I walked here for lunch today which was the worst idea ever since there was a mini blizzard and a high wind advisory. After getting a WWF smackdown by the elements, I made it to this nice cozy spot for some chicken tacos. They were awesome!!! The chips and dip were delish as well. The green salsa was hotter than the devil's vagina (I ate it all by the way). Also inexpensive (2 bucks/taco).I may be out of the loop, but this is the only place in Chicago I've had shredded chicken tacos. Yummy in my tummy! I previously trekked to mount prospect, il for the best shredded chicken taco. Now I don't have to settle for infrequent fixes of my favorite kind of taco. I can just visit this place.Downside: the waitress/cashier/busboy was a bit distracted.  I also heard a microwave in the background while eating. Microwaves don't belong in authentic restaurants, so next time I go I'll check to see what that was all about.

51.description: I don't understand why the use of cheap generic tortillas and microwaving them... Talk about lazy! Regardless of how the meat is prepared and what toppings are included you still end up with a tough chewy tire that there is no excuse for. When the feedback was provided the response was, "we can so that you just have to ask!" Why force your customers to ask for quality versus serving shortcut garbage to them?  How about you put forth the best possible product from the start. Authentic junk I would say.  Poor execution and overall bad experience.

27.description: I placed an order for delivery at 5:58 pm today and was told the food would be delivered in 20-40 minutes.  After an hour I called back to inquire about the status of the delivery and was informed their credit card machine wasn't working so my order was never started.  I asked why I wasn't called and I was given the answer of; "I tried let you know but we got busy, sorry."  I asked if my order would be delivered now and the only answer they would give me was "no."Long story short, I asked to speak to a manager and was told I couldn't and that if I wanted to order again I'd have to wait another 40+ minutes.  I've never been treated so disrespectfully by a restaurant when trying to order from them and will make sure I never attempt to again.

32.description: Very good food.  Steak could be a bit more tender though.  Salsas and chips are great.  Staff was courteous and kind.  Beans and rice had great flavor.

54.description: Great place, I got the steak torta and it was sooo good. All the workers are nice and they have a little student discount. Definitely coming back here

48.description: Tacos here are awesome. I love the rice n beans too! Seating is a bit sparse, so try to get in before the lunchtime rush. Food is very well seasoned and I will be back for sure!

44.description: The food is authentic and delicious. The prices and hours are also amazing.  Great vibes and an amazing staff.

24.description: Not bad, but not fantastic. I had the carne asada taco, chile relleno taco, and the chips and guacamole.The carne asada was a bit tough/chewy and not chopped as finely as I'm used to seeing in a Mexican street taco. It was also not very well seasoned and needed, at the very least, salt. Other than that, the onion and cilantro was fresh.The chile relleno taco was something I'd not seen elsewhere. I love chile rellenos, and I enjoyed this item. I got the "Super chile relleno taco," so it included lettuce, tomato, and sour cream which went well with the chile relleno. The guacamole was much too bland for my taste, and the chips were stale. Bummer.The service was fast and friendly. Credit cards accepted with an $8 minimum purchase.

7.description: Love their food! This place has the best tacos de asada and tostadas. Another favorite is their chilaquiles, which they often make after breakfast hours too. The green salsa is on the spicy side, so stick to red salsa if you're not that into hot food.

49.description: Quiero Taco Bell? Nah, this place is better (and less out of the way). If you are looking for cheap burritos (I recommend veggie or chicken), fajitas, and tacos that will fill you up, you should try De Pasada. They also have free chips and salsa when dining in, which are delicious.The only issue I've had with them is that their ability to take credit cards is lost pretty frequently, and without warning. I have placed pick-up orders on the phone only to find out upon arrival that their credit card machine was not working. I'd recommend asking if they are currently taking credit cards if you ever place a phone pick-up order to avoid the hassle.

40.description: Eh, this place was alright. Friendly, quick service and decently priced tacos. But with so many other choices around the area, it's hard to make this a first recommendation.

53.description: An awesome affordable spot for quick and delicious Mexican food. I always get the vegetarian burrito, I absolutely love it! If you dine in you also get free chips and salsa, and the green salsa is spicy and amaaazing. Definitely worth stopping by here if you're in the area.

30.description: I have tried so many tacos at so many different Mexican places, but this place is my favorite, hands down. Their meat is flavorful and soft, and the tacos taste amazing. They're not really greasy either, unlike TBK or Burrito House or El Gallo, so I don't feel like I'm going to die of a heart attack after eating. Their chips and salsa also taste great (try mixing their regular and hot salsas together). Definitely worth the trip!

46.description: This place is pretty good. A solid B+.I was a bit disappointed with the fact that the food came half an hour early and was still kind of cold and congealed.The flavors were great, though. I suspect if I went to actually eat there, I'd be pretty impressed.

1.description: De Pasada De Pasada... I LOVE me an authentic Mexican taco! Corn shell and cilantro is a must when it comes to authentic. One major tip: if you want light onions just don't order any at all! Lawdy it was onions overload. I mean big, chunky and thick onions. Major turn off. Other than that disappointment, the meat was flavorful but the tacos were so small in size. Sorry I won't be back. Great sauce, great meat! Way too many onions and tacos are too small.

55.description: The worst torta I've ever had. I decided to try the lengua torta instead of the usual lengua taco. I thought the price was more reasonable (for torta $5.25) than individual taco which is $2.50 a piece.And I came back when I said I wouldn't only because I was in the area and starving. Husband says let's try Pasada one more time. I forgot my promise not to come backAnd my, I just regret it. $25 so not totally worth spending on a cheap-quality dinner. My lengua torta had HARDLY any lengua and was near soggy from beans and probably tomatoes. The orchata drink size large is really a size medium.Husband says: Ground need tacos were not so delicious. It is "meh."Okay, PLEASE remind me not to come back for real!

9.description: Its good but it would be better if they didn't always mess up my order.Other than that, foods pretty good. Sometimes the tacos are really salty but otherwise its decent.

26.description: Do not go. Drive the 10 extra minutes to 18th street. Ordered Asada and it was so chewy. Too thick of a piece left way too long. Service: ridiculous. Ordered water three times, two in Spanish one English and still no water. Paid 30 dollars for two plates, 1 taco and rice. Wow.

25.description: This place is ridiculously good. Don't even have to go to Pilsen for amazing Mexican food. I've had em all, and this is in the top 3 around town. Amazing steak and chicken tacos/burritos.

12.description: Tacos are excellent but waiting for my food took a lot longer than I thought. Definitely recommend doing take out.

59.description: Usually the food is really good but today when I ordered for delivery they ran out of rice and when I asked if they would be making more, the lady said maybe later what a joke.

21.description: They have never been bad, but it's not the best Mexican place I have ever been to. It's good, solid Mexican food, and I have never left dissatisfied. When Pilsen is too far to trek to, De Pasada is a decent alternative. Overall, it is a good, inexpensive, and solid place.

17.description: Great steak tacos and super steak burritos. The skirt steak tastes great and both options of burritos (onions+cilantro or lettuce tomato cheese sour cream beans and rice) are amazing in their own ways

10.description: Their Mexican food is okay. But they are not very consistent with the quality.I've been here many many times now. My favorite dish is lengua (tongue) taco and fish taco. But sometimes the fish taco can be overcooked. I've tried their beef taco but again sometime it can be too salty or overcooked.I would give them five stars if only Pilsen is not nearby. But if I'm too lazy to bike to Pilsen, I would go there to eat.Also there is no signal there if you are t-mobile.

5.description: Had a really good experience here. Customer service was good even though they were really busy. The inside is pretty small, but if u want to dine in you can, just try to avoid coming with a really large party. They have a flat screen TV as well which was nice to watch the Cubs game while I waited for my food. The food is really good and I would definitely come back. The ground beef and chicken tacos were my favorite. I didn't like the Barbacoa as much, it lacked a little flavor in my opinion. Beware of the green salsa...it's is extremely extremely spicy. I enjoy spicy, but I couldn't take too much of it on my tacos.

3.description: Good restaurant for a quick meal. If you have the munchies or need to sober up and want some Mexican food this so the go to place. On my last visit I had the steak burrito dinner and it was very good compared to the chicken I had before.

35.description: love the food there, reminds me of the good ole times at UIC. Warm atmosphere and warm tostadas!

19.description: This place is pretty good. A solid B+.I was a bit disappointed with the fact that the food came half an hour early and was still kind of cold and congealed.The flavors were great, though. I suspect if I went to actually eat there, I'd be pretty impressed.

28.description: I ordered takeout from here a couple of days ago. My order was prepared incredibly fast and the food was good!

45.description: Great for dinner and lunch!  Staff is awesome!  A fan of the steak and ground beef super tacos. If you like spicy, try the green salsa! This is a great lunch hotspot if you're in the area and digging the idea of some tacos!

33.description: Darn tasty tacos! Their salsas are also wonderful along with a nice staff. Great on the go or a place to take the kids for a bite. Gracias!

43.description: Awesome! !!!Got the chicken, pork,  and carne asada. All delicious.

2.description: A coworker of mine spoke very highly of De Pasada as a lunch option during the workweek since we work close by. Since then, I've been to the actual location a few times and have ordered delivery for dinner once. When dining in, you get the complimentary chips and salsa. The chips are on the harder side, but still good - the salsas are wonderful! Both the red and green have a kick to them - the green is spicier. I LOVE the red. I went alone once and literally had 2 bowlfuls that I ate with the chips and dumped all over my meal! The veg burrito is my go-to. For 6 dollars, it's a great deal - good size and delicious! The tacos are pretty good too, and a good deal at about 2 dollars each. I've had the gordita and torts, but wasn't as impressed (my torta experience was when I order delivery late at night and the bread was very dry and unappetizing- so it may have been since I ordered later in the day). The server is always super friendly and comes by often. And food service is generally fast, which makes it an ideal lunch spot. My only critique is that I wish they didn't allow people to choose where they sit. You have the people who think they need a table for 4 if they're sitting alone and the restaurant doesn't let more than 2 people sit at a table for 2 (for good reason, it's a smaller restaurant and they need space to walk around) - so if you have people who don't want to move from a table of 4 to a table for 2 when they're sitting alone, you have to wait for them to be done.

18.description: Ordered the steak fajitas.  One word.  DONT!!!!!!OVER Abundance of ONIONS, only a few slices of tomatoes, couple slices of bell peppers......the steak was sub pat at best.  Honestly I only ate a few bites and threw out the rest.

41.description: This is the best taco I've had in Chicago yet! Cheap, fresh, and very good. I had the carne asana super tacos, and the very next day I was back for more. I would go out of my way to eat here again. The staff was friendly and they got my food to me very quickly. So good!

52.description: Worst customer service, cashier has a terrible attitude, the food is not edible and they DON'T accept debit cards for bills under $10, don't bother to find parking just run away to a real and authentic Mexican restaurant where you are actually welcome and they serve good quality food.

50.description: This place has my favorite burrito. Their original steak burrito is just amazing. Great salsas and chips that comes as complimentary!! Tho they don't accept credit card under $8 so just be careful with that. If this place was closer to where I live, would come here at least once a week!

4.description: Awesome little Mexican place on Taylor Street! I recommend coming here if you're craving Mexican food. They have a great selection of tacos, burritos, tostadas, and more! The prices are very reasonable, and the service is great! It's a cool place to sit and eat if you'd like, or you can also get the food to go. I would try to come here for work when I had time to, and I haven't been disappointed yet!

6.description: Came here after enjoying some serious whiskey and needed to get some eats inside of us. We decided to call and order takeout since the gf doesn't live far from the place. They told me it would just be about 15 minutes which was fine. We ordered 3 carne asada tacos with everything on it in addition to steak nachos which came well recommended on this site. The nachos were good as it came with all the usuals like steak and the chips (of course), jalapeños, cheese, guac and sour cream...tomatoes were missing from the mix though. The tacos were very weak as the flavor from the meat was nice, but the taco seemed very dry. Even adding the green salsa didn't help and they must have forgotten to give us the red sauce.  The horchata was very good and helped wash down the dry tacos. Would come back for the nachos but not the tacos. The girl that answered the phone and manning the register was very nice though.

22.description: Its good but it would be better if they didn't always mess up my order.Other than that, foods pretty good. Sometimes the tacos are really salty but otherwise its decent.

15.description: Not bad, but not fantastic. I had the carne asada taco, chile relleno taco, and the chips and guacamole.The carne asada was a bit tough/chewy and not chopped as finely as I'm used to seeing in a Mexican street taco. It was also not very well seasoned and needed, at the very least, salt. Other than that, the onion and cilantro was fresh.The chile relleno taco was something I'd not seen elsewhere. I love chile rellenos, and I enjoyed this item. I got the "Super chile relleno taco," so it included lettuce, tomato, and sour cream which went well with the chile relleno. The guacamole was much too bland for my taste, and the chips were stale. Bummer.The service was fast and friendly. Credit cards accepted with an $8 minimum purchase.

57.description: Simple authentic, yet deductible. The chicken was moist and impressive. Worth the $2 for a taco. Fast service, nice mom n' pop type restaurant. Will return for a second trip, if in the neighborhood.

20.description: Quality food for cheap. The super burritos are the way to go and the beef, pork, and tounge are all delicious. Service staff is always kind and attentive and always ask if you need additional things. Chips and salsa are free for sit down customers. Even though it is so close to Pilsen it is still worth a trip for quality Mexican food.

36.description: Really good food. Ordered a takeout of Vegetarian burrito and Chilli Relleno. Both the orders were good, the green chilli was spicy  and went well with the food. Good quality food at affordable price.

14.description: I recently started coming here a lot because I moved a block away. The food is decent is the location is convenient since I live in the neighborhood. I would've kept coming here, but as of today I won't. I am writing this review right from the restaurant right now however because I am horrified by the way this waitress has treated me and my boyfriend, but particularly me. She came to our table, took my boyfriend's order, looked over at me and saw that I was looking at my phone (I was just reading an important email that couldn't wait) and said "Not ready?" with a nasty tone of voice and just up and walked away. I looked up from my phone right away but she didn't even give me a chance to speak. She turns her back on me and walks away. Then she comes back a few minutes later after she takes a different table's order and serves them water. I just thought that was incredibly rude and disrespectful. It's one thing if the place is really packed and busy but it's not so she really had no excuse for being impatient with me. BUT WAIT, IT GETS EVEN BETTER. She deliberately didn't give me water. She gave my boyfriend water and she didn't give me water. When our food comes out, she brings it to our table without a word. At least we are polite enough to say thank you, but we get no response. Nothing. And we know she is capable of speaking fluent English because we hear her talking to the other customers.Okay, what is your issue, woman? Just because I was on my phone when you came to our table, you decide to give us the worst service possible? I'm sorry, does your restaurant have a no cell phone rule? Maybe you're having bad day. But don't take it out on your customers unless you want us to stop giving your restaurant business. Lucky for you, we won't ever come back. Just a little tip (since you won't be getting a monetary one).

58.description: So happy this place opened up. Extremely convenient to UIC and super cheap. Spend $3 and you are stuffed. Spend $5 and you have an extra meal to go! They have never been out of anything I wanted to order as I saw in other reviews. But even if they were I wouldn't care since they have many great options and I know the food is cooked fresh.

56.description: Yeah. Its cheap. Aaannd you get a LOT of food for your money. That's where the good things about this place stop. I'm Indian and know what good Indian food tastes like. This is not it. I was hoping this place would satisfy my craving for real Indian food... fresh ingredients and untempered spice levels. Unfortunately, both times I have been here have been very disappointing. The food is clearly not fresh or made with care. I guess its OK if you're really drunk and just want something to soak up the alcohol. But if you're sober... I highly doubt Ghareeb Nawaz would be able to satisfy any craving... The restaurant space is also just about bearable and I wouldn't dine in if I could help it. The service is also quite apathetic and the cashier messed up my order and gave me a Chili chicken Biriyani when i ordered a chili chicken. I doubt I'll be back here on my own accord. RATINGS:Chicken Biriyani: 2/5Chili chicken Biriyani: 3/5Frontier chicken: 2/5Ambience: 2/5Service:2/5

29.description: How can folks stomach Ghareeb?I was so excited to learn that we had Indian and Pakistani cuisine near UIC. I wanted so hard to be a fan of this place. It has all the makings of Andy's seal of approval: chicken, curry, and cheap. But alas, I expected a bit more.Most options here will indeed be $5 (pre-tax) and won't include rice or... wait, where's the naan? You're telling me that they don't sell naan here?...That should have sealed the deal.The chicken marsala that I ordered came in a small container and wasn't anything to write home about (minus this Yelp review, eh?) It felt very basic and unimaginative, and seemed like they had simply reheated up some existing curry and dropped in some pieces of chicken.On top of that, I felt very uneasy after eating at Ghareeb- even resulting in some full on hiccup episodes that lasted for a good two days, That by association may be enough for me to not want to come back. It pains me that I can't recommend this place since it's so convenient, but there are likely better options out there in Chicago to better satisfy your Indian cravings.

42.description: not bad... Cheap and two blocks away :) very convenientchicken biryani, veggie biryani and butter chicken once a week... I'm getting addicted lol :) I think the quality of their food improved lately

23.description: Ghareeb is a quick, Indian, counter service restaurant near the UIC campus that offers a full range of North Indian vegetarian options. I was in Chicago, on my way to Madison with a close friend, and met up with a friend that was a grad student.Ghareeb didn't have any naan left: at 1:30 PM, they shut down the naan operations. Imagine the feeling of a red rubber stamp hitting you on the forehead with some red ink that said "No Naan." The man at the counter offered a naan equivalent: he saw the look on my face and knew I needed some form of bread. They also were out of paneer, and didn't have some of the lentil dishes either. We ended up ordering the chana masala, a mixed veggie curry, a potato (aloo) curry, and a spinach (palak) curry.The chana masala was great: it wasn't too spicy, and the chickpeas were nice and tender. The palak is something I won't order again: the blended spinach was just not my cup of tea, and not because I don't drink tea. I can do saag dishes, not but palak dishes. The potato curry was decent. It had this lightness, which was very surprising because lightness is not the first thing that comes to mind when I think "potato." The mixed vegetable curry was a bit disappointing. I need to stop ordering mixed vegetable curries: they always end up mushy.  This place was super cheap; each entrée was only a few dollars, and my friends and I only spent 25ish dollars on enough food for two or three meals. The interior was a bit small, and connected to a bookstore, so it's a strange eating environment, but it works.If I came again, I'd definitely just order one rice and one chana masala. Keep it simple, and focus on the best tasting dish I had there!

47.description: Fast service and polite. The amount of food for the price is unbelievable. The taste is also very yummy! I have found my favorite Byriani place in the UIC area (: Will definitely be back for more!

8.description: Liked the food but they FAILED a Health Dept inspection AGAIN and it looks very bad...again. This place should be shut down. I did get sick from their food a year ago. They care not about customers safety .

31.description: The food was horrible...too salty and no flavor...I would not recommend anyone to eat here...

34.description: One downside of living on the southside? I am very far away from Devon Avenue. However, Ghareeb Nawaz satisfies my need for Indian food. It's also way cheaper than my favorite restaurant on Devon.For $10, you can get enough food for about four meals. They have pretty basic Indian cuisine, but all the vegetarian options are vegan friendly. I usually get biryani and samosas and just add chickpeas at home. They fill a styrofoam box to overflowing with rice! Wow. It's only $3 for all the biryani too. Share with a friend and you'll still have leftovers.Is it gourmet? No. But if all you want is pretty typical Indian fare, Ghareeb Nawaz is good enough.

16.description: I love the chicken biryani, and the butter chicken is DELICIOUS! The service has been great thus far, and the prices are terrific. So wish I had been introduced to this place sooner.

13.description: In all probability this was my worst experience ever. The food seemed like ingredients were somehow put together and given a name. Biryani was more like poorly fried rice with pieces of chicken thrown in from another dish.

11.description: Ignore the lowball reviewers who don't know Indian fast food, they are comparing mangoes and papayas. This is authentic Thaali style Indian cheap eats at student pricing.  It's so authentic, one time when I came here there were a dozen FRESH-OFF-THE-PLANE Indian students, luggage still with the tags on them, huddled around a table eating (by hand Indian style).  They didn't even drop their stuff off at the dorm, this was the first place they came, after traveling a long frightening distance from home.  Normally when one goes out to eat at an Indian restaurant in a Midwestern city, you need a few friends to dine with you to get a good variety of dishes to share.  Eating alone when it's not buffet time can be problematic.  Thaali refers to both the fast food combination of a few dishes served to individuals as well as the actual metal tray or dish and bowls service ware that the meal comes on.  The biryani here is notably excellent, I'm a big fan of the veg combinations. It's like being in Chennai, only with less flies and beggars (though there are some of both outside in warmer weather).  It's a tight, unattractive little corner oddly attached to an excellent bookstore, but compared to any place like it in India, it's clean and spacious.  I always ask the counter guy where I can catch a tuk-tuk or auto-rickshaw and for some reason he never thinks this is funny.

39.description: This place does some things very right: bountiful Indian/Pakistani food, super cheap price, and fast service. However, it falls a little flat in other areas. We ordered the chicken biryani, butter chicken, and aloo palak potato and spinach (that was plenty of food for two). The butter chicken sauce was too thin for my liking. However, my biggest concern was that the biryani had these seeds and small bones that were very hard and inedible. This forced me to eat my food warily which detracted from my dining experience. For those who can't handle spicy, make sure you ask about the spice level of the dishes since they contained some heat. Definitely ask for the yogurt sauce to cool your palate.

37.description: I went here two times in the last week. I thought the food quality was average. I think if you come here expect to receive quantity over quality. This restaurant is similar to Ghareeb Nawaz on Devon ave. However, I believe that the restaurants share the  same name but they are different establishments and they offer different food options.It seems like the restaurant creates mix and match food items. They create a few dishes in bulk, and then allow the customer to order them together. For example, you can order chili chicken with a paratha, in a paratha roll, with rice, or mixed into rice like a biryani. The great thing about this restaurant is that the food is very inexpensive and the quantity is large. You can have a filling and full meal for about five dollars a person.I ordered the gyros and the seekh kabobs with paratha on two separate visits. I found the gyros to be salty, but I really liked the seekh kabob. It was delicious and I  though it was spicy, had a smoky flavor, and  grilled flavor.I also got an aloo samosa, and the taste was okay.My mom ordered the chili chicken on two separate visits, and she said she enjoyed it.The service at this restaurant is nothing to write home about. You order at the counter and then you pick it up yourself. The people at the front are surly, and they seem distracted with other orders as you give them your order. I don't like this at all. They don't have to serve me at all, they should at least pay attention to me as a give my order.Overall, this is an average restaurant but it is good because it is cheap with large quantities.

0.description: The key to going to this place is understanding value not price. Nothing here is expensive, but what are you going to get for your average $3/person here.The answer is enough. The portions are large and the food DOES taste very good. The preparation however is a bit questionable. Early 2015 this place was shut down for a bit for violating a health code but since it has reopened without issue. The food doesn't look amazing and probably isn't your healthiest option, but every now and then it's a good escape. I recommend the Chilli chicken bowl. You have a choice of bread but I would go with the paratha. Its VERY spicy but SO good.

38.description: Great food! Prices are very cheap and you get a lot of food for a small price. Chili chicken briyani is the best option!

51.description: Not for the faint hearted.. If you've got the stomach strength to deal with food that may call into action all the digestive powers, go for it! I'm not built for this combat.

27.description: I love the food and the restaurant and will continue to visit but I had to update my review. Last time I gave it all 5 stars, but now I have to give it a less then great review this second time because of the inconsistent open hours and food availability. There has been at least 10 times that I have showed up and they ran out of chicken biryani or chili biryani. I now have learned and call before making the travel. This I can deal with and understand biryani is long process to make.The restaurant hours on the other hand, I don't get. It says open until midnight but I know I've seen them close at 11 PM. Once they were closed at 10 PM. Today I showed up at 11:15 AM, which on here says they're open at 11 AM but they were closed.

32.description: Tasty and cheap!  For about $3.50 I got a drink and a chicken plate with huge tortilla-like flat bread, onions and delicious tangy yogurt sauce.  Only AFTER eating there did I check out the Yelp profile here and see some grosssss pictures.  I am happy to admit that I saw no signs of bugs or metal shavings in my food, although that's pretty unsettling!  It sounds like they had a sanitation issue, but that's now cleared up.  I'll definitely "roll the dice" and check this place out again for tasty / cheap Indian and Pakistani grub.

54.description: Ok food... Good portions, cheap, and filling. Not really flavored with Indian spices.

48.description: Food is good, however it is very annoying that you have to call ahead every time and ask if they are open at 11AM. From my experience 90% of the time they open late. Their excuse always is that the food must be brought in from the other location and they are stuck in traffic. Hopefully they fix that issue.

44.description: So I'm just going to be straight forward. apparently, the UIC location fired all their old workers/cooks and hired new ones, maybe this is the reason why it's different. I am still a fan of the original ghareeb nawaz on Devon, but the UIC ghareeb nawaz is different then it was a year ago. We walked in on a Sunday night and the tables were filthy, not one table was clean and they weren't even that busy. The food tastes different too now, I always get the chilly chicken paratha but it tasted bland the last 3-4 times I got it. They only messed up the food sometimes in the past, now this location does it all the time. From now on. I will always choose the Devon location over the UIC location. This place has seriously let me down. they charge more for their food too! The most unique thing about UIC ghareeb nawaz was that you got amazing food for a dirt cheap price. Now they are raising their prices, and lowering the quality of their food.

24.description: This place has yummy Indian food, it's super cheap, and the employees are nice and easy. I always get boneless chicken biryani, aloo palak, and paratha. I have eaten here at least 10 times, and there has never been anything bad in the food. Occasionally the food is hotter one time than the next. Occasionally they run out of boneless chicken biryani, but I appreciate that it is made fresh. Sometimes it's a little messy in the seating area, but you should expect that when the overall cost is so low.

7.description: I admit portion is really a lots for the price, but then the food is okay. I had Chicken Biryani somewhere before, so when I tried it over here. It's not even tasty at all. So tasteless. I ordered Gyros-Bati Parhata too. It didn't taste good either. I had butter chicken which was good. That's the only dish I liked.

49.description: Prob the WORST Indian food I've ever had.  Ordered the butter chicken and it was all fatty brown meat. I couldn't even eat it. The bread was greasy and food came cold. Never again. You get what you pay for and this was super cheap, low quality food.By the way... I got on yelp just to write a review for this place.

40.description: Went. It was closed. It was 10 pm and it says on HERE that it closes at 12:30 am.So, I drove all the way from up north for nothing huh? How can you NOT have your store hours at least close to correct? 2 hours is a very wide margin for an error like that.

53.description: I gave this place five star based on everything! I'm 100% asian (and by asian I mean part Japanese-Indonesian-Chinese!). I never eat Indian or Pakistan foods before.Came across this restaurant because I went to the bookstore. And hey, why not try the food!Their chicken bryani is yummy. I can taste the curry taste. The portion is HUGE! I ate it for lunch and dinner. I also tried their veggie bryani. The taste is okay. Not as good as the chicken one. At the next visit, I ordered the chicken wrap. I didn't care much for this. The staff is definitely friendly. He explained the food well to me (I'm totally blind with indian or pakistan food) when I first came here to get food. I did see some of the bad reviews, but at least for me, this place is definitely my to go to restaurant. Cheap, fast and big portion. Although I don't think its good for kids, just because they use a lot of spices in their food.

30.description: One of the worst biriyani's i have ever had in my life. I used to order from this store in past few occassions. Howver, its been long time, So i tried. I ordered chicken biriyanis, I received a call back and i was told that just boneless chicken biryani is only available. What i got a utter junk.. Its Cold, Dry, No flavor, chichen pieces here and there. Overall.. really bad experience.

46.description: My husband and I live in the West Loop area and had heard great things about Ghareeb Naweez on Devon so we thought we'd try the one on UIC's campus. This was the worst Indian food I've ever had. Btw.. I'm Indian. The food was cheap for the quantity served but the quality definitely speaks for the cheap price. We will never be returning to this restaurant. I would not recommend this place to anyone!

1.description: Ghareeb is a quick, Indian, counter service restaurant near the UIC campus that offers a full range of North Indian vegetarian options. I was in Chicago, on my way to Madison with a close friend, and met up with a friend that was a grad student.Ghareeb didn't have any naan left: at 1:30 PM, they shut down the naan operations. Imagine the feeling of a red rubber stamp hitting you on the forehead with some red ink that said "No Naan." The man at the counter offered a naan equivalent: he saw the look on my face and knew I needed some form of bread. They also were out of paneer, and didn't have some of the lentil dishes either. We ended up ordering the chana masala, a mixed veggie curry, a potato (aloo) curry, and a spinach (palak) curry.The chana masala was great: it wasn't too spicy, and the chickpeas were nice and tender. The palak is something I won't order again: the blended spinach was just not my cup of tea, and not because I don't drink tea. I can do saag dishes, not but palak dishes. The potato curry was decent. It had this lightness, which was very surprising because lightness is not the first thing that comes to mind when I think "potato." The mixed vegetable curry was a bit disappointing. I need to stop ordering mixed vegetable curries: they always end up mushy.  This place was super cheap; each entrée was only a few dollars, and my friends and I only spent 25ish dollars on enough food for two or three meals. The interior was a bit small, and connected to a bookstore, so it's a strange eating environment, but it works.If I came again, I'd definitely just order one rice and one chana masala. Keep it simple, and focus on the best tasting dish I had there!

55.description: Very good experience. My family and I went here for iftaar and were in a rush but we received our food in a timely manner. The cashier was highly courteous and offered us dates along with complimentary samosas for our iftaar. True to the name of restaurant. Food was generous in its portions and was cheap.

9.description: Bottom line - good food at an affordable price. I was looking for some Halal food and found this resto on Yelp. I got the paratha, beef biryani, and butter chicken. I liked everything I ordered. I especially liked the flavor of their butter chicken. It's not the usual flavor I'm used to. It's not heavy on curry, which is fine by me. It'sbalanced? I'm not sure how authentic it is because of that. But, either way, I liked it enough to come back again and order the same items.

26.description: Great portions, great food, and great flavored. They never disappoint and are always an easy go-to place for warm, comforting, and flavorful Indian food.

25.description: Got the butter chicken and the spicy aloo masala curry. I couldn't finish either - the sauces were just...off. You do get a lot of food for cheap, but I think I actually have to pass up on the deal here.
