12.description: So so unhappy this is not like the one in Rogers Park.  And so turned off they have issues with cleanliness.  Saw the photo of the roach and wire and was very sad.  Food is good but who wants to risk biting into a roach or metal wire.  Wish they cleaned up their act.  The original is way better.  Very sad it's so close and yet not an option.

59.description: Solid choice for butter chicken and biryani rice. Fast, friendly and cheap!! One problem is that a few times we came late night when it said they were open and they were mopping up and closing shop early. Annoying!! As we drove out of our way to get there! Mohammed is super friendly !

21.description: If you want something to fill you up go hear, but wouldn't recommend if you're looking for good authentic Indian food.

17.description: A bang for your buck. We eat multiple times off our our order for under $15 (which includes byriani, butter chicken, chili chicken, paretha & samosas).Order online from Yelp, ready in 15-20 minutes. Always friendly/good service.

10.description: yah good quantity for the price. Tastes good

5.description: The food here is cheap but okay for the price. Yesterday, I ordered their Boneless Chicken Biryani through Grubhub and found a COCKROACH in the rice! I called the restaurant, and they said it was just "spices" but it had 6 legs and a pair of antennae. I received a refund through Grubhub, but I will never be eating here again. This place is disgusting and unsanitary. DO NOT EAT HERE UNLESS YOU WANT COCKROACHES IN YOUR FOOD.

3.description: This place epitomizes delicious, affordable food for college students. It's amazing in taste, spectacular in price. The atmosphere without the bookstore next door is going to be different. But the staff at Ghareeb Nawaz are always very friendly. You can't go wrong here.

35.description: I love Ghareeb Nawaz and am thrilled that this location exists. I hate having to drive all the way up to Devon to get real Indian food. My mother is from South India, and the dal they make here is the closest I can find to what my mother makes. I spend $10 and have 5 solid meals. It's perfect for when you're in a rush and need to feed your family. Anyone who says it isn't authentic is crazy--it tastes just like my mom's cooking and just like the Indian food that my family eats whenever I go to India (which is annually). I'd way rather give my business to places like this than the over-priced places in the city that serve similar quality.The only reason why I docked a star is because even when I call my order in ahead of time and come later than they say it will be ready, I still have to wait. But, you really can't beat the quality and quantity for the price.

19.description: Great portions, great food, and great flavored. They never disappoint and are always an easy go-to place for warm, comforting, and flavorful Indian food.

28.description: Looking for a cheap meal? Well I guess look no further. The prices here are awesome. While the food is like playing Russian roulette. I go here occasionally with a few friends, the taste results always vary. Some days the food is not overcooked or undercooked. Other days I find that everything is undercook which raises food safety concerns. Once I saw a guy vomit right next to my friend and I, we lost our appetite in an instant. It honestly is only a quick fix for your hunger. If you decide to go to ghareeb nawaz, tread lightly.

45.description: What the fuck. The hours that are posted online are wrong.They will close whenever the hell they feel like it. This has happened to me so many time that I stopped going they for good. When you say you are going to be open till 12:30 ,stay open till 12;30 or don't be open at all.

33.description: This is what I want my Indian food to taste like. I am a regular at this delicious place, and I come here at least once a week! Chili chicken, Butter chicken, and butter beef are the best!!!

43.description: Good food and cheap. What more can you ask for? If you're looking for something healthy, this probably isn't the place but it is still delicious nonetheless.

2.description: Mango Lassi was not to my taste! It tasted more egg-like than milk/yogurt and had a very flat taste, whereas I'm used to having some cardamom or something along those lines (i.e. rose water). Although, price is good (cheap) I would like a bit more quality. The frontier beef (decided to try on a whim) reminded me of hospital food, I don't know why. Samosas were way  smaller than I'd like and am used to and the quality of that was so so. This was the second time trying food at Ghareeb Nawaz and I did think the chicken chili biriyani was ok as well as the vegetable biriyani.

18.description: Tasty and cheap!  For about $3.50 I got a drink and a chicken plate with huge tortilla-like flat bread, onions and delicious tangy yogurt sauce.  Only AFTER eating there did I check out the Yelp profile here and see some grosssss pictures.  I am happy to admit that I saw no signs of bugs or metal shavings in my food, although that's pretty unsettling!  It sounds like they had a sanitation issue, but that's now cleared up.  I'll definitely "roll the dice" and check this place out again for tasty / cheap Indian and Pakistani grub.

41.description: Tasty, relatively healthy, ridiculously cheap.  What more could you ask for in a restaurant?

52.description: This place is so tasty and cheap! You can fill up your tummy and a buddies for about $5.00! They make everything fresh and do their best to provide top quality customer service. Their meat is all unprocessed as well, so you can rest easy knowing that you will be enjoying top quality meat morsels! Don't hesitate stopping by this delicious joint!

50.description: Cheap. Fast. No hassle. Tasty. College town like. Stopped in to check it out on a late Sunday night to dinner in. Decent menu selection. The dals are good, roti and parathas are good size and come out super hot and fresh. The Chili Chicken had a nice heat (spicy). Mango Lassi was ultra runny and comes out of a dispenser, I wouldn't recommend the lassi. Also a plus, the bathroom was clean, probably because it's shared with other businesses. For the price you pay, this place is good.

4.description: Never eat at ghareebnawaz. They are not hygienic at all. My friend got baryani and it had a bug in it- this shows how unhygienic and unsanitary it is. The food isn't good at all either and it's such a big disappointment. Never go to this place again. Even if you go to uic and want cheap food. Don't. This isn't hygienic. Pls don't go here.

6.description: How can folks stomach Ghareeb?I was so excited to learn that we had Indian and Pakistani cuisine near UIC. I wanted so hard to be a fan of this place. It has all the makings of Andy's seal of approval: chicken, curry, and cheap. But alas, I expected a bit more.Most options here will indeed be $5 (pre-tax) and won't include rice or... wait, where's the naan? You're telling me that they don't sell naan here?...That should have sealed the deal.The chicken marsala that I ordered came in a small container and wasn't anything to write home about (minus this Yelp review, eh?) It felt very basic and unimaginative, and seemed like they had simply reheated up some existing curry and dropped in some pieces of chicken.On top of that, I felt very uneasy after eating at Ghareeb- even resulting in some full on hiccup episodes that lasted for a good two days, That by association may be enough for me to not want to come back. It pains me that I can't recommend this place since it's so convenient, but there are likely better options out there in Chicago to better satisfy your Indian cravings.

22.description: There is no way to cancel the order if I placed one by mistake !!

15.description: I love the food and the restaurant and will continue to visit but I had to update my review. Last time I gave it all 5 stars, but now I have to give it a less then great review this second time because of the inconsistent open hours and food availability. There has been at least 10 times that I have showed up and they ran out of chicken biryani or chili biryani. I now have learned and call before making the travel. This I can deal with and understand biryani is long process to make.The restaurant hours on the other hand, I don't get. It says open until midnight but I know I've seen them close at 11 PM. Once they were closed at 10 PM. Today I showed up at 11:15 AM, which on here says they're open at 11 AM but they were closed.

57.description: Extremely affordable. I love the concept for fast food Indian. I always get the chili chicken paratha which is delicious. Kinda spicy if you're not used to Indian food. I love the paratha, very fresh and hot off the stove

20.description: Ignore the lowball reviewers who don't know Indian fast food, they are comparing mangoes and papayas. This is authentic Thaali style Indian cheap eats at student pricing.  It's so authentic, one time when I came here there were a dozen FRESH-OFF-THE-PLANE Indian students, luggage still with the tags on them, huddled around a table eating (by hand Indian style).  They didn't even drop their stuff off at the dorm, this was the first place they came, after traveling a long frightening distance from home.  Normally when one goes out to eat at an Indian restaurant in a Midwestern city, you need a few friends to dine with you to get a good variety of dishes to share.  Eating alone when it's not buffet time can be problematic.  Thaali refers to both the fast food combination of a few dishes served to individuals as well as the actual metal tray or dish and bowls service ware that the meal comes on.  The biryani here is notably excellent, I'm a big fan of the veg combinations. It's like being in Chennai, only with less flies and beggars (though there are some of both outside in warmer weather).  It's a tight, unattractive little corner oddly attached to an excellent bookstore, but compared to any place like it in India, it's clean and spacious.  I always ask the counter guy where I can catch a tuk-tuk or auto-rickshaw and for some reason he never thinks this is funny.

36.description: This place is incredible. I came here because of a recommendation from a friend. The food is delicious and very reasonably priced. The Chilli Chicken was fantastic. Aside from the great food, the staff is incredibly accommodating. The cashier misheard me and accidentally ordered two of my order. The manager overheard and corrected the problem immediately. Great place and looking forward to going back next time I'm in the area!

14.description: I know we need to go here with no expectations considering the price point but the food was nowhere close to Indian. I mean we had biriyani which was made with chili chicken and the they mixed the normal biriyani with SRIRACHA sauce and called it chilly chicken biriyani. SRIRACHA is not Indian. That's I have to say.

3.description: Gary always send such a high standard of floral! He will meet your budget, and still give you a beautiful arrangement! You really cannot get any better than Gary and Randolph Florist for a genuinely nice and honest company!

1.description: The flowers were beautiful, tasteful and Gary, the florist, was able to incorporate some personal elements like my collection of milk glass. Additionally, he was very creative in his design and color. Gary was also very willing to work within my budget - which is fantastic.I will say that at points this florist was difficult to reach and he did not label the wedding party flowers (grandmothers, aunts, etc.) so that was confusing. Lucky for me -- I had an amazing caterer (Phil Stefani) that coordinated everything -- so all was well. I would recommend working with this florist again.

2.description: Great DesignsI've been sending my girlfriend, now my wife, flowers from Randolph for over 15 years.  I discovered them when they were on Lake St. down the street from my office.   The arrangements are creative and beautiful and she loves them every time.  Gary is always friendly and remembers me even if it's been a while since I called.  Delivery is professional, dependable and on time.  I will order from here for as long as I live in Chicago.  I give him an amount I want to spend and I'm never disappointed nor felt short changed.  We always got great flowers at a fair price.

0.description: Beautiful, Beautiful centerpieces were ordered through Randolph for a bridal brunch I threw.  I have no complaints.  The arrangements were low to the table (which I requested so that we didn't have to look over them), square vases with three HUGE cornflower blue hydrangea and a tiny bit of filler, with a brown ribbon tied around the vase.  They were larger than I expected but at a reasonable price. If you need flowers in the loop, I say go for it!

4.description: My family has been using Randolph Flowers for about 30 years--all of our banquets, weddings, funerals, and even spur of the moment arrangments for MOM.  Always welcoming and will work within your budget.  I've never been disappointed once.  Gary is the best!!
